comment: Her lectures aren't as boring as some other teachers but they aren't worth going to, especially if you learned any ancient history at all in high school. Just get yourself a copy of the TA notes from a friend and study that before the tests and you will pass.
Boring class

I didn't go to class except to take tests and pick them up, and I got a B+. If you study the TA notes and other students' notes well an A is easily within reach. As for her lectures, from what I did experience, they were not particularly exciting, but she does enjoy talking about her subject.

Although Sonia's class is boring, it is very easy. Don't buy the book because you will not open it. Just attend the lectures, do your best to stay focused, and take good notes. Also, get a set of TA notes as back up. One of the easiest classes you will ever take if you just do the bare minimum.
She's super boring.... but she's a good professor. Showed up with MATH 140 homework and just listened. DON'T listen to what she says about the TA Notes. They saved me and are the reason i passed.

Having Sonia is part of the Pepperdine experience. She isn't too terrible, just fairly boring. If you attend class and take notes, you'll be more than okay. Don't rely on the TA notes because they can be totally wrong.

Dr. Sorrell, known to all as simply "Sonia," is a professor everyone should have the experience of taking. Her lecturing style is extremely unusual: her passion for the subject is filtered through her passionless voice, which gives her lectures an oddly endearing tone. Tests are all details, which is a pain. She's incredibly organized and clear.

Literally everyone hates Sonia's class. Nobody shows up, lectures are super boring, and what's worse is she bombards  you with spam emails about 'cool Roman recipes.' Try to take this class over summer with another professor if you value your sanity.

HUM111 is by far my favorite class at Pepperdine. Sonia is so passionate about what she teaches, and you can tell by the way she "takes us on a journey through the Parthenon" or even when she goes on and on about not cheating on exams. Her class is so easy- no reading required. She's the best.

Either attend class or read the book (I recommend attending class). She clearly likes the material, but cannot lecture interestingly. TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE EXTRA CREDIT. 20 free points on top of a 300 point gradebook= 6% grade boost

Good teacher, use TA notes. Her class is becoming increasingly hard but still not too hard if you show up for class and take notes, or get your hands on the TA notes. Study 2 hours the night before the test and you should be good. Kind of a strange teacher but hilarious in her own way. DO NOT FALL ASLEEP IN CLASS or you get called out super hard.

Sonia's class is easy as long as you go to EVERY CLASS, take notes, read her outline and stay off of your phone. She tries to micromanage a class of 150 or more and it's really annoying. But she's a wealth of information and if you read over your notes and her outline a couple of times before the test you'll be fine. The only book I touched was GP.

She is a great person and obviously cannot exhibit that in a lecture class. Go visit her; she's very knowledgeable in travel. If you can get TA notes, get them. If not just go to class and print out her lecture outlines. I mean you are paying a lot for these classes. All the test questions are from there. No surprises. Oh and read her book!

Sonia...Class may get boring at some point. She gives a lot of info in 1 class so it's important to go. I had TA notes and did not go until the first test and did well on the test. I began going to class after and got better grades. Passed the class with an A. Get the TA notes, take them to class and highlight as she says them. Then review them :)

Sonia is one of the most genuine professors at Pepperdine. The only people that have a problem with her are the ones that never attend class or read the textbooks. Her class is extremely easy if you go to class; she gives you answers to the tests! I thoroughly enjoyed HUM 111. Also, read her book for extra credit; it's actually really good!

First time taking a humanities class and I learned a lot. I dislike Roman history but she made it interesting. Read her novel for extra credit and you will succeed. Easy A if you form study groups and ask her questions. We' re now good friends thanks to her accommodations.

Hum 111 is very easy. She isn't a bad teacher I learned a lot. Her test aren't meant to trick you at all they are straight forward and easy. She can be mean if you disobey the rules but its simple don't talk during class. Loved the class easy A. Just be sure to take notes!
her job description is to teach.. i mean, really? all she really does is read her notes. hires TAs to take notes but tells students TA notes are useless. i mean, seriously?
Very easy class if you have the notes

She is actually very sweet and willing to meet with you and help you out. You can tell she cares about her students and she loves what she teaches. Recognize that although the class may be boring, it is worth it to attend and I find the textbook reading helpful as well. Don't be afraid to talk to her!
Her class is easy if you show up and take notes. Start studying prior to the night before an exam and you will be fine.

She is actually a really good teacher, but there is a catch in getting a good grade: you have to show up to class and take notes, or you have to decide to read through the TA notes. In any case, you have to really study for the test or you will do poorly because the test is 30 multiple choice and 1 essay. She is really knowledgable about travel! (:

she isn't as bad as people may say. it is boring and her hair flips are annoying but if you have the ta notes (which are constantly being passed down) then the class isnt that bad. you have to study. the best way i found to study for her tests are to answer the thought questions. it makes you study all the material and it is a possible essay.

LOVE her! She's extremely knowledgable, funny & experienced. If you take notes you'll be fine. Her anecdotes keep lectures interesting, and the syllabus is very organized. Side note, ask her for traveling tips as she's been to over 100 countries!

Did not like this teacher she was rude to students. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK! If you get the TA notes you should be fine. It took me a a couple tests before I figured out how to study but after that was easy. Final is a breeze. Sucks you can't avoid her.
Sucks you cant avoid her!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

If you go to class and take notes, you will do fine. If you have essay tests, prepare an outline prior and have it reviewed by her or one of the TAs. TAKE NOTES BY HAND. If you fail the class, get off of facebook and pay attention to what she says. Also, make a friend who has had her and ask about old tests.

Definitely one of my favorite professors! She is INCREDIBLY knowledgable in her field, and very actively involved in it. She is a very passionate person, and she really makes the subject come to life. The class is really easy if you take notes and study, but no need for the books to get an A+. She is very accessible, helpful, and funny.
I hate this professor with a passion! AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!
Worthless instruction. The entire humanities sequence is a fraud.
AWFUL, SOMEONE PLEASE GET HER FIRED!!!!!!!!

MOST BORING CLASS EVER. only one that teaches it, please dont listen to the <3 other people wrote. Essays are graded by TAs that grade differently. A lot of people actually audio record her lectures cause she talks so much.  She puts u to sleep and can be very sassy--she snapped at a girl who asked if it was BC or AD. LOVES to catch people cheating

I hate this class with a burning passion, which is probably the only reason why I'm not a fan of Sonia. The class isn't easy, especially when essays are incorporated. It's a GE and she's the only, prof, so just get it over with. She'll meet with you and is helpful, though.
Fun lectures. She's an awesome professor. Don't buy the books, just go to class and take hand-written notes. Flashcards are great for studying. I had an A until the final, idk what went wrong.

I LOVE SONIA! She is one of the greatest professors I have ever had. She loves history so much and she is so much fun. Make sure you have lunch with her one day because she's great. DO NOT BUY THE BOOKS. Tests are straight out of the lectures...but if I could take the class again I wouldn't bring my laptop to class. Hand notes=A+.
Sorrell's lectures are a drag. Her tests are nearly impossible unless you're into details.DO NOT BUY THE BOOK! Just take good notes.

Sonia shuts it down every class period! She is an amazing professor and person; shes been literally everywhere. Her hair flips are world famous and she is the talke of pepperdine; just you wait. Ive personally met with her and shes very helpful and cares. Take the class, listen and take good notes, books not needed; study hard! U will heart Sonia.
easy if you have the TA's notes. Not helpful and isn't a outside-class-help teacher. but overall okay

Her class is like going to an afternoon at the movies. Bring a snack and enjoy: It's story time with a historical twist. Don't buy the books and always right down everything she says..even if it is that Greece is the size of Louisiana. (P.S. the hair flip is world-famous)

Come to class b/C notes are essential. Try to write everything down (tape it, if possible). Sorrell's a sweet heart, full of interesting/useful theories. If you appreciate passion, you?ll love her. No reason to be one of the infamous cheaters. Study your notes, you?ll do just fine. Forget the book(s).
nom nom nom

I hate history, and I still found Sorrell's class interesting!  Her lectures actually contain some interesting information and are easy to retain information from them.  This class really isn't as bad as everyone makes it out to be!  Also, the tests are easier than any test I ever had in high school. P.S. Don't buy the books.

Sonia is amazing! She is a great professor, love her lectures - always interesting and useful. And she has a wonderful personality, love talking to her during office hours! Plus she's been to what, 140 countries! She truly can relate to all her lectures

She is a fantastic professor, and has alot of enthusiasm in her subject. She grades fair on test, and a little harsh on the mini essays. Just try hard when studying and actually go to her class. Notes are everything, but you can probably find someone with good TA notes. Watch for the hair flip and her "traveler tips" for when you go to Egypt haha

First don't buy the book, she tests on lecture.  Lectures are fairly interesting, but don't take the class that is 3 hours.  Tests are fairly easy and you can get old ones from previous students.  The essay question on the tests are tricky and she grades them kind of harsh. Overall easy class with good prof.

Don't buy the textbooks or her version of that princess story.  She is a bore and is a scary sight to see. You don't have to go to class as long as you get lecture notes from someone else or the year prior. Test consists of multiple choice and an essay.  Just study like an other class. As a teacher, she's draining.

Her tests are a joke as long as study all the necessary stuff.  Not at all challenging like she used to be, now tests are super easy multiple choice and short essay. Just study and you'll do fine. However, she's not exactly the most approachable person outside of class. Who cares, joke class!!!

Sorrell is a good teacher, although study her notes RELIGIOUSLY. you don't need the books, so don't buy them.  her hair flip and corny jokes make the class worth going to.  You do need to study for the tests.  do not think you can slide by.  if you know your material, you will be completely fine
Easy, but seriously HOT and you'll love her. She's seriously such a hot topic on campus...
horrible teacher

Sonia is incredible!  He lectures are so interesting (though I wouldn't recommend the 3 hour long section..it's a little too long) and she is genuinely passionate about what she teaches.  She teaches about more than just the boring cookie cutter history stuff. She is amazing to talk to one on one as well. Watch for the hair flip.
Sorrell is brilliant!  One of my favorite classes ever!  Great lectures and clear instructions.  Read her e-mails--she tells you all about studying for the exams.

Not a bad teacher by any means, but she could really enhance her lectures with PowerPoint. It would make note-taking MUCH easier than it is now. Also, the tests aren't as difficult as everybody says they are as long as you have an overview of the topics discussed. Be warned that it's nearly impossible to concentrate if you take her 3-hour section.

For 2 years people have been complaining about this class!  Basically imposs. to study for.Take VERY detailed notes.  This makes it difficult because having the book makes studying a lot easier.The tests come out of left field and are VERY DIFFICULT.I DONT recommend her class because if you ask for advice about how to do better she isnt helpfull.

The class is interesting, regardless of what other people say. It is not really a hardcore history class- its cooler in that it allows you to learn more   various perspectives. Tests are lil hard. Everytime I was convinced to get an A it was a high B or A minus. Lectures- really important. Take notes like crazy. She is extremely nice and cool!

I found myself looking forward to the lectures from Prof Sorrell. Taking DETAILED notes during lectures is critical. Never once opened my books. The tests are quite difficult.  High standards for the essays on the tests; be sure to include lots of details! Overall, class was difficult but Sonia made it so good and bearable. One of my fav professors

Dr. Sorrell was not very clear on what was expected for her tests prior to exam 1.  Therefore, there were a lot of low scores on that test, mine included.  If there is a problem, she always defers you to one of her TA's, who grade your exam like they are reading a doctoral thesis.  However, she is a very good lecturer and a kind person.

She is a teacher who is very knowledgable about the subject but it is a long class and focus is lost after the first 1.5 hr block. you dont need to books, you need to take good notes and study off the lecture outlines
Dont buy text books, not a single question from any test is taken from them. extremely trivial material in this class

Very nice, very interested in the subject. Classes are long but if you bring your laptop and take notes/look at facebook its not too bad. Tests are ok if you study for them. Grade is just based on your tests scores. No chance for extra credit.
Sorrell is very good. It is a long lecture class (3 hours can get bad), but she makes it engaging and interesting with her strong lectures. Plus, the tests are easy

This has been by far my worst class at Pepperdine so far. The classes are extremely boring, and the tests are really hard. I am a low A or high B student, and I got a low C in this class. I feel sorry for anybody who has to take this class.
very biased.  biggest ego trip i have ever seen.  still, an easy A.

It's just a bad class, no getting around it.  She's a great teacher though, and is willing to help outside of class if you need it.  I never opened a textbook and I was fine.  She wants you to do well, so take advantage of that.

Shes the only prof for Hum 111 so be prepared to take her...wasnt very helpful during office hours, offered little extra credit and her tests are hard. nice woman though. humanities GE is a nightmare at pepp. brace yourself.
Great Professor!!!! Learned so much from her......Her lectures are amazing and her tests are easy....just go to class and youll be fine
avoid her

Sonia is an amazing lecturer who has actually been to most of the places she talks about.  She actually made a three hour class interesting and I looked forward to going.  Don't bother reading the books. As long as you GO TO CLASS and take good notes, you'll do great.

Great class, she's a terrific professor who LOVES what she's teaching, and has been everywhere she talks about.  She keeps her class pretty interesting, even for a 3 hour.  She's also very attractive and spunky!

Lectures the entire class, which can be hard to stay focused in for 3 hours.  If you take good notes you will do fine on the test, but if you don't your not going to be happy.  Her tests ask some random questions which make them a little difficult you have to know more than the jist, you have to know details.
Very interesting woman.  Her lectures are like watching the History Channel.  Her tests are easy.
Tests were a bear and she wasn't the most personable in the world, but I've NEVER had such WONDERFUL lectures.  Overall, I enjoyed her class tremendously!!
Definitely take 111 with her over Colburn
u know why?? She is ****... especially for International students.

I dont know why people say shes hard. She practically tells you what will be on the tests, and she offers extra credit. She takes 95% of the test questions from her lectures and handouts, and the other 5% is the reading. She almost never gives a full 10/10 on the essays though. But an 8 or 9 is very doable.

For being a lecture class, I really enjoyed it. Her lessons are interesting and she is very enthusiastic. She makes witty comments to see if you are paying attention. I personally liked her travel stories. Now I have practical knowledge for when I visit Greece..or Egypt..or other parts of Europe..haha. :) I would read for extra test info..

I don't know why people complain about her so much, I guess they just don't take the class serious enough. You can't expect an A w/o studying. Her class is actually way more interesting than I expected. She is energetic and a great story teller. She's been to all the places that we learn in class and can tell you a lot of first-hand experiences.

Great teacher, great class. It may get difficult though and you must be willing to be challenged. It was worth it for me! I don't understand why people don't like her classes- if you are looking for an easy A don't take her.

the questions on the test are random and if you dont listen every two seconds then you might miss a question on a test. but i got a's every test just by studying and taking super good notes. just take good notes and study and youll do fine.

EVERYONE LISTEN....Pepperdine is as easy as it gets when it comes to a University's with high accolades and I was not a straight A student by any means.  That being said, Sorrell's class takes alot of memorising but just enough that you actually remember some of the facts you learn and can sound like you know what your talking about in a conversation over dinner with authors or diplomats...  If anything you should take this class to have stories of that one eccentric, bizzare teacher with wierd hair!
She treats students like babies, we have like baby sitter for each test. Can't understand anything of what she says. Her class is so not organized. She needs like I, A, 1, etc...
No Comments
Extremely hard!!!!Avoid her....her TA's grade inconsistent and are also tuff....

Her exams require you to memorize essays (practically) and spit them back out for a TA to read and grade.  The TAs do not grade the same and some are very unfair.  She speaks all the time about how "fair" she wants to be, but the class is anything but.
No Comments

One of my fave teachers at Pep. Witty, bright, and always energetic - She makes lectures interesting and is a GREAT teacher! The work is not hard!! Only a few tests - just review the outlines she gives every day and no prob. Don't let the slackers who never showed (and therefore flunked) scare you.

Anyone who thinks that this class is hell needs to suck it up and realize that Pepperdine is not meant to be a slacker school.  If you want an easy class go to a CSU or community college.  Just pay attention in class (and SHOW UP) and you'll be fine.

She is not as bad as everyone makes her out to be. She loves her subject and wants you to as well. If you pay attention in the lectures, the tests are right off the outline. Good course if you enjoy history. Go to class even though you don't have to. She loves to tell stories and make lectures fun.
Don't take her, you will die, If you want to get a D or try to fail a course, Go for it!
Way to hard for a G.E class you can get away with not going to class expect for the actual days of the test but be prepared to study... Avoid at all cost....
No Comments

OK this is GE and someone needs to tell her that. I have been t the class 2 this semester cause it is so boring and you don't need to go. You could get an A if you study for hours upon hours. basically get 50 min to write 10 essays . she picks 10 from about 25 or so essays so u have to know them all
this teacher is brutal. its a ge, someone has to remind her of this. but emily fitzhugh is a good TA. overall, this class sucks, and i feel for whoever isnt almost done with it like i am.

DO NOT TAKE HER!!!! Someone needs to remind her that this is a GE requirement. Ya she tells you what is on the test but just to give you an example on our last test she gave us 38 ID'S (mini essays) she picks 12 and you do 10 in an hour.  You have to know everything about those 10.

way too stuck on herself, she lists her credentials in every e-mail. a student sent an her an e-mail and she replied to it to the whole class and made the student look like an idiot. in love with history, could care less about students. avoid taking her at all costs.
I had her for all majors and she is an awesome teacher and very interesting.  She make sthe lectures fun and is always willing to entertain your tangents. She knows her stuff
She is a right of passage.
No Comments
Tests entirely too difficult.  Very interesting as far as lecture classes go.  If you want to take the easy route...take it in the summer!!
One of the meanest teachers you'll ever meet. She's fine when lecturing, but awful one-on-one. Class is dull. Tests really depend on the T.A. that you get.

Great teacher.  Tells you exactly what to study for the tests.  Go to class and take good notes, because that is essentially the test answers.  Her outlines give structure to the class.  Great lecturer, makes the info interesting and relevant.

She is an awesome teacher. She really know what shes talking about and really informative on the topic. She knows all this little info that u can't find anywhere in ur books. Her test how ever is the hardest test I ever taken. The Ta is not helping either

Ok lets just say the class is outta control.  She takes it a little too far even though she knows what she is talkin about.  She will go on and on at the end of lectures about art forms that are soooo boring to listen to.  Tests are waayy to hard for a GE
tests too spread apart, on too much information. Thinks she's funny but she's not. Not very interesting.
She can't teach for**** without her notes. Love Humanities, but can't stand her. she is no help.
No Comments
No Comments
she requires sooooo much from students...hello it is GE!!!  Im not majoring to become a passionate historian--get over yourself!  must take, so suck it up-- at least she knows her stuff
Tests are really hard, attending lectures gets monotonous and difficult be consistent to, but in the end are worth it for the test.
No Comments
Her lectures are interesting, but she's intense.

What can you do with a required GE that most people are dreading? I think she did a great job on lectures, and she is very fair. She would rather talk to you individually and have your test pushed back a few days than have you try to cheat.

Sorrell is FABULOUS.  Her lectures were so interesting, attending class was almost like watching a movie (well, close).  Exams were difficult because she expects a lot, but she demands as much of herself as she does of her students.  Well worth the work.

Finally, a lecture class I didn't fall asleep in.  Sorrell is intelligent and witty.  Yeah, the tests are hard.  Welcome to college.  Sorrell is passionate about her subject and her class is well worth the stress over tests.
She is awesome!
She's a spawn of satan.
No Comments
Fabulous class, wonderful person. Class was what a college course should be like
grading system sucked...but she was great
No Comments
No Comments
Her class is the most stressful environment. Hope to NEVER have her again.
She's a wonderful teacher, but the exams are killers
Best teacher ever!!!
Great teacher--difficult tests!
Wonderful lecturer.  Knows her stuff!
Great Teacher!
No Comments
I adore world history and am a fanatic, but she killed it!
I Cried many times over. Gave me the biggest Migraine ever.
she makes grown men cry with her stressful exams
She made me cry!
No Comments
great lectures!! if you get only take the class without the tests

this class grade is based on either 3 tests or one final. if you are willing to study hard for the three tests and basically teach yourself the material it is easy. Sexton is a passionate and funny professor, but the class was at 8 am which made learning the material hard to learn lol. overall if you put the work in it's an easy and fun class!
The class is straightforward if you read the textbook and attend lectures. Tests are curved generously, making it manageable. unstuck AI was a helpful tool for exam prep.

Professor Sexton is great at the teaching Economics. Despite that the course could be difficult since the class is only graded on an average of 3 exam grades or you can opt out to take a cumulative final exam. He does do generous curves though. Attendance isn't mandatory but going to lectures helps majorly, also he provides a free copy of the book!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I wasn't a big fan of him. You can either have your entire grade is based off of 4 exams or the cumulative final exam. I asked him for clarification on something once and he told me that I should be asking the student success center. I wouldn't want him as a professor again.

Sexton is passionate and funny and gives put cash to ppl who answer questions in class. Attendance not mandatory but you HAVE TO GO. The lectures are the exact same as textbook, but I struggled teaching myself the material. 4 exams and a final. This class stresses me out so much, but I'm also just not good at econ. Take this class at your own risk.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Go to his office hours. Test's are hard, but use the practice tests to get a feel for what they will be like. READ THE TEXTBOOK. It actually helps. Go to tutoring!

Professor Sexton was a nice guy, but not a great teacher. He expects you learn the material straight away from the slides. He will talk over it and then skip over the slides and say "we already talked about it," so you have to listen to be able to take notes. Tests are curved a lot, though, but your whole grade is just 3 tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Type of Professor who reads power point slides instead of explaining the material. You basically have to teach yourself. Tests are extremely hard but he gives really good curves. On the first test it was 18 point for the curve. Read read READ and STUDY from the book and the practice tests on courses.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Sexton is the type of professor who makes learning an enjoyable experience! He is very personable. If you go to his office hours, he will inspire you to want to learn more! I strongly recommend taking his classes!! You will need to read the material on your own, but you will also learn so much just by attending class and taking good notes!

If you show up to class and read the textbook then you will get an A. All the tests are curved super generously (the average curve in my class per test was 20%), and all the content is straightforward. The professor is easygoing and accessible, and he dedicates a lecture to review before each exam.There are no assignments and 3 exams.

While I liked Professor Sexton as a person, being a first-year in his class was a lot. All of his grades were based on three tests or you could choose the final to be your overall grade. He moves very quickly over the topics and expects students to be able to understand economics from the book, which for me, just wasn't possible.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Sexton is wonderful! I highly recommend you take his Econ200 class!

Professor Sexton is easily the funniest professor I have had here. His lectures are very entertaining, but he can rush through content sometimes which can make it harder to understand. However, he gives very generous grading curves on his exams. If you read the textbook, go to class, and study for the exams you will do well.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Great guy!!!! He is very very funny guy. I would say probably one of the best professors ever here. His tests are not hard, if you study, read his book, and go to lectures. His lectures are easy to understand and easy to understand what he is talking about.
Great guy! Just read a textbook and you will be good! He makes a lot of jokes, and his lectures go fast.

Hes a really nice guy who makes a lot of jokes. My advice is to not go to class but watch the recorded videos of the class so you can slow it down and take notes. Tests are pretty hard, but the two tests I studied for I got a 100 with the curve.
Very clear textbook written by himself. I love the clear examples in the textbook. Really learned a lot!!! Take him!

Professor Sexton is average at best. The textbook is basically the same thing he teaches in class, so it feels worthless doing both. His tests were not easy, and I definitely wouldn't take this class if I didn't have to. Only take this class if you aren't able to find an alternative.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: To sum up, you spend hundreds of dollars on a book, and then you teach yourself economics completely independently. I have heard Sexton's voice ONCE in my whole life, on the first day of class. For the rest of the semester everyone teaches themselves from the textbooks, then has three major exams that make up your entire grade. just don't.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Do not take this class. There are three tests and an optional final exam. Don't rely on the final or the grading curve. They won't help you too much. You're gonna have to study night and day to get an A. He is a nice person but not a good teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: 3 tests compose the grade. The test is not very hard as long as you read the textbook and listen to his lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: good LUCK
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: If you can take any other professor or course, DO IT. I've heard Sexton is a great teacher in person, but his online course begs to differ. We were practically left to teach ourselves. Not once did we actually meet to have a live class. The Aplia will take you at least an hour (probably more). Please, just save yourself the time and stress.

I took ECON 200 this fall semester online. It's part of the Human Institutions and Behavior GE requirement. If you are not interested in economics, SKIP THIS GE AND TAKE SOC/PSYCH INSTEAD!!! Unfortunately I was assigned this class and didn't know I didn't have to take it until after add/drop. No lectures, you have to teach yourself (hard material).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I took this class online, from home, during the pandemic and the professor essentially left us on our own to try and pass the class. There were no consistent lectures, we were basically just left to read his textbook and pay for a homework service which was way more expensive than any of my other classes. The teacher showed no interest in teaching.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: To all Pepperdine students, if you do not like economics, do NOT take this class. Sexton doesn't appeal to students well and his lectures, graphs, and textbooks DO NOT HELP AT ALL. Just do yourself a favor and don't take the class unless your degree needs it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Kids really be out here hating on sexton for teaching a tough class. That ain't his fault. His lectures do sound an lot like the textbook, since he wrote the book, but TAs can help a lot in office hours. Tests will make ya think about little details for sure, but if you can't ace his tests, then you don't deserve an A in an Econ class anyway
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Sexton is great, but don't take his online classes, he doesn't teach. His office hours are TAs. I've only see him once for the entire semester. Textbook and homework are written by him. The course is made up by homework and 3 exams.

If you enjoy having no direction from a professor, then this course is for you. He really doesn't even try to teach the class, I have not heard from him once. Very disappointed and feels like a waste of my tuition money. Practically paying thousands of dollars to completely teach myself a concept. I'm sure he's a great guy, but I've never seen him.

Honestly was really disappointed with how this class was handled in lieu of Covid. There are no lectures over zoom, and office hours aren't even with the professor himself, but TAs instead. For somebody with no economic experience, but simply needing to take the class for the credit, it's extremely hard to learn such abstract concepts this way.

his tests will often be tricky, he really knows how to expose your gaps and separate the 90's from the 100's. the library tutors are gonna be pretty huge if you're going for an A, but overall, this is one of the easier econ classes at Pepperdine. if you can find someone with copies of his test from last year, that's huge bc he doesn't change much
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Funny guy but this class is impossible. You basically have to teach yourself from his textbook and lectures are kind of a joke because he doesn't actually teach you anything himself. He's a sweet guy and really smart, but if you don't have an econ brain then it'll be hard work. His test format is fair, but when we switched to online it was whack.

Only graded on three exams. Nice person, not a great prof. Just speeds through his textbook slides. Needs to slow down and thoroughly explain because ECON is confusing! Go to tutoring, study hard, and read because you teach yourself in this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: I had Dr Sexton in both undergrad and grad school. In the grad class, he made sure you understood what you got wrong on the midterm and WHY. He took the time to review every question and ensure comprehension. If you did better on the final, the midterm didn't count. The idea is that he cares about what you know by the end of the semester. GREAT!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: He makes an 8AM GE as amusing as it can be. Tests are very difficult but he gives $20 to the top grade(s). His graphs are confusing on the Powerpoint, but the textbook covers them in better clarity. He curves each test by 6-10 points. Final is optional.
had to study a lot and his tests are pretty hard. tries too hard to make it fun
hated the class, so boring. he usually gives a small curve but don't rely on it.

took the 8 AM for GE and probably shouldn't have. the lectures are super fast paced so don't rely on them and his slides are straight out of the textbook. tries to be funny but not really. DO THE APLIA! SERIOUSLY! its way more helpful than the lectures. definitely study unless you're just good at econ.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: If you get his tests from last year youll be fine and never have to go to class to get an A. If not youll have to work pretty hard and know the material extremely well. 3rd test is the hardest. Dont do homework the night before.

LOVE Sexton!! This class is impossible to fail! He gave us huuuge curves (eventhough not as huge as the class last year). Some people might say that his exams are hard but I think this is cause his exams are only about 33 questions so you only can miss about 6 to get an A (considering he gave 10-14% curve). Also he never puts your grades on courses
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Bob is one of the most hilariously entertaining professors I've ever had, but at the same time he's an incredibly demanding professor and takes economics very seriously. His approach is essentially the epitome of "work hard, play hard." My biggest issue with ECON 416 was that the final counted for 80% of your grade (yes, you read that right)...
rating_tags: Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: The professor needs to reevaluate his expectations for Pepperdine students' sanity. ECON 200 is the worst course I have ever taken and deciding to take it was the worst academic decision I have ever made in my life.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Somewhat funny, lectures are easy since they're based on the book. Make sure you pay attention to the graphs. Might tease you lightly if you show up late.

His lectures are very fast and hard to follow. NOTE: DO NOT RELY ON THE FINAL! He will tempt you with the fact that you can take the grade on your final and make it your grade in the class plus aplia, but the final is WAY harder than the rest of the tests. Do your best on the other 3 tests and don't leave the aplia for the last second.

don't take it at 8 am, you need time to devote yourself to the class and to do all the homework assignments and you will need the textbook to basically teach yourself. If you are not big on economics or math, and you're not willing to put a whole lot of time in to do HELLA homework then you should save yourself the trouble.

Dude's the man. I normally don't go out of my way to rate professors unless theyre reeally bad or reallyy good. And Sexton's one of the better professors at Pepperdine for sure. Just don't blow off studying for any of the tests cuz you'll wanna put this class on the backburner but if you do it'll add alot of unneeded stress for the final.

Dr. Sexton is a great professor. Reading the book is important to pass but the most important part is to DO THE APLIA. If you would not be catching up with your homework and procrastinate you would not get the desired grade. Do all the APLIA chapters before the tests on these chapters  and get an "A" in this class like I did.

Sexton is an incredible teacher. I was dreading taking ECON in the summer, but he makes it enjoyable and easy to pay attention to. His charisma and jokes, the usual video clip to help you remember the material are very helpful when dreading this GE. The test aren't too difficult, but studying is required.
Pretty good
tough class, but a lot of opportunities for help. tests are hard and the aplia is practically self taught.

Sexton is the bomb. He makes econ waaaay more bearable than I thought it would be. Reading before the classes helps a lot while he's explaining. Take notes and read to help with the aplia assignments. He's an extremely understanding professor and helps keep it interesting and memorable.
Makes an otherwise boring GE very bearable. He gives you all the opportunities you need to succeed in the class. If you study hard and do the aplia, it is very possible to do well.
funny and entertaining guy! doesn't always explain everything very clearly, but is very approachable if you have questions!

One of the easiest classes I've taken so far at Pepperdine. It's literally all common sense. Tests are super easy if you're even the least bit intelligent. Aplia is time consuming but helps you learn the concepts. I would definitely recommend this class--Sexton is awesome!
Professor Sexton was super energetic but his tests are HARD.  You literally have to memorize all your notes.

I really wanted a solid A for this class, but ended up with an A-. I talked to him and he said it's still a good grade. If you have no prior knowledge of graphs or numbers then I suggest to study extra hard to earn that A. Go to the tutoring labs. It's a big lecture class so make sure you meet him. The online HW is harsh.

3 Exams, curved depending on class average. If you do well on those, then no final. The final is HELL. Much harder than 3 exams. So do well on the exams so you don't have to take the final. Online homework is 10% of grade but drops 4 lowest grades. Go to class, read book, and go to tutoring. Easy class if you pay attention and ask for help.

I have to say that he is a pretty interesting teacher and makes the class really fun if you. We had 3 exams which were easy to pass if you read the chapters. Go on the review days which is usually the day before the text, it helps. READ THE BOOK or go to class. Curves on all exams and hw. Aplia (online hw) sucks really bad but only worth 10%.
he is cute nice and funny i look forward to being in his class

He wrote the book, he recites the book, his power points are copied from the book, therefore, class is not mandatory. The online Aplia homework is hell: super long and tedious for not many points. He grades on a huge curve, there are corrections, and you don't have to take the final unless you want a better grade. Overall, easy.

Professor Sexton is the most entertaining teacher I have ever had. His sense of humor is amazing and he shows the best movie clips to relate to the lessons. You may hate econ but going to class wontbe boring.
I took all of my required and electives Econ-related class with him. VERY good in teaching and made me understand all the topics clearly. I was a student in Pepperdine in 1989-1993.

(Don't know if I put in the correct ISBN!) Good class.  Kind, engaging, funny!  On the down side-It's pretty unethical to rip us off the way he does with the books though.  Publish a new book every year with missing chapters just to steal our money?  Not very kind.  I already have enough debt, thank you.  Apparently some people use econ to be mean.
I dreaded Economics, but he made it fun and interesting.  Tests are all multiple choice and fairly easy.
I was dreading this class but Sexton made it interesting

He teaches from the book. His power points are directly from the book. No need to go to class. If you need tutoring go see Tom! He is extremely helpful and understands that Aplia (the online homework) can be hard, but this class is definitely easy if you are willing to read on your own and seek help, beyond Sexton.
Love him. He's so fun to listen to just rambling on and on, even at 8am.
Awesome class. Love the short video clips.  Repeats everything. Go to class it helps.
Great Class, Wish he curved more...Need the hellp...

He's a good professor. He wrote the book, so he knows what he's talking about. The exams are fine with the curve he gives; you just have to study and do corrections. Overall, a good class, but the video clips he uses are pointless. He goes fast too.

I had this class in Fall 2009. While I'm not complaining about getting an A with the curve, I also agree with the previous poster. Curving two grades to get people to pass is ridiculous. On the other hand, Prof. Sexton was a really cool guy! Class is fun. I don't reccomend buying the book because you probably can't sell it back. Get the online ver.

I was in class last Fall 2009 & I loved it. Not sure what the other student is talking about. That student said he taught himself & got a B AFTER the final was curved up 2 letter grades. Sounds to me like he would have really earned a D! I went to most classes, took good notes & got an A without the curve!
Makes economics interesting.

I have no idea what these people are talking about. This man may know his subject, but he's got to be the worst professor here. Sure he's funny, sure he's nice. If you have to curve your final up two grades in order for everyone to pass, something's wrong. This is not a revenge comment, because I got a B in the class teaching myself! Class = LULZ.

Sexton is fun (perhaps a little TOO fun at 8am?) and incredibly smart. You couldn?t ask for a better Econ teacher, even if he does go a little fast at times. Class is not mandatory but highly recommended. Econ is one of those classes that you can use to your benefit for the rest of your life, and that?s especially true when taken with Sexton. Also,

Although I had to take his class at 8 am, Sexton definitely made it bearable!  He is a nice guy and he shows fun video clips in his lectures to break up the monotony. His tests are super easy and he gives HUGE curves. It's almost impossible to do poorly in Sexton's class!

Even though I got a C in this class, Sexton is actually a pretty good teacher. If you want an A, read every chapter and sit in the middle-front of the class. He Is really generous with his curves on the midterms and finals.

Sexton is great!  He lectures out of the book that he wrote (although he does go pretty fast).  He shows movie clips during class, and is funny.  His grading is the best. 2 mid-terms and a final.  You grade is either the avg of the midterms or the final (whichever is higher). Also has double digit curves on midterms.  You can get and A if you read

His tests are pretty easy (all M.C. and true/false), yet he still ends up curving them a lot as if they were hard. You get to watch movie clips during class and you don't have to take the final exam. Good teacher, take this class!!!

I love this man.  I hate econ with a fiery passion, and I went to class maybe 7 times all semester, but I still managed to get a B in the class.  He curved our first test 16% and our second test 18% so I'm not sure how anyone could not pass this class. He is HILARIOUS and makes the class interesting.  Definitely a great GE to take.

Easy class, study the book and the tests won't be that bad.  Great professor, explains his stuff well, and the lectures are actually fairly entertaining.  People who don't like this guy, have to really, really suck at econ.

He is a really nice guy, but ECON 200 can still be very challenging. If you read the book you should be able to do well. He doesn't give any homework, just 2 tests. Understand the charts and this class will be cake.
Sexton is pretty good...he's entertaining in class and shows movies, but doesn't really slow down and teach material or connect with individuals...still, an easy A...not a bad GE to take

Sexton, Sexton, Sexton.  You will skip class at least four times a month but on the days you actually do go, you will have a blast.  From movie clips to Sexton's funny antics with Caesar (the projector tech in elkins), this class is very fun.  Don't just read the textbook, study it!  For Sexton wrote it himself! He practically recites it in class.
sexton and the sextons
i reallly hate econ but this prof made it bearable and didnt drone on in the class for two straight hours. he even includes fun video clips! thumbs up!

For a GE econ class, Sexton is the way to go.  You should really do the reading (in which case you can basically not go to class), but the book is fairly painless.  Plus, if you do decide to go to class, he shows movies which is really nice.  And you've gotta love the curves on his test X-)
Have to be self-motivated/really good at econ to get a good grade. Just do all the online hw's and study super hard. Go to class, as it is entertaining and he is cute :)

Great teacher!  Econ is a hard subject, but he does a good job explaining things.  It's hard to take notes in his class, but he DID write the textbook.  He uses videos, which is cool, and works with you to do well in his class.  Highly recommended!

This man is a great teacher.  His class is fun, and he provides incentive to get up for class in the morning even though he doesn't require it.  We watch movies, he is funny, he grades reasonably, and even though the material is challenging he is willing to work with you.  Take his class.

Professor Sexton is so awesome. Let's be honest...most of us don't want to go into economics and he knows that, because if we did, we'd be in upper-division Econ classes, not his. I got mono halfway through the semester and missed a test, but he still worked with me. I probably went to class 10 times the entire semester, and did well. He is HOT!!!!
Awesome!!

One of my favorite teachers ever!  Everyone who keeps saying he plays favorites to athletes could be right but it makes no difference, if you do bad in his class it's your own fault.  Having no attendace policy was a blessing and a curse but it got you ready for the real world.  If anything, he helps you realize what's important.  And if you think it sucks to have a teacher that can make you laugh as much as help you absorb the material...maybe there is something wrong with you.
Since when is an easy professor a good professor? This class was ridiculous and it is because of people who think its hard that Pepperdine is ranked the way it is.  Seriously how did you guys get in?
Prof Sexton is HOT!!!

Cool guy! I don't play sports and I still got an A, and guess what I went to class six times, including the day of the test, and the days he handed them back (next class period), you do the math! Some get mad because their grade is so low that the curve still doesn't help them! Take him, please!!
Does play favorites to athletes, I'll concede that, but he is amazing.  So intelligent and helps you learn.  If you can take him, do!

Yeah this guy is awesome.  Too bad this class doesn't have an attendance policy, because he makes you actually want to go.  Plays at least two movie clips every class and is a comic.  Really knows his stuff, and you don't have to go to class if you don't want to, because half of the class doesn't.
Absoluely awesome.  Huge curve.  Follows by the book that he wrote.  Plays at least two movies each class period.  Greastest GE ever.
Sexton is one of the best teachers alive! He realizes that you have other classes than just his! The tests are actually a bit intense, but he's EXTREMELY generous on the grading curves!

Possibly one of the funniest men alive.  Class was always pretty interesting & I would have gone more if he had an attendance policy. Will do well if you go to class because he is good at teaching the material. He was always very entertaining
No Comments
Only take if your an athlete. He is extremely hard and plays favorites to athletes. Unfair grader
Great Guy. Tests are killer, but if you read all the chapters and go to class you'll be fine.
Probably the most positive GE Econ experience you could hope for.
You've got to love not having to take the final if you are happy with your grade, and if you do take the final it won't hurt your grade. Awesome prof, fun guy, cool class.
He is one of the most clever professors I have ever had. I don't go to class, and I still do well on the tests. Go to class just to watch him and listen to his witty remarks.
He teaches straight from his book.  He will curve the test in order to pass all the idiot athletes in the class.
good teacher - makes it easy and fun
Great teacher!! Pretty easy! Suggest him to everyone!!! As a helpful tip, learn Spanish, makes it more fun!!!!

Hey is sooo funny! He is there for his students more than any other professor. He goes out of his way to talk to you inside and outside of class. His expectations are clear, and if you study hard and go to class you will succeed.
Attendence is not required.  he only gave two midterms and one final....but the exams are hard...his lecture is ok....
No Comments
interesting and amusing

A fun class, but you have to know your material. But, if ECON isn't you thing, at least he makes it interesting. Even though attendance wasn't required, I would go because I enjoyed the class. I was also overseas with him- he made the trip hilarious.
Funny, funny, funny! Never had such a great class. He stays on schedule, covers all material and manages to play a movie clip every class. He always let us out early.
class is useless and he thinks he's too cool
No Comments
FUN!!  and i never used to like econ before this
No Comments
the most fun that econ can be, we watch movies
he's a great teacher and makes the class fun, only two tests or the final
He's my hero.
he rocks
Uses his own book.
No Comments
Dr. Sexton helped me through the tough times I was going through first semester.
Lots of fun in a boring topic.  Get to know him.
Take him if you want to have fun in econ.
No Comments
At 50+, still a hot babe.  I loved his lectures and he is funny!
Great teacher; proves that learning can be fun
Great professor; text is very easy to understand

Dr. Galles' class is challenging, but using Unstuck AI and diligent textbook reading can help. Lectures can be hit-or-miss, so staying engaged is key. With dedication, you can succeed, but be prepared for a tough, memorization-heavy course.

Class is honestly pointless because of his tangents, only good reason to go is if you have questions. His tangent make lectures so hard to follow & makes no sense. I have learned nothing and feel unprepared for my upper divs. I went to office hours multiple times, went to a tutor, and still feel like his method of teaching & tests are so confusing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He does not teach anything. Only 5 people went to class each day. I went to a tutor twice and that was the only way my grade was salvaged. He goes on random tangents in class and what he writes on the whiteboard makes no sense. He taught me absolutely nothing. Not the end of the world, but terrible professor. Literally get him out.

Do not take him. It's not that bad I guess, but seriously he makes an Intro to Macroeconomics class extremely difficult and is not approachable either if you need help. If you have him, best of luck. Prayers are the only thing that will get you through. Oh, and do the readings before every class. His lectures are a waste sometimes.

Although I love Professor Galles as a person, do not take this class. This is the most I have ever studied for a class, and I still got a C. Only take his class if it is the very last option available for Macroeconomics. Regardless, if you get into his class, focus on using the tutoring lab and use the practice quizzes he gives you
Just terrible. You won't learn and you will have to drop the course
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Professor Galles is definitely a teacher one should take if they actually want to learn something contributable to society from college instead of just coasting into a degree. His class is a grind, but once completed the knowledge one obtains is miles ahead of what the average college student graduates with. Read the Handouts!

I have never had such a bad experience with a professor in my life. I had always done well in economics classes, but did so poorly because he does not actually teach you anything. He emphasizes how he wants you to learn application rather than having us memorize, but then does not actually use application in anything.

Dr. Galles' class was the worst class I have ever been a part of. Three exams were the only scores counted toward one's final grade. If you ask a question relating to the subject matter, be prepared to hear a condescending and arrogant response. Dr. Galles does not belong in the undergraduate sphere--especially in the INTRO level courses.
The grade is based off the there cumulative exams. There was no work in between and the lectures were not helpful. Best thing is to just read the book.
This course is SUPER Hard!!! Choose other professor if you can. The test is incredibly Hard. You have to study 3hours a day for his course!!!

He never tells you how you are doing in the class and doesn't put grades on Courses. He just writes your score on a sheet and calculates it at the end. If you ask him how you are doing, he will just say "IDK". You need to be fired!

To preface, I thought that these reviews were written by students who never went to class or cared about the subject. Although it was a beginner class, it is taught at a graduate level. Only 3 tests! Even if you go for office hours and get tutoring, you will not pass. Do not take! 30 kids started in my class, 5 left and the highest grade was a C+.

DO NOT take this class, UNLESS you are ok with a C in the class no matter what. I saw other reviews and thought it couldn't be so bad. It is. Three tests, nothing else in grade book. Tests are for advanced macro students even though this is an intro class. His lectures are extremely complex and talks too fast. Avoid at all costs, you will regret.
His lectures are way too long and confusing, and he goes off topic way too much

You will not learn anything. He talks to you like you know all of the material. He does not link material at all, everything is jumbled together and doesn't;t make sense. 1/5 of our class is left... does that tell you anything?
Absolute worst professor! He does not teach the material. His tests are super difficult, and you won't learn anything. YOU WILL NOT DO WELL!!

I learned way better by going to a tutor than going to class. his lectures make zero sense and do not help. his test questions are not grammatically correct and he wants to trick his students. would never take again. please dont take this class
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I beg you to avoid taking Gary Galles for ECON211 at all costs. I did everything possible to try and teach myself the material (rewatching lectures, teaching myself the textbook material, etc) but NOTHING WORKED. He makes his tests super difficult where he flat out tells you you won't do well on if you are a nonecon major. Good luck in his class.

Honestly, this is the first professor I can say is just horrible. He does not teach, he talks. Your entire grade is from 3 exams that he just doesn't prepare you for. I felt no hope going into any of them after studying for hours and paying attention to each lecture. I believe he sets his students up to fail.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Went in expecting the worse, wasnt terrible but I can def see why my friends disliked his class. Grade is test dependent and lots of reading. Show up to class on time bc youll need the handouts. Grade ranges are wack bc theyre not specific (for +/- differences). Lectures are LONG. Check tests for mistakes, he made a couple, he gave points back.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Galles gets a hard rap and I only think its partially deserved. The class is hard, yes, but its not unreasonably difficult. As long as you attend the lectures, read the chapters, and read the handouts he gives you youll be fine. His grading scale for an A is an 80% or above too which is nice. He gives lots of practical examples to understand.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Accessible outside class

comment: Absolutely AVOID. This is an intro class that is graded to make you fail. If you spend ALL of your time on this class, you might pass.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I honestly have never felt this way for any professor in my life. Please take it from me and my classmates, avoid taking this class with him as a Professor. He PURPOSELY makes exams impossibly challenging. His words exactly: My exams are made for you to struggle, this is why a barely passing grade is considered a good grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Hands down the worst professor Ive had at Pepperdine. Great guy, awful teacher. His lectures make virtually no sense even if youve read the material beforehand. Used no visual aids and tests are close to impossible to do well on. I am a straight A student and I was thrilled I even passed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: If you can avoid this class, do it. His teaching style is unorganized and he often goes on rabbit trails. It did not help me to go to class, except to get the handouts. The handouts will save your grade.

Make no mistake, this class is hard and he makes no attempt to make Econ as a subject anymore bearable. However, if you have to take this class for your major, I would recommend him. He really emphasizes knowledge and learning the material. He's also readily available for office hours.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He is a very good economist and all the concepts he discusses in class actually make sense. The problem is his teaching method. He talks extremely fast for 99% of the class time. His teaching is all over the place, doesnt follow the book. This is a very hard class. He will say some of the smartest things in class but your test scores will be low.

Contrary to popular opinion, I enjoyed galless class. He is funny, witty, and he cares about his students. The exams are mostly multiple choice, so its not a very difficult class to do well in. The people that complain about his course never show up to lecture, dont read, and dont study. I personally never showed up, but I read and studied  B+

Wanted to leave a review for people like me who freaked when they saw the reviews- you can totally pass this class. If you're willing to put in the work to understand the material you'll do fine since he is willing to round your grade up if he sees improvement. Use and understand the worksheets, it's the biggest key to passing. You'll learn a lot!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: His class is unnecessarily hard. Never expect to have a clear logic through the whole course. Never take his course again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Be ready to really study on your own for this class. His way of teaching did not work for me. He went off-topic all the times and I was very confused, did not know what was really important. He sat in his chair and talked all day, and never once stood up to write on the board. I also felt intimidated to ask during class as he wouldputmeonthe spot.

Since your grade is based of three test you have to make she to do good on all of them. Had a C in the class for the first 2 but then the final which was worth about 44% of your grade came around which was full of confusing questions. NO help just tells random stories in class that makes it even more confusing

Professor Galles is considered the gatekeeper for Econ and Business majors. As such, he takes great pride in upholding standards rather than engage in grade inflation. I resented this as an intro student, but came to appreciate it in the quality of his upper division courses. His classroom "antics" are illustrations only. Read the book before class
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: I have never written a review for a professor, but the experience I had in this class made me feel like I should warn incoming students. If you have the option to take this class in the summer or abroad do so because Professor Galles' Macro class is unnecessarily difficult. Lectures are impossible to follow and tests are super confusing.

I'm not the type that has many regrets in life. I normally think "Well, what's done is done." But, after hearing that there was another professor who taught this class, I REALLY regretted taking it with Professor Galles. His lectures are incredibly hard to follow, and his tests make or break your grade. All you can do is read the text and handouts.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Gary is a fabulous professor, he talks about the material in an very interesting way. This is the most interesting class I have had during my first semester of my university.

Go to every class, take notes, know you won't do well on his tests even if you are extremely intelligent. No choice really for incoming Freshman he's the only one teaching Econ. Good news when the class is over, be glad you won't have to ever take him again.
His class is straight lecture the entire period. Be prepared to take notes and read the book. Don't expect anything higher than a C. But he curves so if you just show up, you get a C.

Professor Galles is a brilliant man, his problem is he simply cannot teach.  All the knowledge of economics is sitting in his head, but he is unable to successfully relay the information from his head to students in a way that is coherent and understandable.  The textbook is your best bet, but even then the tests are quite difficult.

His tests are curved based on 30 years of the class' history, and A's are very hard to come by. He will loath you if you go to his office hours, but still go. Do all this, you will learn more than you wish. He is very hard to deal with; he'll never let you finish your sentence, he'll ramble, etc. You must be intelligent and willing to work hard.

Prof. Galles is a more than fair professor.  Do the readings he assigns which are not extensive and go over the handouts he gives out and you will do fine.  Curves his test 10% which is more than fair.  Go to his office hours if you are confused, they help a ton.  He is a bit arrogant but I found it to be refreshing from the more dull profs.

The worst professor at Pepperdine. I understand stuff from the textbook reading but he just confuses everyone in class. He goes off topic all the time and barely focuses his tests on what he teaches in class. Can't escape his 211 class, but never take him for upper-div classes if you can.
The best

This class takes a lot of effort. For econ-minded students, it's not too bad, but for students who don't conceptualize well, it will be tough. Expect challenging tests and thorough, but sometimes repetitive lectures.  His class weeds out business students from econ students, and is challenging. Always available to give extra help. Loved this class.

His class is not that boring but it's definitely difficult. I would say this is the hardest class I've taken at Pepperdine, but the tests were not the hardest tests I've taken at Pepperdine. The tests were very difficult in terms of wording and the choices he gives. They're all multiple choice and they're the sole determinant of your grade.

Gary Galles has a tangential problem. He literally goes on random tangents that make you lose site of his lecture's goal. Because of this, he will drastically curve his test... he KNOWS his students don't get it (Im talking 42/100 = C on tests). He knows his stuff, we cant deny him that. However, his teaching methods will leave you bewildered.

Gary Galles is an absolutely brilliant man. Though he may have very firm views and teach a difficult class his passion for the subject far surpasses all else. All his bad reviews are from people who did not go to class which is around 80% of the kids. If you read the book and go to class an A is in reach. He also is always willing to help.

Dr. Galles is a great professor who offered college level learning for his students. Yes, his class was hard, but not impossible. Just read the book and come to class and you'll be fine, which many students failed to do. I kept up with the reading and always came to class and I ended up with a B...which is pretty good for this class!

Galles is a fantastic professor. His Macroeconomics class is a weeder class, and if you aren't good with logic it will be tough. He focuses on concepts rather than memorization, so he presents many examples of each concept. Read the text, go to class, do the review questions. I highly recommend this professor.

Literally the hardest class of my life. I am intelligent, I study hard, I go to class, ask questions,etc. What he teaches vs what are on the tests is a near 180 difference. All he teaches are stories the whole time. Think you know the material? nope. You will leave thinking, "wtf was that?" feeling completely defeated. good luck to you, brave soul.

He is one of the best professor at Pepperdine!! Dr Galles is so willing to help you and extremely knowledgeable! Sometimes, I go to his office hour to ask him not only about Econ, but also History and Government! Many students blame on him for his hard tests because they never went to the class, nor did they read the book!

Galles is one of the only Professors at Pepperdine I feel presented a college-level challenging course. He inspired my Econ major and challenges my view of the government, economy, and social structure of the US every class. It is not an easy A because he actually cares about the material. The knowledge you will gain in this class is invaluable.
Overall nice guy, hard tests, and a preset curve. Be forewarned that he's very very libertarian and can come off as arrogant.

Dr. Galles is very hard.  Hoever, if you put in the effort necessary to do well in this class, you will remember what is taught.  Thus, his class is an excellent foundation for later ECON courses, though can be a frustrating amount of work for those only taking it as a business major required class.

Galles is really really nice guy, but he talks at 100000 words per minute.  It's really hard to follow him because he says all these complicated concepts, summed up in 10 words.  His exams are extremely hard compared to other professors' exams. Try to avoid this guy. He's really nice and willing to help though,although I still don't understand him.

Galles was one of the best professors I've had in the Econ division. I'm an econ major so of course I didn't mind going to class and doing the reading. That's essential to getting a good grade in his class. I would recommend him to others, but you have to be willing to put in the time and effort outside lectures.
Pretty good, helpful, not politically biased as some econ professors
go to lectures and read the book. manageable if you put in the effort. Galles is happy to help, but he can be intimidating at times. Extremely intelligent man but a tough professor

Nice professor who always has his door open for students. Material is often complicated and tough to understand for young students. Tests can be nearly impossible, and studying does not tend to help. Probably great for upper-division courses, but a tough Intro to Macro professor.

I had him last year first semester. I had heard horrible things about the class, and though it's difficult, it's not the impossible monster a lot of people make it out to be. He's a pretty quick-talking lecturer, and he's very enthusiastic. He curves the tests, so B's are generally A's. I read the text, took notes, made sure to study, and got an A.
One of the most brilliant professors ever in Pepperdine. You really learn a lot. Read the book, go to his lectures and you will be fine. A is totally attainable if you calm down and study.
He's very hard to follow in class, not willing to help you understand advanced concepts, and fails most of the class on any given exam.

Galles is a brilliant guy. I went to class, read, and listened to lectures, but never took notes. Had B's on all the tests, somehow got an A on the final. His brain is working at a million miles an hour and has a hard time bringing macro down to his students level. Read the book over and over until you understand it- you will learn it. Its doable.
His lectures are very confusing and hard to follow.  His tests are extremely hard.
Repeats the same class every day.  I have taken econ before in highschool and still am having a difficult time.

Very tough teacher.  Doesn't assign any written homework except a ton of reading.  Will give you examples and answers your questions. Sort of crazy and disorganized.  Grades your test right when you turn it in.

For business professor, indeed has tough tests. However, big curve and you learn a lot! If you can focus and take notes in class, he refers to all the hard kinds of questions that end up being on the tests. You know exactly what to expect if you work and attend class. People complain cuz you actually have to be sharp to get the A or B, unlike most.

The subject is hard. The teacher requires a lot. However, if you really listen and try to understand what you read in the book, you will be fine. To take Galles is good for those who want to learn subject. if you don't, do not take the class.

His tests were very hard for a GE because he stresses application like its an upperlevel course. Not a good professor for people who are not interested in a future in economics. His tests force you to apply the material rather than just memorize the material. I learned a lot and remember it after the class. Great class for econ majors to take
well, majority possesses the truth. study hard and do not even doubt any question. follow him then you may succeed

Do not take him unless you have to.  His tests are hard, and he will admit that to you.  If you read his lectures don't sound like they are in Zwahili, but more like French.  Seriously he can be difficult to follow, but he knows his stuff.  His tests are on application, not memorization.

his class notes are boring and he rambles a lot. he considers himself the "gatekeeper" of the econ department and tries to weed out "weaklings". he also loves to hear himself think/talk, distributed tons of handouts of articles he's written in local papers - who cares?! just TEACH

This guy really doesn't care. he is right and he knows it.  he actually told me not to come to class if it wasn't helping. good because you really don't have to attend and he doesn't care but bad because honestly going to the class won't help you. you either get it or you don't. easy to get a C hard to get anything else. good luck.
Leanred a whole lot!!!! Not very clear, so read before class, so you can follow along during his lecture!!! He is by far the best econ teacher. I definitely love this guy!!!

As an Econ major, I feel that this is the worst professor in our department, let alone the whole school.  I don't often dislike professors to this degree, but he truly does not care about his students.  I did not learn anything from him.  Avoid him at all costs.
Hard teacher who will not reward with a high grade for your effort. However, you will learn more in his class than all other econ classes combined.
learned more about econ in his class than in all other econ classes combined...unfortunately my grade didn't show as he is a very tough grader...

He is terrible.  Going to class made me even more confused.  Avoid him if you can.  He tells you that he makes his tests so hard to make people fail.  I study my ass of and with the curve get c's and I am an A student. MADE ME HATE ECON. FOREVER!

Galles is a great Prof for Econ majors and minors. I'm an econ major and a 'B' student that doesn't try too hard.  I went to class, paid attention, studied for 15 minutes twice a week, and got an 'A-'.

Take this class if you want to learn a ton from one of the smartest profs at Pepperdine. Avoid it if you're lazy, don't like taking notes and/or don't attend class. This class is for those who enjoy learning and want to get to know their profs. His tests are hard, but they have a huge curve. They are manageable if you put in the effort.
Really Hard, really unclear, a B is difficult

Ignore other comments. He is knowledgeable, smart, has interesting lectures, and a great teacher. Nice guy,was always availible for help. Tests CAN be challenging, but BIG CURVE! DO come to class, READ text, take notes, study handouts and workbook and it'll help prepare you for exams. NOT impossible

WORST CLASS I'VE EVER TAKEN. I used to like econ but I dreaded each class. I even went to class, read the book and still didn't understand his tests. Hes a smart guy, and he loves it that nobody can understand him. I would ask for help but he'd just go around my question. Makes econ way too hard.

Hes a nice guy and really knows his stuff. His tests are impossible though. I started laughing half way through the exam because it was full of things I had never seen. You have to go to every class and dedicate so much time that it is really not worth it

Sure he's a tough freekin' teacher and has the most coarse personality ever.  But underneath it all he's suprisingly intelligent and can teach you alot.  Lose the intimidation factor.  Take good notes, read the text & study the handouts.  He grades on a big curve!  You work hard & learn a lot here!!

Dont take this course. he likes to confuse students and give out confusing tests to make sure we know we're dumb and he's smart. One time, i approached him out of class and he refused to help me because i didn't attend all of his boring lectures. i would have, if the lecture was good.

Look at the other comments, don't take this class, and if you do, i highly reccomend having taken Micro or at least econ 200, you will do horribly if you have no previous econ experience.  Only good thing is hes always available for help, but its too confusing to begin with.

Whether you go to class or not, you're still going to do horribly on his tests.  One of the worst teachers I've ever had.  Listen to everybody else, you're better off guessing on his tests and sleeping in on days you have class.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!! Trust me, take it in summer school, or take another prof.  Galles is terrible.  I am a straight A student, but no longer after taking his class.  Spare yourself the agony of two hours with this man.
Libertarian...need I say more? What an aweful class.
Wow, there goes my 4.0, just barely managed a C in his course.  He is terrible, good luck trying to sit through his overly verbose classes.

did better on tests when I didn't go to class.  Went to class and got confused.  He tries to help but talks in circles.  Good guy just not a great teacher, also he takes pride that no one has ever scored perfectly on any of his tests
Dont even bother with going to class, there is no point he will only confuse you.  Read the text and hope you can decode his multiple guess exams
He IS Bounderby from Dickens's Hard Times. A pompous character, with little or no ability to convey material through lecturing... an important trait for a professor who doesn't use the book.
he sucks
There is absolutely no correlation between working hard and attending class and doing well in Galles' class. It's all luck. Give up now.

I have never had such a bad teacher/professor in all my years of schooling. Galles is so full of himself and doesn't belong at Pepperdine. He writes the problems on his test in a way to trick you and gets a kick out of it. AVOID HIM!
Terrible.  All he does is yell/lecture straight through the whole class...avoid if you can!
The more I go to class, the more confused I get. Sleep an extra hour, read over the stuff sometime, and hope you can guess well.
zzzzzzzzz.
No Comments
