His exam-40 mult. choice questions that are confusing/tricky. The test is a packet, SEVERAL pages long. If you're susceptible to anxiety attacks dont take the class, or at least, dont take the tests. However, an A on the final gets you an A in the class.
No Comments

Worst professor I've had so far at Pepperdine. Nothing good about his class. He's very hard. He loves to add trick questions on his tests. I consider myself to be knowledgeable in macroeconomics, and I suffered in his class.

Tell's the same story two times in the same class period and multiple times throughout the semester.  He never explains what he writes on the board unless someones asks.  Extremely confusing and difficult course.  Not recommended.

Whenever a student asks a question, he never lets them finish because he thinks he knows what they're going to ask -- but he's wrong half the time.  You'll get the same grade in the class whether you go or not.
He must be using a different book than his students -loves listening to himself
HARD! Attend class and he's survivable.
No Comments

hes a cool guy, but please go to class. the material is easy, but the test is lecture heavy. he drops a midterm, but the final sneaks up on u its way different from the midterms. i failed the final, but did A-s on the midterms, but everyone failed the final so bad he dropped the final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Perrin's tests are literally written in old English, super subjective and insane(he always give u questions that being randomly mentioned in class and they're impossible to be covered by study guide), but his lectures are hilarious though.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Even though attendance was not mandatory, Professor Perrin made me want to come to class every week because he was so engaging and his lectures were fascinating. He is a bit scatterbrained and unprepared at times, but his lectures made up for it. Super funny guy. Would definitely take again!

Perrin is pretty disorganized and goes off topic a lot.  He will test you on his opinions on topics and random things he says in class.  I didn't learn that much and the material and stats he gives feel outdated.  I took this class in Elkins and would recommend taking it in a smaller class if possible.  The only positive is that he curves tests.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Perrin is a hilarious guy and his class is funny and sometimes enjoyable, but his test are absolutely insane. Don't even bother reading the study guide because it wont matter. He is very opinionated and the questions on his test dramatically exemplify that. My advice is to write down every single word you hear because you will get quizzed on it.

Bro's tests are actually written in old english. I don't know how you can get a good grade without guessing. This is enough to give him a 1 because his entire class is made up of 4 tests. Despite all of his lectures which are good, and the fact that he's pretty funny, all that goes to the wayside when you have tests that make no sense whatsoever.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The thing about this class is that not everyone has a grip on sociology, and it can be hard for some students to learn. If you have the brain for it, you will do fine. Go to class because he will say random things and show videos that he will ask about on exams. Put effort into the inquiries because they will boost your grade! I enjoyed the class.

Perrin is an acquired taste, but you can't say he's not passionate about sociology. Deviance is a good class that covers a wide range of topics and Perrin always makes it interesting. I really recommend him for UPPER DIVISON classes. My advice for any Perrin class: be assertive. He respects people who call him out and have strong opinions.

He is a nice guy and funny. His lectures are amusing, but a little far out there. However, is study guides have nothing to do with the test. His tests are HIS opinion questions. His tests can be about the most random thing he mentioned from class. His lectures make people's jaws drop in shock. Good luck.

Flaky and disorganized. Actually sent out an article that would be included as course content on the final exam the NIGHT BEFORE SAID FINAL EXAM. The content of the course isnt challenging, but he does his level best to make up for that.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: So easy. All I did to study was complete the study guide he gives the night before and I got an A on every test. He has random specific questions about the readings and stuff he said in class on the tests, but the readings are pretty interesting for the most part. Grades very easily on inquiry papers which can boost your grade 1/3 of a letter.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Hes a decent professor. You can tell he cares, although sometimes the lectures can be a bit-off putting. He tries to be funny. Pretty down to earth. I dont read the textbook, but I do read the extra readings. The textbook and the lecture overlap, but the readings are important for the test. Decently easy exams with participation and reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Robin Perrin seems like a good guy and his lectures are interesting. The concepts are not too difficult to understand and he makes himself available if you need more help. The only thing is though is that you will be tested on his opinion. He is obviously very liberal and that's fine, but it shows in his teaching when it doesn't have to.

Youll find his class to be tedious and draining. Lectures can feel like an eternity, and are punctuated by flaccid attempts at humor that leave the class palpably unimpressed. Occasionally, Perrins dry humor will result in slight audience discomfort. Poorly written test questions are something to watch for; study reading assignments with care.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Get ready to read

comment: Perrin's class is all based on four tests and two inquiry entries. You do not have to attend each and every lecture to get a good grade however it does certainly help. His study guides are not extremely helpful so I rely on quizlets. Overall the class is difficult but not impossible if you put work into it. His tests do have opinions questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I memorizes each study guide word for word and barely passed the exams. They're based solely on his lectures, which are unstructured, scattered, and always biased. There's no use in learning sociology, just memorize his opinion. If you're not a good test taker - like me - don't take this class.

One word to describe Perrin's class would be controversial. Every lecture there seems to be a joke or thing that makes you uneasy. His tests are very opinionated. You will feel obligated to attend the lectures for the extra credit he gives, but the lectures teach you nothing. Horrible tests and lectures. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO NOT TAKE.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: One of the worst professors I've taken. All of his tests were so unbelievably subjective. Get ready to memorize his opinion. He does not care about outstanding circumstances. He has no mercy. He's insensitive and not very personable. His class was very unorganized and chaotic. I would not recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Three tests are super random. If you want to get high grade, you must remember everything he said. I would not recommend

Three exams decide everything. He is the worst professor I have ever met. Don't do his study guide because not even one questions are on it. Remember every sentences he said in the lecture and class, because his tests questions are based on it. Please be a kind person! If you treat others well, other people will do the same thing to you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Extremely boring lectures and talks very slowly. Assigns a lot of reading (textbook and pdf readings) and 3 tests which consist of very detailed questions. There are 4 inquiry papers that aren't that bad. Made sociology a boring subject, my hardest class, and not enjoyable at all.

One of the worst professors I've taken. All of his tests were so unbelievably subjective. Get ready to memorize his opinion. He does not care about outstanding circumstances. He has no mercy. He's insensitive and not very personable. His class was very unorganized and chaotic. I would not recommend. Literally any other professor would be better.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Perrin is awesome! Literally the reason I am now double majoring! He keeps class interesting and will give you perspective. He is also very caring and kind, truly wants you to succeed. The class is not to hard as long as you keep up with the reading and go to class!

Dr. Perrin is genuine and hilarious. He makes his classes fun and very interesting. He is a tough grader, so you have to make sure you know the info... Definitely worth taking a class from him. He is amazing!
Super funny, sends slides to you so you don't have to go to class and you can study at home. Tests are fine, some questions are worded very strangely and are the majority of your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Perrin is legitimately the best. Hes hilarious and very engaging and makes Sociology easy. Just pay attention in class and youll do fine.

Perrin is what you would expect of a college professor. He is funny and nice, and tries his best to keep class interesting. I go to class but you honestly don't have to. The tests are fair but some questions are oddly specific and hard to study for. I took him for Soc 200 and it's just a basic college class.

Perrin is hilarious and does a good job keeping the class interesting. Although he treats the class like we are all high school kids, I can't complain. Would recommend if you have to take soc200. Tip, don't miss class. He'll have random questions on the test you can only know if you listened to his lectures
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: Elkins class, so participation isn't required, but if you miss 1 class, you have missed a lot. About 40 percent of his exam is based on an account from class or his opinion. A really awesome and caring man. Your entire grade will be based on 3 exams. 4 social inquiries are required that just bump you up/down 1/3 of a letter grade (ex: C+ to a B-)

Perrin is very forward thinking. You'll learn a lot of valuable things when you take this course, but this can be overshadowed by the fact that his tests are very unorthodox. You have to constantly be paying attention b/c on every test, a good amount of the questions will ask what he SAID about a certain topic. Lots of reading. Grade is 3 tests.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Perrin is a funny guy, he's a great person but his tests are minimal and very specific. There are often things on the study guide that don't come up in test, but specific questions in the test that weren't on the study guide and you cannot guess... Although I like him, my aim towards the end of the class was to just pass...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mr. Perrin is an amazing teacher! He has such a funny personality and makes his lectures very interesting. As long as you attend the lectures and pay attention, you will do well in the class. Also fill out the study guides that he provides, they are very helpful!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I love Perrin. Such a great teacher. Just make sure you do the readings every week. Also do the study guides, it practically has all the questions that are gonna be on the test!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many--Amazing lectures

comment: Literally the worst prof ever. Your grade is only based off of three tests and the tests are super random. The tests aren't even based off of the study guide and he literally makes the tests the night before. 10/10 would not recommend. Please don't make the same mistake I did!!!!
Our entire grade is 3 tests. Lectures are word for word off the power point, and he doesn't take attendance. Pretty chill for a required class I guess.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: His lectures are useless he just reads them off, then the tests are all on the book. Questions from the book aren't on important material. Has got to be the worst professor I've ever had! He doesn't deserve to be called a "teacher" because you won't learn anything.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Perrin is a really good professor that is very caring of his students. His exams can be a bit random at times (ie. asks for quotes and statistics); however, the class overall is not extremely difficult and an A is easily attainable if you read all his assigned readings and take notes during lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Perrin is a great professor! Cares about students, tries to make lectures entertaining by cracking jokes and telling stories, and tries to make students aware of why social issues matter. He's a tough grader and his tests are super detailed--take detailed notes on his personal stories too--he tends to test on those as well!

Dr. Perrin is probably my favorite professor! He cares about his students tremendously and knows most of his students names, even in the lecture classes. I forgot to turn  in my inquiries on time for the first set, and he accepted them, graded them himself, and gave me full credit. He's hilarious in class, but take notes on everything he says.

Perrin is a very interesting professor. I learned a lot in his class. Grade  2 midterms + Final + 4 Inquiries. Remember to read the textbook and all of those PDF reading. Also, show up in class. A lot of test questions are based on classes. He will even ask very very detailed things in class. Trust me, remember every single word he says.

Prof. Perrin is hilarious! I enjoy his lectures even if I don't necessarily enjoy the content always. Make sure and study for tests or else you will not pass. Showing up isn't mandatory but it can get you extra points on the exams!

For a large Elkins class, Perrin did a good job lecturing and keeping my attention. You only have 3 tests to determine your grade - if you read the textbook and takes notes in his class, you'll be fine for his exams. Not easy, but recommended!

Perrin is a very nice person and is clear with his lectures, but his tests use a lot of random facts from the text just to make sure that you read. Frustrating that going to class and reading once isn't enough- memorize the stats!

Dr. Perrin is a sarcastic and entertaining person, but he's not the best professor. He puts far too much detail on the PowerPoints (but sends them to you beforehand) and lectures by summarizing what's already written on them. Tests are an odd blend of common sense and unreasonably specific details. He's cool as a person though.

Dr. Perrin is a sarcastic and witty professor. He is very passionate about sociology and loves teaching. Go to class because he will give hints and questions he'll give on the test as an incentive to those who go to class every day. His tests are pretty challenging but as long as you study the day before you'll be fine
Awesome guy. Got a 100% on the first test and then didnt read the book for the second one but still pulled off a 95. Pay attention in class and study his powerpoints and you will be fine

I read every single chapter & studied the study guides he gave us very thoroughly, & yet I ended up with a C- in this class. I really did try. His test questions are just SUPER specific & you do have to go to class because he asks questions about random stuff to give students that go to class a higher grade. I love Perrin as a person though.

Dr. Perrin teaches statistics as if you already know it and can be very condescending, even in his office hours. He is not a good teacher at all- not methodical or organized in his teaching style. You must buy the textbook for this class in order to do the homework, but you do not have to show up (unless you're not OK with missing quiz points).

One of the best teachers at Pepperdine. Go visit him during office hours. He not only helps you with the material, he tells you tons on interesting stuff. One of the first professors I feel like is my friend here. Makes stats easy and funny. Oh, and he will make fun of you.

Does not prepare for class. Simply reads the power points and rephrases what is written on the slides. Sends power points to you before classes so I don't see much reason to go to class besides the videos that he shows that he uses during lectures and uses for multiple choice questions. My least favorite class at Pepperdine.

This guy is amazing! Super cool dude and I ABSOLUTELY recommend his class..his tests are difficult but they come as no surprise..so study for sure! Textbook really important, so read it! But cool, funny, interesting class.

I had Dr. Perrin for his SOC 250 (stats) class as well and all I can say is he is one of the best professors on campus. He is clear, concise, and fair. Nothing on his tests comes as a surprise, and he is always available outside of class for help. Take him for Soc200 if you get the chance, you won't regret it.

Perrin was by far my easiest class, but there's only 3 tests that mean a lot. He curves the grades. If you do the reading and go to class you'll be fine...I recommend taking notes by hand. Perrin's funny and interesting, and the kind of guy you wanna get to know. But some people thought he was hard... I say he's an easy A and you learn a ton

Perrin made stats a bearable course for me, which is saying a lot for a history major. He keeps class lively and entertaining while still guiding us through the material. It certainly isn't the easiest course on campus, but if you want to/need to take stats, Perrin is your man
he's not clear at all. makes an easy class such as sociology hard as Hell. many students i know feel the same way about him.

I really learned a lot from Perrin's class. His expectations are highly reasonable and the lectures are interesting and engaging. He includes lots of videos and polls in his slide-shows, and he sends you the powerpoint presentations prior to class.

He is very interesting. You watch a lot of videos during his lectures, they are pretty funny and interesting and they relate to class. He can be very funny. As for his tests, I always studied the night before with friends, notecards made from the book, and his power points and I did fine. Overall, he is pretty good and interesting.

Take this class if you want to work your ass off. His tests are some of the hardest I have taken in any Stats class. Although he is extremely helpful outside of class, his lectures always end up not following the book and he does not interpret it well. Take Cail instead, where you actually learn the material by just doing 10 somewhat easy quizzes.

Dr. Perrin is an all star! His class is really great, and he knows how to turn a math requirement into an engaging class where you think about the role of statistics in society and really strengthen your analytical skills. He is funny, intelligent, and wonderfully energetic in class---you don't know that stats can be a joy until taking his class.
Perrin's exams are reasonable if you've completely the chapter readings. He adds questions in reference to his lectures so attend class! Great professor, tough exams.

I had Dr. Perrin last year, and it was great. It's easy as long as you read and attend pretty regularly. His powerpoints are straightforward, and all the test questions basically come out of there and the book. It seems like he understands that it's a GE and teaches accordingly. He's pretty funny and makes class interesting.

Dr. Perrin is great!  Very funny and really tries to get to know students by joking around with them.  His lectures are really clear and makes a hard subject like STATS seem easier.  Tests can be tricky but good studying will make them ok. Is always availible for questions and tries to tie everything to real world applications.  Great Prof!

The only time people do poorly in this class is when they fail to do one of three things: show up to class, read the book, take notes he doesnt have in the power point. It really is easy if you just put in the work.

Prof. Perrin is amazing! His tests are easy and come right out of the book and lectures. The only assignments are 4 - 2 page papers about sociological principles. He is funny and makes sure class isn't boring. Also the final isn't cumulative!
He was pretty funny, and the class is pretty easy as long as you show up.  the chapters are loooonnnggg but not too bad.  just make sure you show up! it's in elkins so it's tempting not to..

A nice guy, always tells funny/interesting stories. Shows a lot of clips, reads Dr Suess in class. Overall an intersting class. Tests arent bad if you read the text, and the papers he gives gives you a chance to bring up your grade. Dont have to take notes, but if you miss class and the movieclips, will miss questions on test.
I liked him as a teacher but he formed inappropriate relationships with students! He needs to mind the line!

He is a great guy and a great teacher.  He's very knowledgeable about the subject and knows how to make it fun.  He uses creative examples like Dr. Seuss! He doesn't take roll because it's such a big class.  If you listen to the lectures and don't read the book you will pull a high C or low B.
Funny guy, really approachable, very hard test though.

What a ridiculous little man. Willing to meet you before class but never really willing to help you all the way. Felt like he thought I deserved a grade and made sure I got it. Stench for a sense of humor. Decent handwriting. Wished he was cooler when he was our age. Jealous of athletes and cool people in general.
He was interesting and willing to help students outside of class.

the hardest class i've ever taken in my life, but i went in at least twice a week for help and he really took as much time as i needed to help me. he can be intense because he's so smart and loves the subject, but he's really cool.
No Comments
Class is fun, he's a great guy, brilliant and an awesome sense of humor. He has a huge heart and compassionate spirit. You'll learn a lot from class and leave a better person.
UGH! This class was awful! He is so unclear and gives random quizzes which are impossible. This is math for poli sci majors, man. Help us out here!

Heard horror stories before taking the class, but they're unfounded. A really good teacher, presents Stats as puzzle to make it more interesting. Definitely a theoretical math class, you need to understand what's really going on, not just where to plug in stuff. Read the book, pay attention, get A.
Take this guy...he has such an interesting take on things.  What a witty guy. Not a terribly easy class but wont be murder.  I'll never forget how he accompanied his lectures with Dr. Suess books...

Wonderful guy!  Makes class brilliantly interesting.  He cares about his students and goes out of his way to be there for them (like the night before an exam or to look over exams).  Interesting topics.  Tests aren't too bad if you read, go to class, and take good notes.  Highly recommended!

Super cool guy, very nice and helpful, cares about his students, makes class interesting.  However, do read your text and you should be OK 'cuz tests are multiple choice (objective) and can be kind of tough if you don't know your stuff.  Super great guy!
Very nice guy, extremely funny. Highly reccommend this to fulfill a GE, especially if you are looking for an easy A and an interesting topic.
he makes class interesting
Perrin is such a great teacher. Stats is hard in itself, but he helps so much understand it. If you work hard and keep up you will be fine.

Really hard class, but what an awesome teacher to take it with. Perrin is the coolest teacher I've ever had. I wish more teachers could be like him -- a) I learn b) I have fun c) I respect him. Definately worth the ridiculous cost of tuition.
Stats is just hard, but he is a great teacher and an awesome guy.  If you work hard you will be okay and you will have a worth while time doing it.
This guy is the bomb.  He kind of looks like an oldster ****.  Not an easy course but very interesting.  Work hard and you'll get an A.  Not too bad on attendance.
SUPER COOL PROFESSOR!
Probability taught by using Vegas games as examples = FUN.
No Comments
Overall, awesome guy. He's has a smart sense of humor and talks about interesting topics. He has been a great mentor. A guy you can count on for help.
He's better then any other teacher I have taken, and also he's a friend to the faculty kids.
No Comments

Challenging class, but if you care about learning Hebrew, prof. Heard makes it a really rewarding experience. No tests or quizzes, just pure participation, so try your best and show up to class and you'll get a good grade.

PLEASE DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. He's a nice guy but a HORRIBLE teacher. I could not tell you a single thing he taught me, essentially the entire class taught themselves through the 2-a-week online quizzes we had to take. He also had us play these long non sensical games that were a waste of time. For your sake, don't take the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Absolutely ridiculously disorganized class. He said he wanted to switch things up this semester and it turns out his grading system was super flawed and too complicated to understand. No idea how I ended up with the grade I got because his system was so confusing. Avoid at all costs
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: A pretty good guy but I just did not like how the goes about his class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Heard is extremely organized and I have learned a lot in his class. The reading and the tests are not easy but hes a negotiable professor. He curve grades in a deliberate manner and he gave extra credit if you strive toward it. I would not regret taking his class overall. Plus, hes the most funny and caring professor ever.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Heard changes his class structure regularly so you never know what you'll get, but luckily my class was pretty easy.. and strange. Religious role playing where all grades came from in character papers and reflection essays. A LOT of writing and no quizzes for me, but an all around easy class. He's also very willing to help if you go to office hours
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Tbh I would definitely avoid Heard for 101. His class is so unnecessary. His lectures aren't great and there is so much assigned reading. The whole class is pretty much online, so its honestly all about working the system.

Okay so this class is dumb and called "World of Biblecraft" ?All of the quizzes (i.e. harvest runs) are online and you can take them an unlimited amount of times. Make sure you get 100s on every quiz and save all the answers in a google doc to study for the tests because they are the same. Learn the system!!

Let me just tell you, this professor is ridiculous! This class was probably my hardest class of the semester. I don't understand why he makes the tests and and quizzes so difficult. PLEASE AVOID! I am not kidding, this is my first C and I worked hard for it. TRUST ME DO NOT TAKE. You would think religion would be easy since its a ge, but no way!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Easiest class ever if you just figure out his system. It's all online and you can always get 100% on the quizzes because you can take them an unlimited amount of times. There are SO many opportunities for points that even if you get C's on all your tests, you can still get an A in the class. That's what happened to me.

Extremely difficult course. Says that about 100 minutes of reading required per class session, in reality about 6 hours. He expects you to know a lot about the Bible, even though this is an introductory course. This is the first semester he has changed the layout of his course, and it is extremely unfair. Take a different professor.

Everything including homework, tests, and in class assignments, are ALL online. It was the easiest A I have ever gotten. You don't have to read. The homework are quizzes that you can take an endless amount of times and you just make a Word document of the answers and you're fine. The tests are just the quiz question plus some writing.

Heard is a good teacher and his lectures are actually usually pretty interesting, but I hate the way his class is set up. He assigns way more reading than is necessary to answer the homework questions and it is exhausting to complete. I also wish he would give a later deadline for the homework, like midnight instead of 8pm the night before class.

Love this professor! Such a fun guy! He always has loud music playing at the start of class and has an anagram for the class to solve every time. Classwork + all tests/exams are online! Cons are that he's not always too clear on his instructions and homework can be a bit lengthy + require lots of reading... but its usually pretty interesting!

Dr. Heard really knows his stuff, but he tends to get too theological and that can bore students (since it's a GE and not everyone is there by choice). He isn't a hard A thats for sure, but you got to work!! He never gives in class tests (BEST PART), but you're expected to give tests every couple days via courses Pepperdine. Take him!
Everything is online, assignments every class -- very annoying. His "battles" or tests get harder throughout the semester, plus his grading is messed up so you need at least a 97 to get an A.

The tests and assignments are all done online on Courses.  The questions are super specific.  I suggest that you do the assignments and assessments as soon as they are assigned so that you don't forget to do them.

Dr. Heard structures his class uniquely, like a video game, and it is that uniqueness that will make or break the class for most people. For me, it was an intuitive and stress-free approach, but it's gimmicky so it could annoy people too. The class is really easy though so there isn't much to complain about even if you object to its structure.

Dr. Chris is a great guy. He is personable and friendly. He is passionate about what he is teaching, but can lose some students during lectures. He offers interesting insight, but is spacey and disorganized. SO. MUCH. HOMEWORK. be prepared to work

Dr. Heard is a really nice man and is passionate about his subject. If you do your work outside of class, it is easy to get an "A." There are no in class tests or quizzes. Do not listen to the negative comments; He is a good teacher.

his class is mean to be for theology or religion majors. It is not like usual introductory religion courses, his questions are mean to see different perspectives, reasoning behind the texts, and the literature of the biblical texts. It is not like regular other introduction to old testament classes. He is the wrong teacher for the class.

Great prof! Really easy to get an A if you show up to class! Weekend exercises were a little hard, but most of your grade is attendance and preparation guides which are free points. Heard is really funny and actually cares about his students plus I learned a lot without putting in that much effort.

Really nice guy with a great sense of humor. Is there for help if you need him. If you aren't doing well at first (like I was), make sure you go and ask him how you can improve, otherwise you'll be screwed, as some of the assignments can be confusing. Otherwise, just pay attention to the lectures and take notes; you'll love him!
Grading system made it impossible to track your progress. Lectures are impossible to follow & boring. Not a strong professor. I switched to Carr and I got an A. Carr is amazing.

Has a really good sense of humor and is a really nice guy. His lectures can be somewhat hard to follow and I wish he had clearer powerpoints that he posted on Courses. However I found out that you can use his youtube channel and get quality lectures from there. It sort of makes me wonder why he doesn't use those lectures in class.

I started class thinking the video game grading system was awesome. There is a reason it is unique to Heard: it doesn't work. I never knew what grade I had in the class. I failed the online assessments often because I've never gone to Bible School. Tests not related to lectures. If you just want to pass Rel 101 with a C and facebook, take him.

heard is out of control, a horrific teacher, tests don't reflect lectures, he should be working at SNL or teaching kindergarteners to play dress-up or something, not teaching Religion, because all he wants to see is his students doing skits and other bogus stuff. AVOID.

I have not taken religion before this and I feel its a disadvantage to take this class without much knowledge. He assigns a quiz after every class and I have got 0 out of 250 in four of quizzes although I have paid attention in class. Although I've lost interest in his class, he seems to be inconsistent with what he expects from students.

I had no clue about religion before i came into this class but i learned a lot in this class. His explanations and  lectures are accurate and specific, but when you take online tests after lectures, his lectures are useless to answering those questions and many people receive a zero on those tests.

Robert "Chris" Heard is a pathetic excuse for a religion teacher. It's classes like his that make people who don't want to take religion hate it even more. His class is joke, he doesn't prepare you at all for his tests, and his humor is embarassing. He needs to re-think his career.

This guy is a kook, he plays theme songs before his classes, and he thinks he's the man. He trys to be funny but in reality it's quite the opposite. His grading style is extremely intense, and the way he teaches in class doesn't prepare you for the way he grades at all. He's extremely annoying and uninteresting, so I would avoid him if you can.

Very nice family orientated man. I don't thnnk he necessarily belongs in teaching though. His priortiies are else where. His teachings style is like none other teacher ever! His class is all online. Which can be good/distracting and bad. He grades super hard and his grading system is insanely dumb. Don't take him if you want to learn!

I dreaded taking REL101 because ive never touched a bible in my life let alone actually read it. Heard makes awesome powerpoints and is super helpful in and out of class. I dont think attendance is mandatory but his tests are based on lecture, so go! hes a really cool guy (though sometimes kind of awkward..)

You have 40 points for the entire semester. 10 for the final, 10 for attendance/participation and 20 for two activities of your choice. No homework other than watching a few videos, no major papers, watched videos, and had major interaction with the class and teacher through activities. Easiest college class I've taken yet and incredibly fun.

chris to teach rel 101 differently this year, with projects instead of tests. class pretty easy. homework is important to do to be able to follow along the next day. he does a lot of activities during class. sometimes, i felt like i hadn't learned much, but then helped my friends study for their r101 class, and i feel like i learned what they did.
Bright as a sunlamp; cool as an LED.

Heard is the man!  He takes class participation, so make sure you're in class on time...and have your "clicker" with you as well.  Do well on his online quizzes (which are hw) and do the test outlines and you'll do fine.
He is never in class and he is way to smart. He teached me in Faith and Reason and Religion 101. He sucked in both by degrading his students thoughts and concepts.
This is a pretty fair class, not to hard, but you still have to try. There is no text book and everything is online. He makes really good powerpoint presentations and is a nice guy.
not really a hard class, the daily quizzes are actually harder than the tests.  he tells you exactly what to study for, adn you may not have to take the final.  i recommend him.

Must've done something to improve since the previous comments. Class isn't too hard. Homework before every class are preps on BB that take 1 to 2 hrs. Very enthusiastic in class, but actually shy and awkward outside of it. Class is a little boring, Tests are reasonable and if you ace all the quizzes on the preps, you don't have to take the final.

Dr. Heard is a true Biblical scholar. He is one of the most intelligent teachers I have ever met. I like that he teaches his class like a history class. He rarely interjects his own point of view, or even a Christian point of view. The hours of work he dedicates to preparing for class is astounding. He wants everyone to do well in his class.
Heard is very precise and methodical in his teaching. He is not too hard, but you will learn the information. I am going to take him again soon for an upper division class.

He is a great teacher. No text books.  Homework every night with readings and short quizzes on blackboard but if you do well on them you won't even have to take the final.  He is fun and upbeat. Lectures aren't any less boring than any other class. I'd say they're actually interesting.
dont take this guy!!!  he is a joke.  he thinks hes funny but hes not.  his lectures are so boring.  try to avoid him if you can and take willis

People who don't like him are just extremely lazy. He is SO helpful and clear and has an adorable personality. He is a bit demanding but really not that hard if you study. Yeah I said study. In college. Imagine that.

I've taken religion courses my entire life.  The first tests were super easy for me, but the final was impossible.  Oh, and I didn't realize that the final was HALF of my grade.  Keep that in mind.  And also, I should've done the extra credit, even though I had almost 100% before the final.  I've never had a religion teacher quite like him.
great study guides, easy tests as long as you study. posts powerpoint presentations online. does everything he can to make sure you do well if you try

If you know the OT before the class you should be fine. If not FORGET ABOUT IT. Makes himself available for his students. Seems to really care. Need to study hard for test. For Test three you can not wait till the night before. I recommend him, but just be prepared to go to work.

Dr. Heard is the MAN! He's very enthusiastic and will often come dressed as biblical characters for fun. All his tests give a free 10% so there is no reason, unless you dont give a F*($ about the class to get less than a B on the exams. *This doesn't mean you dont have to study!* Have fun!

You're not going to slide by, but with a little effort you really can get an A in this class. Heard is so helpful and so enthusiastic, a little too much, but he really likes teaching. If you are unclear about the subject matter going in, take Heard, cause he is so clear.

Dr. Heard is great.  Trust me, his tests are not that hard.  I know a lot of people that consistently got over a hundred on them.  Class is very interesting and Dr. Heard is very enthusiastic about the subject.  I definitely reccommend this prof!
Awesome class! Just study the night before and you'll be fine on the test.

His tests are really tough, but he makes class interesting and tries to keep lectures short... The amount of reading can sometimes get a lil rediculous, but you can usually get by with skimming for hw assignments, but you'll have to really study for the tests

he is the thoughest professor in religion i have ever seen. Avoid taking this class if you are not christian or have not studied the old testament previously to this class. The shear volume of stuff he tries to fit into this course is mindblowing. Avoid, avoid, avoid!

Put the time and dedication to learn the material and you'll be fine. STUDY GROUPS HELP A LOT! At times the class is boring but c'mon, it's the Old Testament, that's not his fault! Very nice, always available and very helpful.

True, he is a hard teacher, but he has clear expectations. All you have to do is a bit more studying than most other classes to get an A. He is VERY helpful and always available, and likes his students. He is goofy and funny and so very very cute...

Yeah, that's great that he likes his work and all, but the man is impossible! He goes by that stupid rule that you should have I three hours of homework for every hour, and trust me, he does fill that up! I am in his class now and I have officially decided to finish religion in summer school!

Dr. Heard does his job well.  It is by no means an easy class, but if you genuinely try and learn the material, you'll be rewarded.  I didn't do super well in the class, but I got what I deserved.  He'll teach you religion well, plus he has a great passion for his work.

he puts soooooo much effort into his work, its amazing and inspiring.He genuinaly cares about his studetns. HOWEVER ...the class is very difficult and requries a lot of work and time. ALOT. WARNING: IF NOT A RELGION MAJOR, SEEK ANOTHER PROFESSOR.
the hardest professor i have ever had and he gives so much work it is rdiculous don't take him, please!!

The classes itself are interesting, and he obviously loves his subjects matter. But the tests are impossible (esp. #3). On average, I put 10+ hours into studying for each exam and I still didn't get the grades I want. My 500 level classes are way easier than this one. I

He is rediculous, his study guides for tests are on the wrong material he grades obscenely hard, and hes just simply not a good teacher. He is also not very responsive to students when asking for help, overall the worst teacher I have ever had.

This class is toooo hard! Alot of preperation is needed. Although he is extremly helpful and organized, you still need to study a looot to get a decent/good grade. Unless you've been to sunday school, dont take his class.too diffiicult!
he is so sweet and enthusiastic plus he is pretty darn good looking

this guy puts soooo much effort into his work,it's obvious that he genuinely cares for his students. he has such a passion for what he does and it's really inspriring. as for the tests - well they keep us up to scratch for the exams hello!

Me and three other students had to go to the department chair about Chris Heard. His class made my life a living hell. He can't teach and treats us like we're in middle school, then grades the test like we're seeking PH.d's in Religion. Don't take this class, you'll regret it, I promise.

He has too much time--he puts a TON of effort into his preparation guides that are due every day, and into his powerpoint presentations. His class is pretty boring ususally, but it's nice that he's organized. Overall, he's ok but the class itself isnt fun
hard!
descent

I tooke his class Spring 04 and it is still harder than any religion 101 class should be.  I've been taking religion all my life and this guy makes this class needlessly difficult.  The class is do-able but if you want an A take another professor.

anyone who speaks bad about heard just can't cut it in general. it is a tough class, but this is college - he is a goofy guy, but he helps out a ton, and offers so many bonus points that i finished the class over a perfect score. its not that hard at all.

Always willing to help...goes out out of his way for his students more than any professor I have ever had.  He basically gives the test away every time, and I think that when over half of the class has As, there has to be a reason for it.
No Comments
No Comments
I think he is a great Professor! He has really done a good job at trying to make this class fun. Don't be afraid to take his class! It is not that hard if just put some time into it!

Spring semester much better than Fall '03. I got a perfect score on the first exam and I've never taken any religion class before. He has totally redone the tests and curriculum and I think Fall 2004 will be even better b/c he is continuing improvements.

Ok so his first semester here he struggled but the guy realized it and is chaging things around.  His class is alright but how interesting can make the history of Isreal?  He is a very nice guy and cares about you alot.  YOu have to work but it is ok.
No Comments
No Comments
i guess i dont need to write anything because everyone beat me too it. oh well. just read what they wrote and multiply that by 10x.
GOT INSOMNIA?  This class is your cure!  Sleep Guaranteed- you're gonna fail anyway.
No Comments

Example of a test given by Chris Heard: QUESTION #1: Please write word for word the book of Genesis (worth 2500 points, no credit will be given if you miss ANY word) BONUS QUESTION: Please give a detailed description of genealogy from Abraham to Jesus.

Do you like spending 10 hours a night studying for a test only to find out you've failed? Do you like ****graphic Garth Brooks music videos? Do you like wasting your time and precious tuition money? Then take Dr. Heard's Religion 101 class!
Chris Heard should NOT be teaching Religion 101.  Never, ever, under ANY circumstances would I recommend subjecting yourself to his class.  It is a huge waste of time and a great way to fail.

Ok, if you are looking for a bad grade in Religion 101, take Chris Heard. This guy is ridiculous. He is boring and doesnt really care that his students cant memorize the entire old testement in one semester. HIS TEST ARE RIDICULOUS!
No Comments

Unlike a lot of others, I actually really liked Cumming's class. It was very straightforward: show up to class, take detailed lecture notes on his slides, and study those exact notes. I got As on all tests by doing this, it was just a ton of studying. But like I said, really straightforward. I forget if a textbook was required but I didnt use one.
Tests could be very difficult and overall is too hard of a class for just a 3 unit humanities class, should be easier than this. I would avoid and take someone else for sure.
Great prof. Easiest HUM class.

Dr Cumming is incredibly knowledgable and just a really cool guy--much more than his self-deprecating (and hilarious) sense of humor gets across. He also cares deeply about his students; he is always willing to talk if you need help. However, he can read y'all like a book! He knows when you don't pay attention or skip class, so put in the effort.

I think he is one of the best teachers I've had at Pepperdine. He is super chill and makes class fun. He does take attendance and it is lecture heavy but he makes it interesting. There are weekly quizzes and three tests. The tests are not complicated and if you study the slides and go to class, you'll get an A. Take his class!

Dr. Cumming is super nice and passionate about his work. You have to go to class, lectures are VERY content heavy. There are 3 exams that make your grade so study hard. The multiple choice is super easy. Essays are tough. You just have to pay attention which is hard because he eats this stuff up.

Overall amazing. Reading quiz every 2 weeks or so and 3 total exams. Exams are not difficult if you go to class and take notes, they include an essay section. He is super passionate and well spoken, goes slow during lectures to make sure we understand. Uploads slides, responds to emails quickly, he's great. I just hate history lol.
He is a very good professor and very handsome. His class is traditional you show up listen and take notes and that's what's gonna be on the test. I would for sure take him again

Professor Cummings was great for HUM 111. The class isn't difficult if you go to class and write down everything he says. He makes class entertaining and you can tell he wants to help you succeed. Tests aren't too hard if you study well, but there are Quizlets that already exist that help a lot (also for quizzes, which are online).

He's a really great teacher, he's really good at keeping the class engaged and entertained which is pretty hard to do especially in Elkins. It's VERY content heavy but trust me, tests are easy as long as you're there every lecture and writing notes. ngl everyone who struggles with him either falls asleep in his class or ditches.

Cumming grades exceptionally hard on the written assignments and I have to spend countless days studying for his essay-based exams and I still end up doing mediocre on them. I thought taking his class in a smaller class setting would do me justice, but I have performed much worse compared to his HUM 111 class in Elkins.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Cummings stands out as an exceptionally understanding and engaging instructor. His exams align precisely with the content outlined in his study guides. Regular attendance and attentive participation in his classes is all it takes do well. (though this is prob only applicable to his non-Elkins class)

If you pay attention easily and take good notes this class is for you. Very entertaining especially if you're a History Buff. The only difficulty is the exams. Your entire grade fundamentally stands on three exam grades and you have to take good notes and study a week in advance for every exam.

His Hum 111 class is the only GE I've taken that I actually looked forward to attending. He is super lecture heavy so get ready to write notes but the exams are based on everything he says in lecture. If you write everything down and learn your notes, it's an easy A. Dr. Cummings is a really nice guy! Take his class!

Easy to follow lectures and straightforward work. He's very organized so it's easy to stay on top of assignments. Even in a big lecture class he takes the time to know his students individually and shows he really does care. 1000% would take again.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Yes, his class is tedious. But we're in college now, so grow up (with love). His lectures are great. Just take notes, pay attention, and do your work. You'll be fine. He is also a really nice person that will remember your name a year later. And he listens to feedback. Sit in the front. Ask him questions. Love you! Good luck! Xoxo, Gossip Girl
If you're not a confident test taker don't take this class. I have never gotten a grade below a 85 in a class ever, and I made 63 in this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Cumming wasn't as bad as I anticipated. I managed to do well on the quizzes and studied a week in advance for every exam. Follow the study guide, take good notes, and you will be fine! His grading is mainly based on 3 exams, the first two 28% of our grade, and the final was 29%. Attendance is 5% and quizzes are 10%.

Dr. Cumming is very knowledgeable of western heritage, and this was definitely shown in taking him for HUM 111.  He was able to draw a lot of class topics to current happenings.  Enjoyed the class and would take it again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: I really wanted to like this class, but after only a couple of weeks, I knew that it was going to be a lot. I did not do well on the tests despite studying for hours on end. For the last test that we took, I spent 12 hours going through notecards and even had my friend quiz me and I still barely passed. Avoid this class if you can.

Hard to teach a GE in Elkins, but Cumming gets it done. The lectures are a little boring, but just write down whatever's on the slides and you'll be good. Weekly quizzes are done on your own time. There's an essay question at the end, and here's my advice: just write as much as you can remember. You do all this, and it's an easy A.
My best advice to you is to write down everything Cumming says in his lectures & study for his exams 1-2 weeks in advance. If you do so, you will succeed just fine!

I can see why people dont love him because he does have very long, detailed lectures. He likes to talk a lot but I highly recommend taking his summer course to get this GE out of the way. We had 3 exams (with three short essay qs each) and one 1000-1300 word essay.

Cumming has a bad rep for no reason. The tests are fine. He gives you all of the material you need to know in the slides. Just copy and memorize the slides there are no curveballs. The essay is the easiest part. You don't even have to show up just get the notes from someone who does.

All you literally need to do is take good notes during lectures and then memorize them all and you'll get an A in the class. It's hard but not impossible. Take the quizzes with other people cuz they're so ridiculously specific.  He's act a rlly sweet guy and awkwardly funny. Start studying for the exams like 4 days before- sit there and memorize.

Overall, he was not a bad guy just had to teach a very hard course in an awkward location. The tests, while heavy on material, were completely from lecture so they were not impossible if you were willing to put work in. His weekly quizzes, however, were more challenging than the test and were not accurate representations of what we knew.

Course is demanding, not Dr. Cum. 2 quizzes a week, they are useless. Just copy and know the slides for tests and you will do fine. Guy gets a bad rep for some reason, I thought he was alright. Nice, charming guy.

Dr. Cumming will have you consider transferring out of Pepperdine. You learn how to take his quizzes rather than actually learning any history. His class is based on three exams which are worth 100 percent of your grade. If you do not want your GPA to suffer, please avoid his class at all costs.

dr cumming is a really nice guy and great person. I think that he was stuck with teaching a GE that really shouldn't be taught in elkins. there is no other way to grade 200 people than to have tests, which sucks. more people would enjoy this class if it was small and graded on essays/discussions rather than tests, but he had no control over that
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Mean and hard grader. Did not teach me anything. I failed the class, and I am a good student with a 3.9 GPA. Really do not recommend, drop while you can.

All I'm going to say is that he gets a bad rep from students who don't study or try. His tests are literally word for word from the lectures and study guides provided to you!!! Not that hard to do good on the quizzes either. Literally just pay attention, take notes, and study. Should be self explanatory atp.

3 exams. First one is 26% of your grade and the next two are 27% each. He doesn't believe in a curve or extra credit. Showed up everyday to class and still withdrew with a D-. Cool dude with a terrible teaching method. If you have trouble paying attention, good luck. Classes are straight lecture, no break.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: HE WANTS HIS STUDENTS TO FAIL! Don't get me wrong, he is a cool dude.....terrible teacher. Quizzes due everyday you have class (twice a week). VERY lecture heavy. Class is all lecture and assigned readings are very long and don't always correlate with lecture. Lowest grade I have EVER had. Everyone I know who has taken this class has FAILED
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: lecture heavy. the way he teaches is not interactive with the students AT ALL the exams are literally made for you to fail. Please avoid this teacher it is way too lecture and information-heavy it is really not worth your time.  The exams are literally multiple choice, matching, short answer, and an essay.... all on so much information and history.

Professor Cummings does not teach well and there is a lot of things on the test that are never covered in class or in the lectures. He also does not make an effort to make sure his students are understanding the material. Don't recommend him for HUM111.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I had never had a horrible professor until I met this man. HALF of my class dropped out after the second exam, and the other HALF of my class averaged about a c+. 10% of your grade is random questions from 30+ pages of each chapter. Then, you have 3 30% exams. He gives you a study guide and then asks the most specific questions that make no sense.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: His class was completely lecture-heavy, and notes were needed to be taken, with reading quizzes once a week from assigned readings. Even though this was the case, his exams were pretty reasonable if you studied the notes from his lecture. Everything on the exams was explained or mentioned in his lectures. Quiz questions were too specific though.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Tough professor not flexible at all. Not super hard course material, but wants you to think that his freshman GE is your life's top priority.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Yes, the class isn't the best thing in the world, but you can tell he truly cares about his students! He is so nice so just go up and talk to him. Take good notes in the lectures as well.

Doctor Cumming is a very nice person. Though, there are a couple of critiques for HUM 111. The weekly quizzes are too specific and some questions focus on trivial details of the textbook. Tests are 90% of your grade (three total) and heavily dependent on lectures. If you do not take good notes or attend lectures, you will do poorly on the tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I would never in a million years take this class again. Your whole grade is based on his tests and they are extremely challenging.

Nick Cummings is a gem of a person, and though I didn't really ever grow accustomed to his teaching style, I appreciate him so much. He is a kind, gentle man who has a heart of gold. He prayed before our exam, that we may do well, and he is the cutest ever.

Dr. Cumming gets a bad rap from the students who had him in Elkins and skipped classes. The truth is, if you show up to lecture, take notes and internalize the material, it's not that difficult. Sure, the lectures are boring and long, but you don't even have to participate. There's 3 exams (2 midterms and the final) and weekly (online) quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Cumming knows a lot about the material, but his lectures can get pretty dull. His lectures do not align with the reading, so the weekly quizzes are on material he has yet to lecture about. The three main tests are pretty fair, and if you take good lecture notes and study, you will do well.

Dr. Cumming's class is very difficult. Make sure to take good notes in class, the questions on the test are taken from lectures. There is a lot of outside reading you have to do and the weekly quizzes are difficult. Make sure you go to class, otherwise you're not passing. If you could find another teacher, take them instead. His class was hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Not the best but not the worst. You have to study pretty thoroughly for the exams. Lectures can get boring, but it's truly not the worst. Office hours are helpful.

Cummings is the worst professor in the humanities department. Literally take anyone else. He packs so much information into the tests and is so boring in his lectures. He gives minimal feedback and is one of those professors who like to feel powerful over his students. Content is boring and so is he.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: His class is terrible for first year students at Pepperdine. Makes you not want to be in college with how extremely difficult it is to pass. Talks with such a boring voice, boring mannerisms, everything about his hour and a half presentation is boring and hard to stay awake too. Three exams based on notes: 40 questions, 1 essay, and no makeups. Smh
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I took Professor Cummings for HUM 111, and while I got a B, I had to work hard for it. It was 100% tests and quizzes based grade which I hated! He was a fine professor but you have to just plan on dying in the library the week of the exams. Each exam was 30% of my grade, and quizzes were 10% . So very exams heavy. Exams are based off his lectures.

Unpopular Opinion here: Dr. Cumming's class was not that bad. If you go to lectures, take good notes, and study effectively, you will do fine on the exams. They're extremely straight forward. Most of the people giving Cumming poor ratings did not study well, are bitter because other students have it easier in other HUM classes, or just need to vent
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I have never done poorly in a history class until I took HUM 111 with Professor Cumming. He grades his tests extremely hard and does not allow students to interact with each other. Each class he crams about 3 pages worth of notes into a hour and a half and does not stop talking. AVOID
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He is very passionate about this subject but a horrible class. The tests are too hard if you don't understand something. You have to know every part you learn, you cant just learn from the powerpoints. He talks as he shows the slides and you have to write down what he says too. Quizzes are 10 questions in 10 minutes over the reading.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Nick Cumming might be a good professor in his other classes, but having him for humanities has been the single worst part of my college experience. He's smart, but his lectures are disengaging, monotone, and always behind schedule. He has no sympathy for his students, is incredibly negative, cynical and unaccomodating. DO NOT TAKE.

This class is why I cried every day of the semester. The lectures are an hour in a half long and he speaks mono-tone the entire time. He's probably a cool dude, but definitely not this class. There are 3 exams and they are worth 90% of your entire grade. Fail one and you're done. He is so arrogant. I thought I was an A student, not now though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Cumming is a good person, but probably the worst teacher I've ever had. We were only graded off of tests that were too long to take in an hour and a half and we had weekly quizzes that we were only given 10 minutes to take. I was told we would be given an essay to help our grade, but we were not. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Weekly online quizzes based on textbook reading, which is a lot of reading. Tests cover a lot of material, but he gives a study guide with everything we need to know.. Often goes on tangents in lecture, but the exams only cover what is covered in lecture, not
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Fair. The exams are a little challenging, but fair. Read, attend the lectures, take good notes, and dont forget the quizzes. The quizzes are annoying- weekly quizzes that force you to read the textbook. Helpful in the long run, but still annoying. He has a nice demeanor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall, Prof. Cumming makes REL 101 very straightforward in what you need to know and what he talks about in classes. EVERYTHING on his slides will be on his study guide, so notes are important but will make his exams easy. As long as you write cohesively w/ detail on your essay & book review you should do well. For REL 101 I would recommend him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Midterm and final have the biggest weightings and are CRUCIAL for getting a good grade in this class. Do not do bad on them. He gives a study guide, and the answers are word for word what he says in lecture. SO PAY ATTENTION IN LECTURE AND TAKE GOOD NOTES. No extra credit whatsoever. You have two big essays, so don't wait to start, he grades hard
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Cumming is great! he is funny, accessible, and is very knowledgable. He is also very caring and understanding, while still being a more strict prof. Very fair grader on papers, but tests are very difficult, especially for a 3-credit class. He is an overall awesome prof and I definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Cumming is a great teacher and a nice person to work with. However, for a GE I believe he expects a bit too much of his students. Tests are very reasonable and he is a generous grader, but his weekly quizzes are very specific and difficult. There is also a long essay he requires students to write. I probably wouldn't take him again.

Professor Cumming was by far my worst professor at Pepperdine and REL101 was a horrible experience. He speaks so monotone and his lectures have absolutely no character or student interaction. His exams are very difficult and he is not accommodating at all. His grading is very harsh and he is not very clear in regard to what he is asking for. AVOID!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This professor gave the exam which covers every single point in his study guide. There are only multiple choices, matching, short answers (one sentence) in Midterm and Final. If you review everything he talked about in the lecture. It is a piece of cake. RECOMMENDED

I took REL101 last fall with Dr. Cumming. He is a real gem, I looked forward to his class every week because it felt like a break from my other ones. You're graded on a midterm, final, and movie project, but fill out the study guides, and you're set. Go to his office hours for participation if you're too shy to speak in class like me :)
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Overall good guy who is extremely approachable and understanding of his students' situations. His classes are dense with information, but if you're able to keep your eyes open during the lectures and study for the exams you will be just fine. I took two of his classes, and I know many people even take three :).

At first, I was heavily disappointed by the lack of enthusiasm from both the professor and the class. However, I realized that my education is in my hands and I didn't let the energy of the class determine what and how I was going to learn. I did the work and participated as needed but I later learned that Nick is actually a super caring professor.

Dr. Cumming is very passionate about the Old Testament. As someone who grew up in church, I really didn't expect much from this class and took it just to get it over with. It ended up being my favorite class this semester. Dr. Cumming makes the Hebrew Bible come alive and appear more relevant in ways I have never seen before. A great choice

I had Prof Cummings for Old Testament- and I LOVED it. Overall not a lot of outside work and the lectures were entertaining. Tests were questions you could expect if you took good notes and studied. I would take again in a heart beat.

Dr. Cumming may be my favorite teacher so far at Pepperdine. His REL101 class was so interesting, and he made sure everyone learned something. He is a bit lecture heavy, but they are always so interesting and well thought into, while also allowing time for questions and discussions. I wanted to go every week! Take his class, you will not regret it!

This class was so interesting! It is not super difficult and will interest you even if you are not religious. Dr. Cumming is an incredible professor and knowledgable about what he is teaching. He will make you think.

Great teacher. Straightforward with material. No homework, 1 research paper, 2 reflections, and 2 exams. All the material needed for the exam can be found on the study guide. Classes are solely lectures, but he's very engaging and makes the material fun. If you grew up in Sunday School, this class will be a breeze and you won't have to read.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Cool guy but his classes are very hard to pay attention to. If you mess up on one exam then you're basically screwed because its only the Midterm, the Final, an Essay that make up the vast majority of the points in the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures are painfully boring and his exams are not only way too challenging for REL101 but don't make sense. Take someone else.

Cumming has a way of being sarcastic and funny while also discussing deep topics that matter to the course. He is very welcoming to opposing viewpoints and encourages discussion with peers. (Also, you won't regret going to office hours!!)

Dr. Cumming does not deserve a bad rating, he is truly amazing! As long as you pay attention & take notes, you will pass the class. I didn't use the textbook but I know students that did. He is funny, has a lot of knowledge, & truly cares for the all of his students. He has been one of my favorite professors & he's nice to look at.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I had Proff Cumming his first year of teaching. Overall class is minimal work, just go to class and take notes and you'll get an A. There is just a midterm and final but they are very easy and even fun (he gives extra credit for questions on Harry Potter). He is very nice and caring, I would take him again just make you sure you take notes!

Professor Cumming's class was one of my worst experiences at Pepperdine so far. His lecture is completely scripted and drags on for way too long! He doesn't allow room for open class discussion, yet counts for participation. He TRIES to be funny. Not a tough grader on writing assignments; however, his midterm and final are fairly challenging.

Cindy is by far one of the kindest and most knowledgable professors I have ever had. Although her class was challenging, her passion for the subject made every student fall in love with the class. The midterm and final were difficult, but Cindy is always available for help. Her only room for improvement would be posting our grades on Courses.

This class was so complicated. She lectures the entire time, and you have to guess what notes to take (all while handwritten. No computers). You will also be graded harshly. The final is so much work. It's a project, but it's a lot. This is also a history class. If you can take an art class to fulfill your fine arts requirement, I would.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Cythia Colburn is a great professor and is very fun

Colburn is a wonderful professor. However, the lectures are very boring if you are not into art history. The test come straight from the study guide. The writing part of the exam however is very difficult. You need as much info as possible on them. Go to office hours and she will help you.

Best teacher you will ever have.  She has such a passion that it is infectious.  She had me so enchanted with Art History that I switched my major at the beginning of my junior year.  Definitely a solid narrative teacher.

Dr. Colburn is a great professor but is extremely challenging in HUM 111. Even if you study the entire study guide, you are likely to end up with a C. She will add questions that are not on there.  Beware of this.

She's very knowledgable and tries to make the lectures interesting, but hum 111 is just a dry subject. If you don't read outside of class and review your notes you will not pass. Tests have multiple choice, map and essay question. Study hard for this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is so knowledgeable and overall an incredible person. She is supportive in and out of the classroom. I loved her class and getting to know her. Yes, you have to study, but she is a great teacher and you will always feel prepared.

Dr. Colburn is one of the greatest, most intelligent people that I have had the pleasure of knowing. She is always there for you and genuinely cares about your well-being/education. Her grading is always very fair, to the point, and she is always there for you to talk to if you ever have any concerns.

yo seriously Dr. Colburn has been one of my favorite professors.  She genuinely cares about her students and subjects, and will even cut class to take care of students' personal needs.  She teaches with authority on every subject, and is willing to just drop some life lessons on us.  She's extremely nice outside of class, and I highly recommend her

She always takes time out to explain her reasoning whenever I don't understand my grade. She is incredibly devoted to what she is teaching, and she is very diligent in her work. She grades work speedily, but with care, and I would definitely take another class from her. Her passion for the class made me enjoy learning.

Truly cares about the students in her class and is always willing to help with material, other studies, or any aspect of life. Open to input from the class about understanding and preparedness. 10/10 would recommend.

Dr. Colburn is one of the most dynamic, loving, and intellectual people I have ever met. She cares about her students beyond measure and is so knowledgeable about art history and so passionate about the material. She is the best!

Professor Colburn is a great teacher. She really cares about her students and is willing to work with you. You do need to study for her class, it is not an easy a, but she makes it a lot of fun. She is insanely intelligent and really knows what she is talking about. I'm not an art major and I would love to take any class with her. Favorite Prof.
Dr. Colburn is incredible! I never liked art history before I took her class. She was our faculty family in Florence and was constantly supportive. She was our mom away from mom. Highly reccomend!

Dr. Colburn is amazing. If there is something that needed to be excavated, she's probably done that excavation.  She makes an effort to make sure you understand the material.  I took her Roman Art class as a G.E. and I learned way more than I thought I would. She also tries her best to give you all the resources you need to be successful ! 10/10 !

Incredible teacher, class is difficult, but she will help you any way she can. Very open to ideas on how to improve the class and is passionate about her work. If you ask her questions, she will not hesitate to give any and all experience she has with the topic.
She is great

Great professor, great class, and very engaging material. Overall organized, interesting and informational class. This is the class where the bigger questions of life and art are asked and where you can take previous criticisms at face value, pick and choose, then create one's own ideology. Student interest oriented type of class, and learn a lot.

This professor is amazing, completely rocked my world.  So much that I changed my major within a month of her class.  It's not an easy class, but it's well worth it.  The none majors even liked her class.  She has an organized class directed toward general understanding and appreciation for the artifacts discussed.

took this class for GE req. DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU ARE NOT AN ART MAJOR!!! unbelievable amounts of useless information you have to memorize to pass the exams. never expected to have to do this much work for a freakin fine arts GE. geez. DONT TAKE HER CLASS unless you want to work really hard to even pass. trust me. and i actually like art classes!

Colburn isn't easy, but she's a good teacher. Some might say that she takes her GE classes a little too seriously since the exams are hard and require a lot of memorization. I bombed the first midterm, but knew what to expect on the final and did much better. Be prepared to work, and definitely take good notes. She expects a lot for a decent grade.

She is a great professor. She is passionate about what she teaches and wants everyone to learn and love it too. Her art history classes are a lot of work, but if you apply yourself you will get a good grade. Lectures are mandatory. If you listen and keep up with reading then studying for tests should just be reviewing. Do the service learning Proj.

FIrst of all, Colburn is a very nice teacher and extremely knowledgable.  That said however, if you don't like coming to (a lecture) class, DO NOT TAKE HER.  She will give you practically zero credit for analyzing artwork on the exams if you do not write specifically what she says in class.

She is an excellent teacher and one of the best I've encountered at Pepperdine! Very nice and goes above and beyond in caring for her students! Tests are very straightforward and if you prepare, you can get really good grades.
Great teacher, really cares about her students.  If you are having trouble, visit her during office hours.
Colburn is a great professor. If you are lazy dont take the class.  If you want to learn something of value, she is a good professor. She also cares for her students.

Colburn is a very smart & kind lady; she's totally willing to help and will even drive you to a museum for her art paper if you don't have a car. That said, DON'T take this class unless you're really interested in ancient art and architecture. I love art and this was my least favorite class. The textbook is horrendous and her tests are awful...
DO NOT TAKE FA 200 WITH HER. IF YOU'RE IN IT, DROP IT IMMEDIATELY. she thinks it's a real class, whereas it's just a two credit layup to fit GE's. take music appreciation instead.

Dr. Colburn is one of the smartest professors at pep.  I have had the pleasure of being in her class many times and I learned a ton.  No she does not put on a preformance like some teachers here do, but if you wake up and pay attention to the brilliant things she has to say you will learn a ton.  She is also very available outside of class for help

Colbun is a complete buffoon.  I will say though that despite the fact that she has the personality of a muppet with its strings cut, the class isn't THAT hard.  I got a B and almost never went.  The study guides pretty accurately predict the tests and she is somewhat approachable.  I had a new Colbun appreciation after zalar.
