her hum 111 class migh be a tad boring, but she is a really helpful teacher...if u have any problems you can talk to her and she will help u out.
She is soooo boring... says umm at least twenty times per class.

This Class is impossible!  There are 100 different subjects to study...and in great detail. Then there are works of art to know, then literature to know, and lastly she gives you 6 essays with only one appearing on the test.  Its impossible for the human mind to memorize this information.  DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!!!  She's smart, but horrible !

Colburn is great.  Study and pay attention to lecture.  Hello, you're in college now!  Wake up and get with the picture.  You're not going to skate through her class.  But here's a secret: all you need to know is in the lecture...
Really hard dont dont make the mistake of having her

Humanities 111 with Colburn is known to be the class from hell, and for very good reasons. I highly recommend STUDYING AND READING THE TEXT! People complain all the time because they dont read and wonder why they get Cs and Ds. Take this class very serious and you'll do excellent. talk to her, also

She is such a wonderful person and is always willing to help you out.  The class is hard, but thats what is to be expected for a class which covers so much material.  If you study and go to her with your concermns you will do fine.

This class is ruining my GPA. There is way too much info and you're expected to memorize about 12 pages of ID's and 20 pieces of art (who, what, when, where, why, etc.), then you're tested on about 5% of it, usually the parts you don't remember too well. She's nice, but I do NOT like her style.

She talks very fast in class, and is a hard grader when it comes to paper.  Very knowledgable though. The class was a bit unfair because each TA grades differently, and I don't think she communicated well with the TA in regards to the grading scheem.

She's a hottie :)  Arts Appreciation was definitely one of my more interesting classes. She's very helpful and very clear on how assignments should be done. I strongly recommend this class to everyone.

By far the smartest woman I have ever met.  I have had her for 6 classes as an art major and no one has more interest and concern for her students well being.  She will help you prepare for tests and if you get papers pre-graded by her and fix the mistakes, guaranteed A.
No Comments
the class is hard, lectures can be confusing, and the id's for tests are out of control...BUT she's super nice and will do anything to help you out
It's pretty much pointless to rate this woman, she's the only one teaching it the majority of the time.  All I can say is go to class, take good notes, and study hard.
No Comments

Really not as bad as people make her out to seem, and the class is better than 111. She is a nice woman and is very knowledgeable. Yes, you will have to study a lot, but would you expect anything else from HUM? Don't wait 'till right before the test to do your IDs and you will do fine.

colburn is a very through teacher, although she might be intimidating at first, she is really easygoing and helps you out if u ask her, dont be afraid to take the class, but know that u have to work for it, she is an amazing teacher
Talks fast and very complexly making it very hard to follow the lecture and take notes at the same time.  Very boring class.
need to work for the grade, as long as attend class, take notes , and listen. you'll be fine. college is not suppose to be for those who don't want to work.
VERY HARD TEACHER!  Stay away if you want a good grade.  Take the class when she's not teaching it!

If zeros were an option, I'd give them to her on every category except hotness.  She is good looking for a college professor but was not born to teach lecture classes.  She just rambles off facts and dates and history with no humor.
class is boring!! six papers and no tests.

Professor Colburn is an excellent teacher.  She is very thorough and she loves what she is doing.  She is very down to earth and easy to talk to.  Her course is difficult but doable.  Don't be scared away by the difficulty, its pepperdine suck it up.

This is the hardest class I've had, and it's a GE. Go figure. Way too much effort for an A, or even for a good grade. Huge lecture class makes for boring classes. Even when splitting up the study guides with a group it was a lot to learn. Impossible.
Someone who truly loves what she is teaching, her enthusiasm for the course was  contagious

She's gotten better, however the class seems to be too much for a G.E. Its best to take humanities during the summer if you can. Colburn is a really nice woman and definately knows her stuff. In general, the class is just "ho-hum."

The only bad part about this class are the annoying people that take it.  Dr. Colburn is incredibly thorough and enthusiastic about history and the arts. Turn off your cell phone and shut up people! Sit in the front if you're actually interested.

I'm kind of upset at the amount of work required for only a 2 credit course: 5 papers, 3 on-campus performances and 3 like 5 hour off-campus scavenger hunts to analyze art.  Not worth 2 credits!!!  Lectures kind of boring...really nice lady, though.
She's very helpful.  She's a great person, and she's really enthusiastic about the subjects she teaches.  She also knows a LOT about the art.
Very, very BORING.  Not a good professor but very nice and helpful outside the classroom.
If she doesn't have her notes she can't teach!
No Comments
No Comments

This class was ridiculous..,but it wasn't just Prof. Colburn, her little impish TA's didn't help much either. I hear if you take 111 during summer school you will be much happier. Stay away from this class with Colburn.
This class is from hell. It's way to hard and not going to help you in any aspect of your life. If you take it plan on never going unless you want to waste your time
No Comments

BULL$#@*. This class is a joke... a waste of time and money. I can't handle it; it is so bad, I NEVER go anymore. I will settle w/ a D- gladly just to pass the class and never have to have her again. Like in Gladitor, she gets a thumbs down.
she's nice... and she tries... I think she needs more experience teaching.
Where did Pepperdine get her from? I mean I am paying Pepperdine 30 thousand+ a year for this.I want my money back. Can someone please tell her to take Speech 180...I'm sick of the um's
Colburn is a Spawn of Satan.  She is absolutely the most horrible professor I have ever had in my entire life.

Doesn't know how to teach.  She talks about things that she doens't expect anybody to know.  Says it's not important and then says how to spell it.  Her testing format is insane.  Know everything about 90 or so id's and do 5 on the test.

Horrible teacher, and for the way she teaches she grades unreasonably.  You can ask a question, but i don't think it would get answered.  Talks about stuff that is irrelevant to the lesson.  Does not know how to handle a class.
No Comments
Pretty obvious that she hasn't been teaching for very long.  Getting sick of her talk about her baby.  And she needs to learn to tell some students to stfu.
Bad speaker, very unclear, grades unreasonably

get ready to teach urself with a textbook that is written in archaic english. going to his class is a waste of time bc hes not only boring but doesnt teach u any math that u need for hws or tests. always this is useful irl but not for the test tangents. he drops a midterm out of 3 and up to 3 hws out of 30. 100 hrs of online videos saved my grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Lengthy homework assigned for each class that needs to be turned in physically. He claims that this class should be self-taught, where you need to read the book on your own in order to learn the content. He will not teach you the material in class but review it so you will need outside help if you want to do well in the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Hes a good man, but as a person who isn't the best at Math his class was tough. Homework everyday which will help you understand more about the chapter but its a lot of work EVERYDAY, isn't the best when it comes to lectures but is a fair grader.

Lots of reading and daily homework. Tests were difficult though appropriate for the class. However, he sets up students for success, and if one puts in the effort, passing the class is very achievable. Very caring about students and fun.
He's a good teacher. There's a lot of homework though.

I personally didn't like Dr. Strong. He wasn't a great lecturer, and as someone who isn't great at math, his class didn't work for me. His tests were harder than his practice tests, and I wouldn't take him again.

The reviews saying Dr Strong doesn't teach make me laugh. He's an incredible professor and I've learned so much from him. I have gone out of my way to take multiple classes from him and would highly recommend taking one of his classes. You definitely have to start out strong though or it can be somewhat difficult.

Professor Strong is a very kind professor who does care about his students and is knowledgable about what he teaches, however HE DOES NOT TEACH. The only thing he does is go over the homework a bit and then just goes over random things that are not the tests. You do not need to show up and just study the previous exams and that's all that matters.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Strong is really nice but be prepared to teach yourself the material. He wants everyone to succeed and offers extra credit opportunities, and he also drops your lowest midterm and replaces it with the final.

Dr. Strong is such a sweet person and genuinely cares about his students, but the way he teaches is VERY difficult to follow. Lots of homework, but you'll need it because you'll be teaching yourself the material. He does offer extra credit and drops an exam score.

Dr. Strong is a really nice guy. But he is just not a good teacher. He does not give good notes out. YOU HAVE TO TEACH YOURSELF THE MATH if you want to succeed in his class. There is TONS of homework. I am an A student and this class stressed me out because of the amount of hw and cause he did not teach well at all. I was my own teacher for this.

Dr. Strong is a great professor. He gives his students every thing needed to be successful in his class. It can be difficult to catch up once getting behind, but as long as you stay on track and take advantage of what he provides to learn and study, you have a great chance of being successful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Very good

Professor Strong cares a lot about his students.I did really bad in this class because his lectures were hard to follow.I am an athlete and struggled to keep up with the amt of homework that was assigned and readings. my best advice would be-read the handouts before class to get familiar with the material so that the lectures are easy to follow
Favorite professor ever. Loved him and his class. Highly recommend. One of the reasons I love Pepperdine.
If you can take a different math class, take it!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I'm NOT a math person, but I got a high A in Dr. Strong's class. He gives a lot of interesting analogies. Lectures are recorded, attendance is optional, and there's extra credit. And all old exams + solutions are uploaded! There IS a lot of homework. For the first unit, homework took 2/2.5+ hours EACH NIGHT. It got easier as the semester went on.

He makes his lectures interesting! While attendance is not required, you must hand in your homework in person. He assigns a lot of homework, but if you get stuck, he'll always help you out. He grades homework on both competition and correct answers. He also gives you prior years' tests to help you study for midterms.

He is a very good professor. His lectures were very useful and he made time for students after class. He is very good at helping you understand material you struggle with. The class comes with lots of homework so be prepared. TOOK ME HOUR AND A HALF AVERAGE TO FINISH HW. (crazy) But he is the best math professor I have had hands down.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Super easy class, but I taught myself from the textbook. It is the unfortunate truth that Dr. Strong's lectures made things more confusing than just reading the textbook. As a professor he is kind and thoughtful, a fun guy to be around, just not a good teacher. Lots of EC and easy tests (he gives you the problems before and changes the numbers)

He has good ratings so it could be the online element. He's gotten political in this fall 2020 semester and presented himself as a "fact bringer"; that what he was saying "is not opinion". Misleading, off-topic and wasting the limited class time. His analogies and jokes may help others but personally doesn't help me. HW due before explanation.

Lectures are a little abstract, but he really tries to give you the understanding that the textbook can't provide. Old tests are all online, and he doesn't change them much, so it's a super effective study guide. Seems to care about and know about math in the real world too, not just a theoretical guy. Highly recommend

In my opinion, Dr. Strong is a great professor and a great mentor. He doesnt spend time in class going over the things that you simply could have read in the textbook the night before, but teaches you how to apply the information in a way that you may not have thought of. Gives you old tests to practice with and tons of extra credit opportunities.

Dr. Strong is the best choice for any math class at Pepperdine. I've had him for 3 classes now, taken easy A/A-'s in all of them. He puts his old tests online as study tools, and he barely changes the numbers for the new tests. He also allows notecards on tests in all his classes, and provides formula sheets too in BioStats. We love Dr. Strong

For a tough class, it was really a great experience with Dr. Strong. Great instructor, really easy tests, take home final exam, and he definitely cares about students' lives more than most professors. I would go out of my way to take him again.

Professor Strong is very funny and engages with the class. On Mondays, he starts class with music, and on Fridays, he starts class with polls. He only takes attendance when people stop showing up; every 10 attendances allows you to drop a homework score. He curves your final grade relative to the whole class and gives extra credit chances weekly.

Likable person, lectures are easy to follow, I learned a lot. One note: I'm almost done with my degree, and this class had more homework than literally any other college course I've taken. Homework due nearly every day, graded for correctness. That's not to say it was the most work--it's just a very "high school" approach to assignments.

He really tries to make an impact in your life which is why I came to this university in the first place. He makes the math a little more difficult compared to my previous calculus professor, but he's really accessible outside of class so it's not a big issue. Definitely would recommend him to other students who need a calculus professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: One of my favorite at Pepperdine. He not only teaches math, but also tries to influence your life. I love his $5 plan, the strawberries, and the Thursday voting. Choose him, especially for Math 316 and 260.
Just your basic math class. Do the homework, pay attention in class, it's pretty easy.
A really good professor who knows the syllabus inside and out. Also very laid back and friendly so makes the class interesting and fun. Do your homework, it helps!

I'm not really into math, but he helped (required) us to really learn and understand, rather than just try to teach to the test, like what I used to in high school.  It took some getting used to, but it was for our benefit, even if I didn't like being challenged quite so much.
He helped us learn, but expected us to be independent and learn how to learn, including on our own.  I think that is a good thing, though.

Dr. Strong is probably my favorite math teacher from high school or college, and one of my  favorites at Pepperdine.  He expects you to learn to be independent, but he'll do whatever he can to support and help you learn.
Don't do this to yourself.
Made the class really interesting and enjoyable.  The difficulty wasn't bad either
love him!
Worst Experience, avoid at all costs. I would take calc somewhere else.
GREAT TEACHER. its hard to get a teacher this great these days. take him for sure, you won't regret it.

Professor Strong is really a good teacher overall.  His class is rather difficult at times, but not overbearing if you know your stuff.  I highly recommend him, because he knows his stuff and is passionate about it, too.
Nice, genuine guy.  Math isn't my favorite, but he helped make it interesting and applicable to business.
Juts took the final.  Strong was fair and pretty helpful.  Would recommend.
Friendly guy.  Good teacher.  Makes you know your stuff, but isn't excessively demanding. Fair.

Such an awesome prof.  Class required a large time commitment, but material wasn't hard.  Exams aren't too difficult if you study a little.  Nice guy, he even took us to see an LA Phil concert.  Take him if you have a chance.

Pretty laid back class - no attendance policy. Midterms are a complete joke if you can do basic calculations and study his old tests he gives you. HW policy is really cool too. Strong is nice and funny. The only thing is he makes the final a little harder than the other tests. Still, easier than the other Math 215 profs.

Strong is a really great professor that uses his class time very wisely. He brings up a  new topic and does many examples so that it is easy to understand. Even if math doesn't come naturally to you he remembers what it was like to be a student and has the gift of breaking things down to make learning math simpler.
Pretty good class, actually seems kind of useful.  Prof. Strong is pretty fun, fairly clear, and obviously cares about mathematics and us, his students.
great teacher, very fair.
Good class, didn't mind taking.  I even enjoyed it at times.  Prof is good guy.
Nice guy. Tends to go on tangents and uses corny Mormon humor. The class is straight forward and his tests are fair (he allows the book and a calculator).
Good teacher.  Fairly tough, but fair.  Made math interesting and relevant.  I would recommend him to friends.
really cares about students, really easy class. an all around corny guy.
Good guy, good prof.
Good teacher.  Expected us to work, but was quite fair.  Class was worth attending and often actually kind of fun.

Don't waste your time attending class (he won't count it against you if you dont go). His lectures are vague, boring and pointless. DO your homework and study his old exams that he gives out and you will do very well.

Prof. Strong has corny jokes, but he's a nice guy. He's a complete dork, but he is pretty easy and very straight forward. Just go to class and do your homework, as a freshman I'm getting an A without much effort!

Extremely boring, makes lame jokes, extremely feminine and basically just rewrites what's in the book up on the board and expects you to understand. Tests aren't TOO hard, but you'll be teaching yourself a lot.
He is the worst teacher I have encountered in my four years at Pepperdine.  He is unclear, unorganized, and although he TRIES to help students out, he is judgmental and close-minded.

Great teacher.  I agree with all of the positive comments below, and don't know what the students who wrote the negative comments were thinking.  Maybe they didn't work hard enough and didn't get the grade they wanted.  I would recommend him to anyone!

Prof. Strong does have some pretty lame jokes but at least he seems to know it. Go to class and you should be fine. Tests aren't too bad and he does genuinely care about students well-being: he actually makes you schedule an appointment with him in his office to make sure your year is going okay.
doesnt go over things that people dont understand, ie homework. tests are kind of a bummer, not much help there either. you have to learn a lot by yourself, with the book as a teacher. pretty tough.

I'm unsure as to whether or not these descriptions are about the same Dr. Strong.  He is a great teacher and wonderful guy.  Yes he tells jokes, but they're funny, and he makes class interesting.  He doesn't stutter, is never nervous, and has a lot of enthusiasm.  Great Teacher!
Very nice man but he CAN NOT teach...luckily I had taken the class in high school so I had some idea as to what was going on.
Prof. Strong is a horrible teacher and SO unclear.  He stutters and is nervous all the time.  And he's really weird
I'm not sure what the other Math 210 student was thinking.  Math 210 was great, and most students got an A or B.  Maybe that student was bitter that he/she didn't get an A or B.  Get over it!
One of the best classes I have ever taken. Is a great teacher and is always willing to help. Curves grades.
jokes... lame-o! no one goes to class, and if they do, its for a test or for hmwk. Does a pretty good job of teaching it step-by-step, his tests are medium difficulty.. but he's a cool guy in person
lots of homework, hard tests, ridiculous final, almsot everyone got a C in the class, but that was his 1st semester tecahing
Course was very demanding -- but Prof. Strong knows how to make even the most dificult problems seem easy. Very clear and concise. He could skip the lame jokes and the course would be much better.
This course was taught clearly and thoroughly, however, his presence was awkward and lacked a genuine enthusiasm. Though the course wasn't terrible, listening to him and watching him made me squirm.
Clear, helpful, friendly, enthusiastic, fair.
Great professor.. Open book tests
He' s a cool guy. Young and energetic!
No Comments

She is terrible. She only cares about how much money our parents drop on this school. She will call out students who are doing amazing and say you need to be like them. She always gives quizzes without telling us. She could care less about how students are doing. She won't even stay after to help you with questions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: She is so bad. She always gives us pop quizzes she always gives us stuff one day before a test or quizzes. She never respect students. 10/10 would not recommend
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: She will essentially pit students against each other saying one person is doing so much better than the other and the other person is not trying and is extremely disappointed. She will not quit bringing up our parents money and dislikes everyone unless you are textbook perfection. She can teach fine but her expectations are extremely unreasonable.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is very rude to students. She has little to no care how we are doing not only physically but mentally. she only cares about our parents money. She gives no grace and just hands random papers. She follows no schedule and just does random things. No one can keep up. Do not take her class!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: I absolutely love Professor Villegas. I am 28 now and took her class as a freshman in college. She is the reason I studied abroad and became fluent in Spanish. She is all about tough love but when she sees you're working she is the THE MOST encouraging teacher ever. I love the woman!

I took her SPAN 151 course last sem and am currently taking her SPAN 152 course. This isn't a highschool language course, she wants you to learn and retain the information and knows when you are trying to cut any corners. Her participation includes putting you on the spot about info from previous lectures or readings. Its not easy, but its doable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: You can memorize 90% of the material overnight, she will ask you the single question you don't fully know, and you'll receive no credit in participation (20 percent of the grade). She also becomes amazingly rude and condescending very quickly. Although a great teacher of Spanish, she is in no way a a good educator

so there are very mixed reviews on here which made me wary of taking her class. long story short, if you have a positive attitude and demonstrate that you care about learning the material and not just cutting corners, she will love you!! obviously there is going to be work in this class, but it is not impossible and she is incredibly caring!

I studied heavily for this class and met with Villegas often to review, clarify, and get advice. I thought it was helping, but the more I reached out the more degrading she became. Her class is not a safe or effective learning environment!! Since taking her class I have made two As in higher-level span courses and put in the same level of work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Villegas was the HARDEST class I have ever taken. Even when struggling I can always do well when reaching out to the professor, not in this case. She has no sympathy if you're not getting things fast enough. She will leave you behind and continue to tell you it's all your fault. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. Such a stressful professor!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Learning a new language can be hard. How if you put in the work Mrs v will help you succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I LOVE HER SO MUCH. So many people don't like her because they don't like that they have to do the work. HELLOOOO we're in college, and it's a language course! Of course, there's gonna be work. Most of these comments are people upset that they had to put in effort. wack. Villegas was so clear about everything that she taught and would be on exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Villegas is by far the WORST professor I have ever had at this school. She is very unclear despite her telling you after the fact that she was very clear about whatever you had questions about. Her lectures do not follow logical order with the book and she expects perfection and fluency after only a few weeks. Do not take this professor!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Just don't.

The class itself is not the problem, it is that this professor enjoys belittling her students. A high grade is achievable if you study A LOT, but Villegas will constantly disrespect and ridicule you regardless of your efforts. You are never enough in her class. While you can pass her class with extreme dedication , it is not emotionally worth it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The class was too difficult for anyone to begin to comprehend, let alone enjoying. She does not care about her students and she is just ridiculous. DO NOT take.
She was incredibly hard. So disappointed I took her. Made my love for spanish die.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: If you don't participate or even seem enthused, Villegas won't hesitate to give you a hard time. Demands and expects way too much for it be an intro elementary Spanish class. She acts completely oblivious to the fact that students have other classes besides hers. Avoid and take a different Spanish professor.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Prof Villegas makes Spanish way too intense for it to be an elementary level. Demand and expectations are way too high. It's a GE for christ sake. If you're not enthused and actively participating, she'll give you a hard time. Definitely avoid and find a different professor.

Prof Villegas/Language Dept sincerely care about students' success in learning the language h/e expectations are way too high. Understanding most of us are enrolled in 16 other credits as FT students, she/language dept should reduce completion requirements and give students a break. Incredibly stressful, and are only informed of grade once in Oct.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Absolutely the worst professor I've ever had.  Expects far too much of her students, and the stress she causes is absolutely not worth it for an intro level class.  One of the most rude, arrogant, awful people I have ever met. Do yourself a favor and take a different language or a different professor.  Horrible professor, horrible person.

This class is only a good option if you come in with a prior knowledge of a good amount of basic Spanish vocab, or if you generally pick up languages really easy. If not, you're gonna have to put in LOTS of time to commit her tons of vocabs and verbs to memory & if you aren't big on early classes and you take her at 8 or 9 it's gonna be hard on you

She is such a great teacher! I will probably end up getting a  C in her class, but that is my fault. If I worked harder I would've gotten a better grade, and she is incredibly clear about what you need to know. Lots of work, but learning a new language is never easy.

Honestly, she isn't as bad as most people say she is. Yes, the class is very challenging and a lot of work, however, if you participate in class and make a true effort you will get a good grade. It's only the people who slack off who hate her. I got an A in the class yet got low C's on the midterm and one of the exams. You'll be fine if you work.

Professor Villegas really cares about her students. She wants them to actually learn the language not just get good grade. Her class isn't easy. Yet she pays attention to students who work hard. At the end of the semester, your grade reflects your hard work. If you really want to learn, take her class! She's really sweet.

Prof Villegas really made me want to continue learning Spanish. I'd never previously taken Spanish, and she gave me a great foundation for the language. I'm surprised so many people don't like her. Come to class willing to learn and it will be great.

She is not a professor you want to make mad. If you come to class, participate, and show some interest/enthusiasm, she will like you and be very helpful. She's easy to learn from and understand. Definitely energetic! Take her if you don't mind putting in a tiny bit of effort. I loved her and her class!

She is the worst teacher I have had yet at Pepperdine. As everyone else said, she is very arrogant. If you don't suck up to her she will not like you and if she does not like you then she is very unfair! I would avoid taking her!! She makes me hate learning Spanish!

I loved Spanish with Prof Villegas!  I took spanish in high school, which makes this class easier, and is why i like it. If this is your 1st time taking spanish, it can be kind of hard, but just go in for help. she is tough in the beginning, but as the semester goes on it's fun. i really like this class!
Absolutely the WORST Professor at Pepperdine. Avoid her at all costs. She is utterly condescending and mean-spirited.  Horrible Professor, horrible person. DO NOT TAKE HER-- trust me on this one.

I hated taking her class. I am a spanish major, and she made me want to drop it!  I would go into her office sometimes for help and she made me feel like a complete idiot and I didnt know anything.    She is EXTREMELY hard.  Basically the only way to get a good grade in her class is to: sit in the front row, attempt to talk in Spanish, and SUCK UP!
Learn alot.....very hard class.....had it at 9 AM...had a hard time getting up in the morning having to deal with her.

The worst teacher Ive had in my academic career. It is astonishing she is still employed. She is an emotional rollercoaster from day to day: angry, arrogant, dismissive,and passive aggressive. Comfortability and constructive criticism are not a part of her classes. Adults are treated as if they were in a third grade bootcamp. Avoid at all costs.
I Love taking her class!

Villegas is simply rude and inconsiderate.She does not teach and gives homework that is unbareable to keep up with.Will talk down to you in a condescending way. When you try to talk to her personally she thinks your always attacking her and she always tries to argue. A DO NOT TAKE EVER CLASS!

I agree with everyone else here. I can't believe I didn't read these comments before taking her!>! She makes me hate spanish even though I love learning languages. She can't get it in her head that we have other classes to work for every night. ONLY take Villegas if you speak spanish fluently. She said "you have to speak spanish fluently by the end
Professor Villegas is very unfair, arrogant, and makes learning Spanish a lot more difficult than it should be. Avoid at all costs. It amazes me she is still teaching.

I am a spanish major and let me just tell you do not take Villegas. Absolutely not worth it. There are too many other options who are FABULOUS ie Rogerro and Marshall. si tomas Villegas, pararias mucha! Just don't take her! Not worth the stress she puts on her students.

She teaches as if her students were majoring in Spanish, or care more about learning than their GPA.  She is way too intense for an elementary level spanish class.  In order to receive an A: mandatory attendance, participation in and outside of class with her, and study mucho.  On the plus, she is a nice lady once you get to know her.

Absolutly the HARDEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER TAKEN. the class is for a GE but it is way harder than ANY MAJOR CLASS. grades HUGE on participation and it is SO SUBJECTIVE -- if you want to work you BUTT OFF and get a C-, because you just arnt that good at languages -- Take her. otherwise do EVERYTHING IN YOUR POWER TO STAY AS FAR AWAY AS POSSIBLE.

Professor Villegas is absolutely the worst, most miserable professor I have ever had. She is totally unreasonable and incredibly condescending. Ask a question and she will do her best to make you feel stupid. Of course, you will not feel stupid, you will just feel angry. She is bitter, arrogant, and far too demanding. She makes me hate Spanish.

do not take this teacher she will mos definately make you feel completely stupid and when you are for help in how to say something she makes you feel beyond stupid like you are some two year old trying to comprehend....NOT WISE TO TAKE HER!!!
STAY AWAY!!!!

Whoever reading this will thank me so much. Do not, I repeat DO NOT take this professor. Especially because the other options at Pepperdine are so amazing ie. Rogerro (just out of shear easiness, and Marshall- who is fabulous). She is the most scatter brained teacher I have ever encountered in my years as a student.

worst prof at pepp. She tries to talk students into dropping, makes fun of them for failing and does not care if you are struggling. She will pretty much outright call you stupid if you don't catch on right away.  Not willing to help at all- I had to go to a diff prof to get help with the class. Do NOT take her unless you are already fluent in span

I don't know how to express how much this teacher frustrates me. I am not lazy, and I do work hard...spanish is just not a strength of mine. She is unfair, and treats her students with very little respect. Worst teacher I've ever experienced at Pepperdine. No joke

She is a hard teacher.  Granted, she take you to another lever of spanish, but you will also be terrified in class.  Looking back, I wouldn't take her again.  Too much stress!  I dont mind the work, but the continual stress was too much. not worth it 2 me.

Prof Villegas is a great prof! She is willing to help if you the student put forth the effort and seek her out. She will def help you get to the next level. THIS IS NOT AN "EASY A" CLASS! Lots of work is required.

Not very clear when explaining material...expects students to be fluent after 1 week...shows favoritism...not a good teacher for BEGINNERS, better for students that have taken Span in HS. She's extremely cocky too. Thinks she's the best teacher at Pdine.
Not very accomadating to athletes. Participation counts for a lot and she is unfair in how she grades it. Definentely plays favorites and is not a clear teacher of the materail.

I agree she is horrible.  Profesora es el diablo. I had a problem understanding her.  Even the words I did know were hard to make out when she spoke.  She is extremely tough, and definately has favorites.  If you kiss her @$$ she'll take it easy on you.  She also takes off if you do not give the correct answer in class.
No Comments
No Comments
plays favorites. high expectations and very judgemental.
what a ****
She's freakin hott! And she's a great, helpful teacher. Much work, but you learn a ton. Me encanta Porfesora Villegas.
No Comments
No Comments
Not a big fan of hers. Make sure you talk ALL THE TIME and always PARTICIPATE because she is VERY strict when it comes to participation grading, not to mention partial to certain students.

There is no secret to do well in Villegas' class. You have to work hard -- but she knows when you do, because you make an effort to speak. She doesn't respect lazy student, which unfortunately is a descriptive trait of Pepperdine students. If you are lazy, don't take the class. If you arent, then do
WORST TEACHER EVER!  NOT HELPFUL AND DOESN'T HAVE ONE SYMPATHETIC BONE IN HER BODY!  DO NOT TAKE HER!

She is a teacher that expects you to LEARN.  If you don't put forth effort in her class or you are disrespectful...you'll be on her bad side until you do otherwise.  She's amazing if you choose to see it.
Villegas is funny, smart, and cares a lot about her students. She forced you to speak Spanish, but you learn A LOT!  Great teacher!

excellent teacher, helps you to use your spanish as a conversation piece rather than simple book knowledge.  can be unclear as to assignments, but really works you hard and helps you learn how to use what you know.

Villegas is the best -- you work so hard, but it is so rewarding because you learn Spanish. She's also a very nice woman and class can be lots of fun. Her usage of ziplock bags to transport handouts, quizzes, and tests is cute. Take her for Spanish.

I LOVE THIS WOMA!. She is a spicy latina, who has helped me tremendously with my Spanish. At first, I feared the class, but its very simple to do well in her course. Go to class, speak, and do the homework. She'll respect you. She's awesome.
Professor Villegas is awesome.  My spanish greatly improved after taking this class.
I missed one test and she wanted to fail me, ended up having to drop the class. Speaks very fast and expects you to understand everything.
Very good teacher, but beware that she thinks participation is very important.  This class will prepare you well for future classes.

Can't make up anything, can't miss any class without your participation  grade taking a major hit. Not clear on homework that she assigns.  Overall a terrible teacher. Doesn't like male students either.

She is a terrible teacher. I was sick and missed a test (8:00am class) and offered to make it up on my own time and she said that I should get a doctors note next time. She would not let me make up the test. And she is discriminate toward male students.

overall good. not always clear on assigned h.w. but really stresses importance of learning verbs...in ALL tenses. class participation is a MUST...participation will make or break you.  learned a lot both from the book & practicle life applications.
She is demanding in her work, however you will be prepared for the next level and have fun while you are learning. She's GREAT.

Prof. Folkerts is so great - you can tell he really cares about the class and his students! Grading is based on only 5 tests but the material is straight out of the textbook and he covers everything in class as well. SONA credits aren't hard to get/make up (just time consuming) and extra credit is easy! He gave us a grade boost after the fire :)

Prof Folkerts is a great! He cares about his students and is understanding. His tests rely heavily on the lecture material and reading the textbook will help to further understand lecture concepts. I really recommend attending lectures because he discusses test content. He's accessible outside of class which is super helpful.

Even though Dr Folkerts is such an amazing and kind person, his teaching style did not "click" with me when I took PSYC200. He grades the class ONLY on 5 exams, where 1 is dropped. His lectures are very fun, but he never does review in class, so make sure to go to his office hours. Overall, a pretty good teacher, but be prepared for difficulties.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Gave us all a big grade boost after finals were cancelled from the fire. I loved the class and would take it again if I could.
Great guy and the lectures were interesting. It's easy to get a good grade if you study. I liked the class sm it inspired me to add psych as a double major
Nice guy... tests are awful and the only thing graded. Don't recommend taking. So sad because he Is such a nice guy, but as someone who has all A's this class was brutal.
Nice guy but would not take again. You are only graded on 5 large tests. Class is very difficult.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Good Guy. Tests are hard, but the lectures are just a yap session. Goes off topic for 20 minutes sometimes then flips through slides at the end. TEXTBOOK!!! Pretty unavailable as you have to schedule office hours. Extra credit for about a half letter grade boost. He's nice but just beats around the bush and can't get to the point teaching content.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: I absolutely loved Folkerts, this class had me considering changing my major to psych. He made everything so interesting, even brought a human brain to class for us to touch/hold. Prayed with us before every class, helpful during exams, fair grading policy, overall the best professor at Pepperdine. I could've done better, I just slacked. Take this!

He's an amazing professor. His class materials are hard, but he makes each lecture so much fun and he's an honest and interesting person. His grading is on four exams, two book summaries, and participation when we talk about the book summaries. He's available for office hours but even if you tell him you're coming, he's busy with other students.

Dr. Folkerts is a very HILARIOUS and KIND professor- he really cares about you and makes class so much more fun and interesting to learn about. DON'T PURCHASE the book. Everything he lectures is on the exam. This class is totally do-able to get a good grade as long as you STUDY!  BUT his exams are NOT definitions, they are APPLYING (harder exams).

Folkerts is exceptional, he is so passionate and knowledgeable about psychology. He is hilarious and so excited to teach. I took AP Psych in high school but still learned and retained so much in his class. There is an option to use the textbook, but the tests are more lecture heavy. Please take this class if you have the chance!!!

By far one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. He puts so much energy and effort into his lectures. Even though it is an Elkins class, the lectures are entertaining. Whatever we go over on lectures only will be on the exam. There's 5 exams. He drops the lowest of the first 4 exams. If you take good notes and study you will get an A easily.

easily my favorite class of my freshman first semester. he uses a textbook but ONLY what he covers during lecture will be on exams. he cuts whole modules if we ran out of time to cover it in class. VERY high energy and an overall really nice guy. i already miss his class. if you like to laugh, you'll regret missing his class

I had Dr. Folkerts in my freshman year fall semester for Introduction to Psychology. I will always remember how he stood out as a hilarious, inspirational, and engaging professor. I was excited to attend each lecture and understand more about psychology. Still, remember that you need to keep up on readings and take notes in class.

Dr. Folkerts cares so strongly about the material as well as his students. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! He wants you to learn everything, and he will make sure to help in any way he can. The tests are quite difficult but if you make sure to not leave studying to the last minute, it's definitely doable.

Very nice professor but not the right style of teaching for me. You mainly study with hours of review to the book outside of class and don't learn much during lecture. After the first exam, I withdrew because it simply was not the way I learn best. I would recommend another professor if this type of teaching style wouldn't work for you either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a fantastic professor. He is kind to all the students and tries his best to help each one. But his exam was not easy and he needed to study a few days in advance. Good notes are important for revision. Although his classes were difficult, he was one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. You can get good grades as long as you work hard.

Dr. Folkerts is the best! You definitely need to read the textbook and pay attention to get a good grade, but the tests were well-organized and he made his expectations very clear. He makes lectures interesting because he is a super funny guy, and very obviously cares for all his students. Would recommend to everyone!
It was required course. It was so boring, would never take it by choice.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's a nice guy, makes sure to try and entertain the class by engaging us through comedy, however with major tests almost every other week, and him flying through the content because of how much there is to go through, really made this a difficult class for me and many of my classmates.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Folkerts is a kind and caring professor. His class was simply all lectures, and we had a lot of exams. Honestly, I just inserted my notes into Quizlet and studied this to do well on my exams. The exams were straightforward and directly correlated with his lectures. He makes the lectures fun and tells many stories.

Dr. Folkerts is hands down one of the best professors I've ever had. The class content is very difficult, but Folkerts wants you to succeed and is always willing to help you through the material. I ADORE this man. He often goes off on tangents during lectures, but usually tries to tie it back to the material. Never a dull moment in this class.

one of the hardest classes i have taken in my entire life. if you don't read the textbook before class a lot of the material won't make sense. the tests were hard too but he goes over it during office hours if you want to. responds pretty quickly to emails
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Dr. Folkers, where to begin? What an amazing professor with a love for his subject. This course may seem daunting at first, but Dr. Folkers WANTS you to succeed and learn more about the human brain and interactions with the surrounding world. I strongly suggest taking all of his available courses during your time at Pepp. You will adore him.

Professor Folkerts is a great guy who wants to help his students succeed. Bio Psych is hard though, so the lectures and textbook are necessary. Tests can be difficult, but Dr Folkerts is always available to answer questions and help people study beforehand. He also gives good feedback throughout the writing process of the one big research paper.

Definitely pay attention during his lectures and also read the textbook modules he assigns because that helps you further understand the material he teaches. He never checks if you read the textbook but definitely beneficial if you want an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: 1. Read the textbook before lecture!! When I read the textbook before going into the lectures, the lecture material seemed so easy. When I didn't, I was overwhelmed by everything on the powerpoint. Coincidence? Don't think so. 2. Go to his office hours. 3. His lectures are entertaining. Having this mindset will help you thrive/enjoy being in class!
LOVE HIM. Super sweet, smart, hilarious, passionate teacher. Never thought I would enjoy class prayers
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Folkerts loves Jesus, his students, and psychology and it really shows!

Folkerts is the man, he is passionate about neuroscience and it shows in his lectures. Attendance isn't required, but a good section of test material is based on videos and things he only shows in class, so showing up is a good idea. Very easy to keep up with
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Folkerts is very passionate about psychology and he brings that to class by being engaging and entertaining. However, his tests are very difficult and require you to think critically about the material. The questions are complex and each test covers a lot of material. The other part of your grade is based on simple writing assignments.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: I loved Dr. Folkerts, but this class is HARD. He really is committed to the success of his students, though, and I would take him again for an easier class. If you're not sure you want to take PSCY372, I would advise against it unless you are really interested in the material, becuase of the sheer difficulty of the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--Tests are tough

comment: Folkerts is a great professor. However, his test are extremely hard so you have to study. It is good to go to his office hours because he will make sure you are on the right track studying. Also, ask questions during the test; he will help you a lot.

Dr. Folkert is such an inspiring professor. He is such an awesome guy who really has a huge passion teaching. He wants to make sure that his students do really well in his class. I would recommend going to his office hours when help is needed. Take really good notes. READ the chapters before going to class. Then you will succeed in his class.

Bio psych. He is an amazing person, really nice guy. Great teacher and makes the class interesting. But when it comes to the test, for the normal human, you'll be lucky if you pass. I do not recommend taking this course with him unless you are very familiar with science and like tests that are unnecessarily hard. Seriously. don't do it.

I respect this professor a lot.  I came in with the mindset that it's just another GE because he does not teach my major.  However, he's super passionate about his teachings and he makes the lectures fun.  The book isn't necessary, but it's a nice to have, especially if you're like me and take notes slowly.  100% recommend!
Love his enthusiasm! His lectures are so entertaining! Might be a little more work for a GE but you learn so much from the article assignments!

He is a passionate professor with great teaching skill. But if you want to have a good grade, you need take 100% concentration on every minute in class! There is a lot of stuff in one class that the ppt goes very fast. Class can never end early. There are almost no straight and easy questions in the exam, you need understand the concepts completely

Dr. Folkerts is an awesome professor, easily one of my favorite. He cares deeply for his students, even when in a large lecture course. He is extremely funny and keeps things interesting. It is not necessary to read because he covers all material you need to know for the tests which are not that hard.

Coming from a completely mediocre student, his class is not difficult. GE's at Pepperdine are not meant to be easy, but he clearly communicates what will be on tests and if you review all terms and demonstrations from each chapter, you will succeed. He's also hilarious and a genuinely nice guy, keeps the class alive.
His Psychopharmacology class is AMAZING. If you take good notes, attend every class, and study hard, you will succeed. He is a hilarious, entertaining and helpful professor! Love him!

He runs a very difficult Psychopharmacology course; but you certainly leave the class with lots of knowledge. He teaches the class as if it were a science course, rather than a PSYC course. He's pretty clear about the material that will pop up on the exams, and he's an easy grader. Folkerts' kind and comical personality makes the class worthwhile.
Loved him!

I love this professor. I wish he wasn't going abroad. Best teacher I have ever had here! Wish we could clone him so he could teach every class. His tests are hard but if you go to class and take great notes it's easy
Unbelievably nice guy. Tests however are extremely difficult!!! Strongly suggest taking a different professor for your GE!!

seriously one of the nicest profs ever!  he's such a dork but he keeps me sort of awake during class and he loves what he does.  he talks in these weird voices a lot it's hilarious.  tests are very manageable if you study hard and go to class.

I love folkerts!! he is an amazing teacher, and extremely passionate about what he teaches. I strongly suggest taking PSYCH 200 as a GE! tests are easy if you study. he's really awesome and tells really great stories. I LOVE HIM!! he makes me want to switch to psychology as a major.

Loved him. Took AP psych and this class was a bit repetitive, but he was interesting, hilarious and very very clear. Subjects are easy to understand. Tests are straight forward with info from book, lectures (if not in lecture it isn't on test), and videos/demonstrations we do in class. He is very laid back and understanding. HIGHLY recommend him.

Dr. Folkerts is a funny and eccentric guy. Going into the semester, I was dreading psychology. But he made it really interesting, and now I'm glad I took psyc instead of econ. He doesn't take attendance, but you'll need to go to class to do well on the exams, which are more difficult than you'd expect. Highly recommended, though.

A nice and funny professor.  Class is completely lecture based.  Attendance is a must because he doesn't post his powerpoints on blackboard and whatever movie clips are shown in class will probably be on the test. Don't always count on prior tests because what each class learns is sort of different.  The 4 writing papers are easy points.

He is one of my favorite teachers at Pdine! Sooo passionate and exuberant.  He really makes Intro to Psych interesting.  I even changed my major after this class.  READ THE BOOK!  And pay attention to all the activities during class, always on tests!  Its a hard class but he's great!
Such a hard class the tests are extremely difficult because he is not always clear what is on them. He is very smart and makes lectures interesting and adds humor.

All you need to come to class for is the viedos shown in class. Other than that, he just summarizes the text a bit, and simplifies it too much. You thionk the class is easy until you take the "celebrations." No matter how hard you study for those things, you never do very well. ASk him for help though he is known to give free response questions 2 u
goodtime..funny if you go to class you will do well...have to study for the tests but if you do you will get a good grade...lot of info wants you to know it all

Take Folkerts. He is so easy and you can miss class. The tests are straight from the book except for some class examples. He is very nice and bumped me up to a B+ even though I should have gotten a B (hint: I studied 2 hours before the test, if you try an A is easy). Really good person.
Folkerts is the man.  The classes aren't jokes, but hell, if you want the real thing, this man rules

He added humor to the subject, and made stuff interesting usually. Definately have to plan to study a lot for his tests. All multiple choice, but detailed. Very helpful outside of class too! He went through each chapter with me before the test while I asked him questions about what needed to know for test. He's a great guy!
Completely unhelpful.  I always get along with professors, but this is an exception.
Dr. Folkerts is a great guy and makes class interesting in fun. Tests are a killer though--expects you to know everything!! Good class though, and you learn a lot.

Really funny guy. You don't need to go to class to do well. If you study a lot and read, the tests aren't too bad. I barely went to class and still got an A by just studying before the tests. Plan at least two days to study though.
ggod teacher....hard class.
No Comments
Dr. Folkerts ROCKS. Okay, tests are not easy at all but nothing on them is a surprise. He LOVES what he teaches and that helps with difficult topics.
Nice man--but his teaching style is confusing and not organized. Not great at explaining things.
Very helpful and fun, but tough on tests.
nicest teacher ever

One of my all-time favorite professors. Great guy and a great professor! Really knows how to teach in a fun and interesting way to get you to remember all the material. I definitely wouldn't say that his class is easy, but I promise you'll love the class
Great teacher. Keeps the class entertaining, is hilarious, and cares about the students
Dr. Folkerts is a great guy. His tests are killers though. But you will learn alot from him and he class time goes by pretty fast.
Fun, energetic, and interesting teacher. Fairly organized and structured. Tests are very in depth and difficult at times, but it forces you to learn a lot.
So entertaining and interesting.  Awesome prof.
Folkerts is a really cool guy, loves to help his students.  Class is hard. Tests are very hard, but you learn a lot.

Dr. Folkers is a very nice man, and is very enthusiastic about teaching, yet very difficult to understand and relate to.  He obviously knows his stuff, but has difficultly explaining it.  His tests are KILLERS.
It's a lot of work for a g.e. requirement. He's a really cool guy to listen to for lectures, but his test are in-depth and cover a lot of material
No Comments

Worst prof Ive ever had at Pepp. Not only is this class boring but she is not clear and gets way too political in this class. If youre even slightly conservative, watch out. She rambles about her personal beliefs and attacks anyone that disagrees. AVOID!!! Theres only 5 people in her class for a reason

don't listen to everyone else. dr. dillon can be a tough grader, but the class isn't hard if you put in the work. participate, visit her office hours, and revise your papers--you'll get a good grade. she was always helpful and wanted me to succeed. she'll tell you how to improve your papers if you ask and is incredibly nice. she definitely cares
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Super subjective grading. Pretty much go to every office hour in order to make her like you and give you help on writing. If she likes you a lot, you'll get an A

The only words that come to mind to describe her are wishy-washy. I apologize for the poor word choice, but seeing as I learned next to nothing from this class, it is the best I could muster. Her grading style is so flexible it may as well be water. Speaking of, she must go through 50 gallons/day since she talks so much. Save yourself and avoid.
Go see her for office hours if you want to get a decent grade

This is not the class for an Easy A, but an A is doable. Dr. Dillon wants to see students grow, but she can be very difficult. She has high standards, but if you consistently go to her office hours, she will help. She can be very vague in rubrics and ramble on in class, but she does care for her students. Work on essays in advance and participate!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Her lectures are just her rambling for an hour and a half but it feels like three hours. She is vague on what she wants on papers, stifles students discussions in class, and often times doesnt read the whole paper if you ask for help before you turn it in: just reads your thesis and tells you how SHE would write the paper. Dont take her class!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a good professor who cares about your success and will help you proof read and improve your essay before the due date! Also if you fail an essay she will let you fix it and replace the grade. She does not grade on an accumulation of scores but rather how much you improve. I love her as a professor!
If you care about your sanity don't take her class

Honestly not a good professor. She is unreasonable and boring in class and grades essays a bit too hard. She does not give good feedback and this is a GPA killer for a gen ed course. Try not to take her.

I'm being dead serious when I say this teacher is by far the worst professor teaching ENG 101. Disgustingly dull professor and one of the toughest essay graders. Never teaches anything in class and expects you to write a scholar essay.
She is destroying my GPA.

I hate English classes. However, I got an A in Prof. Dillon's class. All you have to do it be friendly, listen to the instructions on what she expects out of an essay, and if she is unclear (she often is) attend office hours and ask her. Also, she will read essays early and give feedback if turned in early which can be fixed for the due date.
Worst professor ever!!! She will destroy your GPA for no reason!!! If you hate somebody, your can recommend this professor!
Do not take this class, she will destroy your grade. She gives an extremely vague expectation of what your paper should be, then will harshly grade your paper because it lacked what she wanted.
Usually liked to ramble a lot, and when I asked for help she came off as criticizing without giving much help at all.

Very difficult professor. Not only does she go on completely incoherent rants about random subjects including how we are all teardrops of God she also is completely subjective. She never explains specifically what she wants from you or from your essays. She gives you an idea and then marks you down hard because its not what she wanted.
Dillon is a terrible teacher who has unclear standards and is boring. She is an ignorant push-over. I would NOT recommend her. Except to an enemy.
She is very helpful. A nice old lady who is passionate about what she is teaching.  She analyzes text in ways you wouldnt think, making this class very interesting.
Literally the worst professor for ENG 101. DO NOT TAKE HER. This will bring down your GPA. I am warning you.
I will spare you from a rambling description. Long, boring class. Can't teach. Tough grader.

Literally the worst English professor I have ever had. She would spend multiple class periods talking about how to "form a paragraph" and brought back "gerund phrases". Umm I thought I was in college....

She was definitely a tough grader, but once I went to office hours to talk to her about my papers, she helped me IMMENSELY and I started getting As on all of my next papers. She is really kind and helpful, you just have to go to her if you are struggling. I definitely recommend her!

I had her for English 100 and I was bored to death. She taught commas and hyphens during class. She assigns several essays in a semester and she grades them very harsh although its English 100. Despite taking the paper to the writing center, I barely got a B. Overall, her class has not helped me at all.

Boring class, almost died but luckily there's laptops for fb.books are dumb like learning boy talk vs girl talk. Analyzed one book the whole year word by word.  Good: get to write essays based ur on our interest. Bad: her grading is subjective.  No real benchmark or rubric.  I passed AP Lang, but was SO STUPID cause i wanted to review essay writing

if you can drop this class, absolutely do it. she picks favorites at the beginning and grades based on that. she makes changes to assignments and the syllabus, and often forgets what she has or has not already taught to the class. NEVER be short even by a 1/4 page on essays or she will deduct a huge amount of points.
Not an interesting in any form or manner. I was on facebook almost every class and did not listen to anything she said. Would not recommend taking this class!!!
I do not know how she became a English teacher in Pepperdine... Please do not take her class. It will drive you crazy and she has to retire.....

Not a good teacher. Grades papers very hard and has "favorites" in the class. grades certain people harder than others. available outside of class but not helpful. can re write one paper. Old and cannot teach

I am a creative writing major, and what this teacher does to writing is a shame. She destroys any hint of a writing style and is condescending. From the way she talks, you'd think she'd be this amazing writer, but she's AWFUL. I think she RUINS writing for college students, not improves it.
Students should not take her classes. The reason is that she is not fair. The class is not really hard, but it is hard to get grade. Whatever, students must not take her class.

So, kind and so merciful if you really have a problem.  She knows her stuff and appreciates all types of writing styles. Tough grader but willing to let you re-do papers at end of semester. Overall, I'm glad I took this class

Im avoiding this teacher as long as humanly possible. She tries to change your writing style and it isnt even halpful. Her class was always a drag to sit through. She was probably the worst teacher I have had yet at Pepperdine.
She was always helpful and passionate about what she was teaching.

Prof. Dillon offered one of the most boring classes at Pepp ever!  I tried so hard in her class and constantly asked for her input on papers before I submitted them but she never gave me good enough feedback for what SHE wanted.  Very unclear and inconsistent about  what she wants.  Eww.  I got A's in other classes and never one in hers...hmmm.
take care

I could not stand Dillon. Not that she was unpleasant, but her constant over analysis and ridiculous classroom activities made me dislike the class. She is not a very hard grader, but I had trouble understanding what she wanted me to change about a paper until she returned it to me, graded. She does allow some rewrites, which is helpful.
If you like to suck up go for it. I would def stay away and go for lasley. Shes smart put not cut out to be a teacher.

I would stay away from Dillon. I have always been told that I am a good writer but she only gives good grades to people who suck up. I will admit that I put forth no effort but she is totally boring and there is no class discussion. 2 years after i had her she had no idea who i was. time to retire. take peterson if you can

she sounds like kermit the frog..she doesn't allow discussion she merely speaks on her soapbox for the majority of the class. we read ONE book the whole semester and she doesn't allow us to analyze it ourselves. im not a fan. she is nice i guess but the class is the most boring class ever

i liked writing before this class. relentlessly ripped my papers up with her red pen without much explanation. very unclear about what she wanted from us, but was willing to meet with us outside of class. she just was never really any help.
The most amazing prof I ever had at pdine. Always willing to help and listen.
A waste of time and for what? Basically it comes down to if she likes you or not and the only way to get an 'A' is to be a kiss-up.

Students complain about the class cuz they get less-than desirable grades--many of those students need to realize that their writing skills suck. Betty Dillon knows good writing and grades accordingly. Class is dreadfully boring, but she's a nice person, and learning how to write is essential.
While Dr.Dillion is a great person to talk to and get ideas from, she isnt the clearest when it come tos teaching and she has her own way of grading

She is a very tough grader. I would go in for help but still recieve the same grade. I even got help with my papers from other teachers and my papers still got Cs. She is unfair and if she doesn't like you, no matter how great your papers are, you'll get a C. AVOID

This class is good for people who like the sound of nails on a chalkboard, who like to write using appositive phrases, and useless things. This class sucks. You don't learn anything and the teacher cannot grade to save her life. She grades according to how much she likes you

Frustrating teacher that will only give you a good grade if she likes your writing style. Worked really hard on a paper and she gave me a D. Class is more boring than anything in the world (I am in it right now). Nice lady, but horrible teacher that doesn't allow for creative writing.
She really pushes you to learn and write. If you listen to what she has to say, take notes on what she highlights in class, youre bound to succeed.
Super Boring, don't take her, kept on talking for 1.5 hours without any pause....Horrible grader.
very hard paper grader. very boring class, teaches in the most confusing way. And if you don't write in her style of writing be prepared for some d grades on your papers(If your lucky)

She is a cool person, but a not so good teacher. She wants you to think "out side the box," but what she really means is writing the way she wants you to. It was a boring class; however, she was passionate about the subject. If you are not an English major don't take her.
She is a wonderful teacher.  She grades papers pretty hard but she is always willing to go through a paper (essentially grade it) before it's due.  Very, very helpful.

lots of essays, be prepared to change your style of writing to fit her ideal style, your grade doens't always reflect how much you work on a paper, sometimes it seems random. she is usually willing to help you though, but she wants you to do work for sure.
Nice lady who loves hearing herself talk. Grades extremely hard and conducts the class in the most boring way possible. But she is always in a pretty good mood and interacts with her students

It is an extrememly boring class. The books you read are boring and there are many papers. She grades very tough too. Improves writing skills a lot and will help you out. Good class to learn to write, bad class if you are looking for fun.
it can get PRETTY boring/annoying in this class, sometimes you feel like you're wasting your time by going to class. but dr dillon's really nice and she's very willing to try to help a student out.
No Comments
Her classis very boring and she is quite unclear.  She is also a tough grader.
She really helps you improve your writing style
My writing improved a ton this year. I think that alone was worth taking the class.
She demands "writing out of the cage" and creativity.  She is a relatively tough grader.  Prepare to modify your writing style to please her. Hard work counts a lot though.
she is a hard grader at first but if u ask for help she knows your trying. she is a lil hippie-ish and def makes u leave ur comfort zone!! is always available after hours.

Excellent teacher who rewards hard work with good grades.  She is a fair grader who cares about her students progress and social well-being.  Teaches to think outside the cage (you'll understand if you take her).
Dr. Dillon encourages you to really exceed your comfort zone. Her class allowed for as much growth as the individual put into it. I really respect her teaching.
Wow.  I thought the 70's were dead.  What a waste of time.  Easy as hell, but fell asleep more than once with that class.  UGH
Stupid Hippies.  What a waste of time this class was.  She grades real easy, I passed the class by handing in high school papers….pfff… I mean, this was 102!! Stupid ****!
No Comments
This lady is the most annoying teacher I have had. She is on some type of hippies in the 21st century tip.

Dr. Willis is a very kind, knowledgeable man. His lectures are boring and his tests are unnecessarily hard. This is the only Elkins class I've taken that has required attendance. He does provide study guides for his tests but the tests are mostly short answers. Be prepared to study for the exams as they make up a majority of your grade.
Got an A in the class, but I worked long hours for it. Don't take him, and his tests are not easy.  A heavy chunk of it are written response and his final was unnecessarily hard. Blessings!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: As a person, Willis is great. But as a professor, one of the toughest professors I've had on campus. Although I did get a good grade, I worked harder than I needed to for a religion GE course. I caught myself falling asleep every lecture and all he talks about are open-ended (useless) questions. I preach at church, but none of it mattered here.

I truly did enjoy his class. Overall, the first two exams were straightforward and directly from class notes. The last exam, however, was just not a fair assessment of what we learned throughout the semester. Be mindful of this when preparing because it is completely unfair. Other than that, very kind and caring professor!
Good person, quizzes tho are difficult and isn't flexible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: The worst final I have ever taken

You have a reading quiz every class period, but if you have basic biblical knowledge it only takes about 20 min. There are three exams each of which he gives you the exact study guide and I made an A on all three. Your last exam is the final and you have 100 points non accumulative and 50 accumulative. There are two minor writing assignments.
Take good notes in the lectures so you can fill out the study guides before the tests. His tests are straight from the study guides so memorize those and you should be good.

Professor Willis' Religion 101 class is great! It's obvious that he really cares about his students. He is very clear about what is expected and if you take notes and follow the detailed study guide, the 3 tests are easy. There are short open-Bible quizzes before each class, but they help bring up grades. No textbook - just a Bible. Take Willis!
Prof Willis like to shake hands with his students and the tests are given are not super hard, but you definitely have to study for them.

I had Timmy Wills my first semester at Pepperdine and I am so glad I did because apparently other people's religion classes were hard. He is so straight forward and the tests all memorization, so it's not hard to get an A. It was an Elkins class and he made the effort to actually learn all 200 of our names.. What a gem of a man. TAKE HIM

Professor Willis is the absolute coolest professor at Pepperdine. He is smart and he cares about all of his students. Take any of his classes. They're not too hard but you learn a lot and he's really neat.
He is the best Religion 101 teacher! His class is fun even though it is at 8am. His tests are super doable as long as you go to class and look over the study guide. 10/10 would recommend taking him
Great professor. Gives study guides. Test are based off lectures.
Dr. Willis made 101 enjoyable. If you show up, take his online quizzes, and follow his study guide, it's an easy A. Also, his themed ties made my day.

I just took his Religion 101 class this semester. He is a great lecturer, and tries to be funny during the somewhat dull times. He is a fair grader, and tests are straight-forward. He takes the time to get to know every student by name in his class of over 100 people, which shows he really cares. I would recommend him without any reservations.

Prof Willis is an awesome guy and tries to get to know every student, even in a class of 200. Taking this class in elkins is difficult though. Online quizzes are imperitive. This class is no walk in the park.

I'm an Atheist, at first, I was upset to have to take the class, but Willis is one of the kindest professors I've ever met, he's extremely helpful, and he's so nice to every one of the students.  One of the best experiences ever. Tests are extremely doable if you put in effort.
He is the sweetest little guy ever. His big lecture class is very easy. Just do the quizzes before the class consistently and follow his study guide in great detail and an A is basically guaranteed.

He is literally the best teacher for Rel101. Easier than all the other teachers. just write down everything on his powerpoints, know the study guides inside and out, and youll pass his exams. but also pay attention while taking the online quizzes. he tries to trick you. other than that, hes amazing and his class was super easy!
Irrational and convoluted. His directions are unclear and he makes no sense when speaking to him. Maybe someone should buy him a dictionary to look up the word "evidence."

His teaching involves a lot of his own interpretations, but it makes the class more interesting. Reading the Old Testament is boring but he only assigns short sections every week. The weekly online quizzes take about an hour and they can be done as you read. A lot of memorization for tests but easy overall.

Timothy is great! I don't think any other 8am class could've been so enjoyable. The class was super easy, but the best part was Willis's humor. He's so funny, plus he actually tries to get to know the students even in a class of 250.

He is well organized and prepared for each lecture. If you study for tests, you will be fine. Make sure you do well on the quizzes! Overall, I really enjoyed his class and would definitely recommend him for those taking Religion 101!!! Take Prf. Willis!
Willis is awesome... passionate about the subject and cares about the students.

Willis is the perfect person to be teaching REL101. He is passionate about the subject, but makes the information easy to learn. He gives you a study guide with everything on the test, so getting an A in the class is very esay. Just make sure to go to class every day because there are in-class quizzes almost every day.

Timothy Willis is a really nice professor. His tests are straight out from the notes (his lectures/powerpoints). If you go to class and pays attention to his lecture, you will do well in his class. Has quizzes frequently, but they are pretty easy. Very helpful. Likes to get to know his students. Makes religion interesting.

Dr. Willis does a great job of simplifying the Old Testament for students. He understands that not everyone is Christian, and is helpful in and out of class. The tests are very straight forward, and questions are taken directly from the notes. TAKE WILLIS FOR REL 101!

Dr. Willis is an amzing professor. He really loves the subject he teaches and has so much knowledge. Very friendly and he brings cookies to class sometimes.
