His class can get a little boring at times however. His test are straight from his lecture just make sure you take good notes. Do the reading because he gaves a   quiz everyday.

TAKE HIM! cool guy with hilarious corny jokes.  tests are straight forward. gives u a study guide so i rec. just typing all the answer out and ur gonna ACE the tests. no tricks to his tests, no surprises.  great teacher and understands that not everyone knows the Bible inside and out. Awesome man
Dr. Willis is a great professor.  Notes are exactly what is on the tests, study your notes!  He has a great sense of humor when he lectures and makes the class interesting.

I had Willis last year, and he's a great teacher. His powerpoints are very clear and he tries to make them look interesting. Try to come to class pretty regularly as he gives out reading quizzes sometimes. His tests are very straightforward, and if you follow the study guide, you'll likely do well. He also gives us cookies! A really nice guy.

Fairly easy class. Go to all the classes b/c he does give a quiz usually every time you meet. You can earn up to 15-20 pts extra credit from the quizzes. Answer the questions on the study guide and KNOW them for the tests. The LISTS are important!! Brings cookies to class, sweet professor and cares for his students!

Willis is awesome. Super nice, and makes you cookies. Just go to class everyday so you can do the quizzes which aren't super hard at all. When he gives you the study guide, make sure you study it well so you can do really well on his exams. great professor i highly suggest taking him!

You have to take the Religion GEs, right? then take Willis. Super nice guy, knowledgeable on the subject, and seems to have a genuine appreciation of the material. daily quizzes(fairly easy) & 3 big tests! If you take notes and review the study guide the tests will be easy. a fair amount of reading too.
He is very confusing and does not explain very well.

Prof Willis is a genuinely nice guy. He has hundreds of students and tries to learn all their names. His tests aren't hard if you study, and they come straight from the notes. There are daily quizzes, and he does require a lot of outside reading. He also tries to present different views of the material which is helpful. Overall its a great class.
Willis is an awesome teacher, he is really funny and makes taking religion courses that much more enjoyable!! I want to take him for all my Religion classes!!

loved the class. didn't have any interest in religion prior to this class and still doesn't but willis makes the religion ge not too bad. he consciously tries to make his lectures more interesting b/c it is in elkins so he wants ppl to pay attention. overall, a great professor.
A really great guy. HIs tests are easy if you use the study guide. Tries to make class fun by cracking bad jokes. Very nice and approachable. Religion is a boring class, but he made it alright.

Do not miss class! but..if you listen to that advice then you will do well.  I never read the book..everything on the tests comes from class notes.  he brings cookies to his classes.  he didn't leave much of an impression on me but was a nice and fair teacher.  i have never heard anything bad about him.

expresses the material clearly. Take good notes in the class and study. Quizzes EVERY single class on the reading so you'll need to show up. Great personality an overall nice guy with  snappy jokes that got a majority of Elkins laughing. The class is kind of hard - however read the material and study a litlte at night and you'll be fine.

Class can be slow, but Dr. Willis is a great prof. He shows different interpretations of the Bible and forces you to think for yourself. He also brings cookies to class and gets to know all his students. Can be a challenging religion course compared to others, but well worth it.
He's a nice guy I guess but I just didn't like his class. It was boring and I had it at 8am which didn't help. It was really easy though, espcially compared to the other religion teachers.

Took him for my REL101 in Elkins at 8am the first semester of my freshman year. The class is boring and hard to stay awake in, but then again, its the Old Testament - I'm a Christian but its pretty DRY material nonetheless. Basically just take good notes and don't skip class. He takes attendance and is a very nice guy if you get to know him

I took this class because I heard he was easy. Well, he's NOT EASY ANYMORE! Apparently he got too many 'easy' evaluations and decided to be hard. But hes still an AWESOME guy. He brings cookies for his class! Oh, and he lives on campus so dont count on class being cancelled due to weather conditions or mud slides.

Dr. Willis, he is such a wonderful teacher! very good and interesting teacher! tests are pretty easy. very very nice guy! he brings cookies to the class once a week!! yo!! they taste so good...love it! remember, take his class and have fun!
Good prof.  Dry sense of humor makes his classes moderately fun (but they are certainly interesting).  He can be a little boring at times, but never intolerably so.

Willis is a good prof.  The class is pretty easy and he made it interesting.  Quizes everyday but read the assignements and you will be fine.  Take him because I have heard all the other prof's are hard.
He's a good teacher, and his lectures are interesting.  However, the tests are very difficult.

Although he is really short, he makes the history of Israel interesting, even at 8 in the morning. His powerpoint slides makes it easy to take notes and make people laugh at him, even when his jokes are not funny. His quizzes are easy if you read the assignments, and tests are pretty easy too.

Interesting teacher, pretty funny, makes a rather boring subject (the Old Testament) interesting. As far as I've heard, all the other Religion 101 teachers are hard. This guy isn't. At all. Do your reading, study for tests for a couple hours, you'll pull an A no problem. Not much homework either.

dr. willis rocks my face off...his tests can be hard, but you'll do fine if you study.  great wry sense of humor, makes awesome cookies, really cares about his students.  he and his family are awesome!

Great professor, one of my favorites. Just make sure you read your bible and the quizzes won't be bad at all. Tests aren't too bad, just pay attention in class and study the night before and you'll be fine. But he is really nice and makes little jokes that are kinda funny.
He is a little man..kinda funny sometimes
Dr. Willis is a nice teacher who presents the material very well. Just do all the Bible reading selections and the quizzes and tests will be easy.
I love Dr. Willis and his family. Great guy, I recommend him for anything.
The cookies he brought to class were yummy! : )
His powerpoint makes it very easy to take notes, and he makes even the most boring topics humorous.  He knew everybody's name in a class of 150!  He's a great guy,  take this class
No Comments

Great teacher. Powerpoint is fun and nice to take notes from, though lectures can get a bit monotonous (but it's more likely due to the material than the teacher). Wife bakes cookies for the class (very yummy), & has a good sense of humor. Great teacher.
Very good teacher, lectures can be dry at times.  Has quite a sense of humor too. Tests can be challenging to get above a B on.
he's an amazing teacher. u should take him for religion 101 definitely.the best religion teacher but it's a little boring to listen to his lectures (but fun cuz he's quirky) tests are a little hard.
Nice teacher, class can be monotonous.
Dr Willis is a very quirky, quick and amusing man. Great teacher
Very good relligion Prof.  Makes homemade cookies for class.
He's short and cute and sooooo nice.
Awesome teacher, everyone should take him for REL 101

All you really need is to go to his class, listen to his lectures and take notes, and memorize the terms + essay topics on the study guide. All the answers are in his lectures and if not, they're in the textbook. He's pretty accessible outside of class and answered a lot of my questions.

Only gave him a 2 instead of 1 because he offers 20 points extra credit. Other than that, he expects you to remember every single word he says. I'm a STEM major, and I was doing worse in this class most of the semester than my major classes. His TAs grade unfairly and nitpick the smallest of details. Do not take this class.

Prof. Givens taught in Elkins, so there were at least 400 students in class. For an hour and a half straight, he wouldn't shut up. He never answered any questions. You're graded on 4 exams. So if you fail one, that does not benefit you. I had to drop the class because I bombed the first exam. He offers you extra credit, but it is worth very little.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: People who said his lecture slides and study guides are clear, they are lying. His lecture slides only consisted of key terms and outlines; you have to listen very carefully while trying to write down everything he says. His study guides only have key terms from the slides - pretty much useless. AVOID if you don't know history already!

The only assignments were four exams and an extra credit assignment. If you didn't do well on the first exam, there was no way to raise your grade after. He is super passionate about what he teaches but expects everyone to remember every sentence he says. The essays on the exams are graded by the TAs, and it felt like they all graded subjectively.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Givens has a rep for being hard but he expects you to know what he teaches you. Going to lectures is a must. The entire test is based on the lectures so take notes. He gives a clear study guide and great/detailed slides. The tests were a bit hard initially, but you get used to what type of things he asks. He is very passionate and a nice guy!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Had to drop this class. It's graded like a senior level major class, and not a GE. Your grade is only made up of four tests and minimal extra credit. I studied for 8 hours, and still got an F on the first test - and now have to drop. I appreciate the study guides and clear powerpoints, but spare yourself it's just a GE...not worth the stress
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of the hardest teachers I have every had! Always wanted to help but was very confusing. Most of my friends in this class failed his tests. Felt like I never understood the material even though I asked for help so many times. He talks super fast in class but is very knowledgeable. Supper passionate but a very hard teacher. Expects a lot!!

Basically all the people who give Dr. Givens anything besides a top score are pretty stupid. If you are a stupid person, listen to them, otherwise you have nothing to worry about. I never read any of the course material and only got A's in his course. If you think he is a hard grader or boring, drop out of Pepperdine and go to a community college.

Let's face it. This is an Elkins class, you won't show up. You'll still get a C, maybe even a B. I managed an A-! Tests are okay, there are plenty of study guides and test banks floating around. You'll do fine. He gave a generous curve on the final and offered 20 points extra credit for a real simple assignment. Take it and get it over with.

great prof, very passionate, knowledgeable, and responds to emails fast. V lecture heavy, so def prepare the ppt outline b4 class, you won't be wanting to copy the bullets while he's giving key info bc he talks fast and alot. He's nice enough to give a study guide w terms in chronological order AND the essay question. Just study and do your part!

Great professor! He lectures a lot and goes very fast so make sure you take notes. The tests kind of spring up on you because there are few assignments. A lot of required reading, but not all necessary. Make sure you do at least some of the outside reading because there are some points that you will be tested on that he will not cover them in class
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Do not take this class; if you get placed into his class for first year seminar, drop it. You will ruin your GPA for a class that doesn't matter. Take any other class. His lectures are boring, and there's a lot of daily reading. His tests are also extremely difficult.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dont take him for your first year seminar. All youll do is read and sit through the most boring lectures. There arent many assignments, so your grade is based on a few things. Hes an alright guy but taking this class is GPA suicide unless you truly love the subject hes teaching. He expects heavy participation from his students.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Nice guy, but don't respect him as a teacher. I took him for a freshman seminar class, and it was more work than most of my other classes, even though it was only worth 3 credits. Grades papers SO HARD, as if you're a grad student instead of a freshman. I accidentally chose his class for my seminar, and I definitely regret it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: A fun professor! A little quirky, but in a great way. Loves history and so much more. He teaches well, and breaks up his lectures with brief tales from the time period in question. I've taken two of his classes, and will be taking more before I graduate!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Givens is an enthusiastic professor and teaches interesting material, and in an engaging way. He loves history and includes fun, exciting, disturbing, and informative stories and anecdotes related to the time period in discussion when lecturing. Three to four tests, one paper, all very doable as long as you show up!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: BG is the man. Really quirky but a nice guy. A true expert in this subject and totally focused on teaching his students. You will have to attend class take notes and do the readings for the essays. If u do easy A there's allot of extra credit. If you work a little you might actually learn something cause its an interesting class with a good prof.

Kinda quirky but a dude who cares a lot about the subject. He grades pretty harshly on essays and really wants you to give solid evidence/proof. GO TO CLASS, or you'll miss important info. His lectures are pretty long and kinda boring but you won't really get the relevant information if you don't go. Tests are easy, but the essay portion is hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: Really good class. If you actually put time into learning the material, you'll do fine. Givens is a bit odd but very knowledgable, and I appreciated how much I got out of this class. For real, don't stress too hard about his level of difficulty, it's seriously overstated here. Plus he offers a ton of extra credit. I highly recommend him.
Fantastic lecture but harsh on exam essays. Go to class, pay attention, talk to him after class. But worth it. A little quirky but super smart and interesting teacher
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: He reviews doctors publications and I believe he holds his students to the same standard of writing. He is very knowledgeable on the subject. This class had extra credit which saved me. Defiantly do not take if you have a 4.0. That will change if you take his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: I'm sure he's a great man outside of the classroom, but you teach a general education class. There is no reason for this course to be the hardest out of all the classes I have taken at Pepperdine. It's tailored toward one kind of learner with no chance to redeem yourself. I'm sorry, Dr. Givens, but you ruined my GPA and I don't like your teaching.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Givens is a really funny dude, and a bit of a nerd. His class is not for those looking for an Easy A, but you will learn a lot. He is a great instructor, and knows his material very well. His assignments are challenging, but by no means impossible. Take his class seriously, but enjoy yourself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Without a doubt the worst class Ive ever taken. Extremely difficult, complete waste of time, useless information, boring, and all name memorization. Tests are very difficult and grades completely unfair. No EC. Save your time and sanity and take hum 212 over summer with someone easier and knows how to teach without inconsistent TAs grading tests.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: One of the hardest classes Ive taken. He really takes points off on the short essay portion of exams. There isnt really extra credit. One of my tests was scored wrong. You have to read a full book plus 2-3 text chapters per test. His lectures are REALLY hard to follow. Half the time you dont know what point hes on or what hes talking about.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Givens is a good dude, HUM 212 is a terrible class. Boring and complicated. Essays being worth 50% of the test is ridiculous and theyre fairly in depth. You can get a B if you study the study guide WELL and know much about the key terms + navigate a good essay. Its a hard class not gonna lie.

HE HARDEST CLASS I have ever taken. I am a transfer and I came into Pep. as a junior with a 4.0 GPA. This semester I also ended up with all A's and B's.. except for this class where I got an F and need to retake it. Lecture heavy, so I attended every class, studied all notes and every test I failed. If you can't remember names, you will fail. No EC
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Tests are based 50% on lectures 50% essay. Extremely difficult memorization of French names and subjects. 4 tests and thats it. No real extra credit and no curve. Material is extremely boring and dozens of king Louis. Will not learn anything useful and complete waste of time. Im a straight A student and I ended with a C in this class. Class sucks

He's obviously so knowledgable and passionate about the subject but man is this class way too hard for a GE. The only other class I've had that was graded entirely on four exams was O-Chem (definitely not on the same level). This class should have way more buffer for students so that one exam doesn't screw you over.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Brian Givens is very passionate about the subject he teaches, but would be much better suited as just a history teacher. His tests are ridiculously hard and you have to write long essays on each one. His lectures are insanely boring and are all over the place. I go to class but I literally have no idea what he is saying most of the time. STAY AWAY
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Bryan Givens is one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. Sit in the front of class, listen to his lectures, and you will find that his passion for history is infectious. He's hilarious and truly knowledgable. I found his lectures to be highly enjoyable--almost like a story time every class.

If you go to the lectures and actually follow along and take notes, you'll understand the main ideas. He gives study guides which is great. For the essay part on the exams, I just studied the book summaries and that was enough to get As on the exams. I bought the textbook but didn't really use it except to define some terms he didn't go over.

Professor Givens is one of the best storytellers I have met. I was always engaged in his classes, and he didn't use too many technical terms that made his lectures hard to follow or boring. Pay attention to everything he says, often extra credit is offered for little things he mentions in class. Sit in the front and he'll like you. Great guy.

Givens class was only 4 classes each worth 25% of your grade and that was all. His lectures aren't very clear and so you have to study for hours just to pass. If you mess up on one test you're screwed because it is worth so much of your grade. Humanities alone is a tough course, but Givens makes it impossible. Don't take him

Dr. Givens is a very smart professor. His lectures might get overwhelmingly, but if you do the reading, you will be able to follow him. There are only 4 tests, so study hard. He gives a study guide filled with key terms. Make sure you do the secondary reading (3 other books) because they are important for the essay portion of the exams.

Literally never went to this class and still got a C. His lectures are all over the place and his power points are not helpful, so i chose not to go. Just make sure you learn the terms on the study guides and read up on the topics of the extra readings for the test essays and you'll be fine.

He's got a passion for the history.  He teaches through narrative so its easy to understand the subject.  get ready to read, but it's totally worth it.  Also, he brings snacks.  and you get to watch Decisive Battles-- awesome!
He seems very passionate about his teachings, but for a GE, he spits out way too much information at once and expects too much out of you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Test are extremely difficult.  If you can avoid him, please do. He's very enthusiastic, w.e. His grading is too difficult for a GE. And for the exams you just memorize everything, which is terribly annoying.

A passionate guy, but honestly, he's a terrible professor. He hops around SO much that it's impossible to follow him. He's like a rocket that takes off while the astronauts are trying to board. He'll talk about the 100 Years War, skip forward by 50 or 60 years and then back to the 100 Years War. Also, he talks SO fast, so get your fingers ready.

Lectures are kinda long and aren't super helpful, but the reading makes everything super clear. Definitely a possibility to pass the class, but you have to work for it and really know the material inside and out.

Expects too much from kids in a GE class. His TA's are crappy graders and he won't read your essays himself even if you ask him to. Have to memorize tons of obscure information and be prepared to write ridiculously long essays during tests.  He lacks clarity and specificity. Unfortunately he never repeats himself.
Best professor ever!
Interesting experience for sure! very enthusiastic! My favorite professor by far!
Good guy all around. He is very helpful and cares about his students
Great professor! Great lectures! Awesome experience!
Bryan Givens is amazing. You can tell he loves what he does and is always willing to go the extra mile for students!

Please, I am begging you DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! Brian Givens is literally the WORST teacher and person I have encountered in my life. I almost left Pepperdine because of him. His style is abominable, he literally is out to get students, and his tests are  miserably hard, especially the ridiculous essay. I got a B+, but it killed me. STAY AWAY
horrible teacher.

Enthusiastic teacher who does his best to keep a very dense subject interesting. He gives you the important "terms" to study before tests, making exams pretty manageable. The only thing I hated were reading quizzes, which require hundreds of pages of reading for 10-question quizzes. Wasn't my favorite class but enjoyed it a lot more than HUM 111.

This must be his first year teaching Humanities.. very unclear, and rambles a lot. Hard to pay attention because you never know what hes talking about. Tests are really specific so you have to study A TON!! not much reading, but you get lost listening to all his talk about wars.. and of course altoids.

Note: when I rate him as easy, that's only relative to other GB profs. You still have to write good papers, but he doesn't expect research on them, and his reading loads are more manageable. He's a nice and reasonable guy. Also, if you have any chance to go to his Friday films, GO!. He has amazing taste in movies.

Blaaaaah!  Not a great teacher at all... there's no incentive to talk and when people do it's never interesting.  I dreaded the class every time and the paper prompts were terrible.  At least he's an easy grader....

best gb's prof! i took him for gb's 2 and i'm takng him again for the 4th one. out of all the prof's i've taken for gb's (marshall, ditmore, givens) he leads the best discussions which makes it very easy to get involved. i've noticed that the more involved you get the easier it is to write a paper so come to class, talk alot and you'll get an A
definitely did not want to take his witch-hunt seminar... ended up being a lot of fun! he expects you to do the work, and is a great guy.
sometimes he can get a little caught up in the details, but you leave the class really knowing the material.... and he's hott.

Never has a man made a receding hairline look sexier.  His knowledge of Altoids is much deeper than his knowledge of European history, but that is totally fine with me.  He will be in my dreams tonight.

Does his mother know that he is out this late? How did such a young man with a wide knowledge of pop culture get to be so learned in history? I feel myself questioning my own sexuality 2 mornings a week. xoxo
a great, YOUNG professor - has a wide base of knowledge to share with students. loves altoids and movies. hard tests. one of the only european profs, so a nice change of pace

Very likeable middle aged guy. Jokes with the class a lot. Knows a lot about the material he is presenting. Tests aren't too difficult however he grades hard. Just a plain nice guy whos a little too obsessed with witch hunting.

Let's see... he is a very easy grader and very easy to sweet talk... slightly obsessed with altoids, his ex girlfriend who dumped him and horror movies. If you want a chill GB class and not too much work then take him. I loved him.
Kinda wierd but a good prof and fun class
Good teacher and a nice guy.  Aparently his great books classes are easier than his history classes.  Must work to get an A.  Worth taking his class though, he loves what he's talking about
He is a nice guy who is addicted to altoids. He always has them and talks with a lisp when he is eating them which is the majority of the time. Class is pretty easy, nothing too hard or unexpected.

Overall a pretty chill class. HE can be vey weird sometimes, but he really loves history and provokes you to get thought out of the class. Reading the books  and about 5 papers are he only real work one has to do. I would definetely suggest him if you want to enjoy the great books seris.
Inconsistent grader. Nice guy but crazy too. Good teacher but with great books there has to be a consistent level of what is expected and there isn't.

Professor Givens is one of the easiest teachers that I've ever encountered.  The Great Books program is discussion based so it doesn't take a lot of work to get the participation credit.  He doesn't have tests or quizzes, just some papers that most kids do really well on with little effort.
Free textbook

Prof. Daum is one of the kindest professors I've taken. He is a tough grader, but gives specific feedback and genuinely wants all of his students to succeed in academics and life in general. As long as you really try, you can pass this class with a B or higher.

Professor Daum is a good professor, he knows how to engage the class, and makes your early boring com180 class interesting. The problem of Daum, he is a very tough grader, which makes it almost impossible to get an A. Moreover he is very not helpful and mean at his office hours when a student needs help or has question.

Amazing professor. He's caring, respectful, and light-hearted. Pay attention to the rubric and follow it closely before writing your speech; you will do fine. Practice in front of classmates before to ease nerves. Daum is an amazing human who goes above and beyond for all his students.

Professor Daum is such a great teacher and he really cares about his students, but he is such a tough grader. It seemed like no matter how hard I worked or how long I prepared for his speeches, I would never get the grade I deserved. It was really disappointing and felt impossible, but I really like him as a person.

Five major papers are due at the end of the year along with weekly discussion posts. If you stay on track with the papers this class is a breeze. The lectures are very interesting and he is a sweet and caring guy. He will be very reasonable with absences, but values respect.

Prof. Daum is probably one of the nicest professors out there, only issue is that he grades so incredibly difficult on the speeches when most of the class are beginner public speakers. Try to take another professor if possible because an A is almost impossible but at the same time it could also be much worse
Weekly lectures, semi weekly quizzes, weekly discussion posts and a total of five four page essays. Easy if you manage time and engage in class discussions.
Prof Daum is great. The course includes participation points, 5 quizzes, and 10 two-pages journals.

Daum is one of the best. however, he can catch you off guard because he is SO nice and funny sometimes you forgot he is a prof who will grade somewhat harshly. A few easy quizzes, a final, and two sets of journals. Not a heavy class, DEFINITELY TAKE HIM but just remember to give effort in your assignments because he comes off more chill than he is.

I would highly recommend Professor Daum's religion class to anybody, Christian or not. Prof Daum is a wonderful person who truly cares about his students, and he welcomes everyone's viewpoints. He is very encouraging and flexible, and his lectures are engaging. Grade is mostly based on journals/reading reflections along with a few short quizzes.
Fun

He's a really nice guy but he grades you like he'd grade a professional speaker. From what it seems, only 1 person in my 20 person class got an A. He expects you to learn the history of public speaking and demands that you learn every aspect about giving a speech (there are way more than you think). Extremely hard grader.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Even though I love giving public speeches, I did not enjoy this class. He is a very tough grader. If you miss class, it will definitely affect your grade, even more than your test grades. It's hard to get a hold of him outside of class and don't expect him to give accurate reasoning for your grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Possibly the most loving, caring professor I've ever had, even at Pepperdine. Incredibly relaxed classroom environment, and endless forgiveness. Grade is made up almost entirely by 2 tests, but they aren't hard at all, and there are 2 journals to help boost the grade. 10/10 would highly recommend Greg Daum for any class
I really liked him as a person but he was not my favorite teacher of all time.

Daum is the coolest. Even as someone who didn't want to take another Religion class, I thoroughly enjoyed this class. He is careful to try and understand things from all view points, which I really appreciated, and doesn't try to convert anyone, just gives facts. Such a sweet guy, and he is always there to talk if you need it, which is really nice.

I loved Daum as a guy. He is great and energetic and enjoyable, even in an 8am class. He really loves what he does and I appreciated the effort he put into class. My problem with him is that he grades speeches for things he never mentioned being wrong in class. Study for tests bc they aren't easy and take him for REL instead.

He tricks you by making you think that he is an easy grader. All the material in class seems like common sense but when you get the test, you'll be surprised. His tests are nonsense. He makes it as difficult as it can be and tell you "maybe you didn't study enough, don't blame me." It is definitely a hard class unless you really like the material.

Professor Daum is such a wonderful human being! He really cares about his students and does an amazing job of trying to get to know each and every one of them. His lectures are really easy to follow along to and he is always available and eager to answer any questions that you might have. You have to take him at least once.

I just got done with Professor Daum for COM313 this past summer. Though I think he's a good person at heart, his grading system is very strange. I worked really hard in his class and even handed in my work early, and I got an A- in the class. Even though he is a great teacher, I am warning you... He pulls your grade out nowhere.

Take Daum for anything and everything. He cares so much for his students and is an absolute angel. Don't be fooled - his classes aren't super easy. He has high expectations. But if you pay attention, participate, and stay engaged, you'll love him and the class, and high grades will come naturally.

Daum gives a reasonable amount of work for this GE class (some other professors should take note of it).  Your notes are essentially the test.  If you study your notes for the exams and turn in your journal on time, you can pretty much be guaranteed an A.  But be warned...I didn't always agree with his religions views.

Professor Daum is by far one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. If you have the opportunity to take his religion course (which he only offers occasionally), TAKE IT! The class is by no means easy to get an A but fairly easy to get a B. He is so passionate and such a caring man. He always lets you out early and there's basically no homework.

His grading for this course is extremely unreasonable for a GE course! He tells students the first day that they should've taken this course at a community college! He rarely gives out A's. This class was useless and didn't improve my public speaking skills in the slightest--if anything it increased my anxiety!

Daum is a tough grader, but he tells you that the first day of class so don't expect anything different. A is not impossible but you will have to work. He is by far one of the best professors I have had a Pepper. If you want to learn and get better at speaking, this is your guy.

Professor Daum is an excellent  teacher. He really cares about public speaking and teaching, so if you take this class, you will learn a lot of information that will benefit you for the rest of your life. That being said, prepare to work. You have to TRY to fail, but he rarely gives out A's. I would recommend this class to those who want to learn
He's the reason why I wanted to be a speech major. I totally recommend him: he actually loves what he teaches!

Exceptionally difficult grader.  I spent literally 10 hours one Saturday and 5 hours the following Sunday working on a speech only to receive a B on it.  Very, VERY hard A.  He is an AMAZING guy but I would rather have him for religion than for speech.  Do NOT take him for an easy Speech 180 course!
Not a very hard class, but tough to get an A. Read and you will be fine. Tests are very easy.

I had Daum for Speech 180 and Religion 102 and I really liked him. Speech, he is a hard grader and I liked him much more in religion. He made me so much more interested in actually understanding my religion. But study for the tests! He does try to be like one of the kids sometimes, but he will also help you if you get in a bind. Great guy!
Daum was an amazing teacher!! He was alot of fun and uses different teaching methods to switch it up! But don't expect to breeze through the class, you have to work...

Public speaking has always been a breeze for me, and I found it very difficult to make an "A" in this course. Daum constantly challenges you and is a really nice guy, but DO NOT take his class if you're expecting a blow off course.
No Comments

Daum plays favorites in class and on the grading scale.  He is way too worried about what his students think of him and tries hard to impress, especially the female students.  I found his insights were shallow and his character superficial.  Take him for an easy grade but not for edification.
Daum is totally awesome!  Just make sure you are on time and give interesting speeches.  He doesn't put up with lame people who are late.  Down to earth and very cool dude.  Loves to surf.

Daum is the best! Loved his class and his desire to get to know everyone in his class.  Seems to genuinely care about those who are interested in learning.  Even the non-religious students seem to love him...

Daum is the best! Loved his class and his desire to get to know everyone in his class.  Seems to genuinely care about those who are interested in learning.  Even the non-religious students seem to love him...

I started SPE terrified of public speaking. Daum made it fun and interesting. He is a great teacher and what he expects of students is made clear. He is a tough grader on speeches and demands thinking creatively, but very straightforward about material to appear on tests: only what was emphasized.
Very very clear.  Take notes off the powerpoint and study them for an A.  He said **** in class one time.  That was awesome.  Very "youth group leader"-esque.  Contribute to class discussion...

Daum is a good professor.  Very interesting perspective on life.  Great speaker himself.  Class is difficult but entertaining.  That two hours went by faster than a majority of my other classes.  Only negative thing about Daum is that he will be so bipolar sometimes.

He is really nice, personable and helpful.  He makes the class exiting and his open-mindedness on the topics presented throughout the semester is quite refreshing.  It's not extremely easy to get an A in his class but it's not impossible.

Daum is a nice guy, but he can be really anal about tardiness and absences.  He has these really erratic mood swings that catch you off guard a lot and that bothers me.  He also plays favorites and it's really obvious who they ware.  He's generally a good person though and an overall decent teacher.

Has lots of personal examples and interesting stories. Very down to earth, and is clear in his expectations. Calls on the same people a lot, but usually b/c they tend to have good insights. Makes class interesting even if you aren't especially religious. Grade = midterm, final, and journals.

Daum is an interesting guy.  He definitely plays favorites majorly and is really harsh on grading for a GE.  It is pretty hard to get an A in his class and he lets you know it.  He is a little goofy lookin too.  Wouldn't recommend, really gets on the nerves after a while.

Plays favorites. All the positive comments below are the students he liked. He irrationally grades speeches & papers. He does not communicate well nor teach well. Its unfortunate, because outside of class he's a great guy.
No Comments
one of the best prof. here....even though hes a great person doesnt meant its an easy A. takes a decent effort to get an A, a B on the other hand isnt so hard.
Very kind, but comes off sort of fake, like he's trying too hard. Grades papers easy but speeches a bit harder. It was a really fun class, though.
No Comments
he is the nicest and down to earth guy, very passionate about what he teaches and interacts with students well. DEF take him if u have the chance!!!!!
COMPLETELY AMAZING!!!  Definitely passionate about whatever he teaches.  He puts you at complete ease in SPE 180.  Quite simply put, he is one of the best.

can give low grades on speeches and exams that don't always seem justified-assigns entire book for reading but doesn't discuss much in class-teaching doesn't really inspire or intellectually challenge the student-also seems to show spurts of favoritism
He is really a cool teacher! His class isn't all that hard!! He doesn't give alot of work, really easy class. Can't remember what I have done this semester, but who cares! I did my speeches.
Cool guy but classes are a challenge.  He is an awesome person in general though.
good man...enough said
Greg is a good professor.  He's funny and down-to-earth.  He is very passionate about the subject he teaches.
Daum's a really cool guy. Very down to earth and enjoyable. He'll make you laugh just make sure u show up to class and give good speeches.
he is one of the best professors/teachers i have ever had in my life.
No Comments
it's hard to explain, but everyone seems to be enjoying life when Daum is around
BEST professor I've ever had. Doesn't play favorites, just doesnt like em DULL
Highly demanding, yet identifies with students on a personal level. Fun class.
Daum is da Bomb!
He loves what he teaches, cares about his students, and helps you to improve!

He tends to ramble about random stuff during class which really eats up the time given that each class is only 50 minutes long. Sometimes you don't even walk out of the classroom having learned anything because he got sidetracked. Lots of homework but definitely do them because they help you understand the topic more.

I love Dr. Iga! Such a good math professor and cares about his students very much. I took AP calc in high school so his class was very easy for me, but he was still a great teacher. Would absolutely take again. Any bad reviews are from people who either didn't apply themselves or just are gifted in math and would struggle no matter what. I Love IGA

Iga is a great professor. He cares about his students and is very joyful and laughs a lot. His lectures are very understandable and he does a great job of teaching. For 140 there is homework 4x a week but it helps with learning. The homework is tough sometimes but the grading is pretty chill, the tests can be hard though.
I took him in my freshmen year and I can say that he is a great professor, a bit difficult but because of the actual math, but he makes it easier. I highly recommend this professor.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Barely taught and when he did teach it wasn't taught well

Dr. Iga is brilliant but I could NOT learn from him. It's a difficult class and sometimes Iga didn't even know how to do the problems he assigned us. I went to his office hours often and it didn't help me at all (usually left me feeling worse). Unless you're a math prodigy who plans on reading the textbook front to back, I wouldn't take his class.

Dr. Iga is a great teacher and explains the material in such a way that you'll be able to understand the reasoning behind the concepts. The class was a bit of an adjustment in the beginning of the semester, but that's more due to the material than Dr. Iga himself. I highly recommend that you take his class!

Professor is super dedicated to math, yet very difficult to learn. I have taken calculus before but 80% of the stuff I learned this year I had never learned before. In my opinion, it was not necessary for the basics of calculus and we went way into depth about the least important parts. We had pushed the most important till the end.

Dr. Iga definitely has a well-respected background in mathematics. During his lectures, this becomes evident as he uses jargon and goes on unnecessary tangents that go beyond the material. Be ready to work with your classmates and learn from each other since going to his office hours did not really help or clear things up (at least for me).

Professor Iga is very amiable and intelligent. I feel grateful that I learned a lot in his Cal III class. I took this class online and it is not easy overall. However, he curves grades after final and his grading is very reasonable and fair. Professor Iga also drops 2 lowest HW score. It can be really helpful if you submit HW late by accident.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Iga is one of the best professors I have ever had. We had no huge exams - just homework, quizzes, and essays, all of which can be resubmitted until you get the grade you want. If you want an A+, you have to do an additional project. Overall, it was an easy class and the format helped me learn so much, just be prepared to work hard.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Iga is very intelligent and overall a great professor. There are lots of assignments, which can be very time consuming, but it forces you to stay on track. Lectures can sometimes get a little confusing, but he will answer questions if you just ask. Tests and problem sets are straight forward and fair assessments, but homeworks are much harder.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Iga was one of the best professors I've ever had. He shows passion for what he teaches, and he is able to make a boring topic interesting. He gives really good feedback as well. There is a lot of homework, but it's never super hard. I would recommend going to his office hours because he's a great one on one teacher. Take Iga!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Super nice professor! Work consists of problem sets, homework, reflections, 4 midterms, and a final. Homework is a lot so make sure you stay on top of it. His lectures can get a bit confusing but just ask him for help. His tests truly test your understanding of the concepts but they're not too hard.

If you have never taken Calculus, I recommend NOT taking Dr. Iga. The concepts are poorly explained and if you have not taken calculus, you will be very confused. Homework takes hours and is only worth 10% of the grade and the tests are difficult!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: 1) the amount of homework assigned is INSANE. people just end up copying answers from slader. 2) he sucks at teaching. yes, he is a really smart and caring guy. YET, he sucks at teaching. 3) If you are not naturally gifted at math, avoid him as much as possible. I took this course this year and only 5 people actually came to class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Iga is an incredibly intelligent mathematician, but his greatest weakness is in teaching calculus to people who have never seen it before. He's probably been doing calculus since he was in the womb, so it is hard for him to be empathetic with students who don't understand the concepts (which he tended to teach at a very advanced and quick pace)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Iga is an incredibly caring professor ;however, if you are not naturally gifted at math the class will be very difficult. He explains problems that people dont understand very poorly ,and gets offended when students dont understand how to do a problem. The tests are very hard as well. Dont recommend unless you absolutely love math.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: If you are naturally gifted in math, I highly recommend Dr. Iga. He is truly one of the friendliest and most approachable professors on campus. However, if you get frustrated when math professors move too quickly and skip steps when solving problems on the board, I do not recommend Dr. Iga. It is simply a matter of learning style and preference.

Kevin Iga is a gem. Homework almost every night but it HELPS. He is perhaps the most fair grader Ive ever seen. 8/10 points for knowing how to solve even if you cant. Study guides good but he is so technical they get confusing. Lectures are crucial. If you dont know something ask him right away to clarify. Not an easy A but an easy B.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Iga is a fantastic professor and an extremely nice man. He makes it his priority to engage the class during his lectures. The class is graded mostly based on tests, but if you do all the assigned homework, you will do really well.

He is one of the sweetest professors I have ever had. Iga is so smart to the point that he does not relate well to students who do not get it. Not an easy class, but he is extremely nice and wants you to succeed. I overslept the final and showed up an hour into it, and woke up to a text and email from him. Barely passed though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: This professor graduated from MIT!!!!!! Even more, he finished his PhD at STANFORD!!!! The class is also SUPERB! He gives helpful suggestions and goes over the content very well. His tests are also very reasonable, not too hard but also able to test our knowledge. Definitely will take his classes again if possible!

Professor Iga is the best Math teacher so far I had in life. He is very knowledgeable and his lectures are super helpful in helping you to understand the concepts, and ask him for help for any questions if you want to get an A. The 4 midterms and final are reasonable and he is lenient in grading.I highly recommend him and take him for Math 140!

He gives daily homework that really helps students to review every section that he explains in class well. His grading is also lenient and a really friendly person. If you think you are not really good at math but has to take this course, take his class because his explanation is clear and he goes over everything steps by step.
Tests are 60% of your grade. Homework is graded by student-graders who seem to arbitrarily dock points (but homework is barely worth anything). He teaches well and class was always fun.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Dr. Iga is an amazing professor! He explains things very well, so you can understand why everything happens and where everything comes from mathematically. He has the ability to somehow make math humorous which is fun. He is highly intelligent and fast-paced, which makes his classes very engaging though some people may find it hard to keep up.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Iga is a good professor. He gives homework everyday, but it's fair and you can do it if you go to the lectures. There are 3 exams and one final, which all four comprise 90% of your grade, so study hard for them. But, if you understand the study guide and do the homework consistently, then you will do fine on the exams.

Iga, he is a great man outside of the classroom. Inside he is the worst teacher that I have ever had. I might as well have taken the class on my own. He is NOT easy to understand and his examples are the most pointless absurd things I've ever hear. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.
He is a very nice guy yet sometimes he's examples are not even related to the hw problems. There is no curve or anything but his tests are very straightforward.
Great professor, funny, very clear with the material.  Makes concepts easy to understand.
I love this professor. He is intelligent and willing to help. There are many things you can learn only if you use his office time better!

Dr. Iga is an extremely intelligent man, and teaches a good Calculus III class. There is, at times, a lot of homework, and you are graded on correctness. He is very helpful outside of class, I took advantage of that several times. Very nice guy, I enjoyed it.

dr. iga is the man. his classes are pretty hard and expectations are pretty high, but he is very helpful outside of class. will always answer your questions regardless of the topic. he is a funny/awkward guy, but he loves his students. he will invite students over to his place, just to play games and hang out.

He is intelligent, but his teaching only makes since to him. He doesn't explain things very well, and he uses terminology and symbols that he doesn't explain. I ended up having to drop the class, and when I took it from another university, I got an A. He makes the class harder than it actually is.

He is very intelligent, but he can not teach. He explains things in a way that only makes since to him. He uses terminology and symbols that he doesn't explain. I ended up having to drop the class, and when I took it from another university, I got an A. He makes the class harder than it actually is. I'm good at math. I have never achieved less than

I have had Iga multiple classes. He is my favorite prof at Pep. He is a Genius and thus can lose students as he speeds through examples. He is more than willing to stop and slow down as long as you speak up and ask him a question. Almost always available outside of class for help as well. Also he has some awkwardness that you have to get used to.
Professor Iga is a genius, but doesn't know how to teach those who aren't on the same level as him (which is most of the class).  He speeds through examples and does a bad job of explaining.

he is a nice guy, kind of awkward to talk to but you can tell he does care about his students. He's not very good at explaining the topics and there's always one question on the tests that you've never seen how to do. His class is REALLY tough. You have to be ready to pour hours into the class if you want a good grade. Tests are very time instensiv

Good class but Iga is not easy at all.  Don't think anyone got an A in this class.  Insanely long tests that are also hard.  I think the final was over 30 pages long.  Lots of HW and serveral projects that are graded tough.  However, you will learn SO MUCH and Iga explains the material very well and is a complete genius on the subject!
He is super smart and extremely helpful and cheerful. Slightly socially awkward but you get used to it.

Hardest teacher I had at Pepperdine!  He's nice but expects more than other math professors I've had, but you do sure learn your stuff.  Tests are INSANELY long, so be prepared to work beyond lightning speed for a even passing grade.  You do get to use notes on tests tho.  Study hard, good luck.

I took him for nature of mathematics. he always hands out a study guide the week before a test and lets you use a cheat notecard on it. assigns easy hw every week. one of the smartest math teachers ive ever met! SO nice. he tries to make class interesting...can be boring at times, but its only 50 min. study the study guide, it's an easy A.

This class is one of the hardest math class I've taken. Iga doesn't seem to explain it enough in class for students to understand. Oftentimes he prefers to show students his own way of solving a problem but if you don't understand that way, you use the book and try to understand their way. Attendence is MANDATORY! if you don't go to class, you fail
He is a nice guy and a good teacher.  His tests are open note.
If you have a weakness for cuddling, he's your man.  Super smart guy and very sincere.  Nature of Mathematics is a really chill and easy A.

Super smart professor but closer in age to students than other faculty and preffered to "hang out" with students. Very difficult to understand as he is not able to bring material to the students' level. Seems to pick his favorites and anyone associated with them seems to get graded easier.  Willing to help, however I could never understand what he was talking about, even after having him for four classes while I was at Pepperdine.
Very socialy awkward, but super smart. Has intersting political views. Is probably a better professor now than he was when I had him during his first semester at Pepperdine.
Great teacher, very, very, very smart.
i couldnt handle the way he taught so i had to teach myself.
Awesome, super-smart professor!

explains concepts really well and thorougly, almost too detailed sometimes and runs out of time.  clear, easy to understand, but tests ask you to think more than just repeat verbatim.  lectures are interesting 'cause he brings in more than just the math.  good teacher, hard class.
MIT Grad!!!  This guy should teach Philosophy or Chemical Engineering.  He is the smartest motherf****r on the planet.  He knows like 10 languages and has an answer to everthing.

Tests can be pretty tough and long, but he grades very fairly and is very helpful outside of class.  If you keep up, know the material, and know how to think well, then it is very possible to do great in his class.

Iga lacks social skills but is the biggest genius on the planet.  He is by far the most intelligent professor at Pepperdine.  His class is not too difficult if you are decent at math.  If you really don't understand math, then take someone else.

He genuinely cares about his students-I was unprepared for the first exam, spoke with him about it and he let me take it a few days later.  He brought ice cream to class once for a lesson.  Plus he is sooo smart, like an asian Einstein.

Unbelievably smart, young and energetic, which are great traits but he often passes everyone up.  Tests are moderate to very hard. I failed once, then retook for a B.  Whatever you do, don't get behind on the homework!  Nice laidback guy outside of class.
he grades hw.....his midterms are always harder than the practice one and not similar at all....

He allows you to have an index-card for exams, he gives the test of the year before and removes the lowest mid-term grade. He also double majored from MIT and had his phd from Stanford. Probably smartest teacher we have in Pepperdine.

He is a nice guy. I love the attendance policy. If you dont feel like going, dont go. just give your hw to a friend because he doesnt take late work. He takes like 25 mins. to explain each quesiton, so ask wisely. the class is NOT overwhelming at all
No Comments
He's over involved... kinda sounds like the asian Kermit the frog. Genuinely nice and cares -- tough class, but clear. Just attend and do the homework and you'll pass.
Can't ever explain anything clearly, is extrememly boring and not very easy to talk to.  Do not take this class!
One of those guys who's so smart that he sometimes has trouble communicating on the same level as the rest of us.
boring, can't stay awake, gives in depth reasoning, relates to business a lot
Very smart. Class informative, lectured in monotone. hard to stay awake.

Took in Elkins. Lectures were easy to follow, if you are not an international student a lot of it is common sense/learned in hs. Lots of current events stuff. Reading is mainly articles about Congress and current events, theres a lot of them but they aren't too long and as long as you read them before the test you'll be fine. Very straightforward.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of the kindest professors in the school! I love his lectures as he makes poli sci so fun and relevant! He always has a smile on his face & is always happy to talk to students whether it be about the class / personal matters. 5 tests which are curved and pretty easy as long as you study (Can drop one too!). He also offers a lot of extra credit!

Professor Newman is so so kind, and despite finding poli sci boring, I still thought that some current events and other stuff he mentioned in class were interesting. Lots of readings but they're not hard to manage. All tests are MCQ and curved!

Update: after dropping my lowest exam I'll likely be ending w/ an A :) TAKE HIM! he's the best
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Newman was a delight this semester. His class is in Elkins, so attendance isn't mandatory, but I highly recommend going because he breaks the content down well. Lectures are very organized, tests are fair and pretty easy (I got a 100 on every one), and he's very kind and down to earth. One of the best poli sci professors here. Take him!

I had him for POSC 425- Media and Politics. He is a very caring and is always willing to help. He expects that students put in the effort outside of class. Those who are considering taking him for POSC 104, you should! You will need to attend the classes and take notes (you have to pay attention), especially if political science isn't your thing.

Take Professor Newman! His exams are really easy as long as you do the readings and read the slides. He also adds points to each exam depending on how the class did so I got 100% on all of them. Attendance is not mandatory. He gives lots of extra credit opportunities too and he is also overall a very nice person.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: One of my very favorite professors! Dr. Newman is quite experienced and knowledgeable, and a fantastic teacher. He is personable and made an effort to get to know students even in the large lecture. Reading was interesting and useful. Exams were simple and he offers many extra credit opportunities. Please take any of Dr. Newman's classes!

take newman!!!! 5 exams in total, lets you drop the lowest from the first four and adds a lot of points to your exams depending on how the class did. attendance is not mandatory at all as he uploads everything to courses.

Newman is one of the best professors that I have ever had. He is incredibly caring and understanding. His lectures and tests are very straightforward. His tests were very easy (I got 100% on the last 3 tests I took with him). He gives a study guide and a lot of EC. DO THE READINGS!! They are on the test so read them and do the reading questions.
Prof Newman is a great professor. You really have to study for his tests though but he provides a study guide. Take advantage of extra credit opportunities!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: SHOUT OUT TO DR. NEWMAN! He truly cares about his students. Such a sweet sweet professor! I'll definitely miss him next year!

Love Professor Newman: super funny, engaging lectures, very caring. As for the class itself, the tests are a straight reflection of all that is talked about in class and on the study guides so there are absolutely no surprises or nothing that you aren't prepared for. Just pay attention, take notes, study and you'll succeed in his class. RECOMMEND!!

I honestly hated politics before this class. Professor Newman makes polysci an enjoyable class - in fact, this is my favorite class. He is a really great teacher and prepares you really well for his exams! As long as you put the effort in, you should do really well!!

Professor Newman is amazing, and his class is very much doable. Make sure you do the readings and take good notes. His tests reflect everything he teaches you, so don't act surprised when you see it and don't study it. Graded on five exams, which he drops the lowest grade from the first four, a paper, and participation. My advice: make flashcards
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Best professor I ever had at Pepperdine! He really inspires you to THINK and LEARN. If you read the readings and review the ppt and notes before the tests, you should be fine. Professor Newman is an amazing human being. He cares for his students. Oh and plz go to his office hours. He is so nice.

Gosh, I love this guy! Probably going to add a Political Science Minor because I was just so inspired by him! He knows so much and is always leading us in super engaging discussions. He's extremely encouraging and, this may sound cheesy, he makes you feel so loved. Your grade is primarily tests, but they weren't very hard in my opinion. Take him!

Terrible teacher. Your grade was 80% tests, I went to his office hours to talk with him about doing poorly on a test, he told me to make flashcards. I had him for polisci104. Skip if you aren't a good test taker.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This professor is so so so kind. He is a little awkward, but don't be shy to say hi to him. He knows how to break things down to simple yet accurate descriptions, so don't be afraid to ask him questions during office hours. Take good notes during lectures, read the articles (!!), review a bit before the exam, and you should be fine for each exam.

Really sweet and he cares a lot. His tests were really hard for me and I went in for help after doing poorly on the first test and he basically told me to use flashcards. He doesn't offer a lot of solutions if you struggle in the class and if you don't test well you will do poorly in this class. Even when we did an open-notes test I did badly.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Grade is only made up of tests (all MC), but he curves a bit which helps. You could honestly not read the textbook, and he posts Powerpoints on Courses so it's not bad if you skip a lecture or two. He made political science a class that I actually kind of liked, which surprised me since I'm generally don't like political science all that much.

Only grades are 5 tests (MC, 40Q), he drops the lowest one. Review Ch powerpoints (study guide slides on all of them) & do article readings- you can get away with not reading the textbook. TA study session only helpful if you have specific questions. A few EC opportunities- attend something + write an essay. He loves to help in office hours! Funny.

The reason I switched my major... he's very articulate and knows the best way to stay subjective when it comes to discussing politics. He demonstrates amazing connectivity by getting to know his students and being on a first-name-basis with people amongst an Elkins class. I would highly recommend him. Also - LISTEN when he repeats things!!
Newman grades hard, but his classes are super fun and entertaining. I enjoyed going every class!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Newman is one of the sweetest professors I have ever had, BUT just be aware that your entire grade rides solely four test grades. If you do not put in maximum effort into going to this class and studying, the test could really screw you over. Amazing professor, but most definitely not an easy A.

Best professor I've ever had. I've taken two of his classes now and hope to take more. His classes are relatively easy, as long as you pay attention in class and study you'll do fine. Highly recommend!
best polysci professor by far. take him. hes super nice and helpful outside of class. if u study for his exams, an A is definitely achievable
Great professor. Not many can teach in Elkins and actually engage with students. Would highly recommend taking any of his classes.

On of the best professors at Pepperdine. He is organized and clear. He cares about his students and always listens to them. I love his current events part. Review the notes and do the readings, then you will be fine. I took the class in Elkins so we have five exams. He will record the highest 4.

Professor Newman is amazing, he really loves his subject and cares about the success of his students. Go to his office hours and have a conversation about the politics of the world and you will be inspired to do more in the political science field.  He is funny and makes complicated concepts generally applicable. Take his class!

Your whole grade is based off of 4 multiple choice tests, and that made this course really hard for me. I could write an essay a week to accurately demonstrate that I knew the information, but could barely pull off any of the exams. There is very little extra credit opportunity, and the extra credit that  is available only adds up to like 2%.

Easily one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine. He is an awesome professor. Although the class is not an easy A, if you put effort to really understand the material, you can do well. He is very helpful and wants everyone to succeed. I would highly suggest taking him for Poly Sci 104. You will walk away learning a lot.

I had Newman for 104 and he's the reason I'm a polisci major. He's just an awesome person in general and his classes reflect that. Lectures are always interesting and he is very helpful outside of class. Really cares for the students. His tests are a little hard, but if you don't cram it won't be too bad. Treats you like an adult, so act like one!

i failed the first two tests but aced the next two. I loved the class, though it was hard to find out what kind of tests Brian liked. You must work for the grade but the class is very interesting. Brian is a great man and will sit and help you understand things. Be sure that you know all concepts and how they work together, ask if you don't get it!

I have had Newman for two classes, and each were absolutely incredible! He makes sure to make each class interesting and has a great sense of humor. He respects his students and is always willing to work with you outside of class. Make sure to keep up with the readings and pay attention in class, because he expects you to act like a college student

Professor Newman is very helpful and very clear when giving instructions. His papers and tests are not difficult and he goes over the criteria in great detail. He always tries to make himself available to help students.

Had him for the major poli sci class (104.2). Nice guy but hard hard hard grader on papers. 3 papers: 2 argument analysis and 1 research paper. 3 exams worth 20% each. Read the book and memorize the power points. Tests are not too bad but make sure to study A LOT! Outside readings, debates in class..makes things interesting.

Dr. Newman is really nice and when I actually went to class I learned a lot. I hardly went to class and managed to scrape A's on the tests, by doing some of the reading and reviewing the slides. But, a lot of other people thought it was hard. I wish I had gone to class more, esp. because he covers current events. Take newman! and, go to class!
One of the niceset teachers at Pepperdine. We cover current events during class. He also has some really hilarious video clips during class. :)

Brian Newman is probably the nicest professor at Pepperdine. His class definitely wasn't easy, but you can tell he wants you to succeed. He is really passionate about his field and specifically his research with public opinion. I would recommend him for any class he teaches. He's a great guy!

Dr. Newman is amazing! He is always there to help. There are quite a few writing assignments for his 104 class, and he is a tough grader but if you double check your work and hand in an honest paper you'll get an honest grade. He is really one of my favorite teachers. He goes out of his way to be helpful and useful to his students. TAKE NEWMAN!!!!!

This was a great class. tons of current event stuff which was great especially with the primaries. really helpful and tries to get to know the students. there are some papers and a midterm/final, which you really need to study for.  he is a hard grader, but fair.  i highly recommend taking this class! he is a great guy!
good teacher, smart, helpful fair
Newman is terrific! He effectively balances a laid-back, enjoyable classroom experience with real learning and tough grading standards. Easy to get an A if you try, and you learn a lot. Great!

Dr. Newman restored my faith in the Academic world: he cares all of his students and respects the work they put in for his classes. His lectures are well crafted and are a testament to his dedication and knowledge.
Oh captain, my captain.  ~SNG

Newman is very passionate.  Make sure you contribute to discussion in this class.  Great GE course.  On tests, he tells you exactly what you need to know in each chapter.  If there is a discussion on a reading, take notes.  Not too much work, tests are definately passable.

This prof is awesome!! he is very engaging and makes an effort to make his class interesting. class is broken up into 2 parts - half the class is lecture and the other half is playing games, discussing current events or participating in some other activity that does not involve writing or taking notes. he is also fair & helpful
Professor Newman is a great guy.  His class on Cognress is fun (if that is possible), yet we learn a lot.  If you do your work and engage yourself in the class, you should enjoy it.

he is one of the best teachers i've ever had... he genuinely cares about his students and puts A LOT of work into preparing for class, grading work quickly, and improving his teaching methods every day. he respects all viewpoints and encourages participation. i love this class!!

By far one of the best professors @ Pep.  He is funny, very organized, open to all questions, easy to relate to, has a great sense of humor, offer constant and detailed feedback on all of your work, and is EXTREMELY helpful as far as study guides.  Lectures are fun, current events are actually made interesting, and the class was a blast.  Love him!
Such a good teacher. Not super easy, but very fair and clear. Patient with students and avoids bias in his teaching and grading. highly recommended.
LOVE THIS GUY!  Hard grader on papers, but if you go in for help he WILL help you.  I enjoyed this class very much, and newman is very smart and knows his material.  take this class

newman is a young guy, so he knows what its like to be a student and will often adjust the syllabus readings to simplify things for the students. if you ever talk to him, he is pretty cool and more than willing to help. media and politics does have a lot of writing requirements, but the exams are pretty cut and dry. take him.

In a nutshell, he's a relatively new teacher who is still adjusting his system as far as tests and everything go.  Not overly hard, but you definitely need to study and pay attention in class.  Very helpful outside of class, and the class has improved  more and more as the semester continues.

definitely makes political science funny and interestting. he is always willing to help you out outside of class. do well on your essays and talk in class and you're good to go! there's only two tests (midterm and final) so study hard for those. overall great class!

One of the best GE profs ever.  Class is fun, not hard, not very much work, and there's all sorts of group dicussions and talk about current issues.  And we watched the Simpsons in class!  How often does that happen??  Totally awesome!

the nicest professor...extremely understanding. defeinitly take posc with Newman. he is funny, gives breaks, makes class intresting, presents material in intresting manner and cares about his students. very funny guy!!!

in one word: AWFUL. he is sooooo rude, and picks favorites... and doesn't like people for no reason. he is nice outside of class but he is a different person in class. I would stay away at all costs. Not worth it. Take this class with a teacher who is understanding and not two-faced!

best teacher in the world.... i love him. he's great... very helpful, very nice and understanding. class is fun, gets boring some times but he's funny... gives u breaks and lets u out early.... very sweet guy.

he is the nicest professor ever. he is very willing to help and tries hard to make the class fun. very understanding professor as well. since american people and politics is a GE, you should DEFINITLY take it with Newman. he is objective, tolerant, and accepts all points of view. wicked!

he is absolutely the worst professor on this planet.  picks favorites and hates other student for no reason and makes it blatantly obvious. he is not helpful, rude, and totally unfair in every aspect.  no point to study his study guides the tests are totally random! not happy with him at all!

Pretty good prof, tries to be as funny and interesting as possible. Does a lot of group work and interactive discussions. Debates every week. Midterm is pretty easy. Reading is virtually unnecessary. Do a good job on your essays. Participation is huge. Michigan State and Duke fan.

He is like the nicest guy and totally willing to work with you. A mid-term and a final 20% each....midterm wasnt to bad. 1, 5-7  10% page paper and 2 reaction papers (2-3 pages) 10%.  A debate 10% 1 easy ass. 5% and 15% is participation. So many differant options to suceed...reading not to important

His American People and Politics class is long but fun. He is such a funny guy and makes it interesting. We watch clips of Saturday Night Live! We have debates every week that are pretty interesting too. It's a good class! He is a VERY VERY nice guy.

Truly incredible. He has so many inspirational stories and really lived what he teaches. His class is pretty easy as long as you care. He honestly just wants to see some passion and he'll give you an A. This was the only class I never stressed over last semester. Outside of class, he's always willing to sit down and talk and gives great advice.
Dr. Banks is a caring professor full of knowledge and wisdom! The class is not mentally challenging however can be emotionally challenging. Overall, his course has left a positive impact on my life.

Banks is a great professor! He is always there for you when you need him. The class itself is fairly easy. You do have to read a few books, but they are worth your time. Participate in class. The field trips are so fun. Put effort into the essays.

I had Dr. Banks as an organization behavior professor in 1994.  He was such a caring and compassionate teacher and influence and I still share the stories that came out in his class with friends today.  He definitely changed my life ... I'm still talking about it.  Worth all of the vulnerability that you will experience in the class!!
Hands down the best professor at Pepperdine. He is incredibly inspirational and each class you take with him redefines your world view. He will put you on the spot in class, but it's for the best!

Take his class. Attendence is mandatory because you will refuse to skip. You make great relationships. You learn about yourself.  You get an A. You write a paper every week, but its very unformal and its about you, so it is easy and fun.  Beware: you might be challenged to step outside your comfort zone
The best professor you will ever encounter. Amazing course, wish it never ended. Life changing !
Bank is AMAZING! Inspirational and a very great person !
Really awesome guy with a love for all things service. Has a great heart, and wants to spread it on. Keeps class super interesting
Banks REALLY cares for his students and is such an awesome professor! I loved every day in his class and DEFINITELY recommend taking his classes!

Every trait about Professor Banks is one I admire.  He has challenged me to be the person I always wanted to be.  I am so glad to have him as a mentor.  My life has forever been changed because of Dr. Banks and I could not be happier with the changed that has occurred.

I am a freshman this year at Pepperdine, and I can say that Dr. Banks has made me feel so welcome. He tells us to call him "Uncle Jeff". He teaches you real life values, and puts you in hard situations, but its the best thing you could possibly do. I look forward to his class every week. TAKE SAAJ! you wont regret it.
As said before, legend. He's a great professor you'll most likely continue to keep up with throughout your years at Pepperdine!

Dr. Banks is the best  teacher I have ever had.  He has made a huge, lasting and positive influence in my life. He has passion and a huge heart. I love that he is Jewish.  We need more perspective here.
