Dr. Banks truly cares about his students and about his subject.  He is passionate, kind, understanding and challenging.  He is a true example of Christ.  He allows us to explore, grow, develop.  He is awesome
Awesome professor, even though it was an awkward class. I definitely would take another class by him though. Take any class taught by him!
believe the hype. banks is legend.
He was amazing. He is perhaps the only TEACHER I have had at Pepperdine. If you're on the fence, take his class!!

Dr. Banks is one of the best professors I have ever had. His class is so fun! I recommend it to anyone who has never taken it. He is an amazing man who is an inspiration and a blessing to everyone he meets.

banks is the best prof i've had at pepperdine yet. such a great person. he's got the biggest heart and so many memories to tell. the class was super easy, full of discussion and basically talking the entire class period. the other saaj profs are all english teachers so banks will tell you that he's not gonna be like them. LOVE THE MAN!!!
Professor Banks is amazing! He made me choose my Psych major. He truly cares about all of his students. 100% recommendation to take his class!

Dr. Banks is AMAZING. His students absolutely love him. He is the best kind of teacher - articulate, brilliant, and knowledgable about the material, but more importantly he knows and cares about his students. TAKE ANYTHING HE TEACHES!
An inspiring, sincere, and understanding person, who goes beyond being a teacher. His SAAJ class actually gives you some insight on being human- something that few classes do.  Highly recommended.

Human Relations was an absolutely amazing class, and Banks made it that way.  He really, really cares about his students, and you make some amazing friends in there.  You learn about yourself (cheesy but true) as well as the material.  I would recommend this seminar and professor in a heartbeat.

Dr. Banks shares a passion with his students --a passion for understanding, a passion for growth, a passion for wisdom.  He shares his wisdom with us and makes me strive to be a better person.  This course is such an important learning experience.
Dr. Banks was a divine tool in my life.  I will never forget his kindness, compassion and integrity as well as the challenges that helped set this captive free.
Amazing class! Great professor and person.
He is the most amazing professor I have ever had. He is probably the best professor at Pepperdine. He genuinely cares about each and every student.

Social Action and Justice class with Dr. Banks is the best class I've ever taken. i was a little apprehensive about how his Jewish faith would play into the class, but it was actually beneficial if a factor at all. We took cool field trips, the tests weren't too bad, and compared to the other two SAAJ professors he's a God. very interesting stuff
No Comments
Dr. Banks provided a safe environment to examine yourself and understand your peers.  Invaluable class.  Dr. Banks is great.
The BEST!
No Comments
No Comments
He is so great.  He'll teach you business but also family values as well.
Dr. Banks was very encouraging and pushed us all to grow.  He dearly cared for us all and helped us to love others and ourselves.  He gave us tools to use for the rest of our lives.
Empathetic but firm.  Pepperdine is really expensive but Dr. Banks is priceless.  He knows what he is talking about

do you think banks would be a better spokesperson for social justice if he drove a 25 year old pontiac and a better teacher if he didn't help students with personal problems?  This man is the best!!!!!!!
amazing teacher.  i learned more from this group therapy type class then any other here at Pepperdine.

I think Dr. Banks has to be the biggest hypocrite. I love how he attempts to teach us about the injustices and poverty around us, yet he drives a merecedes. Furthermore, he gossips about other teachers and speaks to his students about their confidential matters. This is extrememly unprofessional, and not Ok! And good luck, if your anit-abortions.
LOVED HIM!Learn a lot through class discussion and simmulation. Which requires good facilitation. Knows his stuff.
Unreal...A must for any psyc major! You get to learn about yourself before helping others.  Prof. Banks is the greatest guy ever and is always there for you.  One of the best profs. at pepperdine
Awesome teacher! I have learned so much from him that I can apply to my personal life.
He pushes people to look into their own lives and learn about their passions, strengths and weaknesses.
I didn't realize how much I learned from Banks that was valuable until I was out in the "real" world.
He is there for you before class, during class, after class and even after graduation!
One of the best teachers I've had.  He is a great friend and makes the class very interesting and full of valuable lessons and experiences.  I definitely recommend SAAJ with Banks.

In his class, I learned a lot about the world around me, about life, and about myself. We talked about some interesting issues and read a couple good books. He's a quality teacher and a great listener. He'll talk to you about not only class but also your social life.
I don't know what that one student's problem was. Prof. Banks' class was fantastic. I learned so much about life. It's tough but such an incredible learning experience. I loved it and I'm a guy.

Dr. Banks is not someone I respect. He has no concept of working with morons in group project and does not provide value to a $25K a year education. If you can, elect out of his class, if you're a guy.
Best professor I have had at Pepperdine.
No Comments
BEST TEACHER IN THIS SCHOOL

Winner in my book for most admirable professor. I've retained and learned the most from my classes with him. Several books assigned for reading, but all are fully appropriate and beneficial to the course objectives and application to life.

The BEST teacher at Pepperdine...no question.  I hear the monster's at Seaver have taken away his famous HRV.  Do yourself and everyone a favor...contact Pres. Benton and get THAT class back!  He has saved my life.
Got the granpa-like trust thing goin', great teacher and really easy to talk to. Take a class of his if you get the chance, you won't regret it
Amazing human being. I can honestly say that he changed my life for the better.
Great teacher and friend/everyone should spend as mush time with him as possible/he has a lot to teach you
A nice man who helps students learn about themselves and others.
He is awesome.  He is a great person and a great professor.

Great professor who is organized, reasonable, and caring. She sets clear expectations and listens to student feedback. Her tests are fast paced but they are doable and there are no surprises. There are weekly quizzes but she tells you about them in advance. She provides review sheets that are helpful. She is easy to talk to and wants you to do well

Older rate my profs are outdated. Everything you are tested on are on her slides, so her expectations of what you need to know are very clear. Her lectures are interactive, and coupled with her weekly quizzes, you are encouraged to be actively learning and constantly reviewing. She sets you up to be successful in the course.

Not sure why she has such bad reviews. Yes, this is a hard class, but she gives you all the information you need in lectures, which are recorded and uploaded, and note slides. Don't wait to study night before exam. I didn't have issues with her tests, just remember little details. Will add that points are not weighed, so all points count the same.
check yo tests;  she not want to grade properly. makes the tests too fast even for the poggers students
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: She is a great professor and is available during office hours for any questions you may have! It is definitely a hard class and you have to keep up with all of the material from the lectures as you go, do NOT wait to study until you have an exam! Rewatching her lectures and writing down anything I missed was the main thing that helped me succeed.

This professor... does not understand the concept of helping students out. On the Short answer questions on the exam,  if you have the correct terms, she will give 0 points if it is not exact. Her extra credit counts as an assignment..so it doesn't help your grade; it just inflates the points. She isn't terrible, but improvement is necessary.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took Dr. Stiemsma for Cell Bio and I will say, the tests and assignments can be chaotic with the wording, so definitely ask for clarification. It is a tough class. Very fast, a lot of material, and things are often not very clear. My best advise is to rewrite notes, google a concept that is confusing, and just keep pushing, do not quit.

Amazing Professor, as long as you are studying and keeping up to date. Has some difficult moments for certain sections, however in certain slides some disorganization may be shown. However, she is very accessible during office hours and responds to emails quickly.

Speaking for my peers as well - I don't know why her ratings are so bad. Her lectures were clear and study guides were given in advance & she's very fair on exams (even gave extra credit for doing practice problems). I braced myself for nothing but a fun class and sweet and caring professor. Take her if you can but also be ready to put in the work

She's not the most organized teacher and it was quite difficult to structuralize the information when you have no clue what you are doing, but if you ask for help, then she's super helpful and explains in an understandable way.   You need to be an active learner to do good in class.

Not one of the best professors that I have had, but I also don't think that she is horrible. Her lectures were not super well organized, but she does cover all of the content that is asked on exams. She tries to get to know students personally during labs. Seemed like she was trying to actively improve the course by asking for student feedback.

I am honeslty at a loss of words that she is still a professor. She does not even like teaching and seems bothered to answer students questions and that she does not enjoy her job. This is wrong of pepperdine to hire a person who has no love of teaching.
This class was soo hard. Do I have to end my life and put my name on the final note for Pepperdine to finally realize that she should not be teaching there?
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Stiemsma is very rude to her genetics class and targets students who are having a hard time understanding concepts. Her office hours are a waste of time because she's always in a hurry to be somewhere else and she doesn't even seem to understand the concepts she's teaching. She is also not understanding that her exams are too lengthy.

If the hiring staff reads this review, stop hiring Leah Stiemsma. She's fake kind and lighthearted. Has major attitude issues. When the class is confused why does she continue to sigh, cut people off, and blame them for struggling? She made a borderline racist comment during lecture and could have gotten reported if the student decided to do so.

Genetics is hard but Stiemsma makes it way harder than it needs to be. Her tests are unnecessarily difficult and she doesnt do a good job teaching the exam material to begin with. She is also rude in class and office hours which is why students feel uncomfortable asking for help.

Really nice and I think she wants students to do well, but she is not available for help in office hours and even then she confuses herself. Her tests are really difficult and she does not give enough time for students to finish them. It's concerning when the class doesn't do well on an exam and she blames us for not going to office hours
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--Tough grader

comment: The only way to get an A in this class would be to donate to Pepperdine, of at least 10 million dollars. But lets get real, even if you take the most prestigious notes, you will not get an A. You have to be in her own brain to understand what she says and even then its impossible

She is the worst professor Pepperdine has ever had. I can't believe she is still teaching, no clear lecture subjects,makes the easiest subjects complex. Hundreds of students have all complained about her teaching experience and teaching capability. A third grader who watched one day of introductory biology could teach far greater + better than her

I just want to stay how extraordinarily horrible this teacher is and the entire biology faculty especially Dr. Brewster. For some odd reason she is not being taught the correct way to teach and Dr. Brewster does not do anything about it, shes had numerous complaints yet she is still teaching.

She should be learning Genetics not teaching it, she has trouble teaching because she cant understand the concepts, I really regret having her as a teacher, I had to learn the concepts myself, she made everything more difficult than it was, I don't know who hired her, but she is not capable of teaching. Gregor Mendel would be confused

I had her for cell biology, her class is the most unorganized class without any clear directions and her tests are extremely difficult, I don't know why she is still a teacher at Pepperdine, her reviews are awful, and her teaching is awful, yet Pepperdine does nothing, they must not care about the quality of education. They should be ashamed

I took genetics with Dr. Stiemsma and regret it deeply. She is not good at teaching the material and frequently struggles to clarify concepts to confused students. She is also a very harsh grader and will take off points for not including details that the questions didn't even ask for. An unnecessarily stressful and extremely disappointing class.

Hardest class I've ever taken, beware. She is a nice person but a brutal grader and her tests are super hard. You need to study her cell bio notes every day if you want to get an A in the class (which is incredibly difficult). Do the online readings before she teaches it in class so you learn it better because she expects you to know a lot.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Her tests were impossible and her quizzes were the worst, she puts things on the test that were never taught
Her slides are the absolute worst Ive ever experienced from a teacher. I didnt know what I didnt know in this class, garbage
Worst teacher Ive had I did not learn a thing in her class

If I had to rate the difficulty, I would say Its like taking calculus in mandarin: you will never win unless youre either fluent in her language or you know the subject already. Im not being dramatic when I say I had to get back on antidepressants becasue of her class. I spent so much time studying for nothing
Theres no point to listen to her lectures just watch ak lectures youll learn more and will be able to understand it compared to her style of teaching.
My iq lowered in her class. I definitely lost brain cells everytime she started speaking.
Her teaching is by far the worst at pepperdine, even if you ask questions it is still confusing and does not make sense. DO NOT take her class.
She made the easiest subjects difficult, what a disaster of a class, how hard is it for her to teach about cells. Ridiculous

I dropped this class two weeks into the semester, I needed to take this class its unfortunate shes the only one teaching in the spring. I knew when I walked into her class I should have never enrolled. Beware of her class.
She has no care for her students, I have no clue how she got this job. Pepperdine did an awful thing hiring her
Hate this class, professor is obnoxious thinks she knows the material, but speaks bs the entire lecture. Her lectures look like a child made them, awful and disappointing class. Dont take her
No clear grading material, tests are impossible and she acts as if shes the smartest prof at pepp. I hated this class, NOTHING made sense she makes the simplest things difficult.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I wish I had something good to say all I can say is what a horrible class this was. I didnt learn anything and nothing made sense
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Her pop quizzes dont relate to the material she teaches and she gives an inadequate time for her tests and quizzes. How does she expect people to finish, her lectures are just pictures off google and she always has to look things up because she isnt sure of the answer.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very disappointing class, by all means DO NOT HAVE HER she will fail you without even caring, she does not know how to lecture nor does she know the material she is teaching.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Her tests are too long for the time she gives us and her teaching is just slides with no pictures. Get ready to teach yourself if you take her because she doesnt know how to explain anything. Dont take her
Truly the worst class Ive taken her at Pepperdine. I advise you to take the fall class or the summer class and avoid her.
Horrible wanted to puke during her class, never take this professor, what a truly horrible experience this was. Last of her class I felt free from her
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Horrible class and teacher, shes always zoned out in her own world. She tries to be respected, but shes not. Maybe if she could actually teach people would respect her. Homework has nothing to do with the class, quizzes are legit impossible to take and her tests and too long to finish. My advice: dont take her for anything.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Tests are completely wrong, she herself doesnt know the material, and she thinks shes cool because shes young and gets a long with the students. But know one takes her seriously. Dont take this class
Her quizzes are ridiculous and she expects you to know exam material that wasnt even in her lectures. She doesnt care about her students and could care less about grades.
Sucks at teaching, doesn't explain anything. Study guide doesn't match the tests even though she says they do. expects you to be a genius if you want to pass. Really regret taking this class
Her pop quizzes are ridiculous and impossible, she doesn't explain why the answer is correct. Tests are too long and can never finish. She doesn't put care into her teaching

nobody respects her teaching, googles everything because she doesn't remember. I wish I could've dropped the class. Unorganized, office hours don't help at all. Her tests are so difficult and she grades tough. Would not take her
can't teach if her life depended on it, lectures are all over the place and don't make sense, she constantly goes off topic, would never have her as a teacher
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Wow what can I say, I paid attention everyday yet I still didnt know what she was talking about. Sitting in her class I realized just how awful this class is. Everytime class was over Ive never been so happy.
Tests and quizzes are impossible you need to be genius for this class, she could care less about students.

Lectures are not helpful and even if you do the study guide it will not help you, she puts stuff on the tests and quizzes that she doesnt teach and expects her students to know. Her homework doesnt make sense and has no correlation to bio. I feel like a lab rat in her class. This was a BAD class. Other teachers know she cant teach
Worst teacher at Pepperdine. Beware of her and I recommend taking it in the summer or fall and not in spring with her. You will regret it

She grades like she hates her life. She gives the worst tests and quizzes, not even Einstein could understand what she is talking about. This was an excruciating class, I learned nothing and I will never have her as a teacher and I hope no one does. Save yourself from her. She cant answer or teach a simple class, for a 50 minutes class it was bad
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Worst class Ive ever taken, would not even take this class again for a billion dollars. Do yourself a favor and stay away. She doesnt know about bio and cant explain anything. Why is she still teaching. Pepperdine do something. I feel bad for her students, she doesnt know how to lecture or teach nothing makes sense. Worst teacher and class.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Ive never had such a good sleep until I had her as a teacher I slept because her lectures were soo atrocious, her lectures didnt make sense and all I could think about was leaving her class. Tests were terrible, her study guide did not correlate to the tests, even though she said they did. I mean how hard is it to teach this class.

Dont ever take this class, this was the worst class Ive ever taken. I cant believe you pay 50k a year to have a mediocre teacher that cant even teach an easy subject. How is it possible that Stiemsma makes an easy topic impossible. That science division should really hire better and more competent teachers. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE

She is a new professor when I had her. She is an overall nice lady but her grading and teaching were absolutely awful. Her lecture slides have almost no labels and she is not a good lecturer. Her voice is quiet and it is very difficult to stay awake during her lectures. Her tests are impossible and so are her quizzes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: One of the worst professors I've had at Pepp. Her lectures are all over the place and are based on pictures, with limited text on the slides. Her pop quizzes are impossible and she's bad at explaining why the answer is correct when reviewing. Also isn't reassuring when she says she has to google something because she doesn't know. Tests are hard!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Her lectures are a little all over the place which can make the class hard to follow and a bit confusing. She's a really sweet person and seems to genuinely care about all of us but the class is definitely hard (and she's a tough grader). She also sometimes loses her train of thought in front of us or second guesses herself, which is confusing.

Professor is mean to students when they come to ask questions. She does not care about students on a personal level at all. Grades for spelling of ridiculously scientific words. Hands out grades or short answer arbitrarily. Ignores when students raise their hands in class. Almost no tests at the beginning, then you get slammed in the last month.

Dr. Cail is amazing! She has the best attitude and yes she lectures frequently, but the way she simplified complex concepts for psychopharm was so helpful. I learned things rather than just memorized material. Her stories and real world examples are hilarious, you will literally be sharing what you learn from her with everyone. Study her slides!

Learning & Memory is a misleading name as memory was never discussed- the bulk of 341 is classical/operant conditioning. Cail doesn't always make an effort to connect with students, but she has very clear expectations which will help you succeed. Nonetheless, the course is actually pretty interesting no matter how much work it may be.

Prof Cail taught my remote summer course, it was pretty easy but if you needed help she was there. During the end of the course I did start to feel the weight of how much information was packed into the few weeks we had, but I dont think this was a reflection of the prof. However, sometimes she did not clearly explain concepts which was frustating.

Professor Cail is definitely quirky but makes class super interesting. She tries really hard to make sure everyone is understanding the material and is always available to talk. She recognizes students have lives outside of class and makes sure deadlines are spaced out. I have taken two of her classes so far and will probably take more.

im a senior & ive never left a review on any prof ever-but i had to for prof cail. i have never met a professor who is so genuinely mean-spirited. i actually liked the class a lot, but when i had a personal crisis and started falling behind, she was blatantly rude, unprofessional, & didnt seem to care about the wellbeing of her students at all.

Dr. Cail is an angel and genuinely one of the coolest professors I've ever had. Psychopharm is very intense, but the way Cail teaches and sets up the quizzes makes it manageable. She really wants her students to succeed. Attendance isn't mandatory, but show up to classes because she explains things really well compared to just reading slides.

one of the best professors I have had at Pepperdine. If you do the work, she sees it and you will do well. A lot of quizzes and tests but they are easy as long as you listen to the lecture and study. Her classes gave me the least anxiety out of all. If people complain about her class, they probably just should have studied.

Cail's expectations are not unreasonable by any means, just confusing. The midterm paper was an easy A, but the final paper was harshly graded. The quizzes are mostly multiple choice- but the written answers are graded harshly sometimes. Her lectures are great, just take notes and study. She is not very personable and prob wont learn your name

She is truly such a passionate lecturer and it is evident she knows what she is talking about & cares that everyone learns from her lectures. She makes a 2 hour lecture fly by because of how entertaining she tries to make class. For tests she typically includes one or two things not on the slides that she explains in detail in class. Overall great!

One of the best lecturers at Pepperdine. Both her content and way of speaking are extremely interesting, especially for an Elkins class. She's honestly such a dope person, with many stories to tell from throughout her life. Attendance isn't mandatory and all of the test content is on her powerpoints!

Professor Cail is an amazing professor. She is very passionate about this course and I enjoyed her lectures. She is very straightforward, open to questions, and helpful during office hours. The course does require a lot of work and can be time-consuming: weekly quizzes, weekly labs, lab tests, an end-of-semester project, and a literature review.
You have to pay attention, however all of her slides and video lectures are available at any time. She's definitely one of the better Psych Profs at Pepp.
Her lectures are amazing, I looked forward to her class every week. Perfect amount of work for a GE and everything you're tested on is in the slides.

I didn't attend the class since the second month but I still got a B+. If you are not super interested in psyc, you don't need to attend the class. Basically everything is in the PPT, you just need to memorize those. If you start learning the ppt 2 days earlier and remember everything, you'll be fine.

I loved Cail and found her class extremely interesting. However, there were weekly quizzes that were a bit time-consuming to study for. Also, some of the labs were infuriating. Overall, Cail is definitely one of the best professors within the Pepperdine psychology dept, however quiz-heavy the class may be.

I really like Cail for who she is, but I am not the best test-taker, so quizzes being worth 75% of the class average has been a challenge. She reads straight from the powerpoints (doesn't exactly teach the material) so it's not the most engaging class either

I took PSYC 250 with Cail online over the summer and she made a typically difficult class fun and feasible for someone who is not the best at math. We had a ton of homework and quizzes every day, but she was super organized and always willing to help. The final is a killer so make sure you are paying attention as it was extremely difficult.

She is the best. As a psych major, I tried to take as many of her classes as I could to complete my major credits. She is clear on grading and you have weekly quizzes so you don't have to cram study for huge exams and finals week is easier. She is SO helpful during office hours and will look over all your work to make sure you're understanding it!

amazing at explaining stats, incredibly easy to understand. READ coz there are key ideas in there for quizzes, makes time for hw at the end of class so you can finish + ask any qs you have, super nice and patient! make sure to prep well for every quiz, they count for a big portion of your grade. Totally understands the anxiety a math class brings.
She is a really great teacher and very helpful if you ask for it. Pay attention in class or you will not know what is going on. For the most part, as long as you study for quizzes, you will do fine.

PSYC341 is a surprising amount of work: 13 quizzes, 8 Sniffy labs, two lab exams, a behavior modification project, and a final essay. There was no final exam, but a lot of work during the semester. Dr. Cail tests small details on her quizzes. Study everything! Dr. Cail is very caring, and very accessible outside of class to answer questions.

Dr. Cail teaches Statistics clearly, in a well organized straight forward understandable way. She realizes lot of Psychology majors have math anxiety, and she is available to help students who are anxious about the math material with their math anxiety outside of class. She is very accessible outside of class if you do not understand a concept.

PSYC373 with Dr. Cail is NOT easy. You will need to commit serious amounts of time to studying for this class if you want a decent grade. It was the hardest class I have ever taken at Pepperdine. Dr. Cail is an amazing professor. She is accessible, caring, smart, and available to answer questions. The class material is just very hard and detailed.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Prof Cail relates topics to real life things and actually makes them interesting. She is very real and talks about things how they are. Her class is pretty straight forward- quizzes every chapter, one literature review paper, and NO tests! For quizzes everything you need to know in the powerpoints she goes over. Overall a great person and professor

Profesor Cail clearly cares about her students being successful and is genuinely a great teacher. The course is heavily dependent on chapter quizzes, which are not difficult. There are 4 spss labs, one is the final, and she gives an instructional video and document for each lab making them very easy to understand. If you can take her then do!

Super good proff. Tries to give you lots of examples and easy ways to understand difficult concepts. Teaches what she wishes was taught when she was a student. Easy to contact, cares about students wellbeing, wants you to do well.

Dr. Cail is an amazing prof. For Psych310 there is no textbook use; as long as you read the slides you're good for the exam. The semester pretty much consists of writing your research paper. The draft of the paper is due in small increments so it is very manageable. There are easy in-class assignments for credit and her office hours are welcoming
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I would say that she is the WORST professor I have had throughout my uni years at Pepperdine. DONT TAKE HER CLASS !!!!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Love Dr. Cail! I am not a math person but she made the class understandable. I didn't dread going to class like I thought I would for a stats class and her passion for teaching made it enjoyable. Take her if you can!

Take statistics with Cail! She makes the class very manageable and understands that everyone is at a different level. Homework is done in class with plenty of time to ask questions, weekly quizzes are taken right from the slides, and other assignments come with very clear directions. The class is easy with a reasonable amount of effort.

Worst grade Ive gotten at Pepperdine, which is sad bc its an INTRO to stats course. She is very impersonal and didnt even bother to learn any of her students names. She grades harshly and does not give any opportunity for extra points/extra credit. Very test & quiz heavy and the SPSSs are time-consuming. I dreaded class. I do not recommend her

Confused how Cail has a good rating. Your grade is 75% quizzes that are based on very dry lectures & 25% is SPSS assignments that take forever. If you have the chance to take a diff professor, do it. If you're not good at math, DON'T take her. She was not accommodating or helpful the times I reached out for guidance on how to succeed in her class.

I cannot express in words how much I love her. She understands and relates to students about how difficult math can be and is super passionate and enthusiastic about teaching stats. She makes it fun and easy to learn. Absolutely love her. She will not move on until you understand it and never makes you feel bad about being confused.

Love Dr. Cail. Take Dr. Cail because you will both learn and enjoy class. She teaches so that you can understand and she clearly explains what is expected of you in class. Dr. Cail wants to see you succeed and she will help you!!

One of my fav teacher in Pepperdine. She has her own of explaining everything clear and always add funny things to help us understand. The quiz is easy when you get used to it and homework or SPSS assignment is not demanding. Very willing to help out everyone. Very thankful that she came to Pepperdine from BU.
Great class, good times, and insightful.

The class is very easy, but hard to get an A since it is a 94%. An A- is pretty manageable. Weekly quizzes where the concept part can be difficult. She has great, brief lectures and is pretty relatable. You do homework in class and have a day to work on SPSS assignments. Makes stats less scary

Dr. Cail had weekly quizzes which were basically tests on every chapter. It's best to listen during lecture and read the textbook for tricky multiple choice questions. She stresses on the math portion more than concepts. Homework is very easy and not demanding. Easy A as long as you study and be very thorough on SPSS assignments.
She's a good teacher for this G.E. class for sure. She doesn't make it crazy hard, but be sure to study for her quizzes.
Each student seems to have varying opinions as not all students are treated equally in her class. I would have to agree with another student's comment, as the professor does often throw curveballs.

She only likes a few students. If she doesn't like you, dont get on her bad side. She tends to grade by favorite. Her class was exceptionally hard and always throws curveballs. She's very hard to read and sometimes feels like shes very fake with you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Tips: go to class and just listen. Then go over the slides online before her many quizzes and you will be fine. The textbook is irrelevant. I never owned it and reading is not required. She doesn't do big tests, which is awesome. Always go to class and stay for her lectures after the quizzes because that's when she gives extra credit.

The final is a test of the last three chapters so no need to cram. She is chill, and you can get the grade you want if put the time in. Her lecture slides are clear and organized. She is funny. She really cares about us understanding the material, she won't rush. Would definitely recommend to friends. She's known for making difficult concepts easy.
Amazing, take her or your making a mistake..

Easy A if you study your slides! You don't need the book at all. As for her papers, answer her questions and you're good to go. She knows it's a GE and she understands that your not trying to major in Psych. She does everything to make it fun, enjoyable, knowledge-filled, and it's just great overall. I promise you'll thank me later.
Great teacher
Best teacher I have ever had. I would recommend her to ANYONE. She is truly a life-changing person.
Love love love, Cail.. She makes class so interesting and really breaks down difficult concepts into easier components. Easiest tests ever.

Research methods is a dreadfully boring class, and cail does what she can to make it tolerable. She shows videos, etc. I never do the textbook reading, and the firs test was easy, but there are only two tests; the rest of your grade is your research project. She tries to be really helpful and funny, etc. If you have the choice you should take cail

One of my favorite GE's at Pepperdine.  She makes class fun and I learned a lot.  She is a fabulous teacher and tells you exactly what she expects. Quizzes are straight from the notes. This class is how a GE should be.  Easy and interesting!!

Had her for both PSYCH 250 and 310. Easy A for both. She's extremely understanding about making up quizzes, etc. and she tries really hard to make even dull subjects (statistics) interesting. Great professor, really upbeat.

I loved this class. I have told all of my friends to take her and they all thank me. Her classes are very interesting and she just knows how to teach and connect with college students. She almost made me change my major.
She is one of the best at Pepperdine. very knowledgeable and funny. other than teaching, she also does stunts for Hollywood films and costume designing. She even has her own website: www.jesscail.com

Her classes are easy. She gives an easy quiz once in a while. There is barely any homework. Her classes are interesting as she is very funny and energetic. She tells us clearly what she expects from the students.
Helpful, fun,and easy class.
It doesn't get any better than this. She is awesome! extremely clear and funny.

Extremely nice teacher! Super easy class, take her for psychology! easy A!!!! Don't even have to study for the quizzes, she is also very helpful outside of class. Very down to earth and super friendly.
Loved her class.  She clearly loves what she is teaching and she every class was interesting.
Prof. Cail is a great professor. Her lectures are clear, concise, and entertaining. Just take good notes or find someone with old quizzes and you'll do fine.

You either read or you go to class, just make sure you are there for the quizzes. I would suggest going to class though, it can be entertaining. I liked her class despite my disposition towards psychology.
most fun class i've had thus far. also, it's really interesting.
Yikes, one of the worst classes I've taken at Pepperdine. His lectures never made sense and his pop quizzes were too specific.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: This class was definitely difficult for me. Its super lecture heavy, and thats hard because his lectures get CONFUSING. I dont know if it was just me but I had a hard time following him because its literally only him lecturing and some people in class discussing... so you dont know what its important or not, what notes you need to take, etc.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Carr cares and I think thats what makes him so special. He speaks in a way that makes you question your reality and his lectures develop every facet of your thoughts. He doesnt just teach you to remember, he teaches you to think. I get excited every Wednesday to hear him speak. He is a great professor and an even greater person.

Very lecture heavy and his slides are really overwhelming (be prepared to take a lot of notes). Reading the book really does help (although boring) and he has a lot of quizzes but tells you what to study. His tests, however, are very challenging. He is funny and easy to listen to.

I was really confused the whole time. Has a great personality, but all in all, not a class I would take again. Somehow I passed even though, that was the class I knew the least in. Take this if you like religion. Made me question my faith

He's a good professor and is funny, but the tests are hard. You don't have to read the book at all and you'll still do fine. Save money and use the PDF online. Vocab quizzes help your grade out. It's in a lecture in Elkins, which isn't the best way to learn for everyone.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: If you have biblical knowledge, it should be easier for you. If, like me, you don't know many specifics in the bible it will take some more effort.. I took this class in Elkins, so that's distracting. Overall Carr is hilarious and does a good job of critiquing the bible with an open mind and discusses two sides. The tests are challenging.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: He is disrespectful. I don't know if it's b/c he has too many people in his class, but he gets tense when under stress and it's not pleasant to be on the receiving end. He is sarcastic and smart-mouth. I greatly dislike his style of teaching

Dr. Carr is a good, energetic professor. He gives about 10 quizzes (mainly vocab), two exams, and a final (worth 30%). If you come to class, take notes, and thoroughly go through the study guides, you will do fine on the exams. At the end of the semester, he has you grade yourself on participation, so try to participate the best way you can.

You are tested on everything that's in lecture, not on what's in the textbook. There's also weekly vocab quizzes that help your grade. He's very inspirational and kind. The lectures are engaging and he makes the class interesting. However, participating in class does matter.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Carr is passionate about what he's teaching and genuine in discussions. He LOVES his students and will cultivate a relatioship with you if you reach out. Classes are set up like discussions, but tests are standardized so it's challenging to know what to study. Weekly vocab quizzes are SUPER helpful in keeping your grade up if you do well on them.
Class was easy. If you miss class, you will get behind. You will not know which day the quizzes are on so you have to go to like every class. Tests are pretty easy too.

I took Carr for 101 and had such a good experience that I decided to take him again for 301. I was not disappointed. He is one of the most genuine, helpful, and kindest professors on this campus. I see him in the cafeteria and he knows who I am and he'll approach me and ask me how my life outside of school is. NOT an easy professor but its worth it

Good class if you're willing to put in the effort. DO YOUR READING and actually REMEMBER IT so you can participate cause he'll remember that when it's time to put in final grades. Engage him , he's really cool and super passionate about theology & likes to talk about music as well. if you read and speak in class and take detailed notes you're good

Carr is super passionate about theology and his own studies, which he often works into lectures. It's tough to follow lectures sometimes because he talks fast and doesn't provide power points. He loves discussion & appreciates students who contribute to them in class. He loves to talk and get to know students, so building a relationship is helpful!

his lectures can be very confusing. He knows alot of small details about the old testament that you would think you don't have to know but you do. The test are very difficult. Make sure you get 100% on all the vocal quizzes, they really help your grade. Also don't email him, he won't reply.

He's an enthusiastic professor with a strong grasp on the Old Testament that is really interesting. Get ready to write lots of notes super quickly & often get behindlostconfused. Not much work outside of class at all except for the expected studying for the midterms & final. DONT BUY BOOK ITS FREE ONLINE! (&online means command+F keyword search!)

DO. NOT. TAKE. CARR. Despite what most people say, he is NO GOOD. Sure he can make his class laugh, but his lectures are confusing and off topic. Yet, he expects you to take tests that are purely lecture based. Trust me, Religion 101 will be a lot easier for you if you choose a different professor. STEER CLEAR.

He takes this GE very seriously when it comes to tests, but not so much in class. Read Bandstra like your life depends on it, keep up in the bible reading, & take solid notes of things he elaborates on, not just the powerpoints, and you'll do well. He's a very interesting guy and has funny stories, but the tests are more difficult than anticipated.
Bad Teacher! He is very vague and is into himself.

Really hard class. He doesn't help and his study guides are super vague. He has a nice personality outside of class, but during class, is really hard to follow. His tests dont cover what you are taught in class.

Professor Carr has a good sense of humor that keeps things somewhat interesting. As long as you read Bandstra faithfully, take excellent notes, and don't skip class you should get a good grade. It's important to listen to what he says in class because he gives hints for tests. He is tricky, always be prepared for vocab quizzes no matter what!
Very confusing, not very helpful. The tests are unreasonably hard compared to his lectures and quizzes. I would not recommend.

Carr is the MAN! Love him. Class is NOT easy. Must read the book and attend class to get a decent grade. Pay attention in class; he says majority of the things that are on the test. Memorizing the powerpoint help me an A in this class. He curves ALL the tests and gives out extra credit. If you talk to him, he is very helpful.

STAY AWAY! This class has INFORMATION OVERLOAD! Gave the study guide for the final less than a week ahead of time. 300+ pages of reading per test. Says you don't need to know details but his tests are set up to confuse you. I sent him an email with a question and he sent a one word reply. Very unhelpful and HARD.
Horrible teacher. Non-stop talking without writing any words on the board. Hard test but easy vocab quiz. Study guide is vague and definitely NOT RECOMMENDED to take his class
Very hard class. Very disorganized. Material wasn't clear. Outside of the classroom he is an amazing person and very sweet, but not a good teacher at all.

Very disorganized. Got graded work back 2 months after they were turned in. Lectures were hard to follow and class was required to read way too many books for a three unit class. Failed the final cause study guide was vague and covered topics i am almost certain werent talked about in class. Just take someone else, you will learn more.
He was never clear with assignments, can be very sarcastic, and although his teaching of the Bible can be at times funny, he is never available outside of class. I would DEFINITELY not recommend him.

Just the most genuine man you will meet. I got a B in the class. He makes a boring subject interesting using his funny stories. Test are hard but if you do extra credit and do well on the vocab you should be fine. In all he is an amazing man and teacher who is worth listening too.

A very nice man, and extremely entertaining in class- He really brings the Bible to life. I had no former knowledge beyond some basic stories about it, and he not only makes it understandable, but he analyzes the meaning behind the message. Had a C+ in the class and brought it to a B+. Easy class if you have studied the Bible before.

Carr is the bomb! I wasn't exactly looking forward to religion class but he made it enjoyable and time well spent. He's a very chill guy who plays great music before class and always throws in funny anecdotes during his lectures. If you get the chance to take his class you absolutely should.
He is DA BOMB! Funny, smart, positive, and insightful.  Its always a treat to be in his class.  Best teacher on campus
No Comments.
LOVE HIM!! :) in class and out!

VERY enthusiastic about his subject. He'll keep you awake. Pay attention and do the readings, and you'll be fine. Vocab is an easy grade, so make sure to study every week. His tests aren't easy and cover a lot of info, but they're fair.
Professor Carr is the man. Take good notes and actually pay attention and its so easy. Dont slack off on your vocab tests once a week because they help you a lot and are an easy A. He is the man
Keeps it interesting even though its not my kind of class

Insanely easy if you 1) learn the vocab words 2) pay attn to his favorite themes (like inclusiveness, struggle, scandal of particularity, etc)and 3) memorize the things that he says in lecture "might come in handy." Seriously, 90-95% of the tests are on that info. However, you still learn a lot and he is VERY enthusiastic and fun to learn from.

I was apprehensive about having to take a class all about the old testament, but Professor Carr actually managed to make it interesting.  He doesn't preach, either, which is a plus.  He is a funny and nice guy and his tests are easy!  Take Carr for Religion 101!

Carr is a great teacher. He tries to stay away from legalism and doesn't bash different denominations. His weekly quizzes are super easy, you just have to spend a small amount of time studying. The tests are a little bit harder, but he will curve it quite a bit if the class does poorly overall. He likes what he teaches and that shows in class.

Dr. Carr is AWESOME! He has a great attitude, always smiling, and LOVES to laugh. Its a good idea to laugh at his corny jokes, too. Tests are multiple choice, t/f, and vocabulary,and like one short answer question. Tests are graded on a curve, so youre fine even if you dont do so well. My friends have had hard times w/ other teachers, TAKE CARR.

Very cool teacher.  Reminds me of Cedric the Entertainer.  Jokes around a lot. Stresses key terms and class discussion.  If you have to choose a teacher for REL 101, then this should be your first choice.

A very funny and enthusiastic guy who knows a lot about the subject. The tests are pretty easy if you attend just about every class and study for 1-2 hours beforehand. Seems a bit disorganized at times, but still, Carr is da man.

He is awesome! Really cool and nice to talk to. Always helpful. Vocab quizzes are really easy, you'd better get 100% on each one! tests- kinda difficult if you dont study; i got 86% when i studied for an hour prior to the test. but overall, his class is real good!
nice professor. very funny. vocab quiz is easy but the test is a little bit hard (you have to work your a lil bit to get an A-)
Entertaining and sometimes awkward in a funny way

He always walked into class with a HUGE smile on his face.  He has such a strong passion for what he is teaching. There is a vocab quiz every week, he always gives you the words though before hand, so those are easy.  His tests you definitely have to study for...but it IS college, so what do you expect?  He is really nice but he takes attendance.

I don't know why some of these posts think his tests were hard.  True, there were definitely about 5 out of 50 questions on each test not from the book or his lectures, but his essays are very easy if you study and go to class.  It isn't a cakewalk but definitely very doable and he is such a funny and knowledgable guy
He is a good lecturer but his tests were too intense for a 101 level class.  He is extremely helpful outside of class though.
really nice guy. quite helpful, but you should study hard to get a good grade!!

Carr is a REALLY nice guy, and genuinely cares about his students... BUT pretty much the only way to do well in his class is to be a Church of Christ preacher's kid. The class is tought from a very Church of Christ-y perspective - bothersome, since the subject matter is the Hebrew Bible. Not the hardest class, just frustrating much of the time.
He is an exciting teacher, but way too hard for a 101. I learned a lot but the tests killed my grade!

He is a lively, dynamic teacher with a good sense of humor, but his class was too difficult for a 101. His tests are way too hard. Also, study guides did not match what appeared on the test so it was difficult to study. But if you know the bible well prior to taking the class, you will do well.
Nice and funny guy. Good teacher. Go to class and participate every so often and he will like you.

Professor Carr is a genuinely nice guy, works very hard to teach well, and has a very interesting, balanced perspective on religion and the Bible.  Like someone else already pointed out, his African-American perspective adds a lot to the interest of the class.  The only bad thing about his class is that it is consistently a lecture. Recommended.
good class if you want to learn about how the african american perspective of christianity is different from EVERYONE else... good class, highly recommended
I LOVED HIS CLASS! HE IS SO HELPFUL, CLEAR, FUNNY, AND ENTHUASIASTIC.
He's a fun teacher but a hard grader. He teaches the Bible as a text book, not a very interesting class at all.

This class was very challenging for me because I had to find a tutor to do well in it... oftentimes it was difficult to understand her ALTHOUGH she is extremely funny, entertaining, and nice. She even gave us cookies every friday to nibble on while solving equations! Get outside help once a week and you can get an A in this course

Such a sweet lady but such an awful instructor. Unless biostatistics stuff is review for you, you'll be teaching it entirely to yourself. Lectures are scattered at best and the book isn't particularly stellar at explaining concepts and procedures. She takes roll so you have to go even if it you're just as lost as you were before class.
She's such a nice person, but I really couldn't understand her. She's so unclear.
She is very easy if you do all your work and come to class. There is HW twice a week and a quiz every week but she does give you cookies and is willing to help during office hours

She is very sweet and perhaps one of the most brilliant professors at Pepperdine. Her classes are full of intense note taking and her tests can often be difficult, but she is very helpful one on one and I could go see her for office hours for more personalized help. An excellent person and teacher; just don't think you can skip class and do well..

Professor Adjemian is awesome! I love her :) She is so nice and friendly, and she may seem a little odd at times, with the funny comments she makes during the class time. But prior to her class anything involving numbers was one of the most dreaded things for me; yet she made it better. She is helpful, but the class is not easy.
She is exceptionally kind even though she is kind of out there. Class really isn't that hard.

Terrible teacher. Going to classes is usually pointless, because if she even gets around to actually teaching something, you wont understand it. Because she is terrible at explaining the material. However, she is an amazingly sweet lady who brings cookies every friday! bad teacher, nice lady. good luck passing, get a tutor

Prof. Adjemian is the first math professor I've ever had that honestly cares about her student's performance.  I have never understood any form of math very well but was very happy with how much she was willing to help me catch on.  Very helpful during class and her office hours and she provides study guides for her tests.  One of my favorite profs
extremly hard i got an A in ap calc in high school took her for an easy a bad idea
she is a nice person. but seriously she is terrible and cannot teach. she is helpful outside of class but in class you will not learn anything.

She is a difficult teacher if you are not good at working through problems on your own. She is very helpful if you go into her office for one on one time, but in class and on homework she makes you work out the problems on your own with minimal explanation. This is good because if you get it right it means you really learned it.
somewhat easy unless u really struggle with calculus. good professor.

I'll preface this by saying she's a very, very nice woman. That being said, do not take her class under any circumstance. She moves far too quickly and does not teach the material. Her tests are very difficult, and she expects you to learn the material on your own. She's a bad teacher. She's boring. Her tests are too hard. NOT A GOOD COMBO.

brilliant woman but that tends to limit her teaching. she speeds through problemsand most of the time no one knows what she's doing. do homework early and you can go to her office to check your methods. she is EXTREMELY helpful one on one. case in point - if you care enough you can do well but if you aren't willing to work you will fail.
If you had a good Calculus teacher in high school then you should be fine. Go to class and take notes...if you don't understand something, go to her office hours because she is really helpful.

She was the only math teacher that I ever had who made me like it. It was hard at times, but I got an 'ok' grade at the end- high B. She is an amazing person too, and is always willing to help you outside the class. Advice- as soon as you don't understand something, immediately go talk to her!
dull, hard to stay awake and follow her lectures. She is a fair teacher, but not interesting at all.

She is really smart, but horrible at transferring the information. I pretty much stopped going to her class because it wasn't doing anything for me. In her class, basically all you do is watch her do math problems EXTREMELY quickly. Not a good professor (but for the record, a very nice lady).
She is not easy at all...dont take her class unless you are really good with math... she is nice when it come to general conversation, but she is not too friendly when it comes to grades
She loves math...but doesn't do a good job taching it. Her tests are hard, and she gives homework everyday...nice lady, but not a good teacher

i am not a big math person - but she was very helpful outside of class. i had to work a lot, but think this class will definitely help me as a business major. definitely worth taking math214 with her.
She is so hard.  Take someone else like Clarke
Awesome professor.  Always has her office open for help with homework or questions.  Not easy, but very fair.

Pretty easy if you've had Calculus before...not really clear in explanations, especially for students that don't like math. I am personally good in math so the class was ok for me.    Hate math? DONT take Adjemian.

Going to class doesn't help at all. You have to teach your self. Homework is easy, tests are fairly hard, I thought the concepts were hard... she doesn't help either, she just confused me more. She was nice though.
u own, armenia 4 life

She is one of the best professors on Earth.  She is totally devoted to the students and their learning the material.  If you don't understand something, she is so happy to help you.  The classes that she teaches are difficult and she challenges the students.  Some of the hardest classes I ever took.  But no pain, no gain.  You can tell she's on your side; she grades objectively but teaches and helps with a huge bias toward learning something and helping the students with difficult concepts.
Moves quickly, but always willing to answer questions.  She was always willing to help when she was in her office and was very patient when answering questions.
No Comments
fast teacher but if you slow her down and ask q&a she's very helpful.
Great teacher, can get going to fast if nobody in the class will ask questions about the subject matter. One of the smartest professors at Pepperdine.
No Comments
asaas
Too smart to teach the class... she expects you to understand way too much and there is A LOT of busy work
taught way above the level of the majority of students in her classes
Very sweet lady but she's too smart to teach. If you're the type who learns from reading the book, take her class. Got an pretty high A but it took some work. Enjoyed the class though...
She doesn't teach you math, you have to be able to teach yourself. If you don't stay up with the later chapters you won't pass the class. I expected to get an A, and got a B.

She's better off teaching Math 1,000 to math geeks!  She is a very nice lady however, she does not teach.  Which college professor grades homework for correctness? She does! Pretty much, your on your own to learn the material.   Become her friend, but not her student
This was the WORST class.  Classes were pointless and tests were wayyy too hard.  She's a nice lady, but it is time for her to retire.  DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
nice woman but lectures are pointless, tests are randomly hard or not

i swear she is like from some math planet and speaks in a language of math no one in the universe could undersatnd.  she is a horrible communicater in teaching math. i swear her lectures are between her, her marker and her board. do nat take this unless you are like a freakin genius.

I really like her as a person and she seems really fun and knowledgable about math, but there is no way that you can understand the material by her teaching alone. I feel as though I have taught myself. She is jut way too smart.
Nearly impossible to understand. She is obviously very passionate about math, and very good at it, but she cannot teach.

Very hard Prof in terms of work and grading. Very unclear in teaching & tests are almost impossible even if you do study. Almost always open for assistance (prepare for a long session), very nice but that doesn't help you pass the class. Always happy. Take a different prof if you can help it.

nice teacher, very sweet. always hands out oreos to the class on friday. always in a good mood and has a funny look on her face whenever she is concentrating. always open for help in her free hours, even walk-ins, but very unclear and she sucks at teaching, even though she is the coolest granny ever

She is a sweet, sweet lady but she is the worst teacher I have ever had. You have to teach everything to yourself or spend hours with her in her office after class before you can get it. Shes just too smart and assumes everyone knows everything and can follower her, but thats almost impossible.

I failed the first test but I still pulled off a high B because she throws out your lowest few quizes and homwork grades.  She also replaces your lowest test grade with the final.  So you can still screw up and get a good grade.  She is really boring but will help you when you need it.
Differntial Equation or somthing.. She is a very nice professor.  With out her help, I could not graduate.
Very Nice Professor, Demanding Class, Excellent for being available for help outside of class!

Do NOT take this class...she is a really nice person but can not teach for the life of her...her homework assignments are way too demanding and she is too smart for the subject...she just assumes that everyone knows the material and her tests r impossible
Very nice teacher! Teaches as if all know the material!
She is very nice and a great person.  Class is really tough, take Kirpatrick if you can get in.
very nice
she is a great person, who gives treats every Friday, but she isn't a very clear in instruction and is way to smart to teach!!!!!!
Great teacher, very helpful, clear and concise
No Comments
Loves the subject. If you put in the work, you will get a good grade.

He's a very sweet man. He is definitely a tough grader, and he requires a lot of reading, but overall the class wasn't impossibly difficult. The class was lecture-heavy though, and I had a hard time paying attention because his voice is on the more monotone/soft side. But he means well and is very nice, so I would recommend him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: The lectures are interesting and engaging. He will argue with you about politics but tries to be respectful about it. A caring guy who wants you to succeed.  He grades harshly on writing quality.  He says it is your grammar, but it is more that he does not like the way you wrote the sentence, regardless of if it is wrong.
Sitting through class felt like pulling teeth. If you are not super into politics it is a struggle to make it through this course.

This professor understands the level of work that is expected from a GE and makes his class curriculum GE level. His tests are easy (25 MC & 2 Short Essays) and you will get a good grade if you study. He doesn't waste your time and all of the tests questions are derived from his "Test Term" study guides. One of the best professors at Pepperdine!

I love this professor! He's hilarious and makes what could potentially be a really boring class super entertaining and relevant. Tests are on the harder side but if you actually go to class and listen and do the reading, you'll be fine. Might be tempting, but don't skip his lectures because he goes over a lot of relevant test material in class.

Great professor. His office hours are very useful. Not a hard class if you take good notes, focus on the BIG PICTURE, and read the texts he assigns. Textbook not super necessary. All multiple choice in Elkins.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Soper's lectures involve powerpoints that you can access online (i.e. you don't need to show up everyday). However, I really recommend showing up every day because he is hilarious! I don't even like polisci, but he made the class so fun. We took 4 tests the entire semester, and that was all our grade was. He offers extra credit, so take it!
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: 10/10 choice. Participation doesnt matter if you take him in elkins because its such a big class. He posts all the PowerPoints online and his lectures are literally just reading the pp so you dont even have to go all semester unless its test day. Did this and got an A
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very interesting. No reading required beyond the large take-away message. Easy A but still go to lecture because its interesting!!!

Really great lectures, always interesting and he gets the class involved with presentations. Extremely hard, however, he uses cold calls and makes sure you've done the reading. You learn a lot but you'll work very hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Really great professor! All of his lectures were enjoyable and the time went by too fast. He drops the lowest test score and allows to earn up to 6 extra credit points. Overall, you get a lot of information ad knowledge without working yourself up.

This was the easiest class ever. His lectures are just the readings regurgitated so you can get by with not going ever (he elaborates & stresses what will be on the test though so just go). Plus, if you ditch you'll also miss "political minutes" which equates to like 4% in exam questions. Just read the textbook and the tests are a cake walk.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: his class isn't too demanding, you could self-teach and hardly show up and come out with a C. Now if that's not good enough for you, you'll want to read the chapters, KNOW THE CHAPTER VOCAB, and attend most classes, since there are things on the test that were ONLY talked about in his lectures.

One of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine. Soper actively engages students, answers any question possible, and makes the material interesting. All four tests are pretty difficult, but as long as you pay attention during his lectures, take the online quizzes, and review the given key terms, you will do fine!

Honestly hated politics til I took his poli sci class. He is extremely excited about what he is teaching which makes the lectures so much easier to pay attention to. tests generally stick to the lectures, hardly had to read the book, and he drops questions a lot of people miss. overall one of my favorite teachers this semester

Tests are not as easy as they seem.  You take the test and think that the questions weren't so difficult then get back your test score and realize it wasn't all common sense.  Make sure you read the textbook and pay attention in class.  Also utilize the online textbook.

No work outside of class.  Extra credit offered.  Lowest test grade dropped. Curves tests.  Don't necessarily need to go to the lecture but I recommend it.  Funnycheesy guy. Use online resource on syllabus (great for tests). If you put in the effort you should easily get A-B range.

Easy A if you study. The multiple choice is actually easier than the written part. His Religion and Politics class is a bit more challenging though. Even though it is a large classroom, wait for everyone to leave and ask him questions or email him. I now know my political home thanks to his class. Whether you're Democrat, Republican, take his class

I loved this professor because I'm very interested in politics even though its not my major and he wasn't biased at all. I couldn't tell what his political beliefs were and I appreciated that a lot. He tries to make politics interesting. The only bad things is that his tests are pretty difficult and the multiple choice questions are deceiving.

Great professor! Uses the socratic method, so you will get put on the spot a lot, but it definitely helps you learn! Grades fairly - if you put in enough effort it's totally doable to get an A in his class. Lectures are interesting (it's an 8am and I actually show up if that tells you anything).

I went to this class for a total of about 6 times. I never used the textbook, and even if I went to the lectures, I fell asleep. I ended up with a C+ in the class. Study the online study guides and the terms and you're SET. I did enjoy the lectures when I went & it was pretty cool that I had it during the elections. But I still didn't go.
GREAT TEACHER! I actually enjoyed his 8am lectures, and I have no interest in political science.  The class is easy to get an A if you try.

One of the best professors I've had. His first-year seminar was an amazing time of intellectual discussions. He really helps you deal with the difficult but essential questions in life (the class was faith&reason)
Overall easy class.  Make sure to read the textbook and take good notes for an A. His tests can be tricky, but for the most part if you put in effort you'll get either an A or B.

Honestly did not attend class very often as it was an 8am, but when I did he made it as enjoyable as possible considering the circumstances. Prepare for tests by going over the key terms, and studying the graphs that he includes in the lectures (he loves trend questions). If you have his class at a reasonable hour, attend! He's a great lecturer.

Learn the key terms, and you'll get at least a B. I had him at 8am... So I wasn't there much, but I still did well on the exams. He's cool and tries to liven things up. Read the book and go to class for an A; it's that simple. For those of you that want to put in the least amount of effort and get maximum results; learn the key terms and sleep in!

I had Soper for my first year seminar class, he was great! He isn't a pushover and he makes you do the reading, but he facilitates interesting discussion and tries to get to know everyone in the room. He even made things fun and invited us all over for lunch, and took class outside one day :) Take him, he's a reasonable teacher and a nice guy.

I was not interested in this class before but Soper makes it fun and actually somewhat enjoyable. The textbook reading is important and if you go to class you do well on the exams. He has a dry sense of humor that is really funny when you pay attention to it. I would recommend him for this GE course.

he is great!! i have him at 8am and he does what he can to make it interesting. he knows what hes talking about and his tests arent super difficult. all you need to know is the key terms. you can easily pass the class without going to class but i suggest going if you want a higher grade. take him if you can.
Definitely a good professor. Even in a lecture class he keeps things interesting, or at least bearable. Key terms are crucial to success on the tests.
Professor Soper was one the best professor I've had so. He turns a subject that most people aren't interested in and makes it fun. For the test read the book and study his key terms.

Soper is really cool. He is funny, and he actually presents the material in a way that you can understand. He often shows Steven Colbert videos in his class. For the tests, memorize the key terms (not that hard) and read through the powerpoints, he puts them online
Awesome Professor.  Soper is a legend.  He keeps his class fresh with videos, music and baseball.  Also one of the most intellegent professors I have had to date.
Nice guy, actually makes politics interesting. Make sure you learn the terms he gives you for the test and this class should be real easy.

Soper is the man! He makes American Politics very fun and understandable, plus  he has a great dry sense of humor. The class is not that difficult as long as you show up, pay attention, and take decent notes. Instead of a midterm and final, there are five medium-sized tests and one 2-3 page paper.

i just started this class but i can already tell ill like it. he can keep you interested in a large class (elkins) and i was never even interested in politics before. hes gives students who are lost in the political world a background so they can search out their own beliefs
Pretty interesting guy.  The time goes by quick in his class.

umm, i love him! he is enthusiastic about the subject and he has a sense of humor about the fact that most of the class doesn't care about politics. he does an excellent job relating material to real life and works hard to get the class involved. posc 104 with soper is a worthwhile experience and not difficult if you put in some time before tests.

This guy is really weird but the class is the easiest one at Pepperdine.  As a freshman I never went although I would if I took it again.  I still got a B without attending or trying. It is kind of boring but all stuff that you already know. Take Soper
He is interesting but I usually didn't attend class.  Easy tests, and very little HW
I enjoyed the class and he's a great teacher!
Dr. Soper is a great professor--you can tell he loves what he does and he makes class interesting and fun. Class is challenging, but easy to do well in.
very clear...funny... makes material interesting.

Excellent lecturer, clear, articulate, really tries to keep the class interested in a topic he knows is dry to most people.  Test questions can be ambiguous and hard to answer, but good grades aren't hard to get.  Very nice guy, good sense of humor.

He is a smart teacher and he does a good job at staying neutral on politics.  He is funny and incredibly knowledgable of the subject.  Has a dry sense of humor but is funny.  He is a really awesome teacher.

Hes a good guy and a pretty good teacher. I think he is pretty entertaining but Im not so sure about the mariners. His tests are "alright." I do find some confusing wording and some irelevent questions (this is coming from a poly sci major).The TA's are unhelpful with studying. See Soper and talk to him if you need it. I would say that this is a good intro course and would recomend it it. Can't wait to get in some smaller classes with Soper.
Great professor, great attitude, great family, great educator...he will push you...overall Great
No Comments
Interactive lecturer, great sense of humor. pay attention and you will learn a lot. Just awesome!
good class... he is witty.
He is a great professor who is interesting and thoughtful.
Excellent teacher!!!  Take him.  You will learn lots.
One of the best lectureres at Pepperdine.

This guy is a stud, very clear and the tests are right off his study guide (all multiple choice and a few short answer).  He is funny and really cares about student's opinions.  On top of all that, the guy is a Seattle Lover so I'm a Soper Lover!

Great guy.  It's important to make a good showing in class; it'll influence your grade for the positive.  If you show interest in the class, he'll appreciate your contributions (and he'll always try to get you to argue for the side you hate, a good thinking exercise).
He is a good teacher, if you can stay awake.  Talk in class and get him to like you.  Study off of the study guide and you should be okay.  Trust me though, it is BORING!
I was a PoliSci major, and his classes were the hardest for me. Great guy, very smart, but a tough grader.
He's very smart and very nice (and a Mariners fan).

He expects you to learn everything exactly. He will belittle you if you ask and question and he deems it too simple. Harsh grader, no mercy. Very picky. Not really there to socialize, just wants to teach chem. Old fashioned, won't change for anyone. Seems nice then when it get serious turns mean. Highly intelligent, can tell just wants to research.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Good teacher, took as a highschool class was very funny cracked a lot of jokes, would give lots of types of different visuals so we could understand.

Difficult tests but definitely worth going to office hours for. No extra credit opportunities but there's weekly quizzes that are not too difficult. His homework's are his own worksheets and they're based on the lecture examples. He cracks jokes often and does science experiments during class.

I took his class in 2016 and he told me to give up on my career goals in Medicine because I did poorly on my first exam. The way he made me feel small and incompetent lasted throughout my undergraduate. I am now in a doctoral program to be a nurse practitioner. Avoid him if you can. Nobody should go through what I did.

Professor Green is very intelligent and is passionate about what he teaches. Unfortunately, his teaching style was not for me. Just expect to do a lot of learning on your own. The test content is much harder than what he goes over in the lecture. I would recommend trying to take a supplemental learning tool online for this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Tough grader

comment: Don't take Professor Green for gen chem. Very hard tests. His lectures are not very useful and he doesn't give study guides or a ton of prep for your exams. If you take this professor, get study guides from someone in another gchem class and use their materials to learn the class. Use "the organic chemistry tutor" on youtube to help with this class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: DONT DO IT. He is horrible

awful and rude. His courseworkridiculous. Also, when any time I tried to go into his office for help, he was very rude and made me feel stupid. A few times, I got grades on exams or homework back that I didn't feel were right, and when I went to him, he was PRIDEFUL and tried to belittle me because his grading was incorrect. should be fired ://

I took Dr. Green for astronomy, and while I enjoyed certain aspects of his class, there were also times when I thought he was being extremely unfair to his students.
