You really need to read the textbook if you want to pass, otherwise you just won't be able to keep up. He can be very unclear what to expect for the tests too, so be sure to ask a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Why does Pepperdine give him as a tenure position? He is not helpful at all. All he wants is to destroy students' grades. Worst teacher I have ever encountered for the past 20 years.

Dr. Green is a great choice to take for CHEM120. He is usually straightforward in lecture and his tests are hard, but definitely not impossible. Study your notes, read the book, and go into his office hours and youll be fine. His door is often closed, but once you knock he is welcoming and willing to answer your questions. Also very funny!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: This class was absolutely ridiculous. I usually do well with chemistry, but not with Dr. Green. He gives an overtop amount of homework about things he does not teach. What is on his tests is always a depressing surprise. He does not give the impression that he would like to extend help to students. Odd and unapproachable. Overall very arrogant.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: My favorite of all the (unanimously great) chemistry faculty at Pepperdine University. Any negative review is likely from a gen-chem kid who would do poorly regardless of who they had. So, if you aren't great at chemistry, don't take his course, but if you're genuinely interested & want to learn far beyond the curriculum Dr. Green is the way to go.

Really loves teaching and chemistry. He loves hard workers but has a low tolerance for dumb students. Upper div courses are great with him. Labs are long but SUPER FUN. I wish I got to do research with him :/
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: This dude will talk about random stuff each lecture but don't you dare skip as he will randomly give a  pop quiz. Most classic Doctor Green story I can offer is this: The day before  Thanksgiving break, half the class left early and was gone, so he gives us a pop quiz and makes it worth double points. Learn to learn exclusively from the textbook.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: If you are looking for a professor who is a great lecturer and wants you to succeed look again. He hands out packets that aren't even used in class, and gets through maybe two problems a class period. He then assigns homework over stuff that hasn't been covered in class yet. He tries to crack too many jokes instead of just teaching the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Genuinely the greatest professor I ever had at Pepperdine. The great majority of the classes I took were dull and boring but David Green managed to engage his students like no other professor ever has. You sure need to understand his sense of humor but once you do, there is no better teacher for you to take.
Dr. Green makes you feel like a complete moron most of the time. Does not care much if you pass so it is 100% up to you and the amount of effort you put in and if you are naturally good at chemistry.
He was really unhelpful when anyone had questions even during office hours. His lectures were really unrelated to the exams and the exams were really difficult. Avoid taking him if you can.

Dr. Green is genuinely interested in what he teaches. The course itself is moderately difficult, but if you have ANY questions, GO TO OFFICE HOURS. I cannot stress this enough. He is extremely helpful. He will go over the concept step-by-step, one-on-one.

I absolutely loved having Dr. Green. He gives out notes in class that are incredibly useful. He als provides almost every equation that you will need on his tests. He gives a lot of partial credit and though saracastic, he is a very entertaining professor. He knows his students and their skills and he is very available when you need help.
Ha!...I got an A, but don't even waste your time. What an arrogant EMPLOYEE!! If you're looking for a helpful professor.....keep looking.
Very passionate about his subject. Follow his 6 step program if chemistry is difficult for you and you will get an A. Fantastic professor!

Dr. Green is a great teacher that really cares about his students.  Took the time to make sure you understand and connected with his students on a personal level.  The tests were a little tough but appropriate for a month long summer class.  Weighting is appropriate for the class.  If you get a D in this class you are flat out stupid or didn't try.

Did not care for him at all, His test were fair, however his grading was WAY too subjective for me. You will somehow magically make it to his good side or bad and its a total coin toss to decide your place(unless of course you're a girl). Very discouraging and would NOT recommend. Take Gchem somewhere else!!!
Highly recommended for any Upper-Div course that he teaches.

Dr Green teaches in a fast paced manner but is easy to follow if you pay attention. I found that his lectures are more helpful than his demonstrations although they can help from time to time. There is frequent homework but if done it helps with comprehension and padding your grade. Study book for tests. Hes funny in a quirky way!

Super cute! He is soooo goood at Chemistry! Has odd personality. Likes stars. Tries to be chemically funny. Also likes long walks on the beach. Wears cool shirts. Nice beard!1!! and kinda short but still waaay hott! Likes to draw pie as well as create it chemically using permanganate!

I love Dr. Green! He is funny and makes chem exciting. Be sure to read the book and do the hw and you will do well. He is so helpful outside of class and answers email questions promptly. Be sure to do the handouts before the tests because they are just like the tests. Be sure to study HARD for test #2!

I've heard his tests are a little easier than other professors, but it evens out bc his lectures are all over the place, disorganized, and hard to follow.  Just take good notes, read the book, and ask him for help (he's good at getting back to you).  It helps out a lot if you've taken chem prior to this class.

Great Professor!  Has a passion for his class and his tests are fairly easy compared to the other chem professors.  He wants everyone to succeed unlike other profs in the science department.  My advice is TAKE HIM.  He and a few other professors are the reason I came to pepperdine!  I hope that speaks for itself.

Extremely difficult, he's not particularly interested in whether or not you learn the material.  The man is a genius but his teaching style is difficult to follow- if you don't have a SOLID backgroun in chemistry, don't take him.  My chem class went from 50+ students to less than 20 by the end of the semester... and some still failed.

he expects you to try.  If you're not putting in the effort, you're not gonna get respect.  And effort as in, going to office hours and actually trying to get what's going on rather than just trying to get out with your C.

Very arrogant...I will never take another Chem class with him again. I heard good things about 120, but for 121, don't take him. His tests are hard...Sometimes he teaches the class brand new things one class before a test and then expects you to know extensively about it on a test. One thing i advise is to go to his office hours.
An arrogant jerk, napolionic complexed and weirdly egotistical

Don't take astronomy with him, it's very hard for a GE class. U have to learn chemistry, physics, astronomy at its limits. During summer almost everyday there was a quiz, homework or an exam. I've got my first D of my academic career with him.

He expects his students to already know chemistry. If you're like me and have never taken it before, it's HARD and I cannot follow him in class. I have to try to teach myself outside but it doesn't really work. He's quick to answer emails but his explanations don't usually make sense to me.
He is a jerk and is definetely not here to help you unless chemistry is your life. He is very arrogant and thinks the world revolves around him and what he thinks. Avoid him if possible
His tests are EASY, not too hard.  The other 2 G-Chem professors are harder!  His lectures are OK, but he is kinda arrogant.
Not a terrible professor, but not a great professor either.  The tests are more in depth than lecture so   read the book.  Don't worry about trying to avoid him, but I hear Ganske is easier.
talks extremely fast, tests are difficult, very knowledgable, tries to make funny jokes...

I don't know how these people think his tests are hard, he has so much extra credit and his tests just aren't that hard.  He's entertaining and nice guy, pretty funny with his numerous drug references, gotta love em.  Take it with him.

wow.  dr. green is probably the coolest, most fun person to ever walk the earth.  he makes an incredibly hard class enjoyable and actually makes you want to come to lecture and lab every day.  it's people like him that remind me why i'm a chem major.
tests and labs are LONG
ummm... can't say i'd choose to take it again, but it was fun while it lasted ;/
He gives lots of examples which are helpful, if you have difficulty he has consistent office hours, however he can be pretty condescending and his tests are difficult.
Great professor. He is so hilarious and he loves to blow things up. Definitely makes chemistry fun.
I've had him for two years, G-Chem and Quant.  He's an incredible teacher.  Very hard test.  Expects alot from you, go to office hours.
He is the coolest. He can really keep your attention but if you dont do homework and not go to lecture you will completely fail. His handouts and homework is very helpful and clear. Makes chem fun.

DO NOT TAKE CLASS WITH HIM.. His tests are sooo hard.. If there is an exception to a rule, pretty good chance that its gonna be on the test. He is pretty arrogrant, but it willing to work with his students.. still. dont take class with him..
Funny, very smart.  Unique individual
Arrogant jerk; condensending
fun, um awesome
hes really into chem!! but expects you to show a lot of work.
He REALLY likes Chemistry!!

Dr. Doran is an extremely hard grader. He is very kind and wants to help BUT you have to go to him for help. You have to be willing to put in the work. He seems very serious which can be intimidating. My writing was so much better by the end of the semester. He pushed me really hard which I'm thankful for.
Dr. Doran made me hate the environment
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Doran is by far the worst professor I have ever taken.  am a straight-A student, and he gave me a C in a class in which I worked my butt off. Regardless of whether your paper is good or not, if it goes against his views, he will give you a failing grade. He is an unbelievably tough grader and his class work is unorganized (sust class).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Literally too many readings and papers. SUPER TOUGH GRADER.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I absolutely loved this class and Dr. Doran. The discussions were so interesting and he really keeps you engaged because you are talking about something that really matters today. The essay prompt force you to think but as long as you start early, you'll be fine. He is a harsh grader but you can have him or his TA check it and provide suggestions.

Brilliant, a leader of such deep & profound conversations about creation care based on the resurrection hope of Jesus Christ. He outstandingly connects following Jesus w/ environmental justice. Readings are phenomenal, edifying, & done before class to prepare for his meaningful questions when we discuss together. Hw's are thought provoking essays.

Dr. Doran is my fav professor & mentor. I took Religion 301 with him in New Zealand, and it was the best class ever. This class made me woke. I changed my major because of it. Not gonna lie - he is not easy. You have to work hard and critically think for his class (which is a great thing). He is SUPER helpful and wants you to succeed.

He facilitates fun discussions but he's a tough essay grader Recommendations for the essay: *ask Dr. Doran (preferable) or the TA to review your essay*, don't use unknown words or phases, make sure grammar & sentence structure is correct (Dr. Doran nitpicks), participate in class (most discussions answer the essay prompt), and START EARLY.

One of my favorite classes which surprised me only because of how bad his rating were. There really isnt that much reading for homework and theres only 4 long essays and 4 short ones which are just two paragraphs. The discussions in class are very though provoking and super applicable to whats going on in the world today. Love. This. Class.

This class was very interesting and applicable to today's world. You are only graded on essays (4 short, 3 long) and participation so if you are a good writer, this class is for you. He's a tough grader but will read over your essay before its due and give good feedback. Class is discussion style but its easy to participate even if you don't read.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: Dr. Doran really cares about the environmental topics that he lectures on. The class sits in a circle and discusses current issues. Everyone is expected to participate, but it's easy to talk in class without doing the reading. This is my favorite class this semester by far. A great class for passionate extroverts who are good at writing.

The most disappointing professor I've ever had. I can't believe he's a religion professor in a Christian university. He never gives good, even proper feedbacks on my essay, which I put on a lot of effort and good attitude. He's attitude is AWFUL, and he is narrow-minded. I dropped the class because I didn't feel much of the Christian value of him.

Dr. Doran is one of my all-time favorite educators. I absolutely loved his class--I was put into it at the last minute because I had to change seminars and it was the only one open, and I am so glad that happened. He has been an incredible mentor to me all year, and his class taught me writing and discussion skills that I know will be valuable.
Do not take this first year seminar class, unless you want to do lots of writing and reading. The essay prompts are very vague and he is a tough grader.

He takes this class for freshmen way too serious. He grades your papers as if you are a graduate student. If you say anything in class that goes against his viewpoint he will instantly deny and ignore your point. This class had more papers than all of my other classes combined. Constantly talk about the same things over and over again.

If you want to maintain good GPA, don't take Doran's class. For the most part, his class discussions can be fun and interesting. But, his expectations for your writing is beyond ridiculous, but that's because he gives out zero tests. He also seems to secretly take pleasure in criticizing millennials half the time, which is hilarious.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This class is one of the most thought provoking classes I've ever taken, but it's worth it 100%. I've learned more about myself and my morals, but overall not too bad of a class. Dr. Doran is a tough grader, but pro tip: write in the style of the online writings he assigns you and even in the style of his published work. It will save your grade!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This class is really hard, but really worth it.  Dr. Doran grades essays super strictly, but if you go to him for help and actually read the assignments, you can do well.  Lots of essays and LOOOTTTS of reading.

DO NOT take this class unless you're an amazing writer. He is a VERY tough grader. I am a straight A student and got a C in his class. Worked my butt off on the final project and got a 58%. Only upside to this class is that there's no hw or tests. Take a different section for religion 301. Just don't take this one.

Very intestine class in that the topics he covers really pick your brain.  Gives vague assignments.  Lets you pick your own essay topics, but keep in mind if you write against his core beliefs, be prepared for a low grade.  Overall no 'real' homework, just have to do two essays and a project.

Very convicted and welcomes debate. The class is discussion-based. You talk in a big circle for the entire class. Read to have meaningful input. No tests. Writing intensive. Participation, papers and a group project make up your grade. Be punctual. Very excited to help you write and revise your papers. More revisions=better grades so write early.

Dr. Doran is the best professor I have ever had. He challenges you to think differently about things than you ever have before. Reading the negative comments about him are troubling because they are just students who didn't get the high grade they are used to getting without doing anything. He is demanding, but also kind, interesting and brilliant

Dr. Doran comes off as a little intimidating at first, but once I got to know him, he became the most influential teacher I've had at Pepperdine.  Demands A LOT out of his students, but is readily available to help you with your writing.  I received a B on my first paper, but after I got his help on the rest, I got an A on them all and in the class

I'm not picky about professors but this man is the worst educator I have ever encountered. He is cold, cynical, and pretentious. He treats his class like a platform for his opinions and only favors those who can regurgitate his pompous attitude. As a person of faith I am deeply disappointed that the class claims to represent a christian worldview.

This professor is, by far, the worst professor I have ever had. Not to mention, he always glares at me whenever I walk by his office as if I have personally offended him for minding my own business. Don't let the monkey and the calvin & hobbs comic fool you into thinking he is a warm and charismatic human being, because he is far from it.

Okay so he is not all bad as he will demand the best out of you, but his class is a complete joke. His expectations are above and beyond doctoral students. I always walk past his office and see him glaring at me, but knowing him now, I can see why he is so angry all the time. Save your gpa and take this course from a real professor who cares.

Doran is the furthest thing there is from a "great teacher".  He introduced 0 new ideas, but rather complained and barked.  He did not change the way I saw the world.  The average human being knows about the issues he brought up in class.  How do we solve them? He has no clue.  This class is ideal for those who write EXCELLENT papers. Thats it.

Dr. Doran is hands down one of the best professors Pepperdine has to offer.  He is more than willing to help when you ask for it and if you put in the time.  However, do not expect to get an A...or B... or C for that matter.  He demands PERFECT writing in all aspects and anything less won't be tolerated.  He made me a better writer for sure.
Most professors are nice and helpful. So that doesn't count. Doran's class was a bit interesting, but he was way too tough on grading. If you're not an excellent writer, don't take his class.

Only grades are participation (speaking) and essays (no tests). If you're not a strong writer about your opinions and don't like speaking in class, like me, do not take this class. He is helpful if you meet with him, but he teaches the class as if most of the world already agrees with him...I must not be most of the world.

Yes, Doran is a pretty tough professor. But he is also a great one. This class has been my favorite so far. It really brings a lot of issues to the forefront that are not only relevant but are also interesting. Utilize his office hours. He's a tough grader but is always more than willing to help.

Dr. Doran may not be an easy professor, but he's a great one. You'll learn a lot in his class, and he'll make you think. If you need extra help, he's very approachable. He is a fair grader; you just need to know how to write competent and well-reasoned papers. If you're looking for an "easy A," don't take one of his classes. Excellent professor!

Doran has got to be one of my favorite professors on campus. Yes, he is dry. Yes, he is hard. But he also makes it very clear what you need to do to succeed. He's also very open to meeting out of class, his door is always open if you ever need to stop by and ask a question, get clarification, or just talk.

He is tough.  Grading is fair but again really tough.  Seems to be more open to girls when they challenge his ideas.  He will verbally crucify a guy for anything he deems as a challenge.  Just my experience/opinion.

Interested in what he teaches, but dry, critical, and sarcastic. He attempted to save us $ by having us download pdfs, but this ended up being more of a hassle than a help. To do well, you better read and know what you are talking about. I think he focuses too much on insignificant things (like margins) and not enough on the real part of papers.

Doran's an excellent teacher, but he is not easy. Be prepare to do work, learn a great deal, and challenge yourself to write great papers. He shows no mercy when grading papers, but he's fair. His classes are discussion based and always interesting. He is young and likes to joke around but also knows when its time to buck down. My favorite teacher!

Doran gets a bad rep for being hard. He is, but he's also very fair. He demands a lot out of his students, but is more than willing to help with papers/ideas/proofreading if you take advantage of his office hours. He's a great prof, but if you're looking for an easy 3 credits, look somewhere else. Entirely discussion-based class.

hes bitter at life and will make you bitter too...overall negative energy, rude and sarcastic in attempt to hide his insecurity. only sees things from one lense-his own. loves his grandma and talks about her every class ...??
tough prof, doesn't take any**** from students, but overall pretty cool if you put in some effort

This guy is fabulously intelligent and competent. Show up to class, participate in discussions, and have a proficient handle on the rules of English grammar (shouldn't that be obvious???) and you'll do fine. If you are a slacker or an idiot, you will (did) not like this class. I fell in love with the subject and he's one of my favorite professors.

I can't believe it, a professor that actually tried to educate his students and hold them to high academic standards.  How dare he!  Anyone who doesn't know you don't use contractions in an academic paper doesn't belong in a 300 level class.  All you trust fund kids need to get a life.

REL301=a pathetic waste of $$.America thanks GOD that his mentality is limited by lack of personality and communicative skills.If you crave depression& a want to harbor hate for America's lifestyle,step aboard!!He'd be better in an undeveloped country,weaving his own clothing from fallen leaves.Enjoy your time at P'dine,& avoid useless prof.'s

If u want2 pass this class,A)dont buy books,just go2 class&state ur opinion,he's oblivious 2the fact that only 3/4 out of 20+ students read the assignmt's.B)drop all your classes,&only study grammar for the 2 mandtry.papers.C)Create some humor 4 the class by talking about something intellegent,he'll dodge the topic say"We'll get to that next week"

If you care about the environment, are a strong writer, and participate in class discussions, definitely take this class. I loved it but I fit these descriptions. He is a STICKLER for attendance, even at 8am. Your grade is heavily based on 2 essays, get them proofread!! He has a lot of stupid rules but I learned a lot in the class.
he is way too sarcastic and his way is the ONLY way

this professor is the WORST professor ever. He is against the rich and wealthy. He is against anybody who is not like his sorry self. Avoid his class altogether. Paying $3000 for his class is the biggest joke. even if he paid students to attend his class...nobody would go. He should leave..it would be his best contribution to humankind. LEAVE.

This guy some how made a REL course with a basis of Democratic Environmental Rights and GRAMMAR RULES & REGULATIONS. He is very bitter-should seek therapy before fall.  Actually stated in class "Pep students buy diploma by writing check/ ni effort" Plan to grade hard to decrease ongoing pattern of wealth empowerment- Tree Hugger on Power Trip

If you enjoy listening to left wing propaganda then this is the class for you.  The class was like on long Al Gore movie.  You better have a PhD in English in order to pass the writing portion of the class.  Any new ideas that don't fit with his agenda are passed over and shut down.  Oh and by the way "don't" use contractions in you paper.

Definatly not an easy professor, but very fair.  Entire grade was based on 2 essays, participation in daily discussions, and a final project.  The class was interesting, but needed to keep up with the reading.  Very strict on grammar and spellling in essays and final project.  No note taking necessary.  Just show up to class and write you papers.

Now here's a guy that has the English ability of a third grader. Also talks to his students like a third grader.  Needs more people skills. For someone that is supposed to be student orientated he lacks all of that. Needs to go back to "how do I learn how to speak politely to a student 101"
All about writting!  2 essays and the final consists of 4 essays.  Wait a few years and he most likely will loosen up and be much easier.  If you don't keep up with the reading...good luck!

Says he is really open to suggestions about his teaching style, but he IS NOT.  He asks for differing opinions but gets defensive if it differs from his.  He's not unfair, but he has some personal issues he needs to work out before he will be "open" to suggestions or free discussion.  A girl can challenge his opinion, but guys....DON'T EVEN TRY IT
No Comments

Final grade is based off of 3 assignments, one of which is unrelated from the course. Don't bother studying, exam questions are broad and difficult to answer. Lectures are hard to follow and he often overshares personal beliefs and irrelevant information. Plays favorites and often wastes class time conversing with them. Frustrating course
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Your grade is made up of only 3 things: midterm exam, research paper, and the final exam. Exams are open ended essay questions however the questions are vague and he expects specific answers. He also talks too much about his personal life and shares his political views and it feels like he judges you for not agreeing with him. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: 3 gradebook entries, lecture-heavy, and is a strict grader. He lectures and he rambles A LOT. His grading is 50/50 whether you'll get a good grade or not because if you don't write what he wants you to write you'll get a bad grade even though what you wrote down is right and valid. He makes weird comments too.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Take Davenport for a good laugh! He's amazing! Prof Davenport is one of the most caring professors I have had at Pepp. His lectures are sometimes hard to follow, but his discussion days really help to clarify everything. He grades fair and doesn't try to trick you on tests.
One of the most caring teachers I've ever had and really listens to his students. I wish he was a little more concise with his lectures, but his class is very easy nonetheless.

Hes kind of funny, and definitely a good guy, he just sometimes takes a while to get to the point. The books you have to get for this class are not actually required. I only read 1 of the 4, and while it was interesting and helped solidify the material, it definitely wasnt necessary. Very understanding that its a GE class.
this teacher is awesome. please take him.

Because Hist 200 is mostly up to independent research and work by the students, the professor's job in this class is to guide us as we worked. Davenport does this fantastically and his feedback will always make you a better writer and student. He also cares a lot about mental health and will move things around on the calendar to best help the class

I can understand why he might get some hate, but you just have to pay attention and take good notes. 2 tests and a project. If your looking for an easy A then go somewhere else, but if you get him then just pay attention and take notes and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Davenport is very kind, but his lectures are so hard to follow. No PowerPoint or study guide provided. Basically, you have to take notes of everything he said. The exams will check you on the specifics of history, such as dates and time, and some free writing questions. Very hard class as a GE..
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Nothing much to say- not good but not bad. He is way to political and tends to offer opinion over facts (I had him during an election semester). Only 3 grades, and he grades the essay portion tough. No outside work besides the occasional reading. Wouldnt take again but was not miserable

He is an average professor. Good personality but way too political. He always inserts his political view on all of us which can get annoying a lot. Graded by midterm, final, and one paper. His lectures are very unorganized and unstructured. You take notes from what he is saying; there is no powerpoint or anything. Lack of study tools.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I love Professor Davenport, he's by far my favorite teacher. His HIST204 class is interesting and engaging. He is funny and genuinely cares about his students. His lectures are non-visual, so you have to show up to class and pay attention. If you meet the grading criteria and put in effort you will for sure get an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: He doesn't use a ppt, he just lectures. For a GE, this class is on the more difficult side. 2 tests and a project (easy A) make up the grade.

He is a chill guy and is extremely knowledgeable. Class is unorganized and nothing is posted on courses. Says too many bad jokes that only the 2-3 teachers pets will laugh at. Mentions his liberal views and gets on his soap box a little too much, but overall hes a nice guy and its an easy class.

Very chill person but not the best professor. Lectures are disorganized and hard to follow. Very liberal. The class is more the history of race relations in the US than a survey of American history. Love him as a person but would not take his class again.

Professor Davenport is a great person but his American History course is hard! There are 5 books to read and the only things that are graded are the midterm, final, and an essay/presentation. His lectures are interesting, but the information is only verbal. If you're in his class, make sure you take good notes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: always go to class cause he doesn't use slides or ppt, information is never online but delivered in person

Davenport is an excellent professor and is a kind individual. His class was definitely heavy on tests, as 66.66% of your grade is determined by the midterm and final. There's little outside work to do, but be warned: do not skip class. Since he does not use a PPT or specific textbook for lecture, all the info is 100% verbal. Know dates.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I took my history GE with Davenport and I loved him! I learned more in his class than all of my other classes this semester. He asked me to audit a class of his next semester, and I'm definitely going to try. Tip: GO TO CLASS and TAKE GOOD NOTES! Knowing history is not enough. You definitely need to work for an A in this class, but he's worth it!
Best teacher I have had at Pepperdine.  Take his class!

Truly a great teacher and person.  He is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about history, he makes it interesting.  Such a genuine person - funny, nice, and interested in getting to know his students.  Take notes during lectures & you'll do great, he makes it very clear what you need to know & you'll end up learning very useful information.

What an amazing person. Great teacher and a great friend. Professors like Dr. Davenport are the reason that I came to Pepperdine. ALWAYS willing to meet with students outside of class to help and discuss. After taking his class, I want to be a history major!

One of the best teachers on campus. Dr. Davenport truly loves history and relates it extremely well to students. It's as enjoyable as a US History class can possible be. He's also a truly genuine, cordial, and nice guy. Not an "easy" class--you have to earn your grade by writing thoughtful and clear papers and taking weekly quizzes.
Wonderful teacher. Essays can be a drag, but if youre having trouble just go talk to him. Intelligent and funny.

I really liked his class!  it felt really laid back and easy to follow. Just be clear on your papers, pick a position, and stick with it.  It was one of my favorite classes at Pepperdine I have ever taken...seriously!
lectures are interesting, quizzes are pretty easy just read your notes before hand. He is fun guy

For someone who requires you to be soooo clear on ur papers, he is the worst lecturer ever.....so unclear....all over the place...i mean i would still take him cause you just have to write papers....just know you are going to want to die in lecture....

Really good professor and cool dude. Class is interesting. His lectures are informative, interesting, and keep your attention. He's really nice and is always more than willing to help out with anything. I really reccomend Dr. Davenport - he's one of my favorite professors I've ever had.

He teaches revisionist history, basically he teaches his opinion on history and not so much the facts. He didn't like my writing style so I didn't do so well in the class. I didn't like this class, but I usually liked him okay.
OMG. I love him with all of my heart. That other girl doesn't know what she's talking about b/c he's going to marry ME.
No Comments

OK really hot but a hard grader.  There are easier teachers you can get an A with but they aren't as nice to look at! So you have to decide what is important here.  He hated my writing style so that didn't help me out.  No tests just 5 papers.Kinda boring sometimes but not really an attendence polic
Very Hot! Easy B ..hard A but you can get an A if you go in and ask for help! He is not bad to look at therefore going for help is nto a big deal...TAKE HIM

i am in love w/ dr. davenport. even though the material can be kinda boring at times, i still went to class for some eye candy.  southern gentleman, great dry sense of humor, relates well to his students, clear on what he expects academically.  and he doesn't know it yet, but he's gonna marry me.
He is so cute...very easy to talk to and really relates to students.Class is interesting and fun. I would take another class of his just to look at him!

Extremely passionate about history. A little disorganized, but is ultimately very knowledgeable. Very personable, funny, (and cute.) If you make sure that your papers have a strong argument then you will do fine.  Much better than any of the other HIST 304 classes.

Davenport is a really, really cool person and a fun history teacher. He seems very level headed and teaches without bias those things that many would skip over. Write your papers clearly and concisely, and make a good argument and you will get an A. Makes history very enjoyable. I love the guy.

Class is cake. Do your papers on time. Make them clear and you will be golden. Go to discussions with your question and be willing to present it and you will walk out smiling. plus he is not bad to look at... :)
No Comments
He is hard but he explains from the beginning of class what he wants from each paper and each question.  You will learn alot from his classes as well as his discussions.
Okay teacher. Sort of goofy, sort of disorganized, not real clear.  Nice guy, and it's good to see that a conservative place like Pepperdine would hire an (almost) openly****professor.
Great guy...easy B- really cute personality and fun. Makes history as interesting as it can be
No Comments
Stewart Davenport is the cutest teacher at Pepperdine university. The class is very entertaining.

Class isn't the most interesting thing ever, but you can't expect too much entertainment from a four-hour night class. Only two papers due, a midterm and final, but he's a pretty hard grader. I do like the class, and all my friends think he's really hot.
I think Dr. Davenport is by far the cutest prof at Pepperdine.  His little brown tweed suits make him look absolutly adorable.
A great guy is still coming into his own as a lecturer. Probablly one of the easier B's, but a very difficult A at best. Discussion periods are amoung the best!
he's a good teacher, but very boring

while this man is definitely hot, his lectures are unorganized and he definitely expects way too much in his essays if he doesn't cover the material well enough. He is good, but not the best. He is new, so I am sure that with time he will improve.

He runs a pretty formal class, but doesn't make you memorize much at all.  Just essay exams, in which you really have to be clear and thorough.  He'll help you if you talk to him out of class, but people don't seem to think of that.

Davenport is a very nice guy, but I did not enjoy History 200 with him at all.  His lectures were often unclear and lacked organization, yet he expected a lot out of us when it came to essay exams.  Again, he is a great person, but I hated his class.
A very fun professor, especially his multimedia extravanganze lectures.  I fell in love with History because of him.
so boring. the material can be hard to grasp for those who are new to econ but if you listen in class i think you should be fine. definitely go to office hours that really helps
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: snooze fest i could not focus esp because it was an elkins. the material isnt hard, but ive actually never been so bored. you have to pay to do extra credit and homework, (only 10% of the class will even be affected by the ec), he drops a midterm out of 2. and he grades using a gpa?? system combining ur midterm and homeworks grade. its weird avoid

His explanations during lectures and office hours were not the clearest, which made understanding the material challenging. Since the class is solely based on exams and in Elkins, his confusing teaching style could make it difficult to keep up. He's a great person though and willing to help you out duing his OH, so ask for help and you can do good!

Good professor, very clear in expectations and grading criteria. Content for behavioral is tough, but Yuengert does a good job of making the material more digestible. Very helpful in office hours as well.
Wonderful, pious man! He is highly intelligent and an amazing professor!
Great professor if it wasn't for him I would be struggling in my Macro class. He's very professional and by the book, he's a good man as well.

Attend the lectures and definitely read the textbook. There is online homework each night and group projects every week, but it's not hard work. He offers many chances to earn extra credit, so it's not impossible to get a good grade. He posts the midterm concepts and old test questions before each exam which are helpful for studying.

He is definitely a good professor and is accesible outside of class. He's really helpful in office hours. This class is definitely lecture heavy and make sure to pay attention in class because at times it can get boring. Don't make the mistake of not paying attention at the beginning of the semester otherwise you won't know what's going on at all.

The professor was very prepared when it came to class sessions. He often would try to relate the material to us by asking us questions and having us answer them, which I found to be engaging in a lecture hall class. There were many opportunities to receive extra credit too.

Great professor, he's kind and so smart. Explains very hard concepts so easily and uses class time very well. I did put a decent amount of time into studying and still did poorly on tests. Test material is too hard and tricky, and for some reading quizzes you have to teach yourself the material before the lecture. Would take him again though!

Yuengert is my favorite econ prof thus far. He is caring and accessible. He is a hard grader, and there are simply too many quizzes and tests. The class is a lot of busy work, but you learn a lot. He is a total expert. I would say he is slightly old-fashioned but tenured, so that is expected. I would take his classes if you can.

Professor Yeungert is a professor that is caring and wants you to succeed. His lecture may be not as engaging but he is clear and super helpful outside of class. There are group projects throughout the class and tests are really big in grade.

first Econ class and I hated it. you have a group project weekly, homework daily on achieve which is not bad but having to pay to turn in homework is so unfair. I could not learn as he would teach by showing a graph the whole class time and was very monotone

My guy Ron is really not my super favorite. He is a kind human, and is available for office hours should you need; this semester was a large group lecture and he is not the prof for that setting. I think if you were to be able to ask questions more easily and engage that he would be good, but not in Elkins. I love Econ, and still hated this class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Taking Yuengert in Elkins was difficult, especially when he teaches 100% from PowerPoint. SO MUCH GROUP WORK. You pick your group on the first day of class and have to meet weekly with them to write a one-page paper. If you get a bad group, good luck. Class recordings and materials are uploaded online, and he is available outside of class.

Honestly, I didn't study for the class and got an A, it's not hard. Just be nice to him and actually listen to the lectures. He is also really easy to talk to during office hours and willing to help. His lectures are pretty boring though and there is a small group project every week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Professor Yuengert'c class consisted mainly of his lectures and group projects. I paid attention during class and did all my homework, yet I still got a B+. I did not go to any of his office hours, so I presume that helped. Other than that, his tests are super difficult and take the material to a whole other level, but he does curve them.

TAKE HIM! I'm not some nerd or ridiculous try hard student. I've always been a typical, procrastinating, take the easy way student. And I got an A! It's not hard if you simply pay attention, take notes. Lectures are SO intuitive, that I rarely had to read textbook. The only way you could do bad is if you don't show up. Tests are curved! He's great!

Prof Yuengert might be one of my favorite professors. He's boring, and hard to pay attention to at 3:40pm, however, he knows what he's talking about! His tests are so hard, but he curves them so much you can't really fail. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS! He will explain everything! He is such a genuine person and wants you to succeed. Take his class!

Yuengert's test are ridiculously hard, but he curves them to where it is basically impossible to fail. Definitely go to his office hours, they are super helpful and you will like his class way more if you do. He is so sweet and I loved him, definitely recommend if you are required to have this class.

Professor Yuengert's office hours are super helpful (but lectures are not) and he will resolve all your problems. The whole course consists of two midterms and one final exam(40 questions each). Make sure you understand all the concepts because all the tests are very challenging and if you get a 23/24 out of 40 you will get a B and 30 for an A.
Class is a hybrid, all homework and quizzes online. Tests are really tough, but curved to keep it reasonable. Lectures aren't too bad, must read the textbook to fully understand.
Professor Yuengert is great! Not the most exciting, but he is very clear, concise, and knowledgeable about economics. What more could you ask for?

Yuengert is a caring professor, but his lectures are hard and boring to listen to. The test are super hard. If you don't need this class, do NOT put yourself through it. He will help you if you ask, but the whole concept is still super confusing. Luckily he does extra credit, and the group projects are not that difficult.

He has a very soft voice and often mumbles the last half of his sentences. For an elkins class he gives a lot of opportunities to acquire points. If you're not a good conceptual thinker, then find someone who gets the material really well! You pick your economic application groups on the first day, and you'll write 8-12 one page papers with them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's so so so boring. He's a really nice and fair person but his lectures are brutal. If you read the textbook and study with kids who know what they're doing you'll be fine. I didn't even show up to class and I kept a B. For those who aren't econ people get ready to stress because this is a lot of really boring and really difficult stuff.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: May be boring at 8am in the morning with his drony voice, but he is probably the best econ professor at Pepperdine! He is clear and helps students a ton during office hours! Tests are also fair.

His monotone voice makes paying attention in class/attending class at all difficult. I go to all my classes but I fell asleep whenever I wasn't in the first row so I stopped going to class. He posts the powerpoints he teaches off of on Courses so if you read the book too you should be fine. Weekly group papers. The 8 best groups get grade boosts.

Great guy, not the best professor. Don't take him in Elkins. You WILL fall asleep, and trust me, it's not that comfortable. His voice is the perfect lullaby. There's around 100-150 students in class, but you can't tell until test days. About 30 students go on a regular basis. Go to his office hours, he'll try to help you as best as he can.
Tough tests and its super hard to follow the lectures. Go to the tutoring and read the book. I recommend doing the homework, even though he doesn't collect it.
Tough but great class.  You will learn a lot.  He is very clear and straightforward but you will have to put in some work.
Great guy, very clear, makes you learn a lot. you will have to work hard to get a good great,,one of the best teachers I had at pepperdine.

I started off the class really confused and hardly payed attention...but by the end I was actually starting to enjoy the material and ending up with a B+. He is a great guy...but good luck staying awake.

I have taken both intermediate macro and intermediate micro from Yuengert. He's a decent communicator and is very organized. He will make you participate in class and study for tests, but this means you will learn a lot. The main downside is that he's incredibly boring... bring a latte to class and get over it.

Excellent!  Organized and makes you learn. Tests can be hard but are doable, and no essay questions, just drawing graphs,quantitative/analytical reasoning, and calculations! Come to class and study handouts, HW, and any book diagrams related to stuff in class.  You do have a research paper and presentation tho.
Solid professor. Posts lectures on blackboard which are fairly easy in understanding them. Study hard for the two exams and you'll at least get a B in the class.
He is very nice! Just honestly, it was REALLY hard to stay awake during the classes- that's all I can say

I hated the class. It's hard to stay awake in the class. But you can bring your computer to class so most people just end up surfing the net. The prof is a nice dude but his teaching style is just off. Best off to study on your own. Sometimes he ends up confusing ppl in class so study on your own and you should do fine.

The hardest part is actually paying attention. Huge lecture in Elkins, about 5 out of 100 people are paying attention in a class that has about 250 enrolled (the remaining 150 are MIA) Tests are curved INSANELY. You might get a 50% and end up with a B+.

Tough to force yourself to go to class because his lectures are on blackboard, and he lectures straight from the powerpoint. Very boring class if you have no interest in Micro Econ, but the curves on tests are huge. There is no homework, except for a short 2 page paper throughout the whole semester. Usually a 5 question quiz every week.

he is easy if you pay attention during class or simply do the reading and not mandatory homework that he gives on blackboard. If you put any effort you can easily get an A. He has a curve, so 75 and up is usually an A. He likes if you go to class but he is one of the most boring teachers i ever had... so better study on your own...
Very clear in his explanations. You must be willing to do the reading and pay attention in class. Highly recommended.
If you go to class and seek his help outside of class the class is fairly easy. Read the material and put forth an effort and you will receive a 70% on the exam which turns into an A with the curve
This is the most boring man i have ever listened to
He is a good teacher. I got a B and didnt do too much work. If I tried harder I maybe could of got an A. Big class.
he sucks at teaching...thank god for the curve, only class i know where you can get a 65 on a test and it becomes a "B"
clear, very helpful, very smart, tests are a lil hard, overall great class

He's a really nice man but if you've never had econ before this class will suck He teaches in front of elkins and sounds like the man from the clear eyes commercials, so if you can make it through class and pay attention more power to you He's not very clear in class but if you go to his office he speaks english and things will start to make sense
clear in class but boring because same material gets covered over and over. not that friendly when approached after class. very defensive of test questions. curve makes class easy
NOT HOT, he's like 50. Class in elkins is ok pretty boring, right out of book'
Very smart guy. Tests are about critical thinking using the econ concepts learned in class, so can be tricky, but grades on a curve. Fairly clear in class.

Awesome teacher, very clear and tries hard to make sure you understand the material. Curves tests which is good because the material seems like common sense but is actually pretty hard... Went to Yale and has good experiences to tell. Super Smart!

The class material can be hard but Dr.Y will meet with you outside class to understand concepts. Pretty tough class to take along side with policy or other intense class but def do-able. Important econ concepts!
Very nice teacher, is always there to for you after class if you have any questions. However, the class is not that easy, but he will answer your questions.

one of the highly underrated professors at pepperdine. he is the best econ prof i have had (even better than sexton). presents the material in a very clear way, and makes sure you really get it. try to take him as much as you can.

Dr. Ortbals is one of my favorite professors from my time at Pepperdine. She's incredibly clear with grades and makes European politics easy to understand. I rarely an interest in research but Dr. Ortbals really works with you on papers and research design. Her tests are very fair, you just have to stay on top of the reading. Take her!
Super smart, sweet and gives great lectures. Her tests are brutal but she grades papers easier, so it's possible to get an A or B with really hard work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: 1. You will love her. She is probably the nicest professor at Pepperdine, and if you visit her during office hours she will help you with the class. 2. You will learn a lot. You will read a lot. You will think a lot. 3. You very likely won't make an A. I got an A- and worked my butt off for it.

Niest woman you'll ever meet; that is, until she grades your paper. Kiss it goodbye and say hello to red pen marks for everything you write. If you value your GPA, avoid. But if you want to learn a lot, then take. Don't count on the Dean's List though.

Took Dr. Ortbals last semester and she was awesome! Her class is difficult, but  if it's your major why would you expect any less?? Make sure you read before class and be prepared for the occasional quiz. If you do that you'll be fine! She cares about her students and is super easy to talk to. Try to get to know Dr. Ortbals, she's great!

Took it last yr and guys this was the most difficult class I have taken at Pepp. The professor is super sweet and and she knows a lot about the topic. As a person I think she is just a doll:) but oh my goodness as a professor she is brutal and her tests are not super easy, there's a lot to remember and she's big on details.

Dr. O is great. She's funny & knows her stuff. Tests aren't bad at all, just make sure you nail down dates/names & pay attention in class. There's a lot of reading & she gives quizzes over it; but, she drops the 2 lowest ones. Participation is important to her! Don't be afraid to speak up in class, she won't embarrass you! Super helpful too. 10/10.

Probs the hardest class I have taken at Pepperdine so far. Classes were always interesting but you really need to pay attention because Prof Ortbals tends to jump around a lot. Lots of reading. The tests were hard, with lots of details. The lit review was very challenging, but you learn a lot from it. Proudest A I have ever gotten in my life.

She has a reputation for being really tough, but I found her exams to be pretty straight forward and as long as you began studying a few days in advance you'd be fine.  The essays are where she really clobbers you, so be sure you know the general stuff on the multiple choice so you can get hit there.  She's a really super person.
Prof Ortbals is strict about citations for papers. Her class lectures can get boring but she is pretty funny. She's passionate about the subject.

She's not as hard as everyone says.  Just do exactly what the syllabus says and you'll be fine, and make sure you get her feedback on papers before you turn them in.  Visit her during her office hours and get to know her; she'll really go out of her way to help you and is one of the kindest professors at Pepperdine you'll ever meet.

Very kind person, and always willing to help.  Knows the subjects incredibly well, and is really on top of her game.  Fierce grader. Don't expect to slack and get a good grade.  One of Pepperdine's better professors, but omg you'd better bring it.
Dr. Ortbals is quirky and shy, but has a wealth of knowledge and a genuine passion for what she teaches. She is a monstrous grader though, great papers will be cut down to a B at best.

This class was not as hard as everyone makes it out to be. There was a lit review which was probably the more challenging part about this class, but her midterms and finals are not that hard if you follow her study guide. Her thoughts can be quite scattered but just take notes from her lecture slides and study the important stuff and you'll do fine

Okay do NOT take this class unless you have a light load! She acts like this class is the only class you have! This was a 353 leveled class, & it was harder than all of my 500 level classes! It was ridiculous! Her classes are so hard that everyone in the POSC department refused to take her course for next semester so they cancelled it! don't do it!

Dr. Ortbals is hands down the best POSC professor I have had yet. Unlike some others, she is VERY organized when it comes to lecturing and VERY clear about what to study for exams. The downside is, there is a lot of reading. Like, a lot. But it will be worth it because you learn so much. She  keeps it interesting and is very clear and helpful. :)
She is the sweetest person ever....Grades like a monster though be careful going into the tests

Super knowledgeable, lectures were always extremely organized. She's also very quirky and tries really hard to keep things interesting. I learned a TON in this class. The workload may seem overwhelming, but if you stay on top, you'll do just fine.

She was definitely one of my favorite teachers so far! Compared to all the other political sci classes, her class seemed to be the best. always presents both sides of views & is explains things very clearly. LOVED her class!

I love Dr. Ortbals.  She is so kind and treats students with respect, and is kind of like an older, cool sister you can talk to.  Her classes are not easy, so don't let that sweet veneer fool you.  You'll work like a dog but when it's all done you will have a new friend.

Professor Ortbals rocks! When I 1st came to her class, I considered dropping, but it proved to be THE BEST CLASS I've taken so far in college! She is very nice, smart, knowledgeable, & gives extra credit. You have to put in a lot of work, but it never felt like a waste of time. Tests and the paper are hard. But nonetheless, TAKE HER!

How can a person so sweet, so funny, and so warm be such a monster when it comes to toughness and grading?  Seriously, you'll enjoy the professor, but you'll likely not like your grade when she's done with you.

There is too much go it alone her class. She will give you a review sheet with about 50 potential essays and half of them are on stuff she never lectured on at all. Midterms and finals will be very stressful if you take her class. But personally she's a doll.

Sweet, funny, helpful. But it's INSANELY DIFFICULT to study for her tests. Her study guide isn't even a study guide; might as well say, "Just be an expert and you'll do fine." But you won't be b/c her lectures are too much and too fast. And the reading... ugh.
Well, I'm taking her for a third semester in a row. She is hilarious, intelligent, cares for her student, and is a good teacher. Take her classes!
One of the kindest professors I've met. Extremely kind and helpful as well as quirky. She know alot about what she is teaching, yet she isn't arrogant like some professors. Definitely recommended!!
One of my favorite professors at all of Pepperdine.  Incredibly helpful and very friendly.  Such a kind person.

She's really down-to-earth and approachable, and she spends a lot of time making sure your writing is good.  Very theoretical, but has a really dry sense of humor that will crack some pretty youthful jokes from time to time.

Ok so attendance isn't required but you kinda have to show up to get a decent grade... and yes she will  notice.  The tests are moderatly difficult and the discussion can be interesting.  Would recommend for a GE teacher

She's actually entertaining in class. I remember sitting there laughing at how she would stumble on her words, trip on cords, and lose her balance. She assigns a lot of readings and the tests are rather hard.

Nutty and very funny.  A quirky person, but incredibly friendly and pretty good teacher.  Focuses on the theories of political science more than the day-to-day happenings...too much reading but you'll learn a lot.  The class is much more like a guided reading class than one that centers around course lectures.

Very enthusiastic and excited about the courses and materials she teaches.  Does assign a lot of reading but once you get use to her method of teaching...meaning go to class and take lecture notes, do your quizzes, and talk in class, you should be fine.  Writes good recommendations and can cook!

Teaches the class more like a graduate school class than an undergrad one.  Assigns way too much reading, is more discussion based, and is a really picky grader. Very nice though, and will help you when you need it, which you probably will.

she is the worst teacher ever. she is not only hard, but then completely disroganized and expects you to figure everything out on your own. she makes life impossible, picks favorites and is just all around TERRIBLE.... AWFUL, AWFUL!the worst class ever and not interesting at all!

Good teacher, a little disorganized and scattered.  interesting class (kind of) and overall knows her stuff.  don't take the class unless you are interested in the subject.  she will help you if you need it, just never really was that clear on what i learned in that class.  its a fun course though.
this has been one of the best classes I've ever taken at Pepperdine.  she really knows how to draw our class discussion.  the tests are a little difficult, but she's so caring and friendlty.

She knows her stuff... sometimes trips over her overhead projector cord... but is nice and occasionally funny. Will help you if you ask - gives good review sheets before exams. Exams are hard; you will think you know the ID's for the first test and then she'll expect you to write an elaborate essay on each one. Wait til you get your first one back.
No Comments
tough tests, incredibly nice.  fun.
super nice, but doesn't seem to know anything that isn't already in the book. doesn't mind so much if you sleep :]. oh, and the test ID's are ridiculous.

i learned a LOT in this class, and it totally changed how I felt about the issues.  though sometimes she's a little unorganized, i think her stories are great and she really seemed to know the latest research on the subject.
Um, she's a very nice person, but the class is a bit high schoolish.  I just don't feel that I'm getting a terribly in depth look at the subject, but overall I think she's OK.
Dr. O knows what she's talking about, and her research informs this class a lot.  I think she's really funny and doesn't take herself too seriously, and she's nice.  Enjoyable class.
Quite a character.
No Comments
this was a fun class.  Dr. O really seems to like the subject and her students.  it wasn't too hard or too easy, and the readings/discussions were non-traditional. take this class.
Very interesting!  Good at making the class fun.  Great GE course.
Take her for this course...Attendnace optional...Test come straight from lecture...3 papers short and sweet...The best GE by far
Her class is pretty good, but her deserts are better.  Make sure you eat her cooking.
a lot of fun and very balanced
Very nice, very young, and very helpful. Occasionally funny, but sometimes the lectures are a little dry.  Neither too hard nor too easy. Pretty good choice.
Makes you think about things you've never thought of before.  Funny and very quirky.  The assignments are hard but she grades fairly.
Took him for all of great books. By far the best professor and class experience I've ever had. If you have the opportunity to take him, do it. It is so worth the work

Gose seems like he has a hard shell but he is truly one of the most caring, intelligent, sensitive, passionate, and teddy bear-like professors out there. Don't let his reputation or dry humor fool you. He is so sweet and grandfatherly!

If you are looking to improve as a thinker/reader/writer then take him. If you're looking for an easy A, don't.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Will actually teach, very wise and has a lot of experience and amazing insight. One of my favorite teachers, will help you learn and absolutely hilarious. So good, but very difficult- payoff is worth it entirely though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Gose is an incredible professor. Do not show up to class without doing the reading! He is intellectually demanding and the course requires a lot of critical thinking and classroom discussion, but if you do all of the readings and show up to class prepared, you are automatically guaranteed a B.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: read the books, like really read them, otherwise you can't participate in class and therefore, will fail. He's harsh but that's only because he truly believes in tough love. He's rooting for you even if it feels like you're always in the hot seat. probably the smartest man I've ever met, so listen when he talks but be aggressive with your arguments
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He is VERY intellectual and I learned a lot from the class. If you want intellectual challenge, take him. However the only thing that I want to point out is that sometimes it is hard to catch what he is talking about which makes the whole takeaway from the class hard to tell. Also it is very possible to get a B from his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: I took Gose for Great Books I because Pepp. nearly required it for all first year Regents scholars. If you are not passionate about the subject, please take a different first year seminar. In terms of a seminar, it is very difficult and not worth getting a poor grade. If it is something that you are interested in, you may enjoy it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I have so much I could say about him. He genuinely cares about his students & really wants you to get an A. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS!! It may be intimidating but he will work with you personally to help you get an A. Definitely the hardest great books professor with the most reading but he will be your BIGGEST supporter after his class is over

Gose is very intelligent and has a lot of experience with his subject. He's one of those professors who has the sort of brain you wish you could pick for an opinion on anything. However, be prepared to spend hours upon hours reading old English that's beyond boring. He challenges every thought and opinion you have, so you're always on the hot seat.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took all 4 Great Books and this was the only one I didn't get an A in. Definitely improved as a writer and thinker, but I don't think Gose's harsh methods were necessary. You'll have 350 pages of reading to do in 2 days, and if you misunderstand something, he might kick you out of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Goes loves Cuban cigar and his students; you will have lots of fun in his class if you are a book nerd, otherwise be prepared to read a lot.

Gose is awesome at teaching Great Books. He makes you read more than any other Professor, but is worth the challenge. He lets you re-do papers and wants you to get an A. This class in general helped me understand different perspectives instead of judging, and present evidence in a clear manner. In class essays are not too difficult if really read.

I took Dr. Gose for Great Books I this semester and this turned out to be my favorite class... by far. Sure, it's a lot of reading, but you get out of it what you put in. Dr. Gose is on your side and wants the very best out of you because he knows you can do it. Would definitely recommend

I love Dr. Gose. His class is my favorite. He does a lot more reading than all of the other Great Books classes, but our class discussions are super helpful. He relates everything to real life situations. He comes at it from a different perspective, we only look at the books from the views of the authors, not our own opinion or the time period.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Gose STARTED Great Books at Pepperdine. our class understands the ideas behind the books better than any GB kids from other classes I've talked to. Gose's class is full of awesome and challenging conversation. the class is really tight. we have done everything from yell about Plato to race down the halls in rolling chairs. he bought us chinese food
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Would take again

comment: Gose is such an amazing human being! Our whole class not only has a great relationship with him as our professor, but also with each other. The way he facilitates classes makes for great discussion and great community. He really teaches us all how to think for ourselves and how to really read a book! TAKE HIM. It is so worth the challenge!!!

Professor Gose is an incredible teacher. He teaches his students how to think in such a unique, challenging, and life-changing way. In having conversations about the Great Books with students under almost all other professors, I have found that no student of someone other than Gose I have talked with understands the books as well as Gose teaches us

My entire Pepperdine tuition was worth being able to learn from this one man. He helped me learn for the first time. He teaches you how to actually think for yourself. Hands down, best learning experience I have ever had. This class, this content, and this teacher will prepare you for the world in a way no other class or experience will.

Gose is a great person who really likes to challenge the status quo and make his students think. However he is not for everyone. I had him twice, the first time I was really excited to be challenged, the second time I was just frustrated. I am double majoring in English and Philosophy and still could not understand his interpretations of the books.
Great class. Great prof.

The best teacher I've ever had, his way of running this class the best way possible. Guaranteed a "B," students are encouraged to push limits & take risks in their papers, enhancing your learning like you would not believe. It is very clear that he is not present for your approval, but for your betterment. The class is wicked hard, but so worth it.

Dr. Gose is a superb professor, whose vast intellect and brilliant wit combine to engage and inspire. He teaches his students wonderfully, not only teaching them the material but also teaching them how to think. Expect to work hard, but expect to deeply appreciate every hour spent working and expect to learn more under him than in any other class.

Best professor I have ever had in my life, period. One of the hardest, and most rewarding classes I took at Pepperdine - Gose has high standards, but is brilliant, invests in you, and... frankly, I miss him. Truly a great among greats. I am only now, writing this review 10 years after graduation, because I was thinking of his class and missed him!

Freaking genius, the dude taught me how to think differently and how to appreciate college and the liberal arts. Can not speak how highly this guy has influenced me and always makes class easy and is extremely willing to help. TAKE HIM if you get the chance. Not the easiest but if you show up to class and turn in assignments you can get a B easily.

Best professor ever! Just be sure to do the reading. He will probably pick on you, but its all in good fun. If you don't like being put on the spot... Do yourself a favor and don't take him. He plays tough at the beginning, but he eventually softens up. He cares about his students. It's Great Books... Yes, theres a lot of reading.

He was the best Professor, smoking partner, and mentor that I have ever had. All I can say is that his Greatbooks 3 and 4 will change your life. Never lie about reading your books. If you didn't read, tell him and he will respect you more for it (as long as it's not a habit). I learned more from his classes than all my other classes combined.

The Best professor I have ever had. He is not only a professonal teacher but someone of vast knowledge about life and a welcoming mentor. If you go through Great Books without taking gose for at least one you have missed out on what the program has to offer. He started the GB program at pepperdine and knows how to teach it better than anyone.

he STARTED the great books program, and is dissapointed with the way the other teachers teach it.  SO TAKE HIM!  best teacher ever.  his personality is all a game, he plays devils advocate in class, and acts self absorbed to help teach, really he is the most selfless helpful person i have ever met.  TAKE GOSE!!!

His class is so hard but if you take him for great books then the lowest grade he will give you is a B. Great GB teacher, I learned more from him then any other of my GB professors. Just be sure to get on his good side.

The best professor I have taken thus far at Pepperdine. Difficult, challenging, with a dry/caustic sense of humor -- but I absolutely love him and learned a lot. If you have a problem with confrontation or being put on the spot, beware. Otherwise, a great experience.

Probably the best, most challenging teacher i have ever had. He knows how to push his students to do their own personal best and he teaches you so much more than just the great books, he teachers you to start thinking and pushes you to keep thinking.

Dr. Gose has very high expectations of his students and you don't want to disappoint. He was one of the best professors that I had at Pepperdine and he really pushes you to think for yourself.  I know that if I need anything- I can always e-mail him to ask for help. Take a class with Dr. Gose only if you're ready to work hard in his class.

To succeed in Gose's class, read the material, show up and participate.  Oh... and don't be offended if he tells you he thinks your comment is lame/unfounded.  Dr. Gose is there to challenge you - not coddle you.

one of the hardest classes I've ever taken.  if you put in the time and effort, it's definitely worth it. you might think he doesn't like you, but he sees a lot of potential in his students, and really does want to help them. if you want to learn something, take Gose.

Dr. Gose is the best Great Books professor. The class is a much different style. He focuses more on the idealogies presented by the authors rather than their literary styles. I feel I learn more and that I will be able to use what I learn. He's does the mean persona at first but you know he cares.
Cake Walk
The class is super hard, but it ends up being worth the work you put into it.  Tests are virtually impossible...  Makes perfect prep for grad schools and writes tremendous rec letters!

Definitely the best GB teacher at this school and arguably the best on campus as well. You WILL work hard and it WILL be worth it. Dont cheat yourself, take his class. Great sense of humor, even if he is the most self involved person i've ever met. It doesnt keep him from also caring about his class
Really knows his stuff, but really arrogant.  He is a good teacher, but hard to be great when you are so into yourself.

gb like it's supposed to be..not for the spoiled and complainers, you've got to earn your grade here..if u want to be more virtuous, not just learn about virtue, take his classes..those who can't get over his personality need to get over it
Who does this guy think he is?  It feels like he goes out of his way to be rude and cold.
the most amazing professor at Pepperdine.  you want to go to a good graduate school, get his rec.  taught me how to think differently and analytically.  the best prep for any grad school.
No Comments
fact
The best guy ever. Totally changed the way I think. Most just class ever ;) Do the hard work, come out with instant results.
THE BEST GREAT BOOKS TEACHER if you want to actually come out of the class with an understanding of the material.  Not for lazy people.
film clase is a joke
No Comments
The MAN
I LOVE GREAT BOOKS AND DR. GOSE IS THE BEST!!

Baim is a really overhated professor. His lectures are clear, he's a great guy, he's just very disorganized. I think the only reason people don't succeed in his class is because a 1.5 hour lecture on economics can be incredibly boring, so they just don't learn. Pay attention, take notes, and you'll be fine. Watch out for mistakes in exam questions.

Despite the negative feedback often expressed towards Professor Baim, I thought he was a very kind teacher.  He often joked around too much, but he was very caring and made sure everyone knew what he was trying to teach.  Some things he said were a bit confusing, but I was definitely able to learn a lot from this class.

This class is pretty difficult. There isn't much homework but the exams have a lot of theory questions which makes them difficult to study for. My biggest advice for this class is to do all the extra credit assignments he offers. I had a C in the class but just because of my extra credit and the curve I ended up with an A.

I do not recommend taking this course unless you're good at understanding economics because you will have to teach yourself. There's textbook readings, online assignments, and in class lectures and I was still lost. The quizzes are heavily weighted and can tank your grade. Sit in the front row or else you can't read his hand writing on the board.

If you are a decent student ignore the bad reviews. I didn't study for most of the tests and barely listened in class yet I got an A. His tests are straightforward and are related to his lectures. Many say that the tests and lectures are unrelated but they are the same concepts. Do the extra credit! If you struggle just ask for help he is helpful

Professor Baim is obviously passionate about economics and is a really nice person who wants you to succeed. However, he is not a very good professor. His lectures were extremely confusing, and I ended up having to teach most of the material to myself. His exams are on the difficult side. I would recommend taking a different professor if possible.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He does everything he can to give you a better grade, yet I still got a c. idk why his class was so hard for me (I literally got an a in all of my other classes). my advice is to actually watch and understand the pre-class lectures because those will help on quizzes/midterm.

Baim is a nice professor and cares for his students but I did not like the way he taught. He wrote on the whiteboard and sometimes his writing looked like chicken scratch. He gives two quizzes, a midterm, and the final. Most of them were online and multiple choice. They were short but each question was worth a lot of points. Just pay attention ig
He is funny. He has preclass assignments that basically cover the material in the lecture. He gives extra credit assignments that help you prepare for quizzes. Quizzes are pretty straightforward

He is absolutely terrible. I am not one of those people that complains because I got a bad grade. The fact that tuition is so high and this is the type of professor I get is unbelievable.
