He spends all of class on one page of a handout, gave us an online textbook he never used before, and he thinks he's funny. Get out of this class please.

If you're a good student, ignore the bad reviews. Baim may take a while to get through the material, but this is because he wants to make sure everyone can understand it. Tests are based on lectures/notes, and if you pay attention you'll be fine. Grading system is weird but fair. And yes, he is super funny. Ask about his dogs and he'll love you.

Goofy guy. I was worried going into this class after reading the reviews. Tests weren't hard and he graded them fair. I wasn't able to attend every class and he was accommodating. Good professor. Hard to find outside of class though
Awful. Do everything you can to avoid taking him. Lectures or textbook problems have nothing to do with the exams.
Exams are completely unrelated to his lectures. Class consists of him making jokes and spending half an hour on one demonstration.

More than halfway through the semester we have barely covered Elasticity. Baim wastes time in class by telling jokes and trying to be a funny guy, rather than actually teaching the material. He is consistently wrong when grading and essentially punishes students for standing up to him about him being wrong by making fun of them. Terrible professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: more interested in selling candy bars than teaching a class..
Take advantage of the nuggets- dont fall behind on class work

Worst in the Business Division at Pepp. He is the Dean of the Business Division, which is the worst thing possible for students. Good luck having Pepp be reputable to employers w/ him as the face of your major. No wonder BA students at Pepp can't get jobs. Can't run a division, can't teach. It is like they gave him Dean only because his name.
he let me know how important to read the review before take his class.Because his class is really USELESS! DON'T TAKE, JUST DON'T.

A horrible teacher. He was funny in class, but his tests were ridiculous- not near what we learned in class. Micro econ is my life and what got me into Pepperdine, but after this class, I do not want pursue this passion.
Baim is not for the faint of heart. He clearly knows the material, using plenty of humor and examples to get his point across.
worst teacher...thinks he is the best econ teacher in america but can't explain things properly...only complains about his low salary...

Tells some good jokes. Nice guy. Uses simple, obscure examples for econ points. Too simple, though, cuz you don't learn anything new. And what is tested is way harder than class lectures, not even the same. His upper and lower division courses are the same.

Made me want to be an econ major. Very clear, almost overly clear. If you study his tests are easy, but without studying you will be lost. Also a wonderful man outside of class. Great sense of humor made me laugh every day

This teacher is strange. He makes dumb jokes every single day and gets offended when people don't laugh at him. Regardless, he is a great teacher. He is incredibly knowledgable and will stand up there and just ramble off his lectures with no notes at all. He also grades his tests very quickly! If you work hard in his class, an "A" is attainable.

I had some high hopes for this class. He seems like a nice guy and can be pretty funny at times, but that is all he has to offer. Learned nothing in this class and was absolutely worthless. I dropped out of the business major solely because of him. By far, the worst professor I have ever had. I regret ever taking this class.

great teacher. class is tough and demanding and requires lot of time commitement especially with aplia but is definitely worth it. you learn the material better than any other class, i worked my ass off but got an A in the end, with only 20 min studyin b4 final. he curves against classmates so its GOOD! TAKE HIM!

Baim is not hard, he is just incompetent.  I don't know how someone with his lack of intelligence got so far, but he is an embarrassment to Pepperdine and a living argument for the abolition of tenure.
Great Teacher!

Intro to microeconomics my first semester & first year in college. I get decent grades (Bs mostly), and not only was I confused more after going to class, but what was taught had barely any relation to the homework that was assigned(Aplia).The tests were completely impossible because they didn't relate to what was taught in class nor the homework.

I actually really enjoyed taking Baim: I had him for Microecon (BA210) and Managerial Econ (BA 445) and got A's in both.  I showed up late every class (by at least 15 minutes) for Microecon and was usually late for Managerial Econ as well.  Exams can be challenging,; if you go to class and take thorough notes, you'll do fine.

Dean Baim is the worst teacher I ever had. He wastes time in class which is mandatory. He makes homework due before teaching it and sometimes weeks before its covered in class. Tests are incredibly difficult, especially because he words them in a confusing way and won't explain to you if you ask him in class.All he does is complain about his salary

Baim does not teach anything useful during class.  He is on a power trip in that he only gives you points on a test if you re-write his thoughts for answers.  His class is worthless.  He wastes student's time and money and complains about not being paid enough.

What can one say about Baim?  The class is boring as hell, tests are impossible, to get on his good side throw his insults back at him (he is a sadist & masochist).  This is an actual quote from his email "...if your answer to the question is as long as this e-mail it will be too long.  I have bad reading habits and fell asleep half way through."
He is a very nice guy, but he does not teach the material well.  You are responsible for learning it yourself by studying outside of class.  He's a bit cynical.

i never went and still got a C. actual Baim quote "you know I always wanted to get a cell phone, put it on vibrate, put it in my pocket, and call myself alot." he is really weird and really hard.  he has been at pepp FOREVER. he really doesn't fail people unless you do really bad so if c's=degrees for you then go for it

This guy is a pretty good professor. He explains things well and also tries to be funny at the same time - he fails on that part a lot of times. Still, except the fact that he goes over only a little material at each lecture, this class is quite good. He tries to let you pass - given that you actually know something about economics after taking him
By far the worst teacher I have ever had.  He has a short/bald/power complex. He tries to embarrass students publicly because he has an inferiority complex. Don't take his class.

One of the worst at Pepperdine. DO NOT TAKE THIS MAN. He is bitter to the world although its understandable once you meet him. A truly pathetic individual who is blessed with tenure. While class is challenging and tests/assignments are difficult, he is the main problem.
Really hard, especially if you dont go to Elkins classes. Tests are very hard and I recommend Yuengert!!! (I know because I didnt exactly pass with Baim)
Worse teacher ever. Never take him!!! Couldnt understand anything he was saying. Tests are so hard...

He sucks balls, freaking whiner!!! Complained about how much he gets paid instead of being grateful for having a life teaching in an environment few are blessed to surround themselves with.  Wish he would leave teaching to those compassionate about their s

Worst professor I have ever had at Pepperdine!  Tests are impossible and completely different from what he teaches in class.  He thinks he's a stand up commedian but is really not funny.  He complains a lot about his pathetic life.  Take someone else....anyone else!
teaches on level 1 and tests on level 8. be ready to work and study your @ss off!

Great guy with a great sense of humor.  His tests are fairly difficult - but I was struggling so I studied my butt off for the final and passed with a high grade. He curves the grades which helps immensely, and get an A on the final, you get an A grade
I learned a lot, but the tests were very difficult.

his tests are completely unreasonable based on the material he teaches in class.  he teaches at level 2 and tests at level 4 or 5.  and yes, he's completely unflexible regarding grades and questions about such things.
Yeah, you think he's all cool and stuff but won't even rationally discuss your test grade with you.
No Comments

Hes awesome. As a freshman, it wasn easiest class, but in my experience, if you pay attention to his lectures, write interesting blog posts, and participate in class, he is willing to work with you in many ways. He grades very fair. I got a B- on the midterm, worked my butt off, and raised my grade to an A-. I didnt even read the textbook at all.

One of the best professors at Pepperdine. His lecture was not the strongest among all the Polisci professors, but he is such a caring person. He puts into efforts of understanding you as a student, and a person as well. People on here are way too critical of him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--So many papers

comment: Haha I have no idea what these people are talking about. I'm a terrible student and Prof. Williams is the most caring and genuine human beings out there. If you are struggling even a little this guy will wait on you hand and foot. His style of teaching is unorthodox but you will learn better and more freely because of it.

Williams is extremely unorganized and will cause you a lot of unneeded stress. Not only is he extremely late and behind in confused lectures, grading, and class material, but he is also extremely unjust in his grading style. I was very upset when I got my low grade on a paper he said was "excellent in content" but needed more "grammatical editing"

Im a lousy student but Williams is probably the best professsor I have had at pepp. Very knowledgeable & speaks directly from memory so notes are sometimes hard but tests arent bad & you can make em up in the research essays. theres alot of writing & is particularly anal about grammar & cited sources. Amazingly genuine human/prof nonetheless
barely extra cred, lectures rarely pertain to course, difficult grader, wants whats best for the student, but is not lenient whatsoever

It is true that he gets distracted in class and the organization isn't really there, to pass the tests all you need to do is read the assigned book and do the reading before the lectures because it makes it a lot easier to follow his line of thinking. This isn't a read and recite class, you really need to understand the theories and apply them

Took international studies with Professor Williams. He is a great guy, full of stories once you get him talking - but also full of bs. Half of what he says is either self-promotional or just does not make sense. Very difficult class.

Great professor but ONLY if you love politics and are WILLING TO WORK VERY HARD. It was the best class I have taken so far, but it is difficult for sure. He will tear your grammar apart, so proof it like crazy.
DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASSES! Very unorganized and studying for his tests are impossible.

He is TOUGH. He will absolutely torch you on your grammar, so make sure to read and then proof it, and then proof it again. ZERO hints on what will be on his exams, so write and read EVERYTHING he says or assigns. Or better yet, take another professor.

Quizzes are hard, so you need to study profusely. He's a grammar nazi on papers, but an easier grader on subjective based assignments. He's always open to giving help as long as you ask (just not right before something is due.) Copy everything he says in lectures and do all the readings = A range grade. Get to know him outside of class.

Dr. Williams is a fantastic professor, especially to students who seek to think critically rather than to read and recite. His quizzes are challenging, but attentive reading makes them manageable. The class is largely lecture based- but he allows and encourages discussion and debate. He has high expectations, so if you're lazy, don't kick back.

Very knowledgable guy and I really enjoyed his class. I disagree that he was disorganized, plus he made a lot of material available online which was helpful. I didn't think he was a terribly hard grader. Just read the textbook and pay attention and you'll do fine.

He is a great guy and a good resource. He is soo smart and you learn a TON. But, he doesn't use an outline or anything, write down everything he says and study it all. I suggest you make a study guide throughout the semester, add to it after each class. He is a good teacher, but you will probably be stressed about your grade till the end! Got an A!

For int'l relations: he is definitely a hard grader, but a really sweet guy. He really cares about what he teaches and knows everything about global politics. study tons for the midterm/final and you'll be ok, I learned a ton from this class!

[Internat'l Relations] Whoever said he is organized is insane. Attempting to take notes from Williams' lecture is impossible.  He literally just talks for 1 hr 50 min about random tangents. He is completely intelligent but in no way a professor. This class could have had such great discussions but he never encouraged any.

very tough class b/c of his tough midterm and grading on papers. very interesting though and informative. if you speak up in class he will like you. overall a nice and funny guy, i would take him again.

Dr. Williams is very misleading about his expectations for student work.  He is extremely hard but provides limited feedback on how to improve, grading more on grammar and word choice than content. He loves to talk (class can be very long) and is very intelligent, but is incredibly disorganized and fails to ever grade work in a timely manner.
He really knows his stuff. Be prepared to read to succeed here. If you're willing to put the work in, you will learn a lot.

Dr Williams is a very knowledgeable, organized, and informative professor.  His International Law class (Fall 09) is difficult--particularly because the amount of reading is enormous.  The 20-page paper is a challenge, too.  Lectures are a bit boring but manageable.  Overall, his class is good preparation for grad school, and he's a great guy.

Dr. Williams is a very interesting, intelligent man who shares a great deal of knowledge with his students. The class really helps you learn the subject, and his high standards really help you grow as a student. He is funny and understanding, too. If I had a complaint, it would be that the course needs stricter organization sometimes!

The comments so far have got to be a joke! He is the most pompous, arrogant, discriminating, judgemental and DISORGANIZED professor I have ever had. I keep hoping to see some sort of character in the man. Nope. He is rude and inappropriate. Though he is very intelligent, it is belittled by his poor "teaching" which is more like talking just to talk

well, he definitely does like the sound of his own voice... and his lectures are often disjointed and difficult to follow... but the guy is really, really smart and he's got a pretty good sense of humor. he challenges his students- which can get annoying on papers and essays because he nitpicks them to death. still, he's pretty entertaining.

Class was good - Williams kept it interesting. Lots of reading, but he made two very helpful study guides before the midterm and final. Gets high marks from me just for being able to teach Guy Alsenzter without strangling him in front of the class.  He will help students in any way he can - one of the 3 polysci profs you have to take at Pepperdine.
Ok Prof, learned a lot, fair grader, watch out for those essays questions...

I can't belive he has this high of a rating.....I swear all this guy can do it talk about how he couched his sons baseball team, and told his kid to try and hit the kid who was up to bat.  If you want to listen to a guy who thinks he is the smartest guy in the world, and do the all too famous "library assignmnet" take this guy.  and NO he is not a good looking man.
Very intelligent/interesting man, I especially appreciated the bow ties. That class made me realize how important it is to stay informed on what's going on in the world. Great prof.
Amazing Professor. Extremely intelligent, experienced and deeply cares baout his students. Don't miss this one!

I thought this class would be about women in the political world- historical, current, etc. It wasn't. It was basically a tribute to feminism, abortion, and man-hating. Williams actually called men who serve in the military "Neanderthals". Unless you are a far left-wing liberal you will not enjoy the class. Take him for Int'l Relations.

Williams is by far one of the best professors in the division.  Yes he challenges the students, but you learn a LOT!  You can have different beliefs, but you have to be able to defend them.  Incredibly passionate, extremely knowledgeable, and really cares about his students.

everyone who has complained thus far doesn't understand what it means to actually work. This class kicked ass -- he's really intelligent and well-versed in the discourse of international relations. I will definitely take another class from him again!

He was the reason I changed my major from poli sci to ints.  I enjoyed his class and learned so much.  He expects a lot from his students, which makes him a hard grader.  His class prepared me for other classes I took, because of his high expectations.  Overall=awesome.

Had him for three upper division classes... yes he lectures quite a bit, but it IS politics people, that's often the point. A very nice person who is willing to help outside of the class. Hosted several classes at his home... oh yeah, his "organizational style" makes me feel better about my clutter!
Arrogant, Moody and Pompous. Subjective grader (recieved a D on the first paper and an A on the next). Must work your ass off to recieve any sort of grade.

lets just say this is the WORST class I've ever taken in my life.  It never made any sense because everything was so disorganized, and if you dont write and think in a liberal point of view, you will FAIL the class.  He is very cocky and only likes to hear himself talk

I can't even tell you what this class is about.. that's how bad it is.  not only that but he is disorganized and not worth it, cause you won't learn anything.  He is a nice guy but a bad teacher. Plus no matter how hard you work, he will not hand out any A's!!
No Comments

Williams makes me happy to be alive. His lectures, while rather long-winded, leave you with a feeling of inner bliss. He is a very compassionate person and embodies everything you'd ever want out of a professor. His intellect is amazingly sharp and he KNOWS what he is talking about. Excellent Prof.

Williams rocks my world. He is so smart and so helpful.  Every poli sci student would waste time not to take at least one class from williams and one from caldwell. dont be lazy. you will just be in pain in classes like moore. read and be amused. williams 2008!
Not the best lecturer, but a really great professor outside the scheduled classtime.

Great guy, great teacher.  Not easy, but if you're afraid of Caldwell, he's the way to go.  Awesome bowtie.  Check out his office if you're into structural engineering or architecture - his piles of disorganzied papers are natural wonders.

Had him for 2 uppper division PoliSci courses. Great person, good teacher. Good personality, and perfectly willing to let you disagree with him so long as you can back up your opinion with reason. Also wrote me a great letter of recommendation.
No Comments
Aweome person. Good teacher--very smart. Willing to go the extra mile to help students.
Yes he gets on tangents, but is a great person who is easy-going and will work with you if you are falling behind and need some understanding. I wish all profs had his personality.
i'd do him.
No Comments
Really nice and humorous Professor capable of being a friend as well.

I thought Professor Miller-Perrin was an amazing teacher until it was time for the first test and nothing on the study guide was on the test. She words things in such a confusing manner that I ended up guessing for almost everything. Don't take her if you don't have to
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: She should reevaluate the way she teaches. She needs to make clear what is going to be tested. She doesn't understand that all students come from differing backgrounds. She acts as if she knows individual students more than they know themselves. We are all paying so much to be here; we all deserve to do well if we put in the effort. :) do not take

Not a good professor. Probably one of the worst psych professors at Pepperdine. Was really looking forward to taking this class and she totally ruined it. Her lectures are super boring and she just reads off of slides, which are unorganized and unclear. Wait to take this class with Harriger who is amazing.

She fairly easy because most writing assignments are completion/no right or wrong answers. She doesn't have group projects or presentations. The final is not cumulative. Exam is basically the study guides, which there are a ton completed on quizlet. Shes pretty fun in class, showing videos and activities + bonus she cuts every lecture 15min short
She tries to get into students' heads. She's not a good professor.
She refused to meet with me in office hours, and it seemed like she was not concerned about helping me succeed in the course. Very disappointing experience.
Same as Perrin in SOC 200. Her class is engaging but her tests are so detached from what she teaches. It's like I'm taking a test for a different class.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This is a great professor to take. You will need to study, but nothing a Quizlet cannot solve. If you study using those a few days before the exam, you will do a fairly good job in this class. A great teacher and you will have to write four papers, but they are only four pages long and will help you get the extra points if needed.

I didn't go to class for the first two exams and got A's on the tests. She releases study guides before the tests that are essentially the whole test and there are already quizlets made for the questions on the exams. She's sweet in office hours and the textbook can be rented out in the library so you don't need the book either. I would recommend!!
Extremely difficult testing and curriculum
DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!! Tests are ridiculously difficult for no reason .

many of the exams had bad questions that made no sense. Dr MP was not understanding and not helpful and only like 2 students got As in the whole class. Unnecessarily difficult class and honestly just not very good despite the topic being interesting
Do not take this class unless you want to lower your GPA. She makes her tests so specific and are extremely challenging
This is the hardest class I have ever taken at pepperdine, makes the tests incredibly difficult knowing so many kids still fail and doesnt care.
One of the WORST professors I've ever had. Expects WAY too much from students and will grade you like her class is the only one you're taking. Save yourself and AVOID.

Extremely hard grader and expects you to know the most specific details on the exams. She flies through powerpoints when there's huge paragraphs on each slide and then expects you to know every detail for the test. You will be going back on lecture slides after every class, horrible. Not many assignments, grade is largely based on tests. Good luck.

Dr. Miller-Perrin is probably one of the worst professors at Pepperdine. Her classes lack any sort of excitement, and her tests are mind-numbingly difficult. Also, the class is only graded based off a very small amount of assignments, which make it impossible to receive a decent grade if you do not do well on the tests. AVOID IF POSSIBLE.

I really wanted to like her. Usually, I have no issues with professors, but this woman is completely unreasonable. I have never had a GE be so ridiculously hard. She pulls very specific questions from the lectures that aren't on the study guide and the study guide is so long when she only asks questions on about 1/4 of all the material you study.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: when switching to an online environment in fall 2020 the professor is assigning tests with a possibility of 130 questions to study from and only using 55 on the test. The overload of information is unnecessary and cruel and makes passing this GE extremely difficult. don't take a class you would have t0 study 130 questions for a 50 question test.
Unhelpful and doesnt even host class, expects material to be completely self taught and unwilling to help students at all.

I really wanted to like this professor, but her expectations were ridiculous. There was an insane amount of reading for each unit, and she hardly covered any of it in class. She gives study guides, but they don't really reflect what is on the test and they are extremely long. Also, 24 hours of service learning is insane. Avoid this class if you can
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Unreasonable in how difficult she grades. Expects you to know the entire textbook and will grade you harshly if you miss any part of the very long DSM criterion. 4 tests, group project, mandatory service learning. She demands and expects far too much from an undergraduate level course. Extremely brief powerpoints too. I highly don't recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: CMP and her husband are both extremely similar- incredibly vague, yet fully expects you to be a genius. Tests are difficult and graded unreasonably. 30 M/C and 3 essays (3!). She also allots about 10 seconds per slide while having an essay's worth of text on there. Also, service learning is required. She IS respected but lacks as a teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: She is a solid professor. The material is pretty interesting and she does a good job of incorporating some fun examples and experiments in class sometimes. The lectures are quite boring and there aren't many grades in the grade book, so study hard and do not mess around with the inquiries. Not a terrible course.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is incredibly easy to pass. I never went to lecture and got a B in the class. There is plenty of cushion for your grade if you aren't a good test taker. I didn't use my book really either.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The tests are not clear, the material is far too specific for an introductory Psychology class. If you value your GPA, steer clear! I am telling you, if you want an A in this class, you have to study like its the only goal in your life. The psychological inquire papers are good for a grade booster (All 4 papers add up to one test grade).

I love Dr. Miller-Perrin. Attend class, read, and do the study guide and you will do GREAT in her class.  She has high expectations, but they are not unreasonable. She is fair and very nice/friendly! One of my best classes at Pepperdine.

Dr. Miller-Perrin is a very nice professor but her tests and other assessments are very difficult and are graded harshly. If you are interested in learning a lot about psychology she is a great option, but if you just want to get through the GE with an easy A find a different professor.

Also had her for PSYC 453. Her classes are without a doubt some of the hardest psych classes at Pepperdine - her expectations are very high. However, she is such an amazing woman and there to help you in any way she can, if you ask. She made me more confident in both my abilities and my future career path. So glad to have had her!

She is one of the most wonderful teachers I've ever had. I lived with her for a year in Germany and she is incredible. She passed out in front of the class to demonstrate bystander apathy. I really learned something in her class and she really cares about her students. She's not cold, she's professional. There's a difference.

Great professor and really cares about students. Take time to get to know her, she is a great resource.  Study for her tests but the study guides are true to what is on the exam.  One of the harder classes, but will learn so much.

She is an incredible teacher and woman. One of the most understanding teachers I have ever had. Her tests are difficult but she gives study guides that are helpful. She is sooo interesting and her lectures are very clear to the point. One of my all time favorite profs. Take this class!
No Comments
She's tough, but I owe my entire career to the contacts I made during the required service learning. Very intelligent and makes class interesting.
No Comments

I think she is the best psych teacher at Pepp. Her class is challenging, but you'll learn a lot. Hers have been my favorite classes. Anyone who thinks that she is cold just doesn't know her, because she has been a wonderful mentor. Take any class of hers that you can, and get to know her - she is a great resource.

She seems cold but if you go talk to her in her office hours that all changes, she is an amazing teacher and knows her stuff. Trick for the tests is to really fluff up your essays, she likes stats and facts that go beyond the question, trust me. Best professor I've ever had, so nice!

Her tests are impossible.  She considers a C a good grade!  I am a straight A student and I got a C+ in her class with countless hours of studying.  She is the reason I am no longer a Psych major.  If you value your GPA, dont take her class.
Amazing teacher!!!
She was a good and knowledgable teacher but didn't seem to care about her students very much.  Really difficult class.  Her tests seemed impossible...and I'm a psych major!

this teacher is awesome!!!! alot of people think she is cold and that is because they assume so and we all know what happens when you assume something... her and her husbad are the coolest people ever.. if you make the effort in her class you will do well
She is absolutely fabulous!! She is the reason that I am still a psychology major! I loved her and her class! She is so sweet and approachable! Absolutely my favorite professor at Pepperdine!!

You do have to work in this class, but her lectures and study guides are very clear. I recommend going to her office hours, as she can be of tremendous help, and is VERY nice once you get to know her! =)

This is definitely not your easy A.  You must read the huge book with long, boring chapters, AND the other reading material.  If you do, you should do well.  She wants to make sure that you KNOW your stuff, so you better put in some serious homework hours
No Comments
The COOLEST!!!!
No Comments

Anthony Ahn definetly dose care for his students and always makes him self avaliable in office hours. However he assigns group for the adv plan that lasts the whole semester, usually they end up about 100 pages so if you have a bad group your screwed. Dont need the book, I never used it once.

He was a good professor. We worked on a group project for the whole semester. We were assigned four projects, with multiple group and independent parts. The client that we had was very unprofessional though. We could see how he tried with her, but her products were really hard to market and advertise to new consumers. He put in a lot of effort.

Lots of work. Weirdly very competitive. Tough grader. Tries to make class fun. Not very understanding with attendance. Takes a while to respond to emails, if at all. Courses site not very user friendly. 
If you can take a different professor, I would, but his class isn't terrible.

This was a really overwhelming class at first but I grew to love it. He's so funny and you can tell that he cares about his students and wants us to succeed. There's a semester long group project, midterm and final exam, quizzes, and assignments throughout the week.

Dr. Ahn is so kind and funny. He is one of my favorite professors. He is very thorough in the manner he covers material, but still shows respect for our time and doesn't just drone on for the sake of hearing himself speak. I appreciate how much he invests in both us and the course. He makes class engaging and it's never a class I want to miss.

Ahn is by far the worst professor ive ever had at Pepperdine. He doesn't accomodate to absences unless is university official. His communication is very bad and hes just someone who follows every single university rule. He has group project assignments and is a very hard grader. He has pop quizes and is picky with showing work on math problems.

I really appreciate Dr. Ahn's way of teaching, his personality and desire to make others happy. I like how he is always asking if we have questions and giving us the opportunity to succeed. With our midterm test, he gave us the option to gain points back. That is what a great teacher should do, and in turn, this helped me learn more.

ADV 375 was pretty intense and demanding but allowed me to have a hand on approach with the creation of the Media plan book. I liked how we got to see how media planning worked in a professional light. After the final presentation, I understood the importance of doing this media book and this whole exercise. It is preparing us for the real world.

Professor Ahn is a very nice person, but unfortunately, he would not be my choice for a professor ever again. He assigned large amounts of busy work while we had an immense group project for the entire year. We also had a lengthy midterm exam, which he had not done before. He also did not bother to learn the correct names for students this year.

Everyone told me he would cancel the midterm...he did not cancel the midterm. He is a bit all over the place with lectures and assigns a LOT of busy work when we already have a major project for this class. Nice enough but not worth the stress he puts on students

Professor Ahn is a good person who has taught engaging and manageable courses in the past. Unfortunately, something has changed. Starting fall semester 2022, he has began assigning quizzes, midterms, and finals in addition to the highly intensive group project that spans the semester. Past students have loved him, this is no longer the case.
I love Dr. Ahn. His class is tough, but really interesting. You can tell he cares about his students.

Dr. Ahn is genuinely one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. His class is demanding, but he is an easy grader as long as he can tell you put in effort. He's so funny, and makes his lectures interesting and engaging. He uses real-world examples to explain the concepts we're learning too. I would love to take another class of his.

The class mimic a media planner's real work and I enjoyed the hands-on experience.  Dr. Ahn clearly loves what he does and is an amazing teacher. He comes up with new ways to make class entertaining and engaging and has so much knowledge on advertising. Lots of engaging jokes, activities, etc. I would definitely take this class again!

Prof Ahn was hilarious, I really enjoyed his class. it was challenging but enjoyable because we were learning real-life advertising proposals. he was so understanding and didn't really give tests or quizzes since we had an ongoing group project. i would definitely suggest you take him

One of the best teachers I've encountered at Pepperdine! Professor Ahn is a personable figure who makes class meaningful and engaging. He not only seems to care about the course material personally, he cares about his students success and strives to ensure that they are as enthusiastic about it as he is. Im glad I got to take his class!

I LOVE DR. AHN!! By far, my favoriteee professor at Pepperdine, the one I will truly miss after graduating. He is SO knowledgable about what he teaches and he gives such good feedback. I learned so many things from him by having him for ADV 561 and ADV 375. So kind and caring to his students, AND he's so funny. Work hard and you'll get an A!

Another great class from Ahn. I enjoyed being able to work in different groups throughout the semester with everyone in the class. He uses a lot of examples and he makes class so interesting and fun. He came to my ADV 475's pitch day as a guest judge and he was such a big supporter! He truly cares about his students, advertising and the class.

Wow! Professor Ahn makes me love my major. Great teacher, I learned a lot!! With the kahoot quizzes and using students in examples, he keeps the class engaging, even when the class is at a 4PM-6PM block when most people are tired and distracted. Passionate, demanding, but also kind!

375 was very math heavy which I was surprised. Exams were harder and longer than expected, but Ahn prepared the class well. Overall, the course was difficult but it was rewarding and I learned a lot. I like math so Im happy there is a decent amount of math and data driven-decision . I also like the enthusiasm and teaching style of the professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: I really enjoyed this course and I am so excited that I get to have him as my professor again. In fact, there are a lot of assignments for every class but I did think they were beneficial for the exams. He always has an plan for class so that no time is wasted. He tries his hardest to make the material as interesting as possible.

It was my first time taking a class with Dr. Ahn and as I leave this class, all I have to say is such positive things about the class and the professor. He makes classes extremely fun and entertaining and really provides you with information that I will be able to use in the real world. He makes me believe in my abilities. Always happy in class.

My first time I took Ahn's ADV 375 I thought it was too much work, but in his ADV 561 the projects were actually a lot of fun to work on, and they taught me a lot about real life working conditions in the field. I enjoy having to be creative during journal assignments as well as how hands on the projects are. I adore him, he's kind and so smart!

Oh is MATH-DEPENDENT, that's daunting for com. majors. I was confused by the 1st test (midterm)- after a series of interesting, big idea-centric lectures, the whole thing was basically a glorified math test, which later made sense when he said HE found the class boring. TEST & GROUP PROJECT ARE LONG & HARD. He's nice but has no IRL work experience.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Had him for ADV375. The course was slightly demanding (the math portion), though it wasn't too horrible in that he made difficult concepts easy to grasp. Lots of weekly assignments and a big group project but they were all relevant and good to practice. He provides many helpful resources on Courses so take advantage of them. A fun, engaging class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is a nice guy. However, Adv is creative but he is just very textbook. He teaches defintions and makes it hard to understand because of his english. Also his grading is tough and he is super unspecific when giving assingments but then grades super specific. He is all over the place and there are too many assingments to keep up with.
Great professor: kind, knowledgable, passionate, understanding, fair.

Ahn is the best ever. So fun and teaches really well. He is helpful and wants his students to succeed. His class is very easy too because he is so helping, tells you exactly what to study, and allows retest on quizzes. Love him. And he always brings candies.

Professor Ahn is nothing but amazing. I had him for both ADV 375 and ADV 561. He is an incredible professor who cares a lot about his students and just wants what is best for them. He has really helped and taught me everything I know about Advertising. Thanks to him, I was able to connect with a great internship. Highly recommend!

Dr. Ahn is one of the best professors I have ever had. I had him for both ADV 375 and ADV 561. His lectures are engaging and he is hilarious. There is a lot of work but he is a fair grader and is always willing to help. If you listen to his lectures and put in some effort, you will be fine. Recommend him!

Professor Ahn was absolutely one of my favorite and most inspiring teachers at Pepperdine. He can be a tough grader, but he lays out everything he wants, exactly how he wants it, early on, so if you follow his rubrics you will be guaranteed solid results. Other than this, he's engaging, fun, kind-hearted, and values creativity and hard work!!

Dr. Ahn is by far one of the most engaging, innovative, and proactive professors I have ever had. I constantly find myself practically applying the material we learn in class to other areas of study and other classes or projects, because he made it so memorable and easy to comprehend. He's professional and respectable but he is so fun and funny!

I LOVE Professor Ahn's enthusiasm. It truly distinguishes him among other professors. His energy is a vehicle for better learning. He goes above and beyond. Intentionally picking an interesting brand for the final project, taking interactive videos, and designing fun review-session that he "premiers" in  class. He really goes the extra mile.

Professor Ahn is great. His lectures are very organized and structured. Class consists of one big group project, mini quizzes, and two tests. If you look over his notes from the previous class the quizzes will be a breeze. Very manageable class and funny professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Four mini projects throughout semester.  I liked the projects and working with different groups. I really enjoyed activities Dr. Ahn assigned. They are all very fun to do and I learned a lot.  I like how he outlines what will be done in class that day and follows that outline. The class is very formulaic and engaging.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great instructor. He is kind, clear, and enthusiastic. He really knows what he's doing when it comes to feedback and his lectures. His assignments are clearly presented, and he makes himself available for students. His lectures are not only engaging, they are well-prepared and relevant. Loved Kahoot quiz and FB assignment.

Ahn is a really nice guy and his class is manageable. However, sometimes his grading is all over the place which can be super frustrating. There's a lot of quizzes and homework assignments which kinda sucks. It oftentimes feels like busy work. Also beware of his 3 absence policy. If you miss more than 3 classes you will automatically fail the class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I love Professor Ahn! He makes class so entertaining and enjoys bringing humor into his lecture, but also explains the material in an engaging way. His passion  for advertising are genuine and contagious to students. The assignments and activities he assigned are all very fun to do and I learned a lot. There is a lot of work but it's necessary.

Dr. Ahn is the best Advertising professor I've had in Pepperdine! He is kind, understanding and really wants to help his students succeed. His lectures are fun and engaging and I really learned a lot from his class. As long as you follow instructions in group projects and do your assignments, it's not hard to get an A!

Professor Ahn is a genuine and caring person who want each person to be happy and well. He is excited about every class and makes each class engaging and unique. Never had a class quit like this one. Very fun and interactive. I would say that he is one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine.

ADV 275 summer class was smashed into 4 weeks so assignments on top of the group project and tests like a lot on top of each other. PERSONALLY, I find the subject fascinating and I love how engaging the class is. Ever single class Dr. Ahn makes sure to include some interactive activity to hep use understand and retain the material.

Adv375 is mainly 1 big group project: there are examsfinals amidst group reports, research, executive summary, assignments, and presentations. Dr. Ahn is helpful & nice. If you give him feedbackconcerns he will help youalter the class. He's quick to respond to email.

He is one of the most considerate professors I have ever had.  I love he is devoted to his students best interests.  He presents information in a way that is easy to understand and engaging. Sometimes his pronunciations of words causes confusion, but it's generally not an  issue. Great person who tries to incorporate Christianity into advertising.

Dr. Ahn is new , so I think he is still perfecting his skills. Overall, I liked his class, the interactive nature. He uses various methods of teaching like interactive lessons and class activities that demonstrate his enthusiasm.  I enjoy his personality and find him very likable.  Always available, kind, and eager to help.

Oh Dr. Ahn...  Dr. Ahn is a very nice man.  You can tell that he definitely tries his best to teach and takes his job very seriously. However, his english skills and the clarity of deadlines and assignments can be hazy.  Overall, he is very helpful if you make the effort to get help.  He gives the occasional reading quizzes and his tests are basic

Pro. Ahn is funny and nice.  He is always  willing to help. I admire his creativity. The lectures and in-class activities are very hands-on and I learn a lot from them.  I really like the FB fan page- it's cool to see what other people post.  I  appreciate the format of the powerpoint slides. He needs slower on powerpoints though.
He's funny, super nice, and thoughtful about changing test dates and content. His English skills are sub-par: an assignment rubric literally said "No grammar or spelling or mistakes."
To be honest, if you don't make 100% effort in this class, you will not pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: Not a fan at all. I would have much taken another professor if I had a choice. Unclear guidelines... disorganized. And not an engaging lecturer

I had to take this class for my capstone. I was really excited to take the class but was pretty disappointed by the end of the semester. Wideroe has the experience in the field but not a lot of experience in the classroom. I did not find her to be the most empathetic teacher.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Wideroe has an amazing experience in the field of Advertising and I highly respect her. She really gives you good advice and every week has a speaker come in and just chat with the class about their career. Lots of internship and learning opportunities. She is very caring and passionate. There is a midterm and a large group final project.
Best class I ever took, hands down. I never worked so hard but Professor Wideroe is by far the best professor at Pepperdine. Take her if you're lucky enough.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Tough grader

comment: Wideroe is one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine so far. She is genuinely passionate about the advertising industry and has SO much experience and knowledge to pass on. The grading criteria is clear and she wants everybody to do well, so the tests werent too bad. The final project took a lot of time, but it was fun and totally worth it! A+++

This was by far the most challenging class I have EVER taken. This was the best class at Pepperdine and has totally prepared me for my career in advertising. My book is going to the printer tonight and I am so proud. AMAZING class. Push yourself through it. You'll be happy you did.

I took her for ADV 575. This class is a lot of work and she expects a lot out of you. She is good at giving you time to work and always has student examples on hand which is helpful. You can tell she cares about what she does and enjoys helping students find their passion. She can be difficult to get ahold of and I wish she gave more direction

Best class at Pepperdine but definitely the most difficult.  Professor Wideroe  expects a lot from everyone.  Now that my campaign is done I can't believe I did it. So happy to have a portfolio to help me get a job.
The campaign, although time consuming and demanding, got me a job.  I haven't had a better teacher ever and I mean ever!!!!!!!!
Learned so much this semester. Had a lot of guests from the field and really got lots of real world experience. Loved this class and get challenges.  Think I might want to be a media planner!

Hands down love Professor Wideroe and Advertising Campaigns.  Best class EVER.  Made going to Pepperdine even more worthwhile. Seriously.  Through the class I not only got a project after graduation, but an advertising job! Woohoo.

Best professor at Pepperdine.  I learned more in this class than any other class I took.  It's  a VERY demanding class and  you will have to work harder than ever before. Seriously.    I owe Debbie everything as I just got offered a job when I  showed my campaign to a company she helped me with. She's amazing. Love, love, love her and this class.

Best teacher at Pepperdine.  She is very knowledgeable, passionate and compassionate. She also brings energy, fun  and enthusiasm into every class. I  LOVE the class and her. Sad our class will be ending soon.
Debbie is very impressed with herself and loves the sound of her own voice.

Most difficult and challenging class ever.  Debbie pushed me to do my very best and then some.  Plan to spend 100 hours in the library doing research. BUT it's all  worth it to learn from such an expert in the field who knows her stuff and cares about your success.  Debbie alsp helped me with my internship and now I have a job offer.  Best ever!

It has taken me months to try to figure out a way to define Debbie because of her impact on me. She not only guided me to the advertising world, but mentored me to where I absolutely love my career. Debbie is an honest, straight-forward, very accomplished, and well-respected woman who is looked up to by every person. She is amazing in every way.
Needs to lower expectations.
By far the hardest most challenging class I have ever taken and the best professor at Pepperdine or probably anywhere.  She is inspiring and knowledgeable and has prepared me for the real world.
professor wideroe is a goddess

Professor Wideroe is by far the best teacher at Pepperdine.  She knows the advertising and marketing field from the inside and brings her expertise to the classroom.  Class is fun and she is the greatest mentor there is. Go to class and work hard.  You'll go far and get connected.
best class ever.

Debbie is a stud! Easy to talk to before and after class and totally calls it as she sees it. Communicates well with students and is easy to talk to. Love her as a teacher and person. You won't regret any of the classes you take with her.

Absolutely by far the best teacher at Pepperdine. You will learn more in one semester than from every single one of your other teachers put together. She was the head of Advertising for Warner Brothers and actually knows what she is talking about. Pepperdine is so lucky to have her and school would kill for her!
She's the best professor ever.  I have learned more from Debbie than from any other class in history. Take her classes and it will change your life.

Very knowledgable of the field, had a number of guest speakers that provided excellent insight, helpful and encouragable with comments, available office hours. Only negative may be her semi-difficult test but with a little studying it's easy handled. This class was enjoyable and an excellent experience, highly reccoemended prof.

Debbie is straight foward with her expectations and gives minimal homework and her tests are fine.  The brand plan is a great project that can really help your grade. Take her, she's incredibly nice and knows what she's talking about.  You also have really interesting speakers come to class and she has many connections to the industry.

Such an amazing teacher!  The only thing distracting students from her indepth lectures on advertising and pr are her good looks.  The Brand Plan was a great rewarding project to work on.  Her husband being the VP of Marketing at E! Entertainment plays a huge role in guest speakers, field trips, and what not!  EVERYONE TAKE DEBBIE FOR ADVERTISING!

Had during summer, barely used text book at all.  I wouldn't say she's hard but people got reprimanded in class often, probably subconciously on her part.  Easy to talk to though and helpful.  Tests cover lots of material.  Put in necessary effort and you'll be fine.

This is a very tough class but I learned more than I did in any other class here.  I have had Debbie for several years and she is my mentor and the most caring individual.  Get to know her.  She even helped me find a job. You will learn so much. She is the BEST professor by far at Pepperdine.

I have had her for a few classes and think she's the best there is.  She really knows the business and teaches us from the real world always helping us out. Have no clue what others are writing unless they are slackers.

I've had Debbie for several classes, and she definitely is even more helpful after she gets to know you. She is a little soft, but if you resist the temptation to take advantage the classes are amazingly beneficial. She will teach you so much.

FLAKY! She is really nice but sometimes I think she just makes up random stuff in class just to sound like she knows everything about the field. She brags about her advertising past like you wouldn't believe. The actual class is good, but she's not my favorite professor I've had...

The only reason I am adding a post is to say.... for the final group project, if you find yourself w/ slackers, tell her!! Or do all the work yourself (which sucks) and then tell her when she gives you the group evaluation sheet.  Better be one of her favorites or she will be fakey-fakey w/ you and it's OBVIOUS. Felt sorry for those folks. :/

debbie is such a great teacher! she knows her stuff since she's had a lot of experience in the field. she's not too hard - the midterm IS tricky since it covers so much info, but work hard on your final brand plan & you'll be more than fine. i really learned a lot AND had fun in her class! take her!
AWESOME PROF - really knows her stuff and educates her students about the real world. what more could you ask for?
She is a wonderful professor. She knows her stuff! She is the best professor for this class.
Get ready to explode the dot!
Great professor!!! Love all her classes, wish she could teach all the Advertising classes.
I LOVE THIS PROFESSOR!  She makes class enjoyable and fun, and is very caring about her students.  One of the most memorable experiences at Pepperdine
It was a joy to be in her class. She is extremely good at what she does and is ver knowledgable. She's a role model of a professor. She is a wonderful person and teacher.
excellent
She is one of the best professors I've ever had.  She makes class so enjoyable and you can't help but learn everything about advertising because she is so knowlegable.
AWESOME!! Made me want to become an advertising major.
Awesome professor! She made class fun and is really nice.  She's one of the few professors I actually enjoy stopping by to visit.
No Comments

Pretty old school way of teaching, which can be difficult to keep up with at times, but genuinely one of the kindest people youll meet. Exams are tough, but usually only 11-12 questions. If youre not actually understanding the hw and examples in the reading, you wont get high scores. Lectures are fast paced but he stops for any questions.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: he knows what he's talking about, lots of homework, but he knows that it's best for you.

He explains topics well, but if you ask a question he often doesn't understand what the student is asking or he over-explains and further confuses us. The lecture outlines are super cramped, so good luck annotating. Also the exams are rough. I'm a math major and I spent studied this more than my upper div, but got a lower grade in this class.

Like most math classes, this one wasn't easy. But, Dr. Hancock did a great job of teaching and making sure his students knew what to do. The tests are similar to the homework assignments. Dr. Hancock is a bit old school, but you can tell he has a passion for teaching math.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He is not like other professors at Pepperdine and the tests are very hard. I wish I had one of the other math teachers .
Not a bad teacher but the tests were insanely hard.
Extremely hard. Extremely. Enough said.

He is excited to teach but doesn't really make sure we know it and understand it. Almost no time to ask questions in class because he lectures the entire time it's like a run on sentence for 50 minutes. He only knows how to explain it one way so when you ask questions it doesn't help bc he just does it the way he did it first. Too set in his ways.

The worst option for Math 141. Take Nash or Strong. Don't be fooled by the people that had to study every single day to maintain their A, his quality is 0/5. He is genuinely into the math, but completely disengages from his students. The classroom could be empty and he wouldn't care as long as he could talk to the whole day about math.

He is the hardest professor I've ever had and really doesn't care about anything other than the points you earn. I've had teachers for my actual major be more flexible, more caring, more understanding than him when he is just a math professor. He does not care if you are struggling in life or math. He will not even round up if you're 1 point away.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: THE worst class I have ever taken. THE hardest tests I have ever taken. He is the hardest one teaching this class. Take the other professors if you don't want to go through the hardest class. Worst time, made my semester miserable. Please choose any other professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: The worst math teacher I have ever had in my life. Literally does not have the ability to explain things. Also unwilling to help and does not care about his students. The worst option for Math 141, take Nash or Strong instead.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Hancock has been teaching math for many, many years, and it is apparent. The course is extremely organized, and he is very clear in his teaching. I found it relatively easy to understand. The homework isn't too hard, but the exams can be pretty challenging. But, then again, I find math challenging in general.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Hancock's 3 midterms and 1 Final are hard. The first midterm I got a 93, and the content gets harder, especially in the Probability Chapter. I ended up with a B and really close to a B+. The First B in college but Math 141 is hard in general. But I would still appreciate his helpful office hours. He is such a nice, warm, and funny man.
Be sure to study a lot for the final and always ask for help. He is very nice and his teaching style is great. The final is what hurt me the most.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took Calc in HS, but he still expects me to show up and pretend I care. No chill when it comes to phones either. Too much homework, long assignments due twice a week. Makes me wish I had taken the AP test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: The best professor you can have for this course. He's very sweet and will re-explain problems for you in varying ways until you understand it. His office ours are short, so get there early! His explanations become confusing during the counting chapter, but he gives lots of examples. His tests are predictable and very fair.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Nice guy. Bad at explaining things. Lots of homework. If you do the homework you'll be better off in the class. The tests are kind of insane sometimes. I failed his final HARD.

Professor Hancock cares about each individual student and does everything possible to ensure their success. He offers great instruction inside and outside of the classroom and makes it easy to learn. Always look forward to his class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Very very very good math professor. Super clear and organized. Best choice for Math 141. He only need two classes to memorize everybody's name.

The greatest professor I have ever had the pleasure of being taught by. He is an absolute legend. He loves the subject he teaches and is willing to help anyone and everyone. I highly recommend taking Math 141 with him.

He truly enjoys teaching Math141. His tests can get tough, but its all from the notes and the worksheets. As long as you study, you should be good to go. If it were any other professor, I'd be sleeping through his 8am, but Not for Hancock. cause hes the man.

If you're taking any Business Calc, Hancock is the teacher you need to have. He breaks things down to such an understandable level, unlike other teachers I've had who couldn't think like a student. I went from failing my calc 1 freshman year with another teacher to getting an A in this calc 2 class. 2 HW's a week and 4 total tests. That's it.

This class will be difficult for most people no matter who teaches it, but Dr. Hancock is the best math professor. He gives such good examples. And a number of them too. His numerous good examples makes this class the easiest it can be. He uses the fairest system I know for grading homework. Study for tests and ask questions and you'll do well.

Best professor!! I have taken 3 of his classes and would take more if I could. He is so willing to help his students and is one of the most helpful professors I have ever had. His passion for math is contagious and it is clear he was meant to be a professor.

Very good professor. He explains things multiple times in different ways (in simple terms). He makes sure you understand the material. Do the homework, write down the notes and you will do fine. He gives a study guide before every test. Very straight foward. I recommend him to EVERYONE. Very glad I took his class.

he is an awesome teacher, he explains things multiple times in different ways and is always available to answer questions. his tests are easy if you do the homework and are very straight forward. i would reccommend him to anyone.

incredible, highly recommended. bit challenging but clear expectations. tests and hw correlate very well with material. gives good practice questions before the tests and detailed examples each class. he lectures without any notes! he actually prepares his students for tests. take anything with him!

Don is unfair as a teacher. He cares nothing for his student's knowledge or well being in his class. He doesn't award points for mandatory attendance but merely docks your grade for not showing up. I was .2 percent from an A-(just one point in the class)he wouldn't give back a point that he misgraded me for on a test. A very unforgiving teacher
An awesome professor, and one of my favorites in the math department.  You know exactly what is required and he is extremely helpful, more so than just about any other professor I've had in college.
Very clear teacher. You know what is expected of you, know how you are doing. Sometimes slow, but helpful if you dont understand math. Just a really nice guy. Highly recommended.

He's a nice guy like my grandpa. Corny and I feel sorry for him because no one in our class laughs at his jokes, and only like half the class shows up on any given day because he doesn't care about attendance. Class is decently easy (come on, its 102) HW is manageable, and tests sufficiently explained in advance. Definitely recommend him!
No Comments

No other teacher can seem to be moving at such a slow pace and yet cover so much material in a semester. Dr. Hancock knows his limitations better than any other professor I have ever had, he is technically the best teacher in the department.

His class is really easy, but not because he's a flake or anything.  Really nice guy, very helpful, kinda like a fun grandpa.  Not very strict on attendence, homework is very managable and he's very clear on exactly what will be on the test.  Take him if you can.
His tests are fair and you'll learn a lot!  He is such a cool guy and you will succeed if you plan ahead and prepare.
as easy as a math class can get.  he explains everything and the tests are almost straight from the homework and class
Over explains things which is good if you're not strong in math.  Very nice guy, and great enthusiasm for math.  Homework isn't too bad either compared to some math classes.
not a bad guy but the class was too early for me so I couldn't get into it.  I struggled, but again, not his fault.  MakesCALC III as bearable as can be I guess.  I'd rather have had L. Rogers tho.
excellent teacher, cares a lot about his students, gets you to learn something but if you do the work you can do well!
nice man, tells you exactly what is going to be on test, you don't have to go to class just do the homework

He is such a nice teacher everrrr. sometimes he will make you chuckle in class trying to explain math in simple terms. His jokes just make you crack up in the middle of the boring math class. His tests are relatively easy. Go to class n u wont miss out NE
fun teacher, tells you exactly what will be on the test, no tricks, very helpful outside of class during office hours, very caring, easy to talk to...but he likes 8 am classes :(
Very hard class.. He tends to trail off and not get to the point but he tries. I recommend taking Maddox
Great teacher... for the first time in my life, I'm actually learning stuff in math.
very smart man, hard class tries to be helpful

Great professor for Film 321 - Prof Carr is passionate about the subject and the class is very straightforward. If you take notes during lectures and give a decent effort on assignments you will do well.

Dr. Carr is generally a nice person but I did not like this class one bit. She just has incredibly high expectations for a course that is supposed to be a GE and I really had to work for my A. I get that this class included film, but it's an English class and yet she lectured way too much on film and other things that just didn't relate at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: One of the sweetest professors who is always in a good mood. She's experienced in her profession and a very tough grader for papers but I think she does it to push you which is good.

Carr grades fairly. Do the assigned reading before class and know the material because there are weekly quizzes. Make sure to study for the midterm and final because they're big factors of your grade. She really cares about her students and makes class fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: A tough class that didn't need to be. Professor Carr interjects her own personal beliefs and political views in her lectures, which was thoroughly unnecessary. The other reviews here already outline many of the issues that students face in Professor Carr's class better than I can. Avoid the intro Film class for the sake of your GPA and health.

Joi Carr was nice outside of class, but I think someone forgot to mention to her that FILM 111 is a GE. I love movies, just not the way she does. She gave extra credit and made the final optional because 90% of the class filled out course evaluations which was cool. But for only 2 credits, the class was way too much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Carr is great. Don't let the uneducated first-semester freshmen steer you away. If you're looking for a class where you just sit and watch movies for an A, you won't find that here. You really won't find that anywhere at Pepperdine, which is good, because would that be a good use of your time and money? Seriously, people...

carr is very educated and passionate. participation is a part of your grade. quizzes can be hard, but partners were allowed for one and the other was optional. her notes are important. can earn an A if you study and put effort in. she's v nice to talk to outside of the classroom and wants to get to know you. extra credit is offered a lot

This class is very unpleasant to say the least. Her tests have nothing to do with the lectures because her lectures are filled with her irrelevant political opinions, rather than the material. On tests, she gives us bubble sheets that you scratch off with a penny like a gift card rather than a normal bubble sheet like every class in history.

I am currently failing Dr. Carr's class. I wish that she made the class about the movies we watch, not about her irrelevant political and social opinions. The quizes are confusing and don't relate to the study guides she gives us at all. I studied a week for each quiz and have failed every one of them. I do not recommend taking this course.

Dr. Carr manages to somehow make a GE film class my hardest and least enjoyable class. She lectures for two hours straight and somehow doesn't even cover what will be on the "quiz," for that you'll need to read a textbook (one of which is written by her and required.) But the worst part is that she pushes her political agenda with each film.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Carr's teaching style is highly confusing. Like a old car that starts and stops, she interjects her personal opinions into the lecture, essentially editorializing the material and corrupting the objectivity of the class. It doesn't help that she also promoted her own "music" during one of the final classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: she's a nice professor but its too lecture heavy and dry
Lecture heavy and BORING. WORST professor ever. You won't learn anything in her class. She can make you hate film...
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She takes weeks, if not over a month to grade homework assignments. The tests are also more difficult than the class should allow. You are expected to remember the most miniscule details from the textbook. Stay away for your own emotional health.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took her in spring 2014. The pros of film 200 with her are that the many quizzes, essays, and extra credit assignments allow more opportunities to offset any poor grades. The cons are that the essays are not only harshly graded but are returned with little to no helpful feedback. The final exam never got any feedback. Just the grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mandatory attendance for a 4 hour class that ends at 10pm. No thank you. Film could be interesting but she won't let it be that way. The only good thing is she's so lazy when it comes to grading, she only let's us type 100 words per response. Don't take Film 111
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Joi Car is Great! Most people are disappointed in that she is a very challenging and difficult professor, since they often take her classes expecting a breeze-through film course. She is very knowledgable and you will learn a lot!

Her class is not a simple literature class; rather, it is a stream-of-thought & asinine set of lectures marred by an inordinate amount of outside reading/preparation. Prof Carr prides herself on laurels of past awards & "expertise", and expects such work from you despite lack of instruction.  TLDR - she has high expectations and sucks at teaching.

Dr. Car is a very sweet professor and makes herself available to students. However, I found Film 111 to be a bit difficult and time consuming. I recommend participating actively in this class, reading the book thoroughly and paying attention to themes within the movies.

She's very passionate about film. but most are taking it as a GE requirement. About 60% of those who show up for the lecture part of the class leave during the break before the film. But, she gives out extra credit a few times people who stay. She seems irritable at times. This class is 4 hrs long at night, so avoid if you like sleep.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Carr is a nice woman, but she gets very impatient and it really bothers me. Her lectures are confusing and she assumes that everyone understands things she has never taught us. However, the only test is the final. You do online film and chapter responses which are almost always easy 100s. It's an easy way to get the fine art requirement.

First hour and a half is spent on discussing and going over the chapter and the second half of the class is spent watching the movie. Participation is a grade but is difficult because it is in the Elkins. You must read, take a timed quiz, and write a relfection before class. The reading and quiz is very difficult in my opinion.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Carr is very passionate about film and, as a result, is engaging, but she puts far too much information on the lecture PowerPoints. Her quizzes are easy but her tests are difficult, so make sure not to be lulled into a false sense of security by the quizzes. Overall, though, she's a good professor. I enjoyed the class.

stay on her good side and speak up in class. This is key to getting a good grade. I was excited about taking this class in the beginning but as the semester went on it became a burden. Shes very nice but not helpful. I enjoy film but did not enjoy this class.

I have taken her multiple times. She is extremely nice and caring. If you have a personal issue and need an extension on a paper she will give it to you. She will also not give a quiz if she feels the class is unprepared. However I would say she doesn't really teach much. I could do a better job than her.
not bad as a teacher, as long as you stay on her good side! That is crucial.

Great material covered in its diversity. Professor takes a long time to return assignments and does not give much verbal feedback, however, her grading is fair, she knows her subject inside and out and as a plus, classes are discussion-based. (She doesn't shut her students up and believes in breaks.) If you need praise, don't take this class.

Great class...interesting discussions and the books were fun to read.  The class isn't demanding and she isn't hard on grading.  Overall, she is fair and nice.  Would recommend her for a literature class.
she is the sweatest teacher.
Professor Carr is extremely passionate about her subject matter and that passion translates to the students.

Joi is a great prof, she's open to people of all colors, races, and genders, regardless of what the others here say. She expects people to work and can be a stiff grader, but she's kind, helpful and fair.
JCarr is ok pretty easy class if you try a little she dont seem like whites alot

Joi Carr is the Worst Profs i have ever encountered. She is Unclear and very LAZY. She pretends to be real when i all due actuallity she is Fake. Her smile laught and giggles are all FAKE. I hop she see's this about herself and changes it because i have learned nothing from her................ Final
SHE IS SUPER FLAKY, AND ALTHOUGH SHE IS INTELLIGENT AND GREAT FOR DISCUSSIONS IS VERY UNCLEAR ON JUST ABOUT EVERYTHING ELSE IN THE CLASS.
She is very narrow minded. She will not accept any view unless you are a minority and agree with her.  If you aren't a minority she will make you feel guilty, but the class was fairly easy.

Dr. Carr is one of the most phenomenal professors Pep has to offer.  She keeps it real and challenges you to think about yourself and your place in this world.  Tough, but worth the effort.  She makes you WANT to do the work and do it well.

Teaches interesting subjects because she cares. She gets you to be creative and search for a meaning that maybe she hasn't even thought of. If you just try and speak up in class...it is an easy B and moderately difficult A. She's amazing.
She's not hard but she's a sucky teacher, she's really bad about assigning stuff in a timely manner. BUT she's a push over so don't worry about it.
I enjoyed the novels we read and I like Joi as a person.  However, as a professor, she is intimidating and unavailable-never in her office, doesn't respond to emails, and rarely updates blackboard.
Very nice woman.  Hard grader.  But you will learn a whole lot from her.  It was a good experience.

Nice woman, but difficult grader. It is difficult just to pull B's in her class. Almost impossible to get an A on a paper, no matter how well written. Rarely updates blackboard on time - leaving the student in the dark, with a bad grade.
She's very nice though the material is hard. But you're here to learn. if you get to know her and just try, you'll do fine.

She's nice and genuinely cares about her students. Yes, she is hard but only because the material she teaches warrants that. She's funny and gets the whole class involved!! One of my favorite classes.
No Comments
do not take her. do not. if you don't agree with her, you are going to do badly. she is very intimidating

Professor Rivas is a sweet woman, but that's it. She expects students to "role play" but doesn't explain how to participate. Her study guides do not coincide with the tests, which are extremely hard. Her lectures are ridiculously boring, she loses track of what she's saying, and she mumbles. Do not, under any circumstances, take her!

Absolute worst teacher at Pepperdine, I took her HIST 450 class and learned absolutely nothing. We play history reenactment games during class and her lectures make no sense. You will basically have to teach yourself everything on your own and hope to do well on the quizzes, and her quiz questions are super specific.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Means well, out of touch with reality. Lives in her own world. Hardest class I've ever taken. Acts like she's there to help you but just gaslights you. Tests are unreasonably unfocused to the learning objectives of the class. She is obsessed with role play games.

Darlene is a super sweet lady, but her teaching style is horrible. Be prepared to read hundreds of pages each class and have a paper or speech due weekly. Her lectures are set up terribly, she goes through everything way too fast, and it's impossible to write it down that fast. She won't post her lectures, and the final IS SO BAD!
