rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Really nice person and I like her, but did not like the class at all. So much dense reading about French history and philosophers, you don't get enough time to read and actually understand everything. A paper and/or speech is due almost every class. Grades are mainly participation and your papers. Lots of outside class work and research.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Not recommend taking her class

Rivas is a really nice person and I like her, but did not like the class at all. So much dense reading about French history and philosophers, you don't get enough time to read and actually understand everything. A paper and/or speech is due almost every class. Grades are mainly participation and your papers. Lots of outside class work and research.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Drop out of Pepperdine and become a plumber if you think Professor Rivas is hard. What an absolute joke to think she is anything besides one of the most effective educators you will ever encounter. Be respectful, care about the product you create, and participate even marginally and you will be more than fine.

I do not recommend taking this class at all! AVOID AT ALL COST. Super hard and no one knows what she is talking about. Although she can be sweet she is disorganized and doesn't prepare you for Tests and Quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! She was probably the worst professor I have had and gave way too much Homework. There is so much information that she expects you to know detailed (literally like quotes). The game is fun but the assessments are ridiculously hard, if you go to pepp, take HIST204 somewhere else and transfer the credits. Her final was BAD!

Darlene was the sweetest, most kind professor I have had at Pepperdine. We did online this semester because of Covid and she really put the effort in to get to know all of us. There was a lot of reading and her quizzes were brutal, but if you did well on the class projects, you were fine. She really made my semester and I learned a lot.

Dr. Rivas is the sweetest! While her class does have a lot of reading and a few papers for each of the game simulations, getting an A in the class is totally possible. She really makes all the lectures and discussions interesting and her passion for teaching the material makes it easy to stay engaged and keep up with the work. Take her if you can!
While the class is a lot of work and stressful, Rivas's understanding and enthusiasm makes it all worth it. Make sure to study for the quizzes and tests, as they can be pretty tough.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Great teacher, should have a higher grade

Professor Rivas is one of the most impactful professors I have ever had. She has deep understanding of the course material, and is very intelligent in general. The HIST 204 class takes you into the role of history's prominent figures to have a more nuanced understanding of the past. Lots of reading in the beginning- highly worth it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Definitely have to put in the work (studying/reading) for a good grade but Prof Rivas is so nice and genuinely cares about her students. Also test grades are balanced with two "simulations" (essentially a class wide project that's not that hard to get a good grade) History isn't my fav subject but she tries to make it interesting/understandable.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Rivas is a seriously good professor! She doesn't let you slack, though. Her class will not be your easy A, but if you attend class and do (most) of the readings, an A is totally possible! And you will learn a lot, and enjoy the class. A group role play of an historical event (Yalta conference, for example) often happens each semester.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Lectures are too dense, powerpoints are too vague, study guides are general and tests are specific.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Rivas is really nice and I really like her outside of class but she is a super hard grader. She is the kind of professor that thinks that a B is a grade to strive towards. She is very willing to work with you to improve, but her class is really hard. Especially for a GE.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Do not take dar dar rivs for a freshman seminar, people say that there is no way out but there is. FIND A WAY AND GET OUT. This was one of my hardest classes I have ever taken. She is a super tough grader, thank God for advisor they give you because if it wasn't for her I wouldn't have made it. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Professor Rivas is super passionate and willing to help her students, so take advantage of her office hours and email if you need help! She has super high expectations, but they aren't unreasonable. As long as you pay attention, do your reading, and complete your assignments well, you'll be fine. She's a great prof. to get to know.

Dr. Rivas is definitely passionate about her stuff, but she is very hard and lectures a lot. It can be tedious and boring, and she lectures really fast. she expects a lot of previous knowledge from her students. Prepare to work hard for a decent grade.

Professor Rivas was so nice and helpful! She was so excited about international relations (the subject of the class). Was always prepared for class and wanting to make a comfortable environment. LOVE her. I rearranged my 4 year plan to take her class again.

She was my freshmen seminar teacher. She expected so much from her students and was not feasible; she assigns so much work and she's such a tough grader. Plus, does not give her students enough time to prepare for papers. Rivas holds her students at a really high standard and her class is interesting but not worth it.

AVOID taking Rivas at all costs. Her class is unnecessarily and unfairly difficult. Lectures=boring, textbooks=boring, but necessary. Tests are EXTREMELY difficult and excruciatingly detailed as are study guides (one w/ answers was over 28 pages long!) You can expect to work really hard and only receive a C tops. Nice lady, but horrible teacher!!

Don't take her class unless you really really don't have any other option! She is super nice and will help you but it doesn't do any good because her lectures don't have barely any synthesis and her tests are really difficult. The test seemed to be unnecessarily difficult and the multiple choice questions were horribly detailed.

She's a really nice lady, but I don't like the way she teaches. Her lectures are hard to follow, the PowerPoint slides are disorganized, and the reading assignments are way too long (I've had to read more for her class than for Great Books this semester). The exams are pretty difficult, although she doesn't grade too hard on essays, surprisingly.

Ok as far as the power points go, that is no longer in affect in her class.  She lectures for two hours straight and its the most unclear and disorganized way of teaching i have ever experienced.  She is a nazi when it comes to grading her test and essays... if you are ok with working hard and getting D's and C's then take this teacher.  Rivas=Lame

This class is a joke. The lectures are 60 slides that you can get online after class. The teacher is really nice but will tear your tests apart. If you take her, plan to study really hard and still get an average grade.

This class is a headache. The lectures are never ending. She is very friendly however her lectures are not clear and she has way too much material it is just confusing. If you ask a question you will just be more confused than ever! Don't take this class. The tests are ok except if you don't write exactly what she wants forget it!

She seems to be a very nice person but has no concept that her class is a mere GE ... NO ONE WANTS TO BE THERE!!! Her tests are way harder than they should be and her boring lectures jump all around until you decide to pick up your stuff and leave early ... DAVENPORT, now thats the teacher you should take
This woman is the BOMB!  I heart her with all of my being.  Take her for every class and your life will be blessed with bliss and happiness.
She is by far the worst teacher I have ever taken.Her assignments are worthless as well as her teaching style.
She turned me off history forever. Whatever you do, don't take her.
She knows her stuff, but should not be a professor. She is not cut out to teach and doesn't seem to care if students are interested or learning the material.

She's a good example of what's wrong with Pepperdine's history department and its professors: over-inflated sense of self-worth and intellect, yet under-performing teaching ability. Between her, Zalar, and Davenport this is a department to avoid.  (Thank goodness for Tom Reilly.)
Wonderful

If you are interested in Latin America she is your woman. She knows her stuff and she's tough, but you come out of the class knowing more than  you ever thought you could. She is very willing to help outside of class. A refreshing course for those bored with US and Euro history.
She is smart, but she couldn't teach to save her life. She belongs in a think tank or research institute, not an instructive university. I dropped my history minor because of her.
I changed my plan to become a humanites major because it meant that I might have to take another class with her. Ugh.
She's a good person. She's extremely professional and is very intelligent.  She's done a lot for someone so young. Kudos to you, Dr. Rivas!
Thinks she's smarter than she really is. Plays favorites with the students. Very self-righteous. All-in-all a terrible learning experience.
No Comments
dr. rivas really knows her stuff and teaches history in an engaging manner
very enthusiastic and knowledgable, great course
No Comments

Awful teacher. Always late and cancels lab and makes us text our work to him. He's unorganized and confused. Not sure why Pepperdine has him as head of something. He can't even teach basic astronomy without slurring his words. My friends took him in higher division courses and feel the same. A very confused man. He's a lot older and can't relate.
based

PHYS201 was a seminar class, which means there was barely any homework and almost the entire grade was based off of class participation. Professor Fasel is way too smart for his own good and will sometimes go off on rants. However, most of these rants are where the gems of the lecture will come from.

Dr. Fasel is sometimes hard to follow because he's kind of all over the place, but he's very intelligent and knowledgeable about the field of astronomy, as well as passionate about it, so in that sense he's a great professor. As long as you show up to class and take notes, you'll be fine. His outdoor labs to view stars is so cool!

Professor Fasel is the most caring professor I've had at Pepperdine. He always ensured we were understanding the material and was always available via text to help with a homework problem or question. He also really cares about the wellbeing of his students and knows that it is a lab science we are required to take, so he tries to make it fun/easy.

Fasel is a good guy and really wants the best from his students. He's easy to talk to and his was not too difficult grade-wise, although the material can be confusing because he's almost too smart for his own good.

Dr. Fasel gives his cell phone number to all his students, and truly cares about finding what we want to do, even if that means never taking another Physics class again. He is truly invested in his student's lives. The class is easy, read a chapter and discuss it. The 10 minute speech is difficult to prepare for, but plenty of time to prepare.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Fasel is a textbook nutty science professor but a great guy. Way way way too smart for his own good. Lectures are easy but disorganized. Homework is easy but the final is insane - you can't wait till the last minute to study, you better review the material often throughout the semester.

Gerard Fasel is an incredible professor and person.  I had him for several courses, and while he always made them very challenging, he brought the best out of his students by making them strive to be more independent and to think deeply about the course material. I  Highly highly highly recommend him if you're a serious student and hard worker.

Super nice guy. Wants to help you. If you don't get something, talk to him. Sometimes he goes off track/gets distracted/gets confusing, but honestly if you just talk it out with him, he will explain everything and teach you a ton.
Nicest professor ever - really helpful but too smart for his own good. Love the hair - could use a better text - very cool
He knows what he's doing. He's really smart but he cares a lot about his students. He works hard and teached well. P dine is lucky
Damn, I wish I had taken up his request to provide him the CD with astro imgages. Who knows where that could have taken us. just dreams...
Physics was really hard for me but Dr. Fasel was extremely helpful and understanding. Definitely take him for physics if you have the opportunity.
Best/Smartest professor I have ever had. Knows practically everything about physics and makes you his pattawon. He cares about every person in the class and will help at all times.
Dr. Fasel is a caring and helpful.  His teaching tech, is so on!!!!!!!!   Thanks

Since the final is pretty much the only test, this class is very hard if you're not self-motivated to study.  If you review all along though it's totally doable.  He is very helpful and really wants students to learn so take advantage of that!

Good teacher. He presents the material but then expects you to go back home and study it. At the same time it is a very open class, he allows you to miss class and catch up or just not come at all and learn all the stuff by yourself. He is very helpful and he tries to teach physics not memorization. Remember folks physics isn't easy.
A really great professor. He gives you all the tools you need to learn and it's up to you if you do it or not. Also one of the greatest men I've ever met.
Sharp's vision of a clean, solar-powered world began with their solar cells in a lighthouse in 1966.
It seems like you need to be a physics professor in order to buy a TV. Luckily, I am one.
you're gonna be teaching yourself mostly with him
Took Fasel for Calc based physics 2.  Only gives one test the whole year and then the final.  Don't bother going to class...just read the book and grind through it.

Very reasonable class and teacher, most  people do quite well even though it's a difficult course. He genuinely wants people to do well and is willing to offer help if you ask for it. He's very knowledgeable. Above all, if you work hard and ask questions, you will definitely do well.
He is a nice guy and cancels class alot.  He is very smart and is entirely unable to bring the material down to the students' level.  Your grade will be determined by how much he likes you.

Fasel is SO charming with a head full of platinum locks.. he speaks like Sean Connery mixed with a Canadian.  He is a very laid-back teacher and will give in to students when asked to push back HW or tests.  He cancels class a lot.  Only problem =  he knows his stuff so well that he can't really bring it down to where students can understand it!

Did not factor HW into grades most of the time. Great personality. I think you see things much clearer than your students in class. Only flaked a few times for Physics labs, but was fun. Dr. F- You showed up for lab one time with blood-shot eyes. You weren't fooling anyone. But he does know pro wrestlers and Chuck Norris.

We were a fluke class that got him for Buis Calc. It turned out to be the most frustrating class ive ever taken. He didn't show up sometimes and would give out quizes so he could leave class. He just gave everyone check credit on hw and quizes. This was cool until the average on the midterm was a 45... He doesn't teach and is very egotistical.

He is the worst professor I have ever had.  How can you give 10 out of 12 people in the class a D+ because HE doesn't come to class and always cancels lab.  How can you learn if he isn't willing to teach.  When the highest score on an exam is 38/200 its really sad.  Also, how can you only give one test during the entire year?

Can I just say he is really hot?  That said, his class is so loosely structured, and he doesn't really explain things as well as they could be explained.  But he is awesome and nice and easygoing.  Plus you don't really have a choice if you're taking 102.
No Comments
he is too smart for his own good.  and he talks really fast.  so far everyone in the class is lost it seems.

Thor beheaded me on many tests. He was unclear and often tried to get the students do to much, 20 page research papers. One day he decided he was going to be left handed mid lecture... we couldnt read a thing.
Fasal is one of those people who is too smart to be a good teacher.  He is confusing and the grades seem pretty subjective. He may mean well, but I learned nothing from him.

Fasel is a cool guy who knows about Physics. However, it seems like he only makes sense to people who already understand Physics. If you never took this class in HS, study the concepts in the book for sure and you'll do okay. Also, go to his review sessions. Lab is cake.

He is extremely helpful, he stayed up with me at 24 hour starbuck to help me study before the final.  He's confusing, but he really cares about all his students.  Get to know him, he's completely brillant and he's done a lot with his life.
He's confusing but fair with the final grade. Pay attention in class and take lots of notes.

very very hard class, he's a bit loopy, and i can honestly say i absorbed nothing from going to every single class period.  the book doesn't go as in depth as i'm sure he'd want, but he is ALWAYS available for help outside of class. at least he's nice.
Very brilliant professor, and quite nice!

He seems like he could be a nice guy, but his class is so confusing, and he's very condesending when you ask a question. I find the lectures completely useless, and the only way I can mildly understand is to teach myself out of the book.
HARD...he's sooo confusing.  Unorganized, and jumps around in class.  Don't go to class if you get confused easy.

He does try to make you understand OUT of class, but his lectures leave you in the dust.  He hates whiners and teaches more like he's defending himself than bringing you along to understand and appreciate.
Cool guy/very helpful/take Astro with him in summer if you can/great class-lot of fun but lots of work too
So confusing!! No clear thought pattern, can't stay on the subject, stutters and mumbles...impossible to follow him in class
No Comments
great teacher, helpful, soooo funny
Absolute favorite teacher I've ever had. He gave a fair amount of reading however I've rarely felt like I've learned more from a course.

Contino is very passionate and kind. However, I didn't find his overall grading/feedback to be super helpful. He is also somewhat disorganized and inconsistent with what he expects during each class. You'll figure it out but it might be a little frustrating. This class had a LOT of work but with proper time management it was okay.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: I personally did not want to take Great Books, but wasn't able to switch out of it. That being said, the class itself is very difficult but Dr. Contino is amazing! I am not continuing the colloquium but he was very passionate about me staying and hyped me up tremendously. Great option if you enjoy Great Books!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Great guy who is an expert on subjects like Dante and Dostoevsky and does a great job facilitating discussions. Only downside is a ton of reading before class and a long paper or two, but he gives you the grade you deserve if you do put in the effort.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The Best great books professor out there. You have to read closely and put definite effort into essays, but it's great books, what do you expect? He truly cares about his students and is the kindest prof at Pepperdine, hands down. He is also crazy smart and it is so fun learning from him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Contino is really great at what he does. He is the perfect professor for discussion format classes because he is great at directing the conversation while still letting students lead. His class is challenging because he pushes students to be the best they can be at writing, speaking, and critical thinking. Great Books with Contino helps you grow.

Contino is that magical sort of teacher that while difficult and demanding, makes sure to bring out the best in each student. Reading and writing is expected for each class, and class is socratic-seminar style. PJC is very passionate about material, so if you're prepared, you'll be fine. Class is very hard, but PJC wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: Professor Contino is one of the best educators I've ever come into contact with. His class is hard but if you put in even the minimum effort you will get so much out of it. I really can't emphasize how incredible he is. He is respected at Pepperdine for a reason- take Great Books 1 with him even if you don't intend on finishing the colloquium.

Contino is probably the greatest person I've ever met. Contino really helped me learn how to write and analyze literature. Glad I didn't drop this class, even though I tried. This class was a lot of work but an incredibly valuable experience. I've never enjoyed a class more, or derived so much fulfillment from education before.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: By far one of my favorite professors. Actually willing to listen to opinions he doesn't share and takes them seriously. Be ready to dig deep and back up everything you say with textual evidence. Prof. Contino offers a lot of feedback that will help you grow as a writer, a philosopher, and a thinker. He's good-natured and keeps class entertaining.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Contino is wonderful! His class is definitely challenging (the texts are dense and you will read them quickly), but he truly cares about you. He is accessible outside of class and constantly looking for ways to improve class for his students. Be prepared to participate and ask questions. He values this and will be happy to help.

A wonderful professor who cares about his students. You really need to read the books though. Nearly every single thing you say in class will need to be backed up by specific textual evidence. It is a challenging course with high expectations, but I grew a lot both as a writer and as an intellectual during my time in his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Contino is one of the best professors I've had. He has high expectations, but is more than willing to meet and is there to help. Discussions are meaningful, and he'll incorporate movies & art occasionally.

Contino is by far one of the best professors that I have ever had! He is so kind and helpful. He truly cares about his students! His classes are super insightful and they might change your life! I love professor Contino!

Contino has high expectations for students in discussions & in essays, but he's there to help you along. He's flexible with office hours & is usually super helpful. He appreciates honesty & understands how hectic balancing classes gets. He also has a great sense of humor that's incorporated in discussions. Love Contino!

Contino is one of the most insightful professors I've ever had. Discussions in class are thought provoking, and mentally draining, but Contino is there to help the discussion along and to add his own insights to those shared by his students. He has high standards and expectations, and that is reflected in his grading on essays. LOVE HIM!!!!
I LOVE PJC
He is amazing. SO ENCOURAGING IN EVERYTHING. I love this guy like a dad almost. Such an amazing man of God as well.

This man is one of the most insightful and openminded professors I've ever had. My favorite professor by far. He is extremely understanding and yet expects a lot. As far as the class itself, it literally changed my perspective on life. If you do the reading you're mind will be blown. Each text is a gem. Asian Great Books is a beautiful thing.
Best teacher I've ever had. If you take Great Books, you MUST have Contino at least once! He is so engaging with his students and I've learned so much.

Even after completing a graduate degree at an Ivy League school, Contino is still the most influential teacher I've ever had.  Be prepared to be held to a high standard, but one that will make you a better student, thinker, and even person if you're willing to embrace it.  My three classes with him were the most valuable of my education.

An amazing professor and a great friend outside the classroom as well. The class was demanding (unlike certain other Great Books classes I definitely had to read the texts every night) but well worth it. He's also helped me out a great deal with advising and would do anything to help out his students! Holding out hope to take another of his courses

Professor Contino was awesome. He taught our Russian Lit class and had such great insight into the novel.  Don't get me wrong, this class is a lot of work though, we read 2000 pages worth of books and wrote 2 12 page essays. Class could be long and exhausting sometimes but he is one teacher who has a zest for his job and challenges you to think!

One of the best professors I have ever had, and I have been trying to get him again ever since. He is in popular demand. He is a fantastic teacher, and a good friend as well. He will help you whether its class related or not, and is always willing to listen. Will help you out of class on papers if asked, and will truely make your Pepp experience.

If you want to learn and experience the text, this is the professor for you.  He is the definition of what a college professor should be like; contemporary, knowledgeable, fun and fair.  Take him if you want the best experience possible, not if you want an easy A or one you can sleep through.

This professor is not open to creativity. He vaguely knows his material and the most beneficial part of the class is the discussion generated by students when he's finally quiet. Still a worthwhile class, if you enjoyed Great Books, be be prepared to tell him exactly what he wants to hear on his papers!

If you're in Great Books already, you know it's hard, but Contino brings a solid Christian perspective to the class (he started out every class with a prayer).  He is also more than willing to help you out to make you a better writer or with whatever.
Not very deep and expects to hear his views parrotted back.  Perfect class if you are willing to brownnose and do whatever pleases the teacher.  If you have ideas of your own, not so much.

Contino is flippin' amazing.  This class is doable, but he will know if you are trying to slide by.  Be prepared to work, but also to learn a ton and become involved with the material.  If you do not get a decent grade, it is no one's fault but your own since he is always ready to help students.

Pretty hard class..But now that I'm in a different teacher's i miss his class a lot.  Very knowledgable and a deep thinker, just be prepared to think just as deep on your papers to get a good grade.  Overall I learned a ton in there and appreciate having taken him. I would recommend him.
He brings the books to life. My level of understanding is so much higher than it would be with my last professor. A somewhat tough class, but worth the work.
amazing teacher. great florence prep, dante expert, very affirming, very compassionate, very demanding. read tons, learn tons, grow tons.
i liked prof. contino's discussions and enjoyed writing his assignments. i am thankful to have had him as a teacher.

by far the best prof I've had, hard class, took a ton of effort and you have to be ready to read a ton and do alot of prep for each class, but if you enjoy the subject material, and you are taking this class cause you enjoy lit. not cause you are tryin to ge out of math, Contino is awesome
grrrrrrr...
No Comments
Great teacher, motivating, very into the material, be prepared for tons of reading and class participation
Very helpful and nice, but a little too intense...

amazing, absolutely amazing. helpful, clear, concise, appreciative, open, willing.  he finds the good before he points out the bad.  open forum class, which is awesome, and very good about letting the students have say.

One of the best Profs at Pepperdine. So passionate about course material, an expert on Dante, great preparation for going into Florence Program, cares about his students, writes amazing comments on papers and very affirming. Great experience
If he doesnt like you, your dead! Simple as that.
this teacher didnt like me and i didnt like him, 'nuff said
Contino is cool. Challenging but nice. If you don't wanna work hard then don't take him.

I loved Prof. Contino.  So helpful, ready to listen anytime you wanted to talk, passionate about the material but ready to hear your opinions.  Asks a lot of reading, but not terribly bad, but demands your full attention each minute of class.

Not the best prof ever, but he knows his material and he cares about his students.  In response to the other person's comments:  the class is called "Great Books," so if you didn't want to read you shouldn't have enrolled in the class.
Reading required is enough to make me contemplate suicide.

Professor Smith is one of the nicest professors/teachers I've had. Her course is pretty interesting and although there is technically a lot of reading, if you pay attention in class, you'll be fine even if you don't complete them. She literally tells you exactly what you need to study and what will be on all her tests, and its not difficult.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Quizzes are based on memorization from the texts she makes us read. She cares about her students and tries to give as many outside resources as she can. However, she's an extremely tough grader, and the deductions she gives on exams are sometimes unwarranted. She was a good professor but I wouldn't take her again, especially for GE subjects.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Been 2 years since I graduated from Pepperdine, and I can clearly say that she was by far the hardest professor of all the classes I have taken!! Please do not procrastinate class registration and make sure to compare multiple available professors for HUM 111. HUM 111 is mandatory anyway, so why not take a fun class offered by different professors?
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Prof Smith is a hard grader however if you put in the effort to do well you will succeed. There were times when I didn't understand the material but I was able to email or visit during office hours and get clarification. She values your communication & although lecture heavy the course was informational and helpful.

Super hard lectures and I honestly got super unlucky having her as my professor. I def didn't know what I was signing up for. Never take her class if you aren't ready for long, boring philosophical texts and 30 pages of textbook material to read and write about as your homework. Oh and don't forget about the quizzes and tests!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Amazing person and interesting class. Lots of opportunities to get extra credit and very helpful out of class as well

SO much work just for a GE. Professor Smith's lectures were hard to follow b/c they were so heavy + lengthy, but she's very passionate and always willing to help you out. What was meant to be a 15 min meeting turned into 45 mins of her helping me break down the material. the class is tough, but there are many EC opportunities.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Everyone saying this class is difficult is RIGHT, but also take into account she is always available to help. She has massive office hours times, and her email is always available. You do have to pay SO MUCH attention in the lecture. Geography quiz attendance points easy, 25 extra points in the midterm and final for attending the followup lecture.

The way she teaches is so much more complicated and unnecessary than what's required to know. Approaches the class like everyone needs to love humanities. Confusing grader, terrible teacher, but passionate. Does not provide any study guides. I strongly do not recommend this teacher for the sake of your grade and mental stability.

Professor Smith is a really nice woman BUT her lectures simply do not make sense in my brain. Her google slides basically contain images, and she explains everyyythiingg while she speaks, which means you have to pay A LOT of attention. She xpects you to know all of the context. Its very content heavy. Easy attendance points + easy geography quizes

The practice quizzes uploaded on courses are completely different or modified from her in-person quizzes. It seems like the intention is to ensure that you fail this class right from the start. I strongly advise against taking her class because her lectures are excessively lengthy and she often goes off on tangents that are irrelevant to your exams

Professor Smith is extremely kind and passionate about her job. I will warn that her classes are difficult, but if you look for help, (which she makes always available) and actually put in the effort, you will do just fine.
Lectures go on a tangent, has a three-step process for attendance alone, tests are extremely difficult and she is super strict for a mere general education class. Would not recommend.

Please for the sake of your GPA, do not take this professor. She gives an impossible amount of content and expects you to remember it all for the exam. For reference, I'm a straight A student, but this one tanked my GPA. She is VERY lecture heavy, yet says a lot of nothing, so it's hard to grasp what concepts are important. DROP HER ASAP.

I had no idea what was going on in this class, and other people would agree with me. Her exams are both an in-class essay and a multiple choice. Unless you truly know everything down to the smallest details (including dates) about the topic, then it will be hard to do well. PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Very hard to follow lectures and geography quizzes that have nothing to do with what we are learning in class. This GE takes up the most time out of any other class I have due to the unnecessarily difficult quizzes/exams. No HW just exams and quizzes so it is up to you to study 24/7.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took Dr. Smith HUM 111 online. It was a very hard class, which I spent most of my after-class time on. There's a LOT of things to remember, such as maps, times, and lots of names. The lectures (PPT with voices since I took the online class) were heavy. You can tell that she is reading a script which has heavy long sentences makes hard to focus.
I love her so much. Super easy class and organized class

By far the worst teacher I've had in my time at Pepperdine. For me, it really just was about the way she teaches. She gives way too many details and ends up confusing the students even more. If this class wasn't online and I didn't have my notes in front of me all the time, I would've failed. f you can, drop her and take another professor.
Took this course in spring 2020 and absolutely hated it. She's not understanding and expects you to dedicate your life to this GE course. I would immediately drop if you have her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Very unique type of class but as long as you study the class notes and take advantage of all the extra credit opportunities she provides (she gives lots of extra credit) you should be fine in the class.

I had Dr. Smith during the covid transition, and I honestly believe my grade was saved by going online. But, I think it can also be done in person by PREPARING AHEAD OF TIME and going to tutoring. ALSO RATIONS!! Get started ahead of time because they will save you in the end! Her class is difficult, but she is very passionate on what she teaches.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class took an extreme amount of time and effort for a GE class. You can tell she loves what she teaches, but she goes lectures too quickly and wastes time with unnecessary nicknames and stories that make you more confused. Start earning rations as early as possible and write down everything you can on your cheatsheet.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Earn as many rations as much as you can because they will benefit you in the end even though they are frustrating. I definitley lost sleep from her because of how much work and effort because of her. Write everything you can on your cheat sheet. Study your maps because that's a guarantee A grade. For the MC and essay yeah idk what to tell you.

I don't know where to begin she's terrible. She's too fast during lectures and it's always about these rations. For a GE class, this is just too much work. The only reason why I made it was because I bought all my exams basically with my rations. Did I learn anything, absolutely nothing!

Extremely passionate and truly wants you to succeed. Does a lot actives and uses lingo that initially seems wacky and unnecessary, but actually really do help in understanding the material and can gain you a lot of "rations" that you can spend on boosting an exam grade or extra credit. Textbook optional (I never used) and only three exams.
she is literally the worst teacher ever do not take her you will not do well

Smith really tries to make her class interactive and enjoyable. She makes HUM111 very interesting. She also offers a ton of attendance incentives (free points basically). Really study for her tests; this is college, there is no easy way out. If you pay attention and prepare, the tests are very manageable. One of my favorite professors.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: 30 pg crowd-sourced notes for each test. Read them 3 times. That's it. TAs grade test essays; put in buzz words she hammered on in class, you'll be fine. Multiple choice is tough and there are some BS specifics, but most are easy if you studied. I crammed for 5 hours before each test and got 89s on all. Grade jumped 8% for SHOWING UP to the final.

Avoid this class at all costs, way too hard for a required GE that was only worth 3 credits. Very knowledgable but poor teacher and talks down on students. Read the book, you have to teach yourself because of how specific the test questions are. Tests are difficult, make sure you ask what she wants specifically wants for essays.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She knows a lot about western civ and certainly teaches the class with passion. I also have to give her credit for trying to keep the class fun and for giving a 100% throughout the semester. HOWEVER I was lost in every one of her lectures and the test are RIDICULOUSLY hard. Despite the fact that she is a nice person, avoid her HUM111 class

Dr. Smith cares about her students but her teaching style is difficult to follow. She rushes through slides while walking fervently around the room during lecture. This is extremely distracting. There are 3 (200 point) exams (MC, Geo, Essay) and 10 (15 point) quizzes over the course of the semester. The final is a disputation. Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: As a person, she is very sweet and intelligent. I can see her trying to put in the effort to make this class better, but she is just really bad at teaching. She cant engage the class and goes so fast through her lectures. She doesnt give study guides but makes a shared google drive which doesn't help. This class is hard and if you can don't take it

worst teacher at Pepperdine. I'm amazed every day when someone asks her a well-thought question and she responds condescendingly and ill-prepared. She knows what she is talking about for the lectures, but other than that, she does not hold the gift of answering any type of question. She let all of us use "rations" or extra credit to retake exams.

She is absolutely the hardest and most strict grading professor. I have spent so much time for the tests, and basically it does not work well no matter how much I spend your efforts. The test is consisted by multiple choice, essay, and geography. Do not take her at all costs. The other Humanities professors are so much easier.

Prof. Smith is obviously knowledgable about Western Culture, but is not very good at effectively teaching her students so they can grasp the concepts. Her lectures often don't make sense because she does not bridge her thoughts so you don't understand connections. The tests are very hard and specific. It is overly challenging for a first-level GE.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: The most inconsiderate professor I have ever had. Her exams are wildly difficult (especially for a GE) and she emphasizes points in the lectures that have no actual value in exams. Your whole essay part of your exam is graded based on having a singular word of importance; don't have that word? You get a D. Avoid at literally all costs.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Absolutely the worst professor I have ever had at Pepperdine. She is rude, inconsiderate, and an overall terrible teacher.

Dr. Smith's digital humanities class was undoubtedly the hardest class I've ever taken. For Eng majors, it's required. She is an amazing person, but as a professor, Smith is often unclear about what's actually going on in class. I have never been so confused before. However, she is always available for office hours and that has been really helpful.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: The tests are ridiculously hard. The extra credit doesn't help too much. Definently retake the test at the end for extra credit (it has different questions tho). Write everything you know for the Essay questions and TAs grade those. I learned a ton from the class but it was way too much work for a gen ed.

extremely difficult tests but half the questions come from the homework quizzes. Write as much as possible on the essay portion. Tough grader and tough class. Fast speaker and the tests are ridiculous . Do the extra credit and the retake at the end
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Awful teacher. People like her should be removed from the school.

Worst teacher at Pepperdine. She grades way too hard and tricks you into thinking you can raise your grade with extra credit which just ends up being more difficult tests to take. Avoid this one at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class is HARD, WAY harder than the other prof that teaches HUM111. That said, Smith is really up front about her class not being easy and has extra credit opportunities that can really help your grade. Attendance isn't mandatory and there's crowd sourced notes, but if you want to do well, you need to go to class, pay attention and STUDY!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very smart lady and extremely knowledgable and passionate about the subjects she teaches. Tests are very hard and you need to study almost all of what she talks about in lectures to get a good grade on the tests. Be ready to study a lot to get even a B. Very hard for a G.E. class. Don't forget that she is a nice and smart lady though.

Dr. Smith is a great professor. Humanities itself was a challenging course, and her fast and dense lectures did not help. However, she offers a lot of chances for extra credit and makes herself available to her students. She loves what she teaches and it is inspiring. Also read the book!!

Smith is a great professor. HUM itself is challenging because we have to learn a lot within a semester. I bombed the first test because I didn't study (Definitely study). But she is there for you. Go to her office hours! She really really does care and wants you to succeed! I brought my grade from a C+ to an A. Just put in the effort.
She is really nice but too hard

Her lectures are so fast and she uses words that I haven't heard of in my life. She over complicates the class and expects too much for a GE. The "extra credit" isn't useful. Her tests can be impossible or moderately easy. She is very intelligent, she just isn't a great teacher.
Eager to help students. Talks fast in lectures. Gives a lot of extra credits. Approachable and friendly. Interesting lectures
Really nice! Super easy just turn in your essays! Not that many essays, like no homework ever! She even gives time in class to work on essays!

Dr. Flynn takes feedback seriously and does her best to improve despite her other responsibilities AND having gone through some incredibly difficult times lately. She's super sweet, flexible, and I appreciated her open-mindedness in class discussions. She shared great insights. Ofc the class is fast-paced as a summer class, but it's very doable!
She is super easy-going but it comes at the cost of lacking organization. If you want a good grade, she needs to like your writing style. Her grading is unclear.

If you are like me and like professors who follow a syllabus, please don't take this class. This was easily the most disorganized class I've taken. I genuinely didn't learn anything which is unfortunate. But if you want an easy class and are fine with the disorganized vibe, sure, this might be for you.

She doesn't put grades into the grade book until the year is over, so I along with many others had no clue as to how we were doing and where we could improve. I had gotten A's on the few assignments she had graded but when I checked my final grade it said B-. She's very vague and instead of teaching just had us watch random videos. Thanks Flynn.

Literally the best professor at Pepperdine. So caring and understandable. Absolutely hilarious and connects course content to real life things to make class interesting. 4 essays that she gives ample time to write and revise. She prioritizes the writing process over the outcome. Would 100% take again. CARES ABOUT HER STUDENTS !!

Didn't really teach. No textbook. Just assigned essays, maybe 4, inc. research paper. No hw except the essays. Lenient grader. Lots of extra credit. Very, very lenient on due dates. Used class time to discuss important life topics, half related to classwork. Most of class time was given to work on the essays. Very caring. Really enjoyed the class.

ENG 101 with Doctor Flynn is an excellent choice. A majority of class time is used for discussions or writing. With all the time given in class for writing, you can finish your essays in class. Gives great feedback for essays and is flexible with deadlines. If you put in the effort, you will get an A. Overall, great course and would take again.

Dr. Flynn is the best! Although there was a lot of reading, the literature chosen for the course was spot on and has reignited my love for reading. She was also very lenient when grading, and when people had legitimate excuses for not attending class, she worked with them as much as possible. If you have the chance, take a class with Dr. Flynn.

Dr. Flynn is awesome! She is an amazing professor, and is one of the nicest as well! She is very personable, funny, and tells many interesting stories! She is a really easy grader, and gives great feedback on essays. Dr. Flynn is pretty much available whenever for help on Google Chat or Google Meet. SHE IS AWESOME, HANDS DOWN TAKE HER CLASS!! :))
Incredibly kind and understanding. Due dates were always flexible. Her class was rather disorganized, but was still an enjoyable and easy experience.

One of the best professors at Pepperdine! As long as you read, do well on the daily quizzes, and complete the papers you'll do fine. Study up for the midterm and final as well. Pay attention to her advice on what to study!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: What a doll! The class was so fun to go to. She is very understanding of what each person needs as an individual in order to write their best. She let use write freely about what we wanted, which made english so much fun! She gave critical feed back TAKE THIS CLASS

I loved Professor Flynn. She was a fantastic professor and really encouraged class discussion. She allowed in class work time and she loves to tell different stories and hear your stories as well. This specific class was really driven in the direction of students which was kept discussions very interesting! Very fair grader and gives good feedback!
Dr. Flynn has so many interesting stories. I could sit and listen to her talk for hours.

Really great Professor! Most of our class was discussions and she would allow us to convey our opinions and discuss it as a class. She assigned multiple essays but all essays were due when you were finished (Don't Wait rtil end of semester though!). If you ask for help, she will meet outside of class. Use the Writing Center for help.

Great prof. She thinks outside the box and is really into writing. Her feedback is among the best I have had in my academic career.  Dr. Flynn is funny and sometimes has a self-deprecating humor that is endearing. Love her!

This was THE best upper division GE class I have ever taken at Pepperdine (I'm a senior). Especially with the new $100 summer housing, this class is definitely worth taking in May. EASY. FUN. INTERESTING. CHILDREN'S LIT! fairytale/picture book/story analyses. Beware, it may ruin your cherished childhood stories. Everything seems sexual as an adult.

As an English Major, you will encounter her for almost everything which is awesome. I totally adore her. Funny, smart, light workload, huge creative liberty, fun tangents, no homework, amazing guest speakers, interesting discussions, attendance not mandatory every class. smart and funny, can I have her for every class??!

One of the best, most light-hearted people I've ever met in my life. Still consider her a mentor to this day! She DOES know her stuff, but doesn't turn her nose up to joking around like a lot of professors in her field may. She's a great person and can really be an excellent source of wisdom, friendship, and information for those who seek it.
She is the best the prof I have so far at Pepperdine. She is the dean of Writing Center, and her class is cool. A nice person, She invited us to have a thanksgiving dinner.
She is my favorite Professor!

Dr. Flynn is by far the best English professor at Pepperdine. Knows her stuff but is always joking around and having fun with students! Class was engaging and our final project was a satirical newspaper. Hence we spent 50% of class hours reading Onion articles and making fun of President Benton.
Awesome professor. Really kind and engaging. Tries to make class interesting with lots of discussion. Must of class is spent learning about argument.

Pretty easy going teacher.  She's sometimes all over the place and disorganized.  Really encourages discussions in class, however she herself tends to ramble a lot.  Be expected to write many drafts and share it with your class.
she is very open to writing in your own style. prompts are vague, but allows for some creative license. this class is perfect for those who like to write about what they like.
she is very open to writing in your own style. prompts are vague, but allows for some creative license. this class is perfect for those who like to write about what they like.
Probably one of the most useful classes I've taken.  Dr. Flynn knows her stuff and is a very engaging professor.  She does a very fun project at the end of the semester!
Dr Flynn knows what she is doing and is a friendly, committed prof. Trains her tutors well and prepares them for the actual experience.

I absolutely adore Professor Flynn!!  I've taken two of her classes. Her classes seem overwhelming at times, but in the end you'll have learned a lot.  She will go totally out of your way for her students (even in her last week of pregnancy!!!).  If you are looking for a class that you would find at a "real college" take hers. She is my Fav Prof:)
Seriously the coolest prof. I had at Pep. Very nice, very funny, loves her job.
No Comments
Took it in the summer- great class taught by a great professor... she made it fun and very relatable. She's quite humerous.
My friends told me to take her and I'm so glad I did. It was a fun class but I learned a lot.She writes a ton on your papers and helps you improve.

I loved Professor Flynn.  She's one of those teachers that you aren't too sure what to think of during the class, but after the class is over you are so happy to have had her. VERY Helpful and compassionate! My favorite professor here so far! Take her!!!!
She's awesome.  She wrote me a great rec also.  Genuinely cool and easygoing professor.

Excellent professor! I enjoyed going to class, the discussions and the projects. There is some computer work, but it's fun. The material is always interesting. I would take another class with her in an instant. She is also a wonderful person and professor
Kind to International Students.
discussion based class. easy-going.
She's cool.  She's tough in the beginning but if you meet with her and try she'l help you improve.  nice teacher.
shes a terrible person.  no commpassion for her students whatsoever.  shes boring and on a power trip.  youll never get an A.
Don't even think that you'll get an A on her class. If you get a B that's amazing. Usually you'll get a C or a D, and barely you'll fail.
She's great. A great teacher but also a friend.  I actually liked English for the first time in my life after taking her class.
THE WORST WHAT A BORE SHE IS.  ALL SHE WANTS YOU TO DO IS BE ON THE COMPUTER AND TYPE AND TALK ABOUT POEMS IT IS A HUGE WASTE OF TIME IF YOU DO NOT LOVE THE SUBJECT TAKE ANOTHER CLASS FAST
Looks like you have to know how to spell too. :-)
nice, but you ahve to like english to like her class
dont

VERY specific (10) T/F questions every other week. If you do not read you will NOT pass. Even if you did read, you still might score low on the quizzes (which was the case for me a few times which pissed me off, idk maybe cuz im dumb). Nevertheless, he's a great character, I love him as a person. As a professor, he should ask better quiz questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Dr. Daughrity is a nice guy, although I feel he has a preference for/bias toward Christian students. He also assumes everyone is religious, which is a big part of the assignments. He is a tough grader & scoring criteria for assignments is SO vague. He does not discuss textbook material for tests & you waste the whole class in discussion. Don't.

you do have to engage with him to get a good grade. sitting back and being lazy will not get you an A in his class. but if you go to office hours, he will point out everything he wants you to fix in an essay, so that when you actually turn it in, you can be sure it's A quality work by his standards. you literally just have to spend time with him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Great guy and super fun to talk to. He's super nice and caring. That being said, I would NEVER take this class again even if someone paid me. I would also never take another class with him. He's a very difficult grader and all learning is done outside of class, he uses lecture time for discussions and interviews that are not tested on.

Prof. Daughrity is a nice person overall as he really cares for his students. However, he doesn't directly discuss course material in class, just tells you to watch his ppt and read. Quizzes every other class period, which are incredibly specific T/F questions. Very hard grader & unclear grading criteria for assignments. Avoid if possible.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Develop a relationship! You need to be engaged, and that's about it. He highly values participation in class. While he's a tough essay grader & he usually tries to leave only positive comments, you NEED to go to office hours. He will look over your essay before you turn it in, & he will give you way more feedback afterwards if you ask for it.

Textbook is great and I really learned a lot from it. Reading is the only homework (aside from 2 projects) and if you actually read and study the chapter, you'll do fine. Quizzes every other class period. Classes go by slow and he rambles a lot but powerpoints have good content. Harsh grader on projects but also gives good feedback. Decent overall.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Quite possibly my favorite professor at Pepperdine, simply because I think he emulates the Christian values that the university represents. He cares about and builds friendships with each of his students, without partiality. His class is rigorous, but you learn a lot, and you'll do fine if you keep up with the reading. I highly recommend.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Grades harshly and unfairly. Makes it impossible to improve and seemingly disregards any efforts to do better. You will likely feel hopeless and frustrated if you take this class. He rarely gives As.

"If I give a paper a 95, that means I think it should be published" - Dr. D. Completely unreasonable expectations for an undergrad G.E. course. He definitely judges students who are not Christians. This class is not really that hard to pass, but probably impossible to get an A. Also, not enough feedback on essays, so you don't know how to improve.

Quite possibly the worst class I've taken at Pepp. He's knowledgable, but narcissistic in lectures and degrading towards students who ask for help. Expect to lose brownie points if you express any disagreement with his theological views. Totally arbitrary grading criteria too. I'm an almost straight-A student, but this class destroyed me.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Makes this class so much harder than it needs to be. Wastes so much class time. His grading is severely flawed and expects you to memorize the most insignificant of details for tests. Take this course with literally anyone else.

Expect to learn from reading the entire textbook. He spends class just talking to students. One time he spent the first 50 minutes of class on one slide because he was having a moral discussion with a student. He is very inflexible. Also, his grading criteria is quite unclear, especially in the written assignments. Extremely frustrating professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He changed his Religion course completely, and I enjoyed it. No tests, just papers, a presentation and a debate. Would recommend taking him

DONT LISTEN TO THE MONGOLOIDS WHO SAY THIS CLASS IS HARD.  The course consists of 4 papers and 1 final.  The final is insanely easy.  I received a 90 on it with 40 minutes of studying.  Just stay alert in class and review all the powerpoints a couple of times through the semester. This course is the easiest A I've ever received at Pepperdine.

Super kind guy. Huge stickler on attendance. I should have gotten an 'A' based on my grades but didn't because I missed some class. You do learn a lot in his class but his theology is flawed. Essays are pretty easy, tests are super hard so memorize everything on the pp and do the reading. Avoid this teacher if you can and take highfield instead!
His papers are easy but his tests are out of this world hard.  Expect to work for an A or accept the fate of a B.  This hold true for all his classes.
Likes questions in class. Really considers the subject and if it fits his experiences every time he presents it. Wants you to walk away remembering something. Genuinely likes the subject.

Great Professor!  So good at facilitating discussion and making information relevant.  His tests are a lot of work, but it's college, people-  If you want to do well you actually have to read the book and show up to class every once in awhile.  He also offers plenty of opportunities for extra credit.  I definitely recommend him!

I highly recommend this class from this teacher. However, this is an upper division COLLEGE class. It will take at least a teeny tiny amount of mental and physical effort to do well. I easily received a "B" without too much strain. Class was immensely fun and educational. Teacher gets an A+ from me.

he's unable to teach in an effective manner-no prep for his ESSAY exams- he really does know soooo much about his field-which may in fact be his problem because he expects his students to retain and regurgitate SO much information without any direction as to what to focus on for exams. i studied my ASS off for a B! DONT TAKE THIS PROF! nice guy tho

This guy is terrible at teaching. The entire class is just him saying exactly what's on his powerpoints (which are RIDICULOUSLY long with too much information on each slide). With so much information to memorize and no study guide for tests, they are almost impossible.  All write-in answers on tests so you can't even guess the right one.

Though professor Daughrity is passionate about what he teaches, the way in which he conveys that passion is disengaged and clouted. He goes off on many tangents that are irrelevant to discussion. I would take another class if possible.

He is really knowledgeable and engaging. He is very passionate. I wasn't interested in the subject and I left the class telling everyone what I learned. It is really a great class and he is a great teacher. Besides, the fact he called me out three times for my cellphone going off.
The person that began his rating with "Avoid him." is 100 percent accurate as to what type of teacher Daughrity is.

Think Michael Scott from the office but with a love affair with esoteric facts. He is very intelligent and very engaging, but has some unintentionally humorous quirks. This class is only for serious students and requires hard work and a knack for memorization.
I would highly reccommend taking this course with an alternate professor. It seems Daughrity is under the impression that this is a doctoral requirement,and not an undergraduate GE course.

Requires you to go out to a church and write about it. The research assignment is not long.... But you have to be creative with it. It's just like a high school arts and crafts assignment. Quizzes are on little facts in the book... NOT the author's argument. Midterm and final are impossibly difficult... So much to study...

Avoid him. His lectures are PACKED full of information and he DOESN'T post any pwrpnts or outlines online. Don't actually READ the book, instead go through and memorize EVERY SINGLE date, name, and stat... that's what will be on the quiz. nothing about the book itself. No study guides for mdtrm/final, literally ANYTHING ever said in class is on it.

Awkwardly funny.  Make sure to bring a computer to class since his powerpoints are really long.  Writing the content down will really wear you down.  Tests are pretty intimidating but as long as you go to class, read the required text, you actually will be fine.  Requires a lot of projects.  One included is a field trip to a church.

Interesting course material but he was so easily distracted by his ego that little of what he actually taught was relevant. Tests were inconsistent with the lecture notes which he flies through. If you read the book, you'll be fine but I would really avoid him if possible.

Dr. Daughrity's World Religions class is very interesting. He teaches with a great deal of passion, and his global perspective is much appreciated. Not that hard if you do the work, he is also great to talk to outside of class.
Dr. Daughrity teaches World Religions at Pepperdine now. His class involved a lot of notes, but he was a great lecturer and an easy, fair grader. Great class!

He spends a lot of time on irrelevant material and YouTube videos. Tests require memorizing random, useless facts from the lectures. Assignments are time consuming and unproductive. I'd avoid him if at all possible.

He knows alot of stuff but he puts his passion for the subject out in the form of a billion names and dates for the whole time barely stopping to take breaths. If missing the big picture and memorizing lecture is your thing, enjoy.

He is such a nice guy.  The material is essentially word for word out of the text book, but don't let that fool you;   The tests are hard and you have to know your stuff.  Keep up with the readings as there are not many, but there is a ton of memorization.
what a great professor!! very challenging, but super engaging!

I really really enjoyed his class. he knew the material and was really interested in what he was talking about which made the class more interesting. the assignments are fair, the tests arent too bad if you do some readings and go over your notes. overall a really good prof
really into what he's teaching makes the class more interesting

Poor delivery method, but he definitely know his stuff and whether I liked it or not, I learned a ton. Assignments and essays were fair and my marks were reflective of the amount of time spent preparing for them. I you're taking a RELS course, though, try to take one with Anne White. She is amazing.
Nice teacher, genuinely likes the subject matter, definitely a challanging (read: hard) marker but not unreasonable.

Not very knowledgable but thinks he knows a lot. He told me he knew a lot about something but he really knew pretty much nothing about it . Seems to be influenced by the media. But he is receptive to being challanged a little in class.
What a waste of time. Out of the entire class I couldn't find one person who liked this guy. Don't rub him the wrong way because he will grade you lower than others.

Professor Rouse is very kind and funny. He's a 10/10 person! Yet the weekly quizzes can be pretty tough. Definitely BUY and READ the book! Theres a paper that's optional. The lectures are very interesting and a bit short. Does fun activities in class. Over all good course but STUDY for the quizzes!!

I really love Dr Rouse. His lectures are always interesting and you can tell he's passionate about what he teaches. It's a quiz based class and you need to read the textbook and pay attention in lectures to do well. If you  go to class, youll do well easily. He also has a lot of smaller assignments that are easy and help boost your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: There's a quiz almost every week but no midterm and final. His grading is very straightforward and based on chapter quizzes, around 7 activity response assignments, and 2 book summaries. We took a day to talk about each summary in class. He had a day or two for other activities. He's super nice and passionate about his work so makes class engaging.

Dr. Rouse is the best psychology professor at Pepperdine! Though his sexuality course is demanding, Rouse is incredibly kind and willing to help students succeed. Grade is based on weekly quizzes that are dense, 3 papers, and weekly response forms that take about an hour. I would highly recommend this course as a capstone, assuming it gets added.

Professor Rouse is the best professor ever!! He is very interesting and engaging to listen to during lectures, he uses class time well, and teaches about interesting things. He cares so much about the students. He is so kind and very approachable.
The best professor I've known at Pepperdine, very passionate and caring, he makes things very clear.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: This professor has really made psych testing fun! He is understanding, engaging, and knowledgable. Rouse is definitely one of the best profs at Pepperdine and I would take him for every course that you can!

This professor is my favorite. He is extremely caring and highly knowledgeable in his field of study. I am grateful I got the opportunity to study in his class- I feel I got quality information and that the quizzes were fair in content and difficulty. He is amazing!!!!

Dr. Rouse is everyone's favorite professor in the Psychology department. He's brilliant, an exceptional teacher and a very caring mentor. He wants his students to be successful and he is always accessible for extra guidance. PSYC315 is a lot of studying. His quizzes ask detailed questions. So study the details! There is extra credit available too.

Dr. Rouse is the best professor EVER!! He is so caring and engaging with his students and has helped me so much. Honestly, if you just do the work you will get an A. Definitely recommend his first-year seminar class. He is the best.

Dr. Rouse is AMAZING. I have now taken him three times for PSYC 315, PSYC 321, and PSYC 442. He is such a kind and caring professor. His lectures, coursework, and other expectations are incredibly clear; he WANTS his students to pass and become more passionate about the field of Psychology. If possible, TAKE ROUSE!

Steve is a king. Loves the area he teaches about and both knows tons about it and how to effectively communicate his knowledge to students. It's also abundantly clear that he cares about his students well being academically and personally. Very kind and reasonable.

Professor Rouse is amazing at teaching personality psychology. His lectures are great and engaging, his grading is quick and straightforward, and he genuinely cares about his students. Weekly quizzes are doable if you read the textbook and there is a paper instead of a final. He gives options for extra credit and personalization. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Steve's class is challenging, but very doable. His lectures are engaging despite being about a difficult subject to make interesting. Definitely stay up to date on the reading to do well on tests. Spend a good amount of time studying for his tests and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Rouse doesn't give out study guides, but if you attend class and read the textbook his tests are manageable. Some days he will offer turtle shells that are very helpful for exams. He truly cares about the students' understanding of the concepts more than grades.
He's an excellent professor.

Great professor.  Super helpful and he is very caring.  You have a 20 question quiz every monday.  Read the book and give a 1-2 sentence summary for every paragraph.  For notes, make a quizlet and have everything from the lecture on it.  The lectures are short, most of my quizlets were under 30 terms
WONDERFUL.  SO clear and funny and wonderful.

Super nice and actually responded to my emails, giving me info on a topic essay for another class--not even the Pepperdine Admin responded.  Makes topics interesting, videos, lectures etc.  Reading is half the class. all quizes are multi choice based on lect/book (50/50). I got an E-textbook, maybe that was a mistake but it had practice quizzes.

3 hour lectures are killer. He's enthusiastic about the subject, but it doesn't make it interesting. You must read AND attend the lecture to do well on the quizzes - which solely comprise your grade. Extra credit, which is nice.

Lecture is so worth going to! The way he grades is awesome, there's one quiz every week, which you have to study for, but thats it, and the final is just another weekly quiz. The format is awesome, use the online study guide, he takes questions right from it

The best teacher I've ever had, period. The only class I enjoy going to every week. He keeps everyone interested with interesting facts and fun movie clips. Easy A if you do the 2 hours of reading each week and go to class. I never studied and have a 99%. GREAT subject, great guy, great class. TAKE ROUSE

Dr. Rouse is a great professor and I enjoy his class.  This class is easy if you take the time to actually review lecture notes and read.  Weekly quizzes make up your total grade.  He convinced me to choose psychology as a major.  He is wonderful!

Dr. Rouse may be the best teacher I've had yet. The class is fun and informative, one that you actually look forward to attending... plus he's a helpful, cordial, crystal-clear teacher, and overall an extremely nice guy. The class is a weekly quiz on 3-4 chapters of material, so it's directly based on your effort (easy if you study). Take him!

This is the best class I've had at Pepperdine so far.  Not only was it easy, but it was so much fun that I looked forward to going to class.  There are no tests and the quizzes are easy if you read the notes. Take this class... you won't regret it.
His class is pretty easy and is just 14 quizzes, no other outside work.  Plus the class is really interesting, he does a really good job with that.
very enthusiastic
One of the best professors I've ever had.  Very clear and generous.  Great outlook on life.
makes it interesting even though it's not a fun topic.  had to read more than any other class.
very nice guy, always smiling, cares deeply about teaching and students' success, no tests, but weekly quizzes that you must read the chapters and spend time studying.
No Comments

You must take the online quizes and scan the reading, but hey if you do that you should get an A or at least a B. He tells you how to do well. And I liked the consistent tests. Makes you learn and keep up

Incredibly good teacher. Very willing to help, and excellent use of class time.  Reading the book a must, but compared to other classes at Pepperdine, it's quite easy b/c he actually asks fair questions.  A note on easiness, though: The more I studied the worse I did. Go figure.

This class is super easy. Read the chapter and listen to lecture and you're golden. The quizzes are easy and he's really helpful. We don't have any tests, not even a final, just easy quizzes and lots of opportunities for bonus points.

It's been a couple of years since I took this class, but I remember more from it than any other majors class.  If he still does weekly quizzes, don't let it fool you, cause I had to read more for this class than any other.  But since it was once a week, I read the book instead of just skipping it.

He is awesome..... CHnage my major because of him. Weekly quizes and that is it.  The quizes arent easy but not to hard. He is very reasonable and totally willing to help. Easy B and you can get an A with some effort.

Psych and Religion was great-- Rouse had us read books that challenged our faith based on science, but he supported our faith the whole time. He even admitted he had questions. Also, most professor get older. Is he getting younger?

One 20 question quiz per week, based on the previous weeks material. No final, no term paper just your weekly quiz. Come to class and pay attention and there is no reason you won't get an A. This guy makes psychology interesting, tricks you into learning.

Awesome professor! I had him for intro and for psych & religion. He knows his stuff and makes everything interesting! Extremely approachable and is interested in hearing about what intrests you in the field! I highly reccomend taking a class from him!
He is so nice.  No tests.. just weekly quizzes.
Amazing guy!
He is the reason I changed my major to include Psychology.
The best!  Take him if you can.  Peace from Florence!
Like No Tests! Term papers optional.

Bui is awesome! The course itself really isn't as hard as some were saying. Personally, I began to study and review things maybe 3 days before an exam and got a 90+ on each. Your grade is based on three exams, and two SPSS assignments. No attendance, participation, or midterm/final exams. She is sweet and tries her best to make class fun. Take her!
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: caring professor with entertaining lectures, but the tests are insane. The questions she asks are things like "which line is not from the textbook?" or asks questions that are so specific and are only MENTIONED during lectures, things you normally would not pay attention to. Normally an A student w/ good study habits, but never got As on tests. tf
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: I don't hate her as she was a very sweet person and was always there outside of her class, but her class was far too hard! I had to drop the course, although I had an A, as there was too much work outside of the classroom that had to be done to understand the material. I heard it got even worse after I left so I know I might the right choice.
Don't take her if you're not willing to dedicate 35 hours of your week to one of her courses.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Great professor and interesting lectures, but the class is so hard. Tests seem nearly impossible to study for and do well on. You have to write down literally everything she says... everything.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lovely professor! One of the most wonderful people I've met. Exams honestly aren't too bad; stay on top of textbook reading and review lecture notes daily if you can (her tests are a combination of both). We had one writing assignment, and it was very straightforward (a fill-in-the-blank essay).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: Professor Bui is an excellent instructor who provides easy-to-follow explanations and answers questions in great detail. Her examples of what she expects were assignments that she, herself, completed. She makes sure everyone knows when and where office hours are. However, because she's so clear about her criteria, she's definitely a tougher grader.
Creates unneeded stress in your life by grading so hard avoid taking her classes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader
