comment: Professor Bui is one of the best professors at Pepperdine. She's incredibly intentional, and though her class is difficult she does her best to make it enjoyable. She brings baked goods to class and always is available to help you out. I really recommend her for statistics.

Bui is an angel. She's so sweet and luckily we didn't have any tests since we're online but I heard they're hard. We had 2 group projects because she cancelled the 3rd one and she's a meticulous grader. You have to triple check your work. But she is so caring and sweet. She's hard not to love.

Professor Bui is a meticulous grader. ALWAYS triple check your work before turning anything in or else the points you lose will add up. A lot of people become upset about this, but regardless she helps people to make sure that the work they turn in is proofread. She spontaneously brings in baked goods for the class; please treasure her as a human!
Hard professor but lectures were amazing. Exams are based on both textbook and lecture material. So take good notes and stay on top of reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Bui has a great sense of humor and is very caring. However, her exams are all multiple choice-textbook and lecture heavy. Her questions are very nit picky so do not expect to get a good grade without studying. Don't rely on getting extra credit for every exam. Read the textbook more than once and write very specific notes for lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Nicest professor who cares so deeply about statistics. Your grade is made up of 3 tests and 2 assignments with some opportunity for extra credit along the way. She explains every topic in depth and is repetitive to help you remember things. Her focus is more on comprehension of the topics rather than calculations. Don't miss review day before exam.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Bui is seriously the sweetest professor I have ever met. She cares so much about her students and even bakes macaroons for us! Her class is super organizes but all her tests are extremely specific so you really have to pay attention during every minute of class and white EVERYTHING down. I mean even examples other students offer during discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Great Teacher

Bui is overly enthusiastic.. If you have her at 8 am, her energy level is just overwhelming. The class is pretty easy for a GE math course. However, her lectures are painfully long and boring and she never lets you out early.

The material is not difficult to understand, the tests do not reflect learning in the class. There were 4 tests covering about 4 chapters, very detailed questions were asked so reading is a must. She puts lecture material on the tests. Would not recommend for an intro course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She is very condescending. Her tests do not test how well you know the material rather how good you are at memorizing  the textbook. She puts very specific and irrelevant questions on the test. If you do the readings, you are lucky to get a B, but a B in her class is an A in other classes. Do not take her!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Example of a question she would put on a test: "What was X researcher throwing in a park when he came up with y experiment idea?" She's not available for feedback, I went to her office hours for feedback on a paper and she told me to use google first. Take any other class in the 330 section before you take hers. My only B in a psychology course.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I absolutely love Professor Bui. She is amazing and has a great personality. She wants to see her students succeed and is willing to do whatever it takes. Her office hours are very useful. Stats wasn't an easy nor fun class, but because of Bui it wasn't dreadful at all. She is a great teacher and explains things very effectively.

Dr. Bui is a wonderful person. She makes the topic interesting which is very hard to do, and she's clear and thorough, and she welcomes questions, answers emails fast. But you gotta study hard for tests, and don't blow off the quizzes in every class... i was 2 points from an A-. She's pretty good you just have to work

for the most part a nice lady, will be somewhat rude to you if you miss class. She lectures like you're a baby, but is extremely repetitive so you remember it. Very clear in her explanations with questions. The tests are okay if you study.

She is NOT a good professor.  She publicly humiliates her students and writes rude comments on papers.  She is not open-minded nor does she seem to appreciate or take into consideration student feedback.  She did not give clear or relevant assignments for Psych of Women (don't take this class!)
I had her for stats, and she taught it like we were kindergarteners, so, even though it was repetitive, everyone with an IQ higher than 100 understood it.

Dr. Bui is always willing to help you if you have a problem.  However, her tests sometimes contained extraneous, random material that she never covered in class and was only in the textbook, which she never once told us to read.  Boring class, but, then again, could anyone on earth ever make statistics interesting?

She is nice and makes it her business that u understand everything she says (she will repeat it over and over again).perhaps takes her job too seriously but is a sweetheart. Tests are a little tricky but if u study a little then ur good.SPSS is the dumbest thing you will ever do (if ur not a Psych/Stats major). take her shes cool overall & cooks 4
No Comments
No Comments
She is a great teacher, she makes sure you understand, and if she does not know if you ask her, she will do her best to help you! Just do the hw and understand it and the class should be good

Though this course is hard, if you seek help outside of class and put in the effort, you should get a good grade. She wants to help!! The students who dont like her are the ones who just won't put effort into the class except right before tests. This class is the best class to take to prepare for grad school. Expect to work hard and you'll do well.

She is not the best teacher but not the worst.  If you can take someone else for STATS do it but if you can't you will get through it.  She is very picky and wants every detail written out which is kinda annoying.  She gets confused very easily and get frustrated at students when they dont understan

Very sociable and nice outside of class. Tests are usally hard and require much studying, but after the class, this teacher is an amazing woman and great mentor! She is very passionate and helpful. Recommended to get to know her for letters of recommendation and such!

You have to be very thorough....kinda annoying sometimes.... She is nice but very spacey and looses her train of thought all the time.  She is pretty much the only teacher that teaches it...so take her and get it over with....you will be fine ...just keep up on your work
very attentive to detail, can be frustrating at times for those more focused on big picture as a whole but overall very fair and very helpful
A really nice person.  Very fair and just wants her students to learn.  It is easy to see that she cares.
avoid at all cost

She is very thorough which is good in a statistics course.  The tests are no surprise, but get considerably harder each test.  If a student asks a question in class, she never directly answers it but feeds it back to the class which is annoying because then everyone is left wondering the answer.

So she's a really nice lady but she teaches you like your in 1st grade restating the same material over and over...but it was a really easy class and she goes out of her way to help her students understand, but if you cant understand by the way she teaches maybe you should go back to grade school

she is awesome excited about what she does and cares for students, who ever said she was cold must have done bad in her class, it is easy to not like her if you do poorly but if you try you will do well.

not the greatest teacher at pepp., but the absolute worst in terms of personality. she is cold, not understanding and doesn't let a thing slide. if you put the work in, it's not hard to get a good grade, but she IS NOT AT ALL NICE!
good professor, but hard to get a good grade.
No Comments
No Comments
I do like her as a teacher, but not a fan of chem. She is available for any questions and answers fast by email. She helps wherever she can if you reach out, so take advantage of that.

You do not need prior chemistry knowledge to do well in her class because she guides you through each topic with explanations and examples. She makes lecture handouts for each class. Her tests are a little difficult but as long as you review the lecture hand outs and complete practice problems they are easier. Her expectations are clear.

Dude , all the copium users who rated Dr. Ganske a 1 deserve a special place in the Los Angeles County Jail. She is an AMAZING teacher that explains chemistry to an incredible depth, and the homework is also manageable. You guys just flame the teacher because you're mad and bad xD. Consider putting in some time to actually study for the class xDDDD

Ganske is amazing. She makes sure everyone is following the content as she teaches and doesn't just talk at us. She is very easy to reach outside of class and provides lots of extra help if you need it. Make sure you know your conversion factors for every test and spread homework problems out because they can take longer than you think.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I love Dr. Ganske and would highly recommend that you take her for Gen Chem 1. She was super helpful in class, office hours, and through email. Her lectures were always interesting and engaging. She also goes at a pace that is reasonable for everyone, even if you never took high school chemistry. She is also super kind and sweet, an overall gem.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I LOVE THIS WOMAN SHE IS AMAZING!!!!! best chemistry professor I have ever had. makes the material extremely easy to understand. you should all definitely take her!!!!!!!!!!!!

I love professor Ganske! She was my favorite professor of my freshman year. Shes always open to being flexible with office hours and is very helpful. She gives practice exams and will give you other practice if you ask. Her exams are not multiple choice but you can get partial credit on questions. Also there is usually an extra credit question!
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Ganske is an amazing lecturer although her class and the material are challenging for those who are not good with numbers like myself. However, she has made most of the information clear to me and will help me get a better grade in CHEM 121 next semester. Lots of office hours and is super helpful in them.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: As a chem major student, I am so glad that meet a good professor in my general chem class. Dr. Ganske is a good professor that she cares about her student, she talks jokes in the class, even she doesn't take attendance, but people usually go to her class and enjoy her class. You will do a good job in her class if you follow her instructions.

Had Dr. Ganske for 2nd sem GChem, PChem, and Chem Lit. Honestly one the best teachers at Pepperdine and REALLY cares about students. If you don't do well in her class, unless you really can't wrap your head around the material, it's because you didn't try. Ask questions and show interest, she knows a ton about environmental and atmospheric chem.

Professor Ganske is a very great teacher. She makes sure that her students understand the material and is very caring. Her tests aren't too bad, and I would argue that some of the homework questions are harder than the test questions. If you have her for Chem120 she is an amazing teacher.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: If you are taking her class, congratulations! She is one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. She really cares about her students. Although sometimes the test is hard and the homework may be a little bit too much, but she is always offering office hours. She will also answer your questions via email VERY detailed and patiently. Great teacher!
Pchem is definitely everyone's hardest class. She's a great teacher but the course is tremendously rigorous
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Ganske is one of my favourite professors. Her class is challenging however she is always available to help. Her exams are more difficult than the rest of the Chemistry professors but her teaching is brilliant and she always lets you know what to expect from the class. She also does review sessions which helps for upcoming exams.
Dr. Ganske is amazing!! Her small in class experiments make her lectures fun and also her jokes. She is always there for help

Dr. Ganske is by far the best teacher I have ever had. Her class is definitely challenging, but I have never understood chemistry better in my life. Not an easy A, but definitely worth all of the hard work. Participate in class and go to office hours and she will really like you. I do not regret taking this class despite the challenging tests.

I love Dr. Ganske, she is an awesome person and teacher. But, you definitely have to put in at least 9 hours a week to do well. Her tests are the hardests tests of all the chem professors for gen chem.

She is a good professor who really knows a lot about chemistry and loves the subject. Do your homework!! This is coming from someone who scored a 45 (not doing hw) to a 81 (doing hw, more advanced chapter, no additional tutoring...hw is important!!!) on exams. Labs are tough and a ridiculous amount of work for one unit, but that's not her fault.

She is a great teacher and teaches a very engaging course. She is the only chem teacher that actually made me enjoy coming to class. Usually has some sort of engaging demo going on. Likes to use Liquid Nitrogen a lot. The course is difficult, but if you work at it and GET YOUR HOMEWORK DONE you will succeed. It's easy to pass this class with a C.

Yikes. Basically, if she doesn't like you don't bother asking her for help.  She's mean if you're not a favorite of hers. Also, you will NOT wing this class. When she says 9 hours of chem a week, she damn well means it. If you are a bio major, the tests will probably eat you alive. Course is fast paced and designed as if everyone was a chem major.

Nice. I took her for both Chem 120 and 121. Her tests for 120 were mostly fairly easy, but on the hard side for 121!  Key is to study not just study guides, but also EXAMPLES from class, her notes, and some textbook problems. Her tests are usually about 10 problems for 50 minutes, but they can be done quickly if you know your stuff. GREAT TEACHER!

She's the most difficult but best Chem 120/121 teacher.  GO TO OFFICE HOURS, even though she's intimidating.  You get on her good side by going to office hours, but come prepared.  Its a very hard class but you learn a lot.  She gives great study guides, but study everything!
Dr. Ganske is one of the smartest people in the world!!! She is very encouraging and extremely friendly.

Ganske is awesome.  Very dedicated to helping her students, and is an OUTSTANDING lecturer.  Couldn't be clearer or more intruiging.  Great in-class demonstrations.  Tests are tough, so study!  Also, be sure to read the textbook chapters.  Don't ask for special treatment, but if you have a genuine problem, she will definitely work with you.
Class was most challenging of all chem classes I had.

Tests are basically extended homework.  Lectures are always organized and professional.  Easily the best teacher I've ever had.  Don't ask for special treatment; just do the work and put in the time and you'll get the appropriate grade.
She is helpful, witty, intelligent, and amusing.
Her test are off her lectures.  Study guides often broad overview and test dont apply to them entirely.
Wonderful teacher, by far the clearest lecturer and most helpful professor I have had!!!
Horrible and boring.  She picks favorites and if you are not one of them good luck.  Her tests are hard and not like the homework or study guides.

test are very hard. Don't rely on the study guides because they are often nothing like the tests. Use you notes and make sure you understand the concepts in depth. Does cool demonstrations to make lectures more fun but other than that pretty boring. Tough class.
Made lectures interesting, difficult tests, homework was average, always available for help on problems and tests
Unclear in expectations for students.  very knowledgable, and caring.  study hard for her class.
Very good teacher, very organized, cares about her students, and gets students to learn a lot.  Very nice person, too.
Rude, packed office hours so no help there. Research professor, not a elementary chem professor. still better than mulford

excellent teacher, is ready to help you in office hours and stresses understanding of the material.  clear and organized in lecture.  expects a lot, but makes it easy to get there...as long as you're willing to study and work outside of class.
No Comments

She's a great professor, she prepares demos to help clarifying some concepts, I found those to be very helpful. She's very intelligent and knows the subject extremely well. Her tests are tough, but she is helpful. Overall a very professional professor.
One of the best professors I ever had. She makes chemistry so understandable. The class is extremely hard though.
Loved the class, great teacher.  Helpful, friendly, nice, but the material is hard and she asks a lot.
Makes you feel stupid when you ask for help.  Seems like a fake person
Definitely the cutest of the g-chem trio.
good person, but tough
shes really nice, but a hard teacher!

AVOID. She is kind and passionate. But with grading? Genuinely could not be worse. She highlighted the words "in opposition to" on my essay and said I should say "against" instead. That was the ONLY FEEDBACK and I got an 84. It's all writing, and her grading is unbelievably arbitrary. After every grade I would just think, did she even read it??

Professor Hunnicutt was very passionate about teaching baseball history however her lectures were unnecessarily long and the slides were so info-packed you could barely write down the slide before she moved on to the next. She also talked too much about her daughters. I think she's very kind but not a great teacher.
5. It's impossible to predict what she expects in your next paper. You never know

I'm pretty sure she didn't treat everyone like this. One of my friends in this class turned her blog in late, but she still gave her a 1/1 on that blog. Besides talking about whether her blog was turned in late or not, the point is, I followed her instruction and why did she still give me a 0? Professor Hunnicutt, please explain!

4. She did not treat all students fairly. She offered us an opportunity to miss one weekly blog and mentioned it several times over the semester. I missed one, and she was supposed to give me a 1/1 on that blog. Instead, she gave me a 0/1.

3. Not only in class but even during her office hours. I could tell she was very enthusiastic about baseball (the class she taught), but I couldn't move on to my question because she literally kept talking about her daughters! No one cares about your daughters!

2. She kept digressing in class. Her class was just about the course itself and her three daughters. She talked about how athletic and artistic her daughters were. This was clearly not relevant to this course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
HIST260
Summary: AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS
1. More helpful feedback needed to be provided. She admitted that she was too lazy to give feedback, but I needed it to improve!!! For example, I got a B on one of my assignments, but she only corrected 3 word choices. If the assignment was worth a B, there should have been more corrections than that!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: I had Hunnicutt for baseball history and she was really passionate about the subject, which made the class engaging and fun. I learned a lot from her, and it was clear she cared a lot about both her students and the material she taught. her grading rubric for papers wasn't always very clear, and she occasionally went off-topic during lectures.

I took her baseball history 1st yr class and the material was super boring, but she was also not the greatest. The work was easy, but her lectures were boring and she tended to go off topic a lot. She's super sweet, but I felt that the class was a waste of my time because we would just listen to her talk about her life for most of the class time.
Very easy class, easy A. Just be ready to learn about random facts about small events in American history instead of important things. Very left-leaning class as well.

I took her for hist204 online over summer and she was amazing. Her reading assignments are quite lengthy, but you learn a lot and you can skim over it to understand the gist. Its not hard to get an A in her class and she lets students resubmit assignments if they got a low score. She really tries to make her class engaging and shes really caring!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Her summer classes are too difficult for a GE and she expects too much from us with daily assignments. She often gives us worksheets to take note of during hour long videos that are quite unnecessary. I do not recommend her as a professor but overall she is a nice person who is trying to improve.

I'd say this is one of the better options for the 204 GE. She lectures each class, you take notes by hand. The exams are essays where you can use your notes so there's no need to memorize. There are readings weekly but, I honestly just skimmed them. Some work but, really not that bad.

I have hated history class for most of my academic career, but this was pretty tolerable. She's kind, makes an effort to be inclusive, and the class is honestly not too difficult. Don't take if you hate writing.

Loretta really isn't that bad, she has a wack sense of fashion but if you can get past that she's pretty nice. She does give a lot of work but its not too hard, there is a lot of reading but you can just skim. There were only 2 tests that were open note and 1 paper. She does grade hard but thats just Loretta...

She doesn't use a textbook but instead has a 10-15 pg article you read each week and write either an abstract, blog or comparative analysis on. There's only one research assignment and it's really easy. She's inconsistent in how she grades papers, but her lectures are easy to follow and the tests aren't that hard as long as you study.
Worse professor ever! DO NOT TAKE HER! Papers are do every week and she grades hard. She is nice and all but the class sucks!!!

I feel bad giving her a poor review because she is such a nice person, but if you have the option to take a different Professor for Hist 304, take it! She is an unreliable grader. You will never know what to expect, even if you feel like you have her grading system figured out. There is NO structure to her lectures, which makes it hard to follow.

Very hard for a G.E. class. 10 papers, a research paper, and a book review. And she does not expect for you to write about the actual historical content, but more about analyzing what was read. She treats it like an English class instead of history. Hard grader, with a very unclear grading scale. Do not take her!!
10 abstract one page papers, 2 analytical essays, 3 book reports, midterm, final = don't take her

She is a really nice person, but I didn't learn anything interesting in her class. Every word she said you can find on Wikipedia. The only advantage: I improved my writing skills although the price for that was a lot of writing assignments.
A paper due every week! Extremely hard grader. Intense class for a G.E! Though, you learn interesting facts, but it won't help when it comes to all the papers and exams!
She is super nice and you learn tons of cool facts about American history but sooooooooooo many papers.  I felt like assignments were always due but the test aren't bad.
impossible to earn an A on any assignment! if you want to fail, take her! talks about her kid every class period and it really gets old.

She just assigns too much. She treats her class like it's the only class you have. I had a 300 pg book & a paper to write on it per week, & if it wasn't that it was still the equivalent in articles. I took it while taking 18 units; I didn't sleep that semester. Only take her if your taking 12 units or you will regret it tremendously.
Really awful. Hard, but in the busy work way. Teaches like we're in Jr High. It's insulting. A lot of work for no reason and discussion is pathetic. Bad, bad, bad. Just don't.

Great professor, knowledgeable, cares about her students and whether they're learning or not, assigns a bit more work than others but other than that, she was cool and open-minded.  Ignore the negative reviews and take her, I liked her and her class.

So far she's got some pretty bad comments but I honestly learned a lot. Sure she assigns more than enough assignments and believe me that was frustrating. However, as a teacher she knew what she was talking about and she definately helps you understand the other side of the story. If you truly want to learn some good history take her class.
By far the worst teacher I've ever had, at any level.   She kills any pleasure you ever had in learning about history.  Why would Pepperdine hire a person like this?
her class is idiocy... treats you like you're stupid, very unhelpful outside of class, assigns busywork... should be teaching jr high.

This class is the most horrible class I think I've ever taken. Teacher is nice, makes excellent food, and her husband is nice  as well. Weekly essays would be fine if they were actually on a different topic each week. Her lectures are very boring.  My advice: take another seminar class if you can...
i haven't learned a single thing in this class . . . she pretty much doesn't have a prepared lesson plan. the weekly essays are ridiculous and the class material sucks. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
About as smart as a piece of toast.

Women and religion is not an interesting class at all. She seems nice but is so annoying to listen to! The class is just the same thing repeated over and over and you have to do an essay a week which sucks.

BORING. Her women and religion class is very long and not fun. She basically lectures the entire time about the same thing over and over again. The reading isnt exactly fun either. Grades weekly essays differently each time.

Dr. Long placed a heavy emphasis on written essays which are graded somewhat subjectively.  One will note that any issue on women's history (her specialty) will be graded much more critically.  Lectures are very dry.
WARNING This teacher is a nightmare!

This teacher sucks. I hated her extremely long boring lectures with her fake smile and her actually fake personality. She pretends that she is your helping professor but then after the class her real personality comes out. She in fact forgets your name an
She's knowledgable and a nice professor but the class was long and she lost my attention by the last hour of class.  LOTS OF WORK!!!!!

She's a great professor.  Know's her stuff and is enthusiastic about history, which makes the class more interesting.  She does gives a lot of papers, but they only have to be like two pages long.  She's really sweet and obviously cares about her students

Ok, four hour lecture, five minute break.  I don't understand how she grades essays because it seems like i turn in the same paper everytime and get different grades.  Boring, even for history.  And lasts the whole ... four ... hours, and during MNF too!
Expects way too much fomr her classes, her lectures are long but she is very good at it, especially for being a younger professor. Unless you want to work stay away
had her for a 4 hour lecture once a week, lectures the entire 4 hours with one 5 min break.  grades papers as an english teacher.  impossible to please her.  STAY AWAY!!
Pretty hard. Grades papers as if she were an english teacher but incredibly obvious that she is not. Long lectures. Pretty much 2 hour lecture every class.

If you're taking Great Books, take Clegg! You gotta be ready to read and talk, but if both of those things are up your alley, then you're gonna have a great experience. She is also really understanding and wants the best for her students, so don't be afraid to speak up if you're lost or confused.

Friendly professor and cares for her students. Material can be dry but she is very organized and her expectations for the semester are clear. Her exams are all essay BUT are hard. Prompts are sometimes random and she's a tough grader and in my opinion failed to explain what could be done better in the future. Overall good class for a GE
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: All 3 exams are essays, and the graders are not forgiving. The first essay question came out of nowhere, the second one was more reasonable though. Overall, the expectations are way too high for an Elkins class. However, if you get the notes from someone who took the class previously, then you don't need to show up to class until exam day.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: The class itself is easy. There are lectures every day and 3 books to read during the semester. A book club and essay exam follow each. Dr. Clegg; however, talks way to fast during lectures and is all over the place. She is very unclear in her directions and grades hard. Overall, I learned absolutely nothing but just got by to get GE credit.

I don't write these... like ever. But she is not a good teacher. Lectures do not match the essays. Way too hard for a GE. Not a lot of course work but essays drag that grade down quick. And a bunch of reading and book clubs. Bad class

Clegg is very nice, allows for open (and off topic discussion) in class. However, her essay grades are very arbitrary. If she likes your essays, you'll do well consistently. If she doesn't, you won't do well consistently. Not a hard class, can revise your essays for full credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Clegg lets students lead the discussion and talk about what they're passionate about. She lets students write their essays on pretty much anything, and there's no page requirement. She has high expectations for essays, but allows for as many re-writes as you want and is always willing to help.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: She's a great professor who understands that students can't be expected to memorize all of the material in this class. For that reason all the exams are open ended essays where you can bring one page of notes and each of the readings. This felt far more fair than any other form of exam. Be there to take notes or get notes from someone to do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: No textbook in a course where you almost need a textbook. Taught like an English class, way too hard for a GE. Would never take her again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great Books courses at Pepperdine are supposed to be on another level- an enriching experience. I was disappointed by Clegg's teaching of the course. If you don't want to have to put in work and just want to pass the class then take her. If you want deep discussions, don't.

She is very nice. There are 3 bookclubs throughout the semester and you do those in groups which is easy. You also have an extra credit assignment, and it's not that hard. You have 3 tests over 3 different books that you did for the bookclubs (you don't really need to read the books all the way). She is a tough grader, but her TAs are not.

Dr. Clegg is kind and very knowledgeable about the subject. She provides lecture outlines before class which are helpful since she moves very quickly during lecture. Since she lives so far away, if you can't make it to her office hours, she is very inaccessible. Exams are entirely essay based and there are 3 major group projects per semester.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She's fair and nice, but tough grader. Even with a "cheat sheet" for our tests it was tough to get a good grade.

I wouldn't suggest taking Clegg. Her lectures are horribly long and she jumps all around which makes it super hard to take effective notes. Her tests are all in class essay and her and her TAs grade them. If a TA grades it, then you'll do fine, but if she grades it, expect harsh criticism. Overall, she is just not a very good professor.

I do not attend every single class, but find her class still very easy to do well in.  She gives you a rubric before the test so it is very clear what she expects of you.  Do what she asks, and you will be absolutely fine in this class!  She is also a very nice woman who seems like she would be willing to help anyone who needed it!

I took Shakespeare with Dr. Clegg. I thought she was a very easy grader, and she was always willing to listen to her students. She is also extremely knowledgeable -- one of 2 undergrad profs at Pepp. who have published with UOP! Class was often very boring, but she definitely knows Shakespeare. I learned a lot in this class.

I am being VERY objective here, but her class is the WORST I've had. I am ace-ing ALL of my classes except for some reason I'm failing hers. Everyone seems to have the same problems with her, she's unhelpful, VERY rude, disorganized, incomprehensible, has a bad attitude & her expectations are FAR too demanding for a 200 level class. DONT TAKE HER!
I actually enjoy Clegg. If you take notes and pay attention during lecture, the exams aren't really that bad. Don't miss class because she does have random quizzes over the readings.
very disorganized and stutters too much to comprehend her lecture... AVOID HER CLASS!!! especially if it is an 8am humanities class!!!

She can be disorganized at times. She has outlines that are full of typos. She tends to say one thing and mean another, even on assignments that she gives. Her class is lecture based, but her tests are entirely essay, which doesn't seem like a good match.
Excellent teacher, fair, informative, available for extra help

Dr. Clegg is a brilliant professor, although sometimes it's hard to tell because she rarely interjects in class. She keeps class very laid back, but also fun and interesting. She's always available for extra help and is reasonable about granting extensions. Take Clegg!

Teaches humanities class like she is teaching english class. Tests are english tests. I thought the prefix was HUM, not upper level english class. I found her lectures extremely boring compared to HUM 111 or 113. Only offering at 8am made it infinitely more painful.
Such a fair teacher. Not hard at all, doesnt expect a lot from students, very sympathetic. Super nice person. Passionate about subject. Definetly take her.

It surprises me that students could think Dr. Clegg is a "bad teacher."  If you have a desire to learn and pay attention to her lectures, she's an amazing teacher.  I have recommended her to all my friends.
No Comments
No Comments

Prof. Clegg is a disappointing teacher.  In fact, she doesn't really teach you much at all.  We had class dicussions and 1 paper every 2 weeks.  She graded our 3-4 page papers IN CLASS while we watched movies.  The final project was a good time. You'll do fine w/ grades, but not a good teacher.
Has good and bad points.  I once got a paper returned with no comments and an "A"  written on it.  Good to get the A, but that is not the kind of feedback I want.
It's amazing that months after the class ended, I still find myself pondering a host of Dr. Clegg's lectures.  She is hands down the best professor in her field at Pepperdine.

okay... started out way cool by letting us put together the syllabus.  when class said "no attendance or participation policy" she said "okay!"  grade calculated out to an 83% but received C+.  when asked why, said "it's not like
She's a good teacher and enthused about shakespeare. She let us write our own sylibus for this class (with in reason) so i really cant complain, but 8am is too early for shakespeare
Great class.
Great class.  Would highly recommend any course taught by Dr. Clegg.

Pretty boring as a lecture, despite her enthusiasm for the subject. Assigns an insane amount of reading practically impossible to keep up on if you have any kind of life. Luckily, it's pretty easy to fudge because she tells you everything anyway.
Professor Clegg is a brilliant woman and outstanding teacher.  She truly cares about her students.
Undoubtedly the best professor Pepperdine has to offer.
annoying, whining voice at 8AM! got an A, but had to work hard for it. most interesting of the humanities series though
i can't stand her arrogance
Hacks a lot into the mic. Maybe someone should take her some cough drops. Other than that, pretty knowledgable, very understanding of student problems
No Comments

Very credible and knowledgable. Isn't a  dynamic  teacher but good nonetheless. Sorrell's course is a good prep for this one. Interesting material -- but she was poorly prepared for some lectures w/ audio and slides.

The homework questions are far more difficult than the class notes. He grades the homework based on right or wrong. The exams are approximately fifty percent of the grade. He is not the most helpful professor outside of class and speaks condescendingly. He does not round up your grade even if you deserve it.
Pretty good. Tough class but he gives you everything you need to succeed just make sure you are not lazy. Can get 100% if you do all practice petrucci problems which only takes like 2 days.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: With Dr Fritsch this semester I'm actually really enjoying chemistry (the opposite of how I felt last semester). His lectures are interesting and he never makes it boring because he's super theatrical. I think he's an amazing professor, super intelligent and he never makes you feel stupid.
Horrible. Doesn't teach and then assigns homework that he didn't teach and grades you down when you get it wrong. Avoid at all costs

Dr. Fritsch is an ok professor. Visiting office hours is useful ,but he speaks very cryptically, which makes difficult concepts even harder to understand. Nothing too exciting about his class, uses the same note packets semester after semester.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Fritsch is one of the best chem professors I've had here at Pepp. I am NOT naturally good at chem at all and Fritsch never made me feel stupid for not knowing something. Hes very available for office hours. The only thing I will say is there is a decent amount of homework and the quizzes but if you study and go to office hours you should be ok.

One of my fav profs at pepp. Will do good in the class if you work for it. start the homework early on, do all the practice problems, and GO TO OFFICE HOURS. Dr. Fritsch is very caring and willing to help if you just talk to him and ask questions. He gives plenty of resources to understand material better and practice. Also, don't get behind!!!

Dr. Fritsch is super charismatic, kind and willing to help students. His tests are difficult, so make sure to do the practice problems and review homework questions!! He responds to emails quickly and frequently holds office hours/review sessions. I found office hours very helpful when I had questions about the homework.

Just try to take it with someone else. Requires you to be on the top of your game at all times does not help when there are questions on the material and you reach out. Somewhat understanding of tough circumstances (during corona). Basically self taught class and you would not want that for chem. So much homework and not engaging lecture. Avoid plz

Very difficult class, you have to really work for it to get a good grade. Most of your grade comes from exams so make sure you study and utilize all the resources he provides for you to study and practice with. Lots of dad jokes in class which was fine and sometimes funny but I never thought he was very personable with his students.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I had Dr. Fritsch for CHEM120 & CHEM121. He is AMAZING! Be glad if you get to have him for Gen Chem because the other professors are way tougher. He is so organized, I loved his class notes, and he improves his class based on feedback every year. If you have an average A, you can opt out of the final which is a plus if you're taking a lot of units.

If you have the option to take this class form another professor I would recommend doing so. The class is difficult and some of his exams are much harder than other professors who teach the same course.

Dr. Fritsch is a great professor who really cares about his students. He will spend time to help you along the way. That being said, the class is pretty difficult and there's not much slack available.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: He cares about his students and provides good tools to do so. Make sure to do his practice problems before each exam. ALL of his quizzes are math-based.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Super nice guy. Dr. Fritsch is very kind although he is scary in office hours because he is so smart. He will help you so much if you just ask! Lots of homework in CHEM120 and 121 but it really helps to actually DO IT (not using slader) otherwise you'll fail the tests. His final was super hard, but tests weren't too bad.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Love Fritsch. Great professor, very organized and knowledgable, funny/sarcastic and always very helpful. Even if you get a B on one of your test, but overall you get an A on the average of the four tests, you don't have to take the final. People who talk bad about him here are gen chem kids who don't work hard enough and blame the professors.

His lecture is easy to follow. His is really a interesting guy and he makes his class engaging. Do home works, additional practices and practice exams then you will be fine in tests. CHOOSE HIS CLASS!!!!!!!
A good professor who cared for students a lot. He is available for students outside of class. definitely recommended, he teaches in a very detail way that makes sure you would understand.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I would recommend taking a different professor for general chemistry. When you try to ask him a question he responds to your question with another question making his material hard to learn. His homework assignments barely reflected anything we learned in class ,and his exam were incredibly confusing.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS!!! That was the only way I understood chemistry. Class was difficult but you have to put in the work. I recommend doing the practice problems days in advance, over and over, because you will see the same EXACT style of questions on the test. He is so helpful. He definitely became one of my mentors at Pepperdine. Great guy.

Great professor that really cares.  Tests are tough, but use the practice problems to really prepare.  He has a lot of availability and enjoys meeting with students.  Take advantage of that!! He makes it easy to learn and class is engaging.  Would take him again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's a super nice guy and he does fill in the blank notes so you aren't fighting to scribble in everything he says. He doesn't go very far into detail at all so a lot of what you learn is from reading the textbook doing homework. He's a tricky grader/ test maker as well, so the tests are super hard to ace. But lecture-wise probs the best chem prof.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: I had a 4.3 in highschool, went to a college prep school and received a C in his class. By far the hardest material was taught at a very sub par level.

By far the worst professor I've encountered at Pepperdine. His lectures are incredibly confusing. He does not go into detail and expects you to understand things he has not taught. He is sarcastic and does not answer questions in a straight-forward fashion. Extremely difficult to understand. Talks in circles.
He is so funny and such an amazing professor.  He teaches in a humble way and you can tell that he not only loves chemistry, but he loves teaching too.

BEST PROFESSOR AT PEPPERDINE. I really struggled in chem honors in high school and now I'm getting an A in this class. I really recommend him. GO TO OFFICE HOURS. He will not stop until you understand it! Love him! Looking forward to taking more of his classes!

Love him!  His lectures don't go too far into detail, but if you read the book and go into office hours, it will help.  Also, do the practice problems he sends out before tests!  They help you so much!

Good teacher but stays pretty basic during lecture so a good background is recommended. A's are easy if you understand the material already but prepared to get a tutor and do a lot of reading if you don't. If you passed the AP chem test you'll  be fine.
Without a doubt the worst professor in the Chemistry department. Dr. Green and Dr. Ganske are wonderful. I recommend them whole heartedly, but Dr. Fritsch is a poor teacher.

I loved him.  His class is challenging and his tests are hard but I learned so much!  He definitely prepared me well for chem 121.  Its a lot of work and you can't slack but he's really nice and you should put in the effort to get to know him. But do be prepared for a few trick questions and your grade to be low, even with effort.

Fritsh is a fair gchem professor. he posts old exams which are very similar to the tests you will take. he can be a little sarcastic and goofy but usually this doesn't detract from class. overall, he is a good prof but avoid him if you have a more basic background in chemistry.

Terrible Professor. Especially if you have a poor background in Chemistry.  You have to read the book, please get a tutor,  and his lectures are interesting, but useless for his tests.  Please take another professor.  Ganske was great in the laboratory!

This was a very tough class to follow coming from a poor high school chem background. Fritsch lacks good explanation. His lectures are everywhere but the lesson planned. You definitely have to read the chapters to not be lost and teach yourself to get at least a C.

Aloof. Not very helpful in lab. Jokes about students to TAs. Made math mistakes in class. One question on his test was unsolvable, only gave partial credit back to students. Inexcusable. I wouldn't take chemistry from him again.

Overall great instructor. I had him for both 120 and 121 and I learned a ton of information. The class is very interesting and there are weekly quizzes. Dr. Fritsch is very fair, if you feel like you deserve some points talk to him about it. He has a good personality and is easy to approach. Highly recommend him.

Dr. Fritsch is the best professor I've had at pepperdine. He is really good at explaining things and is very helpful. He makes lectures interesting and assigns a reasonable amount of homework that he partially goes over in class. Other comments are wrong, I never read and was fine. Take his class. Great guy. Funny. Friendly. Very kind. Intelligent.

Dr. Fritsch was slightly disappointing in my opinion. He definitely knows his stuff when it comes to chemistry, but is unhelpful out of class and holds his opinions higher than anything else that is offered to him. You definitely have to study the book to do well on his tests. He is good if you like cheesy humor and airy attitude.
I don't really like his personality but he is the easiest of the Chem 120 teachers.  Still a difficult class but do the homework and go to office hours and you'll get by.
great guy.  hillarious.  highly recommend his lab.

be ready to come in during his office hours or get a tutor. he does not teach the math portion of chem well. and all his tests are similar to the hours of HW and not to his lectures. gives weekly quizzes on thursdays when there is no test

Dr. Fritsch is an amazing teacher. He is very clear and only assigns hw about once every 2 weeks. He is always willing to help students in his office or just chat with them. I would highly recommend him. He has four exams and a cumulative final which combined count for most of your grade.
He is a very nice guy, and a good teacher. Need to work hard for the A but it is definately possible if you show him you want it...great guy!

This class was extremely difficult to follow due to the professor's disorganized teaching style.

While there may have been some interesting material, the poor execution of the course made it hard to learn anything meaningful. I would not recommend this professor to anyone looking for a clear and engaging educational experience.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Talbert, was a wonderful professor who expects everyone to participate in the class and read the material prior to each class. He is very friendly and wants the best for his students. Although he expects you to be prepared and his exams can be difficult, there are plenty of opportunities to prepare through office hours and reviewing notes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Talbert is a very nice person, but if you are not a religious person, you may find the class very difficult to understand. His lectures are not substantially useful for midterms and finals, but you can try to read the textbook and remember to memorize the vocabulary terms and understand the questions at the end of each chapter.

I liked Dr. Talbert, but I did not find much biblical relevance in his class. The midterm was difficult, but one can enhance their grade through discussion posts, attendance/PARTICIPATION, the final project/exam. He is very approachable, but I recommend that one asks him questions in-person.

Not a great professor, kinda teaches? Says the class is the study guide which doesn't really help. Take another professor if you can, but you'll be fine if you take him. HE DOESN'T RESPOND TO MESSAGES QUICKLY. READ READ READ, there's a weird group project at the end of the semester, and still has a final. He seems nice but comes off as annoyed.

Prof. Talbert is a cool and nice guy, but he is just simply not good at teaching. The course goes way too far in depth and I didn't feel like I learned much of relevance about the Old Testament at all. He claims that "the class is the study guide", but most of what is taught in class is discussion-based, and not what was actually on the test.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Do Not take Talbert. He obviously has no idea how to teach and the content is way too confusing to take for a GE. He does not give study guides and his tests are not what you prepared for. His classes are boring and he constantly looks like he wants to leave the class more than we do.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: He tries to be a good professor and has some good perspectives, but in comparison to the other REL101 classes, he is wayyyy too difficult of a professor to deal with for a GE class. Test content was unfamiliar to lectures and there are NEVER STUDY GUIDES as they don't "adhere to his teaching style".
He's a nice person, but avoid his Religion 101.

Professor Talbert is friendly. However, this class needs to be avoided. First, nothing makes any sense. He provides NO study guide for tests, and regardless of the number of notes you take during class, it won't help you on the exams. The material makes no sense, and the tests are unnecessarily complicated. AVOID. Far too difficult for a GE course.

does not provide clear lectures or notes, tests include vocab without providing a clear vocab list of any sort, expects one to be able to quote scripture regardless of previous knowledge of the bible, participation heavy to the extent of discomfort (this is coming from someone happy to participate in a class), does not respond to messages
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: AVOID. Professor Talbert does not know what he is doing, which unfortunately will affect your grade in what should be an easy A. No lectures, NO STUDY GUIDES, knowledge is based on weekly, dense readings (which cover tens of thousands of years of Israelite History), unclear instructions, the list goes on. TAKE ANOTHER PROF!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Professor Talbert is a nice guy. However, I wouldn't say I liked his class. His lectures were unorganized and made no sense. He did not give clear instructions about the midterm and final. He said this class itself was the study guide, and half of my classmates had 40+ notes for the study guide. I hope he improves this year.
The class was so unclear and never knew what was going on.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Couldn't tell you what his teaching style is... It's nonexistent, that's what
Not a good experience at all. No one I know did well in this dreaded class. Boring, frustrating, and poorly structured.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Professor Talbert is a great guy but not a good professor. He does not lecture AT ALL, and so you have to teach yourself the material by reading the book. The worst part is that he does not tell you what you need to know for the midterm and the final. He just provides no guidance whatsoever. I would take a different professor for religion.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: I want to start off by stating that Doctor Talbert is a nice man. His personality is not the problem, and I respect him as a person. The issue for me is that his class is extremely hard to follow. The midterm went horribly for me because I had no clue what I even needed to know. It is challenging to identify what is important in this class.

You are 100% given a fair shot at doing very well in this class if you just do that work and show up to class. People complained about his tests being hard but just read the textbook and you are fine. I put a max 6/10 effort into this class compared to all of my others for the semester and got an A. It is not just an easy A for a GE, but its fine.

Prof Talbert is a nice guy. I'm not a fan of excessive group work, so this class wasn't my favorite. Participation is heavily emphasized, which I thought was a bit much for an introductory religion course. He gives very little guidance for tests, saying "the class itself is your study guide." My review for his final was 40 pages long, no joke.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Talbert is a nice guy but I've learned nothing from him. I've taught myself everything through the readings because the lectures are boring and he gives busy-work assignments in class. There's only one quiz, a midterm, a group project at the end of the semester and a final. It's not a hard class, but you might as well take the Elkins one instead.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: What a gem. Truly one of the nicest guys at Pepperdine, and he is just a stellar professor. Lectures are tough and sometimes tiring, but he definitely wants to see you succeed. Love him

The worst professor I have ever seen at Pepperdine, even my whole life. NEVER RESPOND TO EMAIL. The course is extremely hard and boring, with readings beyond imagination. Definitely a mistake to take this class and won't recommend it to anyone but to the people I truly hate.

I loved studying with Prof Talbert. He was a great guy and his perspective on Christianity completely changed (and revitalized) my faith. I've been inspired to become an SLA because of him. Doesn't respond quickly to emails and lectures can be boring. But class discussions and texts are so so important. Would def recommend for REL 301.

LOVE PROF TALBERT. I took him for 101 and 301, and definitely recc. 301 because it is just great material. He is not an simple info/cram study GE so if that's your style don't take him. If you are interested in theology/religion he has a lot of great insight and is nice and relatable!! He is into group projects though :/

I love Professor Talbert! The classes can be a bit boring but it's an overall easy course. He loves engagement and the final group project is easy if you put effort in and get creative. He's a caring guy and the work load isn't crazy. You can get by skipping some reading as long as you're present in class. He takes time to let everyone speak

The class is manageable and you'll do fine if you do the work. It's just really boring. He cares about his students and wants them to engage, but he doesn't make the material very exciting. He's a super nice guy though! There's a midterm, final, forum posts, and one group project. Not too bad.

Honestly, Professor Talbert tries his best and is very sweet but his lectures are boring. He also doesn't answer emails. If you can get past that, his class is very easy but is mostly a self-study. Participation matters, there are weekly forum posts (easy), a group project, and 2 exams (weirdly easy). Be prepared to read. It's what you make of it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof Talbert is a nice guy, but not a great teacher. He doesn't keep students engaged in class, his lectures are fairly boring, and he doesn't answer emails. If you show up and do the work, you'll be fine. The only graded items were a group project, midterm, final, and participation and forum posts. The tests are easy, but high pressure.

Talbert is wonderful! He is very caring about his students, and gives a reasonable amount of work. You are graded by a midterm, final, group project, participation, and weekly forum posts, but all of them are manageable and easy to do. He is very understanding, passionate, and has a chill sense of humor. Seriously, take him, you won't regret it!

Professor Talbert is a G. His class is doable if you either do the readings or have a good amount of biblical knowledge going in, so if you have neither of those I would look somewhere else. But definitely more interesting/thought-provoking than many of my friends profs for the same class. Pretty cool and will help outside of class if you need.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: People either love him or hate him. Personally, I loved him. his tests and quizzes are extremely straight forward. He basically tells you what to study for the quizzes. Honestly, I don't know why people complain about his quizzes because f you just study you'll do fine.

Professor Talbert is very kind and definitely cares for his students. His class was very relatable and interesting, great for a REL301 class. Very straight forward assignments and exams. Would recommend for everyone as long as you are okay with reading every week.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I would not recommend his class if you want a decent grade. Dr. Talbert is a nice person but not a really qualified professor since he just got his doctoral degree. I do not know how to study for the quiz and his final did not make sense.
New teacher and very evidently does not know what he is doing. I would advise another prof for religion.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Talbert is an amazing professor and very knowledgeable. He cares about his students and is also very funny and relatable which makes the class great. His teaching style is straight to the point and he gives you a study guide as to what to expect on the quizzes, mid terms and exams. I would definitely recommend taking him he is a really nice guy
He's very nice and tries very hard to engage the class. I think he's probably the easiest REL101 teacher because his quizzes are so similar to his study guides.

For his first year of teaching, I think he is doing pretty well. His class is extremely doable because every single quiz/test is straight from the study guide so you basically know everything on the test. You can tell he really cares about his students and is really passionate about teaching. Plus he's super nice and genuine.

I really enjoyed Professor Talbert's class because he tries to connect Old Testament themes to the modern day. His sense of humor is pretty dry but it got a some laughs out of me. It is obvious he is very passionate about his subject and wants his students to do well. Also his tests and quizzes are very predictable and fair.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Stanley Talbert is a great caring teacher. He is a straightforward grader often taking questions right out of the book or class to put on tests. He is highly knowledgeable about modern biblical scholarship and presents the material well. He does not teach with a Sunday school approach but rather in an in depth academic way that engages and grows u.

He would be great if his lectures would actually teach us and if he would follow the reading he assigns. He teaches three weeks behind what we read and then gives us questions that no one can answer. I wouldn't recommend him although he is a nice guy. Isn't very invested in his students like other professors are.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a super kind guy and it's his first year teaching, I think, but he isn't qualified enough yet. His lectures don't match up with the readings, and halfway through the course he told us that his lectures were three weeks behind our reading but we had no idea. Is a weird grader and does not seem well informed, teaches weird theology. Don't take.

Minister, Teacher @ Oaks Christian and visiting professor at Pepperdine... C'MON... How on earth would it be OK for someone to have that much experience/ knowledge in life to not "realize" what he was doing is wrong!!!!!

Something that people should be aware Prof Fike was arrested recently. California minister & former teacher Barry Fike, 67, began an online conversation sexual in nature with a person who he believed was a 15yo girl, according Ventura DAs Office. Fike sent explicit photos to the teen and made arrangements to meet for sex. He is awaiting trial.

Four major speeches, makes you put the work in for the grade, but explains your grade and is super helpful. Gives you exactly what you need for the midterm and final. Offers some extra credit along with three group projects that are easy to boost your grade.

I really liked Fike, but this was a difficult class. I'm a seasoned public speaker and received extremely high scores on my speeches, but it was the unreal amount of essays and written assignments that tanked my grade. There's a chapter quiz at the start of every class, and he grades very harshly, though he gives feedback. There are easier profs.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Professor Fike is a professor that plays a lot of favorites. He also tends to grade women or female-presenting people much harsher, telling them to "smile more" and other statements riddled with thinly-veiled sexism. What he praises men for, he criticizes women for. He also says and shows slightly racist material. He is welcoming at first, though.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Prof Fike is one of the best teachers I have ever had and I have had a lot of great teachers. He made one of the worst classes to take truly enjoyable and always worked hard to make sure each of his students was engaged and learning from the material!

I love Professor Fike! His ratings on here truly doesnt do him justice. He wants to help his students with public speaking and is always willing to meet and help you individually. Public speaking isnt the most enjoyable but Professor Fike does a great job with the class.

fike is an okay professor. a 95 is a solid A but an A- is achievable. most people I know in the class have a B/B-. he criticizes your speech in front of the whole class after you deliver it and grades tough. it passes the threshold of being helpful to being rude.

The Rundown: There's 4 speeches and 2 exams. First speech he goes easy on you, second speech a little tougher, but the 3rd speech needs to be GOOD. It's the most points. By the 4th speech you'll know the routine. Practice your speeches and make sure you participate in class (big points). Barry may seem intimidating first, but he's a big softie.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: 2+ absences automatically drops your final average by a letter grade. Daily quizzes (celebrations) have word bank & at home 2nd chance. Study guides, free textbook. 4 speeches, he's a tough grader but you'll understand why after Speech 1. He brings sunflower seeds to class & cares ab students. Everyone loves Fike, grandfather of the CCB!

Fike really cares about students and wants them to be the best public speakers they can be. However, he does have a lot of quizzes, reading, papers, and other random assignments. Tests are memorization heavy, but not impossible. Participate and he'll like you and be nicer about grades, trust me.
Best Prof at Pepp. Highly recommended.

Fike is amazing! Lectures, powerpoints, quizzes, and speeches makeup his entire course, but I have learned so much in his class. He is a constructive criticizer, which helps you improve. Group speeches either boost or lower your grade. Midterm/final is based entirely from his study guides. You'll work a lot, but it's worth it. Please take his class
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Fike is funny and really wants you to learn over making the class difficult (which is a rare find here at Pepp!). He posts all quizzes online for retakes and is thorough with everything. If you need something, he is prompt and willing to help. All tests are straight from his lectures.

His class was one of the most demanding I have ever taken. I worked my butt off the entire semester, and my grade matched my efforts. That being said, his class prepares your for upper division courses. You can tell that B. Fike cares about each student. The class is funny, and it taught me a lot. It made me a better speech writer and presenter.
Barry Fike is the best there is.

Barry Fike is a great human being, you can tell he absolutely adores his class and teaching. He makes every student feel special, and creates a comfortable environment unlike any other class I've experienced before. The hardest part about his class would be his participation credit and his long written exams, which he grades very hard.

By far the hardest COM180 professor.... expect to do a ton of homework for a GE class. He is a very cool person and helps you get a lot better at public speaking and makes the class as enjoyable as it could be, but don't expect an easy A... or B... be prepared for daily quizzes, four speeches, two exams, and 3 long essays.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He is such a good person. His sense of humor is awesome and his laugh is contagious. He is a very smart person and he is gifted with words, he speaks in a clear and concise way. His material is not hard and easy to follow

I love Dr. Fike so much!!! He is so funny and he always makes my day. He is one of the nicest professors in Pepperdine. It does take some efforts to get an A in this class, since the scale of an A is from 95-100.

Show up to class. He is SO FUNNY and you can eat in class. No one likes public speaking, but this class was easy to get through. He helps you all the way through and is a more than fair grader. He gives you handouts on how he grades you, so you know clearly what is going on. The class was CLEARLY laid out and organized. basicallyNO HW

This Com class isn't the easiest but I felt like I learned a lot from it and became a much better public speaker. He is very specific on what he wants for speeches and the tests so as long as you do what he asks for an A should be no problem. The class has a lot of opportunities to get credit so there is less pressure on tests.
Easiest com 180 professor

He a great speech professor. He is a very funny and nice person. He cares a lot about his students. He made us do speech evaluations, which other com180 classes didn't do; however, they are not too hard to write.

Barry is the best, I really liked him. If you have time talk to him after class, his class was great and helped me a lot with public speaking. He makes you work with the weekly quizzes but will help you get the grade you want. Really nice man and just want to help you learn and pass! His class was a lot of fun- He had a guest speaker that was great

I adore Prof Fike. Take the time to get to know him. A super genuine and caring prof. You won't find a huge number of these no matter the school you're at. I was TERRIFIED to take it with him because of all the Rate My Professor comments. Don't listen to them. He's hard-ish but super doable. And i actually use what i learn in his class in life.

Barry Fike is probably the toughest com 180 proff. but he was extremely patient and helpful when teaching you.  You will probably be worked much harder than the other classes but if you just put in the effort, you should have a good grade.  I enjoyed this class despite it being fairly tedious.

Do you want a relatively easy A in a GE class? Great! As a straight-A student, I did too.  But do you want to do several extra, unnecessary assignments that other COM180 sections aren't required to do?   Oh, and do you want consistent grades for your extra work (my grades: 92, 74, 37, 86, 55)?  Yeah, that's what I thought.

Professor Fike is very passionate about his class and as far as making his students better speakers, he was successful. However, he assigned an absurd amount of work this year due to his experiment with 'gamification' which made the class unfairly demanding in comparison to other COM180 sections. Take him if you truly want to get better at speaking

Really makes you work for the A, however, he is just an awesome professor. You can tell he really cares about his students and takes their criticism pretty seriously. If you want to learn how to communicate effectively, take his class, but if you want an easy A, he's not the answer.

The fikeanator is literally awesome however you have to work SO hard to get an A or even a B. He is definitely the hardest com 180 professor. He's super cool though and I've learned so much (if you're into that)
A great guy. Really funny, genuinely awesome, and pretty wise. However, you will work your butt off to get anything other than a C. So have fun with that. Ya.
The mid-term was a little unnecessarily difficult compared to the rest of the class, the quizzes, and the lectures.

The best com180 teacher! Does fun group activities in class so it's not so boring. Not afraid to speak his mind about the readings if he thinks it's wrong. Pretty much let's you choose whatever topic you want to do your speech on, unlike other professors!

Great professor. Not the absolute easiest route, but you really will look forward to his class. He has a great sense of humor and takes time out of his life to help you. I wished he was slightly more informative about our quizzes, but I loved my Speech class with him.

One of the more easy going and genuine teachers at Pepperdine. Has a very knowledgeable base for the subject matter and I always looked forward to going to his class. I would have a beer with him if this campus wasn't dry.
Fike made that terribly scary speech class fun! He really takes time going over stuff and his tests and expectations are very fair. Really good teacher :)

Professor Fike is the best teacher I have had at Pepperdine. Speaking is a class that many people dread but Fike makes his classes very interesting with bringing in guest speakers. He is a very reasonable grader. Practice your speeches and you will do well in his class.

Professor File is amazing! Before entering his class I had a huge about public speaking. However by the time I left I felt more comfortable. He is a very reasonable grade, unlike the other public speaking professors. MUST TAKE HIM!!!

He is a great teacher, really cares about students learning. Public Speaking is definitely not a class I wanted to take but still learned a lot and improved. He grades really fairly, brings in guest speakers, trys his best to make this boring subject interesting! Since this is a GE and you have to take it choose Fike he's awesome!

One word sums up Barry Fike: awesome. He legitimately cares about his students and wants them to succeed. If you are interested in becoming a more confident speaker and are willing to work for it, take Fike! I feel I improved greatly as a public speaker from Mr. Fike's instruction. Also a very decent human being with strong values.

Very accessible outside of class. super willing to talk to students and give good advice. Although the first two tests were unexpectedly hard and the research project was challenging as well, you will actually improve academically and understand Math so much better after taking her class. She really has a huge passion for Math and science.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Loved class with her. She is very passionate about math and it makes the class an amazing place to be! Material is tricky and has a decent amount of homework, but it makes you prepared for the exam. There is a lot of group work, but she helps guide teams through it by scheduling required meetings

I love Dr. Davis, she is one of the most caring professors ever. She's passionate about math and it shows. Her enthusiasm made me excited for class. Calc II is a hard class in general, but I wouldn't have wanted to learn it from anyone else. Keep up with homework, I'd recommend doing it as soon as you learn it. I'd go to her for anything!

Professor Davis was great for Calc II. She cares a lot about math and you can tell in how she lectures which makes it more fun in class. Calc II is a difficult class and I felt lost most of the time but her lectures and the fact that she is available for office hours helped me end with an A-.

Very wasteful of class time and the homework takes 3-4 hours on average to complete. Don't take especially if you are not naturally gifted at math. She does not prepare you for her difficult exams at all and her review days are spent on two problems that aren't on the test. Please take a different professor!

her class is actually HARD. I don't like her teaching methods, but I highly encourage you to go to her office hours and trust that will help out a lot-plus she'll like you. She's the best professor out of all the options for this class. It's not impossible to get an A in the class. I had an A all semester just bombed the final lol.

Course is demanding, not her. There is a lot to learn throughout the semester, but she teaches it in a great, organized manner. Very nice and available outside of class and responds to emails quickly, even responds on the weekends. Decent and frequent amount of homework. We were allowed our own cheat sheet for each test and there is E.C. on each.

Professor Davis is a great person! She is very open and carrying. However her teaching style is horrible.She doesn't explain the material well. She puts you in a group every class where you need to figure out the material on your own. I love math, and however this class was tough. GET READY TO LEARN ON YOUR OWN, AND BE CONFUSED ALL THE TIME!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Pros: Probably the most caring professor in the university, and so readily available to help students. She's also pretty willing to point out when you're learning something that actually comes up in like professional settings as opposed to just some math theory. Cons: Heavy homework, and her tests aren't super easy but there's usually extra credit
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Great teacher. Really cares. Hard material for someone who doesn't like math, but since I like math, I loved it!

Dr. Davis is amazing! She really wants everyone to learn and appreciate math. She is considerate and available outside of class and office hours to go over tests or talk about what's going on in your life. You have to put in work to do well in the class, but it's not really difficult if you go to class and do the homework!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Take Dr. Davis for MATH316! She was so caring & considerate of her students during this tough time & made sure to record all the lectures & post written notes after class. The homework was pretty hefty so I'd do it after each lecture rather than the day before it's due. Graded on a project, 3 exams, a cumulative final, homework, and participation.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: really a good teacher, and I'm sad that so many people downvote her. She cares a lot and works harder than most professors to really take care of students. Her tests are not the easiest, but apparently that's all anyone cares about when they rate a math professor for a GE math class. Says a lot about the trashy students Pepperdine is letting in

this is a really solid department, there are no bad choices except Dr. Thoren tbh. Dr. Davis is one of the most caring people I've ever known, and she goes above and beyond to make sure you understand things. super accessible, super helpful. she does assign a lot of homework, but let's be real, most of us use Chegg anyway, so what difference is it

Her class is no easy A, but that doesn't mean she is an awful teacher. She teaches 100-400 level classes and she's fantastic at all.
