It is so easy to see how much she cares and how willing she is to help. If you can't learn whatever 100 level math from her... it's just simply not her fault. Math is hard. It's going to hard with any professor.

Such an amazing professor I genuinely love her as a person and a professor. Her lectures are where the test material comes from so if you attend lectures, pay attention, and do the homework problems you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a really nice person, but her class is very difficult. She is very unorganized and does lectures quickly. You won't pass if you don't go to her office hours or hire a tutor. She doesn't consider that her students have other priorities to tend to rather than two plus hours of homework almost every night. Please take another teacher, trust me
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Would highly recommend taking BioStats with Dr. Davis. She is a great professor who is very reasonable with her grading. Her class does require work but is very manageable. She is super understanding and is very passionate about her work. I have never found math interesting until I took this class with her.
highly recommend avoiding this professor. No extra credit offered, lots of group work, hard tests, bad teaching!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: One of the worst lecturers I've ever had at Pepperdine. She makes the class teach each other and forces group work instead of teaching. Do not take her unless you want to teach yourself calculus .

Some people rate her low because the class is hard, but that's not her fault. She teaches well, and she is the most kind, caring professor I've had here. The homework assignments are long, it's annoying, I'm not going to lie. But guys she really will help you if you're not getting an A on your own. You will not regret taking her class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Davis' class is not one that you can wing. The material is heavy and there's lots of homework, so missing class would leave you falling behind. However, she's very understanding and willing to make up tests if you are sick. She was very thorough in her teaching and was always there to help at office hours. One of my favorite professors!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's a good teacher. Very smart.

I had to take this professor for Calculus 2 (Math 151). She assigned lots of homework, but threatened us with academic integrity violations is we so much as used a CAS calculator on homework.  My class started with 35ish people - a full room. 10 of us sat for the final, and not all passed. I'm not excited for having Math 316 with her next term.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Gives lots of homework, cannot teach in class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Don't take this professor!!  I love math I have always been a 4.0 in math.  I had heard never to miss her class so I attended every class. The main way I learned to course was through the textbook and thank God for my tutor. I had to spend so much time outside of the classroom learning Calc my sport suffered  as a result.

Extremely difficult but she will make sure you understand concepts if you make use of her office hours and ask for help. Homework is difficult and will take a while. Not information that you can learn for the test and then forget, but she makes sure you genuinely know how the math works. Feel very confident in my calculus after taking this class.

She uses packets to teach and does not teach through her own understanding. She makes people go into small groups and do questions without us knowing the basic method/understanding. She gives LOTS of homeworks, which is probably how she expect students to learn from. She often leave students confused after asking questions.
Professor Davis is the best math professor I have ever had. Her enthusiasm and passion for math is contagious. She is very helpful so it is important to make use of her Office Hours.

Contrary to what most of these reviews say, she is a great professor, and a genius.  The only way you do bad is if you don't make the effort to go to her office hours and try in class. Do the textbook reviews before tests.  Follow lectures, pick good people to work with, and do the homework for easy points.
does not teach basic calculus well
Worst teacher ever! About 50% of her students have dropped out and half of the remaining are all failing. Pepperdine has to open up a new class just for everyone to retake it.

NEVER take this class w/her She gives an absurd amount of hw that is GRADED. So even if its your first time trying the problems and you cant figure it- it will harm your grade. She tells everyone to get in groups and 'figure it out' rather than teaching you the material first then saying figure it out later.  You will teach yourself in this class.

Gone in for help and would usually leave me hanging at times. Her classes have left me with way too many questions and having to teach myself out of the textbook. Her stubbornness to keep us working in groups is not good at all especially when the entire class is having questions, forcing her to run everywhere, leaving students waiting for help.
Worst teacher I have ever taken, most of the people in her classes are failing after the first two tests.
Homework is easy but she makes her tests pretty hard

Dr Davis is a fabulous professor. every time she introduces new concept and theory, she manages to explains them clearly with examples. i learnt a lot from her class. i appreciate she moves so fast in class, but not idles around and waste time. her tests are basically homework problems, do her homework and you will be good in final.

She moves so fast through the class and makes mistakes almost once a lecture that are fundamental for your understanding. Tests are impossible. Did hours of homework and paid good money for a tutor that couldn't even help me understand what she was trying to teach. I had friends who changed their major because of her. Avoid at all costs

If I learned anything from this class, it was from the textbook and my tutor, not her. She makes so many mistakes in class and my notes were useless. Her lectures are so confusing and really aren't helpful for tests.

Dr. Davis moves extremely fast in class and gives fairly hard tests, however she is extremely helpful in her office hours. It is clear she wants her students to succeed. You just have to take the initiative to go to her office hours when you don't understand the class material and she will help you until you understand it.

Courtney is extremely enthusiastic and gets very excited about math, which is great. She is so nice and always willing to help. She makes a lot of mistakes in her lectures though, and I know a lot of people in the class who didn't think she was great. I thought she was fine, you just have to make sure that you do and understand all the homework.

His TAs are tough graders, not him. So discussion posts required a lot of reading and effort. As long as you have a good group, and stay on top of your responses you should be good. He doesn't do exams, so there is definitely a trade-off you get with him. It's not easy, but you don't need to show up to class to get an A.
Dude is a character. Definitely worth going to listen to this man cook. He doesn't have any tests or quizzes, only papers and discussions.

Loved Prof Schultz's Hum 212 class. Lectures were always thought provoking and he makes the class so much fun. He has a great sense of humor and is one of my favorite professors on campus. Lots of people complain about the TAs grading of our discussion responses, but if you follow the rubric and cite three sources, you have a guaranteed A-/A :)

Never went to class because the classes are not related to the assignments. No tests or quizzes, just discussion questions and answers, 4 one page responses, and a final essay. The TA are brutal graders so what should be an easy A is not...

I've taken Great Books 2-3 with Schultz and he is the wittiest and funniest professor at Pepp. Discussions are always so interesting, and he gives a great amount of creative freedom for essays (3/semester). Compared to other great books profs. there is less reading, and he grades easily on papers if you put in the effort. TAKE HIM, he is THE BEST!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Hilarious

comment: Schultz is so interesting, funny, creative, and he makes the material super relevant for our contemporary world. His HUM212 class is not much work. There's just a research essay, weekly comments on the reading questions, some group work, and 4 Beethoven assignments. There are no tests. Do the assignments and you get an A. Schultz is a gem!

Witty, sardonic, and engaging. Jeff introduces the Great Books sequence in an accessible, entertaining manner and asks tough questions in a way that allows students to gradually approach what would otherwise be daunting philosophical concepts.

LOVE! He's one of the best profs at Pepperdine and it's so easy to get an A, all you do is a forum post once a week and that's it. No quizzes, tests, or essays. TAKE THIS CLASS. Attendance is not mandatory, I haven't been in 6 weeks.

Schultz' class was amazing! I learned so much and never even took an exam in his class. We're graded on forum posts/reflections each week and a final paper tying in what we learned from lecture to modern day. His lectures are really entertaining and hilarious. I learned so much without even realizing it!!

(For hum) Such a good professor. Pepperdine would not be Pepperdine without him. He encourages you to think beyond just the facts of history and gives you the tools to realize how historical events have shaped the world and how we experience it today. Take him if you want to grow as a person and intellectually.

I HIGHLY recommend taking a class taught by Professor Schultz. There is reading, but it is an understandable workload considering it is an English class. He engages the class with unfiltered truth, humor, and thought-provoking discussions. Trust me, he will add to your Pepperdine experience.

Jeff is a no bs guy. His classes contain no busy work. He likes to have discussions, and he brings unhindered truth. No class will be as philosophically thought provoking as a poetry class with Jeff. He's also a pretty forgiving grader, which is saying something bc he doesn't ask for all that much to begin with. 11/10 must take Jeff

He is by far the best teacher I have ever had and likely ever will have. Great at explaining philosophers and guiding meaningful conversation. Every class with him was interesting and unique. He is an oddball for sure but he is a gift.

I love Prof Schultz with my entire soul. I don't even like english, but I love him and he reignited my love to write. He talks about social issues and engages the class with unfiltered truth and humor. You will never have to write anything that you don't want to write about. He is SO encouraging, witty, incredible, and everything good in between.

Caring, passionate, brilliant, a man who will neither sacrifice the truth nor compromise in the face of terrible things. He truly wants to educate you as well as you need to be educated, so don't expect him to make thinking and writing seem like simply tasks. Loved dearly by all of his young poets and students.

Jeff is hands-down the best professor I've had at Pepperdine. As it is for any great books class--the reading is quite intensive. However, his essays don't have that usual rubric where you have to be extremely specific. He truly gives you room to explore concepts that you find fascinating. Don't leave Pepperdine without taking one of his classes!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Jeffrey Schultz is one of the hidden gems at Pepperdine. He does not care about the trivial things; rather, he focuses on sincere discussions and quality of work. Jeff cares so much about his students and his passion for creative writing and thinking is evident in all that he does. Please take his class- you will NOT regret it (I can promise that).
Honestly... please just take his class and have your life changed completely. Please.

This is only my third week being in Jeff's creative writing class. As an avid reader and writer, the inspirations he has given me are like nothing before. He fills me with the wonder of new ideas and thoughts of meaning every time I sit in his classroom. It is truly amazing. He jokes around, but respects his students and gives wonderful feedback.

Take him, you won't regret it. Not very demanding in terms of actual work produced. Don't sweat it. And he's super awesome. If you're taking 101 for your GE, it's definitely one you can sneak in with a heavier course load that semester. Just get it done. Schultz is kinda the man when it comes to feedback and interesting lectures.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Amazing professor! He introduces new perspectives about everything which makes one really have to think. Highly recommend taking his class!
soooo nice

While you do actually have to go to this class in order to succeed, you won't dread going. Dr. Schultz is one of the best professors I've ever had and he's super engaging and hilarious! There's never a dull moment in that class. And he gives amazing feedback on your essays, just go to the conferences and fix what he tells you to and you'll get an A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Amazing teacher with great social and political insight. He challenges you to think, but he also makes his classroom an environment that you feel comfortable to participate in. He is a phenomenal teacher and one of the best professors at Pepperdine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: P. Schultz is one of the most unique professors here in Pepperdine. He has a great sense of humour and has an amazing insight in a lot of things we discuss in class. One of the downsides of his class was that we had many readings, but the only actual work submitted in class is 4 essays. The fourth essay a revision of the 3rd essay. Take him!

Professor Schultz was undoubtedly one of the best educators I've ever had the privilege of learning from. He challenges you to actually think (woah!) and research about the world. You will learn to develop your own substantive and rhetorically articulate claims, which you will use as backbones for writing the strongest essays of your life.

Excellent professor. Professor Schultz is extremely intelligent in so many ways. I enjoyed that he brought up relevant political issues. He is always there to help you with your essays and never fails to make you laugh. If you try hard and take time in this class, you'll succeed. I wish I could take it again. He's an old soul with a modern mind.

350 characters isn't enough to describe even half of the reasons that make this teacher so amazing. Honestly, I've never had a teacher like Professor Schultz before and I probably never will again. He's that special gem hiding beneath the layers of faculty staff at Pepperdine, and if you're lucky enough to get a class with him, bless your heart.
He is a genius.  Take intro to creative writing if you can. It's one of the best classes at Pepperdine.

Best GE teacher I've taken while at Pepperdine. He cares about his students, knows how to make them laugh, understands you have a life, and there are no tests! As long as you show him respect and turn in assignments, you will pass this class. I highly recommend Schultz!

Schultz is absolutely one of the most intelligent people at Pepperdine. No matter how awful of writer you are, if you take his class seriously, you will learn so much. Pepperdine is lucky to have him, and better realize that really soon.
Wonderful!

An incredible guy who will help improve your writing dramatically. You will have to write a lot, but you can write about whatever interests you, and he encourages the controversial. He has a wonderful, sarcastic sense of humor and makes discussion fun. He is understanding with grades and deadlines. He just appreciates effort. And he is gorgeous!
Schultz has the ability to change your life perspective. He is the undercurrent at Pepperdine: intellectual, analytical, critical, and hopeful. He is the gem of the school.
THIS MAN IS AN INTELLECTUAL BEAST! Take his class! It will change your life!

Great creative writing professor. He know what he's doing and his class is enjoyable. He used workshop to help improve most of your assignments (via peer reviews along with his own comments). The best part is that you don't need any books, just print the required documents (said in syllabus) from courses.
Awesome professor. He's extremely helpful and talks about interesting things. No books needed. Your essay writing gets better.
Great teacher. Has a great sense of humor, talks about interesting things, laid back, but extremely helpful when it comes to your writing skills. He is the shizzle nizzle ma friends!
Schultz is the bomb diggity.

Really enjoyed his class. He gives a lot of help outside of class, and has in-class workshops to work on your essays.  He has a sarcastic humor that makes the class enjoyable. Really helped my writing skills.  Definitely take him.
Greatest professor of all times. Difficult exams but its ok. He is extremely gorgeous and great personality. He is the master!
He is a great lecturer, requires your full attention, hot guy, and funny. nice personality and professional
Good teaching style. Clear and firm. Great looking man, his walk shows confidence and leadership. Can't keep your eyes off of him. Hard exams. I took his class twice. I recommend him.

Extremely difficult exams and quizzes. He expects too much from students. Enforces attendance policy regularly. His tests are torture. I made a B- in his class, it is the first time ever I made less than an A! But he is helpful outside the class and available for office hours.
Made math exciting to attend. I have high regards to this professor, He does not tolerate laziness, extremely prompt and very smart. He is a walking brain!
Z was an incredibel professor. He is the best in all: Teaching, looks, Personality, attitude, .. He was my world!

It has been two years since I took a class with Dr. Z Issac. I have to say that he taught me a lot and it all coming useful now. He is by far the most inteligent human being there is. Young, great looking and smart! Wow ... I miss him!

Z is hilarious! He made me laugh every class and I miss him a ton. Although I had already taken calculus in high school before taking his class, so I really didn't need to pay attention and/or come. I found the class very easy. I wish he was still around for Math 215! I hope he has fun in Vanderbilt. "No no no, look at me, look at me".

Z is amazing! I love being in his class! His lectures are clear and easy to follow even if the math is hard. Gives quizzes regularly and tests are hard. do the homework, study and show up to class and you'll get a good grade. Z is hilarious! One of my favorite professors of all time and i hate math!
Do the homework and understand the material after each class.

Z is a strict teacher, he keeps standards. He appreciates hardworking students, it is not an easy A, but you learn alot, wonderful personality. I wish he is staying at Peppersine. What a loss if he leaves!

His 3yr contract w/ Pepp is ending soon! May not be here nxt yr. Is rather intense/intimidating at first, but it ends up being funny. Rather strong Syrian accent. Didn't teach Excel very well, but is a good teacher when it comes to calculus. Don't be afraid to ask Qs. Attendance can up your grade. Regular quizzes. HW lvl reasonable.
I am taking math 212 now with Z. He is Hard, but good, and I feel like I am learning alot of material. He might be the best looking math professor in the universe! I like his professionality.

He is such a demanding teacher but his class is pretty reasonable.  Be prepared to work hard and laugh during class.  He is a brilliant teacher, he knows what he's doing but he's hard to understand sometimes.  Take him if you're ready to learn a lot and be challenged.

Great professor.  Brilliant guy, very fair.  Attendance and being to class on time is imperative but its not that big of deal.  His lessons aren't boring, and he's actually kinda funny if you get his sense of humor.  Nice guy, always willing to give help, and answer questions.  Material can be difficult, so show up and ask questions.
wouldn't take him again

Had Z for Calc 2....freakin' hard, but I studied my *** off and passed with a decent grade.  GO TO OFFICE HOURS!!! And don't miss class.  Quite possibly the best teacher--you really understand the material, but is quite possibly the hardest.

His calc 2 class was so hard!!! I studied a lot so I got a good grade, but I really had to work for it. Z forces you to learn the material, so I feel very prepared for Math 212. I went to his office practically every day and even when it wasn't his scheduled office hour he still helped me. He also came in for a Saturday morning review before finals

Z or Professor Z, should be in Hollywood, he belongs to Hollywood, he looks like that. He does not belong to teaching, he is so d_ difficult! his exams are horrifying, I have nightmares! Do not take this teacher unless you really care about learning math.
Z is the best professor ever, but he is a little on the hard side. He expects you to be in class all the time other than that he is wonderful and nice and smart and good looking!
If you want to learn math, take this class. He is a hard teacher but you learn. If you study and pay attention in class you will probably do well.
If you want an easy grade do not take Z, he is the most difficult teacher there is, but he is good. His tests are killers! But I still like him.
His attendance policy is killing me! But he is (teaching wise) the best teacher ever. very smart and professional

Z is a great teacher.  I failed the initial assessment exam (which he will give the first day) and I got a 97 on the last test.  This is proof that Z is pretty money.  Attendance is a must but it's worth it.
Z is a hard teacher, he is very tough. But if you make it in his class, you really have learned something. He is nice but firm.
I love this teacher, he is nice, professional, strict, smart, and GORGEOUS! Highly recommended
Professor Z is too strict on attendence. But he is very professional and easy to approach. He is a harsh grader but a "c" in his class is better than an "A" whereelse. I learned alot.
he is the best professor i have ever had

I am taking math 215 now with professor Z. Here is the best mathematical formula that describes him. Add the hottest body a man can have + The sexiest accent+ the hottest walk on the planet + the funniest man + the hardest teacher ever and the result is Professor "Zeeeee"

Okay so Professor Z. is one of the coolest professors I have ever had. I went into his class after having a 3-year break from math, and he brought me up to speed in no time. He never once called any of us out of our names, and he always asked if we had questions. I am taking him for Math 210 next semester. I wouldnt want any other professor. Z rox!
nice guy, hot looking, funny,I love his teaching style.
he requires alot of work, but he is great. I love his style of conduct. You really have to know your stuff in order to make it.
Very Hard, knows his stuff. If your lazy he can tell and will call you on it. If you work hard and are intelligent, he recognizes it and rewards it. Do your homework.

Goes by Z, how bad A is that?  At first I hated his guts, but now he's one of my favorite profs.  He's freakishly hard however, but if you study/have the time to study, you'll do fine.  He's an awesome and funny guy.

impossibly hard and taught for math majors. Questions on the test have never been seen in class, and he's not helpful either. When someone doesnt get something, he calls them stupid and says go to the tutor. wish i never took him.
Very Funny

I took this class this summer, he wasn't too bad. If you did fine in Math 214, then this class isn't to bad. Zohair Issac is from Syria, he has the greasiest hair n' probably goes to the gym 3 hours a day.  Hard to understand at times, but has a good sense of humor n' gives extra credit. Knew his stuff, really a good teacher for Math 215 vs. others
Horrible professor.  Always was getting equations wrong.  Constantly had to correct him.  Never in his office for questions.  Didn't really seem like he knew what he was doing.

His class is the most entertaing thing ever! Its not easy though...the final was harder than expected and he likes to keep you on your toes. He is soo freakin buff its ridiculous and he has reeealllly nice arms. ANYWAY, do the homework, pay attention in class,  study hard for daily quizzes and the tests and youll be fine

I was very hesitate to take this class after reading his reviews on rate my professor. While people were correct, this is a demanding class, I am very glad to have taken it with Dr. V. I learned so much. If you take time to memorize all the slides, you will do well on exams. I highly recommend going to tutoring for advice. Beware of lab quizzes.

I originally entered Dr. Vandergon's class thinking he'd be the worst and the hardest professor from what I heard from people. Yet I came to realize he is actually a really amazing professor. There is so much to learn from him and being in this class turned out to be one of my best experiences. Just take good notes and study the review sheets.
This class is difficult but not impossible. The expectations are pretty clear, but there is a LOT to know. Study every day and go to office hours and you'll be fine.

Thinks he's funny. Might as well not go to class he just reads you the slides and then calls you stupid for not being able to connect concepts. A high score on his tests is like a 75%. Stuck in his old ways so don't try to recommend change. Don't take if you have the option.

Difficult professor, but you will learn a lot from his course. His exams are very difficult and require you to apply the information to real-world scenarios. All of the content on the exams is covered in lecture, so attendance in class is key to success. Not very accessible outside of class, and he might ignore your emails.

Worst natural science instructor at Pepperdine!! Avoid at all costs. From day one he makes sure you feel uncomfortable and unwelcome in his class. Super unapproachable to ask questions because he acts scary. Gives vague instructions on assignments and then grades unnecessarily hard. Not an engaging lecturer either.

By far the hardest class I've ever taken strictly because of the amount of content you have to memorize. START STUDYING EARLY. It is impossible to cram the weekend before. 2nd exam is the hardest. Vandergon literally said he likes to see us be tortured by the amount of content. Take a different prof if you can. Quizzes at the end of labs.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Dr. Vandergon's cell bio class in my first semester of freshman year, and 3 years later he's still the best professor I've ever had. Though his lectures are fast-paced, he explains the material very clearly and walks through cellular processes multiple times so you don't need to panic if you don't understand the first time around.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Very tedious lectures, but pay attention because he only uses lecture material for his tests. Anything he has on his slideshows when he teaches is valid to be on his test so you pretty much just have to memorize everything to do well. Looking back at his course I wish I would've just rewritten his slideshows after every class to help memorize.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: By far the most difficult professor I've taken here. But also one of the most rewarding classes. It may seem impossible to succeed, it's difficult, but not impossible. I learned a lot from Dr. Vandergon, definitely more than I would have learned in an easier class. I would definitely take him again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Be prepared to study like you have never studied before. The exams are consistent in format and doesn't include curveball questions, but you have to really know your material to do well. An A is manageable but a TON of work has to be put in since the class itself is hard. Dr. Vandergon is a good teacher overall but he is very fast paced.

Dr. vandergon is a great teacher. his lectures sometimes feel long but important for exams. He always encourages and welcomes students to talk to him for help and makes difficult info easier to understand. Tests are pretty hard so study everyday!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Vandergon is a great professor - he is very clear and will help you until you get it. However, it is a difficult class and he expects a lot out of his students. There is a ton of information and if you don't stay on top of it, you won't do well. Not much homework, hard tests, only a few lab reports, and engaging lectures.

Dr. Vandergon was an extremely good teacher! Getting an A in his class is very do-able. He's labeled "hard" because there is a lot of information -- that's it. There are no curve balls on his tests: what he teaches, he tests on. There is a lot of information, but he does a wonderful job explaining it.

Vandergon will let you know if you are really cut out to be a biology major or not. He starts the first day of class by predicting how many A's will come out of the class and he is almost always correct. Do not be afraid to go to his office hours and talk to him because he is very helpful in those situations. Great teacher, highly recommend.

Abandon ye of little faith.  This man doesn't ***k around.  Any class with Vandergon is not for the faint of heart.  Brilliant and challenging.  Reminds me of a good coach.  Memorize the book because trying to find his testing tendencies is like cracking a government computer program.

One of the best classes I have taken at Pepperdine. Dr. Vandergon is brilliant and makes the class very enjoyable, even for an 8 AM. He puts a lot of time and effort into helping all of his students, extremely approachable. Tests are very fair. This is not an easy class, but if you work hard and follow his advice, you will succeed.

Vandergon is the worst professor i have ever had. His class made me switch my major away from biology. He explains things okay, but then tests on very complex things. You dont even need to go to the class, just read the book, memorize it, then go for the tests.

Wow. He is very tough. Believe me, you have to have taken AP Bio or some kind of strong science course to understand the class. It is extremely difficult and fast paced beyond belief. The tests are hard and he grades hard, the only good thing is that lab is not a separate grade. Don't do it..

I think Dr. Vandergon is a GREAT teacher.  After reading the other comments and wondering why anyone would not like him as a teacher I decided the that people must blame him for the difficult nature of the material he teaches.  Good grades are perfectly achievable in his class.  LOTS of people get A's, but not everyone.  Suck it up, and work hard.

Just a terrible instructor. From day one he makes sure you know that he's mean, really hard, and that you're screwed. he tests at the lowest level - rote memorization with unfair time constraints, and since he hates freshmen will design his tests to make them fail. gets a kick out of his students' suffering. AVOID HIM!

Vandergon makes the material interesting my giving good examples and descriptions of the material but tests are EXTREMELY hard and long. There is no way you will pass the class if you dont put some effort into it. Study hard and study early for tests...DONT cram!

He's the nicest most helpful teacher I have ever had, this man really cares about his students. He wants to see yu succeed, but that doesn't mean he's gullible. I really learnt a lot from him. Prepare to study, this is no easy class and coasters wont even get by with a C.

Just to start off, EXTREMELY DIFFICULT!  I had never made note cards in my life until this class.  Actually had to study before the night before to succeed.  He tells you what you need to know but tests are hard.  However, I learned a ton in this class and still got a fairly good grade.  Overall just be prepared to work your butt off!

Very hard class. He's not kidding when he says to go over your notes...a lot. Definately don't put off studying for his tests last minute. Tests are long and quite difficult. He is very helpful during office hours and explains stuff well.

PRAY HARD... PRAY VERY VERY HARD. I'm not going to sugar coat this - VANGERGON IS Difficult. You're social life will be gone when you take this class. Tests are SUPER long and will require you to think fast. 8am lectures dont help. DONT BUY THE BOOK. It doesn't help. he photocopies everything you need and gives them as handouts. GOOD LUCK.........

Nice guy but a terrible teacher. He tries to make class impossible so that only the smartest people alive can pass. I went to every class, took detailed notes, asked questions, and barely pulled a C-. His class is not worth the stress or frustration that all his students suffer from

Terrible! Barely pulled a low C in his class and I am a straight A student (including classes like Chem,Calc,Physics)! Instead of being a good teacher he likes to be an a** and scare away students. He designs his tests to be tricky and long, he makes class boring,and freshmen never do well.

Worst class experience ever! Unchallenging but impossible to do well in class, not best lecturer too. He's SO rude/boring in class and discouraging. Study guides aren't very much, cuz his tests can be very random (on stuff not covered) and unfair. Won't give powerpt. until 2 late- unfair overall.

Okay, but tries making class harder than needed.  His tests questions can be RANDOM (on stuff you haven't learned yet) and are WAY too rediculously long, like 15 pages!  If you don't test quickly, stay away!  Extrememly difficult A or B!  His lab practical is impossible to even pass!  Uninterestng
He feels like its his duty to weed out all non-sciene majors. He takes the material seriously and forces you to learn. You need to study every second for a chance to pass

can be nice when you go in for help, often intimidating...sometimes whines alot in class, making class not enjoyable- not a friendly bio. class & tests are very poorly designed, encouraging low grades for even the smart, I'm good at bio. yet suffered here
really boring, it's just his voice i think, he expects students to take material seriously and warns to study in advance (which you should). tests were hard.  he was helpful outside of class.
No Comments
dr. vandergon is a superb professor.  expects students to take material seriously, has high expectations, and a very excellent teaching style.
Pretty intimidating.  Lots of info on each test.  Really boring and confusing.
he is a drill seargant and he's very boring. i didn't learn anything with him teaching
SO GOOD cares about his students - wants to make class fun
Very challenging but is one of the best teachers at Pepperdine

Cupp is good he explains things well. It is fast-paced, and there is too much content to master. Pop quizzes are like weekly mini midterms. You will learn a lot; he actually cares about his students. These classes are supposed to be hard, and he does try to accommodate the class as much as he can. For these reasons, he is better than most.

I think Cupp was a pretty good professor; always willing to answer questions and such. One thing though is that his grades are based on limited things so if you don't score high then its easy for your grade to dip super quick. Content isn't that difficult as long as you study and practice on your own which is expected by any class anyway.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Prof Cupp is both patient and willing to help his students outside and in class. The content is difficult but manageable as long as you put in effort outside and in class.

This was my first time doing anything related to computer science and I am inspired to continue pursuing this major at Pepperdine because of Prof. Cupp. He was always there to help me with proofs in office hours and explained everything well and with good energy in lectures.

I had Prof. Cupp for COSC 450 and 465 this semester. He is a very knowledgeable, kind, and experienced professor. Very understanding of my schedule and he was accommodating of reasons that caused me to miss several classes. His tests and assignments are all fair but you just have to put in the work-as for everything in life.
It is clear professor cupp really knows what he is talking about, and really conveys his teachings easily. 10/10

Cupp did a great job teaching this class. Really good integration of data structures into programming principles. Would have liked to have spent more time on dynamically allocated linked lists, but I understood all the previous concepts really well. Homework was usually just a continuation of class work, and office hours are helpful, but crowded.

Very good lecturer and person. This professor creates a very friendly, inviting class atmosphere which allows for students to openly express themselves and ask question etc. He is a very patient and a very smart person , I really enjoyed class and learnt a lot .

I don't like that he hates Trump, but he's actually a decent teacher. You don't actually have to read the book, he just tells you what you need to know in class. Homework is graded slowly, but that doesn't matter when you get 100 every time. If you need to take his class, he's the only one teaching it in any given semester, so just take it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Do not take if you do not have any knowledge of coding. Be prepared to self study and figuring out everything yourself. There are no TA's so the professor is your only help. His office hours are very short and is usually after class but tons of people go for it so you only get a chance to ask a few questions.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Get ready to study yourself! Office hours is very useful but you are mostly left on your own for everything
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: aka: teach yourself JavaScript for a grade
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Everything taught in the course is based on Excel but the tests are paper. They're screenshots of Excel sheets and you write in what you would type in. Tons of memorization but he explains everything well. Posts all the powerpoints so just study those. No book. Friendly toward Mac-users. No homework. Just study and memorize and you'll ace the class
Explains everything perfectly and works with you to get an A
He is a really smart and funny guy! The tests are easy as long as you go to class because he tells you what  he will put on the tests.  Definitely an easy and interesting class.

Completely worthless class. Make sure you go to class and take good notes. I took them by hand instead of on the computer, because on the tests you have to hand write all the equations and stuff. It is easier to study if you have them written out rather than on a spreadsheet.

His computer science classes move rapidly and Google is more helpful during the assignments than the teacher. If you manage to catch him on a day he actually comes to his office hours, he can be very helpful. Tests are fair, its simply the teaching and his disorganized style that makes this course difficult.

This class is either SUPER easy or SUPER hard, depending on the person.  It was super hard for me cause I am not good at memorization and just not interested.  Overload information per day.  nice guy but not a good teacher.  studders a lot when talking. the hardest two unit course at Pepperdine.

good teacher, easy to follow, funny guy too. class is simple enough u pay attention and go to class and study u should do goo, kids who do bad in here are morons and are the ones who dont pay attention and dont do the work. not a bad class at all.

Professor does not have great communication skills and, however, he taught a lot of interesting and really useful stuff and tests were only on the subject of the class. If you go through his lectures and practice a little at home, you'll be totally fine.

He gets very confused and the tests are hard. in the summer we had 4 people in the class who always attended and no one got an A. Comp science is a joke with his new system it is so hard and he grades the homework incredibly specifically. BORING BORING person with NO social skills. You have to really teach yourself alot.

I took this class for the business major, but ended up really enjoying it.  Cupp isn't that great of a professor, but he teaches you enough that you can get by in his class.  I got an A and am planning to add the CS major now.

I took cosc 250 this year under the new format in which Cupp just oversaw all the classes. He never showed up once, did not reply to emails, never graded****, and was probably the biggest joke of a teacher. Pepperdine hired 4 more teachers to be under him so Cupp could sit back on his ass and become an even worse teacher. This man is a ****ER...

Had him for intro to computer science.  Given the subject he tries to make it interesting.  He knows a lot, but does get it all mixed up pretty easily.  Super nice guy, kinda funny in a different kinda way.

Quite possibly the WORST professor at Pepperdine. I have no how this man is still employed. He his course evalutions should seriously be looked at.  He gets mad when you ask questions then won't answer. He told our class that we "were the stupidest class that he had ever taught." Totally unprofessional! Dont subject yourself to this man!

Doesnt know what he is talking about. Don;t know how to teach, BAd jokes. Not helpful. He tried to teach Math, and he doesn;t know anything about that. Students in my class have to correct him every time we meet. Not helpful at all, almost seem like he doesn;t want to teach but have to do it for money. Worse teacher pepperdine ever have. Ps. he looks like a hobbit!
his first year with me he gave us some breaks here and there.  Other people complained about him but they were the ones that don't belong in his classes in the 1st place.
His tests are really hard, but he is a really nice guy.
makes things harder than they're supposed to be. seems nervous.
quote "ugly but effective" - mrs. cupp

nice guy laid back. funny because he always seems lost. terrible teacher, students constantly corrects him. material supposed to be easy but he makes it very hard because tests r seriously IMPOSSIBLE, must memorize all the functions. also doenst give back homework so no way to correct mistakes.

ok, those people that said he was good and a "good mid-day class" are WRONG!!!!!!  This class sucks and so does the teacher.  He does nothing to help and either does the book, take it with someone else all those kids pass.  If you take it with him you will fail!  Good Luck.

very hard class but prof. is nice.  he doesnt teach for hw. lectures arent really useful unless for tests. tests are impossible unless u kno comp programming like the back of ur head. DO NOT RECOMMEND HIM!!
Not a bad guy. This is probably the hardest class I've ever had. The subject was hard, and his lectures did nothing to help. Impossible programs unless you *really* know C programming.
Quite possibly the worst professor to ever grace Pepperdines campus. Ridiculously difficult, incompetent, and just a lame guy. AVOID HIM for MATH 215 at all costs.
a little mentally unstable, possibly insane
Great teacher. Seems a little nervous, but makes some funny jokes.  It's a good middle-of-the-day course when you want to sit back and relax, and learn a little something while you're at it.
No Comments
Easy Course, Nice Guy.

Professor Fetzer is one of the smartest professors. He's passionate about what he teaches, and has many life experiences/research in the area to back it up, and yet he is very humble. Truly valuable class to broaden your thinking and knowledge. Lots to memorize because he covers a lot. Put in the work, and it will be rewarding.

A lot of people here saying lectures were boring, that's not true, they were just dense. But very engaging. Tests are hard but graded fairly, I got high As on all. Study and you will do well. He tests on random terms rather than the most important. Completely changed the way I view Asia and US foreign policy. A super formative class and professor.

Super smart guy. Not very engaging with lectures but TAKE NOTES. The exams are very heavy on lectures and readings so do not skip class. Loved the class and he prepped us for the exams. Very doable class and you will learn a lot!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr Fetzer is one of the smartest humans Ive ever encountered. Took his class on my first year at Pepperdine and remembered me my senior year. Good humor and caring. Difficult tests. Did terribly on the first one, however you get the hang of what he asks for in the next test. Fun field trip! Love the cowboy hat! Loved the final essay prompt!

There's two main exams, the midterm and the final. There's a lot of information from the lectures, so definitely take good notes for the essay portion of the exams. Overall a rather doable class. Pro-tip: try to find make a study group to share notes and split the readings to make it easier on yourself.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Fetzer is one of the most knowledgable professors I've ever taken. He really loves the subject material he teaches. His learning style is difficult to adjust to. He is never very clear with expectations. The reading quizzes on the test are not fair because he doesn't provide adequate materials to prepare students for those questions.
One of the smartest and overall best professors at Pepperdine. Super interesting lessons, incorporates videos and even has a fun field trip. Super caring guy on top of it, highly recommend.

I'm making this review because he said that there are some bad ones about him on here and that's not fair at all. Joel is such a good professor. He's straight to the point. You get what you put in based on grades. He has fun field trips! His lectures CAN be boring, but hang in there he tries his best to be entertaining and they're very informative.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Loved his field trip! Amazing and fascinating! He is also a very caring guy.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the best professors that I have taken at Pepperdine. Very smart and well informed. He is way too smart to teach at Pepperdine tbh. U need to take good notes in all of his classes, otherwise you will fail your test. Not condescending at all compared to the other professors at the polisci division, you are fee to ask any questions.

Not as much homework as expected, however classes are compacted with information spoken by professor. Very auditory, barely any visuals on notes. Lots of videos are shown to correlate to the topic discussed. Tests are not too difficult to take, however you must really know the common idea of lots different material.

Joel is one of the best professors in the Poli Sci division IMO. With a sense of humor drier than the Sahara, a unique ideology on teaching and an anarchist tinge to his politics his courses are dense, tests absurdly difficult and his lectures very filling. You get field trips, he grades heavy on a curve and I've never heard anyone actually fail.
test mission impossible
Brilliant man. Insanely difficult tests. ID's are just plain hard. Study Blue should really help if you take "GovPol of Dev. Countries". You will work for it but it is well worth it.

Joel is a ridiculously smart man and he shows passion for what he does in every lecture. He may come off as smug sometimes, but will help you out in the end. Just talk to him. Tests are impossible, ID's can be a one off thing he mentioned in passing worth points on a test, they're very hard. Lectures will take up 3-5 pages of notes a class.

Fetzer is a very nice and intelligent guy (he can speak 5 languages!). This was the first time this class was taught. His midterm tested for some obscure terms, but after we gave feedback he improved on the final. You'll definitely learn from him if you put your mind to it.

Professor Fetzet is by far the best professor I have had during my time at Pepperdine. His class is so engaging and he cares so much about what he speaks of. Although there is no study guides for his class, and you pretty much have to know everything, I enjoy his class more than words can say. I  signed up for more classes because he is amazing.

He is very smart and sweet. His outlines are organized, but the way he tests is unfair and does not help you actually learn anything important. You just have to know obscure details. I learned from him and would take him again if it weren't for the tests. He does curve though.

Dr. Fetzer... Joel, is a very kind person and a brilliant professor.  He is a fascinating person and an engaging lecturer.  His tests are difficult, and graded on a BELL CURVE, not an "add-points-to-your-current-grade" curve, so just be aware.  Pay attention in class and try to work together on distributing the readings.  A's are hard to come by.

Dr Fetzer is BRILLIANT, and his lectures are always interesting.  He's actually lived in and personally experienced all of the countries that he talks about.  He also knows half the languages of the world.  The reading is dense, but the lectures more than make up for that.  I would highly recommend Dr Fetzer's Comparative European Politics course.

Fetzer's classes were boring at times and interesting at others. However, the final was IMPOSSIBLE!! The material was obscure and we had never seen it before in the class. the class revolted, most only answered 1 question and got A's from the curve.
He really is a nice guy. not a class you necessary look forward to going to however. make sure you keep up with RANDOM keywords. and he DOES take attendance. would take his class again.

Joel is an intelligent man speaks many languages knows his stuff Memorize keywords and IDs for each outline/video  Don't read the book, just study the bold words in each chapter. do this you'll get your A, promise. Just memorize them and make sure you know them all well enough to be able to write 3 facts  a lot of material covered...

had him for many classes and will take him in the future. amazing all around...never met anyone more intellegent, yet more humble and modest. he is the definition of higher education. work hard and don't complain as if you're in 4th grade (as some students do) and you'll get your money's worth.
Fetzer is a brilliant, brilliant man.... it was a privilege learning from him.
No Comments
No Comments
Be prepared to take a lot of notes.  He knows what he's talking about and maybe one day he'll surprise you and walk in wearing his cowboy hat :)
I learned more in Comparative European Politics than in any other class.  This guy knows 5 languages and is a genious.  Truly wants students to succeed also.

He's a great professor, no tricks.  Tests are difficult but the curve he gives is awesome!  His lectures can be boring but no more boring than the other Poly Sci professors.  Take advantage of his humor.  I would recommend his class to anyone.

Tests were really hard, you almost never knew what to expect unless you read the entire textbook over and over again.  Good lectures.  Great guy though, good sense of humor, likes to just be called "Joel".  Also leads the Hong Kong International

He is an intelligent person and funny sometimes.  He's also very friendly and helpful, but he often talks too fast when he lectures.  His tests are very tough too (IDs and essay). The lecture part of the class is a big boring, but the debate part is fun.
BORING.  his tests were impossible.
I really enjoyed this class! Joel kept it interesting and varied but studying was needed to do well on the two tests. Made some very funny comments!  He's very intelligent and an overall nice guy.

When you first take Fetzer's class it may seem difficult, but he curves his test big time. He claims he has never failed anyone in his intro course. Keeps the class interesting with videos and debates. Shy but smart and often witty and lovable guy.
he's the man
That class is so boring!! You can't hardly stay awake and he takes everyones sides.
good teacher, stick it out and he'll surprise with some hilarious comments

This was by far the worst teacher at Pepperdine. She is so passive aggressive, a terrible person, and flat out rude at many times. Has made me cry multiple times all I wanted to do was get extra help and she kicked me out. I put in so much work into this class and she grades basically however she wants to on written tests. Just terrible never take.

Dr. Helm is extremely knowledgable/up to date on current literature, this class is extremely hard. Her grading criteria isn't clear, her exams vary in difficulty/what you need to know for material. I have heard this class has gotten more relaxed, but it's still so hard because of the amount of material you cover. It's an interesting class though.
Goes beyond textbook, keeps current with literature! Each vitamin is her favorite!
She is entertaining, educated, and a passionate professor.

The passion this professor shares for vitamins and minerals was contagious. Clearly, she enjoys the material and wanted all of us to learn more deeply. Dr. Helm is an engaging professor and encourages participation. Due to anxiety issues I met with professor several times outside of class and she was over generous with her empathy and time.

It becomes obvious that Dr. Helm is organized, providing lecture notes that guide you through both textbook and current readings. She does have a strong personality and does not suffer fools, however, if your take responsibility, come prepared to class, you will learn fo much about vitamins and minerals. Her passion shines through her knowledge.

I have gained nothing but respect for Dr. Helm. She is sharp, highly educated, and wonderfully engaging. She spends plenty of time making sense of complex concepts through real-life examples and stories without neglecting important detail. Dr. Helm is also very accessible outside of class, a fast responder to emails, and very accommodating.

Yeah, not the best personality. Some ppl get major anxiety talking to her/being in her classes. Try not to be too intimidated. That's just how she is. Let her be. You can do it. Lean on your peers & other profs. She can be fun & sweet too. Unpredictable temper & inconsistent instructions. Not ur fault. Don't let her b the reason you quit the major!

Her lecture packets are a mess. No consistent organization, packed w extraneous info, uses like 60 diff. fonts & colors. You absolutely need to read the tb. She just skips thru material & goes "oh yeah & this." Gets passionately angry about certain things but her reasoning is always a bit twisted. Likes to scare students bc she's afraid of us.

She has a strong personality, has a saying, "stamp out ignorance". Genuinely cared when I asked questions. Knows her stuff and will spend extra time explaining. Organized. You will enjoy that she has depth to her understanding of Nutritional Science.

What's most diff. about Dr. Helm's classes is her accusatory/condescending language. She says to ask Qs but loves to respond by either getting angry or saying "You should know this." She also gives conflicting answers to ppl & gets angry if you "don't follow directions." My 1 tip: don't show her that you're intimidated b/c that intimidates her.

Just don't if you don't have to. If you have to, don't ask questions and study on your own. She makes it seem like she likes questions and participation but low key feels intimidated by them and might embarrass you. Many have been through rough patches. Lectures are often unrelated to subject so study hard.
an upper division that heavily relies upon prerequisites; always read as she comes prepared
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Tests are tough--Would take again

comment: Great person outside of the classroom and is pretty funny too. However, my friend and I asked her a question in our lab but we both received two different answers. Does not seem to have a genuine appreciation for nutrition. Labs were hard to follow and I was often nervous to ask her questions. But it was an easy A so thats cool

Extremely difficult. Most people have lives outside of class, so that means busting your butt for these upper divs. It's hard enough even if your life is all about academics. She'll make mistakes in lecture, so look for answers in her packets and the book. Be proactive and participate - it's expected. She hates repeating herself, so listen closely.

This class is easy. Do the work, follow the rules, and you'll do well. Dr. Helm is a nice professor. She seems like she enjoys her job. She also is a very straight-forward, frank, and honest person. As long as you respect her, she'll respect you.
Never knew so much about vitamins and minerals.  I liked that lectures were structured but so much discussion was allowed about interests of each individual student. A creative and dynamic teacher.
A clearly outlined introduction to thinking about the many ways to develop a career in nutrition.  Dr.Helm is open to any question, although if you come to class unprepared this prof is candid.

Wonderful teacher, but prove you are interested and motivated. She is GREAT in upper divs!!! She hates it when students put the minimum effort into her classes. Take the NUTR 210 GE, because it is useful and interesting--but make sure you put in the time necessary to learn the information. Study hard. She is a wealth of knowledge--take her advice!
So many applications of nutrition concepts. A wealth of information.
Physiological Chemistry was organized. Dr. Helm thinks about each student and their individual learning patterns.  This is a professor that goes out of her way to be helpful and teach!

I had no idea about Nutrition before taking Dr. Helm's class!  Content went beyond my expectations.  This professor is brilliant, has so many applicable stories, is hilarious and also serious about you learning nutrition.  Tests are from lecture and the textbook, so be sure to read prior to class and extensively for each exam and the final exam.  D

The range on the last exam was 35%-94% but only 4 people in the class (of 26) scored above a 70%. the average score was a 55%. If the majority of the class scores an F on the exam, the teacher is not doing a good job because no one is learning! There is another NUTR 210 teacher-Take that one!

Definitely, this class requires work by the student to learn.   The range of the exam grades was 35.5% to 94%....if you don't work in this class, then you won't learn anything. Dr. Helm is enthusiastIc and teaches so much new nutrition information.

The mean on the last exam was a 55%. If you want to get a bad grade and come out knowing nothing more about nutrition than what you went in with, take Dr. Helm. There is another Nutrition 210 teacher, TAKE THAT ONE!
Provided an interactive environment to discuss current issues.  Followed the textbook.  For a non-major, lots of work.  You learn so much from this Prof., highly recommend despite the extra work.
Learned a lot of interesting and useful information

A rare class without using study guides, instead the excellent textbook was actually expected to be read and understood prior to class.  Discussions on current Medical Nutrition Therapy topics were fascinating.  Dr. Helm expects a lot studying, but I learned so much from this intelligent professor.  I now have even more passion for Nutrition!

Dr. Helm is the only full-time nutrition professor, and she believes that scaring her students into studying and working hard is an acceptable teaching method. I learn by being inspired, and she has made me completely lose my passion for nutrition. Be prepared to pay a fortune to teach yourself nutrition, because you won't learn it from her.

Dr. Helm is an awesome lady! She's a good teacher because she is really interested in what she teaches. Class is lecture/discussion, and she gives you information you can use. She is available for help, and she cares about her students.
She is awesome!! She's very funny and caring, and she knows a TON. She makes you interested in the material, just make sure you read and pay attention.

Demanding,intense,but fair. Incredible enthusiasm for molecular biology and metabolim. Loves genetics and her new interest, nutrigenomics.  Be prepared, read prior to class, spend the hours studying and you'll learn so much.  She is adorable!
Poor.
No Comments
This lady has a huge heart -- although she seems tough at times, she's the nicest professor I had in my 4 years at Pepperdine.  She will always go out of her way to help.
She was a fun teacher, the class was really interesting and fun which made it easy to learn.
Class isn't too hard, tests are off notes all take in class.  Helm loves what she does, is passionate about it, love athletes!
passionate about subject; an excellent listener
super boring, but not so hard.

Challenging but very rewarding, provided you put in the time and effort.  Passionate about the material.  If you want a fulfilling history experience to test your mettle as a student, don't miss Dr. Zalar's class.  If you just want another 3 credits and an easy A, steer clear.

So...the problem with Zalar is that he lectures in a lecture class and requires you to know things for tests? Ridiculous. He's actually a great lecturer who only test on "random" things if you haven't been to class. He is very understanding and willing to work with real students to get the A. If you are wasting time in college, you will dislike him

Professor Zalar loves the material he teaches and thinks everybody else should too. He enjoys bringing other people down. Heard about his class being difficult going into the course and tried going in w/ an open mind..that went out the window after one week. Thinks he's Hulk Hogan while up there lecturing. Class really not worth the lack of sleep.

you end up reading about a book a week, if you read them you get 11/15 on quizes and if you dont 9/15...class is intense and he expects sooo much.  if you like history and enjoy working at it you will like it...otherwise you will not..at all

For some reason I cannot stand listening to him "teach". His abnormally long rants with his annoying words seem to serve himself more than his students. Sitting through about 15 minutes of his lecture makes me want to take off my shoe and throw it at his face. If it can be avoided, do not take HIS course, he is not pleasant as an instructor.

A Brilliant man. Who doesn't know how to communicate with ordinary students. I love the class, it is engaging and he knows his material, but he doesnt make it easy at all. You have to be ready to work hard and pay attention.

Professor Zalar is a great guy. He is not hard at all.....He basically tells you what are on his tests, so his tests are really not hard.....If you work hard, and pay attention you will be fine.....def. one of the best professors i've ever had.

This teacher is a jerk. He is not understanding, thinks he's a bigshot, thinks his class is so tough. In reality, he's no expert on the field. He tries to act as a passionate professor, encouraging students to ask questions. But he is rarely able to answer them well and acts annoyed when students raise their hand. He should be fired for hypocrisy.

Entirely too much reading.  He says things will not appear on the tests that do.  He tests on mundane, insignificant details on his tests instead of the important facts.  He seems to go out of his way to outsmart his students.  He tries to use big words so much that he sounds unatural.  He uses 20 words when five will do.

Zalar=zealot. Everyone who does not take hum 212 overseas is forced to take Zalar's course. Zalar teaches this 3 unit GE like an upper-division Humanities course. He also criticizes people who are involved with social activities, religious activities, community outreaches,-basically anyone who is not ready to devote all of thier waking hours to him

Makes Colbun look like a care bear.  I cannot stress enough that this guy is THE biggest (or smallest) Jacka** at Pepperdine. A direct quote: "you can shoot a cannon off in the library on friday nights and you won't even hit anyone" He thinks that reading and his class are the 2 only things in the world. Seriously stay away

DO NOT TAKE ZALAR.  You will end up studying for 24 hours for the tests and MAYBE get a B. THE TESTS ARE SO SO HARD. He also has like 12 books with IMPOSSIBLE quizzes attached. After A's in the other HUM I took my zalar D+ just to leave this subject behind. He fails seniors too. You will really have to try to do well.

He thinks he is hot. He look like a short****. **** him. He is just sad for himself, becuase he can't teacher major classes. End up teaching G.E. Always metion about his past. Who knows and who even care about his past. He is an **** + idiot. He said his class is hard, but it is only because he doesn't teach. Maybe he never learned how to teach
Horrible. why hasn't pepperdine fired this man?  He's a complete egomaniac.  I couldn't wait to get out of his class.
Energetic and exciting teacher.  Loves what he does.  Willing to help all students if they ask.
An awful teacher and an awful person. Not only will he make you hate him, but he'll make you hate the humanities, college, and organized learning in general.  An ego-maniac with a God-complex.

How does one week to read Tale of Two Cities, which is one of about 8 or 9 books you'll have to read for weekly quizzes in this class. Just avoid this guy at all costs. Humanities 212 is such an easy class, don't screw yourself over and take Zalar. He's brilliant, but he should be teaching at grad school, not a 200 level class.

Do not take this class with him. If you can avoid it at all costs, please do. You will read 6 or more books and the tests are ridiculous. Though the lectures are usually mildly interesting and he is a very approachable person, you will work TOO hard.

Honestly,if you can take this with someone else, please do! It's a GE and a three unit class but the READING for a 6 unit class.  It seems like he thinks this is the only class we are taking by the difficulty of the course in terms of reading.  It is one of the most intense courses because of the teacher.

Great teacher, and quite honestly probably the best one at Pepperdine.  Challenging and engaging, the problem is that 95% of the students are so used to having to work so little in classes, that they forget what real work is like.  Also, anyone who's ever actually spoken with him for longer than two minutes to argue a test grade would know that his personality, kindness, and sense of humor are top notch.  Bring more in like this one.
If you want to work extremely hard to even pass the class, this guys for you.  His personality is extremely abrasive and he is out to prove that no one can pass this class.  Avoid him at all costs!

Hardest class at Pepperdine. Life's too short to study for GE's like this guy wants us too.  He doesn't realize that even though he's only teaching one class, you're taking 4 or 5.  Has an ego big enough to fill elkins.

Very Hard for a GE, but he really takes and interest in his students.  He is incredibly helpful outside of class and if you make an effort and talk to him, you can get a good grade.  I actually learned something in this class.

Dr. Zallar is the best upper division instructor I have had.  He is demanding, but he inspires passion and dedicaton in his students.  As for a general humanities class, I can see how everyone wants to just "get by." But if you really want to learn some meaningful history and have it stick with you, then Zallar is the way to go.
Avoid at all costs. You'll hate the class, and you'll hate him.
Napoleon is exactly right. He's got the worst case of "little man complex" I've ever seen.  Terrible teacher. It's not just that he's difficult, but that his personality is so bad.
He's a complete ego-maniac, one with a serious god complex.  It's hard to learn when he's strutting around the class like he's Napoleon issuing orders to the troops.

Zalar is a different breed of teacher from the average Pepperdine teacher.  He demands excellence, meticulous studying and pristine writing.  However, he is a fantastic teacher who is very passionate about teaching.  This guy was a Fulbrighter, a marine, and now he's a fantastic teacher!
I feel as if he was a good person...but I felt like he knew people would do bad in his class....I got a C- and i am not a bad student usually...I am just glad I passed this class

he's my worst professor i ever have in pepperdine. he never curve his tests even most people get D for the tests. If you really need to take this course, any professor during summer would be a lot easier than Dr. Zalar

Dr. Zalar is somewhat of a personality to be reckoned with but extremely intelligent, and willing to help if you're willing to do the work.  It took some time to get used to his style and expectatations but i learned in tons - just have to learn how to work the system.  overall, good prof
No Comments

I hated this class. He gives way too much work and the tests are impossible.  He also really rude to certain students and tries to preach that we are all not good enough.  Avoid this class but on the up side he does have passion for what he teaches.

He is the worst professor I have experienced. He has passion but he does not know how to channel it. He is a jerk in class and has no respect for anyone but himself. I think  he needs to stick to Upper division classes. He is not a good professor when it comes to GE classes.
too demanding and unclear concerning test dificulty and content.
I found the guy to be an egomaniacal jerk. He's puffed up and overbearing. Avoid taking his classes.

Dr. Zalar, though new to the school, is one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine. His intensity in the classroom is refreshing, and his toughness, though intimidating at times, forces students to work hard...very hard. His teaching style should not be the exception, but the standard at Pep.

Zalar, a new addition to Pepperdine, is very demanding of his students. His lectures are intense and very clear, and he expects a lot on papers. Tests aren't too bad, and discussions are fun. For what it's worth, I'm going to take him again.

Professor stivers makes you do a lot of work outside of class, not only is it homework but going to shows at smothers. He also expected the class to know a lot about music and know how to read notes when most of us did not learn music before this class. He gave us around 3-4 test. they were online test but asked question from the book only.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Had prof stivers for my first year seminar class, communicating with music and sound, and he was the worst professor I had all semester. Despite most of the class having very little musical experience he assigned a ton of work and graded all of it with a stick up his ass. First year seminar classes are not supposed to be your hardest class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Stivers is a good guy. Cares for his student and cares for his lectures. I took him for my freshman seminar course "communicating through sound and music". There's not a ton of homework, just a few projects and he doesn't make his tests very hard.

Really cares about students and is a nice guy but this class is SO much work. 10 projects, 4 tests, pop quizzes, readings, and a final. Theres never a day w/out work. Projects are interesting but its just a lot. He also grades hard and will give points off if he thinks he could do something better. Very organized and passionate. Just way too much.

Professor Stivers is a real sweetheart. He loves to teach and he loves his students. Amazing man. The class is a lot of work though. A project a week. You use all different types of media to tell on "semester topic". He rarely gives full points though so beware. You really have to put the work in. Every point makes a difference in this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: A really caring guy and loves what he does. COM205 is super work heavy, however, and he is a pretty tough grader. His assignments can be kind of vague and without clear instruction sometimes. Still, his projects are fun and creative but it's definitely a full workload. ALSO - do the readings because he often gives pop quizzes that matter.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: BEST COM 205 PROFESSOR EVER!!!!!!!

He's a sweet man who's passionate about storytelling. You can tell he wants his students to be passionate about it as well, and wants you to succeed. He responds to emails pretty quickly. There are quizzes in class but they're pretty easy and the tests are pretty easy as well as long as you study a bit. The projects are challenging but intriguing.

This class is project heavy so youll barely have a day without an assignment to work on. Professor Stivers knows what he is teaching and teaches it well. Sometimes, the material itself is boring but the projects are fun because of the freedom you have with them. The end result is pretty cool. Professor is caring and very accessible. Learned a lot!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Stivers was a great teacher and did his best to outline his expectations for the semester in the syllabus. It felt like there was a new project due every week but that is just the nature of this class. He is a really nice guy who cares a lot about his students. Grading criteria is a little unclear but, if you work at it you'll do well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Stivers is one of the sweetest professors on campus, and he's frequently brought snacks to class to let us know how much he cares. As a professor he's very difficult. He's a very tough grader, but seems to grade without clear grading criteria. He'll take off points just to take off points--I had to work hard for the grade I got.

Professor Stivers is so kind and caring. He really wants to get to know his students and invest in them. His grading criteria is not very specific and he assigns a lot of arbitrary reading. I didn't do a single assigned reading and got 94% on most of the tests. He also spends a lot of time talking in class, which is hard to listen to at 8am.

Chris as a person is really nice and really caring and good guy, but his expectations of what he wants from each student's projects can get a little vague and hurt your grade. His tests are a little more difficult than you'd expect. Ask for help and make sure you ask him what he's looking for when it comes to projects.

Professor Stivers has been my favorite professor so far; He is extremely funny and tries to make the class fun for everyone. Though the workload can be overwhelming at times, he is very willing to help in any way possible! The class itself is very hands-on and requires a lot of creativity and time. I would highly recommend both the class & Stivers!

Chris is a really sweet man who genuinely cares about his students. He wants his students to succeed and will do whatever he can to help make this happen. As long as you do what's asked of you, you will be fine. I would highly recommend him for Com 180.

Avoid this class with him! It's such a waste of time! He gave us projects every week and asked us to be the most basic as possible. If you're creative in the least bit, you WILL be frustrated with him! You could teach yourself more from youtube videos online, it's a highly stressful class with no payoff. Sweet guy though.
Boring monotone voice and uninteresting presentation. Doesn't fully know what he's talking about. Interesting speeches and passionate about music but not such a great public speaking professor.

He is a nice man outside of class but he has no business teaching. He was very unorganized and gave us assignments every week that were not graded until the last week of school. I got A's on everything and then got a bad grade on my research paper. He wouldn't give any valid reasons for this bad grade, not helpful AT ALL. Avoid taking him!

I was a competitive speaker in high school and would do rather well. That being said, I expected Com180 to be a breeze. Haha. He takes the outlines very seriously and the midterm was based on information we barely touched on in class or in the books.

Don't take this class. You'll never really know your grade until after it's over. I got As on almost everything and then was screwed over at the end for a still unknown reason. Lots of meaningless reading.

DO NOT TAKE HIM! He gave us menial assignments and taught us common sense. Our assignment from the first week of class wasn't given back to us until the last week of school. One of our big assignments was to make a power point on a country's food, culture, etc. It was literally like being in 3rd grade. But no one got higher than a B.

He is basic...literally. Don't take Story Telling through Media if you have any interest in furthering your knowledge of media. Worst teacher I have ever had. His class and assignments are basic, but somehow he is one of the hardest graders I have had. He should stick to music, its the only thing he knows anything about.

Besides the fact that it was an 8am, this class was fun. My class only had 8 people so we kind of had to show up haha. Chris is super caring & will do w.e he can to help. It's not an easy class though. He grades pretty hard & the tests aren't SUPER easy. But not difficult either. Just go to class & get to know Chris. One of the classes I enjoyed.
Makes class interesting, really reasonable

Easy freshmen seminar class. if you show up and pay a little of attention, you should be fine. Only difficult part of the class is the online quizzes. The projects are easy, and you actually learn alot from this class. Make sure to check his website for the homework due since he never talks about it until its due. Boring, but easy.
he is amazing!!!!!  so caring about his students!!! love the dinners at his house!
