Very ackward at times but insightful.  Do not take this class if you will have a busy schedule as a freshman.  Class at his house can be very time consuming.  My class went from 4-7:30p at his house sometimes.  Also, a lot of work for a seminar.  Choose a less time-consuming Seminar.  Interesting Class though.
Doc Stivers is a great teacher and friend. His feshman seminar class, while easy to understand, requries that you stay awake at least some of the time. If you try, you will succeed!

quite possibly the coolest teacher. he is so nice and really cares about his students. his door is always open to just go in and talk. and the dinners at his house are amazing!! i am really going to miss him when i am gone.
No Comments

Stivers is a really nice guy, but unfortunately if you take every other multimedia class or any TC class before you take this class, this is a BORING and useless waste of time. I wish the material presented here wasnt so scattered and focused on one of two principles of design rather than spending time on powerpoint. I wanted more web design!
the class itself is kinda odd, but i really like him, he's super helpful and interesting

Stivers cares so much for his students. He will be a teacher that you will visit throughout your college career. The class has some times where there's a lot of work but there are some really fun class periods where you get close to the class... watch out for the midterm...hahahaha
he's such a sweet man, helpful to no end, very concerned for his students...dont know what i would have done without him my first semester!

Great teacher, cares so much about his students and will do just about anything to help, even after they complete the class. Quizes are online and open book. Watch out for midterm , it is very tricky, but not too hard. No need for all nighter, just complete reading assignments and you'll be fine.

Awesome teacher.  Had him for 2003 Seminar.  Best Seminar EVER.  Tests are taken online in your dorm room and is open book.  Be careful of the mid-term.  I studied 6 hours for it, my roommate studied 8 hours for it, and we didn't do all that well.  Overall, the class is interesting and worth taking.
Best teacher I may ever have. He cares so much about his students and puts such thought into his classes. I highly recommend him!

Dr. Stivers is a very understanding teacher and friend.  COM 408 is a very informative class that is well taught through both indivdidual and group projects and presentations that involve media and design within technology.

One of hardest classes at this university. Very content heavy. Professor is harsh grader. Confusing in communicating material to students.  SUGGESTIONS for taking class: MUST have thick skin. be mentally prepared for a lot of work, !OFFICE HOURS!,hire a tutor, STUDY BUDDIES, don't take her criticisms personally,WORK HARD and you will pass.

She teaches well but her exams are TOUGH, and she does not grade easy. If you want to take her make sure to prepare for the exams way beforehand. There are 3 exams that basically make up your whole grade, so if you don't do well on those you will not get a good grade in the class. I personally did not like this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I really enjoyed taking her class. She is very clear, prepares you immaculately for the test, and is always there to help. There is a department-wide group case for this class, and she grades tough, but it is a small portion of your grade, just do your best. I highly recommend her and was thankful to be in her class. She is great at what she does.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor, however, very tough grader. Very confusing direction for final projects but provides excellent resources for studying for exams
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She cares about her students and is a great teacher, passionate about accounting. Her project is really tough, and she is a tough grader. Her tests are hard but she provides old tests as study guides, which really help. She always makes herself available for help/office hours.
Great teacher. Her teaching methods were super clear and she always went over the homework, which is the key for the class. Difficult class but gives a great platform for accounting majors.

Best teacher I have ever had. She is so passionate about what she is teaching and organizs things very well. Clear and professional. The group case is time consuming but worthwhile. The exams are very very hard, but she gives you old exams to practice. They are really helpful. It is very worthwhile to take her class. Highly recommended.

You have to work for the class. It's hard. But it doesn't mean you can't get an A. As long as you put enough time to your studies, you're good. Plus, you learn so much from her. Prof Misch is a great professor to be taught by. I recommend everyone to take Misch if you're interested in Accounting.

I had Prof. Misch for Financial Acc. & I thoroughly enjoyed her class! While the 3 exams are demanding, if you keep up with the hw on a nightly basis & take advantage of her office hours, especially in the days leading up to the exam, you will succeed. She is extremely passionate about accounting & will help you in every way she possibly can.

I've had her for all three accounting classes and I'm honestly so glad to have had her as my professor. She's incredibly knowledgable and wants you to succeed. She's fair with her grading and even gives out three years worth of past tests. She's in her office more than not. My favorite professor thus far. She's difficult but you learn and remember.

this class is NOT EASY! She is a great professor though. She teaches REALLY WELL. However, if you miss more than 2 classes - you're screwed. Tests are really hard. She grades HARD, no curves or whatsoever. WORK HARD OR GO HOME (jk) or CHANGE YOUR MAJOR!

she is an incredible teacher. definitely not easy and expects a lot but is very enthusiastic about the subject and will bend over backwards to help you succeed. if you do the work, you will be fine. she puts old tests on blackboard so DO THEM! she's the best teacher i've had at pepperdine, and i hope i get her again.

Misch is an amazing professor. Her class is hard in that it requires your full attention and continual practice of her teachings. Misch is extremely helpful and always makes herself available. She is passionate and wants every student to do their best. Start strong from the begininning and you'll be fine.

Amazing teacher and person!  Misch makes learning this subject so doable and is very fair.  Has old tests to practice on just like the new one, making the class very doable.  Pretty straightforward and direct exams if you simply study her past ones!  Take any class with her.

I just finished her class today, and although the final was very hard, there was nothing that we did not know.  Her old exams have been on Blackboard since the beginning of the semester and the new exams are the exact same format with different companies and numbers.  She does a great job of teaching the subject and is always available to help.
no comment but dont take her if u dont have to because she WILL make ur life miserable

HATE HATE HATE her and this class. The tests are LONG and impossible. Forcing myself to go to this class was a daily battle. She was rude, and overly enthusiastic. After class every day I felt like I needed hard alcohol. Avoid it like the plague.

great teacher, highly recommended.  tests are relatively straightforward and easy, tho a bit long.  KEY is to study the homework and her old exams she gives you (almost identical to the new one) and guarenteed 'A'!  You hardly need to read the text.  Do a good job on the group project tho.

Hands down best professor I have ever had. I actually learned the material rather that simply memorizing for tests. You should take this class if you are going into business I guarantee it will do you a huge favor in the long run.

Misch is one of the nicest teachers at Pepp. She is obsessed with accounting and is a complete genius in the subject. She grades hard! but if you attend class and study for the tests then its not that bad. You can't miss class. I really recommend taking her, better than the other accounting teachers that I have had.
Very nice, honestly cares about students.  Definitely a good mentor.  Great teacher.
No Comments

She's a fantastic teacher, but extremely hard. I would recommend taking her if you are an accounting major, but if you are simply business, opt for an easier teacher. She is very helpful outside of class.

I was really scared when I got in her class cause everyone said she was hard. But I came to class every day, did my homework, and got an A. Her tests are harder than Galantine's, but they're doable, and you learn accounting in her class.  I recommend her if you actually want to learn.
REALLY hard long tests got a D- not gonna take her again she helps outside class well though
Take Misch!  (If you're masochistic.)
I was having a tough time and she spent hours helping me beside her office hours.  Misch's class is hard but she helps you learn.
My goodness, I woke up to see her at 8am?  Drop the class or drop dead.  Group projects are a joke...what a waste of an alarm clock.

Whoever said she was grotesque..yeah that was an understatement! I must say she is passionate about what she does, but her class is very difficult! You will have to work very hard for a decent, not so great grade. Good luck to all that take her class. Be prepared, she is "different".

Difficult class, but the material is presented in a clear and understandable manner. She has old tests and answer keyes, and to get a decent grade I HIGHLY recommend taking those tests and then grading them yourself.  You will learn a lot but be prepared.

She is a very passionate professor. She can get a little grumpy if you don't understand things but it is only because she cares. She makes you work but you do learn. If you want to know accounting, I recommend her.
Misch rocks.  The class is tough, but she takes time to explain things you don't understand, and she really loves accounting.
She was a pretty hard professor. There was plenty of work. She taught from the homework and not too much from the book. It was if she assumed the student knew what he/she was doing.
Some people are relaly bitter apparently. Yeah, you have to work really hard to earn your grade, but you reap what you sow. She's dedicated to teaching and tries to give the benefit of the doubt.

She is not easy, but you'll definitely learn the material. She's a great professor to get to know. She's very nice and teaches very well. Though I didn't even get a very good grade in her class, I still think she is one of the best professors here.
Best professor at Pepperdine.  She really cares about her students.
You can't not like Misch; she is a wonderful & caring human being. Very Good.

Professor Martinez has got to be the best professor I have ever had. He has always taken the time to ensure his students are all well and understood the course material. Such a kind man who is very understanding and will take the time to help you when you need it.

Dr. Martinez is such a nice man who knows so much about psychology. This class has super interesting topics but it can get boring or long as it's lecture heavy. He's not as tough of a grader as I thought. As long as you read the textbook and follow directions, youll be fine!

I took Prof. Martinez for Abnormal Psychology last fall semester. Although I enjoyed the course contents and textbooks, Martinez made this class much more difficult than needed. Exams aren't too hard, but he is a tough grader. He never responds to emails and is hard to communicate with in general. This class was my first B at Pepp.... beware!

I've already had a difficult experience with this Prof. He goes on a tangent for over an hour about his opinions and experiences in life, and doesn't even make it clear what he is trying to teach. He never responds to emails, isn't understanding of missing a class due to a specific reason and is a very unclear on everything. Do not take his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: My biggest frustration with this professor was that he was extremely loose with instructions on assignments and then graded ridiculously hard. He's practically impossible to reach outside of class, never responds to emails. Tests were very hard as well, considering his lectures are just him talking about life experiences. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dr Martinez is easily my favorite professor Ive ever had. He cares so deeply about what he teaches and his students. Will go out of his way to help you if you ask for it. Took 3 of his classes. Loved! He creates a classroom environment in which you interact with all the students and look forward to seeing him and everyone in class Hes also funny!

He strays off topic way too much. One time ha hasn't even started lecture after an hour after class has started. Pretty much he wastes a lot of time and you don't learn much. You'll survive as long as the class has a good TA. Also, you gotta do service learning AKA volunteering hours for his class. So, avoid him if you don't have time for that.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: While a somewhat easy professor in the department, I was disappointed by his lack of care for his students and lack of preparation for his lectures. They are rambly and repetitive of the textbook so class feels like a waste of time even though attendance is graded. Easy pass, but do not expect him to be helpful to you, personally or academically.

I took Dr. Martinez's abnormal psych class during the summer. I am not even a psych major and I found the class incredibly easy. His TA provides a study guide that follows the outline of the test completely and as long as you read the book religiously you should be fine. He also provides many assignments to counteract test grades.

Dr. Martinez is amazing, inspirational, and is beyond caring. I took both abnormal and cross-cultural psyc with him. His class is not an easy A, and you must put in time and effort into his class, but it is well worth it because you will learn so much!
I had Dr. Martinez a really long time ago and he's a fantastic man and teacher. I can't believe all the negative comments -- he's amazing so please make sure to take him

I am not sure how anyone could have anything bad to say about Prof Martinez. He is an amazing man and instructor. His study guides basically give the exam away, read, take notes, study and have no worries. Assigns a lot of projects throughout the semester but they are actually very helpful and he is not a tough grader so it helps your overall score

I love Dr. Martinez-- he is a great person and a great professor. Martinez is passionate about Ab. Psych, and encourages different ways of learning. He respects his students as adults and as college students by setting expectations of assignments turned in on time and asking for help if you need it. This is an awesome course.

I am so frustrated with Dr. Martinez. I am not exaggerating when I say that he is, hands-down, the worst professor I have ever had. His tests are unreasonable--he doesn't even cover the information on the tests in class... super frustrating. I wish I never took this class because I did not end up with the grade that I wanted.

Martinez isn't particularly organized and what he talks about in class is not what he focuses on for his tests. However, the experience this man has had in dealing with the varying disorders discussed in abnormal psychology is phenomenal. He's either dealt with the disorder, or has interesting stories about someone who has. MUST READ THE TEXTBOOK.
His lectures feel really long... he goes on a lot of tangents , making it hard to follow. His tests are extremely difficult. He also never has clear instructions for assignments.

Dr. Martinez is great. He's really relaxed about a lot of things. You have to do service learning so that sucks, but almost all psych classes require it. He tells you to read the textbook almost every class and his exams are straight out of the book, so READ. He assigns some papers and required two presentations, nothing ridiculous,Great Experience
He is a great teacher and teaches the class so that later on you can remember what he talked about. Sure the grading is a big easy and he's a bit laid back but in the end the info goes to your brain.

Great guy! The Pro's most definitely outweigh the cons for this class. Lectures are extremely interesting. He adds his input & life experience (he has A LOT of experience and is very wise in the field of Psychology). Unfortunately, tests are straight from the book & not the lectures. Very manageable class. Take him! You won't regret it.

Dr. Martinez is an excellent professor. Even though he is a little scatter brained at times, and goes on tangents, I think that his stories make class even more interesting and easier to understand. He is always available for help, and the tests aren't that difficult. A lot of homework, but I actually enjoyed the assignments!

If you enjoy sitting for 2 hours only to hear the words "it's kinda interesting if you think about" and "it's kinda this whole idea" "if you think about the whole idea" etc, as well as BS stats, this is the class for you. if you enjoy relevancy, content, and a professor with a general knowledge of any topic whatsoever, please reconsider martinez.

Sooo laid back and nice!  His class is really easy!  If you read the chapters you don't really even need to go to class.  The class is kind of boring but sometimes there are activities.  He's very straightforward and there's not a lot of HW.
nice guy, avaliable in office to talk, doing great things in research and work, but lazy in grading and not a very good teacher
Nice guy, forgetful and unprofessional.
No continuity...class is opinion based. Lectures have nothing to do with the tests, etc.
Easy A
Always prepared.  Presented opposing arguments and let you decide for yourself.  Warm and friendly.

Ok so here it is...his lectures are EXTREMELY boring. You don't really have to go to class because you can just read the book. He shows movies from the 70s and he probably still uses the lectures from then too. Test are easy if you study...service learning is a joke. I got an A and I'm lazy if that tells you anything.

Even though he is a nice guy, his classes are awful. The tests have nothing to do with the lectures, but come entirely from the book. His study guides are really helpful. Know everything on the guide, and you'll have no problem getting an A. Even though I got an A in the course, I don't feel like I learned much. Class time is really boring and real

I feel as if this prof was very fair...his lectures are interesting and interactive but dont relate to the test...this is what makes the test difficult...I only learned in the end that you had to read every chapter twice
Horrible. Lecture has nothing to do with the test and the service hours are bull****.
The class material has nothing to do with what is on the test.  He gives a detailed study guide and if you know that you'll do well on the tests.  Very interesting topics are discussed in class time.
It's amazing how the exact same lesson can be taught by him in two completely different classes, with no relevance to each other.
No Comments
makes latinos out to be victims of society.
No Comments
What a waste...I learned nothing from him.  Just read the book.
He's really nice and reasonable, and makes an effort to engage students in the material. The class is easy as long as you put in the effort. participation does matter a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: He is the most boring professor ever. He does not care about your well-being and will never actually listen to what you need to say if you talk to him. He interrupted me talking many times and did not help me with my questions at all. Never teach you anything! I have never given a bad review to a professor. DO NOT TAKE HIM
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Avoid! Most boring class I have ever taken. Professor spent every class talking about things that had nothing to do with the subject. He would also take forever to grade our papers but would expect us to write new papers without knowing our grades. When you try to meet with him to discuss how to improve in class he offers little help.

A gem of the great books faculty. Insanely knowledgeable of all material read, but down-to-earth and caring. Discussions will keep you on your toes. Thorough grader on essays, but appreciates creativity and risk-taking over being 100% correct. Very nice man who knows how to challenge, yet nurture his students. Wish I got to know him better.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Ditmore is a very nice man, however he is the most boring professor I have taken at Pepperdine. I took him for HUM 313 and his lectures never related to anything we read and was more small talk than anything. I cannot tell you one thing I have learned the entire semester and it was infuriating.

If American Political Literature does not sound interesting to you do not take the class. Very awesome professor but if you are not interested in the subject matter it makes the class much harder. Overall was not too bad of a class and he helps you a lot through the essay process. If you want to be challenged take this class. A TON of reading too.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Ditmore is wonderful!!! If you have the opportunity to take him for any of your ENG GEs, I highly recommended him. He is certainly a little lecture-heavy; however, he is passionate about teaching English and wants you to actually learn. His class (at least when I took ENG 380 online) was all papers, no exams, quizzes, etc. Take Ditmore!

Ditmore was a great professor. I took him for ENG380 and it was a very tough class with lots of reading, but he was an easy grader and super helpful in office hours. All reading and essays for classwork and homework but I managed an A with little stress. I would take him again
The absolute goat. Made English fun. Not that easy, but one of the most memorable classes at Pepperdine.

For a GE class, this isn't the easiest, but Ditmore is very helpful if you choose to take advantage of his availability. At the beginning he gave a few pop quizzes, but after about 3 I think he got sick of grading them. So mostly just papers and exams as far as assignments.

Very interesting and intellectual professor. He is really excited about his subject so it makes the class fun, even when the material is more on the esoteric side. Treats everyone equally, does not play favorites. Also, he grades fairly. Overall, a great graduate professor.

Took him for 3 of my Great Books classes and was really upset when he went on sabbatical during my 4th and ruined my streak. Tries to sit back and let the class lead discussion, so how good class is depends on your classmates. You have to be a good writer to do well, but once you understand what he wants, you'll do fine.

One of my favorite people ever. Both challenging and laid-back. Really cares about students and VERY accessible. As far as I can tell, assigns lower amounts of reading than other Great Books profs. As far as papers, you can't turn in crap to him and get away with it, but he appreciates creativity where appropriate. Lots of fun tangents in class!
He's pretty laid-back for a Great Books professor, and classes feel more like conversations than formal discussions, which I enjoy. He may not be as cool as Dr. Marshall, but he's really close.
Really amazing professor. Cares about his students. Gives helpful comments on essays. Prompts are specific and easy to follow.
The person below perfectly summarizes Ditmore.  I loved him as a professor and got me to think.  The more I had him, the more I liked him.  He;s a very real person.

very good teacher who absolutely LOVES what he does. classes are very relaxed and you can easily get him off on a tangent. participation is a must. but reading your book isnt always necessary. simply listen to his ideas and you can give a fairly educated response without even reading. he is extremely kind and caring. he will do anything to help!

Professor Ditmore chooses an interesting array of literature and has a genuine interest in engaging students in discussion of the material.  He stays abreast of current events and the best discussions are the ones that have absolutely nothing to do with anything.  He's a fair grader, gives clear guidelines for tests and is really just a nice guy.

Very kind and intelligent man.  In terms of class, he assigns alot more reading than other professors.  Also, classroom discussions literally put me to sleep for the first 2 months and I was driven to Red Bull to stay awake for the final month.  End not: kind person, not intellectually stimulating

Kinda hard, but if you're confident with your writing, you'll be fine. Enjoyable when off-topic, if you want the on-topic discussions to be interesting, you have to make it that way yourself. He is easily reached outside of class for assistance, if you want. Very knowledgable.

A lot of boring reading (American Lit b4 Civil War). He tends to favor those who already have previous knowledge about the subject (why would they take the class if they did?) and teaches it as if it were required for a major rather than a G.E. He only gives positive comments even on crappy papers, so you have no idea where to improve.

I liked this class. If you're a good writer you'll do fine and he's a nice guy. The best part is taking the first 45min to an hour getting him off topic so we don't talk about the book until the end of class. Which is good cause the discussions get pretty boring. But when he's not talking about the books, he's pretty interesting.
good class, comes off hard, but we all know what a nice guy he really is...

Interesting man.  Discussion can be a little dry at times, but he is full of information.  There is lots of freedom on papers, but it's hard to figure out what he's looking for when he grades.  Overall, a good prof.
Good teacher, interesting class, HOWEVER, make sure your papers agree with what he wants to hear. Don't try to write anything original.
The best english professor at Pepperdine.  Incredibly knowledgeable.
great guy... awesome teacher... very caring and knowledgable.  made summer school worth-while and even enjoyable!

By far one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine!! He took not-so-interesting literature, and did his best to make it somewhat exciting for us. Most importantly, he truly cares about his students! I would love to have him for another class!

He is a real caring teacher.  He loves the material and really wants you to learn it.  Sometimes his lectures get boring but it could have been the material (Puritan literature isn't very exciting).  He does a lot of discussions.
One of my favorite professors!  His classes are hard but you learn a lot and are really challenged in them.
He did an excellent job in making the material interesting and relevant. He is really concerned for his students and their opinions.

My absolute favorite teacher hands down that I have ever had.  He is a very smart man but very willing to listen and very open to new ideas.  I was fortunate enough to study overseas with him.  I will never forget that.

Dr. Ditmore is GREAT.  I took both of his Great Books classes.  He loves the material, and gives constructive criticism on papers.  His courses are difficult, but well worth the effort -- I learned more in his classes than in any other Pepperdine course.
helped me more with writing than any other professor
No Comments
Love this guy! He's really knowledgable. Lots of papers, but well worth it!
No Comments
No Comments

Donna is a fantastic teacher. I would take this class again in a heartbeat. I took it abroad, so the course was a lot faster and more information, but I was still able to score well with her teaching. There is a lot of studying involved but Donna makes it so worth it.

This is the best professor I have ever had. She pushes you to succeed, unlike any other professor. It is a tough course, but if anyone can get you through it, it is her. She is the GOAT!!!!!!!! WE LOVE DONNA! She is the most caring, hardworking, and engaging professor. Overall amazing human being too
Dr. Nofziger is one of the most enthusiastic professors I know at Pepperdine. She's very inspirational and will get you excited about science.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Nofziger is so passionate about teaching that she makes a tough class worth it. There are a lot of extra credit opportunities so even if you do bad on a test once you can bring up your grade. The tests are very hard and nitpicky so make sure you get 100% on other assignments so you have a buffer. Study for the first test so ur not surprised!

The class is hard, but Dr. Nofziger is available outside of class and really wants to help everyone succeed. There are frequent pop quizzes and tests are pretty difficult, but the class is enjoyable and Dr. Nofziger is so fun and passionate while teaching!
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Nofziger is one of Pepperdine's gems! Her lectures are very interesting, but fast-paced. Really cemented my decision to study biology. She was very accessible outside class and always willing to help. This class is a lot of work, but if you study a little every day and study hard 1-2 weeks before the tests, you will do great. Highly recommend.

She really cares about your success in the class and is a genuinely good person. The pop quizzes are not fun, but they keep you accountable and prepare you for exams. If you read before class, pay attention in lectures, and fill out study guides after it is easy to get an A/B. Lectures are not mandatory, but you will not pass if you skip class.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: She is nice but the class is rough... so many students end up dropping the class and of those who stay a great part end up with a very low grade - she is passionate about the subject but makes it very challenging to understand ps. I am an A student
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She was super conscious of the difficulties of online class and was always adjusting to make the class better for us. She gave lots of short quizzes and pretty easy homework assignments so that we could get points and boost out grades. Cell bio is an extremely hard class no matter what. Not accessible through email, but is helpful in office hours.

Maybe she's great when in person, but taking her class online was horrible. She expects you to be "studying like crazy every single day", has quizzes at the beginning of the period extremely often, and makes you feel dumb for asking a lot of questions. The exams are crazy hard and almost no one gets As, but she doesn't curve. Not recommended.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I had Dr. Nofziger for cell bio last fall. She was so supportive and willing to help outside of class. Before the tests, she would even invite us to her house to have a quick cram sesh. MAKE SURE YOU DO THE STUDY GUIDES BEFOREHAND !! The tests are basically the study guides, but they are DENSE! Other than that, Nofziger is just a joy to learn from.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I took BIOL108 as my lab science, and Dr. Nofziger was everything I could hope for in a science professor. She is passionate, inspiring, enthusiastic, and intelligent. She wants to see her students succeed and she does her best to adapt the class in order to make it fair for students. It is difficult, but I learned so much and had a great time.

Dr. Nofziger is the best teacher I have ever had. She's very clear about what's expected of students, so as long as you're attending lectures and studying as you go like she recommends, you will do fine in this class. I definitely want to have her again before I graduate! Great lecturer that makes biology interesting

Amazing person and amazing professor despite how challenging the class is. Do the study guides as you go or you WILL NOT get an A. Tough class but wonderful experience overall and will take her classes in the future
SHE'S AMAZING I LOVE HER. :)

This class was definitely challenging. Dr. Planck does want her students to succeed but, at least this semester, she wasn't really on top of her game. She is super passionate about biology and the class was enjoyable, but it was very VERY hard to succeed in it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She is an absolutely amazing professor... probably my favourite ever! Don't get me wrong - she's hard, real tough BUT she's so so helpful so never hesitate to ask questions! She's also HILARIOUS, her lectures are amazing. Don't skip them!!! You learn so much during every single one of em. Study long in advance for exams... she packs a lot in them!

She is was not only a great and passionate professor, she is an amazing woman. If you don't walk away from her class loving her, you did something wrong. She is an incredible person. Just do your work and go to her if you ever need any help and you will get the grade you deserve and earned.

Dr. Plank is the best teacher at Pepperdine. She is passionate about her students as well as the material she teaches. She is one of the most brilliant, inspiring people I have met and goes above and beyond to get to know each student and encourage them to do their best. I would re-take this class every semester if I could!
Very helpful. Did poorly on the first test but she helped me comeback. Her class challenged me and forced me to study. She was passionate about what she taught and wanted us all to succeed.

Plank is a great professor, she really delivers the small school Pepperdine experience that everyone talks about. Her tests are no joke and believe her when she says you need to study as you go and not cram. The best thing I ever did was record class and listen to it while filling out my study guides. All of the information is NOT in the book.
This lady is amazing. She is so passionate about the subject and teaches in a way that brings life to parts of cell biology that are not exciting.

Great teacher, very helpful. I recommend going to her office hours if you need help because she is great with advice and study tips. You need to read the book and study and her class is definitely worth it.

I took the first part of the class and withdrew because I decided science was not my thing. Having said that, know this: you HAVE to have a good science background to take this class. But it's not all grueling work...Professor Plank was amazing and shows a lot of care for her students. If you are sure you want to take the class, take her section!

Always go to class, pay attention and take notes. She uses every minute of class because theres a lot of information. She teaches quickly but is very clear and always willing to explain if you have questions. Extremely nice and funny. Invites students to her house for reviews before tests. Great lab also, lets you design your experiments. Love her!
No Comments
One of the best teachers at Pepperdine in so many aspects.  Take any and all of her classes that you can!

Loved her! She loved her subject and was always available for help and questions. Hard class...studied the most for her classes. Pay attention, keep up with the reading, and memorize those crazy study guides!!!

I can't really follow her in class, but the material is not difficult and her study guides and homework prepare you for the tests. Memorize the study guides!!! She's a lot of fun and really helpful. Try to visit her outside of class.
dr. plank is one hot lady. take her class, learn from her, and laugh with her too.
hard class, but great teach, actually made class semi-interesting and well, that's it.
The lady is HOT...made me wanna come to class each week!

Teaches one of the harderst classes at Pepperdine, but guess what, everyone is passing.  She is very good at explaining material, working with students outside of class, and being one of the best professors ever.  Take her!!!
Great personality!  Enthusiastic, clear, and very willing to give extra time to those who don't get something
i love her. she is awesome. she makes learning fun and she lectures in a conversational style which helps you learn better.
shes so awesome :)

Dr Caldwell supervised a Pepperdine independent studies Internship I had at Georgetown’s CSIS during my senior, year. He helped me learn, benefit and growth then and thirty years later when i returned to finish at UCSD 30 years later. His wisdom,
knowledge, and caring guidance is unparalleled, then and now.  A gem.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: This man is amazing, though I am sad to say I had him for his last semester only because I can't take any class of his again. Dr. Caldwell was a dignified, respected, and inspiring man. His stories were uplifting and informative all at once, and his lectures were some of the best of any professor I've ever had.

This professor is a real gem. I have taken him for two classes now and have another set up for next semester. Please read about his credentials through a google search or check out some of the books he's written. He's more than qualified to teach us. Pepperdine is lucky to have him. Very kind, very knowledgable, very wise. Just be on time :)

Dr. Caldwell was a standout during my years at Pepperdine.  I took him after spending a year in Heidelberg and was so glad I did.  The he man KNOWS international relations and his lectures are packed with illuminating information, they actually make you feel like you understand the complexities of the modern world.  You NEED to take his class.

Probably the hardest exams I've taken yet. There are only two exams in the semester, so it is basically everything that you have learned up to that point. Get ready for long nights and I would suggest you REALLY read the text. He ask's questions about things that were mentioned in chap. 8 etc. VERY difficult course, but it was worth it.
He's ok, but he's well past his prime.  Very, very arrogant and nauseatingly egotistical.
Great professor! Has a wealth of knowledge and experience. Is humble enough to admit when he doesn't know something. Tests are very reasonable and you actually learn in class.

Professor Caldwell is a genius lecturer: Clear, concise, and clever. If you follow his rules, study hard, and show interest in the class, you will do fine. Absolutely great professor, he even helps me out after graduation. Honestly, what professor does that?Highly recommend this respected professor.

I was actually terrified to take his class, but getting an A is totally doable. He will make you work, but with a fair amount of effort you can easily get good grades in his class! On the midterm you will have to make educated guesses on some of the questions, because he will ask you about quotes and names you've never seen before. Tests on details

I was scared to take his class, people have told Me that he's the hardest professor in pepperdine. He actually wasnt that hard, his lectures are very organized and super clear. Just do you work, watch whatever videos he asks you to and  most importantly attend class. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!! professor Caldwell is the best.

Professor Caldwell is a difficult but fair professor; he always expects his students to come prepared and is able to keep everyone engaged in the subject. He is really helpful outside of class and always willing to encourage his students. If you work in his class, you will see the results.

Dr. Caldwell really knows what he's talking about, and the class is therefore extremely interesting. He does have a liberal slant in all his lectures, but he does present both sides. I don't understand why everyone says he's so difficult---the class is pretty easy if you show up and pay attention. Take this professor and learn from the best!

Caldwell is def not a prof whos class youd wanna slack in,but hes my fav prof!No quizzes,only had 2 tests & 2 papers in his POSC 542.Study cuz you wont get a study guide,but he does have a review session.Outlines his lectures so theyre easy to follow & hes very clear about what he wants.Also gives breaks in class.Def take him again,hard but fun!

Dr. Caldwell is a great person! Not only do I consider him one of my favorite professors, but also one of my favorite people at Pepperdine. Extremely knowledgeable person! After taking Intl. Relations and U.S. Foreign Policy, I understand a great deal more about the world than I did before.
Dr. Caldwell was my Freshmen seminar teacher and advisor 17yrs. ago.  I am still using things I learned in his class with the classes I teach today.

The one professor I remember from Pepperdine. As a creative writing major, I was out of place in his class but I learned more in his class than in any of my other classes. He cares about his students AND about his subject. He invited us to his house for dinner, always made himself available outside of class. Incredible teacher.

Professor Caldwell is an extremely knowledgable and caring professor.  He's always willing to meet with students out of class and is a great advisor. His courses are challenging, but well worth the work.  In class work varied, including discussion, lectures, and videos.  This is not a class you can skip the reading in.

He is very intelligent and is always open to talk if you need help.  He is a tough grader and has favorites; but you will learn a lot in his class.  Don't slack off or miss class...you will be penalized!
Super hard. Keep up with your reading. Really smart guy. Passionate about students, teaching. Recommended if you want to learn, work hard.
No Comments

Pompous & increasingly biased, almost to the point of being illegitimate.  Treats students like children.  Spouts off the same meaningless statistics in EVERY ONE of his classes; if you've had one of his classes, then you've had them all.  A good professor to take once, but I would go for Williams if you really want an unbiased, interesting course.

WAY TOO HARD!!!!...pompous...doesn't give you a real chance.  I personally did not learn much in this class.  Basically a waste of time and a frustrating class to take.  Would not recommend it at all.....ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!
He is a good teacher but not much classroom discussion. The class had a large focus on Terrorism. He is a hard grader and is extremely knowledgable. Is helpful outside of class.

Dr. Caldwell, is an amazing professor who sincerely cares about the classes he teaches and his students. He a great resource who will go out of his way both in college and out. He is demanding, but its a challenge, he pushes for your best.

I had Dr Caldwell for a class in the Masters progream back in the 80's.  He is one of the top 2 teachers I ever had and I have had a lot.  He was very organized and his lectures were great!! If you have a chance to take a class from him, DO IT.  He was a great guy to just talk to also.

Caldwell excpects you to come to class prepared.  He will call on you particularly when it is clear you have not read.  His courses are not hard; you just have to keep up with the work.  He is always available for advising and one of the most helpful prof's around.
Ton of work, know your stuff every day, be prepared to argue.  I disagreed all the time and got an A.  Willing to help you do well.  Very brilliant.  I wish more Pep. professors were like him.

Caldwell is exactly what a college professor should be like; his int'l relations class is excellent. He knows so much about the topic and challenges you to work hard and think. The class is rewarding, but not for lazy people. Excellent professor!

A pompous teacher who still thinks he's at Stanford. On the flipside, he genuinely cares about what he is doing and loves his subject. Some of the questions on his exam come from left-field. Just do the reading and go to class. Somehow, you'll survive.
No Comments
No Comments
Very smart, very challenging, very gifted teacher. He makes you work, but rewards you for doing so. I had him for at least 2 upper division Poli Sci courses, and really enjoyed them.
Great Professor

He's incredibly knowledgeable and is highly invested in seeing his students succeed and grow academically and personally. He respects those who work hard-If you're a serious student he'll show you respect irregardless of your political views.Great prof!
Extremely helpful and KNOWLEDGEABLE!!! It doesn't matter whether or not you agree with him, if you are a good student, you'll get a good grade.
Way smart!  Should teach at Harvard or Stanford

Dr. Wertheimer is an exceptional educator whose attention to detail and compassionate teaching create a welcoming environment. She engages students, making complex concepts accessible. Her supportive nature and responsiveness enhance learning. I highly recommend her classes to anyone seeking a valuable and enriching educational experience.

Dr. Wertheimer is an exceptional professor who genuinely cares about her students' success. Her engaging and passionate teaching style makes learning enjoyable and inspiring. I am grateful for her guidance and unwavering support. I recommend her to students who want to thrive, as she fully dedicates herself to helping you achieve your goals!

I described the professor as easy because she is so supportive and warm. However, the class requires a lot of work; so, the class might be on the more difficult side. Keep the Behavior Change Project simple. Dr. W. managed the online class environment well; everyone was engaged--not just a few people. I would 100% take any class she offered.

If you have the opportunity, definitely take Dr. Wertheimer's class.  The class is challenging, but in the best way possible. I learned an incredible amount and I feel like a better student and therapist after finishing the course. You will receive incredible feedback and support. I wish she taught more classes, because I would sign up!

The class itself was assignment heavy, but Dr. Wertheimer did a fantastic job of preparing us for everything. The detailed feedback and encouragement on every single assignment helped immensely. I highly recommend taking her, you will learn A LOT!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Beverly Wertheimer is a remarkable professor with an exemplary work ethic. She is articulate, thorough, and highly knowledgeable about the course material. She is a warm source of support in that she prioritizes student success, communicates with compassion, and makes her students feel valued. I am honored to have been able to learn from her!

I highly recommend Professor Beverly Wertheimer!! Exceptional in both teaching and personal qualities, her passion, and unique teaching style not only ignite genuine enthusiasm but also make each lecture interesting and engaging. She fosters meaningful connections and goes above and beyond for student success. She truly is a gem in academia.

comment:
Professor Wertheimer is organized, thoughtful, and engaging. She provided timely, thorough, consistent, and constructive feedback that helped me learn and improve.

comment: Dr. Wertheimer is a gem at Pepperdine. Honestly, we don't deserve her! I cannot express how grateful I am for her uplifting, yet constructive feedback. Her positivity is radiant and inspirational. PLEASE take Dr. Wertheimer!! Seriously, I never write reviews here but I had to because she is the absolute best at her job and you will learn so much!

Profesor Wertheimer has been one of my favorites at Pepperdine! comment: Dr. Wertheimer is clearly an expert in the field. She is open and shares great information. She makes the material relevant and is incredibly supportive. Dr. Wertheimer is one of a kind, and she will leave you feeling inspired after this course is done. She knows the material like the back of her hand and explains it in a way that's easily digestible. She provides prompt and excellent feedback and guides you along the way through the assignments. Definitely take her class.

I had been unenthused about PSY 659, but Dr. Wertheimer turned it into a highlight of my curriculum. She promised us that if we worked with her and did what we were required, she would do everything she could for us to prosper. Professor Wertheimer always engaged the class in many mediums, including Google Whiteboard, break-out discussions, exciting lectures, etc., which made the course and the material more interesting. Dr. Wertheimer has a remarkable ability to make complex literary concepts accessible and relatable to her students. comment: Professor W pushes you while modeling her best with humble integrity. She is prepared, informed, and personable. Her care and experience bring a higher level of interest to the material.

Prof. Beverly Wertheimer is the best professor in Pepperdine's Online Psychology program. She is exceptionally engaging during lectures, which makes class fly by. She is also very inspirational and taking her class has inspired me to take what I've learned into the real world.

Dr. Wertheimer is a fantastic professor who truly cares about her students! She takes the time to give detailed feedback and helps students develop the best work they can :) I highly recommend her, especially if you appreciate a professor who will challenge you to do your best and support you.

Professor Wertheimer is absolutely incredible! From her detailed lectures, to her incredible knowledge, to her inspirational and heart warming care for each and every student. I really enjoyed class with Professor Wertheimer. She is a fantastic lecturer and made sure the course was very interactive, which I appreciated. comment: Great professor that cares about the student's success. Always gives helpful feedback and class is always interesting to participate in.
Awesome professor who can teach you a lot. Very knowledgeable about the field and very patient. I enjoyed her lectures and insight. A very comprehensive course. Highly recommend!

comment: Professor Wertheimer is one of the most interesting professors I have come across. She has a deep and personal understanding of complex ideas, and she is very eager to convey and transmit that to her students. A true Teacher, and strikingly bright.

Prof. Wertheimer is well prepared for every class, provides a safe space for discussion and makes the material interesting and relevant. Professor Wertheimer was extraordinary! She was very knowledgeable about the information, and delivered it with such enthusiasm. I would absolutely recommend this professor.

Professor Wertheimer gives great feedback and is very knowledgeable. She is always available after class or during office hours if you need extra support.  She is very kind and really wants her students to succeed. You can tell this isn't just a job for her; she cares about her students.

comment: I really loved this class and learned so much. Professor Wertheimer is very organized and well-prepared and the class is well-paced and not a lot of heavy lecturing. Very sweet and caring professor. Knows what she's talking about. Makes class interactive and fun.

Dr. Wertheimer is an outstanding educator and facilitator. Her demeanor and facilitation style established a welcoming environment to engage in the content and grasp complex concepts. comment: Professor Wertheimer is a caring, dedicated professional who provides a safe learning environment. comment: Professor Wertheimer is amazing. She responds to all emails and provides great feedback on assignments. She  reviews all material in-depth (and reiterates information that will be on the midterm!) Review her feedback, apply them, take notes, and you will pass! Highly recommend Professor Wertheimer and would take her again for future classes.
Professor Wertheimer clearly cares about her students and puts a great deal of time and effort into her feedback. I'd love to take another class from her. Highly recommend.

Professor Wertheimer has been one of my favorite professors in both undergraduate and graduate school. She is caring, knowledgeable, professional, and has very interactive lectures. I would certainly recommend her to other students.
This professor is on their game.  Highly engaging.  Caring while requiring academic rigor. Would take the course again.  Critical information.

Prof. Wertheimer was fantastic. She has great command over the material and presents in an engaging way with real-world examples. The classes were interactive and interesting. He is a perfect teacher.
Phillip Freeman is one of the greatest professors at Pepperdine because of how engaging his presentations are. Never a dull moment in that class.

Omg. This man made me enjoy history, and I hate history. I had absolutely no reason to go to his lectures bc there was literally no hw, but I went FOR FUN. Tests are super easy, no papers, no homework. a take home midterm + test, and an in-class final. I loved this class and wish I could take all my HUM requirements with Freeman. TAKE HIS CLASS.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Freeman is the sweetest. You can tell that he genuinely cares and is passionate bout what he teaches. There were two take-home midterms and the final was based on the last three weeks of class. The only homework was readings for each class. Overall, Freeman is a genuine and thoughtful person who I would recommend to anyone.

Dr. Freeman is a great lecturer-- he is clearly very passionate about what he teaches and it makes his lectures very engaging. Readings are all online and tests are very fair. Workload is super easy to balance with other classes. Take his class if you can!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: funniest and most chill dude ever. i took it in elkins so not much 1-on-1 time but his lectures are easy to follow and constantly makes jokes or just says rly unintentionally funny stuff. only 2 grades are midterm and final, but if you show up and pay attention to the lectures and do the readings you'll be fine. one of the few stress-free classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: One of the few profs that treats a GE like it should be treated. Super chill, really passionate, and pretty easy so long as you study and do the readings. Class consisted of 50% midterm (online) and 50% final, so you really need to stay on top of the material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I took his class in Elkins and, to be honest, I rarely attended. That being said, I did very well on his midterm. As long as you catch up on lectures you miss from your friends, the class is not hard to pass.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: TAKE FREEMAN. Class was pre-recorded. No homework, only exams. He's a pretty easy grader. He had an optional review session once a week where he basically gives you everything you need for the exam. The exams were two essay questions, directly from the lectures. He gives you multiple days to complete exam. EASY A. Great professor and fun guy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He was super fun and easy. Apparently the other teachers were super hard and he made this class somewhat interesting, however it would be hard to make me love this class. A lot of reading, but I barely read anything and still did great.

Professor Freeman's lectures are very interesting. The grade is consists of one three papers, which are not very hard but absolutely thought-provoking. You have to read the text he assigned, or you will have nothing to write about in the exams.

Professor Freeman is so sweet! His class was all asynchronous - he had pre-recorded lectures 2x a week and readings 2x a week. The lectures are super interesting and he cracks jokes all the time. There are 2 midterms and the final, each of which consists of 2 essays that we had a week to write. He is also an easy grader - highly recommend!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Take Professor Freeman! You are only graded by a test, midterm, and final, and he hints as to what is going to be tested on each during lectures. He is very knowledgable, funny, understanding, and passionate about this subject. He is such a great guy, and you won't regret taking his class!
TAKE FREEMAN IF YOU CAN!! GREAT PROFESSOR! He is so kind and his class is actually so interesting, he care so much about what he teaches!

Professor Freeman is so passionate about what he teaches and it makes his lectures really interesting. Hes super cheerful and his powerpoints are really helpful. Theres a lot of outside reading, but its mostly interesting. He also gives you tons of time to work on the tests! DEFINITELY take this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: I love professor Freeman. He is really passionate about teaching and loves what he talks about every lecture. He is very personable and loves talking to people outside of class. He is willing to help you do whatever you need to succeed. As long as you watch the lectures and read, you will get an A.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Philip is a great professor! You can tell he's really passionate about his job and is really knowledgeable about the subject. He's entertaining, especially for a big lecture class. The readings are usually short and he provides them so you don't have to spend $100 bucks for a textbook you won't read. if you go to the review session you'll do well.

Professor Freeman is probably the sweetest professor I've ever had. He cares so deeply for the success of each of his students and is so passionate about what he does. I had him during a time of tragedy, and he checked in with every one of us almost daily to make sure we were doing alright and not being overwhelmed. Absolutely take his class!!

Professor Freeman is clearly passionate about what he does. Embrace this class, because he actually cares about what he's doing. It's not too hard, but you will probably have to review a bit for the class. Go to class and read over the notes a couple times and you should be good for the test. He's so nice and I love that he actually cares.

Phillip is a sweet guy who loves the subject. I enjoyed the class. However, I am a history major so if you hate history you may not like it as much. Technically, this course is "test-heavy" and "reading heavy" but there aren't really A TON of either. It's basic and the (4, 30-q) tests are NOT hard if you just attend class and do the reading.

He's such a super nerd, it's adorable. He clearly loves what he teaches. Super straightforward. Entire grade is based on 3 exams. Do the readings, show up, take good notes, and go to the study session a week before the exam (grade saver) and you'll get an A. Tests are super easy. Don't overthink it. Provides almost all readings online for free.

Learned a lot about western culture in Dr. Freemans class. The negative thing about his class is that grades are solely based on the four exams which seems easy but if you do not do well on one of them its a big deal. He does not even round up grades which means if you get 89.9 its still a B and he made it clear that grades are nonnegotiable:(
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: extremely passionate and definitely knows his stuff. not the most engaging lecturer and his voice is on the softer side. the class and tests are pretty easy and as long as you take notes you should be fine. do the readings assigned because they will be on the test! teaches at a good pace. exams are 30 Q
Very caring man. Decent Professor. Knows his stuff and is passionate. The entire course is memorization and reading. Difficult for me. For this who excel in these areas, fairly easy class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Freeman is a good guy and incredibly smart. He changed his class this semester and it is now solely graded on 4 exams, zero extra credit. There is no longer a textbook. Very reading heavy. If you went every class and read every reading you can get an A. But it's an 8am. GO TO THE TA REVIEW SESSIONS. Can pull a B with just TA review and some study.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Freeman gives amazing lectures, and it is evident that he is passionate about what he does. This is not a hard class if you pay attention in class, and do the outside readings. He is an incredibly smart man, and his humor grows on you throughout the semester. Choose Dr. Freeman for Hum 111, you won't regret it, and you will learn so much.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Freeman is an amazing professor that is clearly very passionate about the class topics. The class is fairly easy, if you show up to class and read the textbook, you'll do just fine. He only bases his grades on the four exams, so don't skip readings. I would definitely take his class again!
I had a great experience with professor Freeman! He is fair and teaches at an easy to follow pace, without asking anything unreasonable from his students. I felt that his class was very easy.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Freeman loves his job, and it is very obvious. I did not read the book and got an A in the class. If you go to class, and take notes, you will pass. You will also gain a new perspective that history skips over. If you write down what he says about each slide, and study that, you will be good.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Freeman is obviously knowledgable about what he's teaching. However, he is not a very engaging lecturer and he often jumps around in what he's teaching. The tests are not easy, with random questions appearing that haven't been studied. Using the study guide alone will not get you the grade you want. Be prepared to do a crazy amount of reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Freeman is a great teacher. His class is fairly simple and doesn't require more work than the typical GE class. His tests got easier, and had very fair questions. He is remarkably kind, and the class is interesting enough to stay awake at 8 am.

Freeman is a great lecturer and is very knowledgable of the subject but when it comes to his tests the class got a bit difficult for me. There is a TON of reading and a lot of material is covered at once. He tries his best to ask some big picture questions but his Final exam was extremely picky in terms of information. Go to the TA review sessions!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class was super difficult. He expects you to be a world historian like he is. Also, there is a ton of reading, and so much is covered. There are no study guides and he basically expects you to know everything, but then asks RANDOM questions on the exams. The exams are short like 20 questions so if you miss one or two your grade already drops.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: There is some reading to be done, but he is a great lecturer and has study sessions that helps a lot for the exams. His exams are pretty easy too because he just asks for the general big picture and not for specific details. Would definitely recommend.

Dr. Smith is HILARIOUS and SUPER KIND (she rly cares about you). She is very understanding and gives little assignments, but can be an annoying grader in some ways. Her projects/assignments are fairly easy and don't take a lot of time. I didn't do any reading, and I was fine. Final is the easiest thing in the entire world. Would recommend her!
All I can say is amazing teacher. Not too much HW, treats students fairly, and not a harsh grader. If you have the option to take one of Dr. Smith's classes, take it.

I took her American Lit class (Eng 330) and it was amazing! The class isn't too much work, and the readings are very interesting. She is very personable and has a great sense of humor. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Absolutely incredible class and professor.
Smith is so great and very funny. It's a pretty easy class and I can tell she wants you to do good.

Dr. Smith was one of the best professors I had at Pepperdine. She is so funny and always put a smile on the classes face at 8 am. Her class consisted of 4 in class writings and she offers a make up if you don't show up to the class when the assignment was due. We had two projects: Genesis Lab group project Special Collections individual best profes

She is excellent! I wouldn't say the class subjects are easy, but she makes them easy by being a great teacher. She is understanding, reasonable, caring, and creates a comfortable class environment. She also tries to make the subject more engaging through unique projects instead of essays. I'd highly recommend taking her course!
Overall, she is a very nice and chill person. There will be a lot of readings and writings to do in this class, but I think she is an easy grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The best teacher ever. I had her for my spiritual autobiography seminar and it was such an easy class. I am spiritual and loved learning more but I know people who are not spiritual at all and still loved the class and got a great grade. She is very fun and super caring. You can come to her about pretty much anything. She loves when you participate

Took her for spiritual autobiography seminar, great intro to Pepperdine. She is so funny and you have four easy assignments through the semester. Everyone chooses an author from the text and presents about them, so most of class is discussing the reading. She shortens the class most days and gives you two weeks off for midterms. Wonderful person!

Prof Smith is an exceptional teacher. She gives great feedback and truly wants you to succeed. I feel like I became a much better writer taking her class, she makes writing fun and is always there to help. If you take Eng 101, TAKE HER. She grades semi hard so you have to work for your grade but an A is very doable!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: good sense of humor, very encouraging, available to chat whenever necessary, cares about you as if you were her child.

I took ENG 101 with Dr Smith this fall semester on zoom. She was a great professor and super funny and easy to talk to. Half of the classes we met on zoom and half we had time to work on assignments/free periods. She gives great feedback on papers and you will definitely grow as a writer. She is the best English teacher for ENG 101!!

Dr. Smith is by far the best teacher I've had at Pepperdine. She is SO funny and personable, which makes class fun. Her expectations for GE students are not very high, which is great. I actually felt like I could succeed in her class as a non-English major. TAKE HER. You won't regret it.

Professor Smith is a fantastic English professor- she is always ready to help if you have a question about a paper. The way she organizes the class is genius too: she increases the difficulty paper by paper (mostly by adding extra steps). She is funny, engaging and really wants you to do well. Great teacher for a GE. She will make you love English.
She wants you to write good papers, and sometimes is a tough grader. Lot of writing, to be expected. The writing center really helps with your papers!
Do your assignments and keep up on your reading to be ready for pop quizzes! They're worth a lot! Great humor and keeps the class interesting. One of the best teachers at Pepperdine.
Such a well-educated, hilarious professor. She roasted me a bunch of times but I think it was all out of love?... Loved her class. Read and you will do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Prof. Smith is very fair when offering the first year seminar class, Spiritual Autobiography. You take away a lot from the course while not feeling overwhelmed by the workload. She is very fair and willing to help. She's the best.

I love and miss Lisa Smith. She's hilarious and will call you out in class. She's super clear about the assignments and they're not hard. This class was about finding your vocation. If you have a chance, please take this class with Lisa you will not regret it.
I loved her class! The papers were challenging but that's to be expected. I always looked forward to going to class, it was fun and engaging.

I love Dr. Smith! She is a great professor who is engaging, organised and ensures that she is available to students whenever they need. She has a clear grading rubric for each assignment, and as long as you pay attention in class, take time writing you papers, and get assignments in on time, you'll do well. She is so understanding and a great lady.

Professor Smith is the best English 101 Professor at Pepperdine. Take her if you can! She is not the easiest grader, and getting an A is extremely hard or nearly impossible. If you try you should at least get a B+ or even an A- which is good for English 101. Utilize her office hours and in-class feedback and you will do well in your essays!

Dr Smith is very organized, clear, always puts grades on courses, but corny at times and likes to tease the students. She puts a lot of sample papers on courses, give us clear grading criteria, and straightforward. I improved a lot throughout her class. However, this class is not as easy as you would think.
rating_tags: Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Would take again

comment: Dr. Smith is hilarious! She makes the class very interesting and engages with the students. She is clear about she she wants/expects from you and helps you wherever you may be lacking.

I don't like English/Lit classes but her GE literature class was one of my best decisions. There is a reason she is rated so highly.  Funny, personable, and clear cut, I would take her class again.  No tests, the class is structured around 6 in class writings (drops the lowest), and 3 big essays (2 mid semester, 1 final). Would recommend to anyone.

Smith is a wonderful lady! She's very nice and if you approach her for help she will never turn you down. The only thing you are graded on is 4 papers and 10 in-class 10pt writing assignments so it's very important to do well on everything. She grades her papers very harsh so you have to write in a style that pleases her. My writing really improved

Very easy to understand, sticks to the points (doesn't tangent off), interacts with her students and makes the subject enjoyable. Her jokes makes it easier to remember the materials in class so you actually learn a lot and remember them. Her study guide for the final is clear and cut to the point. One of the best class I've had at Pepperdine!

AMAZING PROFESSOR!!! I did well in English in high school, and I did just as well in her class. If you come to class and pay attention to what she wants in a paper, you'll do fine. She is very approachable and helpful. Take her class!

Dr. Smith is the best English teacher I have ever had!  She makes learning about literature fun because she is so laid back and understands that for her students it isn't their favorite subject.  She begins each class telling a fun story for about 10 minutes. Great Prof! TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!

Dr. Smith is an amazing professor She wants her students to do well and will do anything to help them achieve success. Her exams are easy and her essay prompts are pretty easy as well. She makes literature an interesting subject, and the other two classes ive taken from her were amazing as well. Take her if you can!!!!
I am a freshmen here and by far Lisa Smith has been one of my favorite teachers on campus.  She makes class fun and interacts with the class.  BTW, when in class, ask about the Philadelphia Eagles.

One of the most FUN English teachers that I have ever had. She even helped me write a paper for another activity that I had going on on the side. If you want to get an A, and have a really fun time doing it, definitely take Smith!

Very understandable, clear, enjoys conversation, kept things interesting and fun - also not too much older than us and with some young kids - great class - and always available for feedback or questions regarding papers or anything else really

This class was easy. Lots of notes were taken in this class. We only had one test the whole semester and it was very difficult; however, the amount of group work I participated in during class was able to boost my grade. The professor is nice and easy going!

I took her for FOR 101. Amazing professor, she is so down to earth and caring. There is a good amount of reading and homework for this class, but that's essentially all there is. We've had no tests or quizzes. As long as you truly put in the effort to get your homework done, and if you participate in class, you'll get an easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: Professor Myers is very down to earth and passionate about teaching religion! I had her for religion 100. Assignments were pretty straightforward and easy, there is a textbook that is recommended but tests are manageable even without it. She's very understanding and kind and tries to make her lectures as engaging as possible, would 100% recommend!

I had her for REL 100. She was really nice, and she's definitely dedicated to her subject, which comes across in her teaching. The class itself is lecture heavy, and you do have something due every week (but it's always super easy). However, she was a good teacher, and I would totally recommend her if you need to take REL 100.

Our class was smaller in the summer but we had a great time. I am grateful to have a religion professor who is willing to talk about hard things from a biblical perspective. Very kind and understanding.
So kind, easy grader, easy class. Just pay attention and you'll be fine.

Myers is such a  kind person.. She included lots of different types of activities, which I appreciated because I'm not a great reader. I expected smaller class sizes at Pepp, and this class was like 40+ people. That's not in her control however. I learned a lot from her and I loved that we talked about some hard stuff she wasn't afraid to get into.

Took Myers for REL100, which was her first time teaching the class, so it's understandable that she didn't have everything perfectly figured out yet, but this was way too much busy work. We had assignments due every class that took too much time and effort and that none of us got absolutely anything from. Boring lectures, boring assignments.
Amazing woman who understands that this is a GE and not an upper-division religion course. Take her over the summer if you can, I did and it was super chill.

TAKE MYERS IF YOU CAN!!!!!! She's amazing and understands that this is a GE course and treats it like that. Put in some effort and it's an easy A, she really doesn't ask for a lot. She's very kind and genuinely cares about what her students think. Easy daily assignments, a couple of tests, and larger projects but all easy if you put in some effort.

I took REL102 with Dr. Myers over the summer and God bless her. She truly understands that this is a GE and was very easy on the material while also being very engaging through lecture. There were a couple of group projects and the exams were based on short essay response questions. One of the easiest classes I've taken at Pepp, she's the best!

I've had Myers for two classes now and she really cares about us! I learned a ton in this class but I worked hard especially on the exams. Ask her for help she will do what it takes to help you succeed.

For somebody who knows the Bible decently well, this class was rather easy. Definitely a lot of homework, you are required to do three projects during the semester which do require a decent amount of time. However, the tests were rather easy. Class times were taken up by the lecture and occasionally some in class work, however in total it was easy.
Very loving teacher who cares about her students above everything else. Her classes are basically discussions but there are projects and readings.

Tough class for a summer session but the topic was very interesting. There was so much reading. We needed more time, and I wish she had given a few less assignments. Enjoyed our discussions though, and she was very understanding about online/ distance issues.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: I loved REL301 with Myers, however, there is quite a lot of work to do. There is one group presentation assigned for the semester and must be around 10 minutes long, weekly reading reflections, and a final 8 page paper/presentation. However, she grades relatively easy. Understanding of tough situations and student burnout
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: This was such a hard summer class. There was so much to do in such a short time! The topic was interesting and there was a variety of work it was just a lot. Hard to do this class and a job too. Myers was flexible and understanding so that helped.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: Mixed feelings about REL 301 with Dr. Myers. I learned so much in the class, but her workload expectations were extreme. She expects an intense amount of reading and writing. More than other professors who teach this class. There are definitely easier professors to take REL 301 with. Only take this class is you have the extra time to devote to it.
LOTS of reading but discussion based class. I liked talking about the different topics and hearing different opinions. Wish the textbook was available online. Very nice lady.
Manageable assignments, discussion, paper
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Lots of reading from the Bible! Not a Christian, so I resent these GEs but I appreciate Myers for trying to be inclusive and open to diverse student body. Hard midterm abut use the study questions as you go rather than the week before the tests.

Her class was enjoyable. There is only one mini test, which isn't very difficult and only accounts for 5% of your final grade. Homework, on the other hand, consisted of a lot of reading and having to respond to it. Her lectures and the social presentation she assigned were both awesome.
