Our final consists of a paper along with another presentation
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Lot of homework but easy grader. Lessons are very organized and assignments are always clear. Really nice Professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I LOVED having Myers for Rel301. She cared about her students, was easy on grading and assignments, and was really passionate. My favorite class of the semester.

I liked her as a person, and her lectures were always very entertaining as well as very interesting. I thought that the class was easy but there was a lot of work and I thought some assignments were just busy work. However, I had her class online I may have enjoyed it more if we could have had in person class discussion instead of forums.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I loved being in class with her. I don't know how everyone else in my class feels but I think she is HILARIOUS! She'll make jokes about the bible and honestly life in general but its great. As far as tests go, we only had a midterm and a final and weekly reading quizzes. I'd say reading is pretty important to success but its not bad. You can do it!

I really enjoyed this class. Our class really connected and the material was interesting so I looked forward to this class. Myers taught what could be so boring with humor and creativity and allowed tough discussion without feeling like she had to provide easy answers. A favorite.

She is a very kind and understanding teacher. However, her tests are insanely difficult. You have to know the OT inside and out to get a high B on her midterm and final. She claims her tests are on the study questions even though they don't really help and only cover 30% of the test . Pretty difficult for an unpopular and unnecessary GE.

Hard class because material on tests is from lecture, class discussions AND the textbook. Most of her bad reviews are from people who didnt use the textbook- if you dont use the textbook you will struggle. Very kind lady, super hard grader. Her rubrics for papers very detailed. Lots of work but I liked the class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: This class is difficult, but if you keep up on the readings and listen to the lecture its not bad. Midterm was way too long and hard but she calibrated grades by removing questions a certain percentage missed. Do the work- youll be fine. Needs to clarify study guides but overall tries to make boring material interesting.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Myers is a wonderful person and is extremely knowledgable, but her class is extremely difficult for a GE. Very difficult to get full credit on any papers. Absent in classlower grade. Tests are extremely difficult and are not even close to similar to the 5 page study guides she provides. Class average on two midterms was 58%. Hard to get an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Cari Myers is the nicest teacher IN CLASS, where she lectures and has discussions. Outside though, nothing she says matters. Tests are way too hard for a GE, or even if it's your major. One test avg. was sub D. Her lectures, textbook and study guides have nothing on this test. Studied for 10+ hours per test and still barely passed. Avoid!! No EC
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Awful. Avoid at all costs. You WILL get a B- and nothing higher. Exams are like extreme mental games. Nice lady horrible professor and horrible class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Dr Myers is a good person but awful teacher. No matter how hard you try you will never get 100% on any of her five papers or Jesus in film project. Class average on the exams were below 60 percent and would not curve and very hesitant on extra credit. Exams take nothing from her five page study guides and lecture notes are not helpful at all.

Dr. Myers is a wonderful lady outside of the classroom. The class is even interesting. BUT, the tests are impossible and there is SO much work. Study guides are useless...5 pages and none of it was on the test. Class avg on exam 1&2 was 58%. Also a paper due 2nd week and 2 papers due last two. Arbitrarily takes off points. Great lady horrible class
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Meyers is a super nice professor and really wants to get to know students. Very genuine, however, the class is super boring. Lots of notes and powerpoints. Go to class, pay attention, don't buy the book. It's available as an ebook at the Pepp library. Super easy essay grader, as long as you share an opinion.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: What a gem. Dr. Myers is the most tolerant, insightful, sweet professor I have had. Treat her with the respect & dignity with which she treats you & you'll be fast friends. She's there for you. Her class is discussion & lecture based. Try on the assignments & put a little heart into it, you'll do fine. One paper, one small test, one presentation.

Lectures in every class are long, he just reads off an old PowerPoint. It does not feel like a religion class, just another history class. I took religion through high school and I can strongly say that this class does not forward your faith in the slightest. Tests are extraordinarily hard and make up the heavy weight of your grade.

This professor is very caring and introduces himself to individual students. Although, a GE class should not be this difficult. I have spent 20 hours studying this week for ONE religion test. I am at my breaking point. Get ready to read, the tests are very difficult and the study guides are confusing and overwhelming.

Very nice and caring man. However, study guides and tests are difficult to fully understand. Even more difficult if you do not have a religious background. Lectures are mandatory and serve you very little, just summarizes the bible and random aspects that are not on tests. Quizzes before every class morning. Very caring though

Arguably one of the worst professors at Pepperdine. He is an awful teacher. All he does is lecture, and he is just preaching. I honestly am a big Christian too. I go in ready to learn, and he just makes me fall asleep in class. He's honestly a nice guy. The tests are weirdly impossible, and the study guides are incredibly unclear.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: One of the smartest professors I've ever had. Very knowledgeable of the bible and I'd honestly believe anything this man says.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: This was probably by far the easiest, but most boring class. Attendance is mandatory so you have to go to class and survive through the boring lectures. They usually have no substance and there are no midterms and the online quizzes that you have to do through the textbook are very easy. So to get an A, you just have to suffer through lectures.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Willis is a great prof. If you study the study guides you'll do fine but the short answer portion of his exams are pretty tough. He's a super caring professor though and wants to get to know you!

He gives you an hour to do a ten-question quiz; for every test, he gives you a study guide that tells exactly what's gonna be on the test. Yes, his wording is wired sometimes and can be tricky, but you can still easily get As even if you are not religious. Maybe some people just need to try a little harder before you start complaining?

Willis was a horrible professor. he does not care about his students and grades unfairly. as a rel 101 he assumed everyone had a very in-depth understanding of the bible and his lectures made no sense because they were theological. his tests were way too hard and his lectures were so boring

I learned so much in his class. It is hard because of the tests, but as long as you pay attention and actually go over the study guide in advance you will be fine. He is great. If you participate he will like you.

I have taken religion classes my entire life and this class was by far the hardest religion class I have ever taken. His quiz questions are kind of tricky so you really need to pay attention to exactly what the question is asking and exactly what the answers are. You need to take notes in class because the notes he provides are extremely broad
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I had Professor Willis for "Religion 101" and would recommend! Very easy going and makes an effort to get to know each student, even in a large lecture hall! Continuously makes jokes and isn't too intense when teaching the material. Aside from the weekly 10-question quizzes--which are open bible--there is little to no homework in this class.

This is an easy class if you know the bible and grew up with it. It's also easy because it's located in Elkins, our lecture hall. If you do not read the bible, you will need to read it to understand the exams since the quizzes can be found on Quizlet. I would recommend this class especially for those unfamiliar with the bible.

Professor Willis cares about the subject and his students. He is always willing to explain topics more in depth. Quizzes and tests are open book and notes. The study guides for tests are very helpful and the answers for it can be found within his daily class notes. Make sure to follow the prompt completely when writing essays for his class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr Willis is by far the best REL 101 professor! He explains the material for those that aren't familiar with the Bible already and always takes questions. Tests are open note and Bible and he gives you detailed study guides. He is SO sweet and really cares about his students. Reading quizzes before class are also open note. Take his class!
Professor Willis cares a lot about what he teaches and it really shows. The class isn't too tough and while the assignments can pop up at random times, they aren't difficult enough to stress you out.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Willis is really, really nice. I cant emphasize that enough. He really cares about what hes teaching. There are a lot of reading quizzes but theyre open Bible so theyre not hard. Theres several papers, but hes not a super tough grader so long as you follow the prompt. Definitely take this class!
Great professor. Actually cares about the students. Is willing to work with you. He has the most fantastic quiet humor. I would 10/10 recommend.

Dr. Willis is such a good guy. I loved religion 101 with him; he truly is so passionate about what he teaches and I actually enjoyed going to his Elkins class. Pretty easy tests as long as you do the study guides. Would 100% take him again.

Your fate in this class basically relies in your 3 tests (2 tests and one final). They are hard. The online weekly quizzes are easy and help you maintain your grade so aim for a 10/10 on every weekly quiz. The tests are all memorization from PowerPoints, our final was extremely hard and my grade dropped 4 points. No curve on anything whatsoever.

Here's what you need to know: There's 3 exams, first one, midterm and final. The most homework is online quizzes that are open bible. (One before each class). In class when you see things numbered on his presentations, write them down, they'll be on the tests. The tests aren't hard (matching/multiple choice) & are basically the study guide.

I'm honestly shocked by professor Willis' rating on this site. He is a wonderful professor and if you read and do the quizzes, you will be fine! He is super kind and his power points and study guides are super helpful. Do you need to memorize a few things for the exam? Yes. But if you go to class, and keep up with the work, you will get an A.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: His tests are completely memorization! You pretty much need to memorize his notes word for word to get an A on the test. He offers a good amount of extra credit which really helps in the long run ,but you still have to put in the work to get a good grade. He is a really nice man and made the effort to learn everyones name in our class of over 200.

Take him! He's hilarious, he makes class enjoyable. Don't skip class because his slides contain all the notes for his exams. There's weekly online quizzes which are way harder than those other professors give but if you study the powerpoint notes, show up, and memorize whatever is on his study guides then you'll do just fine in the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: does he shakes everyones hand? yes. does he try to remember everyones name in a 200 ppl. lecture hall? yeah. is he knowledgeable in religion? definitely, he has a PhD from Harvard. Will he ruin your GPA? YEP! He is the definition of a prof who does, "A, B, C, D, A and B only, C and A only, All of above, None of above." Good luck :)
Great person. Great professor. Tells you what you need to know. Tests are very difficult but if you study a lot you will do well. Only downside is he is not negotiable.

Dr. Willis is a caring, hard professor. He shakes everyone's hands before class, and seems to care about his students. His quizzes are tough, so make sure you do the reading. For the final, he gives you a helpful study guide.  As long as you stay on top of the reading and have a good understanding of the main topics from lectures, you'll be fine.

What a sweet professor.  My class was an 8am and I looked forward to getting up each day and coming to his class.  He knew all 200 students' names by the second day of class and tried to shake everyone's hands before each class.  He gave good notes, and the the tests were easy.  I miss having him as a professor so much.

T. Willis is an amazing religion professor... all his tests have a study guide. The study guides are always based on lecture powerpoints (have to go to class). Finish the study guide -- A on his tests. Only have 3 short assignments,  attendance is 25 points. He has themed ties and always tries to get to know everyone.

Very unhelpful, slow grader, and stingy with points. Nice person, but not the best professor. He makes his own quizzes and some of the questions are complete tricks. Would not recommend for religion 101, there's other professors that are so much better/easier.

Professor Willis is a very nice professor. His lectures are long and there are a lot of lists. You should write everything he says down. The tests are hard and are mostly lecture-based. Everything is quiz and test based for the final grade so do well on those. Its a hard class. Consume caffeine or you may fall asleep. The final is not cumulative.
I've never understood why the GE courses at Pepperdine are the hardest courses offered at the university. This one is right up there with humanities, close to impossible to achieve an A.

The course is way too difficult for a 100 level GE entry class. The teacher is so serious about the course, he assigns seats for exams in a 300 person auditorium. The exams usually have a few answers that could be right on multiple choice, to trick you. He also asks you to describe 7-8 different things in short answer. Dude needs to chill...

The class is taught similar to a major course. He gives a quiz every class that is multiple choice but there are normally 5 options for the correct answer and about 3 of the answers could be correct, this makes the quizzes very tricky and difficult. Tests are very detail specific and he expects you to go as much in depth as possible. Way too hard

She was hilarious and interesting. I had a wonderful time in her class although it is demanding and at times she is very specific about what she wants/expects. Fair grader, go in with an open mind since you must take her class to graduate.

Absolutely horrible teacher. She may (or may not) be a good person but she is rude, selfish, and hypocritical. She always shows up late and really shows she doesn't really care for her students. Worst class I've ever had on a subject matter I really like.

If you're a PR major, you can't avoid Shores for PR 380. It's a tough class but it's doable- Make the AP stylebook your LIFE, always have her look over your writing before turning it in and make your final project creative and grammatically correct. Participate in class, be creative in you writing and follow stylebook and you'll be fine.

Horrible Professor! Condescending, rude, and mean to ALL, no exceptions. Belittles students in front of the class, flip-flops on what she tells you from one week to the next, and assigns ridiculous amounts of reading/busy work.  Do NOT take this class, I wouldnt have if I'd known.
She is a nice person, but a terrible teacher. She is a really hard teacher, unless you are a baseball player. Do not take her.
She is a mean person. I have nothing nice to say about her. You must NOT take her for Speech.
She is the worst teacher I have ever had.  Do NOT TAKE her class.  It is not an option !
She is a nice person, but is prone to choose favorites.
don't TAKE HER CLASS if you don't want the worst semester. I wouldn't have taken it if i know her score earlier. Just DONT" TAKE IT. it is HORRIBLE
One big *****. Forget about taking her. If you're not her favorite then you are screwed.

Wicked Witch of the West! The worst teacher I have ever had. Shores is rude and outright mean almost every class. Do not get on her bad side, although this her only side. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE UNLESS YOU CONTRIVE PLEASURE FROM POINTLESS RULES AND CONFUSION.

grab the women and children and run for cover! Quite possibly the most bitter, disrespectful teacher I have ever encountered.  Assignments given are pure "busy work" and she has no concept of students needs or wants.  Awful, horrible, terrible.  I would leave school before enduring her class one more minute.
This woman is **** against males for one, she demands too much from the students in content of class and finally she is just condesending and loves loves loves hearing her own voice.
she must be different with her PR classes, i took her for spe 180 and it was cool, she let us mess around and i got A's on all my speeches, the tests were hard though.

Condescending, rude, and bitter are a few words that describe this woman as a professor.  I have no desire to have anything to do with PR after taking this class with her. I just wish I would have known this before so I could have avoided the knife to my GPA.
I changed my major because of this woman.
she's not as bad as some people say, but she's a very difficult grader and she's very picky about speeches.  nice person but hard class
This was her first year teaching speech. All I can say is that if you value your GPA you will run and hide. Terrible teacher. DO NOT TAKE HER.

She's a beast. Literally, one of the most condescending people I have ever encountered in my life! She is rude to her students... she reinstated a midterm even after saying we wouldn't have one. She gives wrong information and then the students get penalized. She is horrible and should be fired.

This is the WORST teacher I have ever had in my life.  She is mean, and makes all the students feel stupid.  She acts like we should know everything even before she teaches us.  She's unapproachable, unclear and an unfair grader.  I would change my major to get away from her.  Run and Hide from her!

She hits you with every little peanalty on assignments.  I have not been able to get a hold of her outside of classs, besides email.  It seems like she resents questions and ALWAYS has an attitude of "you should have known that."

i feel sorry for every journalism major who comes to pepperdine just because there is no way around taking her class.  she easily turns aspiring journalists away from the career and has an unfriendly demeanor.
She is NOT a very good grader and is not helpful.  Sometimes we may have a good conversation in the class.  You better know AP Style well, or she will give you a C or lower everytime.
horrible teacher. made me hate journalism.

misses class often.  easily one of the worst profs ive had in my 5 semesters here.  turned me away from journalism.  grading system was bad.  my guess is that she only teaches cuz her husband is the division chair or something

Pepperdine should get a clue and let this woman go...she is not meant to be a teacher, and has an awful demeanor.  When you see her or hear her name, you just groan...worst part is, there is no way of getting around her...PEPPERDINE--> GET RID OF HER!!
I basically had this same class in high school. The prof is sick alot, esp at the 10 oclock. Don't let this class turn you away from journalism.

Lighten up a bit. She is possibly one of the worst professors i have ever had. She shouldn't be teaching. A monkey could have taught me what she did. Why the hell is she always so sick. She also has the most anoying voice.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
So mean, so sarcastic, doesn't enjoy life...needs to learn from her husband!!!
The absolute worst teacher I ever had!
The worst professor I've ever had. She should not be teaching.

I tried to be open-minded about her class, as I had heard a fair share of warnings, but they all turned out to be true... The class is not structured well, and she doesn't provide clear guidelines or helpful feedback. There isn't much effort put into the lessons or assignments. Her grading doesn't reflect the lack of specificity in her guidelines.

Avoid at all costs. Elkins but attendance was still required through online polls and you only received credit if you got at least 60% of them correct. An assignment everyday based on very long readings. She wants exact answers on writing but doesn't even tell you what she wants you to say. Very boring lectures. Not class structure, just rambles.

There was homework due every class period and it required a lot of reading. She is a very nit picky grader. Lecture heavy and requires participation through polls every class. If you get polls wrong, there goes ur participation grade.

She is a very easy professor to take, but very controversial regarding her political views. She brings a lot of issues and causes debates in her class. Her lectures are easy and class is very easy as well. Decent lady.

DON'T TAKE THIS PROFESSOR, SHE IS THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD. Her entire class is based on her opinion, so if you don't agree expect to have a bad grade. She also does not grade her tests her TAs do and they will try everything to lower your grade.

While this class was fairly easy, the grading on hw/tests felt very unfair. She seems to believe there is only one right answer when most of her questions are very open-ended and subjective. She forces students to answer questions in class but then demands for better responses when she doesn't like your answers. She was kind of rude too.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Sharyl is quite the time. She taught the content well enough but assignment instructions are super vague. She also cold-calls on people during class, so beware of that. In Elkins, she uses PollEv to track attendance and participation. All lectures are posted on Zoom. Exams are open-note, and you can work with a partner on the final project.

Corrado is the WORST professor I've had at Pepperdine. Although you can google the answers on her tests, half of her questions are poorly worded and based entirely on opinion and speculation. She is incredibly condescending, rude, unreasonable, and self-important. She refuses to have a reasonable discourse w/ students or admit it when she's wrong.

this class is so pointless. she allows unlimited absences as long as you email her and can literally google answers during the tests. Her assignments are very strange and kind of hard to do well on, and there is no incentive to come to class. she is also fairly rude to her students and is condescending when questions are asked.

Don't take if you don't have to. Textbook is not required for class however, she does assign articles and movies along with assignments due each class meeting. Required lecture polls that make up a portion of grade. Must score 60% and above on lecture polls to receive participation points. Tests are open notes, recommend downloading templates
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: She mid at best.
Don't take Corrado.  For your own sake just don't do it.  So much unnecessary homework that has nothing to do with the class.

All of the assignments for this class felt like busywork. The lectures were not engaging and the polls that were required didn't add anything to the class. She frequently said things that were culturally insensitive and inappropriate during class.

The class honestly was pretty disorganized and, in my opinion, too high of expectations for a GE class, but what really bothered me was her lack of awareness or sensitivity around different cultures and identities. For a class revolving around different cultures, there were many uncomfortable comments and questions put forth by her.

Look, I dont want to trash people. But I swear, if you value your life, your sanity, your academic career, or anything at all, DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. If you dont believe me, have a private conversation with anyone from her class. It is bad. Take any professor at all over her; worst Ive encountered at Pepperdine.

She's an amazing prof, very organized, clear, and reasonable. All you have to do is *pay attention in class* and you'll get an A. She doesn't let people get away with stupid excuses, which people aren't used to in a 200-person lecture, but if you have a legit reason, she's incredibly understanding and works with you to get everything handled.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall bad teacher. DO NOT TAKE. she's a harsh grader. Her question & prompts make NO sense. Also she very rude, dismissive & patronizing when you try talking to her. Furthermore in class & how she handles the topics is extremely offensive. Worst she doesn't care & always excuses herself. I actually really enjoy HUM and she has ruined it. AVOID

She grades extremely hard and has a very unpleasant attitude. I attended every class and did all of the readings and still got average grades on my essays. Her grading is not fair and she tries to make questions more difficult than they need to be.

I hate writing bad reviews, but Corrado is honestly one of the worst professors I've had. She grades the essays way too hard and has super unclear prompts, so they're very hard to answer. She grades the tests terribly and takes off points for ridiculous reasons. She's also incredibly judgemental and condescending. I can't stand her.

There's no textbook, which is difficult for a history class, but her lectures are good. Exams are exactly what's on the study guide, not difficult at all if you study. In class essays are graded kinda harsh & stressful because you don't know the prompt beforehand. Overall you can get an A if you just study before the exams & prepare for essays

Terrible. Does not provide textbook and only relies upon class lectures, which are very unorganized and followed by class discussion. For her papers her prompts are very unclear and expects you to know everything. She grades unfairly tough for a GE class. If you want to read 5-6 hours and write paper every week then Sharyl is perfect for you!

Dr. Corrado may be the best professor I have had while at Pepperdine. She incorporates a plethora of resources and materials within her course which helps to keep things interesting. Her teaching style helps to make sense of how all things are connected throughout history. As long as you do the workand study, you will do good!

The class is very casually taught and unstructured. It makes it hard to follow along considering there's not really a specific outline or textbook for you to follow along with. She casually spews trivial information at you in lecture, then to prepare for tests pretty much leaves it to you to guess what she's looking for, so expect to get bad grades
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Monotone, long lectures, and in class quizzes online for participation credit. Very boring, especially considering if you've ever taken history you can easily pass the tests with an A/B. Do the extra credit, she will not bump your grade, not even half a point when it's crucial which is ridiculous. Never had a prof say no. Would not take her again.

Dr. Corrado's class does contain interesting information but this should not, in my opinion, give one any desire to take this course. Corrado is an unbelievably difficult grader. Also her grading system is not standardized because when her TA's grade students, they get high grades but when she grades students, they fail

Grading is not fair in this class and her expectations are unrealistic. If a TA grades your test then you should be fine if you studied, but if she grades your test best of luck. Wish this was a smaller class with a different teacher so that understanding the material was more doable.

One of the most interesting lecture styles for a history class I've been in. Professor Corrado does an amazing job at giving students a comprehensive summary. Her class is "easy" if you go to lectures, be attentive, and take good notes. Lectures are like story telling time. Her essays are decently challenging and will require some in-depth analysis

It is an easy class. She tries to make things interesting but her lecture is extremely quick. It is even hard to take notes with a laptop. But overall as long as you do the reading and homework you will get an A.

She encourages laptop usage. She is so helpful and tries to make the lectures relevant. To take attendance, though, she does multiple online polls and quizzes during class to ensure people are coming. Tests are straight out of the notes, and all the reading is from online sources. Easy is you come to class and take notes. Essays are more difficult.
This professor is very helpful and wants her students to succeed in her class.

Uses primary sources, ie youtube videos, book excerpts, old newspaper articles, instead of textbook. Edgy, likes to debate and present both sides to an argument / event. Connects ideas from what is going on all over the world. Very helpful in and out of class. Very clear, very reasonable expectations for quizzes and tests. Loves the subject.

She is really easy if you go to class and take decent notes. To study for the tests, just read thru your notes once and make flashcards for the terms she gives you. Essays are probably the most difficult to get good grades on, so I brainstormed with friends.

Prof Corrado is the easiest professor you will ever have for HUM313.  Study the terms and you will get an A on the tests.  Turn in your papers and if they are half way decent you will get an A.  She's a little scattered but she is fresh from school and still getting her groove. Great for an easy GE and GPA booster.

Possibly one of the worst professors at Pepp.  Her lectures are incomprehensible and she babbles on about tangents. Her lecture style makes her very hard to pay attention to.  However, her class is very easy. The only Pepp. prof. I know that gives Extra Credit. Is anti-laptop and might ban them (which would make this class imbearable).
I took his class and have since completed graduate work. This class still remains one of the hardest I have ever taken. And the fact that it is offerred to Freshmen?! Crazy.

He expects you to be on top of the readings but doesn't quiz you much. He gives you the essay questions for the tests so if you fail, you are choosing to fail. I learned a lot through the readings about Old Testament history even though I would fall asleep in class about half the time. However, he is a genuinely nice and approachable teacher.

The worst and the hardest teacher I have ever had BY FAR.   You read the bible a lot, but the stories themselves don't matter its the 6 forms of criticism you have to  analyze it with. DONT TAKE THIS TEACHER.  Journals and reading every week, essay formed tests which are extremely in depth, and boring lectures which he expects you to understand...

Honestly, I don't understand why so many people have a problem with Dudley. He's very nice, approachable, and actually teaches a class where you learn a lot about the Old Testament. The class is easy if you want to show up and do the work, he's nice...good prof!

This class is not about religion.  It's more like a history class about Israel.  A ton of reading the bible.  Concepts that you will never need unless you become a pentateuch scholar.  Take a religion lecture class.
a really really hard teacher. Way too much material for one test. Take someone else if you can. Personally he is cool, but his class is aweful.
Dudley is OK. If you go to class and do the assignments, you will be fine. The people that dont do well are the lazy ones.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!! The material you try to comprehend and learn is ridiculous! THe tests are basically a joke because it is so hard.  I am FORE WARNING DO NOT TAKE!! MANY people FAIL! his class and have to retake it so dont bother with your time!

This was the hardest class I EVER TOOK. He is impossible....the review questions aren't even helpful. the first day 1/2 you are finding the answers to his questions...then you get about half a day to study. his class is impossible, if you want to stress and become frustrated please don't take this class

DO NOT TAKE this class...even if you are a senior and need to graduate. He is not helpful, there is no text book...just the Bible. It is an 8 AM class and there are random projects given not listed on the syllabus! STAY AWAY!

This is his only class and I think he forgets that we have more the Religion.  The reading is alot but it wont kill you, you'll live until a test, then your dead!  I study so much for his test and barely got a B, other classes get B's with their eyes closed!
Dudly purposefully makes himself scarce before tests so that he is not flooded with emails and questions. This is pathetic in that he only teaches one class, with a maximum of 40 students.

DEADLY dudley is soooo not "studley."  There's probably like only one fun class period, and that's near the end of the semester.  Half the people drop the class, and I'm pretty sure he favors girls over guys.
If you have this man as your teacher, my best advice to you would be to drop the class right away and get a different teacher. Chances are you'll end up having to drop it later anyway. RUN!

For fall sememster, he NEVER cancelled class and there was a GIANT paper due at the end of the semester. The exams were ridiculous and since he is fluent in Hebrew and ancient languages he expects you to be also. If you're not a science major and you absolutely love lecture (and want to basically have no life except for religion), take his class.

you all can say what you want, but i love dudley.  he is such a nice guy and the class is not boring if you are a morning person.  plus he cancels class all the time.  i think his jokes are funny and he is not bad to look at either!  just study and ask questions like in any other class and you will do fine!!! he is NOT deadly dudley!
Just don't do it. You'll spend your Saturday's studying for this GE. I don't think you want that

This class is rediculously hard for a GE. I would recommend that you not take this class because it takes up way more time than it should. There is a huge service learning project that no other religion 101 class has to do (might be because he is the head of the Volunteer Center???) I dropped it and it was the best thing that I could have done!!!!!

i think he is the devil converting students to the ways of Satan by giving ridiculously boring power point presentations, unneccessary projects, and requiring an annoying sevice learning project. His teaching is HORRIBLE. No one should go throw his class voluntarily unless they are the spawn of satan or retarded.

This guy's got passion. He's got his heart in the right place with the volunteering and all. But tests are hard! I had to research online to figure out questions on study guides! He mentions things in class but does not elaborate on them, and then expects you to know them on the test.  Hard for a GE

He's a nice enough guy and is very passionate about what he does, and that is apparent in the way he teaches his class.  He gives a lot of information in a relatively short space of time and expects everyone to understand and remember it so his tests are killer and he grades hard.  Good guy though.

Very nice man, but that doesn't mean that his class is good. Probably the hardest class I've taken so far at Pepperdine. Requires community service in dangerous parts of LA, assigns unclear assignments, and his tests would make the toughest person cry. STAY AWAY!
No Comments
Anyone who recommends him probably just wants you to suffer the same fate they did. STAY AWAY FROM DEADLY DUDLEY!
If one is not intimately familiar with the Old Testament then STAY AWAY.  Tests are a horrible experience!  Far more work than in any other 101 class...essays, service work, research paper, etc.
No Comments
Don't ever take him.  His tests are all way too hard, and they're based on information not even given in class
He's a nice guy and he knows his stuff, but his class is very demanding.
Not as bad as people say he is
No Comments
No Comments
very helpful man
STAY AWAY!

Professor Pappas is a nice guy that has good intentions, but is not a good professor. He is extremely random and expects you to know random things on tests. The whole class is basically random stuff he teaches, and then teaching yourself from the book. And then he gets mad when people don't answer him after 2 secs, it was just an irritating class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is a nice guy, but not an excellent teacher. Sometimes he does treat his students as dumb and wants to always clarify that he is smart and knows what he is doing. You have to study random trivia he gives in class because it will be on the test. Like for example ; how do you say slope in french? (really?) YES, really. See him outside of class.

He's a really nice guy but his class is SO disorganized. He says random stuff (like what his dad's name is) and you have to know it for a test. In class tests test on random stuff but is worth more than the take home which is actual math. take it if you already know high school math

The person below me says it perfectly. I am GOOD at math, but I could not follow what he had to say. He's so disorganized, he doesn't use the book, and he has random questions on exams that he never went over in class. He also tests on random trivia and talks to students like they are ignorant. I really, disliked this class.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!! He is a really nice Greek guy and can be funny at times but not a good teacher!! His test have random problems that you never go over. I am ok at math and I had such a hard time following what he was trying to teach us. I was taking it hoping it would be a semi easy class, boy was i wrong. Try to avoid this class!
Very wise man. very helpful. He is one of a kind, and I grew to appreciate his style and sense of humor! He loves Jonny Cash!

I came into this class liking math, by the end i hated math and him. Pappas will teach one thing in class and give a test on something completely different. He goes on a lot of tangents and he talks to his students like they are complete idiots. RUN AWAY!!!!

The class is basically in two sectons, "book stuff" and "his stuff" You have to teach the book stuff to yourself, and it is never mentioned in class. Take home tests are used to test what you have taught yourself. His stuff is taught in class and tested in class. Math major = take him. Available outside of class for help, which is nice.
Great teacher!  I am horrible at math and it was all I could do to get a D, but he helped me get it!

Pappas knows his stuff, but can be a bitter scattered with teaching.  He is very helpful though if you ask for it.  You must do a short research paper for this class (about 6 pages) and sometimes can be stuck with really bad topics.  overall though it's not too bad.  not my favorite class by any means, but fine just the same.

Really nice guy, kind of emotionless and bland... He tries to make a lot jokes, but they are only funny because they are bad, which he will even admit to. His lessons arent very focused, and you will find yourself lost very fast if you haven't taken math in a while. Show up to class and get your work done and you should manage okay...

pappas is hilarious. I can understand the other students frustration, especially if you didn't have a strong math background. but if you did, enjoy the joy ride- it's fun! go in for help, shows you care and he likes it. do your homework and examples - you'll get your A...got an A-

Has an arbitrary, disjointed way of teaching and you never really know where he's going, but he REALLY tries to make the material interesting! See him in his office for help and you will be fine. Some people think he's a goofy old man obsessed with old cars and Johnny Cash, but I really liked him -- and I don't like math at all...
He's super nice and helpful, and will help you if you put a little effort in as well

He's always available for extra help, he likes his students to utilize his office hours for extra help-do this and you'll build a wonderful relationship with him, shows him that you show an interest in his subject.
always there to help you, it is like a high school class do the homework go over it in class and then introduce the next chapter.

This guy is trapped in the "Twighlight Zone," no joke people. His jokes, style, and methods are all outdated.  Yet if you go to all his classes, listen, and do the homework you will get the benefit of the doubt and get an average grade.
This is the worst teacher i've ever had. he sucks. does not explain material and talks to you like you're retarded.

Homework never relates to what's taught in class. Doesn't explain things well. Very boring, very frustrating. He's willing to explain things if you go see him in his office, which is often the only way to understand the material.

Funny guy, makes class interesting although its sometimes hard to follow along in class because the homework assignments have nothing to do with the class notes and the tests really.  you could copy it out of the book and be fine because you dont really need to know it

Professor Papass is a good teacher. However, he does not know how to explain things at times.  He might be able to teach upper division math courses better then the GE courses.  Yet he is always willing to help and has very flexible office hours.
Great fun to have and makes Math interesting with all the historical aspects.

Good teacher for math majors, horrible for GE classes.  Do not take his 102 class it way too difficult for a GE class, however is pretty lenient on final grade but you will think you are failing the whole semester till he gives you a C

Professor Pappas is a great professor.  You have to work to get an A, but that should be expected from a college course.  I don't know why everyone is being negative, I have had him for both Math 103 and 104 and he is one of the best teachers I have had.

Class is highly, highly unstructured. Expects students to know something for a test he's mentioned once in class. Homework is fine, but it doesn't really help with tests due to his illogical test creating pattern. None of this is an exaggeration.
No Comments

He is alright.Hard to study for tests, because you are never completely sure what to study for.Talks to students like they are stupid at times.(ummm i'm sorry I am not taking your class because I know the subject, i am taking it to learn...)
Very nice teacher.  He really makes you learn your stuff.
naw, he's no good. His teaching style is poor...it's confusing. he is willing to help you if you ask him though. he's not sympathetic whatsoever. tough grader.
Doesn't explain anything that relates to the assignment, assumes we can figure it out from the book alone- great guy but a poor teacher
hes so great..one of the best by far!
great teacher
My big fat Greek math class.  Good teacher!!
Difficult class but Norgaard is an excellent professor. Super accessible outside of class and puts a lot of effort into lectures.

It was a challenging class, but Porf. Norgaard lectures in a way that makes it more understandable, and in the end, it feels rewarding. Very straightforward, detailed, and thorough. Get ready to learn a lot, as that is the best way to do well in this class. Quiz and exam content is based on the examples she uses during her lectures.
The professor you should choose if you want to learn stuffs, lectures are well explained and organized. Both the study guides and office hours are very helpful for one to get a good score in exams.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Norgaard is an awesome professor and is inspiring to be around. She is easily the best professor in the economics department and puts a lot of emphasis on personal achievement and goal setting. She genuinely believes in her students beyond the classroom and pushes us to think about how the classroom material fits into our broader life goals.

Prof. Norgaard is passionate about the class material she teaches and always supportive to us. She excels at guiding us to think independently and facilitating group discussions of our findings. However, the classes are demanding. I would recommend active participation, engaging with the assigned readings, being self-motivated in learning.

Game theory was my favorite econ classes I've taken. Lecture material heavy, and taking down everything and understanding the material was super important. Tests could be pretty difficult, and the projects weren't crazy hard but could be a lot of work. Dr. Norgaard made the class engaging and fun, and definitely made the subject approachable.

Dr. Norgaard is an engaging and clear teacher. She is great at making the lectures practical and encourages critical thinking in her class. Dr. Norgaard's class does consist many quizzes that may require heavy study, but her practice questions and study guides are helpful in preparing you for success in class
I've never tried so hard for a class but never got such a low grade at college. There are nearly 100 pages to read every week. So much information from books and lectures
TAKE OTHER PROFESSORS PLEASE!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Julia Norgaard is an amazing professor and amazing at explanations but unfortunately it does not make up the fact that she does not prepare you for the exams. The material is generally difficult and you will have to study the lesson regularly in order to do well, but she also makes you cram a lot of information only for none of it to be on the exam

Good teaching, professor. The grade comes from many categories. A lot of busy work reminds me of high school in many ways. Found her class harder than it needs to be. She pushes a very classical view of econ. Learned a lot of skills.

Prof Norgaard is very organized and her class is really straightforward, she breaks down complex ideas into small pieces that makes them much easier to grasp and makes them fun! This made the remote learning much more manageable and enjoyable.

hey guys, come to this 8am lecture so that i literally write out entire paragraphs from the textbook word for word on zoom, and then walk thru an example problem that is also in the textbook... what are we paying for

Professor Norgaard is by far my favorite professor at Pepperdine. I went in expecting to dislike economics and left every class wanting more. She is always available for questions, or really anything. She offered immense amounts of extra credit when she realized people were struggling and her elkins lecture was the most dynamic one I have had.

All of her classes should have a trigger warning lol. As a libertarian, Norgaard asks you to remove all moral values (or bias) from your analysis, because that's what Econ actually is. She is the best actual teacher in the department if you want to learn, and is not overly demanding either. Just be prepared for the debate on why sweatshops are good

Dr. Norgaard is the most dynamic Econ professor at Pepperdine. Her lectures are engaging and I can confidently say that Ive learned how to view life through an economic perspective. She is highly knowledgeable in Public Choice. Though the required reading can be challenging, she outlines questions that you can answer as you read and discusses them
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: I took Economic Development of Africa with Prof. Norgaard. Her class was one the most challenging yet rewarding economics classes I took at Pepperdine. This course taught me to apply all of the economics knowledge I had learned in my years at Pepperdine to real world problems.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I'm conflicted. I love Dr. Norgaard, I have for several semesters now, but Public Choice was an unreasonably demanding course. Good material, should definitely be required of Econ majors, but too much reading, and very difficult tests. The online classes saved us all this semester. But totally recommend Norgaard for literally any other class!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Though I like Dr. Norgaard as a person, I didn't do very well with her teaching style. Her lectures felt very rushed and because there wasn't very much (or very hard) coursework, I didn't retain the material very well. With that being said, she saw that a lot of us were struggling and offered lots of extra credit. She's also super cool and nice.
I want to be Julia Norgaard when I grow up. Best teacher I have had at Pepperdine and I learned a LOT.

Took ECON 320 in the summer. Despite having this class everyday for 3+ hours (omg kill me now) Dr. Norgaard made this class really fun and engaging. She does make you work hard and try to push you to connect the econ lessons to everyday life. Generous curves and offers EC (do it!!!).

Dr. Norgaard is my absolute favorite professor at Pepperdine. She's made an upper div Econ course pretty easy, no homework, no textbook reading. Also one of the most passionate, engaging, enthusiastic professors I've had. Always available, and incredibly helpful in her office. She makes it very easy to love economics and succeed in the major!

Professor Norgaard is nice and cares about her students. This class is pretty difficult in terms of the material that is covered so I would suggest showing up and taking good notes/going to office hrs and asking questions. Stay on top of reading as well. Im an Econ major so this stuff is a little easier for me, I never showed up and got a C+
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: It was more challenging and unique than any Econ class I have had. In spite of this, she made this course enjoyable. She taught me how to learn and think in a different way that will help me for the rest of my life. I hate going to class. I look forward to her class. Solid lectures, always available and actively engaged. She wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor: knowledgeable, good teacher, caring, fun personality. Quizzes and exams are hard but she gives extra credit opportunities.

Prof Norgaard is very enthusiastic and clearly cares for her students. She has a young spirit and is able to relate to us on a lot of topics which makes the class fun and applicable. She is also a TOUGH grader and demands a lot out of us, especially on the quizzes. Read very closely and be sure to do the focus questions. The debate was a lot of fun

Dr. Norgaard is a wonderful teacher, she simplifies tough concepts so that they are much easier to understand and you can tell that she puts thought into her lesson plans. She asks us questions which draws out engaging class participation and applies what we are learning in class to the real world. She is available and helpful during office hours
Professor Norgaard, is an average professor. She often gets confused on her own notes and has a hard time answering questions. Her class is overall easy. If you read and take notes youll do fine
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Norgaard really is passionate about what she teaches and clearly is very very smart. Her lectures, while long, are usually very interesting and she ties in current events. Sometimes her test questions could be incredibly difficult and not in the scope of the course. Overall, she taught me a lot and definitely is someone I will take again.

A well structured class, which accentuated current social paradigms and applied them to fundamental economic principles, innovating the teaching process. By creating an engaging environment that could not be forgotten.

Even though the class was at 8 am, Dr Norgaard was energetic, prepared, and positive. She is open to change and makes sure we get the material. She uses real world applications, podcasts, practice problems, and videos to supplement class material. Dr Norgaard is friendly and supportive and makes this tough class fun.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Tests are tough--Would take again

comment: Very tough, math and computation heavy. Energetic teacher and Econ puzzles are fun, tries to tie material in with every day life

Great teacher. Prof Norgaard makes the class fun and accessible. Quizzes and tests are tough but do the study questions and you will be fine. Very helpful in office hours and does reviews before tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Kim is kind, understanding, and brilliant. She made the challenging and abstract concepts of sociological theory comprehensive and straightforward. There's three exams, regular reading reports, and a mini paper, but it's all super manageable. She's also very helpful during office hours and even by email. Dr. Kim wants you to succeed!

If there was one prof I couldn't rave enough about, it would be prof kim. I took her for intro soc (200) & literally chose to take her again for Social Theory (391) and Research Methods (310). Her lectures are never boring, she explains concepts so well & her study guides are so helpful. She's witty, charismatic, and arguably the best prof at Pepp.

Dr. Kim is so wonderful! She is very intellectual and approaches sociological topics with many unique perspectives. Some lecture points and exam questions can be unclear, but she is eager to answer any questions. Dr. Kim is a fair grader and super funny and engaging in class.

If I could take every class Dr. Kim offers, I would - in a heartbeat. She is by far the best professor I have had at Pepperdine. Her lectures are very engaging, and she heavily encourages student involvement. The material in this class is very dense, yet she makes it very easy to understand. Her tests are not terrible if you make sure to study.

Dr. Kim is the best professor I've ever had. She makes even the most boring subjects (like research methods or theory) not only bearable but interesting. Her lectures explain complicated topics really well and give extensive examples. Her study guides always prepare you for the tests and if it wasn't in the lecture, it won't be on a test.

Dr. Kim is a very sweet and outgoing professor and makes class engaging. That being sad her tests are a bit ridiculous. They dont test for knowledge of the subject matter but rather how many random words/phrases you can memorize from the lectures. If you understand the concepts but arent the best at memorizing you will be screwed for the exams

My favorite professor at Pepperdine yet! Professor Kim was great, even in an online class. I was worried the class would be boring but the asynchronous lectures were still engaging, funny, and educational. The readings could be difficult and long, but Professor Kim explained them well. The tests require studying, but the study guides were helpful.
If possible 10000 take her. SHE IS EXCEPTIONAL. Best teacher Ive had. Overall super caring, hilarious, inspirational, intelligent, phenomenal person and teacher.

Great professor who really cares for the students. I had her for first year seminar and am going to take her for my sociology GE requirement. Passionate for her subject. Can't really comment on how rigorous she is in an actual class however.
One of my favorite professors I have ever had at Pepperdine. Extremely enthusiastic, funny, relatable, and helped me learn the material in an engaging manner. Highly recommend.
Very very engaging and doesn't waste a minute of class. Had great discussions and learned a lot. But the exams were tough. Could ease up on the exams. It is a GE after all.
By far the worst teacher I have had at Pepperdine. Doesn't care about her students' success at all.

Awful, awful, awful teacher. So unorganized, powerpoints don't make sense at all and then I failed the first exam even though I studied for hours, read every chapter and didn't miss a class. Her tests don't reflect what we learn in class at all. Also she is not a nice person. Clearly biased in her own opinions about society.
Dr. Kim is the best--it doesn't matter what she's teaching. I have taken 3 of her classes.  I've never made a post on this site--so that's how highly I think of her classes.

Soc Theory is an extremely tough class but if you gotta take it, take Kim.  I can't imagine a prof that teaches it better.  Her tests are formated so that they're easier for students and her lectures and powerpoint slides are really clear.

Tough class but Kim makes it very easy to learn.Lecture outlines,powerpoints,& reviews all tell you exactly what to study.For this class youll wanna do the reading if you want a decent grade, but thats just the way the class is.Kim is a top notch professor.She'll help you figure out your term papers.Also class participation helps boost grades a lot

Dr. Kim is an amazing Prof.  I highly recommend taking her for any Sociology class you might have.She gives you lecture outlines that follow her powerpoints.  Her lectures are extremely clear so you know everything that's on the tests.  She's always available if you need help on anything (class related or not).  Definitely a top prof at Pepperdine.

Dr. Kim's class is a lot of fun.  As long as you do the reading and pay attention in class, it will be a breeze.  She is really funny and makes the lectures very interesting.  One of my favorites for sure!
Great! I learned a lot of research methods through her class. If you want to be a good researcher, take it. Highly recommend.
Prof. Kim is great! funny, knowledgeable, helpful, easy going, but this class kicked my butt!! good teacher, hard class, especially at 8 am?should have taken it later
i heard she makes you want to attend class but i found the lectures dull and kim herself is rude and mean-spirited. i would not recommend her unless you enjoy irritable and demanding professors.
Prof Kim was a great teacher. I learned a lot and she was very helpful outside of class. Her door was always open, and she cared for all her students. Take her if you can!

an amazing teacher, best i've had so far at pepperdine - and sometimes makes me wonder why she isn't teaching somewhere else? but thankfully that isn't the case :P  -  TAKE HER CLASS - YOU WILL LOVE THE DISCUSSION, THE ISSUES, THE DEBATES!!!!!! this is what sociology is all about right here

i took her class a couple of years ago and she still stands out as one of my best professors, so i had to come and give her props! she really is super helpful and one can tell that she does actually care about her students and really enjoys her field of study. Dont even hesitate, take her take her! I think shes amazing!!!
dr. kim is awesome!!!  take her!!
She knows her stuff and makes the class interesting. It seems impossible, but she makes an 8 am class doable.

Super nice, helpful, engaging, knowledgable, understanding.  Everything every other teacher at Pepperdine is not.  She'll give you all perspectives including the non-christian ones (GASP!) because she is true to her study and an expert in her field.  We could use more experts who can actually teach around here!
One of Pepperdine's finest. She is very organized and knows her stuff. She is also a cool person to talk to.
She really cares about her students.  Her tests are difficult but she also gives several opportunities to gain easy points.  It was a relatively fun course and it increased my interest in sociology.

She is so enthusiastic about her subject and is genuinely interested in our backgrounds and what we can offer to the class study.  She is an awesome and intelligent person with a great depth of very interesting personal views for the inquisitive mind.

She really knows her stuff and gives enthusiastic lectures. She cares about attendance and paying attention in class. (ie don't play solitare on your laptop) Sometimes seems a little biased, but is overall a good professor. Gives good, practical examples.
Without a doubt, Professor Kim is one of the most helpful instructors I have had. Her notes are on blackboard and she involves the class in all of her discussions.
The same thing everyday and lots of note taking from overheads but still not a bad class.  This is the kind of class where the other students that are in it can make or break it.
One of the best teachers I've ever had. He's extremly knowledgable and inspiring. The class isn't easy, but I'm learning a lot.

Dr. Jordan is a great professor and is very passionate about journalism. I really feel myself improving in this class. However, be prepared to do a LOT of out of class time consuming work. I was not prepared to go into LA every other weekend, but you do. Although they are cool assignments it is a lot of work.
He is very entertaining and tells lots of funny stories.

Dr. Jordan cares a lot about every one of his students. He is very helpful and easy to talk to. He is a tough grader, but you can definitely see yourself improving throughout the course. Be prepared for many outside of class assignments. It's hard work, but definitely worth enduring till the end.

Dr. Jordan is hilarious and cares about his students. If you do the reading and are well prepared for the classes and the dockets, you'll do well. Favorite class at Pepperdine by far; you'll be challenged, but you'll probably learn more than with any other professor and, provided you put in the effort, will end up doing well in the class!

Communication Law with Dr. Jordan is the best class I've taken at Pepperdine. It's also the most challenging course I've taken, but it's possible to pull out an A or A- if you invest a decent amount of time in the subject. Dr. Jordan is the man!

Great class. Enthusiastic, passionate professor. You will definitely learn if journalism is the right major for you. Assignments/quizzes are straight-forward. Writing intensive, but it's so fun. Your writing will improve.

Dr. Jordan is the most AMAZING professor at Pepperdine. He's VERY fair, funny, helpful, engaging and overall a great person. His tests are not difficult as long as you pay attention in class- I didn't do all the reading and still did pretty well. His classes are fun and he's VERY flexible when issues come up that prevent you from making it to class

Dr J is one of my favorite teachers Ive ever had,and I'm not even a journalism, advertising, or marketing major.Took the class as an elective since I'm a pre-law student.Perfect for anyone looking to go into law.Do the reading and you'll ace the class no problem.  Tough class but Jordan is a great prof so it's definitely doable.HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
This has been, by far, my favorite class at Pepperdine. I just love my major a thousand times more!!!!! He is so funny, really knowledgable, yet demandind. TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!

He's exactly what a college professor should be... challenging, knowledgeable, and interesting.  He's very passionate about what he does and he wants his students to share that passion.  Students that don't have a huge interest in journalism might find the class to be a little too much work though.

A few years after the fact, I look back at my college career and still remember this as the best class I took.  It was very challenging but brought out the best in me.  He'll push and if you have the  right attitude, you'll see what he's up to and appreciate it for years to come.
Great teacher, great dad :)
Challenging, entertaining and a good teacher. Despite the ego, this class rocks. I wish I could take it again. I have no interest in com law, yet somehow he made it awesome.
the most difficult class a comm student will take as part of their major requirement. It was great. one of the few classes that lived up to what you expect college level classes to be going in.

He is an AMAZING teacher. For Com majors-this is the hardest class you will take while here, but it is worth everything. Made me want to go to law school, and he challenges everything you say-in a good way. You gotta know your stuff for each class period. Hands down best class I have taken at Pepperdine. Take him over Lowry for sure.
Ok class. It was pretty boring most of the time, but he is really understanding when it comes to late articles. If you have to take the class he's not a bad option.
Dr J is the man...he makes you work, but you learn alot.  He is the coolest guy, tell him u like the beatles and ur set
I unexpectedly liked this class.  He takes it to the next level and helps you relate to bland material.  He was obviously passionate about the subject and knew it well.

Is passionate about the subject and makes everyone excited.  Class incompasses so many parts of Journalism.  Interesting lectures, fun assignments, I never wanted to miss this class.  He doesn't have a problem giving 100 pages of reading for a night, can grade hard.

Unfortunately, I think he's afraid to be challenged, and won't admit when he's lost an argument (he never thinks he has).  He makes a tough subject interesting, despite his crassness, ego, and lack of compassion.  All that said, his class is the reason I'm now a lawyer.  Take if interested in law!
Good class, but LOTS of info to cover! Keep the 1million handouts in order and you will do well!
great class, but i had some conficts when i challenged his opinions on some things.  he was a bit too set in his ways.

egotistical and conceited. Manages to offend almost every student and actually called puritans "ignorant" and "stupid." He thinks he's very intelligent and doesn't give any room for differing opinions.
Sparks a passion in his students and makes them want to do the job well.  Caring and multifaceted.  Sexy, too.
He is very intellectual.  He knows the material very well.  He does not care about the individual student.  And at times even comes off as brash and egotistical.
awesome
BEST TEACHER AT PEPPERDINE.  Takes a class everyone dreads and makes it fun.  A model professor for others to follow.
This guy is incredible and is legendary. His energy and his dedication to the subject and his students is infectous -- you've got to love this man.
great teacher very inspiring. cracks me up. probably one of the best teachers as of yet.
Probably the best teacher at Pepperdine!
Inspiring.
No Comments
An amazing professor
He is really friendly. Just attend class and do the readings. There will be only take home exams and very helpful study guides.

I'm gonna be honest, he's so beyond boring, but history is boring. He assigns a ton of reading, but I never once read or even took notes in his class and I got an A. Lots of participation, but it helps you keep on track and understand the material. He gives the test prompts ahead of time and they're all take home, so super easy to score well on.
He is a very chill person
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: I loved Professor Wahlstrom. He was super easy to talk to and very fair with the grades he gave out. The lectures can be boring, but they're worth sitting through for his class. There are a few projects, but they can be done with partners, and in each class there is a discussion/assignment. Very nice teacher, and easy course if you do the work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: A really nice professor, I usually don't like history but the way he sets up the course to have us participate in a group really helps us understand the material in context. The workload isn't bad even if you procrastinate (don't take my word though because everyone's different), It's a lot of historical writing but the instructions are very clear!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: A terrific human being. Ignore the previous comments that others left about Professor Walhstrom.

Bruh I dont understand why people are complaining. I took this class to fulfill a GE and it was exactly what I expected. Laid back and easy. There is a class assignment due every class period with a group, and then you talk about the assignment as a class. Yes his lectures are boring, but his tests are open book open note so it was all worth it.

People on here are too tough on him. Hes a very nice and understanding guy, incredibly easy grader. The midterm was open note and open book. Sure the lectures can get boring, but he definitely knows a ton about history. Wasnt my favorite class but wasnt very hard either

The books he assigns are SUPER long but as long as you read the chapters that pertain to whatever assignment he gives, you'll be fine. A lot of the class was spent doing group work or class discussions. Overall, it wasn't difficult and he is an easy grader as long as you do the assignment with time.

Wahlstrom took this First year seminar class way too seriously. Most of the people didn't choose to take this class, furthermore had zero interest in the topic, yet it was the hardest class that I took by far. There is a lot of reading expected, heavily graded essays almost weekly, and graded participation. He gives good feedback and you learn tho.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: I took this class during covid from home and I can honestly say Wahlstrom is a very good teacher. He makes his lectures flow very nicely with the class and will always answer questions. His grading was fair and offers very good feedback. If you read and understand the readings (evenly spaced) then you should be okay.

This class was way too hard and way to boring. I've taken history before and loved it, but this was not a fun experience. He shows no love for the class, but expects you to want to love history and learn everything. The reading were so long and so much of it was on the test. He goes super fast in the lecture and you have to write down everything.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Wahlstrom is a good person and easy to work with, but makes this GE class way more difficult than necessary. He requires two out of class reading books on top of weekly readings. You have weekly in-class questions, 3 time consuming class assignments, 3 LONG exams, AND an essay. His lectures are difficult to follow and quite boring. Avoid.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Lectures move fast, but most of the important info is in the powerpoint, so focus on writing down what isn't in the slides. Reading schedule is very demanding, but often overlaps with lectures, so read after the lecture, so you can skip the redundant parts. Also he is generous with grading.. Not an easy A, but an easy A-/B+ Often ends class early
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: First test is the most difficult one. Ultimately comes down to reading comprehension and writing skills as the points on his tests usually come from the writing portion. Highly recommend asking questions/participating and showing interest in the class, it will grow on you. Lectures can be long&dry, but still worth it.

People give him a hard time because they expect to come to a GE class and not do any work. Not the hardest GE Ive taken by far. We all know how difficult GEs are here anyway. He does assign a lot of reading, but if you study for the tests then you will do fine. Hes a super nice guy that I dont think a lot of people take the time to talk to!

Super demanding professor but the tests are all directly from the study guides and notes!! His class is very tough and you'll do a lot of reading, but he is super willing to work with you if you just talk to him! Nice professor, tough class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: He seems like a nice enough guy and he obviously knows a lot about history, but he demands a lot for a GE class. It's not the end of the world if you end up having to take him, but I'd recommend looking for a different professor if at all possible.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Wahlstrom is what I believe a right of passage teacher. Is he demanding for a GE? Yes. But this class prepares you for the course load to come with Major courses. HIST 204 is a dry subject but he really tries to make an effort. Also, the final and midterm are literally the study guide. Read and you're fine. If not, you shouldn't be here.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dont take this class!! The lectures are incredibly boring and the professor assigns way too much reading for a GE course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: BORING lecture and unclear! Often does not reply emails. Be ready to read - he assigns WAY too much reading for one week. Quizzes are hard as well. Steer clear of him, not a good professor lol I regret taking his class

Too demanding for a GE class. Treats it like a major course. One of the hardest GE classes taken at Pepperdine. Reading is a must - often gives pop quizzes and randomly calls on students in class to participate.  Obviously well-read and passionate about the subject, just not a good professor for GE history.  If you're looking for an easy A - avoid.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I would suggest avoiding at all costs. He is not responsible as a professor, he doesn't show up to office hours, doesn't respond to emails in a timely manner, and yet he is super hard on his students. He is easily the toughest grader I've ever had at Pepperdine, and most of the time I didn't even understand why i was receiving the grades i did.

He treats the class as if it is a major course or a graduate level course. If you miss 1-2 classes he automatically assumes that you're a bad student and will take points off of all your homework assignments and your participation grade. You have to show up to every single class, know every discrete detail for tests, and participate a lot.

He is an okay professor. His lectures are pretty dry and boring. He has the students do a lot of group work - practically every class session. There is a ton of reading. You have to get like 5 books for the class. And the material isn't interesting, unless you're really into history. But he's a nice guy, and the class isn't that hard to do well in.
too much assignment and reading. He is not a easy grader at all. But if you really want to learn and know everything about history, he is a good choice. Too hard for just a GE class

He is a great professor.  He is very knowledgable and passionate about American History.  His lectures are engaging and easy to follow.  The study guides for the tests are very clearcut.  Definitely recommend taking his class!
really nice guy!!

Prof Wahlstrom is a nice guy and a good teacher. He does his best to keep class engaging and interesting. Although he requires a lot of reading, assignments are not overwhelming. Overall, he's a good option for Hist 304.

A really wonderful teacher. I'm not super interested in history, but this teacher does a great job of keeping the class interactive. There is a lot of reading, but it's easy to keep up on and if you read, class discussion will be easy. He's huge on class discussion so be prepared. I really enjoyed this class and teacher.
Really nice guy, content is a little dry but he does a good job of keeping it interesting. He knows the material really well. Alot of reading and class discussion.

SUCH a nice guy! the course is pretty boring in itself, but the teacher does the best he can to make it interesting. A LOT of class discussion so read the assignments. A lot of reading but he has cut down a lot recently.Midterm is a paper. He is an easy grader. Class is boring but attend majority of classes
Wants you to succeed.
The best professor ever
Good teaching and very bright!
She is the best. If you want to do well in the exam, please do your homework carefully and ensure your attendance. Most of the exam questions come from classroom examples.

She treats you as a friend, not just a student. Perfect balance of control. Takes the material to another level.
The best.

A great college professor  who is not only academically qualified but also has what it takes to, create a learning environment that is conducive to learning, motivates students, and encourages participation.
The best professor ever!
Her class engaging and tying calculus with a practical perspective. They are very interesting and helpful! I strongly recommend to take he classes. She is amazing!!!!

She makes the class engaging and tying probability and statistics with a practical perspective. Her classes are  interesting and helpful especially to understand how important these things are in medical field. Using statistics and probability to analyze data and predict trends will definitely help me someday to ensure a successful medical school.

I truly value each class I have taken with her. Even though I really struggle with mathematics, she always reassure me that trying my best is what is the most important. She  always provides the class with all of the information we need and I am very grateful for that. A great professor that my made my experience at Pepperdine so much better!

I had her MATH 141 and could describe it as an interesting experience.  I enjoyed the class; however, I noticed that a lot of the material on tests was significantly harder than classwork and homework pertaining to the same respective topics.
