However, she always encouraged us to go to office hours and to gain extra points on test revisions.

Rohjani is not bad at teaching. The problem sets are short, which is great. However, the MAJOR issue is with her exams. The exams themselves are not even that hard as long as you're confident in the material, BUT, she consistently grades the exams incorrectly. She'll give you the points back if you meet w her, but this was incredibly frustrating.

If I didn't take stats in HS, I don't know how I would've been able to manage. While I do respect her passion for the course, it does not reflect well on how she teaches the class. Extremely disorganized, makes a lot of mistakes, and overall just not an effective teacher. It's gets so bad that you can feel how frustrated everyone gets in the room.

She is so sweet but a little scatterbrained. She posts pretty good notes on her courses website. She offers revisions on midterms for credit back on points lost. She wants students to do well, but sometimes I have to study on my own outside of class because she doesn't teach super thoroughly.

The bad reviews are true, she should not be teaching. She's a nice lady, but she makes a lot of mistakes in class & students always have to correct her. I went to see her during office hours for help & she still made no sense. When I was honest with her about the difficulty of the class she completely invalidated my feelings. Trust me, avoid her!

She goes over the lectures super fast and doesn't explain. It's heavy on statistics, so she says, "oh its logical" to explain every question when in reality, it's not. The five exams are based on hw but they weren't easy. She allows a cheat sheet but even then, that doesn't do much. Try to get another professor that's willing to teach you.

She is quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had in my entire life. Not only can she barely speak English, but she does not take her course seriously at all. She does not seem to care about her students learning and always makes careless mistakes when presenting examples in class. Don't take her class unless you love being confused
The professor is super sweet! She always explains the questions when you don't understand. Always there to help. Super knowledgeable.
Knowable caring professor.  Always there to help.  Amazing lesson plans.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: A great professor. Extremely Knowable . Very organized and explain the most difficult ideas in a very way. Master in technology.

Literally does not explain anything.If you haven't taken the course she's teaching before I can't even imagine how hard it would be.She is very inconsistent about details which makes it very hard to learn and often gets things wrong when teaching so everyone is confused. Show up last couple of weeks to get participation credit.Tests are hw on crack

Professor Rojhani is super sweet! We can use formulas and a calculator, and she always explains the questions when you don't understand. She does zoom recordings every class, so you don't need to go to class, just watch the recordings and you'll be fine. She has 3 sets of HW, each one due before each midterm. Super chill!

Her class doesn't seem to have much structure, she doesn't really teach from anything. She pretty much just puts up math problems and you work those out throughout the class period. I don't feel like I learned anything & the exams were very hard. She's a very sweet woman and has a great sense of humor, but her class wasn't the best.
Her lectures are long and tend to get boring. Her classes consisted of 3 tests and daily hw. She is very accessible outside of class and her grading criteria is very easy to understand.

Sweet person, terrible professor. Her course seems so disorganized. Lessons are always all over the place. One thing I didnt like was how exams consisted of difficult problems that we barely touched or reviewed in class. She really encourages her students, but I wouldn't rely on her to get a good understanding of the subject. Had to teach myself.

Notes are extremely disorganized. She does not know how to teach. Makes tons of mistakes in her teaching which makes material 100x more confusing than it needs to be. You basically have to teach yourself. DO NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL.

Really caring personality HOWEVER she teaches one thing in class then doesn't apply the same criteria on the exams. There are 4 heavy weighted exams and 16% for homework. She messes up a lot during class lectures which can also impact the way you perform on your exams but is lenient.
Not the best at explaining but the tests arent too hard so its good.

Professor Rojhani is one of the sweetest profs you will meet at Pepperdine. She is caring, enthusiastic about math, and will work with you to understand the concept. Her tests are not hard at all and she looks at all areas of your work to try to give you the most credit. Take her class!

Professor Rojhani is super kind. She doesnt do the best job of explaining the material and she often gets a little off topic. The class is straightforward but she makes her own tests and the wording of her questions are extremely confusing.

Very kind, isn't the best at explaining the material but gets the point across. Will give extra credit and will work with you through problems if you are having trouble. If you really want to understand the material, you will have to work on your own. Tests are easy.
Doesnt explain topics too well but is a super lenient marker and gives marks easily. Good prof to take if you need a high grade but not understand the class properly.

Took him online over the summer - super easy class as long as you do the homework and read the textbook. Also a great dude who cares about your learning and that you can use what you learn in class in your work and everyday life

People like professor flynn are the reason I came to Pepperdine. In his class you learn valuable information that you can use in any career or even your personal life. You will learn a lot in his class if you really try your best. He is well respected by his students due to his knowledge of excel and word

The class had a good level of difficulty. Like you, I saw the ratings of how difficult the class was going to be, however, it was not bad at all. I took the class online and they were relatively simple. If you study the HW and read the textbook, you should be fine.

Professor Flynn is very kind and nice. Normal loads of homework and you can re-do the homework if you are not satisfied with your score. He makes jokes all the time, and they are really really funny. You will get an A if you work hard and participate in class.

This class was a general pain. So much homework every week and challenging quizzes. In addition, the lectures were boring. For only two credit hours, I found this class to have too much work. Flynn is very professional and knowledgable but I would not take again.
Best professor, very caring and nice.
It seems like you can cheat on the homeworks but he catches you. DOn't do it!

A really awesome guy and full of interesting tips and tricks for both the course material and life in general. Class material by definition isn't the most engaging but do the homework and power through. The course doesn't really get much worse as you go on through it, just more of the same. Flynn is totally available to help you with questions tho.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is a solid professor, pretty fair, but his lectures are kind of all over the place. Not a fun class per day, but all helpful information. Be prepared for hours of homework each week. Definitely do all the homework and be engaged while doing it so that you will get a good grade on the quizzes. Not an easy, minimal effort course though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Inspirational

comment: This is one of the most useful classes at Pepperdine and I recommend it to everyone. You learn the ins and outs of excel as well as learning how to do some cool stuff in Microsoft word. The textbook and online HW is super important so do that and know that he kind of makes you figure some things out on your own as he is preparing you for life.
Super smart and nice to look at. He has a great sense of humor. It is a tough class but if you do the work you will learn a ton. Highly recommend.

Super nice professor. He truly cares about his students. This class can be a lot of work only if you get behind. Stay on top of the homework, and you'll do great! Tests are not too difficult if you actually learn what you do for the homework.

Professor Flynn is a nice guy and he wants you to do well. You have to participate though, participation is huge in this class and because I didn't realize that, I payed for it. Show up to class, add to the class notes online, and do kahoot. I didn't do these regularly and he took me from a B to a C at the end... Other than that it's not bad
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Professor Flynn has a deep desire for his student's success both inside and outside the classroom. He has great professional experience and has a passion for teaching.
I took it over the summer. It was one of the best class that I have ever had. He cares about us, and I learned from this class. I love his class and his sense of humor. He is the best.
Prof. Flynn is a very nice person. As for this class, mostly you need to read the textbook and learn bu yourself. The application about the excel is indeed very helpful and interesting.
Really, really useful class, and he does a great job of blending Excel skills with business potential.  Be careful, his tests are much harder than the homework.
Great professor who, if you put the effort in (there are daily assignments) is willing to go to any lengths to prepare you to be a strong competitor in the business world.

He's great.  He is very professional and gets you ready for the business world.  Very insightful.  He totally knows his stuff.  He inspires you to work hard and compete with others. Take him if you want to know excel.
Great class, learned alot! Yeah he has alot of homework, but sometimes he shortens it to give the students a break! Not funny at all, but tells plenty of lame jokes!

I took him in the Summer, and I think he was a lot less demanding than during the school year. Assignments are comprehensive but very do-able, and he always left us with lots of class time to do work in. Tests and quizzes were pretty straight-forward. He's well-spoken and engaging.

Probably the hardest teacher I ever had at Pepperdine. You might assume "he's teaching a lot" if you don't know anything about what he's talking. If studying 10-15 hours a week is okay with you, be my guest ; be his slave.
I had Professor Flynn a couple of semesters ago.  He was really helpful and inspiring.  It was challenging but do the work and you'll be glad you did.
Very Hard Teacher! Stay away if you want a good grade, working hard does not equal a good grade.
You'll do a lot of work but he teaches you a lot.  If you're lazy don't take his class.  If you want to learn take it.

Yes,Professor Flynn is demanding. He's the only professor of the COSC 250 teachers who will actually teach you anything you will use in business. He is professional and well prepared. Those who don't like him are just lazy.  He's one of Pep's best!
Okay teacher, but WAY too much homework to make it worth your time.  The final is also impossible, only 3 passed last semester.  Get outta therrrrrrrrrrr.

Flynn is extremely demanding for the class he teaches. This simple Comp Sci class was filled with boring let-me-teach-by-reading-from-the-book-lectures and an outlandish amount of time consuming exercises. He thinks his is the only important class. Wrong.
Very demanding teacher.  If you want to learn take his class, if you want a good grade leave.
The best professor I ever had.  he's motivational, easy to approach, and has an amazing vocabulary.  Plus he dresses really nicely and makes my motor run!
Does a great job teaching the faculty and staff how to use computers.  Thanx!!
Probably the most important and relevant course I've taken at Pepperdine. Super!
terrible at teaching and possibly on the spectrum

This is a class you really have to work for, you need to pay attention, attend class, do the homework, and I would recommend watching youtube videos for extra help. One group project and 4 exams including the final. Homework is on Cengage and does not help as much as it should. I'd recommend a different professor. Either way AC224 is a tough class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: dropped her class bc she made me feel worthless

Okay listen... she's a nice lady. A little awkward but overall seems like a good person. But she flat out just can not teach, ESPECIALLY in an online setting. Her transitions from using Cengage to doing tests on courses just made no sense. For a topic that is really difficult, she needed to implement a better system. There are better people to take
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Not the worst accounting teacher in the world but there are better options in the department. She's an.. "interesting" woman and very awkward to be around in class or office hours. Passionate about what she does but not a great teacher. Homework load is heavy but feels appropriate for the course.

This is definitely a self-teach class. You don't learn anything from her "lectures". Read the textbook and do the homework and study study study. She has some interesting stories and class isn't boring but you don't learn what you need to know during class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Unprofessional profesor. Tells students that "Accounting is not their calling." Exams were extremely difficult and not relevant to Accounting. Rarely taught anything, the TA would help students. Gave tons of online homework so that she didn't have to grade it. Take another professor if possible.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Class average C Boring and repetitive lectures. If you did not do good on mid term, drop this class. Going to lectures doesnt help. She tries to be funny and tries to fit into the younger generation. Take other professors if possible

You have to read the book. There is no way you will learn from lecture, you basically have to teach yourself. I studied two weeks before each test and got an A. So if you want the grade you have to put in the work, she won't do it for you.

I'm not sure what people on here are talking about? Professor Galantine is great. She's funny, friendly and always seems to be enjoying herself. Yes, her lectures could be a bit more clear but she will explain if you have a question or go to office hours. She tells you what to expect on the exams so you can practice and work for an A.

By far the worst professor I have ever had. You have to teach yourself. If you are an accounting major at Pepperdine then I would avoid her for Financial Accounting but unfortunately she is the only one that teaches tax and audit. Midterms are not bad but her finals are brutal! Trust me even if you think you are ready, your not! so PREPARE.........
THIS IS THE WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. You must be prepared to teach everything to yourself. I cannot believe this was a college level course..
Class is fairly straight-forward and organized according to the syllabus she gives you. Group project is lot more relaxed than Misch and she doesn't grade homework for correctness.

I LOVE Dr. Galantine! She cracks jokes all the time & often let's you leave early. She is a great, caring Professor! The class isn't too bad, although the videos she shows weren't helpful. Just do your hwks, study hard for the quizzes and the tests. The group project is much easier than Misch's. Dont underestimate the course though! Work hard!

Nice lady, she's fair but people just don't listen to her because her lectures need so much clarification to get anything from them. She is unable to recognize people because of a facial blindness condition. READ THE BOOK its the only way to get a decent grade. Go to class and turn in all your hw because each miss exponentially decreases your grade

This class is self taught.  She is a very kind person but teaching is not her thing.  She cant explain the concept well other than "u have to do this so that becomes..."  U learn most from review hw problems in class. Grades hw for effort which is what all teachers should do. tests are HARD--15pt/100 curve says it all. Laughs at everything.

Classes are worthless although you do have to attend to submit your homework.  Homework isn't graded, she just checks to see if you did it.  She does a poor job explaining in class lectures and tests are mildly hard but graded unfairly hard.  Overall the class sucks just try to pay attention as best as you can and you shouldn't have problems passin

Galantine is pretty nice. The only thing was that usually in class she's not that clear. The beginning of the class is super easy but close to the end of the semester...it becomes harder and harder to come to class. Tests aren't too hard. Study and you cannot not pass the class.

Had her for Financial Accounting. Had a 4.0 before taking her class, and she was absolutely horrible. One of the worst teachers at Pepperdine. Her grading was absolutely immutable and she was completely unfair. Seriously, if you care at all about your grade, do not take this woman. I DONT GET Bs, and this woman gave me one. !!AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!

not as bad as people make her out to be.  She has a weird sense of humor but you just have to learn to appreciate it.  People are probably just stupid and unwilling to learn accounting so they think it's hard.  Pepperdine is full of these kind.
This is why you teach your kids not to do drugs.  You will learn nothing and receive a poor final grade.
This **** is off her rocker! She doesn't know a tax from her ****. She needs to go back to undergraduate school and re-learn everything. Please for the love of God do not take this class!!!

she is the dumbest person i have ever met.  she is a terrible person and teacher.  her goal is to fail you, and she's not shy to admit it.  i suggest you don't take her.  if i could do it over again, i would avoid her like the plague.
Taught me nothing, doesnt prepare students for tests, just a terrible instructor
Not that bad of class. Her jokes are Amazing- :0)
in my 17 year academic career, dating back to pre-school, dr. galantine is by far and away the worst instructor i have had.  hope this is helpful.

I really like her.  She is really nice and is always willing to help you outside of class. You sometimes have to remind her to write things down when she is explaining something.  She is more clear that way.  If you show up to class attempt the homework you will do well.

Boring class, terrible jokes, she tests you on stuff that most of the time she barely covers.  She basically reads of PowerPoint and teaches you how to keep books by hand - which nobody does anyway.  I got a good grade but I felt that I could have had a C- or A by the end.  Take MISCH and work hard.

She always tells corny jokes but if you laugh at them and get a great study buddy then the tests won't be too tough. She always goes on tangents so don't take class so seriously. Tests are long but if you study you will be fine.
very nice lady, jokes are absolutely horrible, frequently has trouble speaking, arguably the worst handwriting i've ever seen.  class is usually let out early.
i HATE this teacher. she was horrible. class isn't too hard, she's just an idiot.

Galantine's class was fun and entertaining. Tells corny jokes, but you'll learn to love them. Tests are sort of difficult, but if you know the material you will have no problem. Homework is appropriate and NOT excessive - it will keep you on track. She is always available to talk to her students.
The best professor ever in Pepperdine university, take his class if u can.
As long as you take notes in class you'll be fine!

Professor Reilly is one of the best professors I have taken so far. A very knowledgable and passionate in what he teaches. The assignments and tests are not heavy compared to other History courses. Just make sure to show up and take good notes in each lecture since it will most likely come up in the test.

don't take him unless you love taking long drawn out tests on subjects that don't really matter - He is a date guy, meaning he does very well with history dates - Guess what on the tests - all very niche dates not so much material - classic trash class that is too hard about a topic which is very niche
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Reilly is a hilarious and respected person with immense knowledge and passion on the subject of Chinese history. The workload of his class is doable and fair. Make sure to take notes during his lectures. His study guides are especially helpful to prepare for his exams. Definitely not the history professor that you would want to miss!

My third post: Make sure you take a lot of notes. Write down everything he says in class because they might be a multiple choice question. This class has little homework so do not worry too much. But do give in the time to study for exams. Getting an A is extremely hard (A is 94 percent ) but if you work hard you should get a B+ or A-.

My first post: The most interesting professor that I've had. Professor Reilly is so knowledgeable and funny, and you will feel happier and more blessed after attending his class ( for real). He makes fun of his students every class and the lecture are so much more enjoyable to attend. I look up to him and will certainly visit him in the future!

Basically just memorize things he said in class and do the assignment. He is not a harsh grader on writing assignments. Very nice person and know a lot about Chinese history. Not biased. Take his classes.
If you write down everything he says in class and memorize it, you will get an A. Pretty easy for a GE. TAKE GOOD NOTES.

Professor Reilly is one of the best professors that I have ever taken.  Prof Reilly made the lecture so interesting that I never missed one class.  As long as you go to the class and take good notes, you will pass the class and get good grades. There are weekly assignments but not hard. Just take note and it's an easy A!

Weekly assignments and 3 tests. Really cool class. Made some dry material very interesting. He's humorous, kind, and teaches his class as if it were a show and he's the host. Organizes lectures very well and makes for good note taking. Gives a comprehensive study guide for each test. In lieu of your HW, you can go on fieldtrips.

Prof. Reilly is the best professor I've had at Pepperdine.  His class is so organized, clear, and straight to the point.  Every class follows the same structure. He shows interesting documentaries or movie clips that pertain to the material. Extremely helpful study guides and fair exams. HIGHLY recommend.

Dr. Reilly is one of my favorite teachers/ professors of all time. He is humorous and his passion for Asian history and culture is motivating. Lectures go by much faster than other 2 hour classes and there is always an abundance of laughter. He will challenge you, but paying attention in class and interaction during lecture makes class enjoyable.

I have know Dr. Reilly for sometime now.  He rates more on the easy side.  He is an honest man and will challenge you, if not on school work, but on your worldview.  Far too much of America's education system is that it is far too "western" centric.  He challenges that by presenting China and its history as part of a much larger study of the world.

History is my least favorite subject, but I really enjoyed this class!!! He is witty, and funny, and very knowledgeable on the material.  You have to write 4 short essays, and you have to choose 4 out of the 10 homework assignments he hands out.  You get a great study guide for the test.  Take him for your nonwestern if you can!

Great professor, honestly one of the best that I have taken at Pepperdine. Extremely knowledgeable, presents the material clearly. Regular short essays and homework assignments. Fair assignments and tests. Gives a study guide for tests. You can tell that he loves the subject. Take him if you have the chance!

Reilly is a hilarious guy with great stories, he offers a lot of options for the class in terms of homework and reading. Gives you study guides for the tests, overall a fun guy and a great experience.

Great Guy!! Had him for 2 consecutive classes 330 and 331, Is by far my favorite teacher. Love's Chinese! you dont need the books really just attend class and take fast notes. Gives a great study guide for exams.
Awesome teacher.  Really funny, very passionate and really interesting class!
he is a great teacher!  loves his subject and is passionate about East Asia.  Take this class, you will enjoy it.  He ROCKS!
This guy is way chill. We watch movies and we can eat in class, plus he usually lets us out early. Unfortunately, the class is very time consuming. Your other options aren't much better though.

Dr. Reilly is a solid teacher.  He gives straight forward assignments like weekly or bi-weekly 1 page essays and short readings and gives you lists of terms to know before tests.  He gets really charged up about China and especially the Taiping Rebellion, etc.  Great teacher, fun course.

prof reilly is a really nice guy, always tries to lighten up his lectures with jokes... but i'm sorry, his class is straight up boring as hell. plain and simple, i hated going to class. and the thing is: you need to go to class if you don't do the hundred and hundred pages of reading. TORTURE.
Dr. Reilly is just a great guy.  great sense of humor and a lot of fun to be in class with.  years ago, he allowed me to be the honorary professor of the class for a bit and our class had a blast.
Loves his subject and has one of the best sense of humors that I have seen in a professor. This is the guy to leanr about the East with!

I hate his chinese history class more than anything. Unless you want to know about how great the Chinese culture is and be bored out of your mind, stay away. He grades way too hard and needs to get a life outside of Chinese Philosophy! I HATED IT!
class isnt that interesting, but hes got a great sense of humor and its a good prof

He's completely enthralled by everything Asian, which is really strange but helpful at the same time.  He's a great prof, but it almost seems that he would rather be Chinese than American, which is really annoying.
Great Prof!
Professor Reilly has a great sense of humor and loves what he teaches.
Great teacher/hard course but he helps you understand.

Professor Kelly is such an amazing teacher.  She truly cares for her students and wants everyone to do well.  Her exams are very fair and so is her grading on speech days.  If she ever comes back to Peperdine, take her class! She came back last summer to teach in June and hopefully she will be back again this summer!

I am so glad Prof. Kelley came back to teach speech for a summer month.  She is quite possibly the nicest teacher at Pepperdine and really wants her students to do well.  Her tests are not difficult, but again, maybe it's because she's such an excellent teacher.  It was a blessing to be able to take her class and I hope she comes back to Pepp soon!

Professor Kelley is so beautiful.  She truly cares for her students, she's a professor and a student - she's the type that will embrace you.  She's very devoted to the Christian faith and she lives it out completely. Study her class lectures notes (may not even need to read...but you still need to use the book for presentations) and an A vio'la!

The sweetest, most genuinely caring professor I've ever come into contact with at Pepperdine.  This class (and any class she teaches) is an absolute breeze.  Tests are clear and simple.  Projects are fun and relatively easy.

THE BEST TEACHER!! I would recommend Kelley to all speech students, she is genuinely the sweetest person and is willing to do anything to help you do well... Plus she gives plenty of easy extra points to help your grade. As long as you fulfill the requirements she clearly gives you for each speech you will get an A or B... Plus shes adorable!
She is amazing! Probably one of the nicest and most understnading teachers I've ever had. definitely recomend!!

Shes the nicest and most genuinely caring teacher I have encountered at Pep. Shes beautiful inside and out and will share stories and techniques to help you succeed in her class. She really wants everyone to do well. Take her for whatever course you can, shes the best.

I would take Kelley solely on the reason that she is the nicest, most beautiful person I ever met and I would marry her if I had the chance. On top of that, the class if fairly easy and fun and I am now a better speaker.
She is such a nice person and makes speech class painless.

She is so real.  She made class interesting.  When I first got to class, she seemed like she already had favorites, then I realized they were just personal relationships she had developed from previous class...all to say she genuinely cares about her students.
I'm not a natural born speaker...I got an A-, which i'm not very happy about. The class is fairly simple. Take her...she's nice

UHmazing teacher! So understanding and such an encouragement.  She is super fair on grading and her tests are SO simple...they answer themselves.  The only thing she wants is for you to succeed so she does everything she can for you to do well. I despise speaking in public and i have an easy A.

D-D-D-Damn she's hot. Was fortunate enough to have her for speech 180 my freshman year. Easy class, and its sad that we have to conform our speech habits to the Pepperdine way, but you can get through it. I never use any of my skills from this class because I simply give speeches my own way better than the "right way" we were taught. She's so nice
No Comments
She is a really nice lady, whom I cannot wait to get to know.
she was so good, so sweet and so helpful.  i really enjoyed the class.  you have to dedicate some serious time to your speeches, but it's not too bad.  she's a good choice for this ge.

SO GOOD!! she's my favorite prof at Pepperdine!! tough but fair grader on speeches and tests were straight-forward & direct so it was easy to do well on them. well organized and VERY well run. and the boys all think she's HOTT
Awesome personality, and very nice person.  Its good to have someone who does not intimidate you while you are doing speeches.  She does grade a bit hard.
She's a hot teacher and helps make public speaking a little easier. At the beginning of the class I hated public speaking, now I can do it OK, and I got a B in the class. Thanks Kathy
Her class is relatively easy. She grades pretty strict on the speeches, but her tests are supereasy.

prof kelley's awesome hot and a lot of fun.  she's always in a good mood, really tries to get to know each person in the class; lot of work, but grades really easy.  not a huge fan of public speaking, but love the class
very nice woman, but incredibly boring class.  she's easy and always upbeat -
Easy to work with, really enjoyed her class, even though I hate public speaking.

Cute and single ;) - she's a great teacher and really cares about her students. I love public speaking, so this class wasn't too difficult, but she really helps you formulate ideas and express them eloquently.

She's awesome!  Her class was the easiest class I've taken at Pepperdine and it was fun.  We even got a take home test , which was impossible to fail.  She is really sweet and I learned a lot as well.
The best teacher by far at pepperdine. Also probably the most genuinely nice and compassionate person I know. i highly reccommend this class. :)
Hot teacher with great attitude. I dislike public speaking with a passion, but she makes the class fun. Her tests are really easy and she's awesome. Highly recommended for speech.
She is great, and the class is so fun and interesting she is very helpfull and she is always willing to help the student! Take her speech class it is the best
No Comments
This class is a cake class, and should be taken out of the GE schedule.
She is so great. She actually is there to help and make learning fun. Awesome professor.
More theroretical than practical
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: By far the worst class I've taken. You can tell the Professor cares and is kind, but I have NEVER learned anything in that class. It is a 3 hour long class and he does not cover or teach ANY of the material. When it comes to exams it is up to students to teach themselves. My major was sociology and after taking his class I have switched majors!

Dr. Johnston is probably one of the most genuinely kind guys I've ever known. He legitimately cares about the well-being of his students. With that said, he's not a very good teacher. There is no reason to go to class other than he takes attendance once in a while, because the test questions are straight out of the book.

please don't take this class. lazy and unprofessional professor. he curves test grades because he makes them difficult to pass. class is a waste of time. the only reason you should go is for attendance points, otherwise you would be better off any place, but here.
I loved him!! His class was easy to get a good grade in, but i learned a lot.  I loved listening to him, he is so nice and just a great guy to know.

Dr. Jon is a really nice guy. Granted I only have him for a seminar, but his class is insanely easy, and he's always willing to meet with you outside of class if you need any help. I think any class of his would be a good one to take.

Ok, first of all is he still teaching? And, for that matter, if he is still teaching, is he teaching out of the same binder with the yellowed notes? I mean they were yellowed when I was there 11 years ago! I loved my major but bemoaned every class I had with Jon. Sweet old man who loves to travel, but sociology is a current topic, the Trobriand Islanders, and Ishi are no longer profoundities in the study.
really nice person, but refuses to update material and is unclear and all over the place, goes off on tangents all the time
the SINGLE GREATEST waste of my time at pep.  doesn't pep force retirement once your lectures start sounding like bad talk radio?  i got an EASY A and i STILL wouldn't do it again.  STAY AWAY!!

WORST PROFESSOR in Pepperdine. By all means, avoid this guy. No real world experience. No academic credentials. Boring Classes. Expects the World on grading but offer no helps. If you go to office hours be prepared to be bored silly he does ALL the talking no real listening skills!! Should retire!!!
No Comments
Jon seems to put little effort into teaching his classes.  His work ethic makes an good argument against tenure.
One of the truly amazing professors at Pepperdine.  He rules!
It's about time this guy retires.  Sociology is a subject that should be kept up to date...  In Dr. J's class, nothing is current.

I didn't have any of his classes, but he was my freshman advisor and didn't help one bit.  He didn't seem to care at all about what I took, and even ok'ed taking calc, even though I didn't even need to take the course.  Not the best guy in the world.

Best Soc teacher there is. Read the book and pay attention in class and you'll be fine. He gives you the questions to the test before hand so you know what to study. He's the reason I'm minoring in Sociology. Related all the concepts to todays society.
I'm not sure where some of his test questions come from, but he will do anything to help students.  He genuinely cares and wants to help and understand us.
No Comments
Johnston is the nicest guy ever, but he doesn't like to lecture and so if you don't read the textbook then you don't learn anything.
Dr. Johnston is passive-agressive, extremly right-wing, and uses notes from the 1970s to teach soc. courses.  Two thumbs down.

Being a nice man does not a good professor make.  While Jon Johnston may be sweet and friendly, he does not know how to teach.  In addition, disagreeing with his views will be reflected in your grade.  If you're truly interested in learning, stay away.
Great Teacher.  Funny guy.  Makes class enjoyable.  I even considered being a Soc minor just to take more classes with him.
Dr. J is a really cool guy.  He's just hooked on being a republican.  He's ok in my book as a prof.
He is very easy, and a very funny guy..
give the guy a break. i think he's good and really cares about his students.
Worst prof. I ever had at Pepp.  Very intolerant to other viewpoints.
Best professor ever, doesn't teach you a thing.
No Comments
No Comments
Easiest 'A' on campus, you just have to pretend to enjoy it.
No Comments

Professor Zazzi is very passionate about what she teaches and is very well prepared/organzied as a professor. However, the homework load is extremely heavy and difficult. Do not take this class if you aren;t naturally good at math or you will be spending 12+ hours a week to get a B.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: the gateway exam broke me. i failed so many times, and i go to her office hours and she said she makes it harder each time. so much hw due at the worst times at midnight on a saturday every day it was never ending. first time ive ever cried because of a class. i got the A through w a couple of miracles.

Professor Zazzi is very kind and cares a lot about her students. It is very doable to do well in her class. She prepares you well for her exams and offers help if you need it. I would suggest taking her class just beware you will have more homework than you are used to. Awesome professor would take again!

By far the most amazing professor. She helped me to love math again. While I spent a lot of time outside of class studying and still received a poor grade, I would not switch it because I know I have learned the material and that will help me for the higher level math classes I will take. I would absolutely recommend her to anyone.
She is a good teacher for some but I found her to be quite difficult and wished her homework assignments were written by her rather than the textbook.

Such a sweet professor paired with a tough class. Course work is heavy, so make sure you have time to dedicate. Professor Zazzi is available a lot outside of class and her office hours are a great resource!

Amazing! She over prepares you for all exams, willing to help on homework during office hours, and gives lots of extra credit opportunities. You have to put in the work to get a good grade but if you pay attention you'll end with an A.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment:
Pros:
- Lectures are very useful and informative!
- Very caring, patient and hardworking for her students!
- Clear and speedy grading system where can always know what your grade in the class is
- Class material is well organized on Courses
- Gives great resources to study for exams


Cons:
- A lot of homework
- Strict deadlines for h/w assignments

Professor Zazzi is truly one of the most caring professors I have met. I had her 8:00 am class last semester and she was always super energetic and positive. If you aren't adept at math, be sure to do the homework and all the lectures as her tests are entirely based on what she puts on the practice problems. Very fair grader and wonderful person.

The professor was very energetic and passionate about her job; she loves math. She made it easy for us to follow along when taking notes. There is quite a bit of homework but she gives you more than enough time to complete it and it helps prep you for exams.

Professor Zazzi always takes the time to call on her students by name, there is mutual respect in her classroom which to me is very important. She as has clear and organized notes that allow her students to look back and see each step if they are confused.
Zazzi gives a lot of work with strict deadlines and has tough exams, but she is super caring and accessible. Her office hours are very helpful.

I took MATH 151 (Calc II) with Prof Zazzi. Be ready for lots of homework, but do ALL of it, practice is the only way to success in this class. Her exams are fair. If you stay up to task with assignments, you will do well. Also, take the gateway exam very seriously. It is a large chunk of your grade.
no comment

Professor Zazzi is one of the most helpful and kindest professors I've ever had. She truly cares about your success in the class. There is homework every week but it's not too bad. All the exams are exactly like her test reviews so as long as you look at the review, you'll do really well in the class.

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE PROFESSOR ZAZZI I couldn't recommend her more. She's a very kind and energetic person who is truly passionate about what she's teaching and cares if you do well or not. She's really good at explaining difficult topics and she gives guided notes. Get the textbook, she gives A LOT of hw at first but it goes down through the semester
Professor Zazzi is the best math professor ever!! Her notes are super organized and helpful and as long as you do the homework and study guides you will get a good grade.

She's an amazing professor and is really nice. She surprisingly connects math to business a lot. One of the only math classes I actually liked. Lots of homework tho, A LOT. You'll get a good grade in the class as long as you listen.
Great professor, lots of homework and late nights if you procrastinate. Tests are moderately difficult
She is very friendly and really wants to help each student succeed in her classes. She gives a lot of extra credit and helpful study guides. If you want to study Math 141, choose her.

Professor Zazzi is one of the best professors at Pepperdine University. Her lectures are entirely helpful everything from her teaching style to color coordinating notes. She is always accesible and truly cares about her students and their success. Definitely recommend.

Prof Zazzi is such an amazing person & I really like the way she teaches! Her study guides are really close in comparison to the 4 exams! (The Final is cumulative). I had Rojhani for Math 103 and I really wish I had taken Zazzi instead. Her homework is heavy (like 1 hour to do) & sometimes its way harder than it needs to be, but her class is good.

She is really hard with homework. The assignments are long and hard, and she grades very strictly. The tests will overwhelm you, but if you do the work you will certainly do well. I have not missed any class or homework assignments and I have over a 100. Attendance is certainly mandatory, and you have something to work on almost every day.

Amazing class, she is an awesome prof. She does a great job at making math easier to learn, I would have done awful in this coarse if I didn't have Zazzi. She does assign homework 1-2 times a week but the homework really prepares you for her exams, and the review for the exams is EXACTLY like the exam. Does not trying to pull tricks on you.

Prof Zazzi is a super nice teacher, however if you have ever taken a business calc class before you will be so bored as it is all review and she moves quite slow. Biggest complaint is the excessive amount of homework assigned that really doesn't correlate to the test, other than that he is chill but the homework are insane.

Sweetest teacher I've ever had. She really cares about you and your success in her class. Make sure to do the study guides because that's the best way to prepare for her exams! definitely take her if you can!
Not my favorite class but she always tried to make lectures fun. We did group activities and she offered some extra credit. We had 3 exams, 1 final and quite a lot of hw.

The amount of effort you put in reflects your grade. Goes through material slowly, maybe even too slow for some. Very, very kind and caring. No late work, but *tons* of extra credit. Harsh grader on hw, not on tests. Gives study guides that are exactly like the tests. 4 tests (inc. final), worth 70% of grade. 7/54 students finished with above 100%.

Zazzi is the best professor I have ever had, and you would be incredibly lucky to have her. Her classes require EFFORT and time, but you are 100% given all you need to succeed. She teaches content incredibly well and gives every opportunity for extra credit. I just suck at math, so I got a poor grade, but it was all me and not her.

There is pretty long homework twice a week (so every class) which she is not lenient about and has a grader grade fairly harshly. She is a fairly nice woman but she is going to make you work for your grade. She is not understanding at all unless you get someone to verify your issues (like sicknesses)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: it's the BEST math teacher at Pepperdine I ever had, and you absolutely can take her class for credit because she will give A LOT of extra credit to help you keep your grade up, and you also will get a lot of practice from the extra credit if you do it, and each test also have 5 points extra credit! TAKE HER CLASS!!! REALLY RECOMMEND!!!

Professor Zazzi is incredibly understanding and helpful. While attendance is mandatory she is forgiving and will cut you some slack when necessary. She makes class fun and engaging while also teaching the information in an effective and meaningful way. I thoroughly enjoyed her class and recommend it to anyone.

Super weird. You have homework every single day. You will read and write more essays than in any English class. She doesn't grade with letters or numbers, only checks and minuses?! Every time you understand stuff she questions you making you question your existence. No tests tho! The actual math is so easy but she makes it insanely overcomplicated.

Dr. Thoren is the best!! I took her class twice and had the best experiences in both. She completely changes a math class from being difficult and boring to engaging and fun with lots of interesting projects. She's extremely caring, educated, and makes the class environment very comfortable and accepting. Her class is SO fun!!

Be prepared for an untraditional approach to a Calculus class. Sometimes I enjoyed the different approach, but  I felt like I was learning in the moment but was not retaining. Nightly homework is given with the idea you will struggle, so you must get used to that. The professor is available for office hours and tries her best to help you.
this was a pretty fun class but can be sort of difficult if you aren't a math person. Most of the major grades like midterm and final are group projects so they are pretty easy.

Dr. Thoren is so kind and truly cares about her students; she makes the class a comfortable and safe space to learn. But her class is SO HARD. It is SO. much. work. So much writing! and if you're not in class, you quickly get behind and lost. She is a gem of a person, but the class takes up all of my time.
the only math were you have to write instead of actually do math. so confusing overall I don't recommend.

The material is easy a toddler could take this class. But it is time consuming outside of class. You have to put a lot of effort into your post works and portfolios. She was a pain with masks and made her students wear them after the mandate was dropped. She could lower your grade if you didn't because it's a "trajectory based" course.

THE WORST GRADER IN THE WORLD. DO. NOT. TAKE. THIS. CLASS. She does NOT care about you OR your grade. She doesn't teach, but rather, asks you MORE questions to make you even more confused. The worst teacher I've ever had in my life. If you're anxious about math, she makes your anxiety even worse. Professors matter to get the grade, don't take her.

Was lowkey scared when I read the reviews, but i was totally wrong. prof thoren teaches in a really refreshing way. math isnt my forte & i was expecting to get a bunch of homework with math problems & equations. but nope, we tackled very simplistic concepts & you ALWAYS work together; youre never left alone in confusion. take her class!!

As a Freshman, I was stressed about taking a math class online, but all my worries went away by day one of Thoren's Math120 class. While her grading system is a tad confusing, I found that it kept me from worrying about every little thing that went in the grade book. She cares a lot about her students and I honestly never felt overwhelmed.

Even though I got a good grade, this course nearly destroyed my semester. I was left guessing and so had to scramble to cover all possibilities. Every other student was way more lost, so group projects were a nightmare when they checked out. It would be better to not get a degree than to have courses taught like this. Politics in math too, sad

Her class was the most confusing and time-consuming of any in my life. One poorly taught class took as much energy as 3 other classes combined. I only received an A because I am a math whiz and I did triple the work of anyone else in the class. This course made me consider dropping out of college. She cares, but she may derail your entire caree

She treats you like an elementary schooler and then throws obscure mathematical concepts at you that you cant understand. Its a new and inexplicable level of demeaning frustration. It made me wish I took calculus in high school. But its doable, if you have to get your gen ed credit. She's not good, but she's not the worst.

We do a lot of group work. I took a lot of math in high school so this class was very easy. I personally did not use the textbook. She teaches us like we are in elementary school. I get very bored. This is the only math class where I have ever had to write papers (aka reflections). She is very nice, but I have yet to feel challenged.

The professor does not teach but instead expects the students to teach themselves. She is an incredibly tough grader and makes you give very detailed explanations to every problem. Get ready to teach yourself. She isnt very helpful at answering questions either. Take a different math teacher if you could.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Half the class is just awkward silence. She doesn't move on until someone answers her questions, so if you value your sanity and don't want to silently stare at a whiteboard, raise your hand. She seems like a good person but her teaching just does not work.

AVOID TAKING HER AT ALL COSTS. She is a HORRIBLE teacher! She does not know how to teach. Every day after class you're just more confused than before. She spends an entire class period on one problem and doesn't even finish solving it before class ends. If you go to her office hours, all she does is stare at you solve a problem and is NO HELP.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Worst math teacher. Doesnt matter if you get the problem right the graders will mark you down for not explaining. lectures are group work doing about 3 problems in an hour long class. She belongs at a community college I would give her a 0 if able to.

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS!!! She is a ridiculously harsh grader and you come out of class each day confused about what the lesson was. One of the only things she is good at is demoralizing you. She is very smart and probably has good intentions, but DO. NOT. TAKE.

It isn't the hardest math class but it isn't easy. She is a decent, approachable person who helps if you ask for it but her grading is somewhat inconsistent. A person can get full points even for having wrong answers on hw problems. It can lull you into a false sense of confidence until the exam which is far more harshly graded.

DO NOT TAKE HER! At this point she just trashed me in her office for 15min saying I need to change how I learn because that is how the real world is, while she isn't even in the real world herself. I am contemplating becoming homeless because I hate her class so much!!!

IF I could give her a ZERO I would she is the rudest professor I have ever had here at Pepperdine University. I normally do not like to complain however, she is a monster Professor. She can not explain anything but wants us to explain it, I am having to drop the class due to my D on the midterm. She really wants you to fail the class!

If there was an award for worst Professor in America she was be the Champion without competition. I have never had a worst teacher in my life. I have never received less than a B on any exam here at Pepperdine and she gave me a 58% on the midterm. I went to her office hours right after and she said that I need to change how I learn in her class.

DO NOT TAKE HER WHATEVER YOU DO!!! AWFUL AWFUL WAY OF TEACHING!!! If you can even call what she does teaching. I just received my first midterm grade and it was a D after studying for hours. I emailed her about it when class was over and I got my test back and she said that I should drop the class because I don't have the skills needed. WHATEVER
Legitimately the worst teacher I have ever had. AWFUL just got my first midterm back in her class and I got a 61% on it after studying for a week. AWFUL AWFUL person...

Legitimately the WORST teacher I have ever had. Gives zero instruction on what to do in a given problem and just stares at her students while none of them has an explanation. She grades harshly and is not helpful whatsoever in her office hours. DON'T TAKE HER
She is a horrible professor!!!!! She does not teach at all during class and is not helpful during business hours. She grades extremely unfair and does not give any feedback.
The worst teacher I have had at Pepperdine. She does not teach at all and does not help you when you go to business hours

Doesn't give clear instruction then grades very harshly. I have had several conversations with her about my grades and why she gives me such low scores when my answers are correct and she has responded "I want to push you" or "I think you are capable of more". If she doesn't like you, you won't do well.

Did not explain anything. Gives a question and has you do it as a group every class but never tells us whether we've done it right or wrong so you never know how to do the tests. She's a terrible teacher you won't learn anything unless you can figure it out for your self.

This is the most awful professor you could ever take at pepperdine due to her inability to make students comfortable or feel intelligent. Demands WAY too much for a GE and the structure of her course is ridiculous. You will feel like you are taking an upper division capstone instead of a GE. DO not take this course with this professor.

Professor Peterson is a kind person, but not the best professor. She is very intelligent and knows her course content well, but does not really teach you much. If you are not naturally good at learning foreign languages or do not have prior knowledge of French, I would not recommend this class! Easy course to pass, difficult course to learn in.

Super sweet lady. Lectures are only in Spanish which is hard to understand, make friends with other students in class. If you go to lecture, study hard for the exams, and participate in class, you will be fine. If you're ever struggling, communicate with her. She is super understanding.

Prof. Peterson is a funny & sweet lady. She is a horrible teacher. She only talks in Spanish even when she is teaching the lesson or is giving important information so half the time you don't know what is happening. She assigns lite homework every night and gives hard tests every other week. She's nice but I would never take her for a language.

If you already know French, then take her. She will give you a good review. But, if you are seeking to learn French, then I wouldn't take her. She doesn't really actually teach. I already knew French when I took her class, so it was super easy because she doesn't give a lot of work. But you need a lot of work to actually learn, so.

While she is nice and not a harsh grader, she slacked off in class a lot by not teaching. If you're a student that doesn't care about learning French and just wants to pass, then she's probably the perfect teacher. If you like French, she is frustrating. She also doesn't teach. If you want more explanation, she'll point to the book for explanation.

She is one of the nicest professors on campus. She is very intelligent, humorous and professional about the subject that she is teaching. Her quizzes and exams are not difficult if you go to class and study for them. Take her for foreign language classes! She is a very lovely lady!
Madame Peterson is intelligent, proficient in several languages, and really funny.  Take her if you can!
Her French 150 class is INCREDIBLY difficult. Unless you've already taken french, don't go in expecting an A. Utilize her office hours. You'll need them.
She was hard to understand.  She never explained things clearly and would often get off subject and waste time in class.

Nosy, unorganized and disrespectful towards students when in a bad mood. Very small class size makes it awkward when a student would be confronted in front of everyone- hope you have thick skin and absolutely love French- you'll need both after dreading this class!

I was dreading taking Spanish because I struggled with it in high school, but Sra. Peterson made the experience extremely enjoyable. She is just a fun and outgoing professor who also knows how to effectively teach Spanish. She's not too tough of a grader, either. Highly recommended!
I really enjoy this class, it is a lot of fun and she jokes with us a lot. But it is also challenging, so pick what you want.
Very good teacher!
Currently taking her class. She's like a cute grandma and silly at times. Ask her for help, and she'll help you. Added the class at the last minute and didn't regret it. :)

She was very noisy, wanted to know all about your personal life... which was justified  because it is asked in French. She definitely has favorites- and will act upon her mood swings~ watch out! She is extremely unorganized, caddy and doesn't teach! I absolutely love French and was very disappointed. If you can, try and avoid her all together.

She is a really nice sweet lady.  She isnt too hard just study and she will guide you what to study for as well for the tests.  She actually teaches spanish but likes to have a lot of random conversations! But she is great!!

nice woman but its true- you ask her qs sometimes and she turns to a book. Eng isn't her 1st language either so sometimes she isn't right concerning translations. But she means well and consults the native French profs to get the best answer. I would say that she is the hardest grader in the Fr department. She's very nice and cares about us. i still like her class
She is a very nice lady and a good teacher.  She gives a small amount of homework each day, and her tests are very fair and easy.
like your favorite grandma!

I'm taking a 3rd class from her because I liked her so much. Make sure you go to class and speak up a LOT and she'll like you. Tests aren't too bad. She likes to know a lot about her students--its kind of funny! She's nosey but she asks it in French so she gets away with it. Good prof

Worst French professor-just because someone can speak a language doesn't mean they can teach it. Ask this woman to clarify something and she acts confused and turns to the text book. Beware of her accent-you'll swear she's saying "le" the first time then repeats the same thing saying "la"- fricken frustrating!

she's a fun teacher - true, she gives out a lot of hw, but her tests are reasonable. but she does take participation very seriously! so show up to class and participate in the class conversations and you'll ace the class.
She's silly and fun in class but her tests suck and she barely teaches in class. She gives out a lot of homework and likes to just chit chat instead of making sure you understand the language

She's really fun and lets you have fun in this class. I hear she's much more hardcore with her 152 class though. I found this class hard but that's because French is hard for me. On the plus side I learned more French this semester then I ever have. It's a GE folks, but she really did make it fun
If you show up to class, do the homework and sit in the front she will love you.  Just show her your trying and you'll be fine!

i love mme peterson! she's so cute, easy going, and she seems to really love teaching and she's interested in her students. although she does give out a lot of hw, her tests and assignments aren't hard. i really recommend her! she rekindled my love for the french language

Little german woman, with european tendincies. Knows the language. Isn't always clear on what she expects on test. If you put in the extra study time you will do fine  , but don't  expect to slack off.

She is very nice and very helpful. Her class is fun and she actually makes it enjoyable because she is nosy, but gets away with it because she asks it in French! She's a sweet lady, and a very GOOD teacher.
i had a super small class so there was a lot of one to one interaction. she's a really nice lady and she knows her material.
she's such a sweetheart!
great teacher, hard grader

Though she is a sweet lady, I think she is passed her teaching prime. She is highly disorganized, goes on random tangents, and is not really understanding if you have personal problems. She doesn't actually teach French, more just about culture and life which is cool and all but I wanted to improve my french. She asks Q's, then interrupts you.

Mme. Langford is a nice lady but an absolutely awful teacher. She talks about nothing of relevance for the entire class period and expects you to understand what she is teaching without writing any explanations on the board. Such a waste of $4,000 if you actually want to learn French. She just makes it more confusing.

Langford is a great person. She's very interesting and you can tell that she's lived through a lot and inferred a lot out of what she's experienced. Yes, she's disorganized and often her assignments aren't clear, but the class is fun, and she is hilarious. She isn't afraid to get edgy with what she says. Definitely take her if you're laidback.

Dr Langdon really knows her stuff.  While she does tend to go off on topics regarding french culture and the like, they are often filled with good information.  Tests aren't too hard, but you don't get a lot of time.  If you smile and are engaged in class, she will like you.  Getting her to like you will help your grade!!

Dr. Langford is a highly accomplished literary analyst who has much to teach you if you are willing to listen and engage. She is an expert in her field and although her tangents may be found as distracting, there are gems of wisdom in the majority of what she has to say. Contrary to other comments, she welcomes and adores discussion.
i had her. she is the worst teacher to have, especially if you're not that good in it. She doesn't teach and she expects you to know everything

Although she might be very opinionated, she is cheerful and loves to talk about French culture. She may seem to go off tangents but at least listening to her in French helped me improve my listening skills.

She is, according to those who enjoyed her class and people like me who wanted to die, insane. Her class is a lecture class on her views of US/French society and discussion is kept to a minimum. With a small class, I expected to learn and discuss daily in French. Instead, I found a woman who sees her teacher evaluations and ignores the suggestions.

Madame gets a bad rap. Yes, she does tend to ramble and talk about herself. Yes, you do have to really work hard and teach yourself to keep up. Yes, it's a language and so it's a lot of work. But Madame is extremely cheerful and makes going to class fun. She knows a lot, and teaches you about the language and about life. Very helpful if you need it

I failed the midterm and final, and still got a C in the class. She never has grades done on time, she barely remembered the names of our 12 person class, and she spends most of class just telling stories. But sit through it, just listen and laugh. Don't take her if you want to learn. But I showed up, did most of the work, and she passed me.

i hate when people label her crazy or insane.. please she's a little eccentric thats all. just because she isnt the generic american professor give her a break. she's sweet and funny and a genuinely good person. highly recommendable
madame is obsessed with herself, so if you enjoy listening to old french ladies talk for 2 hours, her class is for you.  I learned nothing except how to tune her out.
Oh LA LA! Madame est tres sympa! She is not too hard, but classes seem to go on FOREVER. I like her though, she knows a lot about France, and can read people very easily. Oui oui!

This is a really easy class..mme langford is really funny and we spend a lot of time in class just talking for fun about really random topics. her quizes are pretty easy if u pay attention in class and take notes. we had to write 2 french essays which were super easy because she tells u 2 use word and sends you a site to check ur grammer.
Great teacher. Always willing to help and very understanding. If you want the real French experience, then take Madame. Once you take her, you will never want anyone else!
Mme is the best, she is fun and knows what she is talking about, even though she alwayz gets on tangents and random topics, it is a real fun class, learned a lot...

Ah, pauvre Madame.  She tries, she really does, but nothing is ever achieved in her classes.  I have had 3 with her now, and my franglais is much improved, which is more than I can say for my French.  Alas, you really don't have much of a choice if you're a French major, she's one of 2 teachers.

Madame is a little nuts, well very nuts really, but she is real nice and the class is too easy...good class, you will learn a lot from her ideas and opinions. Just remember them and try to agree with her...and u will be fine.
Madame is the best!!!  Her class is so easy; of course, I'm french.  I guess if I did not speak the language, it would be a different story...

Sometimes unfocused, hard to pay attention all the time.  Tests were very difficult, but not unfairly so.  Takes personal pride in each student, and after cutting down the class size, she won't allow you to fall behind.  Always available outside of class.

I count down the seconds spent in her class because it such a gigantic waste of time. You could seriously not go at all and learn the subject out of the book and speak better French that you will learn from her. Plus, she's insane! Avoid if possible.
Mme is AWESOME!
No Comments
elle est bien preservee mais elle ne parle que <<franglais>> et cela m'embete.  je n'ai rien appris le semestre avec elle mais elle est sympa et un peu fou
Dr. Langford demands quite a lot in terms of work and is very nice, but the teaching could improve.  less stories, more instruction would be good but overall a good friend and mentor.

Dr. Langford is perhaps the most eccentric prof I've had thus far..her class on days there are not assignments or sondages is like her personal soapbox, but when we have sondages or finals, we are pretty much blown away...by the difficulty. Gotta love her

I want to gouge out my left eye when I'm in her class.  She speaks more anglais then francais.  She's nice but should be no where near a classroom.  Avoid at all cost.  Those who say otherwise are lying.
Mme is an AWESOME prof!  Seriously, she is the best French prof at Pepperdine.  Mme is tons of fun, but she is very serious as well and can be super difficult in her classes.
best teacher in school!
she's the head of the department, which is really sad

LOVE PROF NOVELLE. she is so passinate about marketing and shares so many real world insights. If you are intrested in marketing, this is one of the most worth while classes you can take at pepp. Class is not very difficult at all. Only assignments are the two tests and a project where you learn how to do a marketing plan for a product you create.

Never fails to make a simple and intuitive class overly complex and hard. She has a passion for the subject, but does not do an actual good job making the course fun or interesting. Her lectures are super fast and acts that she does not have time to answer questions in class. Get ready to make this class your priority even though it's 3 credits.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Good person, but not the best teacher. Lectures run through very fast and it's hard to understand all that information in one class. Tests are memory based and has a lot of useless information that could've not been talked about, I would take another professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Professor Novell is nice but is really hit-or-miss. She is by no means a bad professor, she just tries to fit a lot of content into short classes, so all lectures feel rushed. Her exams are pretty easy, just go to class and do the study guides. She's a manageable professor for anyone taking marketing, but don't expect it to be your favorite class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: I honestly do not get why she has such a bad rating, she is such a clear and concise professor. You know what you're getting into and what she expects. A lot of it depends on your group project, but if you meet regularly with your team you should be fine. Learned a lot and would recommend this class!

Prof Novell knows her stuff and her lectures are pretty engaging and relevant to current events. However, the group project is a big part of your grade. Tests are actually 4 small quizzes given during the semester, not cumulative, and no big final so that is a nice break. Would recommend the class, but definitely have to work to earn a good grade
1 group project- 2 parts and 3 quizzes. Professor doesn't give much feedback, limited information is attached within each slide and the course is very lecture-heavy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: All I have to say is: make sure you get a good marketing plan group otherwise you will be living a semester long nightmare. Quizzes are on a lot of info so make sure you study the study guides in detail. She can sometimes take a few days to respond to emails, so I would recommend office hours for questions.

The marketing plan and group project definitely take a lot of time so make sure to be in a group with people that work well together. Tests are off the study guide so review it. I definitely learned a lot about marketing and was able to use that marketing plan as a sample of my work for an internship I got in the summer working at Red Bull.
She is one of the few professors who genuinely wants her students to learn and strives to prepare them for real life. She gives genuine advice and truly cares about her students.

Professor Novell is the second-worst professor I have had thus far in my academic career. She is the harshest grader I have ever seen and a massive portion of your grade comes from four quizzes that are completely based on memory and by no means can gauge the grasp one has on the material. Please please please do yourself a favor and avoid her.
Professor Novell was awesome! She helped me prepare for an interview and I got the position. One of the most caring professors I've ever had.

Loved her! She was always so enthusiastic in class and made the students feel excited about marketing. She was really helpful whenever I had questions about the marketing plan. Definitely recommend this class, I learned so much.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Very nice person. Horrible teacher. Instead of testing you on concepts of marketing that could be helpful in the business world later on, you'll be tested on utterly useless information that is solely based on memory. If this is a required class for you, pick a different teacher. If it's not required, save your money.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Professor Novell really cares about students and you can definitely do well in the class if you put in hard work. However, she puts way too much material on the exams. She even puts material on the test that was never even covered in the classroom. Make sure you choose good teammates for the group projects because it is a major part of the grade
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Oh and here's another thing about Corinne you won't ever know what's your grade in the class unless you personally email her and that's if she decides to respond to your email. She takes forever to grade that's why I can't even tell you my grade and final's already over. You just better pray that curve will do you justice in the end.

Her grading doesn't make any sense at all. Her class structure is based on the midterm and final along with a marketing plan (group project), case analysis (group project), and participation. Just read the textbook because that's where all the answers are for the exams. Her study guide is 33 pages so basically the appendix.

WORST TEACHER EVER. Gives the worst feedback ever& when you ask her to clarify she cant. Never available after class & never responds to emails. Lectures are long & boring. She'll never let you go early. She gives you a 30-page study guide for midterm and final and expects you to know every piece of info, even if she doesn't talk about it in class.

This was a great class because of professor Novell. She is a tough grader but really cares about her students. She is available for her office hours and really tries to bring in guest lecturers from cool companies like Hulu and Snapchat. Her tests are tough but her study guide is self explanatory. I would recommend her class if you can study

This is a class that requires a lot of students but ultimately is fair. Professor Novell is pretty available and cares about her student. Her tests are difficult but she grades on a curve. She is lecture heavy but her tests are fair. Review her study guide and you should be okay. Great class overall.

Professor Novell is one of my favorite teachers. She genuinely cares about her students and I can tell she puts a lot of effort into teaching from real life examples in addition to the book. Her course is difficult and a lot of material but her exams are pretty straight forward. The group project is annoying but overall, I enjoyed the class.

I never write reviews on here but I wanted to write one to warn other students of this professor. I would rather take a 6 hour class on a Saturday night than sit in this class for an hour and a half twice a week. She just lectures the whole time which is fine, but the volume of material that is tested is unreal. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR

I was a marketing minor until this class. This professor ruined marketing for me and made me drop my minor. She goes out of her way to call out students in class and cares more to brag about herself than help her students. She is always in a rush to leave class instead of staying 5 min after to answer questions. AVOID THIS PROFESSOR
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: This is by far the single worst professor I have ever had in my life. We are graded on 4 assignments all year: 2 projects and 2 tests. The projects are not very difficult, but the way she grades makes no sense. The midterm and final test you on every single thing you ever learned. She is socially awkward and tries to be funny but it's just weird.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Novell is by far the worst professor I HAVE EVER HAD. She is extremely unorganized and unbelievably unhelpful. She is not willing to listen to your suggestions to improve the course because she is convinced she knows what she is doing when she clearly does not. Her caused the marketing majors in this class to change their majors. AVOID THIS CLASS
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: One of the worst professors at Pepperdine. Very disorganized and difficult to deal with. Unclear with project expectations and unwilling to change. Bragged about what she owns and plans to buy instead of teaching marketing. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Avoid taking her for marketing at all costs. Unreal amount of difficulty. Has a huge group project and grades it super hard especially with regards to citations and grammar. Tests are super hard. the study guide was 26 pages. Not available well outside of class. Doesn't take feedback about her well either

She's really sweet, but this class was my least favorite of the semester due to the unjustified workload. She doesn't know how to teach to the level of a college student and not a research scientist. It's her first year and I feel like in 2 years she will be one of those hard yet rewarding professor but right now it's just hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is way too difficult for an introductory marketing course. I understand that this is her area of expertise, but she expects way too much. Her lectures are all textbook definition based. She just reads off of the powerpoints for the entirety of the class. If you want an engaging course, look elsewhere.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Novell seems to go out of her way to not help the students. She does not share the slides from the lectures, she does not have a study guide, and she does not give a review the class before the test. Her marketing plan project is too broad. IF YOU CAN TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR, DO IT!

I would not recommend taking courses with Mason. His expectations are unreasonably high and instructions for exams are unclear, which leads to confusion. He makes no effort to connect with his students. He has taken comments or situations out of context and held them against students, which feels unfair and unprofessional.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Genuinely makes a strong argument for the best prof and class at Pepperdine. If a prospective student came to me with one professor they had to have a class with, it would be Professor Mason. This class counts for Religion 300 credit, and needs to be advertised better, b/c more people need to know about it!

I recently finished Phil 301 (Reasons for Faith) with Professor Mason, and I can confidently say that it was the most influential class I have taken at Pepperdine. The class builds your mind, forces you to think critically, and ultimately, can define your college experience if you take it seriously. Should be a GE, best prof/class at Pepperdine

As my very first mentor in philosophy, Mason remains the best teacher and philosopher according to my knowledge. All the works I have done are mere attempts catching up to his level.
