The extent of Mason's philosophical knowledge and expertise is incredible. Take him, and you shall walk out from the Cave of shadows to the world of truth and wisdom.
WONDERFUL man!! He is like a modern prophet.

A wonderful man and educator. Mason Marshall is incredibly intelligent, kind, and hilarious. He feeds you the red pill, which dispels the Matrix of our society, and then leads you to pursue what is true and real. I cannot put into words all this man has done for me, but I cannot RECOMMEND him enough! Take his class, or else live life as a fool.

Mason is the best. He is so intelligent and so easily accessible (he always answers my emails within a couple of hours). His Intro Philosophy class is the reason I changed my major to philosophy. He is a very caring professor who wants his students to succeed. Would definitely recommend him.

I love Dr. Mason. He is so caring and wants to see you succeed. He always made time for me even if it was outside his usual office hours. He is extremely smart and everything he says is so intelligent. I truly respect him and can't wait to take more classes with him. He is a harsh grader but is always willing to go over essays with you.

If you think that his classes are hard, then you're clearly not paying attention, engaging in conversations, or reaching out to him outside of class-he goes above and beyond to provide office hours scheduled or not. Taking his courses has changed my life for the better and has equipped me with the capacity to think clearly. Take him!

This was an all around good class. He is engaging which makes it easy to pay attention. Each exam has an essay that is due outside of class and an in class quiz worth 10%. There are only three but they are very doable. Participation is a quarter of your grade so if you are anxious about speaking in class then do not take. I learned a lot in class.

I can confidently say this has been the worst class I have ever taken. Lectures are excruciatingly dull, and the setup of discussions is very uncomfortable (especially for students with anxiety). There are only three exam grades in this class and we are graded on nothing else. I have never been so stressed about what seems like such an easy course
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Mason is weird because he is a very kind and accessible man, however he is a very harsh grader in his upper divisional classes. Additionally, he grades off of very little. perhaps I wasn't prepared for his class, but it is solidifying that I should drop out philosophy.

Professor Marshall is an amazing professor. I highly recommend his class. It really helps to expand your mind. I took his Reasons for Faith course for a GE credit. Be ready to read before class and participate a lot if you want to do well.

BEST professor on campus. There aren't enough words to describe how kind, helpful, and straight-to-the-point Mason is. If you're ever lucky to have a class with him, you won't regret it. He MADE my Pepperdine experience.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Best professor, no, educator, I've EVER HAD! I came into this class knowing nothing on philosophy. Mason was so respectful and kind; he really took time to answer any question in or outside of class. His classes are pure discussion, based on brief PDFs from the syllabus. His class makes you think, but, and this sounds cheesy, it expands your mind!!

He goes by Mason - Best professor I've ever had, and he got the Teacher of the Year Award to prove it. He cares about you as a person, helps with hw even for other classes, and you can tell he wants every student to succeed. READ HIS SYLLABUS. EVERY PAGE. He's kind, but he has strict grading eccentricities that he only mentions in the syllabus.

Mason improved me by teaching me how to think independently and bravely about life's biggest questions. The thoroughness and dedication with which he structures his courses allow each student to get the most out of her time with him. Too, his syllabi and hand outs are models for other professors. Reallythey're spectacular.

Mason (not John) Marshall is everything a good philosophy teacher should be. I loved his class, it was focused on discussions and not assignments. He is super easy to get along with and very encouraging. He convinced me to double major in Philosophy. You learn a lot in his class without having to do a lot, which I think is amazing. Great professor!

Marshall is the reason why I'm majoring in Philosophy! SUCH a knowledgeable man. He wants each one of his students to succeed. His focus doesn't rely on grading you, but rather educating you and sharing the passion he has for Philosophy to his students. As for grading, don't dread it. Do amazing on the three exams that he gives and participate!

Prof Marshall genuinely cares about his students, in my estimation more so than any other professor I have had. He is encouraging and affirming even when the subject material is difficult. Upper division philosophy is no walk in the park with Marshall, he teaches graduate type material to undergrads and he expects you to bring it.
Mason is an incredible professor. He does not spoon feed you answers; rather, he makes you think well and deep. Do whatever you can while at Pepperdine to take one of his courses.

For an intro class, Mason does an good job covering a large area of philosophy and introducing logical ideologies and how to form arguments. HIs lectures are boring at times, but I don't know anyone who could make the subject any more interesting. Prewrite your essays, come to class, and laugh at his jokes and your pretty much set for an A.

Every lecture is well thought out and he provides hand-outs going over each argument discussed in the class. Very organized, and one of the smartest people I have ever met. He is always available for office hours and will talk for hours with you about philosophy or anything else. Great professor overall.
A teacher in the truest sense. Professor Marshall is the only platonist didact I've come across. Rather than giving you the answer, he lets you dredge it up from within yourself.

To those that want to become better critical thinkers, take Dr. Marshall. To those who want to be spoon fed ideas or information, seek out a professor who's more "clear."  Better yet, take sociology, not philosophy.  Dr. Marshall does his students a service by sometimes being deliberately obscure . . . he encourages his students to actually THINK.
Mason is an incredible person that will always be happy to listen, no matter the subject. I probably learned more last semester (with two of his classes) than I did in the last 3 years of college.

He isn't the easiest of professors and during the class it usually seems that you aren't learning. However, when the class is done I've often found that I learned a ton. One of the best qualities of this professor is that he clearly that he loves what he does and wants students to find what they love to do as well, especially if that's philosophy.

Mason is one of the most  empathetic and interesting people I have ever met. He is truly brilliant and is delighted to speak with his students outside of class; further, he is knowledgeable both about philosophy and other subjects. In short, if you take a class with Mason Marshall, get to know him: kindness and genius are rarely mixed.

Excellent Professor! I learned a lot in this class. Your grade is completely based on papers and class discussion so you have to go to class every time and there is no room for error. Overall it was a great class!

Mason is a very nice person and cares about his students. He is at heart, however, a philosophy teacher, a fact does not go unnoticed in my Great Books class. Personally, I loathe the class because the books are discussed in an entirely round about manner limiting understanding. It is necessary to enjoy philosophy to do well in (and like)his class.

I have Mason for Great Books this semester! This prof is brilliant - his Philosophy Ph.D. is from Vanderbilt! Also, he respects his students and doesn't act pretentious at all. He is always available to help students with their papers, each of which is worth 25% of the cumulative grade. It's essential to know your books for those. Mason is great!

I was super disappointed with the amount of cattiness and lack of professionalism from Susan. You think teachers will rise above, but Susan isn't above disparaging her students and the system.  It's an easy pass, so just take the class and don't engage and you can coast on through without learning a thing.
Professor Salas was the best professor I had my first semester and she was also an amazing advisor. She really cares about her students and her seminar is interesting and fun.

Susan Salas is awesome! I had her for my freshmen seminar teacher and the class dealt with the appreciation of film. We watched movies every class and our homework was to complete sheets about the movie. The difficult questions she even went over with us in class. Salas is very helpful and wants to see her student succeed. One of the best!
best teacher ever, especially for freshman seminar

Professor Salas is very uptight and VERY bi-polar. Her smile is more like a showing of teeth than a genuine expression of happiness. She also has zero credentials in the industry. Not the insider that she wants you to believe she is. Total fraud.

Salas will let on that she is an expert. Let's be honest, she was a commercial actor; she really doesn't know what she's talking about. She calls claims to have "produced films" when in reality she produced a couple short films for film students. She is very condescending and demeaning. Take what she teaches with a grain of salt. She is full of it.
Best teacher ever.

Amazing professor... she really knows her stuff. She may seem "stressed out" duting class, but her stress is what drives the students to perform in real world conditions. She teaches class with an emphasis on what the realworld in the tv industry is really like. If your telecomm major, she will lead you to success (if you do your part)

Professor Salas is energetic, knowledgable and extremely encouraging.  Her studio class is a hands-on blast.  This class is heavily participatory...so ask a lot of questions and don't be afraid to get involved.
The best...hands down
she is way to stressed. does not create a relaxing class environment.

She is a great teacher and person.  One of the coolest teachers at Pepperdine, she knows her stuff and is very helpful.  She is there to make sure you succeed not for her to do research.  Very good teacher, high reccomendation.
She Rocks!

An amazing mentor. Truly believes in her students. Can be moody in a class setting but offer your help to her, and you will gain from just being near her. She is the only professor I care about keeping in touch with after college.
No Comments
She is amazing.  What an excellent mentor to have had in college.
Just a great teacher!

I loved having Salas all through Telecom, she was very good at teaching theory but then also keeping you in touch with the reality of the entertainment business.  She was also always helpful and if you put in the effort so did she.  Excellent teacher!
Great teacher, always willing to help and gives great advice. Is always ready to drop anything to help you out and takes her students seriously.
she has her favorites and if you aren't you are pretty much screwed. Sometimes rude, sometimes nice; depends on her mood.
like my mom says, "if you dont have anything nice to say, dont say anything at all."

Salas is an awesome teacher. The material is boring by nature, but she really tries to spice up the class. Her tests aren't too hard if you do the reading. If not, a "C" is achievable through good guessing!
Wonderful teacher. I really loved the experience having her as a teacher.
great, enthusiastic, funny. She knows her stuff. Very resourceful. Class is fun and you learn a lot
Salas is helpful, but lacks the TRUE knowledge of the industry to be a truly great professor in the field.
very helpful
she is so understanding, like an extra mom
she is a trip!  sit in the front and read the book--she'll love you for it.
only nice to guys
No Comments

You don't learn anything in class. You watch films, and Parmelee tells you what he thinks. Every class is a waste of time. He grades extremely hard for grammar, which should not be the case, as this is not an English class. Overall, he's a nice guy, but the class is highly disorganized and unproductive, so I wouldn't recommend it.

Parmelee is one of the worst professors Ive ever had. Hes a really nice guy but he doesnt know how to teach. He rambles on about nothing for entire class periods. Hell ask you a question and then talk over you when you answer. He grades pretty harshly and all learning takes place outside of class. He could make better use of class time.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's a nice guy. Talks for a long time, but he grades pretty fairly and gives lots of opportunities to improve your grade. Passionate about what he teaches and is knowledgable, but can be a little boring when he talks for the whole class period.

There is a textbook used but it is not required you buy it as he barely discusses it. The class difficulty is reasonable. Nothing extraordinary. The class is not academic at all and mostly consists of the professor commenting on certain aspects of film history. No slides. No lecture notes. Watch films outside class, write essays, and participate.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This is the easiest english class at pepperdine. I didn't do any of the assigned readings (just read summaries) and I passed the quizzes. There are no tests, but 4 writing assignments which are quite simple. Parmelee is a funny and caring guy, and is very knowledgable about literature and film.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's a nice person and gives helpful feedback on essays outside of class but doesn't make good usage of class time. He just mumbles on and on about seemingly nothing. He gives us reading but doesn't care whether we read them or not. The class itself is not difficult except for the final research paper which is worth 3001000 points.

Learned nothing! Parmelee rambles on with  boring & empty lectures then is extremely harsh in grading the many papers assigned. (Papers abt films to watch on our own time & w our own money.) Parmelee doesnt use rubrics & only grades grammar without considering essay content. He must think film451 is a graduate English class. Didn't use the book!
Great teacher and interesting guy. He is a hard grader and its all essays

He is a very nice guy and smart teacher but he loves to ramble. Much of class seems dedicated to him showing how smart he is. He grades his papers as if it is an English class instead of a film class. He grades more on grammar then on content. Reading the book is unnecessary, DO NOT BUY IT.
He's a pretty nice guy, tends to go off on long tangents about how he feels. It's pretty much impossible to get an A on a paper, but overall it's a decent class. he gets mad if you miss class.
watch good movies, a tough grader, tends to go on and on about seemingly nothing. overall its a decent class, almost anyone would do alright.
attendance important....chill class ..not much reading ..watch some really cool movies and he is really nice and always willing to help u out. Take this guy if u want a good english GE
I usually hate english but parmelee is the man lectures are somewhat chill and he is very helpful outside the class room

I loved this class! Take this class if you want your writing skills to be stretched. If you'll put effort into your essays, you'll love this class. You'll write 2-3 drafts per essay assignment, which means that you have many opportunities to improve your paper and get that A!
Great guy, dry sense of humor! Class is very easy and doesn't require much work besides some essays. What makes the class hard is his essay grading! You can never get an A on any paper!

Mr. Parmelee is a really nice teacher....his classes are not extremely interesting, but given the topic, he makes an effort to try to make it enjoyable....you get to watch a lot of movies, but then you have to overanalyze them for hours on end...

Great teacher. English class was a lot of fun - we just watched AFI top 100 films, discussed them, and wrote on them. Cares for students, and even brings snacks sometimes! Very organized and structured.
No Comments
Great Christian man-he truly cares about his students.
easy enough class if you just try a little.  yeah its boring but not too hard at least
yeah he kinda babbles on sometimes, but i liked him, he knows his stuff about movies and gives more time than he needs to his students.
He drones on and on.  He repeats himself a lot.  He teaches an easy class though.

i took his class on american films....u get to watch like 4 movies...not that bad at all but he's a pain about tardiness. not that hard of a grader and he lets u have multiple drafts.probably the easiest of the english 101 classes
Blah, blah, blah, blahblahblah.... lectures so long they last after class!!!
Just when you thought it couldn't get any worse.
He almost kicked me out of school...i have a word or two about him!!
tends to get side tracked, always informative
gets off on tangents, hard grader, but little work
Watch your quotation marks

Professor Harriger is absolutely amazing. Her lectures are very engaging and the information she presents is very retainable as long as you pay attention. The tests are definitely difficult, but she is very helpful in terms of extra help and wants all her students to succeed. As the semester goes on, you get a better idea of how you should study

Harriger truly is a superwoman! She is one of the most well-respected individuals in the field of Body Image & Eating Disorders, and her class is an accurate reflection of her tremendous accolades. Class is essentially a simulation of a graduate seminar. Fabulous class and an even better professor! Take 456 if you're lucky enough to get into it.

Amazing psych professor. Makes her class so interesting and you learn so much. You do need to study but all the material you need to know is in her lectures. Her exams are extremely fair and she's just a great professor and person in general. Take as many classes with her as you can at Pepperdine!!

Body Image & Eating Disorders is my favorite class I've ever taken! This course does have A LOT OF reading, though. Grade is composed of four big exams, reflection papers, discussion leader, and a final project. Participation is also graded but this interactive element makes the class much more engaging. I am glad I took this course, it's awesome!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: I love Dr. Harriger! She's so sweet and understanding. This class was super interesting. There's four exams and four papers but she gives clear rubrics. The exams are pretty long so be ready to write. Attendance isnt mandatory just make sure you get the notes from someone because she doesnt post her lectures!

I love Dr.Harriger- if you get a chance to take her for any class- DO IT. She is so understanding & truly wants you to succeed. She is super fun to talk to as well. She makes you feel like a friend rather than her inferior. Her tests are 80 multiple choice questions which can be a lot, so you need to study. Lecture based with textbook!!!

I JUST LOVE HER WITH MY WHOLE HEART! Such a sweetheart with amazing lectures to match her fun and outgoing personality. Her tests were not too difficult if you read the text and payed attention in class. She was always available outside of class and would respond to emails very quickly. Loved her!

Always a pleasure to come to class. Very entertaining and thoughtful. Stays engaged with class throughout whole lecture. Exams and essays are on the challenging side, but she is very willing to support if you come to office hours. Learned a lot. Definitely take her class(es) if you can.

I absolutely love Dr. Harriger. Not only are her lectures extremely helpful and clear for exam preparation, but she also makes you excited to learn. She is always there for extra assistance and guidance, and makes that very clear to each and every student. I would definitely take one of her courses again and I feel so lucky that she is my professor

Dr. Harriger is not only straightforward in her expectations but also one of the sweetest professors I have ever met! She is always willing to meet with you outside of class if you're struggling and her lectures are engaging. You do need to keep up with class material but she makes a lot of effort to respect your time. You won't regret taking her!

Dr. Harriger is a wonderful person and professor. She is passionate about subject matter, there for extra help, cares about her students, and is excellent at making lectures relatable/having examples, videos, or discussions to demonstrate material.

Dr. Harriger is one of the best professors I've ever had. She genuinely cares about her students as people and is available to meet during office hours or grab a coffee on campus. Her class is very interesting. The textbook is only needed to learn vocabulary not covered in class. Will definitely take more of her classes in the future.

I absolutely LOVED this class with Dr. Harriger. Her class was always something I looked forward to. As long as you read the textbook and are adequately prepared for the exams, they are pretty straightforward and easy to get an A on.

Prof. Harriger is very effective in clearly describing the over arching concepts of the chapter. You can go to the lectures without having read the textbook and be fully in-the-know by the end of the class. If you are adequately prepared, it's not hard to get an A on the tests. She is very fair and explains her reasonings clearly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She is one of the best professors I have ever taken. She is definitely not the easiest grader and her exams are hard and lengthy, but I can't express enough how much it's worth it. She's cute, super fun and love how she actually teaches material that integrates with the real world and people's lives. Seriously take her, just don't expect an easy A!

This was the best class I took at Pepperdine. Dr. Harriger is an amazing professor. I actually paid attention in all of the classes and learned a lot. Be sure to go to class and take notes. Also need to read textbook. But it is so worth it. Couldn't recommend her more.

The first exam was not easy, but if you go into her office hours she is willing to help. It's best to read the textbook because she does throw in some questions on exams. Lectures are mainly videos and notes that are best to memorize. Very generous with paper grade if you ask her for consultation/revision.
Dr. Harriger is the best! She uses lots of practical application. If you take good notes you don't have to read. Very accessible outside of class!

Great teacher! By far my favorite psych professor at Pepperdine. I think she grades pretty reasonably if you know your stuff for the exams. Honestly, those who think she is a tough grader or that her exams are hard, are those who didn't study for them. Go to class, study and you will get an A.

By far the best professor I've ever had, and one of the most wonderful people. Dr. Harriger is intelligent, enthusiastic, and passionate. Her classes are extremely organized and it is simple to learn and follow. She is always open to discussion, questions, and supporting her students.  Prof. is humble and respectful. All of her students are lucky.
She is very clear and thorough in her teaching.
She is an intelligent teacher, but can be a hard grader. Psych 210 (intro to psych for majors) was harder than it should be but I definitely learned a lot.

This was my favorite class. Dr. Harriger is so knowledgeable and interesting.  Even though she didn't take attendance, I went to every class because I loved it so much. I highly recommend her.  Take all of her classes!!

She's kind of immature and it gets annoying to have to sit and listen to her for 2 hours, luckily class isn't mandatory. She's also not the fairest grader in the world. Shows cool youtube videos though.
Really nice. go to class. really important, keep up with the readings and its easy.
she is a great teacher but a very hard grader. You will find yourself loving the course but hating the grades you receive. Make sure you read!
Dr. Harriger was my favorite professor thus far.  She is an excellent teacher, fair, and has a great sense of humor.
She is a very good professor who is fair.  She teaches the same from class to class and her expectations are consistent.  if you read and come to class you will do well

Good teacher. She tries to throw a Youtube clip or an activity into every lecture to make it interesting. She doesn't really use the main textbook (exam questions from lecture), but the psych studies book is essential because she tests on that reading and she has you do an oral presentation of one of the studies. Research paper was difficult.

Her lecture is very engaging. Although tests can be challenging bc materials are abstract, she makes test questions straightforward and doesn't grade harshly on free responses. There are also four assignments, you can pretty much get full points. It's one of the easiest classes I had at Pepperdine. She is also so caring and sweet. Highly recommend

She's super sweet and nice. Her class materials weren't easy but she drops the lowest exam and quiz scores. Her grading is on 3 exams, 4 assignments, 1 presentation with a partner, and 12 reading quizzes. She brought us snacks during the presentation. She doesn't grade on participation or attendance, but attend class or you'll miss a lot of info.

She knows her stuff and passionate with the subject. She's super sweet, nice, and approachable. She had a few tests and drops the lowest one. Her class is lecture based and it's a lot of info, so be ready. She brought over snacks for the group project presentation. She's very passionate about her class, so it never gets boring.Highly recommend her!

If you need clear guidelines for assignments, do not take Trammell. Her rubrics are not very clear, and she takes off points for random things she had never mentioned. She's very kind and she cares for her students, but she is definitely a tough grader. Reading the textbook is absolutely essential for the tests.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Way too harsh of a grader! Impossible to get a good grade on assignments or exams. Dry lectures, even dryer textbook. Do not take if you have a choice. She is nice, but this class is horrible.

I do not understand why Professor Trammell is judged so harshly on this site. Professor Trammell is an incredibly caring, approachable, and passionate professor. You have to show up to class, take notes, and read the textbook to succeed--just like any other class. She is not a "harsh" grader if you take the time to actually do your assignments.

Cognitive psych is "her thing" -- she is very intelligent and it feels like she expects us to be too, so she doesn't teach in an easy way for us to understand. She doesn't give study guides and her exams feel impossible even with a lot of studying.

She presents a huge amount of lecture content, the lectures are so dry, and she refuses to give study guides. I study a lot for her exams but it feels useless because the questions that she asks on the exams feel unfair; it feels like she's trying to trick us. Would strongly recommend taking a different prof.

Any poor ratings of Trammell literally put no work into the class. I put in the bare minimum effort and got an A-. She curves tests, drops your lowest exam and quiz grade (quizzes are on quizlet and completely online), and is really great at explaining the material. One group project that I would've gotten a 100 on but I turned in something late.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: I don't understand the low ratings for Trammell. She's incredible! I have had no problems with her at all. Her tests are manageable if you study, the homework really helps you study for the test, and she's such a quirky, nice little lady, who REALLY loves her craft and knows what she's talking about. Don't be afraid, just take her, esp for PSYC310.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a super caring, sweet, and a kind teacher. The material is hard to learn. It is not Trammel that makes the class difficult it is just the subject in general. She does a great job keeping us engaged during class with discussion and activities.  She drops your lowest test grade and gives you the possible quiz questions before.

Lectures are extremely dry. On assignments, she was very nit-picky with points. Her tests are also kind of impossible. She doesn't give study guides, and lecture content differs from the book but both are tested on. Majority of the class was failing tests so she had to curve. She's a nice person but avoid this course and professor if possible.

Took the class online. Very very very very hard tests. If you have to take her, make sure you watch all the recordings and take notes very carefully. Her criteria for A is 95 which is a mission impossible.
Extremely difficult. Professor was very unaccessible. She had to curve all of the exams because everyone was failing. No extra credit, lectures were fast, and very hard to follow.

I found Dr. Trammell to be one of the most caring professors I experienced at Pepperdine. She really wants to be helpful to her students, and cares to make sure that you are absorbing the material. One criticism I have is that her lecture style is a little dry. Quizzes are easy to study for and the class is not *too* difficult if you make effort.

nice person but a terrible teacher. reads straight off the slides which was taken right out of the textbook; no "new knowledge." exams were extremely difficult. accessible but not accommodating at all.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Tests are very difficult and she doesn't teach the material. Most of your grade is based on a group project where she expects you to write a research paper with no help and very high expectations. Acts like she cares but she really doesn't, no help with group work troubles. Do not take her, one of the worst teachers at Pepperdine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: I took two of her classes in the same semester (310 & 342). I regret everything. Taking one class is bad enough already, but I had her for two of my classes. Just a heads up, her exams are really hard. Especially the free response section. If you can avoid taking her classes, just avoid it. Since an A in her class would be ultra hard to get
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Trammell works hard to make sure students understand the material and what is going on in class in general. Her tests are not too bad, but be prepared to study a lot to be ready for them. She is accessible and accommodating. A big chunk of your grade is a group research project on a topic of your choice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Make sure you show up and make sure you read. As long as you do those things you should be alright. Accessible after class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Seems like a really nice person, and makes the first few classes seem easy. And then you take your first test and fail. I honestly would like more assignments and papers etc. because then my grade would be reflective of more than just an incredibly difficult exam that the mediocre lectures did NOT prepare me for!!!!!! Don't take this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Tough but very caring. Willing to meet with me outside her class. She is passionate about the stuff she teaches and really knowledgeable and tries hard to make class fun. I would definitely take another class with her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Truly, I'm incredibly frustrated in her class  she does not give specific examples of how to complete assignments, and yet grades SOOOOO harshly. It's truly a shame because she appears to be a  nice person, but you're lucky if you can leave the class with a C. She treats this as if it's a graduate class.

Her tests are impossible (no study guide), even her in class quizzes are tough. You have to attend every class and her lectures are really boring. Nice person, tough professor. Kudos to you if you pass her class.

Great person, awful teacher. I was excited to be in Principles of Learning, but I feel that instead of learning, I have just had countless terms and confusing theories thrown at me. The tests are very difficult and there is no study guide. The material is a combination of ppts, textbook, and magical fairyland questions from the mystic beyond.

Her lectures are extremely monotone and her exams are extremely hard. She basically just reads definitions off the PowerPoint slides and doesn't explain them in an engaging way. She's a very nice person, but I wouldn't recommend her as a professor.
Literally the worst professor I have ever had. Reads straight off her powerpoints and the tests do not reflect what we actually learn and read.

She is a great teacher. She knows a lot about cognitive psychology and she is extremely passionate about it. Outside of the classroom she is really helpful and willing to answer any question possible. She is a great help if you are thinking about graduate school! Strongly encourage anyone to take her class!
She is a VERY difficult teacher.  She knows her stuff and I learned a lot it seemed like until it came to the test... The tests are not very representative of what we learned.

Thomas is the sweetest man. Fantastic course if you do the reading. I normally do poorly in heavy lecture classes but he makes it very easy to pay attention. It's easy to care about poetry when his passion for it is so contagious. Highly recommend.

Homework is just reading and a short response paper to 15 of your choice. I appreciate this because I could choose my pace and what story I write on. Fair grader overall. Class is just his analysis and background of the stories we read for homework so it was pretty boring but very useful for writing exams (essays).

Summer session  everything crammed into 4 weeks. Tried to accommodate to us by not giving us much homework outside of class; lectures were a bit long and tedious, but any class that goes on for four hours would be; exams are pretty straight forward if you know the poems well & he's always willing to answer all questions; super sweet personality

Dr. Thomas is one of my favorite teachers! He is hilarious and makes class worthwhile and interesting. I learned a lot about a subject I don't normally care about. He is very kind and I appreciate he understands most were in his class for a GE. Only one midterm (essay and objective) and a final in the same format. TAKE THIS CLASS!

If you love Harry Potter, definitely take this seminar class. Thomas makes the class very interesting because he obviously loves the books himself! He has tons of information to share and is a genuinely nice man!

As much as a class on Harry Potter sounds stupid, it was one of the best classes I've had (and Prof Thomas made it so!) We read all of the books the first half of the semester, then discussed foreshadowing, origin of names, etc for the rest. Only one presentation on a character, and some essays for the midterm/final. TAKE IT IF AT ALL POSSIBLE!!

BEST CLASS EVER to get rid of GE Eng Lit requirement! No papers, no assigned reading, just poems read in class. All you need to do is listen carefully in class and study the 1-pg poems for the 2 tests. Also a group presentation which is an easy A. EASY grading on open note essay part of tests, but for obj part of tests, know everything about poems.
nicest man on earth

Ok, so I was lucky enough2 get in Harry Potter class..but James Thomas is the best professor at Pep.Not only was his course interesting&multi-dimensional,but surprisingly educational.He's nice,funny,loves finding puns&a really good teacher.I actually am going to try and get his for future classes he was so great.Low hw, not strict on attendence.
If you go to class and take good notes, you don't need to read the book.  He is extremely intelligent and can teach you a lot if you pay attention.  I love him!
Great teacher!!!

Go to all the lectures b/c he offers a large amount of credit for attendance. Try and stay awake.. The tests are off the handouts given at the beginning of lectures. Oh, and take the first quiz seriously! Many fail it. Thomas is a nice guy, if you're struggling, dont hesitate to visit him during his office hours.  Good luck!
If you can stay awake he usually delivers a very funny lecture. Memorize notes for tests and you will get an 'A'.
No Comments
monotone voice, but if you listen is very interesting, sometimes really funny.  Tests are simply straight from the lecture...easy A is you go to class.  Better than any other humanities for sure
Good teacher...talks VERY fast, come to class prepared.
Great

I respect him, he's INTERESTING, but I can see where people say boring. I had a hard time staying awake in class, not because HE is boring, but because his voice puts me to sleep (soothing, subdued, monotone).  The content is good but HUM sux in gen..
GENIUS! Take the class in summer school. Very easy and intersting.
Best prof at Pep.  Have to study, but if you mess up on a test there are plenty of chances to make it up.  Wonderful sense of humor, inteligent, nice, engaging and fun.  He's not boring at all.

Really funny guy, but his class is sooo boring.  No assignments except to read.. But sooo sooo boring.. If you want only two tests in a semester and can deal with a sleeper of a class, take class with him.. Again, he's great, but classes are boring
Great material and good grading scheme.  Only one complaint:  HE TALKS WAAAAAAY TOO FAST.  I am a fast typist and brought my laptop to class...and it was still hard to take good notes.
Outstanding professor.  The best at Pepperdine that I had.
He is hilarious! Very engaging.
Knows a lot, very good teacher
No Comments
One of the coolest guys I've seen here at Pepperdine... his lectures are great.
Best professor I have had in Pepperdine. Simply amazing.
He rules!

Super hard for a religion GE for first years. Midterm and final were tricky but he does give good feedback on projects and assignments and is down to meet with students to discuss issues/concerns whenever possible.

Andrew Sutherland is a wonderful teacher. Genuinely so kind and makes time to answer questions in and outside of class. He wants you to do well. Tests are very fair, if you take notes in his lectures you will do very well. It doesn't take someone who is "super religious" to do well in this class.

Prof. Sutherland is a very kind person but very stringent teacher. I didn't find his class as challenging as some other reviews, but it is still lecture-heavy and boring. He cold calls during class so you have to be prepared at all times. The PCA's are easy and a good way to accumulate points throughout the semester. Exams are cumulative.
Unnecessarily difficult.

Do Not Take! Switch to another REL100. Dr. Sutherland is nice but a terrible professor. You have to be ready at all times during his lectures because he calls on his students every minute to answer questions. His projects are impossible to get a good grade on no matter how hard you work. I worked hard and barely got an A-. idk anyone who got an A.

Even growing up in Christian schools it was impossible for me to pass this intro religion class. His grading is so subjective and harsh. lectures were so long and boring. He gave me a B on participation despite me answering every question right when called and never missing a single class. this class ruined my GPA, I had all As otherwise.
Makes it impossible to get an A in the class, very strict tough grader not lenient or understanding even for small things. Nice person but terrible professor I suggest you run.

Absolute worst professor or teacher I have ever experienced in my entire life. I could not even come up with words to describe how terrible this class is. Professor Sutherland is a very nice person and cares about his students, however refuses to provide help on assignments, grades absurdly hard, and does not give clear directions. DO NOT TAKE!!!
unfortunately sutherland is the worst prof ive ever had. thats about all there is to it.
Overall the worst teacher I have ever taken at Pepperdine, cannot say enough do not take this professor.  Impossible and unfair grader.

Every day was a lecture and we were rarely given class time to work on other assignments or projects for this class. Even though he is great as a person, I do not recommend him as a teacher because he was not engaging at all and would cold-call students to answer questions randomly during his lecture.
This is a level 1 GE. It shouldn't be as hard as it was. His subjective grading is tough. Nice guy but not a very good teacher.

Professor Sutherland is a nice guy but is very picky when it comes to grading. You are graded on weekly quizzes, two group projects, a midterm, a final, and participation. For one project, he docked my group a significant amount of points because we went too in depth. He lectures are interesting but he does popcorn call on people.

He is so picky about what he wants you to mention in essays and assignments. If you don't say exactly what he is looking for, it is hard to get a good grade. That being said, he organizes his lectures well and you learn something every class period.

He gets a really bad rep for being a tough grader, but his lectures are outstanding. It's hard to leave his classes feeling like you didn't learn anything. That said, I do agree that I wish he were more lenient (especially when he grades his essays, since there's no rough draft/final draft process).

Worst teacher I've taken at Pepperdine.

Will call on you at random.
Unfair grading, especially for a forced class at this University.
No chill.
Helps if you have prior knowledge (I don't).

Assignments are due over break.

I could go on if there wasn't a word limit on here.

Worst Teacher I have experienced at Pepperdine so far. 

Unfairly difficult grader, especially for a course you are forced to take at this University
Also gave me and everyone I talked to a 0 for an assignment that was never mentioned.

Annoyingly will call on you at random without your hand raised.

I could go on if there wasn't a limit on here.

This class was unnecessarily hard for a GE. Prof Sutherland is a very heavy grader and will not negotiate your grade. Only 2 tests (midterm and final), so quizzes are important. He forces participation and will randomly call on people in class, so pay attention. Group projects are 40% of your grade, meaning you're graded on the work of others.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Projects are most of your grade and he grades SUPER hard on them (70% was class average) but there's only two. Good lectures, informative and he is knowledgeable. midterm and final are the only tests but they are on super nitpicky details. I didn't do any of the reading ever and it was never an issue. Just study a lot and do high-quality projects.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Horrible Professor.... that about sums it up
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: He cold calls and asks questions about the readings! Felt like this was too involved and difficult for a required GE class. I don't know a single person who got an A in the class.

Honestly he's very nice and friendly, but makes this class impossible to get a good grade. The projects are worth a huge chunk of your grade, and he grades harshly. However, the tests were fairly easy. His lectures were well organized, but the grading and weighting made it confusing and difficult to succeed in this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: I switched into Dr. Sutherland's class at the beginning of the semester thinking he seemed young, fun, and kind. I have experienced the complete opposite. He is ambiguous, boring, and a harsh grader. He does not answer questions clearly and does not care about his students. He has small class sizes, yet he cannot remeber a single students name.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: He's obviously a nice guy, but his teaching and grading style sucks. It shouldn't be hard to get an A in a REL class, but he somehow makes it work! Also, he's not that knowledgeable in what he teaches aside from what he lectures about. I wouldn't take him because he doesn't teach about religion that well. Grade weighting is so wack too.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: For a GE class this class is extremely difficult. Being a computer science major, this class was almost as difficult as my major classes because of the harsh grading and the amount of material you must know even to get close to passing the class. Everything depends on exams/projects.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: tbh all of the reviews on here are really accurate. i just don't get why this class was difficult when it shouldn't have been.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This class is outrageously hard for a GE. Its 10% participation, 10% take home quizzes, 40% projects (20% each) and 40% tests (Midterm + Final). He assigns reading due every class, normally about 30 pages and takes over an hour to read. The projects are graded SO HARSH, the average grade is a C+/B-. Class content isn't hard, just expects the world.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor's class is meant to bring down the GPA of freshmen and anyone else unfortunate enough to wind up in it, and given the class is a mandatory credit it sucks. The grade consists of four main things, two 20% weighted presentations and two 20% tests. Good luck getting above 80% on any of these, as his grading is subjective and irrational.

I was heavily disappointed with this class. My hopes were high however, the lecture-heavy course gave me a disdain for the course material. The group projects determined your entire grade and were graded unfairly with little to no explanation. The mid-term and final were equal to 40% of your grade as were the two group projects.

Every single class is lecture-based with no variations on the topic. There is no critical thinking anywhere remotely near this class. The professor leads students to conclusions he wants made. Quizzes and Tests are the monopoly on your grade for this class and are all multiple-choice. Assessments only test memorization and not critical thinking.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: so bad bro

One of the worst teachers ever. His class is harder than ANY major class. He is the hardest grader and grades subjectively. Don't bother going to OH b/c he doesn't help you, b/c the only way you can do good on his projects (Worth 40%) is if you write EXACTLY what he wants. His readings are over 30pg. and useless. His lectures are EXTREMELY boring.
Harsh grader
This was a really good class. Definitely recommend this professor!

I got mostly A's in college ( a couple B's) but this is the only C- I've gotten in my life. Jolivet walks in, sits down, drawls for an hour and leaves. Hard to take notes fast enough. The tests were pretty difficult; I thought I did okay in the first one, maybe a B? I got an F. Hard to recover when there are only three more tests to up your grade.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Worst class I ever took at Pepperdine. Lectures are so boring and monotonous. The newest technology used in this class is probably a really old video about evolution. Jolivet does not use any powerpoint or visual/audio aids to help students learn. All he does is talk for 1.5 hr and read from the bible, digresses a lot to talk about life.

Do not take Religion 102 with Ira. There are only 4 poorly worded tests, and that's it. You won't have any homework other than reading, but the test questions suck. His lectures are not organized, and you won't be able to tell what is important. I already know the material, but I didn't learn anything from him. Take another professor.

I took him 2.5 years ago. He doesn't write down anything and just talks. The grade is based solely off 4 tests. If you ask for help, it's there. He does not allow students to keep their exams however.

GO TO CLASS. You need to hear his lectures to do well on the tests. Even looking at someone else's notes isn't always enough. He can be a little disorganized and unclear with his lectures, so it's hard to take clear notes. Just write down everything he says and study the night before the test and you should be fine.
Great teacher, knows his stuff and engages students in interesting discussions. It is straight lecture, however. You come to class, note what he says, and take the test. No fluff, it's all on you.

Dr. J is a really nice man and this class is NOT hard.  just go to class, pay attention, take good notes, study a night or two before the exam, and you will get a good grade.  there are only 4 non-cumulative exams (including the final).  take Jolivet for 102, he's one of the better ones.
He speaks in monotone and is terribly difficult to pay attention to. His first test was killer but the second was much easier. I would recommend taking this class from another professor.

An A in this class - totally possible. Just make sure to write down EVERYTHING he mentions, because I guarantee you, that one sentence he mentioned, will be on the test. Honestly, it's nothing close to hard. Pay attention, take good notes, underline your book, and re-read everything about 3 days in a row before the exam. Bam, you got an A!
CAN'T UNDERSTAND A THING HE SAID. DO NOT TAKE HIM. HARDEST RELIGION CLASS EVER
Amazing teacher and very sweet :) My favorite!

Very easy class, 4 tests and thats it for the grade.  Tests are fairly easy, but make sure you read the bible passage he sends you in email if you want an A.  Lecture wise...eh.  Tangents make him tricky to follow at times and can get boring.  But he is really funny and tells good stories.  Attendance is checked everyday so come to class

His lectures are interesting. The new testament can get dry in a class room setting, but he makes the lectures interesting and applicable. A super funny and nice guy from the south. Loves theology and his students. Two thumbs way up.
For the love of God, do not take him for religion 301.  you don't wana do this with him. very inconsistent on grading.  I'm just warning you..don't do it.
took him for Rel 102, nice guy, hilarious comments and stories. Textbook reading is light but tests are kind of difficult. overall a fun class but make sure you study.

Absolutely no class structure or clarity; no PowerPoint, no notes and no review, only straight lecture. Jolivet is completely monotonous and extremely boring. Class is mandatory so you can't escape the boredom. Read the Bible and you'll do fine on the 4 tests.

Take him for 102 for sure. only tests so NOTHING else to do/turn in. strict attendance policy. you can completely tune him out and still do well on the tests. he did tell me to put away my magazine one day so i was extremely bored but his stories about life/TV are interesting. not much of a teacher but a good duy.

Dr. Jolivet is not much of a teacher.. honestly, his lectures are extremely boring and he loses class attention fast. 4 tests at 25% a piece, so dont mess up on any of them! He will act friendly to you - which is fake. (4) Exams are 75% m.c. and 25% short answer.  He'll give you the short answer questions beforehand. Good luck with this class!
This teacher is an actual preacher...He provides interesting interpretations of the bible which make a lot of sense...I would take him just to learn about these theories
good to have a drink with and talk about life.  he does LOVE gumbo

Besides some strange mood swings where he'll be lauging with you 1 minute, telling you to shut up the next one, he's a cool guy.  Be prepared to listen to his Southern fishing stories...yee-ha!  Gotta get me some fish!
For this class you have to write 5 page essays every 2-3 weeks; likes to hear himself talk and sometimes dismisses your opinions if they aren't consistent with his-but overall a nice guy

We do essays for our homework, and he is very good at making it real and taking the material seriously.  He is very willing to talk outside of class and quite understanding to students.  (seems kind of politically correct though).
Sometimes makes mistakes in lectures that annoy me but on the whole an interesting lecturer, given the subject matter. Tests are straightforward and previewed well but he is a hard grader.
Knows how to make religion interesting. funny guy.
Keeps things interesting, Tests are very straightfoward.
The best professor I ever had at Pepperdine.
Knows what he's talking about.  Sounds like a preacher.

Actually realizes this is a GE course and treats it like one. He wants you to get big picture of life and moral lessons from history rather than memorizing facts, which I love and found more useful. His class was inspiring and makes you want to pay attention to what he was teaching. He did a lot of funny activities that forced you to make friends.
easiest class of my life, and hes super funny. if u want to a class where u can yap and yap in ur assignments this is the one
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: GOAT professor. HW is super easy, no tests and never take notes. Actually makes HUM enjoyable. Brannan is a funny guy and wants to make you like his class. Has super creative lectures and projects, and cool class design. Show up and turn in the work and you get an A. Take him if you get the chance!
He is genuinely a great professor! His lectures are interactive and actually interesting. The homework is super easy and he is super funny! Definitely recommend him for any class he teaches!

Understands that HUM is a GE and he treats it like that. Makes lectures interesting and funny. He always ties in great life lessons/examples into lectures. Course load is minimal and very simple. Has a couple presentation projects but nothing too terrible. Would highly recommend for him if you want an easy A in HUM.

Easy class but comes off as a cocky professor. He isn't very clear about criteria and when you ask questions he talks down on you. He isn't nice to all students, he plays favorites. Again, easy class but not a professor and classroom all students feel welcomed in. He sometimes turns on music and puts time into his games. Graded on a few things.
This professor is fun to listen to, and gives very little course work which makes it easy to get a good grade in the class.

My favorite class I've taken at Pepperdine! Discussion based so if you want a good grade you have to talk. I never did the readings, but always looked forward to class and found it easy to formulate what I wanted to say based on that day's discussion. Brannan is such a cool guy and it's clear he wants us to take something major away from his class.
The GOAT, like everyone said, the easiest class but he makes it full of applicable knowledge based off of ancient wisdom. Easily the greatest Professor on campus.
The easiest HUM professor out there, he's super funny and sweet too.
Take him if you can!!!
Super chill and a nice guy. He tries to be very relatable but not in a cringe way. He take a really uninteresting subject and makes it really fun and clear to understand.

Professor Brannan clearly wants to connect with students and teaches in a way that makes you want to learn. He keeps up with current trends and interests of students and incorporates it in class in a way that is fun. Assignments are easy, expectations are clear, and lectures are funny and enjoyable. If you can take HUM111 with Brannan do it.
king!!! he is so cool and funny and loves memes, I mean incorporates memes into every slide. he grades super easy and his lectures are short and fun and easy to follow.

Never a bad experience walking into Beau's room. Fun projects, fun way of teaching, funny guy, love the guy all around. Favorite class I took all year. As long as you show up and pay attention a little you'll do great.

Put in the work and youll get a good grade! Brannan has been by far the best professor Ive ever taken at pepperdine. He makes his lectures interesting and really cares for his students. Take him if you can!

Brannan is genuinely one of my favorite teachers at Pepperdine that I have had. He recognizes that his class is a GE, and teaches in an intriguing way to keep his students engaged. You can tell that he genuinely wants you to succeed as both a student and a person. Definitely visit him outside of class, I didn't and that was my biggest regret.

Prof. Brannan is EXCELLENT! He engages us via trivia games, storytelling and amazing lectures. No textbooks! I highly recommend taking him out to lunch and getting to know him. His genuine care of my life outside of class helped me through a LOT. His card game, S Pancakes, is a real gem! I would minor in HUM if it meant I got more classes with him.
Professor Brannan was the best thing to happen to me this semester. Do the weekly assignments, the projects, and watch Shawshank redemption and you'll be good.

BEST TEACHER EVER. understands that this is a GE class and a majority of us do not have any interest in humanities. Makes the lecture engaging and we do fun little kahoot like quizzes every class period. His class reminds me a lot more of a philosophy class, not a lot of history is covered imo. But he is awesome, caring and enthusiastic.

Brannan was a life saver for me freshman year, he cares about his students in the best way. He is understanding, funny, and wants you to enjoy class. He will never give a boring lecture if that is even what you would call it. He is the best, 11/10 recommend!!!! Easy HUM111 teacher!

Brannan is THE BEST humanities professor. You get a weekly 100 word post about the reading or Shawshank Redemption that is super easy to get 100% on. His lectures are not typical for humanities but they are always interesting. He is an amazing person and professor and I cannot say enough good things about him and his class!
literally the coolest person ever. every day you leave his class feeling like you can change the world. take him if you get the chance

I genuinely enjoyed the way he taught the entire course. He is very charismatic and entertaining even throughout his lecture style class. The course work is very light and he incorporates a lot of philosophical material as well. He has probably been my favorite professor at pepperdine yet.

The best HUM professor you can have! He is very chill yet still makes sure you understand the readings well and wants to see you succeed. A lot of good connections to the course and relates it well to why we should study it today. The projects are interesting and fun and exams are not too crazy. Overall, if you have the chance to take him do it!

Not like most professors who just make you memorize a bunch of dates. Lectures connected history to a deeper significance, very insightful. Class was fun and main points came from 2 projects and 2 exams, and study guides were given with exams. Funny guy, and fair grader. Take Professor Brannan for HUM111 hes the best!

Work for the class consisted of writing paragraphs responding to your choice of prompt after the selected readings he has given. So be prepared to read. We also had two projects, a midterm, and a final. I dislike history but he made this class super interesting and related it back to our lives consistently. A super understanding and nice professor!
rating_tags: Inspirational--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Truly the greatest professor I've ever taken. The class wasn't meant for students to memorize but it gave us some material to really use to be successful in life. He was really understanding and really gave his everything in every class. I really enjoyed this class and I hope you take him if you have the chance, you'll thank me later!
Professor Brannan is great. He understands that his class is just a GE that we have to take. He puts in the effort to make the class fun and interesting. The class is more about life than anything.
Truly a great dude that lectures about life rather than making you memorize dates and people. He gives minimal homework and is super understanding!

Approaches hum in a way that is interesting, relatable, and actually understandable. I absolutely suck at history and did surprisingly well in his class. Such a chill and cool guy. 100% take his class!!

Though Dr. Dan is an incredible person, his class was ridiculous. The material we were learning in 301 was quite fascinating, but his disorganization made success extremely difficult. He constantly changed the syllabus without telling students, altered the format of exams without timely notice, and would occasionally miss his own office hours.

you have to write a paper for every chapter of the book. sometimes he gives mini sermons to class, which is nice, but he definitely does not respect students who have different religious beliefs than his own. I wouldn't take him again, but he's not a bad professor. I think he probably cares about the students even if he's judgmental
Dr Dan is an amazing teacher. You definitely have to put work in for this class but he makes it very doable. I would recommend him as a teacher to all who haven't taken 301 yet

Dr. Dan is awesome! This is NOT an easy A. As in, you need to buy the books and do the reading in order to pass! There is a 2-page paper due with each reading assignment, and essays with a couple of movies. But you will learn SO much from him and he is super understanding of other commitments as long as you are honest with him! TAKE HIM!

Dr. Dan's class is outstanding. Class is discussion based around readings from books he assigns.  Be Warned: There is a 2 page paper on the readings due each day when class starts.  (The papers are very easy, takes 40 mins max - ensures you do the reading, which saves your grade).  Tests are simple and straightforward.  One big project at the end.
He is the best teacher I have ever had. The best.
excellent !

Dr. Dan is possibly one of the best teachers at Pepperdine.  He listens to students and helps them achieve their goals. He cares about his classes and puts a lot of effort into making them fun and clear. Incredible man that creates an incredible learning environment!

Dr. Dan is a great guy, super personable and always willing to help. But he really likes to make you write a lot about stuff that might not need to much writing to explain. Class was easy and informational about the latino christian experience in America.

This is literally the best professor at pep. watever they pay him- he deserves more. he's just so good at what he's does. he's always there for help and is sincerely interested in you doing well. and he knows what he's talking about. classes were always interesting and really (bizarrely) fun! if u graduate without taking him, uv really missed out

Dr. Dan is one of the best professors at Pepperdine. He's genuinely caring, knowledgeable, charismatic, and funny. Although REL 526 is a G.E., the knowledge I gained in this class I'll remember all of my life. If you consider yourself an Evangelical Christian, enrolling in REL 526 is a must. It may be the most valuable class you take at Pepperdine.

Dr. Dan is by far one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. There is quite a bit of reading for the class but it's not your average "textbook" reading. He has really good policies regarding grading and really takes into consideration what his students want. I would DEFINITELY take him again

Next semester will be my 3rd time to take Dr. Dan because his classes are that good. It's a lot of work for a GE, but it's totally worth it in my opinion. Study for the quizzes because they're worth as much as your final. Keep up with your reading, go to class and raise your hand every once in a while and you'll make a decent grade.

I LOVED this class, though it is more difficult than he tries to make it sound at the beginning at the semester. DO YOUR READINGS and don't get behind on the quizzes and you'll be fine. This class is by far the best option for your non-western GE credit.

I took this class my last semester at Pep and thought that he was a bit of a hard a$$ for the class being a GE requirement. If he does not like you, he will be a dick and grade your papers hard. My work was decent, but was graded in my opinion unfairly. This was the 2nd worse class I had in 4 years there.

This prof. is very difficult and demanding, but do not miss out on getting to know this dude.  He knows his stuff and is passionate, he doesn't seem to understand that students are slackers and could care less about actually learning (especially for GE's).  I graduated a few years ago and he's the only teacher worth a visit when I'm back on campus.

i absolutely hated taking this class... i'm convinced dr. rodriguez doesn't know rel 301 is a GE because he assigned more work than my upper division major classes. unless you want to spend your semester reading 4+ ENTIRE books and studying for his impossible quizzes... don't take this class

Nice guy, the class isn't too hard but the daily quizes are a ****. I had them every morning at 8am, and there not little reading quizes, you really do have to study hard 4 them. Yet, i still really liked him and his class
No Comments
He's not a very fair grader. I got an A on the Midterm and final and still got a B in the class. He's nice enough and very passionate.

I have had him twice, Urban Ministry and Religions of the world. Lots of work and pretty high expectations, but well worth it. I have learned a ton in both classes. They have both changed my life. Very down to earth. Relates well. Either you love him, which most do, or he can be a little annoying.
great teacher, but expects a lot, the daily quiz is worth a lot of points, and it doesn't pay to skip class

I had him for an off-campus program and he didn't return any homework until the last weekend. (Homework is the lifeblood of OC programs). Had incredibly high expectations and didn't adequately appreciate nuances of OC program.
Great guy, fair, well educated. His classes are hard but worth it! I learned a lot in World Religions and the assignments really enhanced my understanding of various religions.
excellent course, excellent teacher, practical, inspiring
very cool guy.  Down to earth, knowledgeable, and funny
Do not miss his World Religions course!  Non-west credit and you learn a ton!
great guy...very friendly ...muy caliente!!
He helped me a lot and was VERY fair.

This class requires a lot of critical thinking. I really appreciate that Professor Keene takes the time to provide an overview of a culture, then gives an example from a work of art and literature, and encourages us to discuss as a class based on shared readings. He foregrounds the voices of women and LGBTQ individuals in history <3

Having a down-to-earth professor is are at Pepperdine, but Dr. Keene is always making changes to the class to make sure he addresses issues that matter and events happening in-real-time in our world. I love that he has a sense of humor, even poking fun at his own obsession with history. He also exudes empathy while also holding a high standard.

Dr. Keene is woke and extremely enthusiastic. He also genuinely cares for each student's well being, and his perspectives on life are refreshingly different from what I would consider the norm at Pepperdine.

Prof K cares about issues that matter to students, and is not afraid to discuss difficult subjects in class. He always asks for feedback and responds immediately to structure lectures, discussions, or readings based on current or topical theme. I really appreciate the way he manages to cover content and care deeply about student interests

Dr. Keene's art history class is amazing! He makes learning fun considering it's a 2 hour lecture at 8am. He is very specific about what he is looking for on tests and if you follow that you'll get an A on his tests; however you have to put in the time to study for his class (basically if you don't want to study for an Art GE don't take this class)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I've never had a professor who cares so deeply about connecting the past to the present. He brought up important issues and discussed topics that other Pepperdine professors shy away from or completely avoid (or are not prepared to address adequately/sensitively). He seems to have a genuine interest in our well-being and must be an empath.

Prof K made me think more about history and life than any other class I've taken. I didn't realize it at the time, but I do now after studying abroad & being able to recognize buildings and works of art. He discussed relevant issues that connected humanities with today. He's an eloquent speaker and caring person. Challenge yourself & take his class

He is one of the most active people, let alone professors, I have met: he prepares so thoroughly for lectures (even with current social media references!), curates at an art museum, & is so well-read. One word: relevance. That's what he emphasizes. Why should we care about something? This class has been very meaningful. But yeah, it's hard too.

Taking a class from a museum curator has been one of the best experiences as an art history student, from Prof K's accessibility to providing us with hands-on opportunities to see works of art up close. Prof K wove a global narrative throughout every single lecture, using maps, websites, and various readings to craft a unique and inspiring course

Just finished taking the other Hum classes and all I can say is Keene should teach them all. He's the only prof that actually cares about making the course relevant for today. He seems so effortless when teaching but clearly puts tons of time into preparing. He's so interesting and knowledgeable and engaging!!

HUM 111 was the first class I took at Pepperdine and I was immediately impressed with the way that Prof K addressed complex / controversial topics, like gender, race, or sexuality. I had also never studied Islam in relation to European history, and he was really thoughtful in presenting history, religion, and politics, especially at a Christian uni

He is a wonderful professor and person. He works incredibly hard to ensure student's success. ( Ex: in-depth study guides, extra credit, posts his powerpoints, rewrites, and holds study sessions)  He is brilliant and teaches everything that is on the tests.

Literally one of the BEST professors at Pepperdine, especially for his young age! Yes, you have to work for your grade, you have to read, and you have to pay attention during lectures, but it's worth it!  Keene is hilarious, a little sassy, and loves what he teaches! The class is hard work, but it is so interesting and he offers extra credit!

I'm an older student taking Prof K, as he signs his e-mails, and I'm amazed how immature and entitled the students are in class (and clearly here, per the below student)! I'm used to having to work hard for a good grade, so be prepared to read, study for tests, and pay attention in class. Prof K is incredibly responsive and supportive! Work hard!

I don't know where this guy gets all his energy from (ok coffee, but really). I failed my first exam (slept in), but knew what to expect on the next exams and did better. Study, go to class, read the book, and go to his office hours. And he's a hottie with cute scarves. Sit close.

Just barely got the grade I wanted because of Professor Keene being so gracious. It seems pretty impossible to cover everything from Neanderthals to the Renaissance, but somehow we made it, but some of the stuff could be left out (Mesopotamia). I think professor keene really wants to listen to his students needs

Haters gonna hate, but yeah, tons of reading, lots to know, but at least he's not boring. It's refreshing to learn about how art relates to literature, and he asked us to question things we learn. Number one tip: Just listen in lecture and then do the reading.

He makes the class way to hard for a general education requirement. If you are not an art history major do not take him. He teaches history through works of art literature and expects you to be able to critically analyze art. I hated this class!  I will say he is passionate though, and would be an excellent art history prof.

This class was extremely difficult because of the amount of material that had to be memorized. Professor Keene is willing to help if you need it, but the tests are hard. Luckily, extra credit opportunities are available which does help a lot. You can do well without going to class, but you must keep up with the reading if you want to do well.

I have literally never worked so hard in my life on a class, but at least Professor Keene gives extra credit, and reads and rereads your papers, so the grade is fair.  I went into the class expecting to relearn AP world history, but Professor Keene goes into way more detail and is more fun. Some students were really mean to him this semester though

Humanities courses in general are Eurocentric and lame. Ditto most classes at Pepperdine. Professor Keene likes to shake things up by including material not in the textbook, and it's so cool that he has an entire museum worth of art to draw from! Professor Keene makes the world seem so enticing, and he speaks like a thousand languages.

Professor Keene has so much energy at 8am, and he knows so much about so many random things! He talks enthusiastically fast and is pretty funny. He is a tough grader but gives plenty of extra credit (but yo have to actually work for it). He also gives amazing travel advice!!

Professor Keene is awesome. He really does help if you ask for it. The tests are very hard but he gives you lots of extra credit opportunities.  He is funny and really love what he teaches. If you post online about him, he WILL find it. And he will post it in class. His bow ties are cool. If you take him, it will be hard, but you'll learn a lot.

Alright, so I can't really say too many negative things about Professor Keene. He is clear with what he expects for the most part, and he is willing to help if you ask.   He goes way too fast during lectures and it is pretty hard for me to catch everything, but that may just be because I kind of cant stand history.  He offers lots of EC.

Great Professor, but do not take advantage of his kindness. Definitely go to office hours if you need help, and do not get behind on readings. Though attendance is not mandatory, you will not get good grades if you don't go to class. He is a very entertaining professor, but it is a little hard to pay attention to the actual core material at 8 am.

I've just begun this class and already Professor Keene is so willing to help answer my many questions. His lectures are packed with so many amazing stories and details, and he engages with the class a lot. He also keeps it interesting at 8AM!
Lots to read, lots to know, but Prof. Keene is so enthusiastic about the material that you want to succeed.

They say that you do not know which professors were important in your life till after you graduate. This is true for Mr. Keene in that he has broadened my view of the art world. His teaching style and enthusiasm makes his class interesting. Best of all was the field trips to the Getty. If I take another art class, it will be with Mr. Keene.

Took her for ADV 475 and MSCO 371 - so sweet. She has so much energy that she repeats herself a lot. Getting actual instruction out of her requires a lot of patience... this initially frustrated me but she's so kind that I don't mind anymore. Test material and projects are appropriate in difficulty. She's an expert and easily accessible, too.

Ginger Rosenkrans is the kindest woman I have ever met. She really wants her students to learn and succeed. She's always available for feedback and to help with anything you need. The class was so much fun and I enjoyed taking it online. You tackle Photoshop, Illustrator, and Web Design. I highly recommend taking her class!

Don't expect her to teach you anything. This is a really cool class and she is a nice lady but a horrible teacher. Her tests are also super ambiguous so even if you know the material, the tests are super confusing.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Don't take Ginger's classes unless it's necessary. She barely teaches, but you'll probably get an A. She starts every class 30 minutes late, which to me says that she doesn't respect her student's time (or money). She has a required text but does not reference or question you on it, so don't spend your money on it.

TRULY cares about her students. ALWAYS joyful. Super enthusiastic about Photoshop & other programs. Lots of projects & a midterm thru semester. End of semester: package design, Dreamweaver website, portfolio with research article write-ups & final exam (so taxing)! She goes over main points in the book so you don't need it but I liked it.
Professor Rosenkrans is great!!! Learned a lot and had fun too. Take her classes if you can.
Great profesor!!! Great class!!! Sign up early to take her classes because they fill fast. Hsd to wait a semester to get in.

She's an amazing professr - really nice, cares about her students, patient, knows how to teach the adobe software suite and knows a lot about design so we learn what works and what doesn't. Best professor.

Okay... so Ginger is a saint. She's adorable, and extremeeeely nice 24/7 and always willing to help you. Unfortunately, I felt like I knew more going into the class than she did by just tinkering around on Photoshop... I didn't learn much. And paying roughly $80/hr for class at Pepperdine should be better than that. It was SUPER basic.
incredible, highly recommend. cares for her students.
lots of hands on helps learning. great guest speakers and really nice teacher who cares about us.
She is very sweet but never stops talking and there isn't much learning that actually goes on in the classroom. She seems like she will be very easy and then her grading is ridiculous.

hippie and very nice person. Her tests are ridiculous. they are on tedious things and way too hard for a graphic arts class. The highest grade is an 80!
