You can do great on the projects, but the test brings your grade down a lot. do your blogs or your grade will also suffer they aren't worth points but she deducts if you do not do them take zurzolo

She is absolutely full of energy!   You won't fall asleep in this class. You'll learn skills that you will apply later on in life.    She provides lots of supplementary information and explains what the text book is trying to convey in her in class lessons. You should attend class to get the full effect.

The best experience as a class I have ever had at Pepperdine. Genuinely cares for her students and how they do. Ask for help, stop by her office (she has tons of candy). simply amazing! Test aren't impossible and made to help you learn.

Ginger is the perfect example of a wonderful college Professor. You will love her classes because she makes them fun. She is the biggest sweetheart and she really cares about her students. Be nice to her! You do have to try hard to get an A or B.
Best teacher at Pepperdine, she knows her stuff and has a great heart.
Ginger is full of energy. She is so passionate about the course which makes it enjoyable. Take this class
Ginger is AWESOME!!! she knows what she's talking about, and really cares about her students.
The best teacher! Very enthusiastic, genuinely cares about her students, motivates you to do well. If you get a chance, I highly recommend taking a class from her, you won't regret it!
No Comments
very "fun", a socialite, knows her stuff and gets you excited about advertising. Powerpoint lectures are straight book outlines though. good guest speakers.
a little spastic but so sweet
A great class! Best one I have taken here. She knows her stuff and is overly excited everytime she sees you.
good teacher
very bubbly, kind, kind of fast
Pepper is dead, but lives on in all of our hearts.
Very sweet, energetic, loves to teach

Brereton is a great chem prof that understands that chem isn't easy and that people struggle. Tests are honestly pretty east, just prepare and use all the resources. Check your HW with her, she will tell you if its right or not. Office hours always, very available. Test 2 is the hardest, its where everyone fumbles. Take her if you get the chance.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I took chemistry in high school, but this was a very hard class. I think she is a nice, and at times funny teacher, but very monotone. It is very hard to pay attention to her lectures. She did give out good guided notes and what not, but this was not an easy class. I heard that the other professors were a lot easier.

I had Dr. Brereton for both CHEM 120 and 121, and she is great! Her lectures are very clear (she has guided notes). She's very approachable, caring, and patient in office hours. She has a great method of introducing practice problems at a basic level, then increasing the difficulty through homework. She also provides practice tests before tests.

I took Prof Brereton for Chem 120 and Chem 121. She is a very clear instructor. If you put in the work, an A is very attainable. Her tests are fast pace, but if you study, you will do well. She gives great partial credit for accurate work and is just overall an amazing Professor!

Brereton is a great teacher and gives out SO many resources. Chem in general can be difficult, but she gives problems that she writes, homework problems, textbook problems, and problems from previous tests. Her office hours are also super helpful, so doing well isn't tricky if you apply yourself and ask questions.

I took Dr. Brereton's CHEM 120 course last semester, and I could not be more pleased by my experience. She is one of the best teachers in the chemistry department at Pepperdine. Please take her course!

If you wish to receive an 'A' in this course, you will need to apply yourself and study the material frequently. That being said, she is a fair professor. Her lectures are clear / she tells you what she expects of you. The best advice I can offer for obtaining an 'A' would be to frequently practice the material. Use the lecture notes problems.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Brereton is the BEST. Other ratings say that she is inconsiderate which is untrue. Her exams are based off the lecture handouts so be sure to go to class. Her homework is easy and so is her class. She makes chemistry fun. Take Brereton if you can, she fills up very quickly. Be sure to remember that everyone will have different opinions!!

Be prepared to do a lot of outside learning with resources found by yourself. I used Khan Academy, textbooks, and tutoring with the school and friends. The class is dependent upon the lecture handouts. Exams, quizzes, homework, and practice problems are not similar whatsoever so be prepared to treat every problem as a completely new one.

Honestly, Chem is just a hard subject. If you didn't take AP Chem in high school, this course will most likely be very difficult for you. It isn't her teaching that is bad. The material is just difficult. She does a good job at teaching the material but I highly suggest going to office hours and asking a lot of questions. Very lenient grader!

Dr. Brereton is a really solid professor for Chem 120 & 121. Her lectures are very straightforward and easy to follow. Tests are pretty difficult, but if you have taken AP Chem in high school they aren't too much harder. Very accessible outside of class and will answer all of your questions in office hours. If you can, try to get her for lab too!

I had Brereton for 120 and 121. I was going through a lot at the time and she had no grace or empathy. She marked me absent for classes that I was in, which dropped my grade .03% below a B. She then refused to work with me to raise my grade so I wouldn't have to drop out, citing that it was a lot of paperwork. The content was good though

Chem is not the easiest course, but Dr. Brereton makes it do-able. She is clear on what we are doing and what she is looking for. She will also not waste your time. She goes over powerpoints during lecture and records them so you can rewatch. If you review a lot for the exams you will be fine.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Professor! Classes are taught clearly and time is effectively used. Assignments, quizzes, and exams are outlined and are not too difficult for the course content. If you keep on top of assignments and review material, exams are not hard. Lots of buffer points, but exams are the majority of the grade.

I really enjoyed Dr. Brereton's class. She's very reasonable and clear in what she wants you to understand and memorize. She is also open and welcome to answering questions, and I would take advantage of her knowledge! If you pay attention in class and complete all of the work that she assigns, you'll be in good standing when the test comes.

Amazing professor! Extremely helpful and organized the structure of the class makes it difficult to do poorly. Probably the best chem teacher I have ever had. My only concern is she doesnt like The Office which is a major red flag :/

Dr. Breretons one of the best STEM profs Ive had. Grades are heavily based on exams and theres a quiz each week. She grades quickly, gives great feedback, and has great lectures/notes. Its quite a challenging course, but shes available all the time even on weekends. Do the practice in the textbook! It helps so much with exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She was honestly great. Chem 121 is a weed out class so was not the easiest but she was really helpful.

Dr. Brereton is THE BEST! She has so many office hours outside of class and is always willing to help. She is extremely organized and is really good at explaining things. She also offers practice tests before each exam, so it is really helpful to prep for each one!

Dr. Brereton is an amazing professor! She is one of the nicest professors and is very helpful. Her explanations were always clear and she always responded to emails quickly. Her tests are kind of hard, but if you pay attention in class the tests are not bad at all. Dr. Brereton is a rather easy grader. TAKE HER CLASS, SHE'S THE BEST!! :))

She's a great lab professor and did a good job teaching during COVID. She takes a while to grade her labs though which becomes an issue if you make the same mistake on multiple labs and don't receive feedback from her for a while. Besides that, though, she's really easy to get a hold of and always answers questions very well.

One of my favorite and most personable professors I've taken. Very helpful when you reach out and ask questions. Do your work, pay attention and you'll be fine with whatever class you take with Prof Brereton, she's not incredibly difficult.

I don't think her class is really different from a lot of the other gen chem classes but shes definitely one of the better options. Her explanations were pretty clear and she seemed to want people to understand. Do the hw and go to office hours. The class is not an easy a but its not impossible to do well. If you took ap chem youll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: To each its own, I wouldnt take her, she wasnt very helpful when I needed her. It seems like when classes went online she was on vacation. Some people arent used to doing online. The gen chem classes are all hard, I get it but it doesnt have to be. Some of us actually appreciate the challenge, but only when the support is there.

She explained all of the concepts pretty clearly, and she was always available for help during office hours. I only used the textbook for hw, never read it. Dont leave hw problems for last minute bc you will regret it. She drops the lowest quiz grade which is good bc I bombed one but I did well on the others and my grade didnt suffer. Good vibes.

wow I took this class with the expectation of excellence. But nah awfulness is what I got. She does not respond to emails. How are you going to be a teacher but not be available, ESPECIALLY DURING A PANDEMIC? I am at home trying to finish classes ON TOP OF SURVIVING, and she showed no sympathy and also never responded when I needed help. snake!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: During the pandemic when all hell broke loose we are all sent home and forced to finish class online. I felt like I didnt' get the support that was needed during a really tough time. I was very disappointed in the responses that I did receive them. I understand that this is a stressful time for everyone but you signed up the this.

Dr. Brereton is hands down the best Chemistry professor I have studied under at Pepperdine. She really takes time to make sure students understand what is being taught and is an effective communicator. She explains things very well
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Worst professor. Does not take the time to help out students after class, and will spend time talking on phone with friends. Talks excruciatingly loudly and collects homework on a random basis. Not recommendable at all. Take another Italian teacher! 5/2016

She is nice in general but some of her rules are just too specific and unreasonable. This class can be very hard if you dont come to class prepared aka. all the reviewing and pre-reading of the textbook.

Paola is probably the craziest teacher I know. She will say one thing and then contradict herself the next day and it doesn't matter what you say because its her way or the highway. She can be very funny and enjoyable at times while other times she can make you want to drop. Overall she is one of a kind and each day is different from the last.

She picks and chooses favorites the first day you walk in the room. If you're on her bad side, no matter what you do, she will fail you in participation which is a significant portion of your grade. I'm in Florence right now, and I've never met an Italian as awful as her.

Loved this class.  Knight Lorenzi is so funny (yes, she was knighted).  Take advantage of the extra credit opportunities, especially the cinema italian style.  If you go to class and do your homework on time, it's an easy A.

She made my Italian 151 experience. She's seriously one of the meanest professors. I came every day and did all her stupid questions and participation activities, and she gave me a zero in participation. There was a girl in my class that stopped coming after the first 2 weeks who got a one hundred in participation. Seriously, it's horrible.
She is Helpful and enthusiastic plus she is a native speaker! It made a world of difference in the overall class experience.
Professor Lorenzi is very enthusiastic and her sense of humor is like no other
Great teacher, she makes the class very engaging. She is passionate,honest and straight forward.

Paolo is such a good teacher. she is hilarious and is always cracking jokes, which makes class fun, yet interesting at the same time. be sure to study the packets she hands out because more often than not, they're the same format as the test.  attend class because she takes off 1 % point for every missed class.  definately take this class!
She Make the class really fun. As much as I don't like Italian I always looked forward to coming to class.
funny, easy to understand, helpful

Yeah she's crazy and European, but she is a good teacher. Italian is probably the easiest language to learn at Pepp and she is pretty funny too. She'll like you even more if you have Italian heritage or youre an Italian minor.
craaaaazy

I have been so amazed by her kindness and willingness to help me overcome my struggles. Thank you does not expresss my gratitude. i am lookink forward to use my italian and all the personal lessons i learned in this class.

I did not learn how to SPEAK ital in this class, only the grammatical stuff.  Not very good at EXPLAINING new concepts. Tests are pretty simple...if you've had Spanish, class should be pretty easy. She was always 10-15 min late for class too.  Funny jokes.
Loved her enthusiasm and sense of humor!

Paola is awesome.  You joke with her and you're in - but you have to make an honest attempt at the language.  She doesn't demand perfection and likes to yell, but she's European.  That explains A LOT.  She also gets makeovers with Cher.  Seriously.  Italian is very mathematical as a language...

She is very tough with her GE classes, but if you get on her good side, meaning, if you speak Italian with her and really try, she loves you and will help you with anything. Be ready to prove yourself and once you do, you're in!

She is kind of intimidating but she is hilarious. Its a tough class but what do you expect. I like her..she's sassy and if you really need help she's very helpful. She tells you exactly what will be on the tests, she's not a tough grader, you just have to study.

She is super! Yeah her class can be a little challenging at times, but all in all, if you study, you will learn the language. She is an amazing teacher, with a fun approach to learning, not to mention, she has a great sense of humor!
after three years i speak no italian, but i always got a B.

Come on people, stop complaining and start studying more!!!  This is Italian not basket weaving.  I loved her class and I think she does a good job explaining things.  I learned more from her than I did from the other professor.  She's also a fun person.
She's the reason I went back to Spanish...
complete misandrist. was never able to ask a question without getting yelled at. she knows her italian, but very intimidating and easily irritable.

She is awesome-you have to get on her good side which is pretty easy to do as long as you have sense of humor-she will make fun of you but in a good spirited way. I have a hard time with languages and she was probably one of my favorite profs-all 3 sems.
No Comments
good at explaining things, but the class will be rough if you've never taken a language before, she is a little weird, but definately a good teacher

He requires you to spell his name correctly on the final. I managed to get on his "good side" so I got a good grade, but if you don't play his games expect to get a "C" or worse. This type of favoritism is capricious and shouldn't be allowed at any level of education, especially a required capstone course.
In my opinion: the worst!

Hardest and best class I have ever taken. Seshan is VERY intelligent and generally an amazing human being if you take the time to get to know him. Just don't be lazy - push yourself. Just like the real world, go above and beyond what is required and you will be rewarded :) Stay away from 1.6!! (unless you're good with numbers)

Dr. Seshan is the MOST INTELLIGENT person I have ever met. He does everything he can to TEACH and provide his wealth of knowledge and experience for others.  He knows how to read people- he knows if you're BSing or not, he knows whether you worked hard or not- he knows all the little facts you can ever imagine.  If you are willing to learn and grow

It has been almost 2 years since I took Policy with Dr. Seshan. Seshan relishes lecturing, so be attentive, and retain what he says.  If you want an 'A,' be a compiler.   Seshan despises BS.  Know your stuff.  Write succinctly.  Speak up when you know you're on the same wavelength as Seshan.  And prepare WELL for your oral examinations.

Professor: Intelligent, Helpful, Difficult, Hard Working.  Class: Toughest Class I took.  Learned more than any other class.  He does pick favorites, but it is generally based on your participation and willingness to go above and beyond.  If you volunteer and participate without arguing with him, you'll do fine.  DO NOT QUESTION HIM! You will fail!

Dr. Seshan's class is by far the most rewarding yet challenging at Pepperdine, for any major.  If you keep a positive attitude you will emerge more disciplined and better at presenting in front of people.  Most useful class at Pepperdine.

It is a shame this 'professor' is still teaching. whether you are lazy or not, get on his good side and you'll get a good grade.  if you research the material outside of class you can learn from it even though this professor does not really teach. I got a good grade, but I feel sorry for some other students who were not his favorites...
WORST professor ever!

Easily the hardest class at Pepperdine. To make it as bearable as possible don't compile or volunteer for section 1.6. Seshan is somewhat helpful, but definitely serves the function of shaping you into a corporate tool. Don't try to be creative, otherwise you'll just make more work for yourself. Stick to the cookie cutter format and you'll be fine

Toughest class in the school, but you will learn more from his course than from any other course combined. The catch? No excuses, whining, or negativity. Though his expectations may seem unreasonable, he rewards hard work and values respect.

I was one of Sehsan's favorites, I got the easy questions on the midterm and final. I am not deluded and saying he is intelligent, experienced, etc. On the contrary, the out-of-date concepts in this class are useless. The book was written in the 80's! Put your monster project in front of a board of directors and they will say cut it to 20 pgs please.

Picks favorites, is unfair, and makes your life a living hell.  There are a few select people he will like.  Those people may say good things about him because they get on a high -> "OMG! Dr. Seshan actually likes me!" Don't be fooled, the rest of society is screwed. He creates unique mid-term/final for each student, based on how much he likes you.

Never done that much work before but when it was all said and done, well worth it.  He is one of the brightest human beings on the planet and if you work hard and just do the right thing, you'll be fine.  Making excuses and taking short cuts will land you in hot water real fast.  Complainers and the faint of heart need not apply.

Worst class I have ever taken.  This man should not be teaching - well, he doesn't really teach just assigns work.  IF you take this class, you will have to research everything the prof says to try to make sense of it.  Senior seminar has nothing to do with the major.  It's aweful.  Words cannot describe my utter loathing for this class.
i hate this professor for two reasons and i haven't taken this class yet.  you have to sign-up at 5 am so you don't end up in this class and it is impossible to spell his first name

"To walk, first you have to crawl. To run, first you have to walk. To fly, first you have to run." Dr. Seshan - 17 October 2005  Most intelligent, most educated, most experienced, most educative and most challenging teacher I have ever experienced during my academic career.  He's the God of Pepperdine.
Those people who bash him on this OBVIOUSLY got a bad grade... I'm sorry you guys didn't take an advantage of how smart and wonderful Dr.Seshan is
No Comments
Hardest**** on Earth! Unless your a compiler.
You can't say you graduated with BA in business from Pepperdine w/o taking this class. You will be ready for ANYTHING after this class. Suicidal but best class ever at the end!!! Seshan is my hero
He teaches the last business class you'll have to take.  It's the hardest, but you learn the most and get to utilize everything you learned in all your other classes.
He gives you the biggest assignment in you life, doesn't tell you how to do it and gives A's to his favorites.  Stay on his good side and you are ok!!
Insightful class however, he is very unfair and plays favorites. Grading was biased.
Awesome class. One of the most valuable I've taken.
very clever teacher & nice... challenging at the same time
Very Good Prof....

Dr. Peterson is very sweet. He cares a lot about the environment and you can tell with his book choices. His classes are socartic style so you kinda have to talk. For a GE upper division English class this is exceptionally easy. Reading is mandatory because there are pop quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Dr. Peterson is one of Pepperdine's gems! He is kind, caring, hilarious without trying, and educated about the class topic. Your grade is based on 3 poems, 2 essays, and a few journals. He makes it so fun and interesting to read/analyze poetry; I have a newfound love of the craft because of this class. HIGHLY recommend, he's the best!!

there are 2 essays that make up 80% of your grade. He is an extremely difficult grader. Does not grade fast and he didn't grade the first essay in time to give feedback for the second which will screw you. DO NOT TAKE FOR A GE. extremely hard class for a GE. I learned nothing and am no better of a writer than I was before

Dr. Peterson is amazing! It's very obvious that he has a passion for what he teaches and it makes it easy to stay engaged during class because of that. He's really understanding and truly cares for his students. He does assign a lot of reading but I think it is doable if you can manage your time or even make time to skim.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Peterson is a good professor, but he definitely shows favoritism towards English majors. He grades really tough and this might be a difficult course for people who aren't used to writing papers that are ripped apart by their profs.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: Judging from the first few weeks of class I thought he was a nice guy, until he started assigning crazy amounts of reading and papers. To make things worse, he was a very harsh grader when he said he would be lenient. DO NOT TAKE HIM FOR A GE!! Super bummed I had to take someone like him for a course that was supposed to be an easy A ugh
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Amazing professor whose passion for literature infects the entire classroom. He cultivates a kind and friendly atmosphere in his classes (even if you walk in not knowing anyone in your class) and is willing to help outside of class. He grades tough, and gives pop quizzes, so DO THE READING. The books are great anyway.

Dr. Peterson is by far the best professor I've had so far at Pepperdine.  You accomplish lots in his class but he keeps an easygoing atmosphere in it.  I never really felt like the kind of dread I get in my other classes.  He is intelligent and incredibly passionate. If you get a chance, definitely take him!
great teacher. actually listens to your opinion. loves new insight to poems and such. we always watch a movie! very approachable and good office hours

Peterson is definitely one of the best professor I had so far. He is intelligent, sincerely in love with literature, and even film. You'll watch great movies in his class and you can even write your essay on them! Definitely challenging, but you will appreciate both literature and film more by the end of his class.
Hands down best English professor I've had in Pepperdine.

Had him for literature of the American West.  Very witty and bright professor.  I personally found his class enthralling but others did not because he can be bland at some times.  Highly recommend him for a higher literature course GE.
He is a very tough grader. Also make sure you write on what he talks about in class because he is not open to new ideas. Take notes and just use the notes as your commentary.

An extremely smart guy who always pushes you to do better in his class. While a hard grader on essays, he has a passion for teaching and has the best witty humor of all the teachers of Pepperdine. Just do your readings and you'll do fine on the pop quizzes and journals(which he rarely collects). And all this is coming from a B student.

John Peterson is not preferable as a professor. With bias grading, and hatred for those who firmly grasp their beliefs that challenge his... let's just say, if you aren't a tree hugging hippie, kiss your grade goodbye.

JP is hands down one of the best professors I've ever had-- especially for English! He's extremely helpful and is willing to sit down and talk about any concerns you might have for the class. He's passionate about the course material and an overall great guy. Participate, do your reading questions, and you'll be fine!
Alright but really liberal.

No final exam for ENG 101 course. No textbook, a handful of novels and articles instead. Series of 5 papers. Fun class. As long as you go to class and participate in class discussions you should do fine. Also, do reading questions as you do the readings, don't let thenm pile up until the night before.

Peterson is a decent guy but he is kindof pompus.  He assigns way too much reading on subjects that no one really cares about.  If you try to stand up against his point of view he will argue with you instead of letting other students.  Essentially everyone dreads going to class and unless you are a tree hugger the material is awful. goodluck!

I loved him!  Definitely my favorite professor at Pepp.  I'm not an English major but he still made the class totally tolerable.  Very nice guy and very funny and very fun to look at :)  JP is the best!!!

Class is mostly discussion, which he tries to keep interesting. A LOT of reading, but not too bad if you don't try to do it all the night before. As long as you participate, come to class and do the occassional journal entry, you will do fine. He assigns a few papers a semester but gives you a long time to do them. Not too bad to look at either =)

This class is bs! Its the most boring class. I fall asleep every class. This prof. speaks with a mono-tone. He tries to be funny..but it never works. TOugh grader esp. 4 paper...makes us read like 80 pages a night, the name of the book is called DESERT SOLITAIRE (how boring)..this book has no sparknotes either. Just a lot of readings to do, sometimes we have to do journal entry (but really rare) Dun take his class "Environment and the nature"..DUN!! a big NONO! Unless you are someone who likes ENIVRONMENT & NATURE.

best english teacher at this school, really nice and knows a lot about his material.  Very willing to help.  Anyone that rates him poorly probably just understand his intelligence and/or the texts.  Definately take for your english requirements
Super nice, young guy.  Very interesting discussion-style class.  A lot of reading.
Dedicated, fun, dry humor, class goes by fast. I'd take him again any day. Very into English but in the best way possible. Keeps things interesting.

Peterson is new but you should definitely take him. He is very funny and LOVES english. the class is all discussion and goes by quickly. He is very fair and grades mostly according to participation. I would take him if you can, he is a really great guy.
Wissot is a good teacher if you have the patience to cope with his ego. Watch out for the tests because if you only listen to what he says and don't read then you will not do well.

This class made me nervous and killed me. Wissot's class is very hard compared to other COM180 classes but you will KNOW YOUR STUFF by the time you go through his class. I'm glad I stuck it out and took his class though! :)

Hardest class you will take in COM but it is the most rewarding one if you are interested in politics and willing to put the work in. You do a lot of hands-on projects and assignments which are really pretty fun and useful for later on.

This class was incredibly difficult.  Wissot's going to push you to do your absolute best even when you don't see your own potential.  Excellent professor and course.  He goes above and beyond to help his students, including years after.  It won't be easy at all but if you're willing to try it'll be more than worth it.  Best course I've taken.

Very rewarding class if you are willing to put in the work. Professor Wissot will challenge you to do better than you think you can. He is readily available for help and I frequently received advice on my later speeches. We all know COM180 is just another GE but it can really help you with your future because good communication is a key to success

Professor Wissot is one of the best professors at Pepperdine. Unfortunately, he works corporate, so most of his classes are taught early morning. This class is demanding, so you're screwed if you're not a morning person. Like he says, if you put in the effort and don't discouraged, you should be able to get a decent grade. Don't expect an A though.

This class is way more intense than any other GE.  If you want an A transfer.  Other speech classes are a complete joke in comparison.  He'll tear you down and build you up.  If you're willing to push yourself there's no doubt he IS the best professor on the campus, and if you have the honor of taking him do it, just don't expect an easy ride.

Although I didn't receive the highest grade, I did learn a tremendous amount from this professor. He made me scared, he made me want to cry, but he ultimately taught me more than any other professor. You will enjoy this class with him if you intend on putting in the work needed, and if you are prepared to really be challenged.

Professor Wissot is an extremely demanding teacher.  He definitely expects a lot out of his students, but if you put in the effort and show it, he will do the same for you.  He spent hours outside of class helping me with my speeches and papers.  This class doesn't even compare to the other COM 180 courses, but you will be so glad you took it!

Wissot is a without a doubt the most dedicated and qualified professor I had during my freshman year. He cares about his students.This class will be a challenge, but don't drop it. You'll be so much better off taking this class. You owe yourself more than to be snoozing in someone elses classroom. Plus put the effort in now and he'll help you later
probably the hardest and most stressful GE on this campus, yet it was the best course i've ever taken and completely worth it, just be prepared to work way harder than any other class

class has an extreme amount of difficulty! other speech teachers are a joke compared to this class! if your looking to learn and gain alot from this class go for it ! but take with extreme caution your going to be very stressed over this class. he has extremely high expectations maybe even too high!

This is by far one of the most demanding GE's I've every taken, but it the best class that I have take.  He goes above and beyond to help his students, especially getting them internships and jobs.  He is a must take.

if you want a challenge take this class I thought I knew everything about speech but he will take you break you and build you back up.  I am worth more......LOL you will understand that after his class
Very helpful class and great professor. Expect tough grading but lots of useful help. Oh, and a lengthy term paper at the end.

nice guy. funny at times. this class is WAY more serious than any other GE you'll ever take. he takes a lot of pride in being "a difficult teacher." at the end of the day though, he's not that difficult, it's just that he's way more difficult than anyone else who teaches a GE. if you're not a trembling idiot in front of others you'll be fine.

Wissot is the most dedicated teacher you have the opportunity of meeting as a freshman and and that means he will push you harder than anyone else and he will help you more than any other teacher. Simply put, if you are concerned about the grade, transfer, if you truly want to communicate well, then you are very lucky to be in his class.

Professor Wissot is extremely difficult. His grading on speeches seems very subjective. This class was a lot of unnecessary stress for me. Its just a GE i probably wouldnt take this class again just because it was so hard and he critiques you to a T! He pushed his students a lot and it was a lot of work!!

Professor Wissot will really push you.  The class is much more of a challenge than other sections.  That being said, if you are willing to commit yourself, it is more than worth it.  He has unbelievable credentials, goes out of his way to be a help and you will get so much out of the class-beyond being a better public speaker.  He also truly cares.

Excellent class, excellent professor. Definitely one of the more difficult speech classes. If you are genuinely committed to achieving success and put in the necessary effort (i.e. a lot) then taking this class would be well worth your time.  Everyone improved their public speaking ability and really bonded with classmates.

All speech 180 classes are at the mercy of their professors, there is no real structure. Some classes have it easier, others harder-this one is harder. A very good professor who cares about his students and who has a great amount of experience in the field. College is not college without taking his class.

Professor Wissot really encourages his students to strive for their personal best. Although his class is demanding and more difficult than others, I feel I've learned more in this class than any other. His tests are challenging and he grades hard. But he really cares about his students, and he's passionate about the subject. A memorable class.

This class is far more challenging than any of the other sections.  You have to put way more effort into succeeding in this class.  However, you improve tremendously and bond with him and your peers.  He will also make up for the lower grade you might get by using his EXCEPTIONAL connections to get you internships and recommendations in the future.

Amazing teacher who is passionate about speech and teaches you a lot! Hard teacher but pushes you to be the best you can. Great discussions in class that make you think about yourself and your positions. I left that class feeling like my speech skills had increase greatly.
he teaches you a lot, but is very condescending. thats all i have to say about that.
challenging, but teaches you a lot. really cares about the students and willing to help you in any way

A real gem. I loved his class. The class on paper looks overwhelming, but if you enjoy reading or even just reading the summaries, you will do great. The class consists of 3 essays, many videos, a project, and weekly reading quizzes on the assigned books. He enjoys this topic, and I recommend him. I never made below an 80. #franknovakstan4life

This class is enjoyable in that it's really quite easy. But our class discussions are really boring and shallow. We basically just restate what was in the book instead of having real conversations about the material. It definitely doesn't compare to the other Great Books sections, but if you want an easier class, this one is for you.

He's okay for a great books professor, but he has a habit of taking over the discussions and talking over students, which was kind of annoying. The discussions never really went anywhere, but he was an easy grader on papers, so do with that info what you will.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Dr. Novak is a sweet man and I often found him amusing in class. Compared to other Great Books professors, he doesn't lead great discussions (he ends up just talking a lot), so class can be kind of boring sometimes. He assigns a lot of reading but he's an easy grader.

His expectations for papers are crystal clear, but the grade you get is incredibly vague. I never got lower than a B+. Discussions are long and mind numbing at times, but hey, it's two hours of ancient literature. He is incredibly nice and super sweet. He'll surprise you with the funniest stories out of nowhere. Overall, I would take him again.

Classes drag on and on. He seems nice enough but doesn't return emails. The readings are ok but sitting for two hours speculating about why a fictional caracter made so and so decisions about something is brutal

Absolutely terrible as a class. Test consist of random and obscure quote IDs which RUIN any possible chance of receiving a decent grade. Seems easy at first but please don't be fooled. The lectures are longgg. the test do not test true knowledge; only if can memorize entire novel. I have a near perfect GPA and I can guarantee, unless you'd like to stress and memorize quotes SLAVISHLY this class is nt for you. It doesn't really teach you to appreciate LITERATURE. Novak is a sweetheart however. :)

the nicest man ever. he is so cute; i don't even care if i get c's on his papers. people take his knowledge for granted and should participate more in the discussion. he really appreciates it, and it definitely makes class so much fun.

Novak was awesome! He's a quirky guy with a subtle but funny sense of humor. He does require a lot of reading but is VERY lenient with due dates and really listens to his students. Get to know him, he's fun.
Novak is awesome! As long as you go to class and do some reading now and then, you will do well. He is an old school professor and a great sense of humor.

The worst Great Books teacher.  The discussions weren't fluid at all and stuck to talking about the literature in a literal sense instead of looking at the meaning as a whole and applying the text to actual life.  If your opinion doesn't fit his, be prepared to not do well on your papers.

This was easily the biggest waste of a class I took at Pepperdine.  There is no structure to the class discussions leading to pointless conversations that have nothing to do with the important ideas presented in the text.  I learned absolutely nothing in this class.  Take Gose all four Great Book semesters.
He is a really nice guy, but pretty boring. Always like trails off mid sentence. Is into the books you read, but analyzes every detail. A very long two hours.
Made me feel really bad about myself - couldnt stand his class - not a great way to start out great books
Let the students run the discussions so we got a lot out of the books we read. I had him for 3 straight semesters in Great Books and I got a lot out of that class.

The cutest old man ever!  He is kindof your stereotypical college professor because he dresses-up every day and his socks don't always match.  He is a really great guy.  Work load is reasonable and he is always willing to help you with your papers and is a very fair grader.

Class can get boring if students don't step up in the discussion. I like that he lets the students figure out things themselves, but a bit more guidance might be nice. Good class overall, and easy grading.

wow. Novak isn't too hard.  He's really relaxed about his class and doesn't try to stress his student.  This prof likes to take his time and I respect that.  If we didn't get finished discussing a particular book....he would limit the pages to read for the next class. Bad thing is he can be too dry.
Overall, just really boring. I wouldn't take his class again. He's nice enough, and he is pretty good when grading tests, but the classes bore you to tears.

I enjoyed the reading for this class. Take good notes and thoroughly study them for test. I took notes on what I was reading too. I like english and was glad for this GE. However, some english majors do not want non-majors in class. Very rude.

I had Novak for Great Books for two semesters. He's HILARIOUS in a dry kind of way. He knows your limits and even though he pushes you, he is very generous with grading essays. Show you try and you'll get an A or A-. Good man. I suggest him to everyone.
ZZZZZZZZZ. That's what i thought about this class! The lectures were amazingly dry, the notes were ambiguous, and the tests were ridiculously difficult. I would dread having another class with him.
Dr. Novak is a nice guy, so its hard to say bad things about him, but his tests are RIDICULOUS!!!! And his class is really really boring! But overall, he is a nice guy, but not an easy teacher.

I had him some time ago, and this may have changed, but he used to allow you to turn in papers early (pre-deadline), he would look at them, give you suggestions, and let you resubmit it (so long as you were in before the deadline). Resubmit = A.

Good Professor overall. Very dry sense of humor. He is relatively easy when it comes to essays, but the discussions are all business. Discussions aren't the most interesting, but he really knows what he's talking about.
Novak is so great!  He is THE BEST Great Books prof.  He used to be easy, but he heard the rumor that he was finally, and became more difficult.  But he is still great.

Sweetest professor! This class was challenging but she was there to help every step of the way. This class is everything you'd expect out of a jour intro class writing stories, interviews, group work, pitches, etc. It was so fun and she kept everything so engaging, I highly recommend. Textbook reading is assigned but you don't NEED it, AP you need.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Occasionally passive-aggressive with her students, which was frustrating. Towards the end of the semester, it felt like we were just killing time between speeches. Generally, she would be pretty hostile towards students who had to miss class for whatever reason, which was uncomfortable to witness.

Honestly the worst professor I've ever had at Pepperdine. This class was extremely demanding for being what it is. Coursework is not engaging. Rude when you ask questions and is very pushy with her stance, felt like I was being converted. Super tough grader, unnecessarily hard for no reason. Do not take this class for your own peace of mind.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Littlefield has a very condescending attitude. Sometimes it seems as though she is caring and nice, but if you ask questions she comes off as rude. It feels as though she does not want to listen to her students. On top of this, the work in this class is absolutely unreasonable and requires too much reading.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I loved this class, but I want to add a quick disclaimer for people considering taking this class. If you truly want to learn about American civil religion, then take this class. However, it is a lot of work. There's a ton of reading and assignments, and she's a tough marker. That said, she gives extra credit, so achieving an A is quite doable.

This Professor wad the hardest religion 3 Professor. An A requires above a 94% and we were assigned so many readings (3-4 books + more) and had to write three big essays as well as multiple smaller assignments. Soo much work....
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I worked with Dr. Littlefield for Currents for a Production credit. She has pushed me to become a better journalist. Everything I have learned about ethics, meeting deadlines and working in a professional setting has been learned from her teaching. She is passionate about journalism and even more passionate about the well being of her students.

I had her for Investigative Journalism and it was such an amazing experience! If this class is every being offered and you are interested in improving your narrative writing then this is a need to take class!

Dr. Littlefield is an essential connection if you have big dreams of making it in the journalism industry. If you can't handle this class -- you can not handle a newsroom. She cares so deeply about her students and wants nothing more to see everyone succeed, so if you don't do well that is on you.

She is hard. There is a lot of work because of how much material there is to cover in just one semester. She puts a lot of pressure on students. It is a lot of work, so get ready to treat this like a job. By the end of the semester you will be so relieved and feel like you just finished the longest project ever.

This has been the most emotionally demanding course of my time here at Pepperdine. What a condescending roller coaster. Professor Littlefield in some ways seems to care but her condescending nature pushes students away. The class is demanding like a full time job and expects students to work a full time job just for her class. Does she care? Yes?
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Honestly the best professor here at Pepperdine! Is she hard? Yes! But she is so caring throughout the whole semester and actually made me enjoy online learning. Caring, smart and quick.. Genuinely integrated in the subject and discuss with you for hours on the subject and just a kind, genuine soul.

Professor Littlefield has singlehandedly turned me off of Journalism as a career. She often ridicules her students. She is not gracious when it comes to extraordinary circumstances--even 2020. She relies on tricking her students and appears to be constantly looking for ways to dock points. I highly recommend avoiding this professor.

Professor Littlefield gives extremely rigorous curriculum for beginners classes like Jour 241, but the biggest advice I can give is to go in and see her! If you show you care and want to succeed within the class, you absolutely can get through it. I learned a lot within the class in the end.

a big fan of her REL 301 but she is the most unclear professor I have ever had. She does not make any assignment clear and then proceeds to grade as if you are also living inside of her head. she is actually rude when you ask questions and does not live out the Purpose Service Leadership motto of Pepperdine.

This class is not mentally hard but can be very time consuming. Dr. Littlefield basically offers free tutoring -- you can go to her for any help you need if you are struggling. She really cares about her student's success. If you put in the work, you will learn so much and your writing will really improve. AP style is rough though.

She's the best professor. She loves her students so much. She wants learning to be meaningful and relevant to our lives. Subject matter blew my mind. Reading and participation matter but if you read, assignments are manageable.

She is one of the most demanding professors I have ever had. Nothing you write will be right and she will contradict herself in everything. Avoid this class at all costs. This class is for someone in grad school, not a GE class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Im going to be fair. She is passionate about what she is teaching but way too difficult. She was a nice person tho.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: There are no tests. ONLY PAPERS. She grades GE course papers as if they're being submitted in a journalism class, cause she teaches those too. She doesn't shy away from trying to convert you to believing her personal views, and she is the most condescending person I've ever met. If you skip class or get behind on the reading you're screwed.

She is an amazing professor but not going to lie, the class is extremely time consuming. She grades very tough. I would not recommend taking if you're looking for an easy A but if you actually want to learn, remember the subject and challenge yourself, she is for sure the professor for you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She has some experience in journalism, but she always makes herself sound like she KNOWS IT ALL. She is SUPER strict, and the class is super demanding. She won't teach and be ready to be suffered.  IM TELLING U SHE IS THE OPPOSITE OF NICE.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The only exams are essays. Tons of reading homework. Grades you not only as a religion teacher but also as a journalism teacher. I didn't think I was signing up for a social justice and journalism class when I joined her religion 3 class but that's honestly what it was. Not a very nice woman. Insane for a GE class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Expectations for papers and participation are rigorous without being meaningful. Teacher's own pedantic style leaves little room for creativity or inspiration. Subject matter is cool. Feedback on papers is personal, not rooted in true academic rigor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She was one of the worst professors I have had in my life. She is very condescending and contradicts herself in her feedback on essays. She is a very tough grader and she does not make the information fun to learn.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: One of the most difficult classes I've taken. Tough, rigorous essays. Take it if you want to challenge yourself. If you're looking for an easy A, nope.

This is the best professor I have ever had. She wants you to learn, she is incredibly knowledgable and cares about each of her students. She takes no BS from anyone and attending class is absolutely imperative. This class is very hard, but she makes it worth it. Highly recommend her to everyone who's willing to put in effort. Littlefield rocks.

I took him for POSC 140, very good teacher. Overall an easy class if you pay attention and take good notes during lectures. There is a quiz every week, and both your midterm and final are made up of the the same questions as the quizzes every week. If you truly put in the work, you'll get an A.
easiest class of my life. open note quizzes and the closed note midterms were just the quiz questions, so if ur good at memorizing take him!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Great prof.

Professor Roberson is the GOAT. Best teacher extremely relatable to students, and he's really greatly educated and highly respected. He promotes the inclusion of everyone participation and ideas regardless of your party affiliation in current events and topics relating to our government. Trust me he's one of the best professors at Pepperdine!!!

Dr. Roberson is nice and funny. However, he is WAY too liberal. He uses his platform as a way to profess his political beliefs. His class is easy and I rarely ever had to study. If you need it for a GE, take him. It's an easy A class. Quiz every week, reading assignments (very quick to do) and midterm/final. VERY LIBERAL--would not take him again.

Took him for POSC492. The best professor at Pepperdine, take him!! He makes it clear what you need to do to succeed in his class and wants to see everyone do well, as long as you put the work in. Makes the lectures super interesting and engaging.

GREAT prof. The class has weekly quizzes that are open note. The mid-term and final are entirely made up of quiz questions so its super easy to study for. The only other grade is a weekly reading assignment where you make two comments online (takes less than 10 mins/week). I didn't study or pay attention to lectures and did fine. Take him for POSC!

I love Roberson. While it was in Elkins, he made sure that each class wasn't just boring lectures. He made class interesting and was funny and kind to us always. I appreciated that he was respectable when talking about heavy topics in politics. He was so caring and understanding. I liked that most of what we learned was relevant to today.
Great professor, would take again. Textbook reading is necessary but helpful for exams.

Dr. Roberson is a nice person and a very entertaining professor. I did not learn too much about our country's government/ politics, but I am pleased to say that I finished with an A. Reading the textbook is not mandatory and the midterm/ final are all questions from weekly quizzes. The class is very straightforward and I highly recommend it.

Most of your grade comes from weekly quizzes that are open note/open book, and in-class participation came from a group and from online readings/discussion. Quiz questions get recycled on tests. Get with your group and put all your questions together to study for the midterm and final!  Makes it a completely easy A!  Highly recommend!

Along with being one of the most impressive people I've met, Dr. Roberson is one of the nicest professors you could have. Weekly discussion posts & open book quizzes, one midterm, and one final which are all very fair. Very personable and easy going and all around a great guy. Highly recommended for POSC 104

I took POSC 104. Weekly quizzes and discussion post type activity, 1 midterm, 1 final. Dude really cares about his students and the subject he teaches. If you're looking for an easy & enjoyable GE, this is your guy.

Dr. Roberson is incredibly intelligent and his resume is STACKED.  I learned so much in this class. Quizzes are open note and he uses the same questions on the test.  Honestly one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine.  He's the best! You won't regret taking his class

Dr. Roberson is a LITERAL beast. Take him. He literally increased my confidence and my ability to believe in myself. he is also SO SMART and hilarious. Love Dr. Roberson, so sad Im graduating and won't be able to take him again.
Such a king, def take this class
This professor's class was very reasonable. I am satisfied with my decision to take his class.

I took POSC104 in a 4 week summer course. It's reading heavy, but he made the information interesting and thoroughly covers the major topics in lecture. Most of your grade comes from weekly open note, open book quizzes and in-class participation. Quiz questions get recycled on tests. Highly recommend! Learned a ton and enjoyed the process too!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Pay attention and take notes on everything said in lectures; you will have no trouble passing the weekly quizzes. The tests are the same questions that are given for quizzes so group your and your friend's quiz questions together, you have an ultimate study guide for the midterm and final that will have you get an A on the tests.

weekly chapter reading, open note open book quiz on last week's reading/lectures, drops your two lowest quiz grades. you have to participate once a week. there is a political minute that everyone has to do twice where you talk about an article you read. Weights: quizzes 50%, Midterm/Final are each 10%, participation 30%. easy straightforward class

Professor Roberson is a very reasonable nicest, funniest guy at Pepperdine Faculty department. He actually makes GE very understandable, and makes you love it. There are weekly quizzes, midterm/final. Also 50% of your grade is participation, so be prepared to speak up and ask question. If you do well on participation, easy A.
This course is not a GE in terms of workload. Save yourself the time in taking a different professor.

Very nice. Makes you enjoy politics. Grade weights spread out. Quizzes/midterm/final are 40%, participation is 30%, group essay & presentation (same topic) are 30%. Quizzes & tests are open note, multiple choice with short answer, with pool of questions he draws from. Some repeat questions on the tests, from quizzes. 4 books, I believe all online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor Roberson was my favorite professor this semester. I took his first year seminar class and it was amazing. Professor Roberson has lectures that not only keep the class engaged, but are interesting with a few jokes here and there. Would highly recommend taking this course. As long as you read and put in the effort, you will get an A.

I took him for my first year seminar and he was FANTASTIC! There is quite some reading but it's not too bad. There was a lot of group activities but he found a way to make politics and economics fun! He is a reasonable grader and really cool guy! Highly recommend.

Professor Roberson has been my favorite professor at Pepperdine. Im not into politics at all and only took the class because it was a GE, but he made it interesting. There are weekly quizzes, midterm/final. Participation is super important! Kendrick is overall the nicest, funniest guy. Take Professor Roberson, you wont be disappointed.

The best professor I have ever taken a class from! He does weekly quizzes based on textbook& lectures, and I found it easiest to skim through the book and his lectures would fill in the rest. Participation was huge, especially since it was online, but it's nothing crazy. He made it super interesting for people like me who aren't even into poly sci!

Professor Roberson is not just an amazing professor, but also a great friend to his students. He is more than willing to help and listen to his students. You need to pay attention during lectures and read! I never liked politics but I really got into it in his class! Great professor and great class for a GE.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Roberson is great! I never really cared about politics but he made me interested in them. I bought the book, which was quite pricey, and hardly read the book towards half of the semester. I only read chapters for the first 20 pages and stopped since he teaches them in class. Quizzes make a up a big part of your grade so listen in class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Participation matters--Get ready to read

comment: One of the best profs I've ever had. Engaging and hilarious, while also crazy intelligent. Shows interesting and relevant speeches in class, and says weird things like "I don't give a rip snort." Papers are easy if you pay attention in class and participate. Would take again in a heartbeat. LOVE Jones.

Professor Jones is the best professor at Pepperdine. His class applies to the real world. You have no tests, unless you count take home exams, but those are just papers. While some may say this class is demanding I felt that it was incredibly fair. I ended up transferring from Pepperdine and Professor Jones still writes letters of rec for me!

SUPER passionate about the topic. OVES reagan. The class is demanding though. there is homework every day plus (2) 8 page papers (2) 5 page papers. His grader is picky. so it realy depends on who the grader is that year. But overall great class.
really nice, down-to-earth guy who loves pepperdine and his students! respect him, and he respects you! actually enjoyed this final, and i can't wait for my next class with him!

Dr J is great! His lectures are interesting and easy to follow. Test, while you have to study aren't anything that wasn't covered in class. You do have to work in his class since there are almost daily quizzes on the reading but it is a good class and he is a really nice person and good professor.

Dr. Jones is a great teacher! He's fun, makes jokes that he doesn't always expect you to laugh at- but that's funny in and of itself! His tests are pretty fair- this semester his final is open book and relies more on application than on memorization. I think that's great. I have recommended him to SO many people.

Dr. Jones is the sweetest professor at Pepperdine. He LOVES his students (and we love him back!) He is very understanding and passionate about COM 301, and actually makes the subject very interesting. I wish he taught every COM class!

SUCH a great professor! He's passionate about rhetoric and it comes through in his lectures. He truly cares about his students and hosts one class period at his house during the semester. The end of the year project is fun and allows students to be creative. Very easy going, understanding man.

Prof. Jones always tries to make class interesting, really enjoys what he teaches and genuinely wants his students to do well. Take good notes and you'll be fine for the tests. Daily quizes are the worst part so you have to keep up with the reading and be prepared for them.
New at this course, but good at communicating material to class. Needs more seminar style discussion. Quizes almost every day.

His tests are definitely harder than any other teacher's for speech 180 and he is a tough grader on speeches too. No matter how well I did, I always got the same grade. A nice guy, but a poor public speaker - ironic huh?
he's awesome. he keeps class interesting and really, really cares about his students. take him.

Dr. Jones is probably one of the coolest teachers at Pepperdine.  I had him for freshman seminar, The Life and Public Rhetoric of Ronald Reagan, and his passion for the subject was clearly evident.  We didn't have to do all that much work except for reading, and I learned a lot.  Great guy!!

Dr J is a great guy- he has you over for Pizza parties. I have him for a Freshman seminar class, so I don't know how he is for anything else- but, if you want to learn to analysis rhetoric, this is the guy to take.
He is a great teacher, and very nice. You learn a lot and I really enjoyed going to class.
He is hardcore but awesome.  The tests are difficult but you learn a lot.
His tests are impossible.  Take whoever coaches the speech team 'cause they always have class cancelled.

Such a great teacher! I hope to have him for many more classes. He is super nice and cares a lot about  his students. He's willing to work with you, not after giving people bad grades because he can. Truly wants you to learn and is a pleasure to be in cla
Awesome teacher, highly recommended!!
great guy, good teacher. very helpful and caring.

He is a Horrible teacher. His tests are nearly impossible they are 50 short essay questions. He doesn't teach at all. Is not prepared for class when it begins and for being a speech teacher he is not a fluent speaker
Dr J rocks!
No Comments
Fabulous prof who knows his stuff. Truly cares about his students.
Excellent professor!
very helpful, so nice, cares more about his students than himself

I had Prof LKE for Humanities111. I was in an auditorium style class so it was so easy. Although she mounters attendance and has a seating chart, her class is very easy. Listen to her lectures and you will be fine. Tests were all online outside of class- and you get two tries! I would do this class again.

She is such a nice and caring professor and is extremely passionate about art history. Offers extra credit. The only bad thing is almost the entire class is spent in a group and a group project, I don't understand how we pay all of this money in tuition and our grade relies on other students like we are still in High School.

I enjoyed taking humanities with Professor Killroy. For HUM111, everyone was assigned one debate topic for the semester that they would present during class a randomly assigned week. One midterm essay and one final essay. Two take-home tests. We had about 5 extra credit opportunities throughout the semester. Easy A if you attend class.

Dr. Kilroy cares SO MUCH about her class and her students and puts in so much work to her class. It's not a super tough class and she goes easy on the homework, so it's pretty easy, especially compared to the other HUM 111 offerings at Pepp.

Professor Kilroy does her very best for a 3 hour lecture in Elkins. She divides the room into over 20 teams to make class more interactive. She also takes attendance in the teams by giving points for team effort. The tests are online and can be taken twice. She adds in funny cat memes and I can tell she cares about all of us doing well.

Professor Kilroy is by far the best teacher I have ever had. She is so organized and makes class entertaining. Even though it can be a large amount of material that you are learning, she teaches in a way that you really absorb the information in class, so you are really prepared for the tests.
Seems like a professor who is trying hard to make her class good but in fact a three-hour long lecture is very boring and doesn't seem effective. Disorganized and not engaging.

Such a good professor! She made me love a class that I didn't expect to enjoy. Also, she's very reasonable and gives tons of opportunities for extra credit. The only excuse for doing badly is never showing up or just being plain lazy.
Awesome teacher!!! She is very organized, super nice, and offers opportunities for extra credit! You will be able to pass if you go to class, keep up with the readings, and take good notes.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Kilroy is one of the sweetest, passionate, and most caring professors. Lectures, outside readings, powerpoints, & quizzes make up her course. Two exams, but the second one (AKA the final) is optional. Offers a ridiculous amount of extra credit. I studied hard only once (for the midterm) and got over a 100% in the class. Take her if you can!!!

My second post: Attendance is not mandatory but you have to go to every single class if you want an A. There will be in class activities/polls and if you miss one or two your grades will be affected. I have friends who get a B or B+ in this class mainly because they did not complete some homework or skipped a few classes.

My first post: Professor Kilroy is such an amazing professor! She is the easiest professor for HUM 111 and 65 percent of your grade will be homework, team quiz, and other group work. Basically, you will get almost all the 65 percent if you are in good group (randomly assigned). The two tests are not hard, but the essay in test are harshly graded.

Weirdest class I've ever had. Mandatory attendance in Elkins sucks, but most of our grade, aside from 2 tests, was group work. The course is terribly disorganized, I mean it's a complete mess, but that makes it hard for her to give low grades when it's her fault. She's not an unreasonable teacher, and I've put in very little work to have an A.
Currently taking Hum 212 and I miss Dr. Kilroy. She made the class enjoyable and straightforward. She's so clear about everything! Lots of chances to improve your grade.

Lauren Kilroy is one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine!! She is truly passionate about the humanities and makes her lectures very clear. Her tests are mainly lecture based and as long as you show up to class and study the lecture material it's an easy class to pass !! She also offers a ton of extra credit
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This was your typical lecture class. She is a quirky, passionate teacher who is clearly interested in her student's success. Her tests are doable as long as you prepare properly. I never went to the class and still got an A. Would recommend.

Let me start off by saying like 10% of your grade can be extra credit (i.e. this class is easy... Take it with her). This is a GE class and she totally gets it. She's very clear with what you need to know is overall just a lovely person to talk to. Plus the material is super interesting and she's good at getting even uninterested people to learn.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Kilroy is the epitome of a perfect professor. She has a clearly outlined lecture, gives out extra credits, makes easy quizzes and her exams are really straight forward. You definitely need to work for this class, but she makes it so much easier for you, especially for a humanities class.

Dr. Kilroy is an excellent professor and knows what she's talking about. I had her at 8AM, and she would still radiate enthusiasm in her lecture. The key for tests is studying the cumulative study guide. She also has online quizzes before every lecture that you can retake if you messed up the first time.
She is funny and really knows the material, gives a lot of chances to do extra credit and prepares you for the final very well.

I am taking Kilroy's class and it is great! There are many upsides like the extra credit bingo board she offers, turning in your green/blue books early before an exam. Moreover, she is very helpful, available, &  explains the material well, however, her study guides & tests have a lot of info on them. Ta's are bad graders, just talk to her to fix.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I started HUM and wasn't so into it, but I ended up liking it. Prof. Kilroy is nice and likes movies which she connects to class. Do the bingo extra credit. Online quizzes are easy. If you can, go to the museum with her-it's actually pretty cool.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Attendance is not mandatory and you don't get credit for it, but there are pop quizzes and participation credit sometimes. The tests SO HARD. SO MUCH INFO. No extra credit. Office hours are un productive. She is not nice and when I went to get help on how to study she was not helpful, and expected me to already understand all of the material.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Kilroy is a good professor. She gives two exams, one final, and 10 online quizzes. You should read the book, but definitely take advantage of the study guides she provides. You should definitely take notes during class because they can help you with studying for exams. Pay close attention to the pictures of structures that she shows in class.

Dr. Kilroy is great! She is really organized with all her worksheets and quizzes. She gives a lot of opportunities for extra credit. Her quizzes help you to read and understand the topic/chapter more. She really loves cats and is really sweet! 10/10 would recommend :)

Prof. Kilroy is one of the best teachers at Pepperdine. She usually teaches art history but sometimes do humanities. she is pretty organized and has a lot of useful information on ppt. Tests are hard, but she gives studyguide and a lot of chances for extra credit. She is always willing to show you around in museums. Crazy about cats and tech.

He gave us a quiz every class with super specific questions that even if you did the reading you'd get wrong. Lengthy essays for tests and way too much expected from a GE. Made comments that made me and others around me feel uncomfortable, and would not recommend to anyone.

Professor Hoang is the best. If you're debating taking HUM 313 with him, take it. If you put in effort (follow his reading guides), you will likely get an A. I got 0/8 on the first quiz, but frequently going to his office hours helped me earn an A . He offers extra credit and genuinely cares about his students and wants them to succeed.

TOUGH. He's a hard grader, and he expects way more than you'd think for a GE class. Reading quiz every class, and the questions are super specific. There are three big essays, two for the midterms and one for the final. All of them are a lot of work. The instructions and rubrics aren't clear, most people end up with a B- average.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Prof Hoang's a great prof+person: he'd joke with us, bring food, include skits, debates etc instead of the same every class, and always happy to give feedback. Office hours and sending drafts were helpful, especially when deciding your topic. He gave resources (past essays) to reference. Participation is important. There is homework every class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: You will read a lot, and get quizzed every class. Papers are tough, but very doable, I'd recommend emailing him to ask what he looks for, he is very helpful and accessible outside of class. Not as bad as people say, just put in the effort.

Way too much work for a 3 unit HUM class. He's very excited about the topic but having to study for quizzes everyday and write several long essays, especially a 20-page essay the same week of finals week was not fair for a Hum 3 unit class.
He loses his train of thought and is super hard to understand. Coming into college this was concerning because I thought every class would be like this; confusing and pull nothing out of lectures.

For a GE you'd expect to put in consistent effort and show up. However, in this class, the grading scale is unusually harsh, which doesn't seem appropriate for a humanities course. Instead of doubling down on our mistakes when students express concerns about unfair grading and confusion, the focus should be on offering support to succeed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: The reading quizzes are worded so badly and are made to trick you. The format of the essays don't make sense  and he grades really unfairly. The criticisms he made on my essay sounded like he didn't even read it carefully. Every time the entire class does poorly he blames the students instead of taking accountability. Do not take this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This is his first semester teaching this class and it shows. His lectures are about things that aren't related to the topic at hand and his pop quizzes are poorly designed. It says something that his class was harder than anything during senior year. I would not recommend him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: As a person, Professor Hoang is wonderful. He is caring and exuberant. As a professor though, the problems begin to creep in. He demands far too much for his classes. As a STEM major taking eighteen units, I should not feel as if Great Books is my most taxing class... Professor Hoang makes any other Great Books class feel like a cake walk.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This professor was super caring of his students and had a passion for teaching. But there was LOTS of readings and the midterm and final are essays only but graded hard.

Overall Professor Hoang is great. He was engaging and invited students to participate in class. The one thing I was not a fan of was how he taught HUM111 like a Great Books class. If you take HUM with him, there is no textbook, it's all philosophy books and stories. So if that's your speed, take him. If not, don't.

Professor Hoang is an amazing professor. His class was fairly easy, but Professor Hoang and his TA's were tough graders. With that being said, he had countless review sessions and gave us everything we needed to be successful. We just had to put in the work. Not to mention, he is hilarious and makes his lectures very entertaining. 100% recommend.

Take him for Hum 111! He is so funny and makes the class so interesting I actually enjoyed going to class. I like how we don't have tests but instead have essays. He gives you the prompts beforehand and will choose most of them to put on the exam. You can tell he is super caring to every student which shows a lot since it was an Elkins class.

Tuan was super funny in class, he was a tough grader when it came to midterms and the final exam he really does value analysis. His TA's were also tough graders and looked for specific things. he's very caring and is always down to take a selfie
Super fun professor to have, makes class equally engaging and educating.

Professor Hoang is a great teacher to take for Hum 111. He made learning about western culture so fun and easy and if you read and do the discussions you will do great. He really cares about his students and will help you learn and do better if you're struggling if you reach out and go to office hours. Would highly recommend taking this class!

Professor Hoang cares about his students. He hosts study sessions prior to exams which are super helpful and makes class very engaging and fun with debates, performances, etc. Extra credit is always available, making it easy to boost your grade if needed. The exam prompts are provided ahead of time, which makes exam days less stressful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Hoang is so great. He really wants you to succeed and do well and gives every opportunity for you to do so. He will help you with an essay, read a rough draft, give you an opportunity for revisions, ect. He also really cares about students as people and is super fun and goofy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Hoang is a great teacher and is caring. He is always available to review students' essays before submission, even multiple times. I highly recommend sending him your essay because he gives good feedback. Make sure to put time into the writing responses for homework and don't procrastinate. Also, there are opportunities for extra credit.

Quiz once a week with provided study guide; long essays, high requirement on your content, low requirement on your grammar; participation does matter; lot of extra credit chances; interesting class and nice professor in general but still cost a lot of time on writing essays
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Took him for Hum 111 over summer session. Hes an amazing teacher and really caring. It was writing intensive and hes a tough grader but gives wonderful feedback so you can improve! He wants everyone to do well in his class and hes always available outside of class. Also gives extra credit which helps. Start out strong and youll do well

I would say he is one of the best professors in Pepperdine, I have never seen a professor who cares so much about your study and life. He gives out a lot of time to students outside of class. If you really want to learn something, choose him, you will learn a lot and gain a lot.

Tuan is one of my favorite professors! He is a tough grader but is more than willing to give you suggestions for revisions on your rough drafts.
