He also lets you revise all your essays for a higher grade during finals which is something most Great Books professors dont do. His dance videos are magic (and he may even let you make a cameo)!

Professor Hoang makes an effort to get to know each student. He requires weekly forum posts, which I found helpful because you'll know exactly what he wants to talk about during discussions. He cares a lot about quality of discussion and evidence, as opposed to the number of times you talk. He loves to help on essays and allows you to rewrite them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Took his four hour class and it was amazing. He gives you three breaks and keeps it very entertaining. There was a quiz every week over reading (but skimming works), a presentation+paper about any historical topic of your choosing, two take home tests (which are essays), and a take home final (also an essay). An A is a 95, but its a fun class

Quizzes once a week, drops the lowest three. There are 3 exams which are take home papers. Pretty picky about grading. Not difficult but requires a lot of time and focus to earn the higher grades. Nice professor and has a good sense of humor.

Tuan is one of my favorite teachers as a person. As a professor, he's an pretty tough grader. If 10 is rocket science, 5 being an AP high school course and a 1 was my ex girlfriend, his exams are a about a 7.5-8 in difficult. I wouldn't recommend him as a teacher, but he's a fantastic guy.

Dr. Hoang takes a different approach to teaching history. Be sure to take ones on the analysis of different sources during his lectures and incorporate that into the exams. He is very approachable, and cares about students. Hold review sessions for the exams. Take advantage of the extra credit. Do participate in class as those aren't free points.
So kind and hilarious! Went out of his way to help and was so easy to talk to. Very helpful and kind.

My favorite prof at Pepperdine, you actually learn stats. I study about 3-4 hours for the test, open note open book. You should be able to get at least 90 if you follows the direction (round to TWO decimal places!). Fantastic human being! He should definition take over the entire division!

Bob is a great professor who is very approachable. The tests are open-note, so if you take good notes and study for the exams you will do fine. Also, definitely do the homework- it is extra credit and the questions are usually very similar to those on the exams
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Class consisted of completely asynchronous, 15-minute lectures that he pre-recorded a year ago when Covid started. Keep in mind, this normally would have been a 4-hour a week class, but instead all we got were short videos of him reading off old slides- and basically had to teach ourselves. The results were pretty terrible. Don't take online.
4 tests, all open note open book. Easy class to get an A, let alone pass. Escudero is an engaging, fun teacher.

Bob is hilarious making stats surprisingly bearable. His class fills instantly. Tests would be impossible if they wernt all open book and note. If u come prepared for the tests by annotating your notes and highlighting study guide terms you will do fine. If you also study a little you will do great. Overall Bob makes learning stats easy and fun.

So the entire class grade is 4 tests, all of which are open book, open note. However, Bob doesn't really prepare you for the tests, doesn't really teach. He doesn't know most students' names, and doesn't hold office hours. Just take good enough notes and show up. It's not hard to get an A, but it's on you, not on him, cuz Bob doesn't care
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Bob is a really great professor. He teaches clearly and is completely willing to explain difficult concepts. All of our tests were open book/open note and he provided practice tests and a specific class set aside to go over it and any questions. If you pay attention in class and ask questions when you don't understand, you'll do well.

Bob is a great Professor who is willing to explain anything multiple times if needed. All of our tests were open book, open note but I would still recommend studying for them. He is available for office hours and likes to know you actually care. Loves sports and can get off topic, but still a hilarious and caring guy!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Clear and concise, excellent at communicating a technical subject in a nontechnical way. I doubt a more entertaining stats class exists. Bob is highly supportive of students on an individual basis, however values your time and never assigns the entire class an inane amount of busy-work.

Make sure you put in the work! The project takes awhile so get started early. Best Econ professor at pepperdine. They should give him a RAISE!!!! Always gets to the point and cuts class short if the material is taught. Great Guy and can go to him for everything. He will even make your schedule for you
Great Professor. Realizes that Econometrics is not everyones first love. Very accommodating and easy to work with. He should run the entire division.

Bob is one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine. He expects you to do your share of the work (reading, coming to class, etc), but he is always there to help you if you don't understand the material. His lectures are generally brief and to the point; he does not waste your time at all. I would highly recommend taking this course if you can!
No Comments
Get real Bob. This guy talks more basketaball...you get the point!
No Comments
pleased to know that he is a alternative for perrin who by the way stinks, BOB is the greatest

Where has Bob been all my life? Not only is he the nicest human being on the planet, his class is the greatest. I LEARNED STATS! After a rough stats class with Perrin, I took Bob for stats over the summer -- and it was the greatest choice I've ever made. You learn stats and you have fun.
Only A i've ever received.
The nicest man I've ever met.
I wish I had taken him the FIRST time I took stats!!
Unbelievable!   Saved by butt in econ!
Stats is sooo hard, but Bob helped me and got me through it.  Take him!
TAKE HIM FOR STATS!!!!  Bob is the best!!
Very helpful. knowledgable, makes learning fun

If you put forth effort, you can easily get an A. Professor Griswold is very considerate when grading and cares about the success of her students. I would recommend taking her because she is an easy grader.

Pay attention to her, read the textbook or her powerpoints. I took her 315 class over summer and got an A. First A in the psychology major. She's funny and really an awesome forward thinking professor. Possibly one of the best professors I taken at Pepperdine.

Took her PSYC 315 course and passed with a solid A! She is there when you need her. All materials are posted online which make it easy. Read the book, her lectures are word for word from it. Don't read, don't show up, you won't pass. It is such an easy and interesting class. Some may have a different opinion, but I like to pass, it is up to you.

Ha ha ha someone hates her because she wears uggs. That's really comforting to know that someone's critique of a prufessor's competence is based on jealous assessments of her wardrobe.  Dr. Linka rocks those uggs and looks like a former super model. She's also a great teacher.

One of The best professors I've had a Pepperdine. She's really funny, relatable and reaches out and provides tons of feedback. Her classes are so organized and quizzes are online. She offers all her power points and is crystal clear. I did well but I had to work for it.  Take her if you can.

I had Professor Griswold for Intermediate Statistics and she was extremely helpful. The class was designed to where we came out with a finished research study that could be used as a tool in later grad school applications. She was helpful and made time to make sure the students understood. I would definitely recommend taking a class with her.
Passionate about the subject.  Facilitates class discussion.  Relatable and young.

The material itself can be difficult, but all of her tests are open notes, so if you take good notes during her lecture, you'll be fine. She wants you to do well and is willing to work with you. She's really intelligent and passionate about the subject and has had lots of experience in the field. Not available in person often, but will take calls.

She is willing to help and has office hours, but I never used them. If you are naturally good at math, then this course is easy. She tries to scare away students by making it seem extremely difficult, but follow her lectures and read if you don't understand a concept. She made the class super interesting and applied the concepts learned.

I was struggling in the class Prof. Griswold did everything she could to help me. She strongly encourages students to come to office hours. She is funny and her classes go quickly. Awesome Prof! Great class to take for a math GE

great teacher,  participation matters even though she doesn't check sometimes if ur lucky but go anyway. she will make sure you understand. does plenty of examples on board. test questions pretty similar to examples in class so study those.

She genuinely cares about her students and if they are understanding the material.  She absolutely loves her subject and is extremely knowledgable.  She's a very nice person and is more than willing to help whenever you need it.

I struggle with math but this class isn't too difficult.  Although she doesn't take attendance, show up.  Class notes are extremely helpful for tests.  Only 2 pop quizzes.  Lowest test score dropped.  1 big group project (worth a lot of points but not super time consuming). Overall good class.

Fantastic professor; eager to share her experience and love of statistics. Breaks it down for the rest of us who do not speak the language of stats as fluently. Hard A but I was able to earn a high grade by working hard.
I took Intermediate Stats with her; she made a dry and boring topic interesting and even occasionally fun. Easy grader, but covered a lot of material in class.

Took Intermediate Statistics from her. It is a dry subject with confusing concepts, but she managed to make it stick and sometimes even interesting! Professor Griswold is very accommodating, reasonable, and willing. Plus, she's funny.
She helped me a lot during the course! She is such a wonderful professor.
Excellent professor.  Excellent book. She's really funny too.

Professor Griswold is very nice and helpful but I have to agree with the other student that her tests are hard. But she allows us to use her powerpoints as study guides and our grades were based on more than one thing. We had team projects and labs and a really cool program called Sniffy. Overall, I liked the class and the professor.

Her tests were hard and more work than I expected but I learned a lot. The team project was fun and I feel that she really cares about her students. But still, the tests were hard. She gave us all her PPTs and I still had to study a lot.

Prof Griswold is an amazing teacher. Her lectures are interesting and she ties in her own experiences as a clinician. She is an easy grader and really wants her students to succeed. Though an adjunct, she is as good or better than any psychology professor I have had at Pepperdine.
She's wonderful. She makes the course fun and she really cares about the students. She grades fast and returns emails immediately. Limited office hours though.
Prof and class were great. She really breaks down a complicated topic and makes it easy. I hate math but ended up liking stats. I recommend prof Griswold. Tests are hard but open book.
Very easy tests. have daily quizzes but not too bad.
I took her for stats, and it was very easy.  She is helpful and fun and is very passionate about research.
shes so mean and frugal with points for no reason

The material isn't as hard as other upper divs but her grading is infuriating. She is SUPER nitpicky on tests & going to class is pointless bc this course is all self-taught. If people ask questions in class she makes you feel stupid for not knowing. The lab was fun though AVOID HER FOR BIO STATS LAB
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Kind lady but kind of annoying as a professor. Tests questions kind of catch you by surprise sometimes and study guides arent all that helpful. Lab is fun though!
rating_tags: LECTURE HEAVY--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Before I took this class, I already knew what I was in for based off of this site and it was accurate. This class sucked. She expects you to read 40 LONG paged chapters everyday, flies through notes during lecture (with so much info), and on top of all I could've slept each class had I not made myself stay awake. Beware.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I was not a fan of Dr. Martin at first but everyone should take the time to get to know her. She is very dry in lectures but she really knows her subjects and she can be very lively one-on-one or out on field trips. She cares about her students and can offer lots of insight about different fields. Go in with an open mind and you will learn lots.

She laughs at you when you're struggling and during lecture. She also gets annoyed at simple questions or will just ignore your hand. She expects you to know everything but doesn't go over it. The test material is more specific than what's in lecture - but the book doesn't help. The tests are tear inducing and you are tested on too many ch. at once
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You know she's smart, but she has this way of making you feel like you're the most stupid person on planet earth.  Not the best professor for a basic biology class.
Honestly was not really the most enthusiastic professor. She talked pretty quitely and rather monotone. I probably would have done a lot better if I could stay awake in her class.

Read the text books and her lecture will sound more understandable. Overall nice teacher and a kind person. Very enthusiastic about marine topics. Test material is what's on the outline. READ THE TEXTBOOK (It's actually interesting!)

Probably the worst professor at Pepperdine.  She does not teach, she talks about things and expects you to somehow know every tiny detail about everything she didn't talk about.  If I could switch my major right now, I probably would solely based on this experience.
This woman is perhaps the worst teacher at Pepperdine! Try VERY VERY hard to avoid her. Some have even changed their major to avoid retaking additional classes with her.
Does not stick to syllabus, mumbles, goes off on tangents, does no specify what topics will be on test, becomes annoyed at simple questions, lecture structures need work.
Expects too much. X-tra Dry humor. I would have rather shot myself than sit in another one of her classes. (im not kidding) please God, help me avoid this woman in the future..
beware: low talker. Try to sit in the front and you should be okay. Challenging class. Fun and interesting labs and field trips.

Only professor for Zoology, so you don't have much of a choice. She's hard to understand with her nervous giggle and she mutters, and she expects a lot out of her students. My worst grade at Pepperdine is from this class. She's a nice person, though.
It was okay level for non-science majors.... Topic covered was fun in class but prof. is dry and not very enthusiastic.... not helpful outside of class... typical scientist type..dry humor

I learned SO MUCH in this physiology class. I recommend to READ! Make sure your lab notebook is done very well! Also, the tests are half multiple choice and half short answer. Study HARD and dont procrastinate on studying. Good Luck!
She is a very nice teacher, but soft-spoken. Go to class and take notes and study them. This class is harder than Cell Bio.
Extremely knowledgable. Laid back outside of class. Her labs are easy for marine and fun. Although she's hard to hear during lecture, what you learn in class is exactly what is on the test.
No Comments
Definitely passionate about the topic.  Lots of information but she's very nice and very helpful.
what an incredibly nervous laugh
She mumbles like you wouldn't beleive!!!!
No Comments
No Comments

What an amazing soul this woman has... not only did she turn me on to the subject even more than I thought I would be, but she added her own unique and personal touches to the course and the lives of her students that really made her stand out. Think about her often!
LOVE HER. one of the best classes ive taken at pepperdine. changed my major because of this amazing woman
She is amazing. Pepperdine is stupid to have let her go.

geeeez i love love love her. by far the best teacher at Pepperdine. I hope you guys got the opportunity to take her for Italian because now she's leaving after this semester. Too bad Pepperdine politics ran away the best teacher they had. Be prepared to work though, not an easy A, and don't get behind, you'll never catch up. She's the best.

Daste is AMAZING! If my mom died, I would want her to be my new mom, she is that cool.  Haha, she is a good teacher, really funny, very "fashonable" and has an awesome personality.  She privately taught Josh Groban Italian, which is pretty cool, ontop of numerous other accolades.  Not an easy A, but, she does her best to help you out.  Take her!
She is a great professor that really cares about all of her students. You learn a lot but be prepared to be yelled at. Overall she makes somthing as boring as a language fun.

I really enjoyed this class. It will be hard if you don't know other languages besides English..it goes really fast. Don't be offended by her publicly announcing your grade or your absences, it is part of her culture. Very intelligent woman, helps you more than she should on tests.

She has an attitude... you better get on her good side. I pitied the people that came into class late or didn't do their hw. They got publicly humiliated, but from what I understand that is just the Italian way. Her tests are quite difficult but like everyone else says she is like a mother duckling and is very very nice; sometimes even funny
No Comments
Freaking awesome class. She's like a mom at college, and she considers everyone her children. SO much fun, even though she tends to favor boys...

She's so cute! She's always happy and energetic, I love Italian because of her. But you neeeeed to go to class and take notes and study to do well. Got a b- with moderate effort. Really nice and caring not to mention stylish and rich!
She is amazing person with a big heart! But she tends to be a little insane when it comes to teaching Italian. She is a great teacher, though sometimes she may be unclear!
No Comments
No Comments
Crazy and funny. Not very clear and organized sometimes. Will help u if u need it. Pay attention and you will do good. Strict on attendance though. Really hot in a wierd way.
she can be so hilarious at times... and she is extremely nice.  sometimes difficult for her to explain in english... but foreign languages are like that, ya know?

Very entergetic about the course. You MUST come to class every class, she doesn't accept excuses. Ever. Make sure you read the book and check your notes with the book because sometimes she writes things wrong on the board. Overall, she makes you love Italian. Fabulous experience.
Rossana is a wonderful lady, she treats you like one of her own children.  She expects a lot from you, but if your a good looking guy...your'e good to go.
She may scare you at first but she means well.  Italians are just upfront people.  She loves her students and teaches because she wants to not because she has to.
She is a wonderful teacher.  She really cares about her students, and the help on the tests never hurts either. :)
i think rossana is the greatest-i wish she would teach the rest of the italian classes! yes, she could be considered an emotional masochist, but it's done all in fun!
I think you mean emotional sadism...
No Comments
Professor D'aste is really helpful.  She cares about our success and wants us to do well.  She is lively, energetic, cheerful, and fun!
great, if you're into emotional masochism

He goes too fast during his lectures during class. The tests are extremely difficult and barely anyone has time to finish the tests & always have to prep for quizzes every week. The test is literally super hard and even if you study it's hard to get an A overall.  Advise different professor for math class. Overall, tests are unreasonably hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Knows his stuff.  Goes fast to cover lots of material but will help you with what you don't understand.  I don't understand complaints about extra credit.  This is college not high school.

Decent professor, but could be a lot better if he slowed down on his lectures. He blows through the material in order for us to have more study time for the final. Sometimes there are only 3 problems on his notes, making it hard to understand the rest of the problems on that section. Online homework each section. (At Fullerton College)

Notes are a carbon copy of the textbook, no review, no practice tests, no extra credit.  I have to cut him some slack because it was the first time he has taught this class but I felt like a lab rat in a failed lab experiment.  He will get better with experience.  I wouldn't show up to his class if there wasn't a quiz daily I'm better off on my own

I don't know why people complain about him. He teaches everything we need to know for the tests and clear as crystal.  I hate to read reviews in here about how hard heshe is when they clearly didn't put any effort into it. It is very doable to get A even though he doesn't offer any EC. Just do what you gotta do. Put some time first then complain

If you do the homework you can pass the quizzes. Do it even if homework not graded.  If you can pass the quizzes you can pass the tests - same stuff different problems.  Offers office hours and extra help but I didn't bother - I probably should of.

NO OPPORTUNITY FOE EXTRA CREDIT. WORK HARD FOR THE GRADE. HARD TESTS AND THE HOMEWORK DOES NOT HELP EXCEPT FOR  QUIZZES,WHICH ARE PROBLEMS FROM HOMEWORK. NO REVIEWS FOR TESTS, YOU ARE ON YOUR OWN. WOULD NOT TAKE AGAIN.
I wish he gave extra credit or gave credit for homework.  You have to do homework even if it's not graded since the tests come from it.
All the quizzes are from the homework so be ready to do it all even though he doesn't collect or give credit for it.  Talks a little fast but you get used to it.
Be ready for quizzes but all the problems come from homework.  If you get stuck, ask for help.  No extra credit so make sure to understand the homework.
Lot of quiz and test are tough. But very good professor. He helps when tou seek.
I hate math and hope this is my last math class but at least the instructor was young and cute.  It's not his fault I don't like the subject.
Didn't plan on going to community college this semester (Financial aid mix-up at the U).  One of the few classes I took where I didn't feel like I wasted a semester.
Would take again if I had to but last math class I ever have to take!

TAKE HIM! He makes the class incredibly  fun. You just need to do the homework and you'll be fine. He doesnt collect any hmw but you need to do it to pass the quizes he gives almost every class. The good thing about it is that you dont need to study for the tests because you already did for the quizes. Ive gotten all As in the class so far.
First math class after high school.  Really different.  You have to know the material.  At least I feel ready for the next class.
HORRIBLE Professor!!!

He does not care if you fail and will fail you without a curve and send you a nasty reply email if you email him. Only take him if you know you can study hard and understand because he will not help your grade with any additional points.
Had Dr Dolbin's class last year and liked it.  Did well too.
Tried to keep class interesting.  Liked his sense of humor.  Knows his subject.
Covers a lot of material so class moves kind of fast.  Offers a lot of help and tutorials if you're motivated.  Kind of quirky. Don't get his sense of humor but he tries to keep things interesting.
Talks a little fast but will go over material again if you ask.  Pay attention. Go to office hours if you need it and you will do fine.
I liked prof Dolbin. He was a funny guy and was straight forward with his teaching. He has looong tutorials he offers before tests that really help. I'd take him again.
I think he is pretty easy
He is horrible and does not care about his students. His average on tests is a D and he does not care if people pass or fail.

Professor Pardee (or as his students in London call him, Cambry) is a warm person who teaches an interesting class. Cambry requires you to work hard and to turn in quality assignments. He holds his students to the same standards as in Malibu but he is also willing to work with you to come up with paper topics or move due dates if necessary.
horrible professor, would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He is a friendly person but such a difficult professor, just because he has a degree from Yale doesn't mean he has to make our lives miserable with his critical grading. His grading is too structured, makes no sense, and his instructions aren't clear. Not an engaging class whatsoever, would avoid him at all cost!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: One of the worst professors Ive taken at Pepperdine. His grading is unclear and he takes off points without providing feedback. He is nitpicky and condescending. I have never left a review before but I feel it my civic duty to warn yall. He said he purposely makes his class unnecessarily hard because of his bad experience with his REL 102 prof.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: One of the best profs I've had at Pepperdine so far. I had him for online Religion 102 and it was a super condensed course so there was a LOT of reading every night but he made the class genuinely enjoyable and intriguing. There was a lot of open discussion and he always gave the best answers. Recommend taking good notes for final and for an A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Honestly, I was worried at first but I loved him! If you don't like reading, then this class will probably be difficult, but if you pay attention to his lectures(which were bomb), you should be fine. He had quizzes and forums every week, but it wasn't unmanageable. Plus I think he was a great professor who cares for his students. Hope that helps :)
Horrible
DO NOT TAKE HIM! The worst professor at Pepperdine. His grading is totally unclear and he doesn't teach! I wish I never enrolled in his class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: these things called quick Q's. So I just finished the final and all I can say that I pulled an all-nighter for absolutely no reason. Thank you for coming to my TedTalk!
Don't take this professor if you want to drop your GPA. He DOESN'T teach and marks off points for no reason.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This professor did not lecture, and regularly made mistakes on grading and information. He will tell you to refer to the rubric, but the maximum point section won't fulfill the "requirements" he is looking for. I suggest not enrolling in his course.

Had him for online summer school, was not bad. One thing I wish he did was lecture more in person (only talked for 30 minutes, did not really do traditional lecture things), but he uploaded powerpoints of him lecturing and they helped you with the lessons. Homework was not all that bad, online quizzes were meh and forums were fine as well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Take another professor! Pardee is not a party I'll tell you that! So, idk how he grades bc it really doesn't make any sense. Tell me how do I get like 7/10 for writing my own opinion. His hw takes the whole day to do. Like you honestly expect us to read like 2 hrs of the bible as well as our daily quizzes, discussions, open-ended questions with....
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Pardee will forever be one of my top favorite professors at Pepperdine. Not only is he a great spiritual mentor, he is passionate about what he teaches and cares so much for his students. He is a tough grader, which means you need to WORK for your grade. Make sure you don't skip class because lectures are very important for test material!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Pardee is a tough professor, but he undoubtedly loves religion and wants you to as well. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. Pardee is such a great professor! He is very easy to listen to and he really cares about his students. I took his class two years ago and he still stops to talk to me if we pass each other on campus! Great guy, great class!
Pardee is a bomb teacher, but be ready to work in his class! Its a rewarding class for sure and you learn a ton, but you definitively have to put in a lot of work to get an A
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Great professor. His class was challenging for me because i didn't have a ton of knowledge about the bible but he taught it in a way that made it interesting. would highly recommend.

I love Dr. Pardee. Amen. He's the only really interesting professor I have at Pepperdine, but it's not for lack of competition. He is really a great teacher, and he lectures so well that you don't need to buy the textbook, just read the bible and the study guides, and listen in class, which is easy to do because he's interesting. 10/10 love him

Dr. Pardee's religion classes have been the highlight of my G.E. experience. He is very intelligent and interesting to listen to. His 102 class is a bit of work, as there are weekly readings and quizzes as well as a few essays and tests, but it is well worth it as he presents the material in a very engaging manner. Take him for both 101 or 102.

Professor Pardee is an amazing teacher. You can tell that he really enjoys what he is teaching and is passionate about his subject. He is also hillarious, you will never get bored in his class. There are also a lot of group discussions to keep the whole class engaged. It was really a treat to be in his class,
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Would take again

comment: Dr. Pardee makes class fun and engaging. He assigns a fair amount of reading and participation matters. I enjoyed his class and learned a TON about the New Testament.
Assigns a lot of reading but the online quizzes and tests are fairly easy. By far the most difficult part of this class is the reading.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Absolutely the best! He is HILARIOUS! Geeky and quirky. There is a lot of reading, mostly from the bible. Weekly quizzes, and monthly VERY short writing assignments. He also has a book/film report toward the end of the semester. Obviously a spiritual man, but teaches the bible objectively and historically.

He's a great teacher! he gives really great lectures and he's really funny as well, makes the class more interesting. Although, there are weekly short online quizzes (out of class). The midterm and final is also okay, the study guide is really useful!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Holmes is one of the finest professors I've had. He cares about his students and always listens, even if he disagrees. Importantly, his grading is extremely fair and isn't influenced by his views. He expects a lot out of his students and will make you work for it because he wants every student to leave a better writer and thinker.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Would take again

comment: Once you get used to DR. Holme's humor, he's pretty good guy with a lot of insight and he's got a lot of important things to say about social action and justice. Don't stress about him directing your freshman seminar BUT you better be open minded about learning about social injustice or you might get your feelings hurt.

Professor Holmes is the most incredible teacher I've had at Pepperdine. He's eccentric, hilarious, and an inspiring person to be around. Him and I got along very well, but I also cared about the things he taught in class (Caribbean Lit). If you want to learn a lot about life, take him. If you don't really care to learn, don't waste his time.

One of my favorite Professors at Pepperdine. I absolutely hate english class but he made my experience with this class pretty awesome. He's also very funny and enjoys cracking jokes to lighten the mood. Took him over summer and it was by far better then any other class I could've taken.

If I hear one more time about his two masters degrees and his PhD from USC, I may have a nervous breakdown. Dr. Holmes is very intelligent but tends to rest on his laurels and pontificate rather than organize a coherent thought. I shudder to think of what he does to his English 101 students. If you are a minority, though, this is the class for you!
****!  read and go to see him in his office

Holmes is very passionate and a tough grader.  If you write a really good paper and expect to get a really good grade you will get a - or letter lower.  Minorities, especially black minorities @ Pep this is the class for you.  Very helpful and will make you a better writer.  Students are required to clash/critique each other daily.  Take it.

He is hillarious & keeps class fun if you can get past the fact that hes IN LOVE w/ himself. Spends too much time bragging about his achievments & how he has tenure. Expects students to be literary scholars and analyze everything past what many (like myself) are even capable of which hurts participation grades. ALOT of reading!!! you'll die.
Hard.
what a great guy, and even if you think you'll dislike the subject, his passion for what he teaches makes you more interested.

Dr. Holmes is a fun-loving man who clearly demonstrates his faith and his walk with Christ in his interaction with his students. I admire him. As he'll be the first to admit, (knowingly), he is a man proud of his achievements and erudition. However, he is just as quick to applaud himself as he is to lift up his students. Key to success: commitment.

A great professor overall. He is real with you, but still expects you to work hard. Presents the class with great topics for discussion that make 4 hours seem like 50 minutes. Great class to fulfill lit. GE.

Dr. Holmes is a great teacher and we had lots of good discussions.  He really makes an effort to get to know his students.  You'll do well if you work hard and take the class seriously.  This professor is banging!

Dr. Holmes is the professor I've been waiting for in all my four years of college. Dr. Holmes seriously knows what he's talking about and is open to arguments. He's fun, takes the class (if its small) out to eat, and makes ridiculously boring books seem like theyre the best read ever. He is truly a teacher.

Class is fun! If you're interesting, and like critical thinking, Holmes will have a blast with you. Reading is always fun and interesting. You don't have to like it; be prepared to blast it if you hate it. Holmes loves strong personalities and tends to be flexible when he feels students are working hard. You will learn! This is what you pay for!
Amazing class.  Went into it not expecting much but Dr. Holmes is one of the best professors I have had so far.  A lot of reading but a very, very challenging and enjoyable class.

Great Professor.  He knows his stuff but he challenges his students.  He's funny too so that helps.  But I had him for two classes and I loved both because of his style of teaching.  Don't sleep on Dr. Holmes, he's great.

Dr. Holmes is a great guy. He is a very funny teacher and very smart. This class was amazing. If you get the chance to take Literature from the Alabama Civil Rights Movement don't pass it up. It's a class you can really get into.
No Comments
Horrible class.  Arrogant professor. Miserable experience.
Really a funny guy, and has the ability to make horribly boring subject matter palatable. A very easy grader though he talks a big game.

doesn't really plan anything for class, goes off on tangents, pretty much makes up grades. if you can sit through his class all semester, it's an easy GPA booster. i guess language theory could be worse...
He is a joke. You will get a A but you have to sit through him talking about how fine he is for the whole semester.
knows way too much, talks down to students, but I got an A somehow!

I took BA 292. honestly the hardest class I have ever taken. spends his once-a-week lectures talking about irrelevant things, totally going off track from slides. Never went over how to do the homework after the first few chapters. the quizzes & tests never had material he went over. one page notes did not help towards the end.

Just run away! If you're taking BA292 (which is what I took but isn't an option cuz it's new) drop before it's too late! Don't be fooled by the one page it will be useless. Even if you go to lectures, take notes, & do homework, you'll still be lost when you see the test. Spends lecture talking about unrelated things & won't explain all the math. GL
Spare yourself. 2 unit course, but it's more work than any of my 4's.

A solid professor if you pay attention in class. Exams are multi-step questions & his focus is on you thoroughly understanding the concepts.

Most Important for his class
1. Active listening & write all lecture examples
2. Exam questions have multiple parts & most similar to hard homework questions
3. Understand the concepts
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: just dont do it

Great Professor. Exam are hard. It requires for more time studying for the exam than average. Grading by few things midterm and a final exam. Homework are a bit simple. Group study for exam is a bit helpful. Overall the professor is worth taking.

His lectures are fine, hw is not a big deal and he reviews with you in class. The problem is that he makes his test 10x harder than anything we covered in class. Really nice guy but I feel his tests were overboard compared to the material that he taught in class.

Although his lectures are organized, his exams are extremely difficult and nothing like the questions on the PPT slides, homework, and lecture notes. He has an exam review session before each exam, but it is more like a group office hours where students ask him questions rather than being specific about what is on the exam. No study guide either.

Professor Goukasian has a very clear cut class, and he won't adapt to any situation you are in unless it is really extreme. I believe he is the best of the Finance professors from what I heard and his lectures are very clear, yet his exams are very hard and your whole grade is essentially made up of 2 midterms and the final.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Favorite professor since I've been here. Very clear lectures and goes over the homework for an entire class. Wants to make sure you get a full understanding. Go to class and take notes and you will be fine
Great finance professor, one of the interesting ones.

He is one of my favorite teachers I have ever had at Pepperdine. He is one of the most engaging professors and is extremely knowledgeable about finance. He will make sure you LEARN the material and he WILL make you enjoy it. You will remember what you learn in his courses. He is genius, he is charming, and he is kind.

He takes the extra time to make sure his students understand the material and he tries his hardest to engage the students. You get the sense that he wants you to learn the material because it will help you later in life and he wants you to be better off.

Dr. Goukasian is AWESOME! The class is very fair and well-organized. You know what to expect all along. Hwks are 15% of the grade, attendance isn't mandatory. Final is worth 35% of the grade, and midterms are worth 25% each. I have learned a LOT in this class. He cares about his students and ensures they get the material. TAKE HIM!

AMAZING TEACHER. AND THE CLEAREST COOLEST DUDE EVER. This class was so amazingly helpful, and the way he explained the material was like no other teacher I've ever had. I will never forget him trust me..take this class..it will be one of the few expeiriences in your life that u will remember. This MAN DESERVES A PROMOTION AFTER PROMOTION AFTER PROM
One of the best teachers ever!  Makes stuff very clear.  No homework, just tests.  Tells you what you need to know for the tests, and tests are appropriate and direct if you know the material.

This is a great class.  One of the most useful business class I have taken at Pepperdine.  He teaches as a teacher should.  No surprises, a couple relevant tests, and homework problems on a regular basis.  He's very understanding and it's easy to convince him to move homework dates back.
A great teacher. Very clear. I strongly recommend him.
He and Halvorson are THE best teacher in the business division.

Best teacher in the division.  Motivated, willing to help you with anything - not just school stuff.  His lectures are just about as clear as they come and tests are appropriate.  Not easy but because he is so clear it makes material manageable.  Great foundation for your biz degree!!

Amazing Professor! Def. one of the best in Pepperdine.  Very intersting class, very helpful man.  Is really looking to help students. Doest trick you in tests or anything of the sort.  Take him is you can.

Best professor at Pepperdine hands down. He really, truly cares that you grasp material and is friggin brilliant.  Tests are fair and cover only what is relevant.  Wall St. bad a$$ but still the nicest guy in the world, bar none.  Take ANYTHING with Dr. Goukasian!  This man really loves what he does and it shows every single day.
Gouk is the bombest teacher ever. Do your homework, go to class, ask questions, and bring good notes to the test.

Graduate from Paris, Sorbonne & USC ; and a previous teacher at USC , he is quite smart and knows how to teach.Allows you to use notes on the exam, sometimes the material can be hard but as a teacher probably the easiest among all others who teaches these courses. Knows about business & offers jobs.

Reminisces to his days teaching at SC often. If you suck at math, take this guy, he walks through everything and lets you use notes on the exams. He genuinely cares about the students, even though we all screw around in class.
excellent teacher. explains the material clearly.

Extremely sweet man. Sometimes lectures get boring, but he definitely adds something to it to keep people interested. Relatively hard class, but easy to follow and he is always available to help. Definitely recommended professor!!!
Great Teacher, maybe the best I had. But I think that after the class is over. During the semester I thought he and the class was awful. The class is very very hard but not impossible.

Tests are VERY challenging, but can be passed if you put the work in. I study 7-9 hours for each test, as does mostly everyone in the class. Although it is a hard class, Lemley is extremely knowledgeable and wants his students to succeed. Class isn't always a straight lecture; there are a lot of group exercises, videos, and discussions.
He is a very intense professor... laptops are not allowed... lots of reading. Test are hard as are quizzes. You learn a lot but for a 3 unit class there is a lot of work
This class is very challenging, and i had to study my butt off for each exam. Pop quizes are usually unexpected, and he often asks very detailed questions. Just ask him for help, he's very friendly!

Lemley is an awesome professor. Everyone says the class is hard but if you study you have nothing to worry about. Flashcards are very usefull. He's really sweet and can be funny if you catch on to his humor.

First semester at Pepperdine..he caused me to change my major. for a class with mostly new freshmen, he did NOTHING to help us study. The class was so hard - i got a C. I have heard it is easier now but the absolute only key to success is to get the old tests and memorize the answers. a really boring class and person for a fun major

Worst class I have ever taken at Pepperdine.  His tests are meant to trick you and not teach you.  The point of this class is not to give us trick, ambiguous, questions...tho most students make decent grades by obtaining the previous years tests.  Take this class with another teacher...thats what I did and I made an A in Comm200!

He is a genuinely nice man and tries to make sure the class understands the subject. It is a lot of memorization on the part of the student and certain parts of the course get redundant. Still he is willing to help and if you put the extra effort you'll do well.

This was the worst class I have ever had in my entire college career! Yes. He is a nice guy out of class and "cares" but there is nothing you can do if you do not understand his rediculous subjective exam ?'s. He speaks in monotone the ENTIRE time. Don't take his classes. I almost had a nervous breakdown just from one class of his! I warned you!

He may be a nice, grandfatherly-like man, but his tests are awful - so many terms to memorize its dizzying - you better make flash cards from day one, that's all I can say. by the end of the semester you'll be expected to know about a hundred theorists and what they believed. He will give you extra help if you ask - class is boring and long
No Comments
What does nice have to do with mutual understanding. He has got an unbreakable generation gap. Don't take him. BORING.

Lemley's such a nice guy, he really wants his students to do well. If you have any questions, he's more than willing to help you out. HOWEVER, his classes go by really slowly and tend to get really boring! His tests might take a while to get used to, too. But if you like Comm Theory, go for it!

Lemly is soooooooo helpful. If you are unclear on something just go see him in his office. He loves when his students stop by and he is a very nice person. If you read in this class and take notes you will do well. I highly recommend Lemley. He is one of the best teachers i have had.
He's a great guy and a wonderful teacher, but his tests are ridiculous!  Good luck with this class.  My suggestion is pray rigorously and study your butt off!

Lemley is a good professor.  He tends to sometime sound monotone in class...which can almost make you go to sleep.  But he has an interesting take on the theories.  He is also a really nice guy.  Tests aren't terrible if you just study the overall grasp of each theory.

he's really helpful and clear in his teaching.  as long as you study and do your reading, you'll definitely get an A or B.  his tests are hard and the lectures are often boring, but as long as you study, then you'll be fine.
Tests are hard but if you study a lot, it pays off. Pretty helpful professor.
No Comments

A cool guy but a bit unnecessarily long-winded.  Tests are difficult...study!  Go to class, he pops quizzes at the beginnings and ends of some classes but bring a pillow if you're not interested in theory.
GREAT, GREAT Teacher, and cares about the student.  He will go out of his way to help you.
Amazing man, funny, helpful and genuinely concerned for his students. Makes things easy to understand.
Great professor, interesting material, the walk up to the CBC is the worst part.

This class was easy if you finish all your work. The thing is he doesn't grade a single thing. You only see ur overall grade once the course is finished. The readings for homework are pretty long tho u just need to write 500 word responses. The essays have to be like 1500-2000 words but I thought the prompts were fun and easy so it was no problem.

Lasley is cool. His class is fun and interesting. It's not the traditional English class. His class focuses in on real world things and analyzes them.  He is fun and chill and lets us take field trips :)Quantity not Quality

Professor Lasley is a very interesting, friendly person. His class can be very interesting, but he likes to ramble on about things. For his essay, he likes quantity not quality. He will assign three large essays. As long as you meet the minimum page requirement you will get a B-.

nice cool guy, but hated his class. i struggled to get a B- in his class, which ive taken AP eng and lit in high school and both got A's, his assignments are odd enough and he wants extremely long papers as opposed to concise clear responses and analysis. def. plays favorites if ur not one of his buddies you wont get a high grade
Easy prof to talk with and will become engaging in almost any topic
Fun, creative... loved his assignments. And he is really, really hot.
i learned nothing. he likes quantity not quality which i don't like. he never keeps you for the whole class. he makes you read some weird stuff.
best of all! he's task is quite easy and he's very very helpful outside the class. easy to get A
Greatest. Teacher. Ever.
Michael is a wonderful teacher. He's creative, funny and adorable to boot. Good teacher, good person.

One of the BEST teachers I have ever had.  Extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and interesting.  Such a great guy. He is very laid back, easy to talk to, and you will end up learning so much without even realizing it. TAKE HIM, he's incredible.

This guy is not worth your money. Nice enough guy but doesn't know grammer and seems to pull grades out of nowhere. Plays favorites! If you're not one then you won't get an A cuz he will make up reasons to give you lower than that on papers. I've never not gotten an A in english til this guy, including other college english. You also learn nothing!

TAKE HIM- best class, teaches you how to write. The papers he assigns are on cool topics. He has a dry sense of humor, really cares about his students and is willing to help with anything. Hands down, Lasley's my favorite teacher.

Michael is such a great teacher.  He teaches you to think analytically, which is something you will actually use.  The class is pretty easy...you just have to THINK and do your work.  He's funny and also very attractive!

who did he know at this school to get a job? people are rating him high because, yeah, hes very easy. but the man is a slob and is way to lax about his position. i could learn more about english by skimming a pamphlet. dont rate based solely on how little homework you had to do.

Lasley is a great teacher and an even better person.  Class is laid back but interesting.  Lenient grader and flexible on deadlines.  Not much effort required for a good grade, but there is a lot there to get out of it if you go to class.
Funny, entertaining, a great English class to take

Lasley is by far the best (easiest) professor I have ever had. The class is all papers, which he will be more than happy to help you with if need be. You get out of class early every single day, and sometimes class is just cancelled. He's young, funny, intelligent, and cute. Overall he is an extremely amazing person and a very fair grader. TAKE HIM

Lasley is so awesome!  He's such a chill and funny teacher.  You get a lot of papers and the assignments can be a bit vague, but he's a pretty easy grader so it's not that bad.  Plus he's very willing to help and almost always lets you out of class early which is great.  Definitely try to take his class for English 101.

Lasley is by far one of the coolest teachers I have had.  He is a great teacher and down to earth, and is willing to work with you.  He is usually seen walking around campus, because he is just like one of the other students, he is the type of guy you could hang out with.   Take him if you can.

He's an awesome teacher and person.  Class discussions are always fun, homework is never hard, and he usually lets us out pretty early.  There are some long papers due, but he really helps you with them.
Awesome guy, easy to talk to, will work with you to make sure you do well in the class.  Easygoing and can make a subject most people find boring interesting enough.
Awesome Teacher. Very Very nice! Take it forsure!

Ummm pretty much my favorite teacher I've had all semester. This guy is GREAT. Definitly try to get into his class. Class was small, he was really personable, discussions were interesting although I felt that we focused mostly on racial issues. Really cool guy though, he's young so you feel like you can talk to him, really helpful...TAKE HIM TAKE H

Find a different Spanish teacher. While the homework is pretty easy, she almost never tells you about it and is not clear about assignments and yet she is strict on homework. She never accepts late assignments, even if you had a good reason. (even during a pandemic). It's hard to understand her and she gets annoyed when you don't understand.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is super nice and caring. If you are having trouble go see her ad she will make sure you understand it! She makes the class fun, and if you pay attention and and don't skip class, you will do fine.

By far one of the most influential and best Spanish professors that I have had a Pepperdine. I highly recommend that you take her class, she really cares about her students and how they are doing in life. I didn't know what to expect whenever I came into this class but I'm very thankful that I did take this class during the summer session.
She's a very kind woman and her class is worth taking for sure. She grades fairly and teaches very well. Sometimes hard to understand, but overall a great Spanish experience.

Best Spanish professor at Pepperdine.  She really wants her students to do well but at the same time she knows that a foreign language is a GE.  Participation, projects, and papers are fairly graded and weighed.  Always available, though can be tough to get a hold of via email.  And for her age she has a pretty smokin body.

Took her for Span 152 during the school year and 251 in the summer. She is one of my favorite Professors at Pepperdine! She's very nice and willing to help you. Make room in your schedule to take her! I got a C in 151, A's in 152 & 251 w/ Roggero.

Prof. Roggero is an amazing professor. She really wants her students to succeed. She can be a little bit difficult to understand at first but once you get use to hear she makes sense. Her test are very easy if you just read the book and ask her questions.
Nice, friendly, and personable.  Easy to understand, easy grader, Easy class.

Really nice teacher. Not the most clear with lectures, but makes it clear how to succeed. The tests are the same difficulty as with the other teachers, but she grades way easier than any Span teacher I've had, esp on papers. I had never gotten better than a C+/B- in any Spanish since my 1st sem of Span I in high school but got an 'A' in her class!

Rogerro doesn't speak a word of enlgish...which is kind of funny. The class is interesting and fun. Don't expect clarity of any kind or out of class helpfullness. Take her if you know the material. She will NOT fail you no matter what. She really wants to see her students do well. She is a genuine and caring person. By far one of my fav. teachersye

Roggero doesn't really speak english which is a challenge. she is VERY nice but gets easily confused. You have to come to class and be pretty good at speaking. I am awful at spanish and came to this class straight from HS. I failed almost everything but she still gave me a C. i would try to take someone else but she is ok
She's really nice and wants to see you learn. Sometimes she has trouble explaining how grammar works, though, but you'll still learn a lot. Buy the book for this class, too.

She talks fast but she is very fair.  If you try your best you will be rewarded but if you just don't care or try your grade will reflect it. Also, she seems to favor the dudes which in this case is not so bad. To soften her up just ask her to sing her favorite songs about Argentina and especially "Color Esperanza."
A very nice woman, but much more serious than she needs to be. Span should be fun but she killed lots of jokes. Fair grader, learned a lot, lots of speaking practice=good, boring though.
She does speak very very quickly. It's hard to understand at first, but you get used to it. I hate that there is so much participation required, but she is a very nice and helpful woman.

Senora Roggero talks and moves the class along very quickly. She definitely has favoritos in each class but then again all Spanish teachers seem to. Homework is issued often but is mostly easy. She tries to incorporate oral exercises but usually forgets the tapes. Easy if you know your Spanish.

Roggero is a great teacher. She is caring and funny and very good at relating the material to her class. She speaks quickly so you have to listen carefully but you will get used to a normal rate of talking, instead of being walked through things. Take her class, you will enjoy it.
makes spanish interesting- fair grader, i usually didn't do great in previous ones but did in this one- she's so nice and caring too
Always ready to take time to explain things and a really sweet, caring person.

she's aweful.  she never wanted to help outside class & would just tell us to go to the tutor.  speaks very quickley, nad e-mails homework without warning at the last minute and your grade hurts if you dont have them for the next class. avoid at all costs
Awesome!
Nice woman, not good at explaining.
No Comments
Easy for a spanish teacher, kinda moves quickly though. Highly recommended!

As expected, this class is very challenging and difficult, there are a LOT of projects and assignments. MAKE SURE TO STAY ON TOP OF IT, do not procrastinate. I was intimidated by her at first, but ended up loving her not only as a professor but as a person. Work hard and you will get good results. Do not slack off, especially for her class.

There are large case readings every week. You must read them super carefully and be prepared for her to call on you and ask you anything. There is a case writeup which is super painful. Exams are super hard but there is a fundraiser which is the bright spot of the class. Take 366 instead if you have the option. The work never ends.
This teacher has lots of quick turn around for assignments which can lead to large amounts of work and duress for students. Written assignments are lengthy and frequent.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She has good intentions but her lectures are HARD. You have to THOROUGHLY read cases and be prepared for cold called questions. Tests are detailed and difficult. As a class we do a fundraiser on main campus which is fun!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The textbook is irrelevant to class but you are required to read it and speak about it in class. Unclear grading system so you have no idea if you are doing something correctly. I seriously do not suggest taking her. She also comes off as fake.

She's one of the smartest business professors I have come across in Pepperdine. Her classes have substantial amount of readings. She seems very strict and scary in the beginning of the semester, but as the semester ends she becomes very calm and sweet. Easy easy grader. Take her if you want to learn about strategies and gain more business knowledge
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor James is one of the most uncaring professors I have met. She is impatient and is not clear on what her standards are. Her grades are unreasonably harsh and she has no empathy to listen to students. I have never worked so hard in my life for something so unrewarding.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Connie James is one of the BEST professors I have taken at Pepperdine. She will challenge you and maybe scare you a bit, but in the end you learn so much from her teaching and her class. I would 100% take another class with her if I could.

I have never worked so hard in my entire life. This course single handily  made the investment in a Pepperdine degree worth it. Not only did I learn tons of material and retain it, but I was able to apply it to real world scenarios when choosing corporate strategies. You get to present your strategies on chosen public companies in front of judges.

OK, listen, i took BA497 with professor James,  9 people working as a group, clearly you learn a lot from her lecture and assignment. She is a very very nice person, trust me on this one, sometimes she pushes you hard its for your own good. You have to work hard, anyways I did nothing and carried by my teammate through the semester, no pressure !

she does not teach you, she only facilitate the class! you need to teach your self and work with friends! not a usual pepperdine professor type. does not give you insights and lecture about the subject. she just start hitting on projects hard and grading hard

I LOVE her! She is challenging, but at the end of the semester you'll be thanking her for shaping you into such a great business mind! Make sure to stop by her office and ask for a critique on your work so far. She will lead you in the right direction. The class isn't easy, but the companies used for projects we're interesting and made it fun.

Prof. James is one of the hardest, yet kindest professors I have ever had.  She truly wants her students to succeed but she won't make it easy.  Her class is geared more towards entrepreneurs, however.  If you want to work for another company I recommend Seshan. If you want to own your own business I recommend her.  Best class I ever took.

Awesome teacher. She is very tough. But she will push you to learn and to understand the material. I loved her as a teacher despite all the work because in the end I am a better student. She is also a very kind person, even though she is kinda intimating at first.

Dr. James is definitely the best Policy teacher as her class is much better structured than Seshan's and really brings together the whole business major. She can be kind of moody, will pounce on you if you say something stupid that doesnt make sense, & tends to not be completely clear sometimes but she will work with you and help you learn lots.

Absolutely loved Dr. James, on both an educational/professional and personal level!  For one of the most difficult classes I've had at Pepperdine, she definitely helped develop me into a better overall person.  Thanks, Dr. James!
One of the best professors I had at Pepperdine.  Amazing lady.
She will prepare you for Policy and Service Leadership
No Comments
Hard class but you will learn a lot and she will help you if you ask or it. Overall good experience.
James is tough, and she doesn't take any****, but you can learn a lot.  Respect her, and she'll respect you.  She is an amazing woman.
Be prepared to spend some late late nights working on the several cases you will be given.  It's all about women power in this class.  No room for machos!

sounds like a bitter person above me.  dr. james is difficult but she's an awesome teacher.  she inspires students to work harder and sets the standards bar higher than most students want or are capable of handling.
No Comments
Dr. Warford is a great guy and cares a lot about his students. Do the homeworks faithfully and you will get an A.

Prof. Warford is one of the best teachers at pepperdine. With over 40 years of experience, he really taught us computer systems from the punch cards all the way to what we currently have today. He also is so open in office hours to get help.

Although I had trouble learning from him, I think that Warford is a great teacher that displays care and passion for his students to succeed. Here's the thing: he has gotten VERY old -- making it hard to learn from him at a reasonable pace. I think there needs to be a new teacher for future students so they can learn better...
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Although I completely respect Prof. Warford, he has aged quite a bit making it hard for him to keep up to pace in the classroom and to teach us at a faster pace in which we can understand better. I can tell he truly cares about us and wants the best for us, but i think it's about time Pepperdine finds more comp sci teachers.

As always, Warford takes a really tough class and makes it somewhat understandable. Data Structures is still really hard, but Warford is always in his office, happy to help with anything, anytime. Watch out for random stuff though, like drawing a degenerate binary search tree on an exam. Oh and the Sort Paper on LaTeX was a total waste of time.
Beware of how quickly the material in Warford's classes can catch up to you- no answers are online so if you don't understand a concept, seek help before you have to do the homework

Don't blame Warford for the tough material. He's always in the office, happy to help. All the lecture videos are online, it's easy to get ahead if you're willing to try. The enthusiasm is so cheesy it's hilarious sometimes. Even test questions can be a little predictable. Love you Stan
This professor is absolutely amazing. It is evident he truly cares about his students and he wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: My favorite prof at Pepperdine. He is hilarious and is so clear about what you need to study for any test.

I took Warford Computer Science 330 class called Computer Systems. All the material for the class is recorded, so if you have an absence, you can watch recordings of the class. He does a great job of being available outside of class, and offers incentives for students willing to go above and beyond on final projects.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Warford is extremely clear and helpful in class. He moves slowly and is a fun lecturer. He's really excited about Formal Methods and it shows.
Super helpful, wonderful teacher. He loves what he is teaching and really tries to help the student succeed.
Dr. Warford is a fabulous teacher.  He is very dedicated to his students and is always available to help on homework or answer questions during office hours.
No Comments
Teaches theory because it is a *University*.  You know... if you want really practical stuff they have places you can go to learn Excel & FrontPage.  It's call ITT Tech.

I agree with the comment that Dr. Warford does not teach material that can be implemented in the real world.  He teaches far too many concepts and not enough implementation.  In my senior year I started taking extra classes on the side in the Valley on Net

Stan is a good teacher, provided he knows the material well enough to write a book on it. He lacks the vision needed to get the department where it needs to be. Should have tried harder to keep Dung Nguyen back in the 90's.
No Comments
A really good teacher. He's not very charismatic, but he's very good at teaching the subject. The class was interesting, and challenging, but very possible to get an A if you work hard.
Your grade reflect your relationship with the Professor Warford. If you mess up with him, you will get bad grades.
Teaches concepts very well and is always willing to offer extra help.  Tests are challenging, but fair.

This prof teaches only out of a textbook he wrote.  He hasn't worked in the industry in over 15 years now, and it shows. The 400-level courses especially are geared for going into a teaching career, not a real life job. Ego-biased grading as well.
Really simple stuff if you've ever done programing before.

Dr. G. was one of THE BEST professors in my college career. He did not let me get off easy - constant challenge. But in the end, I rose to the expectation. He gave me great confidence in myself in addition to the fantastic knowledge about economic philosophy. Very entertaining lectures; motivational.

PS. One of only two A- grades I ever received.

Don't pay attention to the ratings here! Dr. G's class was horrible. He talks for hours and doesn't stick to the material. Trust me, you will be bored out of your mind. HW every week and his test are insane. 2, 100 question tests and a 200 question final!! Make sure to pick a good group if you want to survive. AVOID AT ALL COST!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Dr G as he like to be called had a great impact on me both personally and professionally. He makes you work hard and wants you to pay attention to what he is saying before you take notes. I found this to be helpful in making the material easier to remember and understand. He was a class act and really miss him since I graduated.

Dr. G tries to intimidate you the first couple courses. After that, he is really nice and caring. I suggest recording his lectures and listening to it again because it is a lot of information to digest in class. I am glad I took him before Finance because he went over a lot of the Finance material better than my Finance professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the most invigorating classes I have ever taken.  Besides from the fact that i am an Econ freak, I loved his passion for teaching and just the insights he gave to the students. Its infectious. I loved his teaching style. No notes taking which is great. I mean in real life, u can't really take notes as much. Its hard but its so worth it!

It's true that he is a great professor. The material was interesting and he genuinely enjoyed teaching. The only downfall was that when it came to grading, individuals with C's on all of the exams ended up with B's in the class. There's nothing more disheartening in an MBA class than working your tail off and seeing others pass without earning it.

A difficult class (you need to really work), but it was honestly the BEST CLASS I've ever taken -EVER. I learned SO MUCH. The class is mentally rigorous but very interesting and rich with information. Dr. G's teaching style really helps you to retain knowledge. Excellent course. HIGHLY recommend if you're looking for a TOP-NOTCH, QUALITY professor.
Great class, not easy. He will work you hard and keep you late and it will be worth every minute you are there and every penny you pay. I learned more in this class than I have in many other classes.
Too much information. he did not stick to course format and he talked for hours . Horrible teacher

He will keep you in class for 4-5 hours with no breaks sometimes, but you will enjoy every moment wanting more. Notes are illegal: "Secretaries take notes; I'm preparing you to run corporations." His experiences at the capitol, in the NSC, being educated, with family, etc. round out the class. "You can only learn by making mistakes." You will.

On a midterm test, Wayne would give you just one point for the answer to a deeply complex economic problem (If a brain were a muscle, it would be working overtime), and one point if you spelled his name correctly. He played no favorites. A genius of the first order!

A great professor and a great class. His stories true or not help make the difficult subject matter more palatable. previous posts--can't imagine anyone calling the class a joke. If he was a joke he would not be at Pepperdine. Very knowledgable prof with alot of history---highly recommend taking the class. 2009 MBA

Entertaining class and likable guy but like someone said the guy loves listening to himself talk and you don't know what to believe and which not to believe.  Do a google on him and you'll see he's got lawsuits that put his character and integrity in question.

If you give it a chance, Dr. G.'s class and the China Trip will change your life for the better and transform you. Both were amazing experiences and provide my fondest memories of Pepperdine. I made friends and contacts that I will keep forever. The China Trip will blow your mind!!! Dr. G. is an amazing person.

His class a joke.  I have an undergraduate degree in econmics from UCLA.  You learn more in an intro Econ class than this class.  All he does is tell stories which you cannot believe because basically, he's a blowhard.
Best professor ever...period!
A great lecturer who simplifies economics without dumbing it down.  A challenging course that is very rewarding.

I can justify all of my student loans with the knowledge I acquired from Dr. G.  You haven't been to Pepperdine if you haven't taken his class!  In addition to the class, the China seminar is a MUST.  It was one of the most fulfilling trips I've ever taken.
If you don't take him, you've wasted your $$$.  He is by far the best prof I've ever had at UCLA and Pepperdine.  A must for all!!!
Best teacher you'll ever have, bar none!

Committed and passionate about subject matter and students' understanding. Teaching goes beyond syllabus to school of life. Style not for faint-hearted, but for some will be one of the best experiences of your academic career.
Hands down one of the best instructers I have ever encountered in my academic history.  Top shelf professor.
Inaugural distinuished teaching Luckman award recipient.

Do NOT take this class. She expects you to watch lecture vids on your own time and then she reviews the content in class. Very unorganized, and frequently changes what material to know for the test. Going to office hours gives no clear answers and you leave more confused than when u came in. Also never answers emails. nice person, terrible prof

Really engaging and caring. Wishes the best for her students and their grades, so she would move a test date if we weren't prepared. Content can be difficult to learn, but she teaches well. Seemed a little disorganized at the end and changed her teaching methods. No homework.

A lovely person but terrible professor. Picks favorites and is absent. Never responds to emails, unsympathetic, and is extremely unorganized. Have seen how nicely she treats her "favorites" and baffled by the way she dismisses serious health/family issues when it comes to others. Spends half of class speaking about her life or praying.

If you are dealing with a mental health issue that is not in remission beware of her. She won't respond to your emails and if you are struggling in class she encourages you to drop the course. She is not lenient with deadlines and you have to prioritize going to exams over your health. Take anatomy somewhere else.

Doesn't answer her emails. Skipped lecture often and made us watch recorded lectures instead. Tests were quite difficult and filled with a mixture of information. Often forgot to send answer keys for the test reviews and would send out reviews late the night before the exam.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Storm- is BY FAR my fav prof. She is SO kind and caring. Makes lectures so interesting and gives LOTS of analogies so u can better understand the material. Exams are hard. U MUST study to pass this class and take it SERIOUSLY. A lot of people dropped out b/c they didn't do good. PLEASE, TAKE HER CLASS! It's the best. Always willing to help u!

Dr. Storm is my favorite professor at Pepperdine. Although her class is very difficult, she makes a point to be available outside of class. Study every day or you will fall behind. Brush up on your spelling as it counts. You must know everything from the notes. I personally found the lab tests (anatomic memorization) harder than the lecture tests.

Dr. Storm is the sweetest and one of the best professors I've had so far at Pepperdine. That being said, her class is difficult. We had five lecture exams and three lab exams that made up most of our grade. Go to office hours and don't wait until the last minute to study and you'll be just fine.

A great teacher, but my God is the class and tests hard. Study for twenty hours and still barely get a B on the test. For one of the tests, it was right after a break, so I studied for the entire week. Barely got an A on that test. Lab exams are even harder. Set aside a lot of time for this class, and then be prepared to set aside even more time.
Very great person, very tough class

Anatomy was one of my favorite courses this semester. The lectures were always informative, and entertaining. If you want to get a good grade (B or higher) in this course, you must put in the work and effort outside class. Doctor Storm is a very kind person and always has office hours to ask questions. Go to office hours, especially before tests.
Love professor storm. I wish I could be her child.
Being her student and now her TA, I love working with Dr. Storm. She cares so much about her students and she is very knowledgable. She is also very funny which makes the class so much better!

the best teacher I have had. really nice to her students and breaks everything down as much as she can. its a hard subject and requires lots of work and studying, though. try and stay on top of things and dont fall behind because its a lot of memorization.

Dr. Storm is the best professor I've had at Pepperdine. I'm not a science major, but I'm pre-med, so I was quite nervous about the course. I ended with an A, and learned that if you're willing to put the time and energy into studying, you will do great in the class! She met me countless times outside of class, and goes above & beyond for students.

Dr. Storm is by far the best teacher I've had at Pepperdine. She is clearly passionate about the subject and wants her students to do well. Be prepared to work hard in the class and put a lot of time in outside of class. If you need help, go to her office hours and study the lecture slides. She is always available to help in whatever way she can!

Dr. Storm is one of the most genuine professors at this school. I love and respect her so much but this class was brutal. If you take it be sure to stay on top of it and do a little bit of review everyday or you will not do well. Class averages are typically in the C to D range so be prepared to work if you want an A or a B.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Storm is hands down the best teacher I have EVER had. Her class is tough - I mean anatomy is not suppose to be easy but she makes it engaging and cares about her students. Her class has still been my favourite class I have taken at Pepperdine. Her tests come straight from lecture notes. Go to the TA study sessions!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring
