comment: Dr. Storm is AMAZING! Fantastic teacher who engages her class effectively. I thoroughly enjoyed this class and she really makes seemingly intricate and difficult material pretty simple to understand. I highly recommend. She is helpful inside and outside the classroom as well.

Dr. Perkins was the BEST teacher I have ever had!! Her class is very hard but really interesting! She is very funny, extremely smart and very helpful at making the most difficult of concepts understandable. I wish she taught all my science classes. Take her class you won't regret it

Dr. Perkins is the best professor I've ever had at Pepperdine. She makes anatomy so interesting and fun to learn. She knows so much and will do anything to help you. She is a great professor and a great person in general. Everyone loves her. You will never go a single class without laughing. she's awesome!
Best teacher so far at Pepperdine.

she is nicest professor i have ever had. she is a great teacher and an awesome person. i don't know anyone who doesn't like her. her class is VERY HARD though. studied more than i had ever studied in my entire life.

This is the woman you will want for anatomy. She's amazing and I don't know anyone who doesn't love her. Gives reading guides and lots of diagrams. Much easier than MacRae. Course has a lot of material, but if you study it shouldn't be too bad. Have her teach you sick dance moves in lab!
very hard
One of the best professors

Prof. Jones was a pretty cool guy...he just got in some ugly moods from time to time.  I ended up with an A and I didn't read once.  He put a lot of emphasis on papers and gave some extra credit.  If you can pull papers out of your butt and do well, take the class!

His tests are only easy if you study for hours upon hours and memorize the textbooks word for word.  Too much effort for a GE.  His lectures do not pertain to the required reading.  Obviously favors athletes...

Arrogant, condescending toward non-Christians (btw I'm a Christian and he disgusts me), doesn't teach, he preaches a sermon that has nothing to do with the material he's supposed to cover.  The book is horribly written and outdated.  Often brags about his supposed life as a student at Oxford (truth is he was only there for 1 month).  Avoid this guy

He plays favorites, doesn't go over test material in class but rather just gives a sermon.  His tests cover the textbooks that are horribly written.  The only reason he chose the texts that he did is because he knows the authors.  He decides to only come once a week and you're expected to figure out the rest out without help
He makes loads of sports analogies and that sort of thing, but he's a lot of fun and a really easy grader.  Great guy.  Take this class with him if you can.

Jones was a pretty cool teacher. Had him this summer for Humanities and he was very approachable. Really cool guy and really nice to his students. He also curved the grades so I wound up with a B! not bad for a whole semester crunched into three weeks. =P

He will lecture the full time which is hard to take at 8 in the morning, but he knows his stuff.  If you enter the class with a positive attitude, you will leave with a deeper knowledge of the Bible from a scholarly perspective, which is a great backround to know about the Christian faith.

Ugh....so egotistical. I am a Christian and he left a sour taste in my mouth about Christianity. He's just very sure about his beliefs, but not in a good way. He is annoying about sports, and gets extremely off topic, and thinks he knows EVERYTHING and that there's no other way to think about things. Not a good choice for a professor.
Jones is awesome he curved his tests and i got an A and hes really funny can be in a bad mood at times but generally amiable.

Jones can be inconsistent at times, but he sure knows how to lecture and to keep you interested in the topic! he's such a funny guy who can always make you laugh with one of his goofy jokes. Enthusiastic, funloving, & very good about keeping his lectures open to new beliefs & thoughts (doesn't enforce a one-sided Christian belief). Good teacher!
Super nice guy and a cool teacher. Loved his class! He makes class fun, entertaining, is knowledgeable, and he cares a lot about his students. Great teacher! Good choice for this G.E.

Great guy, loves the topics, has everything memorized, really intelligent. Gets on tangents but these are neede breaks in an hour and a half class. Very funny, loves a class that will laugh with him. Very easy to talk with and will spend time out of class of you need him to. Makes religion fun.

Ok Jones is nice but sometimes a little weird. An A is easy to get and if you go to his church a few times he loves you.  He wants students to suceed but he is not a good teacher. If you want to get by take him but if you are taking for the religious experience you might wanna look elsewhere.

Guy cant teach. He is funny and chill but I am not sure why I wake up at 8 to hear about his life and not about rel. not that i mind..more just do not really like that he tends to be an   a%* to some people in the class. all in all go for another prof. mcdowell when he gets back.

1 of the worst instructors I have ever had.  The sexism and faithism that permeate his classroom made several people walk out of lectures or sit in extreme discomfort. He is nice to christians.  Not so nice to nonchristians. If you want a professor who fails to teach yet manages to offend, take him.

He came across as a nice guy at first but now his ****, egoistic comments annoy me.  He is also disdainful of those who don't agree with him theologically and I am sick of him digressing from the topic and going on about sports.  The class is cake and I have an A but I'd take it from someone else.
This class is alright--I enjoyed religion 101 much better. Prof gets off on tangents which can be annoying. But he is a great guy, fun to listen to, very funny, and he cares about the subject.

He is hilarious. He oftens tangents on sports and other subjects and sometimes needs reminding of where he left on in the lecture.  Great teacher though, easy but thorough class, and simple tests.  Just do the study guide.
absolutely phenomenal!!! dynamic!!! really caring, and also, his daughter is super hot too!!! :D:D:D:D
this guy really knows his theology and bible, way helpful,way funny, good looking, caring, feel like i've known him for ages, was kind enough to invite me to his home.
Prof. Jones is AWESOME!  I wouldn't have passed the class without him.  If you want a solid teacher who cares about his students...look no further!
Took his Intro to Religion class in the 1970's and I still can't get over how heartless he seemed.
No Comments

this is a good class to take if you want an easy grade... he even lets you out early.  my only gripe is his inside jokes tend to make his lectures unclear... and he also tends to give a lot of personal bias about Biblical characters (i.e. Jacob was a real big loser).  BUT he is a really nice guy!

Take good notes, read the book, and you should be okay once you understand how his tests work.  Also, make sure you go to class, the attendance policy is quite strict; 5% off for each absence after 2. Very dry sense of humor and tendency to repeat self, but a good guy.

Very nice man... sort of trials off at times and is a little hard of hearing.  Class is very cut and dry--take good notes and read and no trickiness whatsoever.  He sometimes says things that are odd but if you just follow the notes it is easy.  Is his age catching up to him?? Hm. How old is he?

A good teacher. His sense of humor is a bit dry but I find it funny. The material is interesting. He's a bit dull, but I still find myself learning a lot from him. I had him for 101 as well as 102 and would take him for 301 one as well if I could. A good man and a good professor.

Tyler is awesome.  As a grad student, it seemed that I appreciated more of his humor than some undergrads did.  Tyler will make you work, but you'll never regret giving the effort.  Absolutely wonderful instructor!
An ok teacher. The class is a breeze, but it also could've been a lot more interesting. He turned a great subject into a chore. But the tests are ridiculously easy if you take good notes.
as long as you pay attention, the class isn't too hard, but make sure he knows you're there! he dropped me a full letter grade b/c his attendance sheets said i'd been absent more than i had been! =(
If you pay attention, it's not hard. He has a very dry sense of humor, but I have the exact same, so I think he's pretty funny. Gets better as the semester goes along.
most boring class EVER, and unneccessarily hard tests, eventually got an A when i stayed awake in class
I love him! essay tests no multiple choice. If youre down take him!
Cool power points.
God help you with this class, Tyler sure won't
I would rather chew off my arm than sit through one of his lectures
No Comments
I must be the only one who gets him: he's funny, if you pay attention!
He knows what he's talking about and he loves Romans and Sarcasm
He rambles a whole lot.  Tests aren't very clear.  his lectures are incongruent.
Really easy, and helpful when asked something, but his lectures make you Zzz...
Of course he's a master of the Apostle Paul: they were roommates in college.
Once you get to know his style, he's funny.  Likes to say  Duh!

Not a phil or rel major or even religious, but it was a great class. Tackles a lot of theological stuff from various perspectives. You learn a lot bc he's sharing ideas developed over decades. Exams are MCQ and super easy. Just memorize the slides and take notes on readings he goes over in class. The 1 essay we had was just a reflection piece.

he definitely tries to trick students with the way he creates his tests. also doesn't believe in giving out 100% on papers. incredibly boring lectures. exams are extremely difficult and there are about 4 grades total. he offers an extra credit assignment, but it's a 10 page analysis of his own book that you have to buy yourself. nice guy though.

incredibly boring lectures, expects you to repeat his own opinions back on tests. has no interest in discussion or allowing students to form their own opinions. Avoid this class and take someone actually interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Really passionate about the subject which makes you want to come to class. There's like two extremely difficult exams and that essentially makes your entire grade. Solid choice if you do want a class with interesting topics and minimal busy work. Very sweet professor overal enjoyed his class.

Hands down, an amazing professor. He teaches you so much about not only the Christian faith, but also life and the simplicity/joy of learning. Other professors throw really difficult philosophical content at students, but Dr. Highfield really breaks it down for you. He's redefined what a teacher really means, and he's strong in his faith!

Professor Highfield is an excellent teacher of religious studies - something Pepperdine is known for. His lectures often tackle difficult, abstract concepts, but he provides guidance both in the study guides and in his office hours if you need clarification.

Highfield is such a great guy who really cares about his students. His lectures can be boring, but also hold hidden gems. His tests were easy (if you study, of course). This is a good teacher, great person, and easy A.

Dr. Highfield is a great person, as a professor he is not the easiest for religion 3. Unless you would like a philosophy based class, take anyone else for rel3. His MC tests are very philosophical based, so it's not common sense. You must read the books in order to understand the tests. He is a great man, just not the easiest for a GE class.

Nice grader. PPT and notes are all available online. He wants you to concentrate on what he is talking about and understand his ideas in class instead of taking notes. Review notes and understand his ideas, you will be fine

Dr. Highfield is extremely scholarly and wise - he's the kind of professor you want to take notes for bc he says such profound things that blow your mind. If you like philosophical, analytical and deep lectures, this is for you. I learnt and grew so much.

TAKE HIM FOR RELIGION 301 OR ANY OTHER CLASSES! He is probably the most wise and sweet professor at Pepperdine! Everything he teaches are very thought-provoking and you will learn more than you imagined. As long as you study the study guide for the exams and read the books, you will be fine for the class. Highly recommended.

I had him for Christian Faith. Amazing man- clearly a brilliant theologian. But what really sets him apart is his genuine passion and care for his students- his love of God just radiates through him. Wants students to succeed. Do the reading, pay attention, and participate, because you'll get more if you put more in. Highly recommended!
What a theologian!

He's a great teacher!  Super nice and fair.  You learn A LOT, but the class isn't too much work.  He's flexible and easy going on the 3 short papers if you put an effort.  MC/TF midterms and an essay final which aren't too bad if you simply study his full text notes.

He reminds me of a grandpa-type figure. He's really caring and thoughtful. A lot of the class felt like he was just sharing his opinions. For the last 3rd of class, he basically read his notes to us and posted the full text on blackboard, so we didn't have to take notes at all. The papers are pretty easy, the tests are easy too, if you study.

I loved his class. He REALLY puts a new spin on the world. Papers are easy, for some reason I found the first test hard because I didn't understand how he worded everything but he was really helpful and I ended up getting A's on everything else. Books are good too! It's a class that will stick with you.

I learned how to share my faith without the Bible and that is pretty awesome.  For the first half of semester I didn't know what it had to do with religion but then it all came together.  Yes he is boring at times and everyone falls asleep but he is so nice and easy that is def worth taking!
Very thought-intensive, but easy...participate in class and get an A

This is an amazing professor.  He thinks about the tough questions and provokes deeper thought about life itself.  He is also incredibly caring if you visit him in the office.  He gave me a good recommendation letter, too.
awesome guy!  the simpsons and religion (he has every episode on tape and likes to show them in class).  he also provides all the notes online ahead of time.
No Comments
If you like living in the cerebrosphere, this is the prof for you.

Great professor who is extremely knowledgeable about Bio, Genetics, and the natural sciences. Class is difficult, especially if you have little background in the subject, but if you work extremely hard it is doable. He has extra credit opportunities, and works hard to make sure everything is understandable.

Professor Jay is a very generous professor. Although the course is difficult, he gives us many extra credit opportunities. He is a very understanding and helpful teacher, and each of us respects him. If you face difficulties, he will help you solve them. I definitely recommend this course!This is the best class I have ever had in pepperdine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: What can I say about jay Brewster, theres so much the word count wont let me. He thinks hes so smart because he went to Rice uni. Hes rude and his teaching is trash, all he talks about his god. He has been doing the same research for the last 25 years, and still no where. Doesnt help, makes you feel like trash, I say stay away. HORRIBLE HORRIBL

I have had Dr. Brewster for multiple classes and he is a great professor. This class was taught by him and Prof Stiemsma this semester though and the communication was definitely lacking. I feel like the class suffered a little bit because of it. The class was really interesting but definitely a challenge.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: The course description is very misleading. Rather than learning about cell biology of stress, class time is spent reading a book about the balance between religion and science. I have not learned anything scientific. Brewster also grades hard and getting an A is difficult, which is not the point of an FYS. I would not take this class again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Really difficult professor and his tests are extremely difficult but he's a great guy

Dr. Brewster is so amazing! He made our first-year seminar class fun to go to, even though we're talking about genetics at 8am. He really inspires you to think big on your research ideas and gives really good feedback on research proposals. He's just really easy to talk to and get along with. Definitely take a class with him if you can!

Brewster is the man.  Funny and easy to talk to.  Not only is he a great guy in the classroom but outside he is an even more enjoyable person to be around.  He pushed me, not just in science but also in life.  The most outstanding teacher at pepperdine in my book. (study hard though)
Amazing Guy, makes you want to go to class!
He's such a great professor!  He cares about his students and expects a lot out of them.  Prepare to work hard and learn a lot.

Amazing Professor! You have to put time into studying, but once you get the concepts you're golden. Take good notes! This professor has a great personality making class fun...especially a biology class!
I loved this class - very difficult, but interesting.  Dr. Brewster was extremely helpful.
Really funny and really nice guy.  Take good notes and study them a lot, he makes tricky tests. Grades strictly and seriously.  Intersting class.

Dr. Brewster is a great professor! He is very sarcastic, helpful and easy to talk to. But when it comes to grading, he is serious and can be taken as "mean". He expects you to be a professional scholar who knows how to be responsible and doesn't complain. My advice is that take good notes in class, study his handouts, don't whine, just do your work
No Comments

Very interesting class. The laboratories were enjoyable. Brewster really wants the students to like him. The tests are difficult! My advice is, take REALLY good notes from lectures, read every chapter of the book and all handouts given, and take the class seriously.
good teacher...hard tests
A brilliant man.  Caring and attentive, but has very high standards.  The class was difficult, but I learned a ton.
One of the best professors.  You will be challenged, but you'll learn a lot.  Joke with him a little, he has a great sense of humor.
his kids are so cute!
Way, way cool!
No Comments

I really enjoyed Dr Barton. The course content can be complicated and overwhelming but he teaches very well and has a clear passion. The field trips are super fun but can be difficult to attend. One of my favorite courses Ive taken at Pepperdine!

My favorite professor at Pepperdine. He values his students time and this class is a breeze homework wise. Weekly quiz and reading, and a final paper. I recommend this class to everyone. This class will actually enrich your life.

Literally my favorite professor ever! Dr. Barton makes this class simple and applicable to everyone. Coming from a non-religious background, it was helpful to know that Barton is kind and willing to explain even the simplest details of religious texts to you if you are confused. 100% take him if you are not religious and need the GE requirement.
Amazing

Great lectures, nice professors, clear coursework, super educational assignments. The only caveat is that if you're a full time student with a full-part time job be weary of the 3 required "field trips" outside of class time and plan early. Attendance is mandatory, tests are demanding, the second section has the advantage. Super lecture heavy.

Dr. Barton's world religions class is amazing! He explains things very clearly and has lots of examples. Weekly readings, 4 quizzes, and a couple reflection papers on field trips. Dr. Barton is super respectful of all opinions/viewpoints and is one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine! Highly recommend his class for the world civ GE!

REL 526 is such a cool option for civ requirement. Especially with John Barton! You'll learn a ton about world religions in an easy and fun way. Barton clearly cares about his students a lot and brings in lots of stories, examples, ect. to make material easier. Graded fair, wants you to learn but not trying to be overly harsh on grading.

John Barton deserves the highest rating I could possibly give. Such a kind and respectful man. Cares so much about students and subject matter. Learned a ton in a way that is actually interesting and exciting. Seriously could not recommend him higher.

If you are not obsessed with diversity and all that liberal stuff, you'll hate him so much. Probably the absolute most liberal professor in the entire religion department. But hey if you're one of those social justice warriors, he might just be your all time favorite.

i cannot stand this guy. he's turned the whole class into a race relations class. no professor at pepperdine has ever been so apologetic about being white before, and it's just so uncomfortable. it's one thing to acknowledge what's going on in the outside world, it's another thing to make a religion class revolve around a political movement. avoid
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: One of my favorite teachers at Pepperdine. I respect Barton so much. I love that he made field trips to different religious worships mandatory. I learned a lot about world religions during this time. Highly highly recommend.

Dr. Barton is such an amazing person and professor. I liked his REL526 class so much I took 301 with him too! REL301 is definitely way less work but it's equally as interesting. He takes attendance but his lectures are so interesting that you won't want to miss them anyways. Take any class you can with him, you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I love Dr. Barton so much. He's such a great professor and the class is a lot of work but you can definitely get an easy A as long as you do it. Overall, it was a super interesting class and I definitely recommend taking it with Dr. Barton.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Barton is a phenomenal human. He is incredibly compassionate and loves his students. He's hilarious and engaging. The last two weeks of class are entirely optional, yet well over 50% of the class chose to come just to soak in his wisdom. Take him, especially since rel 526 counts toward your non-western. (he also rounded my grade. bless him)

Professor Barton is the most compassionate professor I've encountered during my time at Pepperdine. He speaks from experience and is a great speaker and storyteller. He also happens to be hilarious when he's not even trying! Take his class and you won't be disappointed.
Dr. Barton is an amazing teacher. He is knowledgeable, relatable, and inspiring. This class is one of the most important classes I will ever take because it made me aware of my global neighbors.
Amazing teacher, Religions of the world is the best class I have taken at Pepperdine

Dr. Barton is a great professor. He is very knowledgeable about the world religions, and is very respectful of them all.  There are 2 exams, 3 current event reports, 3 projects, and 10 reading assignments. It seems like a lot, but it's a very manageable class. The exams are only lecture-based, and the readings are not long. Meaningful class overall

Really knows his material.  So many areas of study within his subject but he's well-informed about them all, welcomes questions with a really humble attitude, makes you curious to know more.  Shows a genuine passion for world religions and frames complex concepts/ideas in an understandable way.

By far the best class Pepperdine has to offer. Take this class whether you need it or not. If you have a religious background it's a great class. If you don't it's still a phenomenal class. Please do yourself a favor and at least meet the guy

Dr. Barton is my favorite teacher at Pepperdine. Every student should take his world religions class. I also took 301 (Christianity and Islam) and there was more reading but less work in total. If you pay attention in class and do the homework which is easy but thought-provoking, you'll do fine. He's inspirational and has the best corny dad jokes.

Only two exams. 4 projects that are a decent amount of work but can save your grade. Amazing Professor who is extremely passionate about the subject. Has an amazing story and brings personal experiences into his lectures. I took this course as an elective and recommend it to everyone. Barton is one of the best professor I've had at Pepperdine!

Took him for AC224, only professor who helped me out, super nice, took him again for AC225, accounting is hard, he's NOT a bad teacher, people who pay attention and listen to what he's actually saying will understand, idk what to say he's the goat I never comment on these I just thought his RMP score was disrespectfully low. Lot of hw though.

Dr. Lim is a caring professor however he has a very challenging teaching style. His lectures are hard to follow and often don't relate to his exams at all. He is an extremely tough grader and often doesn't give much if any partial credit. He doesn't seem to care if you fail or if the whole class is failing. Would avoid if possible.
Very caring, and always available outside of class. Would definitely take his class again!

Professor Lim is one of the worst professors I have had at Pepperdine. He was a poor teacher and could care less for students who are struggling. Even when you attempt to reach out to him to be able to understand the material he gets frustrated and will either talk down or just tell you you need to read the textbook again. DONT TAKE HIM TRUST!

Dr. Lim is a very passionate professor. The topic in AC 313 (Cost accounting) is very difficult conceptually and thus Dr. Lim assigns copious amounts of homework. His lectures are mainly driven by cases you do in class and is very hands on.
One of the most caring professors I've had, he cares not only about your grade but you as a person. He is always available through email if you ever need him.

What an amazing guy. I had this professor twice, and I loved every class I showed up to. His tests are slightly difficult if you do not prepare enough, but he does everything he can to make sure you succeed. Do not be afraid to ask if you do not know something. He also is one of the most caring people I have ever met! He is always happy.

He started the first day of class by saying that most people will end up failing. He grades so harshly and doesn't curve his exams. Your entire grade is based on 2 midterms, the final, pop quizzes and homework. If I were you, I'd take another class because most people were failing and ended up having to retake ACC 224. Lmk if I should pray for you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I went into the course and was excited to learn the topic. Dr. Lim made the course substantially more difficult than it needed to be. Save yourself trouble and do not waste your time in class with this man. Epitome of a bad professor.

I can tell that Professor Lim cares about his students. Every class we receive worksheets that contain problems from each chapter that we go over in class. However, these problems are different than the ones in the textbook, which made it difficult to practice in preparation for the exams. His exams are a bit tricky as well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Was excited to learn accounting but professor Lim made it very difficult for me to have any appreciation for the subject; I studied so hard for it (like never did) and it had no positive impact on my grade (to the point where I had to withdraw the class at the end of the semester)

I really like Dr. Lim as a person, but I really struggled having him as a professor. He's super caring and makes a lot of time for his students, an overall great man. But his teaching style was confusing and I often felt lost in class because he would jump into things without explaining the concepts behind them.
Prof. Lim cares so much!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: AMAZING professor! He explains everything you need to know and helps through problems. Overall great teacher and great human being

Prof. Lim is a genuinely nice man, and really shows that he cares about his students. He is super endearing. He is always open to constructive criticism, and is willing to grow to better help his students learn and grow. He knows the material very well, and he teaches it in a way that is engaging and understandable.

Professor Lim is strict, but it's because he cares about his students. Class time is spent working as a class on practice problems. He can be confusing sometimes, but the textbook is super clear. He's always willing to help and listen to student feedback. He expects everyone to participate, but it pays off.

Truly one of the best professor at Pepperdine! Overall an incredible professor that actually cares about his students. Exams are exactly like the review and problems he does in class, so there's no surprises.

Genuinely an amazing professor! Instead of focusing on how to just solve something,he ties it into the big picture & explains why it even matters. His lectures are mainly solving problems together, which help a lot. Tests aren't exactly like the study guide but it's nothing you've never seen before. He really cares & does a lot to help his students
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Lim is one of my favorite professors. He is very understanding and genuinely cares about how you are doing. As long as you do the homework on your own and ask questions in class or office hours, you will be fine. The practice exams are also a great resource to prepare well for the tests.

The worst class I've taken at Pepperdine.  Gives only basic examples in class then gives complicated trick questions on exams.  Practice exams are unhelpful.  On the final, we were heavily tested on three chapters that were never covered in class.  He is abysmal at teaching. Failed every exam but passed because of class participation.

Dr. Lim is great. I think people put him into an awkward position by not understanding that he has his own style. Intermediate Accounting is not something everyone can nail it easily. He has improved/changed a lot since last semester. His handouts are life saver. Now his practice exam is real practice. He is always available for office hours.

Dr. Lim is an excellent professor.  He is deeply knowledgable about accounting and cares passionately about his students.  He holds high standards and expects quality work, which may be challenging for Business majors unfamiliar with accounting, but he is willing to work with you if you put forth the effort.  Very good practice tests.

Dongkuk Lim does not know how to teach. He leads you to believe one thing will be on a test, and then something completely different shows up. Do not trust his "practice exam". In fact, study everything but what he puts on there. He is not supportive, not clear, and makes the class feel stupid. I'm an A /B student, but failed his class. Stay clear.

Dr. Holden is absolutely amazing! Her class is so challenging, but she gives plenty of opportunities to help boost your grade. She really is so passionate about physics, and it makes you love her class! Make sure to stop by her office hours, she really is the best and just such a caring human.

LOVE her. Very available outside of class and she genuinely cares about everyone. Also she is just so funny lol. Def a hard class though so MAKE SURE to go to her office and tutoring as much as you can to do well.

Holden is best friends with a lot of students. She genuinely cares to the point where she will remember everything about you after you visit office hours once. She wants you to succeed. That being said, as a junior in STEM, this is the hardest class I have taken at Pepperdine. I would recommend going to tutoring as much as possible.

One of the nicest and most caring professors, but it was the hardest class I ever took. Studied so hard for every exam and didnt do good on any. Exam average about a 50-60. Impossible to fail, A is VERY hard to get. Tests require COMPLETE understanding. A might not be possible without prior physics knowledge. Wouldn't take with other hard courses.

Phys 202/203 are both very challenging classes, but Prof Holden is such a great teacher and always willing to help. She has office hours all the time, and really makes an effort to get to know each one of her students outside of the classroom. One of my favorites at Pepperdine :)

One of the best people at Pepperdine. A true caring human who understands that you have other things going on that aren't physics. Fast-paced, fun lectures. Easy-ish labs. Always available in her office. That said, she grades hard and with no mercy. I was shocked at my test grades. But, she often allows corrections to boost your grade back to an A!

Prof Holden was great! I love physics so I may be biased, but she is a great teacher and really shows how applicable the class is irl. She is also very empathetic and understanding; I have had a rough semester and she has been both an emotional and academic support. Take this class!!
Amazing and kind professor, one of the best professors I've ever had. The class is super hard but she made me want to succeed and offered as much help as I needed outside class!

Dr. Holden is simply put the best physics professor imaginable. Physics is hard but she makes it so much better by really caring as much as you do about your success. Covid made going to office hours easy but if you're in person still go and it will help you understand if you're struggling and you'll get to know one of Pepperdine's finest gems ��

The most caring teacher I've encountered so far at Pepperdine. She is easygoing, always available to help, and is more than capable of teaching this class. Physics will always be physics, but she always tried her best to go beyond the formulas and understand how each student was really doing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. Holden's class may be the most difficult thing for someone with no physics background, but she makes it so worth it. The studying and hard work really pays off & she is always helpful in her MANY office hours! Go to them! Graded on homework, in class assignments, labs, 3 exams, and a final. Take homework seriously & get ready to WORK for an A!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Physics is a hard class, but Holden makes it understandable! Her tests are pretty difficult, but she gives lots of hints/advice if you just ask and wants students to do well. She is always available in office hours and available for more help if needed. She does offer some extra credit at the end of the semester which really helps your grade too!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Holden is a great professor, while attendance is not mandatory, you will very much struggle if you do not attend class. She has a lot of office hours to help you. She has many fun and innovative physics gadgets in her home which definitely keeps you on your toes. summed up: the effort you put in is very reflective of the grade you get out.

Professor Holden is an amazing person, but not the best professor. Her lectures are disorganized and her teaching is not consistent with her homework or tests. Go to her office hours for help, but beware on her tests. They are extremely difficult and confusing.

The most amazing professor at Pepperdine. I have struggled so much with physics but she is available outside of class and willing to help in any way she can. She is such an inspiring and caring person and mentor. If given the chance to take her class, take it.

Hands down the most helpful professor I've ever had. I was so bad at physics but she helped me so much and was so nice to me when I cried in her office hours. I can't wait to take her for phys203 this summer!
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Professor. Mama. Holden, the best professor ever
Best professor and mentor I have ever encountered!

Tests regularly take over the scheduled time which is a bummer, plus they're really tough. However, half of your grade is homework/in-class work/lab which really boosts your grade. She's also super accessible which is awesome and she's such a sweet person. She really wants you to do well, it's just that sometimes the lectures are boring.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Best prof at Pepp. Kind and caring, wants you to succeed, and really knows what she's doing.
She is the most amazing professor I have ever met. She is Mama Holden and she loves her students more than all the other professors combined.  She is a saint and an amazing professor and wonderful.

Professor Holden is the best thing that has ever happened to Pepperdine. She is the most helpful  teacher I have ever had in my entire life. She's understanding, sympathetic, passionate about physics, and eager to help her students learn. If you ever get the chance to take her class, take it. You'll learn so much.
Dr. Holden is the best teacher I have taken at Pepperdine. She is always there to help and is a really nice teacher. Ask questions and the labs are fun and easy.
Dr. Holden is one of the nicest and most sociable professors I have ever had. Does everything she can to help you. Truly cares about her students. A great professor, but an even better person.

Holden can teach and is available for the most part. Her class is as interesting as physics gets. Her tests are simple and challengeing, with a grading distrubution that  allows those who struggle on test to still get a decent grade. Overall, a solid teacher with clear expectations. Expect work as phsyics does not getting easier with Holden.

Dr. Walker is really nice but a terrible professor. She never responds to emails and doesn't use rubrics to grade essays. Her syllabus is super disorganized and it's impossible to find readings on Courses because they're hidden behind layers of folders with inconspicuous titles. She grades super harshly on assignments with little to no instruction.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: She is so sweet, but her lectures are in gibberish and her instructions for essays and tests are so wonky and hard to follow. It's impossible to get it right or score well because there is no outline or set expectations. It was annoying to work for hours on a 10pg paper and be scored badly because the instructions/rubric only existed in her head.
Overall, she improved a lot. Not really a tough grader. Her teaching style is very boring but not possibly the worst thing.

So this class focused on how to communicate in a polarized world, which sounds great right? Well after about 2 lectures you just do the same thing over and over again. She is super nice and polite, but I was super bored. We had to read a lot and buy a book we did not use. Find another seminar class or else you will be sitting there bored.

I have had Professor Walker for multiple classes and while she is one of the sweetest women you'll ever meet, I do not enjoy her as a professor. She grades assignments way harder than needed (basically everyone gets a B+) and doesn't really give a reason for why you received the grade you did. She also has students teach basically every class.
a lot of readings, unorganized grading and class, unclear lectures, never uses slides, boring, hard for a first year seminar
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Trust me if you still want your GPA, don't go for her.
she's not really bad but I do not really enjoy her class.
don't take her
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Avoid her classes
I personally do not enjoy her class as she is not very clear with her views. Very soft and kind dont get me wrong, but just not for me.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Juanie was not my favorite professor at Pepperdine. She is a respectable person, but don't take her if you are in the slightest impatient. She doesn't really use powerpoints or anything, and just sits in front of the class and talks reaaaalllly slowly.  Sometimes you'll have no choice but to take Juanie, but if you have a choice, choose not too.

Dr. Walker is kind, funny & just completely adorable. But she lacks clarity & over-talks about everything, causing major confusion. She doesn't really give specific criteria for papers, but in return, she doesn't grade you down for not doing exactly what she may have wanted. Not difficult if you read, clarify w classmates, & write decent papers

Dr. Walker was by far my favorite professor at Pepperdine!  I graduated from Seaver over 10 years ago and I still think about her often.  Prior to taking Dr. Walker's classes I thought that I was a good writer, but she taught me humility with her red pen!  She taught me to recognize and address my weaknesses... important lessons in school and life.

Juanie like your best friend's mom. Always nice, seemingly cool, and if you can catch her, very helpful. Her class was one of my favorites to go to mainly because it was kind of like group therapy. However, her lectures are a bit all over and it is hard to see a point! Her tests are a lot harder than expected.

She is undoubtedly one of the nicest professors I've ever had, but she's not the best at teaching. I really have no idea what I'm supposed to have learned. Her lectures are all over the place. If she happens to be your adviser, she is impossible to get in contact with.

Professor Walker is one of the most wonderful people at Pepperdine. She really cares about her students and is very flexible...maybe a bit too flexible. If you're looking for a Com Ethics section that isn't too demanding, take Prof. Walker's course.
Professor Walker is wonderful outside of class, but she doesn't accept opinions outside of her own and doesn't answer questions you may have.
Dr. Walker is awesome! She has such a huge heart and she cares so much for all her students. She really makes you think, but you will love her if you take the time to listen to her.
Dynamic and creative professor -- values integrity, hard work, questions.  Respects all students and not afraid to tell them the truth!
To much talking, not enough clarity!!!
Dr. Walker is the BEST prof at Pepperdine.  Her classes are intense, but she is always willing to held during office hours.  Taker her only if you're willing to revise, revise, revise....

Phenomenal professor. I took him for Calc 2 in fall 2024 and loved every moment. The perfect amount of homework; two assignments a week with a max of 3 hours each, and gives plenty of exam prep materials to make the tests a breeze if you actually try to study. He also helps a ton in office hours, probably being his best quality. Best professor ever

GOAT. Calc 2 is brutal but he dosent make it harder than it needs to be. Very hard class, but tests are always fair and he never throws curveballs. TONS of homework, 2-4 hours a night. That being said, that is your studying. He likes when you work hard. Office hours a ton. He will give extensions and work with you, he really cares about you.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: do the hw

If you learn best from collaborating in groups, rather than lectures, this class is for you. I don't, so I did not enjoy this class because I was always confused. The homework is reasonable for a math class. My only complaint is I felt like each time I asked a question, he made me feel like I should just know the answer. Which sucks.

Fabulous professor. He cares about students and always be patient about students' questions during office hours. his exams are reasonable, no complicating simplifying and calculating, only testing on an understanding of concepts. If you are major/minor in math, Take his math classes as possible as you could.

Dr. Lucas is the best prof in Pepperdine's math department. He makes good use of class time & is excellent at making difficult concepts easy to understand. He will spend as much time as is needed in office hours going over difficult concepts & is always willing to help in whatever way he can. He really cares about his students! An absolute legend.

He runs a well-structured course, and he clearly knows what he's talking about. His notes are super-organized. He does occasional group-work, but the lectures themselves can be bland and hard to pay attention to (hence the score of 4). He will help you with any problem, whether math or life related. Take him if possible, you won't regret it.

I love Dr. Lucas, take as many math classes as you can with him. This is a solid department overall, but he is probably the best. Sure he cares about little details, but he knows what he's doing and he's more well prepared and transparent than some professors. Cannot say enough about how much we love Dr. Lucas.

One of the best professors here at Pepperdine and is passionate about what he is teaching. Took him last semester and he provided clear lectures, homework solutions, and notes. As long as you do the homework and take some time to study, you will do well. Usually not good at math, but Professor Lucas was an excellent teacher. Highly recommend!
The smartest prof I've met at Pepperdine so far. Definitely the best in math division. I conclude this after I took others'... Take Lucas if you really want to learn things.
Professor Lucas' class was difficult, with a vast amount of work assigned each night. The organization of the class was straightforward, but the material less-so.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Really nice professor who is always willing to help you succeed even if you dont love math. Very accessible. Tests are always super reasonable with no crazy specific or hard simplification required to get the right answer.

Amazing professor, super organized and his lectures are thought out to the second. There is a lot of homework, but if you do all the homework you'll do well on the exams. Don't skip lectures, once again they are very good and straightforward so take the time to learn from them and you can probably avoid the textbook.
Great teacher. Has very helpful handouts.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Lucas is amazing. His class was easy to follow and understand. I feel like I have a much better understanding of calculus. He's also very easy to get a hold of outside of class time and makes himself available during office hours. Would definitely recommend him.
Great teacher.  He really wants to help you
Straightforward. Super organized. Laid back and nice. Enjoyed his class! Took him for Math 140 and made sure I got into section of Math 141.

Professor Lucas was honestly the best professor I've had to now. His lectures are clear and his notes are outstanding. Whenever we didn't understand something, he'd take the time to explain the math behind the problem. For tests, he'd give out old exams that were exactly like the one we'd take. I HIGHLY recommend taking Lucas for Math 140 and 141.

Makes math harder than it should be, take Handcock or Strong--they r straight forward on tests. Test problems are meant to trick u and sometimes poorly worded. Lucas can be very sarcastic but he does love math. He does hold weekend reviews before exams but thats just to answer hw problems--doesnt tell u anything regarding the exam.  avoid if poss
Lucas is so cool.  He is really laid back and loves his students.  He is always available if you need help.

Lucas is a super nice guy. He has good intentions and he is relatively clear and easy. The only problem with him is that he holds class exactly like a high school class. Always keeps you the whole time ever if you're just doing homework in groups. I would recommend him.

Dr. Lucas is always available for consultation outside of class.  He has high, but reasonable, expectations of his students.  One of the smartest and most enthusiastic professors at Pepperdine.  I would take all my math courses from him if I could.

dr. lucas is such a great teacher! he so organized and gives you fill in the blank notes to fill in for every class. his tests can be difficult but he'll come in anytime just to help his students. i highly recommend him for harder math classes which can be challenging but doable with the right teacher.

Voice class with Professor Maier is so fun, and I learned a lot even as a non-singer. She is not a difficult grader on songs, and there is only one test that she gives a word bank ahead of time for. Take her for your fine arts GE!
Dr. Maier is the best. Super helpful and clear direction, incredibly supportive. I learned so much about singing. Her courses always fills up, so register as soon as you can. This is a great class!
This class was so fun! Definitely take this class for your fine arts GE if you can. The environment is super fun and easy going. You dont have to be the best singer just show effort and progress!

Professor Maier is a kind and encouraging professor! She genuinely wants her students to learn something. I was nervous going into this course as I am not really a singer, but Professor Maier was so encouraging and helpful. I would definitely recommend taking this course for your GE Fine Arts credit!
Prof Maier is amazing. She cares about every student, regardless of your talent/experience. Seriously, take this class if you want to improve.

Dr. Maier is incredible. Tons of real life experience as a singer and songwriter and she really cares about all her students. If you give 100% in class you will get an A. And she has an AMAZING voice - can sing opera and then rock out in the same breath. Crazy good!

Participation (10%), improvement(10%), midterm(20%),attendance(10%), first solo( 15%), final solo(15%),exercise test(10%), and group report(10%). Easy teacher overall and solid choice if you want to get your fine art done. However, it is not an easy A. You will have to work hard for an A-/A. Good that you won't get too pressured from this class.

This is not an easy A class. I worked hard for an A-. I got a 93, 1 percent away from A. 94-100 A 90-93 A- It is almost an easy B+ because even u messed up the midterm badly (first solo piece and written exam which you have to memorize music terms and music eras), you will still be given extra credit(0-5 percent) at the end of the semester.
Lori is the greatest professor you will ever have!

You actually have to try in this class. You can't just sing and get an A. You have to show her that you're improving throughout the semester, and put forth a lot of effort and practice into your chosen songs. I'd say take this class if you like singing, or want to improve your vocal skills, and want to get your fine arts GE taken care of.
Good and passionate teacher. Having been teaching  for over 15 years at Pepperdine. She is so nice. Just attend the class and try hard. It is worth taking.
Professor Maier is amazing. Tons of real life experience and she's an excellent teacher. Cares about every student! Love her!!!!!
Dr. Maier is a great singer and a wonderful instructor.  Take her voice class!  It's easy, and you will almost certainly improve your vocal talents.
If you get the chance, take his teacher! she rocks!
Take this class to fulfill your fine arts GE!!!  It's fun, easy, and requires almost no work.  She knows what she's talking about too, so you actually learn a lot.
Really nice lady, so chill and laidback. Looks at each student invidually and tells them how they can improve, does not compare anyone to anyone else. A highly enjoyable, stressless class, easy A.
The saying A for effort def. applies here.  If you try I gaurentee you get an A

Lori's so awesome! She's helped me develop my vocal skills and also fine tune my hearing so that I am able to have a deeper appreciation for the finer music. If you get a chance to take this class, here is my advice for you: TAKE IT!!!!! You'll be improved in ways you didn't know could be improved.
excellent teacher, very helpful and fun!
No Comments
LOVED learning from her
Wondefully tallented. Great teacher to learn from.

Professor Marshall is one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine! She is such a caring, understanding, and communicative person and truly wants the best for her students. The class itself is very manageable and is nothing too advanced or simple, depending on your Spanish comprehension. Online textbook/workbook is required for this class!

I love Dr. M! She is literally the best ever. Such a caring human being that just wants to see you grow and succeed in life and in Spanish. Her class was fairly easy, but she always will push you to do your best. I studied abroad with her this past summer, and just loved getting to know her even better after having this class in the spring.
Shes very sweet and reasonable. However, the order of lessons and quizzes can be confusing and chaotic at times. She always provides an idea of what to expect and what she'll grade on.
Dr M is the best! I highly recommend taking any class with her. She cares so much, and is so kind. The did use VHL which was a pain, but it was a great class

April Marshall made me realize that just being a college student is enough :) I learned so much in her class; she is one of the best professors at Pepperdine. If you have the opportunity, take her class. Show up, turn your work in, and engage; you'll do great. She cares more about her students than she does about their grades. Thank you professor!

Dr. M is an amazing person and professor. She makes it very clear what is expected. If you do assignments and HW, it will not be hard to get an A. She is super easy to talk to and is very knowledgeable in the field of Mesoamerica. Take her class! You won't regret it!!

April Marshall is one of my favorite humans alive. She was a great teacher, mentor, and friend. She would always ask us how we are really doing, she was understanding, and a good listener. she is the reason I got through freshman year and still talk to her as a senior. she creates a great learning environment and shows that she really cares.

Dr. Marshall was very caring and her lectures were engaging, even at 8am. Homework is mostly reading articles, watching videos, and sometimes answering questions. If you miss class she would tell you what you missed and how to catch up. I missed a quiz once and she made my next quiz worth double to make up for it. I would definitely take her again.

One of my favorite professors I've ever had- she's amazing! Definitely one of the best professors at Pepp. I was so nervous about taking Spa. lit but she made a very fun and interesting experience with very little stress. Show up to class, and you'll have no problem getting good grades. She's one of the sweetest people you'll ever meet, take her!
great teacher, loves the subject, makes it easy to learn, always wants feedback to improve the class, definitely a great teacher.

Take her take her take her!!!!  The best teacher in her division, possibly at Pdine.  She's soooo sweet and so much fun.  She really wants you to understand and tries to make class fun and interesting.  She's very dynamic, if you study and work hard on the papers you'll do great!

Prof. Marshall, is by far the best Spanish teacher in all of Pepperdine. She is so sweet and helpful and really pushes you (in a good way), kinda tricks u into learning. She is awesome....take her!!! She doesn't hand out grades but if you come to class then ur good...homework isn't a big deal (she doesn't check it) and she will even changes the tes

She is everything you could ever ask for in a teacher. Very helpful, a wonderful person, clear, interesting...the class was never boring. She wants you to do well and gives you plenty of opportunities to get a good grade.
Wonderful!

Dra Marshall is by far one of the best teachers at Pepperdine.  I was not a huge fan of Spanish, but she made the class enjoyable.  She truly does care for all the students in her class.  Do you work and you should be fine.  Take her if you can!  You will not regret it!

Amazing professor and person!  I cannot say enough good things about her.  Dedicated to her students, is concerned about us learning, warm, enthusiastic and very personal.  If you can, take Spanish with her.  She is tough but she is also fair.  Do your work, speak up in class and show interest.  You'll get your money's worth and more in her class.

She is by far my fav prof @ Pdine. Just like everyone else has said, shes truly caring and genuinely concerned about every student. If you're struggling or need some pointers,you can definitely talk to her and she will do whatever she can to help you and work with you. I've had her twice and plan on taking her again, she's just THAT fabulous!

WONDERFUL, warm, excited, enthusiastic, generous, kind,... she's a delight. I felt that she was one of the best teachers I had. She cares for her students but expects them to perform. Showing up doesn't get you participation grades. You work, you'll shine!

Spanish 451 was my second class with Dr. Marshall.  At first I liked her and bought in to the whole "I may be difficult but I am fair" thing she always says.  The truth is she picks favorites.  She can be very heartless!!  Be careful with her, make sure to be on her good side!!!
This professor is GREAT!  She really cares about her students and will find an answers for you.  Shes passionate about teaching and truly embodies what a Pepperdine Professor should be.

amazing teacher, I absolutely love her.  she's not a difficult grader, her discussions are clear and interesting and she's a very nice person overall.  very helpful and very caring about the individual student.
Awesome teacher... she's way cool.  She makes spanish fun for once, and really does care about her students.

She's amazing!  Honestly, she's always there to help, she's funny, and makes class fun every day.  It was a 9 am class, so I was always tired, but that class always seemed to wake me up!  Take Dr. Marshall, you won't regret it!

Dr. Marshall is nice, straight to the point, and no BS. An excellent class and teacher. Not to hard, not to easy -- just right. Very accesible professor; it is obvious she cares. She is quite the fashionista to! It's all about that Louis.

Prof Stewart is incredibly passionate about teaching Spanish. She does call on students randomly during lectures to ensure that they are actually understanding the material. She is a difficult grader because she wants her students to learn the material and not just memorize it.

Prof Stewart is definitely not for everyone. I loved her and enjoyed her class but can see why people are intimidated. You need to participate and work hard in her class. It's not easy but doable for sure. She's funny and understanding. I highly recommend her if you know youll be able to dedicate time to her class.

Prof. Stewart's class was so hard that I had to drop it. She'd teach lesson after lesson. If you didn't get something, you would have to see her outside of class. She cares more about her lesson plans than her students. When I told her that I had to drop, she showed no remorse and suggested that I took SPAN 151, even though I already know Spanish.

An amazing professor who is very heavily underrated. She is very engaging in class, with lots of partner activities as well as class participation, but she does it for the students' own benefit. She is very clear about what she expects from her students and is strong on due dates. She is always available and ready to help her students succeed.

Prof. Stewart is underrated. Sure the course may be difficult, but she is very clear about what she expects for each assignment. She is available for office hours and will help you understand the concepts if you didn't fully grasp them in class. The grade I got was the grade I earned and I would take her again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof. Stewart is an excellent teacher. She has an intense personality and doesn't mess around when it comes to class engagement, but she genuinely wants students to succeed. She usually let us know exactly what would be on the tests. Memorization is crucial. She requires a lot, but helped me to get an excellent handle on the language.

Be ready to study up and make this Spanish class your life. If the upcoming semester will be busy with hard classes for you, taking this course will not make it any easier. I suggest taking this professor when the course work in your other classes is light.  Every week in this class you either have a test, quiz or composition. She's a tough grader.

It might be because I'm not very good at Spanish, but I found her to be one of the toughest graders at pepp in my opinion. But, she's always energetic and happy and puts in so much effort to help you learn.

Such a great Spanish professor! She is clearly passionate about what she teaches, and wants to engage students. She can be tough at times, but not to an unreasonable extent. Homework and projects assigned were reasonable and never felt like busy work. She wants the best for her students. Very rewarding and enjoyable class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: prof stewart is such a great professor and I genuinely cannot gas her up enough lol she gave the perf amount of homework and assigned it on the same site every single day which made it so easy to find!! she isn't a hard grader, has no surprises on tests/quizzes, and makes her lessons super interesting and fun for her students. I <3 prof stewart !!!
Toughest grader at Pepperdine. Can't win for losing with her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: tough. but really nice and offers so much of her time!! love profe

Professor Stewart is an excellent Spanish teacher and is more than a great professor. She does a great job teaching and her love for Spanish culture as a whole shows. Trust me, you want to take her Spanish class. She is sure to give her students a wonderful experience and as long as you take time to get to know the material, you will surely pass.
Great professor, though you would have to really study!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I like her as a person but generally, please avoid this class as much as possible. She's a hard grader and genuinely picks favorites. She's a good person but not the best teacher when it comes to how she treats students fairly. I would definitely try to switch out as soon as possible if you get her. Go see her if you do have her during office hours
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She's very "by the book" when it comes to grading and her class is pretty tough, but it's a language. She makes everything as clear as possible and likes to make sure everyone knows what's going on. I loved having her for the semester. She might be my favorite Pepperdine prof so far.

Profa Stewart is awesome! Her summer class is only 4 weeks, and covers a TON of material, but she is very down to earth!  She offers an extra credit assignment, and homework is reasonable. Her tests actually test APPLICABLE Spanish knowledge!Lots of people complain about attendance and participation, but this is college people, what did you expect?

I would definitely avoid at all costs.  She takes attendance, including marking if you are tardy or not (if you are late, you get points taken from your grade). She spends about 2 minutes teaching the lesson, then expects you to somehow know the material you covered.  Honestly, the class was do-able (hard!), but a painful experience the whole time.
Stewart is an energetic and likable teacher, but her teaching is not anything special. If you have no prior knowledge of Spanish, the class will be difficult.

To her, attendance and hw (including forced purchase of useless online pkg) > learning. I was a business mjr. Since I was in Service I had to miss every other Friday or so (so 1/8 class) to meet with a non-profit. She said I would get 0s on the quizzes. So I dropped, studied MY way & tested out of both 152 and 251 with a challenge exam. AVOID

Honestly, the class was pretty hard. Participation is key and so is attendance. Sit in the middle of the class and she will like you more. Seriously. While she may seem abrasive and uninterested in class and emails, i suggest going in to her office hours and talking to her. She is way helpful is a one on one situation. But if you can... avoid

Don't take Stewart. She's rigid on attendance and treats you like a child in this respect (i.e. get a doctor's note to prove you're sick). Quizzes every Friday. She grades oral quizzes very hard and grades class participation very hard. If you get stuck taking her, participate until you annoy the people around you and pretend like you love animals.

Professor Stewart's class is awesome. It's really laid back, and she is very clear about what she expects from you. As long as you study a little before each test you're totally fine. Also, she uses weekly quizzes, so there is never a lot to study at one time. Her midterm and final aren't hard either - not cumulative.

Professor Dillion is super compassionate and tries to make things simple for her students.There are short, online quizzes for each reading and at times the assigned pages are a bit much. She does popcorn call but is ultimately just trying to get everyone involved in conversation. She wants people walking away from her class as better humans.

Professor Dillon is nice, but ignorant. We did an activity where we go to the food bank on campus and "act" like we are the impoverished character in the book. As someone who has ACTUALLY faced this, playing pretend was offensive to me and other classmates. She also made negative comments about jobs she sees as inferior, such as fast food workers.

Made us buy the physical copies of the books and would not want us to use audiobooks or ebooks. Made us answer a discussion question before each class based on the reading and would sometimes call on people she felt were not contributing as much to the discussion. Her essays were pretty open-ended and not too bad.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Dillion is very kind and knowledgeable. She's passionate about what she teaches. Lots of reading, but nothing crazy. Just stay on top of it. The class is almost fully discussion based so be prepared to contribute meaningfully or it'll impact participation. We only had 2 papers and 2 exams- just come to class and read attentively.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Dillion is an excellent professor! Her lectures and class discussions were always organized and engaging. There was never a minute wasted in class. She is very empathetic and always made sure everyone was included in class discussions. She was very welcoming of all majors! :)

Most of these reviews are bias. Even though most of her material is about women's rights, as a male, I enjoyed listening to every aspect and if you pay attention and participate, you can ride the river to whatever grade you're satisfied with. Work hard, she works with you. Quizzes could be on weekends, but it's very short and simple. Love her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: A great professor who is passionate about what she is teaching. She is clear on assignments and usually moves back deadlines to give students grace. Has a good amount of reading but it's manageable. Gives quizzes every night before class to check that you're doing reading. She's a lovely person overall!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Dillion was overall a pretty good professor. She was very passionate about the material she taught. However, she often wasted class time with unnecessary assignments or discussions. She was also a bit condescending especially to the creative writing majors in her class. I dont think this was intentional though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I wish I could have had Dr. Dillion in person rather than online. Her online HUM212 class was asynchronous, the lectures were recorded, and we had daily quizzes & padlets as our discussion on the readings. I'm not a big reader so this class was tough for me, but it was doable! Graded on 3 exams, 2 projects, daily quizzes & daily padlets.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Dillion is so nice and clearly loves to teach and share her love of history and arts. We had daily reading quizzes so you have to do the reading but she is clear about what she expects. Tests arent too hard. Readings and lectures lined up exactly and its nice to hear her own thoughts about the topics you read about. Would take again!

She is a very good professor. There are quizzes before every class. We also had to do padlets. There were two opprotunities to recieve extra credit. There are 2 tests and a final exam. I would definitely take her class again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Just the most amazing prof and person

Professor Dillion was an AMAZING professor. She made class super fun. I look the Victorian Lives and Afterlives literature course and I was afraid I'd be bored to death (from the topic), but she really knew how to make it fun and comprehendible. It was a hard class, and so were the readings, but I think I've gained so much insight on what I learned
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Wonderful person and good instructor. She gives very detailed and helpful feedback on papers and encourages students to share their opinion in group discussions. She happens to be one of the easiest Great Books profs, but at the same time you learn so much. I highly recommend her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Dr. Dillion is amazing! Powerpoints are typical for everyday use, and there are super easy quizzes (5 questions) after each reading. Her rubrics are extremely clear, and she is a fair grader. She is incredibly knowledgeable about her field of work, and makes sure that students know they can meet her for office hours. Would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: As kind as she is smart. Could not recommend more highly. She gives super helpful feedback, is passionate about subject matter, very helpful and incredibly kind. Love her and her class.

Dr. Dillion is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. She is a great professor and is passionate about English. She is very understanding and willing to help us out on our big papers. She gives us all of the reading due dates in advance and even suggests when to start them to finish in time.

Dr. Dillion is a good, caring professor. She is very kind and helpful during office hours. There is a lot of reading, which is key to passing the class; make sure you pay attention in class and know the readings well. Sometimes she will shorten the required reading if it is too much. It's like an English class, so more authors and artists to know.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: By far, best professor I've taken at Pepperdine. She is sweet, understanding, and extremely helpful. TAKE HER
Sweetest and most nicest Professor I've ever had. Made Humanities 212 the most fun course ive ever taken

She is absolutely one of the best teachers I have had in pepperdine. Not only is the class easy, but she is a great teacher so it's one of the best possible equations in a class: Easy + you learn. She makes you cookies, and she is very kind. She is a bright, beautiful person. I loved her class very much!

this professor is really the best one i ever had throughout my whole experience in pepperdine. she prepares you very well for exams. she is so loving,caring,helpful,sweet. take her and u wont regret it not one bit! she's beautiful,smart,makes class interesting. 3 midterms+1final (non cumulative)

He is insanely chill and a super easy grader. You can easily get an A in this class. A friendly dude but kind of bad w/ tech. Class topic is interesting and you do need to read the textbook to learn, but it's easy to understand and very interesting and relevant. Online class is group project heavy but again, he grades easy so it doesn't matter.

Waters is one of those super interesting teachers that you just don't know how to read at first. He's chill and gets on tangents a lot, but Waters is wonderful at letting the students draw their own conclusions. He doesn't tell you an opinion, which has been many student's issue with him, but gives you all the info to do the thinking yourself.
Also took COM 513 and COM 180 with him.  Amazing professor!  He was one of the visiting faculty in Switzerland with our group.  Such a great professor and truly cares about everyone he teaches.

Nice guy but not a fan of the class.  The class is super boring and really theoretical which is hard for me to grasp. His lectures are meh because he gets off on tangents and can really lose you by spending too long on a topic. He grades papers really tough but tests are easy. Lots of work (2 pg paper/week).
One class I don't dread going to.

took speech but hes not a speech teacher so not his expertise.  did not grade speeches based on what he preached in class but rather on how he thought you did in general.  did not know what he was looking for - you could get good grades even if the speech was extremely boring.
Waters is the bomb. He is hilarious and a great teacher. Take all of his classes! They're easy but you learn a lot.
Take Waters. One of the best people I have ever met.  A really really great teacher.

Dr. Waters is AWESOME. In the beginning you just think it's going to be really boring but he makes it fun. He's super laid back and wants you to do good in his class. If you have the opportunity, take him as a teacher, you won't regret it.
Dr. Waters...KC here... he's still helping me and I graduated four years ago! Definitely one of the best teachers I've ever had.
No Comments
One of the best teachers I've ever had.  He's super down to earth and friendly.  He understands his students very well and makes class interactive.
Dr.Waters is super understanding, funny, and easy-going. His tests are okay - very easy if you review for them! I suggest that if you have the option, choose Dr. W as your teacher!
He has a great sense of humor and understanding!
He cares, is nice and has great sense of humor.  Experienced journalist and willing to help.  Love him, although sometimes class is a waste of time.
No Comments
No Comments
Chill guy with dry, biting sense of humor.  Take every class he teaches.
FUNNY, NICE, easy class for most part
One of the best! Fabulous stories!
awesome guy.  Really funny sense of humor
No Comments

She is brilliant and engaging. She welcomes all opinions and provides a very positive environment. I learned SO much from her and would highly recommend. However, the class is challenging. I put my all into it and barely earned an A. Tips: go to office hours, do the readings (twice!), take advantage of EC, and push yourself to participate.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: wish i didnt
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. DeLong is a wonderful professor. She is respectable and knowledgeable. She provides an open and positive atmosphere for discussion. I have enjoyed taking her classes. She is not easy regarding papers or tests, but she gives a lot of helpful feedback. She replies to emails quickly and is consistent with office hours. She's great.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Passionate Professor who gets you thinking! I'm not always a huge fan of campus ministry, but Pepperdine's religion professors are all top notch. Delong creates an environment where I can progress in my faith intellectually and spiritually.
Avoid this professor. She is too passionate about the subject to teach a GE. Teaches the class as if it is an upper division theology class.

She is unclear, and her tests are a nightmare. Get ready to study a lot, and still only get a B. You have to make an effort to get the correct information to study.  Do not take her class unless you are really interested in the course material. There are far easier professors for a GE class. She makes a GE credit far too difficult.

Please do not take her. Class is far too demanding for a GE religion course. She has passion for the subject, which shows though her teaching.  She simply expects too much from students who have little to no interest in the subject matter. Get ready to work, HARD, for a B. If you are looking to get your religion GE out of the way, look elsewhere.

DeLong is super kind and goes out of her way to help you but you have to ask. Participation plays a big part in your grade so make sure to get to class on time. She makes the class fun but acting out parts of the NT but expect a lot of at-home reading if you want to pass the tests. You also are expected to go to the Getty Villa, so be prepared

GE classes should not be this hard. An immense amount of material is covered before each test. When attempting to narrow down what I should study, she replied with "everything is important."  Not helpful even when looking for help with your grade. She is too passionate to teach a GE class. Would not recommend if you're looking to pass your GEs.

She teaches this GE religion class as a graduate level theology/religion class. Simply put, tests are extremely specific, and tough. I would stay away from this prof. unless you have an extreme interest in the subject. If you aren't willing to teach yourself and study for hours for exams, you won't pass. Minor details in lectures/book are on exams.

She's nice but tests are really hard. Makes you do alot of readings and online forum posts. Complete waste of time. Shes too passionate about the subject and expects everyone to be a bible scholar like her. Would avoid.
Prof Delong's lectures can get pretty monotonous. She is passionate about the material but sometimes her rigid structure for the class can get in the way of some good class discussions.
