She is sooo nice! Make sure to get to know her better and she'll help you without hesitation. She's passionate about the subject and knows it. And she's really understanding toward people who don't already know the bible too well. I definitely recommend.
Very nice and easy to follow in class. The tests are hard

She is a very nice woman and loves to get to know her students. However, the class is hard. It seems easy as she lectures, but she brings her game on the tests and expects you to as well. Although tests are hard, there are a lot of opportunities for extra credit and there are really easy quizzes. Getting an A is possible, but it isn't easy.

A few people told me not to take this class, but they were wrong. Delong is a wonderful woman, and she teaches class in a really engaging manner. I learned SO MUCH. There is some reading that you have to do in order to pass the tests, but the tests really aren't that bad. I am so glad I took this course with Delong, and I would highly recommend her

too difficult for a GE course. I did every bit of reading she assigned (which was a LOT) and I still had to study for hours to be prepared for each test. attendance is taken every day. her lectures are engaging and you learn a lot, but only take her if you want to be a new testament SCHOLAR by the end of the class!

This professor was completely unorganized and extremely self-contradictory. She expects way too much out of her students and makes the difficulty of a freshman seminar equivalent to upper division courses. She takes forever to grade essays, making it difficult to improve when you get your paper back a day or two before the next one is due. AVOID!

Prof DeLong is such a nice lady, but the class was monstrous! It was BORING, made me sleepy 80% of the time. TOO MANY assignments. Not easy to follow if you are not of a Christian background. She is a really hard grader too. Let's just say it's TOO HARD of a class for a GE course. Unless you're willing to spend 4 hours DAILY studying for REL 102.

She's a very nice woman and very knowledgeable, but you can tell that she's new to teaching. I had her last semester, and thought the class was alright. Lectures can get a bit boring, but she mostly tests out of the lecture notes. She gives out this pretty extensive study guide, but if you get a big group together to finish it, it won't be too bad.

I was told this class was easy- she must have gotten in trouble because it was abnormally difficult. Lots of assigned reading, but no one does it. Tests are only out of lectures anyways. I am happy to be done with it. She loves her subject and is extremely passionate/ knowledgeable, but it is terribly boring.

DeLong really knows her stuff, although I believe she is a bit shaky in her confidence as a professor. there is a lot of work for this class, but i learned tons from her and studied the Bible as I never have before. I definitely think this class is worth taking if you're up for the work and the extensive tests. Brilliant woman.

If you're an accounting major or genuinely want to understand accounting - take Dr. Ong. She teaches well and you will be prepared for future classes. That said, it's a time-consuming class if you want to do well. Group projects and exams spread throughout semester. Make sure you can do all problems on notes and homework and you will do well.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Class is too hard for just an accounting 224 course. Tests are very difficult where literally everyone fails, too much homework and unrealistic expectations. Definitely is going to be one of the harder classes you will take at Pepperdine if you take her.
She has the same vibes as the english teacher who only likes her male students. Favortism is clear.

extremely harsh grader, extremely unrealistic expectations. She is okay at teaching, and you learn a lot from the class, but as a 4.0 student she completely ruined my GPA. by far the least empathetic teacher I have ever had. Class on average on exams were F's across the board.

Copious amounts of homework. She has boring lectures and difficult tests in which most of the class will fail, but she won't take accountability for her lousy teaching. I'm shocked that she has tenure honestly. All the accounting professors suck and she is the worst one. Take any other professor and save yourself the pain.

If you want to mess up your GPA because the professor gets an ego boost from making her class hard for no reason, take this class! If you want to feel the weight of a 6 unit class and only get credit for 3, take this class! If you want to suffer all semester, take this class!

Take 224 with another professor. Prof. Ong will make ur life hell on earth. She is not mean but not nice either. She is very strict with deadlines and can be unforgiving with simple mistakes. Her class feels like 6 unit class, the work never stops and she has unrealistic expectations. If ur a suck-up, then you'll be perfect for her class.

Honestly the people that complain about how she makes you feel stupid for asking questions has either 1) not read the instructions or 2) doesn't know how to use google. 

You gotta work for your grade tho. Going to office hours and just talking to her helps. Whatever your goal is for this class, she'll help you get there.

Professor Ong holds her students to a very high standard. Office hours and homework checks are useful but she WILL make you feel incompetent if you ask questions or if you can't answer her questions. Her class is extremely challenging and I would not recommend for non-accounting students. Do yourself a favor and take another professor.

Dr. Ong is excellent at teaching; definitely the best 224 prof here. Her class is demanding w/ lots of material to learn, but manageable and straightforward to study for w/ her note packets. Only flaw: she can be very condescending, expecting perfection. She might make you feel dumb for asking questions. But still, take her; great class structure.

Take Dr. Ong. Teachers like her are what Pepperdine students need. She wants you to understand the topic and is always accessible outside of class. She is strict and very professional, and she will prepare you for the real world. Her class is not easy, but study and try hard, it will be worth it. She is THE smartest woman you will meet.

Dr. Ong's teaching is amazing. She is strict but very caring. She is the kind of professor that you can really walk away from her class with many meaningful things. You will do well if you pay attention to the lectures; the tests are not that hard, she gives partial credits for every question, and there's a lots extra credits opportunities.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: dr. ong is the sweetest strict prof. she is so understanding and helpful. she wants you to be the best student possible. she holds you accountable, but she is always ready to help her students. when she teaches, she gives relevant examples that keep people engaged.

Dr. Ong holds high standards to all her students and you need to put a great amount of effort to do well in her class, but she is also one of the most caring professors I have ever met. She knows the material extremely well and knows how to teach the concepts to the students. Exams are hard, but she tells you what to expect and is a fair grader.

Dr. Ong was the worst professor I have ever had, and this is the hardest class I have ever taken. She makes you feel dumb asking questions and answers them in a demeaning tone. The exams are EXTREMELY difficult for no reason. There are way better accounting professors. Whatever you do please avoid her at all costs.

Professor Ong is the most caring professor I have ever had. She is always available after class and responds to emails within the day. Her class is extremely test heavy. Be prepared to put in the extra effort, the grade doesnt come easily. I suggest going to exam prep office hours. DO NOT SLACK YOU WILL NOT PASS.

Dr. Ong obviously has a reputation at Pepperdine as being very hard and strict, and these things are true, but she is also probably the most caring professor that I've ever taken. She really does want you to succeed in her class and if you put in the work, you will accomplish it. You have to show her that you care in order for her to respect you.

She is very challenging professor. Her grading is ridiculous and strict for no reason. She does explain the material well but at a very fast pace. I would suggest taking another professor. Very hard tests and even stricter attendance policy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: This class was a considerable challenge. I had taken another accounting class before, but we went far and beyond anything I had learned prior. She provides ample opportunity to do well with group quizzes, homework, and many opportunities for extra credit. Her tests were quite hard and required you to know the material thoroughly. Very reasonable.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Ong is really young, but she is an accounting machine. She is a very good professor, but she expects the best out of her students, so be ready to work. Her note packets are taken exactly from the book so don't bother getting the book. She is always available and is there to help you. Sometimes she can be blunt, but she is awesome!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She is always available through email or outside class, but her exams are just too difficult. Even if you're an A student, be ready to study nonstop for a B.

Hard subject. Make sure to study the book as well as anything done in class. Still learning her teaching methods, so she is trying new things. She is always available via email and gets back to you really quick. Quizzes are in a group setting so they are pretty easy. The hardest part is the Midterms.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is super sweet and caring, although her tests can be kind of a lot. but she cares about student feedback and will try to help you out as much as possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: You have constant homework assignments and readings. She doesn't grade hard and discussions in class are really fun. Your grade is based on essays but she doesn't grade those that hard.
One of the sweetest but coolest people, she cares about her students and is a very easy class!

I had to write a review for Professor Mullins because she is absolutely amazing. Aside from being very caring, she is phenomenal at what she does. She provides very interesting insight into literature topics! Professor Mullins is always accessible and one of the sweetest professors I've met. Just do the assignments and make an effort!
ridiculous to have to make an art poster in college; doesn't let you use computers to take notes in a lecture class

She is really kind and listens to her students feedback. Her lectures are boring and she has you fill out sheets (like in high school) but it is a good class to take if you don't like English that much. She gives good feedback on papers and is a relatively easy grader. You can tell she loves what she does and wants students to enjoy it too.

Mullins cared about us alot and prompted us with lots of good discussion and material. She didn't make SAAJ overwhelming or difficult and gave us an hour in between class to eat lunch. Required to do a forum post every tuesday night but its only a paragraph. wrote 3 essays, did community service, went to 3 lectures,fieldtrips. Easy and fulfilling.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many

comment: People complained about her grading hard on essays, but she grades fairly and she teaches you to be a better writer. Do the work and you should get an A. She's sweet and as long as you can handle feminism (a lot of it) she's cool. SAAJ is a pretty cool class too if you actually care about social justice.

good professor that will meet with you after class if you need any assistance. will also help you outside of her own class which is nice. class may not be the easiest but it is definitely the way classes at pepperdine should be. its challenging and gets the students involved in something that matters

This woman is so sweet! Respect her and she will respect you. She is very kind and helpful. I loved this class. Some stuff was boring, but it is just the material they have to teach. I would definitely recommend SAAJ and Mullins.
So helpful and caring and passionate about literature! The class was four hours long and I loved every minute of it!

The quizzes and exams are very difficult -- read *slowly* and memorize all the little, unimportant facts: ages, dates, names, places, etc. Once you get the feel for it, it's easy to do well, if a little tedious. Be prepared for the Feminist Version of American Lit.
Great teacher! A little eccentric in her thought, but interesting nonethless! I really enjoyed her class. She grades a little challenging on essays but her tests are really easy if you read! Enjoy!

She is fair and understanding of perspectives and she does make it worth my time... But be prepared to read and read a lot.... Invest in ear plugs and spark notes... Learn to listen to books on tape and Blockbuster video... YOU will have to invest this much to pass

Prof Mullins is amazing! she is so clear, words things beautifully, and brings a lot to the literature.she will give you a reading assignment and then really explain it the next day in class.she only assigned us one essay.her tests were really challenging so study!!and read all your assignments (:

I dont mind reading, I dont mind a lot of work, but she assigns books that seem to be taken from the Lifetime for women channel. So boring. Do 3 hours a night, get a B+, ..... do nothing and read spark notes, get a B-. Your choice
Nice teacher, interesting stuff, always around to help you.

Okay, so she's not a lot of fun and she almost never give an A on anything, but I learned a lot b/c she forced me to read.  I really enjoyed the text she chose and my writing really improved as a result of her grading standards.

Ekkk.  The four hours of her class passes by as if each hour was a year.  Very hard grader.  Very boring.  If I had had her for SAAJ 1, I probably would have dropped the course after my first semester.  My regards to everyone who has to take her.
I learned a lot in this class.  A great teacher!!
No Comments
Yikes, you're in for a ride. NO A's !!!
Love this teacher she made Communications Theory one of my favorite classes at Pepperdine.

Unfortunately she is the worst professor I have had at Pepperdine. She had so many grammar and spelling errors, and was rude when I went to her office for help. Her final exam was clearly unfinished and extremely unprofessional that it was embarassing. She made me dread public speaking. I will never forget the awful experience I had in her class

She is prepared and neatly organized for every class. I really enjoyed her lectures for her amazing examples of the theories! She is extremely caring, friendly, funny, and clear. If you're taking Communication theory class, you should definitely take Prof. Sloan!!!!
Hard work, but wonderful teacher! She is probably one of the coolest teachers at Pepperdine.

This class is a lot of work and Sloan makes you really work for an A, but she is a fair grader.  She helped me a lot when I went to her office hours and did really help me with my anxiety. Overall, hard class but good teacher!
I love this class! Sloan is extremely funny and engaging. We have tons of fun video clips and class activities.

This class was so much fun! We watched a lot of TV and movies and she was really good at clarifying the textbook (which was really confusing most of the time!!). The  quizzes can be hard but if you do the reading you should be OK.  Overall I really liked the class and the teacher.  My fav. com class so far!

She's one of the hardest public speaking professors, but she's really helpful outside of class. Communicate any problems or anxiety you have and she will do what she can to help. You need the book; there are pop quizzes. Everyone loves her sense of humor, the guys love the way she looks.
Dear God this woman is incredible. Her lectures are hard to follow only because she is so incredibly beautiful but she is extremely well versed and intelligent. Good atmosphere, tough material.
She's very energetic and engaging.
You'll need the book, but she's super straight forward on what you should study for the exam. She's also really helpful outside of class.
Final is the HARDEST PART. Speeches are fun.. she makes it very welcoming.. Plus she's HOT.
unnecessarily hard with grading

My favorite teacher of the semester. She's so helpful and a breath of fresh air at Pepperdine, very fun class. She is a tough grader on speeches, but you learn exactly what she's looking for and then it's doable. Every point counts - remember that at the beginning of the semester!
Best. Class. Ever. the entertainment is worth the work level

I just finished this class and I loved it.I was really nervous about having to take a speech class and was really dreading it,but she made what could have been an awful class, a lot of fun and very comfortable. She knows her stuff!

I did not think i was going to like this class at all but it was actually my favorite class this year. The teacher is really helpful if you go to her  office. I didnt like that she doesnt accept any late work and that she gave quizes, but over all i really like the class.
I LOVE HER! She is sooo sweet and so funny. She grades hard but she is a great teacher. I recommend her if you have to take this class. Lots of fun!

A lot of work for a GE but the least work for all the com 180 classes. She clearly lays out everything you need to get an A. Reading isn't necessary just the summaries at the end of each chapter. She will help you too and makes the class very fun and relaxed.

her class is pretty fun but a lot of work for a GE. She is strict on attendance and has pop quizes which kind of suck but not hard if you read. Her midterm and final are alright, but a hard final. Overall, she is funny and young but a lot of work. I think she is new.
No Comments

I loved having Professor Cox for REL 102! The way he approached the content, as he tried to present many sides and he really knows his stuff, was engaging to me. Sometimes he'd present a lot of dense info to digest at 8a, but I actually loved the perspectives & facts that he brought, giving a different angle on something I've grown up with.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr Cox is a fantastic professor. He knows his stuff well and is more than willing to take all the necessary time to explain things you missed in class. He cares for the wellbeing of students as well, and is such a humble guy. I learned so much from his class!

AMAZING PROFESSOR! Although his class isn't the easiest, he is very knowledgable and passionate about religion. He makes his lectures as interesting as possible. You have to attend class and there is a bit of reading, but it's pretty manageable. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed.
Overall a great teacher!  He is very kind and cares about each student.  Really helps during office hours.  Class was interesting.
I loved Prof Cox's Class. Its one of the best classes I've ever taken at pepperdine. So incredibly interesting!
He is by far the best religion professor. He is very clear,fair, and organized. You will learn SO MUCH from him!!! I STRONGLY recommend taking him for Rel 102.

Great Professor, Just do the reading and take decent notes and you'll do great. Knows when things are boring and does his best to engage you, but some things just can't be made very interesting. Would take his class again.

I have only had Dr. Cox as a grad student, but have been more than pleased with his classes.  He has great understanding of the material and really wants people to understand.  Advice? Pay attention, takes notes, study lots for tests, stop lamenting that it is boring, and all will be well.
his rel 301 in CS Lewis requires 6 books! Rediculous
Material and lectures will null the most studious of academics to sleep. ZZZZzzzzzzzzzzz

Dr. Cox is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is fair, respectful of others, and a strong leader. I really like how he takes his lectures to another level; it's about understanding more than it is about memorization.He brings lots of humor into his lectures & exams.However, if you just want to memorize stuff, take someone who doesn't ca

Ok, he may be a "nice" guy, but the class is excruciatingly boring. His jokes are nerdy and the tests are pretty much based off of the notes you have to take in class (although he makes it really easy to space out or catch up on sleep). SO upset i took it with him.

Dr. Cox is very passionate about the subject that he teaches.  He lectures are usually fairly dynamic and daily quizzes are simple if you do the reading.  Tests are straight-forward and fair. Overall, Dr, Cox is a good instructor.

Dr Cox is awesome.  You have to do the reading which can be pretty boring, but his lectures are usually pretty interesting. He does a good job of making ancient stuff applicable to life today. He is also really funny annd very approachable. You have to go to class and read, but his tests are easy. I definitely recommend him.
Dr. Cox is a very nice guy. His class is somewhat boring and you do have daily reading quizzes, but it's not hard to do well. Still, it is a more boring class than it has to be.

An out of this world Amazing professor.  Gives you the best of both worlds; makes the course interesting and dynamic while keeping it manageable grade-wise.  This class was not only informative, but allowed me to grow personally as well.  In addition, his lectures are hilarous and will keep you laughing all the way through. Strait forward testsalso

He's a good teacher with an enjoyable personality. He takes attendance, though kind of passively, but it would be tough to miss class anyways because he quizzes a lot on reading. The reading itself is manageable and he makes it clear what should be known for the quizzes. He has a good sense of humor and he responds to his students.

Cox is a nice guy with a cheesy sense of humor.  You have to go to class and take a bunch of quizes but they're easy and the tests aren't too bad either.  He's kinda strict with participation so make sure to talk a lot in class.  He's easy though so take him if you can.

I expected to hate this class, but he made it not too bad. He's very funny and cares a lot about students. The only thing is he is a bit disorganized, not always clear, and usually seems overwhelmed. Overall, I reccomend this class.

Cox is great professor. If you're at all interested in the subject he really makes it worth while. Tests are pretty tough and you have to keep up on reading for the weekly quizzes, but you definately learn a lot and he makes it interesting. Whoever thinks he isn't funny has a lame sense of humor.

Last semester was his first time teaching and it showed. He is relatively easy but you must attend class and there are quizes weekly. He is a total nerd and his lame jokes get old fast but if you can suffer through his lectures you will be just fine.

Dr Bogardus is probably the most inspirational teacher I've ever had. His first year seminar class and his wisdom inspired me to add a philosophy minor to my degree audit. Always happy to help on assignments and essays, as well as to give any life advice. DO NOT GET THE READER, he prints out all of the texts. TAKE HIS CLASS! You won't regret it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: Doctor Bogardus is brilliant! Truly, he's incredibly intelligent, eloquent, and well-thought-out. This man understands life, about as best as humanly possible, and he will destroy and reform your beliefs. TAKE HIS CLASSES! He and Mason coupled together will bring you to truth.

He's great, felt more like a classmate than a prof. 
Participation is your whole grade. If you don't speak at all in a class, he basically marks you absent + it affects your grade. Midterm paper and final paper. 
He is crazy intelligent. Has answers to questions I've never considered. This class had me doing research out of pure self-interest.

Bogardus hates me & it's low-key mutual. But even so, he has taught me so much and is amazing at his job. If you are a philosophy major or pre-law...TAKE HIM. You may hate him at times but it will pay off in the end. He has taught me so much. I'm just glad he puts up with my attitude. Slay king.
I learned a ton about arguments and logic, even if sometimes student discussions would go in different directions.
You can really tell he loves philosophy. This class helped me learn to think and write more clearly. Highly recommend taking a class with Bogardus.
Recommended.
Very interesting class, which got me interested in philosophy. Good class discussions about topics you don't get to talk about in other classes. A very good professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Really good professor. Learned a lot. Challenging, but that's what college is for.

It boggles my mind why Professor Bogardus has such high ratings. Do NOT take him for First Year Seminar. He refuses to give grades above a 89 on essays except for about two people in the class, and he bases his class on your participation so if you don't like to talk in class then I would most definitely not recommend taking it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Takes opinions for facts
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Bogardus is a GREAT professor. If you put in the effort you can get an A. His class is challenging no doubt but he is a very nice guy
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Bogardus is a tough professor but only because he wants you to really have a passion for Philosophy the way he does. You can easily make an A in his class if you put the effort in. I came into Pepperdine as PreMed and easily switched over to Philosophy after a few weeks in his class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Bogardus is easily the best professor at Pepperdine. He balances everything well: lighthearted but discusses tough issues, hilarious but keeps the class focused, challenging but understanding, brilliant but humble. If Bogardus was not on the faculty I would not be a Philosophy major, and if I wasn't a Philosophy major I would have left Pepperdine.

Bogardus must be the best prof at Pepperdine. He is incredibly bright, his objections are often devastating, and he is consistently very clear. His strength is not only in his own ability to reason well, but also his ability to explain clearly how one reasons well. Epistemology w/ Bogardus is a class guaranteed to challenge your worldview.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Bogardus is a great teacher. He cares about his students and he is clear about what he expects. This class not only made me a better writer, but also a better thinker as well. Take this class if you want to improve your ability to think.
The subject is difficult and the discussions are sometimes hard to follow. But it's worth it. This class made me realize how watered down most other courses are. Made me a better thinker.
Just a beautiful, beautiful man.

The material was great, but you simply must take a class with this professor. Bogardus is hands down the best at Pepperdine. I've seen him critique other professors' work, and the dude is devastating. Fun to watch! He tones it down in class and is supportive, friendly, and hilarious, but his comments are spot-on and you'd do well to listen.

Bogardus is the best professor I've had at Pepperdine: very clear, challenging, and direct. Phil Religion is tough to teach since it's a mix of philosophy majors and newbies to philosophy, but his lectures start slow and then ramp up as we delve into the issues. The syllabus is super helpful, with links to readings, lectures, and handouts. Great!

If you get the chance to take HUM 313 with him, do it. He is the most clear, clever, engaging, and funny prof I have had. I learned a ton- intellectually challenging but not hard to get a good grade. We learned about evaluating important arguments that have been put forth throughout history. TAKE HIM! Best prof at Pep!

For the tuition we pay, this class was unacceptable. Professor Batchelder is kind, but his lectures were confusing, and most students didn't even show up. You're forced to self-study homework that doesn't align with exams, which exams make up 90% of your grade. Nothing made sense, and I learned nothing. Good luck to anyone taking this class.

Don't go to class. It is completely useless. Only go to class to get the hw and turn it in. Memorize and study the hw and you can get an easy A. Don't distract yourself with the other resources or books that are also completely useless. Batchelder can answer any general economic question but greatly struggles to stay on topic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Boring deflating antiquated. Learned nothing in this class. The Final is like the midterm. Everyone fails a huge curve
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I took this guy last semester and he told awful jokes and didn't help me when I emailed him after hours (that is if he even got ahold of me at all). I had to use chegg to pass his class and finished with an A. All in all, I didn't learn much from him and I just would not recommend

Only take professor if you really have to. Grade is made up of midterm, final, and homework. Has a huge grading curve. Pretty much just study handouts he gives and review homework questions and answers to pass exams. Also is not tech savvy. Definitely form a study group outside of class

he is horrible he would never lecture about relevant material regarding econ, he would always ramble about the most random topics like his dating life and how girls drive jeeps? disappointed w/ quality of education here, never had a clear outline of what chapters to go over I didn't learn a thing in that class and feel so underprepared.

The test questions are literally just the homework questions, so ONLY study the homework answer keys he gives out. Lectures are a waste of time, and he's so pathetically lost on zoom. But Batch is the easiest A in the Econ dept hands down, take him every chance you get. Unless you actually want to learn lol then take Norgaard/Baitimbetova

Two tests and homework make up the grade. The first test was alright, but the final was a BLESSING. Homework is easy - not graded, just checked for completion, and the tests are very very similar to the homework. Batch talks very slowly and it is extremely hard to pay attention for 2 hours at a time, but he's nice. Also takes forever to grade test

He just rambles on stories, then checks his notes to get back on topic with 5 minutes left. Even office hours are pathetically off-topic. I'm not sure if he can teach, but he seems to choose not to. Attendance is taken, but get ready to fall asleep in class and stay up late reading the book. Oh, and 90% of the semester grade is the midterm & final
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Truly enjoys economics and teaching. He cares about the students and is willing to help them outside of class. Lectures can be long and dry, but he has many good stories and experience to speak from. Gives unorthodox life advise and has good dry humor.

Batch is an incredibly kindhearted and well-respected man, but he is simply a below average teacher. While his lectures are very informative, they're also incredibly dry and monotonous. Like seriously, imagine staring at the wall for an hour and a half and that's probably more exciting. His grading can also be confusing and without rhyme or reason.

Being a year out of school I can only beg econ majors to take Batch's money and banking class. It is the only class I use for my career and the only reason I had enough knowledge to even get my job. Take money and banking, keep your notes, and pay attetion. Batch is freaking hilarious.

I took him for intermmediate microeconomics and he is the worst teacher ever. He does not explain at all, he just talks forever (assuming the students know everything he's talking about), doesn't simplify things or take notes on board, etc. If he does draw a graph, there is no way you can take notes and see what he just shaded. DO NOT TAKE HIM!

Batch is the best part of Pepperdine Economics.  Great guy and sure, lectures are a bit dry but he likes to mix it up with anecdotes.  If you know how to study properly, you can do well fairly simply.  Study the HW.  It all comes from former exams.

Great guy, very smart. Usually explains things well. Get to know him. Tests and homework can be pretty tough, but if you study really hard, come to class, and go to his review sessions then you'll be okay.
Batchie rocked the whole time. His check kiting stories are great!
No Comments

After taking his class all I can say is "What?!?!" He is very confusing and his lectures are very very very boooooring!! Yet he is nice to both the dudes and the chicks.  I would advise you to steer clear of this guy especially if your new to any Econ. classes.
good class, clearest one ive taken yet

Really nice guy. easy going but lectures are boring.  studying his homework sheets are the key to the class.  He is a slow grader but its just his style.  very personal and social with his students.  Try to get to know him personally.  No attendance policy!!
Batchelder is an incredible professor and such a wealth of knowledge.  Definitely recommend.
"Batchie" as we called him makes great jokes, told us about when he check kited, and teaches at the highest of standards. I'd recomend him 10X over.

Professor Kern is organized, caring, easy to talk to, and very passionate about what he teaches. He will have commentary for absolutely any question a student could come up with. He is not a harsh grader, but he doesn't hand out top grades easily. I would recommend him to anyone.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Kern is incredibly kind and understanding. I had a rough semester and because this was a GE, this class fell through. For a GE this class was very difficult. There are a lot of readings and forum posts. The quizzes were not impossible but had a short time limit which made them difficult. The final exam was all essays. GO TO OFFICE HOURS
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof Kern is a really cool Great Books Professor. He's very funny and personable and is super approachable. His classes were lighthearted and fun. Before beginning class, he always led some sort of breathing exercise and asked a community question for everyone to answer. There's a lot of reading and three essays, but Kern is a generous grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: He thinks that classic works have one interpretation and meaning, his. I zone out now because it was discouraging to have my point of view dismissed every time I had a separate opinion on how to think about the text, most of the time I was trying to highlight something that interested me. If he was not already thinking it, it was quickly dismissed.

Dr. Kern is an amazing professor! I took him for both GSHU 120 and 121, and I really enjoyed it! He's very non-judgmental: He always shows interest in what students are discussing, and he expands upon what others have stated. He's very approachable in office hours to help with drafting and editing papers.

I love Dr. Kern!! Had a splendid time in his class last semester. He's very good at teaching and keeping the discussion flowing, and his expectations for class are realistic. While I do think that some of the other professors are slightly better at leading class discussions, Kern is overall very helpful. He is also one of the easier GB professors.

Prof. Kern is such a nice guy, but the class wasn't. Huge group project, SUPER hard midterm and final exams with unclear study guides, boring and confusing lectures, and if you don't read the textbook, you will not pass. I've never been so confused in a class before in my life. You can tell he cares, but he also is not responsive outside of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Kern is a great instructor! I would highly recommend him.

Professor Kern is a great professor who is passionate about the material he teaches. However, he is quite a harsh grader. You have to put in a significant amount of work to achieve the grade you want, and he does not give above 96% on essays.
Overall, his class made me a much stronger writer and gave me the skills to analyze complex texts.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Kern is so passionate about what he teaches. He is engaging and wants his students to be just as passionate as he is. My biggest complaint about him is his grading techniques and the students' inability to score over a 96%. He is a very tough grader and expects a lot of time to be dedicated to this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Have to read ALOT. Pretty hard for a GE class. He's really nice though, GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. Exams and Quizzes are hard if you don't read and make study guides. the textbook is your life saver. He rounds grades dw. Go to class and participate and turn things on time- he's super anal about that and will lower your grade bc of it. Easy A-/B+ tbh.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: For a GE, this class is ridiculously hard. He's a nice guy and really knowledgeable, but his class is far from easy. Expect a lot of readings + forum posts for every one. He is a pretty tough grader and has really high expectations. Powerpoints are vague, and I felt like I was teaching myself a lot. By far one of the hardest classes I've taken.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I've taken Great Books 121 & 122 with Kern and he's a great professor who really cares about this course and his students. Getting through some of these books can be tough but he provides really good explanations and makes them fun. Papers can be difficult but he is available for help and questions; he wants you to do well in his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Caring

comment: Professor Kern is a good guy who cares about his students and tries his best to help everyone pass. There's a forum post due every class, but he doesn't expect an essay or anything like that. The assigned textbook readings are easy to understand. Grade is comprised of a couple quizzes, a midterm (that was curved), paper, and the final exam.

Expect a lot of readings and discussion post is due every time before class. For a GE, a lot of expectations are placed upon students. Lecture heavy and professor expects students to note down everything said, as powerpoints are vague and don't contain much information. So much information to learn.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Kern is an amazing professor who quite obviously cares about his students. I took his class for GSHU 121 and 122, and the class only got better. The class is quite a lot of reading, but he helps you through it by analyzing the material in class and answering any questions you have about what you read. TAKE HIS CLASS!

John Kern is a good guy! He teaches nicely as well. However if a person like me, doesn't really know religion, it's really hard really hard to understand what he is talking about. I would recommend him if you know religion, and like to think philosophically. If you don't like that. Don't take him.

Easy weekly readings and heavy lecture classes. One major paper along with the midterm and final. The midterm was challenging, but he curved it a lot. The last is a series of essay prompts that you chose from. He is straightforward to work with for absences, but his study guides are vague.

This was his first semester teaching Great Books I in person, and he did fantastically. He's a remarkable person and a really. good listener. Reading books like The Republic feels a lot less daunting with him.

He does a great job of splitting up class time, so there aren't as many lulls. Along with this, he's very accessible outside class and cares a lot about fostering good discussion. If you want an interactive class that makes you ask a lot of questions, then Kern's a great choice!

Understanding and sympathetic. Values mental health and is quite flexible if something personal comes up. Reading assignments are not overwhelming, and the occasional quizzes are not difficult. Lectures are tailored to students' questions, keeping them engaging. Brief weekly forums. No tests, just two projects and a few mini-essays for the final.

A really good guy! You can tell he's really passionate about his subject, plus he just left school so he's got a lot of fresh knowledge about it. Reading your textbook is definitely required but the textbook he uses is easy to understand and pretty interesting. Overall, a solid choice.

Took her class just to fill the schedule and really enjoyed it.  She knows so much about lit and loves talking about it in such a nice and engaging way.  I know there's this idea about literature or writing being pretentious, but Frye just provided an amazing overall experience.  It gets a bit hard sometimes, but good for any freshman/sophomore

I LOVE Dr. Frye! She is super passionate about her subject, loves to teach, super funny and friendly. Our online class has been pretty easy because her lectures are engaging. It's a lot of information to cover and it goes a bit deeper intellectually, but it's definitely worth it. Definitely take this class for GE credit.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Frye was great! I even think she was amazing, compared to other HUM professors at Pepperdine. She was quirky and sarcastic in such a funny way, I loved it. The way she gives lectures isn't boring so it's not hard to pay attention. Her tests and quizzes are on the things that you've read, but they aren't hard. Best HUM professor I've had!
A WONDERFUL human.

Professor Frye was my favorite professor so far! She really listens to what students have to say during class discussions and wants everyone to share. She seems a bit intimidating at first, but is really nice. She does grade somewhat hard on essays, but as long as you put in effort & complete all the pre-write assignments you'll be fine.

She gives a lot of tests that are worth only a few points, so if you miss one it will bring down your grade by a lot. Participation is a grade, but she gives you opportunities outside of class if you are shy. She is smart and a wonderful teacher but also a very tough grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: She looks scary at first but actually she turned out to be my fav! Really just positive vibes around her but be ready for essays and reading quizzes!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Tough Grader

comment: This woman is a delight. She's the most deadpan, witty professor that you will ever be graced with. She has an ability of explaining ANYTHING clearly- and interestingly! Tell me when the last time a professor was funny AND interesting at the same time. She makes you work hard, but you're gonna want you to work hard. She fair and wonderful.

Dr. Frye is amazing. She is very passionate about her work. She can seem intimidating but she is very caring. She will help her students with whatever they need. Her classes are all discussion based. Make sure to read the material outside of class or you will be lost.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr Frye is a great English professor, but she does tend to grade the essays pretty harshly. Participation matters a great deal in this class. MAKE SURE TO READ! Her reading quizzes can be very detailed. She is definitely a nice professor not out to get you, but her class can get boring. Especially during discussions. Overall, I enjoyed the class.

Professor Frye is a great professor. She wants to help you. She's lenient. She'll let you turn things in a BIT late with a good reason. Her essay topics were okay but they're easy. She'll sit down and help you. Checked in on me when I missed class for a few days. Helped catch me up. Easy final. Portfolio. Fun reading. Don't need textbooks.
She is very demure and a great teacher.  You won't be disappointed if you take her freshman seminar Inventing Modern Childhood because its not very difficult if you do exactly what she says.

Dr. Frye was awesome. Inventing Modern Childhood was so enjoyable and really does help freshman get ready for the next 4 years by analyzing great writings and films. She keeps it super interesting. Favorite teacher I've ever had. Also, not too easy, not too hard. Perfect prof. If you try an A is easy and you will want to try with a prof like her!

Pretty easy class. She grades essays very fairly and offers 10% extra credit on each one. Other than the essays, there are daily quizzes on the readings but they are really easy if you actually do the reading. Overall great professor!

I had Professor Frye for my English 101 class and it honestly was my favorite class my freshman year. She has a passion for teaching English and shows interest for each student. Her quizes are fair and she grades reasonably. Has a sense of humor and makes the class enjoyable. Highly recommend her for English!

apathetic and flat. drones on and on, very boring. Grades difficult and was rude to the class. I switched out after two classes. Assigns a ton of work - five books - for her class. Pick another seminar.
No Comments

great! this was by far my favourite humanities class out of all, probably one of my favourite classes at pepperdine. dr. frye focuses on the art and culture and applies all of the history to how it affects us today. she isn't caught up in all the stupid details of history. instead, she challenges us to interpret history and art for ourselves.
Really be able to write!!!  The tests are all essay.  She grades with the bell curve which can be bad because a 96% can be an A- if there are really good writes (English majors) in the class.
No Comments
Easy class! 1 hour discussion/lecture, the rest of class is spent watching movies. Always got out early.

Dr. Sugimoto was a super reasonable prof! Lectures were interesting. Participation matters. Must put in the work - but if you show you care, you will be fine. Easier than other GE's I've taken. He responded to my emails quickly and was easy to access outside of class. He even brought us Sprinkles cupcakes to class!

I don't understand why people are giving positive reviews. What should have been a fairly simple class became my most stressful. I have always excelled in writing and I always started my essays early, but somehow it was never good enough and he REFUSED to provide help/guidance to improve during office hours. Don't waste your time. Not an easy A.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Great professor and very knowlegable. Don't procrastinate on essays, put some thought into it and you'll be fine.
LOVE Dr. Sugimoto! His class was interesting, and he sometimes brought doughnuts to class. 1000% recommend. If you put in effort and thought you'll be fine
Take him! Dr. Sugimoto is super chill. We watched movies during class. If you put in effort and don't procrastinate the essay, you'll be fine.

Save yourself a lot of time and do not take this. The film class may seem chill- once a week, watch a movie...but his grading on the papers is bad!! and he does not give guidance during office hours. A professor being "nice" does not= your success. Don't even know how I got an A? prob cuz I annoyed him so much and tried WAY too hard! wasted my time
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Sugimoto is AMAZING! If you have the opportunity to take him, I would 100% recommend. He is one of the kindest, caring professors I know. He is very understanding. Definitely one of my favorite classes. Overall his class was straightforward and lectures super easy going.

This is the class I was most excited to take, but most disappointed with by the end. His lectures are boring and don't actually help, papers are graded unclearly, and his readings are unorganized, tedious, and dry. As soon as he starts a movie, he just LEAVES and doesn't come back, so most people ditch and watch the movie on their own time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Sugimoto is a real gem, he really knows his stuff and will gladly open up to any specific questions in class. The reading is diverse and well-selected. I had a blast writing the research paper for this class! Would take him again anytime.

Words can't describe how amazing this man is. Both in teaching and in life, he's just an amazing person. I was struggling with personal issues during this time and he was very understanding. This class was so cool and informative and he didn't shove information down our throats. Critical thinking and film background helps a lot. He's a real gem.

i took mr. sugimoto's history of japan. Overall, an amazing professor. class was super easy. attend class, read the book, do the discussion sheets in depth, and you will do well in this class. 2 papers and 3 or 4 fill in the blank and short essay tests. HIGHLY recommend taking this class.
He is probably my hero...  Take his class, and you will love it.  Grades a little tough sometimes, but follow the instructions he gives you and you'll be fine.

Sugi is amazing. I had no interest in Asian history whatsoever and somehow he makes it interesting. He loves relating topics to the bigger picture, so it's not boring. He brings in baked goods and we watch movies from time to time. Class is all discussion and he's really open to his student's opinions. Do the study guide for the test- you'll be fin
Sugi is amazing! He is very easy going. Being abroad, he understood all the distractions that were going on, and he was a lot of help. His cooking is amazing, too!

he is AMAZING. my semester would've been horrible without his class. very straight forward and integrates fun into the class room. very easy going, yet interesting as well. his food is amazing, always an added bonus. he grades a little rough, but welcome to college. A+ for him
Great teacher. Really gets you into Japanese History. Integrates Japanese movies and texts. Love it. Take him!
Cares about students. loves the subjects he teaches. brings food to class. class is fun.
Very smart and lectures are really interesting. Tests are straight forward and not too bad, but the lectures are the best part. He's very educated and published, and I loved the class.
Very interesting class, nice guy.

Professor Hemsworth is a great guy, and I really enjoyed his class. The lectures were engaging, the assignments were reasonable and interesting, and the grading was always fair. I definitely recommend him.

Hemsworth intro class was actually the funnest and most engaging course I've had in a while. Not only is he an amazing lecturer, but his homework assignments are never hard and exams are simple as long as you pay attention and show up. Aside from that he's an amazing person willing to help you with anything, would recommend for any ADV course.

HES A NICE GUY! Best class ever, such a wonderful, funny, caring, highly-intelligent, and easy graded-professor. I would take him again all over. Best person inside and out. Class is so easy and fun. You will learn so much and actually remember everything he lectures. Such a wonderful professor-- I have only good things to say about him. TAKE HIM!

Professor Hemsworth has been my favorite professor at Pepperdine thus far! Homework is very light and tests are easy. Attendance Is mandatory like most classes. If I had to put a downside I would just say he doesn't post a lot on courses rather tells you what he wants done in class, other than that he is absolutely amazing.

Professor Hemsworth is an awesome professor who is super passionate about advertising! I took ADV275 and 375 with him. Exams are super easy and the group projects, while long, are graded fairly and make great portfolio items for the advertising world. He also is super helpful for internship searching and really cares about his students!

So kind and wonderful! I love Brian! Please take him if you can. I have had him twice and both times have been wonderful. He is upfront with what he wants and is acronym heavy. I recommend using a Quizlet to study and be sure to follow along with lectures.

He loves what he teaches, which makes him go on a few tangents while teaching. Homework is relatively easy and can be done within an hour, but it feels like buys work. Lectures are boring and not engaging, but tests are easy. There are pros and cons. He's not the best professor I've had, but he's better than most.

Hemsworth wants his students to learn-he does not want them to struggle. His lectures are interesting and homework is typically less than 1hr/week except before the midterm and the final where he assigns larger projects. He is super helpful during office hours. Take good notes during lectures and study them for an A.
Love Brian def take him if you can.

Prof. Hemsworth is great-- gives super helpful feedback, wants students to succeed, easy-going, kind, and reasonable. He even teaches the class practical skills like how to write a resume or how to succeed in a job interview. He knows the subject well and does not want the class to be difficult. I'd really highly recommend this professor!

Brian is by far the best prof I've had at Pepperdine. Super easy-going guy that cares a lot about his students. Homework was pretty easy and he doesn't grade hard at all. Pretty much just a lecture-based class and no participation is really necessary. Please take him if you have the chance! He is a great guy to know! Plus, the class is an easy A.
professor Hemsworth is so kind. this class is not tough and maybe an easy A if you pay attention in class. There are homework and projects, but he is not a tough grader.

Amazing! I had him for ADV 275 and 375 and I'm so sad I won't be able to take him again. He's so caring with his students and is very willing to help you through assignments. His study guides are exactly like his exams and he has very thorough reviews right before. Super understanding and really has a lot to teach his students. Take him!!!

Brian is my absolute favorite professor at Pepperdine!! I had him for ADV 275 and ADV 375, and wish I could take more from him! He is so qualified and brings his real world experience into his lectures. You can really tell he cares about his students! His class is an easy A, tests are just like the study guides and you can fill them out in reviews.

Second class with Brian and I'm sad this is my last. He is literally the best, the most caring, the most helpful professor and person in general! He has taught me so much and cares so much for each of his students! He makes time to make sure everyone is learning something of value. Take his class and you won't regret it! My favorite professor!!

Loved his class. One midterm and one final, questions directly from the review done the week before the exam, mostly free response and T/F. One major paper and one major group project. He does take attendance but class is usually let out early. Homework is minimal, it is all for a journal you turn in every few weeks. Very chill and nice guy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Brian Hemsworth is one of the best professors I have had at Pepperdine. He really knows advertising and genuinely cares that each student understands what he/she is learning. Even though the class is 6-10 pm every wednesday, I highly recommend to be in his class. His assignments/tests/projects are all straightforward and are not overbearing.

TAKE HIM!!! My absolutely favorite professor at Pepperdine. His 4 hour ADV 275 class may seem long when you think about it, but you normally get out early, and he makes the class interesting. He really cares about his students and what he is teaching. He is so sweet. I actually look forward to this class every week. BEST PEPPERDINE PROFESSOR!

Makes everyone call him Brian. Best advertising teacher. His 4-hour class sometimes seems very long, but he will only teach what is necessary, and helps you VERY much by "hinting" what will be on his tests. He always says "I don't give you grades, you earn them". If you listen in class you will get an A.
Great teacher who is well versed in his field.  I would absolutely take him again.  Funny, professional and interesting!
aight

Had him last semester for his four hour class on monday nights.  I found his lectures interesting but they seemed to drag on after a certain point (as is the way in any 4 hour class).  In retrospect I cannot believe the VAST amount of knowledge I learned from the class.  Do not underestimate his ability to teach.

i took his music appreciation class and loved it! i never had prior interest in classical music until i took his class. he's such a genuine person is always enthusiastic about what he's teaching. you must take his class!!!

Pullen is a very nice, genuine guy. Expect for this GE to show up, smile, listen to some music, and have a fine time. Don't expect to learn much that you'll remember or be challenged. As long as you have the right attitude, the class is fine...an easy A.

Mr. Pullen is the model of what a genuine professor should be. Hands down, the Pullens are the few teachers I have had with their hearts in the right place and their heads screwed on correctly. Mr. Pullen should serve as an example to other teachers. Always available,he is a true inspiration, and you will be sincerly blessed to be in his classroom.

Music Appreciation. Pullens a great teacher and the class is fun. No homework assignments accept concerts (get tickets early), listen to music and watch movies related to music (Amadeus). Tests are easy (multiple choice and listening). Best part is it satisfies the Fine Arts G.E.
Incredibly nice guy who really loves his job.  The class is interesting, and his tests are open book and note.
Dr. P is an awesome Choir Director and an amazing academic musician. He has the rare ability of balancing discipline and ease in his class. You will not be disappointed.
GREAT teacher!  Never gives homework and is extremely kind.  He loves the subject of music and got me way more interested in classical music, which I never thought I would!  Take him!

Mr Pullen is perhaps the only teacher with student interests at heart in the Pepperdine music department.  Though he is extremely unhappy with his staff.  He is so much better than the rest of them even a decent human being looks like a gem next to Lincoln Hanks!
Best teacher EVER and an amazing person with a great personality!

Best Freshman seminar you can get in.  I had him five years ago and still recognize the music and composers we learned about.  If your pledging a real fraternity at Pepperdine (although) very few if any still exist than this is a class where catching up on some zzz's to some great music is encouraged.  Ol' Milt is the grteatest!
No Comments
He was so sweet!
No Comments

Great class, easiest A ever. During tests, if you don't know the answer to a question, just raise your hand and ask. Chances are, he'll end up just telling you the answer. He knows the real value of freshman seminar, and it's not making you study.
Pullen inspires me to continue on into the future with my gift of singing from God, he allows me to enjoy it and i look forward to singing for him each day, keep up the wonderful work!
Easy A for 4 units class...He's a really nice guy...and teach really well...highly recommend to take his class
He is VERY clear about what he wants and it isn't much.  He's really passionate about what he does and doesn't mind if you're not, he'll help you get an A anyway.  True sweetheart.
Great Guy!!
Just a big teddy bear..Students love him almost as much as he loves all of them.
Hands down the greatest person in the world.
Dr. Shores is an absolute sweetheart. He loves what he teaches and that is reflected. The lectures can be dry, but he tries to make it engaging. This class is very discussion-based.

Loved Professor Shores! Good balance of homework/classwork. You have plenty of time for assignments and readings aren't too much. I really appreciated his character and empathy for all of his students. Big fan!

took my first year seminar and was the only class i didn't receive an A in. he's very funny and caring, which makes the class seem chill. your entire grade depends on the midterm/group presentation/group paper so start on those early. you watch tv shows every class. wasn't hard but you definitely have to put a lot of work in to get a good grade

I've had Dr. Shores for several classes at Pepperdine, and he's one of if not my favorite professor. You learn a lot without being overburdened with busy work. Show up to class and talk occasionally. If he sees you put in effort, he's incredibly understanding and cool.

A nice guy but a mediocre teacher. His efforts to teach a class is sophomoric at best. Makes his students "participate", but all that means is making his students do most of the leg work in teaching the class so that he doesn't have to.

He is a great freshman advisor. He helped me plan out my four years here at Pepperdine. He is available outside of the classroom if you need help and genuinely cares about his students. For the TV family class, the class is centered on picking one series and describing the family. Make sure you start early on it because the paper with it is a lot.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Shores is one of the best professors I've had. Even though he is not my advisor or professor, he is still more than willing to help me plan my courses. I've never known a professor to take so much interest in his students-- and even remember you three years later.
wont give As. very condescending
The course content is really easy, but he grades hard. The whole class is pretty much just based on one big project. He is a really nice guy, and we watch a lot of TV in class.

He is cool, and really slow...If you talk to  him you find that he is really cool, but you have to stay on top of your grade or you think you have a better grade than you do. He does make breakfast for you at the end of the semester

The class is pretty slow-paced, but you get to watch TV shows and he's a nice guy overall.  There's hardly ever any homework, but when there is, he grades tough.  He's not very good at making sure you're aware of upcoming projects, so you're usually caught off-guard by enormous presentations.  Just be on top of things, and the class isn't that bad.

Awsome guy in person, group presentations a little unclear on what he expected but overall definitly a GREAT guy. He's willing to help, we watch TV shows in class, and have interesting class discussions. I recommend this guy if you want a caring teacher whose class isn't too difficult.

excellent teacher!  class discussions were both interesting and challenging.  he makes you think and keeps the information relative.  he needs to work on handing assignments back faster.  but as far as class discussion goes, he is one of the best.

Heard rumors about his grading but our class never found out what our grades were because he never turned things back. the last day of class we finally received assignments...cant be trusted. has his students teach the class. Tests are ambiguous and unfair.
can not be trusted.  almost screwed me out of graduating early.
Dr shores is nice but a hard grader and you cannot get anything by him so don't even try it. He gave me a bad grade and I know that I deserved way better than what he gave me.
Dr. Shores is awesome!  Interesting perspectives on media and culture and genuinely cares for his students.  A great man.  Grades pretty hard though.  Made for a great Freshman Seminar.
Interesting professor, worth going to class
Awesome person and teacher!
The best teacher I have ever had, so in tune with students and a great professor

Dr. White is a phenomenal professor. You will have to work hard to do well in his class, but he provides every material needed to succeed. He cares about students, is entertaining, and clearly loves the material he teaches. Top caliber within the Natural Science Division.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Best professor in the science division so far! He seems to be the only professor that gives fair tests for what is being taught. Doesn't expect more than what he teaches. Don't get me wrong, you definitely have to study for tests, but the practice tests and optional homework are giving you problems that will be exactly like test questions.

He is an awesome man and individual overall, however the course itself is demanding. When he lectures that day, do the work for the lecture. Do all the handout problems and problem sets. When it comes to studying start way further in advance then what you think you would normally have to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The class is difficult but he gives you all the tools to succeed, if you're willing to put in the work. He's great at explaining concepts and answering questions clearly. A funny and sweet professor. Really wants to see everyone do well. Read through the lectures ahead of time; it makes a world of difference.

Honestly he's a great intelligent man but his tests are so incredibly hard its unfortunate to see all the effort and hours spent on studying wasted. However, he has a generous curve. But study months in advance for tests if you at least want a C/pass in the class. Over half the class dropped because of the exams and the only grade in class is exams

Class lectures are recorded but if you don't go it's way harder to work up the motivation/actually learn the material. Your grade is based off of four tests ONLY but his curve helps A LOT (even though it's weird and I don't fully understand it). Overall, he's super sweet and has a great sense of humor. He's a wonderful human being and a great prof.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not a hard class if you study and do the practice problems. His exams are extremely fair and exactly what he tells you they will be... it's organic chemistry, so if you're expecting to not put in any work to get a good grade, you'll be disappointed
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great teacher. Hard course. DO NOT PROCRASTINATE.

Hardest class I've had at Pepperdine.  Used packets, textbook would have been better. Very busy with research so you don't always get help when you need it. Very abstract and flies through material, expects you to completely understand nearly 600 pages of packet info by the end of the semester. My suggestion is to take it elsewhere.

Dr. White is without a doubt one of the best professors I've ever had. He's attentive to his student's needs, is available outside of class, and is very clear about what is expected of us.  He does whatever he can to ensure we will be prepared for exams and clearly wants us to do well.

HARDEST class Ive taken, but you learn a lot. Handouts are okay?!?!,as they sometimes are VERY confusing to follow unless you're chemically intuitive. Pretty much always available for office hours and willing to try to help whether he actually does or not. Super nice guy, pretty funny, and laid back if you get to know him.

Such a cool prof.  Lectures are kick-back and go off of outlines provided online, so print off copies and fill them in as he lectures.  Helpful out of class and always gives review sessions before exams.  One of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine.
Boring class as would be expected, but not hard, study before the tests and you'll do fine.  He's a nice guy and kind of curves the test in a way thats unknown to me.

very clear, down-to-earth professor.  handouts are awesome, review sessions even better.  tests can be hard, but easy to pass if you study hard in advance and really know what you're doing.  he's friendy, funny, and is really cool.  make sure you understand everything though before you go on.

handouts make everything more understandable.  gotta work hard outta class and make sure you understand everything before you move on, but he makes it easy to figure out what's going on.  nice, cool, funny, and an extremely good teacher.

Very difficult class, but if you study hard it will pay off.  He's extremely smart and very helpful. His notes are amazing, you don't really need the book expect for extra problems. Ask him about his "Winnie the Pooh" voices and his favorite functional group.
Definitely a difficult class but Dr. White is a good teacher.  He's very helpful and his handouts are like a book in themselves.
The hardest class I have ever taken... but he is a good man.
Great Ochem jokes, handouts are helpful.  Loves to talk enantiomers.
What can you say... it's a hard course
Worst professor I ever had. Dont take her class if is not required. Honestly Im glad she is retiring. Less people have to suffer.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Scott-Lowe is great. Thoughtful, super experienced in her field, and doesn't shy away from challenging conversations. Her classes are the best I've taken at Pepperdine. At least in the SW minor her classes are mostly discussion based and you learn a lot. She makes sure that her students get to know each other and form community as well.

Dr. Emily is very accommodating. However, there is homework for every class and you have to show critical thinking by writing at least 4 sentences for each question. You also have to somewhat read the textbook in order to complete the homework. She isn't the hardest grader, but you do need to put in effort.
Awesome person. Mediocre teacher; teaches straight out of the textbook and has unreasonable expectations
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Absolute must for first-year seminar students. The presentation assignment can be difficult but other than that the class is average difficulty and teaches many important life skills.

Scott-Lowe is one of my favorite professors, and also just one of my favorite people. She is super clear about expectations from the get-go. She is also genuinely interested in the lives of her students. There is no way you will get left behind unless that is your goal. Would recommend her to anyone. Super helpful with class and life in general!

This professor is hands-down one of my favorites. She is caring, honest, and definitely looks out for you if you get to know her! Her seminar class does have lots of papers, but they're pretty easy. However, she expects great critical thinking skills. If you aren't good at that, attend her office hours! She is a GREAT source of help!

She is one of the best professors I have had. She is very well organized, clear in her expectations of students, timely in grading, and she obviously cares about students. She is respectful of and in fact wants to hear differing opinions and perspectives. She is kind, funny, intelligent, and interesting. We didn't have any tests in this class.
Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful. You will learn so much from her!

If I had to pick one word to describe Prof.Scott-Lowe it would be biased. If she doesn't like you... Good luck. If you have opinions I suggest you keep them to yourself, if you want a good grade in the class.
I was in her seminar class. I love her! She is super fun and cares about her students. I would definitely recommend her to anyone.
This class is very helpful, though hard to sit through 3 hours worth at times! Recomended.
cares for students, interesting stories, go to class and take/study notes-- then tests are easy..very nice person
The best professor I've had at Pepperdine. She has genuine care for her students and is willing to work with them. Take her for sure!
Strange bird, but I learned quite a bit.
No Comments
One of the coolest classes I have ever taken...I feel like I learned so much...It was cool to do service learning and field trips...a must for psyc majors
Easy class, usually time flew by, she keeps things interesting and is on a very personal level with her students. Loved the class and my grade!!
boring and very unfriendly
No Comments

I like this course of Prof. Goodman b/c the focus is not on the nit-picky rules of grammar and sentence structure, but how to write effectively to persuade your audience. Current events are often discussed and you get a little glimpse into the SAAJ course she teaches b/c of how often social issues are discovered. She is very kind and fair. Easy A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment: The class seems pretty easy but she grades TOUGH. She is very laidback in class but the workload after class is not a joke. I would say Dr. Goodman is a nice professor but you should really devote a lot of time to get an A. Besides, she takes her time on grading and does not always give clear feedback.

One of the best out there. She genuinely cares about her students and loves to show that. She grades a little on the tougher side but she teaches you a lot so if you invest in the class, it will be an easy A.
The best, if you put effort youll be just fine
Dr. Goodman is the best SAAJ professor! She leads great discussions, and is very committed to keeping the class experience-based. Not a lot of outside of class work.
Dr. Goodman rocks.

This class is pretty easy if you do all the necessary work. Dr. Goodman is a great professor. She keeps things interesting and talks about her interests and opinions. In comparison to other professors' ENG101 classes, her's seems the best.
Easy class. She grades a little tough but I would definitely recommend her compared to other professors I've heard about.

Dr. Goodman is amazing! Yes, you have to show up to every class and actually write essays. But I learned so much from her! She is also an amazing person; we had some amazing discussions, and she is chill enough that I occasionally forgot that I was talking to a prof. Can't wait to have her again!

Goodman is a hard grader, but completely willing to help if you take the time to ask. She lets you do rewrites for a better grade on papers, and tries to explain everything as thoroughly as possible. There are a few papers that coincide, and there's a midterm and final exam. She loves to joke around and cares about the students.  Good class
Take it from someone who normally does not like english. This class is durable. Dr. Goodman is helpful, and wants students to come to her. For English lite take Dr. Goodman.
Love, Dr. Goodman.  She's brilliant and that woman knows her stuff!  It would be a grave injustice to go through Pepperdine and not have her as a professor.
had her for 2 classes and LOVED her. i only wish i had had her earlier in my college career. she is always available to help and is very open to student ideas.

Not your typical English teacher.  She loves politics and makes a lot of arguments having to do with government issues.  Very good teacher... she expects a lot but just do your work and you'll be fine.
Yay technology!!!
Best professor I've had so far at Pepperdine. So smart and enthusiastic -- but be prepared to earn every single point you get, because she's also the hardest grader I've had so far.
DrG is the BEST!
The best english teacher you can ever have during your freshmen year.  I loved her.  she is hot for her age and she is very helpful.  Take her class if you can.
No Comments
GREAT!!!!
This Professor is Admirable,Respectful and  Straight-up Real. Show up, Participate in class and read your book and do your assignments 6, quiz 3 and you will do good. Great Professor and nice too.

I got an A on the midterm, paper, and final but he gave me a B+ in the class because I had three absences. He couldn't cae less that I had to miss class because my car broke down on the freeway or because my kids were sick.
boring as hell.  you can do 0 work in this class and get a B.

Good professor, yet really boring. He shows history channel videos. It's annoying that I paid so much for this class to watch videos. He is also a Nazi on attendance and showing up on time. If you miss class or are late, he will hate you and make it obvious.

Pretty good, interesting lectures. Mandatory attendance, but all the class has is an interview paper, a midterm, and a final. TAKE GOOD NOTES IN HIS CLASS to do well on his tests, but he talks fast so it's kinda hard. Although he grades tough, he is SUPER helpful on giving feedback of all changes needed to get the A on the paper and test questions.

He is a cool teacher but extremely boring!! The test questions are some what hard because they have to be extremely detailed and hes not the easiest grader.  Not my favorite teacher but the class wasnt too hard for the work that was done.  Grades hard though on the interview paper

can't even tell you how easy this class is. just go to class and pay attention. i never read a word of the text. he doesn't engage the class at all, just straight lecture. it gets pretty boring, but if you can actually focus and take very good notes, he gives you the questions from the test and you find the answers. write a lot on the test though.

One of the best professors at this school. He really knows his material and is extremely intelligent. Makes good use of class time, and gives helpful outlines for each lecture. I rarely used the book - just took good notes - and I got an A. He gives great feedback also! I learned so much, Prof. Scott was funny and very fun to listen to. Great prof!

Good professor.  Pretty easy and really interesting.  Worked for the CIA and can speak French and Russian...his experience shows.  Take his class if you can, you won't find a more interesting history prof
He is really interesting and nice, I got an A- but I put in some work most people get an A or B at the least I definately reccomend him.

He is a great professor, lots of story and tape, his class is relatively easier than others, but one thing, you must go to every single class for 2 hours, no leave early, never class cancel, but you really learn, and find "fun" in history
