Prof. Scott is great, especially if he finds you attractive. The class is pretty easy, but interesting.  Sometimes I was disturbed with his fascination with the more risque side of history, but overall he's a good teacher and I learned a lot.
Boring, but easier than the other professors!

A really interesting class. It can feel like an eternity sometimes, though, 'cause he just lectures straight for 2 hours. Tests aren't bad, and neither is the paper. Covers material that most teachers don't (dark side of America).

Hard to open up, but great teacher.  Touches on topics like slavery and Native American history that are often largely ignored.  All you have to do is go to class and pay attention.  Dry humor, which is funny once you recognize it.
If ur a hot chick its great! he's nice and helpful but BOOORING class. VERY VERY EASY!
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.  it wouldn't be so bad if you could ditch but he takes attendance.  this class is so boring.  its two hours but it feels like four.
VERY BORING and monotone, but easy class.

He is a very nice guy, especially if you are cute.  Very thorough explanations, good lectures, and comforting yet obtrusive personality.  Very single...as in unmarried.  Sit in the front row; it is difficult to stay awake in his class.

By far one of the hardest and best professors at Pepperdine. Super smart and intelligent guy. His classes are incredibly hard, lots of readings and graded on a very few things. Accessible outside of class and is always happy to help. I recommend him because you learn so much but not an easy class by any means
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: The class is lecture and discussion focused, so reading is pretty important if you want all those points. Also (when I took the class) your entire grade was 45% essay 1, 45% essay 2, and 10% participation, so if your writing and critical thinking is a challenge, this class might be very difficult.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Blakely is knowledgeable and passionate about the course. However, he doesn't let you use computers, only has two grades in the class, and rarely gives out As. He has two long essays for midterms with very confusing prompts that he either assigns over a break or only gives you the weekend before finals to complete. Good luck in his class!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Blakely is a highly intelligent man who knows what he is talking about. Unfortunately, he grades and lectures at the level of a law professor (WAY too rigorous for under graduate). In this class, you are lucky if you get a B. There are only two grades and one he assigned over spring break. Honestly, class really does make me want to die.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Participation grader and three papers. Requires a lot of reading outside class and will call on you randomly throughout lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Blakely is one of the best professors I've ever taken. There is lots of reading and participation is crucial because an hour of class is pure discussion but trust me you will have some of the best discussions of your life in this class. He is always available to help and you will take away valuable life lessons from this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Make sure you read the homework before going in to lectures. If you aren't a skilled reader, go to his office hours and ask questions because it helps a lot!! Do not think that your questions are dumb because the majority of the class is definitely confused too; but know how to ask questions that show you've critically thought about the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: One of the best Professors at Pepperdine. His class is exactly what a higher education class should be: tough, but fulfilling. You take out what you put in. Don't be dissuaded by the heavy reading and difficult concepts.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Blakely is brilliant, but he is a very tough grader. You have to read, but some of the reading is very hard and hard to understand.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Blakely's class was a tough one, and he does not grade easily. That being said, he is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is a brilliant man but also truly values his students' ideas and encourages dialogue. His classes are half lecture and half discussion, and all of his exams are essays based on assigned readings. No quizzes!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Blakely is an amazingly knowledgeable professor, and he does a great job at clearly and aggressively diving into texts. Some of the concepts are difficult to grasp, but if you do the readings, it will definitely be worth your time.

If you have space & time to take one of Dr. Blakely's polysci/philosophy courses & are genuinely interested in reading and learning more about what some of history's greatest thinkers wrote about, enroll! He's Incredibly knowledgable, Lectures are 100% worthwhile to attend. 1 hr lect., 1hr discussion, helpful in developing critical thinking skills.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Lecture puts reading into perspective of larger ideologies. Hard to stay motivated to do the readings, though, since the lectures cover all the readings.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Pepperdine is lucky to have snagged Blakely. He's great and you learn so much. Structures discussion to help you think through your opinions. He's very intellectual, but don't let it get to you. Always willing to help you out. Tests are challenging, but won't be too bad if you do all the readings (cannot stress enough) and DO NOT CRAM.

Very tough class. The theories are not hard to understand and are actually very interesting. No tests, but your entire grade depends on 4 essays. The essay prompts are easy to understand, but impossible to answer. Lots of participation debate in class so if you're not the eloquent type, you pretty much live in the shadow. Very harsh grader.

I love Blakely he is an absolute awesome professor and person.  Unfortunately as a professor and a Seminar he is way too tough.  He was very helpful but didn't have a ton of office hours.  Get Ready to read and if you don't go to class good luck understanding.

Professor Blakely is an excellent lecturer, I understand all the theories and ideas he tries to explain in class. However, he is a VERY harsh grader. if you thought you were pretty good at writing essays, think again. His prompts are easy to understand but very difficult to answer. You need to be very logical and philosophical to take this class.

He is a new prof, but one of the best in the poli sci dept. I found his class challenging, but if you do the reading, you'll be fine. Not an easy grader, but he's very fair, and you'll for sure become a better analytical writer. I agree with everything said above as well (esp flexibility with office hours!!!), and I highly recommend him!

Truly an excellent class. I enjoyed the lectures and discussion. The reading load was heavy and time consuming, but manageable (Prof. Blakely was flexible about making changes to the syllabus as well), and above all interesting. It is good to have a professor who is passionate about what they teach. It was also a class with lots of applications.

Dr. K is super helpful to her students. Her lectures are totally clear but if you need extra help then she's always willing to be there for you! She makes class very relaxed and she's a great professor.

I hate math with burning passion, but she helped me to like it a little. She over explains, and will help you if you do not understand. Very good professor. She is also sweet, she always brings in treats for holidays.

Not a bad prof, just not the greatest one ever. Nice, but lots of homework, really picky on grading (grades every problem for correctness). Seems to play favorites with girls. Her tests are not predictable. Her final is way longer and harder than the other tests, so don't let her fool you, cuz your grade WILL go down.
hard. lots of work. but i LoVeD her!

Very clear lectures and explanations, always available during office hours and willing to help. Takes student evals seriously and cares about good teaching. Gave extra credit for dressing up on Halloween, how great is that?
Covers all the material necessary to succeed in class. Gives examples beyond the text, and clarifies the text. Keeps concepts clear and understandable.  One of the best math professors I've had.

She doesn't put her students first.  She's not usually available for help during office hours.  She didn't want to have a review for the class (even though she had one for her other classes) because she went to a 4 hour picnic.  I don't think she really cares about her students.
One of the clearest teacher's i have had. Actually explained in great depth each day's topic!!! Props for Dr. K!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Dr.K is awesome and class is fun. She even took her pants off once. Do your homework and go to tutoring with the TA once/week and you'll be fine. Warning: Strict attendence and late policy! Late HW not accepted! NOT PROCRASTINATOR FRIENDLY!

She is extremely clear, and if you don't understand a concept she approaches it from another angle. Her expectations are clear from the very beginning, and if you study then you will do well. Very friendly and willing to help. She is an asset to Pepperdine. Class focuses on activities/projects.
Dr. Killpatrick is the best teacher I've ever had.  She knows her stuff; She's fair; She's nice...She's the best.  I reccommend taking as many classes with her that you can.
Made a hard class as good as it gets.  Very effective teacher.  Truly cares about students and wants everything and more for them. Fair grading and tests.
good professor. helps you out a lot! available and fun!
She's really fun. I loved the in-class activities.  I definitely recommend taking her!!!
always available for help, made math as interesting as it could get, which isn't much, but she gets points for doing it.
Great teacher! Very helpful in and outside the class!! Willing to go the extra mile!! I really do suggest her for all math classes!!!
Dr. Killpatrick is super cool.  she used to be in the circus (honestly), she went to Stanford, and was Miss Teen California.  If I had to describe her in three words they would bet hot Hot HOT!!
No Comments
solid

She is the best. A great person and teacher! Participation really matters in this class. If you do not show up or do not speak in class, your grade will plummet. But, if you show up and engage in discussions, you will certainly receive an A

She's very cool. One quiz every week, open note. Not understanding at all about attendance, you pretty much have to be at every class. Discussion posts every other week. Very particular about the word count on those. Midterm was easy. Takes a while to get back to emails. She's very knowledgable and her class is super interesting. Highly recommend.

She is a great communicator and is clear for all assignments except the final exam which was much harder than any previous assignments. Genuinely wanted to get to know everyone in the class and we would have frequent life updates in the class. If you are more on the quieter side you may not enjoy this class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Super sweet teacher! Focuses on making students comfortable with speaking, and less on technical critiques. Super down-to-earth too.
A good human but exams are tough

She changed my life during the pandemic. I never knew a professor could care so much about students. She put in a lot of extra time to make sure I understood the material but then also took time to check in on all of us during each class. She does meditations to help us relax and is really genuine in her lectures. She is very funny.

I LOVE professor Smith. She is one professor that I know I can always go back to and count on. She's hilarious and she makes lectures so fun. I've had her for COM 180 and COM 200, and for both classes I LOVED her! Make sure to participate and turn in your stuff! She gives quizzes so be prepared for class on your readings!

She is very funny and tries to make the lectures interactive. There is a lot of quizzes but she helps you make up for your low scores at the end of the semester. She is really good at teaching and cares about her students. If you don't miss a class and participate, you will get a good grade.

Dr. Smith's lectures are very easy to understand and memorable. She tells you exactly what to expect on the midterm and final. Read the textbook because most students don't do too well on that section of exams. The 2 hardest things are a 10 page paper & QQCs (all or nothing).

Professor Smith has to be my favorite professor at Pepperdine by far. She has that balance of being a professor that knows/cares for what she is teaching while also being SUPER funny and caring. Her material is not easy to understand if you dont study it, but she does her best to make sure you understand w lectures! I LOVE HER, HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Probably one of my favorite professors and classes at Pepperdine. She is super passionate about the topic and makes everyone else feel it too! She is hilarious and makes the class super interesting! 10/10 would recommend her for this class! Pretty easy A if you're willing to do some work!

Her final for our class was nothing like the study guide which was completely different from the midterm where she was very specific and helpful on the study guide. I raved about her on her course evaluation then she wrecked us with that final and our final project. Went into the final with an A- came out of it with a B-.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Smith was absolutely incredible. She made lectures enjoyable, and the class was very interactive. There are many different components to the class, but as long as you stay on top of things, you will do just fine. She has clear expectations and is very straightforward with what she expects you to know for exams. Take good notes!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Smith is honestly one of my favorite professors I've had at Pepperdine yet. Com theory can be a very boring subject but she made it super fun and as interactive as possible. Basically all you have to do is show up and participate and it will be an easy A. She can be unprofessional at times for a professor but I ABSOLUTELY LOVED her class!

Professor Smith- formerly Williams- is different and not for everyone. She will stop her own lectures and tell us that she is bored so we can switch to something more interesting. She is strict about deadlines which can be a problem. She was very helpful during office hours. She made a lot of information feel easy to learn. She is the realest.

Dr. Smith is a very smart and outgoing professor.  If you're concerned about political bias, she does go off on left-leaning rants from time to time, but she's also very respectful of students to choose to disagree.  Her first-year seminar is fairly easy and she often lets out class early.
This was a morning class but I loved going. The prof is fun and funny.

She's a great professor. In fact, she's honestly one of my favorites. I wish I talked to her more during class/participated. She's funny, and makes the class fun and interactive. There's pop quizzes, but don't worry about them too much. There's some papers that aren't too bad. Her exams seem a little hard, but their really not.
There was lots of information but she is always smiling and seems to love teaching which made me want to be in class. Seriously funny. Very helpful with papers.
GARY SELBY IS THE BEST HUMAN ON THE PLANET! SO SMART & INSPIRING & CARING & INFORMATIVE & JOYFUL!  ***HE ACTUALLY TEACHES IN A WAY YOU WILL UNDERSTAND & REMEMBER!***  TAKE ANY OF HIS CLASSES YOU CAN!

My favorite professor of all time. REL 301, The Life and Writings of C.S. Lewis, is a life changing course. Gary's enthusiasm for Lewis have successfully turned me into a groupie as well. His knowledge and setup of the class (discussion) really make the course so intriguing and fun. You get to dive into theology and really learn about yourself.
SELBY IS THE MOST AWESOME TEACHER AT PEPPERDINE!!! He is really inspiring and I look forward to going to his classes.

He is one of the best professors at pepperdine. I am a business major and I took 3 classes from him because they were so good and interesting. There is work to do but it is all on point and worth while

Dr. Selby is amazing!  He explains the subject well and is very passionate.  Read the book when assigned cause you can bet on a reading quiz.  The final project isn't especially difficult but work hard on it cause he grades harshly.  He isn't the easiest but you will learn alot and you will love him cause he is such a sweet person

I had Dr. Selby for 587 and 588.  He is fabulous!  One of the best professors at Pepperdine. He is brilliant, engaging, cares deeply about his students and is passionate about what he does! Rhetorical Theory is a horrible class, but Dr. Selby makes it barable. He is so inspiring and brings a smile to anyones face!  You have not experienced Pepperdi

Selby is a great professor. He is so enthusiastic about com. research, and he checks back every so often to make sure that his students grasp what he is saying. There are a couple of papers to write, but he tells you exactly how to do them, so they're not hard at all. As for tests, study the notes off of blackboard, and it's cake.

My favorite class at Pepperdine so far! By far one of the better professors in the Communications Division. He is passionate and his teachings are clear. Sticks to the syllabus. The class I had with him was 3 hours long, and it seemed shorter than the ones that I had for an hour and a half. PLEASE take Selby if at all possible!!!!!!!

Professor Selby is a great instructor.  His class was demanding with all the papers, but he has a genuine passion for his work and for his students.  I struggled in the class and ended up with a c+, but it was still one of the most rewarding experiences at Pepperdine to date.

Prof. Selby is honestly the greatest, kindest most helpful teacher I've ever had. Although you have several papers, he walks u thru them so they are easy. And the tests are easy- he gives u an outline to study from, so use that and you'll do great. I got an A on everything,and it wasn't that hard. Plus, Selby is awesome! the nicest prof ever!!!
The nature of this class is difficult but, I wouldnt take it with anyone else. He is a great teacher and will go out of his way to help you. Be prepared to work and KNOW THE NOTES FROM BLACK BOARD!!

What to say!  This class was extremely difficult in the beginning but once you learn what exactly he wants, it gets so much easier.  I am actually glad that I took it with him and not another professor that would make it too easy.
AWESOME! the best professor I've ever had!
People who take this class with other profs say it's a cakewalk. But with Selby it's a lot of work and the tests are nuts.

JEEEEESUS! This is the hardest class i have taken to date.  Selby is a paper nazi ... There is so much material its hard not to fall behind and go nuts. Selby is a fun guy.  He takes his shoes off during class and walks around with a comb in his back pocket.  My class thinks hes a drug addict.  Nice guy but makes his class soooo hard!

The CLASS is what's hard.  No matter who you take.  Selby is fun and always laughing (even at 8am).  He assigns tons of papers and work but walks you through them so there's no way you could miss it.  I like him as a guy, but the course material is just too much for 8am.  If you must do it, take it later.

I enjoyed this class....though it is challenging and does take hard work, it is feasible-do be prepared for his tests though!!!! And make sure you pay attention to his notes cause they seem to get a bit confusing at times.....overall, he is funny, nice, and very smart!
No Comments

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS...or, if you must take this class, take it with any of the other professors who teach it. The average grade of our first test was a D..and he didn't curve it at all!!! If you want to write two papers a week, take the class. I had never received anything below a B on a paper, until I took Selby. STAY AWAY!

Good person/enthusiasm overall but extremely difficult class. The steps are very hard to follow and I wish they were given in a more concrete step by step manner. Tough grader and office hours are always very packed so maybe set up a private session if you have questions.

Extremely hard class because he assumes you already know about the topic. He explains things very fast and it's impossible to keep up with him. He makes snarky remarks in class which often makes the class feel uncomfortable.

He conveys difficult information really well. If you go to class and pay attention, you'll do well. There are 2 exams (midterm and final - noncumulative), both worth 40%, and a group project worth 20%. There's also a chance for extra credit. The group work was hard, you work in a group of 6-7 people for several weeks, but it ends after the midterm.

Go to class. If you go to class and pay attention and participate, this class is simple. I liked it, and think he's a great professor. His lectures were pretty good and he is a funny guy. If you slack out in classes and don't try to understand the content than you'll make it difficult for yourself. I recommend him.
Kiss your mental health goodbye.

Attend class! He thoroughly explains and makes sure everyone understands. There are 8 homework assignments and 3 major exams including final. If you put in the effort, pay attention, and take good notes you will get a good grade.
Great teacher, makes grading very clear. Pay attention in class and you will do well on the exams.

I love Dr. Shearer! He is one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. His class is incredibly structured, well-rehearsed, interesting, and even fun. He really considers the best way to help his students succeed, and as long as you come to class and practice when you don't quite understand, you should easily get an A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: At the beginning of the semester, I honestly didn't really like Dr. Shearer, and I was really struggling in his class. However, he begins to grow on you and once the material clicks, it's honestly a very easy class. Though I ended up doing fairly well in the class, it was mostly thanks to the help of my peers, not his teaching.

Dr. Shearer is my favorite professor in the business department so far. He is extremely organized, personable, and is always working to improve his teaching and adapt in order to help his students succeed. It's not easy subject material, but if you put in the work at the beginning and make good efforts to understand and learn, you will do great.

Dr. Shearer is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. He is so incredibly kind, and if you go to office hours, he will make sure you pass. However, his class is EXTREMELY hard. Some of this is just out of the material (business is stats is tough!), but he also doesn't explain the material well in class. Go to office hours, and he'll help.

I took Shearer for both BA 216 and BA 452, and I hope I get to take his class again before I graduate. He is respected among the university and loves students who care about learning, and he gives amazing letters of rec if you get on his good side. His grading is very fair and he's always willing to help. He's my favorite professor in my major.

Dr. Shearer is a good, personable professor. His lectures are straightforward, and he is open to questions; his tests aren't too hard. There is a midterm (30%), Excel group project (20%), a final (50%), and an extra credit game (+1 -3% extra credit boost). There is Excel and R in this class, so it can be hard if you haven't used them a lot.

Great guy but not the best professor. He sometimes will ignore you when your reach out for help and goes through material without fully explaining examples. This makes hw and tests extra difficult. I wouldn't take shearer for a stats-based course if you really want to walk away knowing the material.

I really loved this class and professor. The material is straight-forward and not hard as long as you actually pay attention in class and don't wait until the day before the exam to study. There are many resources that he gives you that are similar to the test and homework. He is very intelligent and willing to answer any questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: Hardest pre-business course at Pepperdine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: He is definitely one of the best professors I have ever had. The class was not as hard as it seems to be as long as you have some mathematical background. He is a good lecturer but he is not extraordinary on explaining certain concepts. The grading was not bad at all as long as I spent some time to prepare.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Do NOT take Shearer if you have the option. He's a great guy and obviously super smart but his class is MUCH harder than the other BA 216 section taught by Tien. He is also not very good at explaining things, and expects you to memorize like at least 20 formulas per test. He tries to make office hours available, so I guess that's a plus.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Super Great Guy.  Very difficult to keep up in his class however.  Very fast talker and if you space out for a minute in class you will be totally lost.  That being said, he is a funny and personable guy who if you reach out to in office hours really clears up any confusion and will go the extra mile to help you understand the subject.

Communication Ethics with Dr. Hook was a great class, the discussions truly push you think about your personal values. There isn't homework other than reading for weekly quizzes. No tests, instead it is 2 long presentations/papers that she is a tough grader on. Not an easy A, but it is possible with hard work and consistent in-class participation.

COM 200. She's excitable and fun. Weekly quizzes for the assigned readings but they're open note/book. Midterm and final are closed notes/book but she provides study guides that help a lot. Beginning of sem started out easy but things started to pile up. Manageable though if you stategize. She's the best.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--So many papers

comment: Dr. Hook is one of my favorite professors of all time. She is an amazing professor who wants to genuinely help her students. Her class might have a slightly heavier workload than other COM 180 courses at Pepperdine, but the bit of work is worth the amazing class environment and the great professor. I would recommend any student take her class.

She doesn't take late assignments so if it's late you'll get a 0. For her final, you need to know definitions and examples of everything on her study guide. Need to have your speeches memorized because if you forget, it adds to your time which means you will get 5+ pts. marked off. Go to office hours as much as possible to discuss speeches.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Dr. Hook is the best professor ever, she always made us crack up in class with her stories and always motivated us to do our best. she will be your #1 fan, she is a tough grader but gives great feedback. One final exam and 3-4 speeches but she is there to help you throughout the whole process. I am going to miss her class, she is awesome

A lot of people complain about the difficulty of Dr. Hook's COM180 class, but if you're naturally smart and treat her with UTMOST respect, it will be a breeze. The memorization is not that bad, neither are the pop quizzes. Dr. Hook is clever, interesting, and funny. Also really hot. I found myself actually wanting to go to my 8AM that semester...
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Online Savvy

comment: Hook is fun and engaging, I will give her that. But she is an unreasonably hard grader and is not understanding. You will not get the A you are looking for, attendance is mandatory, and there are pop quizzes. Do not waste your time, it's only a GE. Opt for Fike or Wilson instead. FYI she will make you memorize 10 minute speeches.

I LOVE Dr. Hook (I had her for COM200). She is my favorite professor I've had so far at Pepperdine. She has high expectations, but she genuinely cares about her students' success and is really helpful with questions. Her readings aren't bad compared to other classes, and all of the content from the midterm and final is straight from the readings.

Dr. Hook is by far my favorite professor I have had at Pepperdine. She gives pop quizzes sometimes on the reading but they are not hard at all and she is very lenient with grading them. She is such a kind person and really cares for her students and wants them to do well in her class. She is also very funny. I 100% recommend her class.

She made the class very interacting and fun to be in. She was very understanding when it came to overwhelming course load and gave a "Life Happens" pass to turn in late work. She did give Pop Quizzes and if you missed the class during these quizzes you were not able to make them up. Also, you had to memorize entire speech, no note card.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Hook is sweet, understanding, and an angel. However, I would not advise the average Pepperdine student to take her class. Her grading was extremely harsh, and her policies were overly strict. On our last speech, if you went one second over, she would immediately take 20% off, and "BSed" speeches were an automatic F. This is JUST a GE. beware.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: As a person, Doctor Hook is great, but as a teacher, she is a bit frustrating. She is not understanding in the least, and would not round my B+ up from an A-, though it was .09 away from it... I missed a pop quiz because she decided to have one the day after Thanksgiving and I was not back yet, as I live 1,357 miles away, and I received a 0 for it.

Dr. Hook makes COM180 a really fun class. It is a tough class to get an A, but if you put in the effort, you will at least get a decent grade. She puts a lot of effort into her lectures, and the class is very engaging, even at 8 am. You will learn a lot, and she is definitely worth taking.

Dr. Hook is a great teacher. Be careful of pop quizzes as they are kind of specific. You don't know when they are. You will learn a lot in this class and really improve in your public speaking abilities. It is a tough class, and A's are hard to achieve. Practice a lot. You do have to memorize speeches, but it makes you a better speaker.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I LOVED Dr. Hooks class! Shes definitely a tough grader, but shes so kind and teaches in a way that you will only benefit from. Its also very obvious that she cares so much for her students, and the class all begins to feel like a family :)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: I LOVE Dr. Hook! She is caring and very passionate about the subject, which makes it an enjoyable class. She is a harsh grader, but ultimately it makes you a better public speaker. She is definitely one of the harder COM180 profs, but Ive learned a lot. She makes the environment really comfortable, but speeches are stressful with no notecard.

Great teacher. I feel that I have improved tremendously in her class. BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES!! Especially in the beginning, she gives pop quizzes frequently on the readings. There are quite a few impromptu speeches, but they are kind of fun. Dont underestimate the big speeches. Have fun and be ready to learn.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had Dr. Hook for my fall semester of freshman year and I absolutely loved her class. I was in her 8am COM 180 class and although you do have to put in the work, she makes it so fun! She made the subject interesting and made me consider communications as my minor because of how much I have learned. 100% recommend to anyone!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had Dr. Hook for my 8AM freshman public speaking class. This was her first semester teaching at Pepperdine, and I am so glad to have had her as a professor. She is extremely caring and accommodating, and although she is somewhat of a harsh grader, you learn A LOT of applicable life skills in her class. 100% would recommend to anyone. Love her.

He spends the class time rambling about personal stories. He actually fails to teach anything covered on exams. He is completely unavailable outside of class and if you ask him a question he will be sure to avoid it and go off on a tangent.  I might as well have taken the course without attending class because I learned everything from the book.

TERRIBLE professor. Spends class going off on pointless tangents instead of actually teaching. When he does teach, he goes too fast for anyone who isnt already an expert in Physics to understand.  Lots of homework almost every night; his tests are extremely difficult and he offers no review at all.  Avoid at all costs.
Uses WebAssign for homework. Tests are extremely difficult (but he curves it for you). Random pop quizzes. I thought this was a very difficult class but he's funny and he loves physics.

Lectures are a little boring and not a lot of meat to them due to many tangents.  Weekly journals get repetitive.  Tests are fairly easy if you glance over the chapters and are curved.  Overall seems like a nice guy, but is a little hard to talk to and get to know.  I thought it was kind of an easy class and the labs are fun!

Physics is difficult any way you look at it.  Now I know why you take high level math courses.  This is math in motion.  He made it very concrete, especially for me, who had life experiences from the college of hard-knocks, but no high level math background.  He was very encouraging to me when I struggled, and empathetic when my daughter got sick.

Ammmmmazing. Kite is one of my favorite teachers at Pepperdine. His field trips are great and really made science come to life for this advertising/english student. I llooove Prof. Kite! He really cares.

Guy has a real passion for his students understanding, but during class moves to fast if you have not taken physics in the past. Very available outside of class for help. Takes awhile to get used to his teaching style, but overall a good guy. Would suggest getting some type of  other book to help(ie shaums outline), book for calc based physics is b
I got an A in the class, he's funny...reminds me of the guy from "king of the hill" he has his days when he rambles on and on about physics and he was teaching a MATH 104 class. he's cool

Awful teacher.  I went for help and got nothing.  He told me to work with other students and I would learn better.  Okay that's nice but still i pay you to help teach me.  What a waste of money.   I don't see how others say he is helpful.  He talked about crap and said to go work with groups.  Hello, I came to you for help and you tell me this!
haha.  i don't know about sexy, but dr. kite was my favorite professor at pepperdine.  he is EXTREMELY passionate about science, and it rubs off.
If it wasn't for Dr. Kite, I wouldn't be where I am today in my life: career-wise, spiritually, and attitude.
Hard to listen to, rambles on and goes off on a million unimportant tangents.  Boring and unclear.  Takes late work.

Don't get distracted by the gold tooth or the random stories, from wildebeest to earthquakes. He loves science, and like any good science prof, is a little weird. Bring him rocks from random places, he'll love you. His social skills can seem somewhat lacking.
Great man who has a lot to give. tests are hard but he cares that you learn and are excited about science
No Comments
At first it's hard to not think he's crazy, but then class was so much fun. The lectures didn't help me out a ton: it's more rattling off facts. So do the readings.
Likes to talk cars, tell stories, makes physics fun though lab is hard.
Watch  out for his soap box talks, but otherwise very sexy
Her class is different from your average Religion 101, but she is a very caring and flexible person. As long as you pay attention to the lectures and have a bible your fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Pretty great religion teacher. Fluent in Hebrew which is EXTREMELY valuable for teaching the Old Testament and she's only in her 30's.

It's nice we did memes instead of weekly reading quizzes. But I had her twice a week & for every class we had to do a disc post, 20-40 pages of reading, daily meme, and response to memes. If you don't love religion, it's going to be annoying. The study guide is broad, so you end up studying for unnecessary things, but tests were open note/book.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I am not sure why there are so many bad reviews! I thought Prof. Palomares was super sweet! I think there was a good balance of homework and lectures. She was not the easiest professor, but she was willing to hear your perspective and as long as you did the readings, you were good to go. I thought the class was enjoyable!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Palomares’s class made me hate my life and it made my semester very difficult. For a GE she assigns a lot of homework and we not only have to read 20+ pages every day, we also have to write a one page comment about it analyzing the reading which she grades twice a semester. She treats the class as if it was a major class. Harsh grader.

I just want to come to Palomares defense here and say I really enjoyed her class. I promise I wasn't her favorite student and she wasn't my favorite teacher but the class wasn't even that hard and I got an easy A- with no prior religious knowledge. I highly recommend everyone give her a chance. As a GE this was right on par

REL 101, a GE class, should not be as difficult as this professor made it to be. Considering that a majority of her class failed the midterm (class average 57-60%) she was forced to give extra credit opportunities and make the final an open note/PowerPoint essay so that kids would actually have a chance of passing her class. 0/10
Prof Palmores's finals are confusing, as they don't come out of her slides, nor the material she has given. Don't take unless you want a tough time in REL101, especially for a three-credit course.
She's so bad. Never take unless u wanna hate ur life.

Professor Palomares is one of the worst teachers ever! Her tests are super hard and consist of random things embedded into her 30+ page powerpoints. The class average for her tests is incredibly low. Since a majority of the class is barely hanging onto a C, she gives extra credit opportunities and does group quizzes to raise the class average.

1. Talks a lot about random subjects, TALKS A LOT ABOUT POLITICS! 2. Inserts nothing in the grade book until the very end so you have no idea how you're doing. 3. Pulls test questions from random slides off of her unorganized powerpoints. 4. STUDY GUIDES aren't helpful for the test 5. Doesn't post full SLIDESHOW due to "copywriter" violation

Classes are political and oddly structured. Many activities have little to no correlation to actual course material. Her papers are quite difficult and involve a lot of external research. Quizzes include specific details from extremely long and dense readings (down to the verse). Take someone who is more experienced and has better teaching skills.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Professor Palomares created a poorly structured class that has more to do with politics than the OT. It was very noticeable that she was inexperienced as a professor. My grade suffered because of that. She fulfilled her nonexistent ability to teach with guest speakers and youtube videos. The material on the final was nothing like the other classes.
Do not take. Brings politics into an Old Testament religion class.
NOT A BORING, JUDGEMENTAL RELIGION CLASS!

Her papers are really impossible unless you have a prior foundation in the old testament. My dad has his master's in theology, and he said that he did not have to answer essay prompts like these until he was working on his dissertation. I literal had to have my dad half write my essays to get an A. 12/10 would not recommend her.

Take anybody else if you can but please save yourself and avoid her. Lectures are very boring, quizzes are too specific and there is a lot of useless assignments. Is not understanding of issues during COVID and grades harsh on essays. There are a lot of good professors especially for this class and I recommend someone else for a better experience.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Palomares is very understanding, and her lectures are engaging and easy to comprehend. She is very personable, and it feels like you get to know her along with the material. Oral final is pretty straightforward, and you really get the grade you earn. One downside, VERY WRITING HEAVY. Long discussion posts every day. But very sweet person.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The only complaint I have against him is that he's sort of monotone and speaks quietly at times. Never to the point where you can't hear him but just enough so that if you're in the 8am, you're likely to fall asleep. I LOVE the movies he shows. His lectures, cases and examples are all very interesting. Wrote his own law book. 1st test=hard 2nd=easy
He can talk about some random stuff in class for sure but he is a pretty sharp guy and will always help you as best he can. Business Law was a good class.

He is very flexable. Class Participation is a must. And you must read before class.(especially in International Business Law. In regular Business law, his test were good. usually 50 mutliple choice. In International Law, he was way more challenging. He used a projector to facilitate the test. You long had 2-3 mins to answer a question.

Elliott is simply one of the best teachers at Pepperdine.  I got an A with him in B Law and just finished Service with him. I highly reccomend taking him for service. very chill guy.  Calm, relaxed.  Very flecible.  There is no reason why anyone cannot get an A.
Elliott is great--my hero! He's smart, nice, and dresses cool.  Yes, you have to work, but it's Business LAW, so it's important.  He wouldn't be doing his job if he let us slack.  Take him for sure.

Service Leadership is relatively easy if you follow two guidelines: 1)commit to as little as possible; 2) start your final write up early. Elliott is a nice professor, but does have his tantrums. Class time tends to be wasted on everything but the project itself. There's no real clarity in the class either; You just go and do your thing.
This cocky guy... everytime you ask the man a question, has a cocky 'im better than you' smirk on his face...

The class can get boring but this guy is really cool. he knows alot and has great life experience. he memorizes all 88 student names on the first day which is annoying because you have to go but he is really sharp. tests are straight forward and he is a very nice person. really great class/teacher
way cool guy

Great guy all around. Not sure what the hot & not is all about since I'm a guy, but he seemed pretty cool to me. So if you happen to see a class of some interest and he happens to be teaching the class, jump on it you won't be sorry.  P.S. no I didn't

I've had him for 2 classes now and BOTH were off the hook.  Super smart man who is well connected and has a resume a mile long.  Quiet natured but sharp witted, respect him and he'll show you how to kick ass.  Great guy.  Do the review he gives you and be sure to note his cycle of embroidered polos.

A good teacher - probably one of my favorite business professors.  He actually hands out evaluations midway through the semester to make sure he's doing a good job and studens understand the material.  Tests aren't bad as he's a pretty fair grader and the final is 50 multiple choice questions.
No Comments
I learned a lot!  He's funny!
Great Prof!  Knows his stuff!
Great professor!  Excellent!
No Comments
No Comments

She has topic assignments that are a good chunk of your grade. Plenty of time is given to do these assignments but it was hard to understand where the grade I received was coming from. If you make time to go to her after class, you can ask but it is harder to do in Elkins compared to smaller classes. Retaining details from readings helps on tests.
rating_tags: Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Penner's class was eye opening for me.

Be sure your ready to read because there is a lot of it in this class. Despite being a lecture class with 100+ students your attendance matters with the unholy amount of in class writing that are all graded. Her slides have no useful info in case you do miss class and her tests require you to know and memorize way to much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Penner is a very great and engaging profesor. Her lectures are great as they are not information heavy yet prepare you for the tests. She also allows for the option of not taking a test and instead doing projects that are fun, easy, and give a great understanding of the lessons. Professor Penner also is very open to meeting and helping.

Lemme tell you how to pass with an A then I'll say my opinion. Before tests, she gives out a study guide. Put them in Quizlet and go into learn mode and memorize every definition. Go into the writing center and have them help you with topic assignments. Overall the class was boring and she pushed liberal ideologies. Easier than Psych and Econ.

insane expectations, expects to have literally everything memorized including statistics from data. not enough time to complete assignments, not clear instructions. 3 tests including midterm and final, vastly different from each other, impossible to study for. curve and topic assignments are what saved my grade somehow. took in elkins...i'd avoid

Penner is very caring and is willing to help. Her class is not hard but her tests are specific. KNOW ALL OF THE TERMS. There are topic assignments that she grades pretty easy so if you do bas on the tests you can fall back on those. Read the articles bc they will be on the test and take notes on the videos she shows. Very lecture-heavy. Lots of EC

Just know the key terms and you will be fine. Also, put good effort into the few assignments she does assign because they are a large chunk of your grade. If you are unsure about how you are doing on an assignment, meet with her for a few minutes to make sure you are on the right track. It is very simple.

For somebody who is not a math person just trying to fulfill their GE credit, this class met that need. Definitely not an easy class, there is a lot of homework throughout the course, however you have the option of either a project track or test track. Very good lectures, sums up the assigned readings well, and gives clear guidance on assignments.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: The overall class experience was good for a GE course. The tests required a lot of studying on key terms, outside readings, and material found in the lectures. However, the lectures were very well structured, typically covering the textbook readings thoroughly, but not the outside readings. Professor Penner was good, and the homework was never alot
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Penner is not a good teacher. Her lectures are very hard to sit through and the quizzes have almost nothing to do with the lectures. She is also a very hard grader considering the lack of rubric or instructions that she gives. Overall, I would not recommend this class. It is not worth it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The absolute goat. An extremely caring and nice professor who is always ready to help you out. You can get an A by doing just the bare minimum. If you need to take SOC be sure to take her before all the Athletes or seniors fill the class up.
Dr. Penner is a great professor who puts a lot of effort into her classes and genuinely cares for her students.
Dr. Penner is the best. She met with us weekly, and it showed she *actually* cares about us. Online learning is online learning, but she took the time to check in every week.
The GOAT at Pepp

Professor Penner is a great professor. She made sociology interesting despite it being in an online setting. She is kind and cares for her students as well. She is a very fair grader. Understand the material and you will easily pass. Her class is designed for you to pass and not be stressed.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Free textbook. Easy homework but you still learn a lot. She is kind and caring I would 100% take her again. If you want to learn but also have an easy class, then take her!

dr. penner is one of the best profs i had at pepp. she genuinely cares for her students and has changed my experience at pepp for the positive. i might change my major to soc just because of the impact she had on me.

"Good for you". Mullen is a awesome guy with tons of great experiences and stories to share. Cares about students and is fair to everyone. Take the time to meet him and he will help you succeed. Sad to see him leave Pepperdine in 2015.
Great class , interesting.
GREAT TEACHER! take him!!! very easy, relevant, good stories, appreciates students, teaches good practices
Great teacher. Appreciates your participation. Will respond every time with a "Good for you". Focuses on the big picture.

My absolute favorite professor at Pepperdine, by far. Incredibly smart, kind, open, funny, personable, and likable. Willing to help students in any way possible, whether with class, jobs, internships, or interviews. Really cares about his students. Experience as executive with Arco, so he knows his stuff. He was my mentor - we still keep in touch!

BEST professor I have ever had. He's understanding, easy to talk to, FUNNY, has great personal stories, easy tests, open to feedback...just overall the best professor here at Pepperdine. Mullen is more of a friend than a professor. You can talk to him at any time for any reason, just go and relax in his office. I love this man!!! He's a hottie ^_~
Mike is the man!  The best teacher I have ever had.  Makes class fun and is always willing to help outside class.  Take his class!  You will learn a lot and he will not stress you out.  Mike rules!

Best class ever! Best professor ever! He's like a big teady bear, VERY father like! most of all he is completely genuine and willing to go the extra mile with you! I expect to get an A in the class and I never even bought the book!

Mike is awesome!  I was only at at Pepperdine for three semesters (and two summers) but I took three of Mike's classes: Human Resources Management, Organizational Behavior and Current Issues in Management.  Mike had so much information to share, and real life experience.  I work in the HR field partially because of him.  Taking Mike's classes is partially what made attending Pepperdine such a great educational experience for me.
Sweetest guy ever!  I always looked forward to his class.  He is very helpful and makes classes fun.
WITH OUT A DOUBT, HE IT THE BEST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD.  HE IS THE SWEETEST MAN TO EVER WALK THE FACE OF THIS EARTH!!!

I had him for both HRM and Service.He is great. he will push you hard in Service but you don't mind it. He is sooooo practical and knowledgable. Wants his people to do their best and he will help. His class was the  best part of my day! The best Prof I have ever had. "Good For You" & "
Take this guy he's the greatest! GOOD JOB, IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS, ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS ASK. Learned a lot and very applicable to life.
The BEST!
Great!  Just Great!
too easy, over simplified but overall a good experience
He is awesome.  I learned a lot and enjoyed every single class I took from him.
best teacher i had here.  Genuinely cares about the students and teaches w/o pay

Never had a worse professor. He is unclear, unfocused, and talks more about politics than any professor I have ever had. Grades ridiculously hard. Seems like a nice guy but I would never take a class taught by him again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Do yourself a favor and don't take this professor. He's just, not good. Especially for a summer course. I tried to get interested in the class, but this is just not a course that anyone should take during summer, especially with Dr. Wallace.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Took COM300 in a 4 week summer session which everyone I knew recommended against because the class is dense. However, Wallace adapted the schedule well and as long as you start working on the paper early on you will definitely have enough time to do it by yourself if thats what you like. He is willing and available to look at drafts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Wallace, in my opinion, was a great professor. As long as you do the reading, take notes on the reading, and pay attention during lectures, you will get a good grade. I recommend working with a partner for the paper because it is a long one. Stay on top of your work. He re uses questions from quizzes on the tests.

Tough course but is very meticulous in outlining what it is required from all students. Very straightforward and measured. Pay attention to readings and review your quizzes for an A. Has a teaching formula that, if you get used to it, will help you know what will be on the test every time.
I strongly reccomend not taking research methods from Dr. Wallace. He is a terrible lecturer and has a terrible personality.
Research methods is a tough course and he taught it in four weeks.  He was very organized. He was helpful and availible but what was I thinking for taking this course in four weeks.
You know what is requited of you with Dr. Wallace.

Didn't adjust course to summer schedule which really made most of our class very stressed. Lectures are very incoherent. Quizes are direct reading comp., and tests are cut and paste quizes. Seems like a good guy, but not a good teacher.

He wasted our time and money making us do HIS research on a topic no one was interested in or cared about.  One of the worst classes and profs I've had at Pep.  Learned nothing, got slammed on grade because I had no idea what I was supposed to do.
No Comments
Test are so bad, and he is a nice guy but has problems
funny guy but often unclear- uses reading quiz questions for test questions... doesn't look for linking concepts or expanding ideas- grades based on how well you can spit back the book
tough course but he got me thru it.
Very funny and entertaining but a hard class!!
Funny/Quirky guy. Pulls at his hair. It got hard at the end w/o pwr pt.
Ended eash sentence with  what's going on , although he never quite knew himself
Hilarious guy...Great teacher and i couldn't stop laughing at his humor

She is a great person. HOWEVER, when I would meet with her before speeches to discuss specific questions, she would only give vague answers and repeat the same VERY BASIC information given in class. Then I would give my speech (meeting all of the rubric criteria) and get a TON of points off for things I was NEVER told I had to do.

Professor Yoshimura is awesome. She does a great job in preparing you for your speeches and organizes the class in a way that is always fun and engaging. She also does mindfulness on speech days which is super helpful and gives good feedback on every speech.

Yoshimura treats this course as if it's a 300 level instead of 100 level. She presents herself as caring but was unmoved when I had conflicts outside of class. She's overly critical of minute mistakes during speeches. You must participate every class and work hard to get an A.

TAKE HER!! I don't think she's a tough grader at all honestly, a lot of people in my class had no experience speaking and she graded them pretty fairly. If you put in the effort you'll get an A in the class.

If you can manage to get into her class, DO IT!! She is amazing and seriously one of the best at this school. She is caring, but constructive. The workload is not tough and she grades fairly. She makes the 2-hour block fun and engaging. Can't say enough good things about her. She is the best!!! Love her so much.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: One of my favorite professors at Pepp. Get on her good side early on! Really cares about her students and gives you in-depth feedback after each of your speeches. I was a confident speaker before taking her class, but now I feel unstoppable. You get to be creative with your speeches and she likes to have at least one fun exercise per class. Love!
Super fun class. I used to dread speaking in front of people and speeches but she made the class so enjoyable. She grades fair and based on if you improve throughout semester. Super sweet and caring.

Pretty good professor. She is very nice and caring and truly prepares us. What I didn't like is that she is very tough grader when it comes to your speeches. You really need to prepare a lot because the slightest mistakes can really make a bad impact on your grade. Overall really great professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Whoever left those bad reviews is for sure the same person who's salty they couldn't get an A in her class. She's an amazing professor and, although she's a tough grader, she made this class fun and engaging. Just put in the work like any other class and you'll be fine.

She's a tough grader but very sweet and understanding. If you have something going on, just communicate with her and she will be helpful. You will learn a lot and her feedback is helpful. Also, the class is engaging a lot of the time with the activities she does.

Please do not listen to the negative reviews about Professor Yoshimura! She is a hard grader but if you carefully follow her guidelines and treat the class like it matters you'll do great.  I love her lectures and time passes by quick in her class with all of her activities.  4 speeches and 4 application assignments. Take her!
Accidentally gave a five before on the bottom
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: One of the most selfish graders of all time! She is not easy when it comes with grading!
It's safe to say how garbage she is as an educator
She is God awful!

Professor Yoshimura is my favorite professor I've had! She teaches, clearly, loves what she teaches, and prepares you really well for the real world. Every class has one or two class "activities" (games, etc), so if that's your kind of thing you'll have a blast. Speeches are well spaced out and she gives you plenty of prep time. Amazing professor!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof. Yoshimura is amazing for COM180. I looked forward to her class since it was mostly activities, and these helped me feel very comfortable speaking to my fellow classmates. She had clear rubrics for speeches and graded fairly. No tests, just some small quizzes that were from her slides and free textbook. TAKE HER, super kind, young, and fun!

I wasn't excited to take COM180, but Professor Yoshimura made it a really great experience. You have 4 big speeches throughout the semester and she gives really good, detailed feedback for each one. You're also graded on 3 quizzes but as long as you do the reading and take lecture notes they are very easy. Definitely take her if you can!

Half lecture half activity-based lesson plan so it isn't boring at all. She grades fairly and truly cares for students. There are 4 speeches (three are short and one is a huge persuasive speech). Definitely recommend!

A Fantastic professor who is an expert in her field. Everything is clear and she has a deep passion for art. Genevieve has certainly reshaped my view art and inspired me in so many ways. We've been in touch after college and she still always makes herself available when I need help. She is one of the most influential people in my studies and career

Genevieve always encourages students to be better. Her 2D and 3D Design courses are some of best courses you will take, because her projects are unique.  My appreciation of art has definitely grown after taking her classes and she inspired me to pursue a career in fine arts.  Take any one of her classes and you'll see what I mean!

Sculpture 2- Be prepared to work really hard in this class and log hours in the studio on your weekends and after class. The more time you put in for this class, the better your projects will be. Genevieve will hold you to a high standard in order for YOU to benefit from YOUR effort. She can give you unmatched direction with your project if asked.

3-D Design- This was a great class because Genevieve gives you more freedom with your projects. You have the chance to create a more mature body of work that can be used for your professional portfolio. My advice is to really listen to what Genevieve is saying because she has much professional experience in the design world and is here to share it.

Genevieve Freeman teaches the basic design elements well. This is a great class to begin your art career with, as she teaches the foundation for everything you will create hereafter. Genevieve will grade your projects harshly if they look like you just threw them together. Do a good job and you will be rewarded with a matching grade.

Pro. Freeman's Art 106 was excellent. I decided to take my first art class my senior year and she made the transition easy and unlocked my passion for design. Her class taught me many techniques I still use in my art. We have kept in touch since graduation and she has aided in my acceptance to grad art school. She is my most memorable teacher.

I took as many classes with her as I could. I loved her class and learned so much from her. You have to be willing to work hard in her classes, but it is definitely worth it. It is a college-level course! She is fair, but not easy. She is the most dedicated professor I ever had at Pepperdine.

I am a professional artist who had her when I went to Pepperdine. She tries really hard, and truly means well. She plays favorites, will bore you to death with three hour classes, reading text aloud. I never received below an A in any art class except hers.  She has a closed mind, not respected amongst faculty. She shut down the ceramics program.

i was excited to take this class for minor only to find out that it's a joke. the teacher critiques you in front of the whole class and she clearly plays favorites. she expects WAY too much out of a lower division class. she acts like we can spend however much on art projects to make them look good. dont take this class unless u have to.
she is very dedicated to her students students and is open to new ideas she is fun and relaxed as well
excellent professor; u can learn a lot in her class, and the class is also fun.

her class is so very much fun. you go into it with an open mind and realize that even though you may already have an emphasis, that is it important to explore other media and techniques. she is a wonderful teacher who really cares for each student-- in at out of the class room.
Great job!

Genevieve is warm and very helpful. Her class is challenging but very rewarding. I have taken other classes similar to this one and feel that I have still learned so much. I feel this class has laid a strong foundation for work in the design world and life in general. In her class hard work counts!
Gr... she's so bad at teaching. Very elementary with having to do vocab. She's a harsh grader and if she doesn't like you, you're screwed. Don't take her if you dont have to.

This class is so much fun!  You get to work with so many different mediums.  If you're at all interested in design, you should take this class!  She makes it fun and challenges her students to do their best, which allows us to improve, and to think more creatively than you knew you could!

Genevieve does an awesome job of presenting her class with a wide variety of projects, and exposes her students to ideas, and ways of doing things, that is interesting and fun.  She encourages her students, both in the classroom and out.  She is dedicated and enthusiastic, and is an Awesome teacher!

Toxic...awful teacher. Ruined any interest I had in taking other art classes at pepperdine. I've heard only similar things from everyone who has had her. I am sure she is a great person and a nice lady but my advice is to stay away from her classes...

Dr. Bennett is amazing! He is hilarious and very caring to all of his students. He is very knowledgable of chemistry and actually gives real life examples during lectures. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS! He will teach you everything and anything during Office hours, and will give big hints for tests. I had little chem knowledge before, and still did well!

CHEM 310L. Great Professor! Prof Bennett wants you to understand what you are doing, not just get an A and leave understanding nothing. He loves and respects each of his students, but expects hard work and respect back towards him. He is there to help with school or life, whichever you choose. I recommend him 100%, but be ready to work.

I really liked this professor! I was hesitant about taking chem again after my bad experience with AP, but this professor has made me like chemistry again. He has a lot of neat tricks for remembering things. The games he plays are fun, it was definitely giving Q. I wish the school would let his teach 121 I really wanted to take him again!

meh. be ready to self study. kinda rude and is unapologetic about it. 100% picks favorites, if he likes you he might go easier on you. never know with him. he sets a very humorous tone for the class, doesn't really like super serious things. not big on accountability from his side, just tells you to do better. good heart but rough professor.
The best professor - super glad I had him for g-chem 120. Wish he taught 121 too. He actually cares and is a great professor!

Took him for Chem 310. Super qualified and writes MCAT-level tests like nobody's business. More importantly, he is a good human. I went through a dark time when I took his class. His caring and empathy towards my academic AND mental well-being meant a lot to me. I may hate Ochem. But at least I can say I am still here and alive today to hate Ochem.

Dr. Bennett is an incredible instructor who makes the material accessible and does his best to instill confidence in all of his students. He made distant and confusing concepts feel attainable, and cares deeply about the academic AND personal success of everyone in his classroom. Very easy to get to know. Great resource, friendly, and intelligent.

Professor Bennett cares about his students and helps them as much as he can. He is considerate of different circumstances and gives students the opportunity to earn their grade back. His office hours are the best place, he will explain everything until he is sure you've gotten it. He obviously truly cares about his students and will help in any way

I had the pleasure of having Professor Bennett for both CHEM120 and CHEM310. All around phenomenal instructor and human being. Lectures are extremely engaging and his courses are filled with tips and tricks for the class and future classes. He is very understanding of the subject difficulty, and if you put in the work, you will do great.

Prof. Bennett has been one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine. You can tell he genuinely wants everyone to succeed and will always explain concepts in office hours until everyone understands. Lectures are fun and helpful for MCAT prep!!

CHEM 310. Dr. Bennett is an amazing teacher who genuinely makes learning so much fun. He is the best professor I have had at Pepperdine. Ochem is a very difficult course but the community spearheaded by Dr. Bennett made it significantly easier to learn. I genuinely miss the course. I have made lifelong friends all thanks to Dr. Bennett.

CHEM 310. He gets off topic super easy and isn't the best lecturer. He puts a really complicated example up  tells you the answer, and says "it was basically common sense". Had him for lab too. Very disorganized. Gets mad when you underperform, but never taught you what was needed to perform. Paid 20k to get screamed at and never taught anything.

Great professor and always has office hours or at least is willing to meet with you to help grow your understanding of the class material. Super funny and does a lot of thinking outside the box type of chem questions that help you. Show up to office hours & put in the work and you'll do great.
I love this man and sad he doesn't teach 121 :(...
The best chem120 professor! Would take him again in heart beat. Actually cares about your well being and always helps when you ask.

Don't look at the one bad review! He is the most caring professor I've had at Pepperdine and can't wait to have him next semester for Chem 121. You get what you give. Go to lectures, office hours and ask for help if needed! Tests are fair and he gives partial credit, even on multiple choice. Far from "fake," the student probably just didn't care.
I hated him he is fake nice.. don't buy it
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Bennett was one of the best teachers I have had at Pepperdine! I found passion in chemistry again through his teaching style and genuinely learned so much from him and his experience with chemistry. He is a professor I look up to and would want other students to have the opportunity to get to learn from.

Professor Bennett was the best chem professor I could have had. He cares so much about teaching and learning. He's funny and really wants to get to know you. He always provides resources to help and teaches you good tricks for chemistry. Midterms are 10 questions all multiple choice and quizzes once a week. If you can take him for 120 do it!

She is a very nice person but her course if far too difficult for a biology of plants class. The lab is extremely challenging. Constant quizzes and the material is rigorous. I would recommend taking any other professor possible. She does not help your grade and you could study twenty hours for her exams and still fail.

Prof Holmund seems to be always leafing us in the dark. Her passion for plants is so rooted, she often branches off topic, leaving us lost in a forest of facts. Great for the ferns, not so much for us. Hoping for more human interaction, less photosynthetic fascination.

Hard tests that incorperate lecture, lab, and outside reading material. Lots of readings, mini-essays, research proposals, and a multi-week group project. A nice person, but a ridiculously tough grader and not very considerate or understanding about outside circumstances. She seems to think your world should revolve around her class.

Her exams will test your character and will to live. Though the exam time is 50 minutes, rarely do you have time to go over your answers to be sure. She will single handedly rip all enthusiasm for plants out of your heart and smile and giggle like everything is okay. If her one-liner robot responses don't make your cringe, your GPA will for you

She organizes her course to include every possible thing on the exams. Rather than having exemplary information for learnings sake, she will include any and everything on exams. This includes very long scientific papers, vague information given in lab, and random other things ON TOP of all lecture and textbook material. Prepare to read lol.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She is very caring and is the most enthusiastic professor you will have at Pepperdine. She is super passionate about plants, which makes things difficult because she expects you to have as much knowledge and passion as her. There are too many projects and papers on top of studying for her very difficult exams which require textbook reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Accessible outside class

comment: Least favorite class that I have taken at Pepperdine. Extremely difficult with a ridiculous amount of work required, especially for a lower div class. Tested on small, irrelevant details. Not only are there multiple large projects in this class, but she grades them very harshly. A kind person, but makes her students dislike botany.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: She grades extremely hard for her class for no reason whatsoever its as if she wants students to do poorly. Like she gets a High from it. Her grading is absurd and unnecessary. No wonder know one likes plants and animals.
Her tests make me want to cry and She/Monzón dont pass them back once theyre graded. Her multiple choice section is near impossible and she is not helpful if you ask her how to study for her tests.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: I like Professor Holmlund but she makes you read lengthy research papers and then write about them. She grades them really hard and tests on the most minute details of the papers on exams. Her lectures are lengthy and her PowerPoint slides are dense and she doesnt get through them during class so you have to complete it on your own time
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Took her for ecology while it was co taught with Dr. Monzón. She makes the class way harder than it needs to be and her sections of the exams are extremely difficult. She is unwilling to give points back on assignments even after she realizes she graded wrong or unfairly compared to Monzón. Do not take her for this class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Maybe the kindest person I have ever met, and also extremely enthusiastic about science. She would always be available to help outside of class and would go to extreme lengths to make sure all my questions were answered. However, she grades extremely hard and there were more assignments than all my other classes combined. Get ready to study, a lot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: She is the nicest professor I have had so far. That being said, she is NOT the easiest. I've had her 3 times and in the first 2 classes, her lectures were so organized, and the test material very clear. However, I am taking her this semester for Bio213 and it is HARD. Literally so unorganized and all we do is read, tests have impossible questions
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: Caring is an understatement. There are few professors that I've had my entire time at Pepperdine that meet the level of charisma and intentionality that Dr. Holmlund embodies. Don't mistake her excitement for anything other than genuine love for what she studies and passion for teaching it to others. One in a million, a true giver & brilliant soul.

LOVE HER!!!! i took ecology, biostats lab and environmental politics and policy with her. She is so caring, so enthusiastic and such an amazing professor. If you have the option to take her, do it! You won't regret it. She is so kind and a great teacher.

Biostats lab with Dr. Holmlund was so much fun! Although it was online, she makes it all the better by helping us with homework every week. She truly loves what she does and it shows when she lectures on RStudio. The homework was pretty difficult, but I'd make sure to do the most you can during the weekly lectures. Also, take the project seriously!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Holmund was by far one of my favorite professors. She is SO accessible and understanding. She is very enthusiastic about what she is teaching and is always willing to answer questions/ help! I loved learning from her and getting to know her during office hours. If you can, I highly recommend taking her class !!!

Dr. Holmlund is an incredible professor! You can tell she puts a lot of effort into teaching the course effectively, and she really wants to help the students succeed. Her enthusiasm may initially feel fake, but then you realize she just genuinely loves what she does. I highly recommend taking a class with her; she's the best.

Just do the minimal amount of work she assigns and you'll get an A. Only two formal speeches, and she's super helpful and clear. Don't lose the syllabus and don't ask her questions that can easily be answered by the syllabus. She's super sweet and sassy.
I Did not prefer this class at all....too difficult.

I went into this class expecting it to be difficult (which it was), but Ms. Simas made the subject fun and exciting. The class was challenging but not any moreso than should be expected from a collegiate level course; however its obvoius that she wants you succeed. Pepperdine kids are just lazy and want grades handed to them.
She is a very nice person! Pepperdine just wasn't the place for her, people there don't expect to work and can't deal with people who challenge their backwards way of thinking.
She is definitely hard but she does care and is willing to help you out if you make the effort to go to her office hours.

The worst teach I've ever faced by a mile. She doesn't grade hard but its just "weird". She is always moody. She's lazy(admitted herself). She always has that "okay..? and then?" attitude whenever someone asks her any question. Rude to "hot girls" prolly cuz of jealousy. MOS DEF DROP this class if you think you're hot. I'm not even lying. Trust me.

Called "the toughest speech teacher" by many, grades very harshly and has tons of requirements for speeches and other assighnments.
