Very helpful if you talk to her in her office however expect to work hard and be blindsided by the insane parameters for speeches and the random content on her tests. If you can switch out, do it.
Too many requirements. You have to do a lot of work that other teachers don't require

Sometimes she has an attitude, but deep down she really cares about students. If you make an effort to come to her office and talk to her it will help. She has a ridiculous amount of requirements for everything, but it actually makes it easier because if you follow them exactly you know you'll get a good grade.

She is so rude.  Do not take this class unless you really love public speaking and it is a talent of yours.  Simas will make you work more than anyone would ever want to for one class.  this class made my semester really miserable.

She's awesome. If you want a speech teacher that you will actually take something that you can use out of the class, then take her- if you really don't care, then take any other speech teacher that Pepp offers. All you have to do is talk to her, give her the time of day and use her office hours. She wants you to SUCCEED! I suggest the class to any1

You think she's cool in the beginning, but after the second class you realize how much she sucks.  If you want to work harder than any other class you've ever taken, go ahead. She puts down the worst guidelines and expects you to understand them.  She is the worst grader and her overall sympathy for the student is non existent. DO NOT TAKE CLASS!
No Comments
She expects a lot, but if you follow her guidelines it is easy to get an acceptable grade.  Know what she expects and you will be fine.
No Comments
No Comments
not a cool teacher.
No Comments

The sweetest first year seminar professor ever!! Essays and tests aren't hard, almost everyone gets above a 90 on the essays. He is really passionate about Germany, and has everyone sign up for an office hours appointment one time so he can get to know you. Has everyone participate, but it doesn't feel overwhelming. Freshman take him if you can!!

Herr Dowdey is the best, sweetest professor at Pep. He genuinely cares about his students and gives you many opportunities to do well in his class, because his tests aren't easy and are mainly memorization based. The class itself is really easy though, and I had more extra credit opportunities and less homework than my friends in other classes.

Memorization is the only way you will pass. The vocab quizes are based off of 75-100 terms from the last page of each chapter. He is bad at explaining - didn't learn anything. Didn't understand our class when we were answering or asking questions. Bonded with my classmates because of our mutual dislike of him as a professor. Nice man, bad prof.

Dr. Dowdey is the sweetest and most caring man. His tests and papers are pretty easy, while his essay grading is very nice (everyone always got a 90+). He is passionate about what he teaches and incorporates his own experience and opinions into his classes when applicable. Loves his family and is overall a great man.

Dr. Dowdey is maybe my favorite person ever- I had him for my first-year seminar and I wish I could take his classes every year. He's so caring and sweet, and takes time to get to know you. If you make an effort to get to know him or participate in class he will seriously appreciate you and continue to be excited when he sees you in following years

I LOVE Dr. Dowdey! I took his first-year seminar and absolutely loved it. He is such a sweetheart and is always excited to teach. His class is very easy if you read the materials and pay attention in class. Take him if you can! You will love him.

I love this man so much! He is the most adorable, kind hearted professor I know and I absolutely loved having him as my freshman seminar professor. I was very sad to find out that my seminar class was only one semester because that meant not being able to see him everyday. ): He was a great teacher and taught Nazi-Germany in a different way!

My hope is that one day Dowdey adopts me as his grandson, he's an unbelievably kind and helpful professor. I've heard he isn't the most clear professor for German, but as a seminar teacher he is possibly the best possible option to introduce you into the Pepperdine community, and the grading is beyond easy which is a big step towards starting off!

Amazing professor. He grades you based on your own potential/growth compared to the rest of the class, which is nice in an upper division class with a lot of variety. His priority is on making you appreciate and learn the language, not on grading and toughness.
he was my seminar prof and he is like the cutest old man ever i love him!  he's so nice it's so obvious how much he loves his students.  he talks about his family a lot it's adorable.

I LOVE HERR DOWDEY! I want to adopt him as my grandpa. I only went on to take an extra German class because I love him so much. Take him if you can, and make sure to ask him stories about his grandchildren, it's precious! The class is relatively easy and not time consuming. Just memorize the grammar and vocab and you're golden.

Herr Dowdey is amazing! He's so enthusiastic about German and teaching. He tries to keep the class energy up even when students lack interest. He's very passionate about teaching his students and is overall incredibly genuine. Tests and quizzes are easy/very clear. He is very accommodating for make-ups/sick days. Loved his class, take him!

Herr Dowdey is the best!  He is really easy, but if you apply yourself you really learn a lot of German.  Barely any homework and tests and quizzes are relatively easy.  Trust me take his class, I was the only one of my friends not complaining about my German Prof. You will love his stories and old German style!

I LOVE HERR DOWDEY!  he is so funny and such a sweet man!  i looked forward to attending his class everyday.  there is homework almost daily, but it's not hard. tests are also about every other week, but completely manageable.  he sings and dances for the class, and talks a lot about germany and his own experiences.  TAKE HIM IF AT ALL POSSIBLE!!
he is the man! great teacher ...
Friendly guy. you can tell he enjoys his work.
Old-fashioned in a good way, kind, friendly and enthusiastic
cool guy.

Although Chesnutt is the sweetest man ever and is always there for his students (hosting study sessions, giving mock exam questions to students), his class is pretty difficult. Although he tells you what will be on the test and provides concise notes, his tests are pretty difficult and contain a lot of random history facts. I would rate him a 6/10.

I was on track to get an A- but then he gave me a terrible grade on our only assignment bringing me down a whole letter grade. Tests were too hard and the assignment was dumb. Also didn't get his grades in until the final day so there was nothing I can do. Too hard for a GE, would not recommend for new testament prof.

This guy is the worst religion professor at Pepperdine. His lectures are super vague and boring. Also, expect your papers and short answer responses on tests to be ripped apart for literally no reason even though you spend 12 plus hours prepping for both. Avoid at all costs!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I LOVE THIS MAN!!! Anyone who says anything negative about him below needs to re-evaluate themselves because Dr. Chesnutt is incredible. He is so sweet. He is so funny. I am so lucky to have experienced his class. All you need to do is LISTEN, take notes, study his ppts, & go over each textbook chapter (they're short though). Take his class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. Chesnutt was a nice guy and a decent teacher, I just didn't learn a lot about the new testament. The class was taught really as a literary analysis of the new testament rather than a theological survey. If you're looking to grow in your faith because of a REL class this is not the one. If you want an easy class this is it.

Chesnutt basically teaches this class as history masked as religion. I learned almost nothing about the actual religious aspect of the new testament, rather just the historical background. He rambles a lot, is often off topic and barely ties it back. I feel like it's a decently easy class, just so frustrating if you expect an actual religion class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He is very knowledgable and passionate about teaching this class but as someone who isn't christian, I feel very lost. It feels as though it's already expected that we have an underlying knowledge of the bible characters and stories but I do not. He's also a pretty tough grader and his tests are quite difficult. I'm an A student but not this one.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Such a cute old man. I don't know why he has negative reviews, but he is so kind and helpful and really knows the material! He is available outside of class, has study sessions for tests, and each test is really straightforward from notes and study guide. Take him!

Not sure why the ratings are so bad, but I really enjoyed taking his REL102. It is lecture heavy so show up to class if you want a good grade (you also sign a sheet to ensure you're there) but other than that, do the readings, pay attention in class and his exams are pretty straight forward. It is a bit boring but what do you expect from a GE.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Horribly boring lectures. Impossible to listen. Most kids do other things during lectures. Frustrating because the new testament could be made really interesting. Regret taking him for this class.

Professor Chesnutt is the most awesome professor at Pepperdine! He really knows his stuff and is very passionate about it which is great to see. His lectures are funny at times with his anecdotes and slides which is refreshing. Not too difficult of a class is you pay attention and stay on top of things. Absolutely recommend - love him!
He is very organized and clear. Everything is basically on his power point. A lot of memorizing. The Getty Villa paper is very interesting. Grade  three exams, two map quizzes, and a small paper.

Very knowledgeable and religious but understands that most people didn't want to take this class. Doesn't shove useless information down people's throats. Looks at the NT very objectively and historically as literary works. His voice is a little monotone but he is entertaining enough. No homework. Read, go to class, and go to review sessions.

Professor Chesnutt is a kind man who wants his students to succeed. He understands that the course is a GE, and he makes it interesting. I really did not want to take this course, but he ended up making the course interesting and made me appreciate the NT more. If you go to his review sessions he will help you. He is also funny.

Dr. Chesnutt is an excellent Professor!  His passion for the Greek language makes the course so much fun. His class is very straightforward: even though it's difficult & you have to study a lot, there's no surprises content-wise on quizzes & tests. His occasional Bible puns & epic sense of humor make the class very enjoyable.  Best Professor EVER!

Professor Chesnutt is fantastic. As long as you go to class and copy down the notes from the powerpoint (and read over them a few times) you'll do well on his tests. He loves what he's doing and his funny. I recommend him to anyone that has an opportunity to take one of his classes!
AWFUL. I fell asleep basically every class cause he's SO boring. He doesn't really help you with much. If you have an option, DO NOT TAKE HIM. I'll really regret having him
Absolutely terrible teacher. He doesn't give you any help to what's going to be on the test.  This class is just bunch of randomness.

This professor truly adds to your knowledge of history. His quizzes do require that you read, but I usually skimmed the reading and did well. He is a very passionate and accomplished historian and I would definitely take his class again. As long as you go to class and skim the readings, you'll do well! Couldn't recommend him enough.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Beeman is a great guy and a great professor. He somehow makes history super interesting. He's so funny and is super engaging in his lectures. He really makes an effort to interact with each and every student. I think he used to have a bad reputation, but after covid he became a more relaxed teacher. If you show up to class, there is no way to fail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Super vague lectures and is very unorganized. He is a nice guy who cares a lot and seems to be very passionate. However, he graded unreasonably and gave a lot of reading quizez that ask very specific questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Beeman is a really cool and funny guy, like I wish he was my uncle, not my teacher. His class just doesn't match his character. He really wants to teach and have the youth be educated on history, and with that he is passionate. However, there is a lot of reading followed by a lot of heavy written quizzes/tests that are graded crazily.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Beeman is a great professor. If you like history, he's even better. I found the easiest way to excel in his class was to 100% do the readings, and do well on the quizzes. They're not as bad as other people have said -- if you don't do the reading, obvious you're going to do poorly on the quizzes. One of the most passionate profs at Pepperdine.

I was initially worried about taking his class (bc of the reviews), but there was nothing to worry about! Beeman is a wonderful professor and he really cares for his students. There is a lot of reading, so you will have to be on top of that! Also, make sure to pay attention to the lectures because they give you answers to quiz/exam questions.

Great teacher (funny, interactive, caring) but it takes a ton of work to leave with an A! Tons of reading and difficult tests but he will go easy on you if you reach out for help. Btw, he will know whether you read the assigned materials or not!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: i found his lectures pretty interesting and hes clearly very passionate about the subject, but the readings are SO HARD and he doesnt help you with them, so the essay questions he assigns are on your own. he also makes it very clear when hes dissatisfied with the class but doesnt seem to care about what the students think or ask how he can help
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Get ready to read

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! Workload insane. Required to read 3 400+ page books that were so hard to read & impossible to finish. had quizzes on them which were really 4-5 page essays like every week. Learned nothing. Tests way too long. More work than my upper div science classes. Lectures unorganized. No slides only rambling AWFUL
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: The hardest class I've ever taken but ive never learned so much. Beeman's truly an interesting lecturer. The quizzes are so hard and he grades on a curve. There is a textbook reading every week & a quiz, 2 books, and a research project. YOU HAVE TO READ. This is an extremely hard class but I found it rewarding. U got to work hard for your grade.

He talks on and on FOREVER, and gives a quiz every week. He definitely has favorites, and is very full of himself. Not a bad professor but likes to assign HUNDREDS of pages of reading a night. My advice is don't take him if your not wanting to put in WORK, because he makes classes intense.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: STAY AWAY. I took him after hearing that among the hist 204 profs, he was the best of the worst. he is noticeably biased towards students who he likes. he refuses to let you know your grade until the end of the semester. lectures and grading are scrambled and inconsistent. half of his midterm was just vague fill in the blank q's w no word bank.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: All around ok guy that knows the subject very well. A lot of quizzes that can be confusing and a lot of essays. Doesnt put grades on courses so you dont know your grades throughout the semester. I thought I was going to get an A but ended with a B without explanation. Definitely picks favorites and grading is inconsistent so be careful taking him

literally the worst professor I have EVER had. I got an A on the midterm & ended with a C. he gives As to his favorites & hates everyone else. so biased in history. be makes the class so hard. please do not take him
Best Pepperdine Prof. So educated in his field. Made me actually care about the material. Very engaging. I wish I could retake this class because I learned so much. Reasonable exams.

Dr. Beeman is an amazing professor that wants the absolute best for his students. He is probably one of the nicest, smartest people I know. The only reason I got a B was that I did not prepare myself for the quizzes. There are quizzes every week that he GIVES YOU THE ANSWERS TO. Also for the exam, he GIVES U THE QUESTIONS BEFOREHAND. TAKE HIS CLASS

He's such a funny and inspirational man, but by God he has the craziest workload out of all the history professors. There's a quiz on the chapters in the textbook (American Horizons) every class, but they are impossibly long. He's pretty vague about what he wants (he says he wants detail, but also simplify a lot of events?) but his lectures are gr8
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--So many papers

comment: I highly recommend Gean! He is so kind and understanding and truly wants his students to learn. Take him if you can!!!

I learned nothing. Lectures were incomprehensible. Midterm and final both 40% -- crazy. They are completely open note, but I promise it doesn't really help. Random group project near end of semester for 10%. Attendance is mandatory (but I learned nothing by going to class). He curves sometimes. Gean is sweet but this was ridiculous.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This course is not easy like it use to be. Mid-term and Final are each 40% of your grade. They are both open book but it comes at a price-lengthy and challenging. His lectures can be confusing as well. As long as you listen attentively, go to office hours and tutoring, and doing and understand the homework; you will be fine.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Gean is so amazing!!! Although his lectures are not super clear and you do not learn as much as you perhaps could about the subject, he really cares about his students and his exams are really fair (some are even open note / book). He is an entertaining lecturer!

Great man and lovable professor. Throughout this whole semester, I haven't learned one thing. Goes on too many tangents during lecture which confuses the topics. Midterm and Final got harder. Not an easy A anymore. Beware of the multiple choice if taken.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Gean is very kind and caring, but his teaching style may not be easy to learn from. I personally had a hard time following his lectures, and had to ask him specific questions outside of class as well as kind of just figuring it out from the textbook and examples. He let us have open-note exams, which definitely helped to acquire good grades.

Professor Gean is a really nice professor, but you won't learn much in this class. I know nothing more about accounting than I did when I entered the class. He is super chill and laid back. He only talks the whole time and won't actually explain the problems just talk through them. If you do not have a strong background in accounting dont take him

Dr. Gean is a great professor. He is very nice, and helpful during office hours. There are 2 open-book/note exams, one group oral/written presentation, and some homework assignments. If you listen to him during the lectures, and read the chapters, you'll do fine. When it comes to accounting, the important thing is to stay on top of things.
If you think this class is hard, you shouldn't be at Pepperdine. It's open note, book, computer, anything you want mid-term and final...um, how is that hard?

The best teacher I've had at Pepperdine! Overall, a great guy. He makes accounting interesting and fun. He has a great sense of humor and is willing to stay after class and help you if you need. Tests are difficult if you don't study or attend class. Go to class and do your reading and you'll do fine and have fun.

Really cool nice teacher, always wears sunglasses. No HW or req attendance. Be good at teaching yourself. Tests are somewhat different from practice tests, unlike in Misch's class - final was mostly easy but midterm was way harder (and longer)than the practice test.  Great overall tho.

Good teacher, if you don't get along with the guy you are dumb. His midterm is really hard, but be sure to ask for the one from the previous semester and he will give you that. Nice guy, don't need to pay attention much

Dr. Gean "teamtaught" this class in the summer with his wife. I get the feeling that summer classes are a lot easier than his normal ones and a lot more laid back (we got out of class 30-45 mins early most days). Tests are open-book and not too challenging if you keep up and know your stuff
If you read before class it helps in following him in the lecture.  If you don't read then you're basically lost in class.  Not very good at explaining.  Tests aren't bad.  Great personality.
Had him for managerial accounting, Good teacher, fairly easy, knows what he's talking about.
He is good if you suck up or are an athlete. Will tell you what is on the test and is easy, but you dont learn anything
Great guy not very good teacher but easy... just talk about golf. Highly recommended for financial accounting

Dr. Smith is a wonderful professor! She's well-versed, passionate, & offers an organized but flexible schedule. She's willing to work with you when life happens but does still have expectations. There's a LOT of reading and a fair number of assignments, but just keep to the schedule, take notes, ask questions when you have them & you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Elizabeth is one of the nicest people at Pepp. She really cares about your writing, will give personal feedback, and holds you to high standards. I have sat down with her several times to completely flesh out articles and she is very intentional with her time. If you're looking to improve your writing, work with her.

Elizabeth is a truly inspiring and knowledgable teacher. She expects a lot from her students, but simultaneously makes the content and assignments engaging and interesting to work on. I've had few teachers as intelligent and insightful as her, and she makes class something that I look forward to going to and would not want to miss.

She's great! Does not waste her students' time so she will dismiss the class (often early) when she's done going over the day's material. She's serious yet really understanding, flexible, and great at what she does. I learned so much from her and definitely recommend her.
Where to start with Emmy-winning Elizabeth Smith? She's an amazing woman and a great professor. She is passionate about teaching and she's smoking hot. She also cares about her students.

Note: I've had her for like 8 classes. She cares about journalism and is easy to get along with, but she doesn't have the bandwidth or expertise to teach the variety of courses that she does. She rarely follows the syllabus, flakes on meetings/grading/providing feedback. She's a great person, but isn't capable of carrying the journalism program.
She is the best teacher I have had in college. She is really passionate about the news and journalism and equally as passionate about helping her students learn.

Elizabeth is a great woman! She's involved in so much but gives you a great perspective of the real world and how to manage yourself when you graduate. She cancels classes a lot, changes the syllabus a lot and is a bit disorganized as others have mentioned but you're almost guaranteed an A if you do the work and put effort into writing well.

These other ratings are ridiculous.  She's one of the fairest profs I've ever had, and really cares about her students.  Just stay after class to set up a time to meet with her.  The assignments are VERY reasonable, and the discussions are fun.  Get to know her outside of class... fantastic young professor with a lot of professional experience.

It takes her 4-5 days just to respond to your emails.  She is a journalism teacher usually, so she make you write a paper EVERY week.  They are short, but every week is a little much.  There's also 3 research papers.  If you're not a fan of writing, find a different professor for COM400. She grades decently, but I probably wouldn't take her again.

Do NOT take her class. She's a great journalist, but doesn't care about the students. You will never be able to reach her outside class, and she won't even be there for office hours. You'll never know when something's due, as there's no communication between her and the students and everything in the syllabus is subjected to change. Horrible teache

Overall, she's a good professor.  However, she rarely returns work and tends to put too much on the syllabus that we never get to. She's demanding, but flexible. Her classes are a bit disorganized and lack a clear theme. But she's always willing to help.

She had a lot planed on the syllabus at first, but then realized it was too much so took it off. When we had questions about assignments she would tell us we had stuff due that wasn?t due.    And it is impossible to get a hold of her outside of class.  But over all it was not a hard class, just some communication issues.

This class requires a ridiculous amount of work, but she's usually willing to help.  She's a stickler for rules and doing things a certain way though, so watch out for that.  Also, she relies on the text book to teach the information, so keep up with that.
Really great teaching skills. Better than the profs that have been around for years... I would take another one of her classes.
No Comments
She's a relatively new teacher but very professional.  Expects you to work but is very involved and willing to help and makes it as practical as possible.  Fun to talk to, very personal and friendly.
I had him for an ensemble, and he created a great rehearsal environment, set clear expectations, encouraged students/was not overly harsh, and wasn't at all the hell spawn the old reviews describe.

Took his Music Theory III course online and very disappointed. He jumps into something and bulldozes through it and if you don't get it, too bad. Also it was November and he was still grading things from September. If you don't get something he gets frustrated with you instead of teaching it. If you meet outside class he'll maybe meet with you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Norman Lincoln Hanks... Words cannot describe the incredible amount of anxiety and stress he creates for his students.  Knows the material, but approahces everything like his students do too. Not personable; Rude; Condescending. Wants us to visit, but I'm sorry, I'm not about to go ask for help from a man who constantly belittles my intelligence.

nLH is pathetic.  Unfortunately in the music program at Pepperdine it is almost impossible to avoid him.  Try to.  I have countless stories about this man which will turn your stomach upside down.  He misses the concept of music, constantly abuses power without authority, and is universally despised.
He's tough, but a really cool, nice guy. If you have problems, he'll do his best to help you. He wants all his students to suceed. Plus he's funny, has a cute little dog, and is even a bit cute.
No Comments
He is a joke.  He is the most pathetic, jealous, rude human being- he should NOT be allowed to teach anywhere any time.
THE WORST TEACHER AT PEPPERDINE UNIVERSITY HANDS DOWN!
Very mixed thoughts.  He knows his material and is prepared for each class.  The classroom environment is quite condescending and unpleasant.

stuck on himself, mean to students and thinks he's God's gift to the music department. sure he's a genius, but not all geniuses have people skills and are meant to be college professors. it's one thing to have a phD but it's another to teach.

Dr. Hanks is a genius.  He is hard because the subject is hard... those of you who don't get it, shouldn't blame him... stop whining and pay attention - you might just learn something from an incredible teacher.  He is entirely available to help his students and knows more than you ever will.

Really weird man and very frustrating to learn from. He assigns ridiculous assignments as if you have nothing better in life to do.He treats you like a child in your work and makes his students feel like they're completely incoherent. He grades with no mercy and you can never do well enough for him.
Passionate about what he does, strict, but does the job done, makes sure the students understand the matterial.
He is very clear about grading procedures: be there and on time, get good grade.  Pretty simple but not very fun, very to the point and without care for students he embarrasses in front of class.
I agree with student #1. He is cold and not a friendly person, likes to exert his power. He does not care about the students.  I would hate to be in his class.

Full of himself, completely focused on personal gain, couldn't care less for students, weirds out female students, CLASSIC little  big man  syndrome.. Students get NOTHING from him as a professor (unfortunately, music majors are forced to take his classes
very nice, funny, helpful!

Dr. Wilson cares about her students so much. She is a great teacher, and her class is engaging and fun. I took the course online during the summer in the four week version. There is a textbook, but she provides a free pdf version of it on courses. She grades tougher for each speech but as if you practice and put in work, you'll get a good grade.

Super easy class. Barely had to do anything besides a weekly journal and a group paper/presentation for the final. Only thing you really need to do is go to class and contribute to the conversations. Prof Wilson is so kind and a lovely woman. She has so much wisdom and insight. Take her!!

Dr. Wilson is a very caring professor and overall taught a wonderful class. I found her grading to be unfair, even doing well in her class. She would arbitrarily assign numbers on the rubric without any justification or reasoning as to why they were there. She was very sweet but could really improve on giving students better feedback.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Wilson always has a great attitude in class! She pushed deadlines for us multiple times. The only real work you put in is preparing and writing speeches. She gives you the prompt and schedule ahead of time so nothing is rushed. Do your research, follow the rubric, and be passionate and it'll be an easy A.

She is a tough grader, but if you do the work then you'll get a good grade. She is super funny and has great stories. You actually learn how to give good speeches, which I thought was going to be impossible.

Professor Wilson IS AMAZING!! She is hands down my favorite professor thus far at Pepperdine, and her class is my favorite class at Pepperdine as well! Prof. Wilson is one of the nicest human beings EVER!! She really does a great job of making you feel comfortable speaking in public, which most people are afraid of. I 10/10 recommend her class :))
Professor Wilson cares so much about what she teaches. She does a tremendous job in bringing out the public speaker within you and is fair in everything she does.

She is an amazing professor! She's tough and will love you tough but you will feel the love she has for her topic and her students. Be sure to read her rubrics for your speeches as she follows them very closely when grading them. Also beware of her midterm test, it is infamously hard so take very good notes during her lectures, they're so important
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: Is an awesome human being who can brighten your day and give really encouraging words. However, her qualities as a professor does not match to par with her qualities as an individual. Her lectures are pretty basic (it's a GE course), but her exams are incredibly difficult in the way that you would not expect. The answers choices are very ambiguous.

Professor Wilson is AMAZING! She expects a lot from her students but if you put in the work you will do great. Truly one of the most caring, personable, funny, helpful, and motivational teachers I have ever had. She makes the class feel like family! I'd recommend her to anyone and I wish I could take her again for more classes. She was incredible!

Professor Wilson is one of the best teachers I've ever had. She really gets to know her students, is hilarious, fun and understanding. Her mid-terms and finals are known for being tough but as long as you study & really know the concepts you will do fine! I couldn't recommend her enough. You will love her! Her class really feels like one big family

Definitely take Professor Wilson's class for COM 180. She is funny, caring and makes the class fun. She also makes those who are not comfortable with public speaking feel supported. Midterm and final are hard but if you really study and read the book you will be fine. 4 speeches but she really helps you get through them. She does expect a lot tho.

I love Dr. Wilson! She makes class so much fun. Speeches are relatively painless, but her written tests (midterm, etc.) are kind of on the difficult side, more than needed for a GE, IMO. Make sure you READ the textbook in preparation for them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Tests are tough

comment: hard teacher :( speech assignments are okay but the grading is rather hard but her midterm and final are really hard! regretted taking her as a teacher for this GE class. The midterms are unreasonably hard I actually studied so much for this class and thought I was going to ace the exams but I guess not.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This professor is a wonderful example of how to be an excellent human being. She will fill class with entertaining personal stories while also encouraging the kind of openness among her students that makes the class close so it's (theoretically) less intimidating when giving speeches. Absolutely take her, you won't regret it.

She is a really nice lady and is incredibly knowledgeable in her field. However, she is NOT the professor you want to take for COM 180. Even though it is a GE class, she treats is as though it is a normal class. Also, her midterm is INSANE. I studies for 5 hours, made a full study guide, and read all the chapters and got a C.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Very nice teacher. Good choice for public speaking. I love her question of the day. She will assign three to four impromptu speech, but she is not a harsh grader.

He's an outstanding professor. He's really chill and friendly; his class wasn't the easiest, but it required some work. He doesn't use the textbook much and lets you pick groups, so choose a good group.

Professor Conlin is super chill and personable. The class was quite easy and no busy work. Only a midterm and final (he provides a study guide) and a large group paper. Conlin helps with all the data calculations, which makes the project simple. His directions can be a bit confusing, but if you ask questions and participate, you'll do great!

Conlin is super chill, learned a lot in this class and he has real world experience. Class was always out early. Be very intentional and thorough in the semester project. Midterm and final came from online textbook quizzes (not mandatory to have book but keep this in mind for studying) and were hard but not awful and he curves. Really liked class!

It is so annoying that he is the only professor for this course. He is super unclear about everything. Never replied email. Never post any grade on Courses. Never gave any feedback on the group project. The content on the final was different from the study guide. Worst experience at Pepperdine. I'm usually an A student but got a B for this class.

Honestly the worst. If you want to take a stats class and like taking difficult tests for no reason take him for marketing! super confusing, especially on the project. Im an A student, but totally messed up my GPA. thanks!
I loved this class! Conlin always ended early and loved connecting with his students. Not much work outside of class (but one huge project). I would take again and again for marketing!
He's a cool uncle

Lectures are structured well and easy to follow. Applies many concepts in class to his past jobs. Has connections and brings in a few great guest speakers. The group project is really cool. He brings in a real company that needs marketing consultation and we we present our analysis of the company to them. Always get out of class early.

Principles of Marketing. Great teacher. Straight to the point, his lectures are outlines. test is multiple choice (a bit off from his lectures) almost always ends class a bit early. Really like his personality
The best professor at Pepperdine.

Conlin has a lot of real world experience to incorporate and his lectures are easy to follow with his outline on the board. Reading is not really required, but if you read before and can answer questions during the lecture w/ info from the book he'll love you.
The class overall is chill. His tests are very hard. The only part I did not like is that the grade relies on tests and a project. Conlin is a nice guy.

Second class with Conlin because he is one of the best at Pepperdine.  Lectures very straight forward and easy to follow and there is no busy work.  He brings in professionals to lecture to the class which is really interesting and helpful and his own personal knowledge helps as well.  Tests are hard, study using the online quizzes

Prof. Conlin is a great teacher.  He outlines his entire lecture on the board before class and uses it to lecture.  He has lots of professional experience that he draws on in his lectures. No homework, no mandetory reading.  Tests are hard, so outline the book and use the online quizzes, do well and be specific on the Final project, Great Prof!

Prof Conlin is a great teacher.  His tests questions come from the online study quizzes on the textbook website.  Make sure to read the material because his class entails him asking you to explain the material from the reading and it will be awkward if you don't participate in class.  Be thorough on the final project and you'll get an A for sure.

Amazing Professor that made class very enjoyable! Hands down the best professor in the Business division! His tests are pretty though, but it is totally worth taking this class. His real world experience makes the material even better!
Hes soooo cute! love, travis rice

He is an AWESOME guy, so friendly, and whenever he is in his office he goes out of his way to help out with in class or out of class stuff.  Explains everything clearly and uses his experience working for JD Power and a bunch of other places to back it up!

she is the worst professor in the entire world, completely useless, has no idea what she is talking about, terrible grader for speeches. complete waste of time taking her JUST DONT TAKE GREG DAUM INSTEAD

Be sure to attend class and read the text book as you go through the theories! She was super helpful when it came to explaining each theory and used TV shows and movies and discussion to keep class interesting. If you pay attention and study, the class is extremely straight forward.

Professor Lawrence was great. She kept everything extremely applicable and engaging. Be sure to read the text book and take notes in class and you'll have no problem on the midterms and finals. She grades fairly on the speeches as well.

She is a clear but not easy! I asked for help on a paper, saw her 3 times on it, she told me it was good, then she gave me a C.  I wish she was more straight forward, she wants to be liked so she doesn't give you the correction you need in person she just tanks you on your grade.

I have no clue why everyone is saying she grades harshly. She's very clear on her instructions for assignments, and if you just follow her expectations you will get an A. Take the online quizzes and do the study guide before the tests and you'll be fine.

She was a decent person. Grades harshly and there are other professors here whose classes are a lot easier. This is an intro class that starts off students for their majors in Advertising, communications, etc. This professor would be good as an upper division professor but as a beginning professor. No. She is tough. Take someone else if you can

Nice, but she overcompensates in commanding respect by grading harshly, instead of earning it by her demeanor. If you are already a good speaker, you will be graded harder. Leave room for improvement for the intro speech on the first day because its merely to gauge where you are at at the beginning of the class.  Show up to class on time!

She's a cool teacher. Graduated just a few years ago. Was the faculty professor in Heidelberg. Very achieved. Kind of rough on students when it comes to the midterm and final. Doesn't go over material more than once so reading is important. Speeches are graded pretty harshly. Great experience but seems like friends in other classes had more fun.

She is super helpful and nice. I did enjoy her class; however, it's almost impossible to get an A. An A- is pretty easy to get, but achieving a solid A requires impossibly high test scores on the midterm and final, regardless of how well you did on all of the speeches (which are pretty easy to get good grades on).

Prof. Lawrence is a great teacher! I was SOOO nervous about this class, but she worked with me every step of the way and even took time to meet with me and help me work on my speeches and over come my anxiety. Honestly, she was so comforting and sweet. Yes she has high standards, but nothing that is unreasonable.
not flexible at all. not understanding. entirely too tough on the students. the class is straight from the book. she's boring  condescending and I wouldn't recommend taking her class.

I am not a fan of public speaking but she really made the class excited and helped ease my nerves before every speech. She was open to less traditional speech topics which made the class far more interesting. She was so supportive throughout the semester! She is the best!

Although her class does require focus and effort she is always so willing to help in anyway she can. She is a very fair grader and your grade will reflect your effort. Also she makes what could easily be a dry subject to be incredibly interesting and fun. This was one of my favorite classes I've taken at Pepperdine. Plus she is super nice!

She was a very hard teacher and wasn't flexible at all. Her lectures came directly from the book so it made class very boring and repetitive because our hw was to read the book. She graded speeches very hard. She doesn't do a good job in assisting you if you ask for help. The mid term/final is extremely hard not even a speech its written and hard
love her! She is so cute!

Her Lectures are really interesting. She really makes sure you understand it before moving on. After every lecture, she applies it to a real life situation. It has been my favorite class in college thus far.

She is so nice!  Some of my other friends who took this class with a different teacher hated it, but it is my favorite class! The midterm is hard but when she teaches you actually understand the material. Absolutely love it & recommend her.

It's been 10+ yrs since graduating. My career is in a place where I am very comfortable (finally,) I look back on my professors and feel remorse that I took some of them for granted, as their time/lessons upon are now only realized to humble me, except Sadighian. Sadighian is the epitome of a brown-nosing corporate lackey. I was right about HIM LOL
All I can say, Great Professor! I enjoyed every class. Don't expect it to be a super easy class, but if you study and participate, you will be good. I learned a lot. Highly recommended.

He's funny and has a ton of hands-on marketing experience. You don't need the book as long as someone on your team has one to do the case work. You MUST come to class. He can be condescending but is still very encouraging. He cares abot his stdents a lot. Take him if you have the choice to! His tests are easy, too, as long as you actually study!
You r4eally need to study for the test and the group project is a big hassle.

The class is bit harder than BA355. READ THE TEXTBOOK bcuz all the multiple choice questions come from the book. The open-end-ish questions come from lectures. Definitely take this class. It's a relatively easy "A".

Fun guy, really knows his stuff. But he makes the groups compete against each other, so As aren't guaranteed. Also, he will tell you to your face that you don't need to memorize anything for the test, because its all common sense. This is FALSE. MEMORIZE EVERYTHING.

Professor Sadighian's class was easy enough to get a good grade in, but the class readings were way too much. Other than that, he is easy to talk to, if you need assistance outside the class, he is always available. He is a really nice person, but he has a tendency to not listen to other people. He does not really accept any new interpretations.

He is such a funny nice guy! wants his students to truly suceed.  He will help you if you ask questions or see him after class.  The test you have to study for but he makes sure to explain everything that you read.  One of the best teachers I've had.  He really loves what he teaches!!!

An interesting and strait forward class.  He definately has alot of energy and personal experience for the course and cares about his students.  Only problem is that his tests are far too detailed...be ready to do rote memorization of terms and lists for the tests...this is the only reason his class is difficult. Other than that, interesting and fu

Dr. Sadighian is great! he is really passionate about what he teaches and has a lot of real life experience. the tests can be challenging, but if you study a lot, you'll be fine. Take him if you want to really learn about Marketing

The class is semi-interesting. Dr. Sadighian is a little too idealistic especially when it comes to what he thinks you'll learn from the presentations, but he generally does have interesting speakers. He doesn't listen to other people's views though and believes he's the only one who is right, if you disagree, he'll pick on you.
Very nice guy, interesting class.  Moderately easy.
Great Prof! Best at Pepperdine without a doubt.

The best teacher I've had so far at Pepperdine!! Definitely take him for one of your classes if you can - he makes the subject fun, he has the funniest sense of humour, smart and experienced in the field... really great professor and person overall!
GREAT prof! So helpful and understanding. He really cares about his students and what he's teaching about. He relates it to his experience, but doesn't brag about his past. He's wonderful! TAKE HIM!!

Dr. Sadighian truely is the funnest prof. i've had at Pep.  He is so enthusiastic about what he teaches and has a great deal or corporate experience. I am giving him the highest rating I've ever given a teacher.  And he makes the material understandable and always let's you know during lecture what will be on the test.  He's GREAT.
I loooooooooove Dr. Sadighian!!!! He is by far the nicest man in the world.  I am actually excited to go to his class everyday.  DEFINITELY take him- you won't regret it!
Bad
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: It may seem like she is SO serious about the art of literature because harsh grading is a must in her classes, but you will come to see that she is just stubborn about research and the trivial things, completely neglecting, even discouraging, the importance of creativity and skeptical thinking, which are crucial to good writers.

She's nice, but just because you are nice doesn't mean you are good.   If I had any other professor I would have received an A.   Her lectures are basic, and she expects students to memorize lines from 6-8 different poems and the different authors without offering a REAL study guide.   Professors like her are whats wrong with the school system.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I have had the misfortune of taking three classes with Julie Smith. Although a genuinely nice person, she thinks the world begins and ends with her class, and she expects you to be just as devoted to the subject as she is. The workload is outrageous,  and the lectures boring. She only cares about grammar and research skills, not depth of analysis.

Not sure if it was ENG340 but it was a GE. SHOULD be easy and simple enough..instead it was the worst class I have ever taken at Pepperdine. Class is seriously boring and all the students are forced to read so much material about female writers. Seriously not worth your time.

This class taught me a lot, but it left me feeling a bit put-out. She is a very nice lady, but she seemed to only care about the older students in the class. There was a definite bias and if I had sucked up to her like others, my grade would have probably improved. Not my favorite.

I took Dr. Smith for my senior seminar. I had heard rumors that she is a very demanding teacher, but I did not find this to be true. In fact, I really enjoyed Dr. Smith as a teacher and loved the way she organized the class. She definitely did a lot to help me and other seniors create quality work. However, she did sometimes waste class time.

It's true, Dr Smith is a difficult professor, but her hard grading and incredible teaching ability is what should be expected of English professors. If you want a GPA booster DON'T take this class. If you're looking for a professor that actually reads your essays and legitimately gives a****, go for it.

:( is right. she is a particularly hard grader and plays favorites on a low level. meaning that if you talk to her a lot after class and butter up to her, suddenly your papers go from C's to A's. not interested in wasting my time in there again
Grades the class like its Eng 500.  Prepare to have your paper ripped to shreds. Nice woman, sunny personaility however she grades very very hard to make everyone better writers at the starting line.

by far one of the worst classes I've taken at pepperdine. This class should not even be a required class at pepperdine anyone who is an english major has already learned everything this class focuses on in high school. She is a terribly hard grader for how basic the class is, and nearly all the papers deal with uninteresting material.

Like that sexy victorian stylee... defenetly the worst class I've ever taken at Pepperdine! Hot tip: take some herbal remedy before going to class...it will add some fun to this extremely boring and useless class...

She's nice and pretty easy to work with, but the class itself is useless. Everything you learn in there you could learn from the reference librarian in about an hour. The advice she gives on papers is pretty vague, and she is a really tough grader. I wouldn't recommend this class at all.

a really nice professor, but she turned our Modern Drama class into a research project on female dramatic authors of the Victorian era (to aide in her own research).  not an interesting thing, by the way.  not helpful with suggestions for improvement.

she has private review sessions which are a waste of time. she says ur paper is fine, then when u turn it in u get a crappy grade. her class was two hours of my life 2 days a week wasted. it was a research class, she taught us to use the lib. catalog!
No Comments

Dr. Smith is very passionate about English and very knowledgeable about English literature.  She is there to help you and genuinely cares about her students.  She is great...do your papers on American lit and she'll grade easier b/c she only known British

Amazing Professor! Overall, business law is hard and that should be expected but he makes the class interesting and enjoyable. He really cares about his students and the exams are doable as long as you attend lectures and take notes. He also allows a cheat sheet for every exam. TAKE HIS CLASS , YOU WON'T REGRET IT. Love him so much

Best prof in the Business div, if not at Pepperdine. So happy I took this class. blaw IS hard, no getting around that, but Prof Link made it not only bearable but enjoyable. Really cares about his students. Lecture-heavy but class is entertaining & memorable--feels shorter than 90 min. 1-pg cheat sheet on every exam. Hard class but great prof.

Definitely a tough class but it's literally law lol. Classes were always interesting and he has such an energetic and fun attitude, and you can tell he really cares about his students. Definitely one of my favorite classes and professors! Just make sure to really pay attention in class and read the textbook/cases.

The best thing about Link is his attitude. He is always extremely positive and energetic about teaching the class. His lectures are extremely interesting and enjoyable. Even if I didn't want to go to class that day (attendance not required), I looked forward to his lectures.

Prof Link is one of the best professors that I have had at Pepperdine. He is funny and an engaging teacher. This class, while difficult, was fun and he does an amazing job at explaining the tough concepts in a really clear way.

Professor Link is such an entertaining professor because he has a great sense of humor and his class is entirely lecture-based, so you're just listening to him explain all of the difficult concepts in the book. He makes them super clear and if you pay attention in class, you'll be prepared for the test.

Dr. Link is a true gem. He is so enthusiastic, kind, caring, and makes the best cheesy jokes. His positive attitude makes an otherwise dry class almost fun, and he is willing to speak with students about their own passions and goals. Take this professor for BLAW! You won't regret it.

Professor Link is my favorite teacher I have had at Pepperdine. He cares so deeply about each of his students, is extremely intelligent, wants you to succeed, and knows how to teach in a way that you can understand. The class and tests are difficult but he gives you the tools you need to succeed.

Literally one of the best human beings I have ever met. Cares so much about his students, to the point where he will walk around the library nights before an upcoming exam to help them and goes to school events to support them. This class is known for being hard, but he makes the lectures interesting & easy to follow. Greatest teacher at Pepperdine

Professor Link is one of the best professors I've ever had. He made the class very interesting, relatable, and fun. In a tough semester, I looked forward to attending every class session. It's a good bit of reading, but he always thoroughly reviewed with us before every exam and wrote fantastic test questions. I wish he taught more courses here.

Prof. Link is the best professor at Pepperdine. He is such a nice dude and cares so much about his students. I would 100% recommend taking his class. I don't think that he could hurt a fly, he's too nice of a guy. He sometimes will make jokes in class that are too funny to continue so beware of his humor.

One of the most caring and kind professors ever. Not only does he really know what he's talking about, but he always makes students feel grateful and happy. The material is difficult, but it's definitely not impossible

By far my favorite professor I've ever had at Pepperdine. He's the most caring and approachable man. So knowledgeable about everything Business Law, makes class engaging and comfortable, and overall makes the class so fun. I would hands down take any class this man taught.

I would literally take any class this man taught at Pepperdine. The class is hard but definitely not impossible. The subject is hard but he makes it worth it. He's a nerd and so sweet. Doesn't call on people to answer questions so don't have to stress about that (he will call to ask questions about what you think of the subject sometimes)

He's a wonderful guy who really cares about his students. He wants you to succeed, but of course you have to put in the work! Read all the assigned material prior to the lectures to really understand what he's saying in class. It'll help a lot because the course itself is heavy. You have to pay attention to each cases, don't skip class!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Great professor. It was his first year and he did a fantastic job! Just read the chapters and during class, listen to his examples and clarifications, you'll do fine. The reason why people didn't do well was because they skipped the reading (which is pretty much the only task). Only a few online assignments during the semester.

When I took this class, it was Professor Link's first every semester teaching. Considering that, he did an excellent job of explaining the material. His first exam was difficult, but after giving him feedback, he graciously changed the format of the test to be more reasonable. His lectures are engaging and interesting. He is super friendly!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests? Not many--Clear grading criteria

comment: She makes a bunch of assignments due in a one-week span right before Thanksgiving break. Really stressful for students who already have to manage other classes. Class act in bad syllabus design
I love Professor Udall. I wish I could take her for all my language classes. She is so caring and the class times are spent very well.

Such a kind woman! Loved her and you can tell she really cares about her students. FRE 151 was easy enough for an intro course. Do the work and itll be fine. Tests are difficult but Udall lays out exactly what will be on them - no surprises. Getting an A might be hard but I still enjoyed this class/Professor. She even brought us food one time lol

Very sweet woman and was actually very helpful outside of the classroom! Her classes were a bit disorganized but she posted all notes online and gave very good, detailed study guides for all exams. I really did enjoy her class and learning French with her!

Udall is my fav teacher so far at Pepp. Cares a lot about you passing, but pushes everyone to understand French to the best of their abilities in many aspects. I did not think I would be ready to go abroad and speak French out there, but after her class I feel much more confident than the beginning of the semester.
She is a fairly easy grader and a super kind person. The class is not easy in any means, but it is also not very difficult. She will push you, but is also very understanding.

Prof Udall is awesome, very caring and wants each and every one of her students to succeed. Her tests are hard and you have to study for them but she grades them super fairly. She also expects a lot and moves at a quick pace. Overall really nice and funny and makes class entertaining.

Professor Udall was amazing! One of the best French teachers at Pepperdine and I would take her again if I could. Homework is assigned every day but it is very manageable. She wants you to succeed and is open to talking one on one whenever:) TAKE HER

Professor Udall is one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine. She's brilliant, understanding, really invests in her students, and works hard to make class clear and interesting. Her tests are not easy, but neither are they unreasonable, and if you put effort into her class, she makes sure to give you every chance to succeed. Merci Madame!

TAKE her class! I found the homework load to be easy, which allowed me to enjoy the language and ultimately learn far more (tests are hard, but less of grade). She is very attentive to individual needs and values you as a person. I improved the most in my French, especially speaking, this semester with her. I love Mme Udall; her class was so fun!

Highly suggest taking her!! I've learned so much from this course and it was always enjoyable to go to class. She really works with the class, pushes you to learn, but keeps a reasonable pace. Definitely my favorite course and one of my nicest professors!

Loved this class! It's a hard GE foreign language, but Professor Udall is a great teacher and a fair grader. She'll meet you more than half way, you just have to go the rest of the distance - be active in class, ask questions, go to her office hours - then you can't go wrong. I wouldn't have wanted to take it with any other professor.

Udall is a great teacher, and though her class was very fast (I took it in the summer), she was thorough and understanding if people needed her to slow down a little. Some people needed to work hard but I think everyone expects to get a lot out of the class, as well as a decent grade at the least.

Professor Udall is a great teacher, french is hard and she isnt always very clear when explaining, however she is always willing to spend extra time with you and always available during study hours or through email.
Professor Udall was great! She is very nice, understanding, and a really great teacher. She really wants everyone to learn and succeed!

Professor Udall is extremely helpful. She makes sure you understand the material, and she is very considerate regarding the tests and homework. A wonderful introductory French teacher who wants to see her class succeed
Great prof! Very nice, sincere, and helpful!
The most amazing professor I've ever had.

seriously the most liberal/progressive/Obama loving, closet republican hater I have ever met. He is the party for the party man, for diversity over qualifications and will defend ANYTHING the democratic party does. Everything is compared to republicans. He wont let up.

Seriously the coolest professor I've had.  He's so accepting of all political opinions, he actively engages in the lives of his students, and he's constantly striving to find ways to make his teaching style better.  A little hot-tempered, but one of the coolest guys you'll know.
Cool.

Phil has been my favorite prof thus far! He is really helpful and really nice. Don't fall asleep in his class or he will kick you out. For the test you need to memorize his lecture notes. That is where all the questions come from. Ask questions! He bases a lot of your grade on participation. Take Phil for PolySci 104 GE

If you don't understand what he is talking about in lecture he is more than willing to either go over it in class again or meet with you personally. If you go to class, take notes, read the book just (for the multiple choice),and memorize the study guide you will get an A. This class is easy if you do the study guide.

Phil is an awesome instructor!  The class is not easy, but he is very interested in us learning and wants everyone to be engaged in class.  I wish Phil taught all my major classes!  Know the lecture notes and you'll do well on the exams.  Phil is great!  Take this class for POSC 104 G.E.

Really nice and really helpful. Easy to understand. Completely recommended. Even if you don't like the subject, the class isn't too terrible. Tests are not hard particularly if you study. Although it is important to read the book, his lecture notes are what should be your main focus for studying. For a GE, choose him.

My absolute favorite professor so far, super nice guy...doesn't take crap from students which is good, likes students to get involved in class. AND if you're happy with your grade after the first 3 exams, you don't have to take the final!

phil rules! he's a great teacher and he's pretty funny. i really like that he acts as our equal, he doesn't act like he is superior to us. the only thing i dislike about his class is the required class participation.
Even if you do not need this class, take it for FUN. You will thank me later.

Speaking as a student with absolutely ZERO interest in political science, I actually find myself enjoying this class. Phil is clear with what he expects and what he'll be testing on and makes class interesting.  He makes it easy to succeed so long as you put in the effort to do well. TAKE THIS CLASS! my fave GE at pepp thus far.
GUSSIN FOR PRESIDENT!!!! this class is awesome

He kind of reminds me of Daum, really good teacher, keeps lectures fun and interesting and MAKES SURE EVERYONE knows what's going on and understands, he does stop and wait so people will ask. So unless you're really stubborn and won't ask questions the info and what is on the test will be very clear! He's just strict when it comes to grading tests

He was a nice plumber; at first everyone seemed to love him because he respects his students. Kinda. He is very impatient if you do anything in the class. He gets easily distracted if someone is smiling/laughing during lectures. Lectures tend to be dull, but the class discussions are interesting. Don't buy the book. He has a medical condition too.

Practice exam questions are the only thing that come from the book that are on the exams so purchasing the book is pointless. All the essays are about lectures, so go to class and you should be fine. Class discussions can get off topic but are always informative and interesting
Doesnt give good feedback. I dont think Joe knows about drawing at all.

Joe is easily one of the best professors at Pepperdine. If you're not an art major & have even the slightest interest in drawing take this class! Plays music, hosts great conversation, & you have many opportunities to get to know other students you may have never met! Plenty of non-art majors in the class, non-judgemental art critiques. Awesome!!!
Great teacher, great class

Joe is the best! I'm not an art major, but I learned so much about drawing and improved a lot. He's very funny, helpful, encouraging, and definitely very passionate about art. The class is difficult in one sense; drawing takes a lot of mental effort. Attend class and draw as best you can. You will definitely appreciate taking art with Joe.
He is the great, if one does not agree, it is simply because they have not reached a maturity level to appreciate the privilege of working with such a great mind.

You meet a lot of smart and compassionate professors at a Christian school, but Professor Joe is a cut above the rest. He's great at mentoring his students in their art and in their personal lives. He doesn't try to make you paint or draw like he does; he helps you develop your own style, which can be an artist's greatest challenge.
Best Professor Ever. If you plan to develop as an artist he is the man to help you get there. He gives constructive tips and makes you think! It doesn't hurt that he is very attractive!
Aw... that's not true at all. Joe is extremely talented and exhibits internationally. Great guy. Totally helpful. Favorite art professor I had at Pdine.

Piasentin can't paint!  How in the world did an untalented guy like this get to be an art teacher?  He only does abstract stuff, probably because it is less likely to show off the fact that he has no talent.  Anything remotely realistic looking he makes fun of.  He never shows any techniques to help the student, just has you kind of fumble around
Joe is amazing! I learned so much and will always admire his work and value his advice. An amazing man with a heart of gold!
Knows his stuff. Enjoyed his classes. Helped me under my craft.
No Comments
Joe is a great teacher & fantastic guy. He'll crack you up & the time will pass w/ ease. His intro classes are for all.
One of the best teachers ever. Amazingly kind, really helpful, sometimes vague, but that's the nature of art. The class really helped my drawing a whole lot. An awesome guy -- take this class!
So much fun! even if you're not an art major you should take this class. IT ROCKS. he is such a funny guy. sometimes he'll tell stories or read to the class it's awesome!!!

Such a great teacher! Sometimes a little artsy and vague in his painting advice, but extremely friendly and exuberant and really makes you want to come to class. Definitely encouraging of creativity, which is great for an art teacher.

Took GSHU121 and 122 with him. Clearly caring and passionate. This man actually knows how to use Courses, inputs grades ,attendance, rubrics, EVERYTHING super quick. Grading criteria very clear. Lectures super engaging. It's a Great Books class, you're gonna read a lot, Riddle actually might have less reading compared to some other GSHU professors

Dr. Riddle is an incredible professor. HIST428 is the history of medicine and religion class (his expertise), and he managed to make the content very easy to understand while maintaining a challenging yet inclusive academic environment. Class is 1/2 lecture, 1/2 discussion. There's 1 research paper and 10 reading reports. He's engaging & helpful!

Dr. Riddle is honestly one of the best professors I've had so far. His lectures are always very engaging and easy to follow along with. You can tell that he's passionate about what he teaches, and that he truly cares about each and every one of his students. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!! The course is reading-heavy, but it's doable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I love Dr. Riddle. I had him for both GSHU 121 and 122. He is a great professor and genuinely cares about his students both in and outside of class. Be prepared to read a lot, but most of the books are entertaining. This class is almost all discussion based with around 3 papers per semester. If you're a good writer and read, the class will be easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Super engaging when in class. When he speaks he is very engaging and doesn't make you fall asleep. Great Books is very discussion heavy and he does a great job facilitating discussions. Easy to talk to outside of class, overall chill guy. Grading criteria and feedback are very clear including papers. 10/10 would recommend, would take again.

Take him for Hist 204.  If you show up and participate, he gives you points.  If you take notes, you will have no issues on the midterm and final.  He is a very fair grader on the 3 papers you have to do.  I have never gotten an A in history, and I got an A, and I didn't stress out over his class.  He understands this is a GE.

Dr. Riddle was great! His HIST204 class was a bit boring because I had already learned most of the material in high school. However, Riddle makes the class super simple and is really understanding if you have any issues/ questions. There's only a midterm, final, a few online quizzes, and a final paper. The perfect amount of work for a 4-credit GE.

Best teacher I've ever had in terms of staying engaging while still remaining super organized. You won't ever be taken by surprise, and the feedback given on assignments and essays is very good. In person feedback during discussions is also very good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Riddle is so nice! As long as you take notes on the lectures, the weekly quizzes (done outside of class) are a breeze. Riddle understands it's a GE course, and rarely has tests. He has a midterm and final but they are easy to do well on. He is always available outside of class, and will help you succeed. There is one final paper though!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Respected--Accessible outside class

comment: Riddle is a genuinely amazing professor. He structures his HIST204 class super well and it's easy to follow. I actually learned a lot from him! He splits up the class to half lecture, and half discussion which is a combination of the homework reading with whatever we just learned. He's super easy to talk to and I cannot recommend him enough!

I took Great Books 1 with Prof. Riddle. He's very kind and made our discussions engaging even at 8am. No tests, and creative assignments on the readings that built literary knowledge. 6 books, 6 small essays, and 2 large papers, and all were graded fairly with good feedback to grow. Inspired me to continue the Great Books series!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Jonathan Riddle has been great so far. He is very passionate about history and makes lectures engaging. The class does have a decent amount of reading as homework especially for a GE but it is doable. He is HOT, so that keeps me motivated to actually go to class because history is not one of my favorite subjects.

Professor Riddle is amazing! Rather than reading from boring textbooks, he uses books from different periods of time and they are all very interesting. His lectures are great and he is so passionate. He genuinely cares about his students and will go out of his way to help! He is the best HIST 204 professor at Pepperdine. TAKE HIM.

Dr. Riddles class is super easygoing and chill. Hes a nice human being and has his rules, but teaching wise he is great and his lectures are highly unlikely to make you fell asleep. Though theres lots of notes taking but he always leave half the class period for discussions and other activities. Even gone through a few movies in class.
Dr. Riddle does a great job facilitating discussions and is very passionate about the material. He cares for his students and is definitely worth taking.

Dr. Riddle was my favorite professor this semester and he made the class fun and engaging. He gave positive constructive feedback on every paper and helped us understand every aspect/facet of the readings we were given.
Dr. Schaffer is so amazing. She has a contagious passion and joy, is an excellent teacher, and cares so much about her job and students. I love her and want to be like her.

My whole class loved Schaffer. What an amazing lady. Yes, this class is hard. But dang youll realize why - its the most helpful course youll take. Great lady - is tough on you because thats how the corporate world will be. Get to know her. I wasnt supposed to take her class originally and Im so so happy I did. Inspirational. Direct. Great.

I absolutely hated this class with prof. Schaffer. I had many problems with my group and instead of her trying to aid us to find a solution, she assigned us to another professor to deal with the matter and made us sign a contract stating that we won't contact her for group issues. That was definitely a low move that totally threw me off completely.
Most difficult class I've taken, but if you have to take Service, take it with her. She's an incredible professor and cares about her students.

Dr. Schaffer is one of the most inspirational teachers I've had. I learned a lot of consulting skills, helped out a nonprofit, and learned a lot about myself in the process. She will challenge you to give your best to your client, and the hardest part about this class is getting a good team to work with. Lots of in class readings and presentations.
Prof Schaffer is one of the most organized I have had at Pepperdine. Loves students and class. Directions are clear cut and if you follow them you will get good results. Great class enjoy it!

She is one of the best professors at Pepperdine...hands down. The class is demanding, writing intensive, and contains a lot of group work, but it is well worth the time you put into it. She puts her heart into the class and engages students. I highly recommend that students who want to get the most out of the consulting experience take her class.
If you are lazy, take Mullen. Save the spots in Schaffer's class for the REAL students.
Very fabulous!  love her. Her class is amazing too.
Amazing professor, amazing class!  Dr. Schaffer was one of the best professors I had at Pepperdine.
She will teach you the people/leadership skills....  She will teach you how businesses are handled in real life....

Wonderful professor.  She has a ton of real life and in class experience to share and she is enthusiastic about everything.  At the beginning, it seemed like a lot of work, but it was well worth it.  She deserves to be crowned professor of the millinium.
dr. schaffer rocks!  she's another hard professor but awesome individual to work with!  i love her!  she's by far my most favorite professor!

My favorite class by far.  She deserves a medal or something, she's an incredible prof.  It was less of a class, more an experience.  Kicked my ass though, taking it my last semester before graduation.  Requires tons of out-of-class time.
Wonderful teacher.  She had to have been the nicest and most helpful teacher at Pepperdine.  She was the most considerate and really wanted the students to learn.  That means a lot.
Great teacher and person. Great to have a hands on class. She goes out of her way for the students.

I had him for Great Books I Fall 2009. He's one of the most intelligent professors I've had at Pepperdine, but I found his class discussions rather dull. He only requires four papers per semester - which is very reasonable. You get your papers back with a single-spaced typed page of feedback. He lets the class discussion bird walk too much.

Professor Marshall was amazing for my first semester in Great Books. Lots of discussion that is extremely relevant (and interesting!!) to the books being read. Not writing intensive, which is perfect (it's all in the discussion, anyway), and he gives you the opportunity to rewrite papers. I have never learned more about improving my writing than th

Dr. Marshall is one of the greatest teachers I've ever had, and an excellent person to boot. He gives extremely helpful feedback during class discussions and on graded papers. And the only things he cares more about than the classics are his students. He ensures everyone is heard during class and doesn't put anyone down. Take him for Great Books!
hmm. well he is unbelievable smart. BUT he completely discouraged me from writing, because he criticized almost every word of mine. looks so deep into the text its like HE wrote the books. good LUCK

seriously... all i can say is "dr. don" [which you should call him that... or "the don"] he is the best great books teacher ever! why take a stupid freshman seminar when you can chill with don two times a week. haha... in all honesty: i changed my schedule around to make sure i got him!
