Oh Don... his laugh will make you want to die but he's a good teacher.  You get to rewrite your papers and theres only 3 + the final.  He really cares about the subject and wants you to too.  Make sure you talk a lot in class and show up, but you'll like him.

Great man. Really takes an interest in students. He's really passionate about great books and it shows in class. He's usually more excited about the reading than the students but I guess you have to be to be a prof. He expects a lot in his essays but you do have an opportunity to redeem yourself with makeup essays. He won't just hand out A's.

Class is challenging, but if you keep up with the reading it is not too hard. Dr. Marshall really enjoys teaching GB, which causes the class to be fun. There are 5 papers, which he grades pretty hard, but lets you re-write them for a better grade. A great teacher!!!!

I like Dr. Marshall.  He's a really smart guy (degrees from Harvard and Yale), very articulate and well-spoken, and leads discussion very well.  I am often bored by the topics (disappointing), and the discussion tends to go off into boring areas.  He grades papers fairly reasonably, and papers and reading are his only assignments.  Recommended.

Marshall is extremely enthusiastic, even at 8am. He really loves what the books he teaches, and it shows in discussions. Discussions can get a bit too detailed and off on tangents, but theyre mostly enjoyable. He expects a lot on papers, but gives you a chance to rewrite them after a meeting with him. Not the easiest class, but worth it.

He is so great.  I loved his class and had a great time in discussions.  He truly loves great books and believes in the program.  He also really cares about his students and is always available outside of class.  He likes students to lead class discussion so be prepared for that.

No homework, only about 4 essays during the semester.  Final is a take-home essay.  Doesn't grade hard for a great books teacher.  Class is somewhat boring, but the work is so easy, I didn't mind.  He doesn't take off if you miss a couple days either.  Easy, and nice guy.

good, enthusiastic teacher, but can be a little clear and too detailed in discussion, often getting hung up on minor points.  still, is very helpful during office hours to talk about papers and is an EXTREMELY nice, friendly, warm person.

Marshall is a very enthusiastic teacher who is truly concerned with his students' educational journey.  There are not a LOT of papers that need to be written, but clearly, the reading load is heavy and he is a very FAIR marker around the A-B level.
Very friendly and willing to help the class learn. He knows a lot about the books we read.
Prob easiest of Great Books teachers.

Nelson has good lectures but horrible organization. His outlines are more confusing than helpful, but you can overall get an idea of what he is talking about. His main issue is the enormous amount of information he gives. Although he gives you all the questions before hand, the amount of information given is a bit excessive. Lots of reading.
great story teller, extremely passionate about history. wish i could be half as smart as this guy
He's a great teacher... he does go off in tangents occasionally, but its interesting stuff. Though he assigns a TON of reading, most of it is actually really interesting.
Good teacher. He does make you read alot but compared to the other Hist 304 teacher Scott, he's way more interesting. Do the readings and you will get an A.

I think he is a nice guy, with good intentions to teach, we read a lot for class. The exams where almost a 100% based on the books assigned. His tests involve lots of writing. I learned a lot from him and he was pretty available outside of class for extra help.

Very interesting class although sometimes it can be random and hard to follow, he is extremely knowledgeable. If you do get lost in class he is more than willing to talk one on one and is even more interesting, offering much help on the exam. DO THE READING!

Dr. Nelson is both uber-knowledgeable and hilarious. Of course, he's downright random, but if you only take notes on what he says will be on the exam (and DO THE READING) you can just sit back and not do much work. This being said, take into account how much a 4-hr night class sucks before enrolling!

Very knowledgeable and humorous guy but he seems to be TOO knowledgeable for his own good. Goes on tangents that you end up writing down mistaking them for actual class notes. Can hardly differentiate what is relevant to the exams or not. Assigns MASSIVE amounts of readings and gives pop quizzes on them. Exam questions are never clear.

He knows a lot. Too much. He tells ridiculous side stories about every little detail of his lecture. It's interesting, but tedious. He assigns a lot of reading, but it's not really necessary. If you take good notes from his lectures and just repeat everything he says on the essays, you'll do fine. Oh, and he uses the same exam questions every year.
If you want to learn about American history don't take hist 304 with Nelson. He is a friendly guy but he doesnt know how to teach. He goes on random tangents in class and assigns lots of reading.

I had to record this guys lectures on garage band just to pause and actually get something out of this class. This dude did not write one thing on the board the entire semester nor did he make any notes. JUST TALKS AND DOESNT EVEN FINISH HIS THOUGHTS! "Can you repeat that?"

Dude has to be the worst professor of all-time. He def doesn't belong in Pepperdine. He is so damn lazy as a teacher. There's no test review. He just tells us the essay questions, and we're supposed to write em down. All we say is, "can you repeat that one more time?" Why don't you just print it out? Straight up 4hr lecture. He just talks forever..
What a crazy man.he knows too much for his own good. nothing is emphasized, which gives no way of knowing what is going to be on the test.

He's terrible, the worst professor... tangents for DAYS! it was ridiculous. Most of the material covered (65%) was completely irrelevant. Tested on materials that we're covered in class, however nothing is emphasized, he just throws up one huge steaming pile of puke.
No Comments

Absolutely the worst professor I have ever had at Pepperdine. He doesn't really care about engaging his students and takes up the entire 4 hour period. On the day of the test, he lectured for an hour and a half on new material before we could begin. Everyone in the class hates him.
Good Professor. Very empowering of his students. Available for help and discussion. Enjoyed the course
Makes class engaging. Provides real-life application of theoretical curriculum. Enjoyed the many guest speakers. Great Professor.
useless class full of busy work.  plays favorites.

I usually don't bash on professors. But for those who are searching Duta to see if you want to enroll in the class. DONT TAKE DUTA. Take Yates for BA 366. I am a student who did not believe the comments below and took the class. Class is unorganized and confusing. Maybe the worse class I took at Pepperdine.
jsut don't take him

He's Romanian. can't expect clarity from him. presents himself as if he's giving up so much for the students. expects students to be "perfect" he could be a jerk sometimes too. if i could go back in time, i would convince all my classmates not to take him.

I guarantee you last couple comments below mine are probably written by him. True story, got a 85 on the first exam but when I added up the score it added up to be like 89. Told the professor and told me to come during his office hours. Found out he actually deducted more points so the score would actually add up to the original score..c'mon now..
Two thumbs up!
Excellent!

Class is entertaining solely because he is crazy and Romanian and uses odd lingo. Assigns unnecessary assignments and evaluations are harder than need be. OB should be a common sense course yet he tests using a short answer.
He had no clue what he was doing!

Teaches from the heart and is concerned with the life success of students. He is passionate about business and flexible with assigning work. He listens. Unlike many others, I really appreciate his intensity in class, especially in the morning when I tend to fall asleep! Don't be afraid to speak up and clarify due dates and negotiate test formats!
useless and boring

I'd like to echo everything that was said by the other people.  He is nice and caring, but overly energetic.  Very unclear, disorganized lectures where he reads from ppts with far too much text.  Assigns a ridiculous amount of busy work.  Changes deadlines and assignments constantly.  Really wanted to like the class but I couldn't.

I tried to like this class because he seems like such a nice guy, but I can't really say anything good about this class. Too much work (and its all busy work). You don't know when anything is due. You don't recieve any feedback. The tests which account for a decent chunk of your grade are completely unfair. I am really disappointed.

He is new, still trying to figure out his teaching style. He started out easy, class got more and more demanding because there are 2 presentations and 2 major papers required. Very energetic man, almost too much.

she would JUDGE you if you asked a question. she talked about how she hated her job and nows shes the dean. doesnt make sense to me and shes so rude she acts like a child. be mature Lauren amaro and do your job to help students
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: The kindest human alive. Definitely very hard class with a lot of homework and very hard tests, but communicate with her if you're struggling and she will move the heaven and earth help you succeed. Attendance isn't mandatory but you'll struggle if you miss a lot. If you go to class/participate, she'll be your best friend. If not, you're screwed.

First negative review I've written on a professor. had her last semester. I did not enjoy her material. Class should have been called common sense 101. Tests were difficult for no reason. She also made us read a book on Trevor Noah to cover apartheid. Out of all of the amazing people who came out of South Africa, that's who she chose. Worst class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Awesome teacher. Grades not that easy but she cares about students and teaches well.

Dr Amaro is awesome. She's very genuine and she takes her time in class to make sure that her students understand and aren't falling behind. She's always available outside of class and doesn't make you feel bad for asking for help. The nature of the class is hard, but she makes it as manageable as possible. Highly recommend!
Amaro is so kind and genuinely cares about her students. The class isn't easy but it's worth your time! Definitely take Amaro over other professors who teach this class, she'll make your life easier!
Dr. Amaro is amazing! I've taken her for multiple classes. She really cares about the course material and her students.

I rave about Dr. Amaro often. She is such an incredible professor, and you respect her immediately. I would take her for all my classes if I could. It isn't an easy A, she makes you work for it, but you learn so much in the process. She makes all subject seem interesting and wants to go the extra mile to help her students out. Take Amaro!

Dr. Amaro is one of my favorite professors here at Pepperdine. She has inspired me to stick with my major, and has made me really passionate about communicating responsibly. Her COM 220 class really gave me some insight to myself, my family, and the world around me. Such an interesting class; I think everyone should have to take this class!

Professor Amaro is a professor who is invested in the students she is teaching and is willing to help with whatever you need if you simply ask. Her class was very much discussion based, and she uses lots of examples to explain the material for better understanding. She is passionate about what she teaches and keeps it all up to date! Take Amaro!

Her 1st semester with Pepp was in Fall '14 which may have made her a little tougher than usual in her grading and assignments and tests. But you have to have a basic understanding of the chapters to do well with the multiple papers she assigns and the tests/quizzes she gives as well. Don't wait till the last minute to get serious about the class

One of my favorite professors! Whenever I went in for office hours, I could tell she was genuinely interested in everything I had to say, and was extremely helpful in giving advice for my major (communication). Yes, her class is difficult, but if you work hard and participate in class, you should be fine. Also, her class is engaging and fun!

She was a new professor last year. Because she was new, I expected her to be easy since she would not know how to teach this new subject too well. She gave out so many pop quizzes that made my grade poor and her tests were too much. She expects so much from you. There is a final paper. I had to retake this class.

Incredibly intelligent and always available to help you. Her classes and tests are tough because she doesn't only expect you to know the material, but also understand it and apply it. If you work hard, however, her class is extremely rewarding. I recommend taking her for COMM 200 and COMM 300.

She's definitely very helpful& clear with what she expects from you in class. She gives you PLENTY of room to improve. Values& listens to your feedback on assignments; will alter syllabus and assignments if students give negative feedback about it.  You need to come to class but that's for your own good.

She was VERY helpful and gives you  A LOT of room to improve. She loves all her students and she's relatively young (the cool type who won't give you homeworksprojects due on monday or the first class after spring break). She accepts feedback from her students and her tests are only hard if you never listen. Take notes and contribute in class!
Very tough grader! She is new to Pepperdine. Don't recommend to take her for com 200.

Good teacher. Unlike everyone else seems to think, she tries to make class fun and tries to make the arts "come alive".  Her lectures are clear, she is helpful, and her tests are direct and reasonable.
No Comments

It is just a shame that such an interesting subject could be slaughtered in such a way.  It isnt even that hard to get a point across and encourage fair interesting conversation.  She just cant do it...not in her programming.  Not that bad, just not right for Pepperdine at all.  I dont stand alone in this assessment by the way.

You endure this class. It's not enjoyable, but if you do the work and the reading, it's possible to get an A or high B easily. Quizzes aren't too difficult if you do the reading. It's helpful to outline chapters. Just do the field trips and make sure you include art terminology in your short essays (there are only 3).
I didn't know Napoleon had an evil twin sister.

This class is a JOKE. A good bulk of the quiz questions were testing if you were present or paying attention (Was Mr. Cason's favorite composer Mr. So and So? Is there a walk way leading to the piece of art? Was it a stuffed dog or a real dog? Do these questions really test your ability to apply the knowledge of the course to art?). DON'T TAKE HER!

I am astounded at how Prof. Abba taught this class. She took a subject that normally i would enjoy and slaughtered it. She is unfair, gives unreasonable quizzes and makes us sit in assigned seats. It seems as if she hates students and wants us all to fail in life(especially men.) Taking this class was a massive mistake, avoid it.
very unclear about writing assignments...

She is most possibly the worst teacher at Pepperdine. Her quizes are impossible (one question was the pattern on somone's outfit in the school musical) and the write-ups are crazy. She completely sucks the fun out of this class. There's a facebook group called art appreciatin=satan...and that's how I would describe the class.

Without a doubt the worst class I have ever taken. Do not take this class. It is like she is trying to prove that Arts Appreach is a real class, when everyone knows it shouldn't be. She marks you off for minor grammatical errors an papers, she puts random retarded stuff on quizes, and she makes us sit in assigned seats. Terrible Class!

She is easily my worst teacher at Pepperdine and possibly my worst ever ... in any grade.  "Prof. Abba" is unhelpful (read: you never know what's going to be on a quiz), an unreasonably hard grader (read: she'll limit a paper to one page and then tell you you need more information), and treats us as if we are children.  Do not take her class.
HORRIBLE teacher! Do NOT take her.  She needs to be fired and isn't willing to help or explain how you can do better in her class. Hopefully she'll read this and see how much everyone hates her.
absolutely horrible teacher.  the above people are completely right.  she plays extreme favorites and also dislikes men.  avoid
THE WORST TEACHER IN THE SCHOOL. SHOULD BE FIRED. DO NOT TAKE CLASS!!!
DO NOT TAKE ANYTHING FROM THIS PROFESSOR.  She is very picky and unfair with her grades.

He is very passionate about what he teaches, but he did not have the caring personality that a lot of Pepperdine professors have. I went to many office hours, and he always made me feel like I was wasting his time. His class was very easy though with open note tests which was good. He would give us case studies to do and would grade those harshly.

Dr. Monzon is great. Even being pre-med, I found Ecology to be interesting - it made me appreciate the complexity of the natural world. Even if it doesn't interest you, it will make you a better reader/writer - lots of primary scientific literature is read in this class and the lab component is writing-heavy. Follow the rubric and meet w/him!

Dr. Monzon really loves what he teaches and it shows every class. The Case Studies can be challenging but it is interesting to apply what we learn in lecture. He summarizes the readings in his lectures and I liked to read after the lecture to pick up on any lingering details that could be on the Mini Exams. Highly recommend!!

Dr. Monzon was such a good professor for Bio 212. His lectures are so entertaining and I love his sense of humor. The first few tests are difficult, but it gets easier as the class goes on. Tests are online and open book/note/internet. The case studies are so interesting and the final is a video project! Would highly recommend Dr. Monzon!!!

Monzon is rude and condescending. He is not understanding of a student's personal situations, especially with COVID. He didn't work with Dr. Holmlund to make ecology cohesive and fair, which was. very frustrating. It almost felt like I was taking two different classes. I wish he actually spoke to Holmlund, like he said he would, about expectations

Man's one of the best profs at Pepperdine. I'd say TOP 3 would be Cecile Santos, Mary Holden, and Javier Monzon. He's a harder grader, no doubt. Put in the reading and you'll be fine. His field trips are really amazing and he truly loves what he does. Even if you're not interested in studying animals/ecology, line him up for required classes

Overall Dr. Monzon is a good professor. But there was a lack of communication between him and Dr. Holmlund when it was co-taught. I don't think he ever addressed grading/expectation discrepancies among both professors and it was frustrating as a student. This affected students' grades negatively because we had 2 different profs.

I had Dr. Monzon during the covid transition to online, and he seemed to grade tougher based on that. However, his tests in person were VERY reasonable. I honestly think he is the best professor for BIO212. He is very fun, entertaining, and down to earth. If you do have him for online, take the labs seriously!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: For lower divs, his teaching is very straightforward and if you memorize the powerpoint, it really shouldn't be that bad. His upper divs are absolutely amazing and I recommend taking them because he teaches seminar style so it's super fun and you go on cool trips! Definitely the best option for an upper div elective!
He's cooler than an elephant seal. Best Professor out there. Become a part of the Brozone and take his class. u r welcome

It's obvious that Javier loves what he teaches, but I wish that he would help others to love it too. He is condescending and unapologetically called his students entitled. During lecture, he just reads off the slides with few explanations. The group projects are fun, but I'm glad this class is over.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I had professor Monzon during the COVID pandemic. His lectures are just him reading the slides. Read your textbook as well. He is an extremely tough grader especially when we went online. He really loves zoology but is not the best at teaching it. He also is slightly condescending when you ask questions. Nice guy but not a great professor.

Average professor with favorites. He's a funny guy but his lectures are boring and he just uses his powerpoint so class attendance really isn't mandatory. Offers lots of extra credit though which helps because he grades his tests like you're a zoologist and not in an entry level bio class. Doesn't give helpful feedback in office hours either.

This guy is a total stud. Loved taking his class, almost every day my mind was blown in lecture by some random animal fact. He's engaging, super funny, empathetic regarding class difficulty and acts just like a fellow student. I never felt like class was unfairly difficult or boring. Lab is also totally cool. Lots of work but for sure worth it.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: This material was pretty cool, so I can't see how Javier managed to ruin this subject. Super boring,
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Monzon is way better than the other Zoo professors at Pepperdine, but still makes the grading harder than it needs to be. He is a cool guy, but needs to fix some things to make class better. Cheating is something that is going on, but he ignores it. Adds random textbook material on his tests, but the majority of what he asks are from powerpoints.
Demanding class, just focus on his powerpoints and the stuff he tells you to read in the book and you will be fine. Lab is fun

I took her for HIST 204, and she is so so caring!! She truly tries to get to know each student on a personal level, and is super understanding. She doesn't assign much, so make sure your work done because you don't have much of a cushion. Easy A as long as you put in a bit of effort and get all your assignments in. 100% recommend!!
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Stallings is by far one of the best professors I have had so far at Pepperdine. She made her grading clear and was very lenient with it. She was caring and showed us students that she cared for us. If you have the opportunity you should take her as your professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Best Professor You Will Ever Have!!

I took her COM 205 class back in 2021 and she was a very easy and kind professor. She also increased my knowledge of all of the Adobe programs, and she is a great professor to build foundations on for later courses if you are an IMC major. Also an easy A+ grader as well.

I took Prof. Stallings for COM205. Her class was so fun and easy, yet I learned so much! One semester-long project on a topic of your choosing, including photography, journalism, podcasting, and videography. She is very caring and would email us our grades with encouraging feedback. Her class inspired me to join the Graphic and continue writing!

HIST 204 summer online is the easiest class I've ever taken. Cameras optional, all essay prompts given in the syllabus at the beginning of the course, etc. In all honesty, I tuned this class out completely every day and played video games, wrote all of my essays in less than an hour while watching Family Guy, and the lowest grade I got was 38/40.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Stallings is the best History teacher you'll get! She is super kind and understanding. As long as you do the work (even slightly mediocrely), you'll get good grades. She posts the lectures online to refer back to and puts videos to watch in class. HW is super simple and instead of exams, it's two essays.

Prof. Stallings is a true gem- she is one of those rare professors who are super passionate about their subjects yet is a GOOD TEACHER of it. Took her before for HIST204 and now for GEO321 and she's consistent with really asking deeper questions about the world. The only thing is that she's lecture heavy, but she's an easy grader and very forgiving

Professor Stallings cares about her students and sheds light on important events that are omitted/downplayed in most U.S. history courses. For summer session, we had 3 pop quizzes (T/F), 3 writing assignments ("question & answer" handout), a Midterm and a Final (MC and Essay). PowerPoints are always provided. Take her class! You won't regret it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This class was incredibly easy ,and Professor Stallings is a gem. She does give pop quizzes ,but they are not terribly hard if you do the reading. Compared to other HIS 204 classes, she is definitely an easier professor and truly cares about her students. She even brought us pizza and cookies multiple times!

I took this class during the summer session and it was so easy. If you want an easy A take her class. She is very helpful and I strongly recommend her class. Lectures are very long.  She doesn't email or put the powerpoint anywhere so make sure to take your laptop with you when you go to class (you will need it to take notes).

She is a nice person, but never forget to write a paragragh explaining a poem you write for creative writing because she will NOT give you higher than a "C"..she accepts no late work..go to class because you have in class assignments..she makes you think about how to write with images a lot which is good but she can be a hard grader on poems...

I love Courtenay Stallings.  She is very sweet and helpful, especially if you talk to her outside of class.  She truly cares about her students.  Creative writing was easy, especially if you already like writing.  Great teacher!

Lectures are very boring- she just reads right off of the powerpoint.  Tests are essays- very easy if you look at her review guide.  The TAs graded the essays so it was really easy.  If she continues teaching HUM 313, take her!
stallings is technically only an adjuct at this point but she really does care about her students and wants to help them out. ill be happy to see her as a fulltime prof at pepperdine

Just pray that you don't get Humanities 212 with her!  While nice and caring, Stallings does not attempt to prepare her students for exams, nor does she try to make sure that her students are following her.  A lecture class is not what we want--we want to LEARN!  Better luck next class...

The most awesome professor at Pepperdine. She is soooo nice and helpful, actually cares about her students. She really sparks a passion inside you to write and I'm a math major! Tests are easy and straight from the notes, but you will still learn lots. This class is worth your tuition money!

COM 203 Intro to creative writing: easy class, and the assignments are fun to do, lots of writing but you can't get a bad grade on it (points are given if you write it in the correct font, right amt of pages, etc..) She's a cool teacher, really young and fun.
Lectures are great. You will reads a lot, and be prepared for a short quiz (5 to 10 questions) at the beginning of every lecture.

Professor Welday really wants his students to strive and actually learn. He can be a bit challenging. He never says no to helping students. He puts countless hours to helping his students who are struggling with the material like me. He's extremely fair and if he notices something's wrong with the test he gives extra points. Amazing teacher.
Terrible professor. Really shouldn't be teaching. If possible, avoid taking a course with him.

Idk why he has bad reviews he's a great professor. He's so involved with his students. Will stay after class to help u understand the subject fully. Will even show up on days that are not assigned to review for a test. He is always available  if u need help great professor . He seems unorganized but it gets better trust . Take his class!

This semester has been a nightmare He is a new professor and it deff. shows He is unorganized and gets lost on power points that he takes from the book Students went to the chairmen to let the him know this isn't right. His tests are hard and it's harder because we don't understand the material well enough. 2 days to learn a chapter is to fast!

DONT TAKE THIS CLASS! CONSIDER YOURSELF WARNED!! Very bad teacher, he's smart..im sure he knows his stuff but when it comes to giving the info to us (the class) so that we can comprehend) no bueno. Hes all over the place, its very true we will be quized on material he didnt lecture on yet. If you dont really need someone to teach you take this clas
DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. He is never prepare. He gives none sense questions on test. DO NOT TAKE!!!!!

Welday is not terrible but not great either. Hes very new which shows. Hes very inconsistent and unorganized. Some days I feel I learn a lot. Other days it feels like a complet waste of time. Hes nice and seems to really care. Ive had other new professors some better but Ive had worse also. Its just extra frustrating cause he requires so much work

DON'T TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. He is really smart but NOT a good instructor. BORING LECTURES,MAKES SCIENCE DULL and UNSTIMULATING,You will READ the ENTIRE book but maybe understand half, UNORGANIZED,NOT HELPFUL. You MUST be a self taught student with no job and taking maybe TWO other classes max in order to get an A. AVOID TAKING HIM BIO major

Welday is not a terrible professor, hes just not the best. You must be an independent learner to pass his class. requires a lot of work. he assigns quizzes before the material is covered. very unorganized and does not explain concepts well. i recommend taking this class with a different professor.

THIS PROFESSOR NEEDS TO GO!!! He is good one on one, but in class HELP! He gets confused by his own powerpoints that he takes from the book, he cannot explain things well. 54% of the class failed the first exam!! He goes way to fast for us to even comprehend the material, and he quizzes us 1-2 days after being assigned the chapter. NOT ENOUGH TIME!

DO NOT TAKE HIM. He does not teach at all. He just reads from the slides with little to no explaining on the subject. I have to youtube all of the sections to find a better explanation.I learn more from the lab professors then I do from class. I don't know why he is even a teacher if he can't teach!

This guy is not a teacher at all! All he does is read the powerpoints (that he didnt even write) that came from the textbook company. He refuses to give us a study guide and makes us pay $15 to get a clicker to take in class quizzes. Then he lies to us saying," If I don't have the quiz scores up by Thursday, I promise I will give you all A's."
Professor was useless. Confused by his own material. Teaching methods need improvement. Rigid in his methods. Not recommended unless you want to teach yourself. Overall terrible experience.
Frequently arrived to class late, very confusing, and hard to find outside of class. Did not treat students with respect.
Wastes class time, very rarely prepared. A poor instructor. Do not take this professor.
I took her in the spring of 2015  all you have to do is read the book take notes in class and you will do fine on the exams. she curves her exams as well.  do yourself a favor and take the class
UCLA to UC Santa Barbara - nough said.
Try Bachelder or Sexton
Carter bring NO empirical know to the table.
A true waste of time.
Global Economics - hmmm. She can hardly communicate domestically never mind international rationals.
If you would like to learn and dont want to pay $800/cr for a walking corpse, take any other ECON professor.
As bad as it gets. By far the worst Econ Prof in the Department. Take Bach if you want to learn.
A little too liberal for my tastes, but an awesome professor nonetheless.

Dr. Carter was probably the best teacher I have had so far at Pepperdine.  She is funny, smart, and teaches the class in a fair and understandable manner, giving helpful notes that are clearly outlined.  Unfortunately she left Pepperdine this year, but take her if she ever comes back.(She's an alum)
She is an awesome, yet pretty liberal teacher, but presents the material well and if you study the reading and do practice problems online, the class isn't too bad

She's crazy, but fun.  Wrote my recco's for Law School.  Some test questions were so,so but I did well.  When you want to get her off track one day, ask her to tell you about the time she stabbed her brother.
She is ok. Great b/c the final is optional and there are only two test
fun, interesting classes...and she's hot
The best econ teacher i ever had.  she is the bomb, and if you have the privilage of being in her class, listen to her knowledge.  she actually wrote the econ book.
No Comments

While I completely agree that professor Gorton is an extremely passionate and intelligent professor his classes are completely unreasonable. Took him fall semester and deciding not to take him spring semester was the best decision I ever made to enhance my abroad experience. Definitely not worth the amount of work for a GE class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: By far the best professor in Lausanne. Love him or hate him, it is very hard to avoid him. People complain about him because they're not willing to put in the work. If you manage your time well, are a decent writer, and put in moderate effort, it's definitely possible to earn a solid A. He's a weird, crazy, goof-enjoy every moment with Anthony.

Awesome professor, but it's impossible to get an A in his class. The highest grade someone got in his class before was an A-. So good luck if you enroll in his class. There's lots and lots of reading. Also, you don't have a choice but to keep up on the reading, since his pop quizzes are based off on the last three readings you did.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Gorton is well liked (as a person) by everyone, but good luck if you want fair grading, clear instructions, or an appropriate level of work for an abroad HUM G.E. Not only will Gorton not read your work, he will refuse to return your work to you until the day after your final. If you want to have a good abroad experience, avoid this class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He's kinda the best, also kinda impossible. You don't have a lot of choices in Lausanne. He's tough but he's part of the experience. You fear him, you sit with him at lunch, he sounds like a rock-star, he knows his stuff. He's an ART historian, his tests are rough & require some luck. I got As & B+s, took him for HUM212 & 313 and HIST204. A legend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: In one of his pop quizzes he tested us on a section of reading and put in blank spaces throughout the paragraph as if he expected us to memorize our entire reading word for word. Impossible.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He gives you about 60 multiple choice questions, 40 art pieces, and 4 essay questions (study guide) from which you are only tested on 4 multiple choice questions, 2 art pieces, and 1 essay. If you don't answer exactly what he's looking for you'll end up with a low to mid B. Almost impossible to get an A from him. Definitely the hardest prof abroad.
Hardest class I've ever taken. I thought this was abroad? Hes a cool guy tho.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Anthony Gorton is one of my favorite professors. Ever. He's an old man with a British accent, and is woke af  He is indeed a tough grader, but his lectures are honestly really entertaining. He's snarky and makes comments about things in history that you'll only catch if you're paying attention.  I had him for HUM 212, HUM 313, and HIST 204

Dr. Gorton is a really cool and interesting professor. Unfortunately he is a very tough grader. It is very difficult to get an A in his class. It takes a lot of work just to get an A-. He is a brilliant guy and fascinating to talk to and his lectures are interesting.
Dr. Gorton is a great professor, very interesting to talk to/listen too. The issue is he is a very hard grader. It is difficult to get an A in the class.

Toughest class i've had by far. He's not good about putting up grades, pop quizzes are tough, won't give full credit on a lot of assignment. His lectures are very long and he goes off on tangents. Very interesting guy, just pretty tough
Gorton is the man.

It's an interesting class to take abroad, because it's applicable and helps make connections while you're traveling, but it is time consuming! Way more work than there should be for a 3 unit class and he is difficult to follow along with in class. Be prepared for a hard course!!
The greatest class you will ever take because he is the greatest professor you will ever have. An incredibly fresh and remarkably honest approach to the subject. He is truly one of a kind.
GORTON IS THE BEST TEACHER YOU WILL EVER HAVE!!!!!! Such an intelligent British man. The boys want to be him and the girls wish he was younger so they could marry him.

I loved this professor so much! I took COM 180 for Fall Semester and she truly knew how to teach. We barely had homework and her lessons weren't too vigorous. She was always so nice and kind to us. My friends and I would always make jokes with her during class. This class isn't heavy at all and you have 4 speeches throughout the semester.

She is so sweet! I was hesitant to take her based off of the reviews but wow she truly is amazing! Free textbook that you will need for the midterm and extra credit group quizzes. She does activities and videos for class that are fun. She is very patient and kind with speeches. Midterm was hard so study in advanced!! Her lectures are light.

Ok so Professor Phillips is SO kind and helpful! The midterm is hard so do study! Offers a free online textbook and extra credit point group quizzes. Does fun activities in class and makes us feel comfortable with our speeches. Seriously one of thee best teachers! This woman deserves a raise!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Phillips is truly THE sweetest human being ever. She'll go out of her way to make her students feel so so loved! The midterm was insane, but she gave us a project instead of a final this past semester, which I'm so grateful for. She's pretty lenient on grading, but still, STICK TO THE RUBRIC! That stuff realllyyy matters esp in speech 3.
Just don't risk it, tough class and feedback is pretty generalized
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Straight up and awful teacher for a GE. Tough grader the the midterm and final were likely the hardest exams Ive taken at Pep. Most random and useless material. DO NOT TAKE HER AVOID AT ALL COSTS
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Super easy class, just study hard for that midterm, it was hard. Final was easy and the projects were enjoyable. This isn't a super demanding class, easy to pass but if you want an A, go to class, study for the midterm, and participate. She's so sweet and kind. Didn't need to do readings to pass.
tough grader and not willing to discuss grades once given out

Do not take Prof. Phillips for COM 313. She grades very harshly and the first midterm is incredibly hard. She doesn't prepare you at all for her tests so make sure to study extra hard for them ahead of time. So much extra work required for the projects that require you to drive places and go the extra mile just for an average grade. Avoid her.

Dr. Phillips is such a sweetheart, she really cares for her students & helps each and every one to improve on their public speaking skills. Although this semester was odd, she accommodated by letting us feel comfortable and heard. Quizzes were tough, so read the textbook! Graded on participation, 4 speeches, quizzes, and small projects.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Phillips genuinely cares for her students - she is so sweet and recognizes how difficult online classes can be. For the speeches, you are given an outline to go off of - in my experience, I thought she was an easy grader. There are also weekly quizzes from the textbook (free) but they are open-note. Participation is an easy grade too.

Professor Phillips is really kind and genuinely cares about her students. Her class is a decent amount of work and there's a good amount of reading, but it's all manageable. She offers extra credit a few times throughout the semester too. As long as you show up and follow her rubrics, you will get an A. She can sometimes be a tough grader, though.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Had her for my public speaking class during my freshman year and it was definitely my favorite class. She is a really understanding and funny person. Made public speaking less intimidating. I was hesitant to take her because she wasn't on RMP before but definitely did not regret taking her class at all.

AMAZING professor! Absolutely loved her class and getting to know her. She's a great person and very quirky. She makes it clear what she grades on and is a very nice grader for the speeches. Also, the textbook is free!

She made a a Gen Ed boring and painful. Make sure you fall on the same side of her social/political opinions. She is unresponsive to emails and you have to make an appointment for general office hours (through an email that she probably won't answer). I hope the "visiting" part of her title is true.

Professor Phillips is great! She understands that most people dread public speaking and does her best to make sure you are comfortable and wants you to succeed. For the mid-term and final just memorize the study guide - if you do, you will be fine. Do the readings because there are weekly quizzes for extra credit. Textbook is free online.

I love this Ms. Collins so much! She was such a light hearted professor who clearly loved what she was teaching. She never gave difficult homework, tests, or assignments. She truly knew how to make class engaging/ entertaining.She has unfortunately let go of her job as of spring semester in 2025, but in case she comes back, she's an amazing prof!

I love professor Collins. She is such a caring and loving teacher. She uses slides while she lectures, her tests are manageable, participation is easy with her, and her assignments are light. She's just an amazing person who loves and welcomes everyone.
Great Prof. Super kind and approachable.

Her lectures are extremely boring and hard to follow. She jumps around from thing to thing which makes it hard to know what exactly we are learning in class. Her midterm and final are easy though and it's really easy to get an A, just a really really boring class.
One of the best teachers here at Pepperdine, amazing person. Makes the class fair and not difficult for everyone. Take her 100%
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Ms. Collin's great! She makes the lectures fun and interesting. A lot of reading for the reading quizzes but open book. Midterm was surprisingly not bad! She preps you well for it and offers a study guide. Fun group activities. Very respectful to other cultures, religions, and peoples opinions. Will be taking her next courses!

One of the best Religion profs here! Her grading criteria is so fair with a good balance of tests, h/w and in-class participation. She is also very friendly & kind! Offers policy where u are able to buy back up to 50 points for doing an xtra assignment. Only criticisms were that it was hard to reach her by email & lectures were confusing / monotone

Professor Collins is very nice, and her tests are fair and easy. Learned a lot in her class. Attendance is not mandatory, but she does grade participation and attendance, so in a way it is mandatory. Beware- participation is worth a lot more than most classes, and it is difficult to get a good grade in it without good attendance.

Rachel is awesome! The workload was minimal and the final was a group project. She's very laid back, and the exams are super easy if you study the study guide. She also offered multiple extra credit opportunities. Rachel is extremely knowledgeable in her field but understands that people are just taking the class to fulfill the GE requirement.

Professor Collins is enthusiastic when she lectures and makes learning at such a fast pace easy to understand. 2 exams, 1 group project, and a few quizzes. She prepares you well for the tests and gives you plenty of time for the group project. I hope to take another course from Professor Collins in the future!

Best professor ever! Super sweet and funny. Laid back classes. Engaging and simply lectures. Straight forward assignments and choices for how you complete them. Final project is a group project which I didn't like cause my group did not do their part, but she was super easy to talk to and make sure that my grade was not brought down bc of them.

She is a super nice person, if you did all the quizzes well and attend her class and pay some attention to the projects, you'll be fine. But her review session for the midterm and her study guide for final are awful, they were not helpful at all!!! Study by yourself, and look deep into the PowerPoint.

She is passionate about what she is teaching and you really learn a lot!! There is a good amount of group work but it's very manageable, and she cares about her students and hears your feedback. Her midterm and final are multiple choice and are pretty tricky, but if you study enough you will get a B+/A- on them.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: If you really want to learn something about reading the Bible and thinking about faith, TAKE HER! Really nice textbook and discussion. A class that really makes you think. An enjoyable experience. But a little-bit-hard grader on papers. If you do the work, you will get A-, but hard to get an A.

Prof Collins was super sweet and willing to help students! We did lectures outside of class & had lots of in class discussions. Her material was straightforward, which I liked instead of having a bunch of info I would forget. Note- 2 major group projects, & my groups unfortunately didn't pull their weight. Don't take if you don't like group work!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Professor Collins did an excellent job of teaching class during the pandemic, keeping it engaging throughout. You can expect a lot of breakout rooms during class but they are really great for discussion. Lectures are usually short and pre-recorded but have useful information. Definitely recommend taking a class from her, I learned a lot!

She's super understanding and caring! Work consisted of discussions, lectures, readings, group projects, mini papers, and two tests. The readings she assigned were intriguing. She provides you with great feedback for your mini papers and prepares you for her tests greatly. Take her class!

She was such a great REL101 professor, esp for a GE. Really engages the class in the material and all her projects are honestly fun to do which is crazy. You learn so much from her class and she is honestly such an amazing professor to get to know. I'd recommend her to anyone. If you put in the effort you'll score high in the class.

Super fun professor with engaging lectures. Attendance is mandatory but easy to get around if you can't always make it to class. As long as you skim the readings and go to class or get notes, the tests and quizzes are pretty easy

Dr. Hall is a very funny and engaging professor. His class is fairly simple and there is not too much work to complete outside of class. He could definitely improve upon communicating with his students, but overall Hall is a fabulous professor and teaches a wonderful class.

Hall is lots of fun and actually makes class very entertaining, so I would highly recommend going! Some of the readings are pretty long but there aren't all that many. The only tough thing is that there aren't all that many grades, so if part of your grade isn't great, it's hard to get your grade back up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: easy GE and many ways to get around his attendance policy.

If you have at least 1 brain cell you can pass his class. I only studied for the first exam, the other two were completely common sense and you can get an A if you all but skim the textbook. Easiest class I have ever taken, add it to your schedule to get it out of the way asap.

The most amazing teacher of all time. AMAZING. He made me want to switch to a soc major. He's so funny and his lectures are the opposite of boring--you do not need to take notes in class either, he tells you this and posts the notes. My favorite guy ever--take any of his classes but soc 200 was amazing. He's also extremely progressive which I love.
Super great prof, I love Dr. Hall! Lectures were inspirational. Tests are all online, if you go to lectures you'll get an A!

I loved Dr. Hall's class. He is so nice and just a great person all around. The only thing about his class is there's not many assignments so if you do poorly on one test you're kinda screwed. Make sure you do well on exams from the start and you'll get an easy A

He is a really nice teacher and the class is very fun and interesting. The exams are 100 questions and lowkey so hard for me. There is a lot of information you need to study. You also have a pop quiz on a book you read which is 20 questions. Just make sure to study a lot. It is nice tho that homework is super easy and fast

Dr. Hall is a very funny guy. While his class was easy, I did not enjoy the fact that he was not reachable outside of class, the TA helped me more. He also neglected to put in our final exam as a part of our grade. Very nice guy with very entertaining lectures, but he really needs to get more organized.

The best professor I've so far at Pepperdine! He's super funny and the subject he teaches is super interesting. His tests are chill, 2 midterms and 1 final. We also had to read a book, but it was a fantastic one and his quiz on it wan't hard. Great class!

I honestly hated this class, most of your grade is comprised from quizzes and exams.The hw is manageable but there is not enough time to learn as much info as he shares. Details matter to him on tests and participation is required as he asks questions from parts of lectures. We have weekly hw, 3 exams and 1 book quiz.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Hall is a wonderful man who gives great lectures. He also sends out study guides before tests, which is really what you're going to use to pass the class. Though his lectures are useful, there's not enough time to actually teach all of the material, so reading the textbook is actually required. You can also use the second-to-last published edition.

Took Dr. Hall's Anatomy of Hate seminar class and absolutely loved it! He truly wants his students to understand the material. His class is more discussion based. He was very respectful of other people's opinions and actually wanted to hear what we thought. The 3 books were manageable, even for non-readers like myself. I highly recommend!!

I took the seminar class Anatomy of Hate with Dr Hall, and he is also a sociology professor. I learned so much in seminar class with him! He does mostly group projects and book discussions and covers many issues in America and history. He really cares about his students. 3 books and 2 presentations, attendance is mandatory.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: LOVED Erbes as a person. As a teacher, she is a TOUGH grader, if she doesn't like you, your grade suffers. She is so sweet but her feedback is super cut-throat. She likes things done HER way, and is not flexible in this. Get on her good side, work hard, and you'll be fine!!

Dr. Erbes is an absolute GEM!! Any chance you have to take her class, take it!! She cares so much about her students, is hilarious and a really good teacher. She teaches course content in an engaging, interactive and fun manner that makes you want to go class. The most fun class and I learned SO much about teaching

Dr. Erbes is one of the best professors I have had so far. Her teaching methods are very unconventional but super interactive. She is a real gem of a person and takes the time to get to know each and every student of hers. She also makes herself as available as possible to her students if they need any help or have any queries.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Erbes is a wonderful professor. She genuinely cares about each and every one of her students. Cannot recommend her enough!
Great Lectures, But very tough on grades and if she doesn't like you it can effect your grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I LOVE DR. ERBES! She is a mother figure on campus. She not only prepares you for college but also gives you useful tips for life. She's so sweet, funny and genuinely cares about her students. There were 3 projects but all of them could be done as a group and she broke up the work nicely so it wasn't that overwhelming. Lots of work but worth it.

Dr. Erbes invests in her students more than any educator I have ever encountered. She puts a lot of thought and effort into each lecture and assignment, and cares about whether the students are responding and learning. She wants you to succeed, and will help you get there every step of the way. She's simply an amazing professor.

Dr. Erbes is one of the BEST professors at Pepperdine. A lot of these ratings talk about attendance policy. Of COURSE you need to show up to class! Dr. Erbes truly prepares her students for the real world. So many alumni still keep in touch with her, enjoy her hospitality, and follow her adventures. I advise everyone to take Dr. Erbes class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Terrible on research papers. She has two research papers in one semester, both of them is 10+ pages. Limited time. She is sometimes funny, but I do not want to laugh. She is very mean if you are late or absent whatever is the reason. Also, if she does not like you, she will give you low grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Erbes is a truly inspiring professor! She is great at what she does and is highly knowledgeable in her field. I always felt extremely comfortable with asking for help and clarification, which she gave with grace and poise. Dr. Erbes is by far one of the best teachers at Pepperdine and inspires teacher candidates to reach their full potential.

Dr. Erbes means well - at least I hope so.  It is just that she is not knowledgeable.  She has gotten old, and seems angry all the time.  She does not take it out on you, it is just bad to be around it.
Took her first year seminar, and it was by far the most powerful experience of my freshman year. Dr. Erbes is a truly inspirational educator!

She loves what she does but sometimes is a little too intensely involved!  Make sure she likes you! A lot of work and the research paper isn't fun.  It basically is extremely time consuming class.  But if you love teaching then shes good if your passionate about it.  BUT YOU HAVE TO STUDY! A lot of quizzes!!!

Dr. Erbes is one of the best professors I have ever had. She's clear and makes class really interesting. Watch out for the attendance policy and chapter quizzes, but everything else is really easy. She really cares about her students and teaching them to be good teachers. Tests, papers, all easy.

She has rubrics for EVERYTHING, which I guess is so she can say she grades fair (which isn't totally true). If you take her, make sure she likes you, because if she doesn't-the class is so horrible. She made me cry more than once. A horrible experience.

She is very good at relating to her students and applying things we are talking about to every day experiences. Dr. Erbes is so good at teaching that I hardly ever take notes, yet I do fine on tests. Great at what she does and a great person!
Not a bad class but he makes things pretty hard to understand. I enjoyed the class but a lot of it became very confusing.

He is probably one of my favorite professors and I have learned the most in his HUM classes than any other GE. He lectures and they can be hard to follow but it's important that you do. also MAKE SURE you go to the individual meetings, otherwise you won't know your grade. He teaches really interesting stuff but you have be willing to work hard.
drones on and on. difficult to pay attention. not sure what he's saying a lot of the time. bad english

I highly recommend taking his class, but only if you are willing to pay attention. You will learn a lot listening to him, but you have to be actively engaged. I loved all the in class analysis of writing and artwork. I loved how he connected all of history in a few principles of human condition. I gained more from his class than any other GE.
Most boring teacher EVER

Sassot is a professor in Pepperdine's Buenos Aires program currently. As I had taken Hum 111 and absolutely hated it, I was pleasantly surprised by how interesting Hum 212 was with the way he taught it. He is a professor that will blow your mind as he focuses heavily on human condition. Several reading quizzes, a paper and a final. Recommend!

Amazing teacher. You have to follow his monologues and you will really learn. He is a teacher for guys who think above the normal. If you are a lazy guy who just go and sit or you go just because your parents sent you, you won't take advantage of the class.  It is really enriching, he teaches life lessons. Never met a teacher like him.

I have no idea why people are hating on his lectures on this site. He's one of the most intelligent and engaging people I've ever met. Take his class. He's absolutely amazing and the work wasn't too much.

Mess around on your computer and maybe nap while Sassot talks a lot without really saying anything. Then, write a 4-6 page paper on a bad movie. You might learn something in this class, but it won't be from the lectures.

At the start of the class it was clear that Sassot was either a genius or full of crap and here at the end I now feel it is the latter. Although an incredibly personable and kind, even intellectual man, his cryptic monologues are at best not useful when it comes to learning about or even appreciating art and at worst incoherent.

Sassot is first and foremost, a genius. He cares but never gives so much leeway that you lose respect for him and the subject matter is always intensely interesting, especially if you're interested in the study of the human condition. Take this class for great conversations and a passionate teacher.

Professor Sassot is an engaging teacher.  In our humanities course, he spent most of the time discussing philosophy and art.  The philosophy was the most helpful because, as we learned the floorplan of 19th-20th century philosophy, trends in art, music, and social events became very easy to trace.  I'm very fond of his pedagogy.

You might have an A, and you might have a C... as he told me during my end of year evaluation (wouldn't you know a week before grades are due?) His discussions are largely philosophy-based, interesting but scattered... and his voice, Ah, his voice!! not the easiest thing to stay awake during after a night out at the club!!

I learned absolutely nothing in his class. You aren't required to read, there are no grades except the final AND his incredibly subjective evaluation of you... if you want the easiest possible A of your LIFE, take this and suck up to him.

Rafael is the easiest A that you will ever get. However, you will need to endure seemingly endless classes of lecture, that honestly have nothing to do with Humanities. If you have the option of taking Marcello, you essential are choosing between A) learning something (but putting in work with Marcello) or B) Leaning nothing and getting an easy A.

Frau Stimmel offered a really great German class this semester. She's a really fun professor who clearly loves her job. With daily classes and light workloads, I feel like it was relatively easy to keep up with the class, despite its fast pace. 6 quizzes and 5 tests, but only light studying ever needed. Just pay attention and you'll easily succeed.

While this course was challenging for me, Prof. Stimmel made it fairly enjoyable. She is pretty intense, so make sure you know what you're doing. But she also is very helpful and accomodating in office hours and emails. Stimmel is funky and fun to be around!

insanely fast paced class, expected to pick things up immediately. she's a native speaker so doesn't understand why everyone struggles so much. doesn't explain things well or communicate with students on deadlines or tests. be prepared to have 1-2 tests/quizzes every week. going abroad next semester and have 0 confidence to communicate while there
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Stimmel is very organized and her class is easy to follow. She is big on participation, but her grading criteria for that is somewhat unclear. Her class is tough to get an A in, but if you participate and do the hw, you will do fine.

Attendance is mandatory, and she doesn't accept excuses unless you have a form or doctor's note. Other than that, she's a great and patient teacher, super good at her job, and cares deeply about students. German is hard but she makes it easy

Frau Stimmel taught an awesome course- it was fast paced and had lots of HW. She's available for help outside of class! Very big on participation. You can't miss a day of this class without feeling behind. Focus during lectures and study outside of class, and you'll do just fine. Don't be afraid to ask questions - she seems strict but will help!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Frau Stimmel did an excellent job of teaching entry-level German to a variety of different students (especially during the COVID19). You can pretty much expect the difficulty level to be pretty similar to any middle/high school entry level language course. This class is relatively fast-paced with a lot of practice HW. If you practice you'll pass.
Good teacher. Easy tests. Easy homework.

Holocaust is a hard topic and Professor Stimmel is a tough-grader. You will be expected to do two papers, pop quizzes, one oral presentation, one midterm, and one final exam. Participation is 15 percent of your grade so make sure you talk a lot in class. This class is not easy as she grades hard on midterm, final, two papers that are all essays.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I had Professor Stimmel for First Year Seminar: The Holocaust in Film and Culture. It was an inspirational class, and you will certainly become very informed about the Holocaust. She's very knowledgeable in this area, and as long as you read and watch the assigned material, you will do fine in this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Stimmel is actually from Poland so some phrases she teaches you will not make sense to Germans. Other than that, she prepared me well enough to speak to Germans and I was able to take Intensive German in Heidelberg without freaking out. She's a little mean in class but she'll help you with everything you ask about. Good teacher, okay person.

Dr. Stimmel was my professor for first-year seminar. We learned about the Holocaust. It was extremely repetitive & emotionally draining when we went to class. We watched movies & read books. The tests were easy and it's overall and easy class. You definitely learn a lot about the Holocaust. Stimmel is very nice, talk to her & get to know her.

Dr. Stimmel does an excellent job of conveying the language in an understandable manner to beginner level students. She is very fair with her tests and assessments and is a great option if you are planning on taking german.

I had Stimmel for 151, 152, and 251. Her homework load is manageable and her tests are fair, but I honestly just didn't like her as a professor. She wasn't very helpful and got mad at you for not understanding. She's big on participation.
Great professor. Really chill and laid back.  She really wants you to learn German and is good at teaching the concepts.  Tests are decent and she prepares you for them well.

He is such a nice professor. His test are a little technical like specific dates and stuff. Other than that , it is not a hard class, but even if you think you know a lot about the Bible, don't expect to get an easy A. You will have to still put in a little time.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Tests are tough

comment: He is a really good professor, and cares how his students do. Don't walk in expecting to make an easy A, but if you put the time in, you will be fine. He gives really good notes, and easy to follow syllabus.

Mathews is a very good professor, super organized and objective guy. I took Rel 101 and he did a great job teaching it from a academic perspective (being nonreligious I anticipated it would be 'preachy' but it was very insightful). Lots of reading, but if you take good notes and pay attention, don't skip class, and you'll do well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great guy. And really Funny. Takes time to make sure you understand the topic.

He is a nice guy, and seems to know his subject matter. He doesn't make the class too interesting, but it's bearable to the point that it's not boring. If you put in the work, you should be able to do well in the class.

No outside homework was required, but it was recommended. If you do it, it makes such a difference on the tests. Mathews is extremely well versed in his material, and caused me to take an even greater interest in the Old Testament. His tests are difficult if you don't go to class. But if you take thorough notes in his class, you'll be fine.
The class is pretty easy all the way up until the final. I cruised through the class with an A and when the final came along it dropped my grade substantially. Fairly easy class other than the final.

Challenging but rewarding class. Places burden on student to learn.  Be sure to show up in class and be very, very organized!  Believes that general ed classes should be more demanding than one's major!  But I can see why after taking this class.
He's super nice! Busy work but manageable! Every time I hav questions, he is always so patient. Great professor!! Glad that I had him for religion!

Nice guy but... Unreasonable amounts of busy work, reading, writing, and regurgitating homework. Terrible test questions that do not tie in with the lectures or books. Horrible grading. Random lectures are unorganized, boring as hell, and usefulness. MORE effort and homework for this class than all my other (business & GE) classes combined.
He is very nice and understanding. All the work is busy work, but the class is very straightforward and easy if you do all the work.

Class is easy but he has a strict attendance policy, so don't take him at 8am. Class work is boring and monotonous but he's a really nice and understanding guy. There's a lot of work but it pads your grade. not my favorite class but it could be worse.

Professor Mathews is incredibly nice and really loves what he teaches, however, the class is pretty boring and most of the work is busy work, but it is easy to get an A if you just do the work.  There are weekly reading tests on incredibly boring material, but they help your grade.  He isn't the best, but he definitely isn't the worst!

His class is pretty straight forward. He's an easy going guy, and he genuinely cares about his students and the subject he teaches. The weekly reading tests are tricky at first, and annoying, but they have boosted my grade. No midterm! As long as you do the work he asks you, you'll be fine. It's pretty easy to earn an A in his class

He is hearing impaired so it's kind of hard to understand him. You have to do a ton of homework and then do nothing in class, but have to come because you always have reading tests. Do not take him...it is extremely frustrating that you do ALL the work and he does NOTHING but demands a lot from you

Dr. Bauer is one of the BEST psych professors. People say her tests are lengthy but their average. She is a fair grader, nothing tricky. Just wants to make sure you understand the material. I'm taking her for sumer and I also will be taking her for fall as well. YAY DR. BAUER!!! :D
Dr. Bauer is very organized.  You will know exactly what you have to know for each exam.  Study her power-point notes and you will succeed.  Plus she is a wonderful person. Quirky but wonderful.
Terrific professor! Extremely thorough and enthusiastic about her field.
I took REsearch Methods and she is really great. No attendance policy and tests are straight forward. the class is mostly a project that if you work hard enough, youll do well on.

I miss Lisa so much.  She was the best psychology professor at Utica College and her knowledge and wisdom is greatly missed!!  She will help you through your classes and takes time to get to know you on a personal level.  There is not anything she won't try to help you with!!!  Be good to her Pepperdine!!!

Professor Bauer has a heart of gold.  Take the time to get to know her personally, she's got some great stories; the ones about her husband or her childhood boyfriends are especially hilarious!!  She is adorable and has a sweet tooth, so if you want to get her a cookie or something, she'd love that!
One of my favorite professors. I highly recommend taking her classes. She seems to have an infinite amount of time to help students and can explain complex concepts so anyone can understand.

Great Teacher. One of the best I have had in the psyc. dept here. Cares for students. Sad that she isn't Tenure track. Take her before Polage comes back. Smilie. She is effective at explaining or giving tangible examples for abstract concepts. Her class is set up to help you LEARN not memorize the subject. Yeah!

She is one of the best profs i have had at pepp. She is very caring and will go out of her way for the students.  Random stories made class alittle more interesting. She says "OK" and "right you guys" all the time.

She is very helpful and approachable. She really wants you to succeed and is understanding if your computer crashes and you can't print out a report or something. Tests are hard but easily passible if you study your notes and make sure to go to her study sessions before the test. Overall good class.

Great Professor but only here for a limited time.  Very organized lectures make note taking easy which is crucial for tests.  Study your notes and you will do very well on the tests.  Goes out of her way for exam review sessions before tests.  Extremely dedicated to students!!!

If you want to have fun and laugh a lot, take her! She is always making you to laugh so hard and enjoy every lecture of hers! She didn't take attendance, but no one ever skip her class, becuase she is awesome and so funny! You will learn a lot from her, and she is just great!!!

SHe is overly nice and annoying.  She makes her students take "pop" quizzes nearly every class period on every chapter.  She says "right you guys" ALL THE TIME 2 keep the class interested while she rambles on abouut her grandma, her husband or some rgandom story abput nothing.  Her class is boring
she is a great teacher with a great heart. she really wants you to do well. tests can be hard, but just study from the notes. she's really approachable and other work is appropriate to the class.

She is engaging and funny.  She has the ability to make a not so exciting subject entertaining.  Her tests are difficult, but if you study your class notes, you'll do fine.  Utilizes many different teaching methods.  It's fun to count how many times she says "Right you guys?" during class.

Seriously, take Murrie for COM205. COM205 itself isn't easy, but Murrie makes sure it's doable and not stressful like the other prof. Outside participation is graded, which is kind of challenging, but he makes sure to help if you ask for it. He's a great prof, cares about his students, and will work with you if you're struggling with a deadline.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: TAKE CLASSES FROM HIM. Although some aspects were a little more difficult like outside class participation and large media projects, he really wants everyone to succeed. He saw we were overwhelmed and moved the final project back, let us retake quizzes, always asked for our input on due dates, and was really understanding and flexible.

He was the chairman of my thesis committee.  Often times, his contemporaries on the committee were confusing, and he was able to clear me up on their thought so I could go on from there.  I don't know what it would have been like without him.
He really knows the material and cares about students.  Although he's reserved and confusing at times, if you actually care about the subject and pay attention, he's the best!
Great professor for Telecom stuff. I've taken three classes with him and he's simply the best in the division.
Overall bad teacher had no idea what he was doing.  Basically just reworded the reading assignments.
He's a great guy! He will always help you if you need it, just call his cell phone!
Great guy! Learned a lot from him... more out of class than in class. He requires a lot of work, but it's helpful in the real world.

Dr. Murrie- is a great guy.  He is dedicated, willing to help anyone...you just gotta ask.  He will do anything to help you, both in theory and in practice.  I would like to encourage him to come out of his shell and show a lil' more personality.
No Comments
has a good heart, but doesnt know how to teach his expertise to students; hard for him to break it down b/c he knows so much. good person-bad teacher
Murrie is a HORRIBLE teacher.  Has no clue how to deal with people in a major that REQUIRES people skills.  He's not challenging, just not good at actually TEACHING kids. Nuff said.
Knows tons about his field,but doesn't do a good job of teaching it.
Great teacher, really wants to help students...
Great teacher.  Misunderstood, but awesome!

I was worried my literature GE was going to be so hard but this class ended up being one of my favorites. Prof. Fulmer is very sweet and caring. The class is simple. You read a short story and write a short summary every day. There are 3 short papers where you just have to compare and contrast characters. Loved the class & I highly recommend it.

Professor Fulmer is an awesome professor. Shes's very nice and I definitely learned a lot in this semester. I absolutely wouldn't mind taking another class of hers. Just a heads up though, her class is very difficult for non-English majors. If you are an English major however, her class would be nothing to you.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Fulmers class is not for the faint of heart,  but she is just as supportive as her class is challenging. When you ask for help she will help you. There are exams every two weeks, 4 quizzes throughout the semester, and 1 group presentation. Take her course only if youre willing to put in the work. Otherwise, you might want to pass on this one.

Prof. Fulmer is a good teacher but very demanding for what she teaches. For Brit Lit we have big tests every two weeks.  She grades VERY hard (she'll take off points if you don't spell something right). We have assignments every night (that you have to do) and presentations in class daily. We've never had a break and never been let out early.

she is a very nice woman, and EXTREMELY smart, but i honestly couldnt keep up with her. she expects a lot a lot a lot out of her students so dont think youll get by easy. and definitely dont get on her bad side... it sticks.

basically, don't take this class if you're looking to sail through an easy Lit GE because we read 5 victorian novels, take a billion quizzes, and write a billion annotated bibliographies. i mean, honestly... she's a nice lady for sure- but she does think that our worlds revolve around charles dickens and emily bronte.
Dr. Fulmer is off the chain!  She's so intelligent, witty and helpful.  She really wants to see you succeed and she's great at writing reccommendations.

Loved this course! I was not excited to take it at all but Fulmer is a great teacher and you read all the great poets. Her tests are very challenging but study hard and you will do well. Fulmer is incredibly nice and helpful!

Dr. Fulmer is a very nice lady and very knowledgable.  however, at 8.00 am it's very difficult to concentrate and the subject matter can often be boring.  she expects a lot and makes you work hard for your A... (or B in my case!)

Such a kind old soul. This class changed me from hating to loving poetry, and made me think a lot. The tests are a breeze, provided you pay attention in class and take notes. You read some neat stuff in the class. I definitely recommend her.

fulmer is very good about helping students individually, and showing that she cares. she is also quite knowledgeable on the subject. the class had its "ups" and "downs," but overall was enjoyable (other than being at 8 AM)
she's wonderful!
Very good teacher.

British Literature- I feel like this is a waste of my time. Class time is spent reading to each other. Here tests are no piece of cake either. I feel like I truly "learned" more in my high school class.
i have british lit. make sure you do not wear any lotion to class.

Really fun professor. He makes a lot of joked during his lectures, which helps you stay engaged. He also comes up with fun ways to learn the topics. He's pretty accessible outside of class. There's weekly homework and tests aren't long. The final is very similar to the tests, so it's not too bad.
