Prof Sherbetjian gives homework every wk & does not grade it until after we have already been tested on the material. He grades it based on accuracy which can be frustrating if you aren't getting feedback on missed concepts. He is available outside of class everyday which is super helpful when you don't understand something.

poor communicator and unorganized, semesters over, and half my assignments aren't graded. Still made students take the final even with fire and didn't offer anything to those who had to take it in person. Grades on correctness without saying. never responds to emails and homework is weird based on lessons a week before,

If campus is ever on fire don't count on him to be lenient. he'll email you at 9pm the night before your final to say it's still on the next day at 1:30 pm after you've lost an entire study day evacuating and on top of that left all your notes and laptop in your dorm.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Best math professor I've taken at Pepperdine.  Class is hard no way around that, but he'll stay for hours at school the night before a test so you can do dozens of practice problems until you practically know the test.  Makes a difficult subject easy to digest.  Lenient grader as well.

FAVORITE PROFESSOR IN PEPPERDINE. The most empathetic and understanding who is willing to stay in office hours past midnight just to help students out especially before midterms or finals. If you are lucky enough to have him for math 140 or 150 super worth it!1!1!

Sherb is a great dude and has a huge heart, but he lacks teaching wise. He gives worksheets worth 15% of your grade but you never see the answers or get them back. Same with HW, all HW was graded last day of sem, never saw corrected answers. Never responded to one email, also SUPER HARSH with partial credit on exams. There r better Math 150 profs.

If you put in the work for this class, (go to office hours, study and do homework) you'll do just fine. He also takes things into consideration when unexpected things happen, whether you miss class or have test issues.

Attendance is not mandatory. Skipping a lecture will give you alot to catch up on. Harsh grader but will give you points for understanding the concept if you made a computational error. If you are sick he is not considerate and wont help. Doesnt respond to emails. Tries to be likeable but will not change the way does things.

Took him for MATH 140 & 141 last year, he is amazing!! As long as you go to all classes or at least get notes for whichever days you miss and put in effort, an A is pretty achievable. He cares about your learning and that you do well- if you show you care, he will do his best to help you. Also easily accessible for help and questions out of class
I love his class. Clear instructions and great lectures. Would take it again.

Super difficult class!! Do not expect an easy A. He is very kind and helps a lot in office hours but can also be unfair and last minute at moments. We received the study guide too close to the exam and the homework is graded very hard. That being said if you aren't a procrastinator you can 100% get an A. Just go into this class ready to learn.

Interesting class, I take this class every morning at 8 a.m. His class requires full attention, but it's worth it. Go to his office hours and he is always willing to help with every question. I ended up getting an A, thank you professor!

Professor Sherbetjian is a great math professor, and explains mathematics concepts through real-life examples and concepts, allowing students to better understand certain topics. His office hours are useful for clarification and homework questions. He has an open-door policy where you can visit him for questions whenever his office door is open.

this man is the best math teacher I have ever had! sure his class made me cry sometimes because it was hard, but because he is awesome and a great teacher, I ended with an a. also, go to his office hours or even just stop by his office because he might be there. I found that he is available to help during hours that are past his office hours.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: not good at math at all but I actually learned in his class more than I have ever in a any math class. three midterms one final exam and 8-10 in class worksheets you do as a group. homework is weekly due on Saturday or Sunday. super funny and connects math to pop culture

Professor Sherbetijian is amazing and so caring. There are 3 exams and a final, which are usually fair. The course is not a super easy A but you can definitely earn one if you put in the effort. He is very caring and understanding and will help you as much as you need via office hours or over email. Definitely take him if you can!

His lectures are extremely dull and mundane. The material conveyed through the lecture will most likely not be on the exams. The exams are also difficult and not curved. He will make you do an arduous amount of reading per week/give writing that accompanies it. It is nearly impossible to get 4/4 on any writing assignment after the first few.

Professor Luben is a nice guy, but I have issues with how he teaches. Here's my experience:

-too many hours of reading
-class is structured by having to do the readings, then the quiz, then the lecture, which made no sense
-he is not an engaging lecturer
-you don't know your overall grade until the end of the course

Overall, I hated this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Luben is very passionate about what he teaches. He goes in-depth on the main topics discussed in the textbook and is open to answering questions; however, he often leaves you with an open-ended answer. BE EXPECTED TO READDDD!!!!  I DEFINITELY had much more coursework in this class than my other courses, including my Major classes.

As a person this professor is great, but there was a lot of work for a first level GE course. Compared to others in the same course with different teachers, I always had more work and more tests that I felt were not needed. I took many hard classes and this was my lowest grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He is very knowledgable on his subject and gives you exact questions that will be on midterm and final. The workload is way too much for a GE. I spent more time on this class than I did for classes in my major. Weekly quizzes are on the material that you are about to take notes on which doesn't make any sense. Lectures are bland and not engaging.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His religion 101 class is definitely a lot of work compared to the other religion 101 classes, but it is not that bad. He clearly tells you what will be on the final and midterm, so those aren't too bad, just a lot of memorizing. There is a quiz every Monday, which can be annoying, but these help you on the exams so study them well. Tbh take him.

This professor was the most caring professor I have ever had. He always made himself available after class and during the week. Even though I am no longer in his class I still reach out to him. The class was tested on what we learned and it was possible to get an A by doing the readings.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: He's a good guy but his class is quite hard as the amount of information that is given in both the lecture and textbook readings is enormous.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Not too hard if you do the reading and pay attention in class. Quizzes every week and long lectures, but there's participation that really helps your grade. I'd take him again, manageable and tries his best to make a 3 hr lecture entertaining.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Not too hard, I didn't do great in the beginning because I forgot everything on the quizzes was in the review section at the end of each chapter, which was my own fault. Once I was reminded of that I did pretty well. He assigns a chapter a week, a few chapters out of the OT, and podcast papers once in a while. Do the work and you can get an A.

We are required to read around 20 pages from the textbook and then at least 10 chapters of the Old Testament for a quiz at the start of every class. I studied the most out of all of my classes for the first exam and I got a D. His lectures are boring. I DO NOT recommend.

What makes me mad about this class is that compared to other REL101 classes, it is so much more difficult. If you miss a class, he refuses to let you make up a quiz, even if its for a Pepperdine event (excluding athletics). The class is boring and the lectures are long. Dont take this class.

Luben is a great professor and his class is as good as an OT class will get. His lectures are long but he'll try to keep students engaged. He clearly knows a lot about the subject but tries not be bias about certain topics or push religion on anybody. I wish I could take him for Religion again. BTW, can't miss class. Quizzes every week.

Prof. Luben is knowledgable about the OT and I respect his objective point-of-view when teaching the Bible, despite the fact that he is a minister. His class is solely lectures and can seem very long. He doesn't try very hard to engage students. There is a quiz basically every class that's fairly detailed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great guy! One of the most down to earth guys you'll ever meet! I wish I could take him for religion again. As long as you do the reading and study mostly vocab its an easy pass.
a lot of memorization and no explanation on his end, his classes are tough to pay attention in and I don't think I learn
His midterm and final are difficult and make up almost 60% of your grade.
worst teacher at pepperdine! i hate this class with a passion!

She should be a high school teacher.  this class is exactly like a high school class, she doesn't know or teach the information well, and she tests on things she never tells you about.  Readings are unbearable and yet you need to do them.  avoid avoid avoid

Great professor. This is a great class about different perspectives in american history. In the course description the class is about race (native, black, and white.)The previous comments reflect pure ignorance. Tests are essay format but all she tests for is to see if you have read. (1 ch./class usually) Great course, insightful and thoughtful.

She is a sweet lady, but she definitely likes to make everything in history pertain to race. I felt like I was in a black history class. It was very interesting and I feel like I learned a lot. The tests are pretty hard. She is good about meeting with you outside of class. Awesome lady, glad the class is over.

This class often feels like a high school class, but her lectures are enjoyable.  We often get off on tangents that aren't at all related to History, which is kind of frustrating, but for the most part, the class is clear and too the point.

She's an eloquent well spoken professor. She is very well informed in her subject and it amazes me the amount of ignorace she tolerates from the demographic majority (rich ass, stupid ass white kids) The previous comments should be checked gramatically before they can be considered credible. If you have an interest in history, she will nurture it.

She means well and can be helpful out of class but she is not a good teacher.  The books she uses for classes are IMPOSSIBLE to read through.  I would say about 10% of the class actually reads the material.  Her tests are ridiculous and she grades the essays as if all her students were history majors.  DO NOT TAKE HER!
Class is boring and can be difficult to do well in.   It all depends how much time you spend reading the primary sources and essays.
She is never prepared for the class. It seems like she only lecture in class for twice a week and then there is no way you can get her help from anywhere.

She is the worst worst worst history teacher I've ever had. The books she used suck; her class is boring. Hard to communicate with her. She acted as she is humorous but actually she is NOT. She teaches less than what she tests. Don't take her class.

She think she is funny.I don't think so. She think her outlook is good. I don't think so. She try to be caring but she is not. She is the THE MOST NOT understanding professor i ever had at Pepperdine. She loves to talk about slaves. She hardly have any written notes to you. All she does is giving an confusing speech she doesn't cared if u get it or

Professor's logic and way of thinking are way off base. Her "preaching" during lectures really seemed to make several students uncomfortable. While she might be intelligent, her drivel is biased on many levels and she made no effort AT ALL to provide any clarification. Much agreed that she has a chip on her shoulder.  Experience is thankfully over!

Material very imformative.  Class is tough and tests are pretty straight forward with reading and class material.  Professor extremely prejudice and brings personal issues into the classroom.  She made made me feel uncomfortable in her class with her comments about white people and has a chip on her shoulder about being black.

I feel as if this teacher is extremely inteligent...you learn the other side of history and discuss different views of history which leave you thinking about the present...Great person...you do have to put time into this class

She is SO ridicuously easy. She tests ONLY on source readings (which are short), making class attendence purely optional. HOWEVER, in class she will lecture about slavery no matter what the topic is. No matter how unrelated, she will tie it into slavery. Course title should be Black Pride 304.

I had Professor Pendergraft for Foundations of reasoning. He is kind and cares about the wellbeing of his students, but, I found it difficult to pay attention because he would go on tangents and I felt there was no main purpose for each class session. We also watched too many videos and did activities that reminded me of high school.

I did not like his class at all and it felt so draining. One thing I wished I could have seen was the status of my grade, for taking this class as a summer course online I wish I knew where I stood in the class and how I could fix it before not liking the grade I got. I did not know how he graded and there was no strict rubric just a basic one.

Okay so Dr. P is so so kind and caring. His logic class is structured so strangely. You use this online textbook which is 40% of your grade. STAY ON TRACK. You will fall behind and get to the final trying to complete a bunch of assignments. The content is not easy. Go to office hours and tutoring.

Truly a nice guy, and I don't doubt his intellectual capabilities at all, but his teaching leaves one wanting. The grading criteria for his classes are bare bones, but then you'll get grades back on assignments that are rather harsh considering the lack of clear guidelines or detail. Lackluster experiences.

Aside from the flaws in class structure and teacher, I really loved Pendergraft as a teacher and person. Lectures were REALLY monotonous. Class discussions were fun. Gives helpful feedback. Really kind and caring. I still don't know what my grade is, but I'm assuming it will at least be a B considering workload and IP that he would give out.

Professor Pendergraft is a sweet guy, but lackluster professor. It is quite obvious that he doesn't care to be a teacher, and would rather be elsewhere. His assignments are rather inconsequential and do not make you think deeply... at all. They don't even feel philosophical, honestly. He is my least favorite professor in the Philosophy department.

Professor Pendegraft is my favorite professor at Pepperdine. I am a philosophy major, so I am probably biased. Nevertheless, he is the embodiment of what a Pepperdine professor should be. He is unbelievably caring, understanding, intelligent, and adaptive. You will succeed even if his teaching style is not preferable for you (it isn't for me).

Professor Pendergraft is so kind! However, I had no idea what my grade was until I saw my transcript. There were two papers and one group project and weekly readings which weren't difficult. It is hard to pay attention though in class. We don't take notes we just listen 90% of the time. Sometimes there are debates and collaboration but not much.

The material is challenging but he explains it well and is available outside of class. The grading is a mastery based system so it is easy to get a good grade even though the class is hard. He is a little dry in the classroom but the topic is boring so he does the best he can. He really cares about the success of his students. I would take again.

I took Garrett's online logic class in the fall: stay away from his online teaching. We used a program called Carnap which no one else had used. The computer program was confusing and difficult. I missed one class this semester and still didn't pass because your grade was determined by getting 90% or higher on quizzes that were poorly designed.

I really liked this professor. Hes quirky and droll, but intelligent and insightful. It was an interesting course, and he taught it well. The class is well-paced, so theres work but you wont drown in it. Hes also understanding if you need help. I recommend. But beware of that philosophical applications of logic essay though. That thing is rough
super monotone
Dr. Pendergraft really cares about his students and philosophy. He is always open to help you with school or just be a friend.

Professor Pendergraft is the best. While Epistemology is kind of a dry subject, he did his best to make discussion lively. He is eager to help every student... I had no philosophy background at the beginning of the course, and he helped me get a firm grasp on every topic. Very kind, very understanding, and very outgoing. Take Pendergraft!

He was a fantastic Professor who was completely willing to offer help if I ever needed it. He was always very clear with his teachings and unlike most other classes I feel like I actually kind of grew as a person. He is able to teach you everything that needs to be taught without over working you which is awesome and I loved his class a lot.

Dr. Pendergraft is enthusiastic about Philosophy & has these creative teaching methods that get his students excited about Logic.  He goes out of his way to help students, responds to emails instantaneously, and most importantly- he cares about the success of his students.  He is a kind person & an excellent addition to the Philosophy department.
Never replied to any emails. Either he thinks he is too good to respond or he is too busy to respond.

One of the better professors I have had in the business division. He is strait forward and fun.  Class is a little boring but he is a nice guy with a decent sense of humor.  Tests are straitforward multiple choice with 1 fill-in question. Got a B with minimal effort and not doing the homework.
No Comments
Absolutely brutal, if you dont go to class, you will not understand it very well.  adn if you dont understand it the first time he will not help you get it right.

The personality of an eggplant. This guy is hard but the class isn't. I never listened and taught myself from the book the night before the tests and got a B. Take someone else if you can but it's managable. Seems totally uninterested in the students and starts EVERY SINGLE class with "the first administrative task I have today..." I skipped alot

OMG! By far, the HARDEST professor I have had in my four years as a Business student.  The tests are almost impossible, and in the group project, he will try to ridicule you as much as possbile in front of the whole class!  Good Luck.
No Comments

He's got good style - reminds me of Taye Diggs if he modeled for GQ. Class is very boring and many business majors suffer through it. Doesnt explain material incredibly well but does give a decent effort. Easier than Misch but thats not saying much. Lesser of two evils I suppose?
He explained the material thoroughly and he goes over the homework in class before you turn it in!
hmm i thought he was allright, it's challenging but then i also learned a lot of stuff
No Comments

he is a nice guy, a good teacher but you kinda have to put a lot of efforts to catch up in his class cuz he will take forever on one chapter, we will be behind, and yet he still gives out exams without a review day. take him if u want easy accounting.
A very smart person, yet boring teacher and he doesn't make the course at all interesting, but then again it is accounting, what can you expect?
No Comments

Dr. Jasperse is an amazing professor and really knows his stuff, plus he loves his students and wants them to succeed. However, his expectations are high for his classes and he expects them to know a lot of detail. Go to every class, study well in advance for exams and know every detail. One of the hardest classes I've taken but also so interesting
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Tests are tough

comment: JAsperse is great, but his class is really really hard. Expect to relisten to the lectures, write a crazy amount of notes, and study a whole lot. Unfortunately, he is kind of the only option for Physiology. Even so, he really does care and would love to meet with you if you don't understand something and is always available during labs to help.
Most professional professor I have ever had. Very prepared for lectures and is GREAT for labs. Also very difficult though so prepare to work hard!

The legend. A true man of science and wisdom. He brings knowledge and challenge in a fair and simple grading system. An amazing professor and person in general. Although I could do without the sarcasm as I never get it....
Amazing professor, always there to help--go to office hours! Very down to earth, knowledgable, and interesting. Loved his class!!
Amazing professor!  The exams are hard, but you cover all the information for them.  Dr. Jasperse the best teacher I've had at Pepperdine.

Great guy. good professor. A little confusing at times, but he'll clarify if you talk to him outside of class. Tests are multiple choice and long answer but he prepares you for them well with study guides. Labs are fun and most of the time you get out early.

knows material. very helpful. encourages students not to use book, unless for extra clarification. he does good job with presenting the material in an understandable manner. an "integrative" test giver...can't just memorize concepts and facts...must understand. pick his brain go in for help. I was taking this w/ OCHEM II(very time-consuming)

I've never opened the book, and got As on both tests so far because he lectures very well. The material is hard, but he is helpful, and does a good job at explaining. He also makes dry, funny jokes, and his labs are fun. He's a cool guy just to talk to, and he'll move a test if it's a busy day.

he knows what he teaches, is very clear with his notes, is EXTREMELY understanding as a teacher (for stuff like having 2 tests on 1 day, he'll reschedule stuff), but very demanding, just cause the subject is demanding

Dr. Jaasperse is a great teacher. The material that he teaches is hard but he is always willing to help the students out. He really cares about his students and if fun to talk to about the life choices that you want to make once you graduate.
nice guy, very understanding and helpful.  his tests are impossible!!

Well lets just say that he constantly tries his best to outsmart his students on a constant basis by quizing students on unlectured information. Let alone theres the fact that he could put a speed adict to sleep with his nervous and sad lectures.
This guy is a monotoned nervous boring teacher and his tests are freakin hard as hell. He teaches straight out of the book so there's no need to go the class
A really nice guy and cares about his kids.
Great professor

DR. LERNER IS THE BOMB. First day of class, I wont lie I was intimidated, but after participating and making funny jokes, he warmed right up. He is hilarious and knows a ton about everything. We talk about the books in class (ENG 380) but also learn a lot of background history and tons of random, but interesting info too. ICH LIEBE LERNER.

I LOVE DR. LERNER!! If you're going to Heidelberg, definitely take him. Sattler is more focused on art history and wants specific dates/names etc while Lerner will give you the points if you're just in the right century and is more just history based. Lerner is a living encyclopedia, he knows everything and can answer any question you ask.

Embrace him right away because you'll just be wasting valuable Lerner time if you take a long time to warm up to him. A vast majority of Heidelbergers loved him. His teaching style makes it difficult to follow everything he says. Just learn to pick out what's important and what's a tangent. Other option is Sattler. But Lerner is 10x more fun.
Dr. Lerner will make fun of you and teach you SO much about European History. Talk to him outside of class and he will answer anything you throw at him!
Hilariously sarcastic Freud-sounding guy. Will give lectures and ask fill in the blank questions that no one can answer. For example: what does the river do? ... It meanders. Not flows or winds.
knows anything and everything about history... Extremely smart..  gotta love the accent
Gotta Love him. fair.
Gotta love Lerner. Is smarter than i will ever be... and probably cooler too.

Man i love this guy. He is such  funny and sarcastic professor.  Even though you may be completely wrong, which most of the time you're not, it is still a fun class.  Just make sure you have someone in your class who knows alot about history.
This kid is a stud.  Genius.  Austrian.  Need I say more.

My gosh what can I say about Lerner.  He loves slurpees and trying to make you guess the answer to his questions, when all along it was the first thing you said but just another word for it.  Love this guy!
Bruno knows more history than National Geographic. Extremely intelligent, and even throws in those little  did you knows  on the side. Excellent.
one of easiest profs ever, doesn't require anything. knows more about history than anybody i have ever met
this class is boring, but requires little and gets rid of humanities...can be a tough grader, get on his good side early
Best professor ever! He's smarter than you think. Take what you can and you'll appreciate it later down the road. Trust me.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Nice guy but lectures hard to follow.

Dr. Sattler's lectures don't make sense, and are often filled with false information that can even be borderline offensive. While his midterm and final are easy, it is almost impossible to know how to answer questions on his quizzes - even reading what's assigned doesn't seem to leave you any more prepared for his quizzes.

He is probably the worst professor I have ever had. His lectures make no sense and I honestly believe he doesn't know anything about American students. He knows a lot about art and has somehow made this into an art class. He never gives due dates and just expects that we have something ready on random days. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Best dude ever. highlights include when he wore a mask on fasching and poked us all with his beak.  Also he is just amazing and his tests are fun (easy)
Most interesting man in the world.  If you are going to the Heidelberg Program he is the one to shepherd you through it.

Sattler is hysterical.  I am one of the writers for the Heidelberg Heute and this year we made a section called "Sattler Says" because he is absolutely hilarious.  He spoke at convo yestereday and wore a mask the whole time.  He gives you all the answers you need prior to midterms and finals... hes a great guy and loves his students.
when you see him, put your arm over your head, wiggle your hand, and tell him i said "SAHHHH"
I miss this man! He MADE Heidelberg. Famous for "Sattlerisms" when he says things that are hilarious only because it is him that is saying it. Also looks like Santa Claus.
Okay best dude ever.  He likes it when you call him Big Papa.  I usually sleep more in his class than at night.
DR. Sattler is the most wonderful man on earth.  He is so brilliant, charming and caring.  Ask him about art or traveling and he will know the answer. Enjoy him while you can overseas!
Great.  Smart, Catholic, Funny.  But his name is "Martin" not "Marvin" as above.
The man's a meanace. Absolutely hilarious, and will give you 1000 points for a paper, even though it's worth 20. His section of the class should be renamed  Naptime . Gotta love him.
this guy partied with the rolling stones and will not give anything less than a 100 on every assignment-can you ask for anything more?
his section of the class is EASY. he is funny guy though and knows alot about art...just isn't that great at explaining it

The lectures are 3 hours long, but the information he presents is all useful and paying attention will guarantee success on exams. His midterm and final exams were open-internet, and between the two quizzes of the semester, the lower grade could be dropped. Really easy A; I never had to do a single reading to do well in his class.
Definitely take his class! The GOAT best professor!

I took his one day a week Elkins class. Lots of reading from the Bible and two supplementary books, but no homework otherwise. Kind've hard to approach in my opinion, and was a bit rude at times. Besides that, he was a fair professor, probably one of the easier Rel 101 profs here. Understands that a Rel 101 GE shouldn't be too much work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Spivey was okay, I took this class in Elkins when its actually designed for classroom discussion. While he's a nice and funny guy, the 3 hour long lectures on Wednesdays made it really hard to pay attention. The only grades were a couple quizzes, couple assignments, and a midterm/final.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Good class. Being in Elkins made it very light on essays. Reading was important to the class, as well as attending the lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Spivey was great! I had him Wednesday nights 6-9 & he sympathized with our tiredness. I'm not personally religious, and Spivey teaches the Old Testament as a historical textbook; doesn't push beliefs on you. Additionally, he understood the long Starbucks line and would let you come back late from break. Told funny personal stories; I would take him
Homophobic

Spivey genuinely cares about the subject he is teaching and it shows. He really wants his students to pass and gives many opportunities to do so. If you pay attention during the lecture or do the reading (one or the other should be fine to be honest) then you will pass. Worst part about the class was that it was 3 hours long but not his fault.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: My favorite professor to date at Pepperdine! He's super smart, kind, relatable, and relates his material well with personal stories to make sure you understand his concepts. The class centers a lot around reading 5 books but it doesn't feel like a lot because they're all great reads. I recommend his class to everyone I know! Spivey is the best!!

This was my last class at Pepperdine. He has profoundly changed the way I approach relationships and leadership through God. I have nothing but praise for Dr. Spivey. He understands that the course is a GE and the workload is appropriate. His lectures are thought provoking. Drives up 6 hrs round trip from San Diego. Now that's commitment.

Spivey is one of the easiest religion professors! He is a very good person aside from being a professor, so if you go talk to him about something, he'll gladly give you extensions, exceptions, etc. The only thing is that there is a strict attendance policy and the classes are long, but there's barely any homework and the final is easy. It's worth!!

Decent teacher. Sometimes gets on a tangent about atheists and invalid reasons why people dont believe in God, which is annoying. I took his three hour long, one a week class. Weekly online quizzes, but refresh before you finish the quiz(thank me later). There is quite a bit of reading, with both the Bible and the textbook.
rating_tags: Group projects--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This class was so frustrating. I felt like I was going crazy the entire time. This professor has absolutely no expertise in what he was talking about and was using outdated resources from at least 30 years ago. Classes were extremely boring and there was basically no guidance given on the papers we wrote. Was the worst class I took at Pepperdine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: This was a Covid course, and he did the best possible for online teaching. Clear directions, good feedback. There is a fair amount of reading and writing - Put in the time to be thoughtful and on point and you will receive a high grade. He is very fair, and should be sought out by students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a great professor! Make sure you read what he assigns before class and discuss because participation matters. Just pay attention, do well on the quizzes and paper and you should be fine

Nice guy but seriously a poor performing professor. He makes a joke of the entire subject, jumps around, and goes on long declarations about his grandson, whom I know more about than anything on the syllabus. Everyone will tell you he's good because he's nice. But DONT CONFUSE NICE WITH GOOD. THIS GUY CANT TEACH.

I have taken two classes with Dr. Lloyd so far and look forward to taking at least one more before graduation. He is incredibly knowledgable and passionate about what he is teaching. I highly recommend any of his classes if you get the chance. Not only will you learn a ton, but you will grow as a student and as a citizen of the world.
Dr. Lloyd is such a great professor. His assignments and tests are hard, but the class is fascinating. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! He's one of the best lecture-teachers at Pepperdine

Amazing, but hard professor.  He will make sure that you learn you stuff and it might be one of the lowest grades you get here, but you have a sense of accomplishment when you are done! His costumes for PIPAs are always hilarious and help set the tone of the class. Joke of the day doesn't hurt either. :-)

ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE PROF!!! I took both his Com/Neg class and his Africa class--by far two of the best classes I've ever taken! He IS tough--he has high expectations of his students (as he should!!). I wish I could just sit and listen to him talk for the fun of it.

Dr. Robert Lloyd is an exceptional professor! Dr. Lloyd teaches the graduate course MPP665.02: The International Relations of Africa at the Pepperdine School of Public Policy. His knowledge of Africa was incredible, and his exceptional teaching style kept me interested from the first day of class to the last. Definitely one of the best professors I have ever had.
Lloyd's a good guy.
Really nice, FUNNY! But the man seriously needs to learn to limit amount of assigned reading!1000+ pages per week over four weeks!
cuter than brad pritt, tougher than nails, smarter than einstein
He's awesome!  Sooo knowledgeable and interesting.  He also really cares about getting to know his students.  He is a MUCH better prof than all others in the department, including Cladwell.
one of my favorite professors.  WAY overqualified to be teaching the GE class, but likes to do it to get more people interested in polisci
Good professor, demands allot from students.  Very kind person.  Busy, but makes himself available as much as possible.
Great professor -- makes political science fun.  Joke of the Day  is a riot! Would highly recommend!
Who says policy wonks can't be funny? You'll learn 10 classes worth & love i
Engaging and fun, coca-cola bear with a  PhD, but tough class

This class was unreasonably difficult. She moves quickly and explains confusing concepts poorly at best. The homework was relentless and harshly graded. She would not round grades, give grace on homework, or show leniency of any kind. I believe she is a nice person and enjoys math however, she has no place at the front of the classroom. Avoid her!

Professor Britton is one of the worst professors I have ever had. She doesn't care about her students and moves way to fast through material that is very challenging. She screwed over my class with an extremely difficult final that was nothing like her study guide and refused to round grades up even a tenth of a percent. Do not take her class.

The homeworks are long so it should be spread over a couple days. She is also very understanding if grades are low and offers opportunities to boost your grade. The most important thing is that the Tests are very very similar to the Review she provides and the tests are short and she gives ample time unlike other professors.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Britton simply copies down lecture notes and further confuses her students when she attempts to answer questions. I feel like she forgets that students have other classes to take due to the ridiculous amount of work she assigns. Quizzes every Thursday, is highly passive aggressive, and shows no compassion for students.

If you do not already have a good handle on calculus, do not take her class. She is not very good at explaining concepts, and her exams usually feature problems that are more involved than her notes, and I found that very frustrating. I believe that she doesn't care about her students; she doesn't do enough to make sure we understand the material.

She is very tough and does not care about her students. She did not teach the material well and made us come into class for "group projects" every thursday and friday for a grade (where we taught ourselves the material).I really do not recommend as many people dropped the class mid semester or ended up failing. I took M151 (calc 2)

Too much unnecessary stuff blur the key meaning of the concept; too many formatting requirements that are not related to math. However, her test is highly related to her review and she is a nice person. I guess that is the trade-off you must face between a good lecturer and a good person.

Professor Britton is quite a mediocre professor. She assigns an insane amount of homework for it being 15% of the grade, as well as excel spreadsheets, and then quizzes that you are not allowed to use a calculator on. She is an alright person, she lives by her syllabus and she grants no exceptions. Don't take her unless you are willing to work hard
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: A few concepts could have been taught better. Overall, not a difficult course if you show up, pay attention, and aren't afraid to ask questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I loved her as a teacher. She was very approachable and cares a lot about her students. She does assign a lot of graded homework but it is not any more challenging than other classes. I loved her teaching style and would recommend her.

Prof. Britton has my dream job! Teaches by copying textbook problems onto the board and using an answer key to solve them. Assigns a week's work of HW, has a student grade it. Gives zeros instead of grace for late work. I will admit, office hours are helpful Unfinished classwork  Students' HW Unfinished lecture  Teach yourself Take my resume!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Don't take her class! She does not care about her student and is not tolerant at all! Never take her class!!!!! Not a good choice for credit!
She doesn't care about the students' feelings at all. There is also a lot of homework and exams. There are no additional points. Terrible professor. Don't take her class!

Professor Britton started off the year absolutely terrible, and I wouldve rated her a 0, never take again, and hated the woman. After the semester, having her tests, and learning how to adapt to her teaching style proved she is actually very good at preparing you for the tests through her study guides. Do the study guides, or you wont pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof Britton is very smart but is HORRIBLE at explaining the material. Her lecture notes are awful and she reads them to you, rather than breaking down how to do the problems. She also gives a ton of attitude when you ask for help. I decided that it would be easier to drop than fail. Don't take her class unless you are already good at calc.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Laura is amazing, sweet.  I miss her a lot. I love how engaged she was with the class and communicating contentI strongly. I improved my Spanish skills and felt that I was more confident in my Spanish speaking. The class was very engaging I found each topic very enjoyable. The projects kept me busy and focused on the course even outside of class.

Laura is a great teacher, engaging and she cares for her students.  She  wants them to learn and understand everything that she is teaching. She always welcomes our questions and is willing to explain things in different ways in order for us to understand the topic. She only speaks in Spanish but is still able to make everyone understand her.

Laura is the BEST (Spanish) teacher I have EVER had. She teaches the whole class in Spanish, I have never heard her speak English. She is kind and grades fairly; she teaches the content in a clear way. She always makes sure to be clear and that all students have complete knowledge. I liked her enthusiasm and listening skills.

Laura is such a great professor and very knowledgeable about the material. Always open to help and assist in a nonjudgemental manner.She has an attitude of wanting her students to succeed which is incredibly helpful in an intense class. She really cares about the students. I truly feel like I have improved my Spanish so much. I love Laura.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Laura is simply FANTASTIC. She has a very structured/objective based, yet highly adaptable approach to teaching, which has been extremely effective.She is super patient and has manner of delivery  very re-assuring but also challenging when required. I'm not the most confident language learner, but she pushes just enough without being overbearing.

Laura is very sweet and grades well. She has an excellent style of teaching that helped me understand concepts easier.  I love that she teaches completely in Spanish, because my previous Spanish teachers have not done this. She is so enthusiastic and it is clear that she cares a lot about her students. I love how she is always happy. I love her.

Laura is an amazing Spanish professor. She genuinely wants all of us to be able to speak and understand Spanish, and she makes her classes the perfect environment to practice. Her love for teaching shines through each day in class. IShe has excelled in teaching me the Spanish language, and I learned more in this class than ever before.

Profe Moldes is always polite, teaching is her passion. She smiles, and immediately I smile.Whatever she spoke went straight into the heart. She recognised the frontiers of each of us accurately and worked with us to advance those frontiers individually. She recognised individual natural aptitudes and taught each of us constructively at our level.

The sweetest professor ever! Profe Moldes is probably my favorite Spanish professor. She explains concepts clearly, gives great feedback, and is always open to answering questions. She makes the subject interesting and genuinely wants to see each of her students succeed. Take Profe Moldes! You're not going to want to say "adios" to her class!

Prof Moldes was such an incredible instructor. She uses class time well by providing vocab practice, followed by a vocab quiz. Then, for the rest of the week, you go over conjugation practice, then a test is given on each chapter. she prepared us well, and the textbook was helpful! Moldes is very kind and she wants you to succeed in class.

I love Profe Moldes! She's so sweet and really wants you to learn to speak Spanish! I took her class online, but it was still very engaging. She gives you lots and lots of exercises to practice with and learn the language. Do the homework, speak up in class, and you will be fine. I would definitely take her again!
She showed me that a great teacher can bring out the best in her students. Thank you Profe Moldes keep doing what your doing your an amazing teacher !!!
She is AWESOME.
The best!!!!! Willing to help, funny, and very giving. Hard, but worth it.
One of my all time favorite teachers. She really wants you succeed and improve. Her Spanish classes are tough, but if you tell her you are struggling, she is more than happy to help you.

I took Professor Crubaugh for my freshman seminar last year. Overall, his class was very straightforward though his lectures were not the most engaging. I did enjoy that our class took a field trip to Venice Beach as it was a very enlightening experience. He was always available outside of class and was a very nice guy if you got to know him.

Crubaugh is one of the sweetest professors at Pepperdine and really cares for his students. However, he is really big on group work which creates a headache for his students who have differing schedules. Additionally, he is a very hard grader and makes it impossible to get over an A on assignments. A lot of reading too but slides cover the reading.

Prof. Crubaugh really cares about what he is teaching, and it shows. But this class had weekly group work assignments that often required reading 30+ pages of articles. There aren't that many assignments for the grade book, and I find Crubaugh to be nitpicky in his grading, which makes it much harder to get an A compared to other SOC classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Professor Crubaugh is amazing! We didn't have many assignments taken for a grade, so your exam and project grades MATTER. As long as you put effort in you should do just fine :)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Crubaugh is one of the best social professors there is. The lectures are very clear and concise, and he knows how to make lessons relatable. While the class does have a lot of reading assignments, the tests are based off of things that are discussed in class. His study guides also help TREMENDOUSLY for tests. Overall great professor
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Crubaugh is truly amazing- one of the most respectful, intelligent, understanding, and friendly people I have ever met. His classes are interesting and thought provoking, and all of the work is reasonable. He wants the best for his students and is always available for help or just to talk. Take his class!

Crubaugh's course is based off lectures and three exams (final is third exam). Lots of textbook and outside reading, which I crammed in the days leading to an exam (not recommended, but I did okay). Lectures are concise and provide decent information. He's a very nice and caring professor. He provides study guides and study sessions for every exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The nicest professor ever. Classes are sometimes boring but he magically attracts me to want to learn sociology.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Such a caring guy! I strongly encourage you to go to class because many questions of his three tests( not cumulative, and each exam consists of 75 questions) are based on his analysis on the lecture slides. Getting an A is not easy since you have to get at least 66 to 68 questions right out of 75 questions for each exam in order to secure an A.

Bryant is such a homie. The class is very straightforward and organized, and all you have to do is show up to class and listen because he only tests off his lectures. He is young and incorporates a lot of awkward "dad" jokes which is great to laugh at. He truly wants his students to succeed and it shows!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: He is awesome and one of my favorite professors I've ever had. He always makes himself available for help and you can tell how much he genuinely cares about his students. Amazing teacher.
I thought most of the lectures towards the beginning were dry and boring but they got better. Lots of questions based on things that only happened in class so be careful. Overall a pretty easy A

Professor Crubaugh is seriously the nicest guy ever! You will do well as long as you study for the tests. His study guides tell you what you need to know and some test questions are based off of class examples or videos so make sure you don't skip too often. He truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed! Take his class!

He is so kind and works hard to make sure you are prepared and able to succeed in his class. He really cares about his students and wants them to do well. His class has very few points, though so make sure you study and read. Go to class. He rocks.
One of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine. Straightforward lectures, extensive office hour availability, and a really funny and personable guy. If you get a chance, take Adv Biochem as well.

Pretty fair professor. All materials covered on the exams are always gone over during class. Only downside is the class is at 8am, none of his lectures are recorded, and his final exam is unrelated to the the content covered in class.

A lot of lectures in this class and the material can be challenging, but it's manageable. Tests are multiple choice and can be tricky if you aren't good at that format. He wants his students to do well and learn, and is a pretty easy grader when it comes to quizzes. It was an 8 am but I cared less than I would normally bc I really liked his class

Dr. Joyner definitely cares about his students. He has pretty extensive office hour availability and responds to emails quickly. Tests are scheduled very close together to encourage studying as you go, but it can feel rushed (especially in the last few units). Course content is similar to BIOL 211. The recommended textbook is not necessary.

An okay professor. His tests are open note and if you pay attention during lectures you'll be fine. Beware though, you cannot go back to questions on an exam. He has a group presentation and wasn't understanding that group members weren't putting in the same work and penalized students that worked harder than others by giving out the same grade.

This class is a lot of work. I really liked Dr. Joyner as a person and I loved that he brought God into a science class. However, the work really never ends. Even with the shooting and the fire we only had a follow-up presentation cancelled (and that's just because we didn't have enough lab days left).Definitely the best of the biochem profs though
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: A good professor who cares about his students. A little confusing at times and tests can be a bit of a curveball compared to the practice material, but if you understand the material well you should be fine.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT--Tests are tough

comment: Dr Joyner is tough and he acknowledges that the class is not easy. He is very encouraging, and helpful in office hours. Can be careless with his slides sometimes and explanations could be clearer, but if you're willing to seek him out for help, you'll be fine.

I earned an A in the class, no thanks to Prof Joyner. Expect clumsy lectures: Joyner will wonder whether his own powerpoints were written correctly--confusing himself no less than the students. He can be smothering, and comes across as being paternalistic to those who don't appreciate being kept on a tight leash! #WouldNotTakeAgain
dont take him
Difficult class.  Hardest class I've taken at Pepperdine.  Expect to put a lot of work in.
Terrible professor, but good person.  He tries, but his exams do not exactly reflect his lectures.
Challenging class.  Will need to dedicate a lot of time to chemistry to get a decent grade.

He really tries hard to make his students participate and tries to make them understad. He is a nice guy, but his class is tough. His tests are harder than what he assigns as practice. But if you read to book and go to his office hours, your grade will improve! expect a lot of hard work. This is a science class, like other sciences, it will be hard

Do not take him for Biochemistry! Not a good teacher who confuses himself and whose tests are way too long and ridiculous.  Even if you study a lot your grades will not always reflect this and he is a tough project and presentation grader as well.  Expect to do A LOT of work and studying for this class it is incredibly hard.
poor teacher, very boring, grades his tests harshly, makes it clear he hates his job

This guy is a Horrendous teacher. I was only so lucky that the class was easy for me (no past trig experience, mind you). He's available one half hour AFTER CLASS, so you're pretty much stuck teaching yourself. If you know Mr. Pappas, he would probably be willing to help you with some comprehension. Flash cards are a mathematician's best friend.

While the material is taught in a decent manner, he makes it more than obvious how much he dislikes to teach.  He only uses examples out the book, is unavailable outside of class, and doesn't cooperate with students.  He wouldn't even provide formulas on the cumulative final.  The class was pretty miserable even though I understood the material.
THIS IS THE MOST HORRIBLE TEACHER IN THE WORLD.  I ACTUALLY SAT IN CLASS PISSED OFF THAT THE UNIVERSITY WOULD HIRE HIM.  HE ACTUALLY EXUDED EFFORT TO SHOW HOW MUCH HE HATES HIS JOB.

oh the worst teacher. plz kill me now. How do you suppose to study for his tests when you dont understand a single word from his mouth? Well, the answer is "nothing will". If you had stats before this class, u wont have a hard time. However, if u r new to this course, u r screwed
boringgggggggggg !!! if he was more interesting maybe i could have learned to like this class better. he is a good example of how overrated college really is.
This is the most boring class ever.
Nice quiet guy who is actually quite intelligent.  His tests are simplified versions of in-class/homework problems and he is an easy-fairly easy grader.  Enjoys joking when the students will allow.
Hard if you don't have any previous experience.  Tests aren't too bad, but sitting through class is HORRIBLE.
Worst prof. I've ever had.  Sitting through his class is similar to a slow painful death

I dont like this prof. He cant speak clearly & makes mistakes he shouldnt make. You would think that if he isnt going to let you use a calculator on the test, that he would design the tests to not come out to crazy decimal numbers...take Pappas if you can
You cant understand the guy! teaches from the book!Do not take him!

I really dislike this professor.  He is boring, makes mistakes on simple math problems often, teaches straight from the book, and was once over five minutes late with no apology to the class which was waiting for him outside the locked classroom.
Really nice guy, just booring. He means well and does know his stuff. Teaches straight from the text book... ask a question that isn't in the book, he may just look at you blankly.
If you do not get a good tutor, you will not pass the class unless accounting is your thing. You either get an A or and F in the class. There is no in between.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: I really AC 224 with Novack! Cengage is used for the homework, but I think that is for every class. The tests were as expected and I enjoyed the project. I would take again!

Novack is the best. He has real-life experience & success & it really shows. He's always willing to help. I had no knowledge coming into the class but I did well & it wasn't even that bad. Study, be smart, laugh at his jokes, ask for help. I recommend him to anyone. There is a small group project, but even it wasn't too bad. Good stories, nice guy!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Novack is a great guy but okay professor. Lecture heavy (70+ slides per class). Does not give study guides. Exams are short and fairly straightforward. Doesnt change most of them. Do the homework! Extra credit was 2 points on class grade. Well worth it. Dry but a good guy and good stories. Put the effort in and you can get an A.

Novack may not be easy because his test is not well-designed (only have to do 5 questions compare to other professors who give multiple choice and you have to do the balance sheet, income statement, etc). Novack's tests could be hard if you mess up one question completely and that will be a B- or B or B+ or A- if not a major error. Good Luck!

Professor Novack is the easiest AC 224 Professor at Pepperdine. His three tests are easier compare to other professors, however, make sure you go through every lecture slides and homework problems before the tests. His tests are usually 6 to 7 questions and you choose 5. Messing up one question may lead to a B+/A-, so review the homework questions.

He does not teach. He doesn't take the time to go through each concept thoroughly and rushes through everything. He gets easily distracted while teaching. Although he comes off generally as a nice guy, he doesn't really seem to care as much as he lets on.

Novack is easily reached outside of class and a nice guy, but his exams are way harder than what he teaches in class.  I used the textbook a lot and found it almost worthless at time.  Maybe get a tutor or a supplementary book for this class and always see him before an exam because he usually drops hints.

Prof. Novack is one of the most genuine professors I have had at Pepperdine. Although the class is difficult, he is extremely accessible to his students. He also curves the tests to help his students out; he is a good guy and very passionate about the subject. However, he is a tough grader on projects.

Prof. Novack is one of the most experienced businessmen at Pepperdine. He is EXTREMELY accessible by phone or email. He also does a great job of simplifying material into practical application making the textbook almost useless. His lectures are entertaining and informative, but not necessarily mandatory... but go and take his course when possible!

Don't believe what people are saying.  This guy is not easy.  We've had three cases this semester.  The guy gave out one A on all three cases.  On a positive note, if you want a B, it's almost guaranteed.  It's his favorite grade to give out.  If I could do it all again, I'd take Seshan.  At least it's possible to get higher than a B.
He is great guy and does not expect you to devote your life to his class! Take him!

his policy class is the most popular class in divison... he has a lot of experience, but is not the best prof when it comes to actually teaching you something. still if you can take him over other professors and you will love your senior year
best policy class ever

One of the worst professors I have ever had at Pepperdine.I had to miss class for a funeral and recieved a zero for my assignment and said I couldnt make it up when I talked to her.she should b fired considering the horrible reviews from classmates.Wouldnt teach and suddenly when the dean came to watch class she put together a presentation lecture

Prof. Triviza is terrible at understanding her students. Yes, she offers resubmissions but it is so obvious she is biased towards certain works and students and doesn't try to empathize with the class. She is unclear during assignments, grades last minute, and she doesn't accept any explanations to get a better grade for homework.

Anastazia Triviza is probably the worst teacher I have had at Pepperdine. Not only is she NOT concise on the homework, she fails to understand simpathy for students and lacks the ability to have compassion. It is very clear that she picks favorites and is willing to go out of her way to make students feel confused and mentally disarm students.

Professor Triviza is so caring and nice. She really shows you step by step how to build a website. Even though her requirements for assignments on courses may seem a little bit overwhelming but once you get used to her structure of class, it gets super clear. As long as you fulfill all the requirements you get full points. Take her class!

I loved Professor Triviza's web design class! I HIGHLY recommend, her grading was super clear, extra credit is offered and you get resubmissions. I learned a lot about Photoshop, Illustrator, HTML, and CSS. She is also super sweet and willing to answer any questions on coding when you're a beginner.

Took for com205. Not a bad professor. Her grading I strongly dislike. Every point you receive is 1% of your homework. Beware of this because if you do bad on a few assignments then it will ruin your grade. Overall she is very nice. It can be challenging sometimes because if you do something wrong she will grade harshly but you can have 2 attempts.

Professor Triviza is one of the most disorganized professors that I have ever had. Her class is easy to get an A in since she offers resubmissions, but you have to be willing to put yourself through torture to understand her feedback. She is an unclear and unengaging teacher. Do not expect to learn anything new. She's nice, but I would stay away.

It is very similar class material as MSCO 371 if you have taken it with Professor Triviza. She gives clear feedback and lets students to resubmit them for the full credit. She is nice and caring. If you submit assignments on time and meet grading criteria, you will get an A.

She is the best professor I had at Pepperdine so far. She gives clear feedback on assignments and gives you more time to fix them so that you can get the full score for each assignments. It is hard not to get an A if you submit your assignments on time. She is willing to help students at any time.

This is my second time having Triviza, and I would not recommend. Her system for grading / turning in assignments is confusing & unclear, but she gets mad when the class asks questions. Her lectures are very confusing and it's always unclear what we're learning about for the day. Wouldn't take her if you don't already know how to code.

She is the best! Just ask her questions and she will help you do any corrections you need to get an A. Going to class isn't technically required but is super helpful to clarifying everything and helping you get a good grade. She is so helpful for real world things like putting together portfolios and doing internships.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: The most disorganized person I have ever met, she shows absolutely no leadership. Her grading is so unpredictable and really depends on her mood. Not to mention she changes her mind on every assignment about what we are doing, what is required, etc and expects you to always know what she changed it to. Never taking again, rather have a tough prof

If you respect her class and dont be late and she will really like you. She is very passionate about the subject and is a great teacher. Not super organized but the class is really fun. You just work on a project the entire semester and its super creative and not super hard. Shes really nice and wise and makes the class engaging. Textbook: no

She is the BEST professor everrrr!!! Absolutely love her (everyone does)! She is the sweetest and most caring human and knows A LOT about design, photoshop and just everything, really. You will definitely learn lots with her!

Definitely take this class, she spends about half the class explaining design concepts then the second half helping us one by one as we do our assignments. Grades pretty easy, you essentially work on one long project throughout the semester. It has caused me 0 stress and I feel like I've learned a decent amount.

You never thought you could care about plants this much. A super intelligent professor who wants all his students to be as psyched about chaparral as he is. Don't be surprised if you suddenly, somehow find yourself involved in things. You'll be better for it, trust me. And don't be surprised if you're suddenly in shape. Speed hikes do that to you.
The best person in the whole world.

The definition of a scientist and one of the most intelligent people I have ever met! You will eat, drink, sleep and breathe chaparral by the end of this course. Count how many times he says Malosma laurina, Angel Helms, and Anna Jacobsen from start to finish of the class; likely over 1000. Tough, fair, fun, and a good teacher. Highly recommended.

The chaparral obsessed grandpa you wish you had. Also the fastest man you will ever meet. He WILL out-hike you. And yes, you will learn to spell chaparral by the end. He loves to brag about his students. Not sure if he understands how many double entendres are in his root lecture, or if he says them on purpose. The only class I wish never ended.

also known: Santa, Dumbledore, Gandalf, Merlin, Grandpaw, or God. Sexy Jacket. Has the super hero power to make you agree with anything he says using rhetorical question and Jedi mind powers. Know in greek history as the patron god of the chaparral. also makes really good lasagna.
Professor Davis even though I didn't get the grade that I should have in his class is still very helpful for me and a very nice man!

Marine Bio, by far the easiest GE for your lab science. And Davis knows we're all junior/senior slackers who won't take Chem or Bio so he adjusts.  Tests can be a little demanding, but definitely passible and Davis is awesome.
I love Dr. Davis!  He's my Pepperdine grandpa!  Plus he's a great professor and a really nice guy, like everyone else said
I LOVE this guy
Very nice grandpa figure...and loves the chaparral.  Great professor.
I love him. He's like a grandpa. He's just so cute and really cares about his student. I can't wait to have him again!!
wonderfull professor who can change a worthless subject into an adventure  likes to see you do well and is one of the nicest profs i know
One of the nicest profs around.
never had him as a teacher, but he's one of the nicest guy's you'll meet
Overall really nice guy and has an amazing class just beware because his class is very liberal.

His class is fun and an easy A for first-seminar. I got a 100%, and tbh I did not understand anything that we learned. He gives difficult readings sometimes and might give a participation quiz on them, but that's the only difficult stuff. We wrote 3 1-3 page essays, and I believe that as long as you turned them in on time you got a 100% on them.
I loved taking Prof. Begin class for my freshman seminar! We did not have any test just a few essays and alot of discussions! He is a funny, caring and understanding guy. Would take him again!

Prof. Begin is EXCELLENT! The close-knit, discussion-based class keeps everyone engaged. Readings can be tough but are well-explained in class. I highly recommend taking him out to lunch and getting to know him. His mentorship & genuine care for me helped me through a really tough time. Laugh at his jokes (its on the syllabus & he's hilarious!)
The readings are kind of difficult, but it's not the worst. He really does care about his students, and does his best to explain things in a clear way. I enjoyed his class.

The worst choice ever. He said seminar class is just a seminar and everyone should get an A. But hes so ridiculous and assign way too many papers for just a seminar??? Who even cares about Spain and spanish movies? ?
Nice person but not a great prof. Treats class like a joke but grades TOUGH. Extremely narrow. Wont take his class again.

Took this class for my first year seminar. Way too hard for students that cant speak Spanish or who dont care about Spain. Makes you watch movies in Spanish and then write essays over them. He is extremely narrow and liberal minded. I would take a different class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Begin is a nice guy, but the class is harder than it may seem. He treats it like a joke, lets ppl leave early, etc, but when it comes to grading - he's a monster! I was personally annoyed by the amount of English spoken in the class - c'mon, its a Spanish course! Plus, sometimes he made silly mistakes & didn't know some stuff, which is unacceptable

This may sound obvious, but make sure you MAKE TIME to read for his lit class.  Compared to reading it English, it takes five times as long to read a page in Spanish and UNDERSTAND it.  Begin likes to talk so if you don't read you will probably be ok but if you want to actually learn something take the time to do your homework!
The best span teacher ever! Nicest guy you will ever meet. take this teacher! hard but u need to study, but is a very relaxing class, and above all it actually was fun!
Okay, so i have to say he is the best foreign language teacher i have ever had!!!! He is super cute tooo :) If you don't take him your missing out!

I've never had a teacher make learning so Fun.  You should kick yourself if you don't try to get in his class, because you will learn the most from him and he is a blast.  Best prof I've ever had, honestly.
Awesome guy! makes class funny! Truly a good guy at heart. Very clear, speaks slowly, great addition to Pepperdine faculty! A+++

Abnormal is a super interesting course, and Dr. J. is certainly very knowledgable. Course is made up of 3 exams, a cumulative final, a brief group project, a research and myths paper on a disorder of choice, and a two brief individual presentations. Dr J. is an extremely sweet person and wants all students to succeed. Highly recommend this course!

She's sweet, nice and a good professor but her grading is confusing. Hated how she put us into groups, it ruined college experience even after the semester. She's not available much, plays favorites, and doesn't give equal opportunities.

Dr. Joseph is super sweet! I enjoyed her class more than I thought I would. There's definitely a lot of information to study and understand though. The content of the class in general isnt easy but I'm glad I took it with her. She's picky with grading sometimes but gives good feedback and is super approachable.

Dr. Joseph truly does want all of her students to succeed and it shows through her commitment to her class. She is very personable and easy to connect with if you wish, but if you do not want to establish a personal connection she doesn't force you to. Her class isn't as reading based as some others, so pay attention during lecture

Dr. Joseph is wonderful! At first, she may come across differently; however, if you make the effort to participate in the class and attend her office hours, you will find out differently. Her courses are definitely reading-heavy but nothing impossible. Her tests and quizzes are tough, but if you take the time to prepare, you will be FINE!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Joseph really wants to see students succeed, and her lectures are engaging. Her tests are application-based but they follow the study guide. Homework is made up of flipped activities that are based on the textbook. The semester-long research project is almost entirely group work, but Professor Joseph is very clear about her expectations.

Professor Joseph is my favorite professor I've had at Pepperdine. I have her for my research methods class (310) and it's clear she cares about her students and wants us to succeed. Tests are pretty straight forward with what is on the study guide. There are no pop quizzes and the flipped activities are applicable. Highly recommended taking her!!

I'm kind of annoyed by Dr. Joseph. She does those weird "flipped activity" things instead of having us take notes. There are so many little things that she does that just get on my nerves a lot (e.g. she makes us bring index cards to class with answers to questions about videos), and she expects us to actually care about research.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Dr. Joseph is such a sweet professor and the opposite of a tough grader! Her quizzes are easy if you read the textbook (make sure to note exceptions) and take thorough notes in class (cannot use laptops.) She is very flexible with capstone projects rather than assigning us topics. Participation counts for every class session, so don't miss out.

Dr. Joseph was a great help with the semester's group research paper. MC questions are easy when you read the textbook and review lecture notes. Free-response questions are similar from lecture and exam review examples. Besides the flipped activity assignments(which can be long) there are no quizzes. She cares and doesn't make tests hard.

Shes a really caring professor, and if you participate youll do well. Her quizzes are difficult (no tests though so thats nice). For the most part you dont have to read. And she only assigns online readings through courses which is great. She doesnt want the course to be hard and shes really fun to talk to if you get into the subject.
Professor Joseph is a really nice person. She really cares about her students. She wants you to succeed and is willing to help.

She's a nice professor. Her lectures aren't that interesting, but they're not boring either. As long as you go to class, pay attention, and read the textbook, you should do fine. You should also do the study guides she gives because they're pretty helpful.

Super nice lady, she just tends to be a little dry, her lectures seem super long, and she makes questions worth way too many points on tests. MC questions are 3 points each so you're already at a 94 if you miss 2..

She is very vague. She lives off her slides and tends to explain very little. Her tests were unpredictable. She makes a basic research methods course seem like hell. She does not give many assignments so if you mess up on an exam (which is very likely) it will be very hard to recover

This class is certainly tough but Professor Santos is fabulous. She is extremely accessible outside of class and genuinely wants students to succeed. OChem can be super overwhelming and there's a ton of material, but Santos really cares about her students and is always willing to help.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: best teacher but she's leaving so too bad for you

Absolutely amazing professor for Chem 310 and 311. Ochem is a very difficult subject, but Santos is so knowledgable and is always there to help. My biggest advice would be to stay on top of the TB problems and ask questions asap if you are confused :)

I was intimidated to take orgo but Santos put in so much effort into helping us which made it doable.  You HAVE to put in work to do well.  Do ALL the recommended textbook problems.  Exams are difficult, multiple choice is tricky.  Textbook problems, HW, quizzes, and practice exam help you recognize patterns so that the exams are doable.  Love her!
Ms Santos is a literal angel. If you have the chance to take her class, do! She was mostly helpful for me outside of class and she was so patient and clearly wanted me to perform well in the class.

Whoever told me she was the best chemistry professor was lying. Taking her for online class, yet she asks like we are still in person doing the labs. Grades ridiculously hard for no reason, marks 1/2 points off for EVERYTHING and does not explain well in prelab at all. Maybe she is more helpful in person but do not recommend her for lab at all.

Dr. Santos is so sweet and caring! She genuinely loves what she does & shows that in her lectures & office hours. The course was just tough online because of the lack of hands-on experience, but go to office hours for help on the lab reports! Graded on LOTS of lab reports and 1 final, so I'd pay attention during the pre-lab lectures.
Ms. Santos is an amazing professor and she really cares about her students! It's a difficult class but she really wants you to succeed.

Prof Santos is amazing! Seriously take her for any class she teaches. I have her for ochem lecture and lab and she's very caring and helpful. Even though ochem is recorded attend class because you'll miss out if you don't!! She's funny and really makes an effort to get to know her students and really wants everyone to succeed in her classes!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: She cares about her students, and makes sure that we are prepared for her labs and chemistry beyond the classroom. She met with me every week, one-on-one, to make sure that I understood the labs since I had difficulty. She was also SO MUCH FUN during lab! I literally switched my entire schedule to have her for the next chem course.

THE BEST LAB PROFESSOR EVER! I only wish she actually taught chem310 lecture as well. She is so helpful in and outside of lab, and she's the sweetest woman I've ever met. Ask questions and she will help you so much!

A Great Professor I ever had in Chem120, i actually failed when i took CHEM120 last semester, but I improved a lot just because she is so clear in the lecture and make sure you do the practice exam and problems she gave in order to pass the exam. She is also very helpful outside of class, make sure to email her anytime or go to the office hours!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Santos is super caring. I hate chemistry but to succeed in her class really pay attention to in-class problems and homework problems for tests! I also had her for lab and she will answer any questions (even if you think its stupid.) Study a lot and PRACTICE & UNDERSTAND the problems to do well in the class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I had her for my G Chem lab and she's honestly amazing. She tends to talk a lot at the beginning of lab so I would start writing out your outline then but she's so helpful and genuinely wants all her students to do well.

It's a fairly boring class, but math is math... it's the hardest class to make enjoyable. However, the class is very streamlined. Lectures are organized, homework is not too easy nor too hard, and tests are the same. An awesome choice for the average university student.
