rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Professor and very clear instructions. He always makes very good use of time and I highly recommend him.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I enjoyed how clear-cut Dr. Nash's teaching style was. He is easily available for questions and concerns.
MAN, this class was a pain. He is a very nice guy however his teaching style did not suit me at all. You need to put efffort to have a good grade in this class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I had Nash for Math141 and I enjoyed it. Although the material was hard, Nash was always available for office hours and would explain how to do the homework or review material. Grading is test heavy and you really have to work for your grade, but overall a good experience.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is not understanding of his students and jumps to conclusions easily. Does not give partial credit for problems and grades homework harshly. Very confusing teacher. I would advise taking another prof.

Ok let me give you the rundown. Nash has four exams (last  final), and the third is typically more difficult than the first two. There's graded and suggested homework, and but you can get by just fine with the graded homework. Socially Nash is a bit awkward, but genuinely a nice guy. Download the app Slader to see book problems worked out.

Dr. Nash is kind, organized (he writes everything on the board), and gives partial credit on HW and exams. However, when he answers questions in-class, he will leave you more confused. Based on word of mouth, he is the best Math 140 professor at Pepperdine. Yikes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I had Nash over the summer and found him to be a great professor! He explains concepts clearly and simply. His tests werent too difficult nor too easy. Good lecturer and kind guy.

He writes everything on the board and has a general plan for the class, but if you ask specific questions he doesn't take much time or effort to answer them during class, which can be discouraging if you aren't a natural at grasping the concepts. His exams are pretty difficult as well.
Professor Nash is great! He taught clearly and makes concepts easy to understand. He is also a nice person and very patient. Take his class!

Nash is a decent teacher. He explains everything pretty clearly on the board in class, so I think it's worth attending. However, his tests are pretty hard and usually contain some problems that we haven't seen in the homework. He also won't help you during tests at all, so don't offer asking for help.

Dr. Nash was a great professor! He writes everything out on the board that you need to know and gives you some suggested problems for homework that help a ton. As long as you pay attention in class, do the homework, and study, you will do well in the class! He is available for questions in his office hours as well!

He is a pretty basic professor. Kind of awkward, and can explain things in a complicated matter unless you go to his office hours and ask specific questions. He writes everything out on the board which is really helpful
Class wasn't for me, but did ok.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Highly recommend for those who have to take HIST204 as a GE! The topic is boring but Dr. Miller does a great job making the course more fun by showing videos and giving interesting articles to read for homework. She's also so understanding of our time! Just take good notes in lecture for the tests and keep up with the daily assignments.

For the GE American History class, she was extremely easy. We had three noncumulative open-note exams, short daily form posts on the daily readings, and a short essay. She is a very relaxed professor and the exams are easy if you take good notes during class. She breaks up the long lectures for the intercession with short videos. 10/10
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Poor choice on my part
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class wasn't for me.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She is a very nice professor providing study guide before each exam. However, it is kind of hard to pay attention to the long and boring historical stories. Take good notes and review them besides the study guide and you will end up with good a result.
Wouldn't recommend this class unless you need the credit!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Big waste of time, but got credit and an A!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Way to easy. But good if you need credits. Basically a waste of time. She should be teaching grade school.

Miller was SOOO nice! The class is very easy and if you put ANY effort in at all you'll do fine. Just beware that since there are so few assignments you have to get an A on all of them in order to get an A in the class. I am so glad I took this class from Miller! Highly recommended!

All you have to do is go to class and take good notes, study them well, and you will do fine on the tests. She makes class interesting, is knowledgeable, and organized.  She is a really nice person, and the class is pretty engaging. I highly recommend her class.

Miller is pretty easy as long as you pay attention during lectures, since that is basically what all tests are based on. They also involve a few questions on the assigned readings. The class involves one five-page paper. She is a very nice lady who is willing to help you if you need it. I hate history and even I found her class pretty interesting.
Amazing teacher in the way that her study guide is pretty much the test(even though next to impossible to remember everything) and that she ONLY has 1 paper during the semester.

Class was multiple choice, which I am convinced is a horrible way to test knowledge of history. Need to memorize minor details. She was a nice woman, and hen I had to withdraw, she gave me WP, even though I was failing. I took Scott later and got an A.
did not enjoy her class, very boring and dry, outside of class, very unhelpful, so many awful faculty at this school good luck
I meant to rate her in 5/5, but mistakenly put 4/5.

Professor Hamada is one of the best professors that Pepperdine has to offer! She is thorough, passionate, and cares about each individual student. She is all about experience driven learning which makes the class memorable. There's a bit of work and papers to do, but drink that coffee/tea and stay up all night. Hamada's class is worth it.

Hamada is one of my favorite teachers! Really passionate about what she teachers. You are thoroughly involved in what you are learning with awesomeee field trips! Always there for help if you need it. Empowers her students to make a difference. Taking SAAJ is one of the best decisions I made! Going to miss this class. Hamada, you're awesome!

Professor Hamada is such a great professor! She knows what she's talking about and is engaging. Our classes always went on really fun field trips and learned a lot too. There's a good amount of writing/essays but wasn't that bad considering you get credit for eng and lit. easy to do well in if you show up to class and do the work.

Had a blast in this class. From various field trips to Yoga, the Aquarium etc, it was a lot of fun. Be prepared to do work, but it is not that bad at all especially since we get so many GE's covered by this class. My view on the envirornmenthas changed dramatically. Hamada is great and really cares for her students!

Definitely one of my favorite classes! I love the educational field trips. Especially going to Yoga Works, the aquarium, and taking a hike. The open discussions make this class unique. I learned how religion and the environment should be linked together. Now I feel I can articulate the opinions I made to my family and friends.

An amazing class and amazing teacher. There are in and out of the classroom experiences that WILL make you more passionate about environmental justice and want to learn more. You should, without a doubt, take her because she makes learning as fun as possible.

She is energetic and caring. Our class became like a family. Course is not too demanding and the topics covered are very interesting e.g. internalized racism. Do your work and you will succeed and have fun

Professor Hamada is extremely engaging and teaches with an experience-driven curriculum. The books read in class are great and the experiences are enjoyable yet relevant.  She is enthusiastic and really cares about her students. This class was my favorite class of freshman year. Take SAAJ with Hamada you won't regret it!

Larisa Hamada is an amazing professor. She expands our minds to new topics to help us recognize injustices in the world and how to combat them.She is influential and encourages us to avoid society's complacency. She pushes us to never give up when fighting for a cause we believe. She is an asset to Pepperdine and they are lucky to have her.
HAMADA IS DA BEST!
Great Professor! Take her class. One of the best SAAJ professors on campus. Very helpful.

Funny little asian teacher, she makes class extremely fun by providing intriguing discussions and a plethora of baked goods that keep a starving college student alive. I recommend taking her! Easy grader and extremely helpful when you need her.

Such a great professor! The class will definitely help your speech improve. He is always ready to help outside of class when you need it. He really cares about students learning.. it's just a great class to take!

really helpful! makes himself available outside office hours and wants you to succeed. attendance mandatory to learn allophones and practice using mouth. memorization is important in beginning of semester, quizzes pretty easy
Really nice guy, go into it knowing you will work hard and that you want to learn the topic and you will come out with an A.

I love, love, love Dr. Thomason. He is my favorite professor of all time. Never makes you feel judged when you makes mistakes, is always encouraging, and really helps improve student's speaking ability.  I wish I could take him for every Spanish class!

Initially he may seem intimidating but Thomason is SUCH a nice guy and has a sense of humor.  He is all about making time to help you and seeing you succeed.  Your pronunciation will most definitely improve if you take his phoenetics class.  If you want to improve and are willing to do a little homework each day, take him!

Best professor at Pepp. He's an easy grader and class discussions were so interesting. Take him if you can. He is open to others' interpretations and likes to hear what you have to say about the works.
This man is crazy (bi-polar personality).  Never get on his bad side.  Didn't learn much, but got good grades.

Prof. Thomason is an excellent teacher I also had him for spanish phonetics and conversation. He is a fair grader and just a very nice professor. I highly recommend him. I learned soooooooooo much spanish and improved very much from his classes.
for phonetics~ a very approachable teacher who wants you to succeed.

Puts things on the test that are surprising were never well covered.  Inconsistant grading, sometimes a tough grader sometimes easy.  The class helps your pronunciation a lot and there isn't very much work required outside of class.
Best upper division spanish teacher I've had at Pepperdine.  Makes class fun and enjoyable.
Fabulous Prof!
Is an excellent teacher
I took Dr. Storm for COM400. I was dreading 400, but Dr. Storm made it bearable, maybe even fun. I didn't think I would learn anything, but this class actually challenged me.

Storm is the best. The class is easy, but I'd be lying if I said there wasn't lots of work. However, Storm acknowledges it and really tries to make everything as easy as possible, even sometimes giving you templates to just plug in your details into to save you time! His midterm/final are also super easy if you study the study guide he provides!

THIS IS THE MAN! Please, please, PLEASE take this professor if you ever get the chance. One of the best teachers at Pepperdine. he's very understanding and takes time to understand the students and whatever may be going on. Very lenient, not a harsh grader, and actually cares about what he teaches. My favorite class so far.
B.O.A.T. (Best of all time)
dr storm is great--he is one of the few profs to hear students' voices

It's clear Dr. Storm loves this qualitative research, and it seems like he really enjoys teaching it as well. His tests are not the easiest in the world, but they're also not the hardest. Actually they're pretty fair.

Prof. Storm is such an understanding professor. The class material is not very interesting but he made the material super engaging. The class for the most part is pretty easy and he only had one synchronous class a week. Hes also super funny! Definitely recommend taking him. Hes great.

Professor Storm is amazing! He has a wordpress blog where he posts a week by week summary of what class will look like and whats going to be due that week, so as long as you keep up its impossible not to do well in his course. Quizzes are a little tough (just very specific) but overall 10/10 would recommend taking him.

Dr. Storm is one of the most enthusiastic professors I've ever had. He loves what he teaches and loves his students. He is hilarious and knows how to make a dry class extremely fun. His quizzes can be hard. Overall, I would recommend Dr. Storm.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Though COM 300 is research methods, which is boring tbh, Dr. Storm made it pretty fun and interesting. He clearly likes research, and he clearly likes connecting with students. Willing to go out of his way to make sure you do your best. Not the easiest class, but you can pass easily if you do all the work.

I took Storm for an 8 am class, and though I was dreading it, it turned out to be a really good class! He's incredibly personable, he treats us with respect, and he gives good feedback. I would 100% take a class with him again.

Side note: this class is basically AP Lang w/ Public Speaking. As for Storm, super cool guy who connects well with students (is able to meme w/o being cringe). Tests are super easy, just look at study guide. Class consists of lectures, speeches, and speech prep. Make sure you read, he has pop quizzes, and doesn't cover everything in class.

I took Storm at 8am. At first, I dreaded it, but then I loved it. He makes the class so enjoyable and brings the students together. At the end of the semester you have genuine friends. He made me so much more confident and I plan on using what he taught me in every aspect of my life. He's an easy grader, has reading but not strict. Take COM w/ him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Def take. One of the few classes that are super practical for post-grad and he makes lectures interesting. He wants you to succeed and will find ways to bump your grade. Go to office hours, have AI summarize your readings, and participate well in your group project. Attendance is optional but classes are engaging, super fun and caring professor.

I HAD FOR BA 354!! 

But Ben was the best professor I have ever had at Pepperdine. He cares about the class and every single one of his students. I cannot say enough good things about him. Take him if you have the chance

Professor Postlethwaite is one of the best professors at Pepperdine! He really really cares about his students and will go above and beyond to help them and ensure they understand the material! If you are struggling he will work with you to ensure success. You can tell he also really puts time and work into his lectures to make them interesting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Postlethwaite was a fantastic professor. Although the class was reading heavy and required quite a bit of writing, he made everything feel relevant. I took quite a bit away from class, not just from the course concepts, but from the experiences and lectures we had as well. I would definitely take him again and highly suggest that everyone take him.

Really inspired me to do my best with work that was relevant to real post-grad work. Dr. Ben is a phenomenal professor and respected in the business division and beyond. This guy has a diverse professional career which has given him a unique and realistic lens to the matter he teaches, beyond typical academia.

Dr. Postlethwaite is funny and sarcastic. However, he is VERY difficult. He prides himself on his long and hard tests, and he is definitely right. He also pulls material from lectures, the textbook, and random articles. He also takes forever to grade anything. I'm about to take his final and the only thing in my gradebook is my midterm.
Professor is one of the few Id love to take again, he cares about his students and OB. Loved taking his course and would do again in a heartbeat
His OB class requires quite a bit of work and a lot of writing. For this level of class, I feel like the amount of required work is acceptable. His lectures are really interesting and funny.
He is chill and I would recommend him. Unfortunately he is not going to teach this class in the future
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: (FOR MY 1ST YR SEMINAR) He's nice and easy-going. Often doing nothing during class which was nice to do other work except when we did activities that seemed like invaluable time-fillers. My main complaint is he's unclear about assignments, but overall a good prof. He's very knowledgeable about starting websites. No HW--a couple big assignments.

He makes the class fun using a lot of videos/real-life examples. He's pretty funny. He brings food for the tests other freebies throughout the semester. The cases are straightforward. Do the early ones if you want feedback at all though. Tests are very difficult. Study the book and the articles. As hard as it was, I still recommend the class.
Professor Ben is great! Definitely recommend this class class is interesting and involving. The test are straight forward and he always brings treats!
Great Professor. Class is relatively easy but you will have to do some work to get an A. I would fully recommend to take him over any other professor because you will learn a lot.

Exercise Physiology: Intended to take this class with Paris, but was the unlucky class that had her as the prof. She was awful at giving feedback and gave instructions on what she expected after the exam was taken. We ended the semester 7 weeks behind... She refused to clarify test questions and often answered idk. Tested on info we never learned.

bad teacher, don't take. unclear, doesn't give directions, too much homework. Asks students to learn from videos that contradict her in class. Tests are not what she taught on. Takes points away for no reason. No paper tests (horrible).
unclear.

This is a hard class, but she makes it doable. She gives AMPLE EXTRA CREDIT!  Take advantage of it.  I don't know why people are killing her in the ratings.  She presents a very hard topic in a manner that if you study it, you will get a good grade. It doesn't matter the teacher - the class topic is hard. Put in the time, and you will be fine.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Tan is an amazing professor. She explains the concepts in an understandable way. Be prepared to do lots of work. There are many videos to watch as homework, which preview the topics for the upcoming week. Lecture tests are primarily application based with minimal basic memorization. Make sure to do all the extra credit, your grade skyrockets.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Tan is a caring person outside of academia. However, my least favorite professor. She is incredibly unforgiving when it comes to deadlines, even though there as so many and it's easy to mix things up. If you have an emergency, there are no accommodations. Study everyday. Unrealistic expectations imo

Dr. Tan lacks empathy for students. Although she is smart and passionate, it is difficult to succeed in her class unless you are financially stable, neurotypical, healthy, and have few other obligations. I found myself struggling during her class and did not receive usable help or advice. Her class is video-heavy, so you'll need lots of free time.

I loved this class! Physio is challenging in general, so you'll get out what you put in. Dr. Tan is an amazing professor (the best I've ever had) and she explains things in ways that make them easy to understand. She's always more than willing to help in any way that she can and truly cares about her students. You won't regret taking this class!

Dr. Tan is hands down one of the best professors I've ever had. Her class is really tough but so worth it if you love science. She really cares about her students and wants us all to succeed. She gives so many opportunities for extra credit so as long as you show up to everything and study hard you'll be fine!

Her teaching style is not helpful at all. Instead of using class time to re-present info we already have from required videos she should have been connecting the dots between ideas, instead of expecting us to be able to do that on our own on test with no prior mentions. Doesn't answer direct questions- which I don't get bc that's her whole job

Definitely on the harder side to get a good grade, but she is probably the best teacher I've ever had in terms of getting you to understand the material. If you like physiology in general, it'll be hard but its definitely worth your time to understand everything. You have to know material super well but its a fun class!
Dr. Tan's class is very challenging ,but she is truly an amazing professor. She gives you ever opportunity to do well on the exams and will help you in any way she can.
Class is absolutely impossible. Her tests are so so hard and she expects you to know everything. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: prof. Small was a horrible teacher. she clearly does not care about her students and was so rude but would pick favorites. the readings and the lectures did not correlate and the lectures were so boring. do not take this teacher.
Professor Smalls is a really kind person, she just wants to see you care. Go to her office hours and check in with her, even if its not school related and you will be fine.

Professor Small is a great professor with a wealth of professional experience. Her lectures provide practical/relevant applications of course material. Be prepared for class (i.e read the book & complete hw BEFORE class.) Prof. Small is willing to help with anything, even networking/job searching. She is a great resource, so definitely enroll!

Great teacher! I had a marketing/advertising internship prior to to her class & it made me appreciate how valuable her adv career experience is. She makes real connections that will be used in the advertising field & really cares about her students. Shes available for office hours! If you have questions, make sure to ask! She will definitely help!

She is super funny and brings in guest speakers who are high up like the marketing director for BMW for the western region of America. It's a relatively simple and straightforward class which helped a lot. She has a lot of industry experience which is why I like her more than other advertising professors. Definitely recommend.

I really enjoyed Professor Small's courses. I found her class to be incredibly straightforward if you are willing to put in the effort. Granted her classes are not easy As, but should any major classes be? Advertising/Marketing careers are about PROVING yourself. With her incredible expertise, she definitely prepares you for a career in Advertising

If you honestly want to succeed in the real world, take her. I took her ADV 375 class a few months before an internship, and that class prepared me so well. She comes from a real world background and everything she teaches is applicable. The negative reviews shouldn't be taken seriously at all, as these students must not have put in any effort.

Do NOT take any classes from Professor Small. You may read all these negative reviews and think that she's probably not that bad (like I did), but you will regret your decision VERY quickly. She is never prepared for class and just wastes our time. 25% of your grade is a group project she doesn't explain. She MAJORLY procrastinates grading. Avoid.

Worst Professor ever. She rambles off in lectures and is so dry when teaching and goes on forever. I havent learned anything. If you participate in her class and get something wrong shes super dismissive and rude. She barely explained the paper and overall doesnt have any compassion for students and doesnt help them when they need her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Small was fairly decent. I learned a lot from her, and it was mostly from paying attention during lectures. Her midterm and final are very easy if you do the study guide. The group project was fun, but it is up to you to ask questions about it early since she doesn't explain it super well in class. Pretty easy A if you put in effort..

Professor Small is nice and funny and cares about her students. She assigns a group project which makes up about 35% of your grade, which she barely explains. For this assignment she only gave us one example, which she described as "bad." Though the class was not too demanding, I would probably recommend a different prof if possible.

A four hour lecture and she talked about nonsense for most of it. Big group project t the end and she barely explains it. When she did, she showed us one that was not good. Hard to know what is expected of you. She is also hard to get ahold of. Nothing against her as a person, I thought she was funny, but not a great prof.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dont take her class. Super unclear and wastes 3 of the 4 hours talking about useless information that she even says wont be on the test. Assignments do not prepare you for the test and she assigns a group project at the end that no one really understands.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Myers teaches a challenging class, expecting diligent reading and plenty of paper revisions from each student. We had discussions over the books in class, getting into plenty of themes and character analyses.

Wonderful! she is pretty hard, but class discussions are really interesting and she does a good job of grafting social and philosophical issues into the class. be sure to speak up in class and it helps if you write your papers plato-style. it's a lot of work, but genuinely worth it. (be sure to try to bring out her sense of humor!!!)

I have never seen a professor/teacher so dedicated to helping her students.  Myers will seriously skip her dinner if students want to meet with her then.  I LOVE this lady, she is the BEST.  Period.  Class was intense at times, definitely worked hard for my A.  But soooo worth it.  I can't say enough about her.

Myers is the best! You basically sit around and have very intense, interesting discussions about the books. She has a very dry wit...very funny, very smart. She really reaches out to students individually and works with them. You do have to read and write a couple of papers, but that's it...well worth it. Great class, great prof!
Myers is the best. She is brilliant and fascinating. I could listen to her talk forever. You work hard for her class, but you feel like you really earn your grade.
Very intelligent woman, though at times that made her hard to relate to.

Dr. Myers always finds time to help students and exhibits enormous patience.  Her comments on returned papers are highly detailed and helpful.  Her knowledge of her subject is unequaled.  She can always provide interesting background information, adding to the interest of the discussions.

WOW!... This class was a reality check. I swore I was a great writer coming into this course, but v.m. was totally demoralizing. She has HIGH expectations for her students! You will learn a lot about the proper way to write. Lectures were BORING!! I recommend collaborating with her on your papers.
Dr. Myers is very demanding, but she will make you a better writer.  She has very high expectations from her students so one must be VERY familiar will all MLA rules!

Uggh! The worst class ever (material-wise)! Myers is way above most of her students' heads, and she holds us to a higher standing, say, oh, doctorate level. She has an air of superiority about her, and that made it hard for me to like her.

Dr. Myers is the best teacher I have ever had. you are going to work in this course no matter who you take so you might as well come away a better writer and thinker. She has helped me in ways that will carry on throughout my college career and beyond!
hard but good
tries to be intimidating, not very helpful, cynical, intelligent...but not the best at getting ideas across to students

Not the best professor, but not the worst.  Her lectures could be better and more straight forward. Intense studying required to do well.  Be prepared to read the book to supplement the lessons and prepare for the tests and frequent quizzes.  If you ask for help, and attend office hours, she is there to help.  You have to make the move.

To some Dr. Grano can be very confusing and profound, I found it advantageous to attend her office hours regularly as she is extremely clear one-on-one. She is one of the nicest teachers I've ever had an very approachable. As some have stated, her practice exams are very similar to the actual exam, but do not rely on them. Supplement with the book.

Professor Grano moves too fast over the topics to gain any significant understanding of the material. I find myself having to read the entire textbook chapter and teach myself in order to get any comprehension. That being said its not too difficult if you're decent at math. I would not recommend her as a teacher if you have any other options.

She gives you practice quizzes and practice tests that are exactly like the exam. I would seriously study the night before the exam and I get at least a B+.  She is a bit awkward and her lectures are not the clearest, but just study the practice tests. the class is super easy

Tests are somewhat easy but there are so few questions so if you miss only a few, it's hard to get a good grade on them. She also is really bad at explaining herself and often gets her own problems wrong. Also, she's very inflexible, your borderline grade won't be helped. Don't take her unless you want to be in tutoring all semester.

I loved Professor Grano. She is very fair and gives detailed notes for every lesson. The tests are exactly like the notes and the Practice Exams, so it is very fair as long as you study the material. She is the nicest person as well and really wants her students to learn and understand the material. Will help you one on one if needed.
The worst math experience ever! Super confusing explanations and lessons. I taught myself for 2 weeks and just dropped it so I don't have to fight to stay awake every single day in her class.

Very very nice professor, who I have taken for both of my math classes in Pepperdine. She is very helpful when you approach her after class. She is also extremely patient and sweet. She cares about her student. Quizzes and tests are not difficult, practice exams and review sheet will be given before exams.

Literally the nicest person you will ever meet; however, she is very quiet and doesn't do a great job conveying what she's trying to teach.  You can tell she's really smart and knows her stuff though.  If you get her and are struggling, she is better teaching 1 on 1.  Study groups will help too.

You can tell she is very intelligent, but she gets nervous and her students correct her a lot. Brilliant, but can't teach a group of students. If you read the book you'll be fine , but I wouldn't recommend her.

She's a very nice person....... Not such a good teacher. You can tell that she really knows the material but she doesn't know how to get it across. So sad. I'd opt for another teacher if I could take it again I had to teach myself through out the whole entire course.

Always seems nervous and when asked questions she would respond by saying: " Good, good question ! But how would you think?" And it's like...we're asking you how to do this, I don't know what to think....

She's a new teacher, and while she may be a brilliant mathematician, she cannot articulate her knowledge. She just doesn't teach well. When asked a question, she talks in circles until people are even more confused than before. I think she feels very anxious in front of a group. Nice lady, but prepared to spend a lot of time teaching yourself.

Dr. Zola is so kind and is very passionate about Christianity. It's very clear that he is welcoming to everyone. Reading isn't crazy and there are reading quizzes every class. Weird grading system which actually benefits students. Projects are fun and midterm and finals are all essays. Would 100% recommend him for REL 200

Course is REL 200. Professor is very knowledgable of the topic and is available outside of class. However, the class is TOO hard for a GE, I would not recommend it especially if you have other important classes that you want to focus on. There is a quiz due every class, 2 huge projects, a hard midterm and final. Avoid it if you can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: I LOVE PROFESSOR ZOLA. Take his class if you can!!!!! Reading quiz before each class, easy midterm, easy final, one project. He is so amazing I love this man so much. He's so funny and loves his students.

One of the most unique formats for a course I've ever taken. No tests, just online quizzes (open book) due every class period that you can even get ahead on so you don't have to take them every day, as well as some projects. He's so caring about his students and the subject, as someone who isn't very religious, he makes religion very fun to study.

TAKE HIM TAKE HIM TAKE HIM!!!! BEST PROFESSOR AT PEPPERDINE! No test, just quizzes (open book) and projects (actually super fun&creative, I actually love doing his projects). Fair grader. He's willing to know every student as a person. He's super intellectual and love what he teaches. Lectures are super inspiring. My favorite professor at Pepp!!!!!

Professor Zola is super passionate about his subject and also really wants his students to succeed. Though there is lots of reading, the quizzes can be retaken and the projects are reasonable if you put in a bit of effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I've had Dr. Zola for two classes and I like this professor. He's very caring and welcoming to the students. His classes have a crazyyy amount of reading tho. There are a lot of class discussions, so participation matters. He doesn't use traditional grading. Also his theology is really liberal. But he's a good prof and I'd recommend him.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Zola is a great guy. You can tell he puts a lot of effort into teaching his class and making sure students come out of it learning a lot. However, as a mandatory 3 unit GE, the amount of work the class demands is insane resulting from changing exams into projects for online. Only take if you don't mind a ton of work or love religion.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the best Professors! Hes kind and cares about students. He is also super understanding. The class material isnt super hard but there is quite a bit of work. Nothing too crazy though and its actually pretty interesting. Hes so passionate and engaging with material. I really enjoyed this class and is definitely a good professor to take!

Dr. Zola is amazing. Hes very nerdy and caring and does everything to help his students succeed. Participation does matter ,but if you do the reading and pay attention in class the exams are a breeze. Take ZOLA!!!!
Zola is a great guy and great professor overall. He really cares about his students and has alot of character. If you study hard for the tests you'll be fine, but I really enjoyed his class

I loved the experience I had at Dr. Zola's class. He is very knowledgeable about the subject and deeply cares about his students. He tries to make his lectures as interesting as possible. There is a lot of reading (the whole bible) but you can probably find summaries online and you'll be fine tbh

There is a fair amount of reading in this class. However, Professor Zola is fair in grading and is usually understanding about a students work load. Besides that, Zola is one of the best professors that I have had so far. He is passionate about the subject and works hard to keep the class interesting and engaged.

She's a good teacher as well as a nice person. Class is tough so make sure to show up and listen to what she's saying because it can get confusing sometimes. She is willing to help you and teach you when you have questions. Class is fair and if you put in work you can easily do well.
Pretty Good Prof! Just Take her Class!!!!!

As long as you pay attention and go over the examples you will be fine. She gives a lot of examples in class and you can bring in cheat sheets to all exams. She is such kind and helpful person. You get to choose your group too.

If you find difficult the course, I suggest go to see a doctor. She is a best professor in my whole life who offers comprehensive study materials and study guides prior to exams. learn her study guide so you can easily get a A. Throughout the semester, there are only six homework assignments, each with about 5-6 questions. Her test is easy!!
This is the best professor I have ever met, very patient and very helpful.

I loved this professor! She is super sweet and willing to help students. However, I understand statistics isn't everyone's strong suit. I enjoy math so I enjoyed the class. She does have a strong accent which might bother some, but it wasn't a problem for me. Graded on 6 homework assignments, a take home test, group project, 2 midterms, & final.
Great professor but can be unnecessarily difficult when it comes to exams. Wish that class material was a little clearer but overall, good professor
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Fang Tian is one of the sweetest professors I have taken at Pepperdine. If you do not pay attention in class, she will call you out to answer questions. I sat at the front and listened and took notes and she would only call on me to answer the easy questions. She gives lots of practice materials to help you get a good grade despite the difficulty.
Very unfair and difficult professor. Hard to understand and will call people out in class for answers randomly. Terrible at explaining information and very difficult to communicate with. AVOID
Professor Tian is new to Pepperdine and teaches one of the harder classes in the business major. A tough double. She does a great job during office hours which helps a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Extremely difficult class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is super helpful and definitely is on the student's side, reasonable and wants you to understand the material. The class she taught is hard itself, even she said that, so a lot of students think it's her fault when it's just the material. If it weren't for her I wouldn't have passed. She's an amazing person!

Dr. Tian is a nice enough person, but doesn't know much about Business Statistics.  She's happy to help in office hours, but on several occasions wasn't able to solve her own homework problems.  Her lectures are difficult to understand and often make the subject more confusing.  She often publishes notes that she later revises as they were wrong.
Had to drag myself to class. Doesn't care even when he notices that you are struggling. Hated it.

Humorous man, but definitely isn't the best teacher for Music Theory. If I hadn't taken Certificate of Merit or AP Music in high school, I probably wouldn't have done so well in the class. He definitely has his off days...loves dry humor. Good man, not the best prof. though!

The least helpful professor I had at Pepperdine.  Liked to berate students who had difficulty with Music Theory.  If I didn't love music so much he could have made me hate it.  Ironically I teach music theory to middle schoolers today and I learned it all on my own after his class.
as long as students ask questions and show that they care about his class, he will care in return.
words cannot describe my dis-like of this man. If you want to spend you music classes gnawing your own fingers off in anger and annoyance, take his class.

Dr Cobb is a loveable ****.  He is an ****.  But he makes no secret of the fact that he is riding tenure and doesnt give a****.  Hes extremely funny though.  He has a heart unlike Lincoln Hanks- he doesn't hate his students. He just doesnt care!  Hes hilarious.

By far, my favorite teacher at Pepperdine.  While some complain about him, he is one of very few professors that has shown that he cared about students outside of the classroom and had a general interest in their lives and well-being.
In music theory, he tries to be dry and boring, but he's so fun. If you just listen to what he says, you'll just laugh the whole class.
No Comments
This took care of an ISAC course.  100 students enrolled in the class, but only five would show up for lectures.  Test average = 95+.  Enough said.
Great person, but i'm not sure how much you're going to learn in his classes.
This is a great class to take to get rid of non-western heritage class. its really boring, but he didnt even take role.
He needs to retire

She's such a fun teacher. She's engaging, humorous, and the work and exams aren't too bad. If you have the chance to take her for a class, do it. She seems passionate about her job, and is one of the debate team coaches as well. She also does a lot of interactive stuff that's actually teaches you the theories and are pretty interesting and fun.

I also forgot to do the evals because it's summer, but this woman is everything! Funny, smart, witty, nice, gives great examples of material, makes class fun, I could go on and on. We had DANCE BREAKS between lectures! The class is not easy but is doable if you get feedback from her and she is worth every minute of the work. I love this woman!

Just finished Prof Williams COM200 class. She's without a doubt one of my new favorite teachers at Pepperdine. I missed the course evals to rate her teaching so I'm letting it out on here - it's simple, you have to take her. You won't be disappointed. She's brilliant, funny, entertaining, and cares deeply about her work and the students. A+ teach.

Class is fun and you will learn a lot. The best things about prof are her energy and honesty. Says things during lectures that are unexpected for a prof but it is refreshing. She is a too strict about attendance and turning in assignments on time but everything else about her teaching makes up. Great smile too, easy to watch lecture.

Just left the final and it was hard like the midterm, but I will miss the class. Prof Williams always smiles and jokes. She never seems to have a bad day and seems to try hard to keep everyone into the information. One of my favorite people at Pepp!

Professor Williams is quirky and makes the class fun. She can be tough to make an appointment with but she is great to talk to, she was very helpful and takes the time to give specific feedback. Her tests are tough but she tests on lectures so go to class.  She is very understanding and a great mentor outside of class. She is hard not to like.

Prof Williams is very enthusiastic. She creates a class atmosphere that's fun to be in. She can be very strict about being on time, especially for an 8am. Her class has been very interactive and there has been a lot of application of the communication theories.

Williams is energetic & engaged in her teaching. The class calls for a lot of assignments. You'll get 100% on your lens outlines if you have her review & you edit it. Her tests are hard! It's often hard to communicate with her get an email response from her.
Different from any professor I have had at Pepperdine.  I loved coming to class and learned a lot.

Prof Williams is my favorite. She's super down to earth and funny. She is a little bit of a tough grader but if you study and keep up you can easily get an A. She's very understanding and I wouldn't want any other teacher for Com!!!
Life changing class for a GE. Get into her section for public speaking if you can.

Professor Williams is my favorite professor at Pepperdine!! She is intelligent, engaging, and easy if you go to class. She grades very fairly on speeches. Her final is a little hard, but just do the extra credit and you'll be fine. I got an A in there with a fair but not terrible amount of work. Def take her!Also lets u use notes on speeches!
Class is ridiculously fun, tests are ridiculously hard. Taking this class with her is worth it.

Dr. Skelton is easily the best professor that I have had at Pepperdine. He is kind, caring, and very passionate about religion. For summer session, there was a midterm and a final exam, two online quizzes, 10 forum discussions, a creative writing assignment, and a group presentation. Take him. You won't regret it! If only he taught REL 102 and 301!

Exams are pretty easy. His study guides pretty much tells you what the exam questions are exactly going to be about. Pretty much show up to class, do well on the online quizzes and complete the creative writing assignment, and an A should be manageable

Professor Skelton was great to have as one of my first teachers at Pepperdine. He taught very well and held great class discussions. He incorporated interesting projects into the mix and hosted his quizzes online. I wasn't looking forward to taking religion, but he made it interesting and I wish he taught all three levels so I could take him again.

Rel 101 has some tough teachers at Pepp but he is one of the good ones. Not gonna lie, he's pretty boring, but his class is super easy. He is passionate about the subject and a really nice guy. He assigns so much reading but to be honest I didn't do much of it and still did really well in this class. Definitely take Dr. Skelton.

Professor Skelton is really funny and relatable. He assigns a lot of reading, but you honestly don't need to do a lot to succeed in the class. There's weekly open-book quizzes and short writing pieces, but it all helps with understanding the material. He provides a clear, accurate study guide for the midterm and final, and his lectures are clear.

Dr. Skelton is a bit quirky, but extremely knowledgeable about the Old Testament! He is extremely understanding, and grades easy. There are quizzes each week, but they are online, and not too hard. His study guides are exactly what the test looks like. Overall, I would recommend taking Skelton's class!

Davie, as we know him is a hoot. He has a few quirks. OT in context isnt terrible. Took 3hr class and it was manageable. Study guides are pretty clear, but GO TO OFFICE HOURS and ask what he means by each term. He is extremely helpful and wants you to succeed. Will tell you exactly what the question asks for. Final was hard if you didnt do that
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Solid teacher. Doesn't grade the essays harshly at all and he actually cares for students to understand the information rather than just memorizing info. If you study the information on the study guides the tests should be a breeze.

Skelton is a pretty easy professor. His study guides are clear and easy to follow, and half of our final grade was grading our class notes... Multiple online open-book quizzes go towards your final grade, plus a few in class tests (MCQ/ fill in the blank and short answers). A little bit of a weird guy, but that his funny and entertaining.

Dr. Skelton is an amazing professor. He's very knowledgable about religion and is super passionate about it, which makes the learning experience much more enjoyable. He's super quirky and sweet, and will always be willing to help you if you're struggling. I highly recommend taking any class he teaches- you're guaranteed to have a great experience.

Professor Skelton was a fantastic professor! He really tries his hardest to make sure that you understand the material and succeed in the class. His lectures are very straight forward and as long as you take notes you'll do well on tests! He is available to meet outside of class if you need any help and provides study guides for every test.

Professor Skelton is one of the best professors, I seriously love this guy!! He's super caring for his students and is really nice about everything. I got A's on his tests but just study the book really hard the day before and you'll be fine!! His study guides are on point with his tests.

Dr. Skelton is a bit eccentric and a little on the awkward side at times, but he's very knowledgeable about the subject, and is very understanding that this class is a GE and not most student's priority. The tests are easy as long as you do the review and pay attention during lectures.
One of the worst teachers I've ever had.  He never came and never covered the material when he did.  I knew more about his personal life than the philosophers coming out of his class.
best teacher at pepperdine, unfortunately had other things to deal with and had to leave, sorry to not have him here anymore...damn

This guy must have written all of the previous ratings.  He is the worst ever.  Avoid him!  You will learn more by watching weeds grow.  He is very rude to his students.  He scheduled all of his personal appts. during his class time...dr. appt. lawyer appt, then got sick for two weeks, had jury duty, omg, he finally ran out of excuses! Avoid!!!!

this teacher should not be teaching. He has too many other things going on in his life. Doesn't even show up to class and doesn't have the character!!! to let students know he won't be in class.  How is he allowed to teach ethics? the worst ever!

Prof gough is a great teacher, really nice. i thoght we would talk about ethics a little more than we do, but its still a fun class. it's cancelled a lot, and there isn't any hw or tests. there's a project due at the end of the semester, but its a journal, so u basically write about yourself.

This is the easiest class I've ever taken at Pep! We hardly ever have class when we do we would just sit around and talk. No tests, just some journals and a paper at the end of the sem. Very funny and personable man...take him!!!!
easy class, cancelled 75% of the time, only one big project that makes your grade and it is a fun one...hilarious guy, really helps out with your other classes...do whatever you can to get this guy!
He is the easiest ever.  Hardly ever have class.  NO tests but a final.  One big progect that makes your grade.  Very nice and easy to talk to.  YOu want this man

Great seminar teacher, absolutely the best. Very personable, great sense of humor, willing to answer any and all questions, whether it be regarding dating, life, death, current events, etc. Terrific teacher, highly recommend taking any class from him.
great seminar! hardly any hw and we talk about intersting subjects. he is a nice guy, he tries to stay "hip".
the easiest class i've taken (his fresh seminar)he's a funny guy and really nice. he goes off on tangents but it's ok cuz there isn't much hw.
He is a very personable man, he's fair, and he talks about really interesting stuff...

To be fair, he is a pretty good professor and he is passionate about dancing. He is very strict about attendance so make sure you don't miss a single class. However I had a really bad experience with him. He definitely has an attitude and he expects too much from you. If you are naturally a bad dancer, don't think for a second he will baby you.
he is perfection embodied in a flexible mid 40 year old body. best teacher at pepperdine and changed my life for the better.

Bill is the best!! I took his advanced theatre dance/jazz class and worked with him in DIF. He will be missed. He has the greatest high kicks I've seen from ANYONE. He's a great dancer and teacher and he really cares about his students.

I absolutly LOVE Bill! This was such a fun class...the only class i didn't miss the whole semester (says a  lot!) Will def leave the class toned (body).  Dances are fun and he's ALWAYS energetic and enthusiastic about class. Absolutely LOVE this class...wish i could take it EVERY semester.

I FREAKING LOVE BILL!! He has such a great sense of humor and I looked forward to his class every week. As long as you put in the effort and improve with time, you'll be fine.  I'd recommend him as a dance teacher to anyone!
he is a great guy and an amazing dancer!
Bill is so cool!!! I love his class and his dances are amazing, you should take it for sure!  Take it especially if you dance...
No Comments
One word..AMAZING! He is so interested in his students and loves what he does. Even if you can't dance, take the class!
Rude, demanding and pretends to be helpful for a mniute before he turns his back on you.  Wasted countless hours and thought the world revolved around him.  Needs to chill out and lose the attitude.
I LOVE BILL! he is an awesome choreographer. Very creative. Brilliant. He is fun and funny and makes class exciting.

Bill is the best teacher ever! He effectively motivates his students, brings energy to room, and is extremely clear in his expectations. He is also an amazing choeographer! Take any class w/Bill and you will never regret it! Go Stage Dance!

HARD CLASS no doubt, but not impossible. Just don't slack. Go to every class and pay attention and ask questions because he skips over a lot of important info. He takes FOREVER to grade or just does not grade at it all. He is also very disorganized... never sticks to the schedule and always teaches pass class time because he runs out of time

Amazing professor! The class is hard itself (330) but if you go to his office hours and show interest he will be a really helpful professor for the class and for the future in your economics major. He is really interested in students that actually care!!

Funny guy but not always the best lecturer. He does not know how to properly emphasize important information and thus often skims past the major points of the lecture, leaving the class lost and confused. Does not respond to emails but just pop by his office and he is always willing to help. Really take advantage of his office hours.
Boring and one of the worst classes

His class is extremely disorganized and he is constantly jumping from the beginning of his powerpoint to the end and then back to the middle. It's extremely difficult to take notes. Also, he did not respond to a SINGLE email that I sent him throughout the semester, so there's that.

He constantly rambles during lectures and is not very straightforward at explaining concepts. His slides only have the question -- no example problems, no answers to the questions -- so reviewing the slides outside class is not helpful. The majority of your grade depends on what you get on the two midterms and the final.

In comparison to the rest of the Econ faculty, Jones is REALLY good. Econometrics is obviously going to be tough, but if you work hard you will be okay. Study a lot for both the midterm and final and work really hard on the paper (get his input at office hours) and you will be fine. Helps to have a strong statistics background.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: reads straight off of the slides for lectures and doesn't engage the class much. His exams are very difficult. He doesn't provide many resources to help you succeed on the exams. Exams count for majority of your final grade.

Mind-numbingly boring. Rambles monotonously for hours. Class is not interactive at all so be prepared to sit down and be miserable. Does not provide many resources, and requires you to learn r programming language. Homework and tests are quite tedious and frankly pointless. Only take him if you don't have a choice.

Dr. Jones is an awesome, young professor and I've thoroughly enjoyed taking Econometrics with him! My biggest piece of advice is to take advantage of his office hours early and often, otherwise it can be very easy to quickly fall behind. Seriously, his office hours are gold and incredibly helpful when it comes to homeworks and prepping for exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. Jones is a fantastic professor. He's a genius when it comes to econometrics and he's always available for study hours. His tests are very difficult but doable; as long as you study you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Gives many pop quizzes, which count for 20% of the grade. I took him for an upper div Econ class and most of the information was straight out of wikipedia
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Had a really tough time with her class. For several lectures, she just sat in the back and brought a guest lecture.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: The single worst teacher I have ever had. Absolutely tore apart each one of my solid speeches and graded it as if I was an English major. Would never take this class again as it is a GE that is supposed to bring up your grade and teach you something and I ended up getting shafted. NEVER EVER TAKE HER!!!

One of my favorite people at Pepperdine. Her classes are time-consuming, but very interesting and meaningful especially if you care about the topics. Her classes are a lot of work, but she lets you know exactly what she expects. She is one of the most kind and caring people I have ever met, and a good person to get to know.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Nice lady but not the best professor. Online textbook but readings were required as she gives quizzes everyday. Lectures are long and boring. Sometimes pointless assignments are given. Overall the class is pretty difficult unless your a comm major and you're better off finding a better professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She is so kind and truly cares about every subject matter. A tough grader, but a good mentor and teacher. I would take her again, no doubt.

I liked her. I had her for Conflict Management at CSUCI (teaches 2 classes here). She was really passionate about it. There were 8 paper assignments but really simple. She would teach a dry subject one class then come back next class with a fun activity to put the lecture into action. I thought it was a good balance.

Her class was a favorite. You never have homework except for the quizzes (in class essays w/ no resources on 2 randomly selected chapters) after each section, they were really intense and I pulled an all nighter before every single one, but did well on them. She tells you exactly whats on every test before. Memorization heavy, Participation counts!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: You can tell she really cares about her students from the way she teaches. She's totally approachable and willing to help if you actually have a problem and she's a great listener since she was once a professional therapist. She's very engaging and genuine. Read the book, know the vocabulary, and don't procrastinate on the presentation & you're ok

For Comm200 Prof Ballard brings in other members from the Comm Department to do a majority of the teaching, which I liked since it made it easy for me to identify which professors I wanted to take in the future. She's tough on grading essays so make sure you stick to the rubric. If you approach her she is so helpful and her lectures are inspiring

Excellent professor. Very intentional with all assignments. You'll learn a TON of practical conflict skills, both through the readings the group project. Her syllabus is like a million pages but that means she's very clear about expectations. Has a ton of professional experience, so she knows what she's talking about. Difficult but fantastic prof.

While each day wasn't exactly the absolute worst, it sucks that the class really didn't help with my public speaking at all. Grading was really subjective on each speech and she really made it clear that she just wanted to be home with her family and not teaching.

You basically teach yourself and your classmates in this class. Your grade relies on the vocab quizzes and concepts from the book so always read. Also, you learn from your classmates through presentations. Prof. Ballard is fairly unclear on expectations as well which can be difficult when it comes to all the writing assignments.

Dr. Wan is an incredibly hilarious and sweet professor! She made our World Civ. requirement very enjoyable, and most of the class was very simple if you just put in some effort. The final, however, was quite tricky- don't be fooled just because it's open note. Overall, amazing course and professor, and I would highly recommend this class!
Dr. Wan gives engaging lectures and has reasonably difficult assignments. She's also great with students and entertaining to talk to.
She is such a nice professor, very kind and gives you a good grade if you put in a bit of work.
Best teacher
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Best teacher at Pepp

Helen is a real gem! She is very amiable and responsible to her students. The class is fair and not too hard at all as long as you really try to learn the subject. It is important to participate and take notes in class because those can really help you to prepare for the final exam. I have learned a lot from her class even if it is a GE course.
The class is not hard at all but the teacher is a really picky grader. Make sure to get on her good side. Attend all her lectures.
Helen is the actual best. Really easy class and amazing prof

Super sweet, and a solid option even being online. Not too much reading/work, and showing up to class and participating is very helpful in this class. Pretty easy (never had to worry about my grade) but I feel like I learned a lot.
Hard A, unreasonably difficult final exam

I took Professor Wan for the upper div literature GE requirement. She is an amazing professor and the class is an easy A if you attend lecture and participate. The final is also really easy if you attend her classes. She offers extra credit at the end of the semester as well which involves themes covered in the literary works from class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof O'Connor is the best professor for COM180!! He is so adorable and makes public speaking less scary. His rubrics are very clear, and he gives great feedback on the graded rubrics. I was nervous going into the class, but he eased all my fears. I think that my public speaking improved a lot through his class. if you have the opportunity, TAKE HIM

Prof. O'Connor is super nice and chill! He really cares about students. The tests are not hard at all (sometimes he will even give you answers), he gives great feedback for the speeches, and the class is not really about how good of a speaker you are, it is just about becoming better than before. Take him if you can!

Professor O'Connor is a very caring and understanding professor. He is also very fair in his grading, and in his speeches he will take your personality (introvert or extrovert) into consideration and test how much you're improving. You cannot go wrong with taking his class.

Professor O'Connor is kind to his students. He does not overcomplicate the class and wants to help his students succeed. His lectures can be very dry, but I would definitely recommend the class! This class has a significantly smaller work load than other COM180 classes. If you show up to class and put in some work, it's an easy A.

His lectures are dry but he gives you clear grading criteria and study guides than make the class a breeze. Just take it with him and get it over with. Try to cater to his weird speech things though (even though they're not applicable to any real life speech or presentation you'll ever give after this class).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Best COM 180 professor! He is such a warm grandpa. If you show him that you work hard and reach him to practice your speeches, you will not be disappointed by the final grade that you will receive. One tip for success in this class is that you speak clearly and make enough eye contact. Do not rush and try to speak without notes.

O'Connor is a grandfather-like figure with many (perhaps too many) stories and long tangents. He's fun to listen to, if a bit off topic. He is very clear about what is expected of his students, and gives good feedback. He is also very accessible and good at answering questions (once he understands the question).

If you're a terrible public speaker, take Ed. His New York accent is fun to listen to, he's a really easy grader, and he always gives us a break and lets us leave early. You might not learn anything, but the study guide tells you exactly what's on the test, and I got a 92 on a speech I read word for word off a script, so it's not a hard class

Professor O'Connor is a great professor. He is really kind, personable, and very helpful. For my summer session with him, I had 4 speeches, 2 exams, and a couple quizzes. His exams and quizzes are manageable; as long as you do the reading and take lecture notes, you'll be fine. He is not too tough on grading speeches; he gives you clear guidelines.
He is super nice. 4 speeches that are not too difficult. A midterm a final and few quizzes, not too hard though. Definitely take his class for COM180.

Professor O'Connor is hilarious! I genuinely looked forward to class just to be around his personality and hear what he was going to say that day. The class itself is not bad. There is a lot of work/assignment, but he gives a lot of clarity for each one and helps you along so if you put in the work you can definitely get an A.
If you want a relaxed speech professor, take O'Connor. He's super nice and laid back. There's very little homework and he doesn't grade speeches too harshly.

He is definitely highly intelligent. I can honestly say teaching wise, he is the worst teacher I have had in my entire life. He avoids answering questions. He almost expects that you already learned the material (which isn't taught) and class time is solely for listening to his personal stories that are entirely unrelated and jumbled

He requires mindtap which is another $100 on top of getting the book. His lectures are long, confusing, and the only thing you learn from them is that there really are lecturers out there that can drive you to the brink of insanity. I'm gonna have nightmares about this class for a while. Please don't take him.

Wow avoid him for Bus. Law at all costs! His lectures have no structure and just talks non stop for the whole period.  Assigns long homework weekly and tests are super hard.  He is a nice guy but not suited to teaching. It is next to impossible to stay awake or take notes for his lectures.  I have heard Elliot is good for Bus. Law, take him

Two thumbs up! He knows his stuff and is a very good man. He's ONE of the THREE people amongst staff and faculty at Pepperdine that will give you more than your money's worth, and that's after 2 degree's and 5 years worth of professors there. Take em if you get the chance. He's worth his weight in gold. Just pay attn. and study hard.

Dr. Whitney has a lot on his plate because he is chair and he can sometimes be verbous...but he is WONDERFUL. He cares deeply for his students and has an obvious love of the subject. The class is easy, too!!
I have a mild obsession with this man.  The class was hard but extremely usful.  If you show interest and effort he will love you, and thats all it takes

Most brilliant teacher at Pepperdine. The student below is an obvious moron. Dr. Whitney may be a little boring, but always makes himself availible to help despite being extremely busy with chair duties. Study hard and you don't have to worry, get to know him personally and it will help you later.

He is ****. He is not teaching but cursing in the class. He did a good job to put you to sleep during class. Proude of himself because he is the chair. How can pepperdine be so ignorant. I am so regret to come to pepperdine.
And not just because he pays us to say it
No Comments
Nice prof and dept.chair.... but too occupied with the Business Div. tasks that he is not focused on his class.  I really didn't learn much in Business Law
Excellent teacher, Very flexible. Will not regret taking him.
This was my favorite class this semester. Prof Oh is one of the best teachers I've had at Pepperdine. I never thought I would enjoy PR as much as I did! Definitely take him for PR 255

Prof. Oh is a great teacher, the class is difficult but you learn so much! He brings in guest speakers from the field, and his class prepares you well for the professional world. The group projects are a lot (10-25+ pages), but Oh gives clear direction and help. Grades tough on writing, but can be made up with open-book quizzes, exercises & tests.

This class was excellent! Professor Oh is incredibly knowledgeable about the industry and brings that knowledge to his lectures. He tells lots of stories which makes things more fun and easy to remember. Lots of group project work but takes into consideration your group preferences. Highly recommend this class!

He is an awesome professor. Funny, engaging lectures, caring, provides good feedback. He responds to questions so quickly! It's a lot of work + the group project is a huge part of the class. Sometimes it's hard to get everyone on the same page but Professor Oh helped us make it work. I learned a ton in this class. Definitely take him for PR!

Great Professor, so many guest speakers that made the class interesting, and they often give out internships! (how i got mine). his lectures are interesting and he is super funny. Lots of presentations and group projects but he is a fair grader, if you do the work you'll get an A. Def recommend. Everyone in my class loves him

Compared to the other zoom classes I took, PR 255 was the best. I liked the mix of synchronous and asynchronous sessions and his lectures were interesting and fun to listen to. It was a lot of work compared to my other classes, but I thoroughly enjoyed working on them. Prof. Oh really got me interested in PR!
This class was a lot of hand in work: homework due every class, a huge research paper, a presentation, a midterm, and a final. If you hate group projects do not take this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Klive is very passionate about what he teaches. This was a hard class, but I learned a lot. His lectures are pretty good and he uses real life examples to help you understand what he is talking about. He is friendly and always wants to help. Take him for the research class!

Professor Oh is a great guy, but not a great teacher. His lectures are relatively entertaining, but often rushed. He is very uncooperative when it comes down to the workload of his class. You have homework due every class, a huge research paper, a presentation, a midterm, and a final. The paper, presentation, & final are all due in the same week.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Oh is the reason I chose PR as my major. He is funny and he uses a lot of visual aid, which was perfect. I never dreaded going to class and learned so much. He was always willing to meet with us outside of class. The group project can be stressful sometimes, but he puts in so much work to help each team. If you are looking for a PR class, take him!

Klive is an interesting dude with real-world experience, which I appreciate. He's great to talk to about career or school. The class is lecture heavy, follows the textbook, & has 2 tests & one BIG group project (random assignment). The class was great, he's funny & all; the project was treacherous because it really makes you depend on your group.

I was so lucky that I got Klive as a professor and as my advisor! He is super flexible and understanding, and it's a lot of fun to listen to his lectures since he includes a lot of pop culture references and videos. He cares so much about his students and I recommend him to anyone taking a PR class that he teaches!!

Professor Plank is thoughtful and respectful of differing perspectives, and she never forces her opinions on anyone. The way she structures the class is fascinating, especially the use of films that aren't explicitly about religion. These films help us explore what it means to be human and a part of a community, encouraging deep reflection.

Emily Plank is passionate about her courses and wonderful human being. I took her REL 313 film class when I was abroad and it was incredibly influential in my life. Some students are critical of this class- however, its students who expect to get an A by doing the bare minimum. Highly recommend any class taught by Professor Plank.

Emily Plank is a fantastic professor. She is very passionate about philosophy and cares more about conversation than short-term memorization. You watch movies as a class, and then discuss life and religion through different viewpoints. For homework, we read a couple autobiographies and had 3 projects. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: While in Switzerland, Emily's class was the foundation of my experience abroad. By watching movies and reading different theological books, I grew a lot as a person and student. The content of the class really spoke to me and helped me see myself, my relationships, and my future in a new light.

Get ready to watch inappropriate films and then try to connect them to 3 books that we have to read. One of the books is written by a gay man who wants Christians to accept him. Even though this is supposed to be a religion class, we don't use the Bible; there are no connections to God, she connects it to homosexuality and minority groups.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Religion through film. 3 books each being 200-300 pages with 10+ chapters requiring analysis of each chapter on professors terms. 3 papers graded connecting books to the films watched in class, if your opinion or interpretation doesn't line up with hers forget getting an A or A-. Very little assignments with harsh grading. Don't take this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: She is one of the best professors I have ever had. She was so intentional in class and ensuring we understood what was going on and she was very instrumental in our learning but also allowed students to discover things for themselves. I really enjoyed this class and highly recommend.
Very easy. Tells you exactly what you need to know. Test is easier than in class activities. Makes effort to keep people engaged. Took her in Switzerland.

The class was mainly taught by the students. We would watch a movie for two hours, then discuss in our own groups the religious aspects of the movie with little to no teaching actually done by the professor. The grading for her essays is the worst part of her class. She has a very particular idea of what she wants. Would avoid if possible.

One of the most vague professors on the planet. She refused to give any direction on how to study. She told us the final would be major ideas from class and threw in topics that were never discussed in the textbook or lecture. She also assigns way too many in-depth papers for a 3 credit class. Would avoid her even though she is a sweet person.

Religion is Religion. There's no way around it. Professor Plank, however, teaches this class at an elementary level but expects college-level work. The projects assigned are sometimes confusing, so visit her during office hours to grasp precisely what she wants. She also doesn't give study guides which makes studying for exams very difficult.

Prof. Plank is a very knowledgable. Her class has a ton of busy work. The tests have no study guide making studying very time consuming and the tests harder than any Malibu Rel classes. It is doable because she is very caring and helpful outside of class. You will learn allot however it is very critical so don't expect a Sunday school class.
Quizzes every week. Mediocre at teaching, terrible attitude and personality. Barely helps you during office hours, even if he does he is very condescending. Ruins chemistry as a subject for you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is a good teacher for explaining material. He picks favorites in his class, so people on his bad side are treated poorly. He is not understanding towards student's lives and issues. Since he's been teaching here the shortest, he tries to act strict and noncooperative to be dominant and force the respect of his students.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Best professor for general chemistry. Very average, lectures can be confusing. Quizzes are worth almost nothing so tests are everything. Very difficult to get an A in. Tests are extremely hard. You must know the material so well that you could teach it for an A. Go into office hours and get on his good side. Never miss class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Tough class to get an A in but overall good experience. Hes probably the best option of all the chem professors/the only one who doesnt try to absolutely terrify freshmen.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Wilson uses packets for lecture that you fill out as he teaches. Tests are pretty easy if you study thoroughly & do all the hw questions correctly. Quizzes are every 1.5 weeks or so & add up so be sure you get near perfect scores on them. He has office hrs but if you can't go he always answers emails. Tests aren't curved & avg score is 83% (B+).

I will never understand why Dr. Wilson made this class so much harder than it had to be. He is available for office hours, although I must warn you, he will make you feel like the dumbest person alive.
