He is very clear with what he is going to grade you on which helps a lot. He tries his best to help every student succeed, but that being said if you want an A or A- in the class you basically need to get all As and Bs on the tests and quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I really struggled with chemistry but Dr. Wilson is an amazing teacher. He will rearrange his schedule to be available to all students outside of class and genuinely wants his students to succeed. Very clear and focused lectures, doesn't waste time, and helpfully answers questions. Would highly recommend

I had Dr. Wilson in G Chem lab and he was hands-down the best prof I had this past semester. He really wants his students to succeed and is also approachable and helpful during the lab. He clarified the ever-confusing pre lab lecture before we started each lab, and helped me understand the concepts behind the experiments as well. Highly recommend!
Dr. Wilson is a great teacher. Definitely would recommend trying to get into his class if at all possible.

Dr. Wilson is an amazing professor!  I had him for chemistry 120 this past fall.  All of his lectures were helpful, he gives fill in note sheets to prepare for the tests, as well as he is super available for office hours.  He also does study sessions for tests outside of class.  Great teacher, take him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Wilson is awesome. Wonderful lectures, and always extends office hours for students. Definitely take his class, you'll start to like chemistry :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: I graduated in 2022 with a finance degree and took lots of classes with Dr. O'Steen. In my professional career, her courses have been some of the most beneficial outside of my time at Pepperdine. She was and still is an amazing resource, she will always try to help her students. The material she taught me in ba448 helped me pass my FINRA exams.

This class has no midterm nor final but 6 quizzes throughout that are tough and you need to study a lot before each. Theres also a group project for final. Her quiz problems are harder than practice ones. I you study youll be fine
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. O'Steen is probably one my favorite professors I have had at Pepperdine thus far. Yes, this class is hard, but I believe it would be just as hard no matter which professor you have. Dr. O'Steen was always available outside of class, explained concepts clearly and quickly when I needed help, and did everything she could to prepare us.

Young prof; NO real world financial experience. Lots of slides with her bitmoji on it ("so fun!"), but NOTHING is explained clearly. Her quizzes have weird conceptual questions she never prepared us for; average quiz grade is always very low. Wastes a lot of time forcing us to do participation activities. Overall, a strange lady who can't teach...

Dr. O’Steen is a thoughtful and caring professor. It’s apparent she wants her students to grow and she thinks of ways to be more creative and engaging in her teaching style. She is always willing to help students outside of class. Quizzes require a deep understanding of theories - challenging to gather in class materials alone.

O' Steen is the worst professor I have had thus far. She's terrible at teaching and giving instructions. Her quizzes don't relate to her lectures. She misses big portions of key information. I feel like this class is very important for our future, but she's screwing us over. Many of my peers want to drop their major because of this specific class.

Majority of the grade is based on quizzes which average in the low 70s. These quizzes NEVER have anything similar to what she's lectured on. She always throws a curve ball. She is also very rude, and won't accommodate you for attendance needs. Not a reasonable professor. My friends warned me not to take her and I did. My mistake.

Homework is optional and minimal. Lots of quizzes. Her slides and documents are really simplistic and useful (one of the best Ive seen from a professor). Always available for help. Class spends a lot of time on time value of money. Wish there was more things to be graded on. Class starts off really easy but gets a bit difficult midway.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: She's not bad. She assigns quizzes where she does not properly prepare us for. She also have steered me in the wrong direction for the final project multiple times when asked to see if calculations are correct but it is wrong through discussing with other groups. She's very helpful during office hours though. Would take this prof as last resort.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Please save yourself the time and energy and take someone else unless she is absolutely your last resort. Doesn't teach all the material that's on the tests, unreasonable, and has no credentials in the financial field. She just went from grad school straight to teaching so she's pretty much useless. If you're trying to be a finance major, skip her
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Dr. O'Steen is a great professor! I really appreciate that she is a woman in Finance, which is typically a male-dominated sphere. She is really good about making you have enough practice so that you are prepared for the exam. However, she doesn't speak about financial events happening in real life so it can be difficult to apply outside of class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I took BA 442 with O'Steen, and it was a bad experience. There was no rubric for any assignment, she only teaches from notes, and can't fully answer questions unless it is in her notes. The midterm was our class notes, still was given a low grade because my notes didn't "demonstrate my understanding." If you enjoy your GPA, find another professor

The professor is inconsiderate of his students, only allowing 1 absence regardless of what may come up. The course material is reasonable, but his character deteriorates the class engagement. He is not a good teacher, and does not hold an open mind for his students discussions. I would advise not to take course for a GE requirement.

We read War and Peace, the book/class was good. You only have one unexcused absence, after that your grade suffers immensely (even if you have a valid reason like horrible road conditions/medical emergencies). We had a midterm and then 6 response papers, which were easy. But he would ramble for an hour about his life and it got boring most times.

I thought this class was great. The professor is a genuinely good person and he cares. Yes, he is quite shy/reserved, but he broke out of his shell as the semester continued. Quizzes were easy if you did the reading, the midterm/final had a lot of memorization but the material was not hard, and the research paper was just long but fine! Take him!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This Professor had random pop quizzes and required us to memorize 72 short story titles and authors first and last names and then had the tests be quotes and we had to identify which story it's from and the literary styles of the author. Also we had a research paper on very niche topics that made it hard to research
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: If you are a reserved person, don't take his class! If you can't afford physical copies of books, don't his class. He tends to give reserved students and students who use other versions of books other than the specific requirements very low grades. His class is very participation based. His voice is low and makes you sleepy during class time.

this professor only allows one absence in his class. he doesn't differentiate whether it's excused or unexcused and after you miss your second class, regardless of the reason, your grade goes down. he has pop quizzes and doesn't really teach during the class. this class felt like such a waste of time take a different prof for eng380
You will do well if you put the work in for his classes but participation is very important
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Participation matters

comment: if you're a student athlete, just beware. was very shady when we spoke about absences. midterm/final be prepared to be sparknotes for a day
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Struloeff is a kind, difficult professor. For my summer session class with him, participation was 25% of my grade, so you need to talk in class. You have got to do the reading if you are able to participate in class well. We had to do 6 reading responses (out of 13 readings), one oral presentation, and a final that was tough, so do the reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Struloeff is the man! During the first couple classes he comes off as strict and kinda quiet, but after awhile you realize he's a genuine guy who has a lot of great insight about creative writing. He's also one of the funniest people ever. The class isn't a walk in the park--he's not afraid to criticize, but he'll make you a better writer.
Really nice guy, straightforward with what he wants of you, pretty insightful with his ideas, easy grader if you put the general idea of what he wants in the paper. Definitely take him!
Good guy, kind of quiet, but will make the occasional joke.  Good teacher though, if you want to learn how to write he is your man..

Essary was such a great professor! She had a true interest in the subject and did everything she could to keep the class interesting. MAKE SURE you read the text book before the tests! The readings are like 80% of the tests. The class is challenging, yet doable. Finished with an A- and am glad I took the course from her!

Professor Essary is an informative, obviously sharp and entertaining teacher. Her lectures kept my attention for the whole 1 and 1/2 hours that class lasted. I had her for Intro to Soc, and it the coursework and amount of studying required was very reasonable for a GE class. Altogether great teacher, very accommodating, entertaining, and smart

"ProfEssary" is an incredible woman!  She is so passionate about her research and field of study. It is refreshing to have a Professor who is so enthusiastic about seeing her students succeed! There was never a dull moment- we went on multiple field trips and each class was completely different. She is always available for help and is so caring! :)

She is a great teacher, passionate about the subject and very interesting. You better attend class and read the book. Not really flexible with the grade, and rightfully so. Pay attention, go to class, ask questions and an A or A- is possible.

Her tests are made to trick you. So if you are a bad test taker and know the information you cannot get an A in the class, which is stupid. I studied a lot for the tests read the book, went to class etc.. and so did other people and we all got B's.

She loves the sound of her own voice and is rather unhelpful if you go in to ask for help, unless you want to hear everything again. she also doesn't bend with grades even .5%. She's also kind of obnoxious in large class settings.

Classes are extremely boring and way longer than necessary. She goes off on tangents and picks on you once she knows your name. Read the book and the powerpoints online and you will be fine (and save time).

Very enthusiastic about all of her subject material. A devout feminist that oftentimes pushes the boundaries. Makes the subject material interesting. Just attending class=B. Reading all textbook pages= A- / A
Passionate, well orgazined, & fun. A is possible but will have to work for it. Easy on eyes too!
Fun teacher, great class, learn a lot. but really have to listen very very carefully in class. hard test easy to get a B not a A.

New professor, very passionate about her research, class and students. I loved her personality and how she always made classes fun. Tests were hard if you didnt study but not too bad if you do. Enjoyed her class.

Dr. Madden is very easy going and nice. However, he just grades too darn hard. He gives out very minimal A's. Class is based on 3 large projects: article, audio, and video project. I wouldn't take him again because I worked so hard and got graded so unfairly. He doesn't ever give out 100%'s on any projects/assignments. He's a too difficult grader.

I love professor Madden. Super understanding, very chill, cool assignments but not very many of them. You do have to purchase the adobe suite which is $150. Weekly submissions of tutorials on how to use various adobe platforms, but I found them all super useful. No tests or anything, he's great.

Prof Madden is so kind and understanding. During the week, you have Photoshop/Audition/PremierePro assignments, which only take 40 minutes. He provides super-easy tutorials, and he extends deadlines if you email him. He is also quite a normal grader, pretty fair, and follows the rubric. His classes run short for you to 'work on the material'.

Professor Madden is outstanding! Extremely understanding and lenient, he creates a supportive environment that encourages creative thinking. He's patient, allows flexible deadlines, and promotes engaging discussions. Truly makes learning enjoyable and stress-free. Highly recommend his classes!

Most understanding prof I've taken! Weekly homework load can be somewhat heavy but Madden is willing to extend deadlines if needed. You learn by doing in this course and it's useful content. Lectures are not very interesting but they aren't the bulk of the course and you don't need to take notes. Madden also allows work from home days.

Super independent class. No exams, just 3 module projects on a topic of your choice. Weekly Adobe assignments so it helps to be somewhat tech savvy in that area or else it can be easy to fall behind. Very kind, understanding Professor.

His lectures/material are pretty dry, but he really does try to make them as interesting as possible and he honestly is a very good speaker. He's very knowledgable, is ALWAYS willing to meet outside of class if you have a question or concern, and is very lenient with deadlines. He grades everything very fairly, and is just a great person.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He is such a caring and great professor. He knows a lot on history of Screen Arts. He is very understanding when you miss a deadline or so. He is one of the best professors I had so far
Madden really cares about the well-being of his students, both mentally and physically. Very understanding teacher. Super fun class!

The best you could hope for in remote (online) learning. It's Covid time, and he gave us very clear directions, was always available to give feedback, and was consistently positive and educational. I hope to take courses with him in person one day. - One note, I was very prepared and worked hard. If you are as well then the class will go well
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: He is the best professor in the COM section! I learned a lot of useful knowledge from him! thank you, professor Madden!
Really nice guy, but his lectures get dry after a while and he is very new and still sticks to the rules, which gets a bit annoying

Honestly the most chill hum class I have taken. You just do 3 essays the whole semester and a group project at the end. He is a quite normal grader. You need to get 4 books for the essays, but I didn't read a single one and still managed, thanks to the book club assignment you do in groups -- which is also quite easy. DEFINITELY TAKE HIM if you can
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Thompson's class was the most boring class I have taken in a long time. Long lectures, no class engagement, and does not care what students have to say. Passive aggressive in his comments and belittles students frequently. He's such an easy A that it is worth it, but not a great guy.

Dr. T's Hum 212 was essentially just busy work. There are no traditional exams, just papers and group projects galore. In found him to be rather passive aggressive, but this class was easy enough that I would still recommend him. Lots of reading, but there is no need to do them as you can easily get an A without ever touching the assigned books.

Professor Thompson is an amazing professor who realizes that HUM 212 is a GE. There are three papers, three small group papers/presentations, and a fun art recreation assignment. I would definitely take Professor Thompson again for 313.
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's a good professor, makes hum bearable. Easy grader, just put some effort into the papers and group projects and it's an easy A. He takes attendance every class period, will cold call if people don't answer questions. LOTS OF READING, but he gives reading guides to split it up and questions to help keep track of what you need to pay attention to
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Professor Thompson is passionate about the subject and the class is not difficult. However, there are heavy asynchronous readings and long essays per month, and the class lectures may get boring (His slides are pretty hard to read)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: His class was not stressful at all, because tests don't carry too much weight. He was a very lenient grader in essays. Plus, He is very funny and has lots of fun assignments that isn't graded too harshly either. One of my favorite classes at Pepperdine so far, I learned a lot without being too worried about my grade. 100% recommend.

TAKE HIM!!!! Prof Thompson is one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine. He makes a not so interesting course (hum) interesting with his lectures and humor. Literally the sweetest man ever, and this course has a very reasonable amount of work/hw.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I am so thankful that I randomly signed up for this course. He is a wonderful professor who values your time. The course is heavy in content, but he gives you all you need to do well. Literally, show up and turn in your work and you are set. If you have the chance to take him, DO IT. YOU WILL THANK ME.

Make a point of attending all of his classes and taking copious notes! It greatly aids in the completion of the essays he assigns during the course. I strongly advise you to enroll in his class. He's very passionate about teaching this course, and he's just a very sweet person. The workload is typical, with a final and three essays this semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: He is an awesome professor who is extremely knowledgeable while also being very humble. He is very chill and relatable and his lectures keep you engaged. Treats all his students with respect and with fairness. I would definitely recommend taking him.

Cares about you actually comprehending the material and enjoys the material he teaches. Highly recommend taking him. Would definitely take the course again as he kept the class engaged and actually put meaning to the material. He is also a cool dude and makes alot of references to the now culture and sayings.

At first he was ok but its seriously unfair and unmotivating when you have to take his tests. He gives out a test plan which is confusing cause its so random then a test review thats nothing like the test. Seriously not worth it dont even come to Pepperdine for STEM or Math related
Course in the classical great books peppered with trendy-woke garbage. Was interesting, now it is typical university indoctrination. I wouldn't recommend this prof.

He's a nice guy. Class is basically just running through problems, preparing for the exams. There is homework but it's not too long. The exams are pretty straightforward, 10 questions, a few from each section. No surprises in the class and he takes time to answer questions, I just suck at math.

Thankfully, I received a good grade in the class, but it's only because of the work I did outside of class. DT seems to be a great professor in all other aspects, but in terms of MATH 365 (an already difficult class), it was a terrible experience. We were NEVER lectured. He just gave us things to read in and out of class.

Great Books is a lot of work and there is no way around it. DT makes class interesting and you will learn a ton. Make sure to turn your essays in for review prior to turning them in for a grade because if he thinks your thesis is weak the paper will not get a good grade and there are basicaly only three essays making up your entire grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Thompson is an inspirational professor. As a science faculty member, he provides a unique addition to the great books program. He's the only great books professor I've taken and I have been more than satisfied with all that I've learned from him. It's truly been amazing

Honestly, for Great Books, DT is an easy A. If you're looking to be challenged by a Great Books professor, he's not your guywhich is not to say that his class is a waste. But he's definitely more laid back and easy-going. He is not a tough grader at all and discussions are very unguided. He's hilarious and very intelligent and I loved having him.

Professor Thompson is hilarious yet well respected. He will tell you plenty of funny family stories. He is straight to the point with his expectations in the course. He has a lot of office hours, so go see him. If you stay current with the homework, prep for every exam, attend office hours and again "do the homework" you will do just fine.

If you've taken Calc 1 before, you'll breeze through this class. Go to class and he will literally say the types of problems that will be on the test and will give examples. Not a hard class if you know you're stuff, and the stuff isn't that hard to know. His office hours helps.
eww

3 years after graduation, still remember the techniques and lessons learned in his class.  What will stick with you is the melding of humanities and mathematics that motivates you to investigate learnings for the sake of learning. This is something that pays off in so many ways. He is a caring professor eager to help all students.

DT's lecture is pretty clear and when you ask questions during class, he'll clarify it. He has a good sense of humor and he actually sympathizes you if you're bad at math and is willing to help. Prolly the best MATH141 prof.

President Benton is amazing. His course is so worth taking even if you do have to study and work for it. He will give good feedback on our exams and give good tips on how to take his exams. Participation really matters because he will randomly call on you to answer his questions. Make sure you do the reading!
He is the embodiment of everything a professor should be. If you are fortunate enough to get into his class, rejoice!

Amazing professor.  The best at Pepperdine.  Will teach you everything you need to know about Constitutional Law.  Very intelligent man.  Hard Class, but the most rewarding.  Pay attention and read, do your work and go to class and you will succeed!

Benton is by far the one professor you have to take at Pepperdine if you get the chance. Come prepared every day to class and it will be very rewarding. He had us up to the Brock House for study sessions, wrote countless law school rec's, & even outlined his notes for the class. Make no mistake though - he's a hard grader & the reading is extensive
Andy Benton is the BEST professor I had at Pepperdine. He rocks! Congrats on the Dean-ship AB!
Amazing teacher, best I've had at Pepp, and having the President as an instructer lets you learn some interesting non-class information as well. Take him if you get the chance.
Andy Benton is one of the best, if not the best professor in the business division. Wiser and fairer than king Solomon.

There is a reason why this man is the President -- he is awesome. Definately the best class taught at Pepperdine ... learned so much about constitutional law in this class. Teaches in the socractic method -- keeps you engaged. Excellent.
A political wizard.
Thanx for the day off!!  You are the man!!
No Comments
He seems pretty nice

Pretty chill class in terms of work. There are pop quizzes based on the textbook, but she usually says when they're going to be. I honestly learned a lot from her class. There's a midterm, but it's easy. The speeches are fun, and you learn a lot about your classmates.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Accessible outside class

comment: She is the best professor I love her. There are pop quizzes but the readings are literally so easy there is no way you will fail. Just make sure to read and you will be fine. She is super nice and caring. There is like no homework besides the outlines and speeches. I know other com 180 professors are rlly hard so pls take Truelson. She's my fav

Professor Truelson is by far one of the best professors at pepp. She genuinely cares about her students. If you are having trouble academically or personally, she is ready to help. Public speaking can be scary but she makes it enjoyable. Her standards are clear, keep up on the homework and put effort into the speeches and you will get an A.

Ms Truelson is a great teacher in almost every respect. Her lectures are interesting and she makes it clear what she wants to see on assignments. She is very open and cares about every student. If there is one complain I have, its that her mini lecture exams are due the same night which is frustrating if you already have plans or HW you need to do

Public Relations with Professor Truelson is one of the best communications classes I have ever taken at Pepperdine University. She is passionate and genuinely cares for its students. The course is very energetic and fun. I have gained so much insight and knowledge out of this class alone.
Good teacher. Decent class. Some connect very well with her. Others do not.

LOVE LOVE LOVE! Queen of PR! Feels like a Professor + mentor + cool Aunt all in one. 2 absences, let her know ahead of time. Syllabus is very detailed, you know exactly how semester will go. STUDY before class for pop Quizzes, (quizlets on Ch's help, textbook is long). Tests (3, MC + TF + short answer) are exactly like her reviews!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: THE BEST! Truly & in every way. Prof Truelson is qualified beyond belief & an amazing human in general, making her class my favorite so far. I was challenged but never felt like it was a chore. She has pop quizzes but they're based off of chapter readings & there are only so many so it's easy to guess when they are. I wish she taught everything!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She's incredible and inspiring. This class taught me so much but it was definitely a lot of work. It wasn't hard, but there was for sure a learning curve and I was always reading or working on something for this class. She also brought in great guest speakers. I'm considering changing from marketing to pr because of her! Def take her class (:
An absolute genius! Professor Truelson is SO knowledgeable and passionate about her work! If you want to take a class that reminds you what you love about learning, then this is the class for you!

Professor Truelson is an amazing professor who really wants to see her students do well. She has an unbelievable  resume and is able to use her experience to help students learn practical skills that are necessary to be a PR professional. She's clear in her expectations, will go above and beyond to give extra help and is an incredible role model.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Truelson was one of the best professors I have had at Pepperdine. I learned to write press releases, blogs, holding statements, op-eds, pitch emails, etc. Pretty much everything a PR major needs to know how to do. She is a hard grader, but she wants to see you succeed.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Inspirational--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Great person but I can tell he's a little biased. I don't align with a lot of his views and he teaches the class through his perspective but he leaves a LOT of room for discussion and that's pretty much the bulk of the class.

Peris was one of my favorite professors. He teaches clearly and puts the slides online to refer back to. His exams are all open-note open-book and he also provides extra credit opportunities, so getting an A is definitely attainable. If you want to learn the content, doing the readings is extremely helpful so you can follow along better in class.

This guy took an intro to poly sci class and made it hell. I hated every second of the class. Literally 90 percent of the tests come from the 40 page readings that you have to do every night and you have to know the exact answer because they are not multiple choice. They have multiple answers and omg its so annoying.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Peris is a solid professor. I was in his big lecture class. His lectures last the entire two hours, but he gives a ten minute break each class. I recommend doing the optional quizzes, as they are a big help when it comes to the exams. Homework was light, just discussion posts and reading. Txtbk isnt rlly necessary if u don't plan on taking quizzes.

Prof. Peris is a great professor. Despite the class being a lecture, he finds ways to help make it a little more exciting. Theres A LOT of outside reading but the exams are all open note/book so they're not too hard. Also even though the quizzes are optional- do them!! They'll lower the weight of tests and can only help you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Peris is a mild grader, you don't necessarily need to strive for an A. A comes to you if you did all optional quizzes and had some preparations for exams.

Peris is a very average professor. Lectures and content are so boring, but the class is mostly online so it is easy to pass. I never had to study for tests, but there's a lot of information to go through. He doesn't want his students to fail and has extra credit opportunities. Not the best but definitely not the worst.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Peris' is engaging, and really wants his students to succeed. Optional quizzes (do these!) and tests are open-book online, so if you have an e-textbook and take notes on his lecture slides (which he posts after class) it's an easy A. Weekly discussion forums are simple too! His politics are opposite of mine, but he kept lessons unbiased.

Dr. Peris is literally amazing. His lectures are not boring whatsoever and he allows for open-end discussion in the class, participation is not mandatory. He's such a good professor and wants his student to succeed. his exams are easy if you take the quizzes and do lecture notes. They're online and open notes. Take his class, trust me, so good.

Very enthusiastic, but a harsh grader. He also heavily enforces participation but then criticizes students' responses in front of everyone. Very uncomfortable to speak up or ask questions. He acts a little too politically biased to be teaching a POSC class that's supposed to be "impartial". Your grade rides on three tests, so very difficult.

The class is all lecture and short optional extra credit quizzes every week. It's clear that Dr. Peris wants his students to truly understand the material. He really does make it interesting to learn about politics and the history behind the American political system. If you take good notes and fully understand the lessons, you'll do just fine.

Professor Peris is an awesome Professor. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He is a semi-tough grader, but if you try in his class you will get a good grade (per usual). He is funny and super intelligent. If you really want to learn about politics, take his class because you will learn everything you need to know.

Professor Thomas is kind and very nice. Not so much reading, but some of them are a little bit hard to understand. Tests are not very hard, but essays are. You will get an A if you go over all of her handouts and readings in the textbook.

Professor Thomas is a really sweet lady. She has taught me a lot in English 101. The class was a bit awkward because no one participated in the discussions. If you take her please participate! She is so kind and wants to help her students. She only assigns about 5 papers and gives you the choice between several easy prompts. I recommend taking her!

Great professor! Very nice, sweet and would do anything it takes to help her students. Go to her office hours and ask for help with essays she is willing to proofread before they are do. Sometimes lectures can be boring because of her monotone voice, but other then that she is an excellent teacher and cares about her students.
Great Professor! She's extremely nice and helpful. Personalizes class. Reminds me of Ina Garten from Food Network. Definitely lucky if you get her.

Professor Thomas is such an awesome teacher!  She is super nice and only wants the best for her students.  She is very flexible on due dates for papers as well.  She even brought in breakfast for the class a few times.  TAKE HER FOR ENGLISH 101!

She is super super nice. She is like a total mom and really understanding. You don't really have to go to class bcoz she doesnt say anything you wouldnt already know (she teaches how to use commas and hyphens!!!) but attendance does count towards your participation grade. I totally loved her. Her tests are super easy and straight outta the book.
i love kanooooot, the class is easy and you'll want her to be your mother afterwards

Professor Thomas is a very fair teacher. She is very willing to help and very willing to be your friend. She has a "Motherly" type quality that makes her very understanding. Her tests are straight forward, and she isn't a hard grader. When she tells a joke, say "Kaneeeeeeeet!" She will love it. HOT!
Very wonderful and nice, nice professor--she will help you in anyway.
kanet is an awesome person and unfortunately working with her in the summer doesn't give her much justice for her overall personality.  she's great!
She is super nice and is always wanting to help you out, but never gives a solid A on a paper.  Her tests are pretty easy and the course is overall easy.
She teaches the very basic.  she tells you how to use commas and what a thesis is.  It's a really easy course, with a really quirky teacher.

Bowman was a good professor. He cared most about us learning the material, so he would allow us to go back into our tests and re do them which was nice. It was a little hard to grasp all the material as he went very fast and doesn't really stop for questions. He's very smart so it can be a little hard for him to understand that we don't get it all

Bowman was a good professor. He cared most about us learning the material, so he would allow us to go back into our tests and re do them which was nice. It was a little hard to grasp all the material as he went very fast and doesn't really stop for questions. He's very smart so it can be a little hard for him to understand that we don't get it all.

Let me start off saying that Dr Bowman LOVES math. He is an incredible teacher who is passionate about math, and the subjects that he teaches. He has a very unique grading style, which makes his classes easier than other math classes I've taken. Very accessible outside of class, and also leads Math Club. If you are a math major, TAKE HIS CLASSES!

He uses a different grading system but you should be fine if you take the reassessments asap, and understand the homework tasks that you have trouble with, and truly understand the concepts. The professor is available outside of the classroom. very nice and kind.

Dr. Bowman is an excellent professor. He understands that calculus is a difficult subject, so he cultivated a grading system that allows students to truly learn and thrive. Nonetheless, he taught the material in an applicable manner. My advice for students is to reassess missed "tasks" ASAP.
Amazing professor that combines a method of teaching classic calculus along with real life applications. Only math professor to make me want to use and learn math more.

Professor Bowman is a real gem! He is super helpful, understanding, and overall great. His expectations are quite clear, and he gives you various opportunities to raise your grade. Do the work and ask for help when needed. Also, he's super accessible, so definitely reach out.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Bowman's lecture is a bit boring, but his grading system is interesting. You complete specific numbers of tasks to earn a letter grade, and you can retake tests multiple times until you get it. He is always accessible during office hours. Take him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Bowman makes little sense without prior knowledge of material. Participation homework is where you learn-tests can be retaken, but final grade is what he THINKS you deserve. Literally in rubrik says final grade is subjective. I had "100" in class, got mid/high B on final- and I was subjectively given an A-. No math involved in final grade. LOL

Amazing professor! He really makes a dull subject interesting! I was scared to take calc but glad I did with him. Very caring and helpful and you can pretty much retake tests since he doesn't grade off of percentages but more based off mastery of material and gives you ample opportunities to make up for missed tasks on tests.

He is one of my favorite math professors. If you utilize his office hours, then he will help you succeed. Make sure to stay on top of the reassessments so you wont be bombarded with them later in the semester.
Dr. Bowman is tough, but he's good. He really cares, and if you show initiative to do better on reassessments, he'll recognize your effort to improve. I hope to have him for another calculus class.
Good teacher and gives you chances to do reassessment which helps a lot.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Good Teacher with a horrible grading system. Standards based grading does not work in college settings. His take home tests are a joke. Although he promotes them as opportunities to learn, not getting perfect scores on these quizes hurts your overall grade. Final is worth 40% of you final grade, so you can have 100% going in, and come out with a B.
While at the beginning it is hard to understand her, it gets much easier! She is a very sweet lady and cares about her students performance in her class. She even brought us candy once!

Avoid this class and teacher.  Look she is a nice lady, and cares but she is a terrible teacher.  You are better off reading from book and not showing up.  If you ask a question you may end up more confused then when you asked it because she gets to the heart of the issue not a simple answer.  She also is kind of hard to follow and understand.Avoid

This is the worst class I've taken my entire time here at pepperdine (3 years). I am usually an A student, I work very hard and pay attention in class, but this woman does not know how to speak english, let alone teach a class requiring clarity, patience and teacher assistance. I"ll be lucky to get a B which has never happened to me. I can't stress

She's a frail old lady who has a heavy accent and class is extremely boring. Purposely restricts admission to her class, even though there's plenty of room, so register early. Be sure to buy the book NEW! Otherwise the CD won't work if it's been used. I think she's the only one who teaches this, so sorry BA majors, you're screwed.

lazy students...go to a state school. Quant is lame, Cauley is not. Our class is awesome, we tell jokes the whole time, she brings us candy, I IM my friends across the room. Just do your homework. She curves too. Take an evening class, it's more laid back. holler fattaneh is the best.

I completely disagree with the above opinions. She is a fine teacher. The material is not difficult. Homework and test averages were 90% in my class. The people who do poorly are those browsing the internet while she is helping the rest of the class. People here just complain because they are lazy and need someone to blame.
OMG I can't believe she's still teaching at Pepp, I had her in the early 90's and I hear her as if it was yesterday... and I still don't know what the heck she is saying!

I'm listening to her now and I have no idea what she has said for the past hour.  Honestly, when I'm in class...I just want to shoot myself.  How did she get a job here?  Who does she know? Has Pepperdine ever sat in on one of her lectures?  She's the worst teacher next to Emrich.
You cannot understand her.  She rambles about random computer stuff, and her tests are virtually impossible.
No Comments

She is one of the few that "teach" quantitative analysis, but really she just loves to hear herself talk. She doesnt speak english well and expects you to apply what she hasnt been teaching on the tests...one of the worst professors.

Well well organised lectures. Good feedbacks for papers. lots of readings, but all of them are inspirational and worth reading. class discussions pretty bored, but i think it's more because of the students' irresponsibility. nice and energetic professor, always willing to help.
Avoid.
She was very accommodating to the classes concerns. Her enthusiasm made a boring topic fairly interesting. I enjoyed her class thoroughly.
Her passion makes a subject which could be extremely boring and hard, engaging and, well not easy, but easier. Be prepared for work but with a high pay out.

Great teacher. She's very enthusiastic about the subject and it shows in class. She's animated and enjoys when students are passionate about the subject as well. Her tests are straight forward, do the work (all of the readings), participate in class and use her study guides for the test you'll be fine.
She cares about the subject and the students. Everything she teaches is clear and succinct. Some of the readings are complicated but she always goes over them in class thoroughly.

Great professor and very willing and able to help you. The material is not hard to understand and her tests are very fair. She gives you a study guide with everything you need to know on it. Reading is demanding and sometimes hard to understand but overall excellent professor

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. She assigns way too much reading and grading for spelling and grammar is absurd for POSC essay tests. She also makes you fit a term in 12 lines otherwise marks you down. Arbitrary and not a fair grader. She marked half my points (5/10) off for missing 1/5 of a term. Avoid at all costs! All other POSC profs are better!!

Has unrealistic expectations for her class - 3 to 5 page summaries over 100+ pages of reading due every week. Very inconsistent with her grading, I received a perfect score one part of the test and then I received zero credit for another part even though the work was comparable.  I would not recommend this professor.
Gives so much reading to do. Make class write 5 pg papers every week! Annoying as well.
Easy course, hot teacher(although a little annoying), ideal for a summer session people.

Very invested in her students and extremely enthusiastic teaching style. She wants to see her students succeed and provides so many resources to help them do so. There are a lot of assignments, like and Spanish course, but they are intentional. She is always available to help students outside of class.

Sweetest professor ever. Her energy is like a ray of sunshine. She expects a lot out of her students, though. She grades everything extremely generously. She makes class really fun, highly recommend taking her.
Probably one of the hardest classes I've taken at Pepperdine.

Awful professor. DO NOT TAKE. Not too much work, acts super nice in class and says you're doing well, but is SO UNCLEAR on grading. AWFUL GRADER. I have an A, but it is so stressful and she is the worst ive had in all 4 years

Prof. Roggero teaches the grammar concepts very terribly and although she explains how to form the structures, she never really tells us when to use certain tenses. I always had to go back to the textbook to clarify what we learned in class because being in her class was useless. She gives a ton of and assignments and she never grades them on time.

She is caring and understanding. Pushes you to do and be your best. Remember she is a college spanish profesor, so expect to be spoken to in spanish almost all of the time. GREAT service project and is very fun when you go with friends. She will favor you if you put in the time and show your interest and commitment to her class. Please take her!!

Profesor Roggero is truly amazing. She helped to improve my spanish and pushed me to work in and outside of the classroom. She clearly outlines expectations and homework is easily known on VHL. Tests are not extremely difficult. Homework is easy, Pay attention and participate, ask her what you can improve with. Please take Roggero if you can!

Prof Roggero is super caring! She really understands the different situations students are in, which I appreciate! Though u have to make an effort to work in the class though, but within the online environment, the class is a lot easier. I think if you work hard and communicate with her, you will be fine.

Professor Roggero is extremely disorganized and all over the place. She assigns grades on assignments based off how she likes the students. I would recommend taking another Spanish Professor. Ive never heard of someone who took her class and enjoyed it.

Disorganized and wildly inconsistent, she blames her mistakes on her students and makes our lives more difficult than necessary for no reason. Some days she'll be in a great mood, singing around the classroom, and other days she'll make you use your flashlight to complete a quiz because the power went out (all other classes were cancelled).

Great professor. My only complaint is that she speaks spanish nearly the whole time in class. Quizzes are kind of difficult. Individual and group presentation. Grades work pretty easy and is pretty lenient about most assignments. Offers some EC. Always willing to help you outside of class time. Extremely nice and understanding teacher. Lots of fun.

Scalzo is one of the best professors at Pepperdine. He is inspiring and motivating and also hooks students up with research opportunities. His classes are difficult, but you learn a lot. I would highly suggest.
I'm not a computer science major, but I felt inspired by his teachings and helpfulness.

I took Dr. Scalzo for MATH 220/221 & COSC 200. Great & caring, mostly non-judgmental, wants you to succeed. Answers emails, great office hours. Puts all ppts on Courses, but just attend class since it's kinda hard to understand the lectures just by reading them. COSC 200 is kinda intense, he almost never gives hw which would be helpful to have tbh.
amazing. wonderful. so inspiring, such a nice professor. really believes in his students!

Prof Scalzo is a true gem of Seaver College. When he teaches us discrete structures, he makes sure to allude to real world applications such as Data Science and Machine Learning inspiring us for future fields of interest. The teaching is very understandable and the class is fair.

Scalzo is a great math professor who really cares about teaching the subject material. He does a great job of making sure his students fully understand it and allows for some extra credit opportunities to those who need help.

Scalzo is passionate about what he teaches. Gives helpful lectures and although class is not mandatory, it's helpful. Class is relatively easy and if you do homework and go to class you will get an a. Lots of extra credit opportunities and responds to questions via email quickly.
My favorite teacher Ive ever had. Super passionate about Formal Methods. Some extra credit. Forgiving and flexible. Inspirational.

Scalzo is by far the best teacher Ibe ever had. He teaches really passionately and he really understands what hes talking about. He really wants you to understand the material and he allows people to fail tests to make up so points, with extra credit opportunities. I really recommend him.
It's difficult to communicate with him. There are no office hours. I had to conduct self-learning for the entire class. Don't take his class.

1. Meeting w/ him is a waste of time. No kidding! He asked us to redo our project every time we met. Email is slightly better, but sometimes he'll avoid directly answer Qs and give another way (aka REDO!!!). 2. The class is self-learning! He doesn't guide you to learn about machine learning, but only some tips on certain functions you may need.

He is the best professor I have had to date.  He lectured non stop for 8 hours without notes.  Learned more from him than anyone else on the subject. Extremely helpful.  He is not listed under Lipscomb University where he was a adjunct but for all of us in his class he was awesome!!!!
Prof. Miller is awesome. He's got a wealth of knowledge about the subject and he's a funny guy. He makes a dry subject fun.
Fun teacher but you have to work for your grade
easily one of  the greatest professor i have ever had

He is the nicest teacher ever!!! He is sooo funny and makes humanities interesting and understandable! I struggle with humanities but he helps you so much!!! He is so smart and wise he knows everything there is to know! He is soo nice! You MUST take him if you get the chance!! :)
One of the best professors I've ever had. He seems to know EVERYTHING, is really funny, and works hard to help students learn. A great guy, and a great teacher.
simply AMAZING!
Absolutely hilarious

Dr. Miller makes humanites so interesting. He is hilarious when he lectures! He definitely knows how to keep your attention! He is also very fair with his grading and is always willing to discuss your concerns or assist you when needed. He is the best!
hands down, the best professor I've had here. If you can ever take a class with him, do it. he is an amazing teacher: hilarious, very clear, helpful. makes humanities a subject you might enjoy.
One of the best teachers I've ever had. Loves to talk but is really funny and knows everything. He makes what could be a really boring topic seem fun and very interesting.

Class is super boring. You don't need to go. Just stay updated on current events and read the textbook (skim it). His lectures aren't relevant to tests/quizzes. Just current events & textbook stuff. Marketing plan & storybook were graded easily.

He tries to be fun...but it's hard, probably because he's a bit old. He gives a few pop quizzes but everything is in the book. Midterm was open notes and projects are easy. Definitely not interesting but an easy teacherHe's a real nice guy & sometimes careless. My friend skipped an entire question on midterm worth 10 points & he skipped over it.

Has good intentions and personal stories from the industry, however, he spends the majority of class reminiscing about the PR/marketing world instead of preparing you for his tests--I suggest keeping up with the reading and studying hard prior to his two 50-point quizzes along with the midterm and final. Two projects also help to balance out grade.

He just stands at the front of the room reading you different articles from the newspaper for the entire class period. None of the stuff he reads is really ever on his tests. I wouldn't recommend this class because you don't really learn a lot in it. He is an extremely nice guy, just not the best professor.

He really only talks about current events that aren't even on the test. Overall, he's a nice man but this was the worst class I've taken at Pepperdine as far as learning anything valuable goes. He's so monotonous and boring... Be warned all those who choose his class for 8 AM.

He is great! really down to earth and still works hands-on in the PR world.  H elikes to talk about current events for most of the class, but it is relevant to what we are doing. I definitley suggest taking one of his classes!

this is a terrible class. there is another msco 220 with another teacher, TAKE THAT ONE. he doesnt teach, all he does is talk about current events and expects you to know everything from the newspapers. test/quizzes impossible. do not take this teacher if you can avoid him. terrible class. he never actually taught in class!
awesome teacher. really knows his stuff and leads interesting discussions during class. participate and contibute to class discussion and you will do fine.

Oh God! Don't get me started.  Doesn't teach, only talks about current events.  Tests are a joke and extremely hard.  When he does lecture they are so boring and monotonous.  Just talks for 2 hours straight with no break about whatever is going on.  Very partisian as well, so conservatives be warned.  AVOID!

He's a pretty easy professor it was not difficult for me to get a B and I wouldve gotten an A if i tried harder. Doesnt take attendance, no assignments from book just need them to study for tests which are a bit difficult. He is VERY flexible and understanding. Its very easy for him to get off topic. All in all a pretty easy class/professor

Does not take attendance and you won't need to attend class. However, midterm and final are hard and he grades EXTREMELY harshly. If you are only looking to pass and not go to class, this is perfect for you. IF you want an A, look else where.
He's the best

Charles Choi is seriously the best teacher I have ever had. He gave you lots of freedom in your projects and let you work together. If you were confused he would always help you A LOT if you just asked. He gave partial credit on tests, projects, and quizzes. he was an easy grader and gave extra credit. He answers his emails super quickly.

Professor Choi is awesome. His class is basically one semester long group project, nothing out of the norm for upper division com classes. He is very accessible outside of class with emails and office hours and is super kind and helpful, I would definitely take him again
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Charles is a respected professor and a person of great fun to spend time with! He's easy to talk to and is a somewhat forgiving grader. His students all had a friend in him. Only didn't give a 5/5 because sometimes expectations are not made clear enough and you may find yourself rewriting a whole paper after a revision conference with him.

Charles is an amazing person and one of those few professors that cares for his students. He's an easy grader so that's a plus but his tests do require you to do all the reading or get ready to CRAM! Overall he's super understanding to his students needs and passionate about what he's teaching.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Choi is incredible. I took COM 180 and 313 with him and I loved him through both classes. His lectures are very interesting and he truly cares about his students. His exams are 60% textbook and 40% lectures. I recommend going to class because he explains things more in depth as opposed to the textbook. Take his classes!

Dr. Choi is awesome! His class is pretty easy and he makes class interesting. Most importantly, though, he's very understanding of the needs of his students and he's always available and willing to help. Definitely recommend taking him for any class.
A solid professor and a really nice guy. Class isn't too demanding, but the projects require a lot of work. To be expected in a high level class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Basically one big group project. The midterm and final exam aren't too hard if you study. He gives good & clear tips and is a kind, understanding man. Would take him again for sure!

He's a little confusing. He's getting used to teaching at Pepperdine. But he'll get there. This semester, from what I've heard, was much better than the last. Whole class is built around a group research project, so it'll suck no matter who you have. As long as you do your work right and finish things on time, you'll get an A.
Doesn't give clear instructions on anything and wonders why students do poorly. Don't take him.

very difficult compared to other theater classes, but really interesting. i didn't think he was a hard grader but lots of people do. as long as you study for his tests (terms/stuff you discussed in class) and actually try on your papers you will do ok. He is very understanding and cares about his students, but you have to try.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: English major and grades like one. Seems nice but behind the smile he's stickler to his own rules. I tried with him and many students complained to him about his level of difficulty. The class is tough. If you can I'd advise avoiding him if possible.
Awesome dude.

Dr. Griffin is a fantastic teacher, I am not a theater major and I still enjoyed his class. If you stay on top of the work and join in on the class discussions you will do well in the class. His class was my favorite of the semester.

He has SDD. Syllabus Deficits Disorder. He gave us a 20+ page project half way through the semester. He is VERY hard. I have an A in the class currently, but could get a C+ if I fail this final. Which is nuts.

This is my second time with Bradley and while I love him to death, his classes are very hard.  The homework counts for a lot and it is very hard to get an A in his class.  He's a really great guy though and if you're a theatre major you will have to take him eventually so learn to love him!

This is my second time taking Brad, and while he is a challenging teacher, I still LOVED his class. People love to complain about the difficulty, but this is COLLEGE and those people need to suck it up and realize that. Chances are if you're a major, you have to take him anyway, so just try to stay positive and work hard.
He is way tough in his grading.  Not an interesting class at all.  Lots of lectures and group work.  Really sucks the life out of what makes theatre fun.

Very passionate and dedicated. Difficult teacher, but he will put as much effort into you as you put into the class. I learned so much in this class and really got to know my classmates. He can be difficult because he is very full of himself, but overall a great teacher.

I LOVE Bradley!! He has such a great sense of humor and treats his students like they are equals. He is really enthusiastic about theatre and knows his stuff. The class is not easy though. Lots of reading and the project took me forever. But it was worth it to have Brad as a teacher. Everyone will love him!

This is Dr. Griffin's first year teaching, and I think he's a good instructor, but his class is pretty difficult. There is a lot of reading and outside work, and he can be difficult to work with if you get on his bad side. I really enjoyed his class, but I'm not sure if a non-major would agree.

Loved him! The bad reviews were scary going into the class but he's super nice and caring. Just talk to him. He does give a lot of work but it is a project based class, no tests which takes a lot of the pressure off. He's willing to go over your project with you during office hours before you turn it in so take advantage of that!

Take him! Don't be fooled by the other low ratings; I'm taking SART201 and the whole class absolutely loves the material & the professor. He's a genuinely caring man who is accessible for any issue, film and non-film related. He even recently let us know that anyone without a place to go for thanksgiving was welcome to spend it with his family.

One of the hardest graders I've ever had! I question whether the man has any empathy for his students. The structure of the class is set up for groups of students to work on one or two film projects. Be prepared for a lot of time to be spent outside of class with the only real assignments to be "modules," and try not to miss any deadlines.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I am inconstant captivity by the lectures that Prof. Michael gives. Not only do they pertain to the course, but often they pertain to life itself. I wish I could take this class every semester!!!
He's awesome. I'd take him for every class if I could

Not gonna lie, this class is a lot of work. However, he does a great job of organizing everything and as long as you're staying on top of your work and putting in effort, you'll do well. Professor Michael is hugely successful and an awesome person- I would highly recommend taking this class. You'll learn a ton of valuable information.

"hello my friends" will always haunt me. The projects were rushed because everything was due next lesson, we had to teach ourselves, and the grading took forever for him to get back to us so we didn't know our standing in the class. Avoid this professor. Please, he is ridiculous to the point where it's finals and we still haven't had much graded :(
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Michael is the WORST professor I've ever had. I never take my time to write reviews but this class has given me an enormous amount of stress. His "kindness" only goes so far. He assigns an outrageous amount of work. He makes you go to extreme lengths to complete his projects. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: So many projects in so little time. Huge workload, but really nice guy.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: The hardest and most excessive workload I have ever had. In addition to the assigned readings for every class and having to take exams outside of class time, he assigns at minimum one project or paper per week. They are challenging, time-consuming projects.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Fine professor, fine class. Not much work beyond a group project and exam studying. Lots of lectures which made it a bit boring but it got the job done.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She teaches at a fast pace but goes over a lot of practice problems in class which is helpful. Her tests are pretty hard, but there are some easy group assignments and projects that can help improve your grade. You should go to class if you want to understand what's going on. Her lecture slides are not super helpful without going to class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures are posted for one class and the other is over zoom to do practice problems. Tests are a large portion of your grade so save the tutorials and treat them like a study guide. There is a simulation that will help your grade as long as you practice!! She wants you to do well and knows the course is hard so ask and she will try to help.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: So much more fun than Paul Jones. Literally had so much fun in Econometrics, you wouldn't believe it. Now we probably didn't learn as much, but still got thru most of the regressions and learned to use the R coding. Highly recommend Baitimbetova whenever she is an option, especially for Econometrics.

She does talk quickly, however, she's very thorough and organized. She knows the material very well. Grade consists of 2 tests, 1 group project, online homework, and attendance/participation, so it's very fair. She makes herself available for students, and you can tell she likes engaging with them!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: She does speak quickly, so you'll likely need to ask her to slow down. But her lectures are much better organized than some others, and practice problems given out in class are very similar to test questions. Still not an "easy" class, but there's nothing unfair about it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: -she speaks VERY fast and you probably won't be able to pick up most of what she says -you could get an A in everything and if you do slightly poorly on the final, your grade will come crashing down -not the best at answering questions -group project is super vague
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Not the easiest course material, but she got the job done. Tests are very similar to the practice problems that she gives out every week. You really have the ability to control your own fate in her class. Two tests make up like 30 and 35 percent of the total grade each, so you just need to do well on those two.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Your grade is based on what you receive on her three tests. First and final test are easy, second one is harder. She gives you practice problems. DO THOSE! Sometimes the test is similar to the practice questions, sometimes not. There are a couple fun activities in her class though. Overall, pretty normal professor. Also go to her office hours!

She is funny and knows a lot about economics but is not the best professor. Her lectures are mostly her racing through the powerpoint slides which are followed by practice problems you do on your own. I missed class a lot because all she did in class, you could do at home. Also no study guides for tests which are 35% of your grade.
She's a great teacher. Very kind and very informative.

I took French 251 in the summer, and I genuinely looked forward to her class everyday. Professor Khamo is extremely kind and creates a safe and fun class environment. She is happy to help when you have questions and is also hilarious. I came in unconfident of my French ability and she met me where I was at. Her lectures are clear and helpful.

She is a very good French prof! Her material is clear and really helps you with learning a new language. I would take her again 100%. Take her for French151 if you can! Not completely test heavy but does quiz you a lot. You can easily get an A if you actually put effort in.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Khamo is one of the best professors I've ever had at Pepperdine. I currently have her for French 251 and I genuinely look forward to her class every day. She doesn't make you feel stupid for not knowing much French and instead focuses on what you do know - and that shows through her grading. Our class loves her so much!
She will make you feel so comfortable speaking French! Great lectures and a great professor! I was nervous going into the course and made the class feel at ease.

First off I couldn't select what class I have with her for some reason but I specifically have FRE251 with Professor Khamo. She is awesome!! She grades very kindly, gives plenty of leeway on late assignments within reason of course, and she really only gives a number of projects throughout class along with relatively doable VHL.

This class is great for those who have a hard time trying to grasp languages. She doesn't grade too harshly and allows people to still learn without destroying their GPAs. Would highly take this class as there are not many exams and only one essay is done in class. Very helpful and enouraging.

Dr. Khamo is of my all-time favorite professors that I have taken at Pepperdine and I took her to satisfy a GE so that is saying A LOT! She is a wonderful human who exudes passion for the topic and is highly respected in her field outside of Pepperdine. Fantastic books, clear essay prompts, and great pedagogical tools for engaging discussions.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Khamos class on French Literature was very interesting. The class is not overly demanding with only 4 essays and a written final. She is very understanding and flexible with readings plus essay due dates. Definitely read and ask for essay advice to ace her class! Dr. Khamo's passion and expertise made class discussions fun!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I currently have her as a professor for Elementary French and she's is amazing. It is challenging to learn the language and for about 50-60 percent of the lecture she is speaking in French to help you get used to the language. Very easy grader, I didn't recall much from the lecture and I still got an A on the test.

He gives weird commentary and makes uncomfortable jokes sometimes, but that being said... it's not hard to get an A if you put in the work. Tests are just about memorizing how to do problems, and he has tons of resources (old tests & videos of him working out problems) to help you. You'll have an attendance 'quiz' every class but they're easy.

Taught myself everything completely outside of class. Tons of random topics and theories some from 10+ years ago such as "stackelberg duopoly" which no one has ever heard of. Just have to memorize problems he assigns. Doable to get an A. You know what's coming. Just a lot of work. Stopped going to class after the fifth H*tler joke. What a shame.

The grind before the exams are intense but a good grade is doable if you put in a LOT of work. Showing up to class was pointless I would advise you don't go to class because you'll learn nothing useful for exams. He gives you the tools to succeed, though, so make sure you know how to do every review problem before an exam and you'll be fine.

Incredible Professor. Gives you all the material you need to succeed. In class lectures helps. The Review Problems are super helpful. DO YOUR HW. If you try you won't fail. Gives lots of partial credit. Tells some jokes that may offend some, but is great. Really understanding.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: kind of rude outside of class, ppt lectures are confusing and feel like a waste of time. basically memorize how to do math to do well on the tests. not my favorite
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The first day he tells you you don't need the book and gives you all the tools you need to ace the class. He uses slides everyday and posts them to his website. He is really descriptive in class and loves questions. He takes attendance everyday. Beware of his dry humor and don't feel bad if he trolls you. Class is depressing, funny, and interesting

Hilarious prof. Cracking me up every class. Likes questions. Tries to be very clear lecturing. Helps outside of class. Clear with what will be on tests and what is expected for assignments. No book needed. Very organized. Great prof! Quant is useful, sometimes confusing, maybe not exciting.

Burke is the man..seriously. While he is a little more difficult, you'll actually want to/need to attend classes. His dry sense of humor and examples keep the class engaged.  He is very approachable and truly cares about his students. Take him!

I took him for Quant and Econ, and I really enjoyed his classes. While I wasn't too interested in the actual courses, he really tries to engage students and make lectures interesting. He is one of the most intelligent profs at Pepp w/a funny dry sense of humor.  He is a bit ridiculous w/ his examples, but that's what makes him relatable!

Burke is awesome! He cracks jokes the entire class which keeps you engaged. While lectures can sometimes be dull, he keeps it interesting. It's a hard class but Burke is a great teacher. One of the best!! You can tell he loves his job and is always there to help his students. Take him!

He was okay. He's HIGHLY educated in the Bible which is honestly so nice! But, when teaching a GE class, it's  too much informative. He's a very nice person, but his lectures are BEYOND boring, it's treacherous. I will say my fav words he says: "r u with me?" "okay..." "if there's 1 thing I want u to get its.." overall, he was nice + decent class.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Take Marrs if you can!

Marrs is a sweet guy. He seems like someone who'd call me "champ".The class is him lecturing for an hour and a half, and it's hard to focus in Elkins. Your final grade is based on a few tests, which are hard to do well on, even if you study a lot for them based on his lectures. He does give a few extra credit opportunities, which helps.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I wouldn't take it again because I hate huge lecture hall classes, but professor Marrs was very good. There are only a few grades total, so bombing one thing definitely tanks your grade. Another point of difficulty: can be hard to tell what to take notes on at first. Once you get used to the lecture style it's fine. He's a good lecturer.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Marrs is very kind but his lectures are hard to follow. Your grade comes from 3 complex (non cumulative) exams and 2-3 easy projects. The study guides are not very helpful, they do not offer the detail you will be tested on. You have to show up, take extensive notes and do the readings to get an A, but you can still expect confusing test questions.

Professor Marrs is a good professor, and I enjoyed many of his takes on the Bible. However, his class was often difficult to keep up with. Your grade is based almost entirely on 3 exams, and his study guides were quite unclear, and often incomplete. He often put very obscure, specific information on the exams. Still, I enjoyed his class overall.

Professor Marrs seems really nice, his classes are just really lecture heavy and can be hard to follow which can make it difficult. The test format is simple though and he always lets us out early from class which is nice

He is so sweet! Like the grandpa I always wanted. Lectures are thorough and this class helped dispel negative beliefs I had around Christianity. However, he tends to test on pretty specific things in the readings not necessarily covered in lectures (geography, kings, but not dates!) so you have to read the Bible as assigned and study the geography

I think Prof. Marrs makes the test material super clear and most of the questions come directly from the lectures. He is super passionate about teaching and gives extra-credit opportunities as well. As long as you pay attention and show up you should do just fine.
His lectures are confusing and hard to follow. He is humorous but most of the content he goes over is obscure and often does not correlate with what is on the tests. Do not recommend.

Nutrition 340 - She was always prepared and grades you on 3 exams, case study project, in-class quizzes, a presentation, and final.  Drops the lowest quiz.  Very fair grader and drops questions that majority misses. She gives you more than enough time on projects and readings.

She is an incredible and engaging professor. Her lectures were so interesting, she encouraged questions so we got to learn about so much more than what the class covered. She also has a cooking lab at the end of the semester to practice what you learn during the semester. She rocks, definitely take her class.
She's great!
So interesting, makes it fun

Great professor, great class! I went into this class not really knowing what to expect, but I have learned so much! She puts her notes on an overhead and explains them very well. She is also a great teacher if you are a visual learner as well. Take this science with this professor!
very interesting class...one that you take a lot away from. very easy to approach and the labs are fun!
i heard she's pretty HOT huh...i will find out this summer....=)
She is amazingly hot and "forces" you to pay attention. Great lab teacher and I actually wanted to go to this class. She makes my day Sunnie.
The HOTTEST professor at Pepperdine.  And she teaches well also...
Sunnie is awesome--what a great teacher.  Take Nutrition for your GE Lab science.  The labs arent that hard and they are fun

she just can't teach well at all. it is impossible to retain the information she is teaching because her style of teaching is just not it. she has no enthusiasm while she lectures and her exams are incredibly difficult because they are like 80 questions of all multiple choice. i would never take her

The professor delivers lectures solely from slides in a monotonous voice, making it difficult to stay engaged with the content. The quizzes are extremely challenging, and the journals are graded very strictly. The only redeeming aspect of the class was the movie project. Overall, I would not recommend this class.

writes more questions on quizzes than points offered (ex. 46 points available; but quiz is out of 40); extra points. The quizzes are direct reflection with the study guides. She isn't good at replying to emails. Assignments are kind of tedious for a first yr seminar but not hard. Grading criteria is very not clear and not explained.

I feel like I didn't have to worry too much about this class. It was fairly easy, we only took three quizzes (including the final exam). They were all closed-note though. Dr. Fitzpatrick is not the best at replying to emails, making it difficult to reach outside of class sometimes. HW was simple, just tedious. Takes awhile to grade assignments.

Just don't take this class. The workload is too much for a seminar especially if you a have an intensive major. The teacher does not grade work and you will not know how well you are doing until the very end. Save yourself the effort and don't take it.

Dr. Fitzpatrick is an amazing professor! Her First Year Seminar was very interesting! If I was given the option to go back and chose a FYS, I would hands down take this one again! Dr. Fitzpatrick is very nice and is a very easy grader. Her tests are super easy and are a direct reflection of her study guides! TAKE HER CLASS, SHE'S THE BEST!! :))

Cool class, but this professor is really hard to reach outside of class. She lags on responding to emails (if she responds at all). There's a lot of writing: she's not a tough grader but assignments are not very clear. Shouldn't be too concerned about your grade as long as you meet the requirements for each assignment. Quizzes/tests are not too bad

This professor never seemed to be available outside of class and repeatedly ignored emails from her students; stating that she read our emails but never found the need to respond.
