Additionally, this prof. waited until after the final to grade more than half of the assignments and was notorious for changing past graded assignments. Do Not Take!

DO NOT TAKE HER FOR FIRST YEAR SEMINAR, I REPEAT, DO NOT TAKE HER SEMINAR. This class had the most work out of all of my classes, including my major classes. It was tedious and honestly the worst class I have ever taken, not to mention she never gives you your grades back, so you have no idea how you're doing in the class.  Tests are short answer.
Th worst ever...DO NOT TAKE HER!  The class could be awesome but she sucks and should never be aloud to teach again

The people who write these bad reviews are often not in his studio and are mad because the people in his studio get the roles in the opera. He is a great teacher who had a very impressive career. This summer I believe he'll be directing Sam Raimey in the barber of seville. Must be self motivated to be in his studio, must be willing to do work.

Completely a mystery how this man became head of the opera program...  I don't really have words to describe how strange he is and how poor his vocal teaching techniques are.  Sort of a joke in the opera community.  Hes more famous for a scream someone let out during one of his opera performances then he is for his talent!

You need to be careful if he's your voice teacher. He has one technique, and it doesn't work for everyone, and yes, he could ruin your voice. BUT there is a lot to learn from him if you go in with a very mature, independent attitude. Direct your own lessons. Get past his character flaws (and annoying speech pattern!) and you can learn something.
Unknowledgable and entirely detached from reality. A professional burn out and unrelaible source for valid or applicable information.

Henry Price is not only a poor romodel for aspiring young musicians, he lacks professionalism and refuses to maintain a respectable position toward his students. Henry Price interferes with personal issues and has a dispicable attitude of superiority, lacks any sense of humility, and is a joke in the real world of opera. He is not reccomended.

Dr. Price is by far the best professor I have had at Pepperdine. He cares deeply about his students and strives to see them do well. He is selfless and as a teacher he is well informed and knows his stuff. Plus he has had an amazing career with a grammy award to boot. Whoever wrote those nasty reviews should be ashamed of themselves!

Dr Price exploits his students vocal talents with no regard to vocal health.  A failed performer who blew out his own instrument he continues to teach poor vocal theory to those unlucky enough to study with him.  Do yourself a favor if you wish to preserve your talent!  Look elsewhere!
EWWWWWW!!!!! he needs to stop teaching if he still thinks he is the best Opera singer ever. He is very selfish and RUDE to alot of people and he seems to be very very very self ordained!
tends to talk about himself quite alot.....kind of rude to many people!
he really heped me when i took a lesson from him, ive only taken one though
Great professor, caring and very prepared for class. Always bring good articles to share and would definitely take him again.

Dr. Arnold is a professor that truly cares about the professional and personal well-being of his students. His exams are tough since they are all free-response, and he picks questions that test your knowledge on the material. Make sure you read the textbook, and attend class. Show that you care about his class. He is very helpful. Great professor!
Awesome guy. Loves his job and what he does. "it's key"!!!easy class and fun

Dr. Arnold is one of the few professors who truly cares about his students. He has so much experience and knowledge on any given topic. Don't underestimate his courses though - it is tricky as you have NO IDEA what grade you are getting. For Service, we didn't have a final or a midterm, so that was confusing. Try to talk in class.

Nice guy, sincerely wants to help. Great practical wisdom. But not the greatest prof. Tries to help but is very vague on expectations. Expect to regurgitate info on exams - photographic memory is helpful. He basically quotes a paragraph of the book and asks you to list random trivial things. And he expects fact answers for common sense ideas.

Absolutely best business teacher at Pepperdine. He is truely a great person, caring manager and inspiring individual. He really cares about his students and employees. His experience is amazing and gives the best real-world examples. Class is not tough, it's common sense and interesting as well.

Exceptional professor. He is the future of Pepperdine and the Business Division. He could turn the division and the entire university around quickly, given the chance. He expects a lot, but communicates extremely clearly and legitimately cares about the success of his students. Take notes when he goes over the key terms and project suggestions.

Arnold is a great professor. His amount of experience is mind-boggling. Relates everything we learn to practical examples and does periodic surveys to ensure that we are getting what WE want out of the class. He is an awesome man.
Tough class. Must go to class every day or else you won't pass the tests. Thought I knew what I was doing on the first test and failed. Plan on studying quite a bit to pass this class

Arnold is one of the best professors at Pepperdine.  He's really passionate about what he teaches and he's always willing to help.  His lectures are excellent too.  Just go to class everyday, take good notes and you should be fine.  I highly recommend taking him!

The first professor I met at Pepperdine and taught Seeking Truth in a World of Alternative Facts.  This class has two main assignments: the News Analysis and Research Editorial, along with occasional reading and video homework assignments.  Professor Bryce was generally a pretty tough grader, but she was always willing to meet to discuss changes.

Prof. Bryce is kind, approachable, and knows what she's talking about. She makes it obvious that she wants her students to succeed. Assignments were not difficult at all and she makes instructions very clear. There is a partner research project, so class enjoyment can depend on that, but she works with you even if your partner isn't helpful.

She's super nice! While there was homework, she gives you all the tools to get it done easily and without a ton of effort. She's also super caring for her students and always responds to emails or office hour requests. Just do the assignments well and you'll get an A.

Good teacher. For a seminar it had a good amount of homework in comparison to other classes, and at times seemed a little unnecessary. The teacher was good however, and while the assignments did require effort I felt as though I learned something in the class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Love Prof Bryce, even though I hate group projects and INTS250 was about 85% group work! If you get stuck with a bad partner for the semester youre kinda screwed. Course was lecture heavy, but many group activities broke up the monotony. Class had a food break since it was at night. If youre engaged, youll easily pass with no issues.

Professor Forde was amazing and a really sweet individual. Although I had her class late at night, she made it quite bearable. She is a really great teacher, but also a really tough grader. I learned a lot in her class "seeking truth in a world of alternate fact" and found it very interesting. It is also incredibly useful for deciphering fake news.

I disagree with the previous ratings on Prof Forde. Shes super great and kind! Her PPTs are aesthetically pleasing and she teaches them thoroughly. Read assignments and participate if you want to pass! Her class isnt even hard so you should be able to pass with a B and up.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: At first, the course seemed pretty simple with a clear criteria. However, what I failed to catch early on is that every single point matters for this class. I actively participated, read what I needed, paid attention to the lectures, and did all of the assignments. Make sure you follow all the directions and clarify anything that is unclear asap.

Fairly frustrated with this class. She didn't know how to teach, gave pointless assignments, and graded super weird. I'm normally an A+ student, but the way she grades allows her bias and does not give fair assessment. Had 3 hour classes, but only spent an hour doing stuff. Kinda worthless for how good the Global Fellows program is supposed to be.

Took this Global Fellows course, was disappointed, and hope it gets changed. The course and teacher lacked greatly in the caliber expected of an honors course. Forde didn't know how to teach and really just wasted our time. Most stuff was just common sense. A lot of busy work. Almost gave a 1*, but she does try- she just isn't cut out for this.
Great personality and gives great feedback to you about your work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: This class is fantastic for those who have never written a screenplay in their lives. Kreiner does a great job of getting students to write and thinking about how they write stories. For those like me who have been writing films, this seemed like a refresher, and Kreiner gives us tips on how we can start to break our way into the industry.

This rating is specifically for the January session. Lots of homework but thats expected for January session (around 12pg reading and 2.5hr film) (get the video speed adjuster chrome extension to save time). Class goes slow but films/articles covered are great. Wish she would post grades to grade book because you wont know your score until the end
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Class was completely useless and I don't know how she expects students to participate when she calls on people to share forum posts, rather. than ask for volunteers. Her grading is very unclear and she does not create a gradebook for class and you never know how you did on assignments. You find out your grade when it's posted on WaveNet.

She says that participation was worth 20% but we did not participate at all in the zoom sessions, she just reads to us and makes everyone fall asleep. Doesn't give good criteria for our projects and we don't receive our marks until everything was done. I think she teaches differently in person but so far not a good experience.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: All she does in class is read random excerpts like we're back in kindergarten. We were expected to attend a 2.5 hour class, watch a 2 hour long movie, read an article (30-45 min.), and write a response (30-45 min.). Felt like a lot of pointless busy work. She was also very vague with her criteria. I would not take her class again even if I got paid
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Dr. K is not only a great professor, but a good person to talk to. Her HUM 313 summer class is the best way to finish up your brutal Pepperdine Humanities GE requirement. She is very aware of the Humanities stigma around campus and does her best to get you the information you need in an interesting way. She is a great professor to visit in OH!

Dr. Kreiner is the best teacher I've had throughout my education. She's brilliant yet down to earth, serious yet always laughing, extremely knowledgeable but not obnoxious about it, and most of all, she genuinely wants you to succeed. Her learning space was a breeding grounds for creativity, and I'm now applying to MFA program because of her class.

She is so understanding, open, honest, and easy to talk to. Clearly wants students to learn and sees the class as a big picture, not just a grade. Knowledgeable about writing and has great stories. I really enjoyed her class. The final portfolio is manageable if you keep up with assignments, which isn't awful.

Great professor! She is very talented and knowledgable in writing as she is a writer and editor herself. She really wants you to get an A in the class, but you need to put in the time and effort to write an A paper. She has high expectations for A students and does everything she can to get you there.

I attended Pepperdine University Law School in 1984 and enjoyed every single professor there except for Bernard James. Like other reviewers have mentioned, this man speaks in abstract metaphorical riddles and displays a condescending attitude towards his students. Very unapproachable. Ridiculous that he is still working there as a faculty member.
Great Instructor
Horrible.

By simply asking him a question he makes you feel like you're in the wrong for asking especially if you're a guy. Its like he enjoys feeling superior to his students. Very unclear and sporadic style of teaching. He frequently goes over 10 cases per topic. He expects unnecessarily long rule statements. Most impractical exams you'll ever see.
pretty good
Great Prof, verey helpful in office hours.
Ego?  Yes.  Intelligent and insightful?  Yes.  If you really want to learn then take his classes.
James was an intelligent and talented educator.  I found him to be a very effective professor.

Extremely narrow focus on case studies.  He tries to hide his liberal views and pass them off as truths.  His teaching was so unclear that I had do extensive outside research to try to understand the content of the course.  Do NOT take his classes!
This man's ego is a world record. He is so full of himself that he can't help students. Avoid his classes at all costs.

Really good professor. Passionate and interesting lectures. Semester long group project. Bad group? Good luck. Need to participate every class its 10% of grade. Midterms and finals easy if you study hard

Bauer is a very sweet and caring professor. His grading can be a bit tough at times, but if you show up to class and actually study for tests, you should be fine. There is a big group project that was a bit unclear at times on what was expected, but thankfully I had a good group. He was always available if you needed help.

Amazing professor. Hard class, a good amount of work for 3 units. Lectures have great content. Textbook readings before class. HUGE marketing semester-long project; if you get a bad group, good luck. Bauer clearly cares about his students and is very animated. Hard midterm, harder final. There's also a case week. I will take him again when I can!

The professor is nice but he's a little bit harsh on grading. The short answer questions on the tests were hard. I recommend reading the textbook to understand how to applying the concepts to the short answer questions. You need to remember ALL the details of ALL the concepts to get a fair grade.
1 really big project, 2 exams, textbook + 2 books, and a case analysis. Amount of course-work is fair and gives great feedback but a bit of a tough grader. His powerpoints are really helpful.

He is an adorable prof. Love him and his personality. Really wants you to succeed and understand. He is a pretty tough grader bc he expects a lot. Lectures can be a bit boring but it is very well organized and structured. He is very accessible outside of class and is very helpful when it comes to questions.
This man is one of the most genuine people you will meet. He cares so much about his students and is an all-around great person.

Professor Bauer was such an amazing professor that really taught from real-life experience and was very passionate about international marketing. Although a very tough grader and I feel I should have gotten a higher grade, the things you learn from his lectures are super valuable!

He reminds me of a kinder version of my grandpa. He has so much experience in the marketing world, he is the guy that put the almond in the Hershey's kiss. He is always available and is very knowledgeable on the subject. I would definitely recommend taking him.

Most caring professor, he truly is a gem of the business division. You wont regret taking one of his courses. Hes incredibly accessible and has great applicable content in all of his lectures. He has an impressive resume and deeply cares for the success of his students.

Really helpful in getting the important details across to her students and demonstrates leniency/care for her students to succeed in class; you'll be able to revise a hw assignment if it wasn't up to standards. Even when she was dealing a personal matter, during my semester, she still maintained her same amount of professionalism.

I do not understand why Professor Gutentag would have any negative ratings, she is by far one of the best professors I have had at Pepperdine. She cares deeply about each of her students, gives helpful feedback and homework assignments are easily manageable, (one assignment each week) and quizzes that are easy as well just study the textbook

Whoever is saying she is mean or doesn't care is wrong is. She is actually so kind and understanding, her feedback is good (follow it), and she likes it when YOURE CREATIVE. This is an advertising class of course she wants good ideas. Simply do the work, its not that bad, its legit a group project all semester - no final exam
Somewhat knowledgeable in her field but did not care about her students

She is just slightly all over the place. I think she's dealing with some personal stuff this semester and she is doing her best, but she also has not responded to a single one of my (many) emails this whole semester. I so like her application of course material in useful, real-world type projects though. Right professor, wrong time? Take her class!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: This class is the biggest waste of time. Actually a joke, I wish I would have picked a different one to actually get something out of. Lectures are not well prepared, and the group projects are a hassle. If attendance wasn't mandatory I would skip this class any chance I got. Find a more engaging professor, or pick a different major. WASTE OF TIME!

At first I disliked her teaching style which had a lot of participation and she was very intense in her lectures. She is an easy grader and honestly wants the best for her students. You have to pay attention in class because she often calls out people who are on their phone/talking to classmates and really wants people to closely pay attention.

Professor Gutentag is super knowledgeable about digital marketing and modern technologies. She often brings in cool articles and her prior experience. There are no tests or textbooks, just written assignments, and a partner paper (you pick your partner). These are easy so long as you are detailed, always write more than the limit!
Best Professor. So knowledgable and caring!

Never know guidelines (lost 15% for not writing enough/being too vague when I was at page limit). You'll also lose points (10-15%) for small mistakes. Ended up doing fine but I put more time into this class than other business/comm classes (and I got better grades in them). Save yourself the mental health and energy and take some other elective.

By far my favorite teacher I've had at Pepperdine. Difficult class, yes, but very rewarding and doable. It just takes the time and effort to succeed. Being that he wants you to succeed and that everything is clear-cut, it doesn't make it as hard as it may seem. Definitely a role model and a professor I would HIGHLY recommend taking for 321.

Dr. Miller is the best professor at Pepperdine! His lectures are clear and organized. And he is always there to help you. Every time I doubt myself, Dr. Miller is always there to encourage me. He is super caring and taking his class really changed my life. He is a mentor and a friend of life! Highly recommend taking Dr.Miller's class!
come to class, do all assignments & study hard for his tests and you can get an A. Super cool & inspirational professor!

Professor Scott is more of a good person than a good professor. His class was probably one of the hardest classes i've taken so far. His lectures move too quickly and his tests are nearly impossible... he made us do this huge problem in the final exam that took away so much time from us. took almost an hour to do the problem. I do NOTTT recommend

THE best prof. at Pepperdine!! While his exams are far from easy, he goes out of his way and beyond office hours to help you prepare better for the exam. The first exam hit everyone like a school bus, b/c nobody anticipated that level of difficulty. However, with extra credit, asking prof. Miler for help, and re-doing the problems, you'll get an A!

I've had miller for 3 classes, and while he is very hard he helps those who dont complain and actually try, plus you get 50% on hw as long as you turn it in. its hard not to learn a lot in his classes and he only wants the best for his students. just as good/better than misch and goukasian. a teacher who actually makes tuition seem worthwhile

Scott Miller is the best professor I have had at Pepperdine. I have had him for Financial Management and International Finance. He will challenge you, but only because he wants you to become better. He cares about every single student in his class and is available 24/7 to help if you need him. His classes made me want to work in Finance.

Scott Miller is by far one of the BEST teachers in the Business Division. He is genuinely concerned about his students in both the academic world and the post-graduation world. He uses the book as a guideline but really uses his own words to teach finance (a sign of a true teacher). I hope Miller stays at Pepp for years to come!!!

Scott Miller is an AMAZING professor! He really cares about his students and is always available outside of class. This class is not easy and he definitely makes you work hard for your grade but the class is very manageable if you put enough time into it. I loved the class and I hope to see Professor Miller at Pepperdine for years to come!

Professor Miller is a newer professor, but brings some good real world experience to the classroom. He is genuinely concerned with increasing each student's value in the marketplace. He's very knowledgeable and understanding of what student life is like!

Don't take her! She acts nicely, sometimes over-does it, but when it comes to grading... Let's just say it's too hard for a 100-level GE course. Plus, she seems very fake with her office-hour comments, like she says stuff such as "Oh, I LOVE having you in my class!" - apparently to every student in the class. Too hard, boring, and not useful.
Ignore the negative comments below.  Some of them can't spell or write in complete sentences...no wonder they did badly. If you are willing to work, Reid is great!
Demanding, but great teacher who wants her students to be their very best.

Highly do not reccommend, unless you prefer to dedicate four hours a day to a GE. This was the hardest class of my academic carreer thus far, and I am a double major and double minor. In reference to a comment above, this proffessor is extremely bias.

THE WORST teacher I have EVER had in my entire life.  Difficult to work with, EXTREMELY hard grader, and very biased.  She teaches this course like it is an upper division course.  When I took her, 99% of my class considered dropping.  Harder than ALL other speech classes
Really nice.
Yes, she is demanding, but she knows her stuff, lectures with enthusiasm and helps you improve. I highly recommend her.

This class is  MISERABLE. Other classes have fun. She teaches a begining speech class like it is a graduate class.Her demands are high and her tests are ridiculous.She makes you memorize the hist. of speech and  basically memorized the book.1/2 of my class dropped after Spring Break. DO NOT TAKE HER for this class.I've heard she is good for debate.

Professor Reid is a really nice person- I enjoyed getting to know her in office hours. However, she's a very intense lecturer, and most of the class is just memorizing information. I found this excruciating. The speaking part of class was great, but her heavy reliance on the boring textbook was frustrating.
Prof. Reid is a great teacher...she can be a little tough but it helps you to do better.  She is very willing to help her students and she seems to realIy care. I highly recommend her class.
The kindest soul on the planet. I am so glad I took his seminar. The only class I truly enjoyed and looked forward to.

Dean of Students and one of the most respected men on campus, but remains approachable and compassionate. Prefers us to call him Mark. He ACTUALLY cares about his students. Takes each of us out separately to get coffee and talk about life. He is very honest and straightforward with both class and life. Please take his classes! They are amazing!

The most caring person ever. He loves to smile. This class was a family, we all grew together in Christ and with each other. He cares about everyone, and we got to go to his house to have dinner. The class is still tight. We read a lot of books that helped us think critically about ourselves. I recommend this class to EVERYONE.

Dr. Davis is a really cool, kind professor. He cares about his students; before each class, he would say a prayer. His class is mainly led by class discussion, so listen for overall topics and try to participate. Make sure you do the reading. There was one group oral presentation, about 7 quizzes, and a final (about 10 pages written in class).
Favorite professor! Do the reading, participate, and you'll get an A.

One of the sweetest and most understanding people you will ever meet.  Though he is the Dean of Students, he's very approachable and easy going.  Class consists of reading a series of books and for our final, we got to go to his home to eat and discuss our paper.  He's a good guy to have on your side.

He has a way of making everyone feel comfortable and the class has great discussions about current disciplinary issues.  He is real down to earth and you would never guess that he was the dean of students.

I don't remember if I actually had him for any classes, but I did work with him and he is a wonderful man who I have a lot of respect for.  He was very open to students and obviously has a great heart.

This man is AMAZING! Not only is he the nicest man, he has a strong faith and really cares about his students! He even invites his students over to his house! The class is interesting and just challenging enough. He is an incredible professor and a true blessing to this school!
HE'S THE BEST, ALL TEACHERS SHOULD GET TIPS FROM HIM. MAKES EVERYONE FEEL EQUAL, IMPORTANT AND RESPECTED! I COULD NOT OF STARTED UNIVERSITY BETTER~!!!~
Lovely professor! She's super cool and also super smart. Definitely teaches you a lot if you just listen in class and put in effort.

I love Dr. Vabulas- not enough space for all good things I could say about her! Genuinely cares for her students and has a definite mom vibe about her! Super relatable and always kept class fun despite it being lecture heavy. She taught me so much in a way that has stuck. Her exams are difficult and require memorization, but she's a lenient grader

Dr. Vabulas is amazing! Her class really changed my perspective on international relations. It is really important to do all of the reading and to try and speak at least once per class. There is a lot of material on the exams, but if you do all of the readings and study intently for the exam, she is a pretty lenient grader.

Professor Vabulas was inspirational in INTS 351. If you do the reading and pay attention to the lectures, which are actually interesting, then you will do great. Just remember to participate in class (hint* actually ask questions if you don't know the answer). She is accessible outside class and really wants to help her students succeed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor V is an amazing professor, I took her INTL 344 class and loved it. The test can be a little hard because it requires a decent amount of memorization, but if you study for a bit you will do good on the test. Got an A and I'm definitely not the smartest kid in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Vabulas is AMAZING. One of the best gems at Pepperdine. She is so intelligent & you can tell during her lectures. Her class is fascinating, and she explains all the concepts in a way where anyone can understand. To do well in this class you must participate and read. She is also so caring and helpful to all her students.

Dr. Vabulas' class genuinely changed the way I think about the world. It was an incredible class with an incredible professor. Dr. Vabulas is one of the best professors at Pepperdine because of her great teaching and desire to get to know her students. A good amount of work, but it's not very difficult, work hard and you'll get an A easily.

Dr. Vabulas is everything I expect a Pepperdine professor to be. She's extremely accessible in and out of class, her Global Econ lectures explain the material but also connect to current events, and she genuinely cares about each student. Dr. Vabulas is the reason my time at Pepperdine was great. I learned and retained so much information. A gem.

Prof. Vabulas is an instant classic. She expects a lot of reading and participation from you, but you are graded on few things and her assignments and tests aren't that difficult if you read/study. She was really cared about our class, and I'm pretty sure I accidentally called her "mom", once. Adapted really well to the COVID crisis.

I love Professor Vabulas!! She is so kind and helpful and really not a tough grader if you do the reading and generally know the concepts of the class. I was quiet so I did not participate that much but she still gave me an A by emailing her and showing up for office hours. She's super passionate and knowledgeable you'll love her
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Thomson-Bunn was a great teacher and I liked the way her class was discussion based. She was very open to hearing everyone's opinions and gave great feedback on papers/assignments. Her assignments were straightforward and she is a fair grader. She was so sweet in remembering birthdays and would bring snacks for us! Very sweet and helpful!

HTB is incredibly knowledgable and truly cares for her students. Everyone learned a lot in 380, but there was far too much work assigned for a GE. I enjoyed the short stories assigned and her constructive feedback, but there were so many assignments for each class period. Adore her as a person, but skip 380 with her if you can't put in the work.
So caring and kind. Puts in the time to ensure that you understand the information and is willing to meet outside of class. Take her if you have the option!

Professor Thomson-Bunn is the BEST! Shes really kind and personable. Her class is super straightforward and she lays out very clearly what she expects. Her class is really cool because theres a lot of room for your own personal creativity. She doesnt assign topics to write about, only the minimum number of writing required. Take her class!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She's AMAZING. Environment she creates is open-minded and welcoming to any skill level. I had her at 10am so she would bring breakfast sometimes and birthday treats. She's very accepting and understanding. She will also help you with your schedule if you need. Easy hw if you like writing & tests are only about 5 questions about light reading.

dr. thomson-bunn was one of my favorite professors! she made the coursework so compelling and really cares about her students. at the beginning of each class, she would even ask us personal questions to get to know us more and make us feel comfortable enough to share our work. big 3 assignments include short story, poems, and screenplay. highly rec

DO NOT TAKE ENG 306 WITH HER. Harsh grader. Very unfair. Judges your personal stylistic choices when it is actually a question of preference within the audience. She corrects you on stuff that is technically correct, only because she doesn't like how it sounds. Does not take your writing style in consideration. Worst professor in my life.

Professor Thomson-Bunn is a great teacher. She notices your daily moods and takes them into consideration. She takes student opinion very seriously. She grades fair and if you do your best, you pass. She will help you and she will ask about you. She noticed when I went missing for a few days and helped me get my homework turned in. Great to take.

The topics and readings are interesting and relevant to college students. Writing is a difficult skill to ascertain, and she has the tools to help you hone your skills. Grading is completely fair. She can tell how much work you put into it. She'll always review your papers if you ask before the night before. She is really nice so don't be that kid.
Okay teacher. The class was pretty interesting. Take if you need to fulfill a GE

I probably learned more in this english class than I have from any other english teacher I've ever had. She really teaches you how to WRITE. It's back-to-back essays. once you're done with one, she assigns another one right away. But my classmates and the professor made this class enjoyable to attend. Do the work, show up to class, & you're fine.

Dr. James is engaging, really nice, and loves international relations. I love her, and I want to take one of the other classes that she offers. If you want a teacher that knows the material and loves teaching it, take James!!

My favorite class that I have taken in my major thus far! She is passionate about what she is teaching and makes the class very interesting! The long research paper takes a lot of work, but it is such an accomplishment and really teaches you how to do research! She is also always available for questions and advice in other classes!

Such an incredible teacher! I enjoyed her class immensely and always looked forward to it. A lot of notes and reading, but everything is relevant, and very fascinating! I am an A student, but was going through a hard period in my life, it was impacting my school work, and she was very understanding. I am dying to take her again!

She is not a thoughtful professor. She presents a biased view of nearly every subject. She is a bit of a curmudgeon. She merely reads off these poorly-made notes...so she lacks the key ability to teach. She occasionally drops a racial or offensive remark, and she is well-known for this. Not compelling, comes off as cold and under-qualified.

BEST professor at Pepperdine. Extremely helpful, VERY clear, and really wants all of her students to do well. She made a subject I wasnt interested in at all, very interesting, and I left class with more questions about IR- which, according to her, means she did her job. DO NOT miss out on her class.
The BEST IR/POSC teacher at Pepperdine. Not horribly hard, and a wonderful and funny person. She will help whoever possible to ensure they do well in her course.

Most wonderful professor I have ever had at Pepperdine. Prior to taking several of her courses I was ready to give up all hope in the school. She is smart, witty, fair, and extremely knowledgeable! One research paper and an in class presentation. Uses latest tech. in classroom. Interesting and inspiring! A must take! Take all courses she offers!

Wost Professor I have taken in my entire life. Terribly unhelpful, subjective with her grading. If you want to take a class with midterms consisting of 15 pages of notes, take her. Otherwise, find a more qualified Professor.

Prof. James is my favorite professor at Pepperdine!!! I don't know what that other person is talking about. I literally move my schedule around to take her classes. Just go to class, pay attention, make comments, take notes, and you're good to go. If you miss a reading, it's not a big deal at all. She's a wonderful professor. A must-take.

This professor is highly unqualified in nearly every aspect.  She simply shows up, reads off of a few sloppily contrived word documents on a projector screen, and then dismisses the class.  She is not nice, she is not engaging, her information is outdated, biased, and questionable.  She teaches you nothing that you couldnt easily learn on your own.

He is hands down one of the best professors out there he style of teaching is the best. If you do not show up to class your missing out because everything he shows and teaches is awesome, plus it will hurt you in your participation, attendance, and when it comes down to take the final.
Dr. Detweiler is incredibly entertaining and intelligent. You can tell he cares about what he teaches and he doesn't ask for too much. He makes his material very engaging.

4 hour long class, where attendance matters. Don't be fooled that all you do is watch movies, you have to write a 300 word response before every class on the chapter you read, then after class another response to the movie that you watched. He takes random attendance and assigns an 8 page research paper. It's a lot of time consuming work for a GE

Great Prof. for the film class. I liked the lectures BETTER than the films he had us watch. He is engaging, interesting, and informative - especially if you get to know him personally. I would recommend himthe class to any friend looking for a fun, easy class to fulfill the fine arts requirement.  Few quizzesassignments. Only test is the final.

If you have the opportunity to take this class, do it. Though it may seem unnecessary and pointless in the beginning, it was probably the best class I've ever taken. It was such an insightful and impacting class.

If you have the opportunity to take this class, do it. Though it may seem unnecessary and pointless in the beginning, it was probably the best class I've ever taken. It's such an insightful and impacting class.

If you have the opportunity to take this class, do it. Though it may seem unnecessary and pointless in the beginning, it was probably the best class I've ever taken. He's dorky at times, but it's such an insightful and impacting class.
Trust me, he knows what he's doing. Whether you realize it and take advantage of the potential is entirely up to you. Comprehensive, "real-life" learning. Epic individual.
Great guy with awesome connections who engages students in the learning process to allow them to develop

He's laid back and chill. You don't need to take notes in his class. You just need to pay attention and read the text book for the quizzes and reflections. Our mid-term was all essays, and we got to use our laptop and the internet.

Shanna's class was fun. Grade was made up of a midterm paper, biweekly discussion posts, and a final group project. Classwork was not demanding at all. Also grades on a four-point scale. I would highly recommend

Dr. Early is one of the best professors I have had. She is super funny. As for course content, it is super easy, but you do need to read 4 or 5 books. She did not give us any tests, so the class was really easy, but it was also super fun at the same time. She makes learning fairly enjoyable.
This class def gave me a better understanding of comics. Dr. Early is nice and she made the material fun for sure. Recommend!

She was so understanding and whenever life throws you a curve, she will give you an extension. You read comics to understand plot basics and rhetoric which was super fun. She was a great teacher who made the class so amazing.

Amazing!!!! Best Jan term ever! Prof Early is so amazing and cares for each of her students. I learned the material in a way that wasn't stressful or overly complicated. Would take her again a million times over. Love her!

Prof Early is amazing! She only wants the best for her students, and will ensure that everyone succeeds. There's minimal amount of work and interesting lectures that deal with more than just writing. She is funny and intelligent, I recommend taking her class!

One of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. She is very helpful and tries to make her lectures interactive. She tries to make all of her topics in class very relevant and easy to follow for her students. If you listen to what she teaches you in class and use it in your essays you should get a good grade. I highly recommend taking her for eng101.

Professor Early is one of the best teachers at Pepperdine. It is very clear that she genuinely cares about the well being of her students. This semester I have learned so much in her class that I will carry with me for the rest of my life. She treats her students with respect and challenges her students to think outside of the box. A true gem.
I LOVE SHANNA. Had her over the summer for HUM. She's such a nice lady. Wants you to succeed. Just try and show her that you are trying and she will help you succeed.

One of the best professors here. She is very understanding of her students. She is super fun and lax. She actually cares about her students and makes her grading practical and clear. I would highly advise to take her class.

310 is a challenging class due to the fact that students have to create their own experiment, collect data, and complete a paper over 20 pages. With that being said, Dr. Hollingdale made a typically stressful class fun. Her industry knowledge and humor made the class quite memorable, and I would highly recommend her to any psychology student.
She is super funny, understanding, and interesting. If you can take one of her classes, DO IT!

I just loved this woman and her class! By far one of the most caring and knowledge professors at Pepperdine. I took her class during May semester and I really appreciated the fact that she did not overwhelm students with a ton of work all at once. Her lectures are fun, engaging, and super informative. Highly recommend her as she was the best!

Dr. Hollingdale is a brilliant very talented professor. Her PSYC333 class was outstanding. She makes her lectures very interesting and practical with real world examples. She explains complex topics in very clear ways. I absolutely loved her class. Plus her sense of humor is awesome too.
If I could take this class again, I would. She was one of my favorite professors ever. I loved her class. If you have the option, take her!
Loved her, favorite professor at Pepp, super easy but cares about her students. Wants everyone to succeed. Highly recommend.

Professor Hollingdale is amazing! She is a great teacher, doesn't assign much homework, and helps you along with your paper assignment (which is super helpful). She's very funny and I love her English accent. She wants you to do well and makes lectures fun! :)

Dr. Hollingdale is AMAZING! Only good things, if you ever get the privilege to take her course, take her 100%!!
I took Psych200 (the GE course) with no prior interest in the field of psychology, but she made every lesson and lecture interesting and engaging. Attendance was not mandatory, there was a a research essay and final exam (open note)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Easy grader. Easy to reach out. Fun person. Love her.
Easy grader. Easy exams. A relatively easy class in the psyc dept. love her english accent.

Gift is the worst professor I have ever had. He had clear favorites. He did not explain anything. One of the examples he used to explain things in an econ class was "try to write down words while listening to others speak." do not take. he's also rude/angry.
Worst professor out of the four colleges I've attended (I have 3 degrees and he's the worst

From start of class, he was shrewd about not recording lecturers in which was a hinderance for studying purposes. Lectures barely covered asynchronous materials. Did NOT prepare for exams. Can be degrading. Covered what he preferred about economics rather than what we'd actually be tested on. Take another professor if able.

From the start of class, extremely not welcoming. Refused to record lectures and that was not helpful for studying purposes. Lectures would barely cover asynchronous materials. Did NOT prepare for exams thoroughly. Can be degrading. Covered what he preferred about economics rather than what we'd be tested on. Take someone else!

The professor has a tendency to degrade students by saying things like, you should know this already, and there's no excuse for you not to know this. After multiple requests for help, I ended up with a tutor. I felt like this professor doesn't care about his students and teaching ways are misaligned with Pepperdine's culture.

Paul is nice guy. However, his class is not. Some questions in his quizes depends on memorization. He tries to make his final very ambiguous. The quizes and the finals are two separate worlds. The good teacher prepare student with tools for success. Paul will give you the tools but will never teach you how to use it. With respect to him, my opinion

Great class, great professor. If you are willing to learn, to put the time in outside of class (listening to lectures), and ask questions, you will do fine.  His class was one of my favorites from the program.

the raters before me are probably bitter they got a bad grade. it is not the easiest class but Paul Gift makes it extremely interesting. If you follow his lectures, put in the time, you will be able to grasp the material and get an A! TAKE HIM!!

Here is a professor that has not read a single page of the required textbook and tells you to study it "for better understanding". He claims to have a purpose in teaching students the "true" fundementals of economic but in turn, screws everyone on the exam by asking about dates and memorization questions.

Lacking real world work experience. Silly jokes and repeated reference to idiotic "chipotle Burrito". This is a MBA class, and it should be treated that way! Exam's are not 'ANY REFLECTION' of study materials! DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS! DON'T!!
This professor is boring but he is sooooo hot it is worth taking the class just to look at him for 4 hours!

Professoressa Corbucci is the absolute sweetest and always comes up with fun games in class like Simon Says, scavenger hunts, and even storybook reading. This was her first semester not using a textbook/online homework, so it was a bit unstructured, making it hard to know your grade and follow the homework. But her fun attitude makes it wonderful!

Professor Corbucci is the best professor at Pepperdine.  She wants you to learn and enjoy Italian.   She will do everything in her power to make sure that you succeed and will even tell you what will be on the test before.  She is flexible if you are overwhelmed with outside classes or life. She just wants you to WANT to learn.

Even if you aren't particularly passionate about Italian, you should take Corbucci's class just so you can have her. Truly the most caring professor at Pepperdine. Goes above and beyond for each student. Her enthusiasm is infectious and she really makes an effort to make each class fun. If you have the chance, take Professor Corbucci!!!!!!!!!!

Prof Corbucci is hands down the best professor I have had at Pepperdine. She genuinely cares about her students and wants nothing more than to see them succeed. Her lectures are tailored to the ability of the INDIVIDUAL STUDENT, not the ability of the smartest of the class. Classes are interactive and she gives tons of resources to practice!

LOVE LOVE LOVE Mrs. Corbucci!! She is the sweetest, most caring person. She really wants everybody to do well and will take time out of her day to make sure you are where you need to be. She invites the class over to teach us all how to make dinner at the end of the semester. She really loves Italian and ALL of her students. LOVE HER!!

Amazing professor.  She is clear, concise, thorough, joyous, upbeat, prepared, challenging, and has a format that will put you on track to becoming advanced in Italian.  She does not assign busy work, everything is intentional and useful.  Prof. Corbucci is caring and wants to see all of her students succeed.  I would highly recommend.

Best professor hands down. She's sweet, helpful, and really fun to be around while learning a foreign language. She's constantly thinking of new ways to keep us interested in the Italian language while still getting us to learn. Plus, she's just a joy to be around!

Professoressa Corbucci is wonderful. She makes the class really fun and interesting, and she is more than willing to meet with you if you need help. She explains things in a clear way and she doesn't make you learn every little thing but instead tests you on general things like grammar. She is also really sweet.
I love Corbucci, she's the sweetest people ever. Class is easy. She invited her students to her house and cook them dinner!!!! Best Italian teacher!! Take her!!!!

Professoressa is fantastic! She's patient, extremely helpful, cares about her students tremendously, is sweet and bubbly, and on top of that is drop dead gorgeous.  You would be an idiot not to take her class. Best Italian teacher in the department by far.

Ben is a good guy, he cares for his students and wants to hear what you have to say. The philosophy class I took with him involved a lot of class discussions where your participation is graded. Minimal assignments and he is very helpful if you reach out during the writing process. I recommend
Ben is a very clear and good professor. He is passionate about what he teaches which makes the class interesting. I love this class and I love Ben.
He is pretty chill about absences, class is discussion based so just yap and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Lots of reading, but only three essays. Grades participation weekly. Four absences permitted. Generous grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: The class was really laid back. Ben is a chill guy.

Ben gives such good feedback on the papers he has you write. None of his classes are quite boring and are all pretty engaging. He gives a lot of extra credit towards the end of the semester for participation and would definitely recommend taking this class. You learn a lot and he keeps you engaged (especially with all of our tangents)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Overall I really enjoyed this class! Attendance is required, but you get 4 absences before it will hurt your grade. There were three essays in this course throughout the year and he gives good feedback so it's easy to improve. Ben is super fun and chill, I would definitely take this class again.
Great professor
This professor made us think deeply about various topics.
If you have questions that are even somewhat relevant, he has no problem answering them and the conversations are fun and engaging. Class is actually fun to go to.
Best professor would take again, 30 percent participation lots of extra credit

Professor. Quarles requires 3 papers and 1 video essay (final) for ENG101. The essays are pop-culture focused so can be tough at first, but her office hours are extremely helpful and she cares about her students a lot.
I am personally not a fan of writing, but Professor Quarles was able to make it interesting.  She was always willing to give feedback and meet in office hours.  Enjoyed her class for the most part.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: I LOVED her. Dr. Oni responds to emails within the hour and was such a great professor. She taught her class in relation to pop culture so it was really interesting and she let us write our essays about things that we care about.
Pro Oni is a great teacher and her was class great just a ton of work. Be ready to work
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: She is one of the best professors at Pepperdine. She makes an effort to make the class interesting and fun. She is very understanding. There are many papers but you have enough time to do them. She gives detailed outlines to show what she wants. I would definitely recommend taking her class for ENG 101.

85% of the grade was the 4 essays (last one was a speech) and Prof. Oni was always happy to provide comments on rough drafts so that we could fix any errors before submitting final drafts for a grade. Super caring, really wants everyone to succeed. Totally recommend her for English 101

She is also caring, gives good feedback, and very easygoing. I have never had a professor who cares so much for his or her students. Prof. Oni really wants to see you succeed, whether that be through extra credit competitions or an entire extra credit essay. Go to her office hours, and she will help you write your paper. Best English prof at Pepp!!

I really loved Professor Oni's class, she helps you alot with your work and wants you to do better. She is a little bit of a tough grader on papers, but she does it for the best! It's not a super demanding class, and Professor Oni makes it well worth it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: As long as you show up to class or give a valid reason why you can't be there and ASK FOR THE ASSIGNMENT TO BE EMAILED TO YOU, you will do well. JUst make sure you don't slack off, that you turn in everything relatively on time, and if you want to make sure you get that A, go to her office hours and have her review your paper before its due.

Very kind and nice teacher. She makes the boring English classes very interesting. Not a harsh grader but you need to pay effort to your essays. Go to her office hours. She really love to talk about essays with you.

Dr. Estes is caring and very passionate about what she teaches. I think she is a good person, but her class was very difficult for a GE. Participation is a huge part of your grade and answering once in class is not enough. Her tests aren't too hard but she grades the essay portions hard. Lots of reading, attendance, homework, and quizzes. Stressful

I had almost no prior knowledge of the bible and was still able to end the class with a 96%. There are weekly multiple choice quizzes and the same questions are on the exams. The one group project is worth very little. The Final is a paper and informal presentation. Highly recommend taking Dr. Estes for the REL 100 GE.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Had her for Religion 100 online, she isn't the most interesting professor she also expects a lot from her students and assigns various confusing homework assignments and expects a lot from you. I wouldn't take her if you have no prior knowledge to religion as she grades you from a very christian based point of view. Also not very empathetic.

I would recommend Prof Estes to anyone. I learned more in this class than in any other class at Pepp. Her lectures are clear and engaging. There are weekly quizzes that are easy because she provides guided reading questions. The two midterms are also fairly easy because she tells us what to study. Overall, great professor and person.

Dr. Estes was so sweet and always available outside of the classroom. lots of reading but its to prepare for quizzes we have once a week. her assignments and projects were straight forward and was always there for feedback. final project is a creative one so you can make a podcast/storybook/cooking video. exams multiple choice and essay questions
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: This is class is a lot of work and has weekly, in-class quizzes. However, if you actually do the work, it's an easy A. Assignments are not harshly graded and exam questions are directly from the weekly quizzes. Accessible outside of class and makes an effort to get to know you.

Estes is a wonderful religion professor! I learned so much about the historical context of the New Testament. She is a very easy grader, and her tests mirror her weekly quizzes, plus they are open bible. She has a few writing assignments, but they are all short and creative. Also, the final is a project, not a test. So sweet outside of class too!

The worst GE I've ever taken in my life. Thinks students don't have more important classes to study for and treats her GE like everyone is a religion major. Quizzes every week. 15 minute time limit on quizzes which is no where near enough time. Tests are completely unfair. Keeps the room at 95 degrees, no computer policy.

Not a fan of religion classes but she made religion easy to understand and easy to follow. There are quizzes each week on the readings but not terrible at all. Easy grader, young professor, and very engaging. Would definitely recommend taking her.

Prof Estes is literally so amazing. She is so understanding and really wants her students to learn. As long as you communicate and put effort into the class, you will do well. There are a good amount of assignments. Literally just put max effort into these assignments and you will do amazing. I didn't really read in detail and I did great.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: He is the smartest and toughest professor I've taken at Pepperdine, and he cares about building your abilities and making you smarter through legal reasoning. Despite being my lowest grade, this is the class I am most proud to have taken at Pepperdine and the only one I will remember in 10 years. Pepperdine is lucky to have this gem of a professor.

Professor Lee is a kind and caring individual who delivers engaging lectures. His course is challenging, with homework assignments and quizzes every class. It is quite interesting, but the lack of helpful feedback in a course that requires critical thinking is frustrating. It is not easy to grasp concepts when criteria is vague.
I strongly dislike his way of teaching. There is heavy reading and homework every single class period. He does not give enough time for his exams.

Professor Lee is one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. He's challenging, but he is really funny and engaging during the lectures. There's homework for every class, but it's not that difficult and only takes about an hour per class (2 hours of work per week is not bad). Professor Lee is not for the light-hearted, but his class is worth it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: A M A Z I N G Professor !!! Definitely one of my favorite at Pepperdine. Super smart, super funny, his lectures are so engaging and make the class go by fast. You'll learn so many valuable things and jooho makes the concepts so clear. Daily homework and quizzes on reading but they're easy. He starts classes 5-10 min after scheduled time for grace.

Professor Lee is a very caring guy and he is extremely knowledgeable in business law. However, he is not an easy professor by any means! His expectations are extremely high, and getting an A is not easy.
He expects us to turn in evaluations in every class. But he himself explains his guidelines very vaguely. He doesnt seem to appreciate students efforts. Not recommended at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Lee is one of the best I had at Pepperdine. You have to put SO MUCH work into his class (and make sure you do the readings!), but you learn SO much about the subject. No final - just a final paper which will take you HOURS upon HOURS, but really brings together all of the material so you really understand it. He is a super caring guy!

Dr. Lee is a tough, good professor. He cares about his students, but he makes you work in his class; not an easy A. There are 2 tests (45%), daily quizzes (20%), and a final written project (35%). This is not a class where you memorize law vocabulary, but one where you must think critically in a legal context. Make sure you read, and go to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Provvidente is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is exceptionally caring, and very explanatory throughout his lectures. He is very clear regarding what he expects you to know on his exams which helps when studying. I also had him for Hum 212 which I enjoyed!
Amazing professor. Had a great time in the class and truly learned a lot!

Very kind, and excited about what he teaches. Gives consistent homework, but gives time in class to work on. His lectures can be a bit confusing to follow if you aren't paying attention, but is a very generous grader, and gives clear instructions on all his tasks. Would take again, highly recommend for History and for Humanities also!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Provvidente does an excellent job of teaching history and he adapted super well to the online format. As a history major, he was very inspiring to my area of study and I would 100% take another class from him.

I took this class online during COVID in January. The professor was straightforward about his expectations and graded accordingly. His lectures were straight to the point and had a lot of content packed into them. The structure of his class was also easy to follow. Overall a great professor! 10/10 would recommend! I could tell he was very caring :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Don't take this prof if you don't want to write a six page paper in under 24 hours. Doesn't put in grades the entire semester. Doesn't try to accomodate students in times of high stress.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Provvidente is one of the best profs in the BA program. Very easy classes to follow, makes the course interesting, preps you for exams with exactly what he wants and is a generous grader. Definitely take HUM from Provvidente.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: If you can take a class of Sebastian's, do it. He is one of Pepperdine's best. He's so passionate about what he teaches, and is incredibly knowledgeable. He made HUM 212 & 313 feel like more than just G.E's, and I really enjoyed the classes. His lectures are clear, informative, and engaging. He's also always available if you need. Great prof/person

No teacher I've ever had has cared about his material more than Sebastian. Incredibly smart, his lectures (though complicated) are engaging and demonstrate a vast well of knowledge. He knows and cares about many things and is an incredible conversationalist-- just ask him about Argentine music in the 80s and 90s. Sebastian is a must-take professor.

Professor Truax was a good teacher. She cares about her students understanding of the material. She does need extra reminders to answer her emails. There was an odd number of students during my class so I ended up being paired with her for my final assignment. She was great at putting me at ease and making me feel comfortable.
Professor Truax is a fantastic professor! She is so helpful and she really wants you to pass!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: She made the course extremely interesting and was very concise and informative. The assignments and pre-recorded lectures helped with understanding the material in-depth and the live lectures really solidified the understanding of all the material. She is very understanding and lends her prior experiences with clients which enhances learning.

Professor Truax did an excellent job teaching diagnostics. She gave detailed feedback on assignments and always had relevant clinical anecdotes to share. She really wanted us to succeed and that came through in her teaching. If you do the reading and show up for class she'll have your back.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Truax is amazing! I was worried this course would be daunting with all of the material that's required to learn, but she made it engaging and easy to understand. Not only is she caring and empathetic, but the real life examples from her experiences were fun and inspiring! The course outline and grading is also very clear.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Truax is a great teacher! The is A LOT of material to learn so get ready to study! The amount of material that you have to learn is overwhelming but she is super helpful in teaching the material in ways that make it easy to understand.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Professor Truax is committed to student success, making herself available to me outside of the designated class period, and is very responsive to emails. She delivers material in a straightforward manner, expectations are clear, and rubrics for assignments clearly defined. The wealth of practical professional experience she shared is invaluable.

Does not provide a supportive and nurturing atmosphere during classes, each one feeling a very negative vibe. Does not answer emails and unless you interrupt during class, doesn't answer questions. Don't expect extra credit or help towards exams or papers. Wouldn't take this class again or any other classes from this professor. 0/10 experience.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Not a teacher I would recommend in the future. Every class has such a negative vibe, making an already intense course very unpleasant. Don't bother having an emergency and notifying her by email or in class, because you won't get a response. She doesn't have the positive teaching approach that students need to succeed. No extra credit at all.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This is for ENG 101. Prof Donnelly's class is well organized so we knew what to expect. Attendance is mandatory, but honestly you will not mind because she's interesting and funny. Her midterm feedback is detailed and actually helpful

This teacher was absolutely awesome. I would recommend anyone who had the chance to take her to take her. Her grading is super simple and it is very easy to get an A. If you do the work and show up to class which is mainly required you will have no problem. LOVE THIS TEACHER
Her reviews speak volumes! She's the best, by far my favorite professor i've had at Pepperdine. She truly cares about her students and their development as writers. Take her if you can!

Donnelly is a fantastic person and professor who gives work you will actually want to do! She looks for improvement over the semester and gives lots of feedback and help in class. Her essays are manageable, not a lot of reading. Very enthusiastic Prof. I looked forward to this ENG 101 every week.

Her assignments are all super clear, and our Eng 101 only had three essays and another assignment that you finished independently. My writing improved with her feedback. Love her and love this class!!

Professor Donnelly is fantastic, she is so caring and thoughtful and also incredibly knowledgable. All of the coursework for English 101 is completed entirely in class-- if you keep up with the classwork you will have no homework! The classwork itself is fun and interesting, and the prompts are things students are actually excited to write about.

Professor Donnelly is definitely my favorite professor. Most of the time we had zero homework. She lets you out early to contribute 20 minutes of the class towards office hours.  She gives a lot of nice feedback towards writing projects or class journals and really appreciates the work you did. She is so sweet, funny and very understanding.

Professor Donnelly really cares about her students and that is so clear. She is kind and supportive of her student's endeavors and does not belittle others for sharing, even when it might not always be the best answer or the answer she is looking for. I would 100% take this professor.

She also teaches English, but she honestly made me excited to go to my first-year seminar class, she's super kind, always in a good mood, makes the classes entertaining, and genuinely shows that she cares about us. I'd take this class again in a heartbeat and am envious of the people that managed to get into her classes next semester!

Mather is a great professor to take!.. if you want to be disrespected, poorly challenged, and treated like a 10year old in a university classroom. From the very first day, he told a student with a Disabilities Service Accommodation to drop the class even though she was given permission to use her laptop to take notes. Arrogant, crude, & so fragile.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: No clear grading criteria and it's very hard to get feedback on grades

Mather is a very harsh professor. He grades very few things and it is difficult to follow his lectures, you don't know what is his opinion and what is the material. Often it doesn't seem relative to the class and more his views.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I don't know why there are bad reviews... Prof. Mather is a smart and insightful teacher. His sarcasm should not be taken at offense, but rather challenging you. He does not baby you, he pushes you to think outside of the box! Great Professor in my opinion.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Horrible professor
Definitely the worst professor I have taken at Pepperdine! No clear grading criteria. Very disorganized and unprofessional. Often rude and narrow-minded. Avoid if possible
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Took this as a summer class to knock out a GE. We covered approx. 20% of the material that the syllabus stated we would cover. 80% of the material we actually covered in class had nothing to do with the course guidelines, but this never stopped him from from testing primarily on this material. If you prefer typing notes or using e-books, don't take
He's a great fun, and he really loves God.
Good professor, spends session before test covering the concepts on the test, wants you to get it.

She does not understand that some students have little Spanish knowledge or have never taken a Spanish class before. Nice lady, but oh so difficult! I worked my butt off, and yet got a B... I'm a Regents Scholar, so I am familiar with intensive classes and hard work, but this class got the better of me.

Prof. Cividanes' class was very enjoyable. She'd teach, choose students to answer, and have group activities. This was a great mixture of learning and being social. She's a very fair grader. I highly recommend going to her office hours because she's very concise and kind in explaining what you got wrong, and what she expects from you in the future.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: (For SPAN251) Prof. Cividanes is so caring and makes sure we are engaged in class. She is such an equal professor in the way that she does not only give one person corrections or call on one person, she makes everyone participate and grow in the language. Grading wise, if you put effort in and show growth during the year she grades pretty easily.

Might be the best professor that I've had at Pepperdine so far. Super caring about her students and really likes to see everyone improve. Her class is a must-take if you really want to learn Spanish with a nice prof, but it is definitely not easy-- participation is heavily graded and emphasized. +tests can be somewhat difficult.

I heavily enjoyed this class, it would not let me select, I took 151. She is amazing, very considerate of the class, the class is small so participation is 100% necessary. She will call on each and everyone of the students, but is very kind to any kind of mistakes. It is a very "group" set type of class, always practicing. Would take again!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I love this woman! Take her if you get the chance. She is very caring and understanding towards her students. She really wants her students to learn what's important in Spanish. She is really good at breaking down concepts and providing lots of practice and office hours

Very kind woman, and yet does not understand that some people have little to no knowledge or understanding of the Spanish language. Twenty out of the twenty-five students in my class got a C or below on the midterm.... Sweet lady, and a good teacher for someone who has taken Spanish before, but not if you're entirely new

I really enjoy the company of this professor. She is great to work with, homework isn't crazy, the tests aren't hard at all, and she really seems to care for her students. I had a great time coming into class and I highly recommend taking her for Spanish.

I cannot say enough good things about Prof Cividanes. She is the most caring prof I have had at Pepperdine and she really makes sure you are prepared. She is very lenient on her grading and she makes the class very easy with little effort outside of class. The class is very engaging, but the class flies by every day. TAKE HER!!!!!!

Dr. Betre is not only the best college professor I have ever had the privilege to learn under, but also a genuinely empathetic and kind human being. I faced difficult health challenges my first semester and was in awe with the compassion and drive he had to help me through it all. He makes a hard topic worthwhile with his guidance and mentorship.

Professor Betre is an amazing prof. You can tell how hard he tries to teach the material, and he knows physics is tough. His test corrections saved my grade. Lectures are fun and interesting. Highly reccomend
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I really like Dr. Betre because he really cares about his students and goes out of his way to help students understand. The homework is basically a more difficult version of the exam, and will help you understand the material better. Class seems very intimidating but if you put in the work you'll be ok :D

Ive had Betre as my professor for 3 semesters now and I can say hes probably one of the smartest people ever. Hes hard but you learn SO much. Go to class and TAKE ADVANTAGE OF OFFICE HOURS !!! Gives a lot of hard hw that is graded harshly but OH help SO much. Exams are basically easier versions of the hw so make sure u actually do the hw to study
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is genuinely a good human being and clearly loves physics and knows what he is talking about. As mentioned in other reviews he doesn't have tons of teaching experience but he goes out of his way to make himself available and to get his students to understand what they are learning. He will only continue to become a better professor from here.

During his time as a Stanford lecturer and professor, Dr. Kassahun Betre beautifully explained the mysteries of physics in a way that made them relevant to your every day lives. His carefully planned lectures implemented student participation through multiple question opportunities as well as fun quiz-like 'clicker' questions. Highly recommended!

Dr. Betre is very hard to follow. He covers too much material in very little time. He is very nice but intimidating when you ask him a question. This year was his first year teaching and for a class that is as hard as physics already is it makes it harder for you to succeed. Very disappointed be everything that revolves around this class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Likely the hardest class I have ever taken, but that is somewhat to be expected for a modern physics class. He is clearly very knowledgeable about the subject, but perhaps not as knowledgeable on how to teach it.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Betre loves physics and he will work harder than any professor to help his students, but he has like zero experience teaching before this year. As someone who has never taken any physics class before, I need someone more experienced with time management in class. Then again, I don't read the book and I'm almost passing this class.. Stay tuned
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: i'm doing surprisingly well in this class but ballard is awful. thank god he didnt get tenure. this is unnecessarily hard and he is not teaching material that is applicable to my major. thanks for trying to brainwash me but it didnt work.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Ballard is one of my least favorite professors I've had the misfortune of having at Pepperdine. He has no sympathy for his students in any circumstance and he's extremely unapproachable. Nobody can read his handwriting and his grading is very harsh. For anyone who takes this professor, good luck.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Prof. Ballard is without question the worst professor I have ever had at Pepperdine. He is incredibly disrespectful to students, insensitive, unapproachable and arrogant. He is the kind of professor who grades on subjective grounds and will give people a "C" for their own opinion when it is articulated beautifully. He does not give anyone above a B
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor thinks he's teaching us about diversity and issues like sexuality, disability, class, race, etc. He is actually incredibly ignorant, insensitive, and one of the most unprofessional professors I have had at Pepperdine. His in-class activities are very insensitive and juvenile. I thought I came to college not Pre-K.

I've taken Dr. Ballard for 3 classes and he is one of the best professors at Pepperdine. He's a tough one, but extremely clear, open, and honest about expectations. I always learn a lot and have great experiences in his classes. I would definitely recommend him any time!!

He really knows Com Ethics, but he's a tough grader, his handwriting is bad, & I don't get the way he writes his notes on the board. He's not a nice person & is a real control freak. For example, we're all in our 20's, adults paying for the class, & he won't let us go use the bathroom when needed. This isn't kindergarten! #NOTHANKS

Professor Ballard is one of the most caring, intuitive, and inspirational professors I've ever had. He took subjects that could get really dry and turned it into into the most engaging classes. He is absolutely a fair grader and takes everything into careful consideration. If I had the money and time I would repeat the classes I had with him.

Professor Ballard is one of the best professors I think I'll ever have. He is passionate and well-rounded. Loves his students and will make sure to help you if you ask. He's not exactly easy, but if you work hard he continues to give you better grades throughout the semester. You honestly LEARN and GROW in his class, take whatever he teaches!!!!
