An amazing teacher who makes you think long and hard about the learning as it is applied to life outside the classroom. Demands a lot from students but that's what you should expect in a capstone class. 10/10 would take his class again.
Short summer semester, and we still got it done. I am happy. No surprises! :)
I am happy with the class. Good job!

Professor Gershfeld is a great prof! He is caring, funny, and wants you to learn. But lectures are heavy and participation is very important. Quiz every class but it's straight forward and only 10 questions open book.

I am finishing class in 2 weeks. Prof. Gershfeld assigned all of the homework from the beginning of the semester. Many things are online, and he is flexible in changing the due date if you miss the deadline. Extra credits are available. Quiz every week, but it is an open book and notes. I am taking his Couples and Family class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: If you do your reading, attend class and do homework, you will get a good grade. Prof. Gershfeld is caring and allows you to take quizzes late without penalty.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I would not recommend this professor for this course. He does not educate clearly and can be demeaning. He also requires class participation but does not even give the class enough opportunity, especially when there are peers who speak the most and quickly beat you to the punch. He also gives A LOT of outside work from the textbook. 2/10

I would not recommend taking his classes. He appears to be understanding, but when you truly have a question to ask or want clarification, he gets annoyed. Also, he is somewhat disorganized. He is rigid in terms of grading and expectations

He is clear with his grading policy and you'll be fine as long as you read some chapters, attend lectures, and participate in class. He gives quizzes in every lecture but he goes over everything before taking the quiz. There is also a group project but he also gives extra credit. It sounds like a lot but you'll be fine :)

1) he expects you to read the chapter before class 2) participate and be on time 3) exams are difficult 4) weekly pop quizzes  5) he does not really take the time to make sure you understood the lesson
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I love Dr. Kim she makes everything engaging. Ive had her for several of my classes. Although she will tell you directly "you need to know this for the test" and it wont appear, but the thing she said "won't be on the test" is in fact 30% of your test. She is super kind though, just kind of annoying with the incorrect test/study information

Dr. Kim is an amazing professor & person. Her lectures are not only organized, but shes an engaging speaker. She truly has a passion to guide her students to use their knowledge to serve others. Professors like Dr. Kim are what make the Pepperdine experience possible. Its easy to built trust w her & eventually go to her for advice beyond science!

Dr. Kim is one of Pepperdine's best professors, hands down. She cares about her students, is very accessible and helpful outside of class, and works a lot with students to help make sure they're successful after they leave Pepperdine. She is super knowledgeable about her subject and breaks down complicated concepts really well. 110% recommend.

Professor Kim has a heart of gold and is one of the kindest professors I have ever had. You can tell she has a genuine passion/love for nutrition and teaches information that I use in my day-to-day life. However this class was some what frustrating because I busted my butt for all of the tests and averaged a C on all of them. (study in groups)

She is a kind professor and seems to be passionate about her area of expertise. She is pretty easy-going and teaches well. The class I took was mostly interesting, and her notes and lectures prepare you well for the quizzes. It isn't an "easy A" class, but if you put in the time and effort, you should do well.

Dr. Kim is very passionate about nutrition and it shows in her class. You do need to be some what interested in nutrition to enjoy this class because there is a lot of science and information to take in but it is totally worth it. I learned so much from this class that I know I will apply throughout the rest of my life, not just the semester.
Before taking the class, I had no interest in the subject, but this professor completely changed my perspective. If the class is available on the morning, take it! Trust me, it's worth waking up for.

I completely agree with Gary.  Dr. Kim is one of my favorite professors here so far.  She is extremely passionate and knowledgable, and I never felt intimidated by her or her class.  It is challenging, but if you put in the effort the subject is extremely fascinating!

Professor Kim is probably the best and most caring professor out there. She will help you with such a kind heart and she really is passionate about nutrition. Professor Kim is very bright and her excitement has rubbed onto me! I am so glad I am able to add her on this site because she definitely deserves the best ratings. -Student Gary Park

AVOID!!!! He is in love with himself and only talks about Porsche. You're better off saving time and stress by taking a professor who does not overcomplicate such a simple course. Class is a whole 3 hours of him rambling about nothing. Choose your project group wisely or be even wiser by not taking his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Literally very very awful professor. I have never thought a professor could be that awful. Don't ever take him. The only chance if he actually realises what kind of professor he is and starts to change but that would take several students to struggle through him until he changes if he ever will
Bad grader. Overcomplicate a simple class. Even if to attend every class you could loose participation points, which is 15%

Had this class as a 3-hour night class and was very boring. Super hard to stay engaged as the lecture lasts the full 3 hours. The lectures were not super engaging so be prepared to sit for 3 hours and look at slides. Choose your group wisely as that will make or break the class. DONT use notes while presenting and practice good presentation skills.

Professor Barkis is so sweet, he is always accessible outside of class and now, as a past student, he makes an effort to stay connected. His lectures are a bit confusing a times, but skim the textbook on your own before class and that helps for the tests. Choose your group project partners wisely and you will do well.
Just take with another professor. I hated this class and the material wasn't even difficult...
It is a really hard class, you could get the same class but a different professor, and you would actually enjoy the class, whereas in this class you would struggle a lot for no reason.

Avoid. Pop quizzes, ALWAYS lasts the full 3 hours, and he never fails to mention that he worked at Porsche. SO MANY GROUP PROJECTS. There's a big group project lasting the entire semester & a smaller project in the middle of the semester. If you get horrible teammates, good luck b/c you all get the same grade. Tests are vague w/no cheat sheet.

One of the sweetest profs at Pepp. you can tell he has a lot of experience and knows the content well. that being said I HATED THIS CLASS there are much easier options. AVOID AVOID AVOID. if you like cars, congrats -thats all he talks about. the concepts are hard for an into level class and he doesn't explain it well. he is also not an easy grader.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Leo seems to know everything about what he is teaching, there is no question that you can ask that he cannot answer. The class is difficult, but it is totally worth it simply because of how much you learn and the relevance of the class to the culture and history of Italy. Don't be fooled, he seems intimidating but really he is a sweet heart.

It's a lot of reading and it is difficult, but it was literally a life changing class.  Leo is so  intelligent and wants all of his students to succeed.  He is very helpful inside the classroom and out, and this class made me a better student.

Leo is one of the smartest men I have ever met. He takes a lot of pride (sometimes too much) and has a lot of passion for what he teaches. Yes - his classes are hard, you have to work harder than youd think for a GE but what youll also learn more than you'd ever expect. Hes always available when you have questions about anything. Going to miss him!

Leonardo requires a lot, but it's absolutely worth it.  I remember so much of what I learned, and found it fulfilling and inspiring.  Don't miss class, do all the reading carefully, and don't lose your sense of humor - you actually stand to learn something from Leonardo.

Leonardo is a nice man; however, the ratings from 2009 and before do not justly represent the views of past students who have taken his classes.  If you take a class from him, be ready to work harder and be more stressed than ever before.

Leonardo is a great teacher. I had him for HUM 212 and ITAL 251.  People think he's difficult just because they are used to teachers who don't require you to read the textbook or actually study for an exam.  One year after taking his classes, I still remember everything he taught. He's funny too. TAKE HIS CLASSES!
Leonardo is a good professor.  Pay special attention in his class.  Do all your readings.  Then the class will be an A or a B.
He's the man, but don't miss class

leo rocks. at first he seems unclear, but its just the italian style not to have things super organized. he really cares about students, and is really really brilliant underneath. in the end, i learned tons.

His knowledge of Central Asia is excellent and he is hilarious He is not in the least bit boring The first class of the week he lectures or shows a movie and the second class of the week students present and discuss He is very flexible on letting you write and get graded on what interests you which is awesome!

Diener's class was interesting. A few papers plus the midterm/final. He went into detail about each diff region for each class, which I absolutely loved.  study hard for the tests though. He is very smart, and doesn't let us forget the scholar he is.  Jokes around a lot and can be self-absorbed, but its really funny.  Take this class I recommend it

Overall he is the best professor that I have had at Pepperdine. He challenges his students to think critically and he always makes class very interesting. He is hillarious, brilliant and an all around great guy. You will learn a ton in this class, and you will never dread going. Take it.
Life of the mind!
Intelligent, outgoing, fun, and hot.  I had no idea what I was getting into with this class, and it was my favorite class at Pepperdine...you really learn so much.  Highly reccommended!
Passionate, quirky, extremely helpful, challenging - all the makings of a brilliant professor!

I had him for Politics of Identity and I loved him.  He is intelligent, challenging, helpful and willing to listen to what you think.  He's brought a new perspective on the world and I have learned so much from him.  Listen up Pepperdine, we need more professors like him!!!

He is the best professor in all of Pepperdine. He is interesting, fun, smart, captivating. His class is very organized and all the material you cover is interesting.  He is extremely helpful.  Just the best class I have ever taken!!!!

Really nice professor, really into his teaching and his energy shows. His tests are tough, but very FAIR. if you go to class and /skim/read the chapter you'll do well on tests. you'll really learn even if you try not to. He brings in alot of outside resourses (movies, news, web articles, programs)
Professoressa Culp really cares about her students and makes sure you understand the material. Definitely recommend taking her class! :)

I had Culp for both ITAL 151 and ITAL 152. She's such a great teacher; I based my entire schedule around having her again for 152. She teaches in a way that helps you understand and learn the language with ease. I highly recommend taking her class. She's fun, interesting, and even brings her adorable italian greyhound puppy in to visit :).

Well, she speaks Italian the whole time, and expects you to talk in Italian, as my first foreign language I had a very difficult time and she was never in her office and then when we set up a time to meet, she did not show. She will offer assistance during test, however that's usually too late.
Professor Culp is brilliant! I learned so much in her class. She makes Italian language interesting and fun. She is the reason I appreciate Italian language and culture. Two thumbs up!
Ms. Culp is the teacher I've had most fun learning from at Pepperdine so far. I've taken two classes with her and everyone loved her in both of those classes. She makes sure EVERYONE tracks with her.

Prof Culp has been one of my best prof at Pepperdine. She makes learning a language so easy! She gives us extensive reviews before the tests with exactly what's going to be on it. She is super helpful if you have questions. Make sure you do the homework she checks at the end.

Was great at the beginning of the semester then became the worst teacher ever. She is completely unorganized. Doesn't give tests back. She is never in her office. She doesn't respond to emails. There is no syllabus. She tells you when a test will be 1 or 2 days before. This woman has no idea what she is doing.
LOVE HER! As long as you go to class and pay attention you are fine. She always keeps the class super interesting, and is there to help if you need it. She tells you exactly what is on the test!

Fairly easy class. Go to class everyday because she notices if you don't and takes points off your grade. That killed me. Do really well on tests and keep up with homework although it is checked at end of course. Good class. Not bad at all.

Her class was definitely not easy, but all the homework and in class activities are necessary. She used our class time (on zoom) very efficiently although we got tired of being there, everything we did helped. I feel like I learned a lot more than I thought I would.

She's a good professor. A lot of homework from cengage but very easy. This class is obviously harder than 151 and to succeed you need to pay attention to the structure and form of your Italian paragraphs. Make sure to get on her good side or else it will be a tougher class to take.

152 gets a bit hard, and while shes not always the most understanding if you dont get a concept, for the most part shes a good professor and you learn a lot from her. She has high standards, but shes a good person and a great resource on all things Italian. A solid choice.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Lissoni's class is difficult, but mostly because there is a lot of material to cover in a semester. There will be lots of online homework, but it is pretty easy and good prep for the tests which come in three forms: compositions, conversations, and exams. Lissoni will make sure you learn a ton, but be prepared to work for it.

Strict but caring, I learned a lot and succeeded in the class, but she has a weakness in not giving clear instructions. I highly recommend learning the basics on Duolingo before starting with her. Her oral tests sound super sketchy but are pretty chill. Requires watching an Italian film, making a portfolio, and an oral presentation. Work for an A.

She is a very kind teacher and is more than willing to meet with you outside of class. That being said, she is not very good at giving individual guidance and she gets frustrated when you do not understand the material. Her tests are very hard, and she moves through the book too quickly. The class is very test heavy.
She is really good as a professor, and as long as you go to class and pay attention she will help you as much as she can, but her tests are very hard, and her class in general is difficult.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Patrizia cannot teach ITAL151 well. She can teach ITAL251 well as she is more of a secondary teacher than a primary learning teacher. Tests were difficult, very difficult. I don't often go on these to write unless a professor was really good or really bad. Beware! You have been warned about this professor. I recommend for 251, not 151 nor 152

Patrizia is one of the most genuinely kind people I know. If you're struggling at all, she is always willing to meet with you or assign you a good student tutor. Her exams are straightforward and fair. She even gives you the headings of each section so you know exactly what to study. Italian is a lot of work, but she makes it so much better.

Took him for Rel 100 and was probably one of my hardest GEs. Be ready to read like 100 pages every week and be expected to memorize every little detail. He does weekly quizzes and they are NOT easy. However, the midterms and finals are very reasonable, and he gives a lot of extra credit. Participation is important grade booster. He is very nice tho
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment: Super nice man but you have a quiz every class and the quiz is based upon the previous reading but the quizzes have nothing to do with the readings. The class consist of super long boring lectures and then will ask you to turn to a classmate and discuss what nonsense he was talking about. Do not recommend at all.

Assigned hours of reading for quiz that has nothing to do with it. He grades ridiculously, he lowered my grade 10% because I didn't add a period after my headings. You get one allotted absence or else your grade drops. He has no knowledge of the bible and can never answer questions. lots of homework, zero-knowledge gained.

He is a very good teacher and very passionate about what he teaches. I would highly recommend his class for your GE credit. He is very accessible outside of class. He does make you talk in groups and participation does matter.

He is the worst professor I have ever encountered in my college career. He gives you weekly quizzes on irrelevant topics from the readings, and he makes you write a page on the top 5 things you learned and he grades it ridiculously. Boring lectures and pointless group participation. Please save yourself and don't waste your time with him.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Short quizzes every week on the reading for class with one midterm. He drops the lowest two and lecture is super straight forward if you do the reading intentionally. Dr. Manassee is really sweet but he tries to have interactive lectures and they arent super well thought out so its hard to take it seriously.

I have never experienced more rudeness & disrespect from a professor when trying to have a discussion. He is completely unreasonable even when there are facts proving him wrong. Although his quizzes were easy, he pulls random questions for tests. His lectures sometimes contradict the textbook. Poor professor and person, definitely don't take him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I took the once a week class and it was totally worth it. 3 hours is a lot of time to spend listening to one person talk about one topic, but Manassee made it easy to follow along! The criteria for quizzes and tests were very straight forward. I'm not the best tester, but I still did well on his tests! 10/10 would recommend for a great Rel prof!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He is honestly the worst professor I've ever had. He basically just read off his PowerPoints, and lectured for what seemed like forever. I feel bad because he always tried to make his lectures interactive, but like no one raised their hand. He made us do pointless group discussions all the time. And his exam questions are confusing.

Prof. Gilhuis is one of the best profs I've ever had! I took her FOR class (not HIST204). You are graded on participation & 4 papers throughout the semester. There are readings due before every class but they're not difficult. You have lots of time to write the papers, including in-class sessions where she encourages everyone to get feedback!

She is an amazing person and has a passion for history which actually engages students. She does holistic grading which was okay. Just sucks not knowing ur grade consistently. Only a midterm and final grade. Participation is a huge part of ur grade. (React to the past games, 3 papers, & Final Debate)

Dr. G is one of the most kind and knowledgable professors I have had at Pepperdine. She is beyond sweet and her class isn't too demanding, especially considering it is a GE. I learned so much in her class and even had fun while learning about a topic I initially considered boring. Highly recommend Dr. G because she truly is a gem!

I recommend Professor Gilhuis to all of my friends at Pepperdine. She is so caring, and super passionate about what she teaches. She is super caring and sweet. I love the hollistic grading she uses. History was never my thing but I really started to appreciate History through her classes and enjoyed every class, and got an A!

I love Dr. Gilhuis!!! She's such a sweet woman who is passionate about what she teaches. She chooses really interesting topics for lectures. She does holistic grading which is different from my other classes but I dont hate it. I really enjoyed going to her class.

I could not recommend this incredible woman enough. She is caring, intelligent, kind, and so passionate. If you have the opportunity to be in one of her classes, DO IT! She is hands down one of the best people, let alone, professors, you will ever have.

Really sweet professor and great human being. She really cares about her students. There's SO much work in her class though. You have to make African meals, manage "personal goals", do a TON of reading, and participate in class. There's also a role-playing game, which was actually super fun. I'd definitely recommend her but be ready to work
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Prof. Gilhuis is the sweetest human on Earth!!! Very fair grader, no busy work, fair tests, very accessible outside of class. She truly cares about her students and is so passionate about the history she teaches! Def take her!!!

She is such an amazing professor! I've learned so much in this class, there are two papers, which she gives so much help on if you need it. She does a lot of group discussions which have honestly been so helpful and gives one midterm and final! ONE OF MY FAV PROFESSORS!!!

Each class had group discussion, then each group would return to present what we had discussed. The slides were available after class to use for notes. The two papers can be kind of difficult, but you learn a lot while writing them. Very fair grading on papers and essay exams. The class focused on topics that are often ignored  very informative.

For the love of all things holy, do not take this professor. She is the definition of a DEI hire—grossly underprepared and disorganized for the role. At first, I thought it was a language barrier, but after spending time in class with her, I realized how clueless she was. Pepperdine should be ashamed for lowering its standards this far.

The worst professor and worst class I've ever taken at Pepperdine. I have thoroughly enjoyed every single science course previous to this one; however, her inability to teach concepts clearly or answer questions, disorganization and unpreparedness, and general unkindness has made this a terrible experience.

She is disorganized, unclear, unkind, and confused. Seemingly unqualified and incapable of answering questions about any material. The only comprehensible course content is stolen from other professors. This is by far the worst course I have ever taken at Pepperdine.
She has no idea what she's teaching
ES HORRIBLEEEEE! SHE DOESNT EVEN KNOW WHATS GOING ON
Don't take her. She is definitely not qualified for this class. The syllabus is not clear and she may change it throughout the semester

I really do not know, how she got hired, I feel like it speaks of Pepperdine's standards dropping overall. I have never experienced a professor being so rude and dismissive. For a GE class this was the worst class I could have taken.
I lost braincells from taking this class plz don't take

Dr. Qurat has been the worst professor I have had in my history at Pepperdine. At first, I believed it was a language barrier, but soon I realized it was that she didn't have any understanding of what she was even teaching. She would often Wikipedia definitions for her lectures. She is EXTREMELY DISMISSIVE toward student concerns. Overall horrible.

He is the worst physics teacher in the entire school.  You have quizzes every class period on the reading.  He does not really seem to understand what he is teaching, and gets lost when people as him questions in class.  NO partial credit on tests.  Wrong unites/sign is wrong answer on test.  I wouldn't depend on a curve. DO NOT TAKE HIM!

Although the no partial credit on tests can be frustrating, the curve often makes up for it.  Make sure to read all textbook examples and conceptual checkpoints.  Reading and understanding the textbook and textbook examples is important.
WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD! no partial credit. contradicts himself.  unless you are perfect, you will fail each exam.

Worst teacher I have ever had.  Goes back on his word and is very unclear.  Often would make mistakes big enough to confuse the entire class and then get frustrated with us.  No teacher has made me feel this low.  People take physics at other schools just to get away from him, wish I had.

Our "Cosmic Questions" seminar was a combo of Astronomy, Science Fiction, and Religion.  It sounds like a strange combo, but this guy lives and dies for all things space.  It's a very interesting class for the space/Astro nut.  Sure, the work is tough and there's lots of reading, but you're in college now - get over it.
Very Mean and not understanding. Do not take his seminar
he sweats profusly and is not fun at all!
He is ok, not very hard, just boring.Make sure that you keep up with the reading
DR. MacRae is an amazing professor and companion! She wants her students to succeed and will help you anyway possible. She expects alot but is AWESOME.

Loved Prof. MacRae!! She's passionate about teaching and her students. The class was hard. I had to study a lot but I've also never felt so prepared. You learn A TON about the human body. She made me wanna study medicine.

Prof MacRae is extremely sweet and so helpful. The class is difficult, but totally doable. Use the online resources and the questions at the back of the book to help. FOCUS ON DIAGRAMS FOR TESTS. She is always willing to help you and wants you to succeed. Study groups are also useful for tackling the comprehensive final.

Anatomy is a hard course no matter what. Alot of memorization. MacRae is an INCREDIBLE teacher who makes it so much fun and really gets you interested in the material. MAKE SURE YOU STAY ONTOP OF THE READINGS! and you will need to study alot. However, as a teacher, MacRae is my favourite at pepperdine!

She's been teaching for 25 years and wants to keep it that way. Expects all the reading done before class and doesn't stop to explain anything. Boring lectures and hard to pay attention to. Tests are almost unfairly hard. I decided to follow a completely different career path once I took her classes.

She is fabulous!! Such an amazing and intelligent woman.  I had her for anatomy and learned so much from here, she really cares about her students and will talk for hours with you if you would let her.  Take her!!

Amazing teacher. teaches out of the book then elaborates. Topics are so clear and interesting. One of my favorites. Very helpful and nice but moves quickly like the class dictates. Hard class but great teacher.

WOnderful woman. Wants you to succeed and is just as interested in you as she is in how you are doing with the class.  Difficult material but well worth it to have such an intelligent clear prof.  Definately my fav prof at Pep!!

Save yourself, time, energy, and mental capacity. DONT TAKE HER. Shes smart but seriously lacks empathy, social skills, and is a HORRIBLE teacher. demeaning is an understatement. I've never had a positive experience getting help from her, nor have i heard of one from my peers. she has NO IDEA how to help her students. DO NOT TAKE HER AT ANY COST!!!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I had her for algebra and business calc. I can appreciate her grading setup because she drops your lowest quiz and homework grade. However, quizzes can be quite difficult, and the class isn't very engaging. I found it difficult to follow along with her teaching and often referred to online videos for help. I wouldn't want to take her class again.

This class was literally what I learned in 7th grade. Didn't buy textbook or go to class, only went on quiz days and ended with a 99%. If you consider yourself good at math, first of all, test out of this class, but if its too late, take Feller for an easy A. If you struggle with math, Feller is not for you. She tends to overcomplicate basics.

I have had Professor Feller for Algebra and Business Calc and she is a great teacher. She is very knowledgable and she is very helpful when you have questions! The tests and quizzes are very straight forward and if you understand the lecture and homework you will be good. Also, her classes have just enough work: homework or a quiz every other week.

By far the worst professor I have ever had. She does not care about her students and I praise you she does not care whether you pass or fail her class. She was not engaging at all and after each lecture I would leave more confused. She should consider a different profession, since she loved to brag about all the degrees she has. AVOID.

Prof. Feller is an amazing person, however, I felt like not the best professor. Her class wasn't engaging at all and was very lecture-heavy on the content. Going to office hours was not the best because so many other students would also be there, so she wouldn't really focus on you as an individual. Save time and take a different course.

Feller is knowledgeable about what she teaches. However, she lacks efficient ways to sometimes communicate this and can come off as somewhat arrogant when she doesn't mean to. She cares about her students, and gives lots of drops/ extra credit (2 quizzes dropped/ 1 HW dropped/ and Extra credit. Final and Midterms are pretty easy, take them serious.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Feller opened class on the first day "I could ask you to introduce yourselves, but we aren't here for that" then proceeded to brag about being considered for a PHD. She is incredibly smart in her area, but lacks any personal skills. I did not go to her office because others came out crying and being quizzed when they went asking for help.
The best leadership teacher you can ever dream of!!!

I was a nervous student who was unsure whether teaching was the correct path for me and it was through Dr. Stevens mentoring and encouragement that I completed the program and am now in a profession that I absolutely love! Dr. Stevens took the time to get to know me, saw my potential & I can't express how much I've taken away from his instruction!

He is by far one of my favorite professors in the education dept at PLNU! So sad that he is gone. He truly cares about his students and teaches you things that you will actually use in your classroom. Pepperdine is lucky to have him!

Stevens is pretty cool, sad to of heard he will be leaving PLNU. He teaches you more thinking skills and how to pass them to your students. He loves to play thinking games, the winners usually don't have to do the homework. Will answer any questions you have about anything! He cares about his students as people who have lives outside of class.

He is awesome.  He actually teaches you stuff you will actually use in the classroom.  He cares about his students and it shows.  Highly recommend for anyone in the education to take his class.  He gives you a whole new perspective.
great, awesome!!

Stevens is the best! He runs his class based on what is really important in education not on jumping through hoops. He is honest about what is going on and best of all he loves his students and wants to make sure everything works out for them!
Challenged me to think differently about current practices in education.
The most awesome person i've ever met

Lectures were more fun than the films we watched.  Great professor, especially if you get to know him personally. Short weekly reading assignments (write a 50-100 word response - how you felt about the reading).  Overall a great experience.  Would recommend to anyone who wants a fun, easy class to fulfill GE fine arts credit.

If you have the opportunity to take this class, do it. Though it may seem unnecessary and pointless in the beginning, it was probably the best class I've ever taken. He's dorky at times, but it's such an insightful and impacting class.
hes awesome.

A horrible film teacher.... So full of himself and his lost dreams of becoming a big time movie producer that is class is horribly unenjoyable. If you wany to hear a man brag about his sad career and receive bad grades take this class
He is the most entertaining and well-knowledge professor in this campus. His insights are great, he knows the material and understands the industry.
BEST CLASS EVER! BEST PROFESSOR EVER! definitely sparked my interest in film and was a fun, easy class!

Film 111 with Dr. Detweiler is the best class I took at Pepperdine. Even if you're not a film studies student, I highly recommend this course. He's such a great communicator who knows how to infuse entertainment with learning. He's also well-connected, and he brings prominent guests to almost every class. Dr. D is the man!

Dr. Ned is a wonderful professor, who genuinely cares for his students and strives to make accounting and finance entertaining. The class is not difficult, three exams which you can bring in a notecard of formulas, completion-based homework, and one simple group project.

Ned IS really nice and cares about his students! But I did not enjoy his teaching style at all. He teaches exclusively through PowerPoint, goes through material so fast, and mentions things offhandedly that show up on the test. He is vague and sometimes doesn't clearly answer direct questions in class. You can get an A, but it was aggravating.
Super caring professor, class is easy

Professor Ned is one of my favorite professors. I had him at 8am but still every morning he was enthusiastic. You can tell he cares about his students and wants you to succeed. Your grade is mainly dependent on tests with only a couple homework assignments. But if you show up to class and try to understand the problems, you should be fine.

Sweetest man alive and wants everyone to succeed. The class is very boring but very easy to pass. There is one homework assignment, and the midterm is a take-home assignment. There's a total of like 6 things in the gradebook, very low maintenance, and you can use an entire cheat sheet for all tests. Highly recommend if you're bad at accounting.
Great man. Would suggest enrolling in any class he teaches.
Great professor. Enjoyable most of the time. Take this guy, you'll probably get an A

Dr. Ned is an amazing professor! He cares about his students, he's very energetic, and he wants you to learn. There are two exams (50%), a final exam (35%), and some homework (15%). He gives great PowerPoint presentations, and establishes a great rapport with the students. He's very helpful during office hours and open to questions during class.

Professor Soroosh is the best professor I have had at Pepperdine. She is incredibly kind and makes time to meet with students outside of class time. She wants you to succeed in her class and she will help you to do so. She has a very engaging style of teaching and is very inspirational.

She is such a great professor in my opinion. I mean, I went out of my way to write a good review. She is hilarious and easy to find outside of class. When we discussed cheese, she brought cheese for the class, when it was bread she also brought bread! The class itself is participation heavy, like most language classes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: By far the best professor I had at Pepperdine. Mina is so caring and thorough! She challenges you because she knows that you can do better and learn more. I learned a lot of French throughout her courses and I'm so grateful to have applied what I learned outside of the classroom. I also think she is hilarious without even realizing it!

Dr. Soroosh is a very kind and caring professor. She really cares about her students and want her students to succeed. She presents the material very clearly, but studying is required. There is a lot of homework, but it is manageable.

I personally think she is not a great teacher. She was extremely entertaining and engaging for the time being; however, I felt like I hardly ever learned in her class. She was extremely inconsistent with her policies and grading, which made it tough to know what to expect on exams. She's a fun, sweet lady, but overall, I do not recommend.

When I took my first French class I was so nervous because Languages really aren't my thing, but Mina Soroosh is a blessing to this earth and made the class SO FUN and she gives everyone confidence in their abilities. She is so caring and loves to make her students laugh, which she was good at. TAKE HER ALWAYS!!! Love u Mina
Dr. Soroosh is the best! She makes learning so fun and easy and she wants you to do well. Definitely take her class, you won't regret it.

Mina Soroosh is one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine. She is a great teacher and very entertaining. I have taken many French classes in my life but I learned more from here in one semester than all my other French classes combined. She really wants you to learn and do well and gives you the tools to succeed.
I think the class could have been more fun and a good learning experience if she wasn't so harsh at grading. There is also papers weekly. She is a nice person but was a tough professor wasnt fun.
Attendance is really strict. Class is way too heavy. Papers almost every week. Tough grader. Dont take.
She deletes her Rate my Professor comments. Extremely tough grader and class was too demanding. Avoid.

I have taken Professor Stone-Watt's class twice, once for SAAJ and once for Rhetorical Criticism. I was forced to take everything I knew in writing and analysis one step further and was never comfortable in what my end result grade was going to be. However I was grateful for this difficult process! She was extremely helpful and wanted me to learn.

Dr. Stone Watt is an exceptional professor. She is very informative and the class is enjoyable. I'm not sure why people find her intimidating. Yes, she has high expectations, but if you do the work your grade should reflect that.
Stone-Watt's class definitely is intimidating, but it's actually really interesting if you make an effort to participate and get involved. Your grade will reflect your effort.

teacher gives grades after evaluations so you have no idea how she grades. she isn't even published yet thinks she knows everything. terrible scheduling for the class. terrible assignments. terrible class discussions. overall horrible class experience. picks favorites and has clear political agendas she pushes on students.
No Comments
Terrible teacher. If you can don't take her, there is a reason she has 2 rate my professors.
Whatever you do don't take this professor, I don't know how she is a teacher at this university.

Do NOT take HUM 313 with Corrado. She gives two exams yearly and then assigns highly tedious and time-consuming homework. The class focuses on broad topics within Modern Western Culture, and the grade is based heavily on the in-class polls that you must get 60% to receive any credit. The fact she has two rate my professor accounts says enough.
Just testing to see if this site will let me post a review at all.

Professor Corrado is the best! I took her Europe in the Twentieth Century course Spring 2019, and liked it so much that I plan to take two other courses with her as well. She's thoughtful, engaging, and makes the class interesting (museum visits, foreign movie days, etc). Her exam layout for smaller classes is great (I got to take mine verbally).

One of the better professor had Pepperdine. Just wish she graded the test instead of her aides.  Aides are robotic in nature, whereas the Professor that teaches understands the correlations better in the essays much better than a grad student.  Her 4.0 rating is fair. One of the better Professors at Pepperdine, which says a lot about their hiring.

SHE IS AWESOME!!!!!! She has SO much interest in her students and she loves teaching and tell stories! She actually connect her stories to the class and even show pictures from her travels. Her tests are ok, they r easy if you study.If not-you have to read a textbook.I hate history classes,but Sheryl made history sound pretty interesting. take her!

Classes are pretty standard (powepoint, lecture). TA's are the worst. Grade exams like its their job and penalize you anywhere possible. If it werent for the TA with the glasses, I would like this class!
RE: UK  I found Dr. Stoltzfus to be knowledgeable, kind and interesting.  The exams were fine, especially with the study guide.

@ University of Kentucky-   Dr. Stolzfus is a great professor. Class consists mostly of traditional powerpoint lectures. You need to attend class to succeed. Also, don't take the test lightly. Take good and detailed notes.   She's really nice and helpful you need help. Plus 25 Points XC doesn't hurt. Class is very attainable with an A.

lectures don't go along with textbook. cannot use laptop in class so if you miss what she says because you can't write that fast, then sucks for you. must go to every class to get the information needed for papers and exams because it is not clear in the textbook or similar.

As a senior she was the worst professor i have ever had. I feel bad because it is her first semester teaching at UK but i have made friends in her class because we can all relate to how terrible her class and teaching is. the material is common sense but she puts an unnecessary twist on it to make her tests tough. do not take her you will be misera
Encouraging and helpful. Her lectures are interesting. Tests are easy and clear. Need to take a little notes for exams and little homework.

Professor Stoltzfus is very articulate and interesting.  The knowledge of industry she brings to class makes the lectures come to life.  I especially enjoyed the case study - I felt the assignment prepared me for the real world.  I loved this class.

This class is dreadfully boring... fortunately she does not have an attendance policy. Her tests are exactly what is on the study guide-- but the final paper/research proposal is beyond obnoxious. A "B" is very possible in the class. She's nice, but her class is anything but interesting.
She is a great person. Her class was hard but she gives a study guide. She's sometimes difficult to understand, but she wants you to do well and will help you anyway she can

Dr. MacRae was an incredible teacher who has a clear passion for the subjects that he teaches.  His tests are very difficult and detailed, but he is always available to help, go to office hours!  I learned so much in the two classes I took from Dr. MacRae and I wish I could take another course with this professor.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: He is an excellent professor! Don't read the book, print out his powerpoint and take good notes in class. Make sure you differentiate between what his opinion is on the subject and the "classical view" of how things work. He asks about that on tests. Looks mean, but incredibly nice. Labs are 80 points total, same as test, so make those count!
memorize the lectures. don't read the book. MC is hard. great guy go in for office hours!

Very interesting class. He is unclear when explaining things sometimes, but if you go in during office hours he can usually clear it up for you. GO to class...and if the book ever conflicts with what he says in class, go by what HE says. Study a lot...tests are hard and detailed.
He is the best professor EVER! take notes in class... the tests are mostly from class notes. he's very helpful, very clear...
No Comments
tough teacher but a really nice guy.
Gotta like the accent...

I enjoyed my time in Dr. Billings class.  Definitely lecture-heavy but gives breaks to get food and work on group assignments.  I enjoyed how academuc he took the Old Testament, shared his own opinions but also allowed us to form our own about the text.
His class is a little bit confusing, but the four reflection papers help you to not fail this class. No quizs. Only two midterms and one final with four reflection papers.

I didn't think I was going to enjoy taking this class, but I found Dr. Billings lectures extremely engaging. He has a complete handle on the subject matter and makes it accessible to a broad range of students. I'm recommending this section to other first-year students.

Even though the class was three hours long, Professor Billings was able to keep the class interesting with group assignments, videos, and interesting perspectives on the Old Testament. Tests were challenging because of the specificity, but the final grade will reflect the work and effort you put in. I would recommend this course.

Had a hard time at first, but Drew is a teacher that is on your side and wants to help you get the grade. He is very knowledgeable, and very respected in his field. I had Drew for 3 hour lectures, he did a great job at teaching with a narrative design. He also used movies and documentaries from time to time to help the long days! Nice Man, fun!!
He is Ok
Pretty difficult class but his tests aren't too difficult, his quizzes are simple, and he really knows what he is teaching.

His lectures are very unorganized. The good part is that he puts the quizzes at the end of class so if you pay attention, they are easy points. His tests are hard and he is not clear on what is going to be on it.

I have learned so much from this class and would never miss. Dr. Sibul has broadened my understanding of what Independent Film is and where is comes from. There is a ton of reading, but she is adaptable should you need help.

Dr. Sibul is a passionate and compassionate teacher. She has been very responsive and caring regarding pandemic stress. This class has a major work load and it is not easy but I learned a lot and my thinking will be forever changed in a positive way for it.
I love taking classes from Prof. Sibul. She is passionate, entertaining and accessible. She is by far my favorite professor at Pepperdine, and wish she taught all of my film studies courses.
I loved her class. She is a great professor, loved by the students. Take her class -- she is super tough, but you will learn so much.

I loved this class. We had a switch of professor to Dr. Sibul, and she truly made this one of the best classes of my Pepperdine experience. The reading was really tough but the discussion helped a lot to understand them.

Professor Sibul is one of my favorite teachers at Pepperdine. She is very caring and wants you to do well. She has a few papers and a midterm and final exam. There are also quizzes every class. Although she is a tough grader, she does give extra credit if you are willing to work for it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I loved this class and prof. sibul. If you're a film-buff definitely take this class even if you are in production! Professor Sibul has a thorough understanding of film theory and history and her passion for teaching them is apparent in her lectures. She is also extremely approachable and adaptable. Her class is underrated!

First, she is a very caring person, knowledgeable too. The class is v repetitive because its a lot of lecturing over a chapter you already read before coming to class. Gave me a better appreciation for all the elements of film structure though. Her grading is tough because an A is a 94+ and she never gives grades above 95 so the A is hard to get.

Her class is WAY too difficult for a GE. She spends literally the entire class lecturing from powerpoints (in which every single slide looks the same) and doesn't let you take notes because "we should be looking at these powerpoints again and taking notes after class." Tests are so difficult but she'll try her best to give you points where she can.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor Strebel's classes are lecture heavy and focuses on way more information than you are tested on. Her classes can be quite confusing as she bounces around from country to country and never gives a satisfactory answer to any of the students questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Honestly just a bad teacher. Her tests cover 800 powerpoint slides, she basically just reads off those slides in class, and gives way too much detail and over 21 centuries... so her tests are virtually impossible. No study guides and if you ask her what to focus on she'll say "it's all important!" Would not take her again -- way too hard for a GE.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Sweet Sweet Elizabeth has extremely long power points that she tends to read verbatim during class. She is very sassy, and will get frustrated when asked lots of questions. Her tests and quizzes are very thorough and extremely difficult. She loves Dalrymple and Cleveland and Bunton lol. Have fun studying! This is a very work intensive class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Strebel's class will make you informed about the Middle East and prepare you for any sort of debate you might find yourself in... but be prepared to deal with her condescending attitude, unorganized powerpoints and horrible outfits.

Dr. Strebel is a Princeton alumni.  Be prepared to work hard and memorize a lot because you will go from Abraham to the 1990s.  Labor intensive class but extremely fair and must work for your grade.  Also note she loves Dan Brown.

Dr. Strebel is feisty and dances around the classroom on occasion!  Silliness aside, I had her for humanities and history of the Middle East and she's knowledgeable about both subjects. For the tests, be sure to memorize the main facts/key works for each historical figure or event, because she'll nickel-and-dime you those points from an A to a B.
She is a nice lady.  Boring teacher and her tests are carbon copies of here really, really long power points, so that is a bummer.  Other than that she is a total babe...
Loved De Los! She was so helpful and encouraging. Yes, the class was difficult but SO manageable. She was there to help at every step of the way and made class so fun. I highly recommend this class!
My favorite professor at Pepperdine. She not only cares about your future career, but she cares about you as a person. If you want to get somewhere in the journalism field, she will get you there.
Great teacher. No final. No midterm. Weekly online quizzes and modules which are easy. I learned a lot too. Fun teacher really. She has good energy.
Dr. de los Santos is super sweet and cares a lot. She gives good feedback on your writing but she mostly wants to see demonstrated effort and that's what she grades.
BEST PROFESSOR. Don't need to read the book. Very educated in broadcast journalism. Fun class. No midterm or final.

De Los Santos is the nicest human being. She cares about her students and looks out for them. She's AMAZING at what she does and knows what she's talking about. She brings snacks to every class, and it doesn't seem like much, but it makes people's days. The workload is SUPER heavy, but she's there to help in any way she can.

De Los Santos is the nicest person. She goes above and beyond to help students, but it's TONS of work and the class is super fast pace. She's also a really hard grader, so don't expect to get an A in the class. The AP and LA Times quizzes are also tough to keep up with.

a really good journalism professor. She knows broadcast journalism very well. Her lectures are interesting and helpful. She is a very nice person who is always willing to help you outside of class.  Dr. de los Santos is one of my favorite professors. The class was not hard at all as long as you turn in all the assignments and study for the quizes.

She is an incredible teacher,makes a really boring topic at interesting as it can be. She is extremely helpful and willing to meet with students outside of class. Her midterm/final is pretty hard, but as long as you attend her study session you'll be fine. She goes through the entire test with you.
She is genuinely one of the nicest and funniest teachers I've ever had. Expect many quizzes, but if you pay attention in class and put in a reasonable effort you should have no problems.
Love Sensei, amazing teacher and understanding person. She talks a little fast but you catch on fairly quick but definitely study though.

I love sensei!! She's so sweet and helpful, the textbook is used every day in class and we're even given extra side notes outside of the book. She gives great cultural insight to Japanese, casual speech, and truly allows it to be a language you can use outside of the classroom. Easily my favorite professor!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: SENSEI! I love her so much, despite the class being super difficult. This was my 3rd Japanese class so its understandable that its really hard but Sensei really does teach the material well. You just need to study it every day. There basically is homework due every day, a quiz 3x a week and tests every 2 weeks. Shes a true gem, gonna miss her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Ota is a great teacher. She is willing to go at the pace of her class instead of many other language teachers who will move at their own pace or of the pace of the student who knows way more of the language than the others. The class is not too difficult though she does expect her students to actually put effort in to the class.Great prof

Professor Ota is a great teacher. Her accent may be a little hard to comprehend at times, but you get use to it very quickly! She has a cute personality and is a sweet person. Her tests are easy if you review the material learned in class. Make sure you review the vocabulary and the grammar!

I've learned more Japanese in one semester of her class than some people know after taking a few years in high school. She is a great teacher and will go over ANYTHING with you. If you see any negative comments on here, its because some people didn't bother to learn the Japanese alphabet. They expect it to be like some anime or something.

Came in to Japanese looking foward to prospects of me learning a new language. Profeesor Ota can barely speak english. She talks way to fast and is very disorganized. The worst thing about the whole situation is that she is the only professr who teachs 151. She killed my interest in learning Japanese.

read the discussion reading and do the questions, because its so awk when no one knows and its silent. its a bunch of 2 paged papers that he doesnt check until the midterm and the final, which are portfolios of everything. he's very cool w any topic you want to write about within the prompt. in office hours he will just tell you what he wants.
rating_tags: Participation matters--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: Great prof. Cares a lot about his students. I would suggest taking his class.

He was so entertaining, eccentric, and quirky.  Asked us how we were. What we thought about different ideas. We watched a film, then came up with three discussion questions and answers that we could share in class. We never had any tests or quizzes. Our midterm and final was a 6 page double spaced essay, answering questions that we could choose.

*FILM411

This class was so much fun! Dr. Stock is a great professor and I looked forward to this class every week. Has very clear expectations and only grades on attendance and 2 papers. Not difficult unless you procrastinate.
Awesome Professor!

Lots of hw that feels like busy work and time consuming, watching shows and writing about them. HW, a midterm and final paper, and a presentation. Open ended assignments which can make you feel lost but such an easy grader, literally just complete the assignments and you'll do great. Chill prof, and chill classes just talking about different shows.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Very fun! Class discussions are always on point and fascinating!

Professor Stock is a great teacher, he makes class fun and really values participation. The only homework was reading and writing essays. I rented the book but I barely read it, as long as you read the assigned articles you'll be fine. He's super gracious about late work as long as you communicate with him beforehand. A lot of writing but doable.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: STOCK IS THE SWEETEST KINDEST MOST GENUINE TEACHER. He truly goes above and beyond to see us successful and makes himself so available for his students! Such a fun guy.

Professor Stock is by far the best film professor I have had at Pepperdine. He is very engaging and covers interesting topics during class. He is super accessible as well and puts in a lot of effort into each discussion.

The class was small and pretty discussion heavy, but it was enjoyable discussion. You hardly go a class without participating, b/c if you haven't said anything he'll ask for your thoughts (in a nice way!). Chose one technology topic and pretty much all work/ discussion was based around that. Nice grader, a super cool guy, overall a super fun class.

Loved this class. The assignments let you choose a topic you're interested in, which made them more fun to do. He's super easy to talk to and always answers questions. The discussions were interesting, and he actually cares about what students have to say.

He is a great professor. I am currently taking his ENG101 class and while the work may be tedious at times since there is often stuff due every class, he makes it very clear. It is not at all a hard class if you apply yourself. He is very friendly and responds very fast to emails. I would definitely take him again
One of the better professors I've had at Pepperdine in 3 years. His class was a lot of work especially at the end of the semester it got busy. It's definitely worth taking him. Papers graded fairly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: I'm not sure Berliner knew what class he was teaching. He lectures the full 3 hours and attendance is mandatory. Lectures are participation heavy and are completely irrelevant to the coursework, much less the class. There is sooo much reading and it's more like an English or film class. I would not recommend this professor for Hum313.

Professor Berliner is excellent. I was not very confident with my writing before this class but he helped me a lot. Very patient guy and responds quickly to emails. There are two big assignments in the semester. Not difficult if you plan ahead. Definitely recommend taking his class.
Good professor. Work could be a lot at times but class helped in choosing my major.
He talks a lot and you get sleepy in the class but he's a good professor and is really nice. Class is not difficult at all. Grading is pretty easy. Just do the work.

Look. He's a good professor but when I tell you this man needs a podcast so he can vent, I mean it. A lot of us were pissed that he would just end up wasting our time with his drawling plus, attendance is mandatory. Most of the in-class "exercises" were not useful and quite redundant. Easy class but mind-numbingly boring.

He is an amazing professor, extremely organized and well-paced throughout the course. It's kinda like a history course which I personally liked as it didn't feel like the religion was forced on you. There's three big exams throughout the semester, just read the assigned readings and go through the lecture slides and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: He is super nice, but I know everyone in the class has no idea what's going on. His power points are so bad and has little information. It's just hard bc he is not engaging at all. He knows what he's talking about for sure tho. I learned so much by watching the bible project on Youtube for all the books in the Bible.

Unclear expectations for the class. His exams are super difficult and don't align with the slides very well (which have little to no information on them). He hasn't taught a class in 10 years and it shows. He's not engaging and half of the words that come out of his mouth during each lecture are "are you with me" or "does that make sense".

Avoid Professors Mars at all costs unless you like receiving a poor grade. His tests lack the information found from his presentations. The tests are unclear, and fail to align with his study guide. Not to mention how the study guide fails to align with the homework readings in correlation to his slides. In conclusion, avoid this guy!
Great professor!!
Lectures beginning to end. Nice guy, but class can be kinda boring. You have to study for his tests.

He is a very charismatic guy and a great teacher.  If you pay attention, you will learn a lot.  He knows what he is talking about and teaches it passionately.  Couple of projects throughout the semester and you do need to study for the tests.  Highly recommended.
Great teacher, great guy

Professor Zarik is inspirational. That is the problem, he is too inspirational. He talks about himself a lot that he most of the time forgets that he is teaching a critical thinking class. He is not clear with his grading and submission criteria. He does not grade any activities and you will just see your final grade not until after the trimester.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Easily one of the best professors at Pepperdine! He was very inspirational and motivated us to do our best. Wont regret taking his class at all. Easy A.
Doesn't give you grades until the end of class. Isn't clear on grading. Attendance and participation are all over the place. Worst professor I have experienced.
honestly one of the best professors I have ever had. His intelligence is beyond amazing. I wish I could have the opportunity to take him again. So amazing. Love u professor!

Zarik is the best professor at Pepperdine. You would never get bored in his class because he makes you engaged with the topics. He will teach you great life lessons that you will remember forever. He inspired me so much, and I wish I can take him again in the future. He's not only a great professor but also a great human being.

Professor Boghossian is hands down one of the best professors at Pepperdine. He goes above and beyond his roles as a professor. He is a very smart professor who's methods include holding related classroom discussions that really make you reflect, think, analysis and much more. I would recommend! You will learn so much and he makes you feel at home.

Really cool guy, he actually stresses more on being a good human being first with everything he says or does.  Such a welcome refreshment in the middle of all the maddening MBA chaos. Would take him again to get a real, balanced and humane overview of issues we face today!

He's the coolest professor at Seaver. He makes a 4-hr class 2.5 hours because he knows everyone wants to leave after 8. His books and videos are interesting. Group project is developing a business plan for an idea from your group. He's got businesses and connections so ask him to mentor you. Final is very simple. He's tells you half of the answers.

I took her overseas in London this past year. She is not Hard at all. Just make sure to do the reading and know all the terms in the book. She likes to incorporate fun activities every week. Final project included a "teamwork" exercise involving us taking pictures around famous London tourist attractions under time restrictions. Fun class!

i took her for the internship class in london and it was pretty confusing. she wanted us to keep daily logs of our work habits, but she wanted them done very specifically. still, VERY nice and enthuiastic woman who would go to great lengths for her students.
Very nice person.
very hawwwt for her age  class is all memorization, really boring
yeah, yeah, lots to memorize.  if you aren't lazy though you can definitley get an A in this class.  her intentions are good and she tries to make it fun, relax and enjoy the casual environment

At first she seems cool until you realize that she teaches a HORRIBLE CLASS and is a HORRIBLE TEACHER. tries to run her life by her ridiculous class but cant lead worth****.  don't come to her with problems, she will make them worse.  I did not learn a thing in that class.  Don't take this class.

this class was rediculous.  memorizing lists, over 60 things to memorize!! her final was pointless, it didn't reinforce any of the things we learned.  This class was a joke and completely useless.  don't take her unless you want to memorize a bunch of stuff without really learning it.
Awesome prof.  Great class, makes everything easy to understand and fun to learn.  awesome advisor and a good friend if you need one.  london house!
Dr. Klemp is the best professor I've ever had at Pepperdine and makes theory at 8am so interesting and engaging. Take any Klemp class you can take!! :)

HE IS AMAZING! Best POSC class at Pepperdine I have ever taken. No final which made class such a great environment for good discussions. Klemp is the best I would recommend him for every single class.
(POSC 518) Super interesting.  I never in a million years would have thought political theory would be amazing.  His class is really fun and the work load isnt too bad.  Take any KLEMP class!
Best professor I've ever had.

Dr. Klemp is amazing!! He is funny, kind, and evidently intelligent. My only complaint is that I think he went too easy on our class -- I wanted to have more expected of me. Nevertheless, I highly recommend him! I cannot imagine regretting taking a class with this brilliant prof.

Professor Klemp is awesome. I highly recommend taking any of his classes if you are a political science or philosophy major. He is enthusiastic, fun, and most importantly, a great teacher. He is a fair grader and assigns a reasonable amount of reading.

Klemp is a very laid-back, fun professor. His classes cover interesting material in a very entertaining, engaging way. His grading is not extremely easy, but he's still a very helpful prof...highly reccommended!

Klemp is very solid. He encourages great discussion and brings a youthful, fun energy to the classroom. He grades pretty difficultly, but you'll have a really good time in the class if you like politics/philosophy.
Great teacher! Learned more than just public speaking. Two tests and 4 speeches that aren't that bad. One of the most engaging teachers Ive ever had
Jason was my favorite professor last semester!  He really engages with his class and teaches you realistic ways to speak, unlike the book.  He turned a terrifying class into my new favorite subject.

Jason is an incredible teacher. I was terrified of public speaking prior to taking the class but he really taught me how to capture the attention of an audience. He is approachable, engaging, and really funny.

Jason is SO inspirational!  A lot of times, leaving his class felt like walking out of a convicting sermon. His teaching method is total "show don't tell" since he does public speaking as a career and everyone in my class blossomed into confident, articulate speakers because of his epic teaching method.  Take Jason for COM 180!!

If I was rating Jason's personality, it would be an A+. Jason's class had the right amount of rigor attached. Watch out for deadlines however, as he routinely revises expectations or fails to release important material until late in the game. This can frustrate some (as it did me) but I would strongly advise a diligent student to take this class.

If you aren't taking COM 180 with Jason, you're missing out! Knows his trade inside out, always approachable and ready to put in his energy and effort into helping you outside of class. Will make you a better speaker, and a better person. Tests are heavy on content, but provides a good study guide.

I cannot say enough good things about Professor Jaggard (Jason). He not only teaches you how to be a better speaker, but he teaches you how to be a better, all-around person. I hope some time down the road I can take another class from him. I HIGHLY recommend!

Without question, Jason is the most inspirational teacher I have ever had. He is interesting, engaging, brilliant, funny, and helpful. I recommend taking ANY of his classes- you are guaranteed to grow under his guidance.

He's a great prof! His essay prompts and instructions are always clear along with the grading criteria. There are some in-class quizzes that counts towards your grade to ensure that you don't skip class. Outside of this, he isn't too strict about his attendance policy. There are lots of group works that can be helpful. Would take him again for sure

Super nice guy & is pretty understanding of circumstances if you talk to him. Provides really clear grading and no homework. Little quizzes on the readings, which makes attendance mandatory. No homework. Lectures can be boring and pointless sometimes. A lot of in-class group work.

Mahoney is super sweet and a great prof! You are graded on 4 essays, some discussion posts (250 words) on easy required readings, & a few quizzes, but he provides extra credit opportunities for up to 20 extra points as well. Lectures can get a little boring but he thoroughly covers all topics and is accessible outside of class. 10/10 Great class

Mahoney was kind of boring but he was chill. Probably the easiest class I've taken at Pepperdine so far, taught stuff I learned in high school (ex. what is a verb and sentence structure). I didnt show up to class for the last half of the semester when I realised attendance was not mandatory and just turned in all my papers on time and took feedback

Prof Mahoney is actually so kind and sweet. He is always available to help when writing essays; he just emails or talks to him after class; he gives extra credit for going to the writing center and doing some online activities. It's only 4 essays throughout the whole semester, but trust me, you have time. And some online quizzes in class.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He is super nice and sweet. You basically only get graded on the essays which he gives about three weeks to do, and the online in class quizzes. Other than that, the class is simple and he is always available for help. People say its boring but its rlly not that bad. He gives extra credit for attending the writing center! Def recommend
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Pretty tough grader. Overall a really nice guy but his lectures are super boring. I wouldn't recommend taking him I'd pry switch to someone that will give you an easy A. This guy is smart and teaches good material it's just very difficult to get a good grade.
Good professor, class tends to be boring, but grades pretty easily, always use his feedback it makes him happy, happy professor=better grades
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Mahoney is one of the kindest professors I have ever had. He is always open to extending due dates, easy to contact, and allows for zoom when you are sick. The class is 4 essays and a ton of little assignments throughout. Although I am someone who hates writing, I have gotten a lot out of his class.

My writing has improved in his class, because there is a pretty good review process. There are a lot of assignments that are easy to miss, so make sure to check the syllabus and put the homework assignments somewhere.
rating_tags: So many papers--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: He is a great guy, does not cover much in class though. Really helpful and will give great pointers on your writing, but a pretty tough grader. Offers a bit of extra credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Nice guy but very weird grading scale, and its hard to communicate with him outside of class (does not answer emails).

Very nice person and will make sure you pass with a good grade. Extremely lenient on attendance. Class kind of makes no sense but you can tell the professor cares more about the people instead of the content which makes it a joy to attend.

Dr Lemley is incredible. His class is so interesting, and participation in discussion is encouraged. Ask questions! He's available outside of class if anything is confusing. I love the way he thinks differently about grading. It's clear he wants to help us learn in a meaningful way, not just do work for a score. I have learned so much from him.

I don't want to be too mean because he seems like a very nice person, but the class was all over the place. I mean like during the last week he had to go back and clarify the definition of "the way of Jesus", literally the name of the course. He does seem to be a pretty lenient grader.

He is a nice guy but confusing professor. The content and grading was confusing in general. To give him the benefit of the doubt, he was going through personal stuff this semester. It was hard to know where you stood in the class as he never put in grades and had very few things to even grade us on.
Though Lemly may seem all over the place, don't fret too much about it cos he makes sure everyone does well
H's a bit confusing but the man has also been going through a lot. He's very sweet but also understandable, he's very smart and you'll be good to go.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Very confusing class but the grading is easy. Never fully understood what he is talking about but the class was not a lot of work. He makes you meet with him outside of class twice which helps for sure. Good professor, just a little confusing

Prof. Pfeiffer's night class is so fun and you will learn a lot! He teaches through movie clips, songs, and real-life cases, so the class is very entertaining. The weekly reading is super manageable, he is an easy grader on essays and curves exams. He doesn't post grades to courses, however, he emails test grades and gives lots of extra credit.

Professor Pfeiffer is an incredible professor. He seems like a tough professor at first, but has a huge heart and makes his class silly. He lets you out early most of the time and emphasizes so many important real life concepts. He is the best!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--So many papers

comment: One of the funniest professors. He teaches Thr 6-10 but you usually get out an hour early. His lectures are funny and personable. His instructions are unclear at times but he is easy going and understands that his students are not law students and have to take this class. He hardly gives work back though so you don't know your grade until finals
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Pfeiffer is easily one of the most awesome professors at Pepperdine! I highly recommend taking him for Media Law! He only offers a once a week night class, but it's totally worth it! The course is honestly super fun and time flies by! It's so easy to pay attention because he makes the content so interesting and you will actually learn something.

Professor Pfeiffer is one of the best I have taken at Pepperdine. He makes a 4 hour night class fun and engaging. His Powerpoints are so funny and I love his little anecdotes. He really knows what he is talking about and has real experience which is refreshing. Not too difficult if you pay attention and try. Definitely take his class if you can!

This class is educational and fun.  Only time I've been able to stay awake for a 6-10 pm class.  Pfeiffer is super funny and doesn't really care what you do.  Test is easy as long as you pay attention in class.

Awesome guy!  Pretty easy class. meets once a week and lasts about 3 hours instead of the scheduled 4.  Shows a lot of funny/random videos in class. Went two consecutive weeks without meeting, pretty cool.
Great professor, really funny. He makes the class really fun and explains everything really well. Not much work, you just have to read and summarize 1 court case each week. Been a great class.

He is very easy to understand and his tests are literally straight from lecture. Take notes on the side comments he makes about the slide that is up. Skim the reading and do the online quiz-there are pop quizzes. I am non-religious, but I still got an A in his class. Very easy.

Barbarick is good, better than Heard, man Heard is bad, but Barbarick is pretty good. He doesn't know when to stop lecturing, he elaborates on everything, but he knows his stuff and seems to be helpful.
Makes ridiculously hard tests that ask for minor details. Waste of time. GPA killer. Do not recommend!!!

Tests weren't easy, way too detailed. I didn't have the upper hand like other students who have been going to church their whole lives. Barbarick assumes that everyone knows everything about Christianity already, when I got lost as he lectured quickly through the New Testament.

I would not recommend him. He is extremely boring and if he does not like you he will never give you a grade above a C+, no matter how hard you try. Extremely boring class to the point that i decided not to keep trying (since I was getting a C+ on everything). NOT RECOMMENDED
Professor Barbarick is one of the nicest teachers at Pepperdine.  Class is really easy too.  Take him if you get a chance.

Professor Barbarick is a great professor. His tests aren't easy, but they're generally fair. He has quizzes on the reading to get you to come to class, and they can't be made up. Overall, he keeps things interesting and is very knowledgeable. He's a nice guy and is very approachable.

She brags about herself constantly. It's annoying.
