She is getting an online doctorate and teaches at a safety school that's basically a community college people transfer out of, so it's ironic that she's such a braggart about so very little. She's actually terrible at public speaking, which is hilarious since that is what she teaches us.

Super nice professor and very relatable. Only complaints were that as a GE class, she made the tests a little more difficult than need be. Focus was more on the textbook for the tests, rather than our growth as a speaker. I improved each speech I did and still got a C because of the tests.

Delphine Broccard is younger and easy to relate to. Com 180, in principle, is an awful class, but Broccard makes it tolerable and meets the students halfway on a lot of things. And referring to the midterm comment, she practically spoonfeeds people what will be on the midterm. If you don't get an A in this class you are not paying attention.

Broccard rocks! I dont know why anyone would not take her COMM 180 class. And referring to the comment bashing Broccard, the date clearly says 3/3, the middle of the semester, right after a midterm. I wonder why it is such a negative remark... A failing grade perhaps? Lack of work and study ethic, perhaps?

I have more homework for this class than I do for my major classes. we don't learn how to recite speeches we learn how to memorize key terms and spew them out to her when the time comes.  Don't take this class with her, she really tries to engage her audience, as an good public speaker would, but fails terribly. Oh, the irony.
She is a nice teacher but only her first year. It shows in the grading and toughness of the class. Otherwise she has a great personality.
Decent so far!

Amazing professor, if you agree to put in the work. She has great experience and is happy to share. You will finish the course feeling like a professional in the field. I got an A, but I earned it. I read, I wrote, and I visited her in her office for feedback. She will take you under her wing and it will change your life.

Denise is a good person, but PR255 is a a little challenging for an intro class, but it will make you learn. The lectures are a little vague, so it's important to use your book and UNDERSTAND IT, and then approach her if you have questions. You will not learn what you need to solely from lectures and powerpoints. go to class, she's not too bad

Not too much homework, has a fair amount of reading. Then, it comes time to take the first test and you realize you've learned nothing. The tests are hard to get A's on, in fact even if you study really hard you wont get an A, she practically refuses to give out A's. Campaign proposal will take over your life, also she wont give an A on that.
She's a nice lady, but honestly terrible professor. Boasts about being a "hard grader" when there really isn't any basis to be so difficult. I honestly got turned off by PR stuff after this class.

Be ready to work extremely hard and maybe get a B because she usually only gives one A on projects and exams. Our first exam the highest grade was a 92% and she said that meant the class did well. There was zero clarity on our PR proposal and didn't give us clear answers on how to succeed in the class. Take a different professor if you can.
Wonderful woman who loves what she teaches. Be prepared to work hard, she expects a lot. This is not a class for slacking off. If you work hard and participate you'll do fine.

This class is the hardest intro level course at Pepperdine. Although the professor is enthusiastic she is unwilling to give anyone, regardless of their effort, an A. Also, she constitutes a 96% as an A .. rather than the standard 95% A.
I rlly enjoyed this class and actually learned a lot. the tests are pretty easy once uk what he's looking for. Rlly nice guy and his lectures were interesting.

Kingdon is the nicest professor I've had. There are reading quizzes in each class that are 1 or 2 questions. There are 3 written tests based on memorization of art pieces. You must know specific dates, names of artists, names of pieces, and info about the pieces. As long as you memorize the pieces, you'll get a good grade in the class.

Clearly passionate about the class subject! It made the lectures interesting despite his speaking voice being slightly monotone. Attendance has a direct impact on your grade, the 3 tests are worth a LOT but they are completely doable with a bit of studying. You can easily get 100% since it is mostly memorization, and not a whole lot of it.
Really nice guy but lectures can feel long and boring if this isn't a topic you're interested in

Though kind, Prof. Kingdon is a very dry lecturer, as it is just him talking for 2 hours. He gives study guides for tests, but they're a ton of memorization, and grading is unclear, with points being marked off without explanation. Many small papers and 2 long essays on articles that were quite obscure. Hard class for GE, takes a lot to get an A.

Kingdon is amazing and made art history actually really interesting! The key to success in the class is paying close attention to the lectures and taking notes since the exams are basically an exact copy of the lecture.

I really enjoyed Prof. Kingdon, his lectures were incredibly interesting and fun! I got to ask a lot of questions and learn much more than was in the textbook. His slides are picture-heavy and intriguing. I recommend paying attention in class and asking lots of questions, he's really passionate about this class and familiar with a wide range!

Prof. Kingdon is kind but incredibly boring. His lectures are just you staring at the screen and hearing him talk for the entirety of the lecture. He is a tough grader, all tests are free-response and he will take points off even if everything you wrote was correct and he gives no reason for why he took points off. You rarely learn anything.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She's a sweetheart, but not a good teacher. Her lectures are so difficult to understand. You can tell that she is knowledgable but she just doesn't know how to teach. Her instructions are also super unclear and assignments that are supposed to take you 5mins end up taking an hour if you're lucky. Also takes FOREVER to respond to emails.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Good luck. Nuff Said.

Professor Cupid, while super kind-hearted, is the worst teacher I have EVER had. She does not respond to emails, she is unhelpful, she gets mad when you say that you are confused. Even the best of students were lost and confused in her class. She was terrible at communication and graded way harder than necessary. Avoid at all costs.

Professor Cupid is a great person, yet this class was a nightmare. She barely gives instruction so you feel lost for every assignment, and there's only a handful of graded things throughout the semester so tiny assignments end up being a large percentage of your grade. It felt like she didn't know what she was doing just as much as we all didn't.

Professor Cupid is very sweet but this class is the WORST. She gives assignments that may seem simple but take an absurd amount of time to research, prepare to read too. Her quizzes are 5 questions but are worth 100 points and are in a linear format (you cannot go back to previous questions). Her tests are also linear. Strongly would not recommend.

Super sweet professor but half the time our class had no idea what was going on because it was very disorganized. She has a lot of experience and you can learn a lot from her but most of the work was very tedious and there was hours of reading to do for each week. However, if you do the reading and listen to her lectures, the tests are doable.

Dr. Cupid is so sweet. You can tell she is very knowledgeable about the field of PR. She also gives good feedback on all of our assignments. Her tests are impossible. The study guides are never helpful and the tests are a big percentage of the grade. Expect to work hard and pray you can get an A.

NASC class is easy. But she is a TERRIBLE pre-med mentor. She is discouraging and rude and tells certain students to apply to med school to keep Pepp's acceptance rate high. She never went to med school either so she doesn't know what she's doing half the time. Find a mentor who will believe in you and actually went/ got in to med school.

Dr. Nelson is a great professor! However she didn't bring any doctors into the class, mostly PAs, nurses, other profs. Additionally, she only has DO and offshore med schools visit. She also never went to med school, so she doesn't know what she's talking about when she advises pre-meds. Most people who get into med school do it without her help
Her SPME106 class is a true hidden gem for lab science requirement. It's the easiest class I've ever taken in my life, plus she's really nice and funny.

Dr. Nelson is the best pre-med advisor out there. In my 2nd yr of medical school, I have UCLA students that know about the famous Dr. Nelson. Get to know her as a person as take the opportunity to learn from her pre-med wisdom. She is amazingly sweet. I consider her my Pepperdine mother but since she's CrossFit world ranked she more like a peer.

Dr. Nelson is my favorite prof at Pepp, hands down. Her classes are interesting, fun, as well as extremely fair. And I do not believe there is a better pre-med counselor out there. Full of knowledge and best of all, honest. She will tell it to you how it is- which is so helpful. Furthermore, Dr. Nelson is talkative and warm- hearted. Gotta meet her
Very informative, and helps those who seek it to the best of her ability
Intro to the Health Sciences- super easy class; a pass or fail. People come and go as they please to class
Best teacher at Pepperdine! 10 out of 10 would recommend.
him and his dog are both hunks... he rocked my world...

Kats is a really cool professor. He can turn boring global ecological events into a really exciting topic of discussion. Very laid back and chill. I dont think he will be teaching Ecology any longer, but for those that had the opportunity to take his course, consider yourself lucky.
Kats is the man!
the best, why does he teach here?
One lean hunk o' man!
he's cool

I love Hsieh Laoshi!! She is by far the best Chinese professor I have ever had if not the best professor ever. My class is four days a week but for someone who hardly cares about school she certainly makes me want to attend every class. Makes my morning that much better. :)

Laoshi is very funny, and she makes the class super fun. The best Mandarin teacher I've ever had so far. She cares about her students and will be more than happy to chat outside of class. Her teaching methods are extremely effective. She gave us candy on many occasions and hongbao for Chinese New Year. :)
GREAT PROFESSOR AND PERSON! Zui Hao De LaoShi. Learn a lot and have fun while learning. A great advisor and is more than willing to help outside of the classroom.
She's simply awesome. Not a hard grader, not strict. Classes are laid back. Not a lot of homework.
The best language prof @ Pepp....she will laugh with you every class.....great sense of humor and easy-grader....a very encouraging teacher
Very easy and funny...
Hsieh is so funny! I look forward to her class everyday. She is an easy grader, but I am still learning at the same time. She is the best.

The guy is a class act. He keeps class moving and interesting. He's always down a good class debate which keeps things spicy in an English 101 class. I learned a lot about what my strengths and weakness as a writer, while also getting a kick out of him and his class. And he's from NorCal. Enough Said

Dr. Brooks is one of my favorite teachers at Pepperdine. He truly cares about his students and was always willing to help when asked. I learned so much from him about writing (my least favorite subject), and I really appreciate how much time he put in to helping us better our writing. Take this professor!!!!!
Great Professor, very personable and cool. I took his class for 4 semesters and he's still wonderful.

Such a great professor. He really cares about his students and improving our writing style. He genuinely wants us to understand the material and apply it to our lives. Unique in that he actually takes our opinions into account, because he is very open to differing opinions and new ideas. Take his class; you will love him!

Jason is an amazing professor and I highly recommend him. He is eager to help every one of his students and is highly knowledgeable about the texts, especially in regards to Greek literature. The class expectations for reading and grading are very fair and reasonable. Take his class!

He is absolutely incredible. If you go through the Great Books colloquium without taking him, you are missing out. I could not have asked for a better teacher. I learned so much from him and he is so helpful! Take his class!!!!!
He's a brilliant Great Books prof!

I don't think a lot of our lectures related to the material in the way that I'd like. She provides test reviews and you have to be in class or look at recordings for the paper instructions. Exams weren't terribly hard, most people make A's. She really cares about her students. I think the students in your group determine more how it will go.

Professor Tucci is amazing! She truly wants to get to know everyone in her class and cares about her students deeply! She wants everyone to succeed and is a lenient grader/professor. Just be prepared to be vulnerable in class and for her to go on long rants. If you study and do your work, you'll do great!

This professor is very understanding. She is phenomenal at what she does and you can tell by the effort she puts forth. Her tests are where major of your grade is decided however she provides excellent study guides and covers all necessary material for you to be successful. The professor responds to emails relatively quickly and is responsive.

Professor Tucci is one of the most supportive teachers I've ever had. Her classes are all lecture but she guides you through the exams and is super helpful. She genuinely cares about her students and has a passion for the material. Your grade is 80% exams so be sure to take notes so you can do well on the exams! Would definitely take her again!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Tucci is not only kind and patient but also very knowledgeable and professional. This was hands down the best class I've taken in all levels of education. She is extremely fair, very inspirational, and very relatable. I highly recommend you take her for PSY 657!

I loved Prof. Tucci! She was kind, warm, personable, bubbly, and incredibly passionate about the material. As long as you follow along with the async & keep up with readings, you'll absolutely be fine!
Amazing teacher! Would highly recommend. So nice and class was always interesting.

Professor Overton is an extremely understanding person. His lectures do tend to be long, but he makes up for it by planning an interactive activity around the end of class. He explains everything well and also uses anecdotes. He grades relatively fair on his speeches. The textbook is not used as much except for the midterm and final.

Overton cares a lot about his students and is pretty chill. There's a lot of reading but it's never discussed in class. He definitely prepares you for each speech, but he can be a tough grader. The lectures are very engaging. There's lot of funny stories and fun group activities. He's always willing to help out before a speech and give feedback.

Dr. Overton is awesome! Very funny, caring guy, and gives good feedback. Definitely alot of reading, and the two tests are difficult, but he is a fair grader and truly wants his students to do well. Take him!

He's a really nice guy and an energetic teacher. The class has lots of activities, most of them enjoyable, and the discussions and lectures are engaging and full of stories and examples. I dreaded the class going in, but it ended up being one of my favorites this semester. I do feel better as a speaker.

Overton is a nice guy and passionate about his subject. However this distracts from his teaching as he seems to be reteaching himself the lectures instead of trying to teach the class. Also for speeches he is a hard grader one mistake means an automatic loss of points. Make sure you make a good first impression and create a relationship.

Prof. Overton wants his students to succeed. He understands that people taking this introductory Speech and Rhetoric course will not be perfect speakers. He gives good feedback after you give your speech so you understand what you need to improve on, but will not doc your grade severely for those reasons. No busy work. A is easily attainable
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: He is a real nice guy and understands his students. His lectures are fun and interesting. He tells you what is going to be on his midterm and final. The only thing thats hard are the speeches. Thats only because I am a terrible public speaker. He gives great feedback for you to improve on your speeches.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Allison is a great lab instructor and she's super helpful in lab. Lab notebooks are graded harshly but that's all throughout the lab department. Take her for lab!

Dr. Allison is amazing!! As long as you actually study like you are supposed to for any science/ lab class, then you will be fine! She is really passionate and her excitement gets you excited for lab! SHE IS SUPER HELPFUL AND WILL LEGIT ANSWER ANY OF YOUR QUESTIONS!!! no such thing as "stupid questions" with her!!! GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS!!!

Dr. Allison is SO GREAT! If you work hard, study, and take notes then the labs are pretty easy. Dr. Allison helped me so much in class and during her office hours. She genuinely wants to help her students and very approachable and you will become a better scientist! THE BEST SCIENCE PROFESSOR ON CAMPUS!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Allison is an amazing professor! As long as you pay attention in your Chem lecture class the labs are a breeze. Dr. Allison was always very helpful, however she is a tough grader, but you will become a better scientist! The bad reviews are from those that didn't pay attention and received a bad grade because of it. HANDS DOWN TAKE THIS CLASS!
DON'T take her class. I suggest taking another chem120L professor if you don't want your gpa to be ruined. She is also a very tough grader, she takes away points for the most unnecessary things.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Chem lab was very difficult online, points get taken away for the smallest things. Go to her office hours for help. You will get pointers and get to know her, which is hard to do during class. Her office hours were busy so it was often hard to ask your question. She isn't the worst lab professor, but I decided not to take her again for chem II lab.

Dr. Allison is amazing! Shes very passionate about biology. study guides before test are an absolute MUST. i did well in this class but i knew of a lot of people who didnt because they didnt put in the work. Take her if you can! Shes funny and kind, you wont regret it!

His lectures are so hilarious and make content memorable. He also cares about his students. He has high expectations but he gives you all the resources to be successful in his class. TAKE HIM IF YOU GET THE CHANCE!

Dr. Paris is one of my favorite professors! He is kind, funny, and truly cares about his students. His exams are pretty tough, but if you study and ask questions, you'll be okay. Overall, he's great and so passionate about the subject, which makes the class interesting. Also, the lab is really fun and engaging.
Dr. Paris has been my favorite professor. His tests are EXTREMELY hard, but he wants you to do well and he will work with you and make himself available for help when you need it. He's awesome.

The class is structured mostly around two take home exams which are challenging, but with the right mindset, sort of fun. The class is difficult, but not unreasonable. Office hours and asking your questions as they arise is key. Well worth your time, and lab is so fun (lecture is too)

Truly the best professor at Pepperdine. He is kind, funny, and cares so much about his students. Very accessible by office hours or email, and wants you to understand. He gives you a passion for the content, can make anything interesting, and is one of the best men on this planet. Can't say a single bad thing about him.

The absolute best professor. He's tough, but so fun and always available to meet for extra help!! One of the greatest guys on the planet, and makes his classes engaging and so interesting. The time flies. But beware, his tests are tough.

I guarantee you will not meet another professor who is like Dr. Paris. He is absolutely hilarious ,and his class is so interesting! His exams made me want to cry ,but I am so glad I had the opportunity to take his class. He makes the class really fun with his added theatrics and knowledge about anything and everything in the running world.
He is a kind professor and shows films he made during class. I am glad I took this professor.

Professor Coleman is very passionate about film which made for a fun class. He is funny and his lectures are engaging. However, he is hard to follow in lectures as he will go on tangents and often does not follow his syllabus. If you go to class and put in effort for his assignments you will do well.
A nice man, but not very engaging.

Take this class for an easy A, but you probably won't learn anything. I wanted to see if a career in film was for me, but wasn't convinced. Coleman is inconsistent with grading, the syllabus, and the things he says. Also very rude to students. Not horrible but not very good either. Loves to talk about himself instead of getting to know students.
This class is an easy A. Coleman isn't the greatest because he does not follow the syllabus, but as long as you do your work then you will easily pass this class.
Prof Coleman is awesome!! Definitely a gem to the SART department!! If you have to ability to take a class with him DO IT!
Has a lot of personal stories but most of them don't have relation to class. Not a very engaging instructor on the material, but maybe its a fault of the text book.

Took Mrs. Forsyth for a flex class. She makes her own lectures and they are thorough. You will learn and you will learn a lot. Make sure to take good notes. She grades fairly. Everything will be covered in the lectures and the material given. Make sure to know how to use your calculator and how to use the formula sheet. Study the old exams.

She is an awesome professor. Lectures are pretty intense ..If you pay attention, this course might be one of best classes you have taken at Pepperdine. She gives you previous exams and sample problems to make preparing for the exams easier. She is very passionate about teaching. You will benefit from this! Take her !!

Professor Forsyth is the best professor I have had since starting the BSM program at Pepperdine.  Yes, she is difficult, but you learn a ton about finance and she has tons of real world examples.  Study her practice tests, and pay attention in class and you will do well.

If you dont get a good grade in the class it is your fault and your fault only. She teaches you what is on the test, but makes it real world applicable. She seems intimidating but she is a softy. One of my favorite professors at pepperdine

She covered a lot of material in 14 weeks, but was able to move through it quickly because she is very knowledgeable. The teaching wasn't spectacular, but she made a good effort to have some fun with a tough, dry subject. Many of my fellow students struggled, but I was able to keep up. She gives plenty of examples for tests. Study ALL of them!

Tough, but she knows the topic well.  Is very willing to help you understand after class, but moves really fast during class so pay attention.  Yes, you do have to work through all of her past quizzes and exams, but the practice really helps you understand what to do.

By far the WORST class that I have taken since being in the BSM program. The teacher makes no attempt to make the material or class interesting. You end up teaching yourself the material via her practice exams and by reading the book.

Dr. Kendrick is beyond kind and sweet. However, the class is awful in general. Very difficult, SO many readings (2 per week, which take you forever to finish) and one MASSIVE project. The exams are all essay/writing based. If you want to pass, go to her office hours, they helped me SO much and she is VERY much willing to help you. VERY hard class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a very friendly and kind teacher and very helpful during office hours. She grades the essays generously and balances quizzes, assignments, and essays well, so if you try your best in the class, you should be able to get a good grade! The only downside was her lectures which could have been presented w/ less context and make it more engaging.

She's nice as a person but unless you love history, this class is extremely dull. There are 20-page readings before every class with reading reflections with 3-7 questions and between 3-8 sentences depending on the question, direct quotes from the text with every answer. Every reading is an excerpt from a different book so no textbooks at least.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: She is overall nice but she is bad at responding to emails and never replied to me at the end of finals after writing her a long email, I just dont feel like she really cares about her students at all, her class is also super boring and so are her lectures. Lots of reading and essays.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Amazing prof, take if you can

Absolutely amazing in every way! I highly suggest you take her. This class is a little more writing heavy than I expected, but I personally love to write. She is kind, lays out her expectations well, and very knowledgable. I want to take her for another class if I can.
Very nice professor who wants the best for students. Clear lectures and structure. 5 quizzes, 2 exams, and a research paper. Very manageable. Take proff Kendrick!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Awesome class, but very difficult and sometimes frustrating. Expect little direction. Do your due diligence with the assignments and  you will be fine. Also, don't let anybody in  your group slack, else you will feel undue stress. Best if you can work well as a team.  At Utah State University

He is by far the hardest professor I've had the opportunity to take yet.  Brough does get a lot of flack because he doesn't give "clear direction" for the assignments. Instead, he gives you an outline and lets you take it any way you want.  He wants you to be critical and back up what decision you make... Quizzes suck though.

Most likely the hardest class I have taken for my undergraduate. I really enjoyed how he wants his students to succeed. It was a challenge and I liked it. He prepares you for the real world. If you have the chance to take his class be prepared to put some time and thought into the class.

Terrible class at Utah State.  Does not help at all and you are pretty much fending for yourself the entire time.  I was tempted to go to the dean and complain that he should do something about it.  He was never clear on any of his assignments. I'm a 3.95 student and barely have a B+ in his class and it's a miracle I do. I'm not the only one either

Best teacher I have ever had. Extremely clear in his teachings, uses real world examples, class discussions, no midterm, open book final, group project that is actually fun, lots of guest speakers who are actually interesting! you will actually learn and enjoy learning in his class! I recommend this class 100%

Good teacher, lots of group work, so hopefully you get a good group. He is very willing to work with his students, so if you need help make sure to talk to him. Overall he is a great guy, who stresses practical learning, which means no busy work. Definitely take his class if you can.

pretty interesting class. no midterm but grade is heavily based on a group simulation and team cases so make sure you have a good team. brough is super helpful and really educated about the subject. i would take another one of his classes.
Travis is the best professore I have ever had at Pepperdine. He was so interesting andgavev you the opportunity ot
Super straight forward, super boring

He knows what he's talking about and he knows a lot about the subject. His voice is kind of monotone though and the class that I took with him was at 8AM so that just made it worse. Other than though, if you're interested enough in the subject, then you'll look past those trivial things and do well in the class.

Ok......what ever you do never take this professor, especially if you are an athlete. The amount of work for a religion 101 class is an absolute joke.  2 page paper for every class..quiz for every class (that is a tough quiz).class is made up also of a 12 page research paper, 10 minute presentation and 3 exams-r hard (also quizzes and other papers)
Terrible class, don't take it.
He's a nice guy but very awkward and tough to find interesting. He tried hard but I feel like he's unconfident and boring. One of the least interesting classes I ever had.
Very straightforward, helpful. Easy quizzes and exams, just do the readings and take notes in class.

An excellent teacher.  As a person, she has good manners, dresses neat, very decent and a credit to Pepperdine University.  She would make a good president of this university or run for governor of California.
Great person, bad teacher

Awesome teacher.  Totally got me to come to class.  She made school fun for me and I never wanted to miss a class.  Dr. Benson, is by far one of the best teachers I've ever had in my 5 year college career.
She's amazing and really was an inspiration. Her real life experience in the field was fascinating. Made me think about teaching.

Dr. Benson is a nice lady who cannot teach.  She did not display enthusiasm for teaching us PR and she brought her noisy kids into class on several occasions.  She also sometimes popped in videos and never returned.  Several of us switched our majors.
Fantastic teacher. Really cares about her students. Knows her stuff. Great advisor too. Total babe.
Complete waste of time...

The sweetest, mellowest, and kindest professor I've ever had. She really cares about each of her students, and will go out of her way to see how you're doing and how she can help. There's a lot of material, but she makes it fun to learn and her tests are pretty similarly structured. I also love how she prays every Monday before class!

Dr. Dent is my idol.  She's so difficult, but so amazing.  She prays at the beginning of the week in her classes which is really cool, and also she goes into great depth and really helps her students when they need it.  Because she covers so much though, her tests are super hard.
Very difficult class. Dr. Dent is an extremely tough grader and makes it difficult for her students to feel safe about their grades. A very large amount of studying for decent grades. Glad its over.

Wow this class was difficult. Awesome teacher who really cares about her students but her tests are just too hard. At the end, half the class dropped, and even the students who remained had low grades. Really good at teaching but not very good at evaluating her students.

Dr. Dent is an amazing teacher and person. She gives great lectures and really does care about her students. Her only real flaw is that she gives tests that are entirely too hard. I studied 30 hours for a test and earned a D. Half the class dropped and a majority didn't do well. She really is a kind person, but her exams don't evaluate effectively.
I don't think any science GEs are easy at Pepperdine...but she made this one interesting. The subject itself is hard, but the cool labs we did made up for it. I learned a lot.
One of the best, most difficult professors I've had at Pepperdine. Though her classes are challenging, she is a very helpful, very skilled educator who cares deeply about her students.

AMAZING PROF!! He is incredibly engaging.... really quirky guy but great if you appreciate a little dry humor and sarcasm. Class is always fun and he makes you feel really calm going into quizzes and tests. Super helpful with any questions in class and really WANTS to see you succeed... 10/10
Fisher is nice and engaging. He is a little awkward, but his jokes are funny and he knows what he is talking about. Everyone in my class loves him. (easy, too!!)
The class is not easy, but Dr. Fisher is really fair and helpful.  He is a really nice guy and cares about his students. The tests are tough, but he is a great teacher for calc 3!

Dr. Fisher is a great professor!  One of the best I've had so far.  He does have an interesting way of teaching calc; he doesn't go in order of the book's chapter, but the way he teaches made sense to me.  He also has a really awkward sense oh humor!
Great Teacher! take his class for Math GE

Pay attention to the section I listed. He's a decent person and he's really smart but he has got to be THE WORST math teacher ever. The entire class focuses on learning math backwards (you'll see if you don't heed my warning) and the only people who do well are those who have had calculus before. Homework can take hours. Avoid if at all possible.

Dr. Fisher was a great professor. Calc III was my hardest class, but that was expected. Also, he was the only Calc III professor when I took the class. Don't worry about him. He's an awesome guy and really cares about his subject and his students. If you do the coursework and apply yourself, you'll be fine.

Prof Carlsen was one of the worst professors I've ever had. If you can avoid taking him, I highly recommend it. He forgot to give us our final, then gave it to us late and didn't apologize or offer any sort of grade bump for it. He routinely forgot assignments, changed homework 6 hours before it was due, and penalized students for his mistakes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Prof Carlsen is a seriously tough grader. He assigns homework to be due before every single class on material we haven't talked about yet. The readings vary in length from 3-10 pages or possibly more. He grades tests pretty harshly also. The class gets boring and it's easy to see that he gets frustrated with the lack of participation.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Carlsen is one of the best Spanish professors I have had at Pepperdine and he cares about his students as well as Spanish. He is available when needed and regularly updates your grade on courses (which is great because you always know where you stand)

The class is extremely difficult when it comes to tests and quizzes. On a day to day basis, it is enjoyable and helpful, but testing is usually difficult. Other 251 classes are much easier than 251 with Carlsen, but I did enjoy the class for the most part.

He is a great person, but a terrible teacher. I got an A in this class but I feel bad for the people that don't know spanish very well. He wastes his time in class, and he gives big projects but only one night to work on it.
He is a great professor who really knows the material. Sometimes his requirements are unclear, but if you talk to him, he is always willing to help clarify. Lots of work, but a great class.

Carlson is a really good teacher. The man knows his stuff, I was surprised to see a white man teaching Spanish but he really knows his stuff. He makes the subject fun and funny, he continuously keeps the class entertaining. The exams are pretty hard and he is a stickler on spelling and everything. But he makes it bearable. I'd def recommend him.

As someone mentioned before professor Tran definitely seems like she has a chip on her shoulder. She will pick favorites and that is reflected in her grading. Extremely unfair, would never take again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: She only grades well if she takes a liking to you as a student.

Tran is an alright professor. As someone who got an A, I can say she def picks favorites. Smile and participate, it will go a long way with her. She never takes late work and is super strict on that. Show up, she likes the people who show up a lot. She cares about her students, but just has too much of an attitude for what COM 180 is. Not that hard
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: She graded the speeches subjectively. COM 180 should not have been this difficult; even if you spend a lot of time preparing the outlines and practicing, it is hard to get a good mark if she doesn't like you as a student.

Very heartless professor that doesn't care about your success. Nice person that has a chip on her shoulder and will make it your problem. If she doesn't like you, you will struggle. Has a VERY strict no-late policy and missing one portion in a speech will give you a near-guaranteed low grade. 

Choose a different COM professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment:
I love Professor Tran, 
She truly cares about her students and takes into account the fact that we have personal lives. 
She is super enthusiastic and fun in class, which makes it engaging and NOT boring. 
She helps you with all your speeches if you reach out to her. Provides a lot of extra credit 
If you have the chance to take her, definitely do
Teacher grades speeches harshly if she doesn't like you.

Just took Professor Christy's religion 102 class and overall she was a great teacher. She was very kind throughout her teaching and always offered to help her students. If you're struggling with the marks, be sure to reach out to her for feedback as it always resulted in a mutual understanding.

I had this professor for an online Intro to Christian Faith course. I have been an undergrad for over 6 years and I have never had an Intro course graded this intensely. Most of her critiques regarded "grammatical errors." However, you must email her to receive notes. Even then, it's vague. If you want your GPA to tank, go ahead and take her.

You have to specifically ask for feedback for each individual assignment or you won't receive it. When she did respond to questions it would be within hours of the assignment being due. There was no communication throughout the class. This was an online class.

Let's put it this way...I got a 55% on the final, and it was curved to an 85.  Her final was impossible (written by Jesus himself?!?!?!).  Don't take her...that is if she is still teaching next semester.
Extremely difficult class. Must have prior knowledge of the Bible to do well. Her tests cover material that was never covered in class. Definitely the worst class I've taken at Pepperdine.

This teacher is completely unhelpful in every way. in order to do well, you need to have an extensive knowledge (basically memorization) of the entire bible. Never ever take her class, seriously don't, its terrible. She has no interest in her students, and i honestly do not understand why she decided to be a teacher in the first place.

The Professor is an inexperienced teacher & really has no desire to help her students. If you are in her class you pretty much need to know the bible beforehand & be prepared for tricky quiz's daily. She is big on group presentations and just reads her unhelpful powerpoint's for the duration of class. I completely do not recommend this professor!!

Solid professor. Taking this class to fulfill a GE requirement, it was not too difficult. For somebody who is not an art person, she doesn't place such a heavy emphasis on having to be good artistically, but you do need to put effort into the class. There is a good amount of homework that can make the class seem more stressful, but not terrible.
great professor, one of the most helpful in all of my years here.  Funny and helpful.

ive been meaning to write a review, this professor is really great, helped me a lot to learn new ceramics techniques, i was really into it and wish i could take it again, its a good release if you have a lot of book classes to get your hands dirty in the clay, teacher really cares about the students, she even stayed after lots of times ,
Useful information for art/education majors.   The projects are really fun, the policy of public education sucks but the teacher does her best to keep it interesting.

Even as a non art major i got a lot out of this class and especially this teacher.  Really helpful, and encouraging.  The assignements were challenging but not out of control for a non art major.  I recomend.
Really enjoyed the class.  Teacher was clear about assignments and grading, and homework was sometimes fun.
Really nice teacher who takes the time to help and genuinely likes her students.

One of my favorite professors EVER! Super knowledgeable about stats, not too heavy of work to do, and he truly cares about his students to make sure they all know how to do the work. 10/10 professor and would highly recommend.

Take him!! DiLellio is truly a Pepperdine GEM! He is honestly the BEST professor I have ever had. The ebooks he utilized were under $4 total. The class was intellectually challenging, but under his instruction, I felt confident in my abilities. If only all of the Pepperdine professors were like him.. I wish he would train other faculty in teaching!

The best professor I've had at Pepperdine thus far. Wish more of the professors at this school lived up the example he sets. He is caring, instructive, helpful and everything you could hope for in a professor.
I love his in real option valuation.
Very intelligent and helpful.  Wish I took Professor Di Lellio's class sooner!!  Applied everything learned from his class at work and other classes.
rating_tags: CARES ABOUT STUDENTS--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Respected by students

comment: Prepare for the tests by going in and seeing him! If you see him once a week outside of  class to explain things, you will get an A on the test (which the tests pretty much determine your grade)  I didn't find this out until after the first test in which I go a D, but I aced the final.   Great teacher though, you won't be disappointed.

This subject in general is difficult, everything is done in excell.   To pass his class, meet with him once a week. There are two main tests (midterm and final) that pretty much determine your grade,  I got a C on the midterm and after that went in once a week every week and pulled an A on the final.   He loves to help but you have toask for it

He is the head of the financial department at Pepp. He has lots of experience in the business field. You will always learn something from his lecture. He is funny and caring. He is busy but he tries to get to know you on a personal level. Be careful his requirement for projects. Some guy did not listen to him and got an F. I'd take him again
He's a great professor! He reaches out to you and wants to get to know you on a more personal level.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great teacher that made learning accounting a lot of fun! One of the best teachers at Pepperdine.
Best accounting professor at Pepperdine! Professional, makes it attainable to succeed in his class if you come to class and do hw. Fair grader and cares about his students.

Favorite professor so far, and it's accounting! Actually engages class in lecture, hw is graded on completion, explains things well and really makes sure you understand and cares.  Has students over for dinner and hosts study sessions before every test.  Take him!

definitely recommend taking him for accounting, as long as you go to class and do the homework you can get a good grade easily, he sets the class up very fairly and makes attendance and completing hw a major part of the grade which boosts it a lot

excellent teacher, very helpful and wants you to succeed, not a very hard class at all, good amount of homework tho, go to class and do all the homework and review for the tests and youll get an A easily
Not caring, Not listening to students' concerns, hard to understand the material, not clear expectations.
This professor is very kind but is a tough grader and does not supply feedback that makes sense in correlation with her grading.

Professor Robles is amazing! Weekly quizzes, 2 exams (midterm and final), and 1 paper. The tests/quizzes are easy if you complete the study guides she provides. Beware that the guides are lengthy but are extremely helpful! She's passionate about what she teaches and is more than willing to help if you have any questions. Highly recommend!

Dr. Gonzalez is a Great teacher! I really enjoyed her class. She has quizzes at the end of class; if you study, they are easy. Show up, do your homework, and study for your midterm and final, and you will do great in her class. She gives excellent feedback and is super accessible outside of class. If you have a choice, take her class!

Professor Robles-Gonzalez is very knowledgable and loves the field of psychology, but is not a personality cut out for teaching. She is hard to relate to and doesn't do a good job connecting with students on a personal level. Lacks compassion for students and has been seen occasionally rolling her eyes or using passive-aggressive tones.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: Tough class overall with weekly quizzes (for all classes). She's clearly passionate about the subject but I didn't feel supported/encouraged in class (at times, she laughed or eye rolled at people's VALID questions). She grades by the rubric so follow that as a guideline for papers. Exams are tough and include vignettes so study them! Lectures drag
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Robles is a high-quality prof. I am very pleased that I got to take her class. The material is heavy and hard but the way how Dr. Robles well prepared and gives very clear lectures made it so much better. She gives excellent feedback and is very caring and respectful. She always was available outside class hours for any extra help. Would recom!

I really liked her, she gives good feedback and wants to help learn. Class never felt too long and I definitely improved. Short story reading/questions before each class but not too much homework, class was discussion based. Definitely would take her again.

Dra. Carlsen is definitely my favorite professor at Pepperdine. She cares about all of her students and is extremely intelligent. Her classes are a lot of work, but I learned a lot and actually enjoyed the assignments. I would recommend her to everyone
My favorite person on the planet!!!!
I love Professor Carlsen! Clear, helpful, encouraging. I would recommend her for sure.

Profesora Carlsen is a very intelligent teacher, who runs her class in a very organized fashion. Her class requires more work than any of my other upper division classes, so you should be prepared to have a lengthy homework packet due every class. She sometimes seems bothered when students make mistakes, so that can be a little overwhelming.

Dra. Carlsen helped me get back into Spanish after a year without classes. Her 252 class gives a great review of the grammar with lots of new tips and tricks. Very happy to have taken it, though I was afraid at first it would be over my head. Strongly recommended.

Doctora Carlsen is a good professor, for phonetics and conversation she was helpful and directed in the course focus. She is pretty intense and sometimes the course work is "overly academic" which more simply put its dry and boring at times. Final note she is a beautiful woman, if that is going to distract you maybe look elsewhere for this class.
Lectures are very clear. Powerpoints are really useful. Homework is very time-consuming but the actual content is not difficult.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Ng is my favorite professor at Pepperdine so far. He has high expectations and assigns a lot of reading and homework, but he is fair, incredibly engaging and knowledgeable, and shows a deep care for his students.

An actual lawyer who loves to teach and cares about his students. Lots of reading/homework, but he explains the content clearly and grades fairly. A super engaging teacher - I found myself enjoying the homework because I enjoyed the lectures so much. You have to work for your grade, but I've found it to be very rewarding.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: I usually don't take the time to give reviews. However, this professor positively deserves it. The class is challenging and requires a lot of your time. But it is worth it! The professor teaches with great enthusiasm, he is good at it, and you can tell he loves it. I definitely would recommend himthe best professor at Pepperdine, without a doubt.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: I like that Professor Ng has his student's best interest at heart.  Always available and never makes students feel like they are a burden.  All of my classmates seem to really like the class when we talk about it.  I think as a whole the class really respects him as a person. Probably one of my best professors at Pepperdine.
Professor Ng is by far one of the best professors I've had.  The combination of the passion, qualification, and engaging teaching style he brings to the classroom is invaluable.  The best.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Professor Ng teaches in an engaging manner that enables us to learn hard content. He gives plenty of real world examples. He is one of the most caring and compassionate teachers. He knows what he is teaching and his tests are challenging because they force us to truly understand the material but he is so available and willing to help us.

Prof. Hartung was easily one of my favorite profs. She understood that COM180 is very anxiety-inducing for students, so she tried to make class as easy as possible. She'd lecture for a little bit, and then we would work together in pairs or groups to do class activities. For a speaking class, she made it very bearable and I deeply appreciate that.
She is the sweetest would definitely recomend

Dr. Hartung is an awesome professor to take COM180 with at Pepperdine. She is so supportive of you developing into the best speaker you can be. She is also very available for advice outside of classes. Her speech feedback is super detailed and very helpful. Her grading is fair and very wholistic. I hate public speaking but I still loved her class.

Made COM180 bearable. 4 total speeches - 1 of those was online. Only 1 completely memorized speech. Prof Hartung was a very easy, fair grader. Homework due once a week on Saturdays. Doing speech outlines got tedious but were ultimately SO helpful. Peer review was nice too. Lectures could get really boring but the group activities helped.
Great professor, really understanding and doesnt assign too much work besides a weekly assignment. Speeches were not too hard, and she is not a hard grader.
Best professor ever! Very kind and caring. Easy A!

I took public speaking class online. Aside from the speeches, there are other easy assignments that will help you get a good grade. You won't fail if you aren't good at speaking, she grades students individually and looks for personal improvement. As long as you put effort in and try your best, you will get an A. She cares about her students
Passionate and quirky, curse a lot about students understanding. Does best when students Spring questions and feedback. This will open his substantial wealth of conceptual knowledge.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Tredinnick grades solely based on subjective personal grudges. Also, badmouths other people & entities. We had a group project. Professor Tredinnick told me that the group projects topic was not his favorite, and also that he had heard some gossip about me that I was ignoring another student! (??) Graded me well below my exams grades.

All of the lectures come directly from the book and the exams also come directly from the book. The instructor does little to expand on the information that has already been delivered (and not very well) by the book. Ultimately it's possible to barely (or never) show up to class and still do fairly well.

Solid professor. Entertaining lectures and seems to care for students. Is fair with grading and tests (gives study guides). One group project that was not my favorite, but was easy enough. Would take again!

Study guide is useless. Get notes from lecture and power points.  Midterm and final was not at all what we expected. Threw us for a loop. Nice man, but boring. Would not recommend taking this class with other intense classes.
Great professor. Really funny and caring, lectures are interesting. One easy to read textbook. Midterm, Final, one paper, and one group project. Very enjoyable, would highly recommend!
No Comments

I took Dr. Rodeheffer back in 2015 for Great Books IV. I'm writing this review because I still think about that class. We read two books that changed my life: Souls of Black Folk by W.E.B. Du Bois & Song of Solomon by Toni Morrison. I remember her teaching style was stern yet her feedback was always super encouraging. 10/10
Pepperdine has Si. Mary's best
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: This discussion based class was a joy with Dr. Rodeheffer. She got most everyone involved and was obviously interested in the subject material. It's a ton of reading, but if you're taking this class that's probably not something you mind. She's kind and witty and gave a lot of great insight into our readings.

This class was so refreshing for me! Rodeheffer is caring, inspirational, and fun. She works really hard to cater her class to her students' strengths and interests. Fun projects, manageable reading, and only one of the super-long essays you come to expect from Great Books. She does a great job of pulling in current events as well.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She was absolutely the highlight of freshmen year. She's super tough and will ask the hard questions, but she really fosters an open learning environment and helps the students grow together and work as a team.

I really enjoyed Dr. Rodeheffer's class. She is an excellent professor and truly knows the material. She also is always looking for ways to make the class fun and interesting. My only critique is that she plays favorites... Even if you are a good student, if she does not like you, you will have problems. Be careful about how you act/what you say.

Best Great Books professor! Dr. Rodeheffer is incredibly intelligent, loves the material she teaches, and is always happy to advise students' essays or just talk about life. This is a professor who genuinely cares about her students, and she has made my Great Books experience truly GREAT!

She is amazing, cares so much, very helpful! 2 big tests during the semester, 6 one-page intensive essays, a presentation final and little reading reflections. I learned a lot in this class and enjoyed it, the key is participation, good note-taking, and actually reading (or at least skimming well). You get a half page of notes for the tests too!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took Dr. Gould for ENG 201 (wasn't an option provided). She's the sweetest, and I'm so sad to have to leave her class. She's kind and cares about her students personally. She's super easy to reach outside of class, and her office hours are so welcoming. Dr. Gould has made me a better writer and a deeper critical thinker. Recommend 100%.

Im surprised by some of these responses.. Professor Gould has shown more love and care for her students than any professor i've encountered. She is not a hard grader, you just have to actually try in your responses and study for the tests. She genuinely cares about her students, and her course is not overly demanding. I would recommend taking her!
The professor acted rude towards me on several occasions. She is overly harsh in grading, at times. I would have chosen another professor if I could take English again.
I took ENG 101 with Gould. She is very very very sweet person! Very helpful and great teacher!

One of the best teachers I have ever had. She is very supportive of everyone, and she would let me meet with her to proofread papers before submitting them (&most professors I've had won't). The class is very reading intensive, but its so worth it. She makes lectures engaging and often related it to our majors. No doubt I'd retake her class
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Dr. Gould is a true gem. She cares deeply about her students and makes it a priority to help everyone do well. There are discussions every class about the assigned texts so be prepared and do your readings. Heavy on assignments but they help you do better for your exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Love this teacher. She is very involved in theatre and makes an effort to make all of her classes fun and entertaining. Its a very easy class as well as we usually just eat meals while she teaches.

She is such a space cadet!!! She is hilarious and does bomb accents (British and Irish are pretty legit). But, she does not teach. You do "group work" (more like facebook time for 30 mins) which is pointless and then you leave. She picks favorites and if you are not her favorite, good luck on getting an A on your speech!  I am barely pulling an A-.
She is a tough speech teacher. She picks favorites and if your not her favorite you will have a tough time getting good grades on the assignments. I do not recommend taking speech with this teacher.

Well, she basically hates her job and makes it well known from day one. Does have a sense of humor, but plays favorites alot. I would make sure to do well on the speech outlines, and remember to do all the "my speech labs". She is better then barrientos and Shores.

Highly disappointing teacher and class.  Expected a high level class about the finer points of public speaking and persuasion but got a 5th grade class taught by an unpolished and unprofessional teacher.  On a side note, she called the Qing dynasty the "Quinn" dynasty.  Unrelated to speaking but cmon.

She's very energetic and loves telling personal stories.  Class time goes by quick, there isn't too much hw except writing speeches or short critiques.  She grades kind of hard on speeches though.  She's very conservative, keep that in mind while choosing a speech topic.  She let us use notes on the midterm, not the final.  I got an A.

Great professor, hard class. Some people complain about this course but if you put in the time outside of class and go to his office hours you will be fine. Amazing guy and cares about his students and is passionate about sports medicine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Had Him for 3 classes ( anatomy, physiology and health and disease) Make sure you take good notes since thats what he asks on tests - not based on book. Loves case study scenarios for tests. Go to his office hours , he knows a lot! People underestimate him because they compare him to the proffesors who previously taught the classes. Talk in class
Powerpoint Reader.

His tests are extremely hard and he isn't the best at clarifying things in class. Honestly one of the hardest classes I have take so don't expect the A to come easy let alone a B. If you have other classes with a lot of work involved don't take his class because you will need to devote a majority of your studies to his class if you want to do well.

Dr. Klika is a good, but tough teacher - you just need to put time and effort in and you will get a good grade. Go to his office hours and get to know him because it will help and he is very knowledgable, plus he has a lot of connections. Take his class and do well and you will learn a lot.

He own his own cancer clinic, so he knows his stuff. his exams are basically the lectures in class. Lab is very easy. He is funny and helpful :) .. its still a science class, so expect to put some effort. READ THE TEXT BOOK. it helps a lot (but only read the chapters and sections he covers in class)

Professor Andreas is a tough speech grader, who sometimes overlooks or misses something that is said while grading your speech. Be sure to re watch your speech and make known to her what she missed. I do not recommend taking her class. I suggest David Tarvin for Comm 203.

She's perfectly nice. You pretty much teach yourself through reading and study guides. Her lectures are long, boring, and a waste of time especially since she doesn't cover what's on the study guides except for maybe three minutes. I think she knows her stuff but she's one of the worst professors I've had at Pepperdine.
Lets just say she was probably the second worst teacher I have had at Pepperdine

She is not an easy professor. She expects you to work hard and follow instructions. She is always around after class to help and I found her guidance truly helpful. She is such a kind-hearted person and really wants to see her students succeed!

Dr. Andreas is one of the best professors I have had a Pepperdine...She leads a good mix of clear, organized lectures and interesting group discussion. She grades relatively hard on papers, but if you follow her rubric you shouldn't have much trouble. I definitely recommend any class she teaches.

She is a great teacher, but grades really hard on speeches. The textbook is useful for speeches, but only needed for the midterm and final. If you put in the effort, you should get a grade that reflects that.
so no one is going to comment on the fact that she played the voice of ms. Helga G. Pataki on Hey Arnold!  ?
good teacher

She is really nice and responds to her emails very quickly.  The lectures are interesting and she knows a lot about the material.  The midterm and final aren't very difficult if you pay attention in class and contribute to the lectures.  Some of the speech grades were harder than others, but overall she is a very fair grader.
She is awesome and so interesting. She is super hot and that makes the class all worth it. She is tough but you will do fine if you put in a little effort!

You will learn a lot but you will have to work extremely hard. Very hard grader. Harsh on students. Prepare for long lectures filled with sarcasm. Overall a good teacher in that you learn a lot, so take her if that's what you're going for, but don't expect an A.
She is a super neat person! Fun class and interesting approach! Great Communicator!
Get ready to read in very specific detail. All her quiz and test questions are taken from her powerpoints. Do all the extra credit, you'll need it. Very knowledgeable but boring lectures.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Shes nice and give lots of extra credit but has high expectations for a GE. Theres lots of reading, Its hard to know what she will test on, and her lectures arent very helpful. She gave a study guide for the final that had 277 terms on it and it and I still felt unprepared. Would probably be a good professor if you have time to dedicate to it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: boring
Real boring, covers a lot of material in a short amount of time. Midterms and final exams are pretty tough. Would not recommend
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dont do this to yourself
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This is an easy class, but boring. The quizzes are usually easy, but every once in a while we will have one that's hard. She goes on random life tangents a lot. She is a nice woman, but I know too much about her life. It is hard to take notes on her slides because she will spend 20 minutes on one and 2 on the next. Nobody pays attention.
One of my favorite teachers. She is very funny.

LOVE Shanna! She gave us all her cell phone number so it was super easy to get a hold of her. She's really quirky but honestly the sweetest and most hilarious person you'll meet. Class was easy but I'm also decent at art. Take her class!! You won't regret it.

Shanna is the sweetest prof there is. She cares so much about each and every one of her students and makes her art courses assessable to everyone. She totally meets you where you are at and pushes everyone to create the best work you can! All she expects is you to put in time on your projects and tells you directly If she believes you havent!
Shanna is so sweet!! She is an extremely encouraging and supportive person and professor. I would take any class with her!
Take her class! So many works but worth it

Shanna is super sweet and funny. She is definitely artistic. Honestly, don't think there is a person in the world she dislikes. she takes you to the beach and you get an A if you complete the project and follow instructions. Easy and fun. Take her!
She was amazing. Definitely one of my favorite professors ever!
SUCH AN AMAZING PROF! She made classes super interesting and engaging. Gives extra credit and if you put the work in you'll do well. Take her classes, you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Seriously an amazing professor. Teaches with a true passion and cares about her students. I think participation goes a long way her classes. If you really engage with the class you'll be rewarded. She's always available outside of class to answer questions and truly goes out of her way to help you understand. PLEASE TAKE RIZKALLAH.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Another great professor within the INTS department. I hate comparing profs but very similar to Vabulas. She was very caring and understanding during the weird covid-hybrid format and wanted to make sure we all succeeded. She was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the content. Assignments were tricky but if you put in the work you'll get an A

Loved learning with Dr. Rizkallah. She will broaden your perspective and change your worldview, which is the whole reason for taking IR classes. Lots of reading. Graded based on a few quizzes, midterm, final, and some sort of project. I loved 465 with her as that is her specialty. Expectations were clear and manageable. Super inspirational.
Amanda is nice, but very disorganized and all over the place. How she grades is ridiculous. Take Vabulas instead if you want structure and prefer organized learning.

Amazing and intentional professor. Loves everything she teaches about. One massive research paper, a midterm and a final. Clear on grading, but very difficult grader. Works with you through anything that may come up. Truly an amazing professor, overall.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: First day of class he said if you like structure, this class isn't for you. He emphasizes going to class/participation and says it's very hard to get full points on participation. Class time is spent doing thought exercises/activities which you do write-ups on as assignments. This class just teaches you how to think in an entrepreneurial way.

Carruth is nice but his lectures are a bit confusing, and the class lacks real-world experience with entrepreneurship. The group activities are creative, yet most the class time feels wasted. Tests are worded difficulty and he gives no clear indication of what to study. Directions for written work are a bit unclear (easy grader on these though).
Has no guidelines for assignments and exams. We did not learn much, and his projects were not the most useful.

As a person, Professor Carruth is super laid back and easygoing. That being said, participation matters in his class and he pays attention to attendance and punctuality. If you show effort and do your homework, you will for sure do well. He has positive energy and a good sense of humor. You won't regret taking his class.

The class itself is not hard (at all) - he is, simply put, the worst professor I ever had... his expectations are unclear and he teaches nothing all class, expecting your entire grade to come from cases that are extremely unclear and the feedback is not helpful - do not recommend
Awesome professor really fun and energetic class. Class is writing heavy but was doable. Two tests, 4 case studies (3 pg. single-spaced), research paper (pg 7-10 ), and forums.

i don't know if this class exists anymore, but she provided a free space for you to say anything, so say anything. there were papers and reading for every class. do them and shes a really kind professor.

I LOVE HER!!!!!!!!! She is literally the best, so insightful, so intelligent, caring, kind, understanding... she does it all! The content of her material is very digestable but also extremely engaging and you truly will learn a lot if you take her. She is an exquisite human.
Dr. Riddle is truly the best professor.  Her class styles are awesome and help you remember the key points.  She gives handouts that are awesome and help you understand the course material! Take her!

Dr. Riddle is an amazing professor. She is clearly passionate about the topics she teaches, and she presents the material in an engaging way. The course load is manageable, and the readings are directly relevant to the class. I learned a ton in this class and would definitely recommend.

Dr. Riddle is a very lenient grader. Her tests are quite easy as she goes over the study guide in depth before the exams, and they are usually open book in this course, so an A is very attainable. As long as you do the assigned reading and take notes during lecture, you will be fine.

Dr. Riddle cares a lot about her students. Her essays and tests are not very demanding as long as you do the assigned readings and speak at least once per class. Her lectures are a little dull, but you can tell that she cares a lot about the subject she teaches. She is a very lenient grader!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Dr. Riddle is an amazing teacher. She cares so much about her students and doesn't overwhelm them with work. She often allows students time to get homework done in class and the work that you have outside of class takes little time. Dr. Riddle is passionate about her class and get ready for some fun group projects. I would recommend her to all.
I took Prof. Cha last spring and he was tough but inspiring. He obviously knows a ton about machine learning and is there if you are willing to put in the effort. Recommend to everyone.

Took Jesse for COSC 210 and could definitely tell he is very knowledgable and well-versed in the subjects he is teaching. Willing to work with students and make adjustments throughout the course to give us the best experience. You'll learn a lot not only conceptually, but also the ability to apply ML techniques to anything you're interested in.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof Cha is not just a great professor, he commits wholeheartedly to his students growth, going far beyond what regular profs do. Giving his own time other than OH for advices. Learning from him has been more enlightening than my entire university experience. His insights are immeasurable. Be proactive and take all your pre-reqs or you will suffer.

Amazing professor! He is knowledgeable in machine learning and cares more about students' understanding and improvement than the test score. He incentivizes students to learn more by providing a lot of opportunities to get extra credit. All the class materials are available. The class is difficult, but you can learn a lot from his class. Take Him!

Prof. Cha is an expert in robotics and applied machine learning. He cares a lot about his students and pushes them to do their best. His classes are challenging as they cover a wide range of advanced material, so make sure you have ample room in your schedule to devote the time that is necessary to succeed. He is very helpful during office hours.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Cha did not teach, he just told beginner students to go up and start talking about advanced topics. He just tries to act smart to make sure no one understands so he looks even smarter. When people question him, he never admits his mistakes. He's not qualified to be a professor based on his one research that he made us critique in class.

Class is really demanding for a GE requirement. Class grade is determined by the midterm, final, research paper, and four summary essays. You will have to give a brief presentation about your research paper as well. As for lectures, make sure you have an eidetic memory because you will not be given the powerpoints of the architecture after.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Very passionate about the topic and the students. I would take Dr. Simonowitz's class every semester if I could. Not too much homework and is very patient to his students so they learn the best way possible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Simonowitz is probably one of the most personable professors I have ever met. If you miss his class he won't hold it against you but he does expect you to keep up by doing the online homework (be prepared it is roughly 2-3 solid hours of homework every night). He is always available to help you during office hours. He truly cares about his students

Professor Simonowitz is an amazing guy who truly cares about getting to know students. One amazing benefit about his class is the small class size. It's really easy to get help during office hours. Arabic is an amazing language. Everyone should take it! Sad that more people don't take it at Pepperdine.

Amazing professor, Wonderful person. He's really passionate about what he does. I was worried at first about the work load and the amount of information, but he makes it easy by giving a study guide before a test. his class was so much fun. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !!!!!!!!!!!

Wonderful guy who really cares about the subject. Be prepared to have LOTS of homework though. He is fairly lenient if you are a few days late, but this just isn't one of those classes you can fall behind in. I did about 2 hours of homework a night plus studying.

Ty is such a cool professor and really is caring about all of his students. He really is supportive of your ideas, and tries his best to push your idea further and make you think more. He is so chill and hilarious, but do know that this sculpture class makes you learn how to operate woodshop tools, solder, and work with plaster... so be prepared!

beware that the projects low key take a long time. the reading was so boring, but yk we power through. he's a stickler for being late and absent (2 freebies, then knocked down half a letter grade for each absence, 2 lates = 1 absence), but its so easy to get 100% on everything. so its good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Ty is a great professor and he cares a lot about his students. He will give you 100% as long as you turn everything in on time and show up on critique days with your finished project. Attendance isn't required, but it's easier to get projects done when you're in class. Assigns occasional readings/short responses. Overall amazing guy and professor!

*For ART491: One of the best profs I have had at Pepp. He cares A LOT and his feedback is helpful. He is strict on deadlines and on making sure you work on your projects, he is very understanding on everything else. He is a great artist himself which is inspiring and shows he practices what he preaches. Take Ty if you get the chance!

Took in Heidelberg, so much different than normal.

Ty is fantastic at what he does. He just wants us to engage with art, and those who don't will still get full marks as long as they do his projects on time. Very chill, funny and lovable guy who pushed me toward my creative potential and gave me confidence. Get to know him, he has a lovely family.

Literally all you have to do is turn things in on time. If you miss something it'll tank your grade because there aren't many assignments, but it's really easy to get a good grade. Fun and chill class. Professor is a cool guy who loves art.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He's a very good professor overall. Teaches with the intention of allowing students to explore their creativity, gives good constructive feedback. As long as you do and submit all your projects in time you get a 100% on the project.
Great Prof! you have to actually put some time and thought into your art if you want an A. Really fun assignments with lots of artistic freedom. Great atmosphere!

The only professor I have taken that was unfair, I worked hard, did EVERYTHING she asked for, and I did it well. She told me to redo an assignment while the Franklin fires were going on while im looking for a place to go. I STILL redid the assignment, but she said she's taking off 10 pt a day cause it was "late." I'll do it burning alive next time.
Want to take a class and feel useless after? Perfect!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Just. Dont.

Took her for ENPR 280 not BA 366. She's a nice professor and she cares about her students, however it was much more work than my 4 unit classes (and this class was only 3 units). A lot of projects and the tests were pretty challenging, had some questions totally irrelevant to the topic. Expect to do a lot of work for this class.

You work with a group for multiple assignments which are a huge portion of ur grade. Dont have a good group good luck. Tests are multiple choice and super easy if you pay attention during lectures, take notes, and study. This class is a lot of work and she grades very nit picky but as long as you put in a lot of effort you will be fine.

AVOID HER IF YOU CAN!! very tough grader and if she doesnt like you for no reason she will report you for anything, everyone was complaining about the amount of assignment and presentations she has, a very overwhelming class, exam was multiple choice and short answer which came from the slides only

Great teacher, makes good use of class time. VERY STRUCTURED CLASS. Tough grader on projects (and there's many of them, inc group projects).
