Ppl said the class was too hard so for my semester she made the tests easier, they're now all multiple choice (avg class grade on them is prob around 90%). I did have to put A LOT of effort into the projects.

Professor Lassu is a good professor, contrary to these ratings. She is very kind, her lectures are actually interesting, and the class is really not that hard. If you are a hard-working student, you can get an A in her class. Her assignments have clear instructions and she grades accurately. The tests and exams are pretty easy if you study.

Dr. Lassu is a kind person. She cares about the stuff she's teaching. However, the assignments she gives are relatively complex papers. I, myself, struggled balancing this class between my major courses and ended up getting a B+. There are easier professors to take BA 366 with. But Dr. Lassu is by no means a bad professor.

Great marketing teacher! Gives a lot of real world examples and makes marketing easy to understand.  All you have to do to get a good grade is follow the assignment instructions and study the lectures which he posts online and goes over in class.  All the information is clearly laid out in the lectures.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: The Professor did a fantastic job of teaching the information clearly and in an engaging way. His classes were fun, entertaining, and very informative. He worked very hard to make sure students felt valued and welcome, while also understanding course information effectively. It was clear he deeply cared about his students' success.

Professor Lim is a great teacher! He cares about his students and goes the extra mile to be available for them and to accomodate them. I believe that the fact that he is a younger teacher allows him to relate better to his students and present the material in a fresh and engaging manner.

I liked that he played Chris Brown before class and sang along, but I did not really learn anything the entire semester there and his grading is more all over the place than Mariah Carey on New Year's Eve. I think he's trying to prove himself, but he really doesn't have it together and I don't think there is any real potential for him moving forwar

Pros: He brings oreos to class; Cons: Everything else. He is inconsistent with his grading and doesn't really care about students at all--he is unwilling to help and I am pretty sure the class did not learn anything beyond the 1st grade "who, what, when, where, and why" questions to ask. Pretty disappointing that Pepperdine is becoming like this.

New to teaching and it really shows, he does not seem to understand the material and simply reads off powerpoint. He is unable to answer questions and is very inaccessible to students. There are absolutely NO rubrics for his class projects, which add up to about 50% of the final grade, so beware, he will grade you based on his personal feelings.

I absolutely love this Professor! She was always willing to spend time outside of class and meet with me once a week for 2 hours. She is always willing to lend a helping hand to anyone in the class. Her tests aren't hard, mostly MC. Simply pay attention and understand the concepts and you're good!

Quiz at the beginning of every class. Very nice lady but very unorganized - she would do a problem on the board then a student would correct her and then she'd have to erase everything and start all over - very confusing to someone who has never taken stats before - if you've taken stats before you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She's an okay professor, and the material is sort of interesting. Her lectures aren't too bad, and there's a lot of group busy work. The class is pretty easy as long as you put forth enough effort. There's a couple of papers you have to write. And there's a service learning component, which is a big part of the class.

I had Bauman my freshman year for my seminar class. I had the chance to take her one last time before I graduated for Life Span Development. She is very kind and knows about the Pepperdine culture so there for she is not there to screw you over. She's a Pepperdine alum. I had a great time in her class. Do your work, study a little and youll get a B

In my opinion, this professor is actually a fantastic educator. If you attend her study sessions and actually go to class, you will most likely do well in her class. She does have 3 question T/F quizzes every class, but those tend to be simple IF you attend classes. She is actually one of my favorite professors so def get to know her!

All Bauman does is read off the lectures. And they're not clear at all. Reading the book all by yourself and not even coming to class is more helpful than listening to what she says because none of it makes sense. DO NOT TAKE BAUMAN

He rewrote the whole textbook in his lecture notes and made it even longer. The material presented in his lecture notes is not all of the material you will be tested on. But you simply do not have enough time to read the book and his notes and attend his lectures. After covid19 and going online, he made the class even longer. I never tried so hard.

A great teacher that has videos in his lectures, which is helpful for visual learners. He also shares his ways of studying throughout the semester. He records the lectures so if you miss a day or need to review a concept its on the class website. Quizzes once week, tests every couple of weeks and Labs are every week.

THE BEST PROF EVER! He is cares about his students and wants them to succeed. You have to keep up with the studying and it's all doable. You can go in during office hours and just talk to him about anything. He is one of the professors I can get educational and spiritual support. He is a prof I really want to keep in contact for the rest of my life

Dr. Dong is the most helpful teacher I've ever had.  Ochem is so daunting, but he makes it easy to understand and interesting.  He is funny, smart, and approachable.  Probably wouldn't have passed ochem had I taken it with another teacher.
Dr. Dong is super sweet and helpful. The way he covers material is very organized and methodical. Tests are hard but fair, you just have to practice a lot.

Dr. Dong is a great professor. He really cares about the students and how they're grasping the information. He's very approachable and understanding. He has a very vast knowledge of the material he's teaching.

This is a very paper heavy course. There is a weekly 2 page reflection paper and then two large projects due for the midterm and final. She is a tough grader but it makes your work better so make sure you follow her critiques on your paper so you do well on the midterm. Her lectures are long but she does go over most of what is covered in the books
APA MATTERS. Her lectures, on the other hand, do not.

Professor Beck is a hard grader, but she is a great professor. If you do the reading and the homework and participate in class discussions, you will do well in this class. She holds space well, knows the material well, and I learned so much from this class.

Very validating/calm persona - mindfulness-based yet no-nonsense taken. Lecture heavy - not certain it was necessary - would have preferred a group discussion or something since there were no exams, just a big project. Once I realized those "highly recommended" notes weren't really necessary to succeed in the course, I just kind of zoned out..

Prof Beck is VERY lecture heavy, she basically just reiterates the information from the async work.  She is a tough grader, if you missed a comma or didn't double space after one sentence she will deduct quite a few points. She is reasonable if life happens and you need additional time for homework. Not my favorite professor but I've had worse.

I enjoyed Professor Beck's class. She is organized, insightful, and presents the material in a thought-provoking manner. She's one of the few Professors I have had that makes me think a lot about class discussions afterward. She greets us as individuals. Expect graduate-level work. She expects clear and concise work. I've learned a lot.

She is not very flexible. If you are going through any type of hard life situation, I would not recommend taking a class from her. She will cancel class without warning, but if there is an emergency with you, she does not care. Even with power outages, she will put no credit if you have no access to the internet because of a natural disaster.

Grade-wise, Prof Zagury will give you pretty much what you deserve for your skill/effort. That can be somewhat disappointing if you're not great at French but you can EASILY get a high B (and an A with good effort). There is light work, imo, and she really just is truly understanding and sweet and wants to see you succeed.

The worst french professor I have had! She nitpicks every single movement you make and uses it to accuse you of cheating. She doesn't make the effort nor does she care to understand your situation, and I heard this applies to international students. VERY SENSITIVE and constantly lectures you about how you should be as a student. Save yourself TRUST

At first prof Zagury seems fun, but you later will find out that she's neither scholarly nor graceful. She will smile and say things in a soft tone, but she will also roast the heck out of you for something completely forgivable. There is a mean spirit somewhere in her. She might also misjudge your academic integrity and accuse you of nonsense.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Joelle makes you work for it, but you learn a lot. You can't help but love her, even at 8 am she's fun and joyful. She will work with you. Her class is for real, and her tests are tricky, but I miss her now that I'm not in Lausanne. I fully recommend her. Even I was able to get up and talk in front of the class by the end. She's awesome.

Joelle is the absolute best. For all Lausanners at all French levels, make sure you take her. She is funny, helpful, and will engage with you if you engage with her. Her classes are always enjoyable (trust me) and she is fully understanding that people come in at different levels of natural linguistic ability
So Joelle reels you in with her sweet and funny personality, but then she will roast you. Get ready for lots of VHL. Joelle is hilarious, but def the more difficult french prof in Lausanne.
Difficult class. Teacher was nice.
she does everything she tells you not to do on your speeches when she teaches: shy, boring, uncomfortable. tests are overly detailed and do not teach you anything...
VERY VERY BAD TEACHER!!! DONT TAKE HER!!!
Not a very good teacher. Could have been more enthusiastic and helpful. Mega frown.
Not very clear on her expectations, and lecture consists of her reading the PowerPoint. Although she is a nice person, I really didn't enjoy the class.

She's a nice woman and is fairly laid back. She grades fairly on the speeches, but beware, the tests are harder than you would expect. (It helps to do the reading even though it isn't the most exciting material.)

RAFA IS THE BEST PROFESSOR EVER! Also the director of the Pdine Buenos Aires program, he is as easily approachable & loved by both Malibu & Argentina crews. His class is easy, fun, and creative. He doesn't care if you don't study, as long as u can creatively BS it. Textbook - dont buy it. Just write a good paper & present it well, and you're good!

The best prof ever!  Rafa is funny and realizes FINALLY what teaching is about.  No stupid quizzes about $h!t we'll never need to remember, just conversations about real-life, need-to-know things.  The icing on the cake is the fact that there are very very few assignments.  Brilliant guy and a great class.  If only all Pdine profs were like him!!!!
No Comments
RAFA! IM INNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN!

Rafa is the best guy you will ever meet!! He is the director of the Buenos Aires program and the best one, at that. He's a laid back kinda guy with excellent communication skills. His class was pretty easy and we talked about other things half the time. Take his class if you ever get the chance.
Great professor. Only teaches during the summer. He's a great guy and loves to interact with his students. His classes are easy and you also learn a lot. It's not hard to get an A.

Me having Professor Sitter as a Professor is truly an experience I will never forget. He knows the subject, the industry, and he wants to know you as a student. He gives amazing feedback and enough time to finish assignments. He is truly a professor I am more than looking forward to taking again in the future.
He is an amazing professor. I will definitely be taking him again. He is very knowledgeable of the film industry. He does not respond well to emails; however, he will answer questions in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: He is the man. Literally one of few film/production professors who knows what they're talking about and has real industry experience. He is very approachable and willing to go the extra mile to get you gigs beyond his class. Exactly what you want in a production professor.
he's alright

Sitter is awesome. I have had him for 4 different classes now and have loved every single second of every single one of them because he is engaging, hilarious, and knows a lot about what he teaches. I would definitely recommend him to anyone.
Sitter is a great guy who knows his stuff! He's really fun and easygoing, and I like his teaching style. His class is one of my top 3 favorite classes in college.
I took Professor Orozco for both SART 201 AND SART 320. I would recommend taking him for SART 201, but not as much for directing. However, he is very inspiring and encourages his students.

Get ready for a good learning experience, because Orozco is a gem of professors. Not only does he know scripts, but he also wants to know you. He is an extremely caring professor and wants to make sure you succeed as a student.

AMAZING professor! I love professor Orozco so much. He is super flexible and is willing to work with you on anything you need. He is really caring and understanding and a pretty lenient grader. His class is super fun and he is such a funny guy.

*film production/studies student DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! sure, com students might like the guy because he guarantees you an easy "A" at the beginning of the semester, but if you're looking to learn something, skip Orozco all-together. He makes sexist remarks, doesn't bother to learn students' names, and gives terrible feedback. A waste of money.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I really enjoyed taking COM 205 with Professor Orozco, he really cares about his students and makes sure that "no student gets left behind" in terms of assignments and projects. As long as you put in the effort, show up, and submit assignments on time, you'll do well! Would definitely recommend him as a professor!

Professor Orzoco has been one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine! For Com205, you do basically all of the work in class so there is never a lot of homework. He is very chill and cares deeply for his students, answers emails promptly. You write a few scripts and film in groups during class time. It is very fun and I look forward to the class.
Very kind teacher who really cares about her students. TAKE HER! English 101 was a breeze and I learned a lot.

TAKE HER!!!! best decision you will make. She is so lovely, kind, and caring. She treats her students like her children in terms of how caring she is. We love her so much! Great prof- super smart too.

Dr. Bonnici is so kind and caring- she really cares about her students and is very understanding. BUT, she is a tough grader for essays. 3 Essays total for the entire semester. Final is a revised essay- very simple and easy. Honestly, lectures are VERY boring, so participate- it makes class so much better. I recommend her b/c she is very kind.

The best professor I've ever had, seriously cares about you, the class was unbelievably easy, just all around like a dream professor, would take this class in a heartbeat, very little homework or work in general, very good grader, take this class over any other one trust, don't even consider another teacher for English 101.

I had the pleasure of being in Dr. Bonnici's ENG101 class last fall. She elevated my writing capabilities and cared about her students tremendously. She applauds you for participating in relevant and original dialogue. She also is accessible outside of the classroom. I wish Pepp had more professors like her! :(

She is a great professor but makes the class a lot harder than what it needs to be. For instance why is there a midterm and final for a class that focuses on fairy tales. I would much rather had be all essay based than exams because it seems pointless to me

Rel 300 bioethics with Dr. Estes was great, Thought-provoking lectures, interesting readings, a lot of class discussion. He is one of the nicest professors here and is always willing to answer any questions you have
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Estes is so kind and caring. You can tell he really cares about ethics especially applied ethics. I've gone to his office hours and told him about personal things and gave me really good advice. I recommend everyone take him and will always remember him as such a compassionate professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr estes makes the class environment super enjoyable and welcoming. The work load is pretty good he assigns you a reading or two to prepare for a quiz in the next class session and it is super easy as long as you just simply read. his class is very fun and makes you think really hard about very interesting and relevant situations.
Hes the GOAT. He cares for his students and is very understanding when it comes to grades and extensions.
Very nice guy. Class is simple and fair. I learned a lot and I loved the class. He is very understanding and would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Estes is a great professor who is super accessible. Very passionate about the subject and the course is interesting. His syllabus is very clear, if you do the assignments and study for tests, you will do just fine.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Amazing professor. Super understanding that it's a GE and you have other work. Every assignment he allows a 3 day extension. There is an in class assignment every Thursday based on readings. If answered w/ effort, he gives full credit Mondays we take notes & have interesting lectures+discussions! If you take good notes, participate, and study,

Ron is an awesome professor!   He emphasizes that students put things into their own words and by doing so solidifies the knowledge into them---guarantee of much deeper understanding of material then just simple memorization. He only test on what he has time to fully cover and explain, grade 2 , 10 question short essay exams, 50% of grade each.
I am currently a Senior at UCSC. Ron is an exceptional. Ron is the best professor I have ever met. He truly cares about his students. I will never forget Ron.
Dr. Ronald is one of the best professors I ever had! You will be lucky to be in his class. I am lucky I took a summer class with him at UCSC! he is very helpful.
He's the man, too bad he's gone
One of the best teachers I have ever had--Informative, kind, interested in teaching and helping students understand difficult subject matter.  Great discussions...

Den Otter may be the best professor I have yet to encounter at Pepperdine. Extremely thorough in his explanation of the material! Can basically get a B in his class just by attending and taking notes, but to get the A you would actually have to read the material. Very funny and extremely intelligent

Most would say she is the worst professor ever, but I wouldn't say so. Her tests are  tough, but she really isn't that bad. I actually wasn't doing as good as I normally do it classes because of how she teaches (not interesting), but I spoke with her outside of class, and she really helped me out. Take advantage of the help she offers.

There was no syllabus to follow along the course with so I never knew what was expected of me or when, there was no textbook so there was nothing to reference back to before tests, and the PowerPoint slides contained no content whatsoever just a picture. If you can memorize what 200 pictures looked like for each test, you'll be good.

The entire class consisted of 3 test grades (90%) and 3 short participation assignments (10%). I didn't open the textbooks once, but I would say going to class makes a big difference. I never made above an 87 on a test in this class, but thanks to the curve, I managed to snag an A-. She does have reviews for the tests that mostly reflect the tests.
Here's your chance to be more specific

Not your typical Pepperdine professor however, not as bad as people say. She weighted the exams so much that people who had Fs on all exams will end with Bs. She doesn't go out of her way to help but with 400 complaining students I don't really blame her. Don't even need to go to class go to the review and the exam is given away.

She is disrespectful, condescending, harsh, inconsiderate, and rude. I can't believe Pepperdine feels this woman has the capacity to teach such a notorious GE (and one that is required to take at the school, nonetheless). She does not represent the Pepperdine mission and clearly does not wish her students to succeed in any capacity.

Professor Kim is an okay guy. He cares a lot about the subject matter he teaches but he is a harsh grader and his tests are really difficult where it feels like you cannot get the answer right ever. He is funny and enjoys students but his class is just too over the top hard compared to the other higher level courses.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: dry lectures
Although I learned a lot from this course, it was unnecessarily exhausting and mentally draining. Grading scale/method is a bit weird too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Kim is kind but lacks a lot when it comes to class. There are unrealistic answers to all of his fact patterns and tests. He writes the answers to fill in the blank very specific so it is very hard to even match what he writes. Most instructions are not clear and gives a very unfair advantage on his end. Lectures are dry and hard to follow

I'm torn about this class! I took this class bc media and b law were closed, so as an IMC major, I felt behind already. Kim is so intelligent and cares about his students learning the info. However, I found his test(s) impossible and his grading criteria very hardcore. I somehow managed a good grade, but struggled the entire semester. be prepared!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: He is not a good teacher. He knows none of us knew law material before the class, but talks to us like we understand everything and won't explain anything in a coherent way. He expects a lot from us and gives no feedback for improvement. He is also very boring and goes off on too many tangents so lectures make no sense.

Best econ professor I've had so far here. Super caring professor and doesn't make you feel bad if you don't understand something. He's very helpful during office hours and is really flexible. Only had a few homework assignments, but midterm does take a good chunk of the grade. One final project, no final test - moves class online after midterm

Professor Cho is super accommodating and patient with students. His lectures can get confusing sometimes, but he does put in a lot of effort to make the subject very approachable. Super interesting to talk to as well
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Cho is fantastic and extremely knowledgeable. He is clearly extremely qualified as a professor for both his past teaching experience at LSE and his past work experience in consulting and banking. All of that knowledge and experience contributes to lessons that feel pertinent and applicable to the real world.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He truly cares about his students and their grasp of the material. He can sometimes get off track or give super detailed explanations, but he will send clarifying materials later if he felt his point wasn't succinct enough. The midterm was clear, the project was clear, and there isn't too much work in the class. He is super fun to talk to.

His lectures can be difficult to understand at times, but Professor Cho is one of the smartest people I have ever met in my life and he truly tries his best to get his students to understand the material. He always takes time to review the material before tests and is a super interesting guy to talk to!

Prof. Cho is one of my favorite professors so far. He comes in with a ton of practical expertise, engaging, clear, and caring. Pay attention in class. Choose an easy project topic. The midterm is huge. Made me passionate about stats.
BEST PROFESSOR AT PEPPERDINE!
Great teacher who really cares about his students and their lives.  Teaches life lessons and is a very fair.  One of the best profs at Pepperdine.

Prof. Yates is one of the most caring individuals if you take the time to get to know him. He truly wants to be the best teacher he can and asks for open and honest feedback.  Clear, open to all questions, and very helpful. Gives great feedback, really wants his students to succeed. Writing intensive, but nothing you can't handle.  I love this man!
He thinks that he is too good for anyone. Pepperdine should ask him to retire. What he teaches in class is useless. He try be funny but he is not.

Dr. Yates hadn't taught Organizational Behavior for 10 years before last semester, but he did a pretty decent job. The class was definitely much harder than the other OB sections, which are usually jokes, but he realized this and evened things out. He's very competitive and doesn't hide it.
Great inspiring teacher and stretches you to do your best. very caring and understanding. willing to work with you. course load is somewhat heavy
The class is a speech class and he understands some people are natural public speakers while others are not, and grades you on your own personal growth.

Professor Kalinkewicz is great at what he does and is obviously passionate about it. He is very helpful, kind, knowledgeable, and funny. He makes class interesting. He teaches things and explains projects and grading very clearly. He gives great advice and also listens well to everyone's opinions and stories during class discussions.

Karl is really the best and has a lot of interesting things to share if you talk to him about non class subjects as well. I learned a lot in his class and definitely improved as a speaker. He is honestly really cool too.

Professor K is great! Interesting lectures with fun activities, you will want to attend class! For tests, the study guide is key, don't forget to take notes during class or study off the powerpoint if you get one. For speeches, pay attention to his critiques, and you will do fine! You must take this class for COM 180! Also, he is an amazing cook!
I really enjoyed the class.

Very good class! He keeps the class interesting and fun, by using hands-on teaching. We don't usually need to bring our book to class and he really tries to help you understand the material. He's also VERY funny, and extremely chill.

I cannot begin to even remotely think of a reason to take this class unless you actually need it for abroad. Take another professor if possible, because Villegas is notoriously difficult and gives an unnecessary amount of quizzes. When my class asked what to study for a quiz in April, she would just say "study everything you learned this year."
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Villegas expects you to prioritize her class above all. You MUST speak spanish in class & she will basically expect you to be a native speaker everyday. This will tank your participation grade. She never specifies what to study and expects you to remember every thing which makes it so difficult to do well with the immense material.

The most caring, genuine professor you'll ever meet. Is she tough? Yes! What are you in college for is the question you might need to ask yourself if you're worried about a challenge. BUT-- you will enjoy learning a new language, and yes, if you do as Profe says, you will walk away with a firm foundation that will stay with you for life.

Profesora Villegas seems tough, but she only expects to be afforded the same respect and discipline she provides you indiscriminately. I took two classes with her between 2004-2008 and at first, I honestly didn't think I'd return to her, but the second course was my choice. She truly cares about her students and will listen if you reach out to her.

Unhelpful and needlessly difficult, Profe Villegas runs her class like a drill sergeant. Expect 100s of vocabulary words a night, she expects and assigns hours of work a night, and springs quizzes on her unprepared students all the time. She assigned 75 vocabulary words the class before the final and expected us to have them all memorized. AVOID!

She's really nice & helpful. Makes class interesting & fun. Truly cares about her students. You actually have to study to do well though, although studying in excess amounts isn't necessary. I recommend her!

this was an art history class, which was fun for me but i think she was like hum 313 i can do whatever because you arent going to go further. shes very knowledgable on the subject, but the 4 hr classes were grueling. shes super cool as a person though and she likes creativity with your projects.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Test heavy

comment: i took her abroad in italy over summer, so the class was 4 hrs, which was horrific, but it was interesting we did field trips and it had to do w the history of italy. the grading was very unclear, low key idk if she even read my papers. i lost points for titles?? she never explained. but love her shes iconic.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I've never been so touched by a teacher in my life. She is an absolutely incredible Professor and if you can, I implore you to take a class with her. She wants YOU to learn and lets you do presentations and papers on topics you like! What a cool and FASHIONABLE Professor. Readings and course work were very manageable!
Dr. Mazzanti is an amazing Professor who is well respected and kind. She wants you to succeed and enjoy the material.

This class was 4hrs long but the professor somehow made it engaging and interesting. I really enjoyed learning and taking the exams! She also gave plenty of room for you to do your papers on your own interests within the class material and is very caring. I have much respect for Dr. Mazzanti and would absolutely take her classes again if I could.

Allora, attenzione, I hate learning and I never do the readings for any class BUT I actually loved doing the readings and learning in her class. Professor Mazzanti is a queen and a legend. She is the most interesting and amazing professor you will have. She appreciates when you show a willingness to learn and rewards you kindly for it.
She was a pretty mid teacher. I was never really engaged during her lectures and I wanted to pass out. Nice enough lady, but definitely not my favorite class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Such a caring lady and one of the best professors in the Florence program. She cares about everyone and wants everyone to succeed. Fairly easy compared to some of the humanities courses on Malibu campus. Take her!!!

Although she may have great intentions, she cannot teach. Unfortunately, this world is not based on how sweet you are, so would I take her again? Probably not. We learned way more about her personal life than the class itself.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: When it comes to assignments that are due, this professor does not keep her word. She'd have you write a paper and then modify the curriculum at the last minute. Her work has an inconsistency to it. Because she always goes off on a tangent discussing her personal life, you don't learn much.

This professor is well-intentioned, but she is severely lacking in organizational abilities. She doesn't say what she wants on an assignment and then grades you based on her interpretation of what she stated.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Oh man, this professor is all over the place. Would I take her again probably not although she is a kind caring woman as a professor she doesn't have organizational skills. Don't buy the books for sure it's a complete waste of money she doesn't even use them.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: The lady is super nice although she lacks organization skills.

Dr. Pound is one of the best! She loves what she's doing, loves her students like her own children, and teaches lessons that are lifelong learning. She is very understanding and caring, her activities are fun and her class was never boring. We always look forward to every class. She gives a lot of homework but is fun to do.

Great teacher, he helped me a lot and is very fair when it comes to getting the grade you should deserve. Lectures are about interesting topics and doesn't make it too hard for you. He's a great man. 100% would take again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's a great teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Dr. Enriquez is a very caring teacher and truly shows enthusiasm for his class and students. Overall a great guy.

Easily a top 5 professor at Pepperdine. One of the most caring and understanding professors to ever do it. The main assignments are a group project/presentation but very easy to do overall and a 4-6 page research paper that is graded easily. Lots of reading but the professor makes it worthwhile, 10/10 human.

Took him for intro creative writing.(CRWR 203)  Easy, but feedback sheets build up with tight timelines. Never hard work just takes time when doing writers workshop. Great professor very kind and understanding. Class time is always used well and he does take attendance every day.

Great professor. There is around 60pgs of reading due each class. But no other assignments except one 4-6 pg paper at ends of semester. He is very understanding and caring. A few pop quizzes on readings but he lets you know when. If you read and do your work, easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She's a lot of work but really good teacher. If you want to learn graphic design, she's it! Again, expect a lot of work -- but how else would you get better and more knowledgable in adobe programs?

This class was super easy. As long as you do all the work and do it right, you should get an A. Professor Kha isn't the best teacher, but she suffices, since the class is so easy. She's pretty easy going, but sometimes she lectures about what seems like pointless stuff, so it gets boring. But she let class out early a lot, so that was good.

She is never clear on what she wants for an assignment, and we were often behind from the other classes. She is not great at explaining things. She can be lenient OCCASIONALLY, but that only goes so far when things aren't clearly explained. Also, she's a pretty easy grader, so I guess that is an upside.

I would not recommend taking this class with her. The other classes move a lot slower and other teachers have a way better understanding of this course. It was not clear on any of the assignments exactly what she wanted and when you get your grade back she barely explains why it is what it is. Probably the least helpful teacher I've had so far.
Take really detailed notes in class. She moves a quickly so it is important to have your blogs to refer back to while doing assignments.
she's very specific about the answers you give on tests, so even if you're close, she won't count it right. but overall, she's a nice and pleasant professor

Dude...i am not in her class but i grade her tests and not even taking the class i know a lot of the answers so she is not a hard teaches...yes she is passionate but not emotional.  Just cause you people are taking it as a GE doesnt make it easy and mean you can slack...get over it.  She is good and real nice.

WORST teacher I've ever had in my life: doesn't know anything about marine bio (in fact some of the students knew more), always got off topic, material never covered was on the tests and broke school rules by refusing to let students fill out evaluations at the end of the semester.  Arrogant, unfair, unintelligent.  Pepperdine should fire her ASAP!

Professor Tower is a very enthusiastic, spunky teacher who loves what she teaches and wants her students to see how amazing marine biology really is.  She tests off of the lectures which are straightforward and relevant and makes learning fun.  She is awesome!

Far and away THE worst teacher I have ever had. she is an emotional wreck and practically cries in class. her tests were IMPOSSIBLE and not made at all for a GE class. she is arrogant and not at all knowledgable, has clear favorites and grades totally subjectively. i actually hate her.
I came to Pepperdine to study with Dr. Jenkins and I am not disappointed.  She is AMAZING, brilliant and such a kind, wonderful professor and researcher.
I am a Ph.D student in Education because of her influence.  She showed me what a difference effective teaching makes in the lives of students.
Dr. Jenkins totally changed my outlook on life.  She has inspired me to see teaching as a life's mission and not just a job.
The best professor at the school.  She is not easy, but will help you reach your full potential.  The brightest, most engaging, professor who gets it.
Not all that. Thinks she is.

Literally most intriguing class I have ever been a part of. He teaches this at the University of Memphis which is where I took it but I would recommend taking him for ANY class if I had the chance. AMAZING person and I would not pass up the opportunity to have him as a teacher. He really cares about everybody and will remember every single person.

Coolest professor I've ever had. He loves talking philosophy and about life. He brings pizza to every class and I attended every class even though he never takes attendance. Film 111 (or 311) is fabulous and well worth everyone's time. And Tom is fantastic.
Tom is amazing. One of the most dedicated profs to making a difference to his students.

Absolutely amazing.  Sincerely life-changing.  I left his class feeling better about my life and about the difference I could make in the lives of other people. He is so understanding about our world today. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!!! (even if you don't have to)
Good guy, really helpful. COFFEE TRUCK

DON'T TAKE THIS SEMINAR. We didn't even learn about art, but were forced to participate in discussions which nobody was interested in. So many difficult readings. This class caused me the most stress out of any of my science courses. Much more trouble than it's worth.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Her class was interesting, but by the end I never wanted to learn about art again. Very difficult for a seminar class, but also learned A LOT about reading effectively and MY WRITING IMPROVED SO MUCH. Looking back, I'm glad I took it for my wiring skills, but at the time I was a little bitter about the excess work she required. Tough on essays.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: No tests for this first year seminar, but there are 6 essays you have to write. Lots of great field trips, and class is super easy. You do not have to do the readings to participate in class.
She's too nice to fail anyone. I did almost nothing and got a B-.
Really amazing teacher who is extremely knowledgeable in her subject and extremely helpful. Her class is so enjoyable and you are able to learn so much in a really engaging way.
He is the best! This class is an easy A, but is so interesting. All graded assignments are incredibly easy, but he does take forever to grade. My favorite professor this semester for sure!

He's an okay teacher. He's not completely boring, but he's not super interesting and engaging either. In the end, it was fine though. The class is pretty easy, as long as you show up and do all the work, and there's not even much work either. The class usually starts with a presentation by a student, and then he sorta lectures and shows videos.

Great professor! Super nice guy and is obviously incredibly passionate about the class! He really cares about his students and will always offer help if needed. Just a very easygoing guy and fun to talk to!
Really cool teacher, good style of teaching. a bit vague when it comes to grading, but classes have great discussions, really cool topics, and awesome guest speakers! would recommend!
Great teacher, lectures a bit dry but he ends class early and you only have 5 assignments

This man is seriously one of the best instructors and best people that I have ever met! He is a great teacher and is extremely intelligent! The volume of material to study will be large, but he is fair and his tests reflect what he teaches. I wish he could teach every single biology class I take.

One of the best teachers I've ever had, and an amazing and kind hearted person! I would literally rearrange my class schedule to make sure I didn't pass up an opportunity to be in his class. Not easy, but extremely fair.

The most helpful Biology professor! He is amazing. To have such a well respected and renowned professor is such an awesome opportunity. If you have the opportunity to take a class of his or just have a conversation with him TAKE IT!

Greatest professor ever! Will take all the time you need to answer any questions. He made Genetics tolerable and balanced out Dr. Brewsters fiercly sporadic teaching/testing style. I would highly reccomend him! He should teach a class on teaching other professors how to teach:)
I had him for General Seminar he was a great teacher and very interesting to have a conversation with. I very strongly recommend this teacher
Trash

Professor Rowlands is the best teacher I have had at Pepperdine. Her polysci class is so fun and everyone gets good grades if they show up and do the work. Her tests are exactly like the study guide and she prepares you very well for them. She's extremely caring and understands what's going on in a student's life. It is a very fun class, I love.
Prof Rowlands is super super nice and sweet; her class is somehow challenging, but you can use notecards during the tests.

Take Professor Rowlands! She is by far the best professor I've ever had. She is beyond caring and makes sure that everyone understands what is being taught. She gives you a notecard for her exams (there are 3 exams) and she gives a really helpful study guide. Make sure to show up to class because she takes attendance! Definitely take her if you can
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Rowlands is a wonderful professor! Her lectures are amazing and simple and she truly cares about her students! She gives extensive test reviews and allows notecards (can be typed) for exams. Her class is a GE dream!

Professor Collins is one of, if not the best professor at Pepperdine. He genuinely cares for each of his students and takes the time to be there for every student. He is always free to help or just talk. Each class is very meaningful and he really has a passion for what he teaches. Our final class is a dinner at his home which was wonderful.

Professor Collins is an amazing person and professor! He genuinely cares for his students, and our final review included breakfast at his house and pickleball! The class is so fun with lots of activities for team building. It's writing intensive, but he is not a hard grader. Exams are easy if you read the textbook! Definitely take him for OB!!

Collins is great. Nearly every class there's an interesting, unique activity that he relates back to the course.  BA366 is a writing intensive, so obviously a lot of papers (4 case memos, 2 essays). Midterm and final are tough, but read the textbook thoroughly and you'll be fine! I'd take him again if I could, this was a fun, memorable class.

One of my favorite classes! There's a fun activity in almost every class. Uses fun activities to tie in with course concepts. The information you learn is incredibly useful in the workforce. You work with a group for the semester to write case studies. The midterm and final are hard but the other assignments aren't which balanced out the grade.

One of my favorite classes, learned a lot! He has clear expectations and is a pretty easy grader. Assignments and tests are straightforward as long as you pay attention/skim over the textbook. Also participate during case discussions.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I learned so much from her at my piano lessons.  I found her to be caring and reasonable.  She pushed my piano abilities tremendously and I am thoroughly enjoyed my time with her.
Banta hates the department and puts up with a lot of**** from crappy faculty.  I think Sara was nice to the vocalists- and I had great recitals with her she was MUCH better than that **** Bevely Min!

can be nice sometimes but for the most part is verbally abusive and very unreasonable. doesn't care about life outside of orchestra. is often stressed out and projects that onto students and makes her problems our problems. too much on her plate.
No Comments
can be nice sometimes. but can be rude and unreasonable..

Zakian is the bombbbbb.com. The class is extremely long and I sorta paid attention and got an A in the class. STUDY THE DATES OF THE PIECES. HE WILL GIVE YOU BETTER GRADES IF YOU ACT LIKE YOU KNOW THE DATES. seriously.
great professor. Made me interested in art history. Seems to lack a concept of time, relating to the length of his classes... but he's really interesting...

All he talks about are his bazaar off the wall interpretations of art that are so far fetched I cant help but role my eyes.  He gives no class breaks and holds us over.  Tests are graded unfairly and he isnt clear on what he wants out of his students.

amazing professor...really into the subject, lectures show his enthusiasm...grading is fair and tries to raise the bar...feels like a realy college course...sometimes interjects his own opions as fact...always makes time for students

A pretty interesting class. Major flaw is that he grades *way* too hard on the writing in in-class exams. I have never gotten below an A in any English class in my life (including college!), but got a B+ in his class. Tests are entirely non-sequitor.

If you do your homework and pay attention in class, you will do okay. He is a super friendly teacher, funny in a quirky kind of way. He does make mistakes while working problems out sometimes, but he usually catches himself. I overall enjoyed his class.
Seriously if you read this and still want to take him or this class it's your own fault

Class is very confusing, Highfield often makes errors teaching that the class has to correct him on. He is not clear when introducing a new concept. The no-calculator policy makes things tough as well. If you have to take a class with him I would strongly advise finding another teacher because Highfield, while a very nice guy, is not a good teacher

Very nice and very shy. He wants to make students happy and comfortable in the class, but doesn't succeed. He has no backbone and needs to learn to discipline students so they won't disrespect him. This was supposed to be an easy GE class but even for someone who is good at math this will be a challenge. The curriculum is too advanced.
New teacher so he's still getting used to teaching. Class is mostly theoretical, no practical applications, but he's nice to look at.

Professor Testerman is a tough professor who really will push you to your edge. Large multi-page tests are common and the pace of the class is fast for a foreign language. There are lots of extra credit opportunities however, that will assist your grade - they are essentially mandatory.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Tough grader

comment: First of all, this man has a Buddhist Studies and Comparative Literature degree, NOT Chinese studies. He has no qualifications to teach the Chinese language, and is very unreasonable when it comes to workload. The class is extremely disorganized and I put in 3 times more effort in this class than any others. The only thing good is extra credit.

Seems like a nice guy and knowledgable about Chinese culture and history. However, he shouldn't be teaching intro to Chinese language. He expects you to learn the material all on your own, despite not having any prior experience with the language at all.
Hard class not going to lie, but he does offer a lot of extra credits. The class material is super interesting, a good class to learn about China in general.
He is very smart but he is also very anal on writings and grammar. He is probably the smartest man at Pepperdine, get ready to read A LOT! He is also very philosophical.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Melamed is a gem! She definitely pushes you to grow so her class is not easy. But she's the best professor I've had so far here. She's so sweet and really cares about you. There's four speeches, two exams and a lot of activities during class. Take her class!!!

She is a TOUGH grader, and grades always come out later than she says. Her classes are also lecture heavy, although recently she has us do group speeches in class. However, she's pretty nice, and if you're struggling in the class she'll meet with you to try to help. She also provides solid feedback. I would recommend her 100%.
If you do your speeches decently well you will get an A. She will work with you. Two tests and a nice prof!

She was so kind and sweet! Always willing to help outside of class... Her lectures are VERY long and can be boring. She can be a tough grader, but speeches aren't bad if you rehearse enough. The class is fun if you participate and keep a good mindset. 4 Speeches-persuasive is the biggest part of your grade! 2 exams (so easy btw). I liked her a lot!

I liked her as a person and a teacher, but her grading is strict on speeches. She gives a lot of feedback but expects the world. The class wasn't hard. Two tests (midterm and final) are all MCQs and are solely dependent on her lectures (take notes) but are easy to understand. Posts grades later than promised.

She was new this year, but she was decent. She is a confusing grader, but she will give you lots of feedback. However, she would post our speech grades later than promised. The midterm and final are easy if you take notes on her lectures. The speeches aren't terrible, but she was a harsh grader on even our first speech

I took him for BA216: 
Professor Park is amazing. If you do the homework honestly, and follow along in class, you will do great on the quizzes and test. Put in effort, and you will do good.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Really easy class if you pay attention and study for the quizzes. The Exams are exactly like the quizzes and homework. His lectures are easy to understand, he is also a really nice guy. Go to class, take notes, review before quizzes for a little bit and you will breeze through this.
The homeworks given feels like hard work but they definitely help you prepare for the exams. His exams are the same as the class and homework problems which makes studying for them easy.

The structure of this class is great. All homeworks, quizzes and lectures really prepared me for the midterms. The final on the other hand was SO much harder than everything else we did in the class. Park is definitely the best for this class though, he really simplifies everything and makes sure each student understands the material.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: amazing professor!! Every class we go over classwork problems in depth and take quizzes in order to reinforce what we learned. Class lectures were so clear and helpful that there was minimal work to do outside of class. The class is very interactive and easy to engage in.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Very subjective in grading with very limited criteria provided.  Very unorganized in communication and assignments are never fully articulated and lack succinct details.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I don't know what it is with mktg professors but nothing is ever good enough - she is the toughest grader I've ever had. She gives constructive/helpful feedback but her delivery needs work - it's very sharp bordering on rude. "Your topic is boring" is not something a professor should say to a student trying to figure out their dissertation topic.
SHE IS A TOUGH GRADER!!!

1. She may not even know what she is talking about. 2. She gave a heavy task. 3. She is a score killer. Whether you want to learn or just want to get a high score, dont choose her. That is the right choice
Her class assignments took up almost all of my spare time this trimester, although I had four other classes. Also, she gave a very low score.

Ms. Laris is so kind and understanding! Willing to move exam dates and offers help in all areas. The exams are a bit overwhelming at first but aren't that bad when taken. No homework, just class participation. Book required for studying. Her lectures are AMAZING and easy to comprehend/remember. Go to class! It's so worth it. Plus she's gorgeous lol

As a non-art major this is a memorizing heavy class. People say its easy because its do-able with a great prof like Laris, but there's 3 tests and involves lots of understanding a wide range of material or if you're like me, memorizing. If you are trying to do the GE, this is still a great class to take, just make sure to prep for tests
She is the best. So fun and makes the information so interesting. I have nothing to do with art history but it was seriously my favorite class this fall.

I was nervous about taking Art History to satisfy my Fine Arts GE, but highly recommend it! I took it with HUM 111, and that information was especially useful in the tests. Overall you learn a lot; if you like history already, this class will be easy and fun.

AMAZING!!! Professor Laris' art history class is so easy and you'll actually learn a lot. Her class isn't hard, you just have to show up and listen and take good notes. She posts her ppt's ahead of time too so if you miss class you can look at them to study for the exams. There isn't a final in her class just a third unit exam. Offers EC on tests

Dongfang Nie is definitely the best financial accounting teacher to take. His lectures are hard to follow due to his accent, but he gives all the tools you need to succeed on your own. He will let you know similar questions to the test, and it will mostly be the same as the homework. Hes also very kind and willing to help you out. Take his class!!!
Pretty easy, just make sure you do the homework cause they are a lot like the exams. Very nice guy but his lectures weren't easy to follow, just teach yourself its simple. I liked him

Very good professor everybody says he is hard to understand but I was able to understand him clearly, The reason for MY low grade was that I didn't apply myself enough. Overall great professor his lectures are very clear and organized. He is always available to help and he has patience with you which is rare nowadays. I recommend him.

Professor Nie is very caring and understanding. The homework is done through Pearson and he also goes through them before they are due. Exams are very easy, so getting an A in this class is definitely possible. He is also accessible outside of class, offering both in person and online office hours.

Difficult to understanding bc of thick accent but he cares for his students and wants all to succeed. We go over homework and practice quizzes together in class which really helped. He uses Pearson for the entire course. Similar homework questions on Exam. If you pay attention in lectures, do all homework/ assignments, and study you'll get an A.

I took the Capstone course, the counseling theories and techniques. It's content-heavy, but she organizes well, and if you are looking to go to graduate school in this field, it's a must! I'm currently doing a Master's in counseling and my theory classes are a breeze because of her capstone class!!

Professor. Mancuso is by far my favorite professor for psych so far. Her lectures clarify the information from the readings so well and she really makes an effort to make sure everyone understands. Her tests are standard, as long as you understand the concepts (not just definitions) you will do well!

If you can, avoid this class with Mancuso. The material is extensive and extremely dense, with similarly dense lectures. You are expected to know all of it for exams (with a cumulative final). The exams are poorly made, in many instances, there are 2 correct answers. But, you will only get credit for the one Mancuso picks (despite disagreement).
She is such an awesome teacher and overall person! Her tests aren't terribly hard, but they aren't easy A's. There isn't a ton of homework but if you go to class and engage you will be just fine.

Psychology and religion was very interesting. Class was mostly discussion based, so come prepared to talk about the readings! She really knows her stuff and is really helpful if you approach her outside of class!

She's kind, caring, and encouraging. She gives great instruction and her class' structure is specific and organized. She grades very fairly- the whole class is pretty much an easy A if you put in the work. Her class is one of the most fun classes I've ever taken!
Weekly evaluations which require a lot of practice and preparation. Fair grader. Always available through email for extra help. Class time is spent well. Class pace is a bit fast.

She really cares about her students and wants them to succeed in the class. The class is designed for you to get an A as long as you practice each week. She is a fair grader and grades you on your improvement and how well you do for your own abilities, versus grading based on how well you do compared to other students.
Very caring to students but beware of weekly evaluations!

Dr. Lee is one of the nicest professor at Pepperdine. She is so kind. Gradesquiz+final+attendance. It is an easy A as long as you practice her assignments. Definitely choose her for your fine arts requirement!
useless

Assignment directions do not make sense Syllabus does not make sense Grading criteria/rubric does not make sense Assignments are inappropriate and irrelevant for the class, program and level of education. Class topic is irrelevant to program and higher education.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Very kind and knowledgable
Very professional
knows her stuff!

Oh I love Dr. Lucas. Her class was always something I looked forward to. The lectures are simple and there's always an engaging activity after. The labs were not difficult either. If you study the lecture slides, youll do great on her exams. This class was not demanding at all. Just show effort and follow directions. She's an amazing professor.
She the goat, take her she has very interesting labs and she is extremely caring.

Prof. Lucas is one of the best professors Ive had. Shes caring, understanding, and super funny. She makes her class really engaging and its not super stressful at all. The workload isnt extreme and its pretty easy for the most part. Projects arent bad at all. Ive learned a lot in her class and I would definitely take her class.

What an absolute gem. She will make your GE science one of the best classes you'll take. She's sweet, caring, & FAIR. She will always reach out & aims to make a class environment where everyone can learn something & score well (I got a 98% overall). She focuses on interesting stuff that applies to life. If only she taught my major classes (:

This is my fav class by far! Prof Lucas is so sweet and caring and organized. Shell have your exams graded by the end of the day and put it on courses. Gave a lot of free extra credits too. Very accessible outside of class or if you have questions. Exams are easy and straightforward and would bring breakfast to class on exam days.

He's a really nice guy and wants to make sure you're enjoying the class. He's not difficult and understands if you're not the artistic type. It's a pretty easy class as long as you show up and appear to be trying.
Nice guy. Slightly awkward. Okay class.
No Comments
No Comments
very eccentric, but likes eveything you do
Good history teacher!  Love his job!  Very committed to teaching and adores history.
You'll fall asleep, and not learn anything, he is so boring!!
Great professor.  The class was ridiculously hard.  Only take his upper division if you really want to work.  You'll like the class though
Excellent man.  Professional.  He's doing a great job.

Good guy. The class was really hard, and I felt like an idiot most of the time, but I loved going to class because he's really knowledgable about the subject. It was long at times, and he is an EXTREMELY hard grader (he thinks grades are too inflated).

She is my fav teacher at Pepperdine. I actually learned knowledge from her. Though the class is kinda hard, but she is willing to help if you are paying attention in the class. The class is not hard as long as you do the assigned readings.

This class is what you make it. She does not trick people on tests, there are no surprises. Do the readings, follow what she tells you to do, talk to her when you need help and WORK HARD. Hardest class I have taken, but this is what a college class should be like. Best professor I've had at Pepp, always willing to help if you put in the effort.

The class isn't that hard if you show up to class and do at least half of the reading. She gives you study guides for the exams (only 2 per semester) and they're straight off the guide. Also if you want that A or high B, you must talk to her and show some effort.

Professor Faegri is amazing. She's incredibly knowledgeable and knows how it applies to everything. She never seems lost and doesn't rarely goes off topic. She's a little monotone, but after a couple classes she warms up and you'll be able to joke with her in class. She comes off as this crazy grader who's really strict, but she's really fair.

Pretty difficult! She can be slightly intimidating in class because she demands a lot, but she's actually a very sweet person. You must keep up with the readings, and you must study  in depth to give extremely detailed essays on the exam, otherwise she will take off a lot.
She was very helpful in class, and tried to make the subject as interesting as possible. She even had us watch a movie- and it wasn't pointless.

gets the main points across without making the class overly difficult. shes good at working with the class on due dates/extensions etc and adapting to what the students need. cares about the parts of school that matter, and knows when to let the unimportant things slide! definitely recommend.
awsome person, easy class, very easy to talk to. So I definitely sugest you take sucess strategies. It's very helpful in life as well.
awsome person, easy class, very easy to talk to. So I definitely sugest you take sucess strategies. It's very helpful in life as well.

Overall, the course was fairly simple. We had about 2-3 chapters to read every week and quizzes as well as weekly analyses, which weren't hard at all. The course may be a little draining/boring because it is com. theory, but she's pretty clear on her explanations of the theories. Summary: Good prof., very patient & understanding...take the class!
He will remember you...

Henisey is my favorite Professor at Pepperdine and I think you would be hard pressed to find someone who cares more about their students. He is easy to understand, passionate about what he teaches, and always available to his students. Every day I leave class excited to come back. He does expect a lot from you, but it makes you a better student.

Honestly Dr. Henisey is the best professor I've ever had. To the commenter who said his tests are impossible to pass, I consistently scored very well (without the curve, mind you) on tests in both of his classes, so that's false. He loves his students, he loves teaching, and he makes you love physics. He's amazing.

Professor Henisey is my favorite professor that I had last semester. The way he teaches makes the material very accessible, even when the concepts are hard. He makes himself very available to students, and is really accommodating if you can't make his office hours. Would definitely take him again.

WORST PROFESSOR. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!! He only goes over theory of physics, never any important things that we really need like actual equations. He INTENTIONALLY makes his tests impossible to pass. Granted he does curve. He's impossible to get a hold of because theres always a line of students waiting to help them with the impossible homework.

I took her for a night class and her lectures were decent although (if I remember) she usually just read them. She has a VERY strict policy about phones, which is kinda dumb because we could take notes on our computers. Lots of her grading was arbitrary too. If you take her class, do research about interesting events in your hometown/family first.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Horrible experience, she had unrealistic expectations for the class. Her tests were confusing and her assignments were disorganized and irrelevant. There's a ton of extra reading required. Tapper is very unsympathetic and cold when trying to discuss things with her. Definitely not what you'd expect from a Pepperdine professor.

RIDICULOUS class. A ton of reading for a GE class and expects you to memorize all of it. Very unrealistic standards for a professor who does not teach very well. I will be writing a letter to the Dean, because we all expected a different professor until he left out of state just a couple of weeks before classes started and we got stuck with her.
She made the class much harder than it needed to be for a GE. There was a ridiculous amount of reading and her tests were insane.
No Comments

Prof. Gomez is just terrible at teaching BIOL350. It's as if he's learning the material alongside us, given all the mistakes he makes and the uncertain way he teaches. His tests cover material beyond what is taught in lectures—or barely covered, for that matter. I have never encountered a professor who was as disorganized as he was. STEER CLEAR!

Dr. Gomez obviously loves what he does, but his class is so confusing. He goes off on tangents and stops in the middle of sentences. He's not clear at all and tests on concepts he skips over in class. He presented a lab final as an option and then took it away and failed me on my paper, which brought me down a letter grade. His BIOL400 was easier.

Prof. Gomez is a nice person, but his teaching sucks. He often loses his train of thought, making lectures hard to follow. The slides are mostly diagrams with unclear annotations, making note-taking difficult. He struggles with complex topics, & the tests don't reflect the material. Only 2-3 people earned an A- or higher based on our grading scale.

Gomez is a nice guy who comes from humble roots. But he does not know how to teach complex concepts in an accessible way. Often makes errors during lecture and only called out by students. Tests are a veritable disaster, had me worried if I would graduate. Tests things that were not taught. Refuses to explain processes, wants you to learn solo.

Lectures were really hard to understand because it seemed like he didn't know what he was teaching. Tests are extremely difficult simply because he puts things on them that he doesn't teach. Ignores OSA accommodations and often explains things poorly. Talks a lot about nothing and lose his train of thought while changing topics fast in lectures.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures difficult to understand as he often jumped from one topic to another sporadically, used the same pronoun to refer to a variety of items, & often lost his train of thought. Exams were challenging as there were 10-15 pages of FRQs to be completed in only 50 min with the average usually a C. Point weighting on the exam was also imbalanced.

I cannot say enough about Professor Pedram! Her lectures & teaching style are so enjoyable. She explains in depth the intricacies of each theory in an exciting & easily comprehensible manner. She is an OUTSTANDING professor who genuinely cares about her students and is incredibly kind & passionate about educating her students & the material!
Professor Pedram was amazing! She really goes above and beyond what I would expect in a professor. She also genuinely cares about what work you put in and tries to motivate you.

Prof. Pedram explains differently than the book does, making the expected participation difficult. Be prepared for a paper being due every week, a big paper for the midterm, and an even bigger paper for the final. She is nice and easily accessible outside of class, but this class is tough & requires a lot for being at the start of the program.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Sandy is very knowledgeable and I learned so much in this class. Assignments were spaced out in a manageable way and explained thoroughly. She responded quickly to emails and questions. Great class overall. Asking lots of questions really helps!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Sandy was an okay professor. She was knowledgeable, but classes were very participation heavy and some of the rubrics weren't very clear. It felt like her feedback was based around whether she liked the theory being discussed or not, if she doesn't like it, its not a good theoretical approach. Overall, she way okay but would avoid in the future.

I appreciated how Dr. Wangari Njathi leveraged her extensive experience in corporate and agency marketing to enrich her classes. While she is a strict grader, her assessments are highly constructive and provide detailed feedback that helps students improve, provided they take the time to follow through.

Professor Wangari demonstrates expertise and stays updated on the latest trends in digital marketing. Although she applies concepts through real-world projects, case studies, or simulations, this class has a lot of work with weekly quizzes and a lot of assignments. Having taken both IMC 385 it is useful to understand her teaching style.

She is unclear on what she expects, class is mostly a big group project and a final. I didn't learn anything, it's all the same info from other classes, she talks just to talk. Her unclear expectations make this class really frustrating. If you do have to take her, get constant clarification on literally everything and be detailed in the project.

Do whatever you can to not take Wangari. If you like to just sit in class and hear a bunch of stuff that you have heard a thousand times but in a yelling manner then this class is for you. Has ridiculous deadlines for projects and is unreasonable when you ask about changing them. IK most of yall will have to take her, so sorry in advance...

Be warned about taking Professor Njathi's class. She grades her assignments and the group project as if we're actual marketing employees and are not taking 4 other courses as college students... She will note 2 or 3 things that are wrong with an assignment and or group project and mark you down to a B for it. Hates giving out A's.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I love Professor Njathi's passion in IMC385. I appreciate the way in which she thinks about what she knows will help us in our working lives down the road. She taught us how to be real-life marketers. I enjoyed her projects and the ability to have the freedom to be creative in her class.

This class is a lot of work. There is lots of busy work and a semester-long group project. Prof Njathi is very nice but very unorganized and unclear on assignments and due dates. I often leave the class confused about what's due when and what the assignment guidelines are. Courses and the syllabus do not line up and are confusing to follow along.

Just don't. If the prior ratings haven't scared you let this one. This professor is awful and I cannot imagine how he's a part of Pepperdine when I have never met a professor like this man. All of my other professors have been so wonderful and helpful. His grading system is an absolute scam, he's rude, and he does not want you to succeed.

Kamran has been teaching here for 10 years. He has stuck around only because of the nature of the class and the amount he gets paid. He enjoys feeding his ego by bringing you down in class in front of your peers. He is a horrible teacher and doesnt even become available when you ask. He offers his phone but that is clearly useless as he disregards

Honestly just don't take this course with him. It is not worth it unless you're capable of spending all of your free time learning the material from outside resources. Lecture videos are useless, and his feedback is minimal. Beyond disappointed that this is a required course so early within the MBA program. He is beyond condescending.

DESC 624 -- Learn the software well because he will give you a zero if you make a mistake.  Though you did all the work and it's perfect, you will get a zero.  He shows favoritism to everybody during HW1, but after that, you're expected to know it all.  Unless you want to file a grade dispute to fight for a grade, I don't recommend this professor.

This professor absolutely loves giving zeros.  He starts the class saying that his class is simple and that most folks pass with A's and B's even if you dont know the material but even if you spend hours upon hours on your work and you make a simple error, he will just give you a zero with No feedback or communication.  Horrible professor.

I took Professor Conti for both 151 and 152. By far my favorite Professor at Pepperdine. Her lectures are engaging and she is energetic and sweet. She prepares you very well for all the tests. She is organized and very accessible. She made me love Spanish. You can tell she wants all of her students to do amazing. Highly recommend taking her!
LOVE her. Handily my favorite gen-ed professor at Pepperdine. Sweet, energetic, funny. Great teacher, too!

Conti is a hidden gem at Pepperdine! She wants her students to love her class and makes it exciting with Kahoots and personal stories. I took her for 152+251. She is one of the most wholesome people, and she is not too heavy on homework. The tests/compositions are not hard if you study. The oral exams are done in groups, so it is not intimidating.

I LOVE CONTI! She is young, sweet, fun, and truly cares about her students. There is online work due each week, but nothing crazy. Her tests took me 20 minutes max. She keeps class fun with Kahoots and gives out prizes occassionally. She is understanding and sympathetic, and even made brownies for the class. Protect her at all costs. TAKE HER
She is amazing, one of the best professors I have had at Pepperdine. She is a great person who genuinely cares about her students, and always keeps class engaging. Take her if you can.
Actually the goat. Very knowledgeable and has a great personality.

I think everyone I've talked to has taken away a lot from Blakley's class.  It's properly difficult as a 1st semester GE for many.  I think it's press much the "starting university" starter kit.  He's really nice and always gives good feedback.  if you have the choice, take Blakey.  you'll learn and it'll set you up for the next HUM class

Took him at Pepperdine. Not gonna cap, I took this class during covid and on zoom in August 2020. I have struggles public speaking, especially as a person that experiences constant imposter syndrome. I informed Professor Blakley about this and he was very very understanding. I completely respect this man for this reason. Take the class.

Really easy class  he just has you read passages every week and discusses them. Tests are essays which you get the prompts in advance. Offered great extra credit at the end of the semester to raise grade by 4-5% overall. 100% would take him again. He definitely loves what he does.

Dr. Blakley is teaching HUM 111 at Pepperdine this semester and I think he also teaches at other schools in the LA area. He was a great professor and taught a lot more of the material and history than other professors did that my friends had for the same GE. Tests are essays, not multiple choice. You can tell he really cares about his students!

This class is 100% graded by tests. Lectures are helpful but not neccesary. Prof Mejia is a very silly charasmatic prof, and he cares v much about sociology. Lots of note taking during the lecture if you choose to, mainly wrinting definitions. Very laid back class, just do your quizzes on time and you'll get an A. Spontaneous extra credit in class.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Mejia was really cool! He even threw us a graduation celebration and brought pizza for the class!! Just do not slack. You can tell he does not like slackers.

Unorganized. He goes off on multiple tangents about his life & pre-recorded lectures that do not correlate with the class. You must address him as a professional, or he will deduct points from your grade! Doesn't accept late work, no exceptions. His lectures are all over the place, with no presentations, just recording himself & just audio.
I agree with the previous review... Professor Mejia was super chill and caring... He did let us know that Criminology is not his area of expertise but he tried his best IMO... Definitely an easy A...

I highly recommend taking a course with Professor Mejia! The class was an easy A. He is super understanding that we are in a pandemic and the lectures were pre-recorded so you can complete the class materials whenever you want. Straight-forward assignments that challenge you but also are hard to fail. Highly recommend!
