I took Engelmann's summer class in Japan and it was great, no work outside of class other than brief reading, and tests were reasonable. His lectures are clear and he explains tough concepts with lots of practical examples. He was very engaging and was eager to answer questions both in and outside of class. Amazing professor who makes econ easy!

BEST ECO PROFESSOR! The content is heavy and you definitely need to put in work and study to do good in his class, but he well prepares you and is more than welcome to help and answer any questions. Professor Engelmann just makes the class better. I really enjoy this class, even if the subject can be controversial. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor, funny and kind. He is very helpful when you ask. He rushes through his lectures so it's hard to get notes down. The class does not have homework or required reading, but would recommend going to class as a lot is covered each day.

Do the readings before class. Fast-paced lectures, more of a review of readings. Bad at explaining. Relearning material a lot while teaching. Very helpful in office hours. Grade comprised of 3 tests (all multiple choice), presentation, & participation. No hw or extra credit. "Effort does not equal automatic A or B, requires mastery of material."
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: One of my favorite professors. I am a Business major and this class was one of my best. He is a great teacher but tests can be hard-ish! I would recommend reading and taking notes from the textbook b4 class so you have plenty of info. he can go fast in class so maybe take pics of the slides he shows. PARTICIPATE! asking questions is the best!

So sad Prof. Thiel is leaving Pepperdine. He is a wonderfully kind professor, who is truly passionate about teaching the bible. No textbook, short verse assignments per class, small research paper, 2 quizzes, 2 tests, all with a simple study guide! I came into the class a life-long Christian and still learned so much about the basis of my faith!
Easiest religion professor at Pepperdine just take him and save yourself a lot of stress. He was just visiting but if he ever comes back please take him.

Thiel is moving, but if he ever comes back, take him! If you pay attention, you'll do well. I put this class on the back burner, but his lectures were very informative and he LOVES the material. I'm an atheist and I learned a lot. He's so caring, and wants his students to put their well being first. Meeting with him was the reason I got an A-!
Professor Thiel is such a nice guy- he is very approachable and helpful outside of class. If you go to class and do the work, you will do well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the best professors I've had! He is a really great professor and prepares you well for his exams. There's homework for almost every class, but it's pretty easy to get done
Bryson is awesome. Funny guy who has a great understanding of contemporary culture. Lectures are interesting.
Very Caring
Great professor.  Great person.

D.C-Such a loving & giving man. Brought guest speakers in (wife of first man to die in Iraq)-very beneficial. Field trips to sites. Really saw the rel. in culture there. Learned a lot about politics, history, rel., and current events.

I can best describe this course as a poor Cliffs Notes version of HUM 111, HUM 112, and REL 102 combined. He speaks way too fast and there is no text to guide us, just his notes and  expertise.  All together, he is not qualified to teach such a course.
loved her!! she's very laid back and if you care about what she's trying to teach you, she'll love you back(: i def. recommend this class to anyone interested in makeup/stage makeup/theater/art.
Stage Makeup--not a theater major but LoVe HER!!! she's seriously blunt, but always means well and is totally chill!
No Comments

I hated this class! You would think Stage Makeup would be fun... Basically, if you aren't a Theatre major she thinks you are wasting her time. It seemed that I couldn't do anything right. So if you aren't doing Theatre, don't take the class!

Carol is very laid back and helpful.  She taught us the techniques and left us to use our own creativity and have fun.  The makeup class is not an easy A. You have to be able to apply the techniques and improve your skills, but it is a lot of fun!
She is super talented and extremely sweet. Works to help all students individually. Show up to class and put in effort because she truly cares about what she does.

She is seriously so awesome and gets to know you on a personal level. I have taken both her modern dance and ballet classes and will admit that ballet is a lot tougher. Although attendance is mandatory, she does allow you to make up classes. Best class if you want to get your fine art G.E. out of the way.
really fun; knowledgeable
Does not take into consideration that you could suck at dance.
good days and bad days, taking dance for fine arts credit is still probably better than Art Appreciation tho!
An interesting, engaging, but difficult (in a good way) class! Definitely recommend taking him!!!!

Caleb is a great lecturer--always clear, articulate, and entertaining.  His tests are of reasonable difficulty, and he (rightly) prides himself on being fair.  Caleb's Philosophy of Religion course is also a rounded introduction to arguments in natural theology.
clanton is so energetic and enthusiastic about the subject he teaches. he's one of the best professors i've had thus far! take his class.. nowwwwwwwww.

This guy is amazing. He could quite possibly be the best professor at Pepperdine. He is tough and makes you think, but he is so engaging in the lectures that time flies by. He is funny and brilliant and if you don't take him you have missed out on a phenomenal opportunity!
Very new professor but his lectures are dynamic and compelling.  Very well spoken and is a good teacher.

So helpful and flexible with office hours. Really clear and great at explaining econ in terms of current events. And has a charming accent. And great eyes. And that blue shirt that matches his eyes...
One of the best econ professors at Pepperdine - presents material in an interesting method with real-world examples

He was fantastic. always available to help after class, really clear explanations and fair tests. he was great. The movies we watched were totally relevant and really interesting. Amazing professor. And REALLY easy on the eyes. Key words: Roll Tide. Just say it.

Probably one of the best ECON professors you could take! He's very intelligent and knows what he's talking about. He's extremely helpful and makes sure the class understands before moving on. Also, he talks in terms that make ECON easy enough for a non-major.
amazing.

Dr. Olson was the best professor I've had during my time at Pepperdine. Her syllabus is clear and straight forward. Her expectations are fair and her mid-term and final are completely doable. She provides excellent feedback on what she wants and she's extremely caring and positive! I would love to have over and over again!

Reading directly from the book is hardly what I would call teaching. Little to no linkage to the real world. Excelled during the term and received a mediocre grade on the final, which doesn't make sense and was not explained. Group project and final total 55% of the grade, so be prepared to kick butt on those if you want an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Very straight forward course and grading.  Beware, her finals are a little difficult.  The final is fair and not a trick, but understand more than the literal translation from the book.
Excellent professor!  Smart, helpful, and fair-minded.  Explains everything clearly.  Well organized lectures.  Extra credit offered.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--CARES ABOUT STUDENTS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Excellent class, she teaches right from the book which makes the tests a lot easier to prepare for. There are some supplemental readings that compliment the text subject matter very well. Group presentations happen each class and are a fun way to get a discussion going and relate the material to a current event.

Compared to the other reviews, I thought this was an easy class. Regan is super sweet/accomodating and he really wants his students to do well. We received a participation grade (easy), hw grade (can resubmit), and test grade (x3). I didn't read the textbook at all - just practice the homework a bunch of times and you'll do well on the exams.

Professor Regan is really invested in his subject. He wants to help you do well and cares about where you stand in your level of understanding. His class consists of weekly homework, 3 quizzes and a final which are 30% each. The homework is time consuming, but he provides a lot of resources to make it easier, the quizzes vary, and the finals tough
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Regan was very caring and intelligent. Most of the coursework, homework, quizzes, and tests are done through an online program which he doesn't have much control over. He makes the best of it though and is very accommodating. The homework was slow paced and took about 5 hours each week. I skipped a few sessions and was just fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: In average 4-6 hours of homework every week before each week's class. You will have to spend the time into this class or you won't do well on exams. There are three midterms and one final. The first midterms is the easiest and the second one is the hardest. The final is extremely hard but go to his office hours regularly if you do not understand.

Professor Regan is a good professor that expects a lot from you. This was a 2 unit course, but expect to put a lot of work in for this class. The homework is long. Professor Regan is very helpful during his office hours. The quizzes are a little difficult, so study hard for them. The final (worth 30%) is very hard, so make sure you prepare well.
Best mandatory religion class I've taken.

Easy class but engaging. The material was more controversial than I would have guessed. Made for lively discussions that help pass the time. Don't need the book, but pay attention to the essay requirements. Good prof, I'd take her again.
Super cool prof. As a Christian I was proud of how she handled a religion class at a Christian University. Very cool.

Professor Harmon is extremely kind and makes the class incredibly easy. Perhaps too easy. If you're a religion major, I suggest you take someone else, but if you want to pass religion with minimal stress and work, she's great.
Harmon is nice, but she was a visiting adjunct so she didn't really know what she was doing. It was boring and lecture-based. Either get the book or go to class, it's the same.

Tough grading. Ridiculous guidelines. None of the online slides with audio actually work, and it is 100% of the class. Assignments are vague at best. I don't know how this professor has received one single positive review.

She's a nice professor. I took her online class, too much homework but manageable. The only issue is she expects you to understand French by listening to her but she doesn't teach the pronunciations. You mainly learn written French not oral French. Overall, she's great, the class is simple. Canvas is a little bit disorganized but ok.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: She is so nice, but typical French teacher who is obsessed with attendance. If you miss, have a doctor's note and all documentation prepared. She's a tough grader in the sense that if you turn in something 20 minutes late, you will fail it. Her syllabus isn't clear, so ask a lot of questions. Stuff is due at random times online.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: She is one of the best French professors I have ever had. Firstly, she is thoughtful and kind, and she cares about the well being of her students. Secondly, she takes teaching the class seriously and makes you work for your grade. It is hard sometimes, but she's always available for help. You will do well if you try and care about the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Amazing teacher. One of my favorites at Pepperdine. She's actually a native french speaker so she knows what she is talking about but she is SOOO HARD. Really have to work hard in this class and know your stuff. Def need the book. She is a super sweet heart and will help you out with anything you need.

Fun class, really chill. just work on art projects. She doesnt care how well its done, just that you complete the work. don't buy the text book. taking this for elective. easy class and time goes by quickly.
No Comments

The woman is ridiculous! She obviously favors guys over girls, screamed at me in the middle of class for trying to help someone who was totally struggling and then tried to act like nothing happened. She looks for ways to dock point and when she can't.. she makes stuff up! A Real HAG!

fun class to take, you learn about preparing art projects for teaching.  She gets moody and snappy sometimes, but the projects are fun.  Kinda a cold person, but you learn to get over it.  Get used to the New Jersey accent as well.  Dont be late to your final ... she'll dock you major points then gi
NEVER TAKE HER CLASS NO MATTER WHAT She made me hate chem AVOID HER. PERIOD.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Her lecture notes are all you need to succeed in the class; hardly referred to the book for extra explaination (only used for HW). She doesn't like stupid questions. She has no tact when answering stupid questions, but she is extremely helpful to those who actually do the work, study hard, and attempt to answer the question before asking her.
worse teacher in the entire world. period.
Avoid this teacher at all costs. She is sooooo awful at teaching, I'm more confused when I went to class. I was really excited about chemistry, but now I just feel awful about it.

One of my favorite professors, I've ever taken from. Be forewarned that I took her during a COVID summer session so I took her class online. While this limits my ability to comment on the class, I can comment on her as a teacher because the class was short and quick but I don't think I've learned as much or as well as in this class and that all her
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--So many papers

comment: She is my bar my favorite prof at Pepperdine. I'm not even someone who likes English/Literature, but she makes the class interesting and engaging. You'll actually want to show up to class and make her proud through your work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Yomantas is one of the best professors Pepperdine has, what an inspiration to Education majors! Not only are her lectures extremely engaging, her homework is not made up of a bunch of boring reading but instead useful articles and fun projects! Also, she doesn't make you spend a fortune on a useless book but instead posts readings online!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: I love her. She truly cares about her students and will work with you if you are struggling but still putting in the effort. Her class is fun and homework heavy. All stuff you want to do if taking the course. Does not do written tests. Replaces with important group and individual projects. Not lecture heavy

One of the best professors at Pepperdine. Interested in each of the student's backgrounds. Very engaging, humorous, and cares for his class. We had this class for 3 hours each day but I was always excited to attend each lecture! Definitely read the book!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Dennis was the man. A true champion among professors. Incredibly witty, he made learning fun. Plus his jumpshot matches that of ray allen while he runs the court like pistol pete.

if he has any issues with a student, he does not confront directly - he skips any dialog with the individual and goes straight to the head of the department. i did not feel comfortable around this professor.
amazing amazing teacher, and sooo funny

She is the most amazing teacher and person you will ever meet. She helped me discover my voice in a healthy and efficient way. She listens to your concerns and helps you become the best musician you can be. She offers the right amount of encouragement and tough love. When she goes home she thinks about your voice and does research so she can help
She is simply the best voice teacher I have ever had.  She combines a great knowledge of vocal technique with amazing musicality.  Plus, she is incredibly supportive and understanding!
She is an amazing vocal teacher who really has a vision for vocal development.  She knows how the body works to produce sound and gives students lots of options.  You will learn so much from her.
No Comments

The class was pretty easy but she always deducted points for some random aspects that really has nothing to do with learning. very very confusing. Her quizzes have a lot of questions that has nothing to do with the materials which makes no sense.

Take this class with her. As long as you put in the work, it is a very easy class and she grades very easy. She's very knowledgeable on research and made a class that most people had to be in because of their major and not because they were interested in it very painless. She's very nice, funny and understanding.

She is nice but throughout the course she does not give very clear instructions and then grades harshly on minor details she never expressed were necessary. I could never understand what she wanted and no matter what she would take points off for stupid things when the assignments were already not many points. I was confused for the entire course.

Prof. Fischbach has a dry sense of humor at first but as the semester goes on you'll begin to love her. The class has a marketing simulation which is great, IMC Plan which is a pain but not that bad, & 5 quizzes. Kinda annoying that she makes you participate outside of class. Overall great teacher, interesting, and would recommend. You'll enjoy it!

My favorite teacher I've ever had. He very clearly cares deeply about all of his students and wants to see you succeed. The class is truly a safe space to learn and create, and feels like a family. If you try your best, then you will be fine. Take this class!!
Mr Few is amazing. He is fun and makes the class enjoyable. I am hoping to take him again

Professor Few is one of the most caring and passionate professors I've ever met. He is an Angel. He truly cares about each of his students. I would recommend taking this course to anyone. Just don't act like this class is less important than your others or he will be disappointed. Overall, his passion for the subject is inspiring and motivating

Nic Few is a god among men. Ask anyone on campus who knows who he is and they'll tell you the same. I grew exponentially as an actor during my too short time with him, and I wish I could've taken his class again and again every semester. He connects with his students and cares so much about them. My life has been forever changed by this man.

This class was tough but you definitely learn a lot. You MUST do the reading. You spend all class discussing it and you will need to participate. The midterm/final require lots of preparation. Dr. Frye is so kind and understanding. I recommend attending office hours and developing a relationship with her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: Make sure you do the reading- Frye likes to give detailed reading quizzes about the material that was due that day. The class is very reading-heavy, but there is not a lot of writing, just short essays for the midterm and final. She is very caring and makes you come into office hours at least once per semester so she can check in.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I never in my life thought I would love talking about one author for the entire semester, but it was fantastic. Dr. Drye will expand your mind and have you writing differently than you've written in the past. A challenging class, but so worth it. I highly encourage anyone to take her because she is fantastic, and her research is inspiring.

Dr. Frye is an excellent professor who takes time to engage with her students through both class discussions and one-on-one conversation. She will give you consistent opportunities to approach material from your own angles, instead of telling you how to read it. Dr. Frye is not the most lenient of graders, and you should expect to be challenged.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I do not recommend taking this class with Professor Orr. She is highly unprofessional and does not meet the standards of a University professor. She spends most of her time discussing irrelevant things and lacks the ability to aid her students in furthering their writing skills. Taking this class was a pure waste of my time.
Professor Orr improved my writing skills so much. She is a really sweet and caring professor who wants you to succeed. Take her class if you can!!

Prof. Orr is a genuine person, she loves her students, however this class seemed like a lot. It felt like I was taking AP Lang all over again with the weekly reading and writing assignments and the three major essays. She is always available with her office hours and replies quickly to emails. I would highly recommend her for the English lovers.

Be prepared to do a ton of writing. We had at least a 500 word response due every week in addition to 3 major essays (1,500 and 2,500 words) throughout the semester. I probably had the most amount of work in this class than any class, including major classes. If you're just looking to pass your GE english easily, I would look into another prof.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Prof Wolf is amazing! Her lectures are very clear, and the tests are straight forward. She does ask questions in class, and given that fact that it's an Elkins course, it is sometimes a bit intimidating to answer in front of so many people. Your grade is only based on 5 tests (no participation is required), and 1 test is dropped (not the final).

Professor Wolf was my favorite professor this semester! She is very laid back and really nice. There are not a lot of assignments and the exam is fair with space to make up your grade between the papers and class leadership!

She's a clear lecturer and easy to follow so you don't have to pay close attention. Participation matters but if you  ask/answer a question in some classes and go to like 75% of her lectures, you'll be fine. Only homework is reading which it is up to you to do or not not really needed. All her assignments are easy and she's overall a nice professor
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Young, passionate professor who wants to see you succeed. One exam all semester and the class average was a 91, nobody got below a C. Lectures are pretty boring, but she posts the slides so you don't really need to pay close attention. Attendance is mandatory, but has never taken attendance, gives assigned readings, but only tests on the slides.
My favorite teacher I've ever had. She is so sweet and the class is so fun/so useful for my life! Take it.

Professor Lansbach is a really sweet lady! She truly cares about her students and wants everyone to succeed. She is also open outside of class and encourages you to reach out. Her class is nice and easy!
She is amazing! Took her for first year seminar and could not recommend a better professor. She is very caring and considerate. She is very funny and keeps her classes light hearted. Take her PLEASE
love her
This professor was great! Her class is super easy and is set as a beginner English course. She gives LOTS of opportunities for extra credit as well. Very flexible and kind!
Standard English class with reading and research papers.

Professor Wagner is so sweet! She offers a ton of extra credit and makes it easy to get an A. She's very helpful and likes to center the class around group discussion which is really refreshing. There were only two research papers that she gives plenty of time on, and a few smaller projects that made the class fun and engaging.

Professor Wagner is so sweet and she makes this class very easy. She offers plenty of extra credit and is forgiving with deadlines. She encourages class discussions and makes the class fun. Not very lecture heavy, and very little homework besides two research papers throughout the semester. Would definitely take her class again!

Professor Wagner is so sweet and funny. She loves her class and what she teaches and she really tries to help you in any way she can. She offers A LOT of extra credit and only has 2 major papers with smaller papers/assignments. Definitely take her if you can, if you put in some effort and do the work, it's an easy A
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He comes off as a very nice guy, but he is a tough grader. However, I liked this. I don't want someone to just give me an A just because I did satisfactory. He is very critical, and I think this is very important in order to be successful in communication. And is open to give you personal feedback. He also keeps his lectures pretty interesting.

Professor Smith is challenging, however he is very inspirational. He has a dry but hilarious sense of humor. He is brilliant, and it shows. He is super personable, but uses big words. Go to UM on Tuesday nights, he is the leader. He loves God and he loves people.

I love him as a person but hate him as a professor.  He's very nice in person and I never fall asleep during his lectures because he makes them funny and interesting.  I love that he starts out each class with a devotional and prayer, however, I wish that he would show Christian charity in his grading. SUPER CRITICAL. Do NOT take his class!
He is a really tough grader and DOES NOT HELP

Prof. King's classes are all lectures. He has us discuss in small groups, then he lectures for the rest of class. His grading system is complicated. If you're enrolled in his class, I'd switch out. There were many readings that the quizzes were based on. If you "failed" (got more than 16/20 wrong) on 2 of the quizzes, your letter grade would drop.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof King is a very cool and caring guy. Unique grading system, but it really does help students out in the end. There are 4 "tests," but 2 are easy group projects and as long as you pay attention in class, the other 2 are also very straightforward. Take home quizzes to boost grade. He wants what's best for students, is flexible, & hears you out.

Prof. King is one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. He is genuine and cares for his students. His grading system allows for everyone who puts in effort to pass his class, regardless of previous knowledge. He will go out of his way to make sure students needs are met and includes discussion rather than only lecture. Take King if available!

avoid professor king. he's a great guy, nice, and cares about his students, but his teaching style is awful. the grading goes off a surpass,fulfill,&unfulfilled criteria and he expects too much for a GE. reading heavy, lectures are long and boring and he doesnt even share the slides w you to help for studying. wish i dropped, too much stress
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I don't now what these others are complaining about, Michael was one of my favorite teachers in my time in Pepperdine's theater dept!
He is painfully awkward. His idea of lecturing is telling stories about his life that don't make any sense for 2 hours. It was very frustrating, I didn't learn anything. An easy A.

Mike is a great guy and young so he's easy to relate to.  I've got nothing against him but Stagecraft, I must say, was pretty pointless. Don't take it unless you have to (so all theatre majors...)  Good thing is that its really easy and you don't have to show up to class.  I think I went like 5 times and still got an A....
No Comments

He is amazing. I cry when giving presentations or speaking and he made me improve SO much.  One of my best and most memorable professors to date.  Im an athlete and there are a lot of professors that just dont help me with my crazy schedule and he was so open to helping me further and not penalizing me for university athletics events.

SUCH AN AMAZING TEACHER! definitely my favorite teacher at Pepperdine so far. He doesnt just make you feel comfortable and teach you about public speaking, he teaches you about life and makes you a better person! IF YOU CAN TAKE HIM FOR COM180 DO IT!! you wont regret it!

He is possibly the best teacher I have ever had. If you can take him... DO IT! He is so helpful if you go into him. He grades hard, but is clear on what you need to improve on! He is absolutely amazing, and the best speech teacher at Pepperdine hands down.

This guy rocks. He's extremely pretty to look at, as well as being very enthusiastic and interesting in all aspects of life and teaching. Public speaking is something that I'm kind of afraid of doing, but I really feel more comfortable and have become a better speaker after taking this class.

This was definitely one of my favorite classes so far. Her class is definitely more challenging than the large lecture, but well worth taking. She gives the opportunity to engage the material and likes in-class discussions. Very clear with expectations on assignments and always willing to help you out. Pay attention and read, and you'll do fine.

Prof. Francis is really a great teacher. she truly cares about her students and is definitely available when anyone needs help. yes, her class is more difficult than the large lecture class but you certainly learn more. SO unlike the previous comment, I would definitley suggest that poli sci and non majors take her class!

Professor Francis is pretty good for a new professor. Her class is more difficult than the big lecture classes and I would not recommend it for non majors. The tests are fair and she explains and discusses all the material in class. It is apparent that she's new because her teaching is a bit scattered but it is an overall good class

Never never never take her. She is the worst prof I have ever had in my life. She is funny, but NO IDEA how to teach. I am an A student, I barely pass her class. Does not provides class notes, book is hard as hell, boring. U will never learn anything, Exams are super hard, though she makes curve, so hope u will get a C. Listen just DONT take her.

Professor Cawyer (now Nuehs) is a fine professor. She is kind and a nice person, but she grades meticulously and seems to not want to give an A. You can follow instructions to a tee and she will make up a reason to take off points. Don't take her for online bc she will accuse you of reading a script or memorizing your speeches and take points off.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Amazing professor, class isn't super difficult and she will help you along the way if you reach out!

Beverly is an AMAZING and respectable teacher. She cares about what she teaches and cares about her students . Most people dread taking COM 180 but she makes the class so fun. If you can take her 1 billion/10 recommend.
Professor Cawyer is the literally the best COM 180 professor the world has ever seen. Even the legendary Adjunct Professor Karl Kalinkewicz would be envious of the amazing teaching she does.

Avoid at all costs if you can. He is an extremely tough grader and doesn't help much in office hours. When students were sick and unable to attend on quiz days, he would not let the students take the quiz another time. They had to zoom in and take the quiz at the same time. Very quiz heavy, if you struggle on the quizzes, you'll struggle in class.

Dr. Plum is incredibly caring. While his class is very difficult, he's always willing to help you learn. The amount of graded hw is manageable, but you'll want to do the ungraded hw to stay on top of concepts if you aren't naturally good at it. Tests are fair-- difficult but not unreasonable. Don't be scared of him, he's very understanding!

Plumberg is still learning. He is very knowledge in the subject but tends to overcomplicate simple topics. His lectures run fast and I learned more from outside sources than his class. Be prepared to spend a lot of time on labs and homework problems. Utilize office hours and do not get behind because topics build on one another.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: One of his midterms was extremely difficult, but he gave a relatively easy final. He is very eager to help, but sometimes he is confusing. I personally think his future Phys 211 class would be easier than ours. Seems like he is still navigating his teaching style. Overall, nice professor learning how to teach physics to beginners.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: I like Fiona as a person, but I did not enjoy this class. She is known as being the difficult Italian professor but it was extremely difficult. She grades too harsh
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Stewart is a really good professor in class, but she grades too harshly. It is a requirement for students to take three semesters of a language, and as a person learning Italian for the first time I struggled. I took four exams and did not get higher than a 77 on any of them even though I worked extremely hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I liked Professor Stewart as a person, she was very caring of her students, but I wouldn't take the class again. You don't know what you're grade is until she submits your final grade, so if it's not the grade you wanted, you're screwed.

Dr. Stewart is an amazing person. She really cares about students and has reasonable expectations for her freshmen. She isn't here to waste our time, but expects full attendance every day because her class is worth showing up to. She legitimately wants to go out for coffee with students and often pushes us to take Italian, but only in good fun.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Take this class for 140! You wont regret it. He is understanding, a funny guy, and you can really tell he wants the best for his students. He explains everything in a simple and easy-to-understand manner and his tests arent too hard.

He cares a lot about his students and will definitely help you out with the material. There is homework every week but nothing too much to handle. He really tries hard so that you understand the material. I would recommend him for sure.

Professor Mukai was a fun and entertaining teacher who also managed to teach the material in a clear fashion. Always available after class for questions and was understanding when the class struggled.

Dr. Mukai is a great professor. Lecture notes are printed out and he hands them out to the class. Exams are worth about 80% of the grade, but the homework and study guides prepare you very well. Lectures are great and very clear. Offers extra credit. Doesn't waste time in class; if lecture if finished early, then class gets out early. 90% is an A.

Happy that I got to take a class with him. I ended up getting an A- (by like 1/2 a point). Learned a lot about writing an article. Zero chance I thought I would do well but (at least for my group) things start to fall into place if you put the work in and read the things he posts. It's all there, you just have to be smart about reading everything.

Corpuz was the best professor I've had. His course schedule is so organized and caters to the learning potential of students while not being too much of a demand. He really values student feedback which I appreciated. Take home quizzes, no midterm or final, only group projects, uses online resources that current psychologists use in research.

Corpuz is a very professional and organized professor. He comes from a research career and I think his expectations were high but manageable, he is very clear with what he wants and expects you to work hard. I really liked how he communicated with us clearly and decisively about the final week after the fire.

If you're used to cruising by with As, you'll be shaken to your core with how he grades your drafts. Be prepared to learn a lot about scientific writing and make sure to pick a project you're interested in. You can revise everything to rescue your grade but he's super type A and has really high expectations.

I hated the class content and my group but really liked Doctor Corpuz. He's intimidating and intense on grading but he's a very patient teacher. You will definitely feel like you are failing at times but the points setup allows you to turn things around if you revise your paper.

It was a hard course, I never analyzed data or wrote a science paper. I am not a psych major to do research really, but he gave a lot of handouts and links. I liked that he was able to show us real examples of things since he is a scientist in the field today.  Very tough grader on writing but wants you to succeed. Group work was okay most days.

One of the easiest classes to take for an introduction to advertising, PR, and marketing. As long as you do the reading she states in the syllabus you should have an A+ in the course. However, because she is so easy, many dumb athletes will be in the class. Thus, making you feel like Einstein, however you will only have basic knowledge of the cours

Possibly the most intense introductory class ever. It's basically two semesters in one-advertising and PR. You read an entire adv. textbook in the first half, with fill in the blank, T/F, and open ended questions in pop quizzes. She grades the final paper really easily. Requires a lot of study to earn an A. Some extra credit offered.
A bit strange as a person, but lectures are extremely easy to follow. Class was pretty interesting, except as an 8:00am class I fell asleep sometimes. Would recommed class.

Very polite teacher.  Assigns a ton of reading and encourages class participation.  Responds quickly to emails.  Doesn't allow computers to class.  However, posts all powerpoints on blackboard.  Pretty good class, just be willing to do all the work.  She never gets that upset, but you shouldn't miss class.

He is very interested in the material and in discussing it. Bogumil is one of those professors that really wants you to know the subject. His grading was very easy, but the final paper was no walk in the park.

A great class. Grading a bit hard. BTW always checks attendance. Must do the work. He asks you think and then speak. Be prepared to discuss the material or you won't keep up. You be doing Stat programming--dont get insulted-you have to work--a paper too-20 pages
Excellent Prof! A lazy friends in the class. Do the work and come to class. BTW you need to read. You cant ollie him. Step up you snooze you lose--so you cant jump this!
Very easy class, almost insulting.  His lectures can get really boring, but all in all, you come out of the class with at least a ground level knowledge of Stats

I was terrified to take this class since I'm not a Mac user and not tech-savvy with Photoshop, etc. But Dana is very helpful, fun, and sweet. She does teach very fast, so make buddies with an experienced person in the class or make an appointment with her. Take her if you can!

Great teacher and fun class. All lecture time is spent on the computer learning software. Projects are a blast and not too hard. Prof. Z is a sweet lady but sometimes has little patience for stupid questions and she can move a little fast when explaining concepts.  Study for the midterm! (For more reviews, look under her maiden name "Dana Collier")

You will learn a LOT from this class but it gets VERY frustrating. Even if you get As on every project and assignment- each of which you will spend TONS of hours on- you will probably not get a good grade. Mid terms and finals are nearly impossible. You will learn a lot from this class but your grade will not reflect that. Good luck.

I had NO idea what I was doing before taking this class. She was VERY helpful. She loved when students asked her questions and was rarely frustrated if we were confused. Her assignments (photoshop/ illustrator)can be very time-consuming.  You will learn SO much though, so take her! Study for the midterm &final. Do the assignments and youll do fine.

I struggle heavily in learning a foreign language and I made that clear to her the first week and she went far out her way to help me. Exams can be difficult but she prepares you for them. Plenty of points to be earned through presentations, hwrk, and compositions most of all! Extremely caring and a great professor to have highly recommend.

She is very funny and yes you need to come to class, but that should be expected from a language class. she does give 4 absences thought, which is more than any other language class will give you. Also shes fun and easy to talk to, she is very upfront about what is on the tests and the class is very straightforward
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Blancas-Curiel is honestly amazing, I was so nervous about taking this level Spanish class but she made it great. I didn't do well on the first exam but she made it easy to come back from that. She's super personable and really cares about each of her students. She wants everyone in her class to succeed!
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr.  Curiel is a great, personable professor. She is very helpful during office hours. There are a lot of components in this class: quizzes, exams, compositions, oral exams/presentations, participation, homework, and extra credit. Don't get discouraged, and continue to work hard throughout the semester, and you'll do fine.

Professor Gill is fantastic! Her interpersonal skills create a welcoming environment, making class enjoyable. Always well-prepared, her lectures are clear and engaging. A true asset to the department!

Friendly in class, a bit condescending outside of it. 
Not much empathy for external student circumstances as well. Don't expect life difficulties to matter much.
Will give unfair participation grades even if one participates. Ensure you participate more than "fairly often" meaning twice per class at least.

Nice teacher. 3 assignments (draw your family genogram, theory paper (no set pg #), final assignment (MC test)). All due last 3 weeks of class. Lectures are fun. Class is easy. 1 group dicussion on the family crucible, just share thoughts on book.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Gill has gotten great reviews among my peers. She is easy to be in class with for two hours and she is fair with grading. She is newer to teaching but she is extremely nice. I would highly recommend her to other students.

One of the kindest & most caring faculty I met here at Pepperdine!! In this class, we learned how the psychology of how the brain works, how to practice different self-care practices and how to be a better person in this world! He provided a great environment for the class, as I was able to build meaningful connections with many of the students!

He is so awesome!!!! Very understandable and caring. He let us do the final speech a week before finals so we could focus on other subjects. His prompt can be confusing, but I talk to him every time before a paper is due, and he always welcomes me and answer my questions!

I took Ebeling for first year seminar in fall 2021 and he was awesome. I love that the class was super close with each other and with him too. I think that every freshman at Pepp should take this class, it teaches very applicable skills that I use now and will continue to use in the future. Ebeling is always there to just talk and always helps out

I loved Professor Ebeling, he was the best first year seminar professor! He really cared about each and everyone of us in the class. I absolutely loved this seminar "Strenghting Self for Service" and I would recommend it to anyone. He is very there for you as a student and also just to have someone to talk to.

Professor Green is a really amazing and chill professor. He's super knowledgable on what he's teaching. His projects are really straight forward and easy and allow you to be creative. If you ever need help or have issues with adobe he's always there to help troubleshoot any problems and is really understanding. Loved his class 100% would recommend

Easy A. There are rubrics for his projects, but he leaves room for you to be creative. As long as you include what is necessary in the rubric, you will get an A. You get what you put in the class. If you don't want to learn, you won't. If you want to spend time learning about all of Adobe's tools, he will gladly help you. He's always accessible.

Awesome professor, he really just wants you to learn new things about all phases of film production. After asking the students, he even dedicated certain classes specifically towards things that students wanted to learn! Overall, he's just awesome and super chill, really glad I took him.
Great professor, lots of knowledge, amazing class! Highly recommend!

She is a current grad student and you could tell her priority wasn't this class. It was really hard for me to learn anything in the class, she just read off these 70 slide long powerpoints each class. I never felt so unmotivated to learn. She allows cheat sheets on all tests. Free textbook that I actually never opened. HW worth 35% of your grade.

Not too bad of a class. Cheat sheet for all exams. You are taught almost exclusively off of Powerpoint, so some of it feels like teaching yourself. Two exams (noncumulative), one final (cumulative), and HW is worth a ton (35%) of your grade.

Most classes are lectures, and I didn't learn much from those at all. Occasionally she will work out problems on that board (not every class) and that's what actually helps... but lectures didn't teach me anything really. Really light on homework assignments compared to a typical math class.

Lectures are literally just her reading off of screenshots of the textbook for 90 minutes at rapid speed.  Attendance is required, yet I basically taught myself. Never responds to emails, takes a month to post HW grades. PPT slides are outdated and she reuses them. Cool prof, but teaching style is difficult to learn from. Textbook is free.
EXCELLENT
No Comments
prog ogden is the nicest man you will ever meet and is very very enthusiastic about helping students.  he is also the best source on ethics if there are ever any questions
Very nice man, but: Worst. Lecturer. Ever.

Can't decide if this man is a full blown idiot or just a social troll.  Hoping it's the first b/c behavior towards women in the class has been ill-advised. At any rate, he'll never read any of your assignments and is the most disorganized person you'll meet.  You want an A?  You got it.

Paul and the Pepperdine OMET/MALT gang will help you learn one of the most important lessons of your life; -- how to learn.  Be prepared for a course where you are not going to have spoon-fed lecturing. And be prepared for activities that may not make sense to you at first (in fact, may seem crazy), but it will all come together and you'll love it.

disorganized, asks too much while not taking care of his own responsibilities as a prof - way too personal, the personal comments are rude and often 'off-color' - back-sliding Mormon, is disrespectful of women...overall, not good or worth the $$ paid (by the student especially)
His seemingly crazy questions actually make you think and have fun at the same time.

The only assignments that she gives are 3 Five page papers for the entire semester. I personally thought her grading was very subjective and not fair most of the times. She entertaining as a professor but I would not recommend her unless you are an excellent writer or don’t mind getting a B.

You have to write three separate  papers for this class, and each essay has different prompt choices so you can pick your favorite one. Always complete the readings assigned before class because she'll quiz you. Overall she was very helpful and entertaining as a professor. I would recommend her.

She is a good teacher with a contemporary style of teaching.  For example we studied Kanye West and she claims he is a lyrical genius.  Her class is relatively easy with no homework.  The only assignments that she gives are 3 Five page papers for the entire semester. I personally thought her grading was very subjective and not fair sometimes tho.
Definitely one of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine.
Pointless assignments Assignments not relevant to program Lots of busy work Very long lectures Should utilize face to face time and discussions
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Varun was most likely one of my favorite professors. Although he can get a tad boring during his lectures, he genuinely cares about the well-being of his students. His tests are not awfully difficult, just make sure to take notes of EVERYTHING on his Powerpoints.   Also, you shouldn't have to read the textbook. Take notes instead.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Takes himself and his class way too seriously, would not suggest his class whatsoever. Loves to put people on the spot and make them look foolish.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Varun is a really really boring lecturer and during his lectures he will take any chance he gets to shout out his movies that he produced. He claims they are really good and so dramatic that people faint, but the Hollywood Reporter gave him a 0 out of 100. His tests do not reflect his teachings at all and he refused to release notes to the class.
She was the best teacher I have ever had.
Loved her, should have kept her full time
No Comments
I love Dr. Lisagor! She's the best!!
One of the smartest, most personable people I've ever met. Great educator too.

I took Dr. Watson for my first year seminar and I respect and admire him so much. He is a really awesome guy and really cares about each student. He takes the time to learn how his students are doing and really cares about the school. He has been at the school for 45+ years and always has a smile on his face. I highly recommend taking his classes.

He is a great guy, that wants to be a part of your life at Pepperdine. He used to be the athletic director here, and is the head of the Sports Administration program now. One of the few professors at Pepperdine that I consistently talk to.

He's worked at the university for a really long time, and has held several positions, including the director of athletics. I took his 1st-year seminar class (Why Sports?). The material wasn't that interesting, but I'm glad I was in it because he's such a nice guy and really cares about his students. He is there when you need him for any help.

Never left a review but this guy needs one. This class isn't an easy A, but if everything else is taken up, I would have this as a backup class for sure. Lectures are dope and he is funny. It is just the tests. I would say that the tests are all memorization, so make a friend with the smart people next to you and just make quizlets.
so good

Dr. Simonowitz is a very nice guy but his lectures are super disorganized and the class feels as if it has no direction. Test material is only given two days before the exams and you will not know your grade until the end of the semester. I would recommend taking a more interesting class and professor

Dr. Simonozwitz' lectures are all over the place and he grades extremely hard. You also don't know what your grade is in the class until he posts it at the end of the semester. He never posts his powerpoints from class either and doesn't give the study guide for exams until the class before (two days before the exam is not enough study time).

Professor Park is very kind and makes the class pretty easy. Each class is a lecture where you have to take notes. He tells you exactly what's going to be on the exam which makes them not very difficult. There are weekly assignments but they take very little time and are easy. Great class for getting fine arts requirement.

Professor Park is a great professor who is passionate about what he teaches and makes a genuine effort to get to know each of his students. He gave clear study guides and guidelines for all exams and the final presentation. Take notes in lectures and you should be set. The only other assignments were weekly journals.  Loved his class this semester!

Professor Park is super chill & understands that we are college students going through life. Every class is a lecture, but he incorporates music- and its often him playing instruments. The tests & assignments are so manageable & he gives you a study guide. This was my easiest & most enjoyable class. He also listens to your recommended music.

Lectures weren't heavy at all. The course consists of 3 non-cumulative exams that are fairly manageable, then a presentation at the end. The only weekly assignments are journals which aren't difficult, I'd definitely take his class again.

Do not take this class. She is mean as does not care about students. Instructions are different on rubric than what she tells you in class. She grades way to harshly and will not give you a good grade. Way too time consuming and not worth it. Strongly advise not to take this class.

On one hand she is very passionate and wants her students to do well but on the other hand she is insanely strict for no reason. Do 6 hours of homework and send in the studio log but write wrong week number or forget something very minor? No credit. Though she does seem to grade leniently for projects. Be passionate and kind and you'll do fine.
mean and not good

Professor Kim, Truong is so mean that she WON'T give you good grades. The instructions are not clear on the syllabus. She said everything verbally, and the requirements are much more detailed than what mentioned in her syllabus. She is generous in giving students ZERO.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: The lectures are a little dull, but he is very knowledgeable about the subject. Pay attention to specific details in the readings because they will show up on the quizzes!
Very entertaining professor that made this boring subject entertaining. There is no Homework and occasional Quizzes that are easy and take about a half hour to study for.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Honestly ridiculous the amount of work he requires. Quizzes are over multiple textbook chapters/Bible chapters at once and very detailed, hard to keep the material straight. Have to be able to recognize specific verses and what book they're from - for no reason. Spend more work on his class than upper level, major specific courses. Don't take.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Does a great job explaining concepts and he knows the subject really well. There was a lot of reading and lectures were long, but that's partly because I took it as 4-week summer class. The quizzes/exams were not hard if you put in the time to prepare for them, and there was only one other assignment which helped with learning and was not difficult
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Dr. Duron was amazing for calc! Great attitude all of the time, and she would give study guides and practice problems that would be very similar to the test. You never were blindsided or surprised, if you put in the work you will do well. She is also so so so caring of every student, and makes a great effort to get to know you!
TAKE HER SHE IS THE BEST MATH PROF AT PEPP! she explained calc so well, i actually understood everything and barely studied and got an A

I definitely recommend taking Dr. Duron for a math class! She is not only a wonderful person but also extremely intelligent. I think her exams are fair and she is willing to go above and beyond to make sure you get the help you need in order to succeed.

Dr. Duron is one of the best professors I had at Pepperdine. She is so easy to understand and considering how hard the material is she does a great job at teaching it. She is also very understanding and is always willing to help students and support them in any way that she can. She's incredible, please take her if you can!

She is one of the best professors I have had here. She is super caring and will be flexible with you if you are putting in the effort. She expects you to come to all classes and there is a good amount of homework. The materials she gives will prepare you for the exams. I would highly recommend her class!

Professor Duron is lovely. I took her class a little while ago, but still rave about it. She is always eager to help and will find time to fit you in her schedule. However, if coming in without prior Calculus knowledge, be prepared for a slight learning curve. She loves math and loves her students. Take her if you can!

Dr. Hooten Wilson is complicated. She knows a lot about what she teaches and is super passionate. However, she does not tell you your grade until the end of the semester. She expects a lot from her students outside of class and in order to get an A you have to attend every after school event. If you are ready to live Great Books then take her!

She takes the time to get to know her students well, is vert intelligent, and great at what she does. As long as you show up to class with the reading and annotations done and are actually trying your best to learn to strive for excellence, you should be getting good feedback and you aren't graded until the end of the semester.

Worst professor of my entire life. She grades based on favoritism and if she does not like you, might as well drop the class. Never take her and save yourself. She is educated and well rounded, however she has to work on her teaching as it is not professional based on my experience.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Hooten Wilson is the best GB professor I have had (I only got to take her for GB 4). She is brilliant, authentic, and cares for her students growth in academia and as an individual. I have only good things to say about her. She knows A LOT about what she teaches. I will take what I learned in her class with me for the rest of my life. TAKE HER!

Not Clear, topics could be Interesting but he doesnt know what students want. Cynical. I had an A at the end of the semester and he gave me a B cause he said I did a good to very good job-according to Pepp Hanbook-thats a B. Stay Away

His directions=always unclear,even if you stay after class to ask him for clarification.He tries to teach his students about subjects he has no experience in.For example,he tried to teach us about love after openly addmitting that he has never been in love.He makes girls cry(literally).Assignments=worthless.He is on a power trip.What a sad sad Man.

Father Joe IS AWESOME! I took this class as a summer school elective and initially had absolutely no interest, but he made it quite enjoyable. Hi lectures are very laid back, and sometimes he'll play music. It's definitely a relief to have him after some prior experience with nazi Pepperdine professors. Consider yourself lucky if you have him.

While the daily quizzes over the reading were annoying, they were pretty basic if you did the reading (and even when I didn't, I would still get 810). The class is organized, and she's the greatest. The information you're learning is generally relevant, and the speeches you're required to give really will help you become a more confident speaker.

Wonderful COM 180 professor, friendly and personable, Professor Navarro is always there when you need her.  You do have to put in some effort to the class; but it is well worth it.  Her lectures are interesting, and she is crystal clear on what she expects of her students.  She is always willing to help you improve, and gives you stellar feedback.

Extremely helpful and nice young professor. You should write notes when you read the book (for the tests) and need to spend a lot of time preparing speeches to do well. She has high standards but wants to see you succeed.
Not fair and does not care about anyone , but his pay. Isn't kind and be littles all students. Good luck.
an interesting man~
Tony Cason is a wonderful, sexy man

This class is a joke. The sad part is, he tries very hard. He tries so hard that he sweats excessively every class. He wants an engaging learning environment, but I honestly don't think he knows his stuff, OR how to communicate it. And yes, grades are arbitrary - based on participation and 1 paper and 1 quiz, but you never know your scores.

One of the greatest professors I have had. Flawless English with no comprehension problems. Funny man with insight to some of the most important issues of humanities. He loves Romanticism, and is an artistic critique. Makes students think on their own and initiates great classroom discussion.

Watch out for the Gu-isms. Grades are completely random. Use a word with -ism and it helps your chance to get an A.  Don't plan on using the textbook, and to be honest, classes are time to do homework. Consider it a mandatory study hall like in high school. Definitely worth the experience...
Lectures are organized. Incorporates storytelling, which is entertaining. Very laid back. Loves and talks about his cats, calling them ninja assassins.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Critical, maybe cynical, but something thats necessary in a world easily persuaded by image
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Professor Schlessinger is one of of kind. He thoroughly enjoys connecting with students and while providing feedback about their life choices. His lectures tend to be entertaining and will include pictures of his two cats. Professor Schlessinger can be found in the library either sitting on top of counters or in the Caf feeding the less fortunate.

Professor Labban is an amazing lecturer and keeps the class engaged with fun activities, you really learn a lot! There is no textbook and barely any homework. Her tests are challenging but she gives a clear study guide and will help during office hours. For the group projects, you pick your members, so choose wisely and you'll do great.

Okay. Actually really hard for an intro to marketing class. She grades way to harsh and expects WAY too much. For the case analysis project, there was no rubric, we went in for help & she wouldn't help because "it's a competition," and then proceeded to tell everyone how wrong their projects were after each presentation. DON'T TAKE HER!

Labban is probably the best professor in the Marketing dept. at Pepperdine. She challenged me in every way possible, from understanding marketing principles to pitching presentations! Very heavy on GROUP PROJECTS. One huge marketing simulation project runs through the entire semester, CHOOSE YOUR MATES WISELY *Actively participate. Study together!
Honestly one of the best classes I have taken so far. She cares that you succeed in this course. She makes lectures fun and exciting. I defiantly recommend taking this class with her.
Amazing professor and clinician. Learned so much from her and fell in love with Group Therapy. Highly recommend this class. Hands down, favorite class to date.

Best professor! Professor Rose is so interesting and insightful. Group therapy seems to be a universal favorite class but she made this a class I was excited for each week. She shares a lot from her own personal and professional life and it is really helpful. Take a class from her if you can; you'll be so glad you did!

Professor Franco is the sweetest person, but she gives a LOT of homework so make sure you have the time. She is also unorganized with assigning HW & announcements, she'll upload HW 3-4 days after the original date she was suppose to (giving us less time to do it). I did not expect this much HW so please beware.

Professor Franco is one of the kindest professors on campus. She is very understanding, caring, and nice. The homework she assigns can be lengthy at times but nonetheless prepare you well for the exams. Exams are online, a mix of multiple choice and free response questions. Her grading distribution is pretty fair and she gives extra credit.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Franco is amazing! Homework is lengthy but it really prepares you for the exams. She is very understanding and wants students to do their best. Take her if you can!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Martinez is probably one of the most caring professors I have had. Her lectures are clear, the course isn't very demanding, and she provides good feedback. She is very accessible outside of class, and just genuinely cares for her students. I would definitely recommend taking her course since it is a GE.

Public speaking is terrifying but she literally made it fun. Speech criteria was not limiting at all. She's super caring and always looks out for students. I never felt intimidated by her even though this class definitely was as someone who's scared at public speaking. Please take her!

Dr. Martinez was so amazing and so sweet, she valued our mental health more than anything else so was very understanding if we needed to miss class. She gave really great feedback and always would help if you needed it. She answered emails quickly. I would recommend her, she is one of the best com teachers at Pepperdine.

He never explained how to do any assignment. He even said how we would have to ask for help from our peers or watch YouTube tutorials. He loved talking about himself and always gave us personal anecdotes. You can never drop into his office, you had to make appointments. If you take COM 205, get ready to use Adobe on every assignment without help.

constant tests and projects, no time at all between them, not enough guidance or support you're pretty much on your own. LOTS of reading. very high expectations for an intro class. the syllabus is all off. strict deadlines with NO EXCEPTIONS (like partner not doing work or being sick) multiple people dropped throughout semester, even in last weeks

Prof Kim is all around a great guy, he's kind and charismatic, was always clear about our assignments, and just made the classes engaging. Make sure you hand in your work on time, show him that you're listening and I promise you won't regret taking his class.

She is the nicest person ever, so helpful and really wants you to learn and do good. Very caring and one of my favorite professors ever. She wants you to be fully immersed in Italian culture and will sometime bring in Italian food or tell you Italian cultural aspects. Prepares you for tests and teaches wonderfully. 100/10!!

I just took this professor's ITAL152 course, and it was probably my favorite class this semester. She makes learning the language fun, and makes time for you outside of class to go over any material you're having trouble with. She's super understanding, and the small class size makes it a more personal learning environment.
Very sweet professor at Pepperdine and is willing to work with you. Class does move quickly so it is helpful to review the textbook beforehand to not be completely thrown during class. I loved her!

She isn't bad, but it felt like she didn't teach us much on adobe, if we wanted to know how to do something we would all just have to look up a youtube video. This class is easy enough but I didn't feel like I learned too much and class time felt wasted a lot of the time.

Easy class for MSCO371, and Davis is very nice. However, I took this class Davis' first semester teaching it so it was very disorganized. Wish we had spent more time learning the basics of Adobe programs and had more structured graphic design projects. Not a hard class, but it did require some self-teaching in Photoshop and Illustrator.

Professor Davis was fun and knowledgeable, an easy grader, and a great professor. She helped a lot with the Adobe programs and she even made it an assignment to visit an art museum for free (which was fun)! I recommend taking her for any fine arts/digital design classes. My only complaint is that she did not upload grades, so you had to guess.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Christie is a very nice person, her classes are not overly difficult, and she is a clear communicator of ideas. You have no excuse for not doing well if you have a single creative bone in your body and put in a little effort with some degree of consistency.

I recommend taking Clancy to get your COM 180 requirement.  My speeches improved in this class and also it was fun and we talked as a class a lot about current events and random things.  Speech grading is sometimes unpleasantly surprising like all COM 180 classes but things even out in the end.

Take her for COM Theory!  She is great!  Lectures are fun, short, and chill.  Not a lot of homework.  Tells you exactly what's on the 2 tests. Great teacher who likes to have fun with the class to get us through what could be a dull class.  Great Prof!
You do not learn anything, but it is an easy A. Clicker points are taken at the end of class, but other than that you don't have to really participate. Extra credit is given pretty often.

Easy class. Dont buy the book. It costs over $100. As long as you study your notes you dont really need the book. The only reason you would need it is if she said something from the book is going to be on the test and in that case you could ask some one to look at the book.
No Comments
She has a fabulous education background (Middlebury and Harvard) and a charming&humble personality. I think everybody likes her and learned a lot from her class. Just enjoy it!!

She gives students a very specific study guide to work for exams. She even have a class helping you to review before mid-term. She curves all quizs and midterm. But, ARTH is a VERY memorial course. If you are not passionate in culture, art work or religion. Then, I guess it will be a marathon for you to read the textbooks and memorise them.
She's amazing! So nice and always wants her students to do well
Great Professor
I really recommend this professor, I took with him Psy 637 and it was one of my best classes!

I am blown away that Dr. Hanna wasn't listed on this site.  I seriously cannot recommend this professor any higher! This is my 2nd master's degree and btwn both grad degrees and undergrad he is BY FAR my favorite professor. He is so insightful and caring; really makes you think in different ways; very interesting, and a SUPER nice guy! TAKE HIM!
He is not only a great professor, he is helping you to expand your network and giving you different ideas about how is your career look like if you want to work in finance.

Prof. Malladi is by far the best Finance professor that I've had in my MBA program. He curtails the lectures based on the feedback from his students: he wants to make sure everyone can learn the material, whether you are advanced in the field or never had exposure to it. Great professor, I will be taking his Financial Modeling class.
Great professor!  Intelligent, funny, and helpful.
rating_tags: CARES ABOUT STUDENTS--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Definitely my least favorite professor I've ever had. She's not a bad person, but she shouldn't be teaching. She expects everyone to be an expert in her subjects immediately and she's not very understanding or accommodating. If you can't avoid taking her class, work hard and go to office hours.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Satchel is GREAT! Attending class and participating in class is IMPERATIVE for your grade. There is a quiz before each class and the exams are a little challenging, SO STUDY! Never be afraid to ask a question in her class, and give her your best. If you do, you'll be just fine. Gain her respect as a fellow person as well; she is good to know.

A kind woman, a decent professor. The class is basically just projects on top of each other culminating in a very large, professional, presentation. Can get pretty stressful if you don't stay on top of the work because you will sometimes only have the class once a week with the other time devoted to working. Definitely learned a lot. Hard grader.

Knows the content well, very organized. The lectures get very boring, so only your selective attention is needed in my opinion. However, she got very biased towards the end for her grading- she will definitely make it known to you on your grade if she likes you or not. She will note if you went to office hours, etc. and that will be reflected...
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Quizzes every week, so you gotta stay on top of studying. No final exams though. If you have a habit of studying daily and have a low class load, this is a class for you.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Tests are super easy. The lit review paper seems intimidating but you turn in a rough draft. If you fix what she tells you, you'll get full points. 4 exams and one literature review

Dr. Emery may be the best professor I've ever had. He knows how to make class engaging and he really takes well to feedback. He wants students to not only learn, but to understand and engage that knowledge with the world. If Dr. Emery taught all my classes, I would be very happy. He is very intelligent and loves discussing politics with students.

One of the best professors I've had, he's very caring and understanding. Wants all of his students to do well on the course and if for any reason you can't submit your assignments on time, he'll understand and do his best to help you. He's always available outside class and makes that very clear.

Dr. Emery is truly the greatest. He doesn't expect you to come to class, but he's super funny and engaging so it makes you want to actually attend. He's great via email, pretty much reachable at any given time. He doesn't want to trick you, he really wants you to just learn. His midterm was literally word for word the review, so if you studied A+!

People give 5s too easily. But Dr. Mann is a good professor, he's not the kind of teacher that will change your life, but he works hard to help students succeed. Honestly, he took it pretty easy on us, I'm very bad at physics so that made it more difficult, but objectively the class should not have been terribly hard. He was very understanding

Really tries his best to help you succeed in his class. There was very little homework and attendance is tracked! He's always there to answer your questions and guide you through labs and such. The exams were super hard for me.

Homework counts for little, but it's a good measuring stick to see how you will do on the exams. Class is difficult, but Dr. Mann is organized and will go to great lengths to help you understand anything. He appreciates participation, so be engaged; it'll be easier to learn if your following along anyway. Final can replace lowest grade in class

Marcant is a great professor! She really cares about her student's ability to speak French and is willing to work with you regardless of how good you are. If you aren't very experienced, it will be difficult but have patience and work with her - you'll be just fine. She also grades very easily despite some of her exams being difficult.

I took Marcant for both 152 and 251, and she was an amazing professor. Super kind, always willing to meet with you outside class, and really wanted you to be a better french speaker. Her class will be easy or tough based on your knowledge of french, but if you aren't good, do not worry. Work with her through the semester, and you will learn.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Best French teacher to ever live. If I could choose one person in this world to adopt me it would probably be Marcant. She goes out of her way to ensure you have all of the resources you need to do well. Believes that the responsibility is on the student to learn. Goat.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She is one of the most terrible professor at Pepperdine. She is not understanding professor after I came back maternity leave and she gave me hell while dealing with post patrimony and practicum class. She said my case was terrible and I asked for further feedback and she never did. Save yourself the headache and take someone else

Zero lecturing. Gives very little clinical guidance to students. She makes students do all the talking as we have to present a 11page case and a book report. She shows YouTube videos in class.  Waste of money and waste of time.

Waste of time and money. Her class is spent on watching videos and listening to one student reading his/her case/book paper and other students commenting.  Her contribution consists of chitchatting and YouTube videos of animals. If you ask a clinical question, she will ask you to talk to your supervisor. Cancels class randomly. Truly awful.

Awful! Avoid at all costs. She makes being in class miserable. Everyone is quiet because she has a terrible attitude. She should not be allowed to teach at Pepperdine. Basically, everyone picks a week to present, and it is for an hour of the class period, and she does nothing. We do HER job. Our notes are from other people's presentations.

Awful. Would never take her again. The entire class is different presentations every week from students teaching us the material- not her. Massive paper on something she's never taught. She didn't teach us a single thing in fact. Terrible Class culture: silent, worst class I've taken at Pepperdine. Not friendly, and doesn't care for her students.

Schein looked at her phone every class session, she canceled class last minute does not apply the same consideration to her students. The students basically taught class with their presentations she did not provide any new insights or lecturing except play videos. She did not even pay attention to the presentations opting to be on her phone.
Pretty flexible. Caring and considerate of circumstances.
