Prof. Drai was such a great calc teacher. He is patient and willing to answer as many questions as possible for you to understand. The class moves a little slow, but that makes it easy to do well. I spent half the semester in person and the other half online, but Drai was flexible and helpful in both settings. Altogether a solid class!

Great guy, really forgiving on grades ! Don't get stressed about failing the first midterm, you can totally recover!! Turn in your homework bc the grader gives full credit for almost anything, Lectures aren't the greatest for math, but office hours are super accessible! get to know him!

If you like a professor who is organized, she is the best one. English is my second language. Cindy's PowerPoint is always very clear. She had directed answers to my questions and offered extra credit. I enrolled in two of her classes and got A in both. She makes me feel like my work always pays off. If I had chances, I would always choose her.

The younger Sayani Sister to Sheila, she lectures heavy but it this is her style shes very informative and straight to the point. It seems like she's been doing this for a long time. Shes also empathetic and she looks for specifics on projects/papers but she also really wants to prepare you well, as a clinician and for your licensing and law exams.

Insanely lecture heavy. There are two tests, just gotta study for them. She offers a lot of extra credit, but with her second to last assignment, she is very nit-picky. Like WAY too nit-picky. Takes lots of points off for format, grammar. Make sure you triple check before turning in the lit review. And drink something caffeinated before her class.
Brilliant woman! She will do anything for her students!

I love Professor Marshall but I don't think her class prepared me for upper-div classes. I really didn't learn anything. She is an AMAZING lady though, incredible, the most empathetic and thoughtful prof I've had at Pepp. Her grading is very fair, she wants you to succeed, you will not fail.

Dr. Marshall is a very sweet woman and is an awesome professor for French. She provides very clear grading expectations and truly wants each one of her students to succeed. There are a lot of assignments/ exams in the class but her course is very straightforward and doable. I would highly recommend her to any student that needs to take French!
Easy. Accessible outside of class is an understatement….

For: POSC 250, not SOC 200. Super nice teacher! He's very eccentric and fast-paced, but it creates a pretty engaging academic environment. He helps out a lot in the labs and with homework, and your grade is split between quite a few parts, which is nice. The tests were all open note/computer, so pretty easy if you put in the effort.

An easygoing professor. He had weekly online quizzes that were open-note and based directly on the lecture. He usually let class go early and tried his best to keep things lively and tell personal stories. Worth taking for the sociology GE.
Great professor and very easy going.
THE MOST AMAZING GUY THERE IS! THIS GUY ROCKS.. A VERY KNOWLEDGABLE MAN WHO KNOWS HOW TO GET HIS STUFF ACROSS. VERY GOOD TEACHER-STUDENT RELATIONS.
No Comments

Best professor that I ever had in my life! He is super caring, funny, and explains things very clearly. He provides a rubric of what he expects for every assignment so you know what he wants. It does require more time than usual outside of the classroom but it is a totally fun class. Lastly, he teaches things that you ACTUALLY use in the real world
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: BEST EVER. ALSO GREAT WITH GENESIS LAB.
Asks for way too much work. Grades projects way too harshly. Expects students to be able to be pros at photoshop and illustrate.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Taso is really open to adjusting for different people. He's been very lenient with grading when I've struggled, but also makes an effort to teach additional material to students with more experience. He's not looking to give out low grades to anyone, but skipping class is the one thing that will seriously hurt your grade. Really a chill fun guy

Great, chill young guy. He moves very quickly, and tries to set different paces for people of different backgrounds. It's a small class, but still can be confusing. Be prepared to practice everything daily outside class, because it comes at you quickly, and performance is part of the grade
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Had him for intro to guitar! He's really awesome and if you want to learn to play guitar, this is a fun way to do it while getting a GE out of the way. If you haven't played before, you will actually have to put in time outside of class to practice the material in order to do well. Super clear rubric for quizzes so there's no reason not to get an A

I love Professor Mintzer! She is quick grader and a fair one at that. She isn't very tech savvy, but she gives you access to her phone number, so that you can contact her easily and quickly. She truly cares about her students and enjoys participation. I would take a class with her again.

Beyond delivering exceptional lectures, Dr. Mintzer goes above and beyond to ensure that every student feels supported and valued. She demonstrates a genuine investment in the academic and personal growth of each student.  I am grateful for the opportunity to learn from Dr. Mintzer and would highly recommend her courses.

I like Dr. Mintzer! She shows a genuine interest in the material she teaches also in her students. Each week, she'll go around the class and have everyone share insight on the weekly topic- its a good way to see the diversity in the class. At times she's a little all over the place and you might have to ask her to repeat things but she's great!

Kelly Todd is an amazing professor who cares so deeply about her students and what she teaches. I would 100% take this class again. She grades based on how much you improve in the dances not how perfect you are. She explains the steps so clearly and is willing to go over it again until you get it. It was a great way to exercise for 2hrs each week.

This was a fantastic class for me! During the pandemic, it kept me sane. She is incredibly compassionate and understanding. The dances were enjoyable to learn, and she gives helpful feedback. Once a week, students had to learn a choreography, and there was a final that contained a paper. For sure, I would recommend taking a course with her!

She is a wonderfully kind lady who cares about her students and is very passionate about the subject. The class is in no way hard, but you should definitely attend. It's a lot of fun and you'll get A very easily if you show up, participate, and improve over the semester. You do NOT need to be a good dancer, just improve.

Jackson Felkins is so cute and so funny. I really loved his interactive anatomy lab, I couldn't imagine going through an experience like that with anyone who wasn't the most attractive boy in Malibu. He removes all barriers, so you can see everything perfectly clearly, and doesn't hide any of the intricacies of what he's showing.

I took anatomy with Dr. Felkins. He showed me so much about my body that I didn't even know was there. Sometimes I went to office hours for extra lessons; they were that great!. I learned so much and am so much more in touch with who I am because of this class.
Hardest anatomy class I've ever taken. If you try to ask questions he does nothing but interrupts you and pretends to not hear you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Not taking anther class with this professor!

Pam is fine. She is a decent person and if you don't do the essay readings its no big deal. But she does not grade very nicely. Go to her office hours and let he critique your paper before you turn it in. She is very harsh. Attendance is a big deal its -10 for each unexcused absence. She's fine but pick someone else if you can.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Her grading is extremely harsh. I have never met a more harsh grader throughout my entire education experience. I would write essays, meeting her prompts and points, but would somehow always "fail to meet" her expectations. It was useless to ask for help as well. She'd say "I can't spoon food you" and then leave us in the dark, harshly grading.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Best Professor EVER!! So insightful and helpful in and outside of the classroom. Very collaborative and open/receptive to student ideas. 10/10 would take her again!

reflection paper, group presentation, and final paper. She was caring and has expertise in the field. I wish she stayed a little after class to discuss q's but she made time in the weekend. Wish she was more clear on what she wanted but if you ask her to clarify she will. Overall, a great professor.

Professor Ives is passionate, knowledgable, & supportive. Class consisted of 1 final paper & weekly forum post. Initially I was intimidated by the forum post, but it enabled such an enriching learning experience as we were able to share our thoughts/experience and become aware of our peers. I wish I could take all my classes with Ives!

Took him in London for HUM212,HUM313, &HIST204. He is genuinely funny & passionate. However, lectures are totally blended with very personal life stories+angry rants, & you are graded by 3 papers only with vague criteria. I wrote better papers my 2nd semester with him, got points off for stuff that was ok before. The Rachel Barnes worship is odd.

Such a kind and caring prof. Definitely loves history and wants his students to learn, but doesn't expect you to memorize everything. One presentation, two exams (including the final). If you study and prepare you'll be just fine.

Professor Hicks is the worst professor I have ever taken at Pepperdine. I took it online and he does not use any slides. The class was just him randomly talking about his life in the south, like a podcast. He is a really tough grader and all his tests are essay based. Criteria is not as clear as he says it is. Only midterm, presentation, and final.

If you are going to take Great Books, take this professor. He gives very specific and helpful critiques on essays and he does not have you do any discussion posts or extra work besides just reading and essays. 10/10, highly recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: TAKE PROF KOCH! He's nice and relatable because he's young, and he's easy to approach. Yes, there is a lot of boring reading for hw, but if you stay on top of it, it's not a problem. Your final grade depends on 3-4 essays and participation. No other assignments. Give your input in class and put effort into essays and you're good. 20/5 rating :)

Professor Koch is passionate about the course material, and he is intentional about including everyone in discussion time. The reading assignments are reasonable and so are the essays. He doesn't care too much about the length, more about the thought process and content. He has helped me learn how to close read and write better. Take his class!

Prof. Quarles was my favorite professor. This course is the perfect difficulty for a GE. Class is engaging and interesting. The grading criteria is very clear, you are graded on very few things- she gives very clear feedback on your drafts- if you implement them you will get a good grade. She is incredibly understanding. Go to office hours !!!

Professor Quarles is a super caring professor. We need to write 3 papers and 1 video essay as our final. She can be a tough grader, but she is always willing to help if you ask. I would take her again if I could!

Consists of 4 or 5 papers that are written throughout the semester. Pop culture oriented, not realy my thing so I didn't enjoy the class. Not a whole lot of homework aside from the enormous papers. Essay prompts are super specific, you have to understand the material to do well on papers. Be prepared for 2-3 readings before coming to every class.
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The professor is not enjoyable. She was passive aggressive to me all semester until I finally withdrew.

This professor thinks she is high and mighty. Read her psychology today summary. The woman brags and shows now humble bones in her body. She talks about how superior she is and how she is the best. She is extremely disrespectful to you if she doesn't like you. I missed the second class and she hated me from there.

Dr. Bradley is a good professor, she's understanding, she lectures on her PowerPoints, she does not post them, there was a group project that was a total of 30min, a paper, journal entry, and attendance. She does share stories that relate to the material. The books she has us read but doesn't ask questions on them.
Very nice and funny! Easy to relate to and makes the material crystal clear.

Such a nice man with so much experience. I would love to learn from him! Too bad I didn't - I learned from a book and my other classmates (who oftentimes think they know it all- how old are they again?) instead.
Takes Attendance. Class is pointless, waste of time. Don't take this class if possible.

Hands down the best art teacher I have ever had.  I just wish he was teaching a portfolio class!  My work is so much better after having his instruction.  His art 105 class is very labor intensive, definitely not something for the faint of heart.
I really enjoyed the class.  He makes learning the material interesting and enjoyable.  It was a very challenging class and his technique made me a much better artist in a very short amount of time.

Jon is a working professional artist and has a lot of insight to help artists of all abilities.  He pushes everyone to get better and offers valuable critique to help students prepare for the real world.   Its a long class but the classroom setting is fun and relaxed. overall great class

If you do the work, you will get so much out of his class. He is a great teacher if you actually put the effort in to do the work. Entered the class thinking I'd hate it, exited loving it and being so much more knowledgeable.
expected way too much for a GE. take an easier and more interesting GE than this.
Avoid taking as non western GE. This is like taking Humanities x 10. Workload is unreal.

If you want to keep your sanity in this school, stay away from this person. She's not even qualified to be called a professor. She never explains well, doesn't teach, and confuses everyone on assignments, course materials, and tests. My writing skills didn't improve at all. Avoid, Avoid, Avoid. Learn English writing correctly and avoid this person.
Super easy class! She is quirky in her own way, but that is something you can overlook. Super sweet and very helpful. I enjoyed her and really, anyone can get an A.

Do not, I repeat, DO NOT take Professor Smith. I can't say I have ever had a worse teacher in my life. She is unclear about assignments and inconsistent in her explanations. She is not helpful in the slightest.  She does not know how to teach English. She tries to be funny, but fails miserably. Terrible professor. Avoid her at all costs.

Long, boring lectures about "American History" but she skips over very important information and instead focuses on slavery for 34 of the semester. Fine but then don't call it an American History class. There is a lot more to America than that. She did allow 3 or 4 absences before she marked you down which was awesome.

She's approachable as a person and gives helpful feedback on essays. She is not a hard grader at all. The essays are not difficult either. The only problem I had with her was that she took too long to grade them. The course is reading intensive but you don't have to read the whole chapter, just the chronology, chapter summary, and the review.

She knows a lot and wants to share her knowledge and passion, but she reads her lectures off a sheet of paper so she's not very engaging. Lectures don't include anything in the textbook so you have to read everything, sometimes over 100 pages per week. Write papers about discrimination against women, immigrants, and slaves and you'll be solid.

Professor Wimmer is of a rare breed of teachers who really make you think about the subject matter at hand in a new light. His writing assignments allow for creativity, and his teaching style is laid-back, but effective. I would highly recommend taking a course with him.
The best and most entertaining teacher I have ever had. i recommend him for sure!!

Finally, a real writer...fiction, nonfiction, tv,film! What better background could we have in an English profeessor?!  Professor Wimmer is a renaissance man, a hottie, fair to students, encourages deep thought.  Take his courses when offered...and get a real education!!  Why isn't he full-time?!

Probably my favorite professor at Pepperdine. He is real and honest. Its not an easy class, but you will come out of it with more confidence and public speaking skill than before. Register early, the class gets full in minutes.
Mr. Chanos is an exceptional professor.  I feel lucky to have had the opportunity to work with and learn from him.

Mr. Chanos is an incredible teacher. The way he is able to communicate his ideas is something that is hard to find in these modern times. His no-nonsense policies keep students honest, yet he has an innate ability to make his students comfortable, and to make his class fun and very enjoyable. His professionalism is evident in everything he does.

Dr. Bowen is so kind and is an incredible professor. You can tell that she cares about her students and she is passionate about the material. Having class online can be difficult to manage but she was very engaging and made things relevant. Definitely take a class with her if you have the opportunity!

Dr. Diana Bowen is the SWEETEST professor I have ever had. She cares SO much about her students, and she is a very helpful professor. The work is very manageable, just make sure you know the due dates. She is happy to talk to you outside of class, and also gave me almonds and snacks when I wasn't feeling good. :) She is a real gem, so take her!

Dr. Bowen is one of the best teachers I've had at Pepp. She truly cares about her students and is very easy to get along with. Her class is interesting and the workload is very manageable. She designs it to help students learn for future courses and life. Brush up on your APA formatting. Definitely take her course if you have the opportunity to!

Popovich is an incredibly caring professor.  However, he does not understand how to keep things clear and concise.  1 question in office hours may last 25 minutes.  For example, I went to office hours for his class and waited over 50 minutes to ask one question, not because of the amount of people in office hours, but because he talks TOO MUCH.
Great professor, but way too peppy in the am.
Best. Teacher. Ever. (well, duking it out with Kerr).

Did not regret taking Dr. Van Meter! Very passionate about his subject, and is able to explain his knowledge of the subject clearly to the students. Although attendance is technically not mandatory, there is a quiz or a paper due every class so he expects you to not ditch class. In short, if you work for it, you will get a good grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He only cares about grammar and format instead of your content. That's all you need to know to get a good grade.

I considered transferring to another university until I took Dr. Van Meter's Hum 212 course this summer. The minute he opened his mouth on the first day of class I knew that I was going to learn a lot from this professor, and I did. *Daily Quizzes: 40% (fill in the blank), Twice-Weekly Writing Assignments (1 pg double-spaced): 40%, Final Exam: 20%.

Professor Smith was lovely to have as my first-year seminar instructor. She really cares about the mental and physical wellbeing of all her students, and respected our boundaries. SAAJ met weekly for a class period of five hours, which for me was a lot, especially because most other students don't have ANY classes on Wednesdays.
Professor Smith's classes are very much lead by the direction the class wants to take them. It creates a really different type of learning, one that's super interesting and collaborative.

Professor Smith is amazing! She is passionate about her work and she cares about her students. She is flexible with deadlines and is very accessible outside of class. It is all discussion-based, and there are no tests. I only used the textbook for citations on assignments. But, the class requires a lot of introspection and can be very political.
W professor. Definitely take him over any other professors. Prepare for the tests. Brings in super influential people. He genuinely teaches great material and he is such a nice guy.

Take his class - Trust me !!!! He brings in incredible guest speakers (Disney, Google, Rams, Tradedesk, etc) and you make key connections with industry professionals. If you do the work you will get an A guaranteed. He doesn't really put things in the grade book during the year but it is okay because everyone gets an A. Love him as a person!

Ben is the absolute best. He's incredibly well respected in his industry shares his knowledge with his students. He brought in lots of guest speakers including from NBC, Apple, Google, and Twitter who all offered internships to interested students. The midterm and final are very easy-- they are open note and he tells you the questions in advance.
Professor Mendoza was so hopeful and clear on his assignments. There is a lot of ZyBooks assignments which help reinforce your learning in class. GOAT.
Not that hard. I like this professor. He is caring and respected. As long as complete the homework and understand all the problems, good to go!
Learned a lot. Tough class. Drill zybooks.

A really great Professor for some very difficult to understand subjects. Willing to talk through problems outside of class and explains things thoroughly. Test is very clear and fair, pay attention to the lectures and ask questions and you will do well.

Professor Johnson is the epitome of a student-first professor. He is actively involved on campus and commits to helping students academically and professionally. His lectures are easy to understand and often incorporate his work experience with the DOJ. He also has a great jumpshot.

Prof. Johnson makes complex material digestible and interesting. His lectures always provide a clear rule statement and applicable doctrinal takeaway, weaving past topics into his lectures and showing how they connect or apply to current material. He's also approachable, selfless, and willing to provide support and advice outside the classroom.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Possibly the worst experience I have had at Pepperdine so far. The GE class is treated like its your major class and she does not explain the information very well at all. It was close to impossible to keep up, because as soon as you understood one chapter, she was already 4 chapters ahead. Too fast, too boring, not even stimulating.

Professor Stillman lectures in such a way that it's hard to follow along if you don't already know a lot about the subject, but she's more than willing to help clear things up outside of class. Tests are also too hard for a GE, especially the cumulative final. Overall, though, not a bad option for the lab science GE.

She treats the class like it's a major course, not a GE. The final is impossible and over 20 chapters in great detail. I'm sorry but I'd rather focus on my AC224 final that I have to ace, than a stupid GE that gets dropped from my GPA if i go to grad school

this professor is really the best one i ever had throughout my whole experience in pepperdine. she prepares you very well for exams. she is so loving,caring,helpful,sweet. take her and u wont regret it not one bit! she's beautiful,smart,makes class interesting. 3 midterms+1final (non cumulative)
She is cool u can be even late for the essay u have to turn she ll forgive!
pretty good teacher, helpful outside of class

Graphic design class on Thursday 6-10 I learned a lot. She's young (Pepperdine graduate & Parsons) so she is easy to relate to.She kind of throws you into this cage with illustrator, photoshop,etc but it really helped me learn!
I recommend this professor she is the hotest professor at pepp.
Awesome Teacher!!!! Highly recommended!
We had one group project for the entire course. Her tests are easy if you mainly study the powerpoints. She gives great feedback on your papers outside of class. I would definitely take her again.

I love professor LeVan! I 100% recommend taking her. She is such an incredible teacher. You literally don't have to read the textbooks. Just go to class and pay attention and you will do well. She provides all her powerpoints on courses. I thought she graded essay questions a little harshly, but all in all she was so great!! She's super nice too :)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Best Political Science professor at Pepperdine

Other than Jesus Christ, this man is my favorite individual on the planet. He is a gem and it is tragic I won't get the chance to take another acting class with him. He is so caring and warm and it was such an amazing experience to learn from him. Take this man's class!

Smith is great! I took this class while taking a bunch of other intensive courses and it was fun! This class is very participation heavy, but its a great way to get out of your comfort zone and make some new friends. Smith was super caring and very passionate about acting! Would recommend!
Probably one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine. Take him if you have the chance!!!

Most confusing and unclear course. Didn't put grades in until finals week so we had no clue what we had in the class especially for participation which was huge part of grade. Showed insane bias towards certain students for absolutely no reason.

She is an extremely fun professor but sometimes she is a bit tough with grading. Despite that, you will learn from her COM180 class, she is very-well knowledgeable in the topic and really made every student grow to their fullest potential. You do need to attend class as participation is crucial to her, but she is a bit tough for an intro class.

Get ready to be critiqued while also never knowing what's going on in the class. This course was the most confusing and frustrating courses ever. Did not put anything in the grade book until finals week and is rarely accessible outside of class. Disorganized and will make up stuff on the go. Very strict about participation. Take someone else!!!!!!!
Her lectures are chaotic and messy, she also is not very clear on her topics. Additionally, she calls on students randomly when they clearly don't want to be called on.
Very nice but also curious
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Had her for 151 and 152. Great teacher who really cares for her students. Was a pretty strict grader and attendance/punctuality policy, but since we would look forward to class it wasn't an issue. Would 100% recommend.
Hollas Culton is a great professor- very patient with students and presents content clearly

Prof. Hollas-Culton really helped me with my German while abroad. I learned this language under her direction faster than I have learned any other. She has a very strict participation grading system, so be sure to show up to class and participate as often as possible. Her quizzes and tests are very passable and she prepares you very well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Williamson is one of the best profs I've had at Pepperdine. Super smart guy. There are weekly quizzes on the readings, but as long as you stay up to date with the textbook and material in class they are super manageable. Tests are not difficult as long as you follow the study guides. 10/10 would recommend you take him at least once.

Prof Williamson is the best!!!! He's super sweet, he does fun activities in class that really helps you to remember the material and his tests are fair. There's a quiz every class tp make sure you are up to date with the readings, but it's not hard at all! Just do your part and it's easy to get an A. I actually enjoyed the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Professor Williamson is one of the best religion professors at Pepperdine. I'm not religious but I thoroughly enjoyed his class. We have quizzes once a week in his class for the readings we do for homework but they are easy true false, mc questions. We have 3 exams and a final. As long as you complete the study guide, you'll get an A-/A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Except not being on time for the lecture, good professor though. Graded comprised of many things; Not a tough grader. Easy tests
Don't take her, doesn't know how to teach and be on time.

I had Hardika online and it was tough course material in itself. I found the material interesting, but the professor is kind of cold and makes you feel stupid sometimes. Beware of being called on randomly to solve math questions. That was one thing I absolutely hated. She let us have cheat sheets for exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great teacher,very knowlegable on the subject. Very helpful to students. I would highly recommend her.
AWESOME TEACHER, AWESOME CLASS

This gal is a piece of work. My advice- do not ever speak to her, go to her for advice, or take any course she teahces. One of the worst individuals at Pepperdine. Poor character, Total see you next tuesday (if you know what I mean).

She's a really fun teacher who has interesting lectures but her class does tend to drag on after the first hour. She tends to play favorites so participate early on and she pays special attention to you. DO NOT SKIP CLASS b/c she gives daily reading quizzes. They're easy if you've done the reading but can really hurt your grade if you get zeros.
SHe is eazy need to show up to class though. Test are easy and she grades easy on eassa's
Great Professor! Very easy chill. Tests aren't hard at all and she uses the book a lot. Lots of opportunities for extra credit. Definitely take her for SOC

Professor Huggins is a good professor. He gives interesting lectures, and gives out  handouts of his PowerPoint presentations. There are 2 take-home exams and one paper/oral presentation (you choose between the two). As long as you don't wait to the last minute to do these things, you'll be fine. Try to participate; come to class on time.
Nice grader. No written exams in class. Just pay attention to his PPT. He has thousands of examples about marketing in his heads.

Doug green is the man. Easy, but really you wouldn't be in one of his classes if you weren't interested so pay attention. I actually got a b+ one out of the three times I took him, so you have to pay attention and be part of the team you are in. I was soul searching at the time and didnt really want to be doing NPM. He's a loving man.

Prof. Green is a nice guy and a decent teacher.  His class is extremely easy so as long as you somewhat pay attention you will do fine.  He seems somewhat new to teaching tho because he does not seem to totally know what he is doing, but he does his best to put concepts in language you can understand.  Tests and assignments are easy.

Excellent professor.  Upbeat, warm, welcoming.  But, the class is no piece of cake.  But, she makes it so that all of the hours put in are a joy, not work.  I am more cultured, educated, and passionate about Italian Cinema, Literature, and Opera because of her.  I would HIGHLY recommend.  Don't be afraid of the challenge, you won't regret it.

Professoressa Hopkins is my favorite teacher by far at Pepperdine!  She makes class a pleasure to attend, and motivates me to work and study so I can get in on the fun topics of conversation in class!  She makes you work, though, so don't expect an easy A.  If you want to speak Italian well, and enjoy the process, take her!

She is absolutely amazing! She covers very interesting topics and is so passionate about what she teaches. She really makes the classroom a comfortable space to share your ideas and she creates such a free and expressive vibe in the class. Really recommend taking her at least once.
Great teacher, interesting topics.

TAKE HIM if you get the chance. your grade depends solely on the midterm/research paper/final but it's not hard to get an A. he gives you study guides with every potential question on tests. class is lecture heavy (him talking a lot) but if you listen and write what he says you'll understand the material. he wants his students to learn & succeed
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: I thought I loved poli sci & then I took David Ebner's class and he made me hate this subject. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. He is a subjective grader who grades using highlighter colors (green good/yellow OK ). Are we in preschool? He did not know how to give a lecture: made no sense (could not follow for notes so I just gave up). waste of time and money
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Avoid this professor if you can. The sheer volume of assignments (mountainous) is ridiculous while trying to maintain even one other class. If you work full time and expect to take this class and maybe a couple of others, get ready to forget about your life for a semester. There is so much work, there is little time to actually absorb concepts.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Not good! Way too many assignments due on random days and in different locations so it's hard to keep up with. Grades very tough when she doesn't even ask for many specifics in her questions. ����������

Dr. Mueller is kind, funny, and knowledgeable and I really enjoyed her lectures. I learned a lot in her class. However, I wasn't thrilled that the second half of the semester is all group projects and presentations, so your classmates will be teaching you for half the term. Her rubrics for assignments are very detailed but oddly unclear.

This professor is a nice person at heart, and when teaching Human Development, adequate, but her disorganization gets the better of her. I would recommend trying a different professor for PSY658 at Pepperdine.

Professor Foroughmand is such an amazing instructor. She has this gaze in the camera like she can see through your soul lol but as a substance abuse clinician I can understand why. She has a saying for the class that you get out of it what you but in. She does a great job of providing a safe judgement free zone. This class was completely cathartic.

By far best professor I have had at Pepperdine! She is very respectful and attentive to students needs, yet encourages them to be pushed out of their comfort zone. Asks the students to share their personal experiences rather than just lecturing, comes up with activities to do in class, and frames information in a way that makes it understandable.

Dr. Rubio, a respected professor at Pepperdine, deeply cares about student success. He provides ample resources, reminders, and feedback, ensuring students excel in assignments and group projects. Passionate and dedicated, he maximizes class time, offering value for students' investment. Highly recommended for those eager to learn.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Rubio is very kind, understanding, and organized. However, he spends the full 2 hour class period lecturing and does not give a break. The lectures get quite long and boring given that we already watch them in the asynchronous. This made my experience in this class not as enjoyable.

This professor was by far the most kind, caring, empathetic professor I have ever had and I have been in college for almost ten years at this point. She will work with you and is very reasonable and flexible when possible. PLEASE take her. She is SO helpful and made her class feel like home.

Professor Jewett was a very kind individual, a fair grader, and gave good constructive feedback. She was also very understanding. However, she seemed to assign extra assignments that were not on the syllabus and that other sections of this course did not have to do. She also talks quite a bit and will interrupt you a lot. But overall decent.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Terrible class with an even worse professor. She does her best to waste the life of her students through long lectures and unnecessarily complicated projects. Grading is harsh. Do not take this class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment:
Most time wasting class at Pepperdine. The entire class left the semester unable to define what 'service leadership' is. Your grade is based mostly on over-complicated deliverables and pointless presentations.

Please do yourself a favor by avoiding her class. Previous reviews are misleading regarding both Bernstein's course and her character.
Professor Bernstein is a fun, respected professor who knows what she is discussing. She has real-world experience, and her class isn't too hard. I hope you like group projects for this class.

This service leadership class has probably been one of my favorite classes I've taken over my four years at Pepperdine and it's all because of this professor. Her lectures are engaging and fruitful, her story is inspiring, the class content outside of group work is manageable, and her class environment is always happy and fun. She is the best.

2nd course with Professor Wilkinson and enjoyed both. Class is paper heavy, but she explains what looking for & provides templates. Takes 1-2 wks to grade. Received great/helpful feedback on papers & in class. Class is engaging & had wonderful conversations as a group. Participation required. Do the readings! One of my favorite classes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof. Wilkinson did not return grades on time and didn't answer emails unless elicited by the program director. She is very rigid about deadlines but doesn't bound by them herself. She doesn't come prepared to live sessions; she reads presentation slides; if you are looking to learn the material and be inspired, find a different professor.

To those who are not good at finance, or math, I would not suggest taking this professor. The lectures were dry. I found that independently teaching myself the material was more effective. He is a very caring and respectable professor. To those who do not mind teaching yourself the material, you can take him. Do the work, and you will pass.

Readings were a little dry, but class discussions brought relevant and timely information necessary for learning.  Professor brought a great deal of current industry information to discussions.  I recommend this Professor.

I don't think there is anyone else who can teach this class better than her. She's a good grader and gives good feedback. She has great knowledge about the business world. Trust me, take her and you won't regret.

Very conflicted. She's a great person, really enjoyed her class. However, her standards are inconsistent and vague sometimes. Multiple times, a project was not marked off on things that were wrong, but marked off because she didn't particularly like a design choice. Almost impossible to fail though, got multiple Bs for projects and still got an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Harding is amazing and tremendously helpful.  She totally cares about her students.  Sure, she makes one cry every now and then, but it's usually warranted (i.e. students making inappropriate or culturally insensitive comments).  Best professor I had in grad school by far!

This is the worst class I have taken at Pepperdine. Dr. Harding's salary is not justified. She takes forever to answer emails and gives vague assignments. If I had known there would be teachers like her at Pepperdine, I would have considered other schools. She has made me cry several times :(

Tough grader, no mercy, doesn't care about anything and sometimes makes her own rules without telling the students, and cuts points off like rain.. good thing is that she explains stuff and makes you fill a minute paper at the end of class where you ask questions that she answers first thing on next class. Unfortunately she is mean.

Do not take this professor. I don't think she has much experience teaching. She has a lot of experience with children, and sometimes I think she thinks she is teaching 5 year olds. She keeps the room chilled, because I think she realizes she is putting everyone to sleep.

this is the stats class for imco majors, she really in understanding that none of us were good at math, she tried to make jokes, overall this is a good class, easy to take, doesnt take attendance, but i recommend it for a better grade. talks about her husband all the time. overall, good teacher, wants you to do well and emails a lot.

The material can get boring, but this prof tries really hard to excite you about it.  Attendance is not mandatory, but there is a 1 point review question from the reading every class.  There are 3 tests and 1 paper.  Do the study guides in depth and you'll be fine.  As for the paper, she walks you through every step over the course of the semester

Dr. Hamilton was great. Showing up to his office hours really helped out (even for other classes). He was also really funny and his class was enjoyable and I always looked forward to coming to his class.
He is an amazing professor who is very knowledgable about many subjects. He can create a fun learning environment in the classroom. I would definitely take again!

Take any possible class from Andrea Zahler. She is so kind, caring, and thoughtful. She asks us about our lives and opinions and has an engaging curriculum. The speech class is not hard, the textbook is online (free!), and she makes it fun even if you don't like public speaking. Class is straightforward and I can't say enough good things about her.

Zahler is a great professor! She is always there to help you. The grading criteria for the speeches are difficult. The speeches have to be in the time limit or she will dock points. Other than that, this class wasn't too difficult.

Worst professor I've ever had. Never had such an inflexible prof. Her accent plus this subject gives me the worst headache and she doesn't make an effort to clarify any confusing points. She assumes you know the material when really, we're all in this class because we don't?? TLDR if you have the option to take someone else, DO IT!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is so difficult to understand. She has a thick accent which makes it hard to follow and understand the material she is teaching. She isn't helpful in solving problems of R through a macbook even though more than half the class has a macbook. I would avoid this teacher due to the language barrier and lack of understanding.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Nicole is incredibly knowledgable ,but she has a hard time delivering the information in a clear manner. Her slides often have many mistakes and she tends to contradict herself during the lectures. Her grading criteria isn't very clear and her exams are considerably difficult. Not bad ,but you really have to know your stuff for a good grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I had high hopes for professor Elby and unfortunately nothing changed throughout the semester. She reads verbatim off of her slides, does not go into detail about much of anything, and is very difficult to deal with in terms of actually wanting to learn from your mistakes on exams. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT take this professor!

Prof. Huddlestone is the best French professor I've had so far at Pepperdine. He makes you speak in class and doesn't make you feel stupid if you don't get something. Tests aren't hard if you listen in class and study from the textbook.

He sometimes goes at a fast-pace, but understands it's your first time speaking the language and doesn't take off points on tests for every little mistake. He's willing so slow down & explain stuff. Overall he's a decent professor and funny at times, you just need to make sure you do the short assignments he gives you every day and you'll be fine.

An easy A class but feels like barely learned anything solid. Easy grader on the group projects. Good examples. Very little homework. Her voice sounds passionate about the subject. Good choice for a morning class. I just hope to learn more critical thinking skills from the class.

Best professor ever!! Loved her class & highly recommend it. As long as you do the work and put in the effort you'll be alright. She knows the topic is a challenging one especially for non-business majors. Always lets class out early if she's done teaching for the night. Test was difficult but projects brought grades up. Take her.
Such a sweet woman and great professor. Prof. Gellis cares deeply about her students and wants them to succeed in her class. Available literally 24/7. 10/10 class

Professor Gellis is fun, a bit eccentric, and wacky at times, but she's sweet and cares deeply for her students. She is super flexible about deadlines and being late to class as long as you communicate with her. She's a super easy grader and loves to talk and tell stories. Easy enough to knock out art GE (I'm an art major and I had to take this)

Professor Gellis is really passionate and really caring. She will teach you a lot about art and you get to do a lot of fun assignments in her first year seminar class. She sometimes tends to ramble and get off topic with personal stories but theyre always interesting. Overall, shes really sweet and this is a fun class.
Funny guy, hes a good professor but not good at lecture. Recommend to take his class.

He can be inefficient when it comes to the structure of the class, but he's a nice guy. He teaches a lot of different classes, so I think he should try decreasing the quantity of classes he teaches because he isn't able to give his full attention to his students.

She is so nice and can accommodate your needs. If you need help, you need to talk with her, not just sit there. Her tests are hard, but the final was a lot better! She is a lot nicer than the other religion 101 teachers.

She was a very nice professor but a horrible teacher. Her tests are extremely difficult and be ready to read 30 chapters in the Bible a week. She talks like you are a religion scholar even when all of us in the class had never taken religion before. You have to go to class and take extensive notes.

Dr. Garnica was an amazing professor for my first term of graduate school. The grading is clear and fair. It is very important to DO THE READING! The exams come straight from the textbook, specifically the HNB book. I repeat you NEED the textbook for the exams. She was very engaging and insightful about the material and the field.

Dr. Chris is a phenomenal professor. She supports her students and wants them to succeed. She is very fair and prepares you for assignments and tests. If you do the reading and coursework, you will get an A. The tests focus on the Abnormal Psychology textbook. Dr. Chris stays after class to answer questions and responds promptly to emails.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Yau is truly such a knowledgeable and understanding professor. She makes lectures engaging and is always willing to help her students. She is invested not only in her students' academic journeys but also in our personal growth. Truly a wise person that I respect a lot.

Dr. Yau is such an incredible professor. I took her for Stats and she always made lecture inviting even though the material wasn't. For tests just go through the slides you go through in class and do the examples and you'll be fine. She's such a great professor, if you have the option to take her please do! Will literally make your life easier.

She was an outstanding professor! I took her sports psychology and her research methods classes. She was an amazing and caring professor who took the time to get to know her students and their needs. There were multiple times when I was struggling with the material and she willingly spent hours to help me understand it and met me where I was at.

Dr. Chiconia Anderson is a great professor. She is very knowledgeable, attentive, and understanding. She covers the material to ensure you understand it, despite it being dense. There is a lot of reading and tests, but if I were to take the course again with anyone, it would be her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Test heavy

comment: She is a very understanding professor. She understands that life is unpredictable and is willing to go over assignments once they are graded for clarification about the grade received. This class was difficult. But she made the lectures interesting and provided numerous additional resources to students that were interested in more information.

He is very nice and enthusiastic, but sometimes it can get boring. Whenever we did random fun activities it was good though. You have to write two, 2 pg summary and critical thinking pts every week. No midterm. Participation will help your grade. Final was easy & straightforward. 2 papers. Take this class if you want an easy, chill class. He's cool
Most boring class I've ever taken! He just goes on and on and on about the same thing. Requirements are 2, 2pg papers each week. No midterms, no exams. A good class if u want to go on facebook!
J'adore professeur Keating!

Prof. Keating is wonderful. She is the sweetest woman ever and is VERY available to students for extra help. She is also lovely just to talk to about life, spirituality, or whatever. She is very chill about class. If you keep up on the homewrk, you'll do fine in her class and learn a lot too. TAKE her, she is one of the top three professors Ive had
A working professional. I learned more in this class than any of the full time professors at Pepperdine.
Great class!  Wish he taught more in the department.
Terrible lecturer. Doesnt speak English well.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Terrible.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Ruiz is such a nice, caring, cool guy. The class isn't hard, and I found it to be very enjoyable.
Such a dog, cool guy, awesome class.  As long as you try on art projects you will be compensated with a good grade. One of my favorite classes taken at Pepperdine.

Izzo is a sweet and funny professor. The bulk of our classes consisted of review in the form of games, as opposed to the traditional lecture format. She is not always accessible outside of class but will always answer questions after class. Her tests are quite fair and she prepares you well for them. I would definitely recommend her as a professor!

Professor Izzo is a LITERAL QUEEN! She is the kindest and most caring prof I have ever had. I am surprised she does not have a ratemyprofessor page yet because she is the best teacher yet! If you have the option to take her for French while studying in Swizzy, do it! The class is super interactive and fun and she prepares you well for her exams :)

Dr. La Valle is an amazing professor and makes the marine bio G.E interesting and fun. While the exam material makes sense logically, the review and the exam usually do not line up just reread the slides.

Highly recommend Dr. La Valle. I was skeptical of taking marine biology for my lab but so far have not regretted it whatsoever more glad that I did chose this course. I will say if you do not have any background history of basic Biology or Marine Biology it may be difficult at first but trust me you will get the hang of it and learn a lot.

This class (and professor) was really chill, we mostly just discussed designs (buildings, furniture, theater), elements of design they used, and what they evoked. The tests were easy, papers short, homework simple. I enjoyed the design projects (creating small artworks then presenting). He did sometimes assign multiple things the same day though.
Paul is great! He makes his class very fun and enjoyable for his students!
Paul is the best. Cannot recommend him enough. Favorite class this semester!

Vicky was a great prof. I learned so much in this class, she is tough and typical Bavarian (ex. may seem mean to Americans sometimes) but caring, helpful, and funny. Having a prof who is teaching her native language made learning easy, especially with pronounciation. You 100% have to show up and you have to do the homework, but you learn a lot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Gabriel is the best German professor I have had at Pepperdine. She is from Bavaria, so she comes with a lot of firsthand knowledge on German culture that she incorporates well into the class. Puts a lot of effort into her classes and is a fair grader.

He is extremely approachable and will get back to you ASAP via email.  Don't be afraid to ask him questions and run things past him before your big projects are due. Make sure your slides are clean/simple with few words, and practice your presentations. Your projects make up over 1/2 of your grade!

Dr. Pennell treats his 200 level classes like they are 400 level, or even graduate school level. Even when the content isn't difficult, he overcomplicates it. He is an extremely tough grader and very specific, no wiggle room available for small errors.

Be prepared for really fast demos. She doesn't slow down or check in with students. Sometimes it was assumed we would know information that was not posted or mentioned. It was assumed that we had a slide presentation ready that was never posted or mentioned by instructor. She's not personable or understanding of personal circumstances.

Professor Reizman is incredibly knowledgable in graphic arts and using all of the adobe creative cloud apps. Her lectures are easy to follow and engaging and she makes her to always record in class demos so you have them for reference later on. She's super understanding if you need extensions on projects and is super chill. 10/10 would take again

I would strongly advise against taking Professor Falon's class. The lectures lack structure and frequently go off-topic, making it difficult to learn anything substantial. Participation in class discussions is heavily weighted in your grade, so if you're not comfortable speaking up constantly, this class isn't for you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Falon is such an amazing REL100 teacher. Her class is graded out of 1000 points, but it is very easy to earn those points if you put in the work. She is a very easy grader, so do not panic if something goes awry in your work. Attendance is mandatory, but only one exam. She will also provide very inspirational lectures during class. TAKE HER CLASS!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Lasiter is a really chill professor. Always offers a review session in addition to in class review. Understands you want to get a good grade on the class, but also helps you learn. Hes really good about hinting/telling you what to study for exams. Generally a practical, down to earth, and realistic guy. Understands students needs, and helps you out

There is almost always homework. Manageable, and graded on completion.  Attendance is mandatory (factors into your grade). After every lecture, he gives a 5 question quiz (usually with 1 free point). Both of these boost the grade significantly. Excellent professor overall. A bit of a challenge, but he is ALWAYS there for you if you have questions.

Take her!  You will have fun learning Italain.  Paduano is extremely helpful.  She makes the class interesting and fun with her great personality.  She is very understanding and will do what needs to be done to help accomplish things.

Professor Paduano is awesome!  She has a very outgoing personality and makes the class fun.  She is always there to help you with anything that you need. She is very understanding and just wants to help you succeed. She uses Lab book, Work book, and Text book, but it helps you learn Italian much better. Also the answers are online, so its super eas

Best textbook I've ever used. And Dan likes to meet with students for lunch. He's got a pretty well set up course and he knows his stuff. Weekly quiz on the reading and lecture. A few group projects. No midterm, the final took 15 minutes. Lectures can be a bit dry.

The class itself was very interesting, however, because I turned in 1 paper late I received a horrific grade in the class even though I received very high grades on all my other assignments. He is completely unforgiving and not very approachable to older students. Grades should be an assessment of overall work product.

Professor Ross is kind and flexible, with a lenient grading style and an understanding approach to deadlines. Although his lectures are dry and grading can be slow, he genuinely cares about his students and checks in with them regularly. I'd take his class again.

Professor Ross is very kind and an easy grader. However, his lectures can be very dry and he talks quite a lot in tangents that are hard to follow. But, he's very understanding and even offered a paper extension for the whole class. Takes forever to grade. He's super knowledgeable and, if you can stay engaged, you can learn a lot.

Professor Novack is very nice and tries to be helpful. He just is terrible at teaching the information. He is an extremely tough grader and I would not recommend it. The nicest man ever but I would NEVER take his class again.

Professor Novak is one of my favorite professor in the whole business division. He's super helpful and his lectures are well-organized. Do the homework and study before the class you will be just fine. If you need to take 224 225, choose him he's the best.
She's no longer teaching but she was the absolute best and the reason I became a therapist.
No Comments

His class is mainly led by the students, everyone will present on a chapter reading, and the whole class is a big discussion so if you are shy this might not be the class for you, Many guest speakers from different careers. No midterm exam but there is a final exam based on guest speakers, chapter readings & lunch withs activity

Great class, lots of fun. Ned allows student discussions to dominate most class periods, so it's up to you what to discuss. This class focuses a lot on career development, with lots of guest speakers who tell you about their path in the sports media industry. Ned is a great contact to network with, and an outstanding mentor in class.

The atmosphere in Dr. Powell's allows us to feel heard and opens the door to thought provoking conversations necessary to multicultural counseling. Easy A if you show up. If looking to work with diverse populations, I highly recommend taking her class as it offers so many perspectives and insight that's applicable to clinical work and research!

Major issues with this professor. Professor was highly opinionated. Felt like multicultural counseling should be taught by someone more diverse. Professor used unapproved literature when speaking to students. Class is feedback based and that feedback has made a few students in the class cry, it is very intense and uncomfortable. Calls people out.

I think she'd do better as a Highschool teacher. She's very timid, indecisive, and doesn't take control of a room, and is also very young. She grades you on concepts she never taught and is very unclear with instructions. A lot of class time is wasted by her nervous rambling. I'm sure she's a nice person, but shouldn't teach a 300 level class.

Long boring lectures. Super hard grader who never gave us feedback. Took forever to grade things and was super slow with emails. Grades hard on participation. Avoid at all costs. Didn't know 2/3 of the grade in the class after the final. Very unclear expectations.

I believe this is her first semester because she improved over the course of the class. She doesn't grade on a lot and she doesn't grade quickly. There is a lot of reading and weekly journals based on the readings. Class was mentally taxing and not productive. I would take a different teacher if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I think this is her first-semester teaching. My experience hasn't been great. I'm not sure who your other options are for taking 622 but I haven't been thrilled with this teacher. Assignments are unclear and returned late, it takes about a week for her to respond to emails, and class lectures are lacking. I think I'll probably end up with an A tho.

This class wasn't bad for a second level language course. She is a lenient grader and offers extra credit on the exams. Do your VHL homework and prepare for the exams and you're good to go! The class does seem unorganized at times, however.
Great professor. You can tell that she really loves teaching and is very kind and understanding. She really wants you to succeed and loves when you master a topic.

Super caring and funny professor. Is strict and can be intimidating at first, but she really is approachable and cares about her students. She has her expectations but it's not hard to meet them if you really try. The work seems harder than it actually is. I hate public speaking but she actually made me comfortable with it and a better speaker.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly, this is a tough one. She's incredibly knowledgeable on the subject, and you can tell that she has helped many people become master public speakers, yet for some reason, most people in our class would agree that we found the class to be incredibly difficult and would dread having to go and deliver our speeches. Wouldn't recommend it.

Garys the best! if you need an easy chill but fun class to add to your scduale choose this. We never get hw, no test, and the whole class we just make newspapers on adobe acrobat. Bonus points bc Gary only keeps us an hour

Gary is the best! He is the sweetest and so understanding. You will work on a partner project for a good portion of the semester. Class never lasts more than an hour and is occasionally optional or canceled. You learn a lot about Adobe InDesign and the project output ends up looking great!

I took his class in Elkins and for the most part there was not a lot of homework. The class itself was just lectures and he does random attendance checks that count toward your grade. The majority of your grade is determined by 3 open note tests that were honestly extremely difficult. the way he grades does not make much sense either.

I had him in Elkins and it was super relaxed. Attendance is definitely encouraged but he posts all his lecture slides and doesn't take roll. There are a couple homework assignments but the main bulk of your grade is from tests. The tests are not that difficult and he lets you use your notes. Take this class!

It is not super hard of a class however the teacher is very confusing and often gives incorrect directions so you can never actually take what she is saying literally because it may just be not true. She also grades very inconsistently so I recommend just going to her office hours and showing her you care and she will reward you for that.

The course is not too hard along with the content, however, the professor is very confusing. When finals were canceled because of the Franklin Fire and we all were leaving, she decided to try and make us take our final ON CAMPUS on Monday the 16th, after the term ended. We were able to get deans involved and they made her change her final options.
Too bossy and arrogant. Argues with students as it is her way or highway. She is actually good, but her attitude makes it difficult
Class mostly consists of her going through and giving us coding examples. Homework once a week on an online textbook, which can take a little while sometimes but isn't anything extreme
Such a sweet professor! Her enthusiasm is evident in her classroom everyday and she is so passionate about her students. Gem of a professor and I learned a lot in her class!

Sweetest and most enthusiastic professor I have ever had, take her class! She is very very passionate about her students, and will do anything she can to help you! Her class is easy and she does a variety of different activities so you can learn a lot from her. She grades mostly on effort and encourages mistake so you can learn from them.

Professor Wright is an amazing professor. He is very personable, and open to questions. His class is fair; if you put in the work, you'll do fine. There were 3 exams and 8 weekly homework assignments. Don't be intimidated by the computer coding of the class; Prof. Wright will help. The homework comes right from what we learn in class.

Finally- someone in the Business Division that is young and establishes a rapport with his students. He is clear, concise, appropriate difficulty for exams, and gives you the formulas for the tests- allowing you to understand the interpretation of statistics (which is ultimately more important.) One of the best professors I've had at Pepperdine.

Dr. Wagerman is great! He wants his students to do well and is very helpful. Go to class, do the homework, let him know that you are alive by participating in class, and you won't have to worry about your grade. He gives you EVERYTHING you need to ace the exam during lecture and with the how to notes. Attendance and extra credit are easy points.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Dr. Wagerman is very energetic and he makes difficult concepts easier to understand. He truly cares about the success of the students and is willing to compromise to ensure their success. He really appreciates participation and punctuality, therefore, as long as you are solid in those areas, you'll do fine.

His grading is super subjective and somewhat discriminatory. If you're a white girl who will always agree that he is right, you'll get an A. Everyone else, especially if you're a dude, you'll maybe get a B.

Avoid at all costs. Your art is graded based on how good it is, despite what he might tell you. A good class to take in Lausanne b/c you don't have any outside work, but you'll most likely get a C or a low-mid B. People have complained about this class for years and nothing has been done about this guy. Don't take this class, trust me.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Ashley Muhchow is the kindest and the most approachable professor who I met so far. Her lectures are extremely organized and well-explained. There are three tests and the second test is hard, but there are extra credit opportunities, and she does an excellent job in making hard statistic concepts more understandable. Take her for BA 216!

She gives lots of partial credit on assignments and tests so as long as you put something down and kINDA know what you're doing you'll be fine. She's very understanding if you forget your spiral or forgot to submit your homework or something. Do the assignments
Honestly not a good professor. He doesn't care about students and doesn't listen to everyone else.
LOTS OF HOMEWORK!!!! He's very disrespectful and would not do any adjustments for students' suggestions.

THE BEST SAAJ PROFESSOR EVER!!! Cares about the students, very educated professional (he's a doctor) learned so much in his classes, interactive, great energy, has a true passion for teaching, every assignment is clear and straightforward, he has very easily accessible office hours and he's always willing to help or explain topics. Very organized!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He is really enthusiastic about what he's teaching, and he's always willing to offer help.

I took her for ENG 101, super easy class and super caring professor, but a bit disorganized at times and A TON of papers. Homework is due on Saturday or Sunday nights (depending on the assignment) and should be submitted to her email; then the hard copy is due the next class period. (Save all your papers because you submit them for your final.)

Professor Mclellan really cares about her students and their progress. She has unique methods of teaching that allow us to see common mistakes in writing and how to improve them. She encouraged us to write from the heart, showing us how to write about complicated topics & thoughts professionally. The homework is also extremely simple and fun!

One of the best professors ever! She is super caring and really focuses on students actually learning and not just focusing on grades. She will give you feedback but as long as you are completing the assignments and showing up to class your grade will be rly good. Honestly the easiest and most fun class I've ever taken.

Prof McClellan was a fun teacher, she made classes engaging and showed us how much she cared, she always made sure that we were writing from a place of passion and creativity which felt really nice, almost therapeutic to be honest.
TERRIBLE PROFESSOR. CHANGES THE DATE LAST MINUTE AND EXPECTS TOO MUCH. I DON'T UNDERSTAND.

Honestly easy class if you try your best and be open-minded. 6 quizzes, a midterm, and a final. Pretty standard for a language class. She has a personality that makes it silly to go to class, but she is kind and caring towards her students. Attendance = important, esp since the class meets almost everyday. Just put some effort and you should pass.

Professor Kurtz was very encouraging and supportive of students. She utilized class time effectively and allowed us time in class to complete certain projects. She was very understanding of students' schedules and overall a great professor. No complaints!

Professor Haeflinger-Kurtz is very sweet and considerate. She allows students to do certain homework assignments during class time because she doesn't want us to have to spend more time doing it in our own time. She is very patient and understanding of the practicum process and advocates for you the best she can. Would highly recommend!

OB is a joke class and completely worthless. Griffin is easy if you put any time in whatsoever. The papers are so easy-just include some words from the book. His tests you can cram for and just make a study sheet for. You can use 1 sheet of paper of notes on the tests.

Very nice guy but has no clue how to teach college students. Curriculum is beyond difficult (and that's coming from the daughter of a physics teacher...) and tests are impossible. Class averages were below 50%. Took him in 2012 so it's possible he's gotten better, but don't count on it. He is an astrophysicist with almost no teaching experience.
Jacob was very helpful, short classes, lenient, easy tests!

Love Prof. Portzel. At first youre like who is this guy but then you realize hes hilarious. Super dry humor. MAKE YOUR CLASS TALK it makes it so much better. Discussions every class take up the first half so it flys by. 10 min break. First test is tough but READ THE TEXTBOOK. Simple subject matter and fairly simple tests. Textbook is key.

This was easily one of my favorite classes. Barnes makes class a lot of fun. She really relates to the students and makes the topic interesting. If you do the work and go to class you'll get a good grade - she's not trying to fail anyone. I'm pretty positive my whole class was in love with  her. (Her quizzes come right off the website for the book)

She was not very clear about what she expected on the assignments and papers,which confused the entire class.  Reading quizzes were extremely difficult and sometimes people would get a better grade by just not reading the chapter at all. Everything in her class seemed to have a secret meaning that none of the students could figure out.

She is a great teacher! Very pretty and outgoing, almost feels like you are girlfriends chatting it up! Yet you still respect her and she grades hard. She has high expectations for her students and you learn a lot in the class. Be prepared to work hard and be in class everyday because it counts
A really good class and teacher. She gives interesting lectures and values learning over the grades which is what they all should be like

His grading criteria and expectations could be more clear but he's a genuinely caring and amazing person. Definitely didn't have to do much to pass this class. If you want to get an intro into R and statistical data and programming without being drowned in work I would 100% recommend taking his class.

Such amazing amazing teacher. I was always excited to go. She will literally walk around the room and take time with each student to make sure that u are successful. If u mess up, she doesnt care. She makes u feel welcomed so there is no intimidation with her class. There is homework every day, but it is not hard.

This was Yelena's First year teaching at LBCC, so happy i took her theater forum course. You will have submit a lot of reviews. you will have to participate in discussion bored's and quiz's online. super easy!! don't fall behind or you will fail. Read everything, she will grade you on every detail, even if she says she wont. super funny and caring.

The group project is the main part of this course. The professor makes it clear on his guidelines on how to write the papers and create projects. However, there is so much useful information in this class. Engage as much as possible to get a better grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: The semester consisted of just exams and 1 essay. The tests were at the end of every week which you'll do good on if you do the readings and his lectures are based on the readings as well. Overall, he's a great professor!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Absolutely wonderful Professor, both approachable and respectable. A true, high caliber scholar. Get ready to learn. I had him for REL 101 Old Testament in Context. In summary, I wouldnt say that the class was extrinsically hard, but rather inherently challenging. He alleviates this by emphasizing the interpretation aspect. Great Class!

The class is a dance for musical theater class. Thankfully, she wasn't grading us on our ability to dance well/gracefully. She graded us on our ability to try and practice again and again. Overall, it was a great class that put me out of my comfort zone and helped me learn a lot of things.

Dr. Evans is a successful career woman, but her success doesn't translate into her teaching. Her instructions and grading criteria were NOT clear, she consistently arrived to class late, and our grades were not updated because she could not figure out Courses. She has good intentions, but her actions seem very unprofessional.

While Dr. Evans is a nice person, teaching isn't her thing. She frequently came very late to class then complained about her commute. She would make slideshows during class, changed the syllabus 5+ times for no reason, + lacked an understanding of psychology. Rubrics + instructions didn't exist +lecture was just a rant session about her other job.

She is a very personable professor and makes lectures interesting. Gives examples and personal stories rather than just presentation lectures. She is somewhat flaky, canceling class at the last minute, having her daughter interpret the class every time, and often goes on unrelated tangents. However, despite these things, she is a good professor.

She is very sweet, welcoming, and understanding. Fair grader for the papers and gives you points back on quizzes if you email answer justifications. She is also willing to answer any questions regarding the career profession and has a lot of good insight. Overall, great professor!
Herr D is a fantastic professor and overall great guy. Super interesting class, very much worth taking.

He can be confusing at times about what to expect on the test. However, if you spend your time at his office hours he will more than likely tell you the type of questions that will be asked and what to focus specifically on. If you don't go to class, take notes, or go to his office hours it will be tough to get an A. But a B is def doable.

Aside from Dr. Holmes, I've enjoyed all my professors at Pepperdine. She doesn't seem to want to be there and lectures with little passion. She has very rigid standards that are difficult to meet. I would not recommend her. In fact, find a different section.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: If you like doing a bunch of extra artwork on top of your other class work, then I say take this class. If you are not an art major or do not have a bunch of free time to be making twenty drawings as a homework assignment, then please don't take this class.

This was Professor Premoli's first semester teaching at Pepperdine. He's super nice and understanding with what his students need. The class is mainly reading on your own then discussions in class. It's a very chill class with not many assignments at all.

His midterms and exams throughout the semester are easy because they are take home but the final brings down your grade a lot. Definitely make sure to attend the last couple of classes if you want to prevent the final from absolutely wrecking your grade. I went from a 95 to a B.

Professor Tomas is very chill and requires an appropriate amount of work for a music appreciation class. The midterm was very difficult and required a lot of memorization. Besides that everything was an appropriate difficulty and he made the final project very easy for us. Would definitely take again!

He is very chill and nice. Knows what he's talking about. Connects well with students. Respectful of student circumstances. He even let us choose what day to take the midterm. I wish I could take him again.
Great professor. Lecture are mostly in discussion form. Has an open mind

She is very helpful, clear, and passionate about what she does. There is not much homework, but do it when she assigns it. Her class is interesting, often discussion-based. The only hard part is the 8 page research paper she assigns. Do NOT leave that until the last minute. Overall, she's awesome and her class rules!
Easy Class. Show up on speech days. Thats the most important

I loved this class! Dr. Anderson really loves art and it comes through when she teaches. I honestly did not think that I liked art history before I took this class, but Dr. Anderson really made the subject come alive.
