She does expect you to do the reading and she is very exacting in her grading, but was always willing to meet and work with me.
Lecture goes at 100 mph and no breaks.  Difficult to stay awake.  Answers questions but with vague answers.

This is a professor that will challenge how you view film. He's not the kind of professor that turns your brain off as he drowns you with uninspiring lectures. He'll let you speak your mind and lead you to new insights on critical film analysis.
Na

Stef is really sweat and helpful! She just graduated from Penn State and has lots of practical experience in this field. She knows what she is doing. I love her because she is really understanding and supportive for her kids. she stresses her principles in her own polite and approachable way. Love her an Easy A! I would love to take her again!

Great guy, extremely helpful and highly involved in his work, photography is his life. always available after class and lenient with projects, highly recommend his class, easy A, even if you don't know what you're doing; tests were extremely simple and straightforward.
really energetic and engaging lectures. there is no textbook, but the class is structured around interesting articles. challenging and well worth it
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Barratt was a great professor. I would definitely take him again. He was a perfect fit for this class as we actually got over the initial fear of working with our first client. Dr. Barratt is also super understanding and helpful.

Professor Batcheller is so incredibly kind and supportive. She really wants her students to succeed with their artwork, and is very patient with beginners and those who think they have little artistic ability. DEFINITELY recommend taking Professor Batcheller if you get the chance. I cannot recommend her more highly.

do not take her. she's not understanding of her students and her exams are insane. expected to memorize 6 film stories on top of readings for each class. quizzes every class. she thinks we only have her class and assigns way too much work. idk what shes thinking its just an elective we have to take, not want to
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She was so thoughtful with her students. Always asked us how we were, if we needed any help with anything. Would answer our questions after class, and even set up unscheduled office hours. Lots of class discussions.  Even asked us what we thought of what was assigned. If she should change the course content, and to even suggest new ideas to her.
Pro Wray was a great teacher. She made the class very interesting
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Gabrielyan breaks down content and makes it easy to understand concepts that would otherwise be difficult to digest. As a graduate student it's so relieving having a professor that actually cares about teaching you content and making sure you can apply it to your professional practice. I would highly recommend her class.

She used to be Elizabeth thoren at pepperdine before she got married
look up all the things people said about her there
literally the single worst professor in the math department, bar none

Prof Johnson taught a great intro to micro class! Very lecture heavy with weekly quizzes, and random selection of students called on each class so you have to pay attention. Super straightforward and focuses on concepts you can apply outside of class rather than useless calculations that you'll forget. He was also very helpful outside of class!

I cant recommend Pfonner enough if you are looking for a major class that will boost your GPA. He is a very generous grader and thought there's a decent amount of essays, they are worth few points (so pressure is off) and again he grades very easily. Interesting class too!

Hamed is a super kind professor. Her course consist of understandable lectures and open-note/open-book exams. I have no complaints about this professor, she really cares about her students and wants them to receive a good grade in the class.

Professor Vaughn knows her stuff and shes really engaging. However if you like easygoing classes or struggle with anxiety / public speaking I really wouldn't recommend her class. The only way to get deadline extensions or extra credit for an assignment is to answer questions in class. There is 1 oral presentation & it comes with trick questions.
Pr. Del Rosario is an amazing instructor who knows how to inspire with her tone.

Dr. D. is the epitome of a caring and knowledgeable professor. Though she made our interpersonal behavior course quite easy in terms of assignments, we all learned an incredible amount of information. I would highly recommend her to anyone in the IO minor or anyone looking to get some extra psychology credit.

Christopher Reeves is knowledgeable and delivers the material in a digestible manner. He recognizes that statistics and math is difficult for some people and spends much time answering questions and making sure everyone understands what he is looking for. He is a fair grader and clear on expectations.

Professor Stauder seemed intimidating at first but she was so sweet! She was very organized about her classes and we always knew what to expect. There would either be reading quizzes or kahoots based off the reading, the quizzes were out of 5 and could be a little difficult sometimes but Professor Stauder was awesome.

Professor Ferri was kind, understanding, and straight to the point. He never wasted any class time; and always got straight into the material. Live sessions of this course are discussions in breakout rooms, but you come back at the end for a large class discussion. He was available for questions and clear about what he expected for assignments.

Professor Roberts-Meese was kind and understanding of student's personal life and needs. She allows us to take breaks or eat in class if needed. However, she assigns A LOT of extra papers and assignments and is fairly nit-picky about grading papers. Overall, I would take her again but she is a tough professor.

Professor Abramov is so nice and understanding. She explains everything well and is an easy grader. I would take her for every class if I could. Psychopharmacology is not easy, but she makes it easier.

For my first term, wow, what a great professor. He listens to his students, grades on time, and gives great feedback. He is not a hard grader, if you do your work correctly, he will grade accordingly. We have weekly journals (2 pages), a final assignment, and just finish your modules. No quizzes, no exams. Midterm was an essay but super easy.
He was hard for seminar. There were quizzes on random details from each reading that made up most of the grade.

Worst professor I ever had. I could not understand what he said in class. The exams are different from what he explains in class. All of my grades in the program were A or -A except with him B as I took with him 3 classes. He is too old to teach (84 years old). There are many other good professors but the university does not want to change him.

Was a very insightful lecturer for Marketing. Despite lectures feeling tedious at times she was always in a great attitude and made the class enjoyable. You have to make a semester long project worth 33% of your grade and exams are 50% so you do have to put in work to exceed well in the course. Also she's always available for help and pretty funny.

Dr. Bruere is definitely the best for AC 224. She gives out many take home quizzes and lots of opportunities for extra credit. Go to office hours, do the homework and extra credit and you'll do well. Def read the book as it will help you when things don't make sense in the class. Lectures are good and she makes them relevant to the real world.
She is very clear on everything and helpful. She collaborates with the students and listens to what we have to say.

Dr. Cotton is very nice and supportive. She is open to communication and  very equitable. We only had a few zoom meetings but you can tell she really cares. I would recommend her and take her course again!

Professor Wood engages the classroom, despite it's large size. His tests are very fair, if you read and study, you will do good. Enjoyable lectures, no homework, lots of reading. His explanations are very clear and understandable. Favorite teacher at Pepperdine so far.
Professor Hamlin is available whenever needed and she replies to emails within 24 hours which is good when you have a burning question or just need advice. The class does require a lot of reading.
If you listen you will do well. Relaxed teacher that expects your best.  Do the work and its not a stretch to get an A.

This was one of my most dreaded classes. No one ever went, the class had no structure and I learned very little. She would randomly get really emotional and freak out on everyone about the other students not attending. However, she bases your grade mostly on 3 easy essays, participation and attendance so it was relatively easy to get an A

Prof. Ross has an interesting pedagogical approach. He does not use a textbook but assigns readings written by the actual key figures in American History. He is often out of town has he has another job in Ohio. He expects participation and classes can go by slow when no one participates.
No Comments

Kind of strange but he's a great teacher. Has his funny moments. Goes very slow to make sure no one gets left behind so it may be a little boring for people who pick it up fast. Online homework is easy and the tests are all multiple choice. The powerpoints he posts are enough to ace the class. Group project is a little tedious.

This guy is the worst teacher. He gives no study guides and has no clarity. He rambles on a lot and tends to be very drone. The midterm is a must A. But the final is brutal. You have one project and random quiz. He literally is the worst teacher possible. I am an econ major and he made me want to switch majors. He is terrible.
Greatest teacher at Pepperdine business.

He's a nice guy. The class isn't hard if you put in effort. There's lots of quizzes, but he tells you exactly what you need to study from the textbook. You have a few papers and a group project that aren't too bad. You do a lot of group work, but it actually helps learn the concepts, and you get to know your classmates more than other classes.

Professor Pollak is among the best professors I have had at Pepperdine. She really enjoys Economics and keeps the class interesting with additional info from various articles and podcasts in current Economics. She is especially good with communication via texts and goes the extra mile to help students out.
Great Professor. There's many papers due. She grades fairly but it's not super easy. I worked my butt off and and took my time on essays and got an A (and I am not the best writer). She's veryy nice!

Very active and funny as well as interesting in lectures. Tests are average. Brings in speakers that also talk about life lessons in marketing. Very helpful and helps struggling students. If you have no experience you will be enlightened on the subject. Knows Chinese words and China's background for business. Well rounded professor. Cordial.

Great professor. Teaches content in a clear and coherent manner. His grading policy and structure is awful. His final alone is worth 35% of your grade. I would take a different professor with a more flexible grading structure.
Contracts in 1L: Nice throughout the semester, and surprise you in the final exam with an epic 65 multiple choices close book.

Decent professor; lectures are a bit dry. Tests on a very wide range of content that sometimes is not aligned with the primary points of lectures. Lectures are also straight from the textbook, which is not necessarily bad, but if you did not understand the reading then the lectures will not make anything clearer.

Professor Kole is very sweet and the class is easy for a lab science, while being practical information for anyone. Exams are are straight forward and all the activities and labs are simple and fun. Not too much work and diet tracking was useful to learn. I would highly recommend Kole for your lab science GE!

I still do not know if I learned anything in this course, or if I could tell you what we were trying to learn. There were very few assignments that ended up being an incredibly large portion of the grade. He lectures the entire time while going on random tangents. The first exam was easy, but then they seemed to be incredibly specific and strange.
If you want to learn production and are willing to put in the work, take his class. A lot of reading, but worth it. No busy work. Caring and friendly, but knows the industry.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Not sure why Dr. Kealoha doesn't have any ratings. she's been one of my favorite professors at Pepperdine so far. I have taken two of her classes and both courses have been engaging and fun. She is definitely a generous grader and is super understanding of the weird circumstances everyone has been in because of COVID19. Take her class!

I took it for the GE requirement, but it was honestly one of the most interesting classes I've had. Super fun and really easy to do well but how much you really learn is more "you get what you put in." Would definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment:
Incredible professor! 
This was probably the heaviest load I had during the semester, but I learning applicable skills. He is very accessible outside of class, and the relationships I made with peers in his class are the strongest made in school yet. 
Be ready for pop quizzes, lots of homework, and grading that reflects your honest effort.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: DO NOT take him if you can avoid it! He is a bully that does not explain anything well which is hard with a complex subject such as statistics. Causes anxiety for all of his students, will cold call on you and shame you when you don't know answers. Grades super harshly. Makes an already difficult subject impossible.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Very clear with expectations, instructions, and grading criteria. Really focused on real world applications of the course material and always took the time to make sure questions were answered. You need to know the material but expectations were very reasonable. Great professor, would highly recommend his class!

I was a part of her first-ever class teaching and she is truly a gem. She is so nice and helpful. She really cares about students and wants to make sure they understand everything they're being taught. Took this course for a credit/no credit so there is no real grade. Just do the work and you'll pass.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Ray was great! She is very considerate of students' needs and genuinely cares about your success. Especially as a graduating student ending practicum, she made sure all of my paperwork was in very early so I had a stress-free graduation process. Highly recommend!

Professor Ramos was good. She is a bit uptight about using up class time, deadlines, and grading. If you are looking for a more relaxed professor I would not recommend her. But overall she is nice and I had no major complaints.

Professor Vialva was not my favorite personally. He is nice enough but he spends a lot of time talking about himself, gives very long-winded and confusing explanations for his expectations of assignments, and is very nit-picky about grading. He also seems to waste time with unnecessary things during class.

LOVE LOVE LOVE Professor Stahl. I had her for lab and loved it. Never made me feel bad about how many questions I asked and was always down to be hands-on to help. She only taught the 6 pm lab but she made the late class fun and worth taking!

I took Prof. Weiss for anatomy lab and I loved her. She was helpful in answering questions during labs and very good at quizzing us during to make sure we understood the material. Lab was mostly self-study with you and your partners and just asking questions when you got confused. Lab was fun and we got to leave early when we finished our lab.
No homework at all. Grade is consist of labs, one projects, 2 midterms, and final.

The difficulty depends completely on how much technical theater knowledge you have going in, for some it was a breeze, others a struggle. He gives lists of vocab to learn and all you have to do is memorize it. The “labs” are based on attendance and he usually let us out early. There are lots of quizzes but everything is from the worksheets/lists.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Great person, but felt bad for her as it was her first semester teaching here at pepp, so people took advantage. Good intentions and very helpful but you HAVE to stay on top of things because her course is very disorganized. She is a great teacher, but just a forewarning, don't think it's easy...because her Final pulls the rug from under your feet.

Extremely helpful. Great about reviewing  your projects if you ask. You really need to take notes during class to study for exams (which are tougher than you'd think for a Storytelling Through Media class). Lectures are ok. Projects include photography, podcast, video, and website in addition to exams.

Profesora Boruszco isn't the most challenging professor in the world, but she one of the most wonderful people you'll ever meet. She genuinely cares about her students and really, really wants them to succeed. Take her class if you want a relatively easy Spanish 3. You'll learn a lot, just probably not as much as with other professors.

She's a pretty great professor. She seems to be enthusiastic about what she's teaching, and it seems like she knows her stuff. Side note: It's funny that she curses a lot. The class itself isn't too bad. You should get the grade you deserve. She keeps the material interesting and doesn't waste your time in class or with work.

Dr. Graf is a good, caring professor. She is open to questions during class. There are three quizzes (she grades top two), a midterm, and a final. Make sure you read the textbook because it has terms that will help you understand the various mechanics of film. Come to class because there are film screenings. She gives extra credit. Know the films!

Yo hes only a visiting professor till next year so you have to take his GE non western class while you can.Sources of asian traditions. Its so interesting and he loves his subject and students. Really flexible laid back guy....pepp needs more teachers like him.
Ben is great!

LAngford was an adjunct professor for a summer course. He gives a lot of work for a G.E. couse. If you have the ability stay away from this course. He is a really tough grader and expects alot from his students. Never will take him again.

Dr. Schwarz doesn't seem knowledgeable on the subject he is teaching. Instead, students are assigned to present the entire lecture each week based on a chapter they have only just read. Tests were too difficult and ambiguous, and the textbook comprehension level is much higher than what should be expected of an undergrad GE course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Tests are tough (you'll have to upload graphs for some) but she is really smart and I enjoyed her lectures.
4 papers and he was super flexible. He was a great professor. Very Understanding.

Weekly quiz (all MC), 1 midterm, 1 final (MC/10-15 written but easy seriously). If you watch asynch only or lecture only, you will get an A+. She goes over eveyrything. There is a studyguide for quizes/tests. straighforward information. She tells you in her lecture everything that will be on the quizes and exams. She is amazing and passitonate.

Great professor who really cares about her students. You will definitely need to put in work to get a good grade but the teacher is fair and often will curve or give extra credit opportunities. Don't let her class intimidate you because it does get better as the semester goes on.

Dr Robbins is one of the best professors at Pepperdine. She actually teaches and has a high level of education and experience. In every lecture you can tell the great deal of passion and detailed knowledge! This class is very heavy but you learn soooo much! Time & money well invested with such a intelligent professor, HIGHLY recommend!

I do not recommend her. She relies on the students to teach rather than being a leader. It's very much a presentation heavy course. Professor takes up to ten weeks to post grades and does not provide constructive feedback. Also, she is not responsive to email or texts.

Now that I'm further into my online PSY prog. at Pepperdine, I realize that Bogdanoff is a gem. She prioritizes your understanding of the content. Participation is important, but she makes it enjoyable. I disliked the async lecturer/work, but Bogdanoff made up for that in class. She isn't a pushover & effort is required, but good class overall.

Best prof. Super chill and understanding. Empathized with us for this Monday night class and would let us out early every period. Course was very easy - homework can be redone once submitted for up to 100%. Tests are worth 30% each, not cumulative, and open book/open internet. Attendance not mandatory, but if you show up youll get extra credit

there are few good things to be said about lisa. she fails to properly explain her expectations and while she takes accountability for her shortcomings she ultimately expects the class to bear the burden of her error and resubmit multiple assignments. she veers away from the syllabus and fails to provide clarification making it extremely difficult

Dauner is a nice guy, but he goes way too fast through concepts and his lectures are super hard to follow. He gives difficult reading quizzes very often and they are weighted heavily, especially considering it is on content he has yet to cover in class. Also, half his classes are on zoom which does not make the course flow well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Professor claims to be a consultant in "positive psychology" yet a 1 pg recommendation form to continue graduate school was too much to ask."Don't know me well enough"?! I'm not borrowing money or in need of a kidney. I hope I am never so full of my academic self that I forget kindness.If you can't help online students, don't teach online courses.

Dent is such a sweet person, really cares about her students. She definitely knows what she is talking about and is passionate about it, but she isn't the best at explaining and teaching things well. She is brand new to teaching, but has much experience in film. Super chill and easy grader. Wasn't the most engaging class, but really really easy.
I loved this professor, I'm actually sad to be finished with this course. She is so knowledgeable and great at explaining everything! Easy grader and very understanding. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Sean Mike is a wonderful and extremely knowledgable person! He brings in fabulous guest speakers and always feeds his students. The class is somewhat difficult due to some fairly challenging tests and a lot of projects, but it is more than doable. I would highly recommend taking class from him because he is the most caring professor I've ever had!

We have chapter readings first. Then, we write 4-5 pages for the question about this chapter. Then he uses the exact words from the readings to lecture us about the knowledge that we already wrote 4 pages about and no innovation. Even the example he used in the lecture was the same in the reading. Four homework per week. About 15 pages per week.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Professor Pittella was an amazing professor the whole way through. I will say that you need to pay attention because she is not always clear on what is due and for what. Make sure you participate because she cares about that. I would recommend her as I had a great time in her class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor Haywood was fine. She tried her best to ensure you understood the information and was a fair grader. My biggest complaints were that she treated us as if we were in primary school and overall just did not structure the class well. We went over the same lectures and did not have adequate time to finish in-class assignments.

A really great, straightforward question. There is alotttt of reading, so do not slack. There is a weekly journal (2 pages), no quizzes, no exams. We do a lot of group discussions and you have a group project to present for forty-five minutes. Do your work and you won't have a low grade.

Extremely confusing instructions, you spend more time trying to understand her instructions than studying. Material is not applicable to career. Forcing you to ask questions even though you don't have any to recieve credit. Nobody liked her. Really bad teaching. Does not explain material. Class full of confusion.

first half of class is unbearable. requires students to partner up and make 30 minute presentations and discussion that has little to no relation to course material. only need to pay attention to his excel, but he goes by fast. exams are very similar to excel. smart professor, but extremely boring class.

Nice professor, attendance 5% but rarely takes so basically no attendance. Post in-class Excel activity solutions right after class. Two midterms drop the lower one and one final. Test all in Excel, the review guide has everything you need to know. Generous grader. Easy A if you attend class.

Dr. Williamson is a really kind and compassionate professor. She genuinely cares for her students. Weekly reflections and a final paper were required for this class. No exams. Do the asynchronous work. The class with Dr. Williamson was straightforward and understandable. I would take this lecturer again if I could.
She was a great professor. A lot of papers and gives really good feedback on them. Lectures and easy to understand and theres a lot of break out rooms. no midterm (a paper), no final test.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Shes a really Sweet profesor but she needs to be more clear in her directions and not change from her syllabus so much. A big tendency to teach with her ego as well so be prepared to be criticized in a way that you may not be comfortable with. I did not have her for upper division education classes so keep in mind this will be worse
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Real-world experience. Vague. Little to no homework. Grade is very ambiguous until you get it, intentionally. Talks about behavioral finance mostly. More like seminars about "knowing yourself" rather than lectures teaching you specific knowledge. Teaches broad ways to approach subjects with few specifics.

Amazing, Fun, Interesting lectures and way of teaching. I really recommend taking this class! One of a time experience ! Trust me !!! the lectures are really FUN and a good way to learn! He is really helpful ANYTIME, And takes his time to explain everything.

Prof Godburn was great. He was a good teacher, but best of all.. very easy. Show up to class and have fun, interesting speeches, and you will get an A. Very easy to talk to and makes the classroom a comfortable environment while students are giving speeches.

Great instructor but not an easy grader. She expects her students to take the class seriously and will grade accordingly. Comes off somewhat cold and standoff-ish but once you're used to the class, you realize it's not bad. Expect to work and expect to learn how to write. Very clear, straight-forward, and willing to help out.
Best Professor!!!!

Lectures are long and unhelpful. Doesnt show how to use the applications well she isn't great at teaching for beginners. Is caring and passionate but expects way too much. Many outside-of-class mandatory events and the workload and expectations are high. Unless you have experience with and love digital arts do not take her just for a GE.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Dr. Serrano is a brilliant professor. He presents the theories using clinical examples that allow you to understand the concepts better. He is knowledgeable, answers questions and is very engaging. Be prepared to be inspired.

His lectures are so unbelievably boring and he doesn't provide any rubric for his writing assignments. His tests are pretty easy to pass if you pay attention and do the readings and it's not hard to get an A in the class but it will be the most boring class of your week.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Professor Brown is very passionate and energetic about teaching psychology and it made the class engaging! She is great at explaining terms in detail and although her lectures can be long, they went by fast due to her excellent teaching :) The class I took was only test based but the tests were multiple-choice and straight from the lectures!

Professor Brown is one of the best professors you can ever take at Pepperdine. She is the sweetest & makes class/tests easy. Her class consists of lectures with slides that are very easy to follow along with and take notes on for tests. Her tests are easy and straightforward too. Overall she is a wonderful professor and has the gift of teaching.

Wilson is such a well knowlegded individual in the art of religion. He's a great lecturer which made class a lot easier and his exams are simple enough if you just pay attention. No homework just an project, exams and quizzes. As someone who isn't super religious, he still made me emerge myself in the class while staying respectful. 10/10 recommend

Prof Wilson is super easy! He is very lenient and super passionate about what he teaches even with such an early class. The quizzes are every week and he gives extra time on the group project at the end of the semester. All quizzes are online and he's very understandable if you ever miss class. Don't hesitate, TAKE HIM!
Dr. Monzon is a great professor and has made a difficult class easy and fun to learn despite it being online.

Prof, Riedmatten knows more about American History than anyone and will truly enlighten you through his course. There is allot of reading the whole grade is based on two long essays a midterm and final and class participation. You have to know your stuff. But he is inspiring and very knowledgeable take his class for a life changing experience.

If you are going through anything or encounter any medical issues, don't expect Professor Derrick to be understanding. She is an extremely tough grader. Luckily, she is available outside of class whenever you need to but is not super helpful when meeting with her. She is a nice woman, but I personally would not recommend her as a professor.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor White was amazing. I took her class for Multicultural Counseling, and I'd do it again. She delivers great feedback and a non bias perspective during lectures and on papers. She does require participation during class but make it comfortable to interact with her and your peers. 10/10 would recommend.

Professor Meyer is very sweet and personable. However, she is a tough grader. She does not give clear grading criteria and doesn't give feedback as to why you received the grade you did. The asynchronous work for the class is very lengthy and boring. You are mainly graded based on a paper and two exams (which are closed book and very difficult).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ram was a very effective teacher and gave me a good foundation in the DSM V.  His lectures are clear and concise, and his incorporation of film analysis makes the class very interesting.  I always looked forward to coming to class.

Dr. Ain is the most horrendous professor I've had at Pepperdine. Her requirements are not clear, she doesn't give us rubrics, and she emails us last minute about an assignment. She did not have a syllabus until about a month into the class. She is supposed to teach coding in R, yet she has no idea how to use R, or even Excel. Avoid taking her!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: All exams except the first one are open note. She is a super nice person and professor.

SHE'S AMAZING! Tests are lecture heavy. if you take good notes, then tests are EXACTLY like the lecture. 2/3 tests and the final were open note. Lab sessions throughout the semester are easy and for participation, one big group project at the end, and 2 2-page papers I wouldn't get the book, lecture covers everything, she doesn't trick you on tests

One of the best professors I have had so far at Pepperdine. She is exceptionally kind and helpful during class and office hours. She explains things very well and takes time to go through tough topics. I truly learned a lot in this class and had a great time. Take her if you can!

I had no experience with AP calc, but he's very understanding in terms of grading. I likely would've failed without it. He won't mark you off for minor mistakes on homework/tests if you can show that you understand the material. He does over-explain things which, gets confusing. Otherwise, he's an awesome professor! Wish there were more like him.

I took his business calc class. He's a really good professor and I liked his class. He doesn't give homework too often, and is really personable. But, he goes through materiel relatively fast, he offers NO EXTRA CREDIT opportunities, and NO late work, period. Also, each midterm is like 20% of the overall grade.

My class originally had Dr Vick as our professor. The first week of class was very confusing. He cares about the class, but as a lecturer he was very confusing and all over the place. He never made us aware of important announcements, Zoom links, etc. Abruptly left 2 weeks into the class without letting us know once. Very kind, but very unreliable.

Vick is a great person, but as a teacher he is quite bad. The class includes some incredibly hard material, and his way of teaching was not effective to anyone. As an entire class, we were all so lost throughout the entire semester, and it never got any easier. He was a great person but a horrible teacher. I feel bad for even saying this.
Hardest professor you will take at pepperdine. be prepared to work for hours every day if you want to get a good grade

Professor Allen is a genuinely great guy who cares about his students and is an excellent lecturer, but this is by far the hardest class I've ever had at Pepperdine. His grading is harsh, and the exams often include material you've never seen before. You can study for weeks and still struggle to pass. Great class - but it will take over your life.
